reviews.review: Be sure to visit the boulangerie 1st! Make a picnic!. This was our favourite park. Very pretty, even in the fall: leaves starting to change, but flowers still in full bloom and gardens looking terrific. Fountains still working too. We made sure to have visited a local boulangerie and corner store 1st so we had the makings of a picnic including a little wine. Very lovely. The sculptures are fantastic, especially the statue of Liberty and the Zadkine (his museum is near by) and the deer family and the lion. Too many to list. A lovely afternoon!

If you like gardens and parks, stop here and enjoy.. A really nice park. The gardens are stunning. Its a good place to see Parisian families enjoying their leisure time. We walked around the park. It is quite large for a city park. The flowers that were blooming were beautiful. A lot of runners, strollers and families pick nicking.

A wonderful place to picnic, rest and enjoy.. The first place I went when I first arrived in Paris, many moons ago was this amazing park. My co-travelers and I hung out there and ate sandwiches from Brioche Dorée across Boulevard San-Michelle just outside the gates of the park. In college I studied at the Sorbonne and my classmates and I spent many afternoons between classes studying and relaxing in the wonderful and surprisingly comfortable green metal chairs in the park. Last spring, when my husband and I traveled to Paris for his first visit, we picked up sandwiches (the same ones I loved 20 years before) at Brioche Dorée and ensconced ourselves in the park for several very restful hours. It was so beautiful and restful and the spring flowers were amazingly beautiful.
Bring your own lunch!. This is a nice place to have lunch and bringing your own is the best way to enjoy the fountains and people watching.

Finally, a Visit to luxembourg Gardens. After nearly a dozen trips to Paris, we made a special trip to visit these gardens. They were pretty in many respects, however, I believe there are many gardens in Paris that I enjoyed more......Jardin de Plants, Park Monceau, Tuileries, etc. We were there during lunch and were amazed to see about 25 men and women in business attire playing petangue on their lunch hour. We even observed an instruction class with a woman as the instructor. The fountain was one of the prettiest sights.
Beautiful and existed before America was established:). Saw it in the summertime, beautiful, but would like to go back in the early spring/summer when it's in full glory

Fantastic place to stroll and relax. Just loved these gardens, so well cared for, peaceful, plenty of places to sit, with chairs that can be moved and you can lie back in them in the sun and enjoy the scenery, whilst having your picnic lunch. A lovely children's play area that is fenced and beautifully maintained.

Relaxing garden in the city. Absolutely beautiful garden adjacent to the Luxembourg Palace, with fantastic views of the Palace. Ample garden chairs available. However, visitors are not allowed on the grass, which would make this experience just that much better. Great for photo opportunities, as well as relaxation and drinking in nature's beauty.
A beautiful walk. These garden are a lovely way to spend a chilled time out in Paris. They are great in all seasons - take a coffee with you and enjoy the stroll.

Big but empty. Like with many places in Paris, your expectations about it might be too high. The park is relatively big and has a wonderful central area with the lawn, flowers and a fountain, but if you go away from that area - there is not much, just passages between trees. So don't plan to spend much time there. Of course, it is my opinion. i still wonder what can they show you for such an expensive walking tour, maybe there is something i missed

Great Place for A Picnic. On our last trip to Paris we did like the local people. I had found out there was going to be a concert in the park on a Sunday afternoon, so we bought some wine, olives, grapes, cheese, and some sandwiches. Brought them to the park and sat on a bench and enjoyed the view and people watching. It was so much fun. Then later there was an band that played music in the park. It was so cool to see how relaxed it was with kids running up to and on the stage, the conductor stopping to talk with the kids, it was a family event. Filled our hearts with JOY! Just plane cool. If you go to Paris, check for the free concerts on a sign in the park. Pack a lunch bring some wine and enjoy the day walking around the park people watching and the music.
Lovely. What a beautiful retreat but the hustle and bustle of Paris. We were there on a beautiful day. We had hoped to return but our time in Paris was too short

Take a Stroll in the Park. The gardens are stunning. Admission is free and a great place to unwind any time of day. We were there as the sun was going time and the lighting is beautiful. The flowers were still beautiful in October.The perfect place for anyone to visit ; couples, families, and just by your self. Many benches and chairs scatttered around park.

Wonderful, great break with kids. If you can go on a day where they have the sailboats it's amazing, such a nice pace and something you just don't find home in the USA. Otherwise the gardens and the children's playground are well worth the visit. If you have kids to 2-11 I would recommend The enclosed playground. There's a small fee but it's completely worth it, and it has an inc toilet which with kids is helpful.

Relaxing. These are beautiful gardens with a multitude of chairs that you can find it and move around to sit where you please. Very well manicured grass in trees, there is a big fountain where you can rent sailboats for your young children and they can play with them on the water. This proved to be a great place to relax and take in the beauty of Paris.

Make this one a MUST!. We went here on a Saturday afternoon. It was a beautiful autumnal Parisian day. First we came across some locals playing boules. Wow! The competitive ambience was intense for a, seemingly, light affair! It was great to watch for a while. Then we walked through these beautiful gardens and noticed a band setting up on a rotunda. We found a seat and waited. This band was a jazz swing band who were just fantastic. Really high quality... Wish I knew who they were. Overall, the gardens are a must-do in my books!

A lovely place in the heart of the city to spend some time relaxing.. I was lucky enough to stay at a hotel that was a short walk from the gardens. A true gem in the heart of the city; a lovely place to relax, get some sun, and sketch. I found the Fontaine de Medici to be my favorite "secret" spot..... almost magical. Shhhhh, don't tell anyone!

All the flowers are still out in October!. We wandered through the gardens and were surprised to see all the beautiful urns of flowers are still in full bloom! They are an arresting sight and very colourful.There are lots of chairs for the weary traveller to sit and soak up the atmosphere. Paris does leisure time really well!

Perfect for a break. This stunning garden was just across the road from our hotel. We wandered around it several times just to get away from the bustle of the city. Mind you, lots a Parisiennes also love to use the gardens. It was perfect for a morning jog, but there are rules about where you can run!

Quintessential Parisian chilhood experience. One of my greatest pleasures in life is to take the metro to the Vavin station for a meal at the legendary La Coupole (Fantastically ordinary traditional comfort foods), then cross the street and walk up Rue Brea then Rue Vavin to the Jardin de Luxembourg, then stroll through the grounds up that huge Grand Bassin where all the little boys of my childhood would sail their rented toy bateaux à voile, then up north towards the Place de l'Odéon, then towards the St. Sulpice area, then up towards Saint Germain-des-Prés. Paris has changed so much in atmosphere. As much as I do not want it to remain a museum city {Paris needs desperately to reinvent itself to compete with NYC and London, as well as all other exciting modern metropolitans), it is good to have this quaint connection to the past, through this majestic Jardin de Luxembourg, with great architecture, landscaping, and regal statues lining the grand walkways.

Lovely gardens. These gardens offer a great place to relax on a pleasant afternoon. Children full their time casting small boats into the central water feature which sets a nice backdrop for you to pull up a chair and take an hour off to read a book/paper or just day dream. We went through the gardens on a Sunday afternoon where a band were playing to all those visiting, im told this is a regular occurrence. Great place to wonder though on the way to the Pantheon
Beautiful oasis in middle of city. Lovely break from the bustle of the city. Many separate gardens and lots of chairs to use. Tennis courts, playground, and much more.

Relaxing in the park . Beautiful, free location to come and relax. My friends and I kicked it in the grass and took in all the wonderful scenery. If you want to find a pretty place to rest in the city, look no further!

A beautiful walk. Our hostess at the Parc Royal Marais bed and breakfast walked with us through this beautiful garden. She said it is her favorite. It was lovely, with a carousel for children, walking paths, pretty gardens and important French government buildings.

Fantastic day sailing boats in the duck pond!. We had fantastic time sailing boats in the duck pond in front of the Palais de Luxembourg. Rental is available at a little stand opposite the palace for 3,50 Euros for 30 minutes. All is provided on the honor system; and well worth your time. Our four year old son enjoyed it thoroughly and our only regret was that we didn't find it sooner.

Gorgeous Gardens!. Near the Luxemboug metro stop is a spectacular garden that's not to be missed! If you have lunch and good book, this is the place to stroll, people-watch, study and just relax. Don't pass by the Medici fountain, which is a lovely place to spend a meditative few hours. Beautiful manicured grounds; there's a kids play area (I think there's an admission charge) but it looks like great fun for kids. Lots of shady paths, and close to many cafes and restaurants on Blvd St Michel.

Absolutely beautiful. This was a great way to spend time in Paris. The grounds are so beautiful and well kept. There are several statues and fountains. I relaxed on one of the many chairs and enjoyed the morning. If you're a runner, this is the perfect place to go.

Absolutely beautiful. My fiance and I took a stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens while sight seeing in Paris. It was absolutely amazing and I would have liked to spend more time there if we weren't in a rush to get back to our hotel.
Beautiful gardens. Great gardens with locals playing, relaxing, enjoying a game of chess. Don't miss the scale model Statue of Liberty halfway through to the right when the palace is behind you.
Quiet place to rest. Not like other famous attractions, Luxembourg gardens is quiet for the tourist to sit and read some interesting books.

Wonderful place to spend afternoon. Recommend to keep an afternoon or early evening free in your schedule of visiting Paris and spend in of the gardens including this one. Lovely place to enjoy people watching and just spend a quiet afternoon doing nothing. It could be fit between a morning visit to Pantheon and your evening activities perfectly

Must see these lovely Gardens. What a beautiful garden. Great place to bring a lunch enjoy the afternoon sun, read a book, sip a coffee or take a little nap. There are chairs and benches set up all around so you can choose your little spot to sit and relax. Nature as a calming effect.

Lovely walk. Don't miss the chance to have a lovely walk in one of the most pleasant park in town! Statues, fountains and flowers will decorate you journey in your visit. It's just perfect for any visitor or for a quick training at the park!
Beautiful Park to spend a few hours. Lovely park very well maintained. Great surprises around every corner. Children's play area is large and well equipped. People are polite, and clean.
Beautiful combination of nature and man's hands. Beautiful place in the heart of Paris, is a majestic shows sample botany and landscape architecture.

Lovely park. A lovely park to walk around and sit. Has a cafe. Was a nice surprise as we were told there was not a lot there, but we liked it. It was a lot bigger than we expected and wished we would have found it sooner.
Quintessential Paris. Lovely, where residents and tourists enjoy the beautiful setting. Sculpted chestnut alleys were magical.
A highlight of Paris. Absolutely stunning! A must see when in Paris! Be sure to bring a camera. The perfect spot to sit and enjoy a cup of gelato in the sunshine!

Must see. If you want to take your future wife just to propose her .... It's a romantic , beautiful , colorful , historical , classy , classic and incredibly beautiful place to visit . It made me feel so good after my visit . Full of beautiful creations of God and Human's hands
very relaxing!. Amazing experience to simply sit, relax, and immerse yourself into French culture. Beautiful gardens!
Enjoyed Very Much. I love gardens and this one is a good one. The grounds are quite large so I did get to walk all simply due to sprained ankle otherwise I would have tried to walk more.
Luxembourg gardens. beautiful place for a sunny day, to spend some time with the kids or as a couple, nice to walk or run

Nice garden for relaxing.. It is one of the best garden near to the Pantheon. In hot summer days just avoid it but it will be best in evenings.
You can skip it if you have time constraint.
Enjoy :)

On a clear day...what a beautiful place to stop and take photos!. Just the most picturesque place one could wish for anywhere! Great spot to stop the action, and appreciate natural beauty! Get out the cameras, or pose for someone!
Beautiful gardens. Lovely gardens even in October. Many places to sit and relax. Plenty of sun or shade. Wonderful for families, picnics, yoga.

Free. Beautiful! Beware of old gate locks because I stubbed my toe on all of them today. The cafe was yummy, but expensive...best whip cream I have ever had! The grounds are large and nice to walk the whole place. Lots of people smoking cigarettes :/

Great place to relax. When the weather is nice this garden is a wonderful place to take a stroll. Plenty to see without being overwhelming. Nice chance to see gardens, sculptures, and how the locals while away an afternoon in sport and conversation.
Nice place to visit. Emblematic garden in Paris that is usually a must see. Relatively manicured, which is not my personal favorite, but it's a nice place to walk and wander, easy access.
Peaceful. Very peaceful. Lots of people go there to have lunch and relaxing. The gardens are well groomed and the whole area is clean.

Romantic. Beautiful, very romantic garden, if you have time do a morning jogging here, or just sitting here and watching the delightful flowers.
Many family, kids are relaxing here
Do not miss in Paris
Great place to relax in Paris. The gardens are an oasis in the middle of Paris. Take your time and enjoy it. Make it a picnic take a braguette stuffed with deli meats and a bottle of wine.

Beautiful gardens to walk through. This was a beautiful garden walk in the middle of Paris. There are lots of statues, and well-manicured gardens to walk through. It's a great place to relax in the park, and race boats in the pond.

Enjoy a Parisian Picnic Here, or Just Stroll through the Garden. This beautiful garden in the Sixth Arrondisement offers something for everyone. Want to have a romantic picnic with champagne, cheese, and charcuterie? You can do that here with a blanket on the grass or sitting in one of the many chairs placed throughout the gardens. Have kids with you? There is a fun playground and a marionette theatre. Itching to play tennis or basketball? There are courts. Want to just chill out and stroll through the gardens, looking at statuary and fountains and trees and flowers? You can do that as well.There is a bit of something for everyone here at Jardin du Luxembourg, and it is large enough that it never feels crowded. A nice oasis in the middle of Paris.

Stunning gardens. These gardens seem to go on forever. A great spot to wander through. Beautiful well maintained gardens.Lots of individual chairs ( excellent idea) that can be moved. Lots of people having lunch, reading, soaking up the sun or just having a lunch break. Worth a visit
Beautifully kept gardens surrounding area.. Perfect addition to a morning walk. Well manicured bushes and trees, nicley kept grass and ponds, very relaxing even with crowds. Worth a visit!

Lovely Gardens. Great place to relax. Lots of the metal chairs. Watch the model yachts on the pond. Look at the beautiful flower borders. See the boules and chess players. There was a large choir singing in the bandstand on a Sunday, they were fantastic.

The top rated garden in Paris.. This garden should be one of the top priorities if u r interested in visiting a garden, it's the best Garden I have ever seen till date, u can totally see the French colors while visiting this garden because of the building and structures in the garden.

Great Spot to Relax for an Hour!. My husband and I enjoyed our brief visit within the Luxembourg Gardens! It was a beautiful day ... sunny, hot and humid and we sat at a garden cafe amongst the hornbeam trees enjoying a beer and glass of wine and just "simply" enjoyed an hour in the garden! It's a lovely garden and smaller and easier to navigate compared to the Tuilleries.

Another calming spot in the bustle of Paris. Aspiring captains honing their technique.. Got here late in the afternoon, but the kids and the French sing-alongs were still in full swing. Lovely to watch the kids and their boats, but the singing brought a tear to my eye.

Beautiful. These stunning gardens and the Palace offer a place of calm and tranquility in an ever busy city. The gardens offer something for every age group from the fountains, to the tree lined pathways to the beautiful flowers. A must see when in Paris... great for picnics, sunbathing and people watching!
A neat garden area in the middle of the city. A great spot for a casual stroll. Incredible flower displays and topiaries that are worth carving time out for when you are in Paris.

Beautiful day experiencing the beauty of these gardens. The sky was so blue today and the gardens were just gorgeous. So many people were just enjoying the sun and beauty of this beautiful place in the city today.

Great place to relax on a hot summer day. I had just arrived in Paris on a red eye flight and was trying to stay awake until night time. It was hot, and I wasn't ready to jump into any hard core tourist sites. The Luxembourg Garden was right around the corner from my hotel. What a gift. The garden is part of a palace built in the early 1600's by Marie de' Medici, the widow of King Henry IV of France, and today this is where the French Senate meets. There is a lovely cafe on the grounds with tables shaded by the many trees that line the estate. It proved to be an excellent spot to enjoy a Café au lait and watch the endless parade of locals and guest enjoy a hot summer day.

Wonderful place to grab a seat and relax in the sun. We visited this beautiful garden with takeaway coffee and pastries and had a wonderful hour relaxing in the chairs by the pond and watching the locals on their morning exercise routines

Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful place to have a picinic or to just spend an hour or two away from the city. My husband and I recently enjoyed a picnic at Luxembourg Gardens. The Gardens are beautiful in the late summer/ early springs. The only bummer was that you had to stay off the grass. There are plenty of chairs available to enjoy the gardens, but you will not be sitting on grass. The fountain near the palace was beautiful and very interesting. Make sure you check it out! .

Victim of its fame and success. We have always loved the classy ‘French Garden’ part of the Jardins du Luxembourg with its more than hundred statues (queens, musicians, writers, artists …), its historic Medicis fountain (1624) and the octagonal pond where, on sunny days, you could sit on one of the metal chairs and read with a view on the classical façade of the Palais du Luxembourg. But these days we mostly just cross the beautiful garden on our way to somewhere else because it is completely overrun, especially in summer. But we still visit the regular free exhibitions of large photos affixed to the outside of the wrought iron fence of the garden on Rue de Médicis. At present and until 15 January 2017 there are 80 panels on French cultural heritage protection projects (‘Le Patrimoine, une Passion, des Hommes’). Tourists in search of a jogging round, a playground or flocking to the Jardins to have a picnic on the lawns - which is forbidden, of course - will find better alternatives elsewhere.

Lovely park with play ground and boule courts. We stayed at a hotel close to the Lux gardens and I went out running there every morning - Very nice jogging area but the do not open the gates until 07:30 so if you are earlier you will have to run in circles around it for a while.. Mornings were lovely with only fellow runners, afternoons buzy with lots of children and families. Beautiful trees, perennials and statues - Just go there to have a break from all the crazy traffic and some what overwhelming culture impressions.
Lovely park. The Luxembourg is a lovely park; perfect for an afternoon stroll or simply to relax; conveniently located and accessible in central Paris.
Best Place to sit. We sat there for at least an hour or two people watching. it was a great day...just there with your coffee or tea.

A relaxing place to visit in the middle of bustling Paris. Very serene and peaceful area. The gardens are kept up nicely, with tennis courts and play areas for children. Chairs and benches everywhere invite you to relax and enjoy the beauty.

Beautiful and Relaxing Stroll!. Wish I could live or work nearby here as I envied those who appeared to be having lunch and relaxing in the garden areas. If you like walking the grass and path mall areas of Washington DC, you will LOVE this garden and fountain area and easily see how DC was laid out similarly by the Frenchman who designed it. The Louvre at one end heading toward the Arc.

Beautiful Gardens, fantastic Playground. Well worth a visit, my almost 2 year old loved the pathways, the lake, the trees. Felt safe here and he would happily run around. They have a fantastic playground for all ages. You pay a small fee but it has 1 entry and 1 exit point, clean toilets and totally safe. Magnificent setting in a beautiful city.

Great place to stay!. We rested a bit here and I can say it's a good place to just stay and relax! We sat, took some pictures and had loads of fun here. The place is big so even if there's a bit of a crowd, there will be some places where only a few would be seen. definitely one of the places I loved in Paris

Literally accidentally stumbled on the location and it was worth it. While Versailles has gorgeous fountains and nice topiaries, when it comes to flowers, Luxembourg has it beat. I was roaming the neighborhood, saw a statue behind a fence and wondered, "What's in there?" so I strolled in and was taken with the gorgeous flowers, highly walkable gardens, and many garden "rooms" where you could sit and pretend you were a local enjoying the park, like the locals do. There's also a fitness park at the one end if you keep walking all the way through, so you can do your pull-ups surrounded by gorgeous statues and flowers.

Paris out to play. Wrote a poem to sum it up, title as above.....Distant timbre of big band musicA hubbub of laughter and gleeScratching rhythms of jogging treadsSix chimes turn heads to the NorthPalace gold, iridescent watches, caresses While wind whispers on water in sailsCaring eyes sweeping faces to shareHand holding and touch of warm sunshineA rainbow soft colours lights cloudsLuxembourg coalesces smiling free spiritsAs Paris comes out to play.Came here 3 times in 4 days, but also jogged through the park twice. Brilliant!

A quiet garden in the city center. The gardens were beautifully maintained, with flowers and water features that transported the visitor to a calm place amid the busy city. There were chairs and benches tucked in both shade and sun that beckoned one to sit and simply "be" if only briefly.

Beautiful for a stroll. If nearby it's worth a stroll through this park. The park is beautifully planned with its vast rows of trees. The flowers were blooming still at the end of September. It was very beautiful.

a place to enjoy ... over and over again. it is easy to spend a day in these huge gardens .. elegant and well caredAway from the bustle of Paris shoppers you can see Parisians enjoying their gardens. Weekend Jazz is worth expiriencing..

Relaxing . Pack a picnic, lie on the grass in the sun & enjoy a beautiful day at these lovely gardens. Gets busy in summer peak season but kind of a must do if you have some down time in Paris. Great for people watching or to generally just chill out.

Very interesting gardens. These gardens were very pleasing on the eyes with lots of statues and beds of flowers. It was nice to watch the locals playing boules or grab a drink in a cafe. Also managed to see a number of Ring-necked parakeets flying through the trees.
Beautiful!. The gardens are beautiful and definitely worth a visit. Landscaping is amazing and so many beautiful flowers.

Beautiful. This is one of the former palace gardens, and it's spectacular. It's hard to imagine a place this big and beautiful being kept for only a few people. It's a great place to enjoy the flowers, and to watch people as well. There are many places to sit and relax, and wonderful fountains and wooded areas. There are even pony rides for the kids!

Sunday in the Park with George...or anybody you want!!. We have rented an apartment to be able to stay longer in Paris, so we re here for one month. This afforded us the opportunity to just relax and enjoy spending time in the gardens/park on Sunday. We felt as if we were one of the lucky Parisian's who live here. There were toy sail boats..which we sailed, sandwiches, which we ate, and people and children to enjoy watching. Sitting in the sun looking at the Luxembourg Palace was shear joy!

Nice stroll . Nice afternoon stroll through the gardens.A place where families and Parisienne hang out,play board games, read,suntan,sail little toy-boats and just enjoy the day.Gardens are very well kept and taken care off.

Unbelievable!. We took a walking tour of the St. Michel/St. Germaine area. These gardens are a must. You can sit outside and bring a picnic filled with sandwiches, wine, macaroons and share great conversation. Even if alone, the gardens are spectacular. Our guide mentioned that the groundkeepers change the flowers every month. So I guess a visit every month is needed!

A pleasant afternoon relaxation. The gardens are very popular among locals and tourists. They offer a nice relaxing atmosphere in the midst of the bustling city. You can sit in the shade or the sun of comfortable metal chairs and enjoy Nature and man-made attractions.

Great place to watch the world go by. We came here between a visit to the Catacombs and returning to nearer our hotel for dinner, stopping in for a half hour sit down in the sun. The gardens are beautiful, and we managed to grab a few chairs around the fountain to watch the world go by. With more time, it would have been lovely to pack a picnic and sit on the grass, but we were only passing through. Definitely well worth a trip and walk around though if you're south of the river and the weather is good.
beautiful and spacious garden at the heart of Paris. beautiful and spacious garden at the heart of Paris. don't expect high-class gardening but rather a nice big green place to relax.

Beautiful garden.... You can spend whole day at the park e.g reading, chit chatting with friends, enjoy the sun etc. This garden is huge and beautiful. Located at the central of the city,walkable from Norte Dome. Don't miss if you visit Paris, worth to visit.

A highlight of the left bank. I cannot recommend these gardens any higher: Beautiful, elegant, pristine, green, well taken care of. On a sunny day Parisians spend all afternoon hanging out here on the chairs, sailing a toy boat on the pond, having a picnic or an ice cream. The palace is nearby and often has wonderful art exhibitions (recently the Masters of Budapest). Walk around, relax, enjoy the flowers, and don't miss the small Statue of Liberty!

Lovely place to relax in the heart of Paris. We spent a relaxing hour or so in the gardens on our trip to Paris. It was great to take a break from sightseeing and watch the toys boats on the pond or sit near the impressive fountains.It's the first time I've seen a public park with portable single seats that you can move where you want. How very civilised!
Fabulous. Delightful gardens in which to stroll, sit and people watch. Flowers abound! Fountains, pond for children pushing around little sail boats. Humanistic gardens unlike Versailles
Most Beautiful Garden. Right there in the city. Beautiful. Amazing flowers and walkways. Free, lay on the grass and take a nap on a sunny day--where allowed. Went back twice.

A highlight of our trip, lunch in these gardens. We walked to Luxembourg Gardens after finishing a visit to Notre Dame. We picked up lunch from Pasta Luna (AMAZING!) and sat down to enjoy the gardens. It is so tranquil, beautiful, and amazing. There is plenty of room to spread out and sit on benches or chairs. We relaxed, ate, and then strolled through the rest of the gardens. Between the Boccie courts, playgrounds, and gardens there really is something for everyone. On a beautiful afternoon, there is no place I would rather be in Paris!
Beautiful. Nice with amazing flowers. The statues and flowers are mixed and in a kingdom shape. Nice and clean and beautiful,

GREAT PLACE FOR ALONG STROLL.. We did a long walk through the beautiful gardens. We enjoyed seeing the fountain Marie de Medici for whom the surrounding gardens were created. Tourists of all nations were on display along with some impressive statues. We helped a Japanese entourage take their group photo.

Relaxing and great kiosk lunch. Walked to these wonderful gardens and had fantastic food from the kiosk in the gardens. Bought two great filled baguettes and stunning Tarte au Citron. Sat in a green oasis to eat our lunch and then walked up and watched the pétanque games, walked around the gardens and just enjoyed Paris as the Parisians do every day.

Speed chess in the park.. A beautiful green space in the middle of Paris - full of history, quiet and restorative. Look for the speed chess tables - so interesting to watch - we just walked through - but I would have been happy staying for hours. A delightful Paris experience.

Beautiful . Always worth stopping by whatever the season or weather. Beautiful park in the centre of Paris. Lots of seats to stop for an hour to watch the world go by. When the park closes you get to see the wardens whistling every body out!

Lovely and Enchanting. We strolled through the picturesque gardens, enjoying the seasonal display (we were there in October). The sky was gloomy and overcast, which made the gardens that much more appealing. Sparks of color in a grey world.

Perfect for a Stroll. The Luxembourg Gardens are perfect for a stroll on any beautiful day. The flowers and setting couldn't be nicer almost any time of year. It's no wonder you'll almost always see people just sitting and reading books and sunning and soaking it all in. It's also a great place for people watching.

A peaceful well laid out and resourced park. Although the 2nd House of the French parliament is situated at the north end coming with its inherent security, these gardens are a heavenly retreat, not far from the centre of the city. With well laid out borders of flowers, and plenty of trees with benches providing welcome shade from the summer sun, there are also tennis courts.
Beautiful and relaxing. Beautiful parc/garden and it would also be nice to bring your lunch and relax there for some moments...
Just Beautiful . Loved the gardens and surrounding area. It was a real pleasant place to be on a warm day. Parisians live this park and I enjoyed being with them. Would love to go again.

Relaxing picnic place. We visited the gardens in early afternoon. The ambiance was great. A lot of children playing around, people relaxing on the grass or near the pond in the middle. Very good place for a picnic. If you have time, you should visit the gardens.
A beautiful and relaxing place!. What a beautiful garden to sit and enjoy! People watching, sharing a picnic, or just strolling about - this is a lovely spot to enjoy Paris.

An oasis in heart of the city. An amazing green space in the heart of the city. Not as visited as the Tuileries or the Versailles gardens, the Luxembourg Gardens will not disappoint you if you are looking for time far from the city's noise. Particularly pleasant in spring or fall, sports fans can bring their jogging gear and join the groups of joggers that tour the Jardins. On a lazier note one can grab a croissant from across the street and simply enjoy the snack next to the water fountain.

Beautiful! Do not miss the Medici fountain. This is a lovely, large park. We had a wonderful rest break at the Medici fountain and then we strolled the walkways. The whole park is great for people watching. You can grab a bite at the cafe in the park. There is a cost to use the restrooms.

Always worth a visit! . This was my second trip to Paris and I came back to the Luxembourg Gardens. I've been totally blessed with the weather and it's full of palm trees, very peaceful, tranquil and a relaxing place. Both to take a seat or a gentle stroll.

Beware the Grass Gestapo. We love to explore gardens around the world and these gardens did not disappoint. Crowded along the main promenade grass area, less so further along in the gardens, but the reason no one sits on the grass in these areas is because the uniformed park staff shoo you off----rather rudely in our case----if you set foot on the grass in those areas. We obviously missed the signage, but would have appreciated a more civil discussion to redirect us to the main promenade grass area where everyone else was sitting. There are park benches in the quiet area where you can sit, but not ideal if you plan to picnic, throw down a blanket and take in the sun. For that you have to use the main promenade grass area.

Nice on a Sunday Afternoon. These Gardens are far nicer than the Tuilleries and appear to have more locals than tourists. We were there on a cloudy Sunday afternoon. After picking up some lunch, we watched people playing tennis, chess, children on pony rides, kids with their sail boats in the fountain, and other activities. Great way to chill out for a few hours after days of museum hoping.

Nice garden but I expected more flowers. Nice garden but I expected more flowers. During sunny day it was very nice and romantik garden and people all ages some to take a rest there or ate their lunch.

Stunning Reprieve in the middle of Paris!. I love to stroll through the gardens and enjoy the fountains, the gardens, the stone paths that have been carved out of nature and the beautiful flowers and trees that line the paths. Its a gem in the center of a bustling city and worth the time to go relax in nature and enjoy some quiet beauty.

Relaxing Luxembourg. No better place to relax in Paris than the Gardens. Whether you want to read a book,soak up a few rays,match the children sail the boats or take a nap, this is the place. Shade trees and flowers abound.usual an art exhibitor or two can be found. The palace is also lovely. A little history, the Luxembourg Palace was the headquarters of the Luftwaffe during WWII.

Beautiful Garden. This was an impressive garden. I liked this garden more than the one in front of the Lourve. Lots of grassy lawns, a beautifully kept fountain, lots of colorful flowers, and manicured trees. Relaxing place to spend a few hours staring at the beautiful building in front of you. That was a view!!!I could sit here all day admiring it all in. But there's so much to see in Paris.

Gardens of magic in Paris!. Spent a wonderful morning in the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens.The children hired a little boat to sail around the lake, a magical experience - and only 3 euros! We then went to see the Statue of Liberty, and came upon a play park. This was fantastic - it had an entrance fee but we stayed for about two hours. Suitable for toddlers and older children (my children ages 2, 6, 8).The beauty of the gardens on a hot, summer's day is just magical.My favourite place in Paris!

An oasis of calm in a busy city. Parisians and tourists alike flock to this excellent park to walk, run, have lunch, play pétanque, bring the kids to the playground or to ride ponies, sail their boats in the pond, etc, etc.I can't imagine a visit to Paris without a ew hours spent in this lovely setting.
Always a favorite. This relaxed well cared for park with its view of the Eiffel Tower and lovely ponds, trees and flower beds, is a great place to people watch and rest after sightseeing.
Place for a picnic. This is a little out of the way, but it's worth it. The gardens are beautiful. We had a picnic and there was a band playing in the gazebo. So utterly Parisian.

Beautiful garden to relax at. This is still one of my favorite places to stroll through. The gardens are a great place to people watch at. I wouldn't eat at the cafe as it is very pricey and the food was not that good.
Beautiful Serene Garden!. We were walking around the garden before we visit the Pantheon. The garden is a great place to sit down on bench and reflects the beautiful moment in life!

Restored by their beauty. I was tired, hot and hungry. I came across a remote entry and found myself inside the Luxembourg gardens. Peaceful, historic, rustic and grand all at once. They provide respite for the body and inspiration for the soul.

Beautiful is an understatement. This was our 2nd time to Paris and 2nd time to these gardens and they were just as beautiful as we remembered. And this time there was an orchestra in the park on a Saturday, what a treat!!

Great park, my first time. Past times in Paris I never been to this place and I can say it is wonderful. I was lucky to be there while the weather was warm and sunny so a lot of people. The gardens are very well kept.

Really nice place to go!. The garden is a magic place and has a quite relaxing atmosphere. It's very easy to get there and the place is well connected with metro and buses. When I was there, I nice exhibit on fruits (apples, pears and lemons) was taking place. The place is for all ages and I strongly recommend.

Simply beautiful. This is a beautiful spot. We came here with some sandwiches and sat by the fountain on the metal chairs provided around the edge. I thought this was a great touch which meant we could properly enjoy this beautiful gardens.The palace was exquisite and the setting was perfectly maintained. Well worth a visit and in a great location relative to Luxembourg metro station.
Absolutely stunning!. Came here one afternoon and brought a box of macarons and a book. I highly suggest everyone do this and just people watch and enjoy the French culture.

Nice park close to other attractions. Being in Paris, if the weather is good you can't skip this park (gardens). Lots of people doing physical activity in there, its a nice place for some pictures. Les Jardin du Luxembourg is also a nice place to have a seat and relax if you want to take a break during you walk around the city

Beautiful park!. This is the place to visit if you want to relax in a beautiful park. This place has a lot to see, beautiful flowers, sculptures, pavilions, people and it's few steps from the pantheon of Paris.

Beautiful gardens. This park is a great place to spend some quiet time. We took our two kids on a Sunday morning and people were enjoying walks, runs and reading books. There is a play park but you have to pay entry. There is pony riding for the kids too.We didn't go into the palace but didn't feel we needed to. The park has so much to offer.

Don't Miss the Orangerie. Beautiful formal garden, even at the end of September. If you're a gardener, don't miss the Orangerie. Great espalier and citrus display. Spend 2 hours at least.
There are armed guards around the building so don't be shocked like I was.

A Relaxing & Historical Space!. We spent about 2 hours walking the gardens. Each area is beautiful and there are plenty of places to stop, sit, and soak in the beautiful landscaping. Also one of the places you can see the stamps of the Prime Meridian through the grounds. Plenty of locals come to the gardens during the day for the tennis courts as well as a place to eat their lunch, and you can do the same! Don't miss the small Statue of Liberty!

beautiful respite. this is a lovely peaceful place to recharge your batteries after sightseeing around Paris the gardens are absolutely gorgeous many activities available ,horse rides, boule, tennis or just find a quiet spot and sit with a book.

Pleasant and peaceful. We found Luxembourg Gardens to be less hectic as some of the big gardens on the far side of the Seine. It is between the Pantheon and Invalides so is a nice place to stop for a rest or lunch while our sightseeing.

Nice oasis in the city. We stopped by the Gardens yesterday - you enter the gate and this beautiful world opens up. This is definitely a place to check out - it is a large space in the middle of the city.
Luxembourg gardens . Steps away from my hotel was gorgeous and completely Parisian in lifestyle--Luxembourg Gardens! I missed it last time but am very glad I took the time to see all its splendor!
I love wondering around. And finding the statues of the queens of France. It's fun for picnics, people watching and if you look hard enough you will find the Statue of Liberty lurking in a bush
beautiful. There is no charge to enter the grounds. many read, get sun, picnic in these large gardens. They sell food also.

Lovely area to relax in. We got some lunch and just sat in the gardens admiring the flowers and people watched. So wonderful to have such a beautiful space in a city filled with smog, pollution and smokers

Green escape to rejuvenate. Pull a chair up beside the herbaceous gardens, and imagine days gone by. We picked up some gourmet fare at a local bakery and then strolled past the fountains, ponds and statues before heading back out into the tourist fray.
a place to escape from the crowd. A beautiful park in the middle of city. Nice for afternoon walk or morning jog. Visited last December 2014.

Large and bustling and quiet.. This was a low-key vacation, and gardens played a big part. Luxembourg is in the middle of the city, and features various activities, probably the best of which is people watching. Bring your picnic lunch, find a secluded spot, and take a breather between museums.
Big garden. Nice place to have a picnic. Wish there was more shade. It was really hot the day we went. Also recommend wearing shoes not sandals.

Beauty in the city. Really beautiful place to come and get away from the busy streets of paris, It's very near the notre dame so easy to find and get to. Come here to take 30 minutes of peace and relaxation before you go back out onto the bustling streets.

Peaceful Stroll. This is a charming stretch of green space south of the Church of Sainte Sulpice by a couple of blocks. We went on a Friday afternoon and were amazed how many people could be in the gardens and yet not feeling crowded. The accent garden beds are beautiful and meticulously maintained in the summer and on weekends you might find young children sailing boats in the huge pond.

A sunny walk in Les Jardins du Luxembourg. We strolled from the Observatoire past the spectacular fountain into the gardens joining Parisians relaxing in their lunchtime under the horse chestnut trees. After pausing for a spot of nostalgia at the boating pond, savouring the perfume of the still colourful flowers, we admired the architecture of the Palais, drank a tisane at an elegant outdoor cafe and exited near the Sorbonne. We returned to our starting point along the outside wall of the gardens which exhibited at least a dozen scenes of regional French life. After trying and failing to guess me where Hemiingway had lived in the twenties, we had only one real regret and that was that we forgotten our camera. It was a few hours well spent and the walk cost nothing.

Always beautiful . Stunning gardens. Great place to relax. The museum always has an exhibit although it is a small museum. The outside gates always feature a photography exhibit it is very pleasant to walk by and see the images.

A piece of heaven in the urban jungle. The Luxembourg Gardens might be the most peaceful gardens in Paris with wide allees, magnificient trees, numerous statues and fontains. It is well known for families who come here to relax in full nature next to the Luxembourg Palace housing the French Senate.

Beautiful afternoon . Stroll through the gardens on a beautiful fall afternoon. Could ask for nothing more satisfying. People everywhere enjoying the afternoon. Flowers and a natural park setting in the middle of Paris.
Nice Garden. Nice garden in the middle of Paris, good place to stop and rest before continuing your visit of Paris.
Relaxing. In the middle of the historic Paris, a very good relaxing garden where you can sit, relax or walk, jog whatever you want. Believe me not much to say, pictures speak for itself

My kids' favorite place. My kids loved this place. We rented the wooden boats to sail on the little lake, went on a pony ride, played on the swings and in the playground. Be forewarned, that all cost a few euro. Bring cash.
Great place to eat sandwiches. Great place to visit on a nice day huge hedges and beautiful pond lots of statues of Rienns etc beautiful buildings

A Must See. Walking distance from Notre Dame. Easy access and no charge for the most beautiful park in Paris. Live music, plenty of benches and chairs, concessions and toilettes (50 cents), and endless sights. A great place to literally step into a relaxing zone away from the city bustle.
Serenity. The Luxembourg gardens make you feel as if you're a part of the Belle Epoch. It's stunning and beautifully manicured gardens are a must see.

Formal gardens. The gardens are laid out formally, with lawns and floral borders. My preference is for a rather more wilderness look, but if you like formal gardens, these are nice. It's a pleasant enough place for a relaxing walk away from the city bustle.

Great vibes . Went for a short stroll through the gardens today. Was pleasently surprised to find a full brass band performing in the rotunda. The music could be heard throughout the gardens and made for a great atmosphere.
Very clean and well set out.

Fabulous place to sit and enjoy. This is a very well used community area that looks like it belongs in a picture. There are people sitting, painting, playing on carousels, tennis, live music and even special garden areas between the numerous statues placed around the park. I was particularly interested in vegetable and fruit gardens where they have live examples of how the horticulture is done in France

So Pretty. Ah to get lost in Paris is the most Parisian thing to do no. To get lost in the mammoth of Luxembourg Garden is as good as getting lost could get. Beautiful at every corner, it's a great space to do people watching, a rather famous Parisian thing to do if I'm not wrong. There are runners, kids, book readers, tourists, locals, a little bit of every kind and age of people here. The garden is huge and a walk around the whole spot would be good exercise. I loved taking my book and lunch here and just finding a spot to chill in alone for a few hours. There's beautiful statues, planters, trees and trimmings inside. There's also a museum inside, unfortunately I don't know anything about it and didn't feel like exploring either.

More hype than it actually delivers. Although I don't feel like I wasted half a day visiting this garden (more of an imperial garden), I also wouldn't have taken the time to visit if I would've known it was just a large fountain surrounded by trees and grass. I would've liked to gone shopping in the Sacre Cour neighborhood. I recommend this garden ONLY if you're in the last two day of your Parisian vacation, are exhausted (i.e. no more walking), and would benefit from a picnic (wine, bread and cheese) surrounded by grass, trees and people taking strolls through the park. Otherwise, enjoy a two hour picnic at the Jardin de Tuileries so you can quickly walk over to the Musee d'Orsay to enjoy the largest collection of impressionist and post-Impressionist masterpieces in the world.

Relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. Popular with Parisians and visitors to the city, Luxembourg Gardens is the perfect place to relax and do a spot of people watching. We were there in Autumn and thought that the gardens were beautiful even though it was a cloudy day. Our time in the gardens was limited, we didn't know what the opening hours were and arrived late in the afternoon and about an hour after arriving we were herded out the gates.
Charming place in the heart of Paris. A wonderful place to visit if you want to take a moment and relax while enjoying the magic of the city.

Lovely place to hang out. Our AirBnB was right next to this park so we used it as a shortcut every day on our city explorations. Every time I went through (15 times?), I found something new, different and amazingly lovely.
Lovely place. Peaceful to walk through colours of the flowers, well kept and many spots to sit and just relax beautiful landscape garden, nice place

Great place to just wander. Before you go, I would recommend printing out a map of the Garden. It's easy to get lost. And if you do, that's okay too. I just like to know where I'm going so I can see everything I came for. There are numerous statues that are absolutely amazing. Personally, I have an attraction to Lady Liberty. She is here on a much smaller scale and every time I've gone, I've never had to wait to get a picture. In the spring and summer the garden is worth the time it'll take to travel around it. And if you're a fitness traveler, this garden is one of the best for jogging. There is always something going on and something to see. From the bee apiary to the statues to the manicured trees and shrubs there is so much to enjoy. They even have a playground for kids. It looked pretty cool, enough that I wanted to go play on it too. There is something for everyone here. You won't be disappointed.
Gorgeous Place to Run. Beautiful gardens. Stayed near here the week before my sister in law and I ran the Disneyland Paris Half Marathon. Awesome place to run!!
Relaxing . No matter what time of day you attend the perfect place to sit, talk with friends or just take in the beautiful views

Nature's gem. Although this was not our first visit to Paris, it was our first time seeing the Gardens. What a lovely area, with a variety of flowers and the opportunity to watch children sailing boats on the pond. A must see for everyone who visits the city.

Worth a visit. Quite stroll in the park any day of the week. Beautiful gardens and fountains. Not sure if they are there everyday but when we visited there was a live band playing the most beautiful music , very appropie for the location. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city this place is really worth visiting and it's free.

Imagine being a child in the Gardens. Imagine growing up, sailing your toy ship in the Luxembourg Gardens fountains. A serene place to sit and read a book or people watch, the Gardens are an oasis from concrete and cars. Force yourself to sit and just be. You'll never forget the Gardens

Lovely Sunday afternoon respite. After many hours of walking the streets of Paris, Luxembourg Gardens is a wonderful place to sit and relax. It offers beautiful surroundings including immaculate lawns and gardens and comfortable chairs on which to rest after a long day of sightseeing. Bring a book, a picnic or nothing at all. But be sure to see this lovely oasis.
Quick stop. Was a really good place to have a sit down and chill out. Grab a green chair and sunbathe. Lovely gardens and well maintained.
Great place to relax and people watch. We decided last minute to visit the Jardin de Luxembourg and were glad we did. The scenery is fantastic and the people watching second to none.
Great Park for the children. There is a Great Park in here for little kids but you will need to pay a small admission charge to play in the park

Quick Walk Through. Walked through with my wife and grandmas on our way from the Pantheon to the Louvre. We weren't expecting anything more than some gardens and a view of the palace, and were impressed by how well the grounds were maintained. The color scheme of the plants matched the surrounding buildings well. Lots of chairs to sit and take a break, toilets, and there was plenty to see if you wanted to take longer; we spent about 15 minutes and it was lovely. Overall, if you're nearby, you should stop on in. It won't be a waste of time.

Beaitful!. I could spend all day here. I felt like I was a princess in my garden. It is nice to take a break and picnic there or even have a book to read. I spent hours there just enjoying the beauty of this place.
Gorgeous park. Excellent place to have a picnic and people watching. We bought some food and had a picnic there with beer. Nice to relax after a long walk in the city. It's near the Pantheon.

Beautiful, relaxing gardens. We spent a couple of hours strolling through the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens, only a short walk away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Plenty of seating available to relax and watch families around the lake and admire the view. Our visit coincided with Gregory Pol's wildlife exhibition in the Orangerie which was superb. This topped off a gorgeous day in a magical park.
Just Beautiful. Great way to relax, people watch and reconnect amongst the beauty of the gardens. Pack a picnic and enjoy! A MUST!

Great place for a wonder but can't believe they charge for using the playground. This is a wonderful park to visit with kids and just hang out. We took our picnic lunch here and sat by the lake watching the miniature boats being sailed by children. We then spotted a playground and were very disappointed they charged children to visit it. I have never encountered such a thing for a normal playground. We then left - much to our children's disappointment.

My favorite park in Paris. Very peaceful city park. Surrounded by a lively part of Paris, this is a place used many Parisians to escape a busy day, people watch, eat lunch, soak up some sun, play with their children, etc. I love visiting this spot and pretending I'm Parisian.

Big park for relaxation. The garden is very large hence offers many Places to relax. The weather wasnt the best when we were there, but we would defnitely spend more time in the park if the weather was more suitable

Oasis in the heart of the city. Best in fine weather but also fun when it's raining and you have an umbrella. We love strolling around this lovely park in the heart of the city, visit the Palais and the Medici fountain as well as the ponds where people enjoy sailing their model boats. If sunny, we take a while and sit down on one of the chairs near the Palais and relax (maybe with coffee-to-go and some Macarons). Recommended for everyone incl. Parent-accompanied children and people with walking disability. Dogs only on leash. And please do not litter. All in all - go there and enjoy!
impeccably well kept. So pretty, enjoyed bring a lunch here and people watching. The flower arrangements are perfection, there are pony rides for children.

A beautiful park . We had been walking so much, it was nice to take a breather here. Beautiful gardens, nice views, perfect for people watching or stopping for a snack, there are cafes and restaurants inside the gardens, so head over and enjoy!

Great for relaxing or a run. My husband went for a run, while I read my book by the fountain. A lot of people head there in the morning to do yoga or tai chi under the trees or their daily run. It's a must see place.

Pure delight. What's not to like? Awaiting our evening Bistrot reservation in the Quartier Latin, we enjoyed 2 delightful hours in this beautiful and historic garden space. Flowers were in full-bloom and the Jardin was bustling on a sunny September late afternoon. This Paris experience should not be missed. Thumbs up!

Quick Visit. We had a quick visit here in the hour before we checked out. It was pretty quiet with some people playing tennis, and others running in groups. Would have liked to have spent more time here, and would return.

A delightful escape from the city!. These beautiful gardens probably wouldn't be top of my must-visit list if I only had a few days in Paris but as we were here for 8 nights we had time to discover this oasis of calm in the city. It was a hot day so enjoying a shady wander through the wooded area was a bonus! Beautifully planted, lots of seating, a lake, cafe and toilets. We loved it!
Good place. Its good t see this place, if the weather is good but if weater is not suitable then fun element will not come

Spacious, relaxing. Lots of variety of terrain and views. The Medici Fountain was beautiful. I love the fact that so many chairs are just there for you to use as you like. Back home they'd all be chained down!

Relaxing time surrounded by nature. Paris can feel quite hectic at times (as any city of this size, I guess), so it's nice to be able to go to a place surrounded by greenery and flowers, and where one can truly relax. The Luxembourg Gardens certainly tick that box!

A quiet place to enjoy nature. Jardin de Luxembourg is a vast beauty spot in the middle of Paris. Walk through leafy green boulevards and enjoy the colorful flowers on manicured lawns. There are benches lining the walkways and it is a clean, green place to rejuvenate yourself.

My local "running track" in Paris. Great park for running, good distance doing two laps. Stupendous setting for running. OK in early morning but gets busy later in the day. Also a good place to read a book when it is fine to chill out or fill in some time.

Beautiful gardens !. Second visit to Luxembourg gardens , stunning setting and beautiful flowers. Well maintained , a lovely place to relax in the sun and read a book , or wander and look at the garden and lake. Good for families, young children and older people . Little boats are raced in the lake . Plenty of places to sit and admire the view.
Beautiful gardens!. What a delight wandering through these gardens. Planted with varying colours of pink..dahlias, begonias, cosmos. Seating everywhere..a beautiful place to spend some time.

Very nice place to relax. The Garden is very big and full of statues and trees. The garden also has some tennis courts, some restaurants and kiosks and an area for kids. In the middle of the Garden is a fountain and the Castle. A must visit when in Paris, you would not regret it.

Top notch!. Wow! what a lovely surprise! this park is stunning! beautifully tended flowers and lawns surrounded by forests trees . There is also a small man-made pond where kids can push around little boats. We really enjoyed our visit there and were saddened that we couldn't stay longer.

Overrated & Skippable. I don't understand why this park is so highly rated. Its design is very simple. It's just a large park full of repetitive patterns: many straight lines of the same trees, several boring statues similar to each other, dusty paths without any decoration etc. It's just like any ordinary park in the West. Don't shove it into your tight schedule. It's not worth it. If you really want to have a look at it, it's better to visit it in the evening when other attractions are closed.
Picturesque. Charming & picturesque gardens that you can stroll through and look at the beautiful gardens, ponds & scenery.

Go search for the Bee Hives in the South east Corner. Just a lovely release from the bustle, even on the hottest day. Little cafes, beautiful gardens, lovers and friends, locals walking, jogging lunching chatting. Kids playing, little pony rides...a little bit of real Paris. Very very tranquil in the corners , lovely views to the Palace du Luxembourg itself... well worth the walk up from the river but on the metro and bus routes. We've been going to Paris for many years and its still a favourite picnic venue with a bottle of champagne. In the south east corner there is a fully functional array of Bee Hives ..with the bees not interested inn your lunch in the slightest, but gently working their way through the miles if scented flower beds.
nice place for a lazy wander on a hot day. A really attractive park at the heart of the Latin Quarter, with enchanting cafes. I try to go every time I am in Paris

Nice area to have a picnic or just walk around. This was the first place we went because we were staying near the area. The grounds are beautiful and it was an enjoyable place to walk around. If you are only in Paris for a few days I would probably skip it but definitely visit if you have a longer vacation.
Spectacular. Beautiful manicured gardens filled with statues,fountains and glorious colourful garden beds in the centre of Paris
Worth a Look . Lovely & peaceful gardens close to our accommodation. Themed (pink) gardens when we visited. Plenty of chairs to sit & watch the world go by.
A nice place to relax after a morning stroll. Lovely park, with green lush grass and shady trees. You are masked from the noise of the big city around you - the perfect place to relax with a book.
Beautiful. These gardens are in perfect condition with grass that only the pigeons can walk on. A very pleasant park in the urban centre not regularly visited by tourists.

Amazing.... These were the best gardens that we saw in Paris; they completely blew everything else away. The grass was perfect and pristine and there were benches and chairs for you to relax and just enjoy life. It was absolutely picturesque.
Lovely walk. We found a couple chairs to enjoy our take-out lunch. Lovely day in the park! Beautiful gardens. Central location.
Beautiful. These gardens never cease to amaze. This year there are huge pots of dark pink hydrangeas. Stunning!

A relaxing, free day in the gardens. With nothing planned for the day (ie catching up with friends), we chose to pack baguette sandwiches, fruit, water & catch the metro to the Luxembourg Gardens. First week of Autumn, still plenty of people around, a hot 30+C day & lots of shade under the many trees.Flowers in bloom, water features & statues grab the attention. A beautiful environment with no entry fee.Next time we would take a light tablecloth or picnic rug to spread out on the pelouse to rest our sun & heat weary bodies, only where it is permittable to walk on the lawn areas. Some people could not read the signs, or chose not to, and were requested by a local council law enforcer to please move off.Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful. Was absolutely lovely to see all the families and people out walking the paths, kids sailing tiny boats in the huge water feature in the square! It was so beautiful I did not want to leave and actually went back several times!

A beautiful respite. This is a great place to go to get a sense of Paris before martial law was imposed in the wake of terrorist attacks. It is the city laid back and relaxed. Catherine de Medici knew what she was doing when she built this place.

Great break from the Big City. we were travelling by foot from the river towards the Paris Catacombs when we detoured thru the Luxembourg Gardens. It was a great place to escape for a few moments and enjoy the people relaxing, talking and generally being a peace with nature.

Lovely gardens. Peaceful to walk through as you take in the colours of the flowers, well kept and many spots to sit and just relax before moving onto the next museum etc.Interesting to see how many locals take their lunch and eat out in the open

wide open space. beautiful landscape garden, nice place to unwind with comfortable benches & chairs to sit & relax. it was pack with people even on a Monday afternoon. relatively safe, grab a cup of yogurt outside the park next to the Luxembourg metro and have a bite while people watching.
A nice walk. Its very pretty and lots of people walking around, reading, or just relaxing. Be sure not to miss it.

Calm. A peaceful place for a lunch with some friends, with lovers, people reading and children playing. This jardin in the middle of this concret jungle is a good break with the only intention to call you down and to just say: " take your time and enjoy"
Beautiful gardens!. Really liked walking through the gardens. Took sooo many pictures. We were there on a rainy day and is was still beautiful without the sunshine. You should visit this one.

Tranquil Haven in the city. Pull up a chair in the park beside one of the green areas and enjoy an al fresco lunch with the Parisiennes. Wander the grounds and gaze upon the wonderful palace, and the Medici fountain - a lovely shaded area to rest from the heat of the sun and listen to the sound of the water. The Orangery is closed for refurbishment just now. The Fountain dedicated to Delacroix needs a bit of love, but overall the park is a wonderful relaxing day out if you in Paris for a week or more. If you're on a whirlwind Museum quest you might skip this, and miss just "being still in Paris". free to enter the park. Coffee bars / restaurants in the park - if a little expensive, Gaze upon the tree lined avenues once painted by Vincent van Gogh and Edgar Degas. Lovely.
Picnic under the Horse Chestnut Trees. But don't place the chairs on the grass! Wonderful spot on the left bank for a picic (with wine) and people watching.

Beautiful . We walked all around the gardens and although it is Autumn now there are still many flowers out. It was all very pretty and well maintained. It was nice to sit and watch the world go by and relax and take the beauty in.

Beautifl. Beautiful Gardens. Be sure to pick up sandwiches or food for a picnic. There are many chairs and you can watch several events while you eat your lunch. This is close to a great district, the Montparnasse.

Stunning Gardens. This place wasn't on our to do list but we was in the area so popped in.The gardens are gorgeous and the atmosphere is so relaxed and friendly,people just sunbathing and watching the world go by,My kind of place.
Beautiful French gardens. The French are known for their gardens and this is a great example of why. These gardens are beuatiful and amazing to look at.

LOVED these gorgeous gardens- great "playground" for kids!. We stumbled on Luxembourg Gardens as it was close to our hotel & one evening we decided to visit. It's truly gorgeous-- with perfectly manicured grounds, but what I loved most was exploring the "pockets" of cool spots all around the main gardens. There's a great "playground" where you pay, I believe, 1 Euro & there's endless fun for children, plus a restroom, snacks & it's enclosed so you feel safe while your kids zip around. There are picture-perfect tunnels of trees, all sorts of benches where you can sit, read, relax. There's a pond where you can check out fish & ducks but most of all, it's just a beautiful spot to unwind in urban Paris.

A beautiful retreat in the center of Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are a lovely place to go and enjoy, especially on sunny days. They are split into two thematic areas - one resembling a French type garden, with the manicured lawns and fountains, and the other being an English type garden, with a multitude of trees and lots of lush greenery. There are more than a hundred sculptures scattered throughout the gardens, so art fans will have lots to look at. But those who are not art fans can simply grab one of those metal chairs and relax after an exhausting walk.

amazing flowers and shrubbery!. And of course the palace sets it all off. It's a great place to take a sandwich and sit in the shade. But we elected to walk around a while and have a light lunch at a cafe just outside the gates. A nice afternoon.

Calm and Peaceful. We went to gardens after an intense visit to Rodin's Museum. We were tires and hungry and just a little abandoned by the cultural bombardment at the museum.We grabbed sandwiches, beer and snacks. Sit down at some chairs and rest physically and spiritually. Gardens are the perfect place.

Sunny visit! . Got an ice cream and spent some time relaxing in the beautiful gardens. The seats around the pond are a lovely, picturesque place to people watch! Close to metro stop and also to many restaurants, ice cream stalls/shops and cafes.

Beautiful. Perfect place to stroll around in the afternoon. Bring a picnic and a book and soak up the atmosphere. The thing we loved the most was how social it was - so many things going on. Children swimming and making sand castles, sunbathing, chess, tennis, soccer and hoops, children sailing little boats, people picnicing everywhere.

Beautiful . Went to the park with husband and our two babies under 2. The park is absolutely beautiful and goes on for ages but what we were disappointed about is we couldn't actually sit on the grass. It's not allowed and you'll get the security watching you like a hawk. There's not a lot of shade but chairs are provided to sit where you wish.

Nice place to relax & eat ice cream. These gardens are beautiful. Lots to see & do, lots of great photo opportunities. There are little stalls/cafes where you can grab something to eat & drink. Best on a sunny day.

Luxembourg Gardens. The “Luco” as the Parisians call it, is a palace, a museum and one of the most beautiful gardens in Paris, constructed in the 1620’s for the queen Marie de Medici. Three functions united in one place that the centuries have modeled and transformed without losing its charm.Nowadays the palace houses the Senate, the Upper House of the French Parliament, which is sometimes visitable by guided tour. Esteemed temporary art exhibitions are held throughout the year at the Museum. Round the rear of the museum, orange and lemon trees, palms, grenadiers and oleanders shelter from the cold in the orangery of the palace. As for the garden, with its collections of precious flowers, its poneys, beehives and lake for miniature wooden sailboats, is a true heaven where adults and kids can stroll, play, picnic, sit on chairs spread throughout, just relax or exercise. The Luco is a mixture of French culture, nature and playground.Situated on the border between Saint-Germain-des-Prés and the Latin Quarter, the gardens, which cover 25 hectares of land, are split into French gardens and English gardens, being largely devoted to a green parterre of gravel and lawn populated with statues and centered on a large octagonal basin of water where children sail model boats. Coming closer we even notice that there are fish in the water, which doesn’t worry the little children who sail their little boats in the pool. They use long sticks to navigate the colorful miniature wooden vessels; the sight of them having so much fun with these non-motorized little boats is almost anachronistic.The garden is famed for its calm atmosphere. Surrounding the bassin on the raised balustrade terraces are 106 statues of former French queens, saints and copies after the Antique. You will also find a small version of the Statue of Liberty.The gardens include a large fenced-in playground for young children and a vintage carousel. There are many other activities and facilities for children such as puppet theatre, pony rides and playgrounds. Adults, whether they are Parisians or tourists, can play chess, tennis, “pétanque” and cards.East of the palace is the 1630-built Fontaine des Medici, an elaborate fish pond. Next to it stands a Music Kiosque, a gazebo with free musical performances. There is a small cafe restaurant nearby, under the trees, with both indoor and outdoor seating from which people enjoy the music over a glass of wine.There is also an orchard with a variety of old and forgotten apples, an apiary for you to learn about bee-keeping and greenhouses with a collection of breathtaking orchids and roses. The gardens have appeared regularly in French literature, perhaps most famously in Victor Hugo’s "Les Miserables" where Marius and Cosette first meet. Henry James also uses the gardens, in The Ambassadors, as the place where his character Lambert Strether has an epiphany about his identity. The final scene of William Faulkner's novel Sanctuary is set in the gardens. The orderliness and symmetry offers peace and tranquility. Symmetrical lawns surrounded by borders filled with bedding plants, gravel paths, clipped hedges, trees and more statues including a model of the statue of Liberty, form much of the park. The Luxembourg gardens are a great place to relax whilst visiting Paris. A very inexpensive map – size A3, 4 colors, downloadable - is sold on Amazon from the collection called Voila Paris. It shows the location of the attractions with photographs, so that you can find your way around it easily, especially if you have kids with you.

Still lovely. Despite of being very popular, it is still lovely. The overall mood of this place is dreamlike. You can be among many other people, and yet walk around on your own, daydream, just enjoy the feeling of being alive.

Big jardin and place to relax. there are many activities you can do, like tennis, chess, even museum, you can just sit in the chair and look at the people walking and playing, which is already nice way to kill time. there is also place for kids to play.....

Every day. Beautiful park that is the garden of palace of Luxembourg nowadays hosting French senate . A place to walk, to seat to read, to run, you can either have lunch and est very good salad there or stop by to one of the many spot who sell crepes and ice cream ... It is a place full of surprise where you can see French playing there famous pétanque or guys joining to play chess, there very often expositions ... You can go with your kids and enjoy playground ...Really a very nice and beautiful park

Nice little garden. Oh it's qute nice. But it's so little/ Back in Moscow I live near Perovskii park it's very small compared to other parks in Moscow bu it's the same size. Suited in the center of the city. Lot of people there not quite quite.
Beautiful with so many surprises. The grounds are gorgeous with statues and ponds everywhere. We had our Paris picnic here since they have covered patios to shelter from the rain.

Ultimate Romantic Paris. Beautiful place, get sandwich and picnic supplies at monoprix supermarket or anywhere. We had a romantic picknic with sparkling wine raspberries and baguette and Swiss cheese/ It was amazing and unforgettable.
Absolutely magnificent. Be sure to visit these gardens, just magnificent, a great way to spend an afternoon walking, watching and enjoying

Don't miss!. This truly is the most beautiful garden/park in Paris. I have visited it twice, and will do so again on my next trip. Lovely fountains to relax by, sculptures of historic figures, flower beds and greenery, places to eat with great food, and so much more.

An Excellent & Picturesque Place To See. My visit to the Luxembourg Gardens usually happens due to sports activities and more specifically, running. If you are visiting Paris make sure you pay a visit to this place especially after you have visited most of the city sights and you want to rest for a while. You will get the chance of seeing the Luxembourg Palace, the Medici Fountain, the larger center Pool, the tree-shadowed promenades and a series of sculptures placed within the area among others. However, more than that you will get the chance of getting some rest in a picturesque place and calmly reflect on your trip after you rotate back home or to another destination.

The Gardens carry the spirit of Paris. The Gardens carry the spirit of Paris. One can walk the whole place many times; can also enjoy the sunshine, or the snow in winter. The early hours of the morning are the best to visit, and don't miss La Fontaine Medicis, it's a symbol and a spiritual map.
A peaceful place in Paris. The gardens are huge with plenty of seating under the trees. Well maintained with several species of plants and flowers. A good place to relax and people watch.

One of the most beautiful formal gardens in Paris. Paris, and for that matter France in general, is alive with flowers and gardens everywhere. One very special place is the Luxembourge Gardens. Once the estate of Marie de Medici, these gardens are open to the public for walking, picnicking, going to a puppet theatre, riding ponies, playing in the play ground, or using the running track (which many were doing when we were there). The beautiful palace with it's reflecting pool and fountains is not the seat of the French Senate. You can enjoy a relaxing afternoon mingling with the natives of Paris is this lovely space.

Beautiful . I was in Paris for 3 days and went here each day. I was lucky that it was great weather and I sunbathed each day, once on the grass and twice on the chairs that are dotted about all over the gardens.There's a beautiful fountain near the senate building. Also a place to eat and do the toilet (50 cent charge).There's a metro stop right next to it so easy to get to.

Amazing secret. So it was my second time in Paris, the luxembourg gardens are on of those places you go to when you have done everything else, but its beautifull and you get to see parisians using open public spaces in a way that other nationalities dont. I loved it!

Beautiful Gardens. We stumbled upon the Luxembourg Gardens by accident as we were walking to Notre Dame. We got pastries and drinks and went to sit down and chill out. The Gardens are absolutely stunning, I'd have liked to have spent more time here wandering around, but the time we did spend was lovely.
A lovely place for a stroll. A very nice place to visit if you have an hour or two free. We only spent time in the lake area but the place is vast and worth exploring if you have the time

A place to relax and take a break surrounded by history. We visited the gardens with our eleven year old after spending a number of days seeing the must see sights of Paris.Whilst most of the grassed sections are not for walking on there are hundreds of seats available to sit back and relax in. There are also areas where you can rest on the grass and do what most other seem to be doing (i.e. Having a picnic or having a sleep). The garden was well maintained and there is also a large pond area where you can float a hired sailing boat for 3.5 euro for 30 mins.Worth allocation some time here if you can. We planned on a couple of hours and stayed for 5 (an hour of which we were all asleep laid out on a grassed area).
