Another Paris must do. If this is your first trip to Paris you should visit Luxembourg Gardens. Lovely area to eat a pinic or just stroll through the flowers and trees.
Nice. It is a nice place to relax or have picnic when you are tired of the busy hustle bustle. One can easily have some rest under a tree.

Lovely Surprise. we were walking to the bird market in Ile de La Cite and cut through the gardens because frankly, there they were! it was beautiful - people everywhere enjoying the peace and quiet, children having a riding class (on ponies - so sweet), and the boats! kids with boats!!it was great.
Beautiiful. A wonderful place to stroll, enjoy flowers, trees, statues...peaceful. There are fountains to enjoy, tennis courts, playgrounds, a children's pool....

Love love love this garden! . Loved it here so much! The garden was gorgeous and I actually liked it more than the palace of Versailles. It was a great place for a park bench lunch to sit and people watch or just enjoy the beauty of the garden. It was one of my favorite memories of Paris. Loved it here. Which I had time to sit and smell each and every rose in this garden!
Not so spacial. Nice garden,nice statures ,nice ponds.but when i read other reviews before going there, i have expectation more than this.but of course relaxing and safe environment.
Amazing gardens and Palace.. Such beautifully maintained gardens create a tranquil oasis in the heart of Paris, with the Palace as a backdrop.

Sophisticated Lungs of Paris. This is the most spectacular garden in Paris...it has the lot and well worth packing some lunch and spending some relaxing time in its beautiful surrounds. The miniature sailing boats on the pond will amuse the children and adults alike. At the top corner is a fruit garden with espaliered fruit trees and a colony of working bees. The park also has a jogging track around its boundary for a easy few km for the guilty. Its worth hearing the "garden police" whistle when you walk on a grass no go area !!!

Gorgeous. This place is simply breathtaking... If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of citylife, come here.We had a nice picnic here under a tree, it was awesome... Lie down on the grass and look at the clouds drifting by, take a nice deep breath and enjoy life, at its finest. Without any added hoopla, just beautiful landscape!

Great place to eat, drink, relax. Bring your food, wine, or whatever you want to eat or drink ( read a book) end either grab some chairs ( chairs are all around) or sit on grass (in the back area, you can't sit on grass immediately by the fountain ). You can rent a miniature sail boat and put it in the fountain. Lots of shade areas.

Nice Place to get off the busy streets, or have a picnic.. This is a great garden there are many activities for singles couples and families. A rose garden, fruit trees, play areas for kids boules, paths benches chairs etc. If you have been on the tourist path and are feeling frazzled, grab a picnic and relax here to recharge your batteries. And you can have a nice bottle of wine too! This is Paris after all and drinking in public is accepted here...

Rest and relax. Like the Tuileries, this garden has a pond with plenty of chairs around. In a corner there is the Medici fountain which is worth finding. Nice garden beds. Plenty of jogging tracks as well

Beautiful spot to relax after long walks. The gardens are beautiful and many people enjoy their weekend walks or just sit by the pond. Parisiennes as well as tourists gather for some relaxing moments.

A beautiful place to just sit. A nice place to just sit, chill & watch many people go by or read a book. There are public toilets for a small charge & a cafe. The summer had been very hot but the garden didn't show it. There is plenty of seats too.

Relaxing and scenic stroll. These gardens are more like a scenic lark with so many views to take in, right in the middle of the city. This place is perfect to relax in the sun and to enjoy a light snack.

OMG these gardens are breathtaking . The French really know how to make the most beautiful gardens you have ever seen. This place is just incredible to stroll around and take it all in with flowers and beauty everywhere.

A meditation heaven in the middle of Paris. I've been regurlarly to the jardins du Luxembourg since I was a kid, till I was in my thirties.The place is peaceful and inviting. Wether you are looking for sunbathing or a rest under the trees, this is a great stop over in the middle of Saint Germain des Près.
Garden Stroll. Great place for a stroll, take the kids to the play area or to have a picnic. Gardens have some great trees!
Stunning.. The gardens are magnificent . Huge pots of geraniums and petunias are arranged all around the dam. Really lovely place
Beautiful. A lot of people come to Luxembourg gardens to sit on the chairs, look at the fountain, chateau and smelling the flowers. Here you can calm down easily.
Group. Really nice. Comparable to Versailles gardens but a bit smaller. Nice park with replica of Statute of Liberty dedicated to the victims of 9/11.
People watching. A shady respite and a great place to watch the world that is Paris go by. The best place to people watch and catch your breath and plsn your next move in this amazing city.
overlooked treat. very nice place to stroll and observe the grounds. spacious and bring a lunch with you for enjoyment in the sun or shade.

Beautiful palace gardens has a great playground for children. These gardens are as big as any park in London and would be an excellent choice for a park visit. There is a very good children's playground in the south west that charges a few euros for entry. Our infant loved it.

Best spot in Paris. Beautiful gardens, great spot to people watch take a book or you lunch when you need a break from sightseeing and enjoy! The Medici Fountain is lovely to sit by on a hot day, don't miss it.
Great place to relax !. This little park is a must see ! Well maintained with beautiful lake ,a perfect spot for short brake after long walking around Paris !

Stroll through the gardens.. We stayed on the side of the gardens near the Sorbonne University. We walked through to the opposite side and it was very nice. We ended up at a restaurant called Bread and Roses on Rue Madame for breakfast. Expensive but food was pretty good. The Irish Soda Bread was so good. Anyway, it's a very nice walk with a lot of people jogging in the morning.

Huge and beautiful!. My hubby and I passed by the garden which we had no clue where we were. Until we saw the Luxembourg Palace, unfortunately it was under maintenance, and a group of kids chasing each other and playing on the other side of the Palace, we were amazed by the size of the garden, we googled it and found out we were in this beautiful garden. We didn't spend time exploring the garden since we were in a hurry but next time, definitely I would grab a chair next to the fountain and enjoy this place.

A great find. We found these gardens by accident. We needed a break from the museums so we took a long stroll through Paris and just happened upon these gardens . They are pretty, grab a snack and sit and people watch. There are statues throughout the gardens of important figures to Paris. Its a nice leisurely stroll and a nice way to take a break from museums

Great for runners. There are plenty of reviews about the gardens. The guidebooks have it well covered. I'll just comment on my experience as a runner.If you are a runner looking for a place for a beautiful short run, this is it. There are dirt paths around the periphery and winding through the gardens. There were dozens of runners out doing early morning runs.The loop around the perimeter is probably about 1 km. It is not a proper track but interestingly almost everyone (stupid me excepted) ran counterclockwise as if they were on a track.
Beautiful place and free!. We spent two hours here and is was very nice. Everything was clean and very photo friendly. Definitely worth a visit.

A great place to simply sit and enjoy the weather. My wife and I enjoyed simply enjoying the gardens for it's beauty from the the fountain to the flowers to laying on the grass watching the clouds pass overhead. My tip would be to take a bottle of wine and some cheese and just experience the moments of being there.
Perfect place ln a sunny day. Perfect place to stay on a sunny dayjust take a chair in the garden, place it near the fountain and watch kids playin with their lil boats in...

One of the most famous Paris parks!. This park is very vast and very beautiful... In the middle of the park, where the fountain is located, you can hire small boats and have them sail across the fountain. This is very fun for kids! You can stroll leisurely around the park, picnic on the grass, and even hunt for the smaller version of the Statue of Liberty on display... The flowers are always beautiful, there are places to sit and have a café or a nibble... It is centrally located in Paris and very easy to get to via the RER B, get off at at the Luxemburg stop and you will be right at one of the park entrances... On a sunny day, you will see Parisians basking in the sun on the green metal chairs... and tourists alike, it is a great park to visit!
An Oasis in the heart of Paris!. Perfect break to admire the wonderful grounds, ponds and architecture, Sunday is particularly good if you enjoy people watching.

Beautiful lush gardens with a hive of activity. Jardin du Luxemborg is an oasis of calm and lush greenery for relaxation. However, it is also teeming with activity. There was a band playing there on the weekend, pushboats for kids to play with and running space if you were so inclined!

Awesome place for a jog. If you've visiting Paris and want to stay in shape, go for a jog in Jardin Luxembourg. Great vibes, interesting people, tons of history. Get healthy and cultured at the same time? Now that's a good plan.

A little walk from the main attractions but worth it. This park is a little walk from the Notre Dame and other attractions but well worth it. Lovely park in the city, huge, well maintained. Little nooks and crannies everywhere to explore and find exciting things. The flower beds are very well kept up, we saw the greenhouses full.

Probably the most beautiful park in Paris. The visit to the Jardin de Luxembourg is a must when visiting Paris. It's location is ideal, surrounded by the latin Quarter, and close to Notre Dame. You have amazingly beautiful gardens in front of the Palais de Luxembourg, fountains, kids playground, tennis courts, a museum, lots of different atmospheres corners, ideal to go read a book, take the sun, watch people or take a stroll.You simply won't get tired of going there.
Paris 2016. We actually just happened into the garden while we were walking. I am so thrilled that we found this park. It is beautiful!

Just beautiful. I'm sure my enchantment with the Luxembourg Gardens is because in April, there were no flowers in Minnesota, and the Gardens were beautifully in bloom. It was a chilly and rainy day when we strolled thru the Gardens on our first day in Paris. But it was a wonderful beginning.
serene and beautiful. Love this garden. While gardens are kind of a dime a dozen in Paris, this one is pretty special. The fountains de Medici were so neat and tranquil to sit and relax.

Beautiful gem in the city!. You could spend an entire day around the fountain watching the children with their sailboats! Pick up a bottle of wine and some cheese and enjoy happy hour "al fresco" in the garden.

A beautiful respite. The Luxembourg Gardens is a stunning place to just catch your breath while in Paris. Great place to stroll with an ice cream cone or sit on a bench and people watch. Grab a quick and inexpensive lunch at one of the stands. Wonderful food.But go there first before going to Monet's Gardens. Luxembourg Gardens are the opening act to the climax of Monet's Gardens. We made the mistake of doing the reverse.

Beautiful and entertaining. I live nearby and try to visit it at least weekly to see the array of flowers. Gardeners maintain and renew the flowers depending on the season or more often. The place is full of families, lovers, toddlers, young children. It is a jolly place to be.
Beautiful park/gardens. What a beautiful public space! Lovely to just stroll there, watching Parisians enjoying everyday life. Recommend lunch at the nearby Cafe Rostand.
Colorful!. The garden is really colorful and full of people tanning (in August!)! Nice for a pic nic with friends!

Beautiful gardens, good for picnics. Lovely expansive park with lots of shaded spots as well as sunnier places for picnics and sunbathing. Note that sunbathing in bikinis is actually forbidden (despite everyone else doing it) - we were stopped by a guard and told to dress up!!

luxembourg gardens. Great place to visit. Immaculate gardens, vibrant with tourists and runners, and a lovely cafe as well. Fountains, and an amazing historical landmark. We spent a lovely while meandering and soaking up the atmosphere in a very political base. Loved it !

Great park to sit and relax in the middle of paris. We walked to the park from the pantheon which only took about 5 minutes. The luxembourge palace, now where the French senate is located, is grand! The gardens and grounds are relaxing to sit or to walk around in. There is a children's playground as well as tennis courts. Most people were sitting and eating or just checking out the great scenery.

Perfect place for a picnic!. It seemed like all of Paris was here on Sunday (because most things are closed on Sundays, so Sunday is picnic day at Luxembourg). Go to Monoprix or Franprix (there's one a block away), grab some cheese, bread, butter, fruit, wine, whatever, and find a little patch of grass to park yourself for hours. Absolutely lovely. And if you play Pokemon Go, we caught 3 Mr. Mimes here, and there's a pokestop every 10 feet!

Wonderful.. We only scratched the surface of this wonderful facility, but we really enjoyed it. You could easily spend a day here and still not see everything, but we combined a short visit here with the Pantheon, which is nearby.

It's a park. In Paris.. My travel companion had been told that Luxembourg Gardens were worth visiting, so we did. I don't know its history, and without looking it up on the Internet I don't know why it has its name. There's a large, palace-like building, a few ponds, statues, lawn areas, flowers and trees. There are other parks and buildings like it in Paris, but it's clean, attractive, and it attracts lots of locals (many of whom do exercise, from jogging to Tai Chi, there) and tourists alike. I can't recommend making a special journey there, but if you're in the area, it will make for an enjoyable stroll.

Well-kept garden. It is a little bit out of the other touristic attractions but totally worth to see. You can take away some French sandwich and enjoy the garden during your lunch. If you go there, you are just a few miles away from the Montparnesse district. You better see there when you are that close because it is a really good district which reflects the decent face of Paris unlike the northern neighbourhoods.
Mary S. Lovely gardens, well-used by the community. Mature trees, imaginative flower gardens, a mix of modern and classical sculpture.

Best playground in the whole city!!. So, not only do you stroll through beautiful well-kept grounds with a palace view and a fountain to rent little toy sailboats to sail across, but this place has the best playground.You can pay a few euros to send the kids into a fenced off large area full of different fun play structures and sit just outside to watch them outside the fence, from the freedom of playground chaos (if your kids are big enough). Mine is 8, she was not only fine but she reveled in playing in a mostly parent-free, kid-run playground. In fact in was beautiful to see the children organize themselves without any parent input (except for the occasional overly- bearing(?)/controlling(?)/fearful(?) "helpful" instructions. The kids organized a volunteer "work" system at the zip line (which goes fairly fast and turns!). This system included kids who brought the zip line bar back to the front of the line, kids who took that and helped the littler kids on and/or gave pushes as wanted, and even kids who collected eye glasses at the front of the line to give to the kids when they finished their turn. The system had a few flaws, like any, but it was mostly fair, safe and the kids loved "working".
Really beautiful afternoon/morning. Lot's of activity (basketball, tennis running( on spectacular grounds. I would like to find out more about the history, but I ran there, it was beautiful,

Morning walk every day during my stay in Paris.. We stayed in a hotel less than a block from the Luxembourg Gardens. On our first day we visited the garden about 3pm on a Saturday and it was booming with activity. There are tennis courts, boule courts, and children sailing toy boats in the octagonal ponds in the center of the garden. There are also people just walking and picnicking and enjoying the beautiful surroundings. After that I went back every morning around 7:30 am for a 45 minute walk. The garden is much more empty except for a good number of runners and walkers. I felt a great sense of peace walking through the gardens (despite the armed guards near the palace). The flowers are also amazing due mostly to the care taken in the color coordination. I miss my morning walks in the Luxembourg Gardens and if ever in Paris again, I hope to stay in a hotel in this area.

Beautiful park, nice green spaces away from the tourist crowds. Beautiful french style park. The park has a lot of sitting area (although be careful not to sit on the grass as only most patches of grass are not allowed to be sat on) beautiful place to relax away from the tourist crowds.

Bountiful Beauty. My favorite destination in Paris! Located in the 6th arrondissement, it once served as a French prison during the French Revolution. The gardens are spectular. We had a picnic lunch there and enjoyed its beauty. There is an area where the children sail their sail boats, people playing tennis and children on pony rides. There are picnic tables and plenty of benches to sit on and relax. Handicapped friendly stroll.

worth a visit. Our hotel was within walking distance of the gardens. Came back from the louvre using the metro and got of at the north end.Short walk from the metro past many small restaurants and boulangeries where you can pick up baguettes to take with you. The gardens are very peaceful and decorative. We walked from the north end through the gardens,stopping of for an ice cream at a little hut near the fountains. Not much at the south end until you get to Blvd Montparnasse where there are many restaurants and the metro..

Daily Walk. We stayed in an apartment nearby for the month of July and walked the park nearly every day. The Medici fountain area is lovely on a hot day. There are musical performers at various times in the band stand. There is a cafe on each side of the garden but they are a little pricey. It gets busy on the weekends but during the week it's not really that crowded. There are joggers going around the interior perimeter in the morning so it was a bit difficult to enjoy that area when they are constantly jogging (only experienced this once and learned from that).

A Walk in Paradise. Surrounded by a huge fence often displaying great posters and artworks, the Jardin du Luxembourg is a wonderful walking park full of statues, pathways, grassy areas, flowers, play areas, a huge pond, a palace at one end, a restaurant and peaceful ambience.

One of my favourite places in Paris!. It's a big and beautiful garden and I'd recommend grabbing a book to chill in the park. There are events going on every now and then around the garden too so check online for this if you're into such stuff.

very well maintained park. Well worth a visit, this gigantic and very well maintained park is a attractive place to unwind during spring & summer, take a picnic and appreciate the flowers and orchard planted alongside many fruits. The garden also has a very fascinating history, read up yourself or splash out on a guide to tell you all about it.
Beautiful. These gardens are wonderful and so beautiful. They are not too crowded and are a great spot to relax and have a picnic.

Great way to escape the rush of the city!!! . My girlfriend and I visited here in August 2016. It was stunning, the gardens were well maintained, I was amazed at how many benches and chairs were all set out. We had our picnic lunch here which was lovely. Would also highly recommend visiting just to sail the lovely hand made sailing boats in the pond outside the main building. Was such a lovely experience in a beautiful setting! Great way to escape the rush of the city!
Have a picnic. Here is where the youth of Paris comes to talk, share things etc. Park closes early so is good for a picnic then move on by 8 pm

always nice and great on a sunny day. A wonderfull setting, well enjoyed by the public with trimmed gardens lots of Parisians enjoying the warm sunny day. Children at play all manner of sun bathers and groups laying and walking about, and a beautiful castle at the lung end. The pond in front of the castle showed little sailboats, rented from a pushcart vendor,and set in manicured gardens each with color themes offset by counterpoint colors that unified the whole picture

A lazy stroll and a nap. I can't imagine a more beautiful and relaxing park to rest in, have a picnic in, share a game of tennis in, hang out at a playground in, watch a puppet show in, admire the statues in - gosh - need I go on?
Must visit. . Basic must visit site. Sailboats are mandatory visit for small or even medium children. Pony rides are always a big hit. Playground a great memory. Just go. The uber will be worth it
Beautiful gardens. My favorite gardens in Paris. So relaxing, can escape the mad city rush and just people-watch. It's a shame you can't sit on the grass, though! I guess benches are just as good...
Beautiful!. Really gorgeous but go before 6pm as everything shuts down, even in the summer. Playground was awesome!!

Lovely place for lunch . We stopped her for lunch after walking all morning. There are only a couple of areas where you can sit on the grass which unfortunately were in the sun when we went,but there were plenty of chairs in the shady areas. There were a lot of people
Beautiful and peaceful. Such amazing gardens and displays of colour! A good way to spend time outdoors, relax and enjoy being in Paris, without spending money. Bring your lunch and a good book.

Lovely, but why so restrictive on the use of the lawns?. We had picnic delivered by Paris Picnic and had a great experience. Beautiful flowers, shady and sunny areas for your preferences. But seriously, why not let visitors use more of the lawns for relaxation on blankets? People not obeying the restrictions were told to pack up and move, families with toddlers were chased - strange. Three strips of grass by the southern gate (by Rue Auguste Comte) were open for people sitting down, but nowhere else.
Beautiful . Beautiful garden, love the landscape of this garden, a vast and old garden, it has lots of monuments and fountains, all done to the best
Beautiful gardens. Great to sit with a picnic or read a book, I think there's free wifi there also. Huge gardens to walk around. It does get busy but there are plenty of places to sit down
Perfect atmospher on a beautiful day. There is so much to see in this interesting park but my favourite thing is to watch the chess players sitting outside under the trees engrossed in their game

peaceful. This was a great last day area to explore, not too big but big enough to occupy us for a couple of hours and provide us with a peaceful and relaxing place to wind down and rest our legs whilst still soaking up French culture. We bought amazing pastries from a local shop and sat reading and watching the locals sail their miniature boats on the pond. Well worth the visit.
Beautiful place. the gardens are absolutely stunning. Try to go on a dry/sunny day so you can really enjoy it. Huge area but lovely to walk around and see all the flowers and hedges.
Paris at its best. Go there and enjoy some tranquil people watching. I love the tennis. Also: Statue of Liberty is there!
Lovely. A nice place to just stroll and admire, take a rest. Be sure to stop and purchase food, drink the walk in and just take time to enjoy and recharge yourself

Beautiful park. We walked through the park and sat and relaxed a bit. Nice location to get off the busy streets. The park is beautiful and well cared for, flowers gorgeous, trees pruned, quiet, just lovely. The adjacent Palace of Luxembourg is heavily guarded. Recommended spot if you are nearby, don't go out of your way however.
Beautiful gardens. This is one of our favourite places in Paris. The gardens are beautiful and there always seems to be something going on. There are plenty of chairs to sit and relax.

Big and beautiful . A nice park to stroll around in or find one of the hundreds of chairs standing around to sit on (since you can't sit in the grass) and maybe have lunch! I feel like after 4 days in August that Paris is a city you should visit in spring or fall rather than summer if you want to maximize your experience of all the sites but nonetheless if you have the time you should visit this park

My favorite park in Paris!. A most beautiful place to visit. Beautiful fountains, with the large fountain in the middle of the park marking the center of a circular alignment of statues representing many French queens. Open areas and areas with trees, playgrounds for kids, pony rides, and the beautiful senate building at one end. Lots of chairs and benches throughout to sit down and relax. What's not to like?
Stunning!!!. A beautiful and tranquil public park! Well-maintained and many areas to relax and enjoy the stunning surroundings!

Not the breathtaking gardens I was expecting . Funny notices saying you can walk on the grass! Was wondering why the very welcoming looking grass wasn't being enjoyed! Disappointed with the gardens. Was expecting breathtaking, omg wow. It's ok. The locals appear to love the grass.Sure beats the rer b train to get there. Ug. Too many people. No aircon. The soldiers with machine-guns couldn't fit on.

Just as beautiful as it was 20 years ago. I came here 20 years ago on my first trip to Paris and enjoyed picnicking with friends and wanted to see if it was just as beautiful as I remembered- It was! One of the things I enjoy most about Paris is that there are always great Parks amidst all of the buildings and traffic. This is like an oasis tucked away in the middle of the city. My kids enjoyed sitting and texting/catching up on social media without being rushed to the next tourist attraction. Find time to stop and unwind in this beautiful setting that has remained preserved.

Peaceful Gardens. A visit to these beautiful gardens is a must, spread out in the centre of Paris with a stunning display of flowers and plants, large pond in the centre. They are very peaceful and relaxing with places to sit dotted about.

Simply Beautiful. A really great place to spend the day, it is right around the corner from the Pantheon. There are loads of fountains (the main one has model sail boats) and plenty of space in the sun and shade.We visited after visiting the Pantheon and it would be a great place to have a picnic and chill out. For any avid Pokemon Go players this is a hotspot for so many different types of Pokemon! Overall, a really beautiful and spacious park close to the Montparnasse Panoramique Tower and the Pantheon, worth a visit while in Paris.
Beautiful. Beautiful place to walk and sit. The mini-boats on the pond (you can rent them). There is a playground for children (Large!) and a small (take away) café.

Where are the little boats?. I'm sure they were there when i last visited Paris...5 years ago. Disappointing. Gardens beautiful as ever. But was surprised that one cannot sit on the grass. A hot day,sore feet. Grass inviting. But,lo,up came the Grass Police! !
a refuge in the city. The LG are just beautifully maintained. It was very green when we visited. The LG have many places to relax and forget that you're in a city.
Peaceful. Beautiful place to sit and people watch or read a book. Stop at a bakery and buy some food and drink and have a picnic in the park. Lovely.

A beautiful place, where you can walk and drink a coffee at the sunset.. A beautiful place, where you can walk or read a book by the water, or drink a coffee at the sunset, in the company of great people.

Picnic heaven. Pack a picnic blanket, visit on a dry sunny day and enjoy! One of my favourite Paris spots! Excellent spot to people watch. Public toilets ((€0.70) and a restaurant/ cafe on grounds. On a sunny day you'll see lots of French enjoying a picnic with a bottle of wine - must during the summer.
Artful garden. French architecture in building and garden layout is wonderful,but we went on. July Friday and got the best surprise...a free concert made the whole thing even more memorable.
Gardens. We went on a rainy day - no one was there- They have a puppet show that we missed - Try to make that - tons of statutes and places to rest and read a book (if its not rainy)
Relaxing. What a lovely place to visit to relax and take in the beautiful surroundings. Bring your camera, a good book and a picnic, it is a wonderful place to spend an hour or so.

A Beautiful Garden. A lovely place to relax during Spring & summer,although the place has a lot of flowers, as we were there at the latter part of summer the flowers were partly faded.Still it looked nice,there is also an orchard planted with many fruits.The garden has a very interesting history, its better to read up or get a guide to explain all about it.Very well maintained & an enormous place,.Well worth a visit.
Perfect spot for a picnic. Hit a local Monoprix and grab some picnic supplies for your visit to Jardins du Luxembourg. The perfect spot to lounge and people watch, like a true Parisian.

Our favourite location. Paris really knows how to care for its parks, The Luxembourg gardens are a perfect example. The ideal place to relax and people watch. Take a book and a picnic, and soak up the atmosphere in this charming oasis.
A must see . One of the outstanding gardens in Paris. Worth seeing if you don't have time for other gardens such as the ones of Versailles

Beautiful Gardens. This is a stunning garden with beautiful architecture, lots of shady and grassy areas to relax or picnic. There are ample chairs and benches to sit and also makes for a great photo opportunity. Plenty of restaurants to get a sandwich or crepe to-go and picnic in the garden!
Quiet and beautiful. Beautiful gardens and buildings and a great place for a quiet stroll or to jog. Not to mention that there is no admission fee.

One of my very favorite things about Paris. The daily puppet theater; the sailing pond; the carousel; the pony rides; the fountains; the incredible landscaping and topiary; the enclosed children's playground (modest admission fee); the ubiquitous chairs and benches; the cafe. Bring your kids, bring your walking shoes, bring your running shoes, bring a book. It's one of the best places, ever.

Great park for kids. Great kids park and carousel, a great place to go with little ones. Lots of shade if it is warm out, and plenty of bistros near by once your child falls asleep to go grab lunch at.

Always a favourite . So beautiful, so tranquil and restful. Took the kids this time. They loved the boats on the water. We loved the peace and people watching. One of our favourite destination s in Paris.

With teenager & four year old . This park is my favourite place in Paris - it has beautiful flowers & shady tree areas, which we desperately needed on the day we were there as it was in the mid eighties - the park for kids was great even if there was a small fee - take a picnic with wine and stay the whole day if the weather is good

Our Favorite Paris Garden. The Luxembourg Gardens provide a restful serene respite to balance the exciting experiences of exploring Paris. The pond with its little sailboats, the water grotto hidden in the trees, the beautiful flower plantings, the bee hives that encourage the pollinators and the gorgeous palace bring us back on every visit to Paris. The Palace isn't open for public viewing but the gardens are free to everyone.

Nice place to relax. Lovely garden, nice place to have breakfast or a snack surrounded by beautiful trees. There are also tennis/basketball courts, pony rides and small toy boats to rent for activities.
A lovely park. There is plenty to do here. Soaking up the Paris park life with music and chess games. A large play area and swings (you have to pay to access the play area).
Beautiful. Really beautiful garden and a place for relaxing for a traveller after a long walking in paris. Recommended

Excellent place to spend a couple of hours. Lovelly gardens and nice to stay a couple of hours. The museum was closed but i didn't felt sad - the atmosphere and the vibe are very good. Liked the chess players corner as well made me think to a nice novel i just read which was taking place in the Quartier Latin
Go early. At 9 am you have the place to yourself. The paths and pools reflect nothing but peaceful good design. Stay for a picnic, or come again early the next day.

A lovely place to stroll or to sit and read.. This is a lovely place to stroll or to sit and admire the flower beds and lawns that are overseen by obviously dedicated caretakers. Wandering through in the mornings one can find many individuals or small groups of friends who come to read and sit on the provided chairs in the shade or basking in the sun, among the lovely statuary surrounded by colourful flowers and greenery. This is an oasis in the middle of Paris, easily accessible to the neighbours on all sides and beautifully managed.One can sit with coffee and a pastry and read a book or listen to music or nap, all undisturbed. There is a cafe and restrooms are available for comfort, but if one would simply like to sit of lie on the grass in the midst of a thriving garden, then this is the place to go.

Favorite Parc in Paris. The gardens of the French sénat ... what a treat. Always kept in fine shape. Millions of flowers in summer. Just sit dorn in one of the green chairs for a while and enjoy the silence in the midst of the busy city.
Lovely walk. Great to walk around the beautiful gardens and see the perfect design of everything thing in place and balance..very lovely to look at and stroll around

rent a sailboat:). This was our boys' favorite part of the trip. The immediate feeling you have upon entering the garden: relaxed. Have a seat and watch the children pushing sailboats in the pond. I think it was under 5 euro per kid for a 1/2 hour (not that anyone was counting minutes). The gardens themselves and the palace are beautifully maintained, and the shaping of the buses and trees are impressive. Great place for a break to really soak in that you are in Paris!!

Beautiful and well kept gardens.. Beautiful gardens in the heart of the Latin quartering Paris.Immaculately kept. Plenty of space to walk or if you want to watch the world hotels by there are aplenty of seating areas.Note gardens shut at 8.30pm and guards make sure you exit by blowing whistles.Original Statue of Liberty here too.
A picnic or just.... Enjoy the sun and this beautiful gardens, it's another plus, you can go here on your way to the Pantheon.

Stay calm and relaxed in a busy city. These beautiful gardens are a place of Leisure in a busy city like Paris. There are lots of things to do: there's a playground for children, pony riding, you can play chess, there's a place to eat and drink with a nice terrace, but most of all: sit and relax and enjoy the atmosphere. Beware: the park closes at night!

Formal haven from busy life. Situated off the major arteries of the 6th arrondissement the formal gardens bring a world of tranquility of the Medici Queen. The Palace forms part of this visual delight. Beyond is the modern layout of walks and hidden gardens with trees and secret pathways. The bee hive area adds to the rural idyll. This is the perfect escape from hectic life.

Serene beauty. This park has something for everyone. Statuary, flowers galore, play areas, picnic or relaxing areas, fountains, small orchard, public restrooms, easy access, free. Did I mention Medici fountain? Ridiculously gorgeous.
Beautiful. Took a beautiful stroll through here during our visit last summer.Very pretty and made for a lovely walk.Visited July 2015

One of the most beautiful parks in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are the lands behind what is currently the Senate building of France, but was a palace of the Luxembourg family, and then the residence of Catherine de Medici. Evil woman who inspired the king to commit the Saint Bartholomew's Day massacre, where about 1400 leading French Protestants who had been invited to the castle for a cease fire in the war between Catholicism and Protestantism where murdered in their sleep. But, because she missed her luxurious palace back home, she had a truly magnificent grotto fountain built in a grove of trees with a reflecting pond. This park is a bit off the beaten tourist track, so it seems like the population is usually more locals and less tourists. The round pool in the middle has been a favorite of French children for generations to go a float little rental sailboats. The boats have no power source, so they have to be patient and wait for them to reach the other side.
The Parisians know how to design and maintain a garden!. I'm an avid gardener. This place is fantastic. The playground was approved of by my 10 year old, so it must be good.

Wonderful place to walk around or just relax. These gardens were just down the street from our hotel during our week-long stay in Paris, and we enjoyed them several times. Lovely gardens, interesting history, and great for people watching.

Parc de jeux, Jardin du Luxembourg. This is a beautiful Parisian park in the heart of the 6eme arrondissement. There are tree lined walks, a pond for sailing small boats and the part that we always visit, the children's area. There is an entrance fee for the day, and the kids love it (up to age 10), with areas under and above 7 years old. There is a sand pit, slides, tunnels, and a small zip line, with benches for parents. There is a water tap in the middle for cooling down, and a small kiosk for sweets and ice cream (€3 per cornetto which is €1 more expensive than the local shop). Overall this is a lovely place to spend a couple of hours. The toilet needs modernising and unfortunately there were lots of wasps this summer.

Superb place to visit with friends or family. take your pack of beer or bottle of wine and champagne if you are accompanied by friends. Its a very big park with lavish greenery and lawns. You can see some european music performances as well here free of cost. visit during summer days. During summer place will be crowded. you can spend your whole day here.

Picnic lunch at the park. This is a lovely well laid out park with plenty of seating , access to clean toilets (80c?) and clean drinking water . It has plenty of shaded areas for a picnic lunch and people watching . Popular with locals

A little piece of paradise . I stumbled across Luxembourg Garden purely by accident and what a lovely surprise it held, the gardens were peaceful and perfect. Chairs everywhere to stop and sit and take in the wonderful sights or perfectly manicured plants, grass and trees and even a little lake in the middle for small boats (kids only)!

Beautiful gardens, beautiful people. This is a great location for people watching, even the children are smartly dressed. The fern mob chairs are a great way to relax in the sunshine. The off to shop in the little boutiques that surround the Garden.

Splendid Luxembourg Gardens. My mom and I always stay in the Latin Quarter whenever we visit Paris. We always make a point to visit the Luxembourg Gardens during our stay. We get our coffee and croissant (or take-out breakfast from McDonald's on the corner) and just sit at the garden. We relax and enjoy the atmosphere. I like to come here to plan out our day : where are we exploring to and what are we going to eat. It's also nice to sit under the trees and just people watch. I love seeing children playing with the boats in the main pond. I hope to visit there again and really explore the entire garden.

Great place to stop, have a coffee, and relax.. Beautiful garden and grounds, and nice place to take a break and relax a bit. There are a number of trails to explore, playgrounds for the kids, and some great statues. Worth a visit for sure.
Gardens . Stunning, clean and well kept gardens, with fountains, palace, lovely statues, locals playing card and board games. Beautiful place to visit.

My favorite place in the world!. The minute I walked into the gardens, tears started streaming down my face. I was so happy! There is just an indescribable feeling of joy here. It's picture perfect... Children sailing wooden boats in the pond, toddlers wading in little pools, old men playing chess, people sunning, friends picnicking, a puppet theater, statues, incredible flowers everywhere!! Our hotel was only two blocks from the gardens, so we ended up walking through every day of our trip. And every day, my heart filled with a sense of peace and joy. Paris was amazing. The Luxembourg Gardens, however, are the reason I'll go back.

great place to relax when in Paris. Always a great place to go and relax in the park when in Paris. Lots of families and kids relaxing away from the hustle of the city that surrounds it. Bring a book and read under a shade tree and enjoy just being in Paris.

Beautiful, peaceful place. When we stay in Paris, we normally stay near the Pantheon in the 5th, and so we're very familiar with the Jardin du Luxembourg. If you're not, perhaps the best time to visit is early morning, with your croissant and coffee, when you can be nearly alone with the beauty of the park. A very nice place to spend some down time during an otherwise very busy stay in Paris.
What a park. The people watching is great. A mix of people from all over. Worth your time particularly on a sunny day.
Quiet spot right in the middle of Paris. Great place to stop, have an ice cream, and take a load off. The best time of day is late afternoon, when you will find many Parisiens sunning themselves.
Relaxing . Worth a visit just to sit and watch the world go by. Stunning gardens with plenty to see. Perfect on a hot day

A true Parisian gem. strolling through Luxembourg Gardens is a wonderful way to spend part of the day. The summer is especially beautiful with the flowers on bloom. It is so iconic from the children sailing boats in the pool , the beautiful fountains and locals and tourists alike sitting on the chairs and benches just taking in the beauty. It is a great way to take a break from the fast paced sight seeing and experience a more relaxed view of Paris
Wonderful and Peaceful. Peaceful gardens to enjoy and wander through. Slow down the pace and take the time for yourself to enjoy these.

Immaculate Gardens. Well kept, peaceful seeping in history-Remarkable plants and flowers, statues and water features. The little benches allow you to sit and take in the beauty of all buildings and the design of the gardens-Majestic.
Pretty. Great place to walk after visiting Louvre. Especially in the morning, when there are not many people.
Great Place to take your Picnic Lunch. Lovely way to spend some downtime from the bustle of the city. Pull up a chair, two if you need to put your feet up, then enjoy the gardens

A city break IN the city. Take your family here for a stroll, a play, and a picnic...the best place to do it in Paris in my opinion. Been here more times than I can count. A great playground for the kids (small entrance fee, but it's worth it). Lots of cafés on the streets around the parc where you can grab sandwiches for your picnic if you don't want to pack ahead of time.

Good place to enjoy a lazy afternoon. We bought ourselves some nice sandwiches and drinks and decided to have a lazy lunch in the gardens. It was really relaxing and we great time. You are bound to find Parisians enjoying a book or simply basking in the sun here ...

Oasis. The Luxembourg Gardens are a spectacular place to just go, sit and relax, people watch or read. The gardens are always current with the season. They are located a short walk from the Seine on the Left Bank. The Chateau is open to the Public for a charge and worth seeing once. On repeat visits to Paris....just enjoy the respite of the gardens.
Amazing. An oasis in the middle of the bustling city, the Luxembourg Gardens are a must visit spot! A nice place to rest for a weary traveler.
Impressive . Only took the tour for a short time. Had a personal guide who explained all of the history. The grounds are very clean and impressive. The park outside is busy. Worth a visit.
Beautiful Gardens. We ended up in the gardens on one of our history walks across Paris and were impressed by their stunning floral displays against the backdrop of the palace
Oases in the city. Paris has many wonderful gardens, but as this one was close to our Montparnasse hotel we could walk to it easily. Really peaceful and a classic example of the period.

Very beautiful . Great place to bring the family and get a cup of coffee. Plenty of seating area and place for the kids to play around the fountain. They rent out little sailboats that the kids can play with.

Relax and soak up the atmosphere.. You can immerse yourself in the surroundings and relax by water, flowers or just sit by a shaded tree. Their are free chairs a plenty, flat shoes are a must and it leads of to the seine on one side and streets and shops another.
Day Trip. A Fantastic place to visit so many things going on,the statues and flowers are brilliant,this is a must visit if you are in Paris
Great to see gardens and families. Wonderful to see the gardens in the middle of the city. Better to see families having fun. They even had pony rides.
Beautiful. Beautiful free place to relax, eat and enjoy the sun. Plenty of places there to purchase food and drink. Very enjoyable day, definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful gardens . A great place to relax and enjoy people watching, sun baking and watching people use the boats in the pond. The gardens are well maintained, extremely green and is big enough to escape the crowds.

Stunning. Best place to relax , take a stroll or even have some Popsicles in the summer! The statues are beautiful and so is the landscape , it is definitely a great place to go with kids , since it has a really nice playground .

Lovely seating by the sun. We were there for Easter holiday and it was a nice spring-ish weather... we could seat on the chairs, enjoy the calm breeze and the flowers that just started blooming. Nice place for a romantic pic-nic (if you keep away from the crowd).

Beautiful, vibrant gardens. Walk across the Seine, along the left bank and up through the pretty Latin Quarter to this beautiful, large and vibrant park. I visited on a very hot and sunny August day, but even then, there were plenty of places in the park where it was reasonably quiet, there were chairs available and lots of little corners in which to have a quiet picnic, or read a book. The palace is beautiful (I only looked from the outside) and the statues and gardens are extremely pretty- well worth spending an hour or two here, if only to get away from the crowds for a while and take in a bit of real Parisian relaxation time. There were public toilets available (didn't use them so can't comment on their cleanliness), pony rides, places to get a drink or ice cream and plenty of quiet spaces to contemplate your visit. About 15 minutes walk from the river, uphill (but gently) and through an attractive neighbourhood.

priceless attraction. Perfect for people watching without having the cost of a high price coffee drink at a cafe. Beautifully landscaped gardens and water fountains and endless entertainment and relaxation and it's free!

Busy but always serene. One of the best free events in Paris. It is always so nice to leave the streets of Paris and immerse yourself into the Gardens. It is easy to find a bench or chairs to relax in and watch people pass by. My recommendation is to visit often and pause in different parts to fully appreciate your surroundings. There is a lot to do there, definitely visit!

True French feel. If you want to have photo session in or around a Palace, this is the place to be.If you want to grab a coffee and sit by the water side, this is the place to be.If you want to have jog and finish off in a pleasant vicinity, this is the place to be.The architecture and space management is perfectly appointed. This gives you the feel of being in true unmatched French Royalty. We went for a couple of hours to the park as we had some leisure time. An boy oh boy....this turned out to be a really nice and a pleasant experience. Honestly 2 hours is not enough to go through this vast landscape. Recommend that you go in the early morning to enjoy it thoroughly ...also next to one of the exits there are a number of options to choose from fast food restaurants.

Stunning gardens. We walked across the bridge over the Seine to these stunning gardens. They are a mix of trees, vivid pink/purple flowers, manicured lawns and bushes and a huge pond. There are lots of chairs to sit at for free and take in the view.

Beautiful park in the heart of the city. One of the most beautiful parks in Paris for relaxing at every hour of the day ! There's the Senate's building, a museum and many places for snacks and meals around the park. It's among students' favorite places to spend some time. Worth it.

Amazing park in Paris!. Amazing not only because its really gorgeous but also because of the location, in the heart of Paris!Its great for children because it has a pond for boats and a park with lost of games for them, really a great option when you are tired of the stroller.Amazing gardens, flowers, paths and has a restaurant if you wish to grab something to eat.

Amazing. Lovely garden, free, with lots of green chairs to relax on a hot day in the shade or to have a nice picnic! Très beau jardin avec le palais du sénat, beaucoup de chaises et de banc où manger un pique nique ou se relaxer.
Must see. My favorite in Paris. Bring a book and a drink and people watch. The flora is incredible!This is essential Paris -- don't leave without coming here and relaxing by the fountain.

Brilliant and FREE!. Lovely park in the middle of the city, peace and quiet for a pack lunch, with beautiful gardens and statues. There's even a fruit tree section with it's own bee hive pollination area! Very interesting on Sundays too, with locals playing table tennis, boules, chess... although beware of the joggers! All in all a lovely way to spend an hour or so - and free. Skip the expensive restaurants for lunch, and grab yourself a cheap 'Formulae' (baguette, desert & drink) for about 7 euro from one of the many local boulangeries and chill...

Another Time in another world in the heart of the 6th.. The Luxembourg Gardens are attached to the Luxembourg Palace, the home of the French really Upper House Senate. There are many entrances and attractions over many blocks, so it is an excellent short cut on a hot day to continue your walk through Paris. The gravel walks and gardens are beautifully maintained with many benches in the shade of the magnificent old trees most of which are labeled. As expected, there are tennis courts, old men playing pétanque, joggers and hand holding young lovers, and most surprisingly, a section devoted to bee keeping. The Museum next to the Senate has interesting expositions which change every several months, is rarely crowded and only two blocks from place St Sulpice & the r. des Canettes entrance to the many small restaurants surrounding the Marché St Germain.
Lovely place for a walk. Beautiful garden, great for a walk. They have benches under the trees what's lovely to enjoy the stunning view. Snacks are overpriced.

Beautiful gardens in a great part of Paris. Wonderful place to see beautiful gardens. Walk around, go for a run or just sit in one of the many chairs and read a book or enjoy the view. One of my favorite places in Paris!

Amazing Park in the Heart of Paris!. Luxembourg Gardens is amazing! Be sure not to miss it when you're in Paris. Take a bottle of wine, cheese, and other snacks (on your own or with friends) for a particularly special time. It's great for walking, reading a book, people watching, etc. Peaceful and refreshing!

Amazing Day to Visit. I hadn't been to Jardin du Luxembourg in years... what a wonderful day to visit.It was a very hot Sunday a few weeks ago. We took our three year old daughter who really enjoyed the children's area and more importantly loved a 19th century ball which took place for free.Highly recommended for a lazy Sunday.
excellent to visit. When you have more time in paris you cannot miss to visit this beautiful garden. It seems to be in the Belle Epoque when the people where going on and down by the gadens... to do
Best park in Paris. We visited this ornamental park on a hot day after visiting the catacombs. There is a lot of green grass, shady trees and places to sit. There is an attractive pool and statue.

Classic and Gorgeous. Luxembourg Gardens is a large and beautiful park centrally located in Paris. Whether you are a couple looking for a romantic spot or a family with kids, this is a great place to spend a few hours. The grounds are quite beautiful. If you are thinking about picnicking, you might want to check the rules online to make sure its allowed.
Lovely afternoon in the sun. A very picturesque setting to have a picnic or sit in the sun. The boats on the lake are also great fun for kids (or adults!).

Excellent paysage!. I really loved that garden a lot with its perfect, refined paysage. You can see many places in this garden where designed with different atmosphers from each other and you may live trouble to decide which part is your favourite. You can see many french people who is jogging, walking and playing with model boats in the big pool in nature.
relax place. The garden is a beautiful place. Don't forget to take a picture around the pool, it looks so amazing. An ice cream (Angel) store near the northern entrance, we love it.

Squander an afternoon sitting in the shade. This a beautiful park for sitting in the shade and relaxing on a hot day.Sure you can walk around and look at the beautiful gardens, fountains and walkways but it's pretty wonderful to let the breeze wash over you while you rest in the shade.People watching is good but this is more of a relaxing park that a promenade.Chairs and entrance are free.Venders sell drinks and snacks.

Beautiful park perfect for relaxing. We went on a warm Sunday and really enjoyed a relaxing stroll andnsitting peoole watching in the shade. I was disapointed that they charged to go into the kids play area. If I went again I would take a picnic as very little is open on a Sunday so was difficult to Get a cold drink or a snack unless you wanted to buy from the only cafe only in the Jardin which was very expensive.
Just a wel in time and nice garden. The garden is well designed and maintained.Plenty of different spaces with a pond and the young children using small sailing boats for rent on the spot.

Beautiful. This is a very beautiful garden. Everywhere there are chairs you can sit down and enjoy the view, read a book or suck up the silence. It has a kids playground which is nice, clean and enjoyable for the kids.

Sail boats, listen to music, just relax.. It's a big, big park, with beautiful flowers and gardens.
We usually go there with our little one, sail a toy boat for 30 minutes (3.50 euros for renting a toy sail boat). Then just grab a seat to relax and enjoy the nice view.
My favourite place in Paris. Beautiful flowers, lovely design, peaceful in the morning before the hordes arrive. Something for everyone and right in the heart of Paris
Great walk on a Sunday afternoon. Stately, very visited, easy access and beautiful flowers. Venues for water, drinks and food available.

A world class garden. At any time in the year, the Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. They are not only extensive, but are part of a park which Parisians and tourists enjoy as a retreat from bustling Paris. It's a photographer's dream.
NEVER THE SAME. when ever I can I take a short walk to watch flowers changing every season. a great pleasure, always
Beautiful Gardens. Love the current pink colour of the flowers, it feels so Parisian! If only there were more grass that you could walk, lounge and lie on!
Absolutely stunning. One of my favourite gardens in the world !, the buildings, the tulips and the wide open spaces, just a lovely place to visit
Beautiful place for a lazy afternoon. Great for a walk on a Sunday afternoon or just to enjoy the flowers and watching the people play games or relax by the fountain or under the shade of a tree.

A worth while attraction. Providing weather permitting the Luxembourge Gardens are worth a visit.
You can sit here in peace without being pestered for several hours letting your thoughts go of the years go by, if only the area could speak.

We loved it- relax there. Near the Latin quarter
Very nice, free for every and a great stroll. The gardens are very well maintained, you walk in a summer day , a lot of shade, places for kids to enjoy and play there. Various people enjoy to sit and have fun and relax.
Recommend it for Sunday's and an hour away from the rush

Lovely, beautiful and welcome break from Parisian streets. Having trekked along the seine from the place de concorde we headed away from the river past the sorbonne to the gardens. The borders were lovely and the atmosphere relaxing. Sunbathing by the boating pond 👍👍

A beautiful city park. The park is nicer than I imagined. The flowers are colorful, the big pond with its toy sail boats speak to children, and the mood is festive and relaxing.
This park reflects the mood and culture of Paris.
Good place to Run. All the time, I run next this beautiful park, go go it's very google place to run. ~ 1 km to turn around

Beautiful garden escape in middle of city. These gardens offer a peaceful escape in a beautiful setting right in the middle of the city. The flowers and other plants are impeccably cared for, the lawns manicured, and the statues that dot the park are interesting and well-positioned. Tourists respect the lawns by staying off where not allowed, and children pilot remote control boats in the lake. Locals take a jog through the grounds, and tourists snap pictures of every angle of the gardens and the gorgeous palace. There are plentiful benches all around, providing the perfect rest stop during a long day's walk in paris.

Very beautiful and relaxing place. Its really nice and beautiful place. The gardens are worth exploring. Its very well maintained as well. If you want to take rest, stroll around, sit and relax then this is place to be in Paris. Its very green and colorful inside.

Favorite Park in the World. Best people watching. Great for painting & photography. Great for family, all sorts of activities in the park. Sail a boat in the fountain, ride ponies, playground, stroll gardens. Cafe, etc. Always go there when in Paris.

Take a time out!. You have dragged your children and your spouse all over this beautiful city. Everyone is starting to have "culture" ooze out of their eyeballs. You need a break. If it is sunny, then grab some food outside of the gardens and have an impromptu picnic; if it is windy and a little drizzly, be prepared for some fierce competition at the pond with the P'tits Volliers - vintage toy boats powered by the wind only. There are a couple of cafes inside the gardens but on a busy day, you might be wise to avoid them. This is a fabulous place to relax, people watch, catch your breath, and let the wonder of all that you have seen so far in Paris really sink in.
nice place to eat your takeaway. It's a good place to eat food that you have bought with yourself. The green is nice but beware of the strong wind that can interfere with you plans.

Pond is fun for kids but no shade for adults.. My 11 and 9 year old children had a great time with the boats in the pond but a shady place for adults to relax out of the hot sun was difficult to find. The gardens themselves are beautiful and worth a walkthrough.

Perfect for people searching for relaxing atmosphere. Spend the whole day wondering through Paris and in the end of the day wanted to find a place to relax in the sunshine. Luxembourg gardens was the perfect place. Great place as well if you are looking for a place to take a running session.

Beautiful!. I went on a beautiful day- blue skies and pleasant temperature- and I think it was my favorite stop in Paris. It was so nice to drink wine in the gardens and picnic. It was so relaxing a beautiful! Wish I could be there now!

Shady places. It was one of the hottest days so we were very tired from sightseeing when we arrived at Luxembourg Gardens. Although busy there were plenty of chairs under the shade of the trees which made for a very pleasant rest as we sat overlooking the well tended grass. I feel the French like grass for looking at rather than sitting on and are far too fond of grit paths for my taste ( the grit gets into sandals)The Medici Fountain is worth a look - it is also under the shade of trees so was lined with chairs and was very busy on this occasion - we have visited before when it was quiet which was better to enjoy this fountain.
Very family friendly. Lovely gardens, with families out enjoying the sunshine. Kids can hire toy boats to play with on the lake. There are toilets and a couple of snack bars.

Absolutely wonderful!. We purposely visited this garden toward the end of our week in Paris. After a very busy week of sightseeing, this was a welcome, restful afternoon. We took wine, bread, cheese, grapes and a tablecloth and sat down with so many others enjoying a picnic in the beautiful garden. There are places that you cannot sit on the grass, so when you reach the area where you can spread out for a picnic, it gets very busy. However, everyone was respectful and happy and relaxed and enjoying the same thing, so it was a comfortable atmosphere. One of our favourite memories from the week!

Well worth the time spent here.. These gardens are simply beautiful. They are spacious clean and very pretty with statues etc. You can enjoy a beer close by in a cafe. Well worth the visit if you like gardens. They are the best we saw in Paris.

Fantastic Inner City Park. Even if you aren't a fan of parks, this place is a great place to get a bit of peace from Paris. Its massive, there is a museum attached to the park, there is a great cafe attached to the museum. While this isn't something to really go out of your way for, it definitely a good thing to combine if you're coming to visit the Pantheon.
Very nice place to go. It's a huge garden with a pond in the middle where you can enjoy boat sailings activity with your children. Huge garden and maintained very nicely.

Beautiful park. The Luxembourg Gardens are a wonderful place to go for a stroll, or even a run (many people exercising in the park when I visited). The gardens are immaculately maintained and well planned. They are absolutely stunning. I enjoyed watching the children push the sailboats around the fountain with sticks - it was very old world and charming.
Lovely peaceful magical. This is a great place to spend a peaceful afternoon with a friend or a book. The grounds are well-maintained, not too crowded and enchanting.

Peaceful oasis in the middle of Paris. I entered this lovely park and immediately felt a sense of calm. This park was divided into a series of gardens - espaliered fruit, courtyards for boules, a kids park and ponds, a beautiful promenade leading up to the Palais, and shaded allees of trees flanked by statues. There are plenty of chairs and benches to sit on. There were many more local Parisians than tourists and their conversations were quiet. This was after all not a must see tourist attraction in Paris (like the Louvre). This a great place to bring a picnic lunch or snack, read, rest, or enjoy a contemplative moment.
Amazing Place in sunny day. I liked it very much, very nice, and clean, very beautiful gardens that I enjoyed for the whole day with my family
Great place to enjoy Paris. One positive side for having royalty is that they know how to spend money on fancy parks. Can get too dry during a warm day so bring something to drink.

Sit in the shade and enjoy the people watching. These gardens were just a few blocks from our hotel, so we strolled there late one afternoon. Well worth the time to visit. Beautiful flowers and fun to watch children with their sailboats in the pond. We seemed to be surrounded by locals, not tourists. There are lots of free seats which you can place in the shade and just people watch. There were several folks sketching and drawing around us. The park entrance gate closes around 7PM, so get there in time to be in the park before then.
Great. As a tourist i do not advice u to skip this wonderful place ! Very big , and although it is always crowded you feel it is not very noisy

Ok if you feel like sitting in a park. Was really looking forward to this park after reading such good reviews about it. I'm a park fan, especially of city parks, but this was just average. Drinks were overpriced, 2 hot drinks for 10.50 euros. Petanque areas but booths where it looked like you could hire to play were closed. Tennis courts where you had to be a member to play. Boats for hire to sail on a pond were just floating on their own and blowing around in the wind, not remote control. If your boat hits the side, you push it with a stick to get it sailing again. Probably good for children. Might be nice if you just accidentally come across it, but I wouldn't go out of your way to visit.

Wonderful gardens. Entering or leaving the Louvre, you must absolutely visit the Luxembourg gardens. The activities to do are multiple: you can sit beside the fountains, walk and watch the Parisians doing jogging, discovering the many varieties of flowers and plants always well cared by always present gardeners or have a picnic enjoying the sunshine.

Beautiful place to have a picnic. I'd say the only downfall is the connecting benches due to me not being a smoker. There are benches that are placed back to back in this park and whilst eating my lunch 2 guys sat behind me and smoke cigarettes. This ruined my experience but all in all its a beautiful sight.
late afternoon chill out. Grab your book and a reclining green chair and soak up the atmosphere. People watching! View of the Eiffel Tower too.

Lovely Park. We took bus 27, from Gare st Lazare, got off at St michel, walked to Notre Dame. After visiting Notre Dame, we walked along the street, about 15mins, reached Jardin du luxemburg.Free entrance to public. It is a typical french garden. Great place to chill, relax or have pinic with friends/family.Chaires, benches are all around, kids can have pony ride as well. There is a cafe in the garden, great taste with reasonable price.
Beatiful, great oasis. So nice to walk the park, and sit to watch the view, is very peaceful, have sailing boats in the fountain, looks fun
Peaceful, serene, and beautiful.. This is a great place to picnic, relax, and plan your day or take a break. One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris.

Wonderful!. One of the most beautiful parks of Paris. Definitely worth a visit! The park has plenty of room to carry out various sports such as tennis, which costs only 7 Euro per hour, but you can also jog or comfortably sit on a bench and enjoy the view.

Wonderfull garden. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a astonishing garden and really worth to visit. On sunny days the main place is pretty warm to be there, but there are also many places in the shadow of the trees where you can lay in the grass or sit on one of many chairs.

A great place to just sit with a book. This place is beautiful and great for a peaceful walk. But my one piece of advice would be to bring a book and find a great spot in the shade (or the sun) and do like the Parisians do ... hang out. One thing to note: follow the cues and don't sprawl out or even walk on the grass. There are no signs but clearly the custom is to just leave it be.

Delightful. We thought the gardens beautiful and well maintained, there are several small coffee shops, and a huge lake for children to sail their boats. There is plenty of seating a very relaxing place
Gorgeous gardens. I came here to draw. Its a lovely place to be. Good for children. You can sail a boat in the large pond.
Great Place for Picnic. We were able to borrow a picnic basket from our hotel and had a nice time eating and relaxing on the grass facing Luxembourg Palace.

Beautiful gardens to visit and relax . Love visiting these gardens. Take some lunch, book or walking shoes and spend time soaking up the beautiful Luxembourg gardens. And don't forget your camera! You are almost taken back to another time with such a lovely setting within the gardens and the palace and the central pond area. There are plenty of areas to sit or walk or jog around and explore with beautiful seasonal flowers and plants.

A Hidden Gem in Paris. I've been to Paris four times and this was the first time I made it over to the Luxembourg Gardens. They are so nice and not as crowded as other areas. For kids there is a puppet show (even though in French it was fun to watch), pony rides and at the fountain you can rent these little boats where the kids push them around with sticks -- my daughter loved. A wonderful place to visit, highly recommend.

A Charming Oasis of Verdant Tranquillity. Up there with Place de Vosges, it is a very beautiful place to visit. See Parisians sunbathing, playing tennis, boules, chess. Little children playing with sailboats that are available for rent. Check out the fountains and simply be in an elegant pleasure garden. The Orangerie has some fine exhibitions from time to time. Well worth a visit.

Wander and enjoy the magic gardens and castle. What a beautiful place to take a good book and relax. The gardens are just perfect. The shaded walks and if you have children they have a really big playground to keep the kids amused for ages.

Jardin de Luxembourg/Palais de Luxembourg. Beautiful Public park, which is, of course, the grounds of Palais de Luxembourg .It has large landscaped gardens, a pond, huge urns full of summer flowers (When we went), statuary (of Queens of France/Female Saints), lawns etc. But our favourite part was the Medici fountain (built by Marie Medici) which gushes into a pool FULL of very large freshwater fish, and a number of resident ducks. It is surrounded by artful plants/trees, and is a fantastic shady nook in which to just sit (on the usual Parisian chairs) and people-watch, read, contemplate, pic nic. One or two of the locals were sketching and painting.The sound of the fountain is really calming, if not soporific! The freeze at the head of the fountain is a depiction of Polepheme discovering Acis and Galathee in a lovers' tryst. We loved this spot, which we first visited on a recent blistering hot evening, and again a few mornings later. I really recommend it to everyone.

For those who likes gardens, music and walks.. If you are into history, this is a nice preview of what you can expect in Versailles. During our visit there was people dancing in clothes from the early 2000th century. Lots of pokéstops as well, if you dont like history so much. ;)

Beautiful. The gardens are stunning to just walk through , pack a lunch or snack , sit and relax with a book or close your eyes for a snooze. I love just sitting and people watching or just look at the beauty of it all
Fairytale. Simply a must visit when you're in the area.Stunningly beautiful place where you can put you're heart and mind at rest and just enjoy life..And the view!
great spot for a picnic. we had a lazy lunch in the gardens and it sure was beautiful to do. The property its self is well maintained and worth a look.

Beautiful. Huge park with lots of walks. Plenty of seats to rest on. Lovely pond and you can hire toy yachts for the children to play with. Just don't buy anything to eat in the park unless you take out a mortgage. get from outside the park. Great ice cream sellers at the gate.

Large public park. A large, public park free of the souvenir peddlers and grimey scammers that roam most of the interest points in Paris.On our last day in Paris, we finally made time to take a stroll in the park around the palace, since it was close to our hotel that was holding our luggage.Upon entering, we were greeted by a live mini-orchestra, performing for a small crowd. It was a lovely first impression.We walked around, sat in the sun for a while and people watched, walked by the pond where children (smh adults) play with toy boats, and just overall relaxed.This is a wonderful way to spend a Sunday morning or afternoon, to get away from the crowds of other major attractions in the city.

Not big, but some really pretty spots. Visited today. The walk to the gardens was lovely thru an upscale shopping area with historic churches etc... Loved all the many, many chairs to sit under the trees here! Bought a picnic lunch in the garden and enjoyed the nice brown bag we were given... Until we found our special spot. Big playground for children!!! We just enjoyed watching. Nice clean, safe bathrooms for under 1 euro in cost. Not a big place but very lovely peaceful.

Lavish garden to visit on a hectic day. We just visited the garden for two hours but totally fell in love with its offerings. The garden was lush green and had some amazing flora species. It's also a perfect spot for picnicking and photography. It's not an overhyped place but totally worth spending an hour or two!We went to this place after an super hectic day and it totally relaxed us!

Woaahh!. The Luxembourg gardens are absolutely amazing.
Must visit for a wonderful wine and cheese session.
Luxembourg over jardins des Tuilleurs anyday.
Excellent for a leisurely stroll.. Beautiful and worth the visit. The gardens were full of flowers and it was wonderful to sit and watch the children push along their wooden boats in the fountain.

This place is awesome!. Wander through, sit and read, either way this place is great. Shady areas, play areas, grassy areas, walking paths, thousands of chairs for sitting. People watch, read a book, rest, relax, cool off. A great place to visit and linger.

A suck a beautiful place. one in a few awesome place in Paris and its free :). Walk around and breath the fresh air from many trees and flower then take one chair around the fountain the take a sun that's a my good memory in Paris

Lovely place to spend the afternoon . Please note - playground is a pay for entrance, about 3.70 euros for one adult and child. Lovely variety of play equipment, clean toilets, polite staff, and reasonably priced kiosk with lovely coffee. The park itself is beautiful; easy spend a whole day here. Very typical Paris with fountains, lawns, ample seating areas and plenty of shade. The gardens are well maintained with a stunning flower display. It is also surrounded by famous buildings that offer great photo opportunities. Really enjoyed my visit here

Bwutifully kept and peaceful. We made a brief visit to the gardens since we are staying only .3 miles away. We found it to be quiet and lovely. Would like to come back with a picnic lunch and spend more time.

Beautiful gardens. These are beautiful gardens really well maintained, but with a relaxing atmosphere. thee is a boating lake, a children's area and lots of places to sit and read, as well as an orangerie, and a couple of cafes. Worth a visit.

A lovely spot for a break from your explorations!. An immaculately maintained public garden of gigantic proportion. Great for people watching. You might avoid at midday for there is not much shade. Early or afternoon the best.

Amazing Gardens . These gardens are well worth the look and have some well earn't rest. This garden reminds me of Central Park in New York. Plenty of shade and seats as well as grassed areas to have a picnic or just sit and enjoy the views.

A beautiful place. The Luxemburg gardens is probably one of the most elegant places to visit. It is manicured elegant and full of people doing different things. The place is an art place. So many things to watch and so many things to do.

Always so nice in August. This garden is lovely in August offering a calm place in Paris with playgrounds for kids.I love going there for a cooling time.Two (bad) things to know:-The big playground is really nice but you have to for EACH kid (2,5 €/kid) and even for EACH adult (1,2€/adult). Hopefully, you can stay out of the playground which is totally secured.- The dust. As soon as there is a little wind expect to be covered of dust due to the alley made in really thin particles of "dust".

The most beautiful place in Paris!. We've came there only for few minutes but we have stayed for couple of hours. There is not enough words to say how beautiful, relaxing and cosy this place is! Don't skip it! Truly worth to see :) take few chairs snd just enjoy your time here!

Wonderful day. Don't miss spending a long afternoon in this vast, formal garden. It really is lovely and a pleasure to wander in. Great place for kids (playground and small rental sailboats to play with) and adults -- we went back any time we could squeeze in an hour.
Gorgeous park. Absolutely lovely park. Huge gardens to walk around and loads of metal seats to pick up and carry to a spot of your choice. The perfect place to spend an afternoon in the sun.
Sunny day pleasure. It was lovely to share of coffee amid the beautiful trees and colourful gardens as we watched the children sail boats across the pond.
Beautiful gardens. This is a fun garden to walk through or to sit in one of the green chairs and people watch. I enjoy watching the kids play with the sailboats they rent.

Breathtaking Scenery. My boyfriend and I had a quick 1.5 day trip to Paris. We made this our last stop, unfortunately, just for a quick stop in because we were pressed for time to get to the airport! The garden was absolutely beautiful. There are many photo opportunities as the entire park is glorious! There is a large shaded area with benches, tables and lounge chairs along with restaurants. There are fountains, statues and blooming flowers throughout the entire garden! Like I said, we only stayed a very brief time but the gardens were magnificent. Next trip, I will definitely come back and spend more time exploring the place!
One of the greatest parks ever!. The gardens are heavenly and the park thrives with people of all ages enjoying the city - pack a picnic and feel like a local!

Relaxing and beautiful Gardens. These Gardens are one of my favourite spots in Paris. They are beautiful, tranquil and relaxing. Watching the ducks fight for bread from the fishes is amazing.
