There is something for everyone here wether it be a jog, reading a book, sunbaking, feeding the fishies or just having a picnic it's all happening here. Oh yeah the kids can do Pony Rides as well.
Beautiful gardens . Although we were only here for a weekend a visit here is a must. Beautiful and tranquil gardens in the middle of the city

Beautiful green space. Love how many green spaces Paris has and this is one of the outstanding ones. Sat in the sun and admired the view of the gardens and palace. Wish we had realized about the small food vendors inside the park and would have had our lunch here. Great place to relax and recoup

Stop at the playground for kids. This is a great break for families, and if you're staying in a nearby hotel, it's ideal. The playground can keep kids busy for an hour or so at least, although it costs a few euros (we got in for 1/2 price because we came 30 minutes before closing). It has a circular zip line that the kids manage themselves, and all sorts of great play areas. Nearby are pony rides, tennis courts, and places to eat, get a crepe or ice cream, and get a glass of wine or beer. It's a lovely place to loiter and read, and very close to the catacombs as well. Great break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

A lovely place to walk around and have a rest. I've been to the gardens a few times now and really enjoy the relaxed atmosphere as well as the beautiful surroundings a definite addition to any itinerary.

A beautiful place to visit. This is a beautiful garden with a bandstand under leafy trees that provide dappled shade from the sun. Metal chairs are dotted around the gardens for you to take in the sights.Vising brass bands from UK were there when we visited and it is lovely to see people stop and drag up a chair and sit listening to the music in the afternoon.There is also a small area where wooden boats are floated by children and a building that I did not really investigate due to time constraints, but there is a lovely café building where you can get refreshments and a comfort stop.There is a feeling of calm here - its a beautiful place to be.

Beautiful and well makntaines. It was a hot Parisian day and my partner and I wanted to make the most of the sun! As you're my allowed on the grass at the louvre and surrounding gardens, Luxembourg is a fantastic and beautiful alternative. Take a water bottle!

Nature gift. It is an attractive garden for nature lovers. Travelling towards Luxembourg feels like away from lust city buildings to greenery. Almost a place to walk, play, gaming or cycling in the cold winter but sunny on August. Greenery is a shadow for your dream where the tall buildings with many cities never give a feel of it.
Beautiful and peaceful. We briefly walked through the gardens and it was beautiful and a completely different atmosphere to the hustle and bustle of the rest of Paris. Very relaxing.

Exceptional to enjoy flowers and calmness. After going shopping in the enchanted city, going and relaxing in this gorgeous Garden will allow you to discover one of the most lovely spots in paris. Full of flowers in a relaxing area.

Amazing garden/Park. I walked through this park and seen many different areas. There is a big water fountain in the center. There is an area to play tennis, volleyball and bothchi ball. For the kids, a playground and small amusement park rides. It's a big park with all you need for a great day.
Beautiful way to spend the day . These gardens were very beautiful and had many places just to relax. Lovely atmosphere. Bathrooms on site, cost .70 euro.

Never Disappoints a lovely place to be. Whenever we are in Paris, which is a lot, we always pay a visit to the gardens, plenty of space, lots of green, ever changing with the seasons, and a great place for a snack and coffee. Its a must in fact.

A kind, friendly, lovely place to chill out. I've loved the Luxembourg Gardens for years. Sure, there are lots of people. But they are having picnics on the grass (with wine from bottles! When was the last time you saw That in the USA?) They are also playing soccer, walking and holding hands. These gardens sneak up on you. You think about the sand paths, then the amazing square trees (ok, topiary), then the huge still pool and wonder when you can go back.

Luxurious haven in the heart of Paris. Beautifully laid out with blossomimg oeleander and an eclectic collection of stautary - famous French quuens being a theme , this is a gem when the sun is shining . The Musee de Luxembourg , housed in a chateau a one end of the park , looks out over formal gardens with a pond in the middleon which small children can sail charming model sailboats hired from the nearby kiosk. There a re planty of seats on which to sit and soak up both sun and atmosphere and it is not as full of tourists as the nearby Tullieres.

Great place to enjoy a sunny day. You can pack your sandwiches and enjoy a sunny day on green fields. There are plenty of place to sit down if you don't want to sit on grass. There is also seperate running track. There was a very nice customed dance show as well. It was like travel back in time!

Lovely place to chill. Beautiful gardens, come here on a warm summer's evening and revel in the happy tranquility. My wife and I liked this place a lot, partly because (unlike some other well known Paris parks) it's not overrun with tourists taking selfies. Seems to be where a lot of the locals go.
Delightful. Beautiful park, popular with locals, wished we could have stayed longer. Lovely mix of formal gardens and shaded areas with lots of chairs.

Beautiful park with playground. Beautiful park with a playground that kids will love The playground isn't free, but not expensive and has a variety of equipment that will appeal to kids from toddlers to 10/11 year olds

A lovely alternative if you don't have time to visit Versailles. This is really beautiful and the location is great if you're staying the the heart of Paris. Walkable from most of the hotels that are near the Latin Quarter/Notre Dame/Louvre area.

Rent a mini-sailboat. We always love to rent the mini-sailboats in the center of this beautiful garden, which you then use a stick to send on its way across the pond, then keep track of it using the country flag and meet it wherever the wind has taken it to push it off again. There's also a fun area where you can pay to race little bikes around a track, and a pay-to-play playground with all kinds of neat things including a zip line. Summer fun in a stunning environment!

Super playarea for young children. Park Luxembourg is superb, take a picnic, access playarea (small entrance fee,) sail play-boats on the pond; many hours can happily be spend. There's anM&S food hall near by for instant and delicious picnic options.

Beautiful Day Outdoors. We wandered all around and sat and had a small picnic snack. There are benches and chairs scattered around and on a sunny day they will be all taken by folks who came out early. If you are able to bring your own small rug to sit on you will stay longer and relax.

Absolutely beautiful place to relax. Stunning garden that is extremely close to the Pantheon and nearby church sights! I spent 2 hours there just relaxing in a chair in the shade by the big fountain. It was so nice just to nap in the sun and watch everyone walk by.The foliage and flowers in bloom made the garden even more beautiful! If you walk further away from the palace you'll find a huge grassy field that many people were sitting on. I saw so many people with picnic cloths and towels on that grassy area, sitting and eating. I wish I had done that!

Beautiful . Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris and well worth a visit when in the city. There is plenty of seating to enjoy the tranquility of the park, lots of beautiful flowers, cafes, ice cream stalls and some toilets (small charge) I visited in summer but can imagine they are wonderful all year round

Beautiful gardens, great picnic spot. With having to pay for every museum it's nice to spend some time in free park. Great gardens, lots of people enjoying picnics. Fun to watch kids playing with sailboats in the pond. Wife enjoyed early morning jogs in the park.
Walk. It was a very pretty and much needed walking excursion for us. We very much enjoyed our time in the garden.
Beautiful gardens for a relaxing stroll. Lovely gardens; not crowded; relaxing stroll and easy to access. Some portions were under construction.
My favourite place in Paris. So, so, soooo beautiful! Summer days at Luxembourg Gardens are fantastic! Try to go just before sunset
Where Parisians come to chill !!. We went to the gardens on a Friday and it was packed with locals enjoying picnics. The cafe inside is OK, but overpriced for mediocre items.

Great way to spend a few hours with children in Paris. There are toy sailboats to rent (we paid 3.5 Euros for 30 minutes)--the wind carries them and every now and then they need a little push. There is a great playground to play on (including a zip line for the 7-9 year old set). There are clean bathrooms (bring a little change, as they aren't free). There are a few places to buy snacks. And see a miniature Statue of Liberty. On a beautiful day in Paris, this is a great destination. Easy walking distance from RER stop. Bakeries, cafes and restaurants easy walking distance (including an Amorino branch to buy gelato on a hot day).
So beautiful!. Definitely rent the little sailboats and chase them around the fountain. The whole family did it and I'm not sure who had more fun--the children or the adults!
Nice park. Try and nab one of the metal deckchairs if you can! We were able to sit and chat overlooking the main building.

A place to relax!. Great open area where you can relax or have a lovely conversation with your love ones, very quite place (at least when I was there) nice gardens, fantastic place to take pictures! You can also have a walk and you will have nice views and find fantastic green areas. Nice place to relax for a couple of hours!

Gorgeous. This is such a beautiful place. The gardens are lovely and the place is breathtaking. There are some places that you can sit but not on the grass...only a couple of areas for that. Carousels and pony rides should you want to do that or just walk around and look at the spectacular fountains.

Just beautiful. IT had been a while since I had been in Paris and I am not sure whether back in the day I had even visited these gardens. My daughter insisted we went and rightly so. They are just lovely and full of history.

Best Paris Gardens. These gardens are our absolute favourite in Paris. Size, proximity, variation they have it all. No matter what angle you enter from there is something to see & enjoy. The best feature, though, is the lake with the kids sailing their rented yachts & the grown-ups driving their remote controlled cruisers. There is history, wonderful botanicals, the Medici Fountaine, terraces, manicured lawns, flower beds, tennis courts, pony rides & lots of seats to relax in. All in the most wonderful of Paris arrondissements. It's a short walk to all the classic destinations of Paris.You have not enjoyed Paris until you visit the Luxembourg Gardens.

Beautiful and free!. a must-see Paris tourist attraction, a nice way to spend and afternoon and snap photos -- while you are there you MUST walk over and see the L'Orangerie -- Claude Monet's family-developed collection of his Giverny murals -- quite an experience
Great place to visit and have lunch. Beautiful gardens. Bring your lunch and relax. Luxembourg Gardens never feel crowded. A great Paris destination.

Beautiful in the evening sunlight. We entered the gardens for a leisurely stroll - it is very calm despite the many people. the views are stunning.Do note the gardens are closed at 9PM and you will be tactfully asked to leave.

Most Beautiful Gardens. In our opinion the best gardens in all of Paris. Serene, beautiful, uncluttered. There are fantastic statues, a play park for children, great strolling around. The senate building is adjacent to the Gardens, and also very beautiful. One must also see the Medici Fountain, which is quite opulent.
Still very nice. A good place to languish away a very nice day. Very pleasant surrounding neighborhoods. Easy to reach via many Metro lines.

Beautiful gardens close to the Pantheon near the Left Bank. Amazing Sunday afternoon spent in these gardens, watching dancing in the bandstand with dancers dressed in beautiful 1900's costumes, people playing boule, model boats on the lake and a lovely Medici fountain. Great way to spend a few relaxing hours on a sunny day.

Peaceful and Beautiful. I really enjoyed these Gardens. In my opinion much better than Versailles or the Tuileries Gardens. Not as crowded here. Plenty of space to wander around. Statues everywhere. Watch everyone playing on the tennis courts. But the main attraction was the "Palace" and the surrounding gardens. Just beautiful with newly planted flowers and the fountains. You could spend hours walking around here. Refreshing.Not particularly crowded this day.

Beautiful gardens, but watch out for the runners ..... These gardens are spectacular. We visited on a recent weekday evening at around 8:30 p.m. The Medici Fountain is especially beautiful and peaceful. You want to sit down and never get up. The only negative was that there seemed to be a lot of runners that evening and you had to be careful to avoid getting mowed down on the paths around the perimeter.

A Lovely Afternoon. We enjoyed a lovely afternoon in Luxembourg Gardens, reading, drawing, and people watching. There are many benches and chairs to relax in. the chairs are movable so you can enjoy some sunshine or some shade. The gardens are beautiful and the people watching is top notch. We do not have young children, but there were some cute pony rides nearby and some play areas. There is also a large grassy area that was completely covered in people soaking up the sun. The fountain is also a beautiful, shaded, cool area to relax, and the gardens are free to enter.

Luxembourg Gardens. Visited the Gardens based on reviews by tripadvisor. Didn't see the hype about this place. It was extremely crowded and dusty as people were dragging their feet along the pathway that was sandy. Very few flowers to see. It was just average

Excellent and inspiring particularly on a Sunday Morning!. Staying nearby, we visited this park on a Sunday morning and it was a true inspiration - in fact it was the surprising highlight of what was an overall disappointing holiday! The park was packed with people running round the edge, people doing all sorts of physical activities, Pilates, Yoga, Chi Gong, Tennis, Group sports competitions ......... and on the boating pond were the most beautiful yachts imaginable that you could hire for a reasonable price. Chairs to sit and watch are FREE, and there are nice cafe's all around. The only thing to be wary of was the 'entry of the wild horses of the apocalypse' - ie the ponies that are used to provide horse rides round the park. It seemed they are dropped off the lorry each day and then are left to gallop down to where they collect passengers - it looked HIGHLY dangerous but was quite exciting!Oh and the trees & flowers are also beautiful! - WELL WORTH A VISIT!

Wondeful spot for relief from the city . This was a lovely park for all ages. Playgrounds, gardens, picnic areas, cafes, and a beautiful palace.Walk around and take in the statues of famous queens and heriones from French and Parisian history.

Morning at the Luxembourg Gardens. Easy to get to using the RER. Lovely gardens, where you can rent sail boats for the fountain or just lounge around and take in the views of the gardens. The gardens are used by local runners and other outdoor activities.

Great retreat in Paris. It was a very hot day in July 2016, and the Metro as well as my hotel did not offer air conditioning. In order to find a cooler place, I bought cake, and spend an hour under a tree, it was quiet, lovely, and a great escape from the heat. At nine PM the guard asks everybody to leave, another day has ended and tomorrow is a new day.The flower beds are nice, trees magnificent, there are playgrounds for children, a wonderful place to relax after a long day in the city

Lovely Garden. The Luxembourg Gardens is within walking distance from Notre Dame cathedral. Just take a stroll down to the gardens.It's a nice relaxing place to hang out with the kids. There are a couple of water bodies in front of the Palace. Just chilled out there and let the kids run wild. The weather in May was balmy enough for us to enjoy our time here.

Visit to Luxembourg Gardens. Wonderful place to spend an afternoon with children! The sailboats and playground are both terrific. Our children loved the sailboat rental- there was a nice breeze and they spent a half hour racing their boats. The playground is fully fenced which is great. You must pay a small fee to enter, but it is well worth it.

fun and relaxing green space in Paris . What a nice place to enjoy nature, the gardens, the fountains and lakes, the sculptures, the flowers, If you go early it is quieter, but even later when it is packed is a very enjoyable place...and if you go with kids they will love it too for sure, there is pleanty of activities for them too.
Beautiful garden stroll. Perfect garden for strolling or sitting on a bench and reading a book. Beautiful pond with boats to race for children. Ample area for picnic lunches.
Great Place to Have a Picnic. Sit and relax in this beautiful garden. I really enjoy the water features. The flowers are wonderful too.

The ultimate parisian Square. My Grand Mother and Aunt were taking me there when I was a kid... Tennis playing, Poney Riding and Sailing boats on the little lake in front of the French Senate, what else George?
Beautiful!!. My kids love it! they can play and run and enjoy a real Parisian experience while they enjoy an amazing place

Very special place - cultivated, colourful and calming! - make time to visit. The gardens are a really place, the white gravel contrasts beautifully with the perfectly manicured lawns and urns of pink geraniums and petunias with the palace behind. The numerous deckchairs allow people to just relax and enjoy - it was interesting how many were chatting and reading and how few people were on their phones! The flower beds are very formal but beautifully maintained - really stunning. Huge topiaried trees at one end look somewhat surreal. A definite MUST SEE, highly recommended.

Just beautiful !🇫🇷. What a beautiful garden. It is amazing. Nice place to have a walk , exercise , relax, just take pictures , have a snack at one of the little cafes or just enjoy the beauty of the gardens. Kids friendly.

Stunning!. Couldn't believe this was right in the centre of Paris.It was only about a 10 minute walk from our Hotel in Montparnasse.Helped that the sun was shining and there wasn't a cloud in the sky,but the layout is breathtaking. Was jealous of those who had brought their picnics and were planning to spend the day there. Gardens are beautiful,pathways are immaculate. Just a joy to walk round. The Palais itself is stunning.

Fabulous Sunday activity. Experience Paris as the locals do and visit Luxembourg Gardens on a Sunday! If you prefer to be alone, visit early in the week. Sundays are full of spectacle and fun as locals bring a picnic, wine and grab chairs with shade and sun options to spend the afternoon talking and visiting. In July and August, the flowers are in full bloom and the beauty of this place is worth the visit.

Garden for Lovers. Can see why a guy would bring his girl friend here to propose as we witnessed. It is just a beautiful well maintained garden with a relaxed family atmosphere. Just grab a seat and people watch. Watch the kids playing with their sailboats. Watch people get there picture taken in front of the fountain. Watch young lovers walking hand in hand. Just a cool place to hangout.

A place of beauty on a warm summers day. We found ourselves in Luxembourg Gardens and did not regret it. Don't try and walk the entire place, you will end up with sore feet. Pick one section and do it leisurely. We bought a "French" snack -Crepes, black coffee and Perrier - pulled up a chair and watched the world drift by. Wonderful!

Nice spot to relax. Nice area to relax in. They have loads of chairs available for free so you can take a seat and enjoy the gardens. There is a small café area or you can pop to a supermarket across the road to get snacks, as long as its not a Sunday! In case you don't know, Paris shuts down on Sundays. I did not know...

Beautiful and very relaxing. We stayed for three hours here on a hot Sunday morning in August. The park was quieet at first but towards noon started filling up. The plants and ponds are beautiful and well kept, and the park is quite diversified so you will find something to your taste. I hopped over to Dalloyau on Place Rostand and bought a bottle of Champagne and a few savory littleties which were consumed in the shade. That's the real life :-)!
Lovely refuge in a busy city. Lovely to sit and watch the motorized little boats and lovely flowers. A beautiful place to visit and relax.

Blooming Beautiful.... Walked over from Petite Palace through area surrounding gardens and worth it for walk alone ..gardens are surrounded by quaint streets beautiful little shops selling everything from flowers to the largest chocolate eclairs we had ever seen ..plenty of places for cool drinks and eats.. gardens were ...magical. Such a family orientated space..lovely to see. A boating lake for kids and big kids alike ..beautiful plants and flowers. Lots of seating to enjoy sunshine and while away a few hours ...
Beautiful green space in Paris!. Beautiful area to walk or picnic. Not far from St. Sulpice Church and there is a small Statue of Liberty, along with gardens and a pond.

Beautiful Gardens. What a great place to have a Parisienne Picnic and just relax....like the French. Spent a lovely afternoon taking in the flowers, people watching, and food! Will return on every visit ♥️

Beautiful!!. Visited here this morning and wow! Never fail us as bern before but simply stunning! Came early and place was quiteish but by the time we left 3 hours later it was packed! Little sit round on of the ponds and a lovely walk up to The Louvre made it a pleasant few hours :)

The statues are funny.. Straight lines, and overwhelming bouquets of plants and flowers. Children playing with boats at the bassin. Funny-looking French writer statues. Park rangers reminding people not to go on the grass. And pick-nicking people all around. Cosy and fun.

Worth a visit. Huge park space for the kids to run off some energy. The play park in the centre was 2€50 per child but well worth the money. The kids had a few hours of playing and enjoying themselves whilst the adults sat just outside the gate enjoying a well earned restThere's also a little merry go round tooThe gardens are breathtaking and plenty of trees to shelter us from the sun!The tube is only a few minutes walk from the park entrance
Loved it. Cool place to relax if the weather is nice. Great people watching! You can really take a break from sightseeing marathon and just chill here for few hours...

Lots of local families are here, so great people watching. The garden and fountains are beautiful, but the fun for us was to watch the families with their children playing in the park. This park has paths, a diversity of plants, tennis, children's play areas, and more. We were here on our last day in Paris and it was well worth the metro trip.

Downright lovely. This is a beautiful garden for a morning jog or afternoon stroll. Parisians and tourists alike lounge on sunny days, lending to the carefree atmosphere. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here.

Superb. Really nice gardens, there are place to sit and relax near the pond as well. Quite big and impressive gardens - with palms and sculptures around. Fantastic place to sit relax and enjoy the nature!

Don't overlook this gem.. The beautifully manicured garden spreads like a elegant carpet before the Luxembourg Palace. Hedges, flowers...even palm trees provide a natural refuge from the surrounding city. Do bring something to read (and a baguette to eat) in the reclining metal chairs that dot the grounds.

Very pretty, yet very crowded. I love gardens, flowers, plants, parks; I love the "outside." This is a very nice place to go with your family or your friends. The only disadvantage is that during the summer season it is very crowded.

WOW... what a beautiful place. We bought a few baguettes from the 2016 award winning bakery nearby and strolled through Luxembourg Gardens eating the best bread I've ever had...We stopped by to sail a boat on the pond and enjoyed the beautiful gardens....well worth a visit...

Great place to chill. Jumped on a bus near the pont neuf (27 or 85 I think) and 10/15 minutes later was at Luxembourg Gardens. A beautiful park, loads of places to sit in the sun or shade, in the park or by water. There is a brioche doree as well as various other fast food outlets nearby so you can get a picnic and make an afternoon of it. I really enjoyed a few hours reading my book, a nice alternative to Tuileries, feel like a Parisien!

Nice but not great. The gardens are nice but we did not find them a must see attraction. It was nice to stroll around and people watch, have some confection and relax. If you have a limited time in Paris you can skip

Lovely place to relax and enjoy a break . This was about a 10 min walk from our hotel so we decided to walk over. We sat on some of the many chairs provided and watched people go by and move their boats along the small pond. Plenty of benches in the shade and plenty in the sun if you want. Quiet, peaceful and a very nice garden. Worth a stop to relax and get away from the busy streets of Paris if you're in the area.

Right in the heart of the city. If you want to have a nice relaxing walk right in the heart of the city, try the Luxembourg Gardens. It depends on what time of year you visit to what you will find here. Our last visit was in November and a lot of the trees were bare, but the gardens are still beautiful. The Luxembourg palace is beautiful building where the French senate is housed and it sits beautifully amongst the garden.
Lovely. I had a tour of St. Chapelle and Notre Dame with Blue Bike Tours. The tour guide was excellent! He was well spoken, funny and very informative. I would recommend this to anyone!
Really cute. I didn't spend much time here but still I had a very nice afternoon! The gardens are really big, nice and clean. The flowers are wonderful and there are a lot of places where to relax.

Romantic. This is quite a beautiful place to walk through, to sit or lie down and just relax. We have been here a number of times over the years, and love it. You can enjoy the views, the water, the passers-by, the weather. Lovely trees and lots of plants and beautiful flowers to make you feel you are in a kind of paradise.

Paris in Bloom. I rented an apartment not far from the Luxembourg Gardens and my 14 year old daughter and I spent a couple hours one afternoon strolling around the grounds. It was the height of springtime in Paris and everything was in full bloom...absolutely beautiful! There are fountains and plenty of places to picnic or merely just sit and people watch. I think the gardens are a definite walk through if you have the time while staying in Paris!

A great place to relax amid the energy of Paris.. We ducked into the Luxembourg Gardens after walking all day in Paris. This is a haven of peace, beauty, classic architecture, and occasionally live music. Grab a chair around the lake and take in the tranquility. It is a good mid day break/refresher.

Visually Stunning. The Luxembourg Gardens are so beautiful. We strolled through the gardens and really found it to be a treasure for the senses. The colors in bloom of the floral beds and the variety of greens of the lawn and avenue of trees was visually stunning. The eye really has a lot to take in and it's good to take your time here. A couple of hours was enough!I would really recommend this to anyone traveling to Paris even if you are here for a few days like we were.
One of my favorite sites in Paris!. Luxembourg Palace should be one of the places a traveller puts on the "must do" list. It is so relaxing and gorgeous.

Vast garden in Paris. The Luxembourg Garden is a vast garden (23 hectares as per Wikipedia) with lawns, flower beds, statues etc. The seat of the French senate, Luxembourg Palace, is situated in the same premises. The garden is so vast, that it can be accessed from different roads and metro stations. The place is visited by locals for picnics, jogging and general relaxation. From a tourist point of view, it depends on whether you have spare time on your hand. If you are visiting the Notre Dame or Sainte-Chapelle and have adequate time on your hand you can schedule a visit. If not, nothing much missed either.

Beautiful and pretty gardens in town.. We spent a few hours here, and it was very relaxing to sit under the trees, and just watch the gardens. The little kids had pony rides, and carousels etc. to entertain them, and there was a pool in which one could rent toy sail boats to play with.

Meander a bit, and sit to people-watch. Break away from the hustle and bustle of Paris street life in the wonderful and varied atmosphere of the Luxembourg Gardens on the Left Bank. Watch children sail boats in the pond, savor an ice cream, get in the shade (if a hot day) and just watch the passing folks....Sometimes there's a special art exhibit in the gallery building, so you can check that out, unless you're tired of "all that art"....Mostly just find a quiet spot to sit and assimilate your experience of Paris.
Beautiful. This is a great place to visit when you are walking to the catacombs. It is just beautiful and has many places to walk and is great to people watch.

Blooms were suffering from heavy rains but otherswise Luxembourg Gardens is Beautiful. Trip Advisor will not publish my "One Star" comments on poor hotels and restaurants but I did find Luxembourg Gardens a lovely place to spend a half day. Stay away from Aruba though.

A Slice of French Life. We visited the Gardens on a Sunday afternoon and really enjoyed everything we saw. The Gardens themselves are immaculate with beautiful walks under avenues of trees and colourful beds of flowers. Children sail boats on a pond, groups picnic on (selected, carefully marked) lawns and there was a classical pianist giving a concert to a very large audience sitting on chairs in the shade.It was a lovely way to while away a couple of hours in a truly French atmosphere.
Lovely garden. Really lovely garden 20m walk from notredam cathedral. It has lots of places to rest and enjoy the beautiful flowers.

Beautiful Gardens. Walked through this lovely park with gorgeous flowers, statues of famous women and lots of places to sit. We even saw a bride and groom posing for pictures. A great quiet place to unwind, get your exercise and perhaps read a book.

Early morning run. Okay many reviewers have mentioned how beautiful these gardens are... so I won't go there. They are amazing.If you are a runner, go early (from 7:30am). A must for any runner, walker, etc...

A beautiful oasis in busy Paris. We always make a point to visit these gardens on our frequent trips to Paris. Lovely walks around the gardens and also stop to see the amateur skippers sailing their miniature boats in the centrepiece lake - my favourite is the submarine with the French flag!!Well worth a visit on a sunny day and you may be lucky to hear a concert by a local band at the bandstand near the entrance.
Great Plce. We roe bikes to the gardens. My wife went for a run I watched a school jazz band play. Fantastic. don't miss this spot.

Gorgeous grounds, lots to see. We came across the gardens on our walk through Paris. Filled with people, joggers, children and those just out for a stroll the grounds are quite beautiful. If you need a place to stop and rest, people watch or just decompress, this is a good spot. The fountains are also quite lovely.

Beautiful garden. We enjoyed our stroll through the gardens, very well organized and kept. Stunning grounds with mature chestnut trees, magnificent statues, and beautiful fountains and flower beds. Very calming and refreshing. The kids loved it too, apparently rich on spoils for their Pokemon Go game.

Amazingly beautiful gardens. This is a really beautiful place to visit and spend a few quiet moments enjoying the gardens. There were a lot of people reading, painting and enjoying a picnic lunch when we visited.

unbelievably beautiful. We went on a cloudy day in early August and the crowds were less. Everywhere you turn is another perfect picture. enjoyed the atmosphere and the beauty. Packed a lunch and then ate it overlooking the Seine. Perfect day!
Beautiful place to spend a couple hours. . This is a wonderful part of Paris that really comes to life in the spring and summer time when the flowers and trees are blooming.
Where Paris comes to play!. The Luxembourg Gardens were beautiful on a sunny summer day. Many locals were having picnics on the grass and enjoying soaking up the sun. A great place for a wander!

Beautiful location. We ended our trip to Paris here, just sitting in the beautiful gardens, *not* drinking champagne. ;-)
Wonderful setting for a picnic, and one of the highlights of the trip.

Peaceful distraction. This was a nice place to come during the afternoon after walking about the city all day. It's a good opportunity to have a few minutes rest and peace without hearing traffic and bumping into people.

Great atmosphere. Take a picnic or book. Huge gardens bustling with Parisiens and tourists relaxing and playing. Feels like a genuine Paris experience. Great atmosphere. it has a quieter section with sculptures and many chairs with couples chatting and people reading, a playground for kids in the middle, several stretches of lawn for a picnic and then the beautiful palace and fountain area. Plan on an hour just to see the gardens, more time if you want to go to the museum (s?).

Stunning Gardens. These gardens are extensive and beautiful. so many locals just go there to read and have lunch. Loads of seating all around and there's are very reasonable priced cafe in the middle. Lovely walk and great photos
Its beautiful, but dirty sometimes. It has a great garden and it is at a great location at the city. The only problem is that sometimes it is very dirty, with bottles, cigarets, condoms everywhere.
Picture perfect. My niece had her wedding performed in the gardens it was a beautiful day in nearly unbelievable surroundings

Beautiful Park. We went to Luxembourg park with kids ages 11, 10, and 7. We rented the little sail boat (3.50) and the kids played with it just like the other Parisian kids in front of the Luxembourg castle. There are food stands all around the park offering snacks and drinks. There is a great playground for the kids (it's paid, 2 euro per kid). We stayed in an apartment close to the park and came back to the park twice. It's a nice and serene place to unwind from a busy day in Paris.

Beautiful family friendly garden in Paris. We went here based on going to the playground. You have to pay for entry to go the playground. There are plenty of places to sit on chairs but you can't sit on the grass. The gardens are beautiful in Summer. There is a great cafe near the playground. We got some baguettes with various fillings and they yum. Even though it was a weekend when we visited it wasn't crowded. I really enjoyed this garden.

A boating experience. Gardens in Paris are nice. You can mingle with the locals and relax on one of the chairs around. Here however you can also sail a small sailing boat in the middle pond together with your children. A nice experience to do together.

A favorite!. This is a favorite park of my girlfriend and I. Probably one of our favorites in the world. The gardens are so beautiful and we loved watching the tiny sailboats on the water. It's a great place to relax in or walk around. Love the amazing palm trees that fit right in for some strange reason. I could spend a whole day here doing nothing! It's a shame we didn't spend enough time here on our last trip.
Gorgeous!. Charming, beautiful park, with fountains, gorgeous flowers, many shade trees, and statues of famous women from French history.

Beautiful Oasis in Paris. This garden is a lovely spot to stop in the middle of your business touring in Paris. I would recommend stopping here for a picnic lunch or an afternoon snack. There are lovely flowers, manicured gardens and beautiful statues to admire.

Beautiful gardens. We ran into the gardens by accident while out walking. These gardens are absolutely beautiful. It was Bastille Day and the park was full of people relaxing & enjoying themselves. Pay toilets available as well.
Perfect. For a rest / picnic this is just off perfect. The gardens are perfectly maintained and I would recommend even a five minute stop.

Vast, formal gardens. Check out the "hidden" fountain to the side of the palace.. My 8 year old grandson spent an hour playing with the boats. Great fun to watch the kids. Huge park with live entertainment during the summer.

Fantastic for people watching . Went here with my new husband am with a small bottle of wine and some pastries. The weather was excellent and everyone was so relaxed as they sat either on the chairs that were dotted about or on the permitted setting grass area. The gardens are beautiful and tranquil it really is the best place to and recharge your batteries and just relax and watch the world go by.

Unexpected find!. We just happened to stumble across these beautiful grounds! There was some live music playing, ponds for your children to sail small boats around, a cafe for grabbing a bite or a few glasses of wine to sit and enjoy the beautiful day. If you're looking for a nice place to people watch and enjoy the day, this a great place to do it!
Charming Gardens. Took an early evening stroll here, absolutely magical at this time of day. The garden itself has many different areas to explore and the buildings themselves are magestic.
Sailing boats always a winner. Took some friends with young kids here after lunch, and they hired toy sailing boats to sail on the pond. Perfect afternoon's entertainment.

Wow! Just wow!. One thing that is advantage when you're travelling in Paris are the places are just near to each other. came there after I visited Louvre and Orsay. Make sure bring some water if you're going for a walk. A family picnic would be nice too.
Relaxing garden . Luxembourg garden have very beautiful flowers in different verity,it's tree cutting style with designed shape also attractive.it's very good for relax also.

Love this place. This is one of my favourite spots in Paris. Beautiful gardens, trees, sculptures, chairs everywhere to sit, read, chat with friends or just hang out. Lots of joggers. Statues of the queens of France are also fun to discover as you walk.
Elegant and welcoming. The nicest garden (park) in Paris. Beautifully laid out with the palace in full view. Lots of paths that wander through the park and an abundance of free chairs to sit on.

Green Paradise in the middle of the city. We took a stroll here early in the day, around 10 am, we were on our hired cycles so it was really easy to park right outside the park. This is a really pretty garden with areas of shade and lot of sun too, there are tennis courts, a fountain, cafe, and plenty of place to sit and relax or paths to stroll or jog. Would definitely recommend a visit here though a bit early in the day.

Lovely place for a stroll. Stayed near these gardens and found them to be a lovely place to stroll in the late afternoon. The palace wasn't open and it was heavily guarded but the facade was lovely to admire

Great resting spot for the aft.. Must see on a Paris walking trip. Always great to relax in Luxembourg Gardens and take a break from the business of Stites and surroundings. We spent the late evening at one of the surrounding cafés and then rested as the sun was setting in the park.
Beautiful gardens; nice for strolling. This is not a must-see for a sort trip to Paris. But if you have 5-6 days very worthwhile. The gardens are lovely and full of activity.

A beautiful retreat in the heart of Paris, fun for the whole family!. Luckily I stayed within steps of this beautiful park right on St. Michel, so I got to visit it often. Aside from a very welcome green space, the park offers pony riding and toy boat rental that children can launch in the pond. It also has a very popular outdoor cafe with surprisingly good food, the quiche and roast chicken in particular. We went on a very hot and breezy day, so there was a bit of a sandstorm, so we simply walked to nearby Gertrude Stein's apartment, just blocks from the park. A great park for the whole family!

Wonderful for kids. This was a perfect kid centered break during our longer stay in Paris. The sail boat rentals are cheap and lots of fun and there is a huge playground in the back. While the park is free, almost everything else (including the playground) has a fee associated with it. They are reasonable, maybe $2 over child for the playground and $4 for 30 minutes with the boats, but it can add up for a family of you aren't expecting it.

We loved Paris! Felt totally Safe! Enjoyed visiting Le Marais Wonderful SHops.....charming eateries....Art...... Despite an awful experience at a 'Room in Paris', (we left after two hours and checked into an IBIS down the Street.....We thoroughly enjoyed the sites....Walked for hours along the Seine, visited Le Marais and had a lovely dinner. The next day we headed to the Rail Station and left for Avignon and a Riverboat Cruise through the South of France!

Huge park near city centre. Like many others city parks we have visited outside the UK this one is very well used by the locals and there are loads of free chairs provided. This park is notable for the series of statues around of notable women in French history. Well worth a visit.

Heavenly!. I feel like a Parisian when I go here. The gardens are gorgeous. There are recreational areas, playground areas, running areas, a water fountain, and much much more. I could have walked around there every day during our visit. Lovely
Amazing gardens. Nice gardens to walk around, very easy to get there either tube, train or walking short walk from St. Michel fountain.

Beautiful, Relaxing. Planned a respite from our museum going in Paris to spend some time at Luxembourg Gardens. Medici Fountain simply beautiful, watching children guide their sailboats across the boat pond mesmerizing, and just strolling through the gardens admiring the colorful flowers and bronzes was a welcome way to spend the afternoon.

Green Escape from the Noise of the City. Relaxing park filled with fountain, tennis courts, statues, an indoor/outdoor cafe, plenty of chairs and benches. And royal architecture, a place previously for French kings. Good to find a place to relax away from the bustle of the Boulevard Saint-Michel.

Loved it ..miss it. It's beyond any park on the planet....amazing calm and fun
I sailed a pond boat...watched tennis....walked through the statue gardens...watched the patanque games...just the best of times

Relaxing Visit!. We went about 3 in the afternoon. The park was crowded, but we did not have trouble getting a chair by the lake. It is nice to people watch. I liked watching the kids sail boats across the lake. You can rent one by the half hour. Take a picnic and enjoy.
Very nice!. We stopped at the Gardens right before departing to the airport for one last Paris experience. Beautiful place to see and enjoy the outdoors!

Nice enough but not what I call fantastic gardens. These gardens like a lot of Paris gardens, has a lot of gravel and not a lot of grass. What grass exists is well manicured but not to be sat on. The flower gardens are pretty enough but not enough of them. There are however, lots of trees and lots of chairs and benches to sit on which is good if you want a rest from being a tourist.

Beautiful Gardens. Grab lunch from a nearby Patisserie and find a shady spot under the trees in these beautiful gardens to enjoy it. If you want some peace and quiet while in the heart of Paris during the day, come here. The flowers particularly in summer look magnificent. There are well formed paths to walk on and chairs to sit on throughout the garden/park.

Beautiful! Lovely kids playground towards the back.. Such a beautiful and peaceful stop. A must see! As always, it helps to have a little history of the garden available to you via a guidebook so you can appreciate the history of it all. It is a huge beautiful space. We travelled with our 2 children and enjoyed the large playground towards the back (small charge to enter) and pony rides (also a charge) but the kids enjoyed every moment. Take a moment and sit in the green chairs to relax and enjoy it all.

A hidden gem in the heart of Paris. Take a wander up Rue St Michel and find this sprawling park which is just as beautiful but a lot quieter than the Tuileries and other city centre parks, also look out for the statues in the grounds as many are replicas of those found in Versailles and the Louvre
Tricky to find but worth the walk. Lovely and peaceful area to sit and relax and get away from the hullabaloo of the city for a while. the flowers are beautiful.
Great place on a hot day. Paris loose equivalent of Central Park. Wish they had more places to get a cold drink. Loved all of the nice chairs through out gardens.

Colors and boats and trees and beauty . What I find amazing about Paris is how well kept everything is. It is clearly loved by tourists and Parisians alike. A walk through these gardens is like taking a step back in time to a better, quieter more beautiful land, where flowers and fountains and children playing with sailboats on the small lake and not with their cellphones is the norm. What a lovely walk.

Thankful we stumbled on this beautiful place. My husband and I literally stumbled upon this lovely place on our way from Saint-Sulpice to the Pantheon. I am so glad we were able to experience this gorgeous garden. We enjoyed watching all the different sorts of athletics going on in the park. We sat in the shade of beautiful trees and enjoyed a break from the heat while we looked at the palace. We then wandered over to the pond and watched the families launching boats and playing. It was a beautiful way to spend some quiet and down time in the bustling city of Paris.I highly recommend you take the time to unwind and recharge in this beautiful garden.

What's big deal?. We were expecting it to be a nice botanical garden but it turned out to be a decent but dusty garden with only few varieties of plants. Only one strip on grass was open for public and my gosh that was filled with people like ants. On a hot summer day, it was totally not worth it. It took more than an hour on a bus to get here and two changes on metro line to get back from here. Come on Paris, this can't be your #3.

Always a favorite spot. I always stay at a hotel near the gardens. I like to start and end my day here. Lovely place to take a nice walk or sit and read and enjoy a drink. Great people watching as well. My children enjoy playing basketball on the court here as well.
Lovely Gardens!. At the suggestion of a friend of ours, we made the trip to the Luxembourg Gardens... Lovely spot and they do let you lay down on the grass!!!

Beautiful gardens, perfect for a peaceful stroll. Would definitely recommend setting some time aside to have a stroll through these gardens. It's full of pretty flowers and it has a nice and relaxed atmosphere. There is plenty of seating so you can enjoy a picnic, read your book or simply sit there and admire the surroundings. We stayed for around an hour walking along the various paths, but you could stay for as little or as long as you want.
Great place to unwind. . If you are looking for a place to have some peace and quiet in the middle of Paris this is it. Have a light picnic or just sit and read a book. Two cafes on the premises.

To chill during your visit. Your visiting the Latin quarter. You are doing some shopping... It's sunny and you have walk a lot today?This park is perfect to chill and relax a bit when you just want to feel on other Parisian spirit...This garden is huge with seats you can feel the peace with the flowers and tree, and also see some joggers or tennis player. Your are far away from the craziness of downtown but you are in!!
Stroll by. Strolled through on our way to the Eiffel tower, a lot of nice flowers but we're not really flower persons, so we didn't stay that long.

visit for hours!. We gathered picnic provisions from a nearby Eric Kayser bakery and settled in: lunch, a wander through the gardens, watching the boats, paying a couple of euro for the kids to play in the playground (while we watched from outside). Beautiful gardens. Don't be in a hurry when you visit.

Pleasant Atmosphere, Come to Relax. The best advice I ever received about visiting Paris was to: take a walk, eat some food, relax in the gardens, eat some more food, and walk some more. Not entirely poetic as one could be when discussing Paris, but the point is to relax. There are so many touristy sights to see in Paris, and they are spectacular! But what is also worthy of enjoying are the gardens, and there are MANY to choose from. This one is wonderful for kids as there are toy-boats for rent for children to sail in the petit basin (not super cheap, but not outrageously priced, either).The grounds are much bigger than you'd imagine, and has an entirely different feel than the regal Tuileries Gardens next to the Louvre. Bring a picnic blanket, buy an ice cream cone from the many sellers, and sit alongside locals as they bathe in the sunlight.Nearest Metro Stops: - (RER B) stop is Luxembourg -(RER B) stop is Port-Royale- Metro, line 4/10 stop is Odeon (this one is a bit further, but not bad)

Don't really know the origin of the name but the gardens are beautiful in a Parisian way. This was among the first gardens I visited in Europe. And it still stands among the best I've seen till date after seeing quite a few. There a lot of things if you were to spot the details in there. There is a small duck house which looks fascinating, right in the middle of a pond. The columns of well cut tall trees, the people who are sketching there at all times of the day won't leave you alone.

Lovely gardens but have to pay to use the children's play park 😏. Beautiful gardens, v well kept. Lovely band stand. Expensive Ice Creams. Lovely children's playground but you have to pay to use it - children and adults! But a lovely space nonetheless.

Astonishingly beautiful historic setting. Perfect spot to enjoy warm summer afternoon. Can ve crowded in weekends. Make sure to catch something to bite and cold drinks before setting up next to the the water pools.
Beautiful garden!. Stayed a block away and walked thru several times. It was beautiful and so well kept, even in April. Can't wait to go back

Beautiful. We walked through the gardens and then stopped at one of the many seats to share the meal we picked up at the local bakery. There were lots of people just enjoying the day. The gardens are amazing!
Pleasant garden. Nice atmosphere, quiet stroll through garden. Quintessential France......wife n I will always remember.

Beautiful park. This beautiful park with many fountains and flowerbeds is perfect for relaxing. There are many chairs in which you can sit back with a book or get some work down on a laptop. Also clean & tidy. You can see the Eiffel tower too!
The garden is great. it's quite big and very beautiful the unexpectation thing that I have seen is I came across a lot of hot guy there :-)
BEAUTIFUL!!!!. this public park is stunning! there are many cafés around and you can sit for a beautiful pic nic. My 8 year old had a lot of fun playing and taking pictures.

So peaceful - gardens are beautiful. A leisurely walk through these free gardens is a must when your in Paris. The formation of the gardens and colour are spectacular. Statues form a beautiful addition. The ponies looked so tired and hot the day we were there so our children didn't go for a ride. When we attended the play grounds, there is a charge for both of them with restricted times. There's only one section where people are sitting and laying on the lovely manicured lawns, otherwise people just sit on the one of hundreds of chairs, which are on the dirt walkway. It's still worth a visit.
Simply beautiful.. One of my favourite jardin in the world. Walk along the garden and enjoy the tranquility of big trees and beautiful flowers.

Beautiful greenery. This place is a pleasure to stroll around and admire the magnificance of this great city. Plenty to explore with sculptures ,fountains , hedges , flowers and the Luxumbourg Senat building

Take a breath. While there are numerous cafes right at the entrance to the park, grab some food to go from one of the many places along St. Michel and go have a picnic in the park. Take pictures of each other imitating the poses of the statues. Clean public bathrooms too ( will cost you 0.5€).

Beautiful FREE gardens.. Lots of people enjoying these beautiful free gardens. Well kept with in walking distance from many other sites. Great place to relax for a few minutes before blasting off to a new Musee or church.

Joyous!. My favorite park in Paris. Particularly enjoyable from noon on when free toy sailboats are available for children to sail in the central pond. Wonderful variety of spaces for almost every activity.

Breathtaking!. Make sure you get over to the left bank during your visit to Paris . And when you do treat yourself to Luxenbourg Gardens.A little bit of paradise can be found at the Luxenbourg .. It was in full bloom during my July visit and it was beyond beautiful..It's elegant , peaceful, fragrant and has something for everyone. A perfect way to just relax and enjoy . Cest Magnifique!
NICE WALK !!!!!. My family and I went to take a walk and sat on the benches drinking water and chatting ,had a good time here enjoying the view !!!

Run, walk, read, eat.... Lots of runners, lots of walkers, lots of readers, lots of people eating on the lawn....This is a place for everyone who wants to grab a quiet moment in the middle of a busy city. The park is quiet, gorgeous, and open to those who want to steal away for a moment in the middle of the city.

Beautiful and peaceful. We walked from the centre of town to this park and sat there for a while enjoying the view before it started to rain!! On a sunny day it will be beautiful place to spend a couple of hours there, there were coffee shops there and also nearby. There's plenty of space for children to run around and luckily they are not charging for the deck chairs, yet!

Beautiful, Grande Park ! . This park is the perfect place for a walk, nap, picnic and more ! So simple in its design with gorgeous flowers and trees and sculptures. I love the fountain with the sailing toy boats ! Perfect place to sit a spell !
Beautiful Afternoon. Lovely way to relax and unwind in beautiful surroundings........stroll or sit and enjoy beautiful gardens and fountains.

A nice park in a great city. This is a wonderful spot of green in Paris, an easy walk from the Latin Quarter or the Montparnasse district (where we were staying). Beautiful grounds, fun little pond with kids sailing simple sailboats, plenty of chairs all around that you can move and cluster as needed, and anchored by the lovely Luxembourg Palace. A great place to take a breather during all-day walking and sightseeing.

amazing free place !. This park is wonderful. You are in the center of Paris but it's a peaceful place to walk away, eat ice cream or just take a break.Around this park : Panthéon, Musée de Cluny, Saint-Michel...
Pleasant surprise. I have been to Paris many times but never been to the gardens they were a very pleasant surprise . Enjoyed a walk around in the beautiful sun

Beautiful Park for a Walk or Lunch. The whole area is a very popular place for walking, sitting, eating, and just enjoying a beautiful day. There are several places to eat or get a drink (a little pricey, though). There is a pond where you can rent and captain miniature sail boats. We where there when everything was in bloom. There's plenty of shade and benches. I recommend it.

Good foot resting spot. Charming gardens, well laid out, almost gravel free, and plenty of benches to sit comfortably upon whilst easing shoes off feet, and tucking into the saved baguette! The Louvre can get exhausting and this is a lovely lunchbreak... hardly ANY noise!
Must see. One of the best park in paris, it is located just next to the "Musée du Louvre" and after a long journey it s a best place to have a rest.
Beautiful and romantic place.. Photos talk by themselves. I advice to visit in summer (June/July/August/September). More sunny and better weather. You'll more appreciate it.

Relaxing. A trip to Paris is sometimes too busy and you hardly have time to sit down from one museum to the next. Instead, walk around Luxembourg gardens and sit down in the morning or late afternoon for a picnic. Great area with plenty of beauty, people watching, and quiet right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of downtown Paris. It's a great break and excellent way to slow down and just enjoy. Highly recommend it.

Nice causy place. Luxembourg Gardens are a really nice place to hangout and have a break. Little stands to buy some snacks or juice. There is a small lake there where you can sometime see miniature sailing boats. Nice place when there is sun.

Lovely day- park, palace,picnic, playground . We had a fabulous day at the Jardin de Luxembourg. An easy walk from our accommodation we stopped at the market on the way to get picnic supplies. The garden is beautiful just to wander around, and is obviously well utilized by the locals with many runners/ walkers etc.The playground is fantastic and well worth the small charge to get in. And the boats on the pond provided us with a fun half hour (much better than we expected).The main disappointment was not being allowed to sit on the grass for a picnic. We didn't realise this (there were no signs that we saw) so plonked ourselves in a shady spot near the playground. Luckily we had almost finished eating before being moved along by security. Apparently there is one spot in the gardens you can sit on the grass but where this was was not clear!But aside from this minor irritation it is the most lovely place to visit with kids.

A welcome break from the hustle bustle. It's a great place to visit - with or without kids. For kids, there is a great play area. It closes at 7pm though. For adults, we can just sit and relax in the evening; and then head out for dinner. It's a good break from all the "attractions" and "highlights" in Paris. Definitely worth a visit.

Wonderful place to relax in the center of Paris, l'est bank. Great flow ères arrangements, fountain and senate palaceLawns to lay down and pleasant landscape to Forget the cite and believe you are in countryside
Gorgeous! . A beautiful spot to spend a day or afternoon, relaxing, a picnic or just chilling out and people watching. Well worth a visit.

Great stroll in the park. Wonderfull walk through this impressive park. The upkeep is fantastic. If you like to have lunch , one should reserve in advance. Reasonable choice of food at the Delhi is a good alternative.Enjoy!

Great day in a beautiful park. Spent a day in in the garden with my family (children 9 and 5) it was a fun rainy day. The children loved to stay there to get a bit of peace and quiet in the buzzy city.

New meaning to bag lunch in the park. The best times to walk des jardins are in the spring or perhaps early fall. Bring a modest bag lunch and savor the ambiance. Caution: Paris can be oppressive in the summer, even in these beautiful gardens.
Great park. Luxembourg gardens are the place to go when you want to relax on a chair or enjoy a picnic on the grass.
Beautiful garden. Its free & a nice place to sit\walk\talk. Dont need to do anything besides rest while you are there and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.
Great place to wander for a while!. This is a very formal garden .... but there are great spaces! Don't miss the Orangerie ...... this time of year there are some great expositions.

Just amazing!. It's a great place to spend the afternoon, the gardens are really beautiful and if you can , go in a sunny day , it will be an even better experience. The Luxembourg Gardens is easily accessible by subway , there's more than one subway station close to the entries. Inside there's a few places to eat and lots of benches to rest a little.
One of my favorites . The garden is so cute and relaxing. It's a great place to have a picnic, walk around and sit down for a nice break from city walking.

A must and romantic place. I had a friend visiting for a week from NYC. I took her there for a peaceful break and in between monuments nearby. It is an ideal place for a romantic stroll. Very enjoyable also at early evening during spring and summer. You can still go for a pic nic lunch yet I would not recommended it since there are a lot of people!

Lovely on a lovely day. Went here after lunch with my wife, strolled around. Saw a free photo exhibition on the Yang-Tze river. Sat down on a chair in the shade, watching time and people flow by. There are some tennis courts and some playgrounds for kids, but we just got some icecream.

Fantastic oasis in the middle of Paris!. My favourite gardens in Paris and I lived there for 10 years. Beautiful setting. Something for everyone. Great adventure play area for children whilst parents can sit in the sun or under a shady tree. There are a couple of cafés, tennis courts, Tai Chi, outdoor chess, pony rides, plus you can sail a model boat or just picnic and relax. Wonderful all year round. Lovely place to go in the autumn and just sit in the sun and people watch.

A lovely walk in a Parisian garden. Lots of people just chilling out as we enjoyed a leisurely stroll in the park. Adults and children were sailing miniature boats in the water, picnickers and nappers just soaking up the sun and relaxation.

Great place for people watching. With kids launching small sailboats in the pond and people sitting everywhere, eating, chatting, etc., this is a great place to just sit and watch. Decent, reasonably priced food available in the park, or bring it in.
Very beautiful..... The Luxembourg Gardens are a must see when visiting Paris, just as Trafalgar Square is in London, UK.
An average garden . These gardens are beautiful, but hardly stunning. You can easily skip it on your trip to Paris. Evening time is the best

Amazing Beauty, a place for relaxation and reflection. The majestic beauty of this tourist attraction will leave you breathless. It is very well kept, clean, has a bar and also pay restrooms that are clean and not missing anything. If you have the time it would be worth spending at least a half day, if not more, strolling along the paths and taking in the scenery and monuments. There are many areas to sit and just relax and enjoy the Parisian air. I can't wait to go back!

Always a favorite for picnics and naps. Beautiful and peaceful garden for reading, picnicking or napping...just drag a few chairs together in the shade of the trees to do as the local do. Children can play with mini sailboats in the large fountain in the middle.
a beautiful place to relax. a true Parisian experience. Bring a snack and just sit and enjoy the people watching in a truly Parisian setting.
Beautiful park. This was a lovely quiet peaceful spot to rest in the shade. The flower beds are stunning. We wanted ice cream but the cafe appeared not to want to serve us.
Chairs galore. Fab spit to grab a baguette and cop a squat. Chairs all around and fabulous gardens...ice cream inside though is stupid expensive...

beautiful well maintained garden. How lovely to watch locals and students using these gardens and children sailing yachts on the lake. Great views of the Sorbonne, Psris observatory, tour Eiffel and St Sulpice together with the Luxemburg Palace. Hundreds of chairs, restaurant and shade. Robert

BEAUTIFUL SPOT TO RELAX WITH THE LOCALS. Wandering in here during a morning of walking through the streets of Paris. Many locals were just sitting in the sun relaxing, reading books, newspapers. A lovely peaceful oasis.
take a book with, you won't want to leave.... Luxembourg Gardens is a firm favourite, we always make time for a few visits. Peaceful and beautiful.

Brunch at the cafe and then enjoy the Gardens. On a sunny July morning, we had brunch at the cafe within the grounds of the Luxembourg Gardens. Tables and chairs set under the trees with an adequate menu that was reasonably priced, made for a great start to our day. We could then wander further into the gardens to enjoy the fountain, flowers and beautifully manicured lawn set against the back drop of the palace. Lots of chairs to sit on and relax and enjoy.
gorgeous. beautiful to sit down relax & look around , so green & well looked after , free to roam around in grab a coffee & enjoy free entertainment

An absolute must. If it is for a short walk, a picnic etc. then this is just the place. I absolut love comming here - especially in the spring and summertime. So if the weather is nice then buy some chilled white wine and have a break at this beautiful place.
Most beautiful park in Paris. Really beautiful gardens, great views, a nice lake in the middle for kids to enjoy, relaxing atmosphere.

Relaxing place. We spent an afternoon there soaking up sunshine, espresso and a free classical music concert. A completely relaxing place to spend a few hours. Plenty of cafes nearby for a bite. We found it more relaxing than Jardin des Tuileries, less traffic noise, etc.

Beautiful public space with many attractions. Teaming with Parisians and visitors at weekends, this is a wonderful park with a large lake and fountain, formal gardens, recreational spaces - tennis, boule, jogging tracks, etc. mature trees provide plenty of shade from the afternoon sun with several ice cream vending stalls. A lovely place to spend an afternoon and to promenade in the evening.

Greatlaceto relax and forget you are in a big city. Built by the widow of a King after he dies. She, being from Italy build a palace in the style she was accustomed to. It is beautiful. More importantly the gardens are free and open tot he public every day. wonderful place to just sit, meditate, picnic and relax.

Great to relax. We stopped by to see it and grabbed lunch just outside and had a picnic. We were able to sit for awhile and relax. You can rent a toy sailboat for the kids to sail in the pond using sticks to navigate-fun to see kids run around to push the sailboats. No automatic system so kids got exercise.

Beautiful park, perfect to relax . Luxembourg Gardens are walking distance from Notre Dame if you aren't to lazy to walk a bit uphill through the Quartier Latin. The gardens are beautiful. Fill with people who just relax and enjoy the sun. Plenty of cafés and activities for children. We saw many locals having a picnic below the trees enjoying wine they brought from home.

We enjoyed a picnic. On our last day in Paris, after spending the day at the Museum D'Orsay, we took the bus to Luxembourg Gardens. We were starved and found a shop that made us paninis and crepes that we enjoyed in the park with the beautiful flowers. Earlier in the week we'd been to Versailles and saw their amazing gardens. If you can't get to Versailles, this is pretty good on a smaller scale right in town. Their flowers are amazing. We had 3 1/2 short days in Paris and we were able to enjoy all the highlights. The picnic in the park was the perfect ending.

Must see - beautiful and free of charge. The best free attraction in Paris. Love the grounds. Flowers were gorgeous and the lawn well maintained. We were there in the evening slightly before 9pm and though it was so late, there were many families enjoying themselves.

Magnificent! Something for everyone to see and enjoy!. Lots and lots of pic opportunities here. Outdoors and inside. The gardens are magnificent with statues and water fountains. It goes on and on. There are simply no words to describe Luxembourg. The grounds are huge. We didn't spend much time here due to time constraints but it is on our bucket list to go back. A must-see. Very reasonable.

A quiet oasis. No matter what time of year always a great place to zone out and watch people, lovers, kids, every one having a good time. In the distance you can see the Eifel tower. The chairs are free
Nice place for a morning walk. These gardens are very pretty in the classic French style and a perfect place to sit and have a coffee in the morning before heading off to explore the area.

Take a picnic to this lovely park. Paris has many beautiful parks and this is one of them. It surprised us because it is also heavily used by the Parisians for recreation. It is full of courts for many different games being played. It also has nice views. Take a picnic to enjoy and get a taste of daily Parisian life.

A beautiful place to spend some quiet time. It is a great park which is quite large. You can walk around and see the different structures and sculptures. Very good for a quiet
moment.
Beauty in the heart of Paris . If your closely definitely worth a wander through. We rode our bikes there. Spectacular! Also great for runners, tennis players or pony rides for the little ones

Nice Garden to relax. The Luxembourg garden (Jardin du Luxembourg) is situated closer to Latin Quarter and the Pantheon.We walked to the park and really loved the park.It's well maintained and very relaxing. The dense shadow of trees, beautiful flowers and birds will really make you feel that you are closer to the nature and this takes away your tiredness after long walk in Paris.You will see lot of joggers in the evening.You take something to eat and may be red wine to relax for a while in this beautiful park.Relax here if you have time, on tight schedule you may afford to miss.

Beautiful Gardens in the heart of Paris. Just a few blocks from the Seine, this is an excellent place to rest your feet, enjoy some shade, and see beautiful flowers while the kids sail boats in the center pond. Beautiful place.

Great for a walk or picnic with kids. Great spot for families, there is the famous merry-go-round, an amazing playground and of course little sailboats but note none of these things are for free so don't forget some cash even for the playground. There was a little wadding pool which would be great for a hot day for the kids. There were also pony rides and tennis courts and basketball courts. Lots of people were lying around on the grass either sun tanning or enjoying some wine and baguettes.

Pretty garden. Would definitely put this on your to do list if your near Notre Dame. Pretty gardens, large central pond with seating and statues of important women in the early history of France. If you walk around there are other statues and another pond/statue area in the west side. We spent about 60 min walking around and felt that was sufficient to see the park.

The most beautiful gardens in the world. I cant say I have been in any more beautiful gardens than this... spectacular design throughout, everything was in bloom, grass was as green and manicured as you'll see anywhere. There are individual green metal chairs placed all over the park/gardens for people to simply sit and relax, talking, reading, sunbaking, people-watching... just such a great atmoshpere and also the luxembourg palace is a brilliant backdrop too. There were also kids racing sailboats in one of the fountains which was simply adorable... an absolute must when in Paris... a great place to simply stop, relax, and take in the magnificence of this magical city.

Love the trees. A walk in the gardens in a good weather really makes a difference. The skies are blue, the sun is shinning, the trees are green and the air is so fresh. This is how I felt when I visited the gardens.
Beautiful garden. Beautiful garden. Good place for people watching. Flowers, grass, trees. Beautiful Luxembourg Palace. Seats and benches. I painted en plein air here. Cafe.

Picnic like a Parisian. I spent a lot of time in the 6th and Luxembourg was a great spot for our group. We picnicked and I enjoyed drinking rose, eating cheese, and lounging in the grass.They have lots for kids to do whether they play on a playground, ride a pony, swing. Adults can sit and talk, enjoy some food and wine, and there's even a cute little spot where you can rent a small sailboat and push it around the water feature. It's easy, it's free, and it's fun. Go play!

Such a rich, interesting place. We took our 4 year old granddaughter to Paris for the first time this summer, and I do believe Luxembourg Gardens was everyone's favorite place. The pond with boats for children to sail, a fabulous playground, a carousel that allows riders to capture a ring each time they circle around, a first class indoor puppet stage, delicious food--all added to large, beautiful gardens. Take the time to visit here!!
Perfect picnic spot. There are a lot of chairs that you can move to your preferred spot in the garden. We opened a bottle of wine and had a nice spontaneous picnic here by the fountain.

Beautiful park. Of course the gardens are beautiful, but I was so impressed with the park land and amenities it had besides the gardens. Tennis courts, play sets, swing sets, splash pool, card tables, chess tables, cafes, beautiful trees that offered incredible shade. Plus there is space for art exhibits - we enjoyed walking through one.

Great place to kick back with a jambon beurre and play a game of chess on a hot Paris day.... If your are looking for a place to sit in the shade and get a little green on a hot Paris summer day...this is great place to sit and watch the world go by...many chess players gather near the Museum and the pest shade is by the Medici Fountain...
awesome sailboats. you can bring your own sailboat to sail in the pond, .. well kept gardens, park with lots of joggers, walkers and activities (tai chi, exs,....) but limited restroom access.
Family Stuff. Good place to take the family. Really nice park. Couple little places to get drinks and snacks that are reasonable. Nice place for a "easy day".

Fabulous and Free! Stunning flowers, chairs everywhere to sit and relax. A must visit, been to Paris several times and never made it here and now I LOVE IT! fabulous, gorgeous, Royalty, and all for free for all to visit and enjoy. A Great Great place be sure to not miss it

Beautiful place in the middle of Paris. We visited yesterday while doing the Hop on Hop off Bus. Sat in the gardens and had lunch. Beautifully kept gardens and water features. Lots of people there but plenty of space for everyone. Certainly lots of seating. Well worth a visit.

Relax and walk if you have hours to spend . An excellent Park to relax, sit lay down a bit after long walk in the Paris streets. It's near odeon and thus very well located. Take some food with you if you want to be like the Parisians and don't like to be overcharged by a canteen...

Amazing Urban Park. Enjoyed an afternoon in an urban garden.
A very large garden and a pleasant place to enjoy the sun and listen to locals converse. A few snack bars around if you want a snack.
Kids can rent toy sail boats to float in the small lake/fountain.

Beautiful park, one of my fav places. . Beautiful Parc for a pic-nick. Read the signs clearly as some of the lawn is permitted & some is forbidden. The only down side is the children's playground costs a few Euros & it closes early.

It is a public park so it might get crowded. There is nothing special in this garden, it is a public park with no special attraction , just a place to go and see some normal plants,
-There is a nice playground for kids.
-do not waste your time in this specially if you are not stayin in paris more than a week
Lunch in Luxembourg gardens. Buy a baguette, cheese and wine, find a nice spot and enjoy. I find the gardens are best in May (more quiet) but anytime is great.

Beautiful and Great for Kids!. We came here with our 8 and 6 year old boys more than once during our Paris vacation. We loved racing the boats in the little pond (closes at 6) and the playground was "epic" according to the kids. Everything costs money so bring cash - but it's well worth it!
Quietness in the Capital of France?. Wonderful garden in the city center. Perfectly kept and despite lots of people and life, there is many possibilities to relax...

Lovely!. Lovely gardens in the heart of the Left Bank. More to explore than meets the eye, be sure to walk down all of the paths. Bring a picnic and enjoy these wonderful gardens or just sit, relax and breathe! Great people watching too!

Great for a break. If you get tired of the hustling and bustling Paris centre you should definitely come to the Luxembourg Gardens with a good company or just a good book. The gardens are gorgeous and relatively calm.
Relaxing afternoon in the Luxembourg Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens is a great place to spend an afternoon. Something for all ages (play grounds, music, cafes, art exhibits, people watching)

Lucky Location. Our hotel was right across the street, and feeling sightseed out on a gorgeous Sunday afternoon, we decided to not hole up in our room but grab some magazines and water and head over to the park. What a great idea! There were kiddie pony rides and tables of people playing chess and many other areas and activities, but it was lovely just sitting by the fountain, enjoying superb people-watching. It was just absolutely a beautiful Paris local-like activity.

Amazing BIG garden where you can spend your whole day.. We went here a bit like an accident. But we loved what we saw. Everything was done so fine and accurate and we had a chance to listen some music by a big band what was playing in the garden. Loved every bit of it.

Beautiful park to rest and peoplewatch. Conveniently located between the Seine (museums and Notre Dame) and the Catacombs (which are another must-visit). The Luxembourg Gardens has a rich history and is a nice stop when walking back to central Paris. Also located near the Latin Quarter, which is nice for dinner and drinks on a sidewalk cafe.

Good to have a break from the city. Awesome, such a nice park in the middle of city! The park is extremely well maintained and is great to spend some time in! So relaxing so escaping from the busy city, the traffic, everything! The perfect place to have a break!

Beautiful expansive gardens. Excellent place for a walk and to soak up french culture. Not as many tourists as other parts of the city. We brought a snack that we had picked up at the market that morning and ate on benches in the garden. It is beautiful!

Breath of fresh air in a big bustling city. We stumbled onto the Luxembourg Gardens by accident.
