We had walked from Notre Dame toward the Pantheon, looked out to see the view of the Eiffel Tower and ended up in front of a stunning, enormous building (Luxembourg Palace) on beautiful grounds. There were lots of chairs and places to sit, small boats on the pond, ponies, tennis, people picnicking and playing soccer and 50p restrooms. We enjoyed the reprieve from the busy crowded streets in other areas of Paris.
Gorgeous Garden. Wonderful for a pre or post lunch stroll to enjoy the relaxing and peaceful gardens. Not a must see but you'll probably pass the gardens on your trip one way or another.

A favorite place for our family. There is so much to look at and enjoy in Luxembourg gardens... but if you have children (or just enjoy the outdoors) it is a critical MUST NOT MISS for your trip to paris. Its a great way to break up visits to museums, etc. The children still push the toy sail boats in the pond on sunny days and the playground on the far side is lots of fun for kids ages 4-14! They have also just opened up a lovely restaurant near the playground which has some great food!

Amazing. Really pretty parks just near the Latin quarter - excellent place to have a picnic and sit in the shade when it's too hot to walk around the big tourist attractions, really enjoyed it. Closes at 9 on the dot.

Loved seeing how well used this beautiful park is. We spent several hours wandering this amazing green space - enjoyed seeing children race boats on the pond, business people eating lunch in the park at the many available chairs, runners, locals, visitors - a nice respite on a warm day
Beautiful gardens and so peaceful. Really enjoyed our walk in the gardens. There is so much to see and do for all ages and requirements.
Worth a visit!. Saw this garden while having a coffe nearby. Good garden in very crowded Paris, nice walking with many seats.

Wow!. This wasn't on my Paris list, but it was located along my walk through the Latin Quarter so I went in. It's free, and the gardens are simply beautiful. There are ample places to sit either in the shade or in the sun. There is a small fountain where kids float their sailboats, like in Central Park. People all over were enjoying picnics they had brought. If you forget one like me, no worries, I saw 2 separate cafes inside the gardens with food and cocktails.

Too bad you can't hunt pigeons like Hemingway anymore.. It is an awesome park. You see many Parisians enjoying the gardens with their friends and family. It is a nice place to stop in, take a seat and watch the world go by. The Saint Germaine neighborhood and the Pantheon is nearby and this is a great place to get away from the tourists and traffic.
Luxembourg Garden. This is one of the most beautiful attractions Paris have to offer. It's very clean and a great place to take photos, especially if you appreciate fine landscape.

A lovely respite..... The gardens are just so lovely, we have had the privilege of seeing them in winter and now summer, and both times offer a tranquil respite from the hustle of busy Paris.Down the right hand side of the gardens is a Statue of Liberty, life size. If you get yourself a picnic together, or even just a drink and a baguette, it just a lovely place to have sit for awhile or to just have a wander.Saint Sulpice church is only just around the corner, and well worth a visit also.

Smack in the middle of this district - beautiful gardens. We walked to Luxembourg Gardens one late afternoon as we were eating dinner near there. We found hundreds of people sitting, walking, jogging, enjoying the afternoon. The flowers were lovely and the paths make walking very easy. Wonderful restaurants border the gardens.

Less than I expected. I was hoping to see magnificent colorful flowers, but most of the garden was green and really more so like a park. We visited on a weekday around lunchtime & there were many Parisians sitting around eating lunch which I would say gave it the flair I was looking for. However, there seemed to be some shady characters trying to pick pocket and/or conduct illegal business which was surprising to me being it the middle of the day. Just stay aware of your surroundings. It's still worth a walk through or picnic if you've never been.

Unique to Paris. Beautiful gardens with statues and water. Much care was taken in planting a wonderful combination of flowering plants. Lots of seating options, and a great place to read or just chill.
Good place for kids. It's an amazing park in general, but specially for chikdren as they have a special playground and carousel.

Spectacular Gardens. This is an amazing spot, in the very chic neighborhood this garden stands out, one can only imagine the royalty of the day in the gardens.
It is way beyond the Tuileries, in its beauty and solace.
Beautiful and relaxing. If you're staying or just passing through, these gardens are not to be missed. I love to just relax and sit by the fountain. Great gelato is available too.

Paris outdoor living room. Beautiful park that is the backyard space for the beautiful apts of the st germain des pres. Tables and chairs spread throughout the park to sit and people watch. Go to one of the outdoor markets and put together a picnic to eat in the park.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens to relax in and walk around. Sports courts available to hire. Large pond with toy sailing boats. Very close to RER station. Perfect for a romantic stroll.
beautiful gardens. A lovely place to visit on a nice afternoon. You can relax and watch people of all ages and backgrounds enjoying the gardens.

Lovely garden to the spend the evening. We reached the garden via walking St. Michel Blvd after visiting Notre Dame. It took about 20 minutes. We walked on to the pond area and rented a sailboat for 3 Euro for half hour and my daughter had fun playing with it in the pond. They have ample green metal chairs for you to relax in. There is not much shade around the pond, and I retreated back into a small shady spot I got and maneuvered my chair into the shaded spot from the palm tree nearby. :). It was 6pm but a sunny day and the heat felt scorching onto bare skin. We then moved on towards the tennis courts, and encountered pony rides which had just closed (7pm), so we missed that, and then they have a play structure area for the kids towards the entrance of the garden near rue de fleurs.

Beautiful place from a relaxing break. Huge gardens with a magnificent house, there is a small lake where children (or adults) can hire a small sail boat and while away an hour. We sat on one of the many benches to eat our sandwiches that we had bought from one of the many shop just outside the gardens.

Beautiful experience on a warm and sunny day. The day we visited there was a band playing (maybe a group of eight energetic young men) and they were fun to watch. We sat on chairs with our feet on rails and relaxed in the sun. Check it out on a beautiful day while you're in the area.
Wonderful downtime activity. After days of museums and castles we went to Luxembourg Gardens just for some downtime. we just pulled up a bench and people watched
Gorgeous and tranquil gardens. Just a really beautiful place. Make sure to visit the Medici fountain and seek out the statue of liberty replica!

Perfect relaxing day in a beautiful garden . This is a beautiful place to visit and relax with the family. Several French students and families bring small picnics and seat in the grass or the small tables and chairs around the park. You can rent small sailing boats and play in the lake. The garden has a Playground for very small children. I love the atmosphere and the beautiful gardens and flowers.
Beautiful!. Wonderful gardens, even prettier than Versailles. A nice walk, very safe. Several places to get snacks nearby. Highly recommend.

Rest your weary feet!. After a day walking around Paris come here drag a few chairs together and watch toy sail boats float around the central pond. Had a lovely few hours here on a beautiful Paris day strolled around the gardens and then sat and enjoyed the relaxed feeling of the garden. It was a lovely place to be amidst the hustle and bustle of the city. Hot tip toilets are 70 cents but very clean so happy to pay!
Align yourself with the nature . Fresh flowers offer great frangrance, it made me feel so good walking in this area really brong you to other part of the beautiful world indeed

Nice place. Take a baguette and a wine, grab some chairs, and enjoy the sun. The only negative thing is that you cannot lie on the grass like in other gardens in Paris (forbidden). Don't try it, there are guards around.

Beautiful spot in Paris. This is a place that has something for everyone! The gardens are very well maintained and lush. There are plenty of benches, and we found it to be a wonderful place to have picnic lunch, read a book, relax and people watch. There were people playing soccer and other games on one side, but there is plenty of quiet space as well. This is definitely a place I will visit again.

Impressive and pleasent. Paris has a lot of Gardens. Each one has its magic. This one, is a very big one and the lake is always used for children to play with their small boats, what makes it a very good place, to si, relax and enjoy the french way of life. There are chairs where you can sit and enjoy the view. Every time I can I go there.

Paris' Living Room. Beautifully maintained, inviting in sun or rain, a sanctuary of peace and beauty in the middle of a busy city. No trip to Paris is complete without spending some time in Jardin du Luxembourg.

Beautiful. The French love their parks and open spaces. We walked the gardens for hours. Not everything was in bloom so I could just imagine how lush things would have been in a couple of more weeks. Children were playing with sail boats in the fountain. Parisians lounging around, enjoying the spring weather. Just gorgeous.
Wonderful gardens. Wonderful. Enjoyed spending time here, strolling around and enjoying the views. The medici fountain is excellent.

Take a picnic or a fab pastry with you!. Walked over from our apartment on Rue du Four a couple of times. Beautiful place to stroll or sit for a while. The people watching is amazing, every kind, age, shape and color. The water, the trees, the statuary, it was kind of fun to see just who those statues were. Plan to spend at least an hour or two. A stunning city park in the heart of Paris.

Charming!. A great way to unwind in Paris to to take a stroll around the Luxembourg Gardens. There is a huge pond with toy sailboats, lots of chairs to sit around, a playground for the kids, and many shaded areas to escape the sun. Perfect place for a picnic!

Luxenbourg Gardens. Jardin du Luxenbourg is a very large and beautiful park on the left bank. It is clearly a favorative of locals who stroll and sit among the gorgeous lawns, tree, floral beds, statuary, play areas (for all ages). Has a very interesting history, is great for people watching and as a place to relax. Wonderful!

What is a visit to a garden without sitting on the grass?. Bit disappointed you are not allowed to sit on the grass. To me, that is the whole point of going to a garden/ park - to sit on the grass and enjoy the sunshine. Otherwise there is plenty to see and do at Luxembourg

Beautiful Gardens. These gardens are beautiful we were there in July and everything was looking great, the large water feature in front of the main house very impressive the surrounding gardens have lots of interesting nook and crannies with sculptures dotted through out part of the garden, there is a large play area for the children, tennis courts and even chess tables if you fancy a game, or you can relax around the pond/water feature or on the large grass area by the water feature. It is a good place to spend some time and relax
beautiful. lovely garden! so relaxing and beautiful! a heaven! it is quite and full of life and peace there! you can have a nice picnic in the garden!
Relaxing!. Such a beautiful place in a beautiful city. Make time to walk and explore the Luxembourg Gardens. Find a seat and enjoy watching people :-)

Peaceful and beautiful garden to visit and stay. It's in 6e arrondissement-district, and the congress is in this garden. Luxembourg Gardens is very large, plenty of trees grass and sculptures. Many chairs offered there, u can take a book to read and just stay the whole day, enjoying the fresh air and nice views!

Get a boat!. If you are in the park with kids, go to the center and rent a little boat to sail on the pond (3.5E for a half hour). My daughter (10) didn't seem very interested, but ended up have a great time sailing her boat! We enjoyed watching the kids running around the pond, using their sticks to push the boats and seeing where the wind would take them. Overall the park is beautiful. We picked up sandwiches and found a quiet place away from the center by a fountain and pool to eat.

Wish we had more time to spend here. We walked over from our hotel on Rue de Rennes early morning and entered from Rue Vavin. We spent a short time in the gardens around the small statue of liberty. We did see the palace from the taxi when visiting the Latin Quarter and look forward to our next visit to paris when we hope to spend more time here.

A pleasant stroll...!. This park was very close to our hotel and we enjoyed walking around the park and enjoyed the pleasant weather. There were many benches around to sit and just contemplate the beautiful area.

Always the first place I go when I arrive in Paris. After a long trans-Atlantic flight, a walk and some sun shine is needed. Therefore, I always go for a walk in the Luxembourg Gardens, linger near the fountain, or have lunch in the cafe. It's a great place to sit and read a book or just watch people, particularly the kids with their small boats in the fountain.
Beautiful Park/garden. Beautiful place to go for a walk or jog around. Free to enter, picturesque and a great spot for wedding photography.

Stunning. Stumbled across this whilst looking for a Metro stop after a long day of eating and shopping. The gardens are stunning. There are chairs dotted around the magnificent grounds where you can just sit and enjoy the sunshine or watch the French enjoy their leisure time.

My favorite garden in Paris. My girlfriend and I sat at a little cafe in the garden listening to live music and drinking wine while our kids played and ran around. It is absolutely beautiful with the Luxembourg Palace as a backdrop. There is a great kids play area but it was closed when we got there. Beautiful statues throughout the garden so you can't help but wander. My only issue was that the area is pretty dead after 5 or 6 so it wasn't easy getting a taxi back to our hotel.

Lovely gardens. There is a lot of activity in the Luxembourg Gardens. There were joggers, yogis, families on picnics, couples sitting on benches, walkers, etc. The gardens are well maintained. We took pictures of the miniature Statue of Liberty. There is a fenced area where they grow a bunch of different fruit. There are signs telling you what the fruit tree is and when the fruit matures. It is definitely worth taking a leisurely stroll through these gardens.

Beautiful gardens, cafe and pond for sailing little boats. You could spend most of a day just relaxing and walking around the property. I enjoyed a lovely lunch and sat on a bench and enjoyed the views.
Take a rest next to Latin District. In a crowed central district you'll find one of the wider park in Paris. You can play pétanque, tennis or just rest in a chair near the water room.
Absolutely gorgeous!. Paris can be an intense experience, and stopping by the Luxembourg Gardens to sit a while, enjoy an ice cream cone, and soak in the gorgeous views can be incredibly restoring!
Worth a visit.. If you are rushing around doing the site seeing thing, try taking a break in these gardens for half an hour, as we found it relaxing.

Peacefull place. After crazy day of walking we found this place and was really happy. A lot of chairs for sitting and fantastic pool. Local people come here for running, walking and relaxing with family. Highly recommend for all.

Luxe!. Very good place for a solid picture and a relaxing walk. We got a sandwich/salad for lunch and walked around for a bit. There is an Angelina by the museum that we stopped by for some hot chocolate. Good relaxing stop in between the sites.

A fine green parenthesis. Seeing many buildings in Paris, the gardens of Luxembourg were a great parenthesis with they green colour. A quite big place with many locals sun tanning on the grass and other putting their legs into water to cool down. Although it was a crowded place it was peaceful.

Beautiful garden to enjoy and hang out in. Very nice garden in middle of Paris. Do some jogging, hangout with friends, or just sit on the bench seat to enjoy the sunshine. Very comfortable. Only two things that I don't like: a little bit hard to find the toilet; and too much dust.

A peaceful place in the heart of the "latin quarter". I like strolling in that garden, whenever I visit that part of Paris. First it is quite central: you can hop from there to the busy boulevard saint Michel or boulevard saint germain.Second, backing the french Senate the place is at the same time beautiful, orderly, lively and yet surprisingly quiet.You can go there just to relax or to change your mind when listening to the outdoor mini concerts (jazz or classical music) that sometimes take place there.A suitable visit both for adults and children who will certainly enjoy looking at the miniature boats sliding on the central pond...Definitely worth the visit
Stunning. These are the most beautiful gardens in Paris, so peaceful and quiet, we purchased an ice-cream and watched the world go by.

Classic, iconic, full of Parisians. Paris has so many wonderful gardens. This was my 3rd time in Paris and my first time visiting Luxembourg Gardens. Our family enjoyed strolling and taking in life on a Sunday afternoon in Paris.

Excellent gardens. Great for a break. These gardens are quite cool on a long hot summer day and if you can find a good spot with shade, it's great to have a snack. We went and got some "gourmet" items from the la grande epicerie nearby and attacked them under a shady spot.

Beautiful Setting. These gardens are gorgeous, however sadly we visited Paris during their worst floods in 150 years, so I doubt we saw them at their best.The lawns and flower beds are perfectly presented and the actual home on the grounds looks amazing, although we didn't go in as they were doing some building works.This place would be lovely on a warm Spring/Summer day, heaps of room to spread out, take a picnic and watch Parisian life go by.

Beautiful and spacious and clean.. Truly beautiful gardens also peaceful you feel like you are way out in the country side.
You can hire a little boat on the lake that you push with a stick to sail it.
You can get ice cream and drinks.
Lovely fountains and architecture.
Recommend for an hour or 2 away from the city bustle.

Nice stroll, beautiful gardens. Went on a Saturday afternoon, it is a beautiful place where you can sit, have an ice cream or something to drink, and just enjoy the sun and this beautiful place. Plus it is located near many important sites of the Quartier Latin, so you can mix it with a visit to those places like the Pantheon, the Moffetard Street, la Sorbonne, the Cluny Museum, etc

Worth the bus ride . The gardens are beautiful,Grab a seat, a drink ( alcoholic or not) and sit and absorb the views (seats are avail there at no cost)Grab some fresh tomatoes, cheese, meat and baguettes before you go and enjoy It's a good way to relax from the city rush and enjoy Paris for what it is

Gorgeous and special. if you can't make it to Versailles than spend some time in the Luxembourg Gardens and Palace. Clearly not as overwhelming but for a big city "park" it is beautiful to walk in, relax on a bench, have lunch and plenty to see

luxembourg gardens. This is clearly the place to be! All the locals were sitting in the gardens picnicing and relaxing on a sunny sunday. The gardens are gorgeous and lots of trails to walk around on.
RELAXING. Great relaxing place to take a rest of busy Paris. Nice garden a lot of chairs to seat there and fantastic ships to rent on small lake
Lovely. Lovely atmosphere to spend a summers day in. We have visited this a number of times on our trip and loved every minute of it. Highly recommend a visit

Beautiful place to pass time. Luxembourg isn't the most exciting place on earth so don't expect much. Aside from being very beige there are a few beautiful sights which are very relaxing. This park is a nice place to pass some time between sights.

Reason for the Revolution. Lovely and peaceful oasis. Public Garden on the Left Bank at site of pre-Revolutionary palace and grounds. At least walk through it if you're in the area. Very refreshing and definitely French.

One of my favorite places. If you travel to Paris, make sure to book time to take in Luxembourg Gardens. You can sit and watch people, make a picnic, have the kids sail boats in the fountain or climb on the playground. There's so much to do and it's incredibly scenic The last time we were there, we had the chance to listen to orchestra music at the gazebo. If you're from the U.S., you won't want to miss the smaller version of the Statue of Liberty statue.

Wish we had taken more time. The gardens are very nice and have plenty of spaces to sit and enjoy the view. Unfortunately, we waited until the last (and hottest) day of our trip. Would have been an excellent place to picnic. Would also be a good place for families with kids.

Marvelous gardens . When you visit Paris this place is #1 on the must see list. Everyone can enjoy it. You can play there, sit and relax, read or walk. I think it's the best for people watching. My favorite site there is the Medici Fountain. Charming and unique. Well worth the visit.

Peace in the middle of the city. We walked to Luxembourg Gardens from the Sorbonne. On a hot July day it was a wonderful respite. We sat near the boating pond where there was a breeze and some shade. It was a great way to relax, wind down, cool off on a hot day.

Lovely! . Beautiful place! It is very relaxing and pretty big. I really like the idea of enjoying your lunch/snack there, which is very typical of people here. Easy to reach by public transportation as well.

Marvelous. This is a great spot in the middle of Paris. Perfect to chill with some croissant...sitting on the iron chairs in front of the fountain. Kids play with boats at this font. The other side you find a big garden with symmetrical trees

Shady spots for picnics. Another place for Paris locals who just want to hang out in a park. Lots of shaded spots under the trees. It's obviously a working park with a pay to use playground, chess spaces, tennis courts, and green spaces. The flower gardens and sculptures are nice. Just a good place for a break from the city.

A lovely surprise!. I had this on my to do list and as it was a hot afternoon, it was lovely to see so many people enjoying the sunshine and having a picnic.
This is a lovely garden. Do visit.

Very beautiful. We walked through these gardens on the way to our hotel, they're very well maintained and beautiful, although there's a lot of 'do not walk on the grass'. There's a lake in the middle where you can hire radio controlled boats which look fun for the kids and loads of chairs to sit and watch the world go by.

Great to spend a few hours. Beautiful memorable experience, even though I live in Paris, every time I go there I discover something new, it is a must visit if you're staying in paris for more than 3 or 4 days.
Perfect Picnic . Ended up coming here and it was so pretty I stayed to eat my lunch. The grounds are gorgeous and there isn't a bad view anywhere. Definitely one of my top recommendations

Tranquility in the Heart of Paris. On our most recent trip to Paris, my wife and I set aside some time to walk through the Luxembourg Gardens. Especially if you've been bouncing from one tourist attraction to another, the Gardens offers many places to find some tranquility -- whether by the large pond where children are sailing toy boats, along one of the many spacious paths that take you through shady and quiet spaces, or taking some sun on one of the chairs lining the area south of the pond. The lush floral beds and broad vistas make this one of the loveliest sights on the Left Bank.
There are a lot of gardens in Paris but this is one not to miss. Make sure to go to the Medici Fountain. It alone is worth your trip. the entire garden is both beautiful and accessible.

A favourite spot to relax. What a beautiful park, so unexpected in the middle of Paris. Take some time away from all the city chaos and just relax. Big lovely shade trees, a pond, fountains, statues and a palace. Entry to the park is free and there are many places to sit and relax. Lots of free seating is provided. Bring your lunch, so many lovely spots to enjoy a picnic. If you forget, there is a café on the grounds.If you need activities to keep the children busy, toy sailboats for the pond can be rented for a couple of Euros. There is also a very big playground. The playground has an entry fee and isn't always open. Check ahead as I saw a few very disappointed children when we were there as it was closed. The park is also popular with joggers and there are quite a few tennis courts as well. If you don't have time to hang around just use the park as an access route from one block to another, you won't regret it.

underwhelming. beautiful gardens in one of the southern arrondissements of Paris, great for a sunny day and I believe there are tennis courts for the more active. the outer edges of it are looked-after gardens, whilst the inner part is more dusty open space (like a lot of parisian parks) with large rectangles of grass.not brilliant for picnics - there's only one rectangle of grass in the centre of the park which the public are allowed to picnic on, which naturally can get quite crowded. if people don't mind going a little further afield for green space in Paris, the Bois de Boulogne at the end of line 1 are much greener, more open and bigger.
Wa;l in the Park. We walked from Hotel Le Six through the Gardens to Notre Dame. Well laid out gardens and buildings with attractive seating available.
Great free Paris attraction. A good place to unwind from Paris intensity. Bring a sarong, some picnic food & drink, maybe a book, and relax in the gardens like a parisienne :)

Quiet Oasis in Saint-Germain-des-Prés Area. We’d walked to the Luxembourg Gardens from our hotel in the Latin Quarter and were only in the Gardens long enough to go to and from the Musée du Luxembourg. That was our mistake, our loss. The next time we’re in Paris, we will certainly make time to explore the Gardens, and perhaps have a picnic with some cheese, bread, and wine. The 60-acre Garden was meticulously maintained and just plain beautiful! There were large green lawn areas crisscrossed by wide cement and gravel walkways lined with benches and gigantic trees. Flowers, flower beds, fountains, and statuary were scattered throughout the Gardens. The few people who were in the Gardens were quietly doing what people do in large parks: lying on the grass, sitting on benches, strolling, visiting with friends, picnicking, children were playing – just everything. There was no reason to feel unsafe, as Paris police and French military were stationed at intervals all around the Gardens. It seemed like you couldn’t turn around without seeing an armed policeman or soldier, both males and females, someplace nearby; most of them were carrying automatic rifles and/or semi-automatic pistols. Beautiful, just beautiful.

To fully enjoy paris in summer. A beautiful palas, well manicured beautiful gardens, fruit trees and picturesque Medici Fountain.... There's so much to enjoy here. Get off at st michel fountain, walk through the shops and cafes, grab a sandwich and enjoy paris with parisians. The cafe in the park is also a pleasant place for some wine & cheese.

Took a Nap in the Luxembourg Gardens. After a long day of walking and being a tourist my husband and I found ourselves taking a beautiful nap in the Gardens. We felt safe, and welcomed in this beautiful city.

Garden for families . Palace, pond, fountains, boats, ducks, fish, gardens, tennis and hundreds of quiet benches or seats to watch the world go by. Great spot in a good locality. Pity cannot sit on grass.

Lovely Space. Well kept, beautiful space in the heart of Paris. Those pruned square French park trees. The tamped earth. Sculpture of classical stuff. Kids and adults renting model sailboats. Note that since the terror attacks earlier this year, in- and egress to / from the park is confined to a couple of gates.

Pull up a garden chair and chill out . Delightful public space.Pull up one of those free green garden chairs, kick your feet back. and watch the afternoon go by. Will be one of the few simple pleasures in life.Great place to rest and re-charge.If you have children note that there are little sailboats you can hire for a few euros to play in the fountain - both adults and children love it.

Glorious. Stroll, enjoy. Restaurants abut the park. Luxembourg Gardens headquarters of Nazis in WWII. Remember the history. Prussian General refused to burn Paris, although it seems dynamite had already been put under some bridges. Read "Is Paris Burning?"
Centuries of pruning and shaping here.. We spent a loving few hours walking amoung the sculptures and gardens, makes a great place to Picnic in style. Bring some wine and croissants Bamm!

Superb (in season). Wonderful any time.. These gardens are a world class joy to look at, walk through, sit in and simply experience. For us, any visit to Paris includes some peaceful time immersed in the beauty of the Luxembourg Gardens, perfectly tended yet awesome in their presentation of nature's beauty and bounty. I always recall a reviewer who referred to the Luxembourg Gardens as the kind of gardens God would have -- if he could afford it. Amen.
Perfection . Wow what a gorgeous place to spend a couple of hours sitting down and enjoying the view!We had a small picnic here and it was simply fantastic!

Nice early morning walk. Luxembourg Gardens were close to my meeting place and I used to have a long early morning walk before day activities. In sunny morning it was nice to stay there but in rainy days it was a pleasure to walk there and enjoy the beauty of the garden. Number of people were jogging there and it was nice to follow them. It is truly a nice area and important landmark of Paris.

So peaceful and beautiful. My first thought is why don't we have any parks like this in the US? Beautiful fountains, lounge chairs provided, just a really peaceful and reflective place to visit. The fountains are magnificent... Take the time to take a stroll.

Fun in the sun. The boating lake is charming and its worth knowing that the boats are older than your granny! They're still the original boats from 80 years ago.This is a great place to enjoy the sun, sit on a chair, read a book or just watch people in the wild.If you're feeling brave you could try walking on the grass and dodging the bullets fired at you from overly enthusiastic garden guards who love to strongly enforce that default Parisian garden rule "Don't walk on the grass."

Beautiful and tranquil surroundings . Get away from the bustle of the streets and chill out for a while in a serene setting. Green and pleasant with well kept gardens, worth a stroll through if you're in the area

Timeless peaceful break in centre of Paris. It has changed so little! I walked my old route from the Rue de Vaugirard to our catholic school on Rue de Notre Dame des Champs from 50 years ago. I doubt they let 8 year old childrwn do that alone anymore! But families still crowd the playgrounds, the merry go round still lets children reach out and snare the brass rings with their sticks as they pass, the young couples still sit huddled, arms draped easily around each other, and the inevitable older, attractive French woman still sits sunbathing, her skin already leathered and brown from many such days in the park. Ah, Paris. I do love you!
Nice garden in the city centre. Have a relaxed afternoon picnic here. Beautiful landscape, water bodies and exotic trees. Visit if you want a break from the hustle and bustle of Paris

A great place to walk and relax in this Central-Park-like oasis in Paris. Les Jardins du Luxembourg is a great place to walk and relax in the heart of Paris. The fountain is great with many chairs available (for free). You can bring croissants or coffee to enjoy even more this Central-Park-like oasis in Paris.
Beautyful city park. The gardens are a beautiful sight of wonderful colors. Perfect for a lunch or coffee break or just for walking through to get from A to B.

Beautiful park with lots to see and do. Beautiful grounds and very pretty setting. It would be a fabulous park to enjoy a pastry or cup of coffee. There is a great playground for a fee in the park that was quite extensive and perfect for kids to burn some energy before seeing the sights of Paris. Sailing the boats in the pond was another highlight for my kids as well. The Thursday we were there they didn't start renting the sailboats until sometime between 10am and 11am though, so plan accordingly.

Nice park. It is a nice park that you can have a walk. There is a place in the center of the park where you can sit and relax. There is also a small lake with sailing crafts where the children's can play with a smal rent cost.

Beautiful. I have been eager to visit this place longggg before i even decided to come to Paris and it certainly didn't disappoint! Very beautiful and exquisite gardens and you can walk around while grabbing a Starbucks. It also very close to the Pantheon (really nice place) and the Sorbonne (not that much).

Lovely Gardens In The Middle of Busy Paris. Beautiful gardens, a bit of quiet in the midst of a huge bustling city.Nice & quiet in the morning.Lunchtime is busy; but what a great place for a picnic & people watching

One of the best places to visit with kids!. Personally this has been one my favorite places in Paris even before having kids though now with a 3 and 4.5 this really is a wonderful place to visit with them. With kids one can easily spend a day playing with the boats in the fountain, going to the marionettes theater and running around in the fantastic playground.
Beautiful . Very, very beautiful place! The garden is well maintained and designed very well. Well worth spending an afternoon here
Love this beautiful garden. Very nice garden in middle of Paris .this lovely park is an excellent place for rest and recreation .my little one enjoyed a lot.👍👍

A special part of Paris - just relax and enjoy. We checked out of our hotel and had several spare hours before our flight. Rather than explore Paris further, we decided to just spend some quiet time in the Luxembourg Gardens. Good decision! We strolled, admired the gardens, statues, fountains and the Palace. Then we sat and rested in the gentle sun along with many others enjoying this green oasis. A very special place.

Great people watcing!. Our hotel was nearby, so it was an easy stroll to the gardens.In the afternoon, we would watch the gentlemen (and a few women) play boule/petanque, which was quietly enjoyable.A nice, well-kept green space, which is an oasis in a sometimes loud and busy city.

Beautiful Gardens. Centrally located but seem a world away from the hustle and bustle of the city. You can spend a few hours here wandering around or having a picnic lunch. This part is popular with tourists and with the University students next door.

Pretty gardens, park soace. We visited Paris on our 20th wedding anniversary. After hours, and hours, and hours, and . . . hours of museums, we visited the Luxembourg Gardens located near our boutique hotel on the 'left bank.' Excellent stop. Neat exhibition in L'Orangie and wonderful green space. A neat pool where kids sailed boats too. Fun to decompress in the City of Lights. Enjoy.

If there was one place in Paris to picnic, this is it.. Great for strollers, chess players (bring your pieces) or watch, petanque players, tennis players, children, concert go-ers. I recommend hanging out at the Luxembourg Jardin for a long afternoon between days of museum visits. One building is exhibits art of current artists--sort of like an mini-art fair without the on-site sales. The artists are there with business cards and guest books.

Nice to visit if you have plenty of time.. It is nice and huge garden with waterbodies. Chairs are there so you can sit for a while , lots of kids were there with their parents enjoying Toy boat racing .same as stuart little movie.

go, if it doesn't rain hard!. My last visit was with my little nephew. We stopped by each statue and I told him a story related to the character. 4 hours well spent talking and learning history and mythology.
Cool. Calm and cool place to spend an afternoon with friends or by yourself. Looks goos but nothing special.
Cute boating lake!. This is a lovely park, surprisingly big! Outside the senate building there is a big pond and kids (/adults?!) can hire boats to sail - great fun!

Beautiful!. The garden has 106 statues spread throughout the park, the monumental Medici fountain, the Orangerie and the Pavillon Davioud. There are many activities and facilities for children such as puppets, rides and slides. Adults, whether they are Parisians or tourists, can play chess, tennis, and bridge or remote control boats.
Luxembourg Gardens. A stunning opportunity to relax & breath in the 'roses'. A gift to the people of Paris & the 'world' to be appreciated. Wonderful variety of spaces to be enjoyed.

What a way to spend an afternoon!. Merciful heavens, this place is gorgeous! The fountains, the flowers, the neatly trimmed plants: it's wonderful to walk around in. There are great playgrounds and a carousel for children. There's a picnic area and a fountain for relaxing. There's a cafe inside the park, ice cream right outside, and courts for tennis/basketball. A few families were playing soccer in the other open areas. This is a popular running spot, and I can certainly see why.This place might not be the greatest for someone going alone like me, but with a few people, you can easily spend a crazy relaxing afternoon.
Walking tour. Wonderful garden with a pond that the kid's could play with yakt. There is somthing there for everyone, young and old :) ......
Beautiful!. The gardens are lovely and my kids really enjoyed playing with the tiny sailboats in the large fountain. A nice break from the bustling city streets.

Very beautiful. Quite packed on weekends I guess, takes a little bit off the beauty. We entered from the east on St. Michel and headed towards the west, where you can find the little statue of liberty!
Beautiful. Lovely walk through the gardens. Nice location and plenty to see. Did not get the chance to see everything the place had to offer as not enough time but a great picnic spot.

Beautiful Garden. A beautiful garden in the middle of the city. A wonderful place to just stroll and appreciate the buildings, statues, and flowers. Make sure to look for the miniature Statue of Liberty, it is just South of the Rue de Fleurus/Rue Guynemer entrance. Kind of cool to see this one, and a larger version about a mile down river from the Eiffle Tower.

A place to relax near the centre of Paris. Seats in every part mean you can move and sit again in these pretty gardens. Children can sail boats, ride ponies or use the playground. There is tennis and a big bandstand where you might catch a band or pianist. The orangerie has shelter and some art. So if you need some time out, as I always do, this is the spot. I did not try the cafe but it seemed okay.
Enjoyed a stroll. Enjoyed taking pictures with our kids, watching the toy boats and enjoying a summer day in the garden. Was a short walk down the street to the PantheonI liked the Medici fountain.

Nice place to relax. When my husband and I arrived in Paris it was early in the morning and our room was not ready so we left our bags and asked our concierge what he advised to do and he suggested Luxembourg Gardens, it was a short 10 minute walk from where we were staying and it was lovely. Beautiful manicured gardens, lovely sculptures, a lovely pond in the middle with ducks and birds etc and chairs around where you could sit and relax, people watch, read. Lovely photo opportunity's great if the weather is good which it was on the day we visited.

Like a fairy tale.. The gardens are the most stunning in Paris, in my opinion. You can stroll or you can run, but don't miss the sights here. Especially enjoy watching the children sail their boats on one of the fountains. In the middle there are ball courts and also a small cafe where one can buy a snack or drink.

While away a day. We had the good fortune of staying just a block or two away from Jardin du Luxembourg for 8 days in June of this year. I spent the better part of a day wandering around the garden, I brought a book and found a great spot to sit and read near the little lake, and later moved over near the tennis courts where I alternated between reading and watching Frenchmen engaged in some serious tennis. I had an ice cream cone and ended by taking in a special exhibit of paintings at the Musèe du Luxembourg. This is a marvelous place to escape the crowds on the right bank and enjoy a beautiful afternoon.
lovely walk. Everywhere you look could be a postcard picture. Just beautiful. An early start before the sun gets too hot is advised
Lovely garden worth a visit even on cloudy day. Paris has many wonderful gardens but this is one of the best. Allow about an hour to stroll through the walking lanes lined on both sides with trees.

Lazy day at Luxembourge. What a relaxing enjoyable visit to these beautifully kept gardens. Walking through you can't help but notice the abundance of feminine ambiance with all of the female statues waiting to be explored. The relaxing reflecting pond and fountain and the meticulously maintained garden areas are sure to leave you wishing that you had an entire day to enjoy your gelato or latte under the trees with a view of the Eiffel tower in the background. Serene and refreshing after the hustle bustle of walking through Sainte Germaine. Put this on the must see list.
Best to go in summer . We went in winter. So the we couldn't see the beautiful flowers. So it was nothing special. Just like a normal garden.
A lovely walk. There really is not much more to say about this place. It is a park and it is lovely. Enjoy it, take a stroll through and look at the flowers and trees.
Great for a picnic. Easy to bike to using Velib, but no bikes allowed in park. Grab a sandwich and enjoy a relaxing picnic with the locals!

Beautiful gardens a must see. The history of Paris is it was the only city not destroyed in ww2Hitler fave the order to burn Paris but the general disobey him not wanting to go in history books as the one who burned Paris It is in its original lusterAll the buildings in tact the city of fountains and parksMust see

beeautiful. This is a top garden. Lovely lobelia, geranium and marigolds. Sounds like your Nana's garden? Well its not., In Paris they make ordinary look beeeautiful.
Also - lots of chairs to sit on, grass to look at. Whatever you do, don't be sitting on the grass, you crazy kids. Don't be bringing your crazy foreign grass-sitting ideas to these gardens.

Take the time to roam around and relax here. Beautiful well kept gardens and palace... lovely to roam around and relax. The locals seem to love bring a picnic here and the facilities for kids are great!
Good on a sunny day. Find the Medici Fountain and enjoy the open spaces within Luxembourg. There are nearby cafés and brasseries if you fancy a snack.
Beautiful garden. Beautiful garden in district 5 Paris. This garden is just some foots next Pantheon. Come to enjoy in a sunny day...so beautiful.

Peaceful. Free activity and away from the hustle and bustle. Watch families relaxing with their toy sail boats. Stretch the legs or sit quietly, the choice is yours. There are quite a good supply of seats there which is considerate of the curators. Very popular with locals.

The gardens are a feature of a Paris visit that we always enjoy. The gardens are terrific as are the management of the gardens that are manicured to a degree that is incapable of being exceeded! Whether the burner weed removal or aspaliated apples or the vertical trimming if the trees, than agreement/control of the plants is terrific management of the plants. The excellent basis layout of the gardens is a given. The use of flowers to generate color interest and balance is terrific also. Although the restructure of the gardens near the building with security overtones is unfortunate as we missed the superb color and design that normally exists (and hopefully will again next visit). Overall a fantastic facility that tourists (and locals) are lucky to be able to access - for free!

One of my favourite places in Paris . Lovely to visit, large garden with many surprises Free entrance Beautiful flowers currently Watch the chess, tennis or pony rides for childrenRelax in the sun at the lake and rent a small sail boat for your child at €3.50 for 30 minutesStroll along Bd Saint Michel to Notre Dame
Enjoying . After a lots of walking and everybody was very tired. This is the best place to spend your last hour of day. Nice view, fresh air...

Fabulous park; great for Families with small children. . It has a really awesome kids playground. They do charge per child and adult but it is well worth it. My children had a blast and didn't want to leave.

Buy tickets online and take a taxi. I have done this a few times now, once by bus and twice by taxi. Taxi is the way to do it. Also, do Marie Antoinette's house, and start there. Everyone starts in the main palace, and it's super crowded. If you start in the back and work your way forward then it's much more enjoyable. Don't wait in that long line out front.

Lovely Paris Park/Gadens. Thoroughly enjoyed our strolls thro the park on our last visit to Paris. Happy to see it being used extensively for many forms of activity and leisure, our visit certainly added to our city break.

Beautiful gardens. We came to Luxembourg Gardens at the end of our vacation. Glad we did because the weather was perfect and the 10 days that we were in Paris had some rain. Didn't stop us from seeing things but the gardens benefited. The flowers were plentiful and the lake had people with their remote controlled sail boats plying the waters. Great for photography.

Romantic paradise. Whether you're sitting back to people watch, read, have a conversation or take in the beauty of these city gardens, you'll find how beautiful it is. It allows you to escape the chaos and noises you'll find in any major city. This is a must see escape!

A great place to relax and enjoy Paris. Sit in the sun near the pool and watch the children play with the small sailboats in the water. Or rent one yourself for a couple of Euros/half hour. The gardens are stunning. Statues of many prominent women in French history line the walkways. If you'd like some shade and quiet, make your way to the magnificent Medici fountain and have a seat in one of the chairs so you can relax and listen to the sounds of the water. One of our favorite places in all of Paris!

a nice break from walking. The gardens are a great way to relax and to sit and people watch. Close to the Sorbonne and Pantheon in the Latin quarter you will be ready to take on more walking after an enjoyable coffee and crepes at the cafe inside the garden. There is entertainment for kids in the park (fee) and the adults can watch locals play boules, chess and cards.

My favorite garden in Paris. I went to the gardens at the Tuileries, Palais Royale and the National Archives on a recent trip. I am are there are others I have not seen. But this was the loveliest of the ones I did see. Simply beautiful, grand public space. Must see.

The Garden of the People. I love this garden from the children sailing boats in the pond to the beehives and people hanging around reading books. You can see flowers, lovers, fruit trees, chess players, buy a drink and listen to a concert and just enjoy beauty. It is always a treat.
See the real France. Luxembourg gardens is the place the residents of Paris come to relax. Lovely area, well maintained gardens. Oasis of calm within Paris.

A happy accident. We didn't mean to go to the gardens... Didn't think it was anything we were interested in. While walking through the city we wound up there by mistake. It's a great break from the hustle and bustle and a beautiful place to people watch.

Quiet place with busy streets around. The garden entry is free and is frequented by Paris residents and visitors. There are extensive walking trails and some outlets selling beverages. Chairs are also placed at certain points to just enjoy the beauty of the place. Palace entry is not open.

Beauty even in the rain. I visited the gardens on a June rainy day but that didn't stop me from being taken away with the beautiful arrangement and design of the garden. Lots of statues of Queens and consorts of the French Monarchy are on display. Lots of places to sit and take in all of the beauty.

Beautiful. A huge beautiful garden in the middle of busy Paris Latin Quarter. Many families were around the pond sailing boats with the kids, sunning themselves, eating lunch or just relaxing on the grass. We had lunch at the cafe under the trees or umbrella's. Relaxing day!
Gorgeous. Jardin du Luxembourg and Jardin du Tuilleries is simmular, but both worth the visit. The view is great, it's romantic and beautiful. Especialy when the sun is shining!

Nice, relaxing respite from the craziness of Paris. Come here early (before 10) and you'll beat the tourists, can have a quiet breakfast at the cafe, and enjoy the beauty of the gardens. It's a pretty historical area too; numerous writers and artists have graced its grounds and lived around.
Spectacular but off limits to really use.... The Senates private garden. Often used for weddings. Palms and other trees that need to be taken indoors every winter.
Always beautiful!. Take some time by first buying some French pastry and a drink and go for a walk and sit in the park! Just another way to enjoy Paris.
Very beautiful . Very beautiful place for travel and taking pictures and videos. You must finding a good restaurant with a good view to the arc and drink or eat and enjoy it
fantastic place to relax. Beautiful gardens perfect for relaxing. There is a café and live music available plenty of areas to explore and a great afternoon activity

My favourite place in Paris. This park is very popular among residents as well as tourists. It is a nicely maintained garden with towering, orthogonally trimmed chestnut hedges in triple rows as well as a big pond and a Museum an the Palais which houses the senate, the 2nd chamber of the parliament. People go jogging, play Tennis or Boule or just sit and relax in the chairs which are all over the place or on whichever lawn is currently opened for this purpose. There are cafés, kids playground, a carousel and ponyriding.

Beautiful and Relaxing . We walked to the Luxembourg Gardens from the Legend hotel we were staying at. It was incredible that such a serine place could be found in such a busy place like Paris. It was the first thing we did after checking in. I wasn't sure what to expect, but being surprised when we saw how large it was. People jogging, sitting relaxing, a very large playground for the kids (to have been a kid would have been fun). Walking further you arrive at a rather large concrete pond where people are taking their own or renting sailboats. Oh, and there were also ponies to ride. This place has something for anyone of any age. Don't skip it.

Garden is really a park . . .. We did not go into the palace; I'm speaking only of the 'garden.' There were very few plantings. It was really a park with wide gravel paths, trees, benches, tennis courts, a cafe, and not too much in the way of plantings that I normally think of when I think of a garden.
Beautiful, quiet setting!. The gardens were absolutely beautiful, and the area was serene. My husband and I enjoyed walking through and snapping lots of pictures.

Almost left this off the schedule. What a wonderful, relaxing place. We took the Metro here and walked around this beautiful space. Watched old men play a bocce-like game, children chasing each other, men playing chess, people reading, a painter sketching. We went back to our room to get books and spent the afternoon reading! There are hundreds of arm chairs scattered throughout the park. One of our best days in Paris!

Worth A Visit!. Whether you are in Paris on your own, with friends, family or on business and you need a break from the hussle and bustle of Paris, look no further. This park is beautiful, made for relaxing or taking a stroll and near Notre Dame and the Pantheon. Our girls (ages 9 and 12) sailed the small boats in the lake and we had to drag them away. This was my first visit to the park (third time in Paris) and I will never miss it again!

Worth a visit. Love this place. First time I went with my 6 month old daughter. Went today with my 16 year old. There is something for everyone. When my daughter was young we would go to the play park (pay) or puppet show. As they got older they would bring a ball to kick around. Today we watched the people playing pétanque and the little kids sailing their boats. Fun!
Just wonderful. One of the best picturesque outdoors places to walk around and see parisian life during spring, summer, and autumn
Walk in the park. Almost directly opposite the hotel are les Jardins de Luxembourg. Great for a walk away from the main streets

Beautiful Place. We weren't there long, but it's a beautiful place to relax, people watch, and enjoy a crepe or some ice cream. The gardens themselves are very pretty and the kids had fun looking at the small boars in the fountains. Lots of things to see here including the palace, flower gardens, and fountains. Take a few minutes at least to sit and enjoy one of the most beautiful parks in Paris.

Amazing gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are about a 10 minute walk from where we are staying. We go there each morning for a walk. The gardens are beautiful and its a joy to exercise there. It's extremely popular with the locals as an exercise place.

Wonderful place for children. We went to the gardens with a toddler (my sister and I). It was a cloudy day, and the gardens was full of joggers as it was a public holiday. The toddler enjoyed running around the ponds and looking at the ducks. There were lots of chairs for you to sit and watch the ducks as well. We had gone to look at the merry go round but it was unclear where it was located as there were no signboards. We headed randomly towards the left (back towards palace) and finally saw some recreational activities. There was pony riding, a playground, a small basketball court, a puppet theatre a cafe, a carousel. The carousel was closed, and the playground charged for entry for both adults and children so we gave that a miss. However, our toddler got to try the pony ride, and it was great fun for her. Helmets were provided for the kids, and the parents walked alongside for the entirety of the ride. It's a wonderful place for relaxing if the weather is good.
Not as Nice as Expected. I had been here almost 30 years ago and returned to be disappointed. I did not find the flowers or gardens in the condition I expected.

Europe vacation . Awesome place to relax and see the sunset.
The palace is very well kept with very nice gardens and walking trails. We visited in the evening but missed a musical concert.
We walked from Norte Dame area.
Beautiful historic gardens.. Enjoyed early morning runs in these beautiful gardens. They open at 7.30 am. There are tennis courts and a children's playground but fees for their use.

A shame it was closed to the public.. Because of its location bordering EU security facilities. The park was closed without any announcement today. Since Brexit, this may be a concern for some time. It is a lovely park, in a lovely area, and I'm not sure there is any way to check for a closure before arrival, but I would say try anyway, and if it doesn't work out, walk north and east, and discover some great neighborhoods.

Wonderful!. We visited the gardens on our last day and it was wonderful to sit down on the benches and enjoy the views. The sculptures and flowers and various bushes are beautiful. So many wonderful corners and different areas to see and relax. You may have a picnic or just lie down and relax. Definitely one not to miss!

Breath of fresh air. Lovely is the way to describe it. Green, fresh and a breath of fresh air. You can take your pick as all if the above describe the gardens.Metro station right next to the entrance gate. Walk to the gardens. Make your trip around noon and bring a picnic lunch.Remember the gardens really stretch so if u r visiting in summer it will get warm. Bring your water and try to walk in the shade, of which there is plenty. Lines and lines of elegant trees towering up to the sky. The gardens are in sections. Each set lined by trees and benches. Stretch out and dream ur fav dream . Spend a whole afternoon. You wont regret it.

Peace. Wonderful place to have packed a lunch for.We chose a spot just inside the main gate off of Blvd St. Michel. It was serene. Then watching the children with the sail boats in the pool for enjoyable.
Beautiful Garden. I was in Paris for a day trip and went to this garden to relax after a long foot tiring journey throughout the Paris. Garden is beautiful and have picturesque views.

nice gardens in the heart of the latin quater. Since it is the Senate house, there are guards around the building wich was once a palace. You can visit it one day per year (wonderful and luxuous). The park is very nice. It is a must to rest (on chairs or grass when permitted). Take your favorite book and a drink and just relax.

Simply beautiful !. Me and my wife walked in this garden several times, since it was close to our rented apartment,at lunch time on a sunny day it is at its peak.Locals bring their lunch there and eat. Amorous couples are caught in the act of passionate kissing along the Medici Fountain.  The young children delight themselves by floating the toy boats in the round pool. These toy boats carry the flgs of different nations giving a hint of their owners. The majestic statues all arround,exciting you to fall in love,embrace and roll down the slopes of emerald grass. This garden was built for a king who never came.Now parisiens frolic here. There is nice cafeteria,seniors who take hours to finish a tiny cup of coffee, linger here reminiscing about there youth possibly spent amongst thesese trees.The working, splashing fountains add another dimension of glory to this green oasis. As i mentioned before donot under estimate the suggestive power of these marble statues, they may be made of stones but they are alive with deep and delicate messages.If you are in Paris donot miss this garden, choose a sunny day, buy a baguette, grab a bottle of wine , make a pinic basket and make wonderful memories. Best of all it is free!
Serenity Now!. After a busy day in Paris the Luxembourg gardens provided a much needed break! Beautiful gardens &architecture. Don't miss.

Relaxing . Makes for a peaceful walk with lots of chairs and benches. Beautiful flowers and swans in the made man pools. Great place to read your map while taking in the surrounding. Ice cream coffee sold by ventors.

Let's go and stay in Luxembourg garden early in the morning. after a gorgeous coffee and chocolate in one of the nice bistrots all around there, have a walk in, without any special aim or direction and simply observe the life. Better on saturday or sunday morning, nice people everywhere, and take time to talk to someone, look at plants and flowers,or finish with a visit Musee du Senat, not so far, always nice expositions wonderfully settled

Luxembourg Garden. It is a pretty good garden located in the middle of Paris. It is a goof place to walking around the trees and flowers and enjoy the nice weather. You cam seat on a chair around the garden and relax and enjoy.

The Parisians Backyard. Visited Paris for 2 weeks and it rained every day but the last. It didn't matter in the least as I was in Paris! On the day the skies cleared I headed to Luxembourg Gardens as did hundreds of other's. The gardens were lush and beautiful and the atmosphere invites leisure and visiting. The garden is peppered with endless comfortable chairs that beg you to sit and relax. Allow at least 30 minutes for a stroll through or bring a picnic and hang out!

Most beautiful garden in Paris. We were touring Paris with friends that had only been to Paris once before and then only for two days and knew we must take them to Luxembourg Gardens. The main building is the home of the French Senate and occasionally have restrictions on entry, but that has only happened once to us and we've visited many times in many years. Large garden area with a round pond, (used by children to sail model boats) and the most beautifully kept flowers you'll ever see. Stop there, take a seat, eat a picnic lunch and enjoy Paris like you should.

Something for everyone here. Beautifully landscaped with lush green grass. Many people sitting at the edges, reading! Very few i-pads and phone in use. Very encouraging about the future. Places for young children, teens and adults. Bocce Ball, improvised games, healthy fun.

Fantastic garden right in the center of Paris. Great place to rest after a long day .many seats in different spots such as the water po ds , or the music kiosque where you can listen to orchestras during summer . You can jogg , play tennis if you have a good related friend, take your kids to the playground which is safe and well done ,hiire a small toy sailboat , have a poney ride or old Fashion kart,and the Best is to take them to the Guignol, a famous French traditional pupetts show.
Absolutely perfect. Wonderfully beautiful, so calming and ethereal! Wish one could also sit on the grass, but there are lots of benches and chairs to enjoy this beautiful atmosphere. Must see
Gorgeous!. Perfect for a stroll through or a longer visit - we had a small picnic by a fountain. Tables and chairs everywhere on the grounds.

Romantic break. What an amazing place. Beautiful gardens, amazing architecture in the beautiful grand house in there. But then just as important is the glimpse of French lifestyle. Families playing, children playing football, joggers exercising, adults sat around chatting or playing boules, clusters of small ponies for the children. Just an amazing beautiful, peaceful space!
Pretty stress free area to relax. Easy stroll through the park from one end to the other. Plenty of chairs to choose from. We had arranged for a picnic in the park, nice and quiet, just lovely!

Great place to chill out on a sunny day. This is not one of those green parks
It's in at the heart of Paris
Great neighborhood
Surrounded by beautiful french buildings full of history
The park itself has a big pound at the middle, also many green areas and lots of chairs and benches to stay there ...
Great area for pinic also

Our family's favorite . The grounds are gorgeous. For a couple euro you can rent a small sailboat that the kids can play with by pushing with a stick. Simple fun. Horse rides. Tennis. A giant fenced in playground that is well worth the entrance fee (2 euro, or close to) take the break and enjoy.
Gorgeous city park. Bring a book and read on a bench. This is a place for a nice jog, a rest, a picnic of food, or just people watching.
Wonderful. The gardens were a delightful escape after an afternoon walking tour of Paris. We enjoyed an ice cream while people watching at the fountain.

Beautiful surroundings - with chairs to sit in for free!. Great gardens, really beautiful, on the left bank in a great location. As long as you don't step on the lawns (you will find out soon enough if you do) then this is a great relaxing place to visit in Paris. Nice restaurant with reasonable prices in centre of the gardens: crepes, coffees, sandwiches, plats, all good and fast service (for Paris).

Perfect afternoon in Paris. I cannot stress how lovely this garden is - exactly how you would expect a Parisian park to be. Beautiful flowers, trees and pathways as well as lovely fountains. Very nice for photos but we sat around the fountain in the sun with so many other people - reading , talking and sailing little boats with their kids. Like a storybook.
Beautiful . We visited at the beginning of the spring, and the flowers were not all in place or in full bloom. However it is a great place to visit, relax and take beautiful pictures.

Favorite Gardens in Paris by far (even over Versaille). There are so many wonderful gardens, squares and parks all over Paris. I felt this was by far the most beautiful. I also loved all the activities available, from relaxing, to play area for kids and adults (boules), tennis, even stumbled upon a live concert.

Favorite outdoor spot. . Having been to many outdoor spots in 10 days - gardens, plazas, monuments, botanical garden, etc. I think this was definitely my favorite. Interesting, well kept, a mix of things to do and see, refreshments - it had it all. Great way to relax for a few hours.

A wonderful oasis in the heart of a pulsing city.. Beautiful and Serene, is the best way to describe these gardens. With acres of parkland and some forested aeas, it is a wonderful way to take time out and relax in Paris. In the latin quarter near the university, take the exgtra time to wlk around the streets and take in the ambience.

Beautiful but overcrowded!. The grounds are gorgeous! No doubt and worth an hour or two or if you have leisure time to go to have a picnic but be aware...you and like 10,000 people have the same idea as you. NOOOOO JOKE!!!

10 year old boy loves the park!. A must on any trip if you have children that need a break from touring and museums. Beautiful gardens, a couple nice places to eat, with restaurant by the Medici fountain very nice for lunch w/ a menu and super friendly waiters. Beyond the main fountain where one can rent a small wooden boat, there are pony rides (open on Sunday), and the enclosed playground area with numerous things to do including a mini-zip line (quite safe)that all the kids love!!! 2.5 euro for a child and 1.2 for the parent to go in(Tip: save the 1.2 and send your child in while you sit outside the fence on one the classic Paris park chairs.)

Beautiful gardens. These gardens are a must see in Paris and is the perfect place for an evening picnic. I recommend grabbing some food and wine from the market and sitting in one of the grassy areas.

Beekeeping in the garden. Having been to the Luxembourg Gardens many times over the years I thought this visit we would seek out where the bee hives are kept, I had seen images of the hives before, not the standard white square boxed hives but elegant wood stained boxes with hexagon shaped lids.The bee hives are located in the corner of the gardens near the rue de Fleuris entrance of the Luxembourg Gardens. On the Saturday morning of our visit this section of the garden was corded off due to a beekeeping class in progress, extracting the honey. Fortunately we could see a little of the action from afar before we moved on to enjoy other sections of the park we had not seen before. As always the park attracts locals and visitors, it is a delightful large public park in the centre of Paris.

Relaxing space and yet so many active people!. This is a beautiful garden in the heart of Paris well worth a visit. Sit and watch the children run around with their poking sticks playing with the sailing boats on the water of the fountain and remember the simple pleasures of childhood.

Almost a Tuilleries. Don't get me wrong, the Jardin du Luxembourg is awesomely beautiful, with is classic statues and great pélouses - but it is also full of tourists and has way less room to just chill with a bottle of wine and some cheese than the Jardin des Tuilleries; if you have only a little time in Paris, leave the Luxembourg for next time and make your route towards the iron chairs that face the Seine and the Eiffel tower from the Tuilleries;
Not that important. Very normal and usual garden.Nothing very special about it.Some waters and benches.Ntg impressive.

Gorgeous garden. This is absolutely beautiful garden with classic and relax atmosphere. Spend here 1-2 hours to enjoy sunny day, have a picnic, watching local people habits (seating on the grass and drink a vine, talking with friends, just relax etc). Be aware the all doors around garden would be close by 8 pm and no way to go out after that.

Best Park Ever!. Went with my 2 kids (5 & 2). It costs a couple euros to enter the playground but so worth it. Shaded and tons to play on. Also the rest of the park is breathtaking and I photographed my kids playing with the little sailboats in the main pond.

Amazing. I wandered in and sat and watched locals playing boules (bocce ball in the U.S) and had a very relaxing afternoon. It is a charming park. The gardens are wonderful and the people are great. It was my favorite afternoon in Paris.

Free and lovely . Spent a good 2 hours at the Luxembourg Gardens, which was enjoyed by both adults and children. Clean and well-manicured, beautiful sculptures and lawns. Activities for children such as miniature boat sailing. Free admission to boost!
Beautiful walk. no matter what time of year you visit the Luxembourg Gardens are always so beautiful. One of the best free walks you can do with your special someone.
Beauty.... Just a beautiful public space. Well maintained and really attracts a plethora of people. Relaxed and vast in space.

Perfect break in Paris. don't miss a visit to these lovely public gardens. Outstanding layout and upkeep. Bring a snack or lunch and relax in this amazing space. Chair available to pull into the shade as needed.

Royal Running. The Jardins du Luxembourg was right around the corner from our hotel. It is a superb park in the 5th area of Paris.Filled with families, lovers and folks relaxing the location is fantastic for running, a picnic, reading a book or a glass of wine relaxing with a loved one. The gardens are beautiful, the senate palace impressive and the fountains regal.A legendary location in the middle of the Quartier Latin, a great spot do some people watching in their element. This is also a location that has inspired countless French composers, a quick search on your music apps returns multiple answers for a wonderful playlist for your visit!

LOUXEMBOURG RELAXING GARDEN MIDDLE OF PARIS. Excellent relaxing wide park in the middle of Paris.. went there with my pic-nic as a stopover while walking frantically around Paris.. thought it better idea than sit at a cafe.. they provide you with director style chairs.. wonderful group of trees to stay under its shadow..has a fountain ... bought my baguette and a coke.. ideal if you are coming from Notre Dame, or Latin Quarter... highly recommend it....if you are wlaking in the area...

One of my favorite places in paris. I always love going to the Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful places to relax, have your lunch or dinner picnic. Last week we saw the Eric Valli exhibition at the L'Orangerie du Senat. I highly recommend it (and it was free!).
Such a lovely space. Always enjoy wiling a few hours away wandering these delightful gardens, relishing the wonderful combination of trees, water, flowers. Highly recommend.

Must visit with children . Perfect place to bring the kiddos when traveling! There's a massive playground (2E), toy sailboat rentals (3,50E), pony rides, and lots of grassy areas for picnics. There are also a few cafes and food vendors. Great way to spend an afternoon!
Luxemnourg Gardens. We walked through the gardens by accident and were in for a treat. Plenty to see on a great summers day stroll.

A place to decompress!. The gardens are in front of the palace of Catherine deMedici which is now home to the French senate. You see wonderful,planting a, huge trees, a tree lined esplanade, a carousel, bee apiary, test gardens, tennis courts and a pétanque court. All available to everyone. There are chairs to sit at leisure, people picnicking , chess centers and card players and sandy areas for children. The highlight is a large pond with boats...you rent a boat and place it on the water, wind powers it and should it hit the opposite side of the pond you have a long stick to push it back out. Twenty boats were on the water flying across with the wind and pushed back out by children racing around the pond. It was magical.
A quiet refuge from the bustling Paris streets. We spent part of a morning in Paris quietly walking around the Luxembourg Gardens. We found a quiet bench and watch the locals engaging in Tai Chi.

nice garden to spend leisure time. the alignment of trees the scent of flowers and the green beauty all around its a nice place to spend a sunny day with your loved one ... just sit on a chair near the pond reading a book or relaxing ... the garden is good the smell of fresh grass will get you.. i loved it more than notre dam cathedral or any other historical building.
Meh.. Overrrated. Park was beautiful, but nothing to go out of your way for. Disappointed considering all the hype on this site.

Great place on a sunny day!. People running and excersing, mothers with kids staying in the shade, fountains with clear water - a great place to visit on a sunny day.The property is very well mantained, access is free.What an awesome place to spend a few hours!

So much fun and so beautiful!. So much fun and so beautiful! I went here on honeymoon. My husband who is a French citizen. People just bring their chairs and relax, or walk through to see the beautiful flowers...

Spring 2016. We come to paris nearly every year and always include two or three visits to this wonderful space. It's so lovely and diverse while being stately. Flowers, sculptures and the people make this my favorite place. And their is eye candy for everyone. We spend at least an hour, usually more and then get a bit to eat.

No Flowers. We were in between seasons for flowers. They were just putting in the summer flowers the day we arrived. Not much to see,so we only spent 30 minutes there watching kids playing with sailboats in the lake.
Romantic and amazing garden!. Amazing garden independently of the weather. You can have a nice sip of coffee around the garden and enjoy the view! Pretty romantic!
beautiful. Awesomely designed, beautiful flowers, great place to relax and chill out, for a picnic and best of all it is free for all

Such a delight!. Ohhh, such a delight after walking for hours and hours, days and days indoors in museums and galleries, it is a great place to simmer down, enjoy the landscape, have an ice cream from one of the vendors outside and just relax.

Visit other places if you are short on time. This place because it is FREE, it was mob with kids and retirees. I would prefer to visit other attractions than this one. You didn't miss anything if you skip it.
I went to this place based on Trip Advisor's recommendations but the reality check is not worth it.

Smell the roses. An amazing space in a beautiful city.
We took wine and cheese and had a small picnic while we listened to a local choir sing.
Why wouldn't you!
Amazing. A must see and so close to my hotel. What an amazing place, so many statues, museums, ponds and the green landscapes are amazing! Pack a picnic basket and enjoy the space!
Beautiful, quiet space in the crazy city of Paris. This is a fantastic place to relax in during a dry, warm day to get away from the hassle and bustle of Paris. Nice open air cafe options too.

Beautifully curated trees and rive gauche ambience. Romantic, romantic, romantic! Jardin du Luxemburg is better than the Versailles in my opinion. Take a stroll through, rain or shine, and you will love the fresh air and adore the beautifully curated trees. Such a treat in the heart of the city.

Great gardens with other attractions. Well worth a visit, given its proximity to the Pantheon, zoo, natural history museums, etc. Great place to picnic, people watch, and generally relax away from the crowded tourist areas.
A lovely oasis. Lovely gardens filled with Parisians enjoying their beauty. Beautifully laid out with a peaceful aspect to the fountain.

Put up your feet and relax. The Luxembourg Gardens are the place to go to take a breather from relentless sightseeing. Find a chair near one of the small basins and watch the children play with the sailboats. Enjoy a concert at the bandshell near the snack stand. Watch a game of amateur volleyball. Stroll through the paths to enjoy the planting seeds and statuary. Just take the opportunity to refresh your soul.
Very pretty. We took a break in the middle of the day to go here. One of our guides said not to miss it. It was beautiful and a nice break from the busy city. Worth a visit.

Paris Gardens. The first time I saw the Luxembourg Gardens I was blown away. Then again it was started by a Medici.I stumbled upon it by chance many years ago as a teenager inter railing around Europe. Like much of Paris it's pure class.I walked back there this month as I was in Paris for Euro 16.It was just splendid.
Buy some wine and grab a book. What a terrific place to spend a beautiful afternoon. Lots of chairs and locals enjoying the gardens. Unfortunately, it rained the day we were there .

One of the Most Charming Parks in Paris. This is for the most part a formal, symmetrical "jardin á la française," but on the west and southwest sides lovely curved paths wind around immaculate lawns, with many lovely spots to sit and read a book, or just take in the scene.

acceptable. not at all what I expected, but that doesn't say much. Small, with not much in it. Came for the marrionnette show, but it turned out to be hand puppets for kids, still worth it though. The Big Bad Wolf looked like Evil Goofy - i couldn't stop giggling.

Summer walks and chess. It was a great place to stroll around the gardens. Area for tennis courts, chess playing, croquet for older adults groups, children park and exhibitions inside the atrium.Different sculpture located inside every corner of the garden.A cafe to hang out with friends

Music in the park. Fortunate enough to be present for an afternoon performance by a young pianist who played Chopin for an hour. Sitting beneath the trees as evening approached with a hundred plus people was extraordinary .
Beautiful spot to spend an evening (with a nice bottle of wine!). Take a bottle of wine and some snacks and spend the afternoon (or evening) taking in the beautiful scenery of the gardens and ponds.

One of the best attractions in paris .. One of the best attractions in paris . The perfect place to relax . At the centre of the fantastic latin quarter . Good place to relax and read s book .
