Also suits family trip . A lot if pony horses near the gardens waiting for the children . There is tennis courts also , chess table and more . Off Course the garden itself is one of the most beautiful in the world .

Escape the crowds, let the children play, and admire classic laid-out french allées and gardens.. We spent many years in Paris and raised our family not far from the Luxembourg Gardens, before moving back to England. Covering 23 hectares (57 acres), the formal french park layout encompasses rows of trees precisely planted along gravel walkways, two fountains, and more than 80 statues, including a small version of the Statue of Liberty by Bartholdi, that was given to the United States in 1886 and is in the Jardin Anglais. The gardens remain a splendid spot to rediscover nature and find peace in the middle of the bustling metropolis. Hard to believe, that one is just a couple of hundred meters away from the tourist-and-student quartier of the Left bank.Children float rented toy boats in the wind that ruffles the water of the octagonal pool in the park's centre. The formal lawns are dotted or framed with trees, bushes and flowers. Many of these are out of bounds, others can be crowded by sunseekers in the summer high season. In autumn, the chestnut trees drop their shiny seeds, to the delight of children. At the south end of the park is the Palais du Luxembourg, erected in 1631 in florentine style, to remind Marie de Medici, widow of Henri 1V, of her native Florence. It served as headquarters of the Luftwaffe in WW11, and houses the french Senate today. Not open to the public.Boulevard St. Michel adjoins the east side of the park. It offers a pleasant walk downhill, through the Latin Quarter, crossing Boulevard St. German and ending at the Île de la Cité and Notre Dame Cathedral.

The best place to run in Paris. Not to mention you run in the gardens of a palace. It houses the French Senate these days and therefore it is very safe area as well. Spring in the gardens is stunning and the peace it provides within the hustle and bustle of Paris is a welcome retreat anytime of the day. Enjoy one of The cafes that are located across the street as well. Well worthy the visit

Gorgeous. A beautiful setting for a picnic or walk or just sitting and reflecting on the beauty of this gorgeous city. Close to cafes, Beautiful gardens and places to walk. Fountains statues and architecture beautiful.

My favorite garden in Paris. There's probably hundreds of parks in Paris but the Luxembourg Gardens is my personal favorite. Either you go in the fall, summer, spring or winter this place is always beautiful and full people enjoying life. Fun for people watching which is definetely one of my favorite activities whenever I find myself in Paris.
Very relaxing. Great place to take a break in Paris. Nice to walk around, find good place and relax after all other activities in Paris.

All parts worth a walk and a watch. We love the Luxembourg Gardens and have learned not just to stroll the main, gravel paths and watch the families and sailboats on the pond. Its heavily treed western side is full of playgrounds, tennis courts and paths winding between them. On a warm spring day Paris comes alive in all these nooks and crannies.

Authentic Parisian Afternoon. Huge walking garden that is full of interesting flora but offers the best people watching. Be sure to bring a blanket and a bottle of wine to spend an afternoon on the lawn relaxing and watching people from around the world explore this beautiful garden.

Beautiful grounds to enjoy for free!. Come watch all the locals running in the morning. Yes, running, not jogging so stay out of their way. Beautiful shady grounds open up to a colorful highlights around the palace and statues.
Pretty gardens. If you have an extra hour to walk around, then is definitely worth seeing. Right in the center of Paris in the St. Germain area with beautiful flowers and plants.
Lovely Gardens . Enjoyed an early morning visit to the gardens. I love the French style and there were many flowers to see.Well worth a visit.
Great place to relax. This is a wonderful spot to stop and relax and enjoy life. Pull up a chair and catch up with a friend or just enjoy some peace and quiet.

If you want to relax in Paris, visit these!. Our hotel was very near these wonderful gardens, and we were extremely impressed by them. They have excellent pathways throughout, making it easy for those with limited mobility, and some wonderful photo opportunities. While not comparable with the magnificence of the huge gardens of the Palace of Versailles, these are wonderful examples of the best of 19th century garden design and construction.I don't know how busy they get, but in mid morning when we visited they were quiet, and they were a lovely tranquil place to relax and soak up the sunshine.Not to be missed!

A beautiful morning. From Odéon Metro station I walked , for 15min, along the back streets in Paris and was able to absorb the backdrop to Jardin du Luxembourg.The gardens are well maintained and enjoyed by many locals and tourists. Among the statues you can play tennis, bowls, entertain the children in the playground, listen to the band in the carousel, visit the exhibition in the L'Orangerie Centre or simply sit in one of the many comfortable seats and absorb the beauty of the park. Can recommend the café there too (I had a delicious fettuccine lunch).How lucky are the workers/members of the French Senate to work in the beautiful residence of Marie de' Medici - created in 1612!

Always a place of beauty and serenity. I was just there this June and while it was drizzling, it was still a pleasure to walk the loverly paths of the Luxembourg Gardens. The exhibit on the fence of winter was educational and visually stunning. The men playing boules. Great spot to rest while in Paris.

Beautiful Gardens!. What a wonderful place for a walk in gorgeous surroundings. Beautiful shades of green trees and vibrant blooms on shrubs, flowers and gardens. I wish we had more time to sit and just people watch.
Great place to relax and take in the views. We enjoyed taking a rest here, and watching some people play tennis and also playing chess in a heated match. Relaxing park setting.
Lovely quiet space. A pretty little space, but not easy for the disabled as very few ramps or dropped curbs. Nice place to just chill out.
LOVELY ON A WEEKEND. Lovely gardens and especially enjoyable on a Sunday when families are out and about. Very relaxing place to hang out. Take a picnic.
Where the artists strolled. A beauiful garden in the Latin Quarter, with a magnificent fountain ( of the Medici) with statue complexes adorning it. The palace adds to its charm.

A beautiful afternoon strolling through the gardens. We spent a leisurely afternoon strolling through the gardens. There are plenty of places to sit and relax and also an outdoor cafe for food & wine. Great way to spend a relaxing morning or afternoon!
A nice stroll. Had a really nice stroll in this park. It wasn't that big but enough to hang around for a while. There's a Chopin concert when I was there.

Better than the pictures can show. This is an extremely large gardens. It is laid out so beautifully and with many people there you still have a great deal of room to explore. The palace where the Senat meets is the icing on the cake.,Look at all the French Queen statues. Enjoy the flowers and the fountains. Great place to just sit and enjoy a picnic.
If the weather is good, do it.. If you like to walk and be outside this is a great place to walk. It's also in walking distance of several Museums and the Seine.
Gorgeous Gardens. Fabulous garden that's just wonderful to stroll through. As if you needed a reminder that you are in Paris but everywhere you look you will see all the things you expect to see.
Best park of the city. Lots of nooks and crannies to this park. Water, castles, statues, flowers, boats, and a lot of happy people.

Amazing "Park". This is a great public space, great to just stroll or if you have kids with you, to spend a day there. They rent little sail boats, have toddler play areas, and areas for adults to sit and enjoy!

Quintessential Left Bank. These magnificent gardens are simply not to be missed. A quintessential Parisian experience in the heart of the Left Bank. With the gorgeous national Senate as a back-drop the Luxembourg has many different facets, from formal flower gardens to pétanque courts, and quiet corners for reading, tennis, poney rides and puppet shows for kids, a band rotunda, the exquisite Medici Fountain with its optical illusion, superb sculptures, outdoor cafés etc, there is something for everyone.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens for any age! They have chairs and benches all around to sit and enjoy the view, you can also stroll/walk around as the park is very big with relaxing beautiful views.
Love it!. A beautiful garden and a very good way to spend a hot sunny day in Paris. Plenty of chairs, bars, toilets and everything you need.
Beautiful place. Beautiful and relaxing place. Good place to have a picnic because the cafes inside are not good and extremely expensive!!!!

The absolute romantic parisian garden. If you want to feel what is a garden in Paris just go there. This is part of the history of the romantical Paris. Just feel the atmosphere in the morning and imagine the black and white photos from Robert Doisneau.. Iconic!

Beautiful garden/park in the center of Paris. Lovely place to relax, specially when is sunny, beautiful gardens,peaceful,colorful. You can have a break next to the fountain, under the trees, many chairs to get some sun and /or read a book.

Beautiful place to sit and relax. Good place to sit down and relax. Also nice place to have some cheese and bread.
Plenty of chairs and lounge chairs.

Relatively small but well kept. Coming from London with city parks which can be hard to beat Paris' spaces whilst not as big are very pleasant. The Luxembourg gardens were very peaceful, very well kept and had quite a few amenities. One particularly nice feature were all the chairs that were just placed around the park randomly and which you can just pick up and move as you wish. Nice spot for a peaceful break but it's quite small so don't expect to take a big long walk in it.

Our favourite place in Paris. We've been with our children when they were small, and when they were big and it's always the first place we head for when we arrive in Paris. Just go! Hire a boat to push across the pond, watch the marionette show, have a pony ride, watch the old men playing chess under the trees, have a drink watching the band playing, read your book in the sun, it's a dream place. Just go!

Stunning . Grab a picnic lunch and head to the Luxembourg gardens to enjoy the day. There are plenty of benches, chairs and places to relax. Grab a sail boat for the kids to play in the small pond and soak up the wonderful sites of this location.

Obviously really classy but also dull. I guess it doesn't work for everyone. If you are looking for a small relaxing walk this is the place. But if you want to hang out on the grass, have a picnic, get in touch with nature, no worries there are a lot of other parks, but this is not one of them

Don't Miss!. This beautiful park has everything; a beautiful building, a pond with little sail boats, statues, chairs to sit in, gorgeous landscaping, and even food! Locals abound, not just tourists, which makes it really feel French.
Great with Kids. A very nice park with playgrounds, sitting areas, walking paths and a small lake. Especially, the main playground area can entertain children for long time.
Relax. Enjoy. Nature.. If you want to take a stroll and enjoy the evening, this is the place to go. The garden is well maintained as well.

A place to relax in busy Paris. Our 3rd visit in the past 8 years, this time just 1 month ago. A very relaxing place to just wonder around, enjoying the gardens, lovely fountains lined with statues of past queens and well known ladies. The Chateau Luxembourg is an impressive building and is the seat of the Senate of France, I believe. Beautiful roses if you get there in early summer, even late spring. Interesting horticultural experimentation.

Perfect example of the best of Paris. The park consists of beautiful grounds well tended and enjoyed by the locals. From the artwork to the gardens to the fountain to the gazebo there is something for everyone. Parisian culture at its best and not overrun w tourists.

Flowers and expanses of grass. This is a wonderful park to walk or rest on the many green chairs available along the way. Here you will see joggers and picnickers. The fountains, statues, and grassy areas are pleasant places to enjoy. I felt like I was enjoying Paris like a Parisian!

Quiet break from hectic Paris. We were able to walk to the gardens from our hotel and it was a quiet break from the hectic streets of Paris. Seems like a place that Parisians visit for reading and walking on s nice weekend day or after work.

gardens. absolutely gorgeous a nice respite from the bustle of city and noise ,,,birds are singing and beautiful gardens well tended etc...worth an afternoon then went to jardin des plantes which was not well tended a bit weedy.
Lovely way to relax in Paris. Flowers and plants got a late start due to cold and rain for most of May. A few more days of nice weather should have the gardens in bloom.

Worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood. There are so many parks to choose from in Paris. This one is quite lovely with tennis courts and children's playground (for a fee). The kiosk (Table du Luxembourg) was good for lunch.

Great place for a morning jog. My husband and I visited this park twice during our stay in Paris. We ran the perimeter track for a morning jog. It's about 2.1km for a loop. Great flat running track with pretty gardens to look at. Lots of Gardeners working on the flowerbeds. Beautiful place for a picnic or to sip your morning coffee and eat a pain o chocolate of you please.

Place to rest. Paris is a wonderful city with many things to do. If you like bike and want to rest a little bet, just take some wine with you, let your bike locked outside and walking, siting an relax into Luxembourg Gardens.

Picnic time. this is a great park to bring food and do a picnic, Parisians love to do that, I've seen picnics happen in a street corner standing up. What I don't like about this park is the absence of shady areas at the center and you can't move the chairs next to the very small trees for a little shade. Avoid hot summer says during peak heat hours.
Peaceful and relaxing. Located in the middle of busy Paris streets. Great way to relax, unwind and enjoy the views. The garden is well maintained.

Enjoy the outdoors. It is the perfect spot to walk the gardens and find a spot on the grass to just chill out. There is so much to take in, such as: the flowers, sculpture creek and great people watching.

Lovely, extensive gardens and park.. Lovely atmosphere, lot of trees, grassy areas, large fountain in the middle, large play area for kids (small fee to go in), tennis courts, cafe. A really nice place to sit and have lunch and relax. There a chairs scattered around the place for you to grab a bunch together and sit and chat. It was spotless! Everyone puts their litter in the bin and looks after the place. Highly recommend to go and chill.
The most peaceful and charming parc of Paris. My preferred parc in Paris.The most charming peaceful and beautiful public space of Paris.Try the chairs with a book for few hours...
Peaceful. Just relax in this amazing and peaceful park after a long day visiting Paris or you can decide to have a quick lunch and enjoy the place. Great with kids who can play safely.

Beautiful gardens but crowded. Beautiful place for a stroll or walk. Really well maintained gardens and building. If your looking to sit down on the grass for lunch or to relax you'll be arms length away from a stranger. The fountain where kids put in their boats and push them around is fun to watch. The boats have flags from different countries and there is one that's a pirate ship so if your bringing your kids and you can't get the boat from the country of your choice the pirate one might be good.
Great for a relaxing sunny day. Beautiful on a sunny springtime morning. Lots of great statues, plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by. Fee to use the WC.

The most pleasant place!. The Luxembourg Gardens is (arguably) the most pleasant place for a walk or afternoon respite in all of Paris. Don't plan to just stroll through -- plan to sit, stroll, rest, stroll, enjoy the beauty, stroll . . . even take a nap if the sun is out!

Great place to chill :D. It is one of the most beautiful gardens in parisDont miss it especially on a hot day , you can hang out there by the pond and have a great time enjoying nature and architecture
Picturesque. We visited when it was a sunny day so the place was full of people but still enjoyed our stroll and best of all the picturesque view.

Magical place to relax and play. This playground, at the price of a couple euro, buys happiness for a sunny afternoon. My advice is to stop by a lovely boulangerie a few blocks away (Le Petit Lux) and grab quiche, sandwiches, salads, and treats to make a picnic lunch. This is a fantastic fully-appointed playground with creative structures in a safely enclosed area, making it an ideal place for parents and kids alike to relax and enjoy.

Gorgeous landscaping!. The landscaping was absolutely gorgeous, I couldn't stop taking pictures. Its a nice place to wander about, lay on the grass, read a book, have some lunch, people watch, and take a nap. All of which I did on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.
Lovely. A lovely peaceful retreat from the craziness that is Paris.Toilettes disgusting despite charging 50cents.
Only if nothing else to do. This is a well maintained garden with a beautiful palace, but go to Versailles to see real splendor.

A must see. beautiful - Great way to spend an afternoon. very relaxing. The main fountain is spectacular, we really enjoyed watching children playing with the sailboats they rented depicting their countries flag.
Most romantic place i've ever seen. There is a beautiful grotto with a heart shaped hedge, you'd have to be stone not to feel a little romance

A Wonderful Resource for Kids and Adults Alike. The Luxembourg Gardens are (is) one of our favorite places to visit when we go to Paris. It is wonderful to see kids playing and adults strolling. The pool is great. The kids play with sail boats sending them all around a pretty large pool. And there is bandstand where you might see any sort of entertaining event, dancing, singing or musical. A very relaxing spot to sit and watch Parisians at their leisure. A good way to escape, sit and have a sandwich.
Stunning garden!!. I was amazed by the size of the garden and grounds. I also liked the fact they gave you seats so you could sit there all day if you wanted.

Breathtaking!. I visit this garden at least once a week! I grab my kids or a friend, get a sandwich at Le Petit Lux, a bottle of wine from the Monop' and head to the garden. We grab chairs by the Senat overlooking the large pond. It is so fun to people watch and relax. The garden is even beautiful in the rain!!!
Beautiful Garden. One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris, whether you want to relax or jog with the Parisians. A visit at Musee Luxembourg is a nice addition to visit to the park.
Beautiful place to go in Paris. A lot of colorful flowers and a big lake with some sailing boats! A great place to spend some time of tranquility.

Beautiful on a pretty day. Our apartment was on Rue de Vaugirard, so it was very nice to walk to this. There were children racing boats in the water and there was a band playing by the café. If the weather had been nicer I would've loved to sit and stay for a long time. Very beautiful and filled with locals.
Beautiful and relaxing place. I had lunch at my favorite place in Paris @lespapilles and this is a short walk from there. Highly recommend a walk in this relaxing park

Beautiful, free, relaxing . This is a free garden to wander about. It did help that the sun was shining AND we had picked up fresh pastries to enjoy on one of the seats around the water. A lovely couple of hours spent walking around these well kept gardens, enjoying the weather and the greenery. Recommend thoroughly. Grab some pastries and have a snack whilst enjoying the surroundings.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens are a must see. Such a beautiful place. I have young children and they loved the playground. Something suitable for all ages. But just be aware that you must pay to enter the children's playground, it isn't expensive, €1.50 adults and €2.50 children. Just to be aware so you carry some cash on you. They have a small tuck shop, bathrooms also pony rides too. Children can also play with small wind boats at a charge too. We had a wonderful day there. Definitely take your camera, beautiful clean gardens suitable for all. One of our highlights of our Paris trip :)

Even if it is for 5 minutes, you must visit. If a nice day, spend a few hours wandering, or bask by the fountain/ pool. It was a rainy day, but it was still worth a ride on the RER to wander the Garden, and view the palais on the other side of the pool with the fountains.

Beautiful Garden. It is absolutely beautiful and within walking distance to the Latin Quarter. It was built for Marie de Medici, from the powerful Florence family who married the king of France. The palace is great and there are a lot of statues, including one similar to the Statue of Liberty. The world's oldest carousel is also there.
Beautiful! . Beautiful place to rest your feet after touring the city all day! We enjoyed the shade provided on a warm day! Great place for a picnic!

Beautiful garden. Luxembourg gardens were a must place to visit when we were in Paris. Even thought it rained that day we didn't let that bother us. Garden is quite big with lots of beautiful flowers and trees which were given a "box shaped cut". There's also little park for kids to play and it cost 2,5€. Our kids loved to play and run around there while we had some coffee and rest our feet for a while.
Relaxing and Beautiful. Walked through the Gardens following lunch one day. It was a relaxing walk and wonderful to see the beauty of the Gardens.

Truly beautiful. A truly enjoyable and beautiful Garden and it's free. A great place to stroll or bring your Lunch. The grounds are immaculate and easy to enjoy. A nice break if you're on a hectic sight seeing schedule.
Ah, peace!. It's vast, it's peaceful, it's beautiful. And surrounded on all sides outside it's walls by cafes, bistrots, and restaurants. What could be bad?

Relax . . . where Parisians sunbath and relax. Luxemborg Gardens is a place to relax, enjoy the gardens and statuary . . . or just people watch. It's a great place to go after hours in museums.Beautifully grand, you can walk the gardens or watch locals sail small boats in the huge fountain. You can eat nearby either before or after your visit, so this is a good place to go . . . anytime.

Stumbled upon this gem of a garden during a neighborhood exploration.. It is nice to see people utilizing a park. All the trees are perfectly aligned in all directions. This was near the Le Royal hotel.
Terrific. Go, walk around, sit a while and enjoy. Free to all.. Highly recommended. Go with kids and families or just walk around and enjoy the beauty of the gardens, the quiet, the trees and more.

Sunday afternoon at Luxembourg gardens. There's so much going on here. Amazing , huge kids'playground,definitely the spot if you are travelling with kids.classical statues, a model nboating lake and pettanque to watch. Also tennis and pony trekking. A real haven within the city.

Nice play area and beautiful castle. The garden for 10 min walk for us from our place. It has a very good kids play area and nice walk around. The castle is magnificent and on a bright summer day, its a treat to watch with families and friends enjoying the small pond and lawns.

Beautiful park in the middle of Paris. The Luxembourg gardens have been a fixation of mine since I was learning French as a teen: the "famille Vincent" would visit those gardens so the younger son could put his model boat in the lake. Well, it's all true. The palace in the background is everything a place should be, while in front of the little lake is full of model boats [you can rent them at a kiosk next to the pond]. A bunch of metallic chairs are available for free for people to just sit and gaze at the surrounding, the water. We walked around slowly, enjoying the fresh air and the calm setting. We bumped into three people who were reading books. An excellent break, for a quick rest, if you're into walking in Paris.

Grand. The Luxembourg Gardens are very grand but we were disappointed that there were so few flowers. A lot of the flower beds were still empty and several were currently being planted. We visited on a warm sunny afternoon and everyone was out enjoying the sun. There are benches and chairs all over the garden to sit and relax. There is a beautiful museum at one end of the garden that is very picturesque. If you love gardens do not miss an opportunity to visit this grand garden.
Lovely park. Beautifully well kept gardens. Well worth a visit. Plenty of seating to relax and watch the world go by. Nice little pond with little boats on. Very quaint

Beautiful gardens - especially on a sunny day!. These gardens are really something special, especially in the Spring time with the beautiful flowers. It's a lot of fun to hire one of the boats that you can push around the little lake, and there's ample seating around the park!

Perfect for relaxing. Great place in the middle of the city where you can take a rest and relax in this peaceful garden. Take your lunch there and enjoy the scenery after exploring the Latin quarter and St.Germain.

The epitome of Paris. This park makes you feel like you've arrived in Paris. The gardens are immaculately maintained, and the look of the manicured trees are impressive. Every corner has new statue or fountain to discover. They are all impressive and easy to appreciate. A lot of locals are strolling or jogging through. There are chair all around to sit and ponder or appreciate for everyone's use. We thoroughly enjoyed our walk through this park and it has left us with a great memory of Paris.
worth it!!. easy to get to, by metro or walking , best on a nice day, to sit, stroll, and near the nicest places in st germain
Gorgeous! . You must go it's glorious - an oasis! We stayed near it and regularly walked through even if it was out of the way... Just gorgeous!

Must visit gardens in Paris. Great family spot.If you're on a group tour then you must insist your guide to let you explore these gardens. They are incredibly well maintained and very beautiful with tall lush trees at the entrance and a scenic pond at the center where you can grab a bite. The sculptures at various spots are very precise and intricate especially one of the lion you must see. Relaxing and peaceful area. Grab an ice cream and a bench and enjoy the nature.

Delightful oasis. We walked from our hotel in the Opera district all the way down to the Gardens and it was well worth the walk. Loved sitting in the chairs and listening to the many languages that surrounded us - particularly the lively young Parisians on their lunch break.

A Beautiful Place To Rest and Relax. Visiting a large city like Paris can mean a hectic week - with limited time, we always feel we are rushing from attraction to attraction to wait in line. As a result, we loved the simplistic beauty of Luxembourg Gardens. A quiet, peaceful bit of nature in the center of city - with many places to sit and relax and a sea of colorful flowers!
Lovely gardens. The gardens behind the Senate are well set out and peaceful in such a busy city as Paris. Well worth including in your walking tour around Paris.

Fabulous!. I've been to Paris about 8 times so I've tried to go to the lesser known and visited tourist sights. This is a lovely garden, full of locals. Great setting for pictures. Also fun for kids, separate fenced off area for toddlers which is hard to find.mmAlso, I was with a friend who was a mythology expert. Interesting statues of mythological greats like Athena. In addition there are statues of members of the Medici family who came to France (the entire park itself is fashioned after Italian gardens) as well as the main people involved in the St. Bartholomew's Day massacre. If you are a history buff, bring a device with Wikipedia and look up the people/statues.

Another good visit.. It is a few years since we spent any time in Paris. During our recent visit, we went to the Gardens on a very warm and sunny Saturday morning.We were able to have a rest and my wife was delighted to sunbathe. We watched children playing with boats on the lake.A great place to pop into when you are in the area.

What a local area. This is an amazing garden with childrens activities kiosks and tennis. This is a great area, the 6th is a very monied area and it shows in the surrounding parkland, houses and cafes.

Most Favorite Garden of Parisians and Tourists. Jardin du Luxembourg (盧森堡公園, Luxembourg Garden) is one of the most favorite garden of Parisians and tourists. It is located just south of the Latin Quarter in the 6th arrondissement of Paris. The duke of Luxembourg originally owned the Jardin du Luxembourg. It was purchased in 1612 by Marie de' Medici, the widow of King Henry IV. After the king was murdered in 1610, she decided to move from the Louvre to a new residence. She built a new palace and had the garden laid out in an Italian fashion. It was the beginning of the current Jardin du Luxembourg. The current garden covers 22.45 hectare (55.5 acres). Today, the Senate is housed inside the Luxembourg Palace. The Senate owns the Jardin du Luxembourg, but it is open to the public. Jardin du Luxembourg is featured several times in popular culture such as in Victor Hugo’s Les Misérables (雨果 悲慘世界) and Henry James’ The Ambassadors (亨利•詹姆斯 大使).We walked from Abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés (聖日耳曼德佩修道院) to the north entrance of Jardin du Luxembourg in about 15 minutes. When we arrived at the gate, we saw republican guards patrolling on site with machine guns. It must be the Senate that occupies the Luxembourg Palace. It was a pity the beautiful garden beside the palace was blocked by some construction. In few minutes of walking, we saw the beautiful monumental Medici Fountain, which was built around 1630 by Marie de' Medici. Medici Fountain was moved to current location and extensively rebuilt in 1864-66. When the lighting is right, you can the see reflection of the giant Polyphemus, in bronze, observing the lovers Acis and Galatea, in white marble. Not so far from the fountain, there is a statue of L'acteur Grec in the front of a long lawn, and at the end is the Panthéon (萬神廟) in far distance. Pretty soon, we noticed the center area of the park with an octagonal pond, known as the Grand Basin, in front of the palace and many flowers between the paths. It was a warm afternoon. We saw lovers, families, tourists, and people in suits and ties sitting in the chairs and enjoying the sun. They really know how to enjoy their lives. There are many sculptures and beautiful flowers in the gardens. Be sure to stroll it, and you might find the La Liberté, a miniature version of the Statue of Liberty.You can simply get one of the many chairs and take it to the exact spot where you want to sit. Those chairs are made of steel and are quite heavy. The only problem is the birds also love them and left droppings on them. There are numbers of metro stations in the area; you can pick one that suitable for you. It is also very close to other attractions nearby. You can easily walk there after you visit the nearby attractions.
Take a lunch. We enjoyed our visit here...it was well kept and safe. It was easy to get to with lots of signs directing you.

Stunningly beautiful Parisian Oasis. Luxembourg Gardens epitomize Parisian elegance, charm and graceful living. Immaculately tended lawns, floral plantings and trimmings invite visitors to stroll or settle into one of the many seats throughout the sprawling space. Absolutely accessible and free, this landmark is a destination worth visiting.

My childhood favorite! . My Maman use to take me to the Fontaine Medici and tell me historical tales of the fallen family. With also swings, tennis courts and chess boards: a couple of hours to be spent in front of the senat. On some days bands are also playing in the carrousel near the pantheon entrance Charming, full of history the all family will enjoy. Note to DEAR families: avoid going in sunny weekends, everyone else loves it too!

My favourite spot in Paris. After the cramped Catacombs, this was heaven. Good vibes from the other tourists and locals in sun chairs, wide sweeping views of the gardens and fountains and of course, the palace itself. My slice of heaven.

A beautiful place to have a romantic picnic and quick getaway from the city, or a nice place to hang out with friends. I discovered these beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris just last year and I've fallen in love with them!On a warm, sunny day it is the perfect place to enjoy a quick lunch or nice long picnic with your loved one or your closest friends, you also have a nice view of the Eiffel tower and of the Sénat.It is nice to see such a green and beautiful place in the middle of such a big, fast-paced city, where you can take your time and just wander around and escape stress.

The Windy Green. As we were walking our way to Eiffel we saw something very pretty to our right. Green, majestic and just asthonishing. When we approached the gardens and the castle we were amazed about how so many people where in the area even with high wind, rainy weather and 12 degrees weather. Its a pearl in the big city which has thousands of parks and castles. We reccomend dearly.
Beautiful. Really lovely and peaceful to walk around, although as soon as the sun was out it was very busy however there are plenty of places to sit and enjoy lunch or watch the boats on the pond.

Paris Picnic . A gift from our wedding by great friends we decided to go to the garden for our picnic in Paris
Setting just beautiful with fountains flowers sculptures the day was gorgeous
Romantic for our honeymoon would not have picked any other venue
Just relaxing
Absolutely Lovely Gardens!!. My daughter and I spent an hour or so wandering through the gardens admiring the fountains, flowers and sculptures. The Medici Fountain was a must see!

Great green space near Latin Quarter. We are staying in Latin Quarter so this was an excellent after-arrival activity when we were jet-lagged and needing something non-to strenuous to do to jump into the new time zone. Even though it was drizzling and gray and cold, we could see the great potential of this park. Very well maintained, great gravel walk paths and concrete paths. Lots of space to lie down for a picnic or day in the park. Beautiful flowers, just overall a relaxing time.
Very beautiful. Our hotel was just down the road from the gardens and it was a wonderful place to go and walk around and see some beautiful architecture! Lovely gardens!

Great for Families. We thought we would stop by the Luxembourg Gardens for a quick visit. The Gardens were absolutely amazing. There is a fantastic park that kids of all ages can play in, carousel rides, tennis courts, a beautiful garden with a palace to look at. It was an unexpected surprise to our trip.

Childhood memories. I spent most of mi childhood wandering around Luxembourg Gardens, it's a gorgeous place for any person of any age. There are kids play areas but some are paying, however they are really good!I would definitely recommend it if you are searching for a garden to go to in Paris.

Fifty acres in the heart of the Left Bank. Something for everyone in this varied park, lovers, grandparents with their charges, runners, daydreamers, sportifs (pétanque players), brown-baggers, students. Lots of chairs and benches to lounge and stare. It's French style, which means very formally laid out, and it can be dusty and pebbly so leave your Louboutins and Berlutis at home. It showcases France's upper house, the Senate, which gives added gravitas. One thing you shouldn't miss: they nearly always have a wonderful open-air exhibition of thematic photographs fixed to the railings along the rue de Médicis. And if you want to know if spring has sprung, this is the place to go.

garden in the city. a beautiful place to rest from walking just in the center of a a crowded place.All around shops cafes restaurants and crowded streets and after few steps you are in a big garden and a palace in front of you

One of the best places to hang out in town. If you want to hang out and talk to someone calmly and enjoy paris just go there and sit on a sunny day. I love the place and just love to sit there. Highly recommended

Watch the Parisiens at play. Located off Boulevard San Michel and sandwiched between the Latin Quarter and San Germain visit this beautiful green park and gravel pathways at the weekend andwatch the locals play open air chess,play tennis and children sail model boats on the huge lake.Take in the surrounding views including the French Senate,the avenue of trees leading to Montparnasse, and in the distance the Eiffel Tower.Relax,soak up the sun or sit in the shade beneath the trees.Picnic on the grass or eat and drink at the cafe listening to visiting bands play your favourite music.It doesn't get better than this..

an amazing moment. walked to the Luxanbourg at last, wow I was amazed by then. Busy but acceptable.Very well designed flowers beds. Remember that if you seat down they may change your for it.great moment in these garden and highly recommended These garden were created around 1612 by Marie de’ Medici and also the residence she constructed, the Luxembourg Palace.Beautiful fountains ….

Relaxing elegant gardens. Visited the Gardens for a second time this year. Great space in which to relax in spectacular open space. The imposing palace is a magnificent backdrop. Cafes in the gardens offer reasonable food. Recommend the Gardens as a place to sit down and have a lunch in the sun.

Relax. Came here 2 times, first one was for relaxing after a long walk. Second one was for enjoying our baguettes, birds, flowers, everything in the garden. Many people come for running, so this is a good place to relax and also to exercise

great place to relax and unwind. there are a lot of places and gardens in Paris for you to relax and unwind.the Luxembourg gardens allow you to do so in an immensely nice place. in a good day, there'll be crowds definitely. but it's a nice feeling to just sit back and relax with everyone else. the grass is a good spot to chill.

Beautiful and relaxing. We spent an hour or so here one late afternoon just strolling the grounds and sitting at the fountain. It was beautiful and peaceful and a great way to take a break from exploring the city.
Nice gardens for a stroll or running. Well laid out and manicured, but don't you dare step on the grass! Has some outdoor exercise equipment at the far end, but doesn't open until around 8am.

Green space in the heart if city. Luxembourg garden!! I love this place. After visiting Paris, busy city with people smoking everywhere, I came and took a rest here. The garden was a lot bigger than I thought it would be. There were many small corners with statues and chairs. Many trees and flowers. The palace was really beautiful too.
Beautiful. Beautiful especially on a clear day. Great place to people watch, relax, and just take in the fact that you are in Paris!
Lovely gardens, free art exhibition . Lovely walk in the gardens and a free art exhibition on the railings, lovely afternoon. Would recommend for a picnic on a nice summer day
Feeling Parisian. I think it is a must to see. It is lovely to sit around and watch the real Parisian take a break from the rush and traffic of the city.

Some green space. These gardens are a peaceful sanctuary from the frantic pace of the city.You can just go there to wander or sit by the fountain on one of the many chairs and watch as people go about there day or read a book.Great place for a lazy spring, summers or Autumn day.

Nice garden, good to chill around on the warm day. The place was crowded on the sunny days. We sat there and enjoyed the sun. We was interesting to gaze up and watch all the planes in the sky on the clear day.
Attention to detail like you cannot imagine. These gardens are manicured in a way you cannot imagine until you see it. Worth a 1 hour walk through on your way to or from a cafe or another attraction.

Great place to sit back, relax and people watch!. We had been travelling non stop from early morning to late into the evening for three weeks. On our last full day of vacation we spent an hour here just strolling through the grounds and then sitting for another half hour. It is beautiful and so full of life (people and plants!) and activities in each and every nook and cranny of the park,
Beautiful!. The perfect place for a walk, to have lunch or just sit and relax. Check out La Fontaine des Medicis. A great spot to unwind.

Very beautiful but be careful of the weathers. Paris is a very full of beautiful things place and the Gardens of Luxembour are something beautiful which is worth it to see during a visit here. But be warned the weather in this city can change at any moment and become dreadful leaving you as drowned as a dog. Is not a good place for a rainy day :)

Play, rest, read, relax, eat or enjoy a museum.... Luxembourg gardens truly has something for everyone. A wonderful place to read and relax, a great place to play tennis or jog. If you have little ones there is a park with slides and other playground equipment, for a small entry fee approx. 2 euros (per person) you can sit and relax, have a coffee while your child plays in a gated area. If you prefer to admire works of art by world renowned artists there is also an incredible museum (for an entry fee) with additional free exhibits at the L'Orangerie also in the parc.Cute little restaurants and snack stands for a quick bite.Located in the 6th arrondissement, near some of the best shopping and restaurants in Paris. Also, very close to the Sorbonne and the Pantheon. I could go on and on... Just a perfect place to be on a nice day!

Very romantic . You can find very romantic spots in this beautiful and well maintained park. Or if you prefer you can go just to have something to drink in one of the 3 cafes inside of the park. Or go with your children to the play area it's really nice.
Not that impressive. Nice gardens, well maintained, but really not that impressive....just a nice park to rest after a long walk.

Perfect Paris picnic spot . This charming and beautiful park is not to be missed on a visit to Paris. The gardens are lovely and it's a relaxing way to while away an afternoon. Watch the old wooden toy boats, lunch at the cafe or better still pack a picnic and sit by the enormous hedges to watch the world go by. Easily found on the subway or on foot with some great cafes nearby. Good Disabled access and free toilets.

Pack a picnic. This is the perfect place to relax for lunch and or a bottle of wine. Lots of activity and opportunities to people. The gardens are very well maintained and there is a nice pond with a fountain to sit in front of and relax
Great park for a picnic. We packed a picnic lunch and really enjoyed a mid day break! Cool and relaxing. Made me fell like a Parisian
Gardens at night. Love this place when the sun is going down and the locals are exercising and unwinding after a hard day at work. Precious

Stroll, Sit on a Bench, Take Photos, Spend time with Family and Friends. The Luxembourg Gardens were just a 3-minute walk from my hotel the Senat. I decided to spend a relaxing afternoon walking the garden and taking photographs. What a splendid place to relax and spend some down time. Many singles, couples, and families take the opportunity to relax here. There are a number of statues throughout the park and a wonderful, massive fountain there.The Gardens are also a short walk to a number of shopping locations and dining spots.Dr. Marc, PS 63:7NOTE: Also see my reviews on the Eiffel Tower, St. Etienne du Mont Church, St Sulpice Church and Notre-Dame Cathedral.
A good stroll in a sunny day. Nothing so special, but when visiting the Quartier Latin why not extending the walk and visit this XVII century gardens, with its lakes, statues, etc.

Always a lovely respite . These gardens are always a lovely respite in a big, busy city. Centrally located...wander around, see the flowers, watch children sail boats or play in playground, or just sit and watch the world amble by

Plan to relax here for a while. The Jardin du Luxembourg is lovely, and a must-see whenever I'm in Paris. Bring a picnic, take a seat and people watch, or simply stroll. These gardens remind Americans that Parisians enjoy a different pace of life. They (literally) stop and smell the roses, read a book, talk to friends, play a sport. Late May is not the ideal time for flowers -- the April tulips have died and the June flowers are not quite in full bloom -- but it's always a pleasure to visit.

Very romantic on a sunny morning. Get here early as it does get busy by midday. Walk all over and be sure to have a sit. Its beautifully planted and the Medici Fountain is worth a visit also. Time to relax!!
Pretty Sight. I wouldn't take time out of the trip to visit the gardens but if you have extra time I would definitely visit. It is very well maintained and pretty for pictures and a nice walk.

Excellent for AFTERNOON STROLLS even though we went in the morning. We were staying closeby and hence wanted to go out to some famous park for morning jog. Though it does not have a well defined (cushiony types) jogging tracks, but the flower rows, landscaping, sculptures, etc were pretty awesome and loved our morning walk out there.....and that too free from any noise or loads of people. It was blissfully quiet.

A favorite of most Parisians -an outdoor living room!. Great place to just hang out and visit. Stop for a tea. Watch the kids push boats in the boat basin. Enjoy the seasonal plantings.
Mostly enjoy people watching- one of the best places to do it!

A lovely spot to take a walk. The gardens were large and pleasant to walk through with greenery and/or sculptures at every turn. I like the mixture of green space, fountains, and hard pack with tiny rocks and well manicured shade trees.
Romantic but also family style. Went there in a sunny day and there were kids playing around the fount with small boats that were for rent. Nice view!

Serene, stunning and perfect. It was gently raining when we arrived, Picnic lunch in hand. We dashed through the entrance and took shelter under the trees in the "woods". the leaves kept the raindrops, gently pattering on them and concealed our picnic. Then we heard the sounds of an orchestra tuning up. We dashed in the direction of the music and took seats at the cafe, nestled under the trees. We enjoyed a glass of good wine as we listened to the marvelous orchestra playing in the bandstand, in the rain. This may be our best Paris experience yet. Simply beautiful
Picnic in a fabulous park. The Luxembough Gardens are open to the public. You can sit in the sun, picnic and watch people piloting their boats around the lake

Dreamy park in my favourite area in Paris. I always like to swing by the Jardin when in PAris, in particular when the weather is nice. It has such a relaxed and more local vibe than some of the other famous Paris parks. Grab a chair and relax while munching on a baguette and taking in the ambience and the kids sailing toy boats in the lake.

A special place. Magnificent gardens. We took a picnic and there are plenty of places to pull up a chair and relax. There is an enormous, amazing playground for kids. We loved watching the boules, and the little kids sailing their boats on the water. If you have kids, you could easily spend the whole day here. There is lots to do and see. I will definitely return on my next holiday to Paris.

Exeptional Gardens and Park. We were staying near the gardens on our recent trip to Paris and stopped in. we were glad we did, what a great place. It was very family friendly and it was a great place to relax and enjoy the day. The had pony walks taking children through out the park, not just on a little carousel. There was a play area for the children, a pond to sail boats on,walking and running paths. If your in Paris in the Latin Quarter just south of The Notre Dame Cathedral its a must see.

Gardens of the City of Love!. Beautiful, inspiring, surprising! The statue of the mask is worth a visit. I walked from the 9th all the way to the Jardin....and boy, it was worth it! You can also take a veil' bike if you have the patience with the damn machines...Enjoy the trip! :-)
Nice relaxing walk. A quiet park in the Saint Germain area. All on the level so easy walking and plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by.

Beautiful Relaxing Gardens. A lovely place to relax, eat ice-cream and enjoy the atmosphere. Children can float boats on the lake or take a pony ride. Adults and children alike can enjoy the hot chocolate at Angelina. If you really want to fit in, bring a book and read in the sun. Take the metro to Luxembourg station.

A lovely way to slow down. Easily accessible by the metro system. Huge area in which to stroll just taking in the beauty of this park. Lots of seating areas where one can rest their weary feet and people watch. Great space for families! Depending on when you are there, may happen upon musicians playing. Best of all, it's free!

Bring the kids. The Luxembourg gardens are always lovely to visit. However, if you have children, they will love the playground which is colour coded for different ages. Although it costs a small amount for entry, adults can remain outside and easily see their children if they don't wish to pay for entry. The flower displays are well managed, and there are plenty of chairs if you wish to linger

Beautiful and nicely maintained . These gardens offer a getaway spot after a busy day in Paris, whether after work, touring around the city or shopping. The pretty vast gardens are well maintained and offer nice sceneries to the people taking a break. People were scattered throughout the garden, with some just resting, others reading and some chatting with their respective groups. Small statues and sculptures are well put throughout. There were groups of kids playing at the time I visited (after school). There are also some tennis courts. Memorable visit for sure.

Favorite gardens in Paris, by far!. This is our favorite garden in Paris and is such a relaxing spot away from the bustle of the City, but within the City - Especially like grabbing a sandwich and munching at a couple chairs overlooking the fountain
A great free place to go. Not only is the entry free, but the gardens are spectacular. If the weather is sunny and warm, this is the place to go.
Just sit, and then walk again. Stroll, walk, sit, repeat. Lovely any time of year. One of my favorite spots to think. Truly lovely.

Beautiful garden/park area. This is a very picturesque garden area. We were there in the spring, and the trees were in full leaf, the flowers were blooming, and they had the boats sailing on the fountain pools. Plus, there was some sort of concert happening in the gazebo area with the orchestra.
Beautiful. Beautiful garden to walk around and sit in the middle of the city. Best of all, it is free! Find an open seat or bring a blanket to sit on the grass.

Wonderful. One of our favourite areas of Paris. The gardens are a little piece of peace and quiet in the middle of the city. Wonderful surrounding neighbourhood with great restaurants and shops. Don't miss.

Worth a visit. Amazing to see the locals enjoying this beautiful green spot in the heart of Paris on a warm spring day. Read about them in high school french now I've seen them for myself. Well worth the visit.

Beautiful picnic spot!. The gardens are lovely! Everyone seemed to be lifted up smiling due to the beautiful atmosphere and weather. First time in awhile I've paid to use the bathroom, but it didn't cost that much and there was laughing in line. Enjoyed a beautiful afternoon picnicking (made our own) and sketching. There is a huge tree everyone likes to take their picture sitting on (I've enclosed a picture) I wasn't tall enough to sit on it myself. It was one of the few places open May 1st. Keep forgetting that is a big holiday in Europe.

Very pretty and peaceful.. It was such a nice break from rushing to see the sights of the city to these gorgeous gardens and learn the history behind them. The Jardin du Luxembourg Is now owned by the French Senate. Marie de Medici the widow of King Henry IV of France built this as her home in 1612. The Medici Fountain is a must see!
Beautiful gardens!. Went on a rainy day, saw beautiful gardens and statues, however the museum was under renovation, so I couldn't go inside.
Amazing Botanical treat. Even though we visited early in the season you still get the vastness of this gorgeous gardens. I can only imagine what it looks like in full bloom.
Beautiful park for picnic. Large park in the centre o Paris providing many shaded places or seating at a pond on green metal chairs. Or you can seat on law and nibble at brought food.
I love greeny it fascinates me.. lovely gardens I loved walking on the glass. It's a cold day with little showers of rains and then nice sunshine I loved it

Not all that exciting but very green.. Pros: undercover shelters for rain/sun and water feature/pond in front of the palaceCon: green green green, not many nice flowers or gardens of which I was expecting Perhaps nice for a picnic or lunch

Lovely open space. This is a very peaceful open park area very near to where we were staying, the flower beds were just being planted out so I am sure in a few weeks time it will look gorgeous. In the orangery we were fortunate to see an exhibition of mosaic pictures some excellent pieces of art work. Plenty of seats and a children's play area.

Nice spot to wander. Nice spot to wander or even pull up one of the numerous seats lying round. Lots of statues and sculptural art in the gardens. Nice spot away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Lovely gardens and kept very well.. Spent a few hours walking around these gardens and really enjoyed the experience. They are kept very well and there is plenty of seats and resting areas to have a picnic or just watch people go by.
beatiful but not good on a cold day. One of the most beautiful parks I've ever been. Since it was november the day was very cold so we could not enjoy it for a long time. It was a very quick visit.

A taste of Parisian life.. A visit to Paris would not be complete without a stroll in the Luxembourg. Take refreshments under the trees from one of the little kiosks, admire the sculptures and fountain, wander amid the formal floral displays. But do not walk on the grass!
Good for a nice walk. I found this park to be so beautiful, especially the area with the fountain and the palace as a backdrop. It was a very lovely walk. Definitely recommend it.
Wonderful park and social gathering place. Great to watch the Grandfathers hiring model boats 'for les enfants' and having a great time or just chill out at the petanc area

The Perfect place to stop and have Lunch. This is the perfect place to stop for a short rest and if you plan ahead and arrive there for lunch hour with some food from a near by shop even better. This is a huge park with many benches and trees proving a shade from the sun and allowing a perfect little break.
Nice Gardens. It was fun to walk around the gardens and see all the families enjoying the park as well. The kids with the sailboats on the pond were really enjoying themselves.
Nice stroll on a spring day. Nicely presented gardens, and lots going on, Cafe serves good food but be prepared to queue for service on a nice day can be very busy.

Absolutely Beautiful. Our stroll through this lovely park was a highlight of a warm spring day in Paris. It was a weekend and families were out, with young children floating sailboats in the pond. Stunning grounds.

Lovely Parisian park . Great park to walk around and watch Parisian life around you. Tennis courts, bowls, children's playground all going on. You can pull up one of the many chairs and sit and enjoy whatever part of the park you like.

Soak up the family atmosphere. Free park, free chairs, watching families spending quality time with each other; a good book, some wine, kids boating on the water, and simply relaxing. Put your feet up on the chairs and have a nap. Behind us was a covered band-stand type area where some young girls were practising their Asian dance moves - Balinese or something like that; with a small crowd that came in to escape some rain. Lovely area.

Lovely sunshiney picnic even in December!. Took locally-bought charcuterie and wine and had an excellent picnic here for my boyfriend's birthday in December. Ate overlooking the boating pond. Later we returned with our ping-pong bats and had a game on the free tables!

Not just a garden! So much more.... This was one of the places I could not miss to see on this trip. Lovely garden, magnificent art everywhere, peaceful. There's a fantastic fountain worth seeing! Look for it!Enjoy and use it to rest a bit and feed the kids.

Excellent Design and well maintained!. Truly gardens and park of splendour!Beautiful, well structured plantings and hedged trees. Formal areas, informal areas, arrays of colour, new and historic sculptures, lawn, water features, jogging track, tennis courts, massive kids play area, cafes.It is just WoW and free!(Even as we had to endure some rain!)

Amazing place to relax and walk around. Stunning views, many people just enjoying the nature and taking it all in, other great sites and restaurants very close by, you definitely should come here during your time in Paris.
Don't miss it . On a sunny day this is the place to be! A picnic on the grass is perfect. Feel free to do your Saturday or Sunday long runs here too

Beautiful gardens . I wish we'd spent more time here. It was so beautiful, especially on a sunny day. It would be great just to buy something from the shop and eat it in this wonderful park. So relaxing.
Nice. Beautiful garden with distance view of arc de triumphe and eiffel tower...full or color and charm with the lovely palace in background..

A different kind of garden. We went to the Luxembourg gardens on a sunny Spring day, and found a lot of people sitting on chairs around the edges of the gardens and ponds. The flowers were pretty, and were all yellow - this was a bit unusual for someone used to English gardens. And no walking on the grass! Definitely a different kind of garden for a New Zealander! But pleasant enough.
Amazing treat for anyone who loves gardens.. An amazing garden to explore. Wonderful fountains Fantastic views from all sides.relatively safe for jogging or walking.

Gyros amd beautiful views. My family grabbed some gyros to eat at Luxembourg garden, after all it was a 15 minute walk from where we stayed. The gyros were great and the park was beautiful. It is so well maintained that you can't walk on the grass, (there is pavement of course.) There are amazing statues like the original model for the statue of liberty and many others. There are benches all over to sit and relax, and a kids area for the little ones to enjoy. This park is honestly the nicest one in Paris and you can't miss out!!

Serene. The gardens were absolutely lovely. I very much enjoyed walking the many payhs through the gardens. Flowers were every. There are many opportunities to sit and relax with chairs scattered throughout the grounds. There is also a cafe to sit and order a wine and lunch.

Loved it. There is so much to do here. So beautiful. My kids loved the lake with the sailboats, pony rides, playground was amazing, carossel and bathrooms are clean but you do need to pay 50 cents. The whole place was beautiful quiet and shady. Perfect place to spend a day. We went on a Saturday. The morning was quiet but by 3pm it gets quite busy.

Beautiful Garden. It's really refreshing and relaxing to take a leisurely stroll in this beautiful garden. Sitting beside the pond while little children sailing boats is amazing. They have pony rides for the kids and also a very beautiful playground. The garden has something for all ages.
Lovely gardens. Beautiful gardens and a beautiful building, would be nice to take a picnic and just relax watching the people go by. Not busy at all.

A must-go to feel the Parisian vibe. It was a sunny day and there were a lot of people in the Gardens, Parisians love to sunbathe and picnic under the sunlight. The Gardens was beautiful and it was indeed a place to truly feel and acknowledge Paris as the city of flowers. There were occasionally some temporary exhibitions at the corner of the Gardens and painters would sketch the sceneries while smoking. It is indeed a must-go for those who want to have a taste of how locals enjoy their lives in Paris!

Too big to photograph, bring your wide angle lens. This is another spectacular garden and a must visit in Paris, its so good you won't want to leave.I had trouble photographing it, no photo will do it justice!! I'd say its pretty close to Versailles, if you don't get to visit Versailles, make sure you go see this place.And there is also a cafe you can have great hot chocolate in. Win!

Lovely afternoon in the sun.. In Spring the gardens are magnificent. On a sunny afternoon it is even more so!Musicians were playing in the Rotunda, we had crepes and coffee at the outdoor cafe, under the shade of the trees. People clapped the performers.Children were sailing boats in the Central Circular Pond.The Palace of Luxembourg stood proudly and stately there.Many enjoyed the ambience - luxuriating in the deck chairs surrounding the pools and gardens.Truly a Parisien afternoon!

Perfect for a picnic. My husband and i arranged to collect a picnic from a local company at the gardens then enjoyed the sunshine. Was so perfect. Only thing that disappointed me was they had just closed the grass so there were chairs all around it we had to sit on and couldn't step on the grass or sit on a blanket. Other then that was splendid

beauty in the center of the city.. This garden has so much to offer, places to picnic, rent mini sail boats for the kids while you enjoy a bottle of wine in the sun. It has a large closed in kids play area, great for letting the little ones run wild. We loved the Jazz music being played in the upper forest area. It is such a great garden and park atmosphere, loved every part of it.

Jazz concert livens it up. This garden facility really is a must visit in Paris. The Senate is on one end, the Sorbonne complexes on another. Luckily this visit included a jazz concert in the band stand. The round pond for children sailing toy sail boats, a partly sunny day, joggers making the circuit, tennis, pétanque, pick up soccer football, children playing in the separate children's area, and the flowers in bloom and trees leafing, all the background for sitting and relaxing or strolling. An amenity for the neighborhood and for we tourists.

This is a classic, not to miss. This is a superb renaissance palace in the middle of the city (it hosts the French senate). It is elegant and refined. You will get part of the atmosphere of Paris in this parc. Spring is probably the best time to go.

Just wish you could visit the palace... This garden is beautiful and full of things to see. The Medici fountain with the three arches Is mesmerizing. There was no access to the palace itself and, honestly, I don't know if there ever has been for visitors.

Beautiful, feels like you are in paradise!. It was a great place to visit, it is quiet and children can go with little boats to sail in the pond - is great for couples as well as families with small children.

Worth a stroll. Love the tranquility of this park. Medici Fountain and surrounding sculptures are lovely and the area was not crowded when my husband and I visited. Worth the effort of taking a peaceful walk through.

Relaxing . Beautiful place w lot of yrain station you can get by. Close to the parthenon, notre dame cathedral and Latin quarter. There are many seats you can relax and enjoy the views. There are close for kids and you can easily spend an evening here. The palace is also there plus playground areas.

Do yourself a favor and surrender yourself to this place. After sightseeing, go to the Luxembourg Gardens. Buy a sorbet or bring some wine and cheese and surrender yourself to this tranquil garden. (there are venues there, where beer, wine and food are available) Enjoy sitting by the pond and fountains for a bit, just take in the beauty and watch the other people enjoying this beautiful place. Stroll down paths and watch the children ride the ponies or playing on the toys. Listen to an orchestra playing.Enjoy beautiful statues and flowers that this place has to offer find your own quite spot and just relax.If you give in to it, you will be refreshed like never before!
Beautiful gardens. My husband and I visited these beautiful gardens a couple of days ago. They are truly magnificent and free to the public.

Sunbathe, chill out and bring your favorite book.. The Gardens are a good place in Paris to avoid the massification of the big cities. Some things that I like to do in the gardens: Running, reading a book while I sunbathe or just taking a stroll and discover a spot that you may have not paid atention before!
Wonderful. Just beatiful gardens, ideal to take a stroll. You'll probably need comfortable shoes and a lot of time to visit.

Beautiful Gardens. I always spend some time here when in Paris - calm, peaceful and beautiful - nice outdoor resto and, if you have kids, play areas, puppets and donkeys to ride - something for everyone in a beautiful setting

My first visit to Luxembourg Gardens . The gardens are spectacular. I couldn't see them all. But I saw a lot of them. The greenery and the sculptures were pretty neat. Then I went inside and saw more.
The entrance looks like it's made of gold.
Statues all over. Make this one stop. You'll be glad you did.

Average, but maybe better when plants are blooming. The gardens were nice, but nothing special. Lots of places in the U.S. just as nice or better. Its a very big area and a good place for a picnic or just to relax.

Brief but nice visit. If you're looking for a nice walk or jog while you're on Paris' Left Bank, try the Luxembourg Gardens. We wound up near there after an early dinner at Cafe Luxembourg. We could have explored longer, but had to get back to our hotel before dark. Go there and report, for the rest of us! While you're at it, try to stop at the Arenes de Lutece, the ancient Roman theater nearby, which was excavated some years ago. Too bad much of it was destroyed.
Pleasant. Luxenbourg Gardens is a very pleasant walk with lot's of nice scenery and events going on. I saw a racket sport i have never seen before, looked competitive. Nice area for photographs.

Lovely place to visit. The gardens are so lovely, there's plenty of seating around and it's so peaceful!There's wide open spaces with grass and trees but there are tennis courts and basket ball courts for sports. A lot of the people there were running so it is great for a jog!There's statues of what I assume are Royal/Famous French ladies which are lovely to look at. A nice place to have a picnic and there are little stalls dotted around too.

Beautiful Gardens. The gardens are stunning ! The fountains, flower beds and statues are a feast for the eyes. It is very large with many walkways and paths. A beautiful place for the Parisians to enjoy as well as for it's visitors.

Relaxing Gardens. We were walking and tired until we arrived at these Gardens. They were appalling from the very start. The gardens are very large with flowers, green grass, trees a very large pool and a good number of trees. We strolled around and afterwards we stayed on the grass enjoying the nature's beauty and relaxed and relaxed. While relaxing you will forget about busy Paris!!!

This is by far my favourite park in Paris. Situated in the 5th arr of Paris is this park that is my true favourite parc of the ones I've this far have discovered. Not much to say really, it is a little bit more tranquil compared to many of the other parks that might be a little bit more touristic than this one, thats why I like it I think. I try to visiti it every time in Paris.
Relaxing stroll through the gardens. An area of peace and tranquility in a bustling capital city. A pleasure to stroll through in the spring sunshine
Perfect people watching while soaking up the sun. Gardens are gorgeous and people watching fascinating. Relaxing in the sun as the French love to do .... perfect
A quiet pleasure. Room to roam. Lovely garden. Families with children. Children sailing boats on the pond. Chairs to rest in. Groups practicing Tai Chi. All good

Lazy picnic day. Although we were alone this trip to the Gardens, this would be s great place to bring kids 5-12Plus or minus a few years depending on their ability to be flexible.Great sailing pond, choirs in the band stand with orchestra, food, pony rides. Beautiful gardens. A quiet spot to enjoy holding hands, sharing a picnic, or just reading a book in the sunThis place is awesomeGreat hotels in the 6th district. Walking to 101 additional attractions is easy from this well maintained and safe garden/parkFilled with old and young, couples and kidsOne can spend an hour or a day here, people watching, sunning or enjoying the beauty of the settings

Just a wonderful place.. This was a wonderful place to stroll thru the massive gardens. We bought lunch just outside the ground and eat under a tree in the gardens with beatutiful statues and birds singing.
Wonderful park-well-used by everyone. Vast and beautiful right in the heart of the city. Wonderful to visit & relax on a bench and watch the world go by after a long day sight-seeing.

Great place for kids. While I was disappointed at the lack of flowers (although it was May after all) I was very impressed by the amount of things you could do with kids. You could spend an entire day here. Bring a picnic. Rent sailboats in the pond. Play on the numerous playgrounds. Grab ice cream or crepes. It's a gorgeous and peaceful spot to kill some time.
Great Park. Nice park to wonder through. Can't say there is that much to do here other than sit and relax. A museum which we did not visit.

Beautiful. Beautiful gardens and palace. You can picnic lunch here as well as there being chaises and chairs if you want to just stop and take in the beauty. It is in the Latin Quarter and within walking distance of the Sorbonne and Pantheon.

Enjoy a picnic. These gardens are beautiful and quite relaxing. Grab a sandwich and something to read and relax for a few hours on a chair down by the pond surrounded by statues and beautiful flowers.

Wonderful Oasis. Luxembourg Gardens is one of my favourite places in Paris. A place of calm tranquillity, with a wonderful display of flowers and people enjoying and being energised by the beauty of the place. A must for any visitor to Paris.
Beautiful gardens. The gardens are lovely- an ideal place to take nice photos with your loved ones! The gardens are peaceful and romantic.
Gorgeous. Really lovely park. We visited in the evening on a beautiful sunny warm day. The wallflowers smelt lovely and a band was playing in the bandstand! Perfect!!

Beautiful. Much more beautiful than you can imagine. Very nice "decorated". Gardners made an amazing job there. The palace is really beautiul. Also few cafes on the corner. Always full of tourists....worth a visit for sure

Beautiful Gardens. Spent just a little time at the gardens in our three day Paris trip.
Flowers were in bloom and was just a beautiful place
Nice and beautiful . It's not a park ⛲ and it's not a garden - it's a mix. A really appreciate the beauty and uniqueness of this place.
climbed it. This is an amazing architectural feat and inspiring even to the less than religious like me. The long climb is actually worth the effort.

The Gardens are Magical. Walk the entire length and don't plan to have a picnic on the 'children's section' of the yard unless you have a child with you. It's funny as there is a sign that says keep off the grass and tons of folks all over it. Not very enforced. A great escape in the heart of Paris.

Lovely Gardens. The perfect place for some rest and relaxation. Lots of work going on to renovate garden walls. President was visiting the day after so lots of TV equipment around and everywhere was being titivated. Lovely place
Paris in the spring. Ideal park to while away a few hours, especially if the sun is out, watch the kids using the pond yachts, or seel out the newly opened cafe.
Lunch time. We met some friends suring lunch time and sat at he small cafe. The cafe was average but the garden is really good for a short walk.

Nice park for jogging lovers.. This park is the best location for jogging and get trained karate from masters in the morning.
And for kids there is a boating area which runs with remote.
The park is also have a small theater which is for art lovers.
Apart from this this is the best place to relax for long time.

Beautiful parc. Bring a book, take one of the many seats, lay down on the grass, do your morning run or drink a coffee...and enjoy the spectaculair views in this beautiful parc. One can spend a day easily.
Stunning. We went here on a drizzly day in May near dusk and the park was nearly empty. Couldn't have been more lovely and romantic stroll.
So Beautiful. I live in vegas so its been awhile since i saw real grass and real flowers i could have sat outside there on one of the benches and read for hours

gorgeous walk, great people-watching. Luxembourg Gardens has it all--places for kids to play, quiet corners for reading or romantic liaisons, sunny spots, the fountain.... Take a walk or take the kids or sit on a bench and watch people. Check out the collection of heritage pear and apple trees or the beehives or.... You get the idea. Don't miss it.

Be sure to check out the Medici Fountain. So many little gems in this beautiful, centrally located park. The one I 'discovered' last time was the Medici Fountain -- my goodness, what a beautiful little corner of the park! Still, calm water surrounded by classical statues, urns, trees -- the setting is tremendously romantic and evocative.I wanted to check out the apiary (bees) but that area was closed when I went -- gotta check it out next time. (visited April 2015)

Nice shortcut or detour if walking nearby. Entered southern entrance, exited northwest. Beautiful greens and pedestrian walkways outside for joggers, walkers and families in good weather, multiple access points to cut through.

So beautiful. A stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens is a glorious experience. The gardens encompass a wealth of flowers, statues, fountains -- even a museum and a palace (now the seat of the French Senate). There are also sports facilities of all kinds, and even special areas for small children.

A Gem. What a beautiful place to relax, play or people watch. There are statues and art throughout the garden and the area around the lake is breathtaking. Located in the Latin Quarter it is only a 15 minute walk from the river, Notre Dame and San Chappel,

Beautiful Spot. What a beautiful spot to relax. Beauty surrounds you in the gardens. The weather was mild with a light breeze the day we visited, and many Parisians and tourists were sitting around the water or in the shade, reading or simply people watching. There were small boats sailing in the fountain and the flowers were blooming. Some people used the gravelly paths to jog, while others found shady nooks to take photos or paint. If you have a few hours to relax during your trip, head to the gardens with a book. There are public toilletes near the cafe, which can be used for a small fee, which was nice as these can be hard to come by in Paris!

My Favorite Park in Paris!. The most beautiful park in Paris. Pack a lunch and spend a few hours relaxing in the park. Pay a visit to the nearby Luxembourg Museum. It is a great place to be on a warm and sunny day.

Take a champagne pinic. We went on Friday night. Stopped in a wine shop called Nicolas for champagne called Besserat (26 e)then next door to cheese shop for a delicious Brie (3e) and finally to the patisserie for a small baguette (.80e).Had the most romantic picnic in Luxembourg gardens before dinner. I love the gardens. Took wonder photos of my handsome husband in the amazing Paris light.

Must See!. We went to the gardens on an overcast day. Although we thought it wouldn't be "as great" we were wrong. We were able to find 2 reclining chairs in the garden area overlooking the pond. We enjoyed a lunch and a nice bottle of wine we brought with us.After spending a few hours in the garden you have to be careful not to get lost. We could have easily spent an afternoon here. There is a great play area for kids, and you can people watch for hours.

Oasis. An absolutely beautiful oasis in the city. It has everything; benches and chairs, fountains, playground, tenniscourts, basketcourt, ponyriding, carrousel, cafe... And still there is plenty of room for you to find your own space.
Beautiful!. An unbelievably stunning part of Paris. A little out of the way from the other main attractions but it is well worth the effort to visit!
Beautiful park even in the rain. Wonderful afternoon in the park. Beautiful gardens and spectacular please to people watch, even in the rain the children ran gleefully!

Exceeded Expectations. This place is beautiful. It is an awesome garden with fountains, hedges and flowers. Also ping pong tables, tennis and basketball courts. Awesome park to randomly walk around in or have a picnic on the grass.

Space and people in harmony. The park is very beautiful in itself but for it's really the people that make it perfect. Visit early in the morning and see the many forms of exercise that all kind of people do in the park.
Favorite place in Paris. A place with really good vibes. I was lucky with a sunny weather so I definitely enjoyed the views, the energy and the good vibes from the people.

Beautiful place. When we visit Paris we always tale a stroll thru these gardens as they are so peaceful and beautiful. This time it was a sunny and hot Sunday and there were so many French people out enjoying the day, it was a day to remember for us as when we have been in the past it has usually been a cold week day, still beautiful but so much better on a sunny spring day. You have to visit these gardens and allow at least half the day to enjoy them.

I wish I could live there!. This garden is the highlight of my 1st night in Paris.
Loved every second there, more places like this in the world please.
