Marvelous Break for Relaxing. Delightful park and formal garden (with palace, of course) which seems to be a favorite of the local University crowd as well as the neighborhood residents. Tennis courts, paths for wandering among the trees, with lots of movable seats around the fountain and gardens for relaxing, chatting or sunning on a lovely Spring day.

Wonderful well used gardens!. All of the parks and open spaces in Paris are well maintained and well used by all ages either playing, exercising or just relaxing, but none more so than the beautiful Jardins de Luxembourg. Situated adjacent to the museum and upper house of the French Parliament/senate and between the Seine and main student area around the Sorbonne and the Pantheon and Montparnasse the gardens form a green lung for the city full of locals and visitors enjoying being outside in beautiful surroundings
Beautiful!. Another beautiful location and amazing weather. Take a stroll around and enjoy relaxing in the grass or enjoy the arcitecture of the nearby buildings and statues.

Lovely garden!. A beautiful spot for a picnic lunch, after lunch stroll, or people watching. This is a garden dedicated to children and it is wonderful to watch them enjoy the lovely surroundings - as we did!

Lovely garden. The garden is beautiful and we enjoyed a lovely afternoon here just leisurely strolling around. There was a pony ride for little kids costing 3.5euros which was quite well priced to keep them entertained. The playground for children is good.

Lounging about on a sunny day.. Simply stunning place to relax and enjoy the surroundings.Plenty of seating be it scattered around the flowered areas or down by the big central pond.Sculptures a plenty to gaze upon.Excellent place to chill out and people watch.

Nice but dusty park in Paris. Looked for a place for my 2-year-old to burn some of his energy during our visit in Paris. They say the gated children's area is the best Paris have to offer and maybe so. Glad I'm not a Parisian... It's ok but c'mon - in a city this size why aren't similar parks offered much more.
Very pretty. Really nice to walk through. It's got a nice little cafe and it's a very relaxing area with plenty of seats around and just pass the day away.

Serene and tranquil. Lovely place for kids to float their boats at the pond. Nice statues and sculptures surround the gardens. Lots of seats for visitors to read and have a picnic as well. Opposite the garden is a famous cafe - Le Rostand.

Gorgeous Spot in the City!. The Jardins Luxembourg offer a beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Though the gardens are busy at all times, you can usually find a spot to relax with an ice cream and people watch.

Great Playground for kids! Beautiful gardens.. There is a large kids playground with a good mix of equipment for kids of all ages - so the adults can enjoy the gardens and viewing the palace and then drop by here to give the kiddies a run. The play ground cost €2.50 for children over 15months and adults were €1.50 (but there is a toilet so almost worth it?) there are seats around the outside if you have older kids to watch and don't want to pay entry. There was also a carousel and pony rides outside but I didn't look closer at those.
Nice place . Beautiful gardens and a fantastic place to relax for a few minutes to take in the sights and sounds of Paris. Highly recommend!

Beautiful. Visited the gardens when we had a hour to spare before checking out of the hotel. They are stunning, load of chairs dotted around to sit and watch the world go by. Lots going on with Tai Chi, boot camps, and great area for children. Would be perfect for picnics!

Ideal place for weekend visit. So big and so beautiful!! Easily accessible through RER B and Clunny La Sorbonne Metro station.The Luxembourg Palace is off the limit now,some renovation is going on. There are lots of sitting arrangements,both benches and chairs. People generally laze around on a sunny afternoon by reading books or playing with kids. A great picnic spot, food is easily available outside. We had a great time here,sitting on the lawn,watching small kids floating wooden boats in the mini water body,having a picnic lunch...and talking for hours! Expect a huge crowd in weekends. Folk musicians and local bands perform outside the garden on weekends,which is truly entertaining.But always keep something with you to protect your face,at least a big handkerchief, because there is so much dust in the air. Also wear a wide rimmed hat,because near the water body there is no shade from the afternoon sun.Loved this place for the beauty and lots of flowers.

AMAZING! . Without question it was the best place I visited in Paris! Even better the Eiffel Tower!! It was a sunny and warm day and the place is just... AMAZING! If you go to Paris and don't visit Luxembourg Garden I'd say you didn't enjoy Paris as much as you could!
Wonderful if the weather is nice. Really wonderful and quiet place in a Paris centre, it is great just to sit there and relax, not too many tourists like in Tuilleries.

Wonderful picnic in the middle of paris. There is a spot you may use the grass to sit. Bing a blanket and buy a sorbet in the small icecream shop, you will not be dissapointed. We fell a sleep in the sun on the grass, and it was wonderful, romantic, relaxing. We also went to watch some people who played boule. There are people everywhere, doing stiff together. Tennis, soccer, boule, basketball, badminton. Just go there to enjoy the beautiful setting or activate yourselves!

Mother's day stroll. My sister, mother, and I walked through the gardens for mother's day. It was perfect for a post lunch walk on a sunny day. They have lots of chairs to sit on, and many people brought blankets to picnic on the grass. There were pony rides for little kids too! Overall, beautiful gardens, and I definitely recommend going if you are in the area.

A nice gettaway in the middle of the city. We planned a trip on the 1th of may (not a good idea for shopping, because every shop was closed). So we went for a very nice lunch, and afterwards a nice walk. I've been many times to Paris, but this was the 1th time for me in the Jardin du Luxembourg. It was very crouded (on a good way) with locals who sat everywhere. The palace is beautiful and there is a nice restaurant, a playground, tenniscourts and "jeu des boules-alley". We enjoyed it very much and left the city very chilled!

Walk through the Park. We enjoyed the walk through this beautiful park on a sunny May day. The park was very busy lots of kids playing in the large dedicated playground.
The small lake had several remote control water craft entertaining the crowd.
nice park to hang out in on a sunny day. this park is great for hanging out by the fountain, have a picknick, go running the ca 2 km path around it or just walk around enjoy central paris

A beautiful park!. I went to Jardin de Luxembourg on a Friday evening, I took a peaceful troll inside and around it for over an hour. Absolutely beautiful and tidy, there are plenty of chairs that you can place at your convenience to sit! I also liked the many statues there and their stories. It is big but still convenient for a short stroll if you don't have much time. I think it's a great place to visit at the end of the day to get a sense of the garden culture of Paris

Relief in a crazy world!. Loved the Luxembourg Gardens! They were within walking distance from our hotel, and well worth the visit. If you want to get away from it all, and I mean crazy Paris streets with everyone in a hurry, then you will want to visit Luxembourg Gardens. There is something for everyone here...a great children's playground with a carousel, benches and chairs located everywhere throughout the park, gorgeous flower gardens and fountains, and even old guys playing chess. We took some snacks and had a little picnic - seems like a lot of people do that. It was like a breath of fresh air!

Beautiful!. We visited on a baking hot May afternoon and, after a brief stroll around the beautiful gardens, found ourselves a couple of comfy chairs and joined the Parisiens to sit and soak up some rays by the octagonal lake. Kids can hire a boat to sail on the lake and this seemed like great fun. Well worth a trip to get away from the usual rush of sightseeing and relax.
Nice Garden in the middle of Paris. Luxembourg is a very nice garden in Saint Germain area. We loved time spent there with our friends. Area is lovely as well.

An Oasis discovered too late. We didn't discover this little gem until the last day of our visit while killing a few hours before our flight.Beautiful to walk around, there are many areas from tennis courts, boule area, walk ways, and a miniature boating lake. There were an abundance of chairs arranged around the park where you could sit and chill.Strangely, we did not see a single dog in the park, so I presume they are banned, given the amount of dogs we did see around Paris.

A wonderful afternoon!. There is so much to see and do in these gardens. Boating lake, petang, tennis, kiddie play areas or just lazing around. There are seats everywhere and the flower beds and trees were beautiful when we visited in the first week of May.

An absolute must on a sunny day. These gardens are more like a park and are an absolute must on a sunny Sunday. They are a destination for Parisiennes, not just tourists and a great place to watch Paris life go by. The gardens have several sections to suit all. There are beautiful formal gardens nestled in the backdrop of the palace, shaded areas where people do tai-chi or yoga, tennis courts, donkey rides and play areas for children and of course the chess area, where serious speed matches are played out on tables made of tree stumps. A great feature is the central boating pond where children (and more likely their dads) can hire miniature boats to sail, powered with the aid of a stick. What is great is that there are plenty of sturdy metal arm chairs provided all over the park. We spent several hours relaxing in the sun with our newspaper, picnic just watching the world go by.

A Parisian Treasure. A visit to Paris is not complete without a walk in this large, beautiful park, which is filled with statuary and exquisite trees and flowers. This is where Parisians come with their children on holidays and weekends. After a walk, you can relax at one of the nearby bistros and have a coffee or lunch.

Nice park. This is a nice city park -although French parks are heavier on gravel than grass- and it seemed like a decent place to run. When I was there they had cool sculptures of French queens scattered throughout the park. Apparently, the sculpture selection gets changed out occasionally.
Nice gardens. The gardens outside the senate are nice and relaxing and make for a pleasant stroll on the way to the pantheon.

Lovely location to just relax or picnic with friends.. What a hidden gem in the middle of Paris. The structure is the home of the French Senate which supports the garden upkeep. Lots of chairs available especially close to the circular pond where you will see many children propelling sail boats on the water. Lots to see and do here.

Pretty . The Luxemburg Gardens is an expansive space with many trees and beautiful flowers. The palace was undergoing some maintenance so you couldn't get near it. Not a lot to see here but it's a place to relax and take it easy. Visit the Medici fountain and you will see the extra part that the architect Haussmann added. He wanted to extend a road and the Paris government only gave him permission if he saved a fountain that would be demolished. This was added to the rear of the Medici fountain. Nive relaxing location.
Great time . Lovely park, was staying right next to the gardens. Worth a visit, an afternoon in the park even if not staying next door. Lots of activities around and in it.
A lovely place. Such a lovely way to chill and wander as the locals do . My son 8yrs loved the play ground , swings, the paths to ride his scooter . I could have stayed all day.
Stunning park. This park is beautiful to take time off, see how the old fellows are playing chess, enjoy the stunning pathways surrounded by beautifully cut trees.

Not only gardens, Boats too!!. The Luxembourg gardens are beautiful any time of the year. It is especially worth a visit to look at all the different boats being sailed in the large pond. Puppet shows are a feature especially in school holidays, and I have listened to a few excellent bands playing there.

Sailing boats on the fountain!. Every time I visit Paris I go to the Luxembourg Gardens to sail boats on the fountain, and in this trip got to introduce my daughter and nephew to this lovely Parisian pastime. The gardens also contain a large playground with a wide and creative variety of play equipment for all age ranges. There is a small fee for use of the playground but it is well worth it if you are in Paris with young children.

Best Parc in Paris . Our favorite park in Paris. Find a chair and watch the people. Take the kids to the play area. Sail a toy boat in the pond or listen to and watch the dancing. Just a wonderful place relax.

Yellow flowers, gravel and shade . This park is a wonderful haven of soft green grass blades; benches under tall trees; gravel pathways; steps around a fountain and gorgeous yellow flower beds. Great spot for runners, wanderers, readers, or anyone wanting to surrender to scenic beauty.

Beautiful in Spring or anytime! . I've been to Luxembourg Gardens a number of times but today (a Saturday) the Spring sun was shining, the flowers were blooming, children sailed their boats on the fountain pond and there was a full brass band playing for anyone to listen! What a spectacular visit. However... I've visited in winter and summer and it's always a special place to experience a different part of Paris.
Awesome. Beautiful gardens and a great 2k running track around the perimeter. Wonderful flowers and a great lake in the middle.

Dejeuner sur l'Herbe. Did a picnic here today - bought cheeses and jambon/saucisson and wine at Marche St Germain (Sanders) and sat on the permitted lawn (so funny) along with lots of other folks happy to be basking in the 70+ degree May sun. Beautiful.
Beautiful Gardens . These are really beautiful gardens and very well maintained. The kids had a really good time there. But do not have coffee there. It was the worst coffee we ever had.

So lovely...just breathraking. This was my 7th trip to Paris (my husband is French) and I loved the Gardens more this time than ever. They are in immaculate condition and there is so much space to relax in and enjoy. It's peaceful and beautiful. We usually bring a lunch here but it was too cold this time. I especially love the monuments and walking about slowly to discover all of the statues and nooks and crannies. It's a must do when in Paris. So beautiful, civilized and relaxing. Great cafes and food shops in the area so do some research (I love Gerard Mulot on Rue de Seine) and have breakfast or lunch.

Peaceful day in the sun!. Walked to the gardens from central Paris and was not disappointed! Very relaxing park with a great restaurant and lots to see. Flowers everywhere and a lake for dipping your feet in after a long walk! A must see.

Beautiful in the Spring. I am a sucker for gardens and arboretums and such. This place didn't disappoint. Large and open walking areas, places to sit and enjoy the sites, a view of the Seine along the periphery, chairs by a fountain with the Louvre in the background, a carousel... this is a perfect place to sit after walking the city. While many tourists were strolling through the park, many locals were here as well. Lovely!
Amazing park. Wonderful location, I liked the atmosphere from here. In a sunny day it look really good. Easy to get there.
Wonderful place to sit in the sun and relax. Gardens that are freely accessible and are used by young and old to sit and talk or simply enjoy the beauty of the palace and its garden.
Hideaway from Busy City. Very well kept gardens and fountains. Come here to see locals hang out and work out. Not many tourists were here last time I visited so that was very nice.
romantic. the best place to relax in a virbrant city, i've been there with my wife in a sunny day of last september, we had a nice walk and relaxed by the fountain in the park

Playground. We have four kids that we drug around France for a few days. They did great but this was a lifesaver. The park is beautiful, so beautiful but all the kids wanted to do was play on the playground. So for 2 bucks a kid they were able to get an all day pass. The loved it. They played for a few hours, we went to the McDonalds across the street (far side of the park from the playground) and then we went back for a few more hours. The playground got crowded when the French children got out of school so we bailed after that. But Thanks to France for their playgrounds in almost every park.
A grand park, but don't go there looking for elaborate gardens.. I was disappointed not to find any real gardens here. There was a rose garden and a few other spots, but nothing breathtaking.
Paradise in the city. We saw the gardens while it was raining but that was a spectacular activity. The flowers, the trees are so perfect to watch. Nice to have a coffee.

Play grounds. Great park for families. We stayed next to the park so that our children could run around and have some fun away from the museums and sights. Would highly recommend for young children as the park is large, clean (for a big city) and has a fantastic playground (it costs a couple of € per child).Make sure you check out the most southern tip of the park for a beautiful fountain and beautiful long views to the Luxembourg palace. There is also a fantastic restaurant la cuisine de Phillipe on the north side of the park opposite Angelina. They make the best soufflés in the world.
Beautiful especially in summer . A lovely place to wander around and sit especially in summer.Free to get in so a bonus for such a nice area.Busy when we went but still nice.

Lovely place to wander, but very busy!. Our last day in the warm sun of early May was spent in these gardens! It was extremely busy with the majority of Visitors coming from Paris it is clearly a local attraction! Lovely pond for children wanting to sail small boats. Dog friendly which might annoy those not keen on dogs!
Beautiful Gardens. If you have some time and want to walk around or relax in a beautiful place, this garden is amazing. .

Cozy park on the way to the Louvre (With playground). Very colorfull flowers and trees. Bring a blanket, and some drinks/food and this will be a very relaxing day. (They even have a playground for the kids).
Perfect for a Picnic.. Perfect spot for a Picnic. Lots of shadow spots, and lots of sunny spots as well! Located in a very nice neighboorhood. Loved it. And it has amazing pictures spots!

Beautiful oasis in centre of busy city. This is a beautiful garden and relaxation spot - great for people watching. The bandstand is the focus for many activities including music and dance.
On our last day we sat for an hour just watching people and the birds - perfect peace in the centre of an incredibly busy city.

A romantic walk. We walked through these gardens for one simple reason... It's where Cossette and Marius met according to Victor Hugo's book Les Miserables. The day was very over cast, but one can only imagine what it's like when the sun is out and warm. Plenty of walking paths and kids play area ... Can't wait to return !

Nice place to relax. We walked here from our hotel while just aimlessly wandering the streets of Paris. The day was nice and sunny, and the gardens full of people enjoying the good weather.
The wonderful atmosphere here makes it a great place to come, relax and just breath in the wonderful atmosphere of Paris.
Packed but beautudul. Would be even better minus 80% of crowd and another week into spring for full blossom. Mea culpa. Note to self: Go later in season, avoid Sunday and skip on French Labor Day!

A a Great Garden. If you enjoy walking about some of the fine gardens in major cities, this is one to see. But try to either watch or actually sail a toy boat on the small pond in the garden for a special experience!
Loved it. Even on a coolish early spring day, the gardens are lovely to visit. Nice fresh air and plenty of flowers. Easy to get around and lots of need things for pictures

A Beautiful Stroll in the Middle of Busy Paris. This is a pleasant garden with flowers and statuary. Many types of flowers, trees, pools, fountains and open park spaces. A large pool serves as a toy sailboat play area for children.There are cafes within the grounds. Also, the gardens are very close to Rue Bonaparte (1-2 blocks), which is the location for some of the best bakeries in Paris (Pierre Hermes). Pick up a croissant or a pastry and enjoy it within the gardens.

Beautiful. Lovely area with trees, beautiful flowers, open space to let children run free, pony rides, a garden cafe, a stately home, a miniature boating lake and lots of seats which is perfect for a sunny rest in Paris.
Peaceful stroll . We had amazing weather this day and the gardens didn't disappoint. Highly recommend the pond with the little sailboats. Great for taking photographs too.

Very pretty, perfect for a sunny day. There was some construction whilst we visited, but otherwise the gardens were lovely and you could spend a couple of hours here easily just walking around exploring, or relaxing on a bench by the fountain.
We visited as a couple, but there were many children playing with the boats in the fountain so it's a great spot for families too.
Very nice place to spend a sunny afternoon . Beautiful surroundings, plenty of places to sit. Worth a visit if you have time. 50 cents for the toilets and they can't change a note however

Nature is queen. One of the most beautiful gardens in the world.You'll be able to see how pretty nature is.You can have sit to read a book or to relax or have a walk around the park.If you want to, there are two little restaurants to take something to eat or to drink.Also you'll have a nice view on the many fountains that there are in the park and on the Sénat.

Beautiful garden. Luxembourg garden is an old garden full of mysteries and legends. It suits well for History-lovers and just people who want to enjoy the peace and tranquility of nature inside the big city

The most fabulous garden. The Luxembourg garden is for me the most fabulous garden of Paris. It is quite a magic place where an astronomic kind of different people will meet with tons of different activities: running; karting for kids, kindergarten, carousel, basketball, tennis (with a lot of VIP), chess, cards, yoga, tai chi, reading, boating, cofee, restaurant, rest on grass, romantic conversation, dating ...Since 35 years now this magic did not disappear for me.

Improve the Water Closet Situation!!!. Lovely, lovely, relaxing park. My young family and I walked here straight away upon arriving. We ate delicious crepes and strolled through the gorgeous grounds and watched all the different people. But the bathroom/water closet/lavatory/restroom/toilet situation simply must be improved! For as many people as there are in the park, it was insufferable how few rest areas were available, and unforgivable to have them all closed save one. Adding insult to injury, the queue was lengthy and - in classic Parisian style - a FEE was required prior to relieving oneself. WARNING: go potty BEFORE you visit this luscious oasis!
vacation . perfect for relaxing in a big garden with a lake inside . especially for couples and honeymooners ......also some ducks

Hope to revisit some day. We walked through the gardens after seeing Notre Dame on our way to the Ferris wheel on a rainy day. I hope to some day revisit and spend more time here. What beautiful gardens.

Very picturesque. Well protected Palais in the gardens and tennis courts as well. Bring a racket if you care to play.We loved the Gardens! They have chairs scattered throughout for icnic's and to simply sit in the sun.

Perfect spot to relax in the sun. Such a beautiful garden and a perfect spot to relax in the sun, any tourist can come and watch the world go by and feel like a true Parisian. Its a beautiful garden, i try to come back here when I'm in the city as i used to live across the road from it no doubt its one of the best spots in the city.
Peaceful beauty. Beautiful gardens, great to take a walk around or sit down and relax with a sandwich or crepe.Good place to do some people watching as well.

Go if you're a fan of gardens. I'm not sure what the fascination is with these gardens. It's fairly far away from other Paris attractions, so if you're on a tight schedule and want to see the best of Paris, I wouldn't go out of the way to see these. Moreover, it didn't look great in the spring with most flowers and greens not planted yet.

A quiet oasis in the middle of Paris. This little oasis is well frequented by the young or not so young of Paris. We saw people playing chess, cards basketball and tennis. Others jogging, walking, sun bathing, eating lunch or just chilling. There are cafes, a carousel, children's boat swings and pony rides.The formal gardens are something to envy, with the backdrop of the museum and palace de Luxembourg.When walking out, an unexpected exhibition of 80, 6'X4' photos of the "appeal of the cold" hanging on the railings of Rue de Médicis

Worth the visit. The gardens are lovely. So much to see, lots of sculptures, men playing boules or chest. Children having fun in the big playground and sandpits. Boat races in the pond. Live music. It's a great place to sit and people watch.

The weight of history is balanced by the beautiful gardens. With so many cafes and restaurants around, this is a favourite place. The ability to ponder nature and the little lake in the middle is balanced by the vicinity of the urbane around. I returned again and again to take a breather from the hustle and bustle.

Hemingway , Pigeons and The Park. While exploring the Latin Quarter area on a recent visit to Paris, my wife and I made sure to include the Luxembourg Gardens. We only spent about an hour at the park but the experience was well worth it. It was a sunny day and we could easily see how people could spend a lot of time on a regular basis enjoying the park. You can stroll wide comfortable paths, view the flowers or just hang out by the beautiful pond and watching a family use a remote control to have a boat navigate the water. We could easily imagine it filled with people throughout the warmer months.As to Ernest Hemingway , he lived in the Latin Quarter in the early 1920's with his first wife and very young son Jack. The story goes that he would put Jack in the stroller and walk to Luxembourg Gardens. If there was no gendarme presence , he would spread kernels of corn on the ground to lure a pigeon to him. He would grab the pigeon , snap it's neck and take it home to enhance the diet of the family of a struggling writer. It reportedly happened often enough that family made it through hard times but were completely sick of eating pigeon. I'm not positive of the truth value of the story but it certainly adds to the lore of Paris.

timeout. If the weather is nice, mingle with all the other sun worshipers and enjoy the quiet side of Paris. Find one of those green chairs that all seem to look a bit different, walk across the gardens and watch some older gentlemen play boules. The Luxembourg Gardens are kept quite clean and are well taken care of. You can find all kinds of people enjoying their free time there and it's a nice place to relax.
Amazing Gardens. We had a beautiful afternoon here after visiting the catacombs. It was great to just sit down and relax for a bit.

Wonderful green oasis to chill and escape the rush of Paris. A great place to sun bathe (there was a mini heat wave mid April) or find shade, with free chairs and loungers for all (UK please note - this is yet another thing that Paris does better!). Huge central pool with fountain, several cafes and very importantly, clean toilets. Also has drinking fountains where you can refill your water bottle.
Really nice gardens. The gardens were amazing. The flowers were blooming and the pond was beautiful. Such a shame it was raining when we got there. Definitely a must see.

Gorgeous grounds. Very large garden that allows for a nice stroll. We did pack some bread and cheeses in order to eat in the gardens (no alcohol or glass in the gardens). Many parts of the gardens do not allow sitting on the grass but there are a lot of chairs for public use. They may, however, get quickly taken on very nice days but since we went on a cloudy day there were plenty chairs available.Great free attraction to relax (or read) and enjoy all the beautiful plants.

Most favorite place in Paris . The perfect place to spend the afternoon. Go grab a bottle of wine, cheese and bread and watch the world go by. The actual gardens are perfect and all the people enjoying themselves make it even better.

Inner peace in the middle of Paris. Whenever I am in Paris this is one of the places to which I want to return. You can read the very detailed history of the palace and gardens in various websites, or you can just go there to absorb the regal atmosphere of the place where William Faulkner's novel 'Sanctuary' ends. Many Parisians take books to read while sitting on one of the available chairs taking some sun and personal solitude.

Beautiful Gardens. This is a lovely and lush park that is free to the public. The day we went there were lots of families and people picnicking all along the fountain. Next time, we would take a picnic basket with cheese and wine.

A great garder to visit and grab a quick lunch picnic. Beautiful gardens. Nice haven away from the Parisian noises right in the center of the city. Grab a baguette sandwich with a small bottle of wine and just have a great lunch in the middle of the parc. Amazing.
Beautiful gardens to visitin the spring. These gardens are wonderful to visit in the early spring. Its very relxaing to walk aroung and view all the colors of the gardens.

One of rare places of Paris not very crowded. Relaxing green garden worth visiting if you appriciate flowers and trees. Enjoyable place to spend time in. The garden is of average size, with many pathways. A great place to have a breath of fresh air in a relaxing picturesque atmosphere.

So nice to walk around. Worth to spend time in this beautiful landscaped garden, there is a bit for everyone, from young children to "pétanque" fans. The flowers are also blooming at this time. Also on the gates there is a temporary exhibition of photos of Nordic sceneries.

Pretty park. A really wonderful park and still a place with less tourists. It can be busy on the other hand. A good place to relax for a while and there is a lot to see, like the castle in front and the pond in behind it. Don't miss the gorgeous fountain on the side of the park. On a sunny day you can be there for hours. I would recommend this park when visiting Paris.

A must see if you appreciate the beauty of gardens!. We were there in early April, so many of the flowers hadn't been planted yet, but some were. The grass was gorgeously trimmed and the hedges were all perfectly manicured. This was well worth the stop! It has fountains, statues, flowers, and is just beautiful and peaceful. And HUGE! I didn't realize how big it was. Absolutely gorgeous. Make this a planned stop on your way around Paris. Enjoy a baguette while sitting in a chair people watching.

Perfect place for a tour and a picnic. You can set in the gardens of the palace an enjoy the view, as well do a god picnic, with family, girlfriend or boyfriend and friends. It's a really nice place to set and think and be thankfull for being there.

Nice stop on a sunny day. The gardens turned out to be smaller than I expected but lovely. Take a seat by the pool where kids play with their toy sail boats. Walk around and see the neatly trimmed trees, statues and flowers. Definitely see Fontaine du bassin Soufflo (get a map, if you don't know where it is).
Very pretty. Was near our hotel so well worth a visit to see the beautiful gardens and all the locals jogging. Not sure I'd make a special trip across town of not staying in this area.

lovely place for sunny afternoons. there's something very romantic about having a pic-nic in this park. mind where you sit down though, not all of the grass is open to the public, they have alternating "resting weeks" for the grass to grow back. you will get a fine if you ignore the signs.
wonderful Luxembourg Gardens. we had to come to visit this place, its wonderful, much more nicer than on the pictures, we enjoyed every moment.

Perfect Sunday stroll for people watching. Pick a nice day and take your time in this park. It is beautiful! Watch the kids playing with the boats or riding horses. Great place to see French families enjoy Sunday afternoons..
Luxembourg Gardens. Lovely day and gardens were great . We ate lunch there obtained from nearby shop. Don't sit on the grass.

Beautiful, take a stroll and a picnic . What lovely gardens and grounds to explore. Lots of seating dotted around different places. Great photo opportunities when looking at the palace. It would be a wonderful place to sit in the sun with a picnic. Can't wait to return!

Always lovely in Spring, Summer & Fall. Luxembourg Gardens are a tranquil lovely place to visit during all but rainy days. Around sunset the gardens close (exact hour depending upon the time of year) and the police chastise stragglers. When the gardens are closed, however, you can still see the ever changing exhibits of photographs and posters. This month's theme is the Arctic, with photos from Alaska to Greenland, Norway and Siberia.

Nice on a sunny day. It's a beautiful place during spring/summer time. Plenty of sun and shade to spend a day in the park. You are usually not allowed to sit on the grass, there used to be a rotation system where you could sit only on one part of the garden, so the rest of the grass could recover. I am not sure if this is still the case or not. There are metal sits all around the park anyways, just be sure to be patient to get one available.
romantic gardens. good place between statues to seat on a bench and having a great lunch of ham sandwich , very well maintened

Lovely gardens. Visited on a Sunday morning when most of Paris seemed to be in the gardens exercising ! The floral displays are beautiful and it is a perfect place to sit with a coffee and watch other people do all the hard work !

It doesn't deserve that importance. I have visited all the gardens, forests, and parks in the ile de france region. Luxembourg is the most famous one. However, it is not the most beautiful one. For example, parc de sceaux, Versailles chateau gardens, etc. All deserve visiting before wasting your time in Luxembourg.

Soooo Beautful!. Love this place! It is calm, peaceful, even in the high season. You can relax, read a book, listen to music, and forget all the stress. In the spring there are exquisite flowers, in the fall it has all the brown leaves, in the summer you have people sun bathing, and in the winter you have a beautiful scenario and lots of peace.

Very nice "jardin à la française" right in the center of Paris. Take a break while in the historical center of Paris. Many things to enjoy from the architecture (Palais Brognard, Fontaine de Médecis and its fabulous trompe-l'oeil), the trees, the flowers, the birds, some activties for the kids, or just resting in a chair looking at the parisians families...
Timeless. Atmosphere unchanged since C19th ... I'd bet. Understated elegance of grounds and majority of park habituees.

Beautiful, a must if you come to Paris. This Garden it's great, beautiful, I used to live near this park and I did a lot of running there, beautiful during the spring, very crowed the summer and just amazing with the colors during the fall!.

Luxembourg Gardens = beauty and serenity. Need a break from Paris ? Children need to scamper without getting a Gallic arched eyebrow? Want to be refreshed by flowers, tees, and majestic design? I visit the Luxembourg gardens every time I go to Paris, sometimes sitting there by myself and reading amid the beauty of the park, sometimes strolling with business colleagues or friends. There are no lines, there are no tickets. It's just a lovely, expansive garden, extraordinarily well- maintained.
A Garden Stroll. On a glorious sunny day, this is a great garden to wander through with beautiful flowers, statues, seating areas, fountains and really good cafe

really really nice!. i loved it!love that place love the flowers and the colours!im not sure if its a good spot in a rainy season but at the time we where there the weather was really nice!!they had chairs s you can sit down close to the foundaine int he center!!if you have the time dont miss it! :)
Good Visit. We spend about 2 hours here which was enough due to the not so good weather. The gardens are very nice along with the water features and abundance of plants, trees and statues.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens surrounding the French Senate are popular with locals as well as tourists. They were only a stone's throw from our hotel, and we thoroughly enjoyed wandering through them after a hard day's pounding the Parisian pavements - particularly as we were enduring a heatwave of 38-40C while we were in France. They close in the evening.

Fröhlich in the Sun. Essentially a garden infused with culture and memories of young and old, the then and now. Colors that changes each season provides a different memory for anyone that is there standing, waiting or immersing in the magic since....1612 by Marie de' Medici, the widow of King Henry IV of France until today...

Another Great Parisian park. This huge park is full of interesting sights. Lots of statues, flower beds, pretty pathways, the Medici fountain and a circular pond, on which the locals sail miniature sailboats. There is also a small replica of the Statue of Liberty.However, we came for the highly rated children's playground. We were not disappointed. There is a small fee - but the result is that the playground is not very busy and everything is working. The older children enjoyed the zip line the most.

Nice Break From Busy City . This park is located near the senate building. Security is very present and you feel safe. The gardens are gorgeous. It's a big place you can walk for a while. If you want you can pack a little picnic, wine, cheese, sandwiches whatever, grab a chair or just sit in the grass! It's a beautiful place to relax, soak up some sun or just walk. Very family friendly too. Lots to do inside for kids too.

A delightful garden. This was a surprise find. We were visiting the Saint Germaine area and chanced upon this garden. We were glad that we walked into it. This is a huge garden, and very pretty. There are many spots for photo taking. And lots of beautiful flowers in bloom as well. However, the day that we were there, the weather was not that great, with occasional shower which mar the photo taking opportunities. Remember, the next time you are in Paris, do not miss out this charming place.
Dusty and ponies.... A lovely place for a pre-supper Saturday evening walk... A great sense of history and stunning architecture.

Lovely . Wonderful park, a great place to relax and admire the beauty of this park. Currently there is a collection of photos related to arctic places, flora and fauna. This is also a perfect spot for a picnic.

Tulips plenty in spring . Time to spent reading here as we had great weather and it's just beautiful though there's still gardening work around the palace so can see construction barricades that ruin the view
Beautiful and well maintained. Must visit !!!. Garden with huge space located at a buzzing place. Very well maintained. Lots of tulips around the garden. Great Architecture.
Lovely grounds. Nice to waste an hour or two walking around if its a sunny day. Some work was being done on the main building which was a shame. Didn't go to the museum.

Walk in the Park. This huge and beautiful park is a must see in Paris. The magnificent Palace building overlooks an ornamental lake and paths lead in many directions to statues surrounded by ornamental flower beds, boules, tennis, great children's playground and, in a far corner, a beautiful crab apple orchard.
Wonderful!. I wish this was local to me! I would be there everyday with my children. So pretty! Lot's of space and areas to walk! A huge park for kids and lot's of wonderful statues!

Beautiful gardens. Always a great place to walk through, sit and enjoy the flowers, the weather, people watching, and small children and their parents sailing their small sail boats that they can rent along with a stick to push the boats!

So relaxing. Whether you are sitting by the gardens or pond or strolling this place is an oasis. We were there a few times in this trip but dying one the sun was aging so we found some comfortable chairs and read in the sun for a few hours. There were children sailing boats in the pond, families picnicking and couples walking hand and hand. A lovely afternoon enjoyed in a beautiful space.

Stunning and clean. A great place to take a break and enjoy Paris like a local. Grab a bottle of your favorite beverage and snacks and head out to the gardens to enjoy the views. Well protected Palais in the gardens and tennis courts as well. Bring a racket if you care to play.

Beautiful!...even in Winter!. We loved the Gardens! They have chairs scattered throughout for picnic's and to simply sit in the sun; and the little lake is very nice too!Very picturesque. Would recommend an afternoon stroll here.

Nice morning. . Beautiful sunny day. We spent the morning at the Luxembourg Gardens. The statues, architecture, gardens just beautiful. Kids enjoy the miniature sailing, playground, carousel. Sitting under the sun while they are playing very peaceful.

Lovely chilly afternoon. We wandered through the gardens on a cold afternoon sipping hot chocolate and admiring the statues. We were surprised to find a huge playground that my son was desperate to jump into but we sadly found it at the end of our time there. Nonetheless it was an afternoon well spent.
Last stop in paris. Nothing unique about this place. Visited on our last day to Paris. Just a time pass place if u have lot of time.

Favorite Garden in Paris. Luxembourg garden is my favorite in Paris. the place is fantastic. very large and quiet.you can rest there without any disturbing. the large pool is great . the children can pass big time to play with the boats electriques using the remote control or fishing the small boats also.....if the weather is good, you can relax and take a sun-bath.Nice place to rest
Beautiful Gardens. Such lush green gardens!! With lots of space to sit! Including public chairs and benches! Stop for an ice cream or crepe!!

Beautiful location to visit!. The building and gardens are stunning. One of the most picturesque locations in Paris. You can also see many icons around the city off in the distance from these gardens.

Paris on a budget. First wander up Rue Mouffetard to get to the gardens. So many dreamy shoppes and cafes, take your time. Along the way, buy a bottle of rose, there's a shop and they will uncork the bottle and give you some paper cups! Then buy some fruit from the market, strawberries or something enticing. Maybe a sandwich, even, then continue on to the Luxembourg gardens and find a bench. Start sipping your wine and do some people watching- really good people watching here, slowly eat your strawberries and sandwich. And tell yourself- " I'm in Paris, sipping wine and doing absolutely nothing!"

Indispensable romantic garden "à la Française". Probably the most beautiful garden in Paris.You will find there the Parisienne and the herds of tourists you see in the Jardin des Tuileries It offers several different ambiance from the "grandeur" of a Cartesian organization of nature to the charmest romantic hideaway close to the Fontaine Medicis. Beautiful views on the Pantheon, the Senate palace an the 18th century Paris astronomical observatory.A must

Lucembourgh. Simply the mostt beautiful garden in ParisSpend an hour sailing a small wooden sailboat on a lovely pondEnjoy lunch and a wine at the park cafeListen to live music from the center of the parkPull up a chair or two and just people warch or readIts very special
relaxing place to visit. This park is only a few steps from the RER station at Luxembourg. It is a nice relaxing place to visit on a sunny day with plenty of seats.

Perfect picnic place. If it's a sunny day, this is where you come for a picnic. Beautiful imaculate gardens with plenty of seating available to just read a book, write or listen to music.Very big park with lots of different views, perfect location for a stroll or even a jogWe absolutely loved it !!

The magnificent Luxembourg Palace is the seat of the French Senate sessions. Luxembourg Gardens was laid out in 1611-1612 years by order of the Italian Marie de Medici, widow of Henry IV, the monarch around the country palace, is being built at the time far beyond the city. The prototype served as the palace of Palazzo Pitti in Florence, which has grown Marie de Medici.Люксембургский сад был разбит в 1611-1612 годах по заказу итальянки Марии Медичи, вдовы монарха Генриха IV, вокруг загородного дворца, возводившегося в то время далеко за пределами города. Прообразом дворца послужил Палаццо Питти во Флоренции, в котором выросла Мария Медичи.

Beautiful in the sun. We took a lovely walk in the sun through the gardens.Children guiding boats on the fountain, old men playing boules and lots of seating to relax and enjoy the surroundings/atmosphere. The locals seem to enjoy sitting back with a good book in the sun.Unfortunately when we visited the main building and one corner of the park were closed for, what I gathered was, renovations. Despite this, what we could see we enjoyed.
CLASSIC PARISIAN STYLE. We stumbled upon these gardens, which are quite close to Notre Dame by foot. Beautiful, classy in the formal Parisian style of garden with avenues of trees and lovely colour.

Peaceful Park. The gardens are a shining example of a French park surrounded by typical Parisian architecture. The main body of the park is well kept, architecturally designed and a great space for couples, friends and families. There is a bandstand (we were lucky enough to hear a band), a large pond (where kids sail boats) which is surrounded by chairs to picnic or relax and a beautiful house -there are even free table tennis tables (walk towards Park Royal, through the park from the pond). It's a great and tranquil place to spend some time and escape the tourist madness

Afternoon in the Gardens. On a beautiful sunny day we walked around the gardens and enjoyed seeing Parisian families playing bocce ball, chess, floating boats around a large pond, The Medici fountain is beautiful. There is a small Statue of Liberty by the playground. They have bee boxes to pollinate their plants. Nice park to sit and relax.

Great on a Sunny Day. If you get a sunny, warm day, go to the Luxembourg Gardens and soak in the sun and the flowers. Just stroll the grand promenade and take detours into the alcoves. If you are lucky you will even find the statue of liberty hiding on the side.
Great place to sit after a long day of sight seeing. Loved this park. In the Latin Quarter, and by the University. A little less travelled than some of the iconic sights. Great place to sit and relax

Lovely public space. The Jardin du Luxembourg is much larger than I expected, but like other Parisian gardens it's full of trees, flowers, art, and people. There's also an allee, a playground and carousel, a reflecting pool with model sailboats, and the stunning Medici fountain. There are plenty of places to sit and a couple of food stands. It's a great space to spend a couple of peaceful hours.
Beauty!. Fantastic place to see and to feel. The garden is so beautiful! It was the tulipe season and everything was so colorful
Calm spot. A calm and cozy park, with loads of seating. Nice for taking a jog or just a rest. Worth the walk up from the Latin Quarter.

Beautiful park in the middle of Paris. A scenic park right in the heart of the city. Must go to if you haven't before. The large basins are great with the change to hire model boats to sail across them - great for young children. Huge playgrounds too and a large area to play bowls. Giant beach hedges line some of the paths as well as lines of horse chestnut trees.
nice garden. When the sun is shining then you will like the garden. There is a big fountain in the middle of the square and nice buildings around it.
Rain.. The rain stopped our visit, We went to a café and had coffee. It rained a great deal the week we were there.

Grandeur of flowers and statuary. In the middle of the city, a huge space of stately tree avenues, enormous flower beds, and statues, statues, statues. Especially interesting are the illustrious French women, including Mary, Queen of Scots. The Medici Fountain itself a bit peculiar but the reflecting pool in front makes you understand where those Impressionist water paintings came from.

2.50 euros/child + 1.50/adult for the kids play area. While the walks are great and the sitting area by the pond is wonderful for people watching when the weather is good, I was appalled by the fact that they charge to use the kids play area. Two kids and two adults to pay 9 euros for the kids to play? Disappointing, especially in a city that is very friendly for kids and all museums are free for under 18.If this is a capacity issue, they could just charge a nominal fee (50 cents?) and not let in more than x kids/adults.

What a pleasant spot. This came as quite a surprise. Just a delight with excellent statuary, fountains and ponds and a most welcoming garden. To think this was a "petite" home. The little coffee stand serves and excellent cafe' creme and cafe francais.

On a sunny Spring day - it doesn't get better. Ok, so we were about a week or so too early on 18th April.....why? Because the chestnut trees were all in full spring leaf but the 'candle' flower heads weren't out yet and that would be breathtaking to see in these manicured gardens with cropped and shaped trees. Tulips and other flowers abound, plenty of chairs to sit around in and just soak up this phenomenal public space gazing across ornamental ponds to the architectural splendour of the Palais de Luxembourg . To have this in the middle of your city is just intoxicating.
picnic & people watching. bring a baguette, cheese, wine and a blanket. gorgeous and great people watching! just so relaxing and a great way to rest up before yr next sightseeing stop

Very stately. Luxembourg gardens are big and centrally located. It's the perfect place to join the other runners in the morning or to grab a take-out coffee or ice cream nearby (there's a columbus near the RER entrance and an Amarino across from it) and enjoy lazy chats watching the tennis/basketball or in the leafier part of the park where it's quieter. Great for kids too, I think you have to pay a couple of euros but you can drop them in the playground and sit outside to keep an eye on them. There are also a couple of spots for exhibitions (photo, art, sculpture etc) that can be nice.

Beautiful park and perfect for kids. This park it really beautiful and a great get away from the city in the city. There is a great playground for kids, a traditional wooden carrousel, swings and tennis courts. There are courts and lessons available for adults and kids on the ground. There are flowers everywhere in the summer and people playing chess. Truly picturesque.

Pull up a chair and relax. Had a couple of hours to kill one afternoon and headed to this beautiful park. The sun was shining (which always helps) so we pulled up a couple of chairs, put our feet up and enjoyed a lovely relax around the pond.

Real life Paris. The gardens are a wonderful place to hang out with the family on a nice day. Real life not touristic. Many Parisians live in apartments and this park is their back yard. Rent a toy sailboat for the kids, pick up a game of times chess or just enjoy the sun on one of the many chairs provided.
A relaxing walk . In a sunny day that is the perfect place to visit in Paris..perfect for couples family and friends this garden is really nice especially in spring time

Very peaceful and pretty. Cool place to visit. Plenty of space for walking or running. Huge green grounds. I did not go into the museum. Plenty of places to eat around the garden. I think they even have a snack cart on the garden grounds. There is actually a kid park in the garden. Although you had to pay to enter. For kids an adults. Not exactly sure why an adult would have to pay. It's not like I am going to use any of the equipment. Also its a short walk to the Pantheon another cool place. Lots of places to take pictures at, some cool statues.

Great spot for a stroll, a picnic, a an afternoon with the kids.. This is quite a large large in the middle of Rive Gauche in Paris, with a lot of different things to do. Beyond just strolling around through the beautiful gardens, you can have a drink at the cafe, watch folks playing boules or chess, check out the free art exhibits in the orangery (summer only- the rest of the time its full of palms and orange trees!) go look at the large collection of espaliered fruit trees, gawk at the armed guards standing around the Senat, or just plop down in a bunch or one of the many chairs scattered around. Also a huge playground that you must pay a few euros to get into, and other activities for kids such as miniature sailboat rentals, pony rides, and a small theatre. All-in-all a nice spot to spend a pleasant few hours.

Beautiful Park. it is located near Luxembourg metro station. the area is very big and beautiful. its very good for relaxing and have some morning exercises. the entrance is free and very green area. try to visit this park if you have time.

Daily walk. This was only two blocks from our hotel so we walked it a lot! I love that such a big city will dedicate space for public gatherings considering the price of real estate in Paris! I loved the smells of all the flowers in bloom.

A quiet space only 20 minutes stroll from Paris central. Good sized green space for a leisurely hours stroll, away from the hustle of the cityWe were particularly interested in the extensive collection of apple trees pruned in every conceivable way- patience required as many of these have taken 50 years to achieve their shape

The child-friendly Luxembourg Gardens. The French Senate offers children a variety of possibilities in the Luxembourg Gardens.  Toddlers have a fenced-in park of sandboxes, a water spigot and patches of lawn, crowned by the statue of a woman with one breast exposed and usually a pigeon resting on her head. Parents sit on surrounding benches An indoor puppet theater welcomes crowds of children seated at the stage, calling out GUIGNOL, GUIGNOL while parents sit apart.  Children can ride the classic merry-go-round to catch brass rings or enjoy high flying swings. Snacks of freshly baked waffles may be enjoyed nearby; there are seats and benches everywhere. Pony rides occur in summer, and live music fills the bandshell on Sundays.  Parents purchase access to an enclosed amusement area filled with climbing structures. Older children can fly on a trolley wire or climb a cable mountain. Toy sailboats are rented by the hour to float in a circular basin on the lowest level of the park, in front of the Senate. Youngsters push them off with long sticks. A few remote-controlled power boats chase the resident ducks about. Around it all, effigies of famous French queens, carefully pollarded trees and the colorful ever-evolving flowerbeds evoke a sense of calm and order. Open from dusk to dark each day. Highly recommended.
Very beautiful place for relaxing. pastoralic and quite gardens.Alot of places to seat and take a mid day breakThe streets around are very good for cafe and deserts
Beautiful Gardens. A must when in St. Germain. This is one of the most beautiful places to see and escape the city environment. From spring to fall is is beautiful

A lovely garden to sit and enjoy the athmosphere in Paris. One of our best favourites in Paris. To sit on the chairs looking the children play with the small sailing boats, let the sun shine and feel Paris.
Beautiful Gardens. Luxembourg Gardens is a special and tranquil place for young and old. Unfortunately, the carousel was not open yet for the season.

Wow. These gardens are beautiful! I got so many amazing pictures of these gardens. I recommend taking a morning or evening stroll in these gardens. I took an evening walk through and it was so calming and peaceful!

Good people watching. Good place to relax and watch the people walking around, we just sat by the pond and enjoyed the few hours we spent there. Good place to take children lots for them to do. Want to take a break from the busy streets this is a place to go, have a coffee and a pastry.

Beautiful!. We stopped here after being told by friends that it was not to be missed. So glad we went. We sat basking in the glorious sunshine taking in the beautiful gardens, statutes, ducks and sailboats. It appears that the locals frequent this place by having a picnic here, which we saw many of them doing. Great spot for people watching too. Don't miss it!

Very Relaxing on a sunny day!. This is a very nice garden with plenty of places to stroll. There are lovely statues and plenty of places to sit and observe the pretty flowers. It felt more like a park to me than a garden, but still very nice. We went on a Wednesday afternoon so it was not too packed but I Imagine it is on the weekends. Bring a backpack with you and make a picnic out of it~

A breath of fresh air.. On the particular day we site seen this beautiful gardens, they where not in full bloom yet. But the set of the garden was just lovely, benches, patches, of different types of flowers, through out the entire garden, walk ways that lead you to many different types of flowers, I will return, in the future, it is abreast place to take pictures in.

My favourite place in Paris.. If you have read about the Medici family, you will be even more amazed by the brilliance of the garden. It is possibly my favourite place in Paris. You feel relaxed over there. Bring a book or your photo machine - and you will be fine.

Very French. Walking in the Jardin de Luxembourg is like stepping back in time, being in the 18th century. Its very enchanting and relaxing. Great place top rest and relax between visits: Pantheon, Bon Marché, Catacombs and other attractions on the rive gauche

Where you see life happen, paris style. Runners, families, toy boat sailors, fish, crunchy sand, a grand circle of benches and movable chairs, in a royally elegant setting with a great building, expansive gardens.

Great garden. Great visit with Notre dame why not have picnic here, just Google monoprix there is one near garden. There are toilets though I walked up and over towards kids play area, cost 1 euro but good toilets. Gardens are fab, so many statues and lovely gardens

Nice to walk through on your way to somewhere else or to just take a break. It is a large, open garden full of Parisians hanging out, sailing toy boats and reading their books. It has a number of nice sculptures to see, although they are nothing compared to the Louvre or the Rodin. If your head is pounding from too much fine art or too many crowds, then head out and kick back, read something, and enjoy an hour in the sun.

Beautiful Secluded Picnic Spots. In addition to the central pond with its sailboats, magnificent lines of sight and recreation from chess to tennis, Luxembourg Gardens has many small secluded picnic spots. These gardens within the garden can be found along the edges. Our favorite is in the northwest corner. There are a series of small areas of flower beds, lawns and benches. While sitting on the lawns is discouraged, moving the numerous garden chairs to a suitable location is encouraged. We often used one chair as a table and enjoyed memorable picnics.Note: I have seen some online debate about having wine with your Paris picnic. We did and it attracted no attention whatsoever.

Gorgeous Milieau. This is a beautiful and spacious park, replete with walking paths, park benches, and an abundance of visual appeal. Those things, along with the tranquil environment, help make this part of the quintessential Paris experience.
Lovely Park. A perfect oasis for a stroll or jog on Sunday morning. There are some lovely flower beds and our boys enjoyed hiring a yacht to sail on the boating pool.

Amazing playground for the kids - small cash fee to get in. Take a break and go to the playground here. It's a huge, wonderful distraction for kids who are otherwise tired of walking all over Paris. Bring cash for small entrance fee. Best park I've seen (much smaller version available at the park across from the Louvre too...free)

Lovely garden. Lovely garden situated in a lovely part of Paris. Went for a walk early Saturday morning and found the park alive with runners, walkers, and a few tourists. Great place for children to wander/run about. There is a huge playground (you must pay to enter) that looked really nice for kids. Lots of gravel paths, too bad we were too early for most of the blooming flowers. The tulips were just starting to bloom. Highly recommend this for a break from the city.

A touch of beauty within the city. A beautifully landscaped place to escape with tennis, model boats, restaurant and something for the entire family. You easily put the hustle and bustle of Paris behind you.

Perfect Sunday!. We visited the other day, and absolutely enjoyed our time in the sun! The tulips are out, and the trees are turning green once again, making Luxembourg Gardens a beautiful spot to enjoy the spring weather. The little toy boats on the water are really fun to watch--my sister and I were reminded of Stuart Little! Overall, a nice park to take a Sunday stroll and sit by the pond/fountain to watch the boats.

Not Great in Early April. The gardens were overcrowded on a weekend and a bit stark at this time of year. We had hoped to have a Sunday picnic, but all of the benches were full and no one is allowed to sit on the grass.
Great stroll on a lazy afternoon. Perfect place to chill out on a sunny afternoon, people watch, read a book etc. Plenty of seating available

Loads of fun for families, but not quite free. Huge gardens and park, enjoyed the retro style 'Guignol' puppet show (Les Trois Petits Chochons) with my niece at the reasonably priced old theatre in the park. Even beginners in French would be able to understand the familiar story (with a twist at the end!).There are clean toilets, although these cost .50 euros each so bring a bit of change. There was also a nice looking café, although we didn't go. The park has a massive and impressive looking playground with areas for younger and older kids, but we didn't go due to cost of entry - there is a fairly substantial fee for the kids as well as the adults to enter to supervise. It was too much for us but may be worth it for some families - we played in the grassy areas instead!
Just beautiful. A very beautiful place. Walk through the park, sit down with some of the little coffee shops. And enjoy a glass of vine or a cup of coffee, and take in the view.

My Favorite Garden in Paris. This is my favorite garden in Paris. When I was studying here I would grab lunch and walk to the garden just to sit, eat, and watch the people pass by. I remember children would play with boats in the fountains and you could watch older men playing chess. It is just a very tranquil and personal place to me. I recommend having a picnic or an afternoon stroll here.
Fun on a sunny Sunday. Nice to see families out with small children, and watching the toy boats on the pond. Nice to be there as the trees were just leafing out. Bring a picnic!

Beautiful large space in middle of Paris. We went on a sunny day in March in between cloudy, wet days - it was such a treat! Grounds are very well kept, flowers were starting to bloom, visitors were strolling or sitting on chairs and benches - everyone enjoying the warmth of the sun. A great place to relax and take a break from crowded touristy spots.
Beautiful Garden in the heart of the City. We have visited the gardens a couple of times and have really enjoyed it. The garden is relaxing and beautiful with lots to explore.

Lovely Place to Relax on a Nice Day. Our trip was during the rainy season but the one day of sunshine we visited Luxembourg Gardens which was only a 5 minute walk from our hotel. I imagine later in April/May, the gardens would be more beautiful as flowers were just starting to bloom. Should you decide just to take a peak, 30 minutes would be plenty. If you would like to relax in one of the many chairs or benches, or even have a picnic, this would be a delightful spot!
Beautiful garden.... Great for a short stroll... Small beautiful garden with a far away view of the Eiffel towel. There is an photo exhibit going on and some of the pictures/photos are stunning.

Go on a Sunday with the rest of Paris. The busiest park I have seen. So many Parisians out enjoying a sunny Sunday. A band was playing in the bandstand. Small boats being sailed on the late. Lots for kids to do with pony rides, swings and a park.
An oas in Paris. embourg Gardens is a very nice oas in Paris - quiet and peaceful. Sit down and enjoy the flowers and trees and people walking around.
Nice place to relax. We walked a lot today and the Gardens was a nice place to relax and have some snacks. It is peaceful and well kept. We even tossed around the frisbee a bit too!
Beautiful but busy.. Don't expect a nice quiet quaint park. This park is bustling with people. It makes for a pretty cool time. Seating everywhere for lounging by the pond.
beautiful. Was an amazing day. The sun was shinning and the colours of the flowers where just beautiful. Bought a brioche from a nearby café and just sat by the fountain to enjoy it. Do visit it.

Stunning gardens. These gardens are just stunning. Walk or run around the track, have a game of tennis or just sit back relax and enjoy people watching or lazing in the sun.Grab a baguette from 'The Parisienne ' bakery just 2 blocks away ( they won baguette of the year 2016 ) and enjoy. The cafe at the gardens serves amazing cakes and the hot chocolate is to die for.This stunning park gives you the time to reflect on how beautiful this city is.
Classic garden. A classic garden that is so beautiful to enjoy a walk. We oftenly come here with my friends to chill out when I am in Paris.

A Family Place to Be. On our very first trip to Paris, we knew one of our destination points would be Luxembourg gardens. We knew it was very early spring, but that wasn't stopping a good crowd from enjoying all this beautiful place has to offer. We saw many families enjoying the grounds, strolling, kids running and playing. We especially liked the little lake area where the kids can set sail small boats and watch them float across the water. There was a wedding going on and what appeared to be college age kids in large groups who appeared to be studying the gardens for a class project. As I said. It was a bit early for the flowers and shrubs to be in bloom but that did not deter our excitement of discovering this lovely place.
The Central Park of Paris . Beautiful gardens, with lots of hidden statutes around.. perfect for a romantic picnic or a family lunch out.. or even a jog. It's the Central Park of PARIS! Loved it !

Magical- rain or shine. This is a special place for many people- my story is that I had the pleasaure of enjoying it one afternoon with my Mom. She has since passed and still every time I visit I think of that afternoon-she's been gone now for nearly 15 years and the statue that we took our picture in front of is still there. Go and expeirence it and start your own memories.
The most beautiful gardens in Paris. Amy and i had a wonderful walk in this garden around the 5th district! Watch out closing hours! not to miss!

Relaxed time. This place was 5 min away from our hotel. The gardens are well maintained and while we were there there was live band playing irish and scottish music . The energy of the place was quite lively with people dancing and music.

To do when the weather is nice. Lovely garden visited by tourists and parisians... You can walk around the park sit in a chair enjoy the people watching... Just a very parisian way to spend a sunny afternoon...

Delightful . Paris in spring - delightful. Trees just starting to come into leaf, freshly planted borders with yellow primroses, daffodils and forget-me-nots. A beautiful escape from the busy streets?
gorgeous. One of many great places to take pictures in Paris. Also a great place to relax and enjoy a sunny day in Paris and watch local Parisian life.

Beautiful and tranquil. Can't believe it took a 3rd visit to Paris before we visited here. Don't miss it as the statues and art has to be seen and the birds bathing in puddles are so cute. It must be stunning in the Summer. Little kiosks for drinks. Beautiful old carousel in park. Great to see people playing games together.

Paris in the springtime & its free!. We enjoyed a nice walk in the warm sunshine in these beautifully kept gardens and also a nice lunch in the cafe. A great place on a Monday when so much else is closed.

Don't miss this quiet but beautiful garden in the Luxembourg Quarter !!. No crowds, no tourist buses just quiet beauty and peace of this wonderful garden. Locals use the garden to sun, have lunch and jog around the gravel paths. The Medici's fountain is incredibly beautiful and covered in shade making it a cool place to take a break . Bring a good book, lunch or just take pictures its a step back in time to a quieter life. Entrance to gardens is free and the annuals change with the seasons . If you walk farther into the garden you will find a Museum and a an Angelina location smaller and without the wait of the one on Rue De Rivioli .Metro stops in front of the garden.
Awesome place. It is an amazing place with gardens flowers and the view and the quiet is relaxingIt seems you want to spend the all day in this placeBeatiful pictures, landscape and silenceI love it

Lovely garden. We liked this garden a lot! It was such a romantic place :) Although a lot smaller in the size, we thought it was so much better than the Tuilerie. It's cozier with more wooded area! Visit on weekday so it's not crowded and you can really enjoy it.

A paradise in the city of lights. It is the green lung of the Paris metropolis. A well maintained garden with the beautiful Luxembourg palace in the background, currently home to the French senate. The garden is open from 8 AM in winters and 7 AM in summers and there is no entry fee. It is easily approachable on foot, by metro through its four gates in four directions. It also has an Italian style Medici fountain, a large pond with rental boats for kids. The garden is a place to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life for a quite picnic with family and friends.

Not for Tourists. I was disappointed, maybe because it was early in the season? No flowers in bloom and not a lot of things to do as a tourist. But I did see a lot of locals enjoying the gardens, hanging out or having a picnic.
beautiful and relaxing even in March. The gardens were relaxing. No real activity as it was a cool day in March. Still lovely even though a little chilly. Great for exercise.
Pleasant Garden. If you are near to Pantheon, go to Luxembourg Gardens to relax bit, enjoy fresh air in center Paris and see all those persons running.

Very average garden. The gardens may look prettier in the summer months. We visited at the beginning of April and found it to be quite an average experience. When compared to gardens such as Kirstenbosch in Cape Town, it doesn't compare. It was however a lovely place to take a stroll and have a break from the busy Parisian life.

Beautiful and Relaxing. The park is beautiful, even when the trees and flowers are not yet in full bloom. It is very relaxing to sit near the chateau and enjoy the surroundings. Ideally, if the weather cooperates, I highly recommend bringing a picnic lunch to spend extra time in this relaxing setting in the middle of a busy city.

Chill out from the nearby city centre. A great spot to soak up the local atmosphere and enjoy a chilled and relaxing break away from the busy city centre. Impressive palace and grounds to enjoy. The statues around the gardens are worth exploring for a sample of France's histoy.

Super nice facilities in middle of Paris. It has been a true pleasure to be every day for a few hours at Luxembourg Gardens. Cool play area for the kids (entry fee was 2.50 €/child & 1.30 €/adult), endless opportunities to have a nice walk and super for our early morning jogging! The palace which accommodates the French Senate is beautiful and so was our experience with the fellow-guests visiting the park. A "must" for families visiting Paris!

Pleasant park. A city centre park which is well worth visiting for a quiet break if you are in the area. Somewhere to stroll in green surroundings watching people enjoying the plants, flower and fresh air and children having fun. It is not a garden of great horticultural excellence but is good of its kind.
French style garden. A beautiful French style garden with flowers and trees all around. You can see people walking and running everywhere.

Breathtaking. One of the very beautiful spots in Paris. Huge gardens with spaces for all sorts of activities and some very nice scenery. The gardens are breathtaking and make you feel fresh any time of the year. A spot to be visited any time you are in Paris.

A perfect Parisian afternoon. The entire garden is perfect for enjoying the sun, nature, and people watching. The walk leading up to it is just as majestic especially if you're coming from the Montparnasse area/ 14 arrondissement. Luxembourg gardens is one of those great Parisian attractions that won't cost you a penny to walk in yet there's a ton of riches to be observed and appreciate. Grab a coffee and a croissant or pastry of your choice and enjoy any time of the day. This place is perfect for reading, walking, picture taking, connecting with friends, and most importantly: people watching.

Nice escape from the hustle and bustle. This is a nice retreat inside the city. Pack a picnic and enjoy the gardens and fountains inside this historical park. Plan for about two hours as it is not very big but offers a nice relaxing atmosphere with beautiful surroundings.

Avoiding the raindrops to view the gardens. Not quite spring yet, so the flowers haven't really bloomed, but still a nice visit to stroll the gardens and view the Medici Palace from outside. Heavily guarded.

Gardens and CHill. Such a perfect place for a picnic in the summer time. Flowers blooming and people walking around. If you like people watching this is the place for you. Pull up a chair and sit for hours and tan!

Nice park to relax. A nice place to take a break from the city.
There are many benches and chairs to have a rest and enjoy the weather.
As well a good place to see some locals playing boules

A nice walk in the park!. The Jardins de Luxembourg was on my list of destinations and it certainly didn't disappoint. The spring weather was perfect for a couples walk through the gardens, watching the children sail their little boats in the fountain. The Eiffel Tower can be seen in the background, making it a beautiful photo op.

Wow!!!!. Wow. What a park. The gardens itself and house are stunning, for us as a family though looking for the children's park all i can say is wow, such a perfect play park, yes you pay a €2 entrance fee but its so worth it, completely stunning lots to do and my boys loved it The gardens are stunning to walk around!

Peaceful retreat. A pleasant and relaxing green space off the busy area just north of the Pantheon. Ignore the machine gun toting soldiers guarding the senate building toward the east side of the gardens. Seems to be popular among runners, but it would seem to require many laps to generate any significant distance.
Beautiful. What a lovely green space in the middle of a bustling city. A great place to rest and do some people watching! Even this early in spring the flowers are showing their beautiful colors.
Nice spot to relax. Not many flowers in early Spring, but plenty of seats to relax and watch the world go by. Enjoyed the Arctic photography exhibition along the rails of the gardens
Favourite part of Paris. We landed up visiting the Luxembourg twice on our trip to Paris, as our daughter loved the park so much. Worth a visit, one of the most beautiful parks in Europe,

A romantic walk in the park. I love this part of town. I wish I had been there a mid more in the Spring as the trees would not be so naked. But it still is an awesome place for a walk, to sit down and relax, people watch or a small picnic in the afternoon (if the weather permits).

lovely place to chill. Busy bustling gardens on a glorious October Sunday afternoon. Hired bikes to get here after cycling around the cith centre. Lots to see and do with pony rides , tennis and animations for children and coffee, sun and beautiful gardens to admire for adults

An interesting spot. It is a park. There were a considerable number of people there on a beautiful spring day. There is definitely an old world romantic charm where you can easily picture women with parasols walking along.
Very friendly, family oriented atmosphere.

Undergoing renovations. The gardens are undergoing rather extensive renovations. I was surprised in late March there were no flowers planted in the garden whatsoever. It was sunny, but cool and there were a fair number of people enjoying themselves outside.
Not many flowers in April. Nice park with statues, fountain and pool. Some flowers, but not very many in early April. I enjoyed it more when we were visiting in July

The most beautiful XVII th century garden in Paris. Living in front of this beaitiful garden, I have walked across it every single day since I was born ! I love it !It was designed in the XVII th century by Queen Marie de Médicis, wife of our king Henri IV.The French garden is situated in front the palace, now the Senate. A magnificent English garden is all around the French garden.The numertous gardeners change the flowers all the time to keep them always very fresh. Situated in the Latin Quarter it is the garden of students? A very romantic garden.
Great place to escape some of the bustle. We grabbed a picnic , sat in the sun and people watched for half an hour. On a good day a nice place to watch the world go by.
Grab some wine, bread, and cheese!. Grab some wine, bread, and cheese and head to the Luxembourg Gardens! That is what we did. It is beautiful!

April 2015. I spent a morning walking. Along river and in and out of streets in the ST Germaine neighbourhood. Strolled up hill crossed a busy street and entered this park. Always so beautiful.
