I purchased a coffee and sandwich from stand on the right hand corner.I found a chair in front of the famous pond. I sat for an hour or so watching natives who greet and meet at the park and stroll off to next destination along with tourists in a hurry to snap a photo to hurry on and visitors who enjoy the day The flowers are lovely here but the great sense of history brings a sense of joy in the time.less city while savoring the peace of a beautiful park I took s stroll down a path that meandered through the famous chestnut trees Do this it is wonderful

Wonderful Respite For A Busy Day. The Gardens are beautiful in and of themselves. What makes this more special is the eclectic mix of people enjoying time out from their respective 'day jobs'. Families with children, well dressed business people, tourists and a mix of locals all relax at the fountain, on the lawn or recline on the numerous benches in order to find time to enjoy life as it exists in the moment. For we harried Amerricans, this provides a fine example of how the pace of life can be moderated.

One of the most beautiful in Paris. A beautiful area that contains a pretty large variety of trees and flowers.
We spent more than an hour just walking around and sitting back on the chairs beside the fountain (which is stunning as well).
Great grounds. The garden was behind our Hotel and a great walk! We were there in March and the flowers/plants were not yet in bloom but Im sure when they are it is a beautiful sight.

Absolutely Gorgeous. Luxembourg Gardens is a must see in Paris. It is so beautiful and relaxing. Lively, without being crowded at all. Many people enjoying the gardens, running, sitting, visiting. I absolutely loved seeing these lovely gardens in the middle of a crowded city!!

Beautiful, worth a visit!. The gardens were truly beautiful.It was wonderful to visit such a well kept area which was secure and free of charge. There was a post area and you could hire small toy boats for the children at a very small charge which was a nice touch!There was a child's park and pony rides(quite smelly, but looked well kept)The coffee rooms were overpriced but I guess this has to be expected.Would be wonderful in the sunshine!
Jardins du Luxembourg. One of my favorite places in Paris. Bring a baguette, some cheese, and a bottle of wine. Sit on the park bench and enjoy the scenery and do a little people-watching.

Beautiful even not in bloom.. Tranquil, big, with fountains and impressive statues. Even not in bloom it's a nice oasis in the middle of claustrophobic and ever loud Paris. I'd recommend it more in spring though.

My favourite place in Paris. A wonderful place to relax with a good book in one of the many chairs in the shade of the trees. This time it was a bit to chilly to do that, but we got to see some sailing with model sailing boats in the pond. It was very nice to see the same happy faces on both children and grown-ups. :-)

Great place to relax on a sunny day. Very pleasant place in the heart of Paris. You can have a walk, read a book, go jogging, have a picnic... There are chairs available that you can put anywhere, there are also gazebos in case it's raining. Make sure you find the Statue of Liberty :-)

Beautiful place to spend an afternoon with children . The weather wasn't the best to spend the afternoon there,but the place was so beautiful and there were so many activities for children that we stayed until 7 pm. My daughter could ride a donkey around an area of the park and ride a spinning wheel. I was surprised because you had to pay if you wanted to use an open air playground.

Fab day in a fab garden. these gardens are simply amazing - we spent an hour just walking around them and sitting back on the chairs beside the little lake - what a way to spend time on Easter Sunday!

The French Senate and the Pantheon are its immediate neighbours. An Oasis of tranquility and beauty in the heart of Paris. A beautiful Park that you can explore in 30mns, a lot of interesting discoveries, from statues to special orchard. Tennis courts, fountain, beautiful gardens with a large variety of trees and flowers. Good place for jogging if you live or are staying nearby.

Wonderful in the spring time. Spring the flowers are all in bloom. This is a park where the kids run and play. Pony rides are offered and there are tennis courts and a big fountain to sit and just relax with a coffee and a good book.

My favorite place to relax. We visited Paris for a few days in spring, and while there is a lot to do and see, this was my favorite place to hang out and soak it in. While other places like the Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel, and museums have a lot to like, they are so tourist-centric that it's hard to really enjoy them. Everywhere you look it's selfie sticks and boisterous crowds.At Luxembourg Gardens, sure, it's busy and there were some people taking photos, but by and large it seemed to be people just going to the park. We saw lots of teenagers hanging out, playing, holding hands, just being teenagers. Older men were playing bocce while friends cheered and jeered nearby. Children played and mothers walked around with strollers. It just felt like a slice of French life, and oh by the way the park is beautiful, with trees, flowers and statues scattered all around. My favorite area was the Beethoven bust, nestled in some striking trees.If you're staying in the Saint-Germain area and want somewhere to just relax and take it in, Luxembourg Gardens is a great place to do that.

Beautiful on a Sunny Day. This is a very large park that is quite beautiful. There is a pond in the middle where children can rent boats. There are many walkways that pass by large statues and trees and lots of green grass. Many people use this park so it can get busy but it is well work a trip. On line you can find walking tours that take you from Notre Dame through the Latin Quarter to the Luxembourg Gardens.

Love this Garden!. You feel like you are in a BABAR book when you see the little pond with the boats you can rent for only 5 Euros per 30 min. An adult can feel like a kid again! The gardens are beautiful. Right now they are doing maintenance to the Palace and there is a lot of security around but this does not hamper a visit to Luxemboug Garden. Bring a bagette for a pic nic lunch. Lots of chairs and places to sit.
Bon Jardin. This garden is near the senator office. You can walk around this garden and walk through to the Patheon.

Big playground. We walked from Notre Dame to the garden. We didn't enjoy the garden that much because it was cold, windy and a little wet. I can just imagine that it must be more enjoyable in the summer. The one thing that I really appreciated was the big playground. Our 3 year-old enjoyed it a lot. You have to pay around 2 euros per head to get in the playground but it was worth it for the kid.

The best place to relax in the middle of Paris. This garden is lovely and so calming that you can easily forget that you are in the middle of Paris. I loved taking a walk there , enjoying the lake in the center and watching the swans. If you have a spare hour you will not regret spending it there.
Nice. It's a very nice & peaceful garden in Paris & most importantly has an excellent cafe inside it that serves really tasty food

Breathtaking. We visited the gardens on the day that we arrived,they were within walking distance from our hotel,we had a sunny afternoon on a Saturday so there were alot of people walking and sitting on the benches taking in the beauty of the gardens

Wrong time of year but still nice . Our visit was a little cold and the trees had no leaves on in the park, but this didn't stop us from having a good time and enjoying our lunch outside. I imagine this would be even better in summer and hopefully we'll visit again when the sun is out!

Watch Parisians at leisure, take fabulous pics. We walked by on our way back after deciding the line at the Catacombs were too long. Our boys are 9 and 11.This is a stunning place for photographs, a wonderful place to picnic and watch the Parisians play.The gardens are gorgeous, and who can miss the subject of famous impressionaist paintings such as those by John Singer Sargent!?The boats are only 3.5 Euro for 30 minutes, inexpensive enough that you can run back and pay the man more since you won't be able to drag the kids away.We didn't plan ahead, just stumbled in, but had we known, we would have grabbed a bottle of wine to kick back while the kids played.

Paris at play. The gardens are filled with Parisians enjoying their lives. Watch the chess matches. Play tennis. Sail a time boat in the fountain. Amble along to the cafe and catch a concert. You'll feel like you are in a painting by Renoir.

Family time. Well laid out gardens, usually full of french families enjoying outdoor time. Recommended as a break from walking the streets of Paris. Go catch some sunshine and look at the flowers and the little sailboats in the pond.

Charming Place!. The Jardin du Luxembourg, or the Luxembourg Garden, located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, was created beginning in 1612 by Marie de' Medici, the widow of King Henry IV of France, for a new residence she constructed, the Luxembourg Palace. The garden today is owned by the French Senate, which meets in the Palace. It covers 23 hectares and is known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, the model sailboats on its circular basin, and for the picturesque Medici Fountain, built in 1620.
take a walk .. you are in Paris. very nice walk and relaxing place,, take a pause and lay down for a while.. it is beautiful at day .. not a night.

Great place to relax. We visited on a cool day before the trees were leafed out and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We want to visit again when the trees and gardens are in bloom. The Medici fountain was very restful.

Peaceful place. Very relaxing and peaceful environment. They have chairs where you can sit back and relax. A lot of historical monuments around it. Beautiful walk to the garden. We happen to pass by Latin Quaters which was a happy coincidence.

Rest, relax, play tennis.. Grab a green chair and chill. Beautiful grounds. It was still cold out and the trees were not budding yet but still a great place to sit on a sunny day and eat a pic-nic lunch of cheeses, bread and wine.
A bit small. Not that big. Huge palace in the garden, but not that impressive. Nice to have a picnic in though, but not anything like central park etc.

Secret Paris. Spend a few hours sitting and walking. Great location for a picnic! Full of locals. Beautiful in spring. Explore the gardens, the bee hives and ponds. Off the tourist trail but on the locals trail. Visit highly recommended!

A unique view of Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are not only full of beautiful plants and trees but also full of unique architecture and history. I´d definitelly recommend anyone to spend sometime having a picnic in these amazing gardens, you wont´regret it! In my opinion you should visit the Masoleum, get some snacks on the way to the gardens and just spend a couple hours lost in those amazing gardens. There are plenty of chairs to sit around!

Hang Out Here with the Locals. The Luxembourg Gardens are large and have many spaces to visit - the local Parisians love to hangout here during summer or you can sit under the trees in one of the iconic green chairs. My favourite corner is the Medici Fountain.

Oh Paris in the Spring!. When I think Paris in the Spring, I think of the Luxembourg Gardens. They are beautiful, but my favorite part of the gardens are the couples, young and old lounging on the grass thoroughly enjoying the sun and the beauty of the gardens. I highly recommend venturing to gardens and bringing a picnic.
nice gardens. it is a very nice tour. everybody who visit paris must go to these gardens enjoy fresh air and beautiful sight!
Luxembourg garden. Should be very beautiful during spring and summer time. Pure French garden with classical building (senate). A nice place after good lunch.

Lovely!. A walk in this wonderful gardens is always a great idea! I love this corner of Paris!! You will take plenty of pictures and relax before moving to the next attraction in Paris! Have fun! And enjoy the flowers :)

Not to be missed, especially the playground . Went towards end of day with boys age 7, 8 and 13. The playground in the back is our favorite place to relax after a full day of sightseeing.The playground is different than most US playgrounds and my kids could have stayed all day. There is a small fee to enter the playground, merry go round etcObviously the gardens are beautiful too, but my boys focus was on the play equipment.

A Beautiful Park. I went to explore the Luxembourg Gardens and had a lovely picnic in the park while families relaxes around me. A great spot for a mid afternoon break to rest your feet or to have lunch as there are plenty of shops nearby to grab food for a picnic.
Great wildlife photography exhibition . Arctic wildlife photography exhibition on the periphery fence is outstanding . Nice cafes opposite the main entrance are a great way to finish the visit
Huge Park. Great for a stroll on a nice sunny day. Beautiful grounds and lots of activities going on. See everyday life in Paris.
Still beautiful even in winter. Although the gardens were mostly bare, it is still an amazing place to see and spend some time just walking around

Relaxing and Beautiful Park. The Luxembourg garden is one of many beautiful breaks from tightly packed buildings in this old city. This one is slightly removed from many large tourist sites and therefore tends to be less busy than ones by the Louvre, etc. The old palace is now the senate house and can only be visited once per month. The gardens feature open grass, trees, flowering plants and water features.
Beautiful park . What a large, beautiful park. True Paris experience. Beautiful fountain, people relaxing, kids playing, just a relaxing place. Well worth the visit.

Luxembourg gardens and the fountain Medicis inspired all the famous writers. I went to walk into this garden recently and the words of a song of Joe Dassin came to my mind The Luxembourg Gardenlong ago that I had not comeThere are children running and falling leavesThere are students who dream they have finished their studiesAnd professors who dream they beginThere are lovers dating discreetlyAnd the red carpet rolled out in front of them by the fallWhere the child goes, I passedHe follows a little track I leftMy boats are still playing on the pondIf the years have diedMemories are doing well, Well there is something special in those gardens : The Medici fountainThe Medici fountain ... today people come to read in the shade, to dream or to kiss out of sight ... but our most illustrious ancestors such as Victor Hugo, Musset or Chopin were inspired.by this place. Located at the western end of the Luxembourg Gardens, the Medici fountain dressed with ivy curtains is one of the most romantic places in Paris! Do not miss the place if you are passing in the 6th district.Formerly called the cave of Luxembourg, the Medici fountain was commissioned in 1630 to Thomas Francine engineer Florentin by Marie de Medici, then widow of Henri IV. so tired of the intrigues of the Louvre palace and nostalgic of Italy, she wanted to feel the atmosphere of water lilies and fountains present in the Boboli Gardens in Florence.Often remodeled during its history, which was first a cave, will even be moved in 1861. Alphonse de Gisors then added a pool of water, 50 meters long, bordered by a row of sycamores that gives to the place its magical allure. The current sculpture, in my opinion one of the finest in Paris, is the work of Auguste Ottin; it is a representation of Polyphemus surprising the nymph Galatea in the arms of the shepherd Acis. God it's beautiful!

Tranquil respite.... Strolling about the grounds, Alleys and Sculptures--you are transported and relaxed immediately. Looking at the Palace, Gardens & Trees unwinds you---A wonderful place to retreat to break up mad sight seeing, shopping etc...One of the most lovely Places in Paris....

Beautiful atmosphere to relax in. Ease your aching soles from all the sightseeing and kick back on a chair or on the grass in the Luxembourg. The former royal palace now houses the French Senate. The gardens are very popular with tourists and students who come to read and flake out on sunny days. Gorgeous flowering plants, inspiring ponds with the occasional toy sailboat and the famous Medici fountain, built at the behest of the French queen who was a member of that illustrious Italian family.
Lovely walking and a relaxed atmosphere. Great on a sunny day as you can sit and relax. The pools are very poular and the fountains are cool.

Charming and Relaxing. I visited the Luxembourg Garden in the middle of winter and it was absolutely beautiful; I can only imagine how lovely it would be in the warmer months. I particularly enjoyed the Medici Fountain and various sculptures around the garden. It is a nice place to relax in the middle of the city and is definitely worth checking-out!

Hidden spots in the centre in Paris. I live in Paris and this is just my favorite park. It is just amazing to walk trough it and find hidden and beautiful spots such as statues, fountains and flower and fruit nurseries!

Even in the spring it is a beautiful walk. The gardeners were busy fluffing up the park. But we enjoyed sitting in the sun amongst the spring flowers. We were a little disappointed that the boats were not available...but there is always next time!

Great park, would like to see more . This park was close to our hotel but we didn't get here until we were almost due to fly so didn't really go too far but would love to explore more.
We got tied up sailing a little boat on the lake that we had hired for €3 - great way to spend our last half an hour in Paris!

Relaxation and Opulance. This is a great place to visit when in Paris featuring pre-revolution opulence of a 17th century palace and now senate building with lovely gardens to walk around and sit in the sun. You get a real feel as to how self absorbed the aristocracy were, but its nice to marvel at their legacy. Logistics: We came in via the Metro from the Rue de Fleurus side and found a number of nice cafe's and eateries in relatively quiet part of Paris. The Boulevard Saint-Michel side is good for a bit of shopping but is a lot more commercial where you get to pay more for less.

Tranquille. These gardens are so peaceful and enjoyable to stroll through. We sat down near the fountain and soaked up the ambience and traditional french feel. Take you time when you go and make sure you don't just walk through as quickly as possible.When we visited, the water in the fountain was frozen. This made a lovely and amusing photo since the birds seemed to walk on water!

It was raining. An incredible park, we took time out here to just walk in the misty rain. It was kind of stressful flying into Paris right after the attacks and nothing was open. We were here just thankful for the time together and a chance to see Paris and I thing this it what the parks all about. If you get the chance don`t miss it.

Goegeous place. Such a gorgeous place. Visited here on the first day of our visit and made sure to return on our way to the airport home. Great atmosphere with the boats in the fountain and local groups performing in the gazeebos. Features the original Statue of Liberty. Great experience. Loved it!

Best Playground Ever. My 4 and 6 year old loved the playground. The small sandbox, large rope climbing structure, swing pulley system, and large playset were the hits. I saw kids playing from ~10 year olds to babies.The ground is the sponge-like playground mats. It is fenced in, and there are plenty of benches (in and out of shade).Once paying, you can come and go all day. Bathrooms (without sinks) were available, but not awesome.

A little oasis - probably looks wonderful in the sunshine!. Pretty, lovely walk round with a variety of things to see. A nice spot in the busy city. There were some lovely free seating ideas - chairs with a lean to them, like a lounger, so you could relax in the sun. Chilly in March, but plenty were still getting the air and relaxing there. Also saw tennis courts being used - and a lovely bandstand (empty). I'd love to see in the summer

Beautiful and relaxing. We paid and got a sailboat to sail in the fountain and my daughter loved it! We ate lunch in a little outside cafe and found a pretty cool playground, although you have to pay 2.5 euro, it was a lovely garden, highly recommend for families!

A Lovely Oasis. The French know how to relax. From the moment you arrive at Luxembourg Gardens you can't help but envy Parisians relishing in the relaxation of a simple nap in a chair amidst the shrub-lined pathways or reading a book in the sunshine during lunch hour. It's a wonderful place to walk, to watch children with their remote-controlled boats in the pond, or to enjoy an oasis of calm.
Perfect place. Perfect and one of the most romantic places in the Capital. Better visit it in the late autumn with somebody who loves you.
Oh the Gardens and the Fountains!. Gorgeous gardens that you can admire as you walk around them. Then you can seat and have a picnic with a nice bottle of wine or champagne... or both <3
great place. We visited this place three times,its so beautiful place . A great experience to see all these amazing places in paris ,so much to visit .
"C'est magique". I used to go all the time while I was living in Paris, beautiful place to sit and read you favorite book.

Good place for respite. This is a good place for a bit of peace (even though it's busy!) in sight of the Palais de Luxembourg, if you're in the area. As a garden, I don't suggest a special trip. (We were there in March so it might be more colourful in Summer.)
Relaxing place. Beautifull gardens, perfect for sunny day. Everywhere you can find chairs, which you can set wherever you want. Perfect place to relax and break surrounded by greenery and art.

Beautiful Gardens. Went for a quick walk around the Luxembourg Gardens this afternoon. The area is beautiful and the Luxembourg Palace is a beautiful building. A very relaxing and peaceful part of Paris which is so close to the historic centre!
Nice. A nice beautiful garden in the heart of Paris. Seems like a local favourite due to many joggers around the clock.

Outstanding, she is beautiful.. It has everything you desire from an outside space. Places to relax and discuss the poetry you read at school many moons ago, or laze around on the grass cuddling and kissing your loved one (or two...these days even two seems a low number) :-)The Palace is stunning...her gardens are equally breathtaking...an absolute must.(Oh, and the quaint little cafe just as you enter the gardens is a good watering hole, plus it has clean public toilets...if you have drink etc in the cafe you get a token for the toilets which is then free, otherwise you have to pay).

A great place to walk or sit. This is a very nice place to visit in the busy and hectic city of Paris. It is Jewel to behold, with a full pallet of colors and plants. It can get crowded, but still you can find a place to just enjoy the sites. It is also a great place to photograph plants.

Beautiful, relaxing escape from bustling Paris. I thoroughly enjoyed spending an afternoon relaxing here, in between meals. The gardens are beautifully-maintained. Even though it was in Winter, the lawns were immaculate, and the bare trees added a sense of mystery. Crowds were low, so there were plenty of lazy chairs. I probably wouldn't go out of my way, but as I was staying nearby, I deviated through here twice on two long walks throughout Saint Germain.
Nothing much to see. Big park but pretty boring and nothing much to see or do. Lots of joggers and families around. Good for a simple chill out I suppose. Exorbitant charges to use the toilet!

A park at the heart of Paris. Beautiful spot at the heart of Paris, the gardens follow the seasons. Located right at the beating heart of the city, surrounded by the senate, the pantheon as well as most of the famous frnch universities. You want to have a walk through it, jog, work out or just rest under the fresh shadow of the trees or tan your skin by the pound.
Perfect for your tired feet!. After a long tiresome walk in the city, this is a relaxing place to grab a sandwich and reading your book.
Relaxing. It’s a great, beautiful walk. It was freezing when we went but still, we enjoyed walking around the gardens. It’s peaceful and sometimes it’s exactly what you need.

Just a normal park. May be I went in wrong season. I spent around 2 hours here. Just walked around. May be, Parisans do not have an open place where they can relax, read books, have Sun light etc. Apart from this, I was not impressed with this place. The trees are grown in a particular order.
Beautiful relaxing gardens. Went in March when the gardens were first blooming. Wonderful place to see the locals relaxing and taking in the sun. Children on break playing football around the pool.
Chilling spot in the city. Beutiful harden in the center of the city its a most go to see not just the nature but also the parisian customs of beig ouside and enjoying the city lovelly atmosphere
Beautiful greenspace. Beautiful greenspace in the heart of Paris. Plenty of space to relax and enjoy the beautiful flowers, trees and the quiet of an urban oasis.

Lovely gardens.... winter, spring, summer or fall. Stroll the lovely gardens, reminisce of times long past, have a picnic when the sun's out, or just enjoy the garden's beautiful architecture. The Luxembourg Garden, located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, was created beginning in 1612 by Marie de Medici, the widow of King Henry IV of France, for a new residence she constructed, the Luxembourg Palace. Today the garden is owned by the French Senate, which meets in the Palace. It covers 23 hectares and is known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, the model sailboats in its round basin, and for the picturesque Medici Fountain built in 1620.
Worth a visit to relax. It’s a nice park with lots of chairs and benches to sit on. I bet it must be nicer in summer time though.

A very nice place for a strol. At a central place, next to the metro station, it is a very nice to visit. Allot of people on the weekend, kids, families, tennis players, pony riding activities, little sail boat sailing, etc. It is certainly worth to spend 2-3 hours there.

Nice place look out for the runners. Me and my girlfriend stayed close to here so visited a couple of times. Its very nice to walk around but at the time it looks as though its being worked on so we did not see it in its full glory. Its very busy with the constant runners. Its very quiet.

Green area. Huge green area & lovely garden & fantastic architecture
Very good place for children
Very nice place for running
Very good place for set there
My best garden in Paris. alwasys clean and safe and the gardeners do a fantastic job... so highly recommend to all flower loversa;;; enjoy

one of best gardens for chill. we love this place you can take a seat get your wine and cheese and chill for hours with bird singing. I went there on march may be it could be too hot in summer don't sure
Bueatiful, Peaceful. A hidden gem of Paris in the 6th arrondissement. Plenty of cafes around in a university neighbourhood. A great place for a peaceful respite from the usual PAris tourist sites.

Lovely gardens, place to relax and do various activities. Gardens with walks embellished with statues, chairs by the fountains, bee hives and activities including poney rides , tennis, basketball, puppet shows and a good playground for children. Sometimes photography exhibits around the iron. two important buildings on the property: the senate and the Luxembourg museum that organizes important exhibits. Difference entrances: the main one off boulevard St Michel across from the Pantheon and lots of interesting things to visit in the neighboring 6 eme arrondissement

Worth a visit even in Winter. Stumbled across the Luxembourg Gardens by accident whilst on a stroll. I enjoyed it here a lot despite the cold - there are crepe places and cafes hidden away but easy to find. Great for killing time on the way to Saint Michelle.
Beautiful Park. See the Medici Fountain. Not well maintained or clean, but that's even part of its charm. If you run, there's plenty of good paths to do it.
Wonderful garden. A place to relax, to dream, to meet people. Those gardens in the heart of the city are as nice as the history of their creation.
Playground with my son. VERY cheap stamp to get in and valid ALL day to re-enter. And such a location always found other English speaking children to play with

Sunday stroll. As the beginning of Spring approaches and the sun begins to show its face, what a better way after brunch than to take a stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens. I used to bring my son here everyday when he was a baby ( 30 years ago ). I haven't been here for many years but it hasn't changed. What a peaceful pleasure!

a typical urban garden. The luxembourg gardens are located next to the French senate, also next to a museum of the same name. It is typical french public garden where score of French from the neighborhood frequent often with their children. It is a calm place in this crowded city. It is often represented in paintings and photographs. One feels better the heart of Paris as it was and is. A wonderful place to go and feel how parisians enjoy nature in a nice and sunny day.
Sunday stroll. A sunny March Sunday afternoon watching the Parisians at play is delightful. Great for kids, model sailboats and pony rides.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful gardens.Very tranquil walking around and having a good look.It would be a nice place to stop and have a picnic

Breathtaking!. I visited in the fall when the leaves were changing and it was just beautiful! The park was huge and very kid/pet friendly. Grass is open to run around on, the trees and plants are well manicured and its a great place to take some good pictures or go for a run. The building inside the gardens is very grand and the large pond out in front of it has chairs to sit around and kids can rent mini-boats to sail in the waters. Great place to relax and visit with friends.

Pretty. The gardens are lovely, very neoclassical, and free. Entrance to the Palace is separate. Grab a baguette, some cheese and a bottle of wine-lovely. Very clean and safe. Accessible by metro and hop on/off bus

Excellent place to spend a sunny day!. I visited Luxembourg gardens during the summer and really loved the place. It is huge and well maintained with lots tourists visiting especially during the spring/summer. You can take a nice stroll inside the park or indulge yourself into a novel.
Wait until spring to visit. The grounds are beautiful, but it's not a good visit in the winter or before spring. Time your visit well and enjoy lunch and a stroll like the locals.

my favorite garden in Paris. All the generations find what they are looking for in this magnificent garden situated between the Latin Quarter and Montparnasse. We meet students, artists but also children around the games and less young playing game of bowls. Hives, pond and its small boats, and a lot of other marvels without forgetting the magnificent flower beds.

A lush green expanse right in a spectacular part of town. As soon as the weather is pleasant, "Les Jardins de Luxmbourg" are soon overrun with Parisians and tourists alike seeking fresh air and relaxation. There's a wonderful sensation of space and intimacy combined.The large fountain is particularly attractive. If your hoping to grab a chair you had better turn up early though, depending on "la météo" as the French say.Yung children will be delighted with the old-worlde carousels (UK-merry-go-round), especially te one where riders attempt to catch dangling rings on a hand-held shaft with a vie to scoring a free ride.There's also a fenced-off play are for children, and pony riding as well. With lots of restaurant and fast-food possibilities immediately on the eastern border of the park, you can make a day of it with the young ones.

Voluptuous garden !. This is my best garden in Paris.Quiet, a good place to have a slow walk looking at all the beauty around (nature and monuments).Have a little break during Paris' visit, it is magical.

Véritables jardins à la française / True à la française gardens. Ce parc est très agréable, en plein Paris, au milieu d'artères très fréquentées de la Capitale, derrière le Sénat.Y aller au Printemps et en été est très très agréable, il y a beaucoup de zones pour s'asseoir, au soleil ou à l'ombre.This is a very pleasant park, in the middle of Paris, surrounded by busy roads, that you don't hear from the park, beside the Sénat.Go there during Spring et Summer is very pleasant, there are several zones where you can seat, under the sun or beneath shady treas.

My favorite garden in Paris. Fantastic and beautiful garden. A little like Loire Castle. For children very exciting games, poneys, boats. History and beautiful flowers. To be Parisian you must be there.

Please Go in the Spring - late Spring. diana-c.comA wedge of a very jardin a la francaise that blooms with the horse chestnuts in the spring and voila you are in Gigi or a Renoir painting. The Musee du Luxembourg once a private small palace hosts world class exhibits - like the Chagall expo 3 years ago, and is opposite the Odeon Theater. The Guignol dips deep into French puppet and street fair tradition - The puppet theater is a Lyon import and yes, it is still very popular. A very nice chichi snack bar offers limited refreshments and the lovers communing on the public benches are a treat for the eyes. Eternal Paris. A slice of la Belle Epoque.

Lovely park but probably lovelier in spring. We visited on a cold but sunny morning in late February. The park is peaceful and beautiful; well laid out with decent, wide paths. There were plenty of places to sit and reflect as joggers went past and ducks swam in the fountains. I was a bit disappointed by the lack of evergreen trees, as even though it was the end of winter, I didn't expect the park to be so bare and it was difficult to imagine how it would look for the rest of the year. I'd have liked more winter colour.
Wow. Verse lovely gardenIt's well recommended to buy food and wine and sit ther to eatVery good place for children Very nice place for running
Ver pretty. We visited in March 2016, just before most flowers and trees were out. The garden looked very nice with some beautiful primroses

A truly French park in Paris. Relax. Ambulate. Have a coffee. Cuddle and kiss.. We always visit on our trips to Paris. The highly manicured flower beds. The very well pruned trees. The statues. The classic surrounding buildings. The large pond with children sailing toy boats and their fathers giving them instructions. The couples walking arm in arm and cuddling on the benches. This is Paris. This is France.

It's just beautiful!. Definitely worth at least a walk by...
We stopped there for a coffee and to enjoy the afternoon sunshine.

Beautiful Park. In the Latin Quarter, a short walk south of Notre Dame. It is a beautiful park with many people relaxing and enjoying Paris. Not a must-see in terms of Paris landmarks, but a good break from walking and museums and landmarks

Busy delightful garden. We happened upon the Luxembourg Gardens a couple of times as we wandered round Paris. It was bustling with people getting on with their own pastimes. Some people were playing chess (some with spectators), others tennis, football, basketball and pétanque. Everyone just having a great time.

Beautiful and fun. The gardens are beautiful, but the playground in the middle is amazing. My children are still talking about it. Zip lines, and other fun activities, plus pony rides, a carousel, puppet shows. A wonderful place to spend the day with children in Paris.
Beautiful park. Such a lovely park this is. In the middle there is a pond/fountain where kids can sail boats (rented, €3.5 for 30 minutes) and there are plenty of sport activities for kids.

Oasis. Huge stunning gardens with a large lake and plenty of garden benches. There is also a cafe near the entrance and the palace is also in the grounds. A perfect place for a summer picnic to relax for an hour, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Beautiful location for a walk on a nice day. The Luxembourg gardens are very conveniently located near Paris St Germain. A nice way to spend a spring morning in Paris.

Nice green area in Paris. It's a nice garden inside Paris
There are a lot of joggers in the morning
Good view on the Senat
There are a lot of chairs and bench to just rest and or read
Beautiful place. This a beautiful place to visit and very easy to get to. During the off season it's not necessarily that green though.

The great gardens of Luxembourg. One of our favorite parts of the city is the Luxembourg Gardens. You feel the soul of Paris expressed here as much as anywhere in the city. It is wonderful in the spring and probably best in September. For us, a trip to Paris is not complete until we have visited the gardens.
Pretty gardens, right in the center. Very beautiful gardens, right in the city center. A great place to relax after a busy day of site seeing.

Beautiful. What a beautiful garden, the fountains the chairs around were you can just sit and see the world pass in front of you, I would said that if you are staying in the area around The Eiffel, this would be the best romantic place to experience the Paris that you see at the movies.
Lovely. Great place to stop at the afternoon, walk through it and maybe sit to read a book. Beautiful heart in Paris

My absolute favourite place in Paris!. I mean literally, my absolute favourite place! The location is beautiful, the flowers stunning, the palm trees surprised and delighted me. The sound of the fountain splashing, the kids playing with the little rented sailboats, the gravel crunching underfoot... utter peaceful bliss! I actually took a video during my 2015 visit (I was also here in 2012), just so I can watch it over and over to recapture the feeling of being there. Beautiful in both spring and fall, and always bustling with people enjoying the beautiful Parisian oasis.
dream garden. Beautiful and dream location.Luxembourg Gardens are located in a beautiful and dreamy. Beautiful nature and its beauty attracted the eye of visitors.

Most beautiful park! . I love this park! It's so beautiful on a warm summer day. It's completely non touristy and there is a lovely cafe in the corner. My husband and I would get coffees and just sit and people watch people that sit in parks are very special people. The people we saw in the parks we're having conversations, reading papers and books. Completely not like the people you see sitting in the cafés texting and not talking to each other.

Like a True Parisian. One of the most surprisingly stunning gardens I have ever seen. We had half a day to kill, so we picked up some cheese, wine and bread at a local market and walked through the gardens. We parked it on the grass in a less crowded area and just people watched for hours. It was probably my favorite "activity" on our trip. It was relaxing, romantic and I felt "truly Parisian". The gardens are kept in immaculate shape. You could wander and get lost here if you really wanted to. It's my "must see" to all of my Paris visitors.

Huge park for joggers and walkers.. Since we were here in March, there isn't a whole lot to see but the all the trees are cross-hatch planted, which means that no matter which angle you look at them they are in rows. I wonder why there is so much dirt areas and not much grass areas? The large historic building in the park had a fence totally surrounding it, being renovated? All rest rooms in the park are .5 euro to use in case you are wondering.
so great!. It was wonderful to walk here, even on a cold, windy day. A special treat was seeing children/parents renting small sailboats to sail in the fountain.

Beautiful, and less popular than Les Tuileries Jardin. Luxembourg Gardens are beautifully landscaped and well maintained, complementing the palace. They are a popular destination for families, tourists, artists and lovers. It's like stepping into a parallel universe, in slow motion. Very peaceful and tranquil. I always visit here when I'm in Paris.

Beautiful Place. The gardens are beautiful, great for a nice walk in the park. The gardens are well looked after with amazing views and statues throughout the gardens. There is also tennis court, children's play area and cafeWe were very busy while in Paris trying to fit everything in, in a short space of time, the Luxembourg gardens was a well deserved break the gardens are so relaxing and peaceful.
Beautiful in any weather. It was a beautiful garden filled with lot's of interesting sights, we went there when it was a little colder but it was sunny and amazing.
Beautiful. I love Luxembourg Gardens, even in depths of Winter this garden is beautiful as only Parisian Gardens can be.
Beautyful. Had the plesure of coming across this place by mistake so glad we did . The gardens are amazing so worth a visit

Nice walk and who knows what you will find. Its a lovely little park for a nice walk/picnic. There is also quite a few random activities going on. Last couple times I've been there were no beggars that seem to permeate paris and places like the Jardin des tuilleries. Not sure what the situation is now.

Luxembourg Gardens, Paris. This is a fantastic place to have a wander around the magnificent gardens, terraces and boating pond. Lots of chairs to sit and enjoy the sunshine, or just watch the world go by.
Nothing to see during Winter. We were in Paris this February 2016. The garden is empty. Typical winter scene. Might as well went in another place. But I may visit again during spring perhaps?

A super peaceful heaven in the middle of the busy city. Great place to get away from the city, enjoy a well maintained garden with beautiful views. I went in Autumn (fall) and I believe it made it even more beautiful with all the colors and the amazing weather.

A slice of Parisian life. The Jardins de Luxembourg are one of my top favorite spots in Paris. The people watching is unparalleled - you can see locals, tourists, families, lovers, older folks, small children, etc. During our week in Paris, we grabbed sandwiches or pastries several times and just picnicked while watching the world go by. It was extremely relaxing and fun at the same time!If you have children, go when the little sail boats are out at the pond in front of the palace - they love it!

Just simply beautiful. This is a location that there's nothing that can best describe what we can see. It is just simply amazing and beautiful and worth going. We didn't aim at going, it was just on the to do list but we got lost and found it.

A Wonderful Outing Any Day.. By rain, hail, sun or snow, this garden is just bliss. You can always find a quiet spot to ponder, or people watch, or bird-watch, or just sit quietly doing blissfully nothing.

Great place to relax. There are wonderful deMedici statues and gardens and benches to just and watch people or read or doze off. Jog if you'd like. It's an easy walk to both left bank sites and montmarte.

Peaceful gardens. In the middle of busy Paris an oasis of calm and peace. Close to L'Odeon, Opera and an easy reach to the Bon Marché.
Great for recharging one' s batteries before plunging back into the crowds.

Eden in the 6th Arrondissement. The Luxembourg Gardens help make the 6th Arrondissement my favorite quarter of Paris. Here, after strolling along Boulevard St. Germain and exploring the backstreets of the wonderful Left Bank, the traveler is transported to a floral paradise. We've visited twice and seen wildly differing flower beds, as they rotate often.
A beautiful garden to relax. This garden is stunning, we stopped over just briefly and relaxed on a bench. Ended up staying an hour admiring the views and enjoying the ambience.

Perfect family outing. The Location: Metro #4 & 10, Exit : Odeon. About 10 minutes walk to the garden. The Admission: FREE!Perfect family outing place~ the garden is huge!!! There is a big pond surrounded with chairs. Perfect spot to relax and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere in the park. There are many beautiful statues in the park. Lots of greens. Totally kids paradise to run around the park.

Much closer than Versailles, beautiful and serene.. this reminded me of Central Park. Lots of couples & families. Beautiful and very relaxing. We were there in Winter but there were still flowers blooming.

A break from the tourists. Even though, I'm a ..tourist. We enjoyed a quiet rainy day in the gardens away from the crowds. The restaurants in the area appear to be full of the locals too. A nice change.
Nice place to visit with family. Great place to visit with children.. wonderful garden with lot of flowers and maple trees.. many activity options for the kids..

Relaxing and Beautiful. A beautiful park for a nice stroll or to just sit and relax after a busy day of shopping. The fountain and the garden is so lovely to look at it. Definitely worth a visit in between your busy days.
Great on a sunny day. Take a picnic and enjoy the sun! Not too touristy and beautiful gardens change often. Not worth an out of the way trip if you don't have much time though.
Fantastic park. Vast gardens, beautifully maintained. You can stroll for hours, and yet it won't be enough. Or you can just sit and enjoy the sun and the environment.

Beautiful Gardens!!!. We took a bus city tour and jumped on and off the bus where we wanted. We selected this garden and spent hours looking at the layout and design, the beautiful flowers and enjoyed relaxing while others were enjoying the beauty.
Beautiful Garden. Beautiful Garden to visit to relax. Take a break from museum visits, and get a cozy spot to sit and relax.
Watch locals and tourists alike.. Take a croissant and a bottle of wine with you as this place is asking for a picnic as soon as you get there.
Heaven in the city. Lots of locals were chilling in this lovely garden. The atmosphere is so relaxing. Recommended to take a short visit when you feel tired after shopping.

Beautiful park. This is one of my very favourite places to soak in a bit of peace in the hustle and bustle of Paris. It is beautiful, big park where you can meet locals practicing tai-chi or playing tennis, small children playing in the playgrounds or runners. You can sit in one of the many chairs available and read your book, drink coffee or wine and just enjoy the life.

Beauty in The City. My wife and i were lucky enough to have an apartment across from the part. We would walk their almost every day. In the center is a beautiful lake were the children could sail little boats. Seats are everywhere, so it was wonderful to just sit and soak up the sun.The park also has one of only three Statues of liberty. The main one being in New York Harbor and the last on Ile aux Cygnes in the Seine.
favourite garden of all. This is my favourite garden in Paris, it is huge and good for a walk and chill. I spent a few days sitting on one of the chair and enjoyed people watching.

Pretty gardens. It was freezing when we walked through the gardens in a bit of a rush - but would love to return in the Spring or the Summer. Really well kept, a nice vibrant feel with locals walking dogs, running etc. Lovely view of the palace.

Quintessential Paris. Was so glad we strolled through the Gardens during our week in Paris. In spite of it being February, the gardens were beautiful and full of Parisians enjoying the brisk morning. A must-do during your visit.
Picturesque Gardens . So pretty, fantastic for a stroll around looking about its landscape. Plenty of seats and benches to sit and take in the views. A must see if visiting Paris.

one of the most beautiful parks of paris. the every-day-flowered jardins du luxembourg are one of the most beautiful and relaxing spots of paris. great place for sitting and relaxing, picnics, to lie under the sun, walking around, reading.
spolights: a hidden statue of delacroix, in the middle of the garden and the fointain of the medici, next to the huge building of the senate.

Lovely open space. A really pleasant place to go on a lazy Sunday morning. A brisk walk to get an appetite. Remote control boats to hire €3.50 per half an hour . Cafe to get hot drinks as it was icy cold today. Plenty of chairs to move around and arrange as you like. I am sure the bank stand attracts a lot of visitors in the summer .

Nature in Paris heart. All year long there is a good reason to go to Luxembourg gardens. Love the small boats competitions in the bassin. Choose what you prefer:enjoying the sun or doing some running.
Beautiful sculptured gardens. A lovely and relaxed part of Paris, would have loved to see it in the summer but I think it is worth a visit.
Nice visit. Lovely visit, gardens are quite peaceful place to walk, enjoy the views, have a rest in the middle of your day

Refreshing sunny day in the garden. On the late afternoon early evening of our last day in Paris we took in some crepes and lunch and then wandered over to the Luxembourg palace garden grounds were we found people and children out enjoying the sunshine and various activities in and around the garden. We walked for a bit, took a few photos and then we found the perfect spot with two metal lounge chairs to sit, relax, people watch and unwind while soaking up the sunshine and vitamin D. We just sat there for over an hour enjoying it all. A great place to get away from the large crowds to just relax.

Beautiful!. Beautiful gardens with a lake inside of it. It is a nice place for taking pictures or just have a walk or make some footing. There are some metal chairs for sitting next to the lake. A good place for summer.

Wonderful spot to stop and take in all of Paris. THis garden is wonderful, my favorite part is the RC sailboats that are often seen in the garden pools. This garden is near the Latin Quarter, the Pantheon, and so many great shops and cafes. When your feet get tired (and they will), this is a great spot to relax, have a drink, and watch Paris.

one of the most beautiful parks we have ever been. We came here because i realy love parks and nature at all,it was my wish to see this beautiful park.As far as I could see, the park is very popular,it is always crowded,but it is not a problem because it is spacious park.It stretches over 25 hectares,woof:)cheerful voices of people and children,a lot of things to interest for all.Octagonal lake,we liked it very much.We spent some time relaxing on chairs arranged around the lake.Sculptures and gardens in the French geometric style are fascinating.Fountain Medici is the most valuable work of art in the park,really nice to see.I was delighted with the big vastness of greenery and flowers,the sound of water, birds, happy people.You have the feeling that all are smiling,charging you with positive energy.For children is wonderful too, have the freedom of movement,has a children's playground, tennis courts, a puppet theater..Of course, cafes with gardens,but for us it was not necessary.We had a wonderful time here.Park closes at 9, so we were sad we had to leave, although it was still largely a day,late getting dark:)
Beautiful and serene. Very beautiful gardens, perfect to relax (or run! It's a great spot for that as well). Also great to take the kids to for a walk.
Pretty place to rest. Enjoyed walking around the perimeter of the gardens, sat in the chairs to people watch and rest by the middle pond.
Well worth a visit / stroll. Historical gardens, the subject of many paintings back to the expressionist era. Beautiful fountain(s), with sailboats for rent!
Best of the Paris Gardens. This was a lovely space and beautifully maintained. Felt much more welcoming than the Tuileries or Jardin des Plantes

classic french garden. Located in the heart of the left bank of Paris is the free Luxembourg Gardens in the Latin Quarter. The whole park is in the classic French style - symmetrical, orderly and uniform. It's particularly beautiful and lively in the summer time where children play with small rented wooden boats in the central fountain. Great for enjoying your takeaway lunch.

Beautiful gardens. Very beautiful gardens although in February the flowers and trees werent at their best. For sure wourth a visit or just a picnic in a nice day,or just for a relaxing walk.plenty of people joking, having a picnic or just drinking coffee

In a sunny day, it's a perfect plan. You can enjoy a sunny weather day in a such big garden, some areas are nice and quite with a a lot of roses around,small lake and many other nice views and areas inside it

A site to see with only a little time required. Stopped into see the Luxembourg Gardens in the afternoon on a winter day. It is a beautiful site with manicured gardens abound. Given it was winter the flora was certainly not in its best shape. Worth checking out in summer for sure. Then again the tourist factor would be a consideration.

Lots of work being done, so not as pleasant as usual. There was construction everywhere, and even one of the two playgrounds was closed, so it was more dismal than usual. I hate having to pay for the bathrooms (50 euro cent), but they were cleaner than your average public bathrooms.
Beautiful. Beautiful even in winter. Incredible in spring or summer. Some areas were blocked off due to France still under state of emergency.

Very pretty, even in March. This was a lovely little treat, recommended by our host. The garden looked lovely, even though it was really early in the year. We watched people playing bowls and enjoyed the lush plants and trees on a short walk round. Wonderful

Wonderful Even In Winter. To visit Luxembourg Gardens in spring or summer is one of the main reasons we will return to Paris. Even in Winter is was a peaceful beautiful place to walk; around the lake were planted beautiful yellow flowers.  We walked through the gardens on the way to and return from Notre Dame Cathedral and all of the great places to visit near the area. It was a great short cut to our hotel. Paris has some beautiful parks but Luxembourg is unique. It is beautiful and austere in winter, but you can picture in your mind what it must be like it the spring and summer.
Strolling. The Luxembourg Gardens are one the most peaceful enjoyable places to still in Paris. No trip to Paris would be complete with a visit.
Peaceful and Serene. Beautiful gardens and park. It is a public park so there is no charge. Great place to relax between museums and other site. A must see.... Sculptures, fountains, amazing gardens.

Quiet and comfortable. I am not a big fan of parks, and honestly this one was not on my list. But when I was walking by it, I just couldn't resist spending some time there.The park was full of individual chairs, so I picked one next to the fountain and started reading a book.Right in front of me there was a lawn, and the park staff was busy planting some flowers.They were so engaged that I almost asked them to let me join them! And I was not the only one. There were some families with children and the gardeners allowed them to plant some flowers!I am very happy I decided to spend a couple of hours there. Even though there were a lot of people, it was quiet and relaxing.

Peaceful Place to have your break fast with your spouse or friends. very nice place not away from the metro station, i went at winter this is why i gave a 3 stars only, but it was also nice but surely it would be magnificent at summer days, if you are near and have time you can visit but do not dedicated a certain time for it especially if you have a congested schedule, a two hours visit early morning would be good, take care toilets is quiet little compared to place area so if you have a children be careful, food is available there in cafes and entrance is free.

Breath taking . This garden is Beautiful. We had a wonderful time strolling around. It a must visit and experience. Its a real good rest stop if your doing quiet afew things. We loved it and had a great time.
Love it..Chess..Basketball..picnic .... Must go to this place..yes they play Chess! Got to play with locals. They also play basketball ! My wife enjoyed flowers and picnic.

Under construction . Unfortunately the L.G. area is under some major reconstruction project so a lot of the palace is blocked off. The gardens were well maintained even though it is technically winter.
Sunny day. It's for the 3rd time to visit Jardin de luxembourg but in a diffrent times.this one is in the summer so it's hot but i love the weather the pepole and everything .

An eternal delight. There are constant discoveries. Just to sit on a metal bench and read as the suns hits you and you're conscious of yet somehow oblivious to the noises around you, that's some kind of heaven, and if you can't understand that there's something odd going on.

Even nice in the Winter.. We toured and walked through the Gardens on a walk from Notre Dame. It is visually beautiful and relaxing. There are museums adjacent to the grounds and fill out the experience. It gives you a chance to see how the Parisians and their dogies live and have some downtime.

Exquisitely elegant gardens. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a very large park with many tree-lined pathways and beautiful statues. One of the most prominent features of the park is a lovely octagonal pool with a fountain in the middle. This garden is also home to the magnificent Luxembourg Palace, the seat of the French Senate. It’s a charming place to wander around and relax away from the hustle and bustle of the city. One could spend hours admiring all the wonderful statues, colourful flowerbeds, and elegant fountains. The sunsets in this green oasis are always spectacular. Even if you don’t have much time to explore the extensive park grounds, it’s definitely worth at least a short stroll. The park closes in the evening, so plan your visit accordingly.
A must visit for any visit to Paris. Should not be missed! Lovely place to stroll and sit and relax. Excellent people watching. Many excellent cafes and other places to eat right nearby.

A treat to see. What a lovely place! This was the first time I had been here and I would definitely recommend you put it on your list of places to see in Paris. There are wide paths to enjoy the beautiful vistas and narrow twisting paths through trees. At the boating pool it was a delight to watch the children engrossed with old style sailing boats they launched with sticks. They were hiring these from a vendor nearby and I was surprised how substantial they were when I saw them out of the water. There are chairs and benches all around the gardens and it must be great to picnic here in the warmer weather.
stunning. Gorgeous gardens and a great place to picnic with the locals. You will enjoy the grassy scenery and parks for the kids
Top. Pleasant for a picnic for a walk It s so romantic and so peacefulReally quiet and bigA good place for a break during your shopping dayI love it
Walk. Stunning gardens and well worth the effort. Lovely views and it offers a glimpse of the wonders of Parisian life! A range of refreshment stalls available. Lovely for keen photographers!

Just stunning. Gardens are one of the many things that make Paris so wonderful and Luxembourg is one of the best.The gardens are beautifully laid out and manicured. They are gorgeous to walk through at any time of the day but there is also heaps of seating to allow you to just sit for a while and take it all in.They are in a very central location on the left bank and make a lovely addition to your walk. There is often (if not always) a photographic exhibit of some kind on the perimeter fence which again just adds to the enjoyment.

A chance find while wandering.. We happened on the Luxembourg Gardens while wandering the streets of Paris and we're surprised at this jewel in the city. People strolled through the grounds whether on their lunch hour, a nice afternoon picnic or a leisurely visit taking advantage of the beautiful gardens and scenic palace and fountains. You could also take in the Montparnasse building as a backdrop behind the floral gardens. This was a fun addition to our trip to explore and people watch.
Magical gardens. We thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon stroll in the gardens, it is a great area and also the surrounding neighbourhood, next time we will for sure book a hotel in the area.
Beautiful Gardens. Loved going here and would go back, will be there this spring, lovely restaurants nearby which have fantastic menus and affordable.

The Gardens Parisians Go To. These are the gardens that you'd go to if you lived here and I highly recommend them. If you get the chance (like I did), take a peek at how the many gardeners are trimming the hedges. Doesn't sound fascinating until you see the perfectionism that they bring to their craft!

Best Gardens to Quietly stroll or walk the dog. The gardens are part of the government so watch your manners and step. Dogs only allowed in the South East portion of the park. Amazing trees, ponds, and tennis courts. Even playgrounds for children. A beautiful spot to spend a few hours.
Peaceful and beautiful . If you want some relax and quiet time in a nice scenery, definitely visit this garden. It's really well maintained and pleasant for eyes even in February!
Beautiful to walk thru. Really large park, amazing, well maintained park that is truly one of the best "parks" i have ever seen. Flowers everywhere, fountains with sailboats kids play with. Amazing.

Rose Meridian Markers. Did you read the Da Vinci Code? The original 0 Longitudinal line was in Paris and the avenue between the Luxembourg Gardens and the Paris Observatory mark this line. About every 100 meters or so there is a Rose Meridian Marker set into the ground. You can find the all along the avenue from the Observatory and down through the garden. If you want a little adventure, you will find them as you head north as well. There is one near the bridge at the Louvre covered in locks. There is one in the square near the glass pyramid at the Louvre.
Beutiful. It's a big place where you can walk around and even picnic. Just be aware to be very clean. You don't wanna dirt this pretty place! Recommended when sunny tho.

A Little Bare in the February Bleakness. Took my husband on a nostalgia walk around the gardens. Lots of maintenance work in progress and not so many flowering plants. Should be looking wonderful by late March.

100% Recommended! 👍🏽. Incredible place to spend an afternoon. Buy a cheap bottle of wine/champagne, relax and take in the beauty.
Can't wait to go back!

Beautiful gardens and entertainment space. It was a scorching hot, sunny day when we wandered into this park and we spent a very enjoyable hour sitting in the shade of the trees around the bandstand listening to a school orchestra perform. Strolling further unearthed a plethora of flowerbeds interspersed with many impressive statues, all of powerful women or mythical creatures. There is also a model boating lake, a supervised pony ride for young children and many chairs and grassy areas to sit and relax in. A lot of locals use this park for their training, with boxing, running, tai chi and pilates all happening at various points amongst the shady trees. The large building in this park is now a government building and as such is guarded by armed sentries, an impressive if slightly unnerving sight. There are public toilets here too, always a bonus in Paris.

Beautiful oasis in the middle of Paris. Original statue of liberty, senat, museum, fountains, medici fountain, beautiful place. For running, reading a book, having goute or walking. For children there is s big playground with daily entry tickets, carrousel, theater, horse rides and another free playground a bit further towards observatoire.

Nice place for children. It's a big park on south and good for children . They can run and play freely . There is a big pool and ship toys with flags can be rented here . While children playing parents can seat here relaxing .
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens to just sit and savour a cup of coffee. It's not uncommon to see people just sitting back and enjoying the sunshine.

Huge! You will never see it all! But definitely go!. It's free to see! And best of all its so relaxing and peaceful! The gardens run about 100 miles. So very big! I'd suggest bringing a blanket and doing nice photos, and have a picnic lunch with your loved ones. Don't try to see it all, you won't!
Stunning, relaxed city space.. Stunning, relaxed city space. A great place to sit on a bench and take a break from sight seeing, café visiting and speaking French!

A Place to Pull-up a Chair and Relax. Centrally located, Luxembourg Gardens is one of our favorite spots to stop and chill-out. There's always seats around the expansive fountain. Nearby is church of St. Sulpice, the French Senate (housed in the Palais Luxembourg) and the shopping of St. Germain.

Make sure you spend a sunny afternoon here. One of my fondest memories in Paris was spending the after in Luxembourg Gardens. I took a book and a brownie with me, both of which I enjoyed simultaneously, whilst basking in the sun.

Beautiful place, underrated. These gardens are very underrated. Great place to go if you want some time to take in a French style garden without the bustle of tourists and crowds you get on the Champs du Mars or Tulieres.

Too often overlooked.. I can't say enough about this beautiful garden. Way too overlooked by tourists coming to see the real Paris. In my opinion, this might be the most beautiful attraction in Paris. Come especially on a spring/fall/summer day and sit down for an hour or two and just watch the people going by. You're sure to see a bit of genuine Parisian culture.

Relaxing park. Would recommend going another season other than winter. During winter times there isn't much to see, since their isn't much grass. But it's still a spectacular view everywhere around the park.

A Paris Must!. This is a place to get away from it all. The gardens are absolutely beautiful; and they have plenty of seating throughout the park. We loved just kicking back and putting our feet up with the sun on our faces; just relaxing on our last full day in the city.Make sure you plan enough time to just stroll through the park - looking at the beautiful gardens and architecture; and there is plenty of people watching too. A Paris must see.
Perfect place. I was there 3 times in 5 days. Jardin is fabulous. Everyone seems so happy there. Just sit and enjoy the sun
Stunning classic gardens!. Beautiful legendary gardens with a plethora of superb cafes around! Absolutely recommended - really impressive sight compared to English gardens.

Probably nice in the summer!. The gardins of Paris must look beautiful in the summer. I visited in February and it´s not really possible to enjoy a picnic or even grab a bite on one of the bridges, as most days are wet, a bit cold or windy. Would definitely love to come back and watch the flowers and the trees with their leaves on.

Bring your picnic blanket. The Luxembourg Gardens provide a fabulous setting for a relaxing place to meet friends for a quiet picnic. Whether you like sun, shade, quiet, or the sounds of children playing with their toy sail boats in the artificial pond, this would be an excellent place to spend a few hours one afternoon.
Lovely!. It is literally a very beautiful park. One of the must-see places during a Paris vacation. Grab coffee from nearby coffee shops and enjoy your walk.

Romantic stroll. We were blessed with a sunny day as we strolled round these Gardens. Put these any were else in the world and it would be mediocre.But the feel of Paris really does vamp all things up.

Beautiful and neat. Very "Frenchy". Very nice place, although I would recommend to visit this place only if it fits into your route around Paris - would not advice to travel to this destination only to see the gardens.

A truly beautiful garden to visit in Paris,Even in winter,when we visited the gardens,there is a lot to see and enjoy.. We enjoyed an afternoon in Luxembourg Gardens in December,it was a late sunny day a bit cold,but in the winter sun light it gave the Gardens a Beauty that only that time of year can give,a must to see any time of the year.

Worth a visit. If you have time it is definitely worth walking through these beautiful gardens. I have been there both in winter and in spring - obviously they are more beautiful in Spring when the flowers are in bloom but winter was still quite lovely. It's also good to see the locals playing chess, petanque/bocce, tennis etc
Beautiful serene garden. Great place to wander around. While there were a fair amount of visitors it never felt crowded. There were may places to just sit, rest and take it all in.

Loved It. This is such a beautiful garden! The walk is absolutely splendid! We were really lucky as we went in September and it was still very warm and sunny. There are shops around too so you can grab snacks, bubbles, bird food, etc. You are also able to rent the mini boats for the kids to have fun with. The atmosphere is so vibrant and cheerful! I love this place!

Wonderful Park in Paris. This park is great for kids and for the whole family. It is on the grounds of the France's Senate and includes a huge fountain and many fascinating statues. Not to be missed is the carousel and horses for the kids to ride

Gorgeous garden in the fifth quarter . I have visited this garden many times, in all seasons. In summer it is at the height of its glory. But all through the year, this large very French manicured garden is happening. I visit friends who live close by. So a long, leisurely walk there is a must.

Lovely even in the frigid temperatures. There were so many people of all ages wandering through the gardens. The gardens are beautifully maintained and offer clean and level walking/running paths. The large fountain is fabulous and the chairs are comfortable.

Formal Gardens. A beautiful formal garden for the most part, austere in a pleasing way, adjoins the French Senate building and museum. A pleasant place to stroll since Marie de Medicis built her palance here
Fun stroll through the gardens . Excellent way to relax and have a great little stroll though Paris. I enjoyed it. Good for the whole family and even better with the wife
Luxemburg Gardens. Have visited twice. Once November 2013 then May 2014. Would visit again if I visit Europe again. Wonderful Gardens

One of My Favorite Stops. I have been to Paris and this is definitely one of my favorite places to visit. Beautiful and tranquil. You feel like you are truly experiencing the essence of the city. The architecture of the palace and surrounding landscaping in the heart of the city are a must see.

Best gardens in Paris. The best gardens in Paris and the home of the French Parliament building. Often has free concerts which I thought were great. I went back several times as it is also very peaceful.

A must in paris. If you search a moment of quiet in paris, choose the luxembourgs gardens. I like this place, it was an amazing garden. You take a chair, you sit, you look around, you are really in Paris.

Beautiful garden to walk around and relax. Great in the summer/Spring! there are chairs all over the garden that you can take to sit and take in the sun while you people watch or read a book. In the summer it may be pretty tricky to snatch a chair, you just have to be patient and as soon as you see someone get up swoop in before someone else does :)

Just lovely for walking, resting, having picnic!. One of the main attraction of Paris! A lovely park, ideal for walking, resting, reading a book, sunbathing, watching Parisiens' routines, having picnic or ice-cream! The best time to visit is spring & summer.

Formality v Informality. I love the formality of parts of the gardens along with the old buildings - but I like just as much some of the less formal parts such as the area taken up with the locals apparently enjoying very much their boules and each other's company. Paris has other wonderful gardens.

Beautiful Paris Park. This a special park in Paris. I stayed in the area and enjoyed an August afternoon simply walking, and sitting in various locations to relax. It is a gem and a great place to enjoy some beautiful open space in Paris.

Breath in, breath out. What a great spot to hang out in the summer time. It is just a wonderful location which should be on your agenda while travelling through Paris. Just sit down, take a book, read and relax. Or just enjoy the sun, as long as you relax :)
Great for walk but don't miss the pantheon. The gardens are lovely, unfortunately I went at end of autumn so the colours are already gone. But try to go at the Pantheon is very closed and amazing.

Great park. We spent a few hours here walking around viewing the beautiful gardens soaking up the sun and just generally relaxing.It would be great to take a picnic here and spent a few more hours here.It is suited for couples who enjoy gardens.

What you might not know about the Luxembourg Gardens. The Luxembourg Palace was begun in the 17th century by Marie de’ Medici. She imported Italian gardeners to train their French counterparts, and gardeners still change flowers completely every few weeks. (Marie also brought courses and cutlery to French meals.)In the 19th century, the bourgeois middle class came here. Now the gardens are enjoyed by readers, joggers and tennis players. (Courts are public and cost about $6 an hour.) And the palace is occupied by the French Senate.

A great park for a nice walk. The park is very nice and has a lot of activities. Also they have chairs which are publicly available and are great for sunbathing. Also it is very well maintained. A must see in my opinion when the sun is shining.

a walk in the park...so lovely to see so many trees. As I entered the garden with my partner i became aware that almost everyone around me from age 9-90 was running and looking intent on healthy pursuits! By lunchtime the garden pace had slowed down and the healthy runners were ensconced in cafes or smoking outside. The number of trees was amazing, and despite it being winter it was an impressive environment. great play space for kids, and lovely to share a park on a Saturday morning with the locals

A Garden of Style. A great living grand garden - lots of locals enjoying the space and style of this icon of the Left Bank. A nice place to unwind and relax - very near the Sorbonne/Notre Dame area. Free.
Pretty. Pretty area to relax and walk around. There is a playground for the kids. It is a nice playground, but expensive for entry. There is also a wooden carousel to ride.

Pleasant stroll on the Left Bank.. We have tended to stay in this area of the Left Bank over our more recent visits to Paris, and have enjoyed many walks in the Luxembourg Gardens, summer and winter. Always a pleasure - a truly relaxed place in a frenetically busy area, bordering on the Boulevard Saint Michel. I have many happy memories of this place, including one of a small boy worrying his mother by showing attention to a large tree-clipping machine. Small boys are small boys.If I have any criticism, it is that it is not as intensively managed as many UK and Irish city parks such as St Stephen's Green and Merrion Square (Dublin). Little effort is made to enhance its attractiveness in winter. It is possible to do this with an effective programme of flower-planting. I have in fairness to say that, on our most recent visit last October, the park's management seem to have appreciated this, and are trying to improve matters.Perhaps not an absolutely top attraction in Paris. However, if you are in the Left Bank and have the time, I would recommend a relaxing walk in the Luxembourg Gardens at any time of year. Obviously, summer is the best time. Best regards, OMB/JR.

Romantism. Beautiful gardens and building. A place where lovers should spend time. Watch people passing by. A nice place to take a break when visiting le Quartier Latin, la Sorbonne and the Museum de Cluny ( a must as well).

Beautiful. We had beautiful weather in April. No clouds and the sun was shining. We got cheese, meat and bread and ate on one of the many seats provided. The gardens are beautiful. There was a cafe in the park also to get a class of wine. Great to just sit and relax.

Nature in a metropole!. A beautiful park, where nature can be appreciated at it's full splendor! It's also a great place to joy free time with family, do sports or just get to know the city, it's definitely a must!

Relax and Enjoy Paris Environment. A beautiful place to have some moments of peace inside Paris. A good advice is buy something to drink/eat, find a chair around the lake and enjoy this wonderful place.

this is SPARTA hum... AWSOME. This is one of the best parcs i ever visited and this is just a fatastic place to take a nap... you can have so much activities just like chess or ping ( if you set the net up) or a place for... love! This is one of my favorite places and you can basically come here for no reason... come on and chill there;)

Sunday morning stroll with the Parisians. A superb setting to mix with the locals, take in the architecture and the garden. Great to be with so many people enjoying the fresh air and just being out in this lovely city.

One of the best places to feel the life in Paris. Get some bread and cafe au lait, find a bench and spend a couple of hours in the afternoon looking at the beautiful garden. One of the best places in Paris to fell it.
beautiful in winter. it was beautiful in winter so i am guessing its better in summer. cant wait to go back and visit. Saw lots of people running - would like to do that the next time.
Will always have a place in my heart.... We had our elopement ceremony in these gardens.. I will always feel a connection. It was absolutely beautiful!

Nice place to relax. This is a nice park to go to, walk around and relax. I've been there on Sundays just to stroll around, listen to free concerts or sit near by the water. If you are a jogger, the park is also a suitable location for running around.

People watching . This was a great place to people watch and enjoy the beautiful scenery. If you have young children they can rent mini sailboats and let them sail in the large man made pond near the palace. There is a large area to walk around and a park where all the local children play. It's a nice place to go and relax towards sunset.
Nice. A good walk in the heart of the 6th, pleasant architecture with the French senate and the regular French gardens. Go if you stay à week or more. Close is the Zadkine museum

Nice to stroll around. Went end of Jan - the Palais Luxembourg is closed & seems like it is going to be for a while. It's nice to have a stroll around & then you can walk to the Pantheon which is well worth a visit - they have a crypt underneath where many French literary heroes are buried et. Marie Curie etc. You can also stroll to the Latin Quarter via the Sorbonne & then head onto Notre Dame.

A nice, relaxing place. The Luxembourg Gardens are a little dry, especially during the summer, but once the sun goes down it's a nice place to eat or relax.
