There are a few nice ponds and fountains adorning the place but there will always be visiters and artisans around. It is a very large place but the nicest bits are around the large ponds and the Palais du Luxembourg. There are also very nice free chairs and table underneath trees to use if you want to sit back and read or enjoy a meal.

Beautiful . We stayed a 10 minute walk from these beautiful gardens. A perfect way for get some peace & quiet from the hussle & Bussle of Paris. Beautiful ponds & statues scattered throughout these lush gardens.
We highly recommend visiting

So very French. We meandered into the Luxembourg Gardens about 4 PM. The French know how to relax--this is where taxi drivers and stock brokers, mothers with strollers and young lovers, fathers with toddlers and elegant 80 year olds all meet to gather near the lovely pond. They either relax on the lovely wrought iron chairs or stroll through the wide avenues of gorgeous flower beds. Great people watching and lovely to see the community of Paris relaxing together.

Something for Everybody. We visit Paris regularly and on each occasion enjoy visiting the gardens to enjoy the wide variety of activities.The gardens are a delight for children,with a large activity play area,boating lake,donkey rides and marionette theatre.For older people there are tennis courts,long tennis,boules,chess and other attractionsPleasant place to stroll or sit,watching the wide range of activities

A favorite park.. I enjoy coming to sit and contemplate my day or read a book and rest. There are chairs that can be located to any spot you choose. Much less crowded than the Tuilleries and well placed in the Latin Quarter on the Rive Gauche.

Colorful, pleasant place to relax. We visited Luxembourg Gardens coming from the Pantheon on our way to Montparnasse Tower. Created by Maria de Medici, the palace in the Gardens houses today the French Senat meetings. Look for the Medici Fountain when you go there and relax watching the ducks on the water or take a snap on the grass.

Best place on a sunny day in Paris. Mad at your King/Husband? Go build yourself a replica of the Petit Palace and make the gardens extraordinary. Really. Worth seeing. Enjoy an ice cream as you wander about. Want to see real Parisians? They'll be here too enjoying the day. Located behind the Sorbonne and near the Pantheon in a lovely area on the Left Bank, this garden is a welcome respite from all the beauty indoors. Plan some park time alongside the museums....you'll be glad you did.

Large park. Lovely park made up of several gardens. Good vibe with many people having picnics. Fountins are historic. Could do with more toilet facilities. Did not like fact you had to pay to use childrens play area. Just as well we did not take our son on this trip!
Best seen on a sunny day . Beautiful gardens - especially if you visit Paris durin spring or summer that most of the flowers are blossomed and the colors conquer the atmosphere!

It's grandeur but it's better to view during summer time. We went nearing the closing time which is at 5pm. The guards were prompt to announce its closure. Well since its winter time no greenery around for contrast with the building. But I could imagine the beauty of it during summertime.
always lovely. We strolled through these gardens several times in August, at and watched the entertaining crowds, and admired the flowers. It was wonderful, as always.
Superb. Nice garden and a perfect harmonious curation of how it's supposed to be. A tranquil park which compares to any other parks such like Hyde Park etc.

Perfect Setting for a Picnic. It's centrally located in the city center so you can easily reach this if you're near the St.Germain district. This home of the French Senate in one of the biggest parks in Paris is the perfect setting for a picnic, so peruse the shops close by for meat, cheese, baguettes, and wine, then hop over for a quaint lunch while people-watching. To get here, the nearest metro station is Odeon on Line 4 or 10. If you plan on using the metro frequently--which isn't a necessity because Paris is a fairly walkable town--buy a carnet of 10 metro tickets for 14.10 euros, rather than paying 1.80 euros for each ticket individually. The 1-Day Mobilis tickets (for unlimited 24-hr use of public transit) are only economical if you plan on using public transportation more than 4 trips per day since it costs 7 euros.

Favorite place in Paris. This is like the oasis in the concrete jungle of Paris. Perfectly quite during the day or swarming with people on a sunny weekend day, Jardin du Luxembourg is a place for the soul. There's a place to go for a run, play with your kids, go for a pony ride, just sit in the sun or stare at the palm tree surrounded by perfectly designed flower beds or visit a museum...it's a perfect little getaway place in the heart of Paris! Make sure you pay it a visit!
Lovely gardens. Lovely gardens worth taking a stroll through. Managed to take some great postcard worthy photographs. Plenty to look at and enjoy even if you aren't into flowers.
We rode our bikes around here. We did many days or bike riding through the city and stopped at the gardens. Always beautiful to see even in the autumn season

Take your time. Beautiful big gardens to walk through. Make sure to take your camera with many photo opportunities. Set aside time to sit and read or soak in the sun by one of the fountains, chairs are provided. Also recommended to hire a boat during the summer and have a boat race. Very fun! Don't plan to eat or drink in the cafes in the gardens, highly overpriced and not so good.

sunday day out. I went there to watch the traditional doll show but my time didn't match their schedule so I couldn't watch but next time for sure..We were there on a Sunday afternoon, there were so many locals playing games(chess, backgamon, pokunta?,sailing mini boat in a fountain pool) and relaxing. We saw an original statue of liberty and just relaxed and enjoy watching people. There was tennis court, merry go round, riding ponies..so many children activities there too.

Take a Picnic or just a short visit. We stopped into the gardens after lunch for a look.We could have spent all day relaxing there it was so tranquil and peaceful.The grounds are well maintained. Even if busy you can find a quiet corner to sit in. There is food and beverages to purchase around the gardens. And also inside.Would be great for kidsIf you love your flowers or are in the area its worth a stop in

Incredible! Magnificent!. Such a beautiful place to visit. Best on a Summer's day for a stroll through the gardens. Enjoying the architecture, the beautiful maintained gardens and the gorgeous amounts of flowers. Definitely recommend.

Nice enough - little bit tatty. I've allowed for the season in my review and been generous. 31/2 stars would be better I don't think they compare with London's parks which are maintained to a very high standard and are obviously a lot bigger. Nice place to have a stroll and chill though.

One of my favorite places in Paris. We only ever walk through the beautiful gardens but it's striking to have such a peaceful setting in such a bustling city. You also get to see Parisians at their most relaxed. If it's a sunny day, its even better. Take a seat in one of the many chairs and soak up the vitamin D!

Beautiful gardens. Started our day here, stopping to grab a croissant at Bread and Roses - some of the best croissants in the city - and eating it as we walked throughout the Jardin du Luxembourg which is beautiful. We were there in the winter so it wasn't as lush and green but still a wonderful sight!
Such tranquility. It was a feeling of tranquility when I was there on a Sunday morning, although with many people there.

lovely place. This is a lovely garden to visit with cute tearooms. Well it is in the summer when you can sit by the big pond and snooze in the sunshine after a walk around. In the winter the tea rooms were closed and it was freezing, even the pond had frozen over, but still a lovely place to wander around.

Beautiful and very large. If you really want to get the most out of the gardens, start your day here so that your feet aren't as tired as they would be at the end of the day. Really lovely place to sit and relax.

Take a few minutes or hours to relax. I love the Luxembourg Gardens! It is the perfect Paris destination for couples, families, everyone to take time out from busy sight seeing days. Most visitors try to pack in sight seeing destinations during their visit. When you have seen all of the 'must sees', pick up a baguette and make your way to these gardens. Take a leisurely stroll around the gardens, before securing a chair - try to get a reclined one - and taking a much deserved break from walking around the city. People watching is prime here...especially on a sunny Saturday or Sunday, where locals and tourists alike flock to the gardens. There is often a band playing in the gazebo. Fantastic destination if you have children with you. You can hire a sailing boat for a few euros to sail on the lake....pushing it with a stick...a lovely step back in time. Walk to what I call the back of the gardens, past the tennis courts, and there is a great playground. You do have to pay a couple of euros to enter but it's worth it and the kids will have a great time. There is a stall selling treats and drinks and look out for the nearby stall making fairy floss.....yum. Lunch or a coffee at the Pavilion restaurant is a great option too....no matter the weather. Sit outside on warm days and inside if it's cooler. I always order the Dish of the Day and have never been disappointed. Once you have discovered the gardens, I'm sure you will return any chance you get during your stay.

It is interesting =). First of all, what was a big surprise for me: everywhere, instead of the usual asphalt, a strange coating, similar to a very fine white sand that has all the properties of dust. I suspect that this is the authentic coverage of past centuries, but that does not help. So I would recommend not to wear for walking the dark suede shoes, as it smoothly turn into white. The same on the Mars fields. In general, the impression is excellent, lots of chairs near the fountain, where you can watch a beautiful view of the beautiful antique building, which still functions! Just before the entrance to the park very tasty pancakes are sold, only 1 euro. Chocolate with caramel mmmm!

Beautiful gardens to wander and enjoy some peace. Beautiful gardens with so much to see and to enjoy some peace from the city. There was a playground for small children although the charge was 2.5 Euros to enter. Lots of space but the grass areas were not to be walked on. This may just be a winter thing but beware as we were told off for walking on the grass.
Very pretty even in January. The Luxembourg gardens are definitely worth visiting even in January. The gardens were still quite busy and a perfect way to spend a Sunday afternoon

Gorgeous Gardens!. Loved visiting the Luxembourg Gardens, so beautiful with amazing colourful roses and the perfectly shaped shrubs. Never imagined I would visit the place I read about when I was young. Awesome.

Fantastic place for a run. My favorite place to see while on my morning runs. The gardens are great and runner friendly. Sadly I never did take my kids here for the park and pool, but can see it's a great place for families. Fantastic garden that adds to the greatness of Paris.

Do not visit in winter. My husband and I visited during winter and it was a waste of time as there is nothing to see really. It makes for a good morning stroll or playtime with kids. This is a summer place.

Too bad it's winter. This is our first time in Paris, we came here before going to the Notre-Dame Cathedral. Too bad it's winter, the garden and the palace of Luxembourg looks to be amazing, people, local people are jogging and kids are playing in the playground. Looking at other tourists photos they took in the summer, I wished I could came in the summer. Will definitely re-visit if I go to Paris again.

Must visit . This is a must visit in Paris. Beautiful park with a variety of flowers and shrubs. Lots of benches to sit on to soak in the quiet atmosphere. Great park for walking and having some quiet time to reflect.

Sit a spell!. We didn't tour the palace, but we did enjoy the gardens one afternoon while visiting Paris. We accidentally stumbled upon this gem on a beautiful, sunny day. The kids racing the sailboats in the pond was the most perfect cliche Parisian backdrop to sit and enjoy some coffee and put our feet up in the chairs. The grounds are beautiful and amazingly manicured. This was one of those memorable didn't-plan-it-but-glad-we-did-it vacation moments!

Beautiful Parisian park near the Latin Quarter. This is a beautiful Parisian park located in the Quartier Latin. It usually appears in the French films as it is the place where Parisians go to get away from the bustle and hustle of the city. This is also great for children as they have a big fountain where they can float their ship toys which I think you can rent there as well as some pony rides. Nice to chill out with your book or stroll around. Take your camera to make some nice pictures of the surroundings and there is also a little museum in the park but I have never been there.

Probably more impressive in the spring/summer. In January, everything is naturally brown and flowers/trees are dead, but still you can appreciate the expanse of the gardens. Saw others review of the gardens mention joggers and that was no joke, even in winter. So since our hotel was in the St. get main area, I went jogging myself. Beautiful place to jog with the locals. Saw groups doing exercise routines and boot camp type programs.

Gardens to please everyone . You can spend days enjoying these lovely gardens, the plantings are colorful, the buildings are interesting, the places for children make them very happy, you can enjoy the view and weather when it's not rainy, you can read a book, have a bite or watching your children happiness. There is a metro station for RER B just in front of it.
Amazing!. If you love plants, then you definitely have to five the Luxembourg Gardens a visit, you'll be glad you did!

Parisian Park. I love visiting this park and feeling like I belong to this city. I enjoyed running around the park for my morning jog. I especially love seeing local people enjoying their park. Visiting in the winter is not the optimal time to see the park but it is still a place that gives the feel of intimacy with the city of Paris.
Great walk. These gardens brought tears to my eyes. They were perfectly manicured and we'll kept. I would highly recommend, and it's free!

To start or end a day in Paris. It´s a perfect place to start the day - or to finish it, due to the peace provided by the fountains, monuments, the lake where old man play with miniatures of boats, children playing and people doing jogging (firemen use to make their exercises there, in the morning). The Fontaine of Medicis it´s impressive, huge, but my favorite sculpture is that one dedicated to Delacroix. Just be careful to do not lay on the grass, it is forbidden on the most of the areas.

The most beautiful and the most romantic Paris garden.. Few steps from my favorite hotel, the most beautiful and the most romantic Paris garden. You can look at "a pétanque party" so frenchy ! or attend a chess game, or a tennis game ! Or just or jog around the garden 1,24274 mi (2km).
Beautiful Parisian garden . Admission is free. The garden is so beautiful. The walk is very easy and many locals visit the garden regularly. I recommend spending at least 1-2 hours there.

Unbeliavable beauty. Very beautiful place, where everybody can find her corner. You can visit it alone and relax or with family and friends and chill. It was very beautiful in spring, i guess it's much more better in fall.
Tranquility in the city. A beautiful and well maintained park like garden. Fountains and play areas as well as an extensive path system make it appealing to all ages.
Every day should include a trip to the garden. This garden is my favorite, be it for a good power walking morning or an afternoon stroll with my husband. So peaceful in the center of the city.

beautiful plave for Breakfast. During a trip to Paris in September 2011 my husband and I stayed near the gardens. We would buy a baguette and pastries at a nearby boulangerie and eat our breakfast in the peaceful garden. Felt like a dream.

Great looking and nice garden in central Paris. This park is very central and offers a great place to rest, walk peacefully and admire the beautiful architecture and landscape. It has several pounds that are well located and spots to lay-down on the grass or using some chairs (attention, these chairs have a limited number and you might have to wait for someone to free some up).

Beautiful. Truly a beautiful and peaceful place. So much larger than I thought, Luxembourg Gardens goes on and on with different paths to walk or run on, an area for children to play, various athletic courts, gardens, fountains, and of course places to sit and people watch. What a gem!

Winter in the garden. While there are no flowers there is a way of life that should not be missed. Buy a baguette, a piece of cheese and something to drink (water is fine) a book is good to and sit on a bench. Just sit there....you don't need to do another thing.

Great park for a stroll, run, and kids. We can't visit Paris without going to "the Luxembourg" with the kids for them to play and for the adults to have casual walks, or morning workouts. In the summer the attractions are better, but the gravel everywhere makes your shoes/feet dusty.

Peace and Relaxation in the City of Light. We spent two weeks in Paris on our second trip there (With a small, two day excursion to Normandy). One of the highlights of our trip was spending half a day hanging out in the Luxembourg Gardens. Granted, the weather was terrific, but there are so many places to sit and read or people watch. Not to mention how photogenic the park is. On your way, stop for a picnic meal and enjoy the sights. I would definitely go back on out next trip!
Great garden. It is large, lots of space of any kind of activities. Shame that we visited during Winter, thus it felt kind of cold and dry.
Best gardens in Paris. These gardens are simply beautiful, it is full of history and really calm. The beauty is simple but it is important.
Worth a visit!. We visited in January and the gardens were full of locals and tourists. One a sunny day it would be great for a picnic.

Nice place to read a book on a warm and sunny day. Visited Paris in June 2015. I went to the Luxembourg Gardens because my map had it as a good place to visit. I don't regret comming there. Nice and clean place with loads of seats for those who fancy to read a book or rest.
Nice park. Nice garden to walk around and sit after a very long day. Is good to sit down and recharge your "battery" here.

Do whatever you want any time in year. Want to play, jog, relax, play with your children, practice your mind or body in a group or alone? You can do whatever you want any time in year at this place. Just enjoy the most beautiful garden of the city.
Picnic is a must. You must enjoy a wonderful summer picnic in the parc here - stop by one of the bakeries at the entrance and pick up some food.

Lovely, peaceful walk. Luxembourg Gardens is wonderful. It's a huge park with a lot to offer. There are heavily wooded paths through the trees, clearings with grass which would be prefect for bringing a blanket and having a picnic or reading a book, several statues and things to see, and even a children's play area. The main attraction is the palace and surrounding area, which is just gorgeous. It's a very peaceful walk and you should find somewhere to sit and people watch. I sat near the palace and was undisturbed by other visitors as I wrote and drew some pictures. Even in the winter, this is a lovely park, worth a walk through. Enjoy!

Gorgeous Garden. I stopped by the Jardin de Luxembourg on my way to another place and I definitely wasn't disappointed. Everything was perfect and beautiful to look at. I went on a rainy day so I didn't spend too much time looking around but what I managed to see was great.

Take a peaceful stroll. Even in the winter time this was a great place to take a stroll. The history, nature and peacefulness that surrounds you while walking is amazing. I only wish we had, had the time to sit and just soak in the atmosphere.

Precious. Is there anything more beautiful for an afternoon walk than the marvelous Luxembourg gardens?I passed away and woke up in Heaven :) the sculptures, the scenario with the fountains and the flawless architecture will leave you speechless.It's so French and you can really appreciate the good taste and how well preserved Paris is, chapeau!

Medicis. Marie de Medici needed her own palace when her husband the King died, so Luxembourg Palace and its gardens was erected on the Left Bank. In close proximity to the Sorbonne, one can find students strolling and studying and love making in a wonderland of fountains, flowers, lawns and pathways. The French Senate still uses the Palace.

Best place to run in Paris. Finished my 12 km run here and really enjoyed the soft gravel surface and on stop running after pounding the pavement and stop starting for road crossings the last hour. Lots of runners. Follow the well worn perimeter path to get maximum distance. Can't wait to come back here ahead of the marathon and enjoy the espaliered and pleached trees in spring.

Nice Afternoon. We have been to Paris a few times, this trip was one that we would see sights we always missed. So on to Luxembourg. What I am impressed with at first sight are the green park chairs, they are everywhere and not locked down. You can move them to your group in the shade or by the pond. I loved the children playing with the boats, grandma and grandpa walking with the family. We just enjoyed the day as Parisians do, just enjoying the day. A must see.

beautiful even in winter. Having seen this amazing palace and surrounding area, I'm convinced I'll have to return in the summer! The grounds are meticulously kept and there are so many little hidden treasures all around. Make the time and enjoy a stroll. Tip-Winter months have the gates closing much earlier, usually just at sundown, so plan accordingly

Beautiful Gardens. Perfectly located to enjoy the gardens and various shopping/cafe culture around it. The gardens are lovely in the summer as you will see the bee garden, the locals playing petanque. There's a play area for young children, as well as somewhere to sit and enjoy the scenery and setting. They also have exhibitions going on from time to time.
Stunning even in winter. We visited on a cold, winter day but the castle and grounds still impress. Amazing. Will go back in summer to see it all again.

Good atmosphere!. I was there in December so almost tree leaves fall off. The weather was about 11 C degree without rain, so it's a good time to walk around to see children playing, boys and girls jogging, old people seating...

Well presented, beautiful gardens. Really nice gardens that were kept in great condition for it being the middle of winter. Beautiful views, could walk around or there were also loads of seats where you could sit and have lunch and relax. Would be great in summer

I don't see the big deal. We went in winter, so no flowers, but I honestly don't see what the big deal is. The building is impressive, and the gardens look like they'd be nice in summer, but I found it a little boring.
Great park. If you have the time. Spend a few lazy hours having a picnic and walking around on a Paris' great parks.
Bring a picnic lunch. A great garden to visit with lots of open spaces and places to sit. A great place for a loaf of bread some cheese and wine on a warm day.

Every visit to Paris has to combine a trip here. This is one of the nicest places to visit. When the weather is good take a picnic, a good book and a seat near the boating pond. Sit back and watch Paris at peace.Find the Chess players, the tennis players and seek out the Statue of Liberty.

luxemburg garden at winter. this charming gardens at winter are a whole different story, but still
very beautiful, families gather to enjoy the facilities and to relax
Beautiful, great stroll!. A really lovely afternoon walk about the gardens and sitting in front of the house and water. Advise a nice stroll!
Probably not the best time of year to visit. Visited in December so the trees were bare so didn't look it's best, might look better in the spring!

A great set of gardens to walk through even in winter.. Well worth visiting. The gardens are used by a vast quantity of locals on a daily basis and I would thoroughly recommend visiting. From the formal displays to the avenues of trees, tennis courts and outdoor chess games the Luxembourg Gardens has something for eveyone even model sail boats on the pond in front of the house.

A nice place to walk. It's a nice place to walk and take photos for those interested in photography. Try not to go there afternoon as the gardens close at 5 pm (not sure about summer timing where days are definitely longer)

Spent a day in fall. I didn't expect to see such beautiful gardens groomed for fall. I can only imagine spring or summer there. Spent the day with my granddaughter. Many things to do. Play park a lot of fun. Small entrance fee. Clean different playground experience from Canada. Bonus clean free bathrooms. We also had a pony ride, exciting for children 3-9.

Beautiful. Take the afternoon, the morning, or if you like it , the whole day to walk it completely, it is really beautiful, there are families, runners and schoolers around the area, also some street food places to grab a pan au chocolat or sort of food.Dont you dare go into the museum that is next to the gardens, youll spend money and time, both with nothing interesting to come with , excepto you are an art fan.

Beautiful gardens, better to visit during spring!. We had heard a lot of the Luxembourg gardens, and it's definitely worth it. Although we visited this place early January, with a rough weather and real cold, we really understood why this place is so famous. The serenity of the place is unique. I suggest you visit it during spring time, and this is what I'm looking forward too.
A respite. If you have had enough art and walking, take this wonderful respite into nature and people watching. Bring a sandwich and just relax.
What a treasure!. We spent several hours here. What a fun place to watch people and enjoy the outdoors. Also a good place to rest after walking for the morning.

Magical - captivates all of Paris's soul. These gardens are the perfect way to relax for locals and tourists alike. If you are a tourist these gardens are a must have on your itinerary. Make sure that you take your time to not only walk around the gardens/park but sit down on the chairs which are all over the garden and let yourself get immersed in the surrounding peaceful atmosphere the gardens have to offer. Try also Parc Monceau in the 8th arr. and Parc des Buttes Chaumont in the 19th arrod. for a similar experience.
Romantic and very relaxing moment...out the time. Good for anybody,family,lovers,....romantic and refreshing walk....history again...shadows....of the past....any day..even rainy day...

Nice for a walk. Nice place to relax or take a walk and we were surprised how pretty the flowers looked even in November. It was cloudy the day we went but on a nice, clear day you could even get a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower.

Great park, particularly with kids. AS others mentioned, this is a nice park with beautiful sculptures, lots of plants and an elegant building in the background. Very enjoyable even in winter. Even better if you are traveling with young kids: there are poney rides available and a great, enclosed playground perfect for ages 3 to 12. The playground costs 2 euros or so per kid and is totally worth it; it is a large enclosure with zip lines, various kinds of monkey bars and structures to climb on - a couple of steps up from your basic playground. Adults can get in for 1.5 euro (I think) or sit outside and not worry about their kids getting lost.

Magnificent parc in the heart og Paris left bank. Great to walk, to run, to have a quiet moment, to get a coffe. Great for children with its "Marionnettes", playground. You can even play tennis or go to the "Musée du Sénat".

dont miss. The secon most beautiful and attractive Paris garden after Palais Royal garden, and before Tuileries.
This garden is kinda sum-up of french elegant spirit and culture.

central park but smaller. this garden reminds me of central park, NYC but in a smaller scale. Situated right in the middle of the city, it's a beautiful garden with serenity. I enjoyed reading a book and just relaxing there in the heat. Well maintained for sure!

Stunning. We ventured here during a trip over the new year period and found it was well worth taking the time to do so. The views from the entrance of the gardens are amazing. I would have preferred to visit in the summer as the fountains were not in action but nevertheless, we loved it.
As Tuileries. Worth to have a stroll there as well, as in Tuileries, actually you can see French people there, not just tourists.

Beautiful. These beautiful gardens provide the perfect setting for a leisurely stroll. The grassy areas are well kept - perfect for a picnic, and there are plenty of chairs throughout for public use. We bought some pastries, sat by the pond and had a lovely morning tea!

Beautiful garden even in December. Walking through the gardens on a raining day was lovely. The flowers were still alive in the gardens. People were jogging and very safe area to tour. The palace on the grounds is stunning. Would definitely like to revisit when it is warmer weather

Beautiful. We spent a late summer afternoon exporing the gardens. While they were definitely not at their peak, the blooms were still beautiful and the crowds were gone. It is a lovely way to spend time in Paris if you are looking for quiet time in September.

A big park in the heart of the city. Thus park is well layed out with multiple entrance gates. The gardens of sculpture a beautiful and there are lots of chairs provided to sit and watch the world go buy.

for lazy surfers. it is a beautiful place to visit during your trip. try not to go to there directly instead walk around and once you feel tired get a extra hot take away coffee and go to the gardens and enjoy your coffee under the sunlight.
Beautiful Gardens. Although it was a cold and overcast day and no leaves on trees, this was a lovely place to visit. I enjoyed checking out the statues of what turned out to be a few of my ancestors.
A Fun Place to Walk Around. This is such a fun place to walk around. And it's free! A highly recommend strolling through and looking at the amazing flowers and trees.

Even in winter worth a visit. If you're already in the Latin Quarter then take the 10 minute walk to the Gardens. You will be glad you did. Even with the trees bare of leaves, the park has a nice tranquil feeling and the palace makes an excellent backdrop.
Lovely gardens. The gardens are famous for it's calm and relaxing atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit, but nothing special.
relax. very beautiful and enjoyable. central to many a wonderful link around this part of Paris. Particularly also one should mention the Museum.

Magnificat!. A wonderful park to visit, so peaceful and quiet as you can wander around and admire the surrounding historic buildings. Not many tourists here, more locals and families. Take in the fresh air and admire the beauty of Paris.
Always a favorite. I always make time for the Luxembourg Gardens when I get to Paris. Each season has something special. Don't miss the Medici Fountain.

Shutter stop. If you want to meander or do some jogging, these palace grounds are a good choice. If you are looking for a 'garden', this will disappoint. You can float a boat on the grand pond, find lots of statuary and fountains, even the statue of liberty [original model] is in the gardens.

Not what it was billed as. We came here before the holidays for carousels, xmas markets and donkey rides. None were even present. The carousel opened at 2 pm! The nearby playground was fun but cost €4 to get in. Not what we anticipated at all.
nice place to chill out. Nice place to go for a stroll and a sit down away from the crowds. There were plenty of places to sit but it was March.
Huge garden. Huge garden, really nice to walk, talk and also enjoying some time sit at the sun during the winter time.

Manicured and peaceful. Gorgeous park to sit and have a picnic anytime of year! Some lovely elegant sculptures to see and a charming little duck house surrounded by boats on the pond to watch and enjoy. Very romantic!

Smaller Than I thought.. This is the place where Tony Bourdain got ambushed by a mime! This is a classical public garden in the middle of the 6em arrondisment close to the Surbonne and the Pantheon. It is a gorgeous place, filled with statues, a wonderful pond that can offer a place for a quiet rest and break from the rest of the area. The Dome, where Tony went to recover from the mime attack is not far away!
Beautiful !!. Great place to walkI stayed across the street and a hotel located right on the gardensIt is a beautiful place and with seeing

Great playground . Visited with young children in tow. Beautiful park, even in winter. You have to pay to use the playground: €2.50 for kids, €1.40 for adults. It is clean and there's lots of different equipment for children of a range of ages from little trains, to spinning wheels, flying fox, climbing rope pyramid, sandpit etc. Lots of benches inside or just outside for parents. Also has toilets. Make sure you go to the central formal garden and lake in front of the palace.

Gorgeous and my favorite in Paris. A perfect and beautiful place to chill out and recharge. The view of the palace in between the green and colorful scenery is amazing, i spent an hour of silence enjoying this wonderful view, looks more like a painting. I was there during spring so the garden was colorful and fresh.Definitely will visit whenever in Paris.

Heavenly for children. Wonderful playground--we were here almost every day on a visit this summer and came back on a quick visit this December. Great carousel outside the playground--and in summer also pony rides, swings, and a boat pond.

Seats and female statues with clothes!. This is a great place to sit and relax. There are lots of chairs and they are reasonably comfortable. You can see the world go by or read a book. They have a series of statues of famous women. They are all fully dressed which is unusual.
Wonderful!. These gardens are simply amazing..with some beautiful trees and colourful flowers and plantations! We spent a nice relaxing afternoon here!

Strange to see armed guards in a park. I visited just after the attacks in Paris and while the park was very beautiful it was strange to see people doing tai chi with military guards stationed 30 feet away. Its a lovely place for a walk and a surprising oasis in a very busy city. Great park for kids 2+.

Luxembourg Gardens. I was there during Winter....no good....but in Spring is another beautiful place to visit.
The Pala however is good to visit all year round.

Incredible!. Luxembourg Gardens wasn't really on our agenda while in Paris but we were wandering around on a Sunday afternoon and decided to go. This truly is a MUST SEE! If you've ever dreamed of living in Paris and wanted to really get a peek into Parisian life, this is the place. Its full of families picnicking, children sailing toy boats, there are tennis courts, pony rides, the list goes on and on. There are also just couples lounging around soaking up life and relaxing. The grounds are spectacular and beautifully landscaped. Grab a baguette, a hunk of cheese and some fruit and spend a couple of hours there....you'll love it!
Amazing. If you love gardens you will not be disappointed with The Luxembourg gardens. They are magnificent, especially in spring.

relaxing, peaceful. This place is very near to city center and full of green. It has running tracks, tennis courts and basketball fields. It is also good place to read your book. Quite place to rest, too.

Charming grounds!. By far the best outdoor spot we encountered while exploring Paris. The grounds are immaculately kept but very easy to enjoy. Places to sit and people watch are combined with soft walking paths and lovely foliage. People of all kinds were enjoying the spaces as did we!
Tourism. Beautiful gardens well worth a visit. Make sure it is a sunny day to get the true colourful benefit. Definitely take a camera.
Very nive. It's very peaceful and romantic. Just sitting in the garden on a peaceful day and watching the sky goes by was wonderful.
Lovely park. Beautiful place to walk and rest in the center of Paris. If you have the opportunity take a moment to visit this gorgeous garden.

In Seine. Don't let a few crazy ragheads put you off, Paris is still the jewel in the crown. And what better place to escape the hubbub than the exquisitely laid out Jardins des Luxembourg.Laze away the day watching budding Federer's hammer balls on the tennis courts; seek the shade of the Medici fountains; marvel at the pristine architecture and precise arboreta and topiaristic splendour. The gardens cover many hectares and it's absolutely free - unless you need the toilet or indulge in one of the carefully planned attractions.Take a baguette and a bottle of wine - but be discreet and leave this charming oasis as perfect as you found it.
Okay Garden. The garden was nice, but nothing special. But this might be because I've been to Versailles on the day before...

Quiet park, with boat sailing fountains and high security close by. Large park, quiet for the city, lots of locals walking dogs, tour groups, gardens with fruit trees and tennis courts, children's rides, lots of paths to wander. The palace on the north side is heavily armed with young men with weapons lots of men with weapons. Very secure and safe park.
nothing extra ordinary. good park to stroll in, and sit around on a summer aftrenoon, lovely flowers, but nothing extra ordinary
Relaxing. Garden is very relaxing, lots of activities for families and solo traveler also. Garden is very big, you need half of a day to walk it through.

Beautiful. I had been in Paris several times before, but had never visited the gardens for some reason. We walked through them on December 19th, and the sunny, 15 degrees celsius day made it perfect. The park is a great place to sit and have a coffee or a picnic. Lots of seating, a beautiful fountain, and lovely grounds. I could have stayed there and relaxed all day!

Thanks for the Memories Luxembourg Gardens. First visit was Sunday 20th December after I attended mass at the Great Notre Dame Cathedral for my Late Loving Dads 2nd Anniversary. Peaceful, Friendly, Safe Surrounds. Just what I needed that day especially. Returned again before I left as you just loose yourself in these surrounds, Beautiful.Thanks for the Memories, Máire

Beautiful Walk and sights.. We got lucky with the December weather and were able to enjoy this park. As with everything in Paris it is beautiful and perfectly done. It offers wide open spaces with playground, tennis courts,and bocce ball, Since the season the flowers were not out, but it was such and nice walk. Locals were sitting in chairs enjoying the fountain water.

Get Outside . Unfortunately we went during the winter, so many of the flowering plants were dormant; however, it was still great (and free) entertainment. There are many trails that are great for jogging, or just an evening stroll. The vegetation is nice and the whole aesthetics of the place is profound. Definitely visit this place for a taste of local life.

Should return during summer. A nice and open garden with a beautifull pont and building (=senate) in the centre. Many seats available, use thema and enyoi a break with a view. A bit harsh and naked during the winter period, will return later on the year. Lovely surroundig area also.

Brilliant place to let small children burn off some energy. Great place to run around. There is a good park with slides etc which is €1.50 for the day but you can leave and re enter with your ticket. There are also free slides to go on which are in an adjoining garden. Ducks to feed and pony rides. Heaven for toddlers!
Don't go in the winter. Definitely something you would want to see any other season than winter. Still a nice place to visit but I would imagine it's quite the spectacle in the summer or fall.

Full of surprises. It takes a while to understand the depth of beauty abundant at Luxembourg gardens. Sculptures artfully posed among trees heavy with leaves catch your eye while competing with extravagant flower gardens across the way. Spacious lawns, fountains and ponds with convenient seating allow you to contemplate the peace and beauty of this treasure amidst a busy neighborhood in Paris. DO NOT MISS!
lovely especially during springtime. no matter what time of year you are lucky enough to be in paris, the gardens are a must. But to be there in spring is an experience

Beware the playground costs!!. A lovely garden albeit fairly brown in winter. Not a lot of grass. Still it was nice to have a walk around. The playground looked like fun but we were there at 3.45pm and it was about to close. There is a fee to get in.
A nice park to have Sunday morning walks. You will find a lot of active Parisians there on Sunday morning: joggers, gymnasts, taiji enthusiasts, boat floaters (also grown-ups!) and walkers.
wander around. Great escape after shopping and eating on the streets , bring a book find a free chair under a tree and have a nice nap and listen to the sounds of Paris

Beautiful City Park - a Must See!. Luxembourg Gardens was only a few blocks from our hotel, but we didn't have a chance to visit until our last night in Paris. If we had discovered it sooner, we would have walked through the gardens more often, along with the other Parisians and tourists who stroll along the elegant manicured lawns and tree-lined promenades. Napoleon dedicated the park to the children of Paris, and, during the summer, many children come to ride the carousel or watch puppet shows. There's a beautiful fountain in the middle of the park. The original palace there is now home to the Senate - the upper house of the French Paliament. It's a great place to walk, jog,have a picnic, or just sit and relax. Allow at least an hour.

Comfortable and glamorous like visiting a rich aunt. . Such a beautiful place. We had temps in the 50's in December. There were many people there, but the park was not crowded. Only takes a couple hours, but is worth your time. Visit the museum (12e pp) while there. Classy and intimate. A great place to appreciate the artist being shown.( was Fragonard)

Beautiful haven in the middle of the city. In a city like Paris, so full of landmarks and attractions, it would sound a bit strange to recommend a park. But this one is really outstanding, beautiful at every time of year. Its gorgeous gardens provide a good free rest for those a bit tired of exploring the beautiful Left Bank. If you don´t fancy much seeing around the Senate, an interesting building just in the middle of the park, just enjoy this beautiful place: take some photos at Medicis Fountain, stroll around the park, or take a chair and sit for a while by the lake.

Beautiful gardens even in winter. This month has been particularly mild making the visit to the gardens around the palace particularly enjoyable. With sites to see at every step the gardens are well kept and def with seeing

Lovely place to relax and Chill. We came to Luxembourg in the afternoon on a lovely day( this not a good thing to do if it is raining) the gardens were beautiful and I expect they would be even better in summer. The down side to it was all the playgrounds require you to pay about 3 euro, so if you come to the park with kids bring some money. The lake is beautiful and I recommend this attraction for people wanting to relax and have a stroll on a sunny day.
Beautiful Garden!. I always visit this beautiful place when I am visiting Paris and I definitely recommend it specially in summer or spring.
Classy!. Nice and peaceful with all that you need for kids and adult. Meilleur en été mais il est luxuriant et en automne...

So Beautiful!. Luxembourg Gardens was a long walk from our apartment, but we didn't mind. The scenery was wonderful, and we took a well-deserved one hour stroll. We may come back to play some tennis, but for now we are satisfied with our visit. Will go again!
Just zipped through but in the summer would be wonderful. We just passed through and did not give these gardens the time they needed. Summer/spring/fall they would be wonderful.

My favourite place in Paris. Go for a long walk, play chess, or sit for a picnic. It's free - no charge to enter the gardens, but note the closing times (around 4:30 in the winter). There is also a big park with playground equipment where children can play.

Gorgeous any season. We visited during mid-December and this garden was still beautiful. Some flowers were still blooming due to moderate temps. Visit any time of the year. No charge for admission. Stroll by if you're in the area.

Nice for relaxing. The garden is big and pretty.
Have a lot of chair to sit.
If you are lucky you could have a nicer chair!
It's perfect for picnic or just chilling.

Beautiful gardens. The Gardens were walking distance from our hotel, we loved our morning strolls and also sitting at the chairs in the afternoon with a lovely bottle of wine.
The grounds are very well looked after, just lovely!
Stunning views. This is a must see in Europe! So beautiful...every where you turn! All different types of flowers and shrubs; some of these aren't available in the US.

Excellent Playground for the Kids. We stayed near Luxembourg Gardens specifically becomes of the playground. It has a toddler area and an area for older kids. Lots of play equipment and a padded floor to minimize injuries. Only downside is that there is a small fee to enter.
Lovely place to relax.. The Luxembourg Gardens were the perfect place to visit on a hot day. We found a nice shady spot to sit and watch a very competitive game of Bocce while eating ice-cream.

TAKE A LITTLE BREAK. Relax in the sun or under the trees. Bring your snack or enjoy something at one of the many beverage and foodies outlets. There are tennis courts and petanque areas and children can sail wooden boats in circles about the fountain in the central bassin. You are just next to the Quartier Latin, La Sorbonne, the Pantheon or the Senat waiting to be visited after your pause.We settled for a few chairs under the trees because because it felt a little too hot fully exposed and the sun was bright. Bye!
Great walk. A very nice place to have a walk. Nicely preserved even in December. Well worth it to have wonder there on your way down from the Pantheon.
Lovely. Spent the day in the beautiful gardens. Many shops nearby for food and drink, kids activities (paid) inside.

Beautiful. So worth visiting, especially if you like landscape architecture! The boats on the little late were fun to watch and the gardens provided a lot of variety to admire or just sit and people watch.

If you have nothing else to do, you can spend a day relax here.. We went there in a cold October day but sunny. There are some kids playing model boats. There are also some ducks playing in the pond. Other than that, there is nothing else interesting going on here. Good place to relax.

Favourtie place ion Paris. This was definitely my favorite place on 2 recent trips to Paris. Iv'e seen many things in my 18 days in Paris - Luxembourg Gardens became our sanctuary. Perfect place to sit in the sun and people-watch. Divine gardens with lovely outlook to the palace. A must see attraction

Wunderful park in the middle of Paris. Don´t miss the Luxembourg Gardens with a wunderful sunny day.You will enjoy it to walk in this wunderful park in the heart ofParis. Take the traffic outside and sit down and relax.
Peaceful!. Very nice to go for a stroll and just relax! We went during the winter so we didnt get to see all the flowers, but it was still a beautiful place!
Fun and Chill. The ambiance was nice. The crowd is acceptable. it is specially nice during nice weather. It 's good for chilling.

Nice but not amazing. Maybe it was because it was winter but this was not the most beautiful gardens I have seen in Paris and was over run by joggers so constantly looking out to make sure you didn't get in the way!

Would love to enjoy this place in the sunshine!. We were there the last week of November- it was COLD that week and not many people around that morning. A group of older people working out together- how great is that! Some people were sitting on the benches with newspapers and lots of runners ran by us. It's definitely an escape from the city. I really went here to see the Medici Fountain which sadly was closed off!! I couldn't believe it. They look like they were doing work on it, I was super bummed out that I couldn't get a closer look- they had gates all around it. We didn't spend that much time here, the wind was picking up and the rain was starting again, but I can see why so many people would find this THE place to go and enjoy a picnic in the Spring/Summer and early fall. It is beautiful. Very simple with its statues and ponds, but a place to stroll through on a warm day away from the hustle and bustle!

Beautiful Oasis in the Heart of Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are a wonderful place to sit and people watch in addition to admiring the gardens. The Palace is not open to the public but gardens are magnificent and great place to visit after a long walk through out Paris.
lovley gardens. in the heart of the 6 quarter Luxembourg gardens is a pearl.the gardens is a very good place to have picnic near the pool.

Wonderful green space to relax. Chill in the Luxembourg Garden instead of the side of the Siene River! Located south of the Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Garden is a green space centered around the Luxembourg Palace, but the garden itself is more beautiful than its palace. The park ground is well-kept and the two large fountains had many chairs for you to sit, so grab yourself a pastry from the nearby bakery and a book, and enjoy just relaxing by a beautiful Parisian garden!*Admission to the garden is free. The best station is the Luxembourg RER stop.

Walk amongst the statues. This is a large attractive park. There are many areas to explore. A playground for the little ones as well as a lovely garden to wander through and see the statues. The lake area is so peaceful and there are seats all around. A great place to relax and take in the history or just to have some peace and quiet.
The real Paris. I went there to rest from my long day of walking around Paris. And then I discovered a beautiful park where a lot a Parisians were having picnic and beers. It felt like paradise.

Sunday sorted. Having been to Paris before I really wanted to go back to Jardins du Luxembourg. What a pleasant place for Sunday morning. You can go running, stretching, do a martial arts or just watch the others and enjoy the outdoors.
Wander around. Nice to walk through the gardens, on our way to find the best baguette in town. Trees were bare but the park was full of life from hundreds of runners.

Beautiful Gardens and Statues. I saw these gardens from the 56th floor of the Montparnasse Tower observation tower and decided to walk over the next day. They were just near a university. The grounds are expansive. It was a fall weekday and yet there were many tourist there. It is a peaceful place to stroll and contemplate. The seagulls will swarm if you throw food in the air. Quite hilarious.
One of the world's beautiful gardens. What can be said ... beautiful, relaxing gardens to stroll after a day of touring or just to take in the Parisian atmosphere.

Wonderful place to spend time in Paris!. Spent the afternoon eating a late lunch that I grabbed at a early market here on Armistice Day. Even though it was cloudy and overcast - the place was bustling with families, couples, people. What a fabulous place to people watch, to soak in that which is only Paris.

Glamorous and big. I love these gardens : running, tennis, playing fields for children - it's got it all! Many tourists come here to take pictures but beware of the closing hours (usually pretty early!)

Relax. Wonderful garden in the middle of huge town. There is lot of flowers, trees and grass, but garden is worth seeing for people who take sun, eat... And of course there is families with little children. Walk, walk, walk... and enjoy! "Must place" in Paris, absolute.

Beautiful but not many flowers during fall . The garden was absolutely beautiful but not many pretty flowers during fall. I would like to return to Paris in the beginning of spring when the flowers start to bloom.
Nice. Its a really beautiful place but i believe that its not as beautiful in the winter as it us during the summer. But is a nice place to sit down and relax for a while.
Beautiful garden to take a breath. Our tour guide took us here. Wonderful experience of Paris with no lines. Love looking back on it on in our pictures.

Wonder. Went to this amazing place for the first time on a sunny winter day!
Let's say there is no other way to fall for it! I wish i could go play tennis there once in my life!
Beautiful any time of the day!. We wandered around lunchtime and then went back early morning to get more photos and each time was just a lovely.

Try not to miss spending a couple of hours here.. This beautiful park sets the gold standard for public parks. See what urban planning and a conscientious citizenry can do with a public park. No vandalism, no graffiti, no litter, dog or otherwise, just flowers, fountains, statutes, and trees, etc. Bring your own lunch, the Parisians do.

OK so I am biased.... My husband proposed to me here, so how could I not rate it excellent?! However, I must say the reason he did is because we find ourselves here time and time again when we are in Paris. We are drawn here by the serenity of the park in the middle of the bustling arondissement, the peace of the Parisians going about their routines and the simple beauty of it all. Go to read a book or have a picnic, try the petanque or get involved in one of the activities for children (good playground and a puppet theatre!).

For a relaxing interlude. Wandered around the Gardens between Catacombs and tour eiffel. A very welcome change of pace. As a gardening nut I was happy to see everything ... how they trim trees, the formal gardens, beds in the midst of being planted, autumn borders, and more informal areas. This is a beautiful space.

Time for a break and enjoy life for a moment. Luckily our whole stay in Paris was sunny and quite warm for April and so we enjoyed very much to stay outsides and did a 30mins break in the beautiful assembled Luxembourg Gardens.Life is great

Always something new. Have been here many many times and always find something new and wondrous to look at. Each season brings its own slant and exposes something that you didn't see last time although you were looking very carefully. Peaceful, calm, yet energising. Locals run, walk, do tai chi, yoga, sit, sail small boats on the lake, talk, meditate. Wonderful!
Deluxe Luxembourg. These gardens are just gorgeous! Beautifully designed and kept - and the locals just love them! Great place for an ice-cream or just to sit and read!

Couldn't stop singing Les Miserables. These are beautiful gardens, especially in the fall! We walked through them multiple times because they were close to our hotel. This is where Cosette and Marius meet, and its a fitting place. Really awesome for a stroll or picnic.
Even beautiful in the late fall. We arrived in Paris 12 hours after the attack. Walking through the gardens gave us a place to just relax and try to find some peace in times of such violence.
Heaven. Beautiful place for relaxing after long day in Paris.The best thing are the chairs everywhere. It makes relaxing more easier.

Beautiful and big, a must see.. These gardens are mind blowing. So big, so perfectly manicured, and so beautiful. My favorite time of the year to go is in Autumn when the leaves have changed color, and you can walk through the back parts feeling like you are in a mini forrest. It get's pretty busy in the summer and it can be hard to find a chair, but it's a perfect place to chill out and soak up some sunshine.

Gorgeous gardens to relax. There's so much going on in the Luxembourg Gardens. People are playing tennis, basketball and bocce. There are radio controlled boats on the lake/pond. The autumn trees were gorgeous. Numerous chairs are available which you can move around wherever you like. Sculptures to view and a children's playground. But note, you're not supposed to walk on the grass, which is something we're not used to. Great place if you want somewhere in Paris to take your purchases from the fromageries, patiesseries, boulangeries, fresh markets and charcuteries and sit back, relax and indulge.

A wonderful castle in Paris' most beautiful gardens. Located few minutes away from Sorbonne and Pantheon Jardins du Luxembourg are arguably the most beautiful and harmonious architectural ensemble surrounded by exquisite landscaping in Paris. Maria de Medici's selective artistic taste combined with centuries of incremental refinements and additions make these gardens a perfect place to immerse oneself in nature, reading, relaxing or just having a picnic. Not Monceau, not Viviani, not even Parque del Retiro in Madrid can come even close to these wonderful gardens.

Away from the hubub of the city. The gardens are a great place to people watch away from the hustle and bustle of Paris. There are other people there, but they also are getting away from the daily grind or touring.
Les jardins du Luxembourg. If you have ever heard the song by Joe Dassin, that will give an additional reason to wonder around and just have the pleasure of being here, lovely...
Perfect place for a jog in any season!. The Luxembourg Gardens is a wonderful place for a jog and to see local Parisians out and about for leisure!

A lovely place to spend a quiet afternoon.. While the gardens are not as spectacular as they are in the spring, they are truly beautiful in November. My husband and I spent a late afternoon walking around the gardens and enjoyed being among the Parisians taking pleasure in the final rays of a late autumn sun. There were many young mothers with prams, older men (perhaps professors from the Sorbonne,) and young lovers seating on benches and chairs that could be moved around to face the sun, or each other in the case of the latterMy advice is that you not leave Paris without spending some time in the Luxembourg Gardens..

A nice stroll in the center of Paris. Picnic here. Sit here. Relax. Stroll along the fountains. Do some tai chi. Play tennis. Watch the kids kick up leaves and play. Wear your running shoes and run amongst the parisians that are as fit as a fiddle!Find your inner peace here and find the biggest pigeon house you've ever seen! It is a great and fun find!
spectacular even in November. A stroll through these gardens is a must when visiting Paris. Bring a lunch and spend some time people watching here!
Beautiful gardens, and quieter spot in the Summer. My girlfriend and I shared a small picnic here after a long morning walk through Paris. A highlight of our time in the city.

Beautiful place to relax. Use this park while walking around the 6th and St. Germain. Beautifully landscaped, with many places to sit on a bench or the grass. Maybe have a picnic here. Good people watching here also.

Great relaxing place. A place where u find all age ranges that come to a peaceful place ... Some can read a book, others just lay down and indulge the beauty of the scen, kids playing... Amazing specially on a sunny day

A walk in the park in the late afternoon. I got here 30 minutes before closing. The park had students jogging and people strolling about. It wasn't as pretty as when was last here in the summer. The trees were semi bare, and the grown was damp from the recent rain. Looks like most people were visitors. The local were in the observatory park adjacent to this one. I would recommend going there if you have young children. It's livelier at this time of the year with many places to play.

Nice gardens south of the Seine. Pleasant and very Parisian gardens south of the Seine but still very central. There are usually a number of exhibits within the parks buildings that are more of a curiosity rather than being informative.
Beautiful gardens shame half were closed. We visit here often and it's such a great place to meander and chill out. This time due Tuesday the latest security measures, the place was off limits.

Stunning. This garden is absolutely stunning! The area is so very peaceful and well-manicured. My friend And I decided to walk through, but then we realized we needed to stop and enjoy it a while! Certainly worth a visit.
Relaxing. I visited Luxenburg gardens with my family. It is suitable both for kids and also for adults. A must see place in Paris.

Relaxing. It's always a wonderful garden to wander about, or sit and read. The large pots of flowers were blooming and the grass was a rich green, despite the trees being bare at this time of year. Comparing the seasons and changing landscape is interesting - I've been four times this year and there's always something new.
Reading. Best place to be with a good book,looping at The people,some of them are running or playing tennis or playing chests.Le Luxembourg can be quite or overcrowed,you always find a good chair .
So well manicured. Unlike in Australia, you should not access the grass. The gardens are simply beautiful - the lion statue is fantastic.
a wonderful place to stroll. Yes go - it is a lovely park, and so very Paris - well worth any detour. Enjoy the flowers and the strollers and the lfe all about. This is Paris at its best

Beautiful gardens in all seasons. Have visited these gardens many times and am impressed with the availability to sit on chairs supplied - freely - and bask in the sunshine or just watch the chic people pass by & meditate. Stunning flower displays. Can enjoy a glass of bubbly or a coffee in bistro inside gardens. Very civilised.
Wonderful . The gardens are enormous and very well maintained. In the autumn the sheets makes everything technicolor!

Iconic park. My young son will never forget this park, for it's unique feature: sailing miniature boats in the fountain pool. We'll never forget either, for this was one of the highlights of his young life.

Bring a latte and a book.... These gardens are absolutely amazing in autumn! It's so nice to relax here with a good coffee and read a book or even people-watch. A friend and I spent at least two hours just taking in the fresh air and beautiful surroundings. Make sure to stop here after lunch to unwind.

A secret of nature in Paris. I loved this place, we visited in the fall and it was just absolutely beautiful. If you go visit Paris, even if just for a short period, you really need to see this garden. There are a lot of children playing, parisians running and tourists strolling. Very romantic...
Beautiful to Stroll on a Sunny Day. The well laid out gardens is one of Paris's most well laid out. I love strolling and enjoying the green within the city.

A beauty amongst the Metropolis. Visiting this place for the first time in October, we were met with a stunning 'Summers Day' picture of loveliness. This Park although highly recommended in guide books, can't in my mind be recommended enough. It is tranquil, colourful, beautiful, incredibly well tendered and thankfully well visited by families, couples, individuals all seeking a moment of pure indulgence. Long may it reign!

Beautiful place for a coffee and a walk . We visited here in Autumn so the trees were bare but the flowers were still in bloom. It was a lovely place to sit and walk around. There is a little cafe where you can get a coffee and croissant. You can walk from Notre dame to here in about ten minutes.

A Sometimes Overlooked Treasure. Many visitors to Paris go to the Tuileries garden because of it is close to the Louvre, but Luxembourg Gardens are more beautiful and much more spacious. A large pond in the middle is one of the main focal points. Take the time to sit in one of the many chairs around the garden and watch the children (of all ages) playing with toy sail boats. Stroll the gardens viewing the many statues and the large variety of trees and plantings. This should be your pleasant day away from museums and shopping.
Beautiful Gardens!. Nice to relax with your partner, very romantic! It is also a good spot to have a picnic with wine and just relax in nice weather!

One of the most beautiful gardens in the world. A magnificent mix of statuary, fountains and fine examples of many species of trees,The Medici fountain is spectacular and a lovely tranquill spot to sit by.Particularly gorgeous in mid autumn.

A 'must do' in Paris. I have been many times. I like the weekends in summer when students spill into the gardens to court, play and make music. It is also a very community-based space for activities from entertaining young children safely to adult activity including Thai Chi. Beautiful vistas and spaces, horticultural development, great planting and individual standing works of art. Wonderful.

View . I'm in awe of the land scape and the views created by the talent which looks after these gardens. No litter, very peaceful and a lovely walk for anyone. Well maintained and suitable for all ages.
beautiful surrondings. if u love to see nice green and beautiful places, this is the place u should go and visit for sure, its not that great but i liked it a lot.
Wintertime is not the best time but still very tidy and tranquil. On a cold November day it was lovely to stroll through these lovely gardens en route to the museums...

The garden is simply gorgeous !. The garden is absolutely breath taking ! I went in the winter this time for its not that special but during spring its so colorful! recommended for romantic picnics =)

Home of the Senate. Toured the Gardens on an overcast, wet day.The flower beds were in a state of flux but it was obvious that the presentation would have been superb when in full flower. An added bonus was an exhibition on bees worldwide which was both cleverly presented and educational. The wrought iron fence provided the backdrop for the works - brilliant.

Amazing sunshine in November. A beautiful and peaceful half an hour just sitting watching the world go by in spectacular winter sunshine. On a bright day, I strongly recommend. What would be better in the summer but to take a nice red wine and sit with a book?

Beautiful free resource. Walked through the gardens today. It was about 4*C but sunny and just gorgeous in the gardens. Lots of people sitting in the chairs scattered all around the gardens to enable people to bask in the warmth of the sun & enjoy the views. A beautiful oasis.

FROM BON MARCHE TO LUXEMBOURG GARDENS. We love to shop at the Bon Marche for a half poulet, some pate, salami slices, a baguette, a demi bottle of wine and a pastry and walk down the Rue de Vaugirard and picnic in the Luxembourg Gardens. We watch the children play and young lovers kissing and we kiss too. This time the gates were chained. No admittance. The terrorists saw to that. The venues in Paris are closed but the heart of the city is still open.
Very nice.. Great place to spend a afternoon. And a good place to visit while in Paris. Near to public transport.
Beautiful on a Beautiful Day. A must do for a wonderful walk in the garden. It's relaxing to say the least. It's simply amazing that chairs are available for sitting in the gardens.

Beautiful Garden. Not a huge fan of gardens compared to other things -- I prefer walking around on streets and stopping at restaurants, cafes, pastry shops, etc. Still, the layout and atmosphere are amazing and particularly nice if you just want to sit in place for several hours or would be good with children.
great park to jog around on weekdays morning. If you are staying in the local area, the parc is a great place to do your 30 mins or more morning jog while experiencing Parisian park life

Beautiful garden. This is a great place to sit and relax with a baguette and soak up the very french atmosphere. I think there are more locals than tourists here so you get a little glimpse of what it is like to be a Parisian.

Large greenspace in downtown Paris. Paris is a large city full of narrow streets which was quite a change from the small village in the Alps we had visited as part of our travels. The day we arrived was getting on and this park was a short walk from our hotel. We passed the St. Sulpice Church which was worth the stop and not at all crowded. The park itself was large and green and a nice change of scenery from urban Paris. There were kids sailing boats in the large pond and all sorts of everyday people wandering around. Conveniently there were some pay public toilets as well. Definitely worth the time to stroll and relax away from the hustle and bustle of Paris.

Everyone enjoys it. On the left bank, close to St.Germain is a beautiful park that has been at the center of the Parisian life for a very long time. Go there on a Sunday when every thing else is closed and just walk around with luck you will attend a free concert from one of the many orchestras that roam around Paris. If you have children, they will love the place and so will you.

French Luxury in Luxembourg Gardens. If asked about what is my best and prefered gardens in Paris, i would definitely say The Luxembourg Gardens.Best season to visit is spring, summer and fall but, mainly, when everything is blooming. It's a colorful painter's palette with all those wonderful colors that brings luxury,peace and rest in this most romantic place of Paris.Unlike old classical gardens , it is made in a way english gardens are.Several little spaces of green where you could read, rest , listen to music, have a nap or sandwich or a romantic chat with your lover. Kids can watch Guignol, ride ponies, pushing little boats in the pond, play games and once tired taste some icecream. Adults, have chess, petanque"metal bowl game",tennis, basketball,reading, sunbathing, having a piknic on the allowed lawn (summer only),among all those marvellous statues, wonderful trees,peaceful ponds and a beautiful view of the palace of Luxembourg (senat house). In Summer season music is played at the kiosk.The good thing is that the gardens are at the center of Paris.

A Large, Charming Garden in the Heart of St. Germain des Pres. If you have some free time on a sunny day, a visit to the Luxembourg Gardens is in order. You can sit in the green metal chairs and watch people for hours, take a stroll, buy an ice cream cone and enjoy life like a Parisian.The gardens are behind the Musee du Luxembourg, a small museum that hosts exhibits for a few months at a time. On my last visit, I saw an excellent show of works by Fragonard. Their web site has all the pertinent information to help you plan a visit.

Beautiful place to pass the time . I had a few hours before my train and chose to read a book by the fountain. Couldn't have spent the time better. There was plenty going on in the park but it was never too loud, very relaxing environment. Plenty to see while walking around, too.
nice place to have a break during city tour. beautiful, silent place. It's a good idea to visit gardens during city tour - you can sit and rest :)
Nice place, nothing special. Compared to the other things to see in Paris I would have to say this place was OK. I would not go out of your way to see it.
Incredible garden. It is a very beautiful park. You can jogging or walk. Take a sit on a bench, read a book and relax! Take a camera with you so you can take great pictures.

Too big for two hours!. This is a special place to relax and take in the views of Paris and the gardens. A walk around this park will be the perfect respite to a hectic touring day. Within a block of the park there are great restaurants for an early dinner when the park closes at dusk.

Beautiful Gardens for a Walk or Picnic. By all means take a stroll around or picnic to the Luxembourg Gardens. It is located near the Pantheon on the west bank of the Seine. There is a grand lawn, shade trees, nooks, crannies, all inviting exploration. Suitable for young and old alike.
Absolutely Beautiful!. Would definitely recommend a visit, the gardens were just exquisite and it was such a nice place to sit down and relax.
back to 1800. its like a trip back to 1800 every step every view everything its romantic and this feeling its marvellous .

Picnic in the Park. The first time in the park we brought picnic supplies from a few blocks away. No tables, there are moveable green chairs everywhere. We made our own arrangement. Park was full of people of all ages, families. Kids were sailing boats, pushing off with long sticks. Flowers blooming, beautiful setting. Very large park, we only saw a small area. The next day we walked through after seeing the Pantheon. I couldn't find where we were on the map, talking in English (there are maps all over the park) and said "ici" which means here. A woman jumped off a nearby bench and pointed to the red circle that says "ici". That was very helpful. Once we were oriented we walked on the other side by the many playgrounds.

If you have small kids with you, this is where to come...and stay nearby. When our kids were little, we were told by our Parisian friends that this is where to bring the kids to play. Paris is generally not kid friendly, especially toddlers. Here they are treated as royalty. We always stayed nearby so we could stroll over there, and we loved every minute. Check out the nearby hotels.
Peaceful oasis. Grab a sandwich and make your way to a bench in the gardens. It's a beautiful place to relax and people-watch.

A quiet place to rest in a very busy city. The garden is a peaceful place to rest and enjoy viewing families with their children in a very busy and nosey Paris. The fountains and statues in the gardens are art in itself. Recommend you go and spend at least an hour and enjoy this quiet place..

Great place to take your camera for a walk!. If you're looking for a great garden this is one of the best places in Paris. I love watching the kids playing with sailboats in the large fountain. There are lots of photo-ops in the park - buildings, the fountain, gardens, statuary, tennis courts, people, etc.

Beautiful in the Fall. The Luxembourg gardens are among the most beautiful city gardens anywhere. Splendid in the summer, they are even delightful in the fall or winter. Just walk around, or sit and watch people (when it is not raining).

Where waiting for the beautiful season. Beautiful, in Spring, Summer and expecially in Autumn. In particular the Medici fountain ( s u p e r ! mix of Italian and French style ) and the round fountain, with small boat for kids.. as one century ago.. And very nice to walk (a romantic garden is hidden eìin French garden..!)

Peaceful escape from the nearby hustle and bustle. When you enter these gardens you will be amazed how peaceful and colourful the whole area is. The flower displays are superb and a lot of the office workers from close by obviously regard this area as a nice place to spend their lunch break in.

A "Don't Miss" in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is such a great place to wander around, enjoy the outdoors and have a picnic meal/snack and a bottle of wine! We've spent hours just lingering around the grounds and the pond, walking and people watching. Sit a while in the chairs and enjoy the day. It is an icon of Paris and a classic French outing.

Great place to have lunch. Do yourself a favor and break up your busy tourist schedule by buying lunch from one of the little local places nearby and come and sit down her and eat it. It really is a destresser!

Gardens that you should not miss on a sunny day!. I think it the most beautiful gardens in Paris. I loved spending there hours. My most favourite water fountain is there..Fontaine Medicis..Such a romantic place. You should walk around. The palace is beautiful (i did not go inside) but you feel like a princess walking in the royal gardens when you are there. You will see people exercising, running, doing martial arts, yoga etc. And there is a beautiful, little, artificial, octagonal lake, where children put little ships inside and they watch them sail around with the wind and I think you can rent little ships too. There are (free) chairs around the lake to sit down and relax.

Charming gardens in the heart of Paris. We have spent many afternoons strolling around the gardens or sitting and chatting by the large pond. This is a true slice of Parisian culture and life, just relax and enjoy. The gardens are beautifully maintained, with the orangeries exhibition hall just next door.

Great for walkers!. Stroll through the Latin Quarter on the river's Left Bank, past the Sorbonne to this great park. All kind of iconic statuary: Medici fountain. Don't miss the carousel, kids playground and marionettes. Great place for a picnic.

I love to go here everyday. This is one of the musts to go see if Paris. Relaxing, fun, beautiful and historical. In August I went everyday to sit and read. A true luxury in the middle of a great city

Most visited garden in Paris . This could be your peaceful green space to sit back relax and plan the next steps in ever buzy Paris Entry is free and you have a pond ,lots of chairs n tables to relax ,French senat building and fountain etc here.Ensure that you don't sit on grass or lawn unless where've it's specifiedBest enjoyed with a baguette crepe with a warm hot cofee

Beautiful and Relaxing. The perfect place to relax and take in the Parisian lifestyle. With beautiful gardens for miles, enchanting sculptures and a lovely pond this is the perfect place to relax on a hot day in Paris.
Tranquility in amongst the hustle of the city. Lovely chilled green space, well maintained and well used by the locals. We had a picnic here, very romantic.

Jewel of a park in the middle of Paris.. It reminds me of being somewhere outside of Paris with the large gravel walkways, neat rows of trees, the small pond in the middle and beautiful foliage with a palace at one end of the park. There are chairs scattered all around the pond. We relaxed and drank a coffee before strolling through the garden again. Seeing this at the beginning of fall colors was a treat.

Lovely visit to the Luxembourg Gardens. I was really happy to visit the Luxembourg Gardens on such a beautiful sunny November morning! The gardens are just beautiful and I was able to get lots of great photos. I would highly recommend walking though the gardens when in Paris. There are many benches and chairs in the park so you can stop and relax. We stopped at a bakery near the park and ate our breakfast there, it was lovely.
