Nice views with a variety of green spaces. Nice scenery and a great mix of colour. Not too easy to find as the street naming may bring some trouble. Worth a visit.

Peaceful place to people watch. One of my favorite evenings in Paris was spent enjoying the Luxembourg gardens. We purchased a bottle of wine and sat just beyond the greens of the gardens. It was a great place to people watch and relax... for free in the heart of Paris!
Free entrance. Not a must go, it just a nice garden with good landscaping, popular jogging place for local, better to visit during Summer time.

Be sure to stop for refreshments at Angelina's the the near end... Picturesque profusion of landscape design and floral abundance..A wonderful place for a respite from the bustle of traffic and noise. .

One of my favorite places in Paris.. Go early and make a day of it. Yes, Autumn and Spring is usually the most attractive seasons to fully admire this gem, but that doesn't mean you can't visit during summer or winter, although I haven't visited during winter.
Weekend people watching. Calm oasis in Paris with superb people watching. Bonus was the very young children riding small ponies in the park-- it looked like a lesson but was quite picturesque.
Beautiful surprise. The gardens were just across the street from our Airbnb apartment and are absolutely beautiful -- an oasis in the midst of Paris. Just wander, walk, sit, enjoy the beauty.
A great place to relax. Amazing gardens, just beautiful ideal for an afternoon stroll a coffee and plenty of opportunities for photos.
cool. this place is where you chill after a day of wandering around Paris. its beautiful. you can put your feet up and have lunch or coffee whilst pondering on which direction you go to next.

Lux. Such a nice stop for a few choice moments. Very relaxing. Went there close to evening time many years back, was lovely. This last year in 2015, took a quick trip over via metro on the morning we were leaving...crepes & coffee in the bright warm morning sun. Statues, and flowers are superb...and it's all free!

Great place to visit to savor a pastry, and soak in some rays, away from traffic.. Oasis of peace in the middle of a busy city :)
Stroll through the quiet gardens, sit on a bench, relax, give your feet a break...
The best garden.. The garden is the perfect place if you want to spend your evening in a relaxing mood. The flowers and the trees just seem to refresh your mood.
Join the French promenade. This is a fantastic place to just stroll and watch the Parisians do the same. Lovers, families, friends, joggers make it a place to see and been seen.

Beautiful in Autumn (esp. for photographers). More than anything the fallen brown leaves on the ground and pathways made for a photographers dream! Like many attractions around here there's no need to rush, if you're travelling to just tick the boxes you're in the wrong place, this is just a really beautiful place to slow down and take your time!

Beautiful!. Beautiful grounds, challenging in some areas for wheelchair users but much to be enjoyed. Went in Autumn, the fragrance of the leaves and air was wonderful, as were the changing color of the foliage.
splendid. Gorgeous, charming, beautiful fountain, lawns, flowers and crepes!! A photographers dream. Take a leisurely walk or sit and relax.

Actually a park, the Luxembourg Gardens should not be missed! I was a short walk from my hotel and was one of the high. It was a short walk from my hotel and was one of the highlights of my stay in Paris. I was particularly impressed by the giant tree near one of the entrances to the park that had an extremely long limb. A fulcrum kept the limb from touching the ground and was quite a sight to see. Other highlights to the park were the statues and grand buildings. Plan on spending about 4 hours.
Reading on a sunny afternoon. Used to go there to read in the sun, and enjoy an ice cream. Used to have a great time there though it tends to get crowded during summer time.

Relaxing and beautiful park. I always enjoy to have a walk in Luxembourg Garden , at any time of the year , its always beautiful and relaxing . A lot of flowers , beautiful old trees , many great sculptures and the romantic Fontaine de Medicis and the French Senat of course .Many chairs and benches where you can seat and read or just watch people passing by . You can also play tennis or if you have kids offer them a ride on poneys , and have a drink or a bite . Around the Garden there is always very good Photos Exhibitions .
This was a beautiful surprise. Wonderful garden which we really enjoyed. Still had many blooming flowers in October. Lots of beautiful statues. Interesting people watching. Lovely and colorful!

Keep off the grass!!!. A great place to visit on a warm Sufnay afternoon...sit around the pond and watch the kids play with the the toy boats. Several times we have been entertained by visiting groups performing oon the stage in the park. Great place to spend an hour or two enjoying a baguette and a glass of Rose...just don't get carried away and sit on the grass...unless you are in a designated "grass sitting upon area"!

In the heart of the city. My wife and I visited the Luxembourg Gardens in October. The gardens were still lovely at this time of year. There are numerous tables and chairs for you to sit and take in the beauty of these gardens. We are big fans of green space like Luxembourg in the heart of the city. Will always visit when we return to Paris

Luxembourg gardens. This attraction is close to our hotel and a lovely place to sit in the sun and people watch. There are buildings you can tour but after a long sleepless flight we found the tranquility of the gardens just what we wanted. There is no admission charge into the gardens and many spots to sit and enjoy the flowers that are still blooming and the magnificent trees

Quiet and Peaceful. If you want to decompress and get away from the swarms of people this is a great place to stroll or just sit and relax. The gardens are beautiful and the park is filled with locals exercising and enjoying life around the fountain. We did not enter any of the buildings but we did spend 2 hrs relaxing and enjoying the peacefulness.

The best gardens in Paris. All seems perfect, even when it's crowded. The lakes, the grass, the palace, everything fits perfectly. You can sit on the chairs around the gardens or lay down on the grass. Any option is perfect to relax and enjoy a perfect afternoon.

A walk in park in Paris. Excellent place to grab a formula (baguette, drink and pastry) for lunch (from one of the sellers at the front gate) and relax by the pond and enjoy your surroundings with the locals. Gardens are well maintained.

Peaceful and lush. Really enjoyed walking around this park and taking a break from the equally gorgeous architecture that surrounds it. Go to the fountain with a takeaway sandwich and relax on the chairs!

Nice park with alot og chairs/benches. Went to Luxembourg Gardens to relax after a day of shopping. Brought a blanket hoping to find a place to have a picnic. The park was mostly gravel, and not grass as we were hoping for. Nivce buildings and a cosy small pond with small boats.
Not worth the time if you are limited. Unless you spend a lot of time in Paris, DONT GO. There are many many other things to see. It is just a big park more than a garden
Nice break. Lots to and lots of people everywhere and then it all slows down when you get to these gardens. Beautifully arranged and cared for and a compliment to the Palace. Really a wonderful place
Beautiful Symmetry. Just returned from Paris and the gardens still have plenty of flowers and gorgeous mums. A serene park,plenty of chairs to stop and literally smell the roses and people watch.

Beautiful any time oof the year!. We visited in October and it was still a gorgeous experience. Great place for taking photos and people watching. We strolled through the gardens and enjoyed every minute!

Our Favorite Paris Garden!. This fall we had but a couple of days in Paris at the end of a week in southern France. The very first thing we did was to walk to the Luxembourg Gardens. It was a sunny day in late October; flowers were basically red; and the pool was crowded with sailboats, almost as there was a race or a contest. We sat and watched people stroll amidst the majestic statues of (mostly) French queens, and then we strolled past the puppet theatre (everyone should see a performance, whether or not one understands French), the kids playing on swings, etc., and on past the tennis and pétanque players. This a park for unwinding and flaneuring.
Wow. Having done gardening for many years, this garden just stopped me in my tracks. It is truly excellent with it's symmetry, it's statues and the gardens. A true highlight of our trip.

Now THIS is a garden. Impressive landscape. Enjoyed every second of my visit there. All corners of the garden are designed to impress. The garden is very well maintained and there's always a good spot for everyone to just sit and relax. Parisians should be proud of this garden. If only we have anything close to this where I live.
Relax and enjoy with children. We were lucky to be there on vacation period for kids and my son had an excellent time! You can rent a toy boat and push it around the pond! Great fun!

Great place for a walk. Went here specifically to see the garden. It's a great place to stroll if you need a break from the art museums or sight seeing. Lovely garden and a great place for kids since they have a place where you can rent toy sail boats and then sail them in the fountain.

Fantastic place. This was a big hit with our family. The playground is very nice. True, you can visit ones just as nice for free in London, but the admission here is still reasonable. Best thing is the boats in the octagon fountain. Beautiful old-world fun for everyone.
Favorite Park in Paris. Beautiful flowers, paths to walk, chairs to seat.... We enjoy reading the morning paper in the park. Bring a croissant or a snack and people watch on a beautiful day.
Perfect place for chilling out. Nice, beautiful garden and many place to sit and chill out, and there are many places shops to bring quick food to eat.

A Very Pleasant Surprise. Of all the Parisian sites and attractions recommended to us before our trip, I'd never once heard we should go to Jardins du Luxembourg. Our first day, after arriving in the city around noonish and suffering from severe jet leg and a night without sleep, we decided to take a walk around to the sites around our flat. We saw that the gardens weren't far away and decided to check them out. They were beautiful! We got a hot cup of coffee nearby and then stopped near the water in the center and had a seat in the chairs. It was a very relaxing stop for weary travelers.
Nice and relaxing. We had a nice walk around. We also chilled on the bench and enjoyed the afternoon. It's a nice place, maybe a little smaller then we expected.

Great place to enjoy the day. This place is great to sit back and enjoy the day. We decided to grab some food and eat in the garden near the fountain. After our little picnic we strolled around the whole garden. We even saw a man sailing his boat in the fountain. Just a relaxing place.
Peaceful.. Beautiful gardens, a lake in the middle, plenty of chairs to sit and people watch. A perfect place to sit and escape the bustle of Paris.
So beautiful and romantic..... Just like they came out of a fairytale... Full of trees and green, a lake with beautiful flowers in front of it, sculptures of queens a lil further... peacefull!

Nice place to stroll or relax.. We walked through here on the way back to Sainte Chappelle and there was families and joggers everywhere. These gardens are huge and have multiple different areas of gardens and recreation type areas. Well maintained.

Peaceful city escape. This is one of the nicest green spaces in Paris. Always well maintained and lovely atmosphere. If you go in the morning you will see runners and lots of people doing Yoga. Also there is a lot of Boules played here. Usually yopu can grab a free deck chair and relax. On this occasion I went on a Sunday and as it was a beautiful day the park was extremely busy. Still enough space to find a quiet corner.

Jogging in Paris. Not far from our Hotel on Rue de Buci are the Jardin du Luxembourg. The garden today is owned by the French Senate, which meets in the Palace. -covers 23 hectares, It is known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, the model sailboats on its circular basin, and for the picturesque Medici Fountain. If you like to relax in a garden setting and feel like you are becoming a Parisian head here for a jog or a stroll. My husband always goes for an early morning jog and this was one of his favourite running places in Paris. Great if you want to sit and have a picnic lunch instead of paying for a cafe style lunch. Go to a supermarket and buy some fabulous delicatessen cheeses/meats/bread and fruit and relax. Just lovely and it's free.

Beautiful. We visited in September which is probably not the best month for garden viewing, but it was beautiful (I can only imagine how stectacular it was during the summer). Our time was short, so we didn't get to see the whole thing, but you can tell it is well used by the locals and we can certainly see why.

Just soooo beautiful park. It is beautiful walk in the park, water basin with chairs around it to see and enjoy the view or read a book. In the middle of the city ,great place to take a break and rest before starting over trotting around beautiful paris

Maybe better in the spring/summer. We love going to parks when traveling so our friends recommended Luxembourg Gardens. The highlight of the park is definitely the gardens in front of the Palace. While pretty, I had expected more. We did see this in October, so it may be more impressive in the spring/summer. The rest of the park is geared toward locals with tennis courts, etc. but there are nice tree covered paths to walk along. While nice, it wasn't a park that made me want to grab a snack, sit down and just enjoy my surroundings.

Relaxing spot on a summer day. During a relaxing trip to Paris last summer we had our lunch on one of the many park benches and then practiced some sketching. Felt a bit pretentious but it was wonderfully relaxing! Walking distance from Boulevard Saint Germain.
Beautiful. Strolled through the gardens. Didn't spend a lot of time there. Weather wasn't great on the day..such a shame. It's on the do over list.
in the heart of the town. We enjoyed walking in this park, I have read about it in many stories, books.Dont forget the museum in north of park, with the same name, if you like museums.

Large park vwithin the city. I took my children there on a sunny day and they had a blast. It is perfect for kids who want to exercise their legs, romantic for couples, beautiful and relaxed setting to pause and read a book. Definitely recommend
Beautiful Park for Children. This Park was built for the children of Paris, and it's still a wonderful place to spend a relaxing afternoon.
Je Jardin du Luxembourg. Pull up a chair, sit & enjoy watching the kids playing with their boats & feed the birds. There is a Luxembourg stop on the metro Not packed with tourist. Beautiful.

spend the whole day. you can spend the whole day
there are some chairs , benches
lawns for play
fountains for mist
trees for shade
food stands
carrousel for kids (for a fee)
easy to walk if disabled, babies, big group

Peaceful, glorious and more.... You can run or walk, watch older people playing some games or children playing at the big playground, or just sit and enjoy in nice environment looking at the glorious Luxemburg palace.

amazing views. I visitied Paris last December. Jardin de Luxembourg (Luxembourg Gardens) was amazing with its leafless trees. Go there and fill your lungs with fresh air. The gardens are very easy to reach !

Beautiful, Diverse Garden. These gardens seem to have something for everyone: beautiful flowers, a pond, a wonderful children's play area complete with a little zip-line, tennis courts, and a cute little puppet theater, just to name a few. I was impressed with the colorful flower beds they had in late October. There are comfortable chairs we enjoyed sitting on while sipping our morning coffee. Lovely start to the day and a great place to leave the noise of the city behind.

Still a treat in autumn. Just a relaxing stroll while still having the senses flooded with history and horticultural finesse. Love the big pond with children guiding primitive toy boats around the water.

Beautiful Grounds. My husband was feeling sick and it was cold out but I forced him to come along with me. we walked around the park once but it was really pretty and worth it. I know he wasn't feeling well so we had to move on quicker then I wanted to. But since it was cold I knew this was my only chance. I would walk the grounds again if I ever go back to Paris. I believe it would be gorgeous in the spring time.

Beautiful park. We didn’t spend too much time here. It was chilly so we just did a walk through on our way to the Pantheon. It was a gorgeous, large park that had a very nice looking children’s play area. I actually think our children were a bit jealous of the play area, compared to those in the U.S., even though they have outgrown them. The water fountain area was cute, children were launching sail boats that a vendor was renting. There was a line for this so we didn’t pursue it, no idea what it costs. If we ever went back to Paris I would probably plan a picnic in the park or something of the sort.
Wow!. Beautiful garden, especially changing of the leaves in October! Very quiet retreat from the busy Paris. Brought pastry from onsite cafe and walked around the grounds all morning long. Must see!
Relaxing. Green oasis in the middle of the city, with a big fontain in center where theyused remote controlled sailboats. I believe you can rent one, but we didn't so I'm not sure.

Perfection. Love these gardens, one of the best places in Paris. My husband and I were married in front of the Medici Fountain this July in Paris. We had a photographer take pictures of us throughout the ceremony and for an hour after throughout gardens, they came out beautifully. Truly a special place for us in France.
The best in Paris. Really, really really beautiful!! You can spend the entire morning here that you won't regret!! Besides its beauty, it has also a great energy! It's a must go!

Great public space.. Renting the city bikes in paris is the best way to explore the city, and cutting through Luxembourg Gardens is no different. This public space is enjoyed by all, and connects a lot of the city's attractions without all the traffic.

Why I Fell In Love With Luxembourg Gardens. The best part of Paris after the Seine and Eiffel Tower, this is one garden that has a rich historical value besides also being a contemporary landmark. There are small boats in teh park too that can take kids for a sail.Paris comes alive at the Jardin du Luxembourg. In fact, there is also the Théâtre du Luxembourg insides that exhibits superb shows for kids such as Three Little Pigs.Visit round the year and do not miss out on the pony rides at the spot.

A Special Place. Luxembourg Gardens are one of my fav go to spots in Paris. We walked a mile or two through Paris to get to the Gardens after a 3 hour hedonistic lunch at L'Attelerie Joel Robuchon. The day was brisk but sunny. and the Gardens were teeming with people--old, young, kids running around, rings of laughter everywhere, healthy and happy, the Gardens were colorful and playful. Autumn colors were everywhere.I found the spot where a Gendarm chased me out of the Gsrdens a few years ago for coming too close to a flower patch and we moved everywhereAll in it was a great visit. Late afternoon the Gendarmes blew their whistles and chased us out, and even this ritual leave-taking was fun. We'll be back!

Great Place to Experience. Luxembourg Gardens are a great place to experience Paris. You can observe the beautiful gardens and orchards. You can also see great games of tennis locals playing chess or just people watch. It is a great place to sit by the gardens or fountain and relax.
One of Paris' hidden treasures. We stumbled along these gardens by accident and it was a true blessing. The gardens were amazing and there was such a lovely atmosphere.

Love the whole set up of this place. Just walking through we see a well planned Luxembourg place with trees alongside & chairs for relaxation. They have also little sail boats for hire for kids & parents in the big fountain. Love it!

Walk in the park. Unique not so touristy experience. This is one of those places where the locals go and most tourists miss. Don't miss sailing a little toy boat on the pool especially if you are visiting with kids
Stunning park. It was beautiful sunny weather and the park was the perfect place to be on a day like this. plenty of places to sit and no shortage of seating.

It is easy to see why.... It is easy to see why Hemingway spent so much time here. I do not think it was just because of the pigeons. Go during the off season. Stroll around, sit and enjoy the views when you get tired. Personally, I would go here every day if I lived there..
Lovely gardens. Really nice gardens to walk through whilst exploring Paris very large gardens and very well maintained
Nature's beauty in Paris. Breath taking views, colors. With good weather you can pic nic calmly and enjoy the great vibes. Loved it.

Best Jardin in all Paris. Paris has many beautiful parks but Jardin du Luxembourg is my favourite. For kids there is a great adventure playground and the Théâtre du Luxembourg which puts on puppet show of Three Little Pigs, Pinnochio and Little Red Riding Hood. The theatre is very popular so plan you visit and get early if you want to see a show. There are also pony rides, tennis, basket ball courts and spaces just to sit and relax, meditate, jog... All of these things go on. The grounds are splendid and well maintained all year round. Not to be missed
Vey beautiful.. I went on the winter, the trees were all dead.But it was a very beautiful place. Had some pretty pictures taken there.I wanna go in the summer time, so there will be flowers.

Beautiful and relaxing. I spent a while here as I was waiting for someone. It was a warm sunny day and I had a lovely time in the beautiful gardens, people watching. There are lots of places to sit and a large pond. A guy arrived with some boats for children to sail on the pond during the morning.A lovely quiet spot.
Beautiful during the summer. I was there last summer. It was beautiful, with a lot of flowers! Nice to have a picnic or even a borrow of vine.

In every season. I am passing by luxembourg Gardens almost every single day. And honestly? It is not enough! Every season is so different. Colours, people, ambiance... I recommend to everyone to stop here for a while and just relax and take up a bit of energy for the ensuing discovering the beaty of Paris.
Beautiful day . Very nice and clean gardens. Its good placeto relief all weeks stress. Although it closes early in the winter months.
While in Paris, do what Parisians do, go there on Sunday mornings. Tai shi groups, joggers, open space chess players,.. right in the middle of the city and so far away!
unexpected place. It was not planned on my tour, but suddenly I found it. Its very beutiful, peaceful and colourful. In spring must be totally different, but in autumnn was very nice! Pass by!

A delightful garden much used by the Parisians. We came across this garden by chance, but we were very impressed. There is a nice café where you can sit under the trees and imagine you're sitting in a Renour painting. There is a very large pond where children can play with toy sailing boats, a lovely area.

Pond life, but not as we know it. It is lovely to wander through the gardens on a sunny day and watch the 'children' sailing their boats in the central circular pond or watch the tennis matches, of all abilities, taking place. There is lots of seating available throughout the gardens as well as cafes to eat in/at. In short,a ideal place for a sunny week-end wander.

Nice garden with a beautiful pond. It is a beautiful garden which is great for walking around.
There is even a playground where kids will be able to enjoy themselves.
There is a pond in front of the house, where kids are able to rent RC controlled boats.
The house was splendid.
You will be able to sit around the garden and enjoy the weather.

A magical spot to spend a sunny afternoon in Paris. This is a fantastic place to bring a book, a glass of wine, some cheese, some McDonald's (whatever), pull a few chairs together and just enjoy the pleasure of doing nothing in Paris. It's a truly gorgeous garden with beautiful trees, flowers, architecture, and even the Eiffel Tower in one corner. Tourists seem to hang out behind the Louvre, but Parisians seem to come here. A brilliant place -- not to be missed! Surrounded by good transit connections or a pleasant walk from the river.
Beautiful. Very beautiful.One of the most impressive public spaces I have ever seen. A must visit..Love this place gave beautiful memories

Autumn in Paris. We visited here in late october as the leaves were changing and the park was awash with vibrant colours. The sun was shining and it was a fantastic day. There is plenty of chairs scattered around so you can sit and relax for hours. certainly worth a visit.

Great, even in Autumn. We visited at the very end of October and were happily surprised at the array of flowers still in bloom. The house looks spectacular and the large amount of seating makes it easy to find a comfortable spot.There is very little litter and the trees look beautiful in their autumn colours.Be aware that the toilets close promptly at 5!!

RELAXING. After visiting the museum we decided to take a taxi and visit these beautiful gardens that had been recommended. It was a very relaxing walk, the gardens are really beautiful. On leaving we walked to the Pantheon and then took another taxi to our hotel.
Relaxing!. After days of running from place to place to see all of Paris we came here, and it was stunning and relaxing. So peaceful to sit and just watch people go by, Lovely place.

A Beautiful Garden. While in Paris we decided to walk through the Luxembourg Gardens and we are so glad we did. It was a beautiful place to spend a few hours. Quiet, peaceful and beautiful. An amazing garden in the middle of a large city.

Last day in Paris. On our last day in Paris we went to Luxembourg Gardens, it was magnificent and beautiful. It looked like something from a movie. It was a warm, relaxing atmosphere, people sailing their small boats in the pond situated in front the house, children playing, birds flying and chirping. It just gave me a cozy feeling being there.

Relaxing time. On our walk back to the hotel one sunny Sunday we picked up some food/drinks and spent some time sitting in chairs (seemed like we were with many locals) lounging around enjoying the sun & atmosphere. There were many families with young children around. We walked around the gardens and saw the numerous statues. It was really a wonderful relaxing way to rest our tired feet after 6 hrs of walking in Paris :)

Very Beautiful. The Luxembourg Palace at the Luxembourg Garden is exactly what I expect to see in Paris. All the history books and pictures you see of France and how it looks like, and I don't know how to explain how this is the definition of what someone expect Paris to look like without ever visiting this amazing city. Try to find the Statue of Liberty!

Flowers in October. The Luxembourg Gardens are a spacious and peaceful park, just right for strolling, looking around, floating a small sailboat or little speedboat, playing petanque, or even grabbing a game of tennis. What surprised me was how lush the gardens were, particularly so late in the year. O, another nice surprise, seeing one of France's top actresses casually walking through the garden toward the Boulevard St Michel.

honeymoon destinations day 4. these gardens a truly magical with its manicured lawns statues, fountains and large vases full of flowers. it seems to be the go to place for the people of paris too as the gardens were full of people lounging around enjoying a late afternoon.

THE BACK YARD OF PARIS. This is a don`t miss park to visit. Has to be one of the world`s best `freebies`especially in expensive Paris. The locals call this their back yard and I would too if I lived here.
Very cool. If you are in Paris for more than a day you should bring a picnic lunch and bottle of wine and spend a few hours here. The flora and architecture of this park are beautiful.

Something for everyone. Beautiful gardens. The flowers were magnificent. I loved the lake in the middle with sail boats for kids. The various statues are nice.When in this garden I felt like I saw many different things as each area offers something different. We will definitely visit again.
Lovely and relaxing . Needed a break from the rush if the city and this was perfect. Beautifully well kept gardens in the heart of the city

Beautiful and serene garden. A nice quiet place to rest and eat a sandwich while admiring the autumn foliage. Less crowded than Tuileries. There is a paid toilet (0.50 euro) in the center of the garden. Beautiful and well maintained garden, make me feel like I am away from the hustle and bustle of the city. One of my fave place in Paris.

A lovely oasis.. Paris has many beautiful gardens throughout the city. This one is very special. Once inside the gates the frenetic pace of Paris slows down and one can reguvenate. It is very large. Would take a long time to stroll through the whole park. A particular delight is finding a vacant seat around the lake and watch the little sail boats while eating lunch or enjoying a cafe. Well worth a visit if only to recharge the batteries.
Sunshine walk. Still beautiful in October and great for a sit down and some bread and cheese while watching locals enjoy.

a wonder to experience. there are many gardens to choose from, in and around Paris, and this one is a gem. set away from most of the others, and a bit of a trek if you are based on the other side of the Seine, but well worth the effort. a huge variety of plants, shrubs, statues and works of art/sculptures to capture you whilst you stroll around the grounds. if you get tired there are seats and benches dotted around (in plentiful amounts) and you can easily take a leisurely stroll, picnic and recharge your batteries.
Beautiful Gardens. Nice place to relax, enjoy a nice stroll with your loved one. Sit down talk and drink a nice hot cup of coffee.
earthly beauty. In Paris, all you can see. Also the Luxembourg gardens.Choose a sunny day, if you're lucky.they're beautiful in daylight
Truely Magnificent. A visit in autumn is a must. We came and saw and didn't want to leave. The colours were amazing. You can wander for hours

Wonderful. This is time well spent. I visited with a family member in October, and even then the grass was beautifully cared for and flourishing, and there were still roses in bloom, as well as many others. If I ever make it back to Paris, I will be sure to visit this lovely spot again, hopefully in summer to get the full effect of the gardens.
Wonderful. If you can spare half a day, and enjoy a walk, these Gardens are quite the spot. Sumer and fall are the best.

Great playground for kids up to age 10. Entrance fee about 2.5 euro for kids and 1.5 for adults but a nice clean well looked after playground with some good equipment and climbing frames. The playground is set in a lovely park which is walking distance from Notre Dame/ The Pantheon and Montparnasse tower.

sunny afternoon in Paris. Spent an afternoon lolling in the sun, picnicing near the boat pond and watching the locals play bocce ball...all surrounding by the lovely gardens.
One of my favorite places to relax in a busy city.
Beautiful well maintained gardens!. Well maintained & artistidally designed gardens! Lots of open space, boating lake for model sail boats & cafe!

Took my breath away. Too much to say and photos do not do it justice! Beautiful flowers, ponds, fountains and statures everywhere! Didn't have as much time here as I would have liked, couldn't see everything this gorgeous Paris garden had to share. A great place to walk through or sit awhile and take it all in. If I ever get back to Paris, I will make this garden a priority!

Romantic travel in time. This place transports you to a different time, where life moved at a different pace. Romantic garden, where you can sit and relax for hours, the perfect arrangement of flowers, the classic (and classy) feel of the building and pool. It seemed like a lot of people and their kids enjoyed the boats, i personally felt lile they didn't belong in the picture, just a way to get xtra money from the place.

summer dreams. the bset place to be in the summer heat. sitting on a metal chair or at the border of the pond where small sailling boats are using the wind to go to the order site to enjoy the childeren and some adults as me. dreaming away to your earlier life when you see those beautifull gardens and bildings from centuries ago. Just sitting, relax away from noisy paris.

Peace and tranquility in Paris. Escape the hustle and bustle of downtown Paris and enjoy a peaceful sojourne in the beautiful and restful Luxembourg gardens. By using the multi-line Montparnasse metro station the gardens are only a 10 minute walk away. And on the way a large number of reasonably priced eating establishments offer a range of ethnic delights. Take a picnic to the gardens, sit on the ever-availlable chairs and breath in the colour and aromas of the flowers in this haven of peace..

A Peaceful Paris!. A Sunday (the one they designated as no-cars) in the Luxembourg Gardens was the most peaceful, uplifting spot we have found in Paris. Peaceful because we could sit in the October sunshine, read a book, people watch, and just enjoy being together. Uplifting because we saw so many families enjoying their time together. Mothers and Fathers were enjoying watching their children sail the little boats, just spending time together, laughing and playing. What a lovely time we had here!

Oasis in the heart of Paris. This was a peaceful place to just sit and relax after some frenetic cycling through the traffic of Paris. The gardens are beautifully designed and easy to walk in. Definitely recommended.
The heart of Paris. Four visits to Paris and the Luxembourg Gardens remains my favorite. I could spend whole days here. It's as moody and romantic in 2015 as it was when we first visited in 1984.

Peaceful place in a busy city.. We had to swing through Luxembourg Gardens for a couple of hours. What a treat to lay in the grass and just chill after a busy day of hiking through Paris. We got drinks and snacks and just watched people being people. Make sure to swing by the pond where kids from all over the world sail toy boats. Do not visit Paris without giving these gardens at least an hour of your time.

Central Park Feel with a Parisian Twist. Fun enough to explore. Lots of people out and about just chilling, relaxing, chillaxing... it gave the wife and I the impression that this was something similar to Central Park for New Yorkers but for Parisians instead. If you're headed somewhere and this is on the way, definitely worth a leisurely detour to check out. It's free too. Can't beat that!

A Place to Rest. Extensive gardens surrounding a large pool. The pathways are well maintained, with sculpted trees, hedges and statues. The flower gardens beckoned you to stop and admire their beauty. The pond has a huge fountain filled with rented remote control colorful sail boats. The pond and garden area is full of park benches and chairs for you to sit, relax and enjoy the beauty. Many locals come here to relax with a bottle of wine and people gaze.

expansive. Whether you want to just relax, sketch, have a coffee or stroll; you can spend an entire day here just on the grounds. I was solo but many families with children were there and sailing little boats. Obviously the buildings' architecture is awesome and historical. I needed 2 days to cover it all but it is not necessary to see everything. There are several entrances. I entered for free so I am not sure if you have to pay at another entrance or not. Even with a drizzly day I was able to find shelter under the trees and had a very relaxing, no touristy line-up day!!!!!!!!!!

Large and Peaceful!!!. Good place for a nice evening stroll in the centre of the city. It was beautifully maintained and easily accessible. We culd find kids playing, people jogging, moms with their babies and people just sitting and doing nothing!

Hire the yachts grest fun for the kids. At 3.50 per hslf hour ot was one of the best value tjings we fid in Paris allowed the parents to sit on the plentiful deck chairs whilst yhe kids ran around the pond sending the boats back across to thr other side. Non motorised no remote control just the wind snd sails good old fashioned fun

Amazing. No other words to explain.. Its Amazing. The beauty of the greeneries. the Birds, the water fountains, the loving couple all around the world, the playing kids, the joggers, the reading atmosphere, the silence amidst the crowd....and the list is more. you 'll forget time here.

Beautiful . Bought pastries from a little bakery on Port Royal and enjoyed them in the sunshine in this beautiful garden. Lots to see and do- a great way to relax and escape the hustle and bustle for a while. Loved the little sail boats for children to rent and the ponies too. Absolutely stunning in Autumn.

Lovely. Lovely park. The house sits infont of the duck pond which on a sunny day glistens beautifuly. Great to have a stroll round and see the pretty fountain. Feels like you are away from the hustle and bustle.
Beautiful spot in heart of Paris. A little gem in the centre of Paris. We went here for a breakfast picnic one morning and weren't dissapointed. Calm atmosphere and beautiful scenery.
Must visit. A nice stroll around the gardens helps you complete Paris trip. This is easily accessible by metro. You need to spend one full day just to have a nice stroll and feel the garden

A Slice of Parisian Life!. First heard of this park and its gardens when i was a young student in French class, and i knew i wanted to visit the legendary grounds. Found immaculately maintained pathways, well pruned trees and hedges, and statuary that fulfilled every expectation of mine. I watched three generations of women, adoring their youngest girl-child, and an older couple enjoying their iced sorbets. Sat on a classically French green bench and read in the sun till i too felt as French as my surroundings. Went back the next day and the next.

Beautiful lawns and gardens. Was a beautiful spot to get away from the hustle of the city, easily walked here from Notre Dame in 30 minutes. The pond with the remote control sail boats were cool to watch. Perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine and just relax.

A park, beautiful gardens and a regal Palace all in one place. Great for a stroll. What Europeans call a garden, Americans consider a park. The Luxemburg Gardens have both, a park and gardens, plus the beautiful Luxemburg Palace. My favorites were the two pristine lawns and the huge fountain that sit directly in front of the Luxemburg Palace. Each lawn is adorned with a beautiful marble statue and is surrounded by lush flowers. The lawns and fountain have chairs all around them for you to sit and relax in, its very European and very nice. There’s a large gravel walkway that loops around the park, its lined with a statue of France’s past Queens, they’re really great to look at and see the years of each of their reigns as you stroll through the park. It was easy to picture these Queens taking the exact same walk in this beautiful palace garden. The Palace itself was beautiful and regal, you can only see the front of it from within the garden but its stunning and well worth it.I was able to get a Nutella crepe and a glass of wine at one of the parks little kiosks. We found a restroom over by the children’s playground and paid the attendant a few cents to use it, safe and clean.

A spectacular park. The Luxembourg Gardens is a gem of a place that features many activities -- from tennis, chess and boules to jogging, walking and just enjoying the beauty of the immaculately landscaped grounds and the Luxembourg Palace looming over it all.

Take time to enjoy this gem and watch locals and tourists relax. Great to enjoy on a sunny arvo; pull up a chair and kick back for an hour or two if you can. Great picnic spot and you can easily combine with a visit to the Montparnesse tower.
Perfect for a picnic!. Lovely gardens to visit during your stay in Paris. I love taking a stroll around this place in the late afternoon. There is a lovely light during the sunset time.
Beautiful Gardens!. We visited in early October so the plants were all fall plantings that are not my favorite compared to summer plants.

Beautiful place for a walk. This large park is a beautiful place for a walk. On a sunny autumn day, it was lovely with all the trees changing colours. There are loads of activities; playgrounds, tennis courts etc.If you're feeling lazy, there are numbers of chairs and benches where you can take a rest and just enjoy the peace and quiet.

Wonderful place. We had friends take us here on a walking tour of the city. In the summer it would be fabulous, but even on a late fall day it was beautiful. Mostly Parisians who use it and it was interesting to see the children around the lake.

Great place to run in!. Got here early in the a.m. Sat my husband by the pond and off I went. As my laps increased, so did the number of joggers. Very motivating. We were staying close enough, so we walked. Just be careful, if you are early you might get sprayed by the street cleaners😄

Excellent for a nice relaxing walk. The Luxembourg Gardens is not so much a destination, but a place to go when you are burnt out on the other Paris destinations. The Gardens are beautiful. It was nice to see a few couples enjoying a their bottle of wine on their park benches.
Running in Paris!. This is a beautiful park and a great place to run while in Paris. Clean and well maintained. If you are staying anywhere near the Gardens, I would highly recommend it!

My favorite!. I have a favorite tree, a favorite area that I have to see each time......love the men playing chess! I have seen it in summer and fall and it is always beautiful and worth the time to walk through and experience the flowers and fountains....

beautiful refuge in the middle of the city. Always a relaxing respite in one of our favorite cities. Plus it's free, so what's not to like? Grab a sandwich at a boulangerie and have a picnic in the park!
Get lost here!. Wide open space to stroll and sit. (Tip there are toilets here). Many locals hang out with kids, play tennis & hoops as well as footy. Grab a bench with your derriere and enjoy.

Jogging in the Heart of History. Recommend going for an early morning jog around the
perimeter of the Park and say bonjour to jogging Parisians
and historic figures (statues/busts) such as Baudelaire.
Quiet spot in Paris. Walked over from the Eiffel tower to have a look. Quiet spot in the middle of Paris which is nice for a break. I think it is more geared to locals rather than tourists

Beautiful Park in Paris. This is a lovely place to visit on a sunny, warm day. Lots of things to do and see, and you can stroll through scenic Saint-Germain and Montparnasse to get here. Lots of good restaurants nearby.

Total Parisian Highlight. Without question, our family's VERY favorite few hours in Paris. With a fantastic playground (costs a tiny bit) and the SAILBOATS, this is a picture postcard Paris experience. Sitting on a bench while your kids push around sailboats in the shadow of the Luxembourg Palace is basically perfect.

Beautiful grounds. There are so many little secret hideaways and paths through the park!! The Man Friend and I wandered in through the front gate and continued throughout the gardens, the fountains, the carousels...it was beautiful little find to spend an hour or so wandering through.

Heavenly Park . A short 10 minute walk from the Seine. In Autumn the colurs were magnificent.
It provides a peaceful spot in a busy city. Great for people watching and enjoying the splendour of the gardens.

Amazing. Another iconic Paris landmark. Can be reached on the Metro/RER or as I like to do to toughen up for spiral staircases, is to walk, Paris is a very walkable city. Beautiful and relaxing gardens, Palace is much photographed. Bathrooms are available for a 0.50 euros, and are clean.
Beautiful! Don't miss it. Just a wonderful place to wander slowly and enjoy the gardens. At the end of visit, we sat at the outdoor cafe and enjoyed a glass of wine.
I simply love it.. This is my favourite Parisian park - always sth happens there. Really worth to see /listen the summer open air Chopin concert ! Unforgettable experience.

The Medici Garden is a must!. Unless you are in Paris for less than 3 days- then you can put this place on hold otherwise you must see this immaculate garden. I have seen this garden both in Summer and in fall but I have to admit that you would be in awe during the spring and summer just watching the mastery of fine gardening in the place. For a short visit I suggest that you: 1- Enter the Garden from the northern entrance2- Visit Medici garden (inspired by Italian gardens)3- go by the Senat Building and the garden in front of it4- Exit by the other northern entrance close to Musee de Luxembourg - there is an Angelina Cafe by that entrance- try a cafe and pastry! For longer visit- explore the Bee keeping and vegetable garden!

Beatiful!. My wife and I were here on a somewhat drizzly day but still had a great visit. Easy walking, very nice views, and we found a covered area to sit when the rain picked up. On a sunny day it must be even better.

Beautiful and Relaxing. This is a little gem in the Latin Quarter. It has many little nooks and crannies to explore. It is picture postcard pretty. The Medici Fountain is a neat spot to visit as is the pond more or less dead centre where radio controlled boats can be seen. The whole park is alive with activity. The palace (which is now the seat of the Senate) is grand and heavily guarded. The visit was enjoyable and relaxing.
Luxembourg . Wonderful place to sit and have a cup of coffee or tea. Or just to rest! I went on a beautiful Saturday afternoon when there were children racing boats in the fountain. So lovely!

Nice place to visit. I had been here briefly back in 1993 conducting a band on the famous bandstand and surprise surprise I found myself back here again this June - again conducting a band.Different situation this time, adults rather than children, so a bit of time to wander around and no supervising.We spent two consecutive afternoons here, very appreciative audiences of 75-100 people sitting listening, loads of others passing.I had the chance to wander around, see folks playing with the boats on the lake, others strolling, some sitting on chairs provided. As another reviewer said, you could imagine people doing the same thing a century or more before. Perhaps not so many joggers in those days.Just one negative point, it seemed very dusty on the paths and left us cleaning our black gig shoes twice !!

Beautiful garden to stroll through. If you want a mellow evening after a busy day of sight seeing, this is a beautiful place to have a walk, or a picnic. There isn't much to do here other than sit back and just enjoy the scenery..

Good place to relax. It's a beautiful and huge garden in the heart of Paris where you can exercise, relax or enjoy a picnic. I especially enjoyed walking under the trees to see the different colours of autumn leaves. It may not be the top attractions in Paris, but it's worth a visit.

Massive, With Amazing and Diverse Features. A few blocks from our hotel, I was just out for a walk and spotted it. A real 'Central Park" in Paris with hundreds of people doing everything from reading in the sunshine, to riding their bikes, to playing tennis and more. Aurrounded by amazing posh looking aoartment buildings outside the fence.
GARDEN ( just a garden). if you have just a short time in PARIS i would cancel this one, and use my time to go to others places

Timeless visit. We could easily picture ourselves in 1800's clothes waundering the gardens, watching the children chasing the boats on the pond while the fowl duck in and out of the wakes. The gardens are a classic design study iwith many nooks to hide into for privacy and scholarly discussion. Benches strategically embrace the gardens - filled today with reds and grasses celebrating the oncoming cold. Linger, walk, indulge yourself in smells, sounds and visual stimuls as manz generations have done before. Be curious about the statues and tasteful pools and fountains.Not too far from the Odeon, the Pantheon and the Latin Quarter - fit this in the middle of a busy tourist day for a self reward.

Beautiful in all seasons. You really can't go past a beautiful city garden in the heart of Paris. The landscape and vibe of the gardens varies throughout the seasons, worth a visit any time, perfect to walk or run off some of the Parisian fare!

We got engaged here!. Stunning gardens and so peaceful and quiet for Central Paris. Lots of locals using the park but didn't feel crowded or busy. My boyfriend proposed to me here so it was extra special.
October Visit. Well worth a visit. Beautiful gardens and hard to believe you are in the centre of such a big cityLots of runners and keep fit people there

Awesome place for pics. Luxembourg is very beautiful, if you want to take photos then this is a best place for nice photos. The roses and the green garden looks amazing.At the right side of the garden, near to palace is a breath taking view of a water and sculpture. Its a best place for perfect fb photo

Beautiful Garden in the middle of Paris!. When you need a bit of peace and need to collect your thoughts take a stroll through this peaceful garden. We visited during fall, the leaves were turning, it was absolutely stunning. Photos to follow.

Truly magical place. My husband surprised me with a picnic at the Luxembourg gardens and it was one of the most precious memories that I have. The grounds are immaculately kept and just ooze French charm. A particular highlight was the dozens and dozens of statues of French Queens and notable women, fascinating to do some further research on them as they all had compelling stories. The flowers, grass, palace are all just stunning and the gardens are huge so you can walk around for hours, we even found a children's splash pool area fenced hedges and purple flowers. So sweet.Highly recommend to anyone who enjoys Mother Nature and picnics!(Word of caution, there is a large designated area where you can set up a picnic or lay on the grass with an amazing view of the palace. Other parts of the garden are not for venturing onto the grass but the landscaped paths are a lovely way to explore)

Beautiful place to sit with a book and watch the passersby. When I return to Paris, I'll spend even more time at the Luxembourg Gardens. It's a great place to sit with a book and watch the world pass in front of you. When I was there, lots of locals seemed to be sitting there and enjoying the weather themselves. It was nice to be able to sit and listen in on the variety of conversations around me. Of course there were tourists too, but it never felt crowded there to me.
A must see. A beautiful place to spend a few hours as long as its not too cold and not too rainy. Take something to eat and drink and just walk around.

Autumn Walk. Lovely place to visit. Out of season late October but visited by plenty on a Sunday afternoon. Band of random instruments playing for the entertainment of an appreciative audience. Cafe open for that warm or cold drink. Lovely array of a variety of flowers with their red blooms especially being so late in the year. Children sailing boats on the lake. Peaceful environment and well worth the visit.

Stunning. These gardens have the most stunning sculptures and they are so relaxed and peaceful. Chairs for the public are easily found and can be moved to where you would like to sit and look onto the gardens ( not on the lawns though!). You can picnic there and it really is very popular with the locals which signifies a good site to see.

Beautiful Park. We visited the park immediately upon our arrival in Paris. It's in the vicinity of many Hemingway hangouts. It was a warm Fall Saturday and there were throngs of families and students from the nearby Sorbonne in the park and everyone was enjoying themselves. The many, many chestnut trees were shedding loads of nuts and I was surprised no one was gathering them. There are several beautiful statues and fountains in the huge park and it was extremely relaxing to stroll around as we decompressed from our flight.

A Beautiful Green Space in Paris. On a wonderful day with Parisians and tourist strolling just step back and relax in this great green space. Discover the children playing with their sailboats in the fountain, enjoy the architecture the gardens and step back in time. This place must surely have been the same years ago. A place to pack a lunch and enjoy the feeling of Paris.

Highlight of the day. This place is great. Something for all. Bowls, basketball green space wooded areas small boats with sails, theatre puppets and more. Loved spending a few hours at this place. Had to pay to use the loo and the lady never even looked up never mind said hello when I came in. Otherwise fantastic place.
Don't miss this park. I felt like I was visiting Catherine de Medici.Beautiful gardens and statues. Palace is lovely but not open to the public. Go anyway.

Could any place be more beautiful?!. 2nd time visiting the Gardens. Unbelievable how it is so breath taking with it's beds that have a fall color emphasis. It is a very tranquil place to get away. You are very lucky, Parisians, to have this!

Quite average.... Had great expectations to find a beautiful garden but I'v seen much better elsewhere and really not sure whether it was due to October there was hardly anything to capture the eye here.
There are lots of folks jogging and idling. The fountain in the middle is a shame....dirty brown water. Not worth the time even tho its free.
Must visit!. Simply beautiful! No need to say any more. Just go and visit when in Paris to relax and people watch.

Great Jogging spot. A run through Paris ended up with me running through these gardens. Clearly popular for joggers I was far from alone. The multitude of paths and beautiful flora made the popularity obvious.
Relaxing. A beautiful place for relaxation however you're not allowed on the grass and there aren't enough seats

A park in name only, more like a palace garden.. Weekends are the best time to escape here. The frenetic pace of Paris and city melts away here with the Tai Chi practitioners, dancers, and multitude of other sports trainers.
Grab brunch in the bistro in the gardens and enjoy the Chateau and grounds...one of my favorites.
Nice vibe. Even the weather wasn't so lovely we spent some time there looking at kids running little yachts in the pond. Quiet and relaxing place.

Great place to relax. This is a great place to wind down at the end of a long day. It's beautiful, serene and always had vacant places to sit. Grab a baguette and a bottle of water before you come here and there's you're evening before dinner.

Great place to spend a sunny afternoon.. Lots of chairs available to sit on and enjoy relaxing in the gardens. You are not allowed to sit on the grass. Lots going on - volleyball, chess, tai chi, people watching etc. A real oasis.

A great place to relax for a while.. It's too easy to turn a visit to Paris into a procession of museums, restaurants, and shopping expeditions. Consider cooling your heels in this always-gorgeous garden, where the flowers are sumptuous and the people-watching is always great. You will be glad you took some time to relax on what was, after all, supposed to be a vacation!

Great on a dry day. Goods for younger kids.. Lovely gardens but don't walk or sunbathe on the pelouse interdite (forbidden lawn), only go on pelouse permise (permitted) and that will keep the park keepers away. Younger children can have pony rides, play tennis, hire go-karts, or see an outdoor puppet show. There is a large pond where children can play with boats but I don't know if they hire them or bring their own. Bring bread for the ducks or the huge fish living in the pond.There is a cafe and a couple of kiosks selling toys and ice cream so you could spend a bit of time here on a warm day. Plenty of chairs for adults to sit on while kids play.

Quiet spot of paradise.. The Luxembourg Gardens are more attractive with more birds, butterflies and colour that the Jardin de Tuilleries. More locals than tourists which always says a lot. Plenty of eateries around the area too which again are patronised more by locals than tourists. Lovely afternoon spent there.
The nicest place to walk around. If you're looking for some to sit that doesnt actually have thousands of tourists wandering round then this is it. Better than the Tuillerie Gardens!
Gorgeous!!!. It's elegant and relaxing! A great place for a picnic, to read a book or just have a nice stroll! There is a RER B Station directly in front of it....the "Luxembourg" stop.
Beautiful gardens. This is a beautiful garden and grounds on the Left Bank. I would recommend. There is a central fountain with a pond, all beautifully manicured and laid out.
Maybe the most beautiful park in Paris. I love that park. Is Is located in nice area between 5. and 6. Arr. Gardens are Well kept and Full of local people living their life. Not too many tourists.
Paris' backyard. A wonderful place to go and relax for a bit. Great people-watching, beautiful gardens, and no litter or crazy people (yes, New York, I'm talking to YOU).

One of the most beautiful Gardens. Among the many parks and gardens of Paris, the Luxembourg Garden is certainly one of our favourites. Fascinated by this oxygen bottle in the centre of the capital, I enjoyed the greenery and the playgrounds. Wow

A well needed respite on a sunny Sunday afternoon. A massive park with lots to see and a boat pond for children who rent a small remote boat and navigate it around a manmade lake. Lots of space for children to run and play, lovely quite areas to sit and have a picnic lunch or watch the locals play a game of botchy (I think this is what it is called). Statues can be found throughout the park and a lovely fountain greets you as you entre. We loved the day there.

One of the most romantic in Europe. This garden is one of the most beautiful and romantic in Europe, and if you visit Paris you should take the time to take a walk through it. Either with your loved one, with your children or with your family, it is worth while. Take some time also to read the history of the garden and if you have the time, buy a bagette, ham, cheese, fruti and a bottle of wine and just enjoy a picknick in the heart of Paris.

Great place to relax and unwind. This was one of our favorite places in Paris. It's beautiful, there's space to run, there are pigeons to chase, and it's free. Grab a green chair and sit in the sunshine and watch the world amble by!

Great place to zen in Paris. Went on a Sunday morning, Paris was waking up and the Gardens were just coming alive with people. The gardens are expansive, you can easily find a nook to relax and take it in. Suggest getting breakfast in take away and bring a double espresso. Sit and enjoy the garden. Luxembourg RER station is right across so if you are coming from CDC or ORY airports, it is easy to access. There were quite a few tourists with bags relaxing before heading off to the airport. If you want an escape from the busy city, Luxembourg gardens is a spot for you.Best time is morning, it can get quite busy later in the day.

Best Park Ever!!. Go on a Sunday afternoon when it is filled with activity - Parisians strolling arm and arm, locals sitting and reading, children with the little bateaus in the fountain pool. So much to see - a bandshell with an orchestra playing movie theme songs in one area, pony rides and puppet shows for children. A bonus was no bicycles - so you can just relax and stroll. Plan to spend several hours wandering and then sitting with a picnic and a book. Highly recommended.

Fabulous city gardens. I took the opportunity to stroll through themail grounds every time I had the chance. A garden of eden! Lovely lanes and artwork. The children's areas were well populated with happy families.

Beautifully maintained from centuries . This place is very quite, picturesque and amazingly maintained from centuries.What a quite place in the heart of busy streets of Paris.Clicked so many pictures of here andloved this place completely!!!

Summer 2014. In the middle of the city lies this large expanse of luxurious gardens! At first, you walk through a path of forest-like setting, leading to surprising sculptures that tell you about the history of the former estate's ownership. Then you are caught unaware by this view of vast towers and carefully designed greenery that offsets the wonderful Luxembourg palace! This was a lovely place to escape the usual sights of Paris, and enjoy nature and architecture at its finest.

Always a nice break from the Rat Race. The Jardin is always a nice break from the busy streets of the Latin quarter. I usually go in the afternoon, but this time we came early in the morning while it was still cool and few people were there. Just a few runners and people reading the newspaper. Very calm and restorative. Be sure to wals all of the allées and check out the palace, which is where the senate meets. It is a beautiful park.

A beautiful place filled with sculpture and life. Make a picnic lunch and go find a scene spot here to relax and take a moment to appreciate Paris. This is a gorgeous garden, filled with art, sculpture, flowers, and life. Amazing. It never gets old.

Beautiful Park in the Center of the City!. Amazing you walk around and into these gates where this huge beautiful park is that goes on and on. There are chairs all over for anyone to sit in and several go to have a baguette, rest, draw or just relax. It was just beautiful walking around and on the day we went there was a band playing which added to the beauty.

Delightful; Wonderful place to people watch. These beautifully maintained gardens are a wonderful example of an urban park used by both tourists and locals. As my hotel was close by, I took early morning speed walks along its paths to get my daily exercise.
In town and beautiful. Luxembourg Gardens are in Paris and beautiful. It is a classic garden with a symmetrical design. It is a tourist site but also a place where locals gather. Good experienc.

Beautiful Gardens. An idyllic spot to watch Parisiennes chill.
We spent an lovely afternoon relaxing in Jardin du Luxembourg people watching. Bring a coffee & pastry and enjoy the elegance. There are plenty of comfortable park chairs upright or recliner (no charge) throughout these beautiful gardens and always something to see... fountains, flowers, chess players, tennis, runners, readers, families strolling by.

A sweet time in between flowers. You will love the smell of the flowers and their colours...What I suggest you to do is to go to Dalloyau (a patisserie next to the Jardins), buy a sweet dessert of your choice (if the that challenge is too much for you, you better take two pastries instead of just one!)... Then just reach the Jardins... You're gonna love every second of your sweet life.
Typical French. Beautiful.. To wander gently or just rest by the water is lovely. The bustle of Paris is very close but you feel you are in the middle of nowhere.

Beautifully utilised area. We stayed for two weeks in Paris and both Sundays we walked to these gardens. On one Sunday we pulled up two of the many metal chairs and sat in a very relaxed way to watch the children and dads sail the boats on the lake and the many other activities going on for families. On the second occasion we arrived just as some musicians began to serenade us from the rotunda. What a delightful place utilised by the community!
Peaceful have in a busy city. Beautiful gardens , charming walks , puppet show for children and the opportunity to sit and rest and watch the passing parade , an oasis in a busy city.
Beautiful, Beautiful Park. Plenty to photograph here. Not sure the significance, but there were dozens of guards with UZIs walking around the park.

Beautiful, peaceful gardens for a stroll!. Whenever we visit Paris, we love to stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens! The flowers and grassy areas are all beautiful! We always equate this park with Paris!

Always a nice spot. This is a great spot on the left bank to go for a walk or sit in a chair taking in the pond, trees, and sunshine. When you want to take a break from sites or shopping on the left bank, this is a perfect place to come and relax.
Beautiful. Great park for a stroll with fountains and plenty of trees, flowers as well as statues. Of course it is free and is in close proximity to other attractions.
Relaxing experience. This is a large area that is great for a walk and especially to sit and have a lunch or snack and just people watch. Always a lot of activity and easy to get to by metro.
Beautiful Gardens to visit on a Sunday for music. Beautiful gardens and the backdrop of the palace is amazing. A great place to spend a Sunday listening to music in the park. Love the location.

A stunning and well manicured garden in the left bank and most beautiful. This is an unknown gem for visitors to Paris but I think its worth the visit.To walk through is great and parisians,in the summer or springtime take advantage of the beautiful lawn to have lunch or read a book.The sculptures are great and so are the surroundings.There are chairs to sit and people watching is revealing plus the park is always in great shape and well kept.
Great place to chill. Just walk around in the Beautiful gardens or sit enjoy the views and relax, stress. .. doesn't exist here.
Beautiful Park. Stunning to stroll this magestic park. Be aware of the hours it is open because they mean business when it's closing time.

Toward the end of the season. The gardens are a beautiful spot to relax, but by mid-October it is starting to lose its lustre. The work crews were just starting to clean up some of the flower beds and the leaves on the trees were starting to fall. Even so, there were more activities available than we expected. There were tennis courts, table tennis tables and lots of trails for jogging. It is worth a walk through.

Lovely on a sunny day. Great gardens, manicured and tended beautifully, visiting in the springtime yields an absolutely gorgeous display of flowers, the perfume almost heady.... Pretend to be Parisian take your lunch and a book, sit on one of the many chairs dotted around the gardens and watch the world go by.

Loved walking this garden. We loved the gardens, but more so, loved the long rectangle pond in the garden; had terrific statues! We spent a good long hour in the gardens taking photos, people watching... sitting near the fountains, day dreaming. Well worth the visit.
Breathtaking!!. I couldn't capture the beauty in pictures, a video is a must here. You will be amazed at the splendor and grandeur!
Nice park for a little walk. It's a nice park for a little walk to get a break from the craziness in the other attractions in Paris. Very good for people watching.

M'y favorite Garden in Paris. If You like garden, That one Is large and beautifull.Ideal place for children, donkes,spécial area.For adult Teas rooms and beautifulls walks."Pièce d'eau" With small boats for children.Fantastics beehives.Greenhouses With Teaching.Splendides trees and flowers near the Historic' Sénat ..Don't Forget Luxembourg Muséum and Angelina tea-room .People come here for running ,play chess ou Chi Kong.Known al so, for Puppets Theater.It Is a beautifull place for To be Happy and Relax!

amazing .. one of the most beautiful parks/gardeds of Paris . Just get inside , see the green all around you , look at the statues , enjoy the kids sendig their rented small boats upon the the small pond/pool inthe middle of the park - and relax .
Nice garden. Nice place to visit if you have time to kill. I have seen better gardens, but if your near it is worth a quick view.

VERY FRENCH EXPERIENCE FOR FREE. Dress comfortably and wear walking shoes. This is not only a park, it's a French experience where high school students (from one of France's outstanding schools) accross the street meet regularly, Parisians read a book in the garden chairs provided when it's sunny, where you can picnic on certain lawns, visit the French Senate, see the statues of Frances queens adorn the gardens whose gardners change plants with new seasonal flowers every 3 months... and take shelter in the Orangerie (a museum located within the park) and eat at a restaurant or take a break in the tea room...

Wonderful Garden!. More properly, a park with carefully manicured flowers, shrubbery, gardens, walking paths, and benches for sitting and contemplating the beauty around you. Plus statuary and a children's play park. Perfection and a must see for visitors to Paris.

An oasis of calm after the frenzied kitsch of the Quartier Latin. I took my girlfriend for a stroll from our hotel on Rue de la Harpe to the Jardin du Luxembourg on our last day in Paris. It is a lovely oasis of calm about ten minutes walk south of the Seine but a world away from the raucous streets, T-shirt kiosques and mini Eiffel Tower schlock merchants of the Quartier Latin.She loved this place.Buy a croissant nearby, stroll along the paths or feed the ducks.

Why can't we step on the grass?. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful, and an absolute delight to visit on a weekend. It seems like all of Paris is out reading books, catching up with friends, or simply soaking up the sun and gorgeous surroundings.It was so strange that we weren't allowed on the grass. I came to Europe to see all the beautiful greenery, but I felt like I was back in Australia as I ended up trudging through gravel and sand!

Perfect escape of crowded Paris in Paris. The park is nice and quiet, and well maintained. Good for an escape of the crowds although located in the center of Paris. It also seems like the criminal gangs of begging and pickpocketing gipsies have not found their ways here, which is a relief in paris anno 2015.
Absolutely beautiful.. The gardens in Paris are truley amazing. Take some time, get a glass of wine and enjoy the life set for royalty.

Well worth a wander.. I walked round the Luxembourg Gardens on a lovely sunny Sunday morning in early October. What an absolute delight it was to see a beautiful park so well used.There was a park run in progress, numerous groups practicing marshal arts and exercise regimes, tennis players, pony rides, a choir singing in the bandstand as well as people having a relaxing walk or sitting on the many green chairs enjoying the views. An uplifting start to the day.

Peaceful autumn walk. After a few days in Paris a peaceful walk in a beautiful garden was just what we needed. The gardens are beautifully manicured and just look stunning with the autumn leaves.We took lunch from our local boulangerie and had a cheap and wonderful lunch in Paris. Followed by a stroll around the gardens

Gorgeous any season of the year. I've been to the Gardens in Spring, Summer and Fall and each one is beautiful. Last May, I saw an army of gardeners planting the summer flowers and just this week, they were pulling them up to put in the Fall beds. Anytime of year is magnificent. Be sure and see the Medici Fountain, a quiet respite from the bustle of Paris. This is the place to bring a picnic or a good book and spend a few hours.

One of the many Oasis of Paris. Wandered through many times. If you are in the vicinity it is a must see. Paid tour not neccessary. Recommend finding a public toilet before going there as there are really not enough here (like a lot of Paris!)

Where Parisians have most memories. Every little Parisian has been taken here by their Granny, for a donkey ride, to play on the adventure ground, to see Guignol, to sail a mini boat on the pond.Every Latin Quarter student has spent hours on the iron chairs, talking politics and skipping classes. You will find Lovers' Lane in the shade.Plenty of surprises, even beehives.A nice museum and cafés nearby.And looking up here's the Senate for when you become older.

Lovely gardens in the heart of the city. The area around the gardens is great, full of bistros and quaint stores, great for walking or just for taking a coffee. We stayed closed by and enjoyed it very much
Amazing. Beautiful garden specially in the summer.The lake and chateau add alot to its beauty.Should be one of your destinations if you love a nice walk in a beautiful centrally located garden

Beautiful gardens, worth wandering through!. A beautiful, well-manicured garden. Worth walking though or sitting for a while on one of the many chairs. Kind of strange that you cannot sit or walk on the grass, but nice to go to nonetheless!

A Very Kid-Friendly Park. The Luxembourg Gardens date from the early 1600s. There are extensive, wide paths for walking. Possibly its most prominent feature is the large octagonal "pond" (Grand Basin). It is here that sailboats are sailed (they can be rented). There are other children's activities, including pony rides, puppet shows, and a merry-go-round. The huge Luxembourg Palace is on the grounds of the Gardens. There are more than 100 statues, including figures of 20 French queens.We arrived a little past 6 P.M. for a picnic dinner, on a weekday. I thought there were quite a number of people there, i.e., still there.

a must seeing in Paris. lf you go to Paris, you definitely have to visit these beautiful gardens and walk around. lt is much better if you can go in spring or summer, but anyway Paris is always beautiful.

Visually stunning. The gardens are absolutely beautiful and so well manicured and maintained! Since this was a surprise little detour in our trip, I didn't have time to pack snacks or a picnic which would have been lovely. It's a lovely venue to read a book or just people watch...
Loved this!. Perfect for a picnic or a walk - loved watching the children sail their boats! What a gem smack in the middle of everything else we wanted to see!

Peace, tranquility, style. If you've been bashing the boulevards of Paris for hours, the Luxembourg Gardens are a haven of elegant peace.
You may not like your gardens elegant and formal, you may prefer them wild and less controlled. But here you have to admit that they are superb, peaceful and capture the essence of Paris. I love 'em

Wonderful park and playground. Have been here many times with the family on our trips to Paris. This is such a wonderful place and if you have children there is a magical playground that works for kids of all ages. Such a great dynamic to watch kids from France play so wonderfully with their new friends they instantly make from the UA, Netherlands, Australia, New Zealand.

beautiful park with activities. This park is perfect for a run, walk, piknik, anything you can think of. Also seen children riding ponys and people playing tennis. Absolutely must see on a pretty day.

Luxembourg Gardens, Paris. The gardens were fantastic, and given that it was mid October there were a great display of flowers around the entire gardens. The place was packed with locals and tourists, and all were enjoying autumnal sunshine. Chairs are provided all around the area, so no need to take portable seating with you - a great place to relax, especially the pond where kids, and big kids were sailing boats.

Gardens include playground in the center Paris. The gardens are a beautiful but if you have kids the playground is absolutely amazing. The attractions include slide of various sizes, swings, ziplne and much more. There is a fee to get in but we spend several hours there. There is a little snack place where you can buy things like ice cream or chips. The gardens also have a nice pond.

Amazing Chocolate Fondant at the cafe. The sit down café within the gardens serves an amazing chocolate fondant with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Definitely worth sitting down and tasting as you watch the other visitors pass by. I visited in October when the gardens were quite beautiful. There were still lots of leaves on the trees but they had started to turn colour to autumn reds and oranges and were beginning to fall off which added to the beauty of the gardens.

Best way to spend a lazy afternoon in Paris. The gardens are a very popular attraction, both to tourists and locals, as it has something for everyone. We spent some time wandering around, and then just sat down, watching the world around us. A good way to spend a lazy evening. The garden spans several hectares, with a pond at its centre. There are several walking paths and lawns, several beautiful fountains, an orchard, and numerous garden beds, all laid out in formal fashion. There are also more than seventy statues, mostly of French queens and other famous women.At the far end of the gardens is a former palace, currently housing the French senate.
Beautiful gardens!. Visited the Luxembourg garden on the last day of traveling to Paris.Beautiful place with plenty awesome scenery. Photo taking at its best.
Absolutely pleasant!. It's a beautiful park to wander about, sit in the shadow of trees or in the sun, relax, doze off, reconnect with nature ...
Picnicking. We love to go to Gerard Mulot to pick up a baguette, white asparagus (when in season), rabbit terrine, marinated mushrooms, etc. and go to the Luxembourg Gardens for a picnic.

Spectacular . My partner and I brought a picnic to the Luxembourg Garden, but there was no grass to sit on! But thankfully there were plenty of chairs to sit on.
The garden itself was so pretty and very well maintained. It was packed at lunch time, but it didn't feel too crowded.

A Leafy Oasis in the Heart of Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are everything Paris is not, laid back, quiet, serene. The park really is an oasis in the middle of the city. The girls absolutely loved the 150 year old carousel and playground. Bring your own refreshments because the stalls in the park are extremely pricey. In addition pay attention to where you have your picnic, park staff are zealous about keeping folk off the lawns that are closed or out of bounds. Come early as the best spots are taken early.

Even in Autumn A Beautiful Sight. No trip to Paris is complete until you spend a little relaxing in this this place. There is a beautiful fountain in its own little grove, complete with a flock of mallards. There are reflecting pools, one with a duck house. This is an expansive park, bustling with activities for the young and young at heart. There is a puppet theater with scheduled performances in the summer.
