Lots of pretty walking paths, beautiful sculptured gardens and then there is the palace. No matter the time of day, there is something to delight the senses.

Lovely, tranquil ... authentic!. What a lovely garden: something for everyone! What you'll see runs the gamut from a wedding party to old guys playing chess. All very family-friendly and delightful. Plenty of places nearby to get something to eat and have an impromptu picnic!
Relaxing & Pretty. So pretty & relaxing. Love the chairs they have around the big pond. Nice to take a coffee & get off your feet for a while during a busy sightseeing day :)
Nice place to relax. This was very close to our hotel and we appreciated a great place to sit and relax. There were many French people there doing the same thing!
Oasis in Paris. beautiful place to take time out. would definately take a picnic there and chill out. there are plenty of seats to rest up also has a cafe and toilets,

Relaxing and beautiful.. It was a sunny evening then we got to Luxembourg Gardens.It was warm, relaxing and beautiful. We visited Luxembourg Gardens on our previous trip to Paris and it was rainy day so I could not enjoy Luxembourg Gardens.

Beautiful Gardens!. The Jardin du Luxembourg is one of my favorite spots in Paris! It's really large, clean, and beautiful. There's also a mini Statue of Liberty in the garden for all the US tourists - which was a pleasant surprise! There were a few places to grab a beer or crepe as well. There was also a really awesome playground for kids, but it wasn't free (although it was pretty cheap) and it closed pretty early the day we were there. We also played a pick-up basketball game against some french guys, which was fun!
Must see. This is the heart of Paris. Have a coffee and watch people in Jardin du Luxembourg! It's a fantastic place and a must see if you're in Paris.
Quiet space. These gardens were just up the road from where we stayed and are a relaxing oasis in a busy city. Spend some time here if you get the chance
Must see!. Absolutely beautiful garden, in October the flowers were blooming, a spectacular garden, loved our visit.

My Paris Favorite. The gardens are a gem. It is my favorite place in all of Paris. Plan to go and spend at least an hour, sitting in the sun. Suggest a walk from the St. Germaine through the gardens to the Montparnesse to one of the famous brasseries for a petit dejeuner in the morning or a drink in the late afternoon.
Luxembourg Gardens. This visit was part of a break to see the sights and as it was warm and sunny this was a lovely afternoon.

A good way to relax. Going to the Luxembourg gardens is a good way to see the locals relaxing. Whether it is playing boules, running, sitting by the pond or having a coffee, it seems to be a place they relax in. There are some lovely areas to sit and enjoy the sun. And there are some nice paths to stroll up and down too.

A garden with many faces.. First visited on a warm September morning, a Thursday, about 9:30. Very few people in the gardens with the exception of joggers and a few people taking the sun on the chairs above the pond. Got some lovely pictures with no people....returned on a sunny Saturday afternoon on the 3rd of October to a completely different world. People sitting in the chairs along the pathways enjoying the fresh air, students in groups doing homework, a group sing along with accordion and guitar in process at the bandstand and what seemed to be hundreds of children pushing boats across the pond in front of the Palace! What a vibrant and well used green space. If I was visiting Paris with a youngster the gardens on a Saturday would be a definite must do. Made me appreciate all the natural outdoors we're surrounded with here in British Columbia.The border plantings were outstanding with vegetables and herbs (chard, basil) mixed into vibrant reds and tall grasses..along with Caster Beans ( DH recognized these from his prairie upbringing ) well worth a visit for anyone remotely interested in gardens. Also enjoyed the many espaliered apples..a true multipurpose space in the heart of the city
I visit this spot every time I am in Paris. Make sure to take the time to walk through the gardens. There are several maps posted and plenty of spots to sit and relax and enjoy the people watching
Beautiful Sunny day. These gardens are beautiful and should be in everybody's to do list. We visited on a beautiful Saturday morning in early Ovtober and they looked amazing. Do not miss them!

Sunday in the park. We walked slowly through this lovely city park on a sunny Sunday morning. There was much activity, most of it families with children, and young sweethearts. The flower beds were marvelous. W wonderful afternoon destination.
Nice park. It's a nice park but if you don't have too much time in Paris to visit everything I wouldn't add this to your "to do list". It's much nicer the "Jardin des Tuleires".

Beautiful!. We were lucky enough to be strolling through Luxembourg Gardens on a sunny early October Friday late afternoon. There were so many people out enjoying the sunshine in the gardens! It is a lovely place. If you have the chance, you should take a few moments and enjoy the flowers, water features, trees, and city views. Tips:Wear comfortable walking shoes - it is a fairly large park. They have chairs available. You can bring a picnic if you have time and the weather is good.

Beautiful, but lots of smokers. Gorgeous garden, but I seemed to have every smokers in Paris sitting next to me. I went a second time and stayed away from all smokers, and it was a better experience. Bring bread to feed the ducks. :)
What a great Park. Great park, full of life and activity. Beautiful gardens in a minimalist fashion, like most french gardens.

Amazing place to picnic and people watch. The gardens and its statues are a remarkable oasis in the middle of Paris. We have visited MANY times - picnic, walking, resting, relaxing. We have had spontaneous musical performances crop up and have watched children sail boats on the little pond. A great place to relax.

Our favorite park in Paris. Each time we go to Paris, we spend a couple hours here. It is just plesant! Within the park, the Medici Fountain is our favorite spot. While sitting there in a chair (or two - one for your feet -- if you are lucky), you will be as close to being Parisian as is possible for an etranger.
Wonderful. This garden is one of the best ive ever visited in my life. Really good to have a good timr with family and friends. Picnic is also a good idea around. I really enjoyed my time. Have fun

Unforgetable. unforgettable! in fact, Paris is so! wake 9am we went to Notre Dame, then we strolled through the nearby streets and came to the gardens, that was enough, but the garden is to sit, observe, enjoy the people, the kids have fun, has great restaurants on the street, but inside the garden It has good snacks.

A green lung of the most elegant in the center of Paris!. A green lung of the most elegant in the center of Paris!I particularly like the Medici fountain ; it is also in the early sixteenth century the garden was " built " , driven there seems to Marie de Medicis ... 23 hectares of greenery before a truncated and distorted ecology , what happiness ... to appreciate and respect , there are always people in all seasons
This is how a park should be. This park is amazing. Parks at home are not utilised like this, or get the attendance. Go and buy a crepe and people watch.

"Nice Spot On A Hot Day". These formal gardens, open to only royalty before the French Revolution, now serve as one of Paris's most popular destinations for relaxation.It is a great place for family, the kids can play.

strolling in the gardens in a mild october afternoon. the gardens are near my son's place and after a sumptuous lunch we made a stroll in the nearby Luxemburg gardens, in an unusual mild october afternoon
Gardens are lovely, skip the museum. The adjacent museum is 12 Euro and not included on the Paris Museum Pass. It wasn't really worth the entrance fee.

Great spot. I had never been on a sunny day before. It was magnificent. Make sure you visit this garden--see the men playing chess, the tennis players, and people sunning themselves at the pond/fountain. One of my favorite places in Paris.
Beautiful Scene. Beautiful scene.... Great place to relax, read, picnic, people watch etc. Highly recommend a visit! Perfect spot for picnic lunch.

The best place to be in a sunny afternoon . It is a great park, with a small pool in the middle where kids can sail a boat. We did a nice picnic. There are some place to play around. A tipical Park of paris.

Beautiful Palace & Gardens. This was my 2nd time to Luxembourg Gardens. The flower display throughout the gardens are beautiful!!. There are places to sit and just soak up the sun and watch the people walking through the garden. There are different levels that can be explored. If you prefer shade, there are areas to sit. Tennis courts are available for use and there are restroom facilities on the property. If you like photography there are many great pictures to be taken. There are several ways which to enter the gardens and many statues displayed throughout. In front of the palace is a water fountain that you can sit and enjoy.I would highly recommend a visit while in Paris.
Great escape in a busy city. The kids used the park for their daily run. It is very lovely to sit and watch the locals go about their leisurely activities.
Pretty garden. Nice spot for a picnic or a rest. In the central part of the city so you might as well pass by along the way to other sites.

Don't sit on the grass!. Lovely gardens just shame they're so particular about where you can sit down and have a picnic on the grass. Eventually found some grass you can lie on opposite the large ponds in the centre. There are chairs you can move but it's not quite the same if you're picnicking.
Small cute park. This park was not as big as we imagined but it was still a nice place to visit. There is a small pond in the middle where people played with toy boats.
Central Park of Paris with a Palace. Beautiful garden at the center of Paris. A perfect place to relax after lunch before going on with touring this beautiful but large city

Beautiful gardens. The gardens are larger than we imagined with tennis courts and walkways mixing with beautiful fountains and views of the palace
The central area is great people watching as the locals lay back on the chairs and grab some winter sunshine
The garden beds are fastidiously maintained as are the lawns
Gorgeous!. The old gardens of the royalty and everything here is very well preserved. The statues of the old queens are charming and a lot of the french history!

Perfect respite from the city. You have to love how the lovely gardens of Paris are located just where you need them during a day long walk about. This is my favourite garden in Paris, with parallel applause for the walking the path between the squared trees of the Tuileries Garden. The Luxembourg is a great place to have a morning run or sit on one of the many benches before carrying on to the Latin Quarter, the Musee d'Orsay or Notre Dame and Pont Neuf. I would say a coffee or tea however I have never been able to coax a café aller from any cafe owner in France. The gardens themselves are beautiful and like all in France, very manicured. Flower beds are spectacular in high summer moths. Personally I prefer more wild free form gardens but they do have a charm.

Luxembourg is a quiet oasis in the city. It is a wide open park with numerous gardens, fountains and a beautiful former palace now occupied by the French senate. A treat was the Creperie with wine behind the large pond.
Nice gardens. I have been there with my wife and two sons. We all enjoyed it. It fresh and nice. You can spend one to two hours there walking and enjoying.

Nice garden on a sunny day in Paris. A large ornamentally landscaped garden with lots of fabulous statues, and interesting walking paths. Snack food and drinks available with adequate garden benches scattered throughout. After doing indoor museums this is a nice outdoor experience easily accessible

Picnic in the park!. My fiance and I had a picnic on the lawns in the sun and it was just delightful. A real community atmosphere in these gardens, you almost forget you're a tourist for a while. The structured gardens are so beautifully maintained and are studded with history. I'd definitely recommend a visit for an afternoon or just a stroll through.

I have visited this "garden" over a hundred times and never fail to find it new and fascinating.. Just possibly the single most charming experience available in Paris (and therefore on planet Earth). A wonderful place to stroll around in and plop down in the fairly comfortable metal chairs which are scattered about all around the park. Watch the tennis, knock down a café noir and a brioche at one of the several outdoor restaurants, gaze in wonder at every manifestation of French social behavior possible, wander over for breakfast in the park if you are staying in the area, don't forget to dodge the joggers when entering or leaving the park, check out either before or after your visit the ever changing but always fascinating photo exhibits hanging from the great fence on the outside to the NE, if you have children with you stop in at the Punch and Judy style puppet show (no need to be adept in French - mostly pure action), etc., etc. And do not fail to stop in and spend some time in the grotto just to the E of the Senate Building with the monster looming over the loving couple swept away with mutual admiration at the far end of the pool. Go and enjoy.
Must Visit. The garden is very beautiful and must visit as per me, please take your children as well as they will surely have fun over there.
Time for relax. If you want to find the great place for relax, than Luxembourg garden is great place for you. When is sunshinne, I can stay there all day, just take the chair and relaxing

Relax and reflect. After two or three days of sightseeing in Paris, set aside an hour or two to stroll through and relax in the Luxenburg Gardens. Stroll through the many gardens, wooded areas, activity areas, etc. Or, find a place to sit (public seating throughout), and catch up on your journal, read up on sites to see or just watch the world go by. I'd recommend having a glass of wine, but that is not permitted, (but perhaps you can deploy a little ingenuity and descression).A perfect place for a restorative break from the hustle and bustle all around.
Down time among the museums. Beautiful gardens with multiple areas of different style and feel. A good loaded to stroll and sit after being inside to long.

A perfect spot to relax in the heart of Paris. In any given day you will find students, families and tourists, all enjoying this beautiful garden. There are paths to wander (look out for the dog droppings), statues to admire, fountains, a pond to sail miniature boats and a palace (although you can't go in). The perfect place to while away a sunny afternoon in Paris.

Beautiful stroll.. We had only one day in Paris and this beautiful place was one of the great enjoyable experience. Stopped to sit and people watch and have a crepe with coffee. Enjoyed with a moment to relax in a wonderful spot.

A must visit in Paris. Great gardens with numerous beautiful trees, plants and flowers with a trodden and rich history. It`s large and easily located on rue Saint Michel with a RER and Metro stops nearby.

best place to chill. it is wonderful to chill or run in these gardens, the flowers from march until november/december are great. the winter is not so cold in paris so the garden remains lovely. the little mini lake for sailing toy boats is so cute and they have plenty of chairs to launge and read a book or just contemplate. it also has an exhibition hall in the back where you can see lovely paintings or sculptures of local artists. they also have pony rides, tenis courts, a lovely jazz music platforms. there is also a hidden pond with lovely sculptures and plants.

Historical grandeur + beauty and serenity. The Luxembourg Gardens is beautiful with it's pond, statues, flowers and magnificent buildings. Most parks in Paris have an interesting past but the Luxembourg Gardens has both the size (it's one of the biggest gardens in Paris), the historical grandeur and at the same time the beauty and serenity that typifies a small Parisian garden.

Paris Playground for Grownups. A wonderful place to pause and enjoy a respite from everyday life in Paris. Seasonal plantings are skillfully done. Kids with their toy boats fun to watch. Experimental fruit tree research is fascinating. Walking/ jogging paths good for exercise.

Best gardens in Paris. This is my favorite spot in Paris, great to just sit and watch the locals and tourists hang out. Watch the kids play with the little sail boats. If you visit in Sept, one weekend a year they open the Palace on National Day, it is spectacular. Also close to the Pantheon, Latin Quarter, lots to see in the area

A walk in the park. Near the top of everyone's to do list. It really is a must see. Near the Sorbonne, Blvd San Michel, and the Cluny and the Pantheon, it is your oasis from the commotion of the Latin Quarter. Stroll the gardens, get a café at the teahouse, or just grab a chair by the fountain and watch the Parisians recreate. Peaceful, beautiful and serene, in the middle of the chaos of the student district. One of the places I visit each time I come to Paris. Its not real big, but the few hours I spend here reinvigorates me every time.

Beautiful park. It is a lovely place to spend a day in Paris or at least part of your day on the left bank. There are comfy chairs to relax in the sun and give your feet a rest. We loved the flowers, trees and a great place to people watch

Paris relaxes here!. This place is great. Lovers necking, families strolling, children squealing with delight while sailing toy sailboats in the pond. This place is beautiful and seems to be how Paris relaxes.I love this place!
Beautiful. The gardens were very nice, and had some blooming flowers. I'm sure in the spring it's even more beautiful
Luxembourg Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful, great for a morning stroll which is what we did. It was peaceful and the mansion was stunning.

Hidden Gem. We were on a guided coach tour of Paris when we stopped here. What a revelation. This really is a hidden gem, which I think the Parisians keep to themselves and who can blame them?? The gardens are really beautiful with a large lake in front of the Palace. People were just sitting around in family groups or as individuals just reading or relaxing. A wonderful relaxing place in the heart of the city.

For a quiet morning stroll. Jardin du Luxembourg is close to the Panthéon, Boulevard Saint-Michel and many other attractive places to visit. This summer we met friends who had a long stopover in Paris CDG on their return to Canada from Africa. They easily took the RER from the airport to the Luxembourg stop and arrived about 30 minutes later. We met for coffee and croissants and then enjoyed a quiet stroll around the gardens before the crowds arrived. Unfortunately it was too early for the boats on the pond. Wear good walking shoes as the garden paths are stone gravel.

Gorgeous large garden behind the Parliment Building. Lovely garden used by many peope in Paris. Plenty of chairs to sit and just people watch. Concession stand also has drinks, water, wine etc. and small lunches.

Pack a picnic and chill. Beautiful gardens in Paris, easy access with metro very close by. We brought a bottle of wine and a baguette and just relaxed enjoying the beautiful sunny day. There is a large pond where children can sail boats and Luxembourg Palace is beautiful. Well worth the visit

A relaxing retreat in the middle of Paris. My wife and I visited Luxembourg Gardens one afternoon after going to the Pantheon, which is only a few blocks away. The gardens were beautiful in the late afternoon light. Many Parisians were relaxing and strolling in the park. It is a very pleasant retreat from the busy streets surrounding the gardens.
Lovely way to spend a Sunady. A lovely way to spend a Sunday and see Paris at rest. Brings Sunday in the park to a whole new level.

Take a picnic.... ...a baguette and a bottle if cold white.
Can't beat it!
Very beautiful and calm x
This is my fave memory of Paris, simple and delightful!

Gardens, museum & Fountains at the LUX .... Visiting the LUX is like a walk in the greenery of Central Park, only classier, more interesting & safe. Maybe a concert will be heard, fountains to enjoy & the museum, with changing exhibitions, will be going on. Right now the emphasis is on the anniversary of WWI, with amazing exhibits. Afterwards, there's a market nearby, or off to visit Cluny or the Eglise St. Sulpice. Enjoy ...

One of My Favorite Places. We did a gourmet tour in St. Germain and took some of gourmet food finds to Luxembourg for a picnic. The weather was a bit chilly but the gardens were beautiful. I think these gardens are prettier than the Tuilleries. We had wine, cheese and bread. We found some chairs and had our picnic. It was probably for me one of the highlights of my trip. I think that might sound weird because it was just a picnic in a park but there was just something relaxing and special about it.
lovely park. Great place to spend a few hours walking around great park with beautiful flowers and trees.Well worth a visit

Sunday Morning in the Park.. Delightful way to spend a Sunday morning. We walked from our hotel in St. Germain des Pres on a lovely morning. The park was alive with locals jogging, exercising and just sitting and taking in the beauty of the park. By the time we left in the late morning the park was really bustling with visitors, get there early for the a nice local vibe.

wonderful relaxing morning in Paris. Our hotel was across the street from this beautiful park, so we took advantage of the green space. There are statues, fountains, artists painting, mimes and a huge variety of fruit trees, vegetables and plants from all over.

Beautiful place in a beautiful city.. These gardens are a sprawling complex around the Senat building in the heart of the Left Bank. They are beautifully maintained and heavily used -- a very good place to spend an hour or so. The gardens are, for the most part, formally laid out, with elaborate plantings; but at the edges they become a bit more park-like. On a sunny day, it would be almost impossible not to enjoy oneself here.

Beautiful . If you have a sunny day in Paris head here. Great open spaces to relax in. Park closes in the evening so don't be late. Plenty entrances to choose from so you do not have to retrace your steps.

Well maintained regal gardens!. We took a stroll at this wonderful preserved garden after taking lunch. Metro station is right outside the park,so it's easy to reach.There was a big variety of flowers all around with the palace right in the middle and a little pond surrounding it. There were people relaxing in the metallic chairs provided,having coffee, taking lunch.Stepping on grass is strictly forbidden though, and there are guards for that reason.Excellent view to Montparnasse tower,great landscape for taking photos.

This is best place in paris!. I think this is best place in paris!
This park doesn't busy so you can rest and see the sight slowly.
I'm sure if you go this park, then you love paris more.
Loved these gardens. This is a beautiful garden with a beautiful palace. The grounds are great to walk around, but you can't go in the palace. Definitely a must do.

Beautiful and relaxing. Don't remember why we went to the Gardens but ended up there on a trip in 2008. Since then it has been a more of less required stop. Probably the most beautiful large gardens in Paris, maybe the most beautiful period. The gardens are popular with Parisians who picnic there or just stroll through the gardens. It has a large pond where children sail their model boats (can be rented there.) There are also fountains and a pavilion where free concerts are given periodically. A small version of the Statue of Liberty is also found in the Gardens.Visit for an hour and stay for the day.
You gotta walk through here, it's sort of a Parisian must. One of the prettiest places in Paris, and so relaxing. It's great for a stroll through, or a bike through. It's a must-do every trip.
Beautiful~. A snack of McDs bought opposite here, and ate in the garden enjoying the beautiful scenery. Perfect for a bit of relaxing before moving on to the next sight seeing location.

Great little gem in the city. The Luxembourg Gardens is this hidden gem in the heart of Paris city. The garden is pretty large, serene and really quite. You get the feeling of a public park, although beware of pickpockets and other such elements. The place does close down in the evening so beware when you go there.

Beautiful garden and palace. This is a wonderful place to visit while walking around Paris taking in the sights. You can pull up a chair or sit on a bench around the lake and have a picnic lunch while you relax and take a break. Very popular with locals and obviously well appreciated.

"Best Park in the World". My 6 and 4 year old declare that this is "the best park in the world" and attempted to have every day in Paris include a visit. We made it twice and both time left impressed. From the beautiful gardens and Luxembourg palace through to the decidedly Parisien atmosphere the adults were enchanted. The kids playground (admission 1.20 for kids, 2.50 for adults) includes a flying fox, huge climbing equipment, sand activities and a kiosk. All able to be supervised from seats outside the playground if you choose. A carousel next door (cost 1.50) was a real treat with a game of jousting to collect steel rings available to children on the coveted outer horses. There were also swings, horse rides, tennis, a toddler play centre a other activities we did not get around to. Highly recommended.
Beautiful garden!. Definitely visit if you're in Paris! The flowers and the view is great. It's beautiful and a great place to sit and relax for a bit as well.

Magical. We visited the gardens on our way to another attaction and wished we had left more time. It was a bright crisp Sunday afternoon and there were lots of people there, families, singles, couples, lots of kids with boats on the pond……kind of magical. We hated to leave and will spend more time here on our next trip.
A Must See. Beautiful public space with lovely gardens. Walk through at least once while you're in Paris. It will take your breath away.

Picnic perfect. Lovely park, nothing like you get in the UK. Spend time watching people play chess, petanque, tennis, basketball, children enjoying pushing boats on the large pond, have a beer from the cafe, take a picnic - lovely way to spend an afternoon in the autumn!
Lovely walk. Definitely recommend going to this garden for a stroll, picnic and if you have time just to people watch and enjoy the weather.

Great Gardens. A great place to just walk around in and relax. Lots of things to see, and a good atmosphere. We recommend really just sitting down and takin in the place. Good for couples and anyone really. We visited just befoe Tourist season really it, but I can imagine it getting really busy.

Wonderful Picnic in the Park. We enjoyed lunch in the Park and watch the various activities that were being undertaken. Great afternoon, away from the bustle of the busy city, but in the heart of town.

One of the Best Places in Paris.... and it's free!. These gardens are positively spectacular. We were not all that smitten with Paris, but this changed our minds. The landscaping and the public use and appreciation of this space are first-rate. Very soothing. Great to see families and friends enjoying this beautiful space.
Paris at leisure. Fab to sit here on a sunny weekend and watch the Parisians going about their leisure. A glass of wine is cheaper than a coffee!
Pack a picnic lunch and enjoy. delightful place to sit and people watch and eat your lunch , bought from one of the surrounding fabulous Boulangerie

Picturesque. There is something for people of all ages. The views are amazing and there are many people just sitting around taking in the scenery. Further in there are children playing tennis and soccer. My kids also played with the locals and enjoyed themselves immensely. In a city where kids have to mind their manners -- the park is a great reprieve!

Probably the most beautiful park in Paris. This is a wonderful place to relax. Everything seemed very well-maintained. Beautiful gardens and fountains... could easily spend a few hours walking around. Definitely a must see.
Well worth a visit.. Went here on Sunday afternoon the sun was shining and it was filled with families having picnics and spending time together.
Sit for a bit. Beautiful place to sit for a bit. I enjoyed a coffee and croissant on a bench. Good people watching in a lovely green space.
Beautiful. Such perfectly manicured gardens and the mansion is lovely as well. Good tip - head in early on a nice day for breakfast in the gardens of crepes and coffee. Perfect!

Beautiful. Very quiet place filled with statues, fountains and a well kept garden. Love the Medicis Fountain.
Plenty of attractions for kids as well.

Decompress in the Heart of Paris. I love this garden more than Versaille or Giverny. Both of those may be worth the trip once, but I can return to Luxembourg Gardens again and again. It doesn't hurt that it is walking distance from so many wonderful pastry shops. It is my choice for a sugar and chocolate loaded picnic!

Beautiful.. These gardens are simply beautful, the sun was shining all week an I came here in the afternoon to do just what Parisian's do best relax an take in the beauty, loads of seats you won't be stuck for a place to sit. Not far from the Pantheon, Musée Curie & The Catacombs of Paris. Must see.
Luxembourg Gardens. A very large garden close to the Latin Quarter and St. Germaine districts. This garden is worth spending a hour or two strolling through on a sunny day.

Must see in paris. This french garden is a good combination of french civilisation and nature. The garden arrangement is very french, symmetric, good perpective design. People will take a stroll in the garden on a sunny day or just sit around the center fountain to enjoy a nice cup of café, watching the birds.

Beautiful. Visited in a whim. Got the train exited at Luxembourg station so close!Stunning gardens and palace. The whole family enjoyed walking through. Sitting on the grass (where allowed), it's clearly marked where you can and can't sit. Parisians where enjoying the fine weather, sitting in the sun.The cafe there is great. If you need the toilet make sure you have 50 Euros cents ready. That's per person.But seriously, its beautiful and we loved spending time there. Enjoy!

My favourite park in Paris. Every time I go to Paris, I have to spend at least one afternoon lounging in this wonderful old park with its green metal chairs, it's pond facing the majestic Palais, it's gardens... It is peaceful, yet so close to St-Michel or Odéon where you can go for a pint or a coffee right after...

Lovely place to relax. After a very busy day doing the tour bus we took it easier on the second day by spending the morning here. Beautiful gardens, we walked round for a bit and just sat down on one of the many chairs dotted around and enjoyed the sun on our faces whilst watching the world pass by. A really picturesque place, and although quite busy it still felt like an oasis of calm. Really really nice.

A Gorgeous, Kid Friendly Park. We love Luxembourg Gardens even though you can't go on the grass (except for maybe one or two tiny places). There is a huge yet crowded playground, pony rides, and spectacular gardens and architecture. A win-win for parents and kids alike.
My favorite park. A great park to wander. They have a playground, admission is charged but that keeps it uncrowded. There are pony rides and an antique carousel.

Tour of the Gardens. The Gardens are a must! It gives you a sense of walking into an impressionist work of art. The various activities are a delight to observe, the gardens are gorgeous and statues so impressive.

Romance is the thing. Strolling around Luxembourg garden is awesome. The live music, sunshine and trees in the fall cannot be more romantic. My problem is that I visited by myself and felt so jealous with couples :D :D :D
Lovely place to stroll through on a beautiful day!. There are tons of important things to see in this section of Paris and the Luxembourg Gardens is not to be missed.

Wonderful picturesque gardens . Lovely place with plenty of people wandering around.Community feeling, lots of couples, families and joggers. Wonderful to wander around and people watch. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and beauty of the gardens. Definately a must. Close to lots of lovely shops and café.

Beautiful gaden. This place is a fabulous place to sit and relax in. The boats look like great fun although I didn't get a chance to try them. There's a stall where you go to rent them, each one with a different country's flag. There's so much going on its easy to spend a day here.

Lovely Childrens Playground. Great childrens play area. Unfortunately we were moved on by an officious guard when my grandson was sitting on a rug on the grass, apparently the grass is for looking at not using, when the weather is so beautiful.
Beautiful park.. Relaxing, lots of people watching, great location, met friendly people. Great park for a lunch and relaxing from walking.
Lovely. This and the gardens near the louvre are worth strolling through on a nice day If you can find a chair sit for a while and feel life in paris
Beautiful.. A must see in Paris. The gardens are just beautiful, we unfortunately didn't get to stay very long otherwise we would have had a little picnic.

Glad we visited. Luxembourg Gardens is a definite must see. There is no cost to visit the gardens. The flowers, landscape, statutes, and scenery are beautiful and there are plenty of seats to sit and just enjoy the views.

A must see. The walk through this garden was absolutely refreshing as you suddenly enter into a different world. In every part of the garden you see people enjoying different activities. There were toy boats available on rent, artists performing, beautiful flowers all around and so much more.

Gorgeous. Definitely worth a visit. Probably better to spend a couple hours there to absorb the beauty. We took a bus which stopped right outside the gardens. The pantheon is just a short bus ride away from here as well.
Peace and Quiet. The gardens are stunningly beautiful. They were the prettiest gardens we visited in Paris! Well worth the visit...I didn't want to leave!

Beautiful. Visited these in our first day in Paris on the left back. We went staying in Montparnasse and it was an easy walk. Felt more like a Parisian than a tourist since many local people take advantage of their beautiful surroundings.
Jazz Band in the Park. The end of September, the sun is shining and there is jazz band playing in the band stand. A beautiful way to spend a Saturday afternoon in Paris.
Beautiful!. Lots of runners, lots of families, and no pets! The gardens are huge, so there's plenty of room for everyone.

Very attractive spot for a quiet stroll or picnic lunch. The gardens are quite beautiful with many statues and water features. There are many benches to relax on and enjoy the displays. Well worth a visit.

Nice stroll. Didn't know what to expect before visiting this garden, maybe that's why I was so amazed at how beautiful it is. Lots of sitting spaces where you can relax and enjoy the view to the fountains, statues and flowers in blossom. On one of the adjacent street there are a few restaurants/cafés...I decided to have take away and enjoy it in the park. Also it was not crowded, ideal to relax and escape the crowds!

Nice park in Paris. Spent an afternoon there. It was crowded because it was during a national holiday. Lots to do for the little ones. A playground, pony rides, and a big fountain where you could rent a small boat to push around. Nice place to relax.

A Delightful Excursion. These gardens make a pleasant excursion on a sunny day. They are scattered with statues, including a replica of Bartholdi's model for the Statue of Liberty. Around the decorative pond is a raised terrace with marble statues of the queens of France, female saints and famous women. There is a large playground for children & an orchard devoted to 600 different varieties of pear & apple trees. There are over 1000 trees in total & they are all espalier or trained to grow in pyramid or other shapes. There are hundreds of chairs available for seating in the sun & a couple of public toilets. Outside the gardens on the fence from Rue Gay Lussac along Rue De Medicis to Place Paul Claudel there is usually an extensive photographic exhibition. The current one is a fascinating documentation of bee keeping around the world with explanatory text in French & English. Recommended.
Nice place to meet sunset. One of the best places in Paris. Park closes about 6-7 pm. Architecture and perfectly straight tracks makes space wider than it actually is.
Best during the week.. We love to come here and read and walk. Weekends so do a lot of others. There is still room for all and people watching is good here.
Beautiful gardens for a picnic! . Had a light lunch with my family here. You can buy sandwiches and chicken at the local market near by, and eat on the grass near the gardens. Beautiful view!

Beautiful and relaxing. Strolling the gardens on a beautiful Sunday afternoon is to be reminded that Parisians know how to live. People sitting on benches reading books, young lovers walking hand-in-hand, children on pony rides - it is a marvellous public space. The lineup to the palace is long but you can enjoy the gardens for free.

A Great escape. I just loved the vibe of this place, easily one of my favorite places that I visited during my 1st visit and would happily go back if in Paris again.its a great place to spend an afternoon...classic park.It was nice to escape the city and yet you right in the middle of it

Amazing garden. Whenever I travel to Paris I can not miss a visit to this place. It gives me peace of mind and never ceases to amaze maintenance that have given forever. A great place to remember the monarchy.

Stop and Smell the Roses. You can spend pleasant, restful hours here while in Paris. The grounds are beautiful, the view of Paris architecture surrounding the park is wonderful, the atmosphere is serene, the people are gentile and friendly. It is a great place to come on a Sunday afternoon after going to the Marche Raspail in the morning. (Just a 5-10 minute walk.) Bring food and drink for a picnic, and keep your eyes open for what is in the art exhibition spaces. Such spaces in Paris as these gardens help make Paris the world's most civilized city.

If you have time to Spare. Good place for a nice evening stroll in the centre of the city. It was beautifully maintained and easily accessible. We culd find kids playing, people jogging, moms with their babies and people just sitting and doing nothing!
Peaceful!. Loved the gardens. It was a beautiful, peaceful place to stroll through to escape the Paris traffic and noise.

grab some lunch and eat it in the gardens. The gardens are a lovely green space in this busy city with s I me nice gardens, paths and water features. We grabbed a cheap 5 euro lunch deal from one of the nearby cafes that serves the university students and eat it in the gardens. It was a warm day and so kts a very pleasant place to be with lots of other people enjoying the sunshine and gardens.

Best Park Ever?. If the sun shines, go here. Take a picnic, wine, and especially a camera. People watching is unsurpassed and the park itself is immaculate and has more smiles per hour than any other city park ever visited.

Great to stroll through the Gardens and watch the People. The Luxembourg are an incredible asset for Paris and its citizens. We walked through on Sunday morning and saw the start of the "Luxembourg Marathon" foot race around the perimiter. Then in the evening another stroll through saw thousands enjoying a warm late summer Sunday evening.

Beautiful, relaxing park. I must say Parisians love their parks and it is easy to see why. This park is free, well maintained, easy to find and incredibly relaxing. Sitting by the fountain in the glorious sunshine in a chair (thank you Paris for realizing that one does need to sit and take it all in) is the ultimate Parisian activity; be sure to partake!!
Statues around the pond. Lovely oasis on the Left Bank. Great for relaxing and taking a quiet moment. Flowers and lawns are well-maintained.

pleasure time during the day. People can come with their children to play with the ship toys in the pool or just sit and enjoy the sun in summer, or even come over to read books, sit in the grass chat with your friends etc. etc. It is really lovely big park that you can enjoy seeing the green color :)

A beautiful relaxing spot in a busy city!. We visited this beautiful, quiet park several times during our stay in Paris! The immaculate gardens were a delight to the senses! It was a restful spot in a busy city!

Beautiful place to spend some time people watching and having a glass of wine. The Luxembourg Gardens are absolutely lovely and shouldn't be missed! Beautiful sculptures peek out from the trees, the flowers are gorgeous....definitely take the time to visit. We purchased snacks and wine from a vendor in the gardens, and sat on a bench for a long time, watching people go by on a sunny afternoon in October and it was just about as perfect as it could be.

Spend a few minutes, or a few hours. We always try to spend some time here when visiting Paris. It is not as large as some other parks, but that is what makes it special - It is not as crowded. There are lots of places to create your own quiet space.
Enjoy the beautiful flowers and sculpture. We especially enjoy spring and fall for the colorful leaves.

Beautiful gardens!. Super nice to walk through on a sunny day and just chill on the chairs around. Has plenty of space for kids to run around and play or for one to sit and enjoy reading a book. Great place to people watch as well :)

A beautiful place for enjoying a sandwich and relax. Le jardin du Luxembourg is a great green area in the 6ème arrondissement, a very nice area in Paris, where you can take take a walk or sit down for lunch (by bringing your own sandwich) and relax.

Wow!. We accidently fell upon this looking for the Notre Dame! Breathtakingly beautiful! A must see if you want to see some amazing gardens, water features, parks or to let the kids play! Chestnut trees everywhere.
One of my favourite places in Paris and we found it by mistake and I'm so glad we did
Lovely Garden. Luxembourg Gardens is a nice place to relax and view the locals relaxing and enjoying free time. Great place to take a break!
Peace & Tranquility. Be sure to visit the Luxembourg Gardens to wind down from the fast pace of the city.Beautiful open grass areas with colorful flowers and kids playing areas
A romantic stroll. This is a must if you like slowly ambling through the garden soaking up the atmosphere seeing the statues etc.

Promenades !!!!. Great walks (promenades). You can also enjoy seating in any of the public chairs you will find there. Its a great place to rest a while in a walking day in Paris. There's also a cafe restaurant near by the palace.
Beautiful gardens.
Amazing ambience with parisiens and tourists.
perfect for romance. simply WOW, magnificent, mystique, and perfect for romance. carry your seating arrangements and foods. please keep it clean, its a part of history. see the BIG FACE.

Favorite spot for a quiet break from the city. I'm always amazed that I can be a 5 minute walk from the hubub of St. Germain and in the gardens I can sit with a coffee and watch the casual parade of people taking their daily walks. I've spent many an hour in these gardens and there are many quiet corners to hide in to relax in the middle of this bustling city. If you're looking for excitement and a fast paced morning, go elsewhere. If you want a peek into how many of the locals spend a Sunday morning, grab a snack, a coffee and a good book and settle in for a few hours.

Something for free. This was an easy walk from Notre Dame Cathedral. This attraction had lovely gardens to stroll around and enjoy the picnic atmosphere. It can get quite crowded in the warmer months but the entry is free so you can spend as much or as little time as you like there.
A gem!. This is a great place to see Parisians enjoying the sun and/or their families. I even saw a fashion shoot.

Lovely Gardens for a Nice Afternoon Walk!. The Luxembourg Gardens in Paris are beautiful and are great for a nice morning or afternoon walk. You can spend an hour or two there and enjoy watching some beautiful trees, flowers, pool, fountains and some statues. You have to pick a nice day, otherwise it can get pretty hot in the summer and ruin your visit. Have some water bottles with you anyway. We have been there twice. It is a nice place to visit, after you have seen the must places in Paris: Orsay and Louvre museums, Arc De Triomphe and Champse Elysees street, Eiffel Tower, Montmartre, and Notre-Dame church.
A must see when spending a week or so in Paris Paris. Fabulous in the Fall and Spring a bit more crowded in the Summer. Bring good walking shoes and plan for a delightful experiemce in the gardens!
A respite from the hustle of Paris!. Very beautiful garden with small sail boats, operated by kids, floating around the small pond. Very relaxing and spacious.

Beautiful and Free!!!. We lucked out! The Luxembourg Gardens were just at the end of the street from our hotel (Le Senat). We took advantage of some peaceful relaxation mid-day to read and rest. Lots of chairs available around the ponds to soak up some sun and put your feet up after a morning of sightseeing. Beautiful flowers! If you go with children, a great place to let them run and explore.
Great spot to relax. Beautiful public gardens near Montparnasse....many chairs to admire the views, sun or shade, great people watching, tennis courts, cafes--classic french.

Medici Fountain. We always visit the Medici Fountain when we are in Paris, usually with a newspaper, a book we're reading, or a KIndle, so that we can relax in a chair by the fountain, enjoy the tranquility of the place, and often, have a snack or drink that we have brought.
Luxembourg Gardens. A quiet oasis in the middle of a bustling city. Take a walk in the lovely gardens, enjoy the Medici fountain or just sit and rest.
Delightfull!. One of the best places to be in when in Paris, especially spring to autumn. And ,y favourite gardens, of course.
Very cute place. I went to the gardens with my cousin and my grandma at the last October and we all really enjoyed the beautiful gardens with the nice coffee houses at the eraea

Could Have Sat Here for Hours!. We viewed these lovely gardens in the rain! I would have loved to come back on a sunny day and picnic! The grounds are just beautiful. A great place to go sit and relax - away from the museum hoards.

Luxembourg gardens - a must see!. Luxembourg gardens is very beautiful and a must see when visiting Paris. Take some time to sit on a bench in the shade or look how children play with little sailing boats on the big pond.

Feel like a true Parisian!. Spending a leisurely afternoon in this park is one of my favourite things to do in Paris. There's plenty of chairs to sit on for you to enjoy the beautiful scenery, greenery, a picnic, a read or simply people watching. The flowers and trees are gorgeous. For families there's a great playground complex - it has a nominal entrance fee but it gives you all day in and out privileges and free use of the washroom on site.
Ce très tranquil !. What a lovely garden, beautiful and calm beyond description. The garden has many seating options for you to lie down, watch, read and do whatever you want.

One of the best parks.. Well manicured lawns and beautiful flower gardens. Ideal place to chill out for lunch or picnic even when busy as it has the typical Parisian ambience. There are toilets, cafes, play area, etc. Well worth a visit.

A great place to send a few hours or a day. A great place to wander & explore, with great access to the Metro. Sail a model boat or just sit & watch the children play, lots of statues & art to see good eating spots.

One of the best parks in Paris. If you're looking for a day in a park, the Luxembourg Gardens are definitely the choice. It has access to lots of activities (tennis), lots of alleys with trees and many open areas. There is also a small lake in the middle with lots of chairs around it.

An afternoon picnic. We took a lunch of meat, cheese, bread and wine and ate in the gardens on a lovely day. It is beautiful and relaxing and very french. there is a children's garden as well as people playing chess--very nice.

Great gardens. Pleasant place to unwind from the crowds of Paris, although the gardens can be a bit crowded too,but the flowers and grass and fountains are lovely, the chairs and the sandy pathways are very sweet.

Good walk, lovely gardens. Breathtaking gardens with something for everyone. Plenty of seats to take in the views. Every corner there is anther aspect to look at. We were there at the start of Autumn but I imagine there is something to see all year round for both garden lovers and non.

Beautifully cured garden in the heart of Paris.. We came here to have our picnic lunch of the most expensive olive patè (in the world, bought at a booth nearby) and great bread. Excellent place to people watch, and the great chairs available to all were a godsend. We would have stayed longer, but a cloudburst sent us on our way...
I was there in the off season. You would have to visit the garden during a month other than March. I expect it would be beautiful then...
A park worth visiting.. A wonderful park for walking, people watching, and just relaxing. The palm trees give it a very Mediterranean feel.

Nice place for some peace. Beautiful gardens
Especially nice to sit in the sun for a while and avoid the crowds and Craziness of the city. Sit with a book. Locals come here to do just that.

Beautiful Gardens. We went on a Sunday afternoon. It had rained earlier and the day was cool, but sunny. The flowers were gorgeous and very perky after the rain. We sat in the green chairs, watched the crowds, and just relaxed. Nice way to unwind after a museum morning. This would be a great place for a picnic.
Luxembourg gardens. Amazing and fabulous garden!!! A must see sightseeing!!! Nice to relax and enjoy the beautiful view!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Peace in a busy city. An oasis in Paris. Lots of people but such a huge area you don't notice them. Men playing chess and cards at tables. Great to see kids enjoying the pony rides and sailing their yachts on the pond - all with national flags on them. Including an Aussie one. A great spot to relax and watch the locals
Beautiful walking park. It is quite lovely and we met more locals here. Lovely grounds. A great place to pack a picnic and just enjoy.
beautuful. Beautiful and a great place to stroll and enjoy the beauty!!! Lots of opportunity to see the gardens while in paris
Beautiful!. The gardens were gorgeous and the statues, the fountain especially was dreamy. This seemed like the perfect place for a stroll through Paris. So happy we went.

Beautiful garden.. Metro station Rennes, Odeon or from Pantheon 15 minutes by walk. Another amazing and huge place for to take relaxing walk, look around on the beautiful statues, amazing flowers, people and playing children. Do not miss this garden.
Very pretty. It's wonderful that people can come here for free and just spend the day relaxing and enjoying the view. Perfect for a nice sunny day. The castle is stunning.
Beautiful. Gorgeous gardens. A wonderful place to take a romantic stroll or sit and read. You won't be disappointed.

Beautiful Gardens well worth a visit. The gardens were quite extensive and was very lovely. There was plenty of seats to sit and admire the gardens. There was something for everyone, people exercising, young children with their mothers. There was a public toilet available for a small cost. The Senat Building was very imposing.
Highly recommend

Jazz. Saturday afternoon jazz at bandstand. Luck to be there but maybe you can get lucky too. 20 piece group played classic jazz from 2-4. Wow. Followed up with evening vespers at Notre Dame. Paris is wonderful.
Lovely place to relax. A lovely place to relax and read a book, especially on a warm parisian afternoon. Nice art deco chars, very well kept clean park, with a very large play park for children.

Nice break from the madding crowd. Walked through the gardens during our stroll back from the CatacombsVeered into here to avoid the crowded pavements of Boulevard St MichelBeautifully kept gardens with a nice fountain at the top of the parkWe sat in the sun for 15 mins and watched the world go buyWe then exited to the east of the park and entered the Latin quarter with the impressive Pantheon
Le jardin on a cloudy day. Rain or shine, a wonderful place! Just gorgeous. The flowers were enjoying the cooler weather! Loved all parts of the garden including the apple trees.
Classic. Beautiful gardens, great for families or runners or couples...for anyone who can appreciate beautiful gardens basically. :)

Nice place to relax or take a jog. I grew up in NJ and NY and know Central Park very well, so after hearing the hype about the Luxembourg Gardens, I was a bit disappointed. Having said that, they are pretty and you get a sense (especially on the weekends) on what life is like for Parisians. Many just sit by the duck pond, others exercise by playing tennis, tai chi, jogging, or enjoying a good game of chess. The flowers are very pretty in a formal garden-way. It is very popular on the weekends.
Gorgeous Jewel of a Park in Paris. We were lucky enough to stay nearby this wonderful park. It is so beautiful and full of little niches to sit and just soak in Paris and all the beauty.

Any trip to Paris requires a stroll from Lux Gardens. This is a great place to people watch even when it is drizzling!! Not the best circumstances but a light drizzle doesn't keep the locals inside - it's just preparing for being out in the rain. I love watching the children and nannies (often) and the elderly who sit on the benches around the area and appear very content.

Don't Miss the Luxembourg Gardens in the 5th. This huge, varied, and delightful public garden is a delight. Its beautiful landscaping is terrific and there are hundreds of chairs and benches for your use. The central pond is a favorite model boating location in good weather and it also features a gazebo with free concerts. Walk, lounge, people-watch, sun worship, enjoy a picnic - it's an amazing antidote to the city traffic and bustle and free. There are even donkey rides, a playground, and a puppet theatre for those with kids. It's any tourist's respite and I make a point of spending an afternoon there everytime I visit Paris.

Beautiful gardens, and magnificent building.. Lovely gardens just a short walk from the Left Bank. Under valued by the tourist industry in my opinion. Other than myself and my partner, most other visitors appeared to be French. I have seen most of central Paris, and this is the only place I know of that could genuinely be called 'romantic' in the whole city.
Great garden. The great of french gardens are the chairs, everywhere you go you find chairs that you can move to sit wherever you want. Besides the garden is very nice, great to take photos

sun and flowers. A lovely garden to stroll through to get a rest from the hustle and bustle of Paris. Beautiful flowers, lots of places to sit and a cafe to have a cup of coffee or a glass of wine and watch the world go by.
Nice and beautiful garden. One of the most beautiful places in the city . This neat gardens are perfect to have a picnic, a walk or just rest.
peaceful gardens. Really nice well kept and maintained gardens - At weekend be careful as the place is absolutely crammed with joggers a lot with prams !
Don't miss it. Beautiful garden!! Stroll around to see the sculptures or just enjoy your day relaxing. Nice place for a picnic.

Probably my favorite place in Paris.. Ideal for spending a lazy summer afternoon. Just perfect. Beautiful statues, fountains, lots of trees and flowers, etc., etc. One can sunbathe, take pictures, read, have a picnic, listen to music, have a cup of tea at the cafe nearby, or visit some sort of exibition in the park's museum (best way, of course, is to combine all these activities).
What a lovely place !. Amazing views, relaxing place to sit and watch the world go by. The flowers and plants were lovely and so well done. The statues a great viewing .
Quick visit but beautiful. It had been raining so we only had a quick visit but the gardens looked lovely and it would be good to visit again.

Beautiful even in the Fall. We always come here whenever we are in Paris. It is such a quiet oasis, no wonder the locals love it here. You will see joggers, tennis players, parents with strollers, couples holding hands, sitting together, just enjoying the sunshine or the flowers etc. etc. Bring a picnic here and just sit, eat and people watch. You can easily spend several hours here. Flowers in the summer are absolutely stunning - but in the Fall, they are still beautiful. It is a great place to visit away from the hustle and bustle of central Paris.

An oasis of sanity in a very busy beautiful city. This park epitomizes the French embrace of the quality of life. It is always being enjoyed and rightfully so. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy watching the other park goers enjoy their time there as well

The nicest garden/park in Paris. The garden itself and the views from here are incredible. It is a lovely peaceful place to wander and also to sit on one of the many chairs that are helpfully placed in most of the green spaces in Paris. I wish all cities would do this. This should be on everyone's list of places to visit while in Paris.

Rest when needed. When Paris gets too much and no matter how much you love it the feet let you down eventually. The gardens are a real treat letting you contemplate and regain your equilibrium. And there are lots of seats!

Beautiful Garden less tourist . My wife loves this garden/park and I can see why. It's behind a lovely palace. It's gardens are planted exquisitely. In a central area is a large pond the the children launch boats across. It's fun to watch the children get excited and race around the pond. If I had little one I would bring the here to wear them out. The Medeci fountain is one of her favorites in the garden. The garden feels more like a locals park less tourists. If you get a chance you should include this in your sites to see. It's free! Easy off the Metro.

My favorite spot in Paris. I loved revisiting the Luxembourg Gardens last week, just relaxing in a seat after a frenetic day of crowds in the city , and watching all the runners, mothers with their little children, and lovers walking hand in hand.All of the beautiful plane trees, the fountains, statuary, especially the grotto, and my favorite, the mini lake where the children love to play with their little boats make this such a unique and special park. I love the sound of my shoes crunching on the gravel on all paths. Everything about the park is such a bucolic retreat from the Paris city life.
Not to be missed, truly beautiful!. My favourite spot in Paris especially on a Sunday afternoon. Beautiful little haven of tranquility. Do not leave Paris without a stroll through the gardens.
Beautiful Expensive Gardens. Lovely gardens and grounds that transport you to another time. Wear comfortable shoes, lots to see here, and photo ops, as well.

My favorite place on earth. This little garden is a gem in the 5eme arrondissement, so charming and calm. A must go when in Paris. The fountain close to the castle (senate) is just gorgeous and a great place for resting in the shadows.

Relaxing. Enjoy your time. Visited the gardens September. With my wife and one year son. We enjoyed every minute here. So relaxing inside busy town. My son enjoyed running and chasing the birds. Laughing and excited from the Fontaine and from the atmosphere. Great great quality time with the family. Must see attraction.
Luxembourg garden, Paris, France. Gorgeous grounds well treed with nice walks throughout the garden. Easy access with metro. In Latin quarters!
Beautiful and nicely located. A must see in my opinion. The gardens are beautiful and neighbourhood outstanding for other activities . Lunch, dinner, getting lost .

Go on a Sunday and watch all the "Flaneurs".. We went here on a sunny Sunday afternoon in September. Great place to people watch Parisians. Lots of people strolling about, with kids messing with the little sailboats in the pond. A true Parisian experience.
Relax. Super nice place to have a beer in the afternoon and people watch. Free chairs to sit on are located throughout the park
Worth the visit. Best seen on the weekend to get the Parisienne experience. Flower and grounds excellent. People watching great.
Beautiful gardens!. What a beautiful Garden! This was the most beautiful garden we visited within Paris. We enjoyed the grounds as did school children, walkers, joggers, and lookers.

A Place of Beauty and Relaxation. Loved wandering around this property as an antidote to busy Paris life. Perimeter walking/jogging path. Pond for children to sail toy boats. Carousel. Places to sit and just people-watch or read. Lovely.

Peaceful + good for families . Great place to take the family for a relaxing time in Paris. Lots of history as expected + a nice play ground. My son had an amazing time there. Itthere is a reallyniceniceplayground
Walk the Gardens. Lovely walk in the gardens and see the sculptures and just enjoy a take out sandwich and admire the geometric layout
Well tended and amazing statues. Beautiful well tended gardens with amazing statues throughout. I think it is perfect any time of year but the spring and summer are more beautiful for a stroll.

Paris in the Park: Jardin Luxembourg. Grab a picnic basket full of fromage, pate, baguette and a bottle of sparkly and spend a lazy day in this wonderous park with the ferris wheel!! Youll find therewill be chairs scattered all over for your personall use...ponds and sculptures to view.... goats and ducks to amuse... people watching people watching.... icecream .... the Musee de l' Orangie , full of the most wonderous art works including Monsieur Monets exceptional Murals of waterlillies....Jardin Luxembourg is a no brainer just go and enjoy!
Paris' best park & gardens. Its such a wonderful slice of life here...I used to live across the street when I was a student. I still miss the neighborhood.

Beautiful, spacious, and prestine gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens in Paris are simply beautiful. Meticulously maintained to reflect the splendor of Royal France, the gardens offer a wonderful place to stroll or simply people watch on a bench adjacent to the hustle and bustle neighborhood of the University of Paris. Well worth the visit.

Delightful Open Space. What a gem in the middle of the bustling metropolis of Paris! We had a whirlwind couple of days to take in the sites and this was a great place to end. We strolled through the peaceful gardens and the forested areas. The cafe there had a great menu selection, outdoor seating which was perfect for people watching and absorbing the view. Very clean and well-kept; a nice place to snap some photos.
Peaceful, charming stroll. Perfect for a stroll with lovely scenery. Rainy day or not, this really is peace for the soul. We loved it.
Paris with only few tourists. Calm oasis close to the center providing a glimpse of the real Parisian life. Nice to spend few hours walking

Just beautiful!. Our hotel was just around the corner from this truly beautiful park. You could almost forget that you were in a bustling city after only a few steps past the gates. This park has beautifully landscaped grounds, wonderful fountains, quiet seating areas and loads of sculptures and monuments. We even saw an impromptu performance a local small band. The vistas to many public buildings are magnificent.

Beautiful Gardens worth a visit. An excellent place to wander around on a nice day with plenty of photo opportunities.
The gardens are beautiful and a nice place to relax.
Walk through it. Chill and relaxing walk. It was sunny and the breeze perfect. Helps that the location is central so it is not out of the way.

Most Beautiful Gardens in Paris!. If you're longing for an authentic French experience, swing by the Luxembourg Gardens for an hour or two, grab a chair by the fountains, and watch the world go by. To me, these are the most beautiful gardens in Paris (even lovelier than the Tuileries). Definitely worth a stop when you're in the city of lights.

Huge gardens to relax. This was era of having 5-6 gardens with 50-60 rooms. These are well maintained and have multiple entrances with lot of greenery and chairs to sit and relax. There is big circular pond in centre. The entrance is free and is grand with sculptured fountain to welcome you.

Gem in Paris!. What a treasure! The landscaping is wonderful, the places to just sit and observe people are abundant, and we were thrilled with a photographic display in the bottom level of the Senate which was free and accessible via the garden side of the Senate.

Great garden. A wonderful garden to sit or stroll around. There are chairs and benches to sit on and have a picnic or just relax. You can sit on the grass too. Bring a blanket and some sandwiches. You can buy gelato too. There are little art galleries too. Lots of fun and a relaxing place to chill out.
Worth a side trip. Definitely worth a trip for an hour or so on a beautiful, sunny day. Magnificent grounds and spectacular setting. Easily accessible and easy walking around the gardens.

A wonderful place to relax. It's absolutely free to find a chair and watch the people, boats, and fountain. Walking around though you can admire the statues as well as the flowers if they are in bloom.

Charming and restful. These beautiful garden park is a must-visit place on any trip to Paris. Make sure you find the Medici fountain located in one quiet corner of the park. There is also museum in there.

Luxuriant beauty. We stayed in a small hotel bordering the Garden and had occasion to walk through or to sit in the Garden several times over the course of our ten days in Paris. Each day was different. It was ever so lovely to see so many individuals and families and couples using that lovely space, doing so many different things.
Good for walking and take pictures. Calm place to walk while looking to all the beauty around. You can take nice pictures and eat a snack too.

Excellent playpark. We wanted to make sure our 2.5yr old had good playtime and there is an excellent playpark there. It costs to get in (only a few euros per family)but it is very big and he loved it! Two seperate sections under and over 7's. In the park there is also the puppet theatre and pony rides.

History, Romance and as much exercise as you want. You can watch people play chess, jog, fall in love, argue or just walk or sit. You can reflect on your thoughts and leave the frenetic pace of the city behind. It never rejects you and always takes you as you are.

Best local tip. Do as Parisians on a sunny weekend. Get some great food a good bottle of Champagne or wine and head for the gardens. There are a lot of activities in Paris where you can spend your time. But to sit in the gardens eating some great good is probably the one most worth while in Paris.

On a fine day - perfect. Lovely spot with so much going on. Great for relaxing, people watching and picnicking. Fountains, boating lakes, pony rides, table tennis, beautiful flowers and stunning architecture.

Haven of calm.. Huge immaculate park that had a very calm atmosphere with lots of people sitting around on the free chairs reading, relaxing and enjoying the weather. Lovely pond with children sailing old fashioned boats. A haven of calm amongst the busy city.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park, good for running or strolling or lying on the lawn. Great little fountains, sculptures, playground for the kiddos.
A beautiful spot in Paris. What's not to like? a beautifully manicured garden in the middle of Paris. What more can you ask for?

Stunning place and great staues. In the grounds of the French Senate lays some of the most beautiful Parisian gardens. No matter what time of year, there is something to see. Look out for the now replica of the original Statue of Liberty.

A fine Parisian Garden - and a moment of calm. Visited these gardens on our last day - just a 15 minute walk from our hotel (see earlier review). The Palace itself is lovely, and the gardens - great! We enjoyed seeing kids captain their toy boats in the huge decorative pool, and seeing various kids groups do fun things like ride horses. Lots of locals and tourists alike, on a sunny day one can sit in the shady and have a moment of zen.

A Must see relaxing environment. Loved visiting Luxembourg Gardens. The grounds were very clean and well kept. They had plenty of chairs out for you to sit and enjoy the gorgeous scenery. There were also little push boats you could rent to push across the pond or you could just sit back and relax. Do not miss this area. You only need about an hour to visit and enjoy.
"Park" would be more accurate than "Gardens". I was surprised as I expected something like a botanical garden. However, it is very beautiful and serene and the palace is beautiful.

If you have little kids go!. I am always surprised more visitors with small kids dont take them for a run around Luxembourg Gardens. For visitors old and young the gardens and monuments themselves are wonderful. However for children the play areas are just fantastic. I actually recommend staying nearby, using the benefit of the garden for the inevitable 7am wake up call or family picnic and using the great transport links from the area to see the rest of Paris.
Silence. Soooooo lovely. Go there when the Sun is shinning. Enjoy the tiny boats sailing around. But becarefull on sundays.... NOT to get run down by runners!!

Little known gem enjoyed by Parisians and we lucky that stumble upon it. We enjoyed the gardens on a sunny Sunday morning after a week of off and on rain. It was great to be with the Parisians as they enjoyed family and friends. So beautiful and incredibly relaxing

Where time stands still. 23 hectares of endless beauty is difficult to review and find adequate words for. Every step you take inside this impressive and truly stunning garden is absolutely breathtaking... Time seems to stand still in this place and yet has so many stories to share. The immaculate landscaping, romantic vistas and impressive architecture all stand as a witness to its remarkable history.

Beautiful city park. Nice walk through the park. Lots of chairs standing around. One minus was that at one of the entrances there is a mcdonalds, which makes it like a day out for familly picnic and you will smell it on that side of the park, which is a bit weird.

Amazing garden is a must see. This large oasis was not listed as a top site to visit. . . . What a miss. This park is a real gem and stunningly beautiful. This is a great spot to have a romantic picnic lunch. This is a must see.
beatufiful garden but nothing more. Very nice and clean, it allows a very calm stop from the noise of the city or for a quick run. Worths a visit

Did not disappoint! . After being thoroughly let down by the Tuillerie Gardens we had to get to Luxembourg. Certainly the highlight of our trip! We loved seeing the children playing with their school groups and NOTHING can compare to the flowers!

Wonderful scenery, beautiful gardens. Wonderful scenery, beautiful gardens with rare trees and flowers . The walk in this garden will relax you on a sunny day. Sit on the benches in front of a small lake with wooden kids boats and It's good to have a snack with you, also.
A nice and quiet place. A nice and quiet place in the left bank, in the center of "Quartier latin", an historical place with a wonderfull 16 century palace, now the Senat.
Beautiful relaxing garden. The flowers were so brilliant and the grounds well maintained. I recommend it as a walk through if you have time.

Royalty...for the people.. So we can thank the French Revolution for this "park". Indeed, with the king's head chopped off and absolutist royalty pushed to the side, many of the magnificent palaces and gardens which were once reserved for the French "top of the food chain" now belong to the people! And what a joy! The Luxembourg Gardens, kind of like Versailles and many others fall into that category. To me, it is a simple and complimentary way to feel like nobility for an instant. Grab an ice cream at nearby "Dalloyau", pull a chair, feed the pigeons and marvel at the regal design of this palace and gardens...while enjoying hundreds of Parisians and tourist do the same thing...exquisite!
peace land. beautiful garden and flowers, palace was amazing, best place to have a breakfast or to do some exercises
Cafe. After strolling go to the cafe for a glass of wine and a plate of pomme frittes, my favorite in Paris and I only ever allow myself to consume them in Paris...enjoy

Gorgeous, relaxing, and peaceful grounds.. Beautiful grounds! We had the pleasure of being able to stay right across the street from the gardens so we had access to the grounds at anytime, however, this was a very peaceful and relaxing park in Paris that is not has busy as some of the others right downtown. There are paths for running, benches for relaxing and private areas to relax for picnicking or socializing. This is a romantic and family-friendly area. They even have small actual food gardens on location. It is enormous!

A wonderful park in the middle of Paris. Take a stroll, sit on the chairs and look into the fountain, walk around the park, have a drink, a snack, play with your children, it is a delightful experience

Paris, relaxed. Grab a sandwich and come here for a lunch or mid day break.Take a seat by the fountain and watch the children with their sailboats in the fountain.\Enjoy the floral arrangements throughout the park. This is the place Parisians come to relax, be they students or teachers from the nearby universities, lawmakers from the French Senate, or everyday Parisians just taking the time to enjoy life's simplest pleasures.

A wonderful oasis. I spent twelve days in Paris on my own, and by the ninth day I needed a little downtime. Le Jardin du Luxembourg was the perfect solution. I enjoyed the palace, the sculptures of the French queens, and the beautiful trees and flowers. It's a great place to sit on a bench and people watch, too! Afterwards, you can go to one of the many cafes in the area. Delightful!

Beautiful . Spent hours here walking round enjoying the flowers and the amazing scenery. Took a packed lunch and just sat amongst the people just taking it all in. Especially enjoyed watching all the schools having their PE lessons.

Lovely place. Its an ideal place for chilling and spend valuable time with your friend/friends.
Chairs and benches are for everyone. The hexagon shaped lake is interesting.
The gardens are in the middle if Paris.
Worth it!

Wonderful open space, great for kids. This is a must visit especially with kids. With an amazing playgroud, lake for racing model boats and ponies set in immaculate gardens you should go there. Only thing you should know is that the boats and ponies are only there in school holiday times...
The Paris at Leisure Experience. This garden is a must when visiting Paris. Watch people, read a book, soak up the sun, enjoy the gardens, it's all good

Nice hangout. Jardin de luxembourg or the Luxembourg Gardens is a nice place to go for a stroll if you have time while you are in Paris. In summers specially on weekends expect it to be packed with people. A lot of time mostly throughout the year it has a nice amount of people mostly during weekends. Its a very pleasant and tranquil place to go around during week days, refreshes ones mind. It has a fountain in the centre right as you go down the stairs where you can pull a chair and just sit around admiring children playing with small boats in the water or just read a book or have a nice quite snack. On the weekends theres normally some free music concert going on to entertain people. Depending on the time of the year right at the entrance gate you may find a ice cream vender. Theres a stall inside the garden too where you can buy sandwiches and drinks ect and sit and eat out there. Over all a very nice place to relax and calm down. Once you exit the garden walk down the lane and you can find a few nice little shops to shop or window shop from. As you will keep descending you will reach the fountain of Saint Michel in the Latin Quartier which is surely worth a visit!
Gorgeous garden escape. Lovely, wide open garden with plenty of joggers, families and couples wandering about. Classic design and stunning flowers in season.

A nature retreat in the heart of Paris. These are beautiful, very tailored gardens. The symmetry and scale are impressive. I especially enjoyed the views of the large pond sitting in front of the building that now houses the French Senate. It was very peaceful and would be a wonderful spot for a quiet coffee or picnic.
So beautiful!. Great upscale gardens for strolling. Very well maintained selection of flowers and plants. Huge park with many styles and sections to enjoy.
Oasis of beauty. Stroll through magnificent gardens, listen to a Sunday afternoon open air concert or sit and read or just watch the people.

an ideal place to relax. during summer, you often come across concerts in the park; alternatively its the ideal spot to sit and soak up the sun, plan your itinerary, have lunch, appreciate the garden and enjoy people watching.

A lovely place to walk and relax. We visited the gardens on our final day. Fortunately it was not raining, as it had been on the previous two days. A wonderful setting and easily reached by the Metro. The SENAT are based in the Palais. How lucky they are to be situated here.

Beautiful garden . It was a very hot day in late August when we went through the gardens. Still worth the walk in the hot sun. Beautiful sculptures throughout the gardens, and a great atmosphere. There were some activities going on which were fun to watch, and a great part for kids. Definitely take some time to enjoy these gardens.
Luxemburg Gardens. Beautiful no matter the weather. We walked around on a lovely sunny day and also on a wet stormy day and loved every minute. I
A 'must' when in Paris for beautiful well kept gardens, fountains and statues.. Beautiful historic gardens- lovely promenades and chairs to sit and watch the world go by. The Senat is there too.
