Quiet Beauty. Near our hotel, always a pleasure to take a few minutes and spend relaxing time here. The gardens are always beautifully planted, fun people watching or just take a time out and have a drink there.
A an urban park should be. Trust me, just go and stroll through this space. It's great for a picnic and there's plenty of available seating.
Wonderful garden. Very nice chateau and garden. Look forward to visiting again. Amazing how quiet the place is on Sundays...

Good time to visit. The flowers in Luxembourg Gardens at this time of year are better than those in the Tuilleries which were better in Spring but the walks are well worth the stroll especially on a sunny day with families sailing their model boats on the ponds, joggers everywhere, families enjoying their outdoor excursions etc. lovely way to spend half a day

Beautiful way to spend an early afternoon in Paris!. Beautiful location to spend an afternoon or picnic - either walking around or just sitting and enjoying the view. I was a little surprised that it really isn't full of plants and flowers, but rather the beauty of the layout.

Peaceful gem in the hustle and bustle. We went for a lovely walk in the sunshine, and sat on one of the many seats placed around the garden for visitors and simply enjoyed the garden in the sun - a perfect oasis!

Nice to see greenery.. After spending some time in Italy it was refreshing to be greeted with such a lovely park. Green green green. Manicured lawns. Chairs to sit around and relax in. Tennis courts so you can watch people play. Children's playground. Clean and tidy.
Beautiful place. It is an amazing place, despite it was raining all day, the visit was nice. The park has nice places to take a rest and are lot of fast food commerces around.
Nice Gardens. Lovely gardens, with quite a few nice sculpture's, and lot's of places to sit and relax, is also a café in the grounds.
Luxembourg Gardens. We spent a morning wandering through the Luxembourg Gardens and found it to be very relaxing and fun to experience.

These remain a high spot to see when visiting Paris. These remain a high spot to see when visiting Paris
Lovely gardens to walk through to just sit and enjoy

Fantastic to Relax on a Sunny Day. After spending most of the day in the center of Paris my wife and I decided to walk back to our hotel in the Latin Quarter. I noticed the Lux Gardens were on the way soo we decided to go via there.The sun was out and when we entered the gardens we just has to sit down and take in the scene. They are so large we changed locations a few times. So beautiful and pleasant yet so central in Paris. The flowers, ponds, fountains, statues and trees ann with a backdrop of the Senat buildings. Well worth a visit if you are passing by or just somewhere to relax in the sun.
Gorgeous gardens!. Loved it! Is so pretty and its free! Good place to relax, specially if the weather is good. It has a playground too!

Nice garden. We bought some food and went to have it at the garden. The garden was nice, clean and quiet. It is a good place for a family to hang out and spend time together. It is also good for people who like exercising.
beautiful park. Nice place to spend your time, beautiful and calm place in the big Paris center. I recommend to visit there once.
walk around the park and search for your spot. Just walk around the park and search for your spotrelax and enjoy the sounds of this parkthe best looking spot are in the entrance, a pool and a castle

Be Parisian and enjoy these beautifully free stunning Gardens. Located in a posh part of Paris. These are an excellent place to snap a few photos or just relax. Make sure to enjoy a beer or coffee at the many cafés around the park.
Must!. Beautiful, pristine garden! They have an outdoor restaurant, with good quality food. Get some food and enjoy the view!

Perfect spot to rest and enjoy.. A wonderful respite during a very busy trip. Each day we were in Paris was full of things to do. But twice we wondered back to the gardens. The shade and peace and quite were a much needed and enjoyable break to our days.
Grand Jardin. Expansive, grand and beautiful. A good place to stroll, relax and admire the grandeur of a classic nobile landscape. Not to be missed

Beautiful, multi-use park. The best part of this huge garden/park is the availability of chairs. Yes, real metal chairs that can be moved wherever you want them and configured just as you like. I don't think I've ever been in a park with plenty of moveable individual seats. Add in the garden features, the tennis courts, the kids playground and what could be better for a break from the city.

Always worth a visit no matter what season. Plantings are completely changed at least 3 times per year and it's always impeccable. Bravo to the chief gardener and his team of real professionals. It is a delight, the best in Paris.

Great place to hang out or with kids! Loved the old merry go round!. Great place to hang out or with kids! Loved the old merry go round!A nice way to split a busy city trip up with some time in the gardens. My daughter loved running around and exploring.
Jardins de Luxembourg. This is a beautiful park, carefully laid-out yet with no sense of artifice. The national toy yacht race is particularly enjoyable.
Peaceful gardens.. Beautiful gardens enhance by a youth orchestra playing and cheering up a slightly grey day. Great place to unwind.
A must visit. A magical place to visit while in France. I can not say enough about the magic and beauty that take part of this beautiful place.
A gorgeous place that deserves to be seen. An elegant, wonderful place, which is preferred by Parisians and tourists alike. A perfect place for relaxation, meditation, reading or walking.

Green lung in the centre of Paris. Whenever I'm in Paris I set time aside to visit Luxembourg Gardens for at least a couple of hours. I love the noise & bustle of central Pris, but it's also very nice to spend some time enjoying the green tranquility of Luxembourg Gardens. It's also a great place to observe Parisians at leisure - jogging, cycling, playing boules, tennis, or cards - or just sitting & reading.

Amazing amazing amazing. Truly beautiful garden. Everything is just perfect there, I'm not a big lover of gardens, but this one is worth your attention! Buy an ice- cream and sit near the fountain to feel the absolute happiness.
Green and Scenic Park. its a scenic and green garden which is located outside of the Luxembourg Palace. There is no entry fee for this park and its a good place to relax after a long day in Paris...

Beautiful. We were there when the sun set so the sky was marvelous. There is no access to the palace itself but the gardens looked wonderful. It was nice just to sit and relax and watch the gardens and the visitors.

Cool kids playground at Luxembourg Gardens. Even though you had to pay to use the playground, it was still a very good place for kids to enjoy and let out steam. The best part was the children's zip line, which in effect was three long poles with a plastic bottom mounted on a fixed track which kids can go around as if it was a zipline. It was a fun and somewhat secure place where kids can go and let off steam, after being dragged around museums all day long.

Beautiful gardens. We enjoyed walking through the gardens and seeing the Luxembourg Palace. Although you can't visit inside the Palace, the outside area is beautiful and teaming with activity. If you are in the area definitely stop by and enjoy a walk through the gardens.
Huge garden . Nice place to sit down after a long walk in the city during the day. Spend the evening in the garden next to the palace. soak in the sun as you sip wine or champagne.
A place to relax and enjoy. Great place in Rive Gauche to hang around, specialy during weekends. Sit and watch the parade of locals and tourists.

Serenity in Paris. Great place to relax. Good space for many types of exercise ( walking, jogging, tai chi, tennis, etc.). Nice gardens, flowers still in bloom during mid-September. Statues, history has played out here.

A charming park next to Latin Quarter. A few steps from pantheon and Sorbone there is a beautiful place - Luxembourg Gardens. This is a very quiet and clean place wher you will take a rest after walkig around latin quarter and close areas. ailing boats models sailingaround give a lot of joy to the children and their parents. You can have a sunbath or rest in a shadow.
Pretty Garden. Very nice garden in Paris. This place wasn't crowded and had plenty of chairs and benches to enjoy the view.
Beautiful Gardens!. Absolutely beautiful gardens & sculptures. Lovely place to rest and read a book, have a picnic or simply people watch.
Romantic. Lovely gardens for a walk with the other half, they are very impressive and immaculately kept. We had a coffee in a cafe in the gardens with a lovely view out.

A beautiful oasis. We stayed next to the gardens while visiting Paris and loved strolling the pathways and sitting in the sun people watching or reading a book. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area - the gardens are huge and theres so many different parts to explore, the big pond, the orchard, the tennis courts and patonque area plus all the beautiful statues and colourful flowers. The main building is also stunning. On a hot sunny day the chairs fill up fast so get in quick!

OMG!!!!!. If you love gardens this is the place to visit....the colors and assorment will leave you with many wonderfull pictures and ideas for your own garden....just after a short rainfall the fregranzes will fill your senses with sweet aromas of freshness....dont pass this oppertunity while in Paris....

For kids and stars!. Probably the most beautiful public garden in Paris. Beyond the traditional mini sailing boat, a lot of playground space for kids...and adults!On Sunday afternoon, one or two French stars may pop up, taking care of their kids like you and me.

Nice park for a rest and saunter. Quiet seating areas for your drink and snack whether brought or bought locally. Nice park with gardens, statues, flower displays, lawns and lake. Model boats on leke. Orangerie and Palace can only be viewed as govn building

Lost generatin revisited. When a place is two blocks from boulevard St Germain and right behind Gertrude Stein home at Rue Fleurus, you are really in the garden of eden. So much history and such a beautiful garden that tou have to go any day, at any season at any hour. Always a place to visit in Paris. Go before or after to eat at a walking distance La Closerie des Lilas.
Love it. Go around and look on all this green love u see there.Lot of pretty people just relax Just buy some food and make urself a picnic day(:

Great Walking Grounds. I spoke of this in my review about the Louvre. This is a must see attraction. The flowers, plants, fountains, and statues give so much allure to the location. If you don't want to wait in the line for the Louvre, devout your time walking through and admiring the gardens

Beautiful gardens - must see!. I didn't visit these gardens until the third time I was in Paris. And I wondered how I had missed it so many times! It is beautiful and so many people are just out and about enjoying it. The pond in the middle is full of little toy sailboats - kids racing them about.

A Wonderful Place. When we came to Paris we came with an ad telling us of a Chagal exhibit. I collided the gallery and they said the exhit was no longer there but in Luxembourg. I was most disappointed as I would not travel to Luxembourg for the exhibit. A couple of nights later I mentioned this to friends living in Paris and they said the exhibit was in the Luxembourg Gardens. To our joy and delight we went to the Gardens and saw the most complete Chagal exhibit featuring paintings from early 1900's until the 1970s. Extraordinary! I have no idea if the exhibit is still there but if you are in the neighborhood, Paris, you should check it out.

If you see obe park in Paris this should be it. What sets this apart from other parks is the Luxembourg palace, the fountain and the beautiful statues found throughout the garden. I love how there is plenty of seats of various types for people to sit on. I saw people catching up with friends, families out for a stroll and people finding a spot to read.There is a children's play area, food avalable and toilet facilities for a small fee. You can also buy icecreams, crepes and drinks at one of the entrances to the park.

One of the finest places in the world. Amazingly enough, the sun always shines brightly when we visit this marvelous garden in the middle of Paris. Drinking coffee there and eating your sandwich is a distinct pleasure whilst pondering the fact that anyone of any note in the last four centuries of European history has walked through and enjoyed this historical and wonderful place. Les jardins de Luxembourg are a must see in Paris.

Lovely free concert - big band music in Paris!. Always a favourite with us, we were strolling through the gardens and spied a band setting up - were treated to 1.5 hour concert featuring US Big Band music and singing - Nat King Cole, Ella Fitzgerald, etc. An unexpected treat and a great way to rest your feet after waling all day in Paris.
Beautiful! . This place is just amazing. It is so beautiful to walk through especially with the sun shining! I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Paris

Very relaxing park. It is one of the most marvelous parks in Europe, it is smaller than other parks like English garden in München, but it is beautiful. As usual there are many places you can just sit down and read your favorite book or listen to lovely music and songs. There is a nice small lake where in summer you can see people are playing with their RC Boats. If you like such a game, do not hesitate to practice there. Metro is near by to reach it as most of Paris sight seeings

Charming garden. A beautiful place to walk, rest and have lunch. There is a lot of people always, and you can have a picnic on the grass. If you don't like picnics, you can always have lunch at one of the existing restaurants.
Beautiful!. Lovely formal gardens just off the Boulevard St Michel. We spent an hour sitting in the sunshine admiring the views and people watching. Nice little cafe as well.

One of the nicest parks in the world. This is why you came to Paris: see couples young and old cuddling and kissing, watch children floating toy boats, listen to live music, play or watch boules, great playground for children. Great for a casual or an exercise walk/run.
nice garden. I spent the whole day wonedring in the garden,i saw the bees too,and there are some monuments ,lots of chairs available

Relaxing Greenspace. The gardens are huge and open to relax in a chair around the pond or stroll along the walkways. It is fun to watch the kids pushing toy boats around the pond and the apiary is really interesting.

Fantastic park. Yes, it's very formal in design, but it is a great place for a stroll or to settle in with a good book -- or both. I love the more remote corners and sculptures -- and also the popular Medici fountain.
Stunning. We were surprised at how big this oasis in the middle of Paris is. From Citrus groves to sailboards and manicured shade trees this is a must see in Paris.

Best gardens in Paris!. Spend time at the Luxembourg Gardens during your next Paris trip - you won't regret it. If you are able to stay in St Germain, even better, as you can visit more than once. It's a lovely place for a picnic or to take a break from the tourist attractions. Enjoy one of the inclined seats for a quick nap!

Beautiful Respite in the City. We were here on a hot day in early September 2015 and found it to be as beautiful as any Gardens I have ever seen. As with most of the Parisian parks and gardens, it was filled with locals picnicking, playing, drinking wine and, of course, smoking.The city provides plenty of seats for those not wanting to sit on the grass.

Relaxing . If you have enough time in Paris I recommend to go there for a walk. Easy to get to. It can be busy though we enjoyed nice few hours sat watching the world go bye. It is one of the largest parks in Paris.

Lovely gardens . We visited the gardens on a lovely day. The gardens were full of sculptures and there was something to suit everyone. There were puppets which unfortunately were not showing on the day we visited. The park is very popular with runners of all abilities. There were also tennis courts, boules and children's parks too. There were fruit trees, bees were plentiful as they have their own home within the gardens.

Picnic anyone?. After a grueling morning of pickpockets, string bracelets, and "pregnant" gypsies in front of Notre Dame. The long line to get your ice cream at Berthillon. It's time for a break before tackling the Louvre. Cross the Seine on Ponte St. Michel and walk west on Blvd.St. Michel to the roundabout. On the way there are a number of fast food joints plenty of small cafes. Or stop at the Monoprix St. Michel one block West of Bvd. St. Germain. This huge park has it all. The Palace, Senate, and Museum are worth a look. But in my opinion this is a quiet, calm, and shady place to relax and wind down and recharge.

Place for a good rest. One of the best gardens in Paris.. You can sit on swards and have your snack, in such a great environment.. even if many people prefers here, it is a very clean and well kept garden..

Very pretty and relaxing. Great spot for photos and relaxing outside in the gardens. Sometimes there are shows going on as well. Ice cream is available if it gets too hot. Definitely a must see in my opinion.
Beautiful gardens. Not only are the gardens visually beautiful (and a nice break from the urban stress of a big city) but this is an interesting way to compare English and French cultures.
Lovely Garden. very lovely garden, good place for relaxation or walking.... I enjoyed the area, there were lost of chairs on which you can relax around the pool

Great place to relax and soak in the scenery. We stopped by the Luxembourg Gardens prior to our dinner reservation for a quick stroll and were surprised to find such a beautiful gem near Saint Germain des Pres.There were hundreds of people hanging out, reading, walking, running, and enjoying the sights. It seemed like a place the locals went for a quick afternoon jog as well.If you are in Saint Germain and have an extra 30-45 minutes to kill. This is definitely a place to stop by and check out. You won't be disappointed.

Sailboats and sunshine. This is a great place to catch your breath in Paris. We walked here after visiting the Pantheon, and enjoyed watching the children sailing boats in the pond in front of the palace. There are lots of benches and quiet little spots. The people watching is plentiful and free.

Pretty but?. I took a walk in and around Luxembourg Gardens and although they were green and manicured, there was a real,absense of colt from flowers or bushes. The place really looked like a jogging track for health nuts

A nice garden / park, not much more though. It's a nice gardens and a nice walk. A peaceful and quiet spot in a noisy and bustling city. It's not much more than that. Not worth a special trip but walk through it instead of around it when you are in the area.

Color explosion. By far my favorite Garden in Paris. The color schemes were ingenious, an meant to be an inspiration. Many different places to sit and enjoy the scenery. Bring a lunch and spent some down time.
Enjoyable garden for summer. I have visited this garden many times but it is the best in summer when you can enjoy the warmth in Paris and benefit the local life.
Most amazing garden. Amazing place to relax, do sports or have a romantic outing. Its vast fountain is really relaxing. There is also a paid playground for kids.

Nice but not exceptional. I jogged in these gardens every day while I was in Paris. Although not exceptionally interesting they're well kept and pretty. The air there is a bit polluted for comfortable jogging.
Peaceful. This is a great place to stop and relax during a long day of sightseeing. It's truly beautiful and so peaceful. I would definitely recommend it.
Nice park. This was next door to us at the westin Vendome so an easy walk, lots to see, good food vendors or nice to use to get to other places instead of just using a sidewalk

Great. A great place to pay a visit. Enjoyable for people who like calm and cool shades of trees and also for people who loves strolling, walking and gossiping. You will find people resting and setting back their shoulders in chairs in Summer times. A scenic place full of warmth and green.

Nice park to relax in. We stopped off at Luxembourg Gardens whilst waiting for our Eurostar back to London and it was a nice relaxing couple hours. There is a free water fountain for refilling bottles which was greatly appreciated as the price of drinks at the cafe was a bit expensive. Overall a beautiful and well maintained place; great for spending an hour of two sitting outside!

Beautiful lunch spot!. These gardens are beautiful and worth a visit. We stumbled upon a few shops and a street market along the way for bread, cheese and wine. (Saint Germain Street about .5 mile away). Took it with us and had an awesome lunch in the gardens. The shops had knives and cups to make it easy.

Peace in between the bustle. A beautiful, lovely spot in the midst of the busy Left Bank. The house is stunning, the gardens are beautiful, lots of people jogging, stretching, strolling. I can imagine at weekends it would be even busier with families (there is a playground) and Pétanquers (boules players) but it's large enough to accommodate everyone.Whether you picnic, sit with your morning café or are en route to somewhere else, a walk through these gardens will do your soul good!
beautiful place in the centre of Paris. Really enjoyed walking around this beautiful garden.Lots of things to do.You can play tennis too. There is a play area for kids too.

Worth visiting on a sunny morning . Glad I went as the ground and building were equally impressive. Very different from a typical English Park as has less green grass and lots of well manicured trees and potted plants, but I suppose that's normal given its in Paris! If you are in Paris for the second time or more, then this is the place to go to avoid the crowd!
beautiful gardens. Beautiful place to walk about and relax. Entrance is free. Amazing collection of statues and very rich in history

Luxembourg gardens. Good value to use the boats on the water. Horse riding available near kids playground. Kids playground was a highlight although you have to pay for use. Get there to buy tickets to the puppet show 30ish minutes prior you can't buy tickets online just at the theatre in the gardens. Kids get to sit in the front row. Three little pigs in French was a highlight

A walk in the Gardens. Beautiful gardens, plenty of space to sit down and smell the roses. Security around the government building. Chess games, Bocce Ball with locals...........looks like very experienced players. See the monuments-Statiue of Liberty, 1870, Marie de Medici area and many more.The Museum next door is expensive and really not worth the money.
A must see!. As my partner wished to go these gardens, we booked a hotel close by. We weren't disappointed as the gardens are magnificent - excellent for families and couples etc.
Paris. Great location, bring a picnic and relax in the park so beautiful and peaceful! In August the flowers were abundant!

A nice park. A nice walk when its dry. We went in February, so maybe we miss flowers or activities that make this more worth while visiting. That said, I can't remember seeing any other places you could comfortably go for a picnic.

Great place to go for a run or a nice relaxing walk. Ever wonder how the Pariseans can eat all of that cheese, baguettes, and Nutella, drink that wine and not gain any weight? They run it off. And a secret place to do this is the Jardin Luxembourg. A loop around the park is just over 2k. No matter what time of day you go there you will find other runners doing the same thing. Once the park is closed, the runners still run around the park but on the outside. While the park is open there are 4 fountains to ensure that you are keeping hydrated.Enjoy. I love running in this park.
Beautiful.. beautiful gardens, very peaceful. has views of the eiffel tower, montparnasse tower and the pantheon.

Fantastic place to stroll or picnic or even nap. What a wonderful park and the Luxembourg Palace is an incredible backdrop. Being from New York City, it took us some time to get used to dirt walkways, but the grass and vegetation and flower beds are all amazing. The flowers throughout Paris are planned and kept so beautifully. We loved this park and would have returned to it except that we ran out of time and had so many other gardens and museums and neighborhoods to visit. Plus it doesn't hurt to have armed guards nearby at the Palace. makes you feel more secure in light today's world.

Far from madding crowd. Easy to get to and a step back in time kids sailing small yachts on the lake and well beautiful gardens and trees.It can be busy though we enjoyed areaaly nice few hours sat watching the world go bye.

Lovely Peaceful Park. There are many lovely parks in Paris beside the Tuilleries. Luxembourg is one of the largest and prettiest of them. Easily reached in St. Germaine it is also close to the French national Senate and many other attractions.
A great place to stroll. A favourite place to stroll whenever we are in Paris. The Luxembourg museum in the grounds often houses some excellent exhibitions.

Best place to rest in Paris! :). To me it is the best place when you rest when walking around Paris. Just find a nice place with nice view, grab a pair of chairs, sit on one of them, put your legs or another and enjoy the time :) Small bottle of wine and a baggette wont harm ;)
Relaxing. Went there in June 2015, it was very sunny and bright. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit, one of the spots i would recommend to visit in Paris.

Great park for the entire family. Great park for the whole family. Bring your lunch and spend the whole morning or afternoon here . Children can rent small model boats as they sail by .
This is a park that is perfect for peace and tranquility in an otherwise hectic city .

Very pleasant morning's walk.. Very pleasant large gardens - lots of interesting trees, memorial statues of interesting people, large pond where you can hire little yachts for the children. In our visit there were some terrific large photos of French scenery on the railings outside, and a very good group doing kareoke! Playground for kids in one corner of the park. On Sunday there didnt seem to be much in the way of snack shops.

Must see, bring lunch. This is one of the most beautiful gardens on the left bank and a great place to have a picnic lunch. Afterwards you're so close to walk to other attractions on the left bank. Bring your camera.

Easily My Favourite Outdoor Spot in Paris.. This was easily my favourite spot in Paris. A lovely break from the noise and crowds of central Paris. They have an abundance of chairs you can take and put pretty much anywhere you like. It doesn't matter how many people are around you will find a chair to sit on. We were very lucky to be staying in a hotel very near here and we visited a few times. We bought crepes from a little stall the first evening we visited and ate them while admiring the fountain and we came back several other evenings just to wind down after a busy day sightseeing.It's a great park for kids too and there seemed to be lots of locals there enjoying the sunny evenings with their families.

Breathe and relax. After what seemed like hours walking across the city amidst the usual traffic and incessant horns we eventually found the gardens. It was a lovely and welcomed respite, gardens superbly maintained and just sitting watching the world go by.....lovely
So crowded. On a nice day, things get crowded so fast!! Everyone will be here so be on the lookout for a seat. Nice place to chill if you can find a chair!
Nice and relaxing. Pretty big garden in the city. Really well-kept, with beautiful sight. Just sit down in a bench enjoy the view, the green and wtach the people in the park for a while :)

A beautiful spot in the heart of the city.. spent a wonderful afternoon walking around these gardens watching tourists and locals enjoy the scenery. Its an easy walk from the latin quarter and well worth it. The kids playing with the toy sailing boats in the lake is wonderful. There is so much to do in paris , but things like this make it special.
Serene Oasis. The Luxembourg Gardens is so well thought out & well manicured. The sculptures add so much to the visual impact of the garden. It's a place to take refuge from the city humdrum.

Great Oasis to unwind from the city. A nice break from the bustle of the city. Fun to watch the families enjoy the park with their children. Sailboats on the pond, walks among the trees. There are plenty of chairs if you want to sit and just enjoy the park.

Wonderful gardens with lots for kids to do. We spent much of a Sunday afternoon at the Luxembourg Gardens, mostly people watching. There's a great pond where kids can hire boats to push around. There are great playgrounds too, with swings and other gym equipment (there is a fee to enter). Plus there are the petanque and chess areas. We spent ages watching teams play petanque (boules). When it started to rain we sheltered under the many leafy trees. It's a great park and well worth of visit, especially for families.

A peek through history. Just enjoy the atmosphere of it - the magnificent gardens, the view of the palace, the statues, the children sailing with there magnatized boats. Just a perfectly enjoyable spot in the ever crowded city of Paris.
Family Friendly. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and scenary of the gardens. Great place to visit, entry was free and is very family friendly.
Nice French Garden. Nice French Garden/park. Well maintained, Kids sailing boats in artificial lake. Small cafe to eat sandwich in the park. Quiet and well maintained. Felt relaxed and safe.
Pretty and Serene. The garden was truly beautiful, well tended and quite relaxing. There were plenty of seats around and interesting features to admire.
Sit-back and relax. After a hectic day, thats the place to just sit back and relax, absorbing the beautiful view around you.

Very large and beautiful gardens. Very diverse and beautiful gardens.
Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the peaceful gardens while people watching. Just don't sit on the grass!! (it's not allowed) there are plenty of chairs provided everywhere in the shade.
adds to the Paris experience. it is very relaxing even if you just stroll through without taking the time to let a boat swim in the fountain
Luxembourg Park might be a better name.. I can see why Parisians love the green space but to me it is more park than gardens. The name drew me to see flowers.

Gem of Paris. When visiting the busy but exciting latin quarter of Paris, and you want a piece of tranquility or a lovely place to have a takeaway lunch, or read a book, then look no further that the Luxembourg gardens. A beautiful palace is surrounded by wonderfully kept gardens where you can sit and let pleasant time pass by all for free !

relax and enjoy it like a parisian. if you come to a point in your trip that you just want to relax and your legs are giving in, this is a great place to visit. Beautiful flowers beautiful beautiful people on a gorgeous sunny day is what just the doctor ordered. we sat on the grass watched the children as they dropped their little boats in the water and raced, shared wine with another parisian couple and had a great time. if you need to eat there are restaurants on rue de medicis that we liked. fuxia has great italian food and le petit medicis is well liked by us and most travellers on tripadvisor

Fabulous park - wonderful way to spend a few hours. Cannot believe we had to pay for the playground! Otherwise we had a wonderful visit. The rental for the toy boats to race was a highlight and our daughter loved the carousel (1.50 to ride) and the playground was great as well but with 4 adults and a child it cost us 7.30 to enter. Beautiful gardens and wonderful way to spend an afternoon.

Beautiful place to relax between sightseeing. We got a sandwich from a little deli outside and sat in the sunshine soaking in Paris, loved it so much went back the next day and did the same thing. Definite must-do on a sunny day

Beautiful park. We stayed at a hotel that was right near by this beautiful park and enjoyed walking through it. I feel like it was a mix of both tourists and locals. The layout was easy to navigate and I'm glad we took a little time to enjoy it.
An oasis. After walking everywhere we came across the gardens and what a pleasant surprise a great place to just chill for a while and rest the weary feet.

A lovely place for a romantic afternoon. The Jardin Luxembourg is a beautiful park in Montparnasse. It's where it's most famous resident of the 1920s, Gertrude Stein, courted Alice B. Toklas. Trees, flowers and a lovely pond where children will sail their boats, this is a great place to escape the madness of the city.
Luxombourg Gardens. This was one of my favorite places to go in Paris. It was just a few blocks from our hotel. The fountain is gorgeous and the atmosphere breezy and light.
Relaxing walks. Quite busy but big open spaces which make for nice relaxed strolling. Full of nice fountains and plants so plenty of nice photo opportunities.
Amazing park. An amazing park in the Latin Quarter. Clean, green and very well saved, it's definetely one of the best spots of this amazing city!

Some fresh air. A garden of green lawn, bushy trees, blooming flowers, beautiful building, fine statues, people watching, strolling lovers, playing kids, happy families, a real place to relax and take some fresh air in the middle of the city of Paris.

What a maze..... I can't even describe how amazing this place was. We just walked the grounds of course and it was so peaceful. You could almost put yourself back in those times and realize how hard work persisted in making this place great.
Breathe of fresh air!!!! . Beautiful and a wonderful area to have lunch, have a glass of wine and people watch. Very relaxing!!!! The gardens were well kept. Enjoyable!

A delightful experience. Well worth spending an hour or two in theses pleasant gardens
There are many lovely trees and beautiful flowers
Take some time to visit. Lovely park to walk in and feel safe. Lots of statues and a big pond for the kids to rent a sailboat and sail it. Beautifully manicured and just a lovely place.
Horticulture!. Beautiful horticulture. Great place to spend an hour relaxing and walking. Very relaxing. Not crowded.

Relaxing spot in a bustling city.. Spent a relaxing weekday mid-morning in the Gardens on visit to Paris last week. Lovely atmosphere and a real antidote to the bustle of the Latin Quarter and St Germain districts, which the Luxembourg Gardens lie between. I really like the fact that there are plenty of chairs scattered around and you can move them and sit where you want. Don't forget to check out the quieter, western area of the gardens, which has a children's play park, orchard, and other attraction

A must see. One of the most beautiful places to visit in Paris,I never miss it.Located right in the middle of Quartier Latin,an amazing elegant,shining park made by Maria de Medici to remind her of Florence,like Luxembourg Palace(the French Senat)and the Medici Fountain,a reminder of Boboli Gardens.
Wonderful gardens!. The gardens were made out of dreams! The place was extremely clean and with breath taking scenery. Wish we could have spent more time relaxing there!

Amazing place to Relax!. This garden is right in the city but its peaceful and beautiful. Its amazing to come back after a busy day strolling the city to this place and just soak in the Parisian lifestyle!
Fun Family Day. Stopped at a boulangerie on our way and grabbed a baguette and some quiches and enjoyed a mini picnic with the family.
Nice place to see the locals.. Get a sandwich and relax. Don't be surprised by the armed guards this is where the senate meets. Surprised to see Palm trees.

Relax in the Gardens. It's good to have a rest from the frenzy of the city. Don't forget to buy from the nearest supermarket some drink. In the summer there are toy boats to rent, and there are lots of children playing in the pond. 'Tis great!

Not to Be Missed on the Left Bank!. Where Parisians recreate (walk, run, play chess, romance, walk their dogs, read Le Monde, read Le Figaro, play tennis, etc.) and where you can learn the most about French culture and horticulture in one single spot! Well-worth a stroll and even a picnic!

Besutiful gardens and statues. Beautiful gardens and a relaxing place to visit. Has seats to sit and rest for a while amidst the trees and gardens. Nice for some time out while visiting a very busy city .
Lovely park for walk. The Luxembourg Gardens is a nice and lovely park for a walk, within the city, right next to the Latin Quarters.
This is Parisian Life!. A beautiful destination to just walk around, read a book, have a picnic... you will see Parisians doing it all here. The grounds are beautiful with lots to see. A must visit!
This is Parisian Life!. A beautiful destination to just walk around, read a book, have a picnic... you will see Parisians doing it all here. The grounds are beautiful with lots to see. A must visit!

scene from a storybook. A must see/do thing when visiting Paris...feels like a scene from a storybook... relax in this beautiful park or have a picnic. Kids enjoyed sailing miniature boats on the central fountain for 3.5 euros. Each boat has a flag representing a different country. Many nice walking paths, plenty of benches and chairs to relax on. Short walk to Parthenon. Gelato stands on the grounds. May have had the best one hour nap of my life while wife and kids were taking a stroll. Should be on everyone's to do list when visiting Paris. Easy accessible.

good place to rest. It is a very nice place to rest, to spend the time with friends or alone. There are chairs just waiting for guest who will take them and seat wherever they want. Grass, flowers, trees - all seems to be perfect. Just good place to be there if you have enough time for it. And if you live in Paris - you will find this place as one of best possibilities for rest on the free air.

Lovely Place to Walk or Run. We loved these gardens and visited them every morning for a walk. It is interesting to share the gardens with the locals who jog around the outside. Our teenage son joined these joggers whilst we walked. The gardens are easy to get to and offered a peaceful haven in a very busy city.
Peace in the city. Lovely gardens providing a little peace and quiet in the busy city. The grounds are beautifully kept and there are plenty of seats where you can put your feet up and relax.
Great place for a picnic.. The gardens are very beautiful...nice place to have a picnic. Then stroll around the grounds. We stumbled upon a statue of Lady Liberty. Great place to play tennis.
Breakfast under the trees. Great for early morning walk or run, have coffee or brekfast at the cafe, remember to take 50euro cents if you need to use the bathroom
Beautiful. A beatiful garden to enjoy a meal, run or just stay on the chairs on the lake.The flowers are beatiful.
great Petanque. If you are into Petanque, this is a place to see the real thing. A glimpse into the spare time of my generation.

Tremendous!. I acknowledge that I am drawn to the big city gardens more than most, but after experiencing the Tuileries near the Louvre, I was expecting the gardens at Luxembourg Palace to be a real come down. Nothing could be further from the truth. I spent a few hours on a perfect day in early September admiring the setting for the beautiful palace itself. The grounds were immaculately maintained, and even some of the larger trees had been manicured to near perfection, giving the entire location a feeling of formality, stature, and respect, while still making the various visitors comfortable enough to sit in the many chairs generously scattered along the many paths throughout the gardens.The grounds are considerable, and people can feel they are in beautiful, pleasant, and intimate surroundings, because the grounds are creatively broken up into large, medium, and small sections via the creative landscaping. I did not take a formal tour while there, but I believe they were being given.If you enjoy city gardens, do not miss the chance to spend 2-4 hours here. There are lots of picture perfect sidewalk cafes just across the street as well. This is a good place to tie in with a walk to Notre Dame Cathedral.

What a lovely garden. This garden is magnificent in that it boasts a stately home with beautiful flowers and trees.One can transcend oneself to the 1800s where images of horse carriages carrying the rich and powerful of those days driving up to the lighted home attending a grand party and music and laughter can be heard from the inside the opulent mansion.I only wished I had stayed longer to embrace the wonderful feeling of sitting on a chair or bench, trees all in a row on both sides of the pathway leading to the home and just enjoying the cool wind and the atmosphere it exudes.Its a place where a person can calmly sit and reflect with a cup of coffee and perhaps a fresh croissant.
A place to relax. After a busy day of sight seeing when in Paris this is the ideal place to sit and unwind and watch the world go by.
Lovely garden. One of the most romantic areas in Paris. This amazing garden is perfect on sunny days. real parisian lifestyle...

Lux Gardens. Paris does a good garden but this is one of my favorite places in Paris to have a picnic. Grab a lawn chair near the fountains, sit in the sun and enjoy the people watching and a croissant. Adorable wooded areas and tennis. Short walk from the Pantheon so if you are heading there make a detour on your way.

Truly pretty!. Beautiful gardens right outside the Louvre Museum where one can eat by the fountain. We bought sandwiches at the food cart right on the premises and sat by the fountain to people watch and enjoy the flowers, birds, etc. Great experience...specially if you like the outdoors.

Nice but VERY hot. My friend and I walked through the gardens on a summer afternoon and quickly gave up. It was beautiful but extremely hot. The following day, we tried again and had a better experience. There is an amazing fountain near the entrance we used; however, that area was very crowded.
Luxembourg Gardens - Beautiful. Don't miss this beautiful garden. Be sure to walk through it if you are in the Latin Quarter. It is near the Pantheon.

Amazing!!!. After hours of walking around the city, the Gardens were the best place to relax and enjoy the beautiful enviroment. Great place for the kids to play around. If you need a place to clear your head the Luxembourg Gardens are the best place for that.

Beautiful!!!!!. The tranquility of the gardens just lets you sit and ponder of days gone by.Very family orientated with seniors playing bocce ,park runs ,playgrounds and people watching from the Medici fountain.museum closed day of our visit.

One of the largest and most important public parks at Paris. Impossible not to cross the Luxembourg Gardens when you're staying in the Latin Quarter in Paris. Although you need to cross the city , worth the effort to get to know one of the largest and most important public parks. Parisians stroll through there in the late afternoon , leaving aside the hasty step to enjoy the beauties of the place.Unmissable!

beautiful garden to relax. it was a hot day and there was a lot of people walking and sitting by the trees but its so huge it doesn't feel crowded.the palace was closed but me and my husband has a great time sitting by the trees and enjoying the beautiful garden and kids playing around and riding horses.
Beautiful. Nice stroll on a nice, sunny afternoon. People sailing toy boats, or sitting and enjoying the sun & scenery.

Beautiful Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are so beautiful and well designed, that they attract a large number of visitors, especially on a Sunday, which is when we were there. It was a sunny day, there were people picnicking, sunbathing, or just relaxing by the water.
If I was a Parisian, I would spend a lot of time here.

True Alrounder. Great place for spending time with family, Great place for kids activities, Great place for hangout with your friends, Great place for being with your partner. This place suits each age group. Also a great place for some great pictures, vibrant colors all around. This place has so much to offer. Even the places outside the gardens are very happening and lots of things nearby. If you are in Paris, you wont want to miss it.
Lovely. A lovely place after a long walk in quartier latin and saint michel area. bring ur lunch when being there.....

Great place to bring the kids or just yourself.. Beautiful gardens. It was wonderful to see all of the children playing in the massive playground area. The flowers were wonderful. Unfortunately the Luxembourg Palace was closed until September when a new exhibit it opening. Don't miss it, well worth putting on your bucket llist of things to do in Paris.

Perfect Place to Relax. This is one of the best parks in Paris. It is the place where Parisians go. There are many joggers and people just hanging out with families, friends or by themselves enjoying the sun and the beauty of the garden, palace, and recreational facilities. Our hotel was close to the park, so we visited a number of times. There are many chairs which you can arrange how you like, or stroll about the wonderful grounds. You can do your people watching and relaxing here, instead of going to an overpriced cafe. Definitely very Parisian.

If you've got little kids, you will come here.... We were in Paris for 2 weeks with our three-year-old. Luxembourg gardens was a fantastic place to visit, it's nice a shady when it's hot. There's a puppet show, carousel, and huge playground. Clean bathrooms. Pony rides. Really, just a fantasy land for a small kid.
Wine, Coffee and Relax. This is a great place to grab a bottle of wine, coffee, etc. and take some time to enjoy the quieter side of Paris.
Lovely Gardens. It is wonderful to walk through these gardens and enjoy the beautiful greenery. There are many things to do here, and it is very safe.
Beautiful and historic gardens in Paris.. These gardens were both beautiful and historic and definitely worth a visit. Great place for a picnic on a blanket as well.

AGarden of Delights!. An absolutely wonderful place secluded in places in spite of being in the middle of a very busy city. There are sports facilities, gardens, and just somewhere to amble along of sit and people watch. An excellent and welcome green place among the avenues and boulevards, and a short walk from everything, the Sorbonne, the Left Bank shops, Tour Montparnasse, and countless beautiful buildings and churches, where you can lose yourself for a time.

Typical French gardens, formal and enticing. This lovely park is next to the domed Palais de Luxembourg the French Senate, so the park is extremely well tended and immaculate. great scale and variety of areas: petanque ball, pony rides, pear orchard, grotto, boat fountain, statues, tree-lined alleys, puppet shows and wonderful flower beds. Yet it is all tremendously harmonious and peaceful. Very typically French in the best sense.
Beautiful place with old world charm. Lovely park to have a picnic .unexpected in the middle of Paris.Huge place bring your walking shoes .Plenty to see and do

Beautiful gardens any time of year!. Gorgeous place to bring a picnic or have an outdoor nap. By far the best place to watch the cloud formations over paris. Don't wear your best shoes: they'll get very dusty!

Opulence abounds. It is hard to believe that there was this kind of money in the treasury back when the gardens were built. Aristocracy, though, has always placed a high value on what things look like. Oh well, we may as well enjoy their excessiveness! Beautiful park and grounds.
Great for kids. We visted with the children and they can sail boats in the pond. Nice place to eat an icecream relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

beaux jardins. LOVED LOVED LOVED this park. Beautiful. My BF and I arranged a Paris picnic to be delivered to us in the park. Truly an amazing place to sit and eat and people watch. The grounds of the park are kept immaculately clean. There are seats and loungers for use all around the park. You can buy water and ice cream. There are toilet facilities. If you visit any park whilst in Paris, make it this one. Absolutely beautiful.

Gorgeous!. This Garden is beautiful, full of different plants and trees, free for entrance, you can bring blanket and enjoy in the grass, or grab a chair (lots of chairs all around the garden, you can arrange them as you want!) and enjoy by the lake. Kids were playing by the lake/fountain with boats available for renting near by. You can walk for hours! If you like places like this to enjoy sun and grass don't miss it.
Beautiful park for a picnic. Had a picnic there provided by Paris Picnic on a Saturday evening. Had an excellent atmosphere and was an easy walk to Saint Germain.

A Beautiful Spot for a stroll. i can see why some people don't see what the fuss is all about. perhaps too if they come here after having been to versailles. there's nothing spectacular about these gardens, but there is a beautiful tranquility to them. i love how the french put out chairs around the park to sit in - not just here but at other park and garden locations too. we don't do that in sydney, presumably worried they'd all get stolen. but it's such a simple touch, and so nice to sit down and take in the ambience of your surroundings. it seems a popular spot for parisians to meet and chat and why wouldn't you?

Beautiful place in center of Paris - for various activities.. Beautiful place in the center of Paris. Great for the kids, great for families to take a walk or relax during the day. Also includes children playground, just make sure you check the operating hours.Also excellent place for jogging...

Picnic Perfect. The grounds were large and pretty, but I don't suggest being there too long as it can get kind of boring and if its a hot day it kinds of suck being under the sun for too long. But on a good day I think its a nice spot for a picnic.

Romance or family, this place has it all. Visited this lovely place whilst on a break to Paris with my family, 2 adults and 2 teenagers 13 and 15yrs. Sun was shining, picnic in hand (with wine of course) and set out to visit this under estimated visitor attraction. Lake with model boats, and old fashioned stick for children to guide them - lovely!Gardens and the building itself were amazing. Had a cafe if you want to spend on food and drinkNo fee to get into this attraction.We sat on the grass and had our picnic, people watching and relaxing. It was lovely.If you want a lovely spot, near the centre of Paris, visit here you won't regret it.Although McDonalds is just 10 min walk away, you won't believe it when you sit on your rug or chairs which are provided all over the grounds.

Beautiful setting. We visited this large garden today. We would call it a park in the U.S. We came through an entrance where there were bocce ball courts and watched a number of older men okay ( and where a few flirted with me, at 62 that was fun!) I would call this whole area of the garden "the play area for children and adults". Along with bocce, there were tennis courts and several very very nice playgrounds for children. Paths here are tree lined and mostly gravel. As you draw closer to the "Palace" there are floral gardens, quite fantastic, also a pool of water and fountain, many statues, many potted flowers. It is quite lovely, many people in all areas of this park, but it's so large it did not feel crowded, lots of seating everywhere....good picnic place. There are refreshments available, paid potty 1/2 Euro per person. Go and relax for a few hours, taking a break from the whirlwind sight seeing one does while in Paris.

Best all-round Parc inside old Paris. Want culture? The Palais T the north end is a great castle, often with excellent art exhibits. Want formal gardens? There are formal flower beds throughout the Parc. Want informal gardens? The walk around the periphery curves and wanders among bushes and overhanging trees. Want to lounge in a chair by a huge fountain, maybe even sail a toy boat? One of the largest fountains in Paris is right here. Want a great place for a run? Come here. The local firemen (pompiers) do. From walking to running, from picnicking on the grass to snoozing in a chair, from playing tennis or pétanque to studying plants, this is the Parc for you.

Oasis in the city. I would not have gone had it not been so close to the hotel. I went there to relax and have lunch in a park. Beautiful and well maintained... many fountains, statues and flower beds. If I was a local I'd be here often. I ended up here a few more times while I was in Paris. Played guitar sitting on the edge of a fountain... wonderful.

Don't pass this one up!. So gorgeous! We went here on an "off day" for us, as just something to do. SO Glad we did. It is really something. We enjoyed just walking around and lounging on benches to enjoy the scenery. Lot of picture opps too!

One of my fav spots in Paris. This place was just as I had imagined it and I wish we had had more time to explore and relax in these beautiful grounds. It was so hot the day we visited so it was lovely to walk in the shade of all the large trees.

Very underrated attraction!. These gardens are stunning! The flower beds have such elaborate patterns, a variety of colors, gorgeous statues, and a fountain with a long viewing pool attached. It's a jewel in the middle of a city full of hustle, a peaceful and quiet place to relax and enjoy some time.
Lovely well kept large Gardens. Free entrance to well maintained gardens. Allow at least half a day in the summer to fully take in the gardens and time to relax by the main fountains.
If you have kids, just go on sunny day.... playground, toy boats, marionette show. nuff said, kids won't bother you and you can enjoy your starbucks in peace.
Let's make a picnic!. Beautiful place to take a walk and seat with family and friends for a picnic. Near the "Palais" there is a lake with kids riding their boats. Very nice to watch.

BEAUTIFUL. If in this area, these gardens are beautiful. There are better in Paris, but these are well worth a small detour. They are the gardens of a former 'palace, and just give a feeling of space, tranquility and - to some extent - beauty. Go and enjoy.

One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris. Don't mis these lovely garden and plan a whole afternoon or evening walking around, exploring and pacing your admiration by siting around and enjoying the beauty. Enjoy it and don't try to time it. You'll love the experience

Superb park with a great playground . The park is beautiful with a wonderful playground for children. You pay a small fee to enter but it is well kept and very large so kept our 3 year old entertained for an hour.

Breathtaking and Serene. When you enter the gardens, you will be mesmerized first by the sheer size of the place and that it is in the most amazing and immaculate condition. To truly enjoy this garden, bring a picnic basket and a good book to enjoy the afternoon or evening in. There is plenty of photo opportunities here and it's an amazing venue for day events. There is a wooden sailboat activity here where a family with young children could also partake in. I would love to return and have a nice picnic in the park here again.

Peacefull. In the morning and late afternoon, a lot of people joguing or making gimnastics , like tai chi and others, and all day, people relaxing, reading, talking with friends, kids playng, wonderfull garden!! A lot of chairs to relax !! Fabulous

Relaxing place to stroll. We were staying in a flat just round the corner so visited the Luxembourg Gardens a couple of times. Very pleasant to relax in a chair or to stroll around. A very elegant setting.

Beautiful garden. Simply beautiful. Perfect for relaxing, for photo shoot session, reading your favorite books, chilling with the pigeons. If I live in Paris, this garden will definitely my favorite spot.

Atunning. Stunningly presented and immaculate gardens.
Most definitely worth a visit. Perfect photos to be taken within these gardens.
Pack a picnic and take a moment out of your busy Paris schedule to enjoy this place.
Beautiful walk. It is beautiful and a great walk ....make sure to be somewhere to walk as you are visiting the Louvre and then back across the seine

Oasis in the heart of Paris. Today was stinking hot and so muggy - 31 degrees. I spent an hour at the Jardin du Luxembourg from 7pm to 8pm. What a delight. So cool and relaxing. The park was filled with people relaxing or having picnics.

Take a camera, a book, and don't rush it.. A large, elegant , regal park complete with trendy benches and chairs for all to enjoy . Take a book or a picnic and sit to watch time and people go by. An essential experience that will make you feel like an insider.

A relaxing place in the city of Paris. I went to the Luxembourg Gardens while on vacation. It is a very nice place to sit and relax. Some people were just relaxing laying down on the grass while other people had brought some food for a quick snack. There is a very nice pond, too.
Beautiful Gardens. Absolutely a beautiful gardens. Had only a couple of hours to spend wish I could have spent most of the day there.
Very Relaxing!!. Beautiful garden...great for just reading a book or having picnic lunch. Walking distance to RER. In the heart of the Latin Quarter (5th Arr).
Nice stop. Beautiful gardens and architecture, great for a break. Close to the metro station and Notre Dame cathedral.

Away from the Madding Crowd. One of the world's great green spaces. Fountains, flowers, a pool where children floast their boats, tennis courts, running tracks, the Senate, tout Paris on a summer's day.

Luxemberg garden... What a magnificent garden. Beautiful statues, flowers, perfectly manicured chestnut trees.There is a pond where children and adults can sail small boats. A serene and calm atmosphere. Plenty of benches and seats to relax and take in the beauty.
Stunning must see.. Stunning must see and experience. The grounds are amazing and so many people out enjoying the gorgeous environment. Really felt like being in Paris

A great place for a picnic. The grounds and buildings are beautiful, and the gardens were in full bloom in July 2014 when we were there. We took a picnic lunch and ate at the picnic area, while watching the model boats in the pond. Lovely and relaxing.
Beautiful gardens. Fantastic place to chill in the sun! A great picnic had here. Very close to opera metro station and a short walk away from notre dame.

What an amazing park. Amazing place to take a picnic to and watch the world go by. Perfect for a lazy day in the sun.
The park has several activities such as tennis courts, play areas for children and even radio controlled boats for hire.

Romantic and beautiful. The gardens are perfect for a romatic walk and to sit and watch the world go by.. with a bottle or 2 of wine. A group of 4 off us sat in the gardens on a sunny day drinking some great French wine which was lovely. The gardens are beautiful, you are not allowed to go on the grass which was fine for us. Its a great people watching spot and would highly recommend, even more so on a sunny day.
good. Great for a walk or chilling in the sun. The park is nice, the castle too and there is a bunch of chairs available.

place to catch the dreams. its amazing place to walk a lot and imagine yourself how could be like living like a French in those architectured gardens of Luxembourg its worth visiting even for that feeling.
ok. It was a gorgeous place, but rather boring, spent about 10 mins in there just for a sit down and a refresh and then went on to visit all the bigger attractions!!

beautiful in spring and fall. it's really a nice place to visit. just the perfect place to relax with the fountains, people playing sports and having the beautiful sights of the palais du luxembourg and the pantheon

oases in Paris. Lovely peaceful oases in the city. All ages enjoying the park, relaxing or watching the daily chess players at work and listening to their debates.Only pity, not allowed to sit on the grass. Lots of free chairs and benches dotted around.

Gorgeous glistening gardens. These gardens are gorgeous, so green, so many flowers, so much colour. There's also a lovely patch of grass to just sit and people watch, and also a chance to take your shoes off and just rest after much walking!

A Beautiful Garden in Paris. These gardens are beautiful and it is a wonderful place to stroll late in the day. Kids will like renting the little sail boats with sticks, and setting them free in the raised pond.
Great escape. Like people watching? This is the place. Young and old will enjoy people watching and enjoying teh sires. Anytime of day it is enjoyable. Away from the maddening tourist crowds

Beautiful. Really beautiful gardens in the summer, a cute place to picnic or take children to the small lake.
We really enjoyed our visit and will definitely return next time we are in Paris.

Gardens; Open Spaces; Room to Breathe. Built for the widow of Henry the 4th, these gardens offer a great place to sit back and breathe a little. Pony rides and puppet shows for the kids, a tranquil place.

Beautiful Garden. Beautiful Garden close to the Sorbonne University.Lots of great gelato shops just outside the park. The sculptures and gardens were beautiful in July! Our favourite was the Medici Fountain.

fascinating place. a very good place to visit.
ideal for relaxing and beautiful flower views, lake is very well placed seats are everywhere.
definitely i will visit it again.
Just wonderful. As almost everything in Paris, these gardens are very beautiful... a calm place to relax, even during the peak of tourism.
must see in paris. even for a relexing sunday walk the garden of luxemborg is the place to come to, very clean and lots of place even to sit and relax

boring. alot of grass but you cant sit on it, whats the point of having grass and you cant sit on it, only for show, well i walks through it , and i saw people sitting on stools and chairs looking at each other

Beautiful space to relax. We spent about an hour just wondering through the park during the afternoon. It really is a beautiful place to roam and lounge. It was fun just watching the boats play in the fountain. The neat chairs were fun for just enjoying the time.
Lovely gardens. This is a lovely place to go to relax and enjoy the gardens and scenery. Take a book and find a nice comfortable seat and you won't be disappointed.

My Paris favotire. What a wonderful place to sit in a shade of its trees or in a sun by a fountain watching kids navigate sail boats. We always bring high cal goodies from Pierre Hermé few blocks away to indulge in while watching many fitness minded Parisians jog by.

Gorgeous park, great place to relax.. It was a beautiful day so we decided to stroll through the Gardens and although we spent about 2 hours in there I'm sure there was a lot we didn't see. We saw the kids riding ponies, people playing tennis, the carousel, the beautiful water fountains (some with miniature boats in them), about 3 brides getting their pictures taken. And it's a great place to be a bride.There are plenty of chairs placed all over the park, not to mention benches, for you to sit on and read, eat, people-watch. I didn't get the sense that it was okay to sit on the grass. It was perfectly manicured so I'm assuming they don't like it if you do that.People of all ages will like this park and will want to sit down by the fountains to relax after a full day of museum-ing.I'm so glad we took that stroll.

Beautiful Parisian Garden. Probably our favorite in Paris. We met extended family here because it was a convenient location, but really enjoyed the beauty of the park. Very nice to walk around, talk, and catch up with distant family.

Friendly city Park-garden. All in colors, fortunately it was summer, the perfect maid, calm, lofty. Lots of benches, chairs. Come to mind ringtones by Joe Dassin. Very pleasant to spend time in throughout the day.

Very pleasant afternoon walk in the gardens. We had a very pleasant afternoon stroll through the gardens, admired the flowers, children sailing boats in the pond, and beautiful weather, on our way to the Latin Quarter.
Nice place to visit with lot to see. Nice place to get some fresh air inside Paris. Beautiful trees and flowers. Many places to rest and eat.
Have to visit!. The parc is amazing. You definitely have to visit it when you are in Paris. Go for a picknick and sit on the "allowed" grass. Or take a book and go sit and read on one of the seats.

Tranquillity on a Sunday Afternoon. A beautiful park in the grounds of one the the many stunning palaces of Paris. We had a very enjoyable lunch at the cafe whilst watching the world drift by, then wandered to the formal pool with fountain to watch the kids playing with their hired model yachts. The ground are obviously cared for with well manicured lawns and very colourful flower beds contrasting with the hard but beautiful architecture of Paris' copious grand buildings. Well worth an afternoon at a slower pace.

Tranquility in the City. Take a picnic and go for a nice lunch. I suggest a baguette, some cheese and a nice bottle of wine. Find a quiet spot over near the Tennis Courts and enjoy the people passing by it is well worth the quiet time for sure.

What a beautiful experience. We were recommended to visit the gardens by our son and we were not let down. The gardens were delightful and to cap it we enjoyed the concert given by the King Edward Band from Macclesfield.
Only draw back is the quality of the toilets. Having paid to use them you would hope that they would be maintained better.

Beautiful as always! A nice break from the city.... Had a great time strolling in the gardens, playing in the kids area (though the prices were quite steep for what the play are really offered) and mingling with the locals as they take refuge in its hidden beauty.

Good place to relax. A beautiful spot to sit and relax. Very popular with tourists and Parisians alike. Gardens include plenty of seating areas covered and uncovered therefore a relaxing place whatever the weather. A small above ground lake sits in one part and both children and adults can sail the toy boats

Great Place to visit with friends. The garden is a great place to relax after visiting all the sites in Paris. I would stop by a grocery store, grab some wine, and lay out under a tree in the garden. Make sure you bring your camera!

Nice place to relax. We had a great afternoon exploring these gardens. There is a tremendous playground for children (there is a cost), an area to enjoy some toy boats, and I had a good time watching some competitive bocce ball. I realized I am sorely uninformed as to the actual rules of bocce ball... Nice place to relax after a day or week of sightseeing. We enjoyed our afternoon here. Lots of people just lounging, eating, enjoying some ice cream, or playing in the park.

Great place to unwind. A gorgeous and well maintained garden. Such a great place for a nice, quiet, romantic stroll. We spent several hours walking the grounds, and completely forgotten that we were visiting/tourists.
A great place for an afternoon stroll. We really enjoyed strolling our way through the Luxembourg Gardens and it is a great way to spend a sunny afternoon in the heart of Paris.

Grab a sandwich and some wine then enjoy the day!. Wonderful spot for a picnic and to people watch. Beautiful gardens, lots of chairs and tables if you want. Rest rooms, although they do cost 1 euro to use.

Lovely place. Luxembourg gardens is a lovely place to rest and make a picnic. There you see a lot parisians and is not overpacked with tourists as the other attractions for the city. Great place to take a walk or just rest.

A Little Piece of Heaven in a Busy City. After going to Notre Dame, we decided to walk to this park and have a picnic. It was a wonderful change of pace. Our kids (8 and 10) sailed boats on the lake, went to the fantastic playground (for a small charge) and wandered the wonderful gardens.

A True Beauty. We didn't have a chance to spend as much time at the gardens as we could have liked, but from the time were were there we could see that everything was just stunning! Everything is so well maintained. Certain parts of the Gardens can be more serene and peaceful if you stray off the main paths, so that's great if you're looking for relaxation.
The Best Gardens. A very big and full of well groomed flowers garden with many seating places, sculptures and water fountains. It has a very royal look, especially because of the Palace.
Best in the world?. This is a garden for everyone and it is just beautiful with the activities , the exactly cut trees and the palace with its pond and flower arrangements and green lawns, beautiful!
beautiful view. It's my favourite Jardin I guess - it's so beautiful, you can rest there and near to this you have Sorbona, Pantheon and Luxembourg Palace

Peaceful Garden to enjoy. We visited these gardens on a damp morning but that didn't spoil the atmosphere and scenery. Was pleasantly surprised by the size of the gardens. Ideal location for a quiet stroll to enjoy the peace and tranquillity.

Elegantly chill?. I'm not sure it's possible to chill and relax in a place so elegant. The thing is these gardens are really attached to the French Senate building so they have all this refinement defined in and are so well kept and clean. At the same time, they're one of the most central and accessible, open space, green areas this side of the river, so you feel like you could go there to escape the city. Lots of seating space but a confusing vibe. Do people come here for an elegant stroll around the floral gardens in their fancy attire, or to throw their legs up and take some sun by the pond? Who cares? It's somewhat green, it's pretty and it's free.

A little (huge) bit of everything.. Huge, beautiful garden with many (many) different areas where you can grab a chair and laze in the sun or watch kids play with wooden sailboats in the main fountain. Flowers, huge stretches of grass, lines of trees with shade walking 'avenues', play areas, etc, etc. The gardens are so big you will need to sit and rest a bit just to get through them...and you will enjoy each minute you sit soaking up the atmosphere.
Lovely gardens!. A good place to have a picnic and spend some time relaxing. My son had a great time playing with the toy sailboats.

On Oasis in the City. This is where the Parisians take their jogging seriously amongst beautiful gardens and ponds. The chateau, home of the French Senate is a wonderful building. The Gardens are a 'must visit'.

A walk through Luxembourg Gardens. The gardens were beautiful in the summer with plenty of room for everyone to enjoy. The walkways have been beautifully designed to form a logical route. It sits in the busy but beautiful city of Paris like an oasis. We enjoyed having a long walk in the gardens.

wonderful picnic and family place. excellent on weekends, lots Parisians families, hire toys sailing boats on lake, teach kids of history during french revolution, clean, organised, lots shaded trees and green grass. bring picnic and spend day.

A beautiful park for walking or relaxing. This is a beautiful and very peaceful park! If you are lucky enough to be staying in the vicinity, you could spend a very pleasant hour or so each afternoon here, just relaxing after walking miles around the sights! There are lots of seats and benches, and lots of activities to just sit and watch – eg chess players at their little tables, and children sailing their toy-boats. SO relaxing!! There are also lots of seats in the shade of trees, for those who don’t like to sit in the sun.

Perfect place to relax. We spent a few hours in the gardens. We took a picnic lunch with us and there are plenty of chairs throughout to relax on. The gardens are just beautiful and there is a cafe in the grounds if you prefer. A great place to unwind and relax after walking around Paris in previous days.

A beautiful haven. Whenever I travel to Paris, I always try to stay in the 6arr so I can enjoy Jardin du Luxembourg. It's an excellent place to run or walk with gorgeous scenery. It's the perfect way to start your day, or to end a busy one in Paris. Absolutely beautiful. One day, there was an art exhibit open at one end of the garden

a nice park. just come there at the afternoon. and enjoy the surounding. great old building, pool with a fountain, birds fly, and a lot of people who sit around the pool enjoying the situation. thats cool :)

Beautiful place well worth a visit!. Loved these gardens and people watching. My young boy loved sailing a boat on the sailing pond. He also loved the carousel (by the playground). When getting on the carousel he was told to sit on the outside if he wanted to 'play the game'?? The games was so basic and yet he loved it. You are given a stick and as the carousel goes round you have to try and hook little metal rings onto your stick. The rider with the most rings at the end of the ride wins!

Must see. This was my wife's second visit, my first. It was a brief stop (30 min) as a part of a city tour associated with our riverboat cruises. This 1612 Marie de' Medici palace and grounds are spectacular and well maintained, even under the extreme August heat. Many nice photo-ops, with columns of old growth trees, strategically placed flower urns, statues, fountains, etc. There was an ice-cream stand and kids' playground, so it is a nice family spot, not too far from Notre Dame. One could easily spend several hours here.

Amazing place to relax and enjoy your day. Green green green and again green!! Everywhere!! It was so beautiful. After a lot of walk we arrived in this paradise! So amazing! There were chairs everywhere and people can relax and enjoy the place.

One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris. A must see during your stay in Paris, that can be done while visiting the "Quartier Latin" and the "Quartier Saint Germain-des-Prés" for it's situated just in-between. Careful you can't seat anywhere on the grass though, and the toilets cost 0,50€. For the kids there is plenty of areas where they can play and by the fountain you can also rent little boats with sticks.

A breath of fresh air - literally - within the busy city. Beautiful place - a real piece of luck finding this place. Hot summer day - the shady boulevards were heaven sent. Played a bit of Boule, wandered around the stunning gardens - found the Statue of liberty. Take a book with you and chill out - if you're going. I lovely relaxing walk is just what you need to get away from the swarms of tourists throughout the city!

A peaceful, quiet place. A lovely place to sit and rest after having walked around Paris for hours. Nice atmosphere - and since we were here on a hot sunny day everything was nice. The little lake, where children play with sailboats - sitting in the shade of the palm trees. We actually went there twice in our four day visit to Paris

Lovely. I loved my stroll through here on my visit in paris. Not super touristy which was nice. My favorite was the fountain and the flowers were beautiful. I Wish I would have come here earlier on in my trip.

Beautiful historic site. A perfect place to come for a morning walk if you are staying in the Quartier Latin or the St. Germain district. I came here every morning to do some intense walking and breathing and it was the perfect complement to an urban vacation.
A nice park. Nice place to relax after a museum day if you happen to be in that area (near the Pantheon or Cluny).

Free green chairs are available. You can put them wherever you like.. Lovely parc with free green chairs all over the place. It's peaceful and quiet. There are trees for some shade or you can sit in the sun and enjoy. Children can play with boats in the pond. Very French looking parc. You just gotta love this !

Beautiful and peaceful. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. The flowers are obviously tended with a great deal of care and attention and it is almost impossible to find a wilted stem or dead bloom. Every flower is perfect and they patters are spectacular. Watching the children sail their toy boats upon the lake is equally relaxing. A must visit to rest a weary soul.

Palace if Versaille overrated. I went recently on a wet day to Versaille during the week. We had not bought tickets beforehand and were aware there could be queues which there were. We stood in line for forty minutes and then, as we didn't have prepaid tickets, were sent to another counter to buy our tickets, come back and go to the end if the queue again.Positive note though, the security line was quick though have been told can take up to two hours on a busy day.The palace visit was pretty busy but held up by people on their audio devices and therefore shuffled along for about an hour. As part of each room is cordoned off, it is difficult to appreciate the beauty and splendor of some if the rooms with so many people ( we were there at 11 am on a wet day). There are some beautiful ceiling paintings to be admired too.The gardens were quite pretty as it is Sumer and in flower though none of the fountains were in operation. The most disappointing though was the modern art structure on the avenue ( called Dirty Corner) which blocked the view of the water and looked like an old pipe dug out of the ground. Spoilt the whole structure of the garden layout.All in all, not up to what I expected but at least only cost 15€ to go in plus train fare.

Pleasure gardens - and what a pleasure. The Luxembourg Gardens are what previous generations called 'pleasure gardens'. The focus isn't on botanical specimens or 'sustainabilty' or conservation - it's on the pleasure of the people who make use of it on a sunny day. And what a pleasure it was on the day we visited. People sitting in the sun, drinking coffee at the cafe, eating their baguettes for lunch, sketching the lovely Medici Fountain, or helping children with their sailboats on the pond. Like something out of an impressionist painting. Just lovely.
Beautiful. Well worth a walk through. We took this in as part of a tour. LovelyGrateful for tick if you find this helpful

Wonderful park with many areas to explore...and free.. We visited this park en route to Pantheon after breakfast, and as most attractions don't open until 10:00am this was a good side visit to kill time...and to see more of Paris. We were there about 9:00am, and many locals were jogging, walking and exercising around the various tracks.The park grounds are very big with several entrances and many sections, gardens, plant nurseries, statues, playgrounds and (what looked like) a day care centre.
