Obviously the most spectacular section is that opposing the Palace Luxembourg with it's manicured gardens, well kept lawns and huge pond. There were ice cream "carts" but as we'd only finished breakfast we didn't investigate further.We only spent about 45 minutes using the visit mainly as an interesting way to the Pantheon after breakfast, but you could easily spend 2 hours (or more) if you wanted to walk the tracks and see the many other sections we did not.Overall, a glorious place to visit on the way to/from the Pantheon...on a warmer/fine day a perfect place for a take-away cafe lunch. A prefect accompaniment to a tour of the palace. Highly recommended if you like parks, statues & gardens.

My favourite gardens in Paris. I just love these gardens. So beautiful and relaxing, perfect to absorb the Parisian sunshine. Ideal spot to just read a book, or even have a little snooze. Try to grab one of the reclining green metal chairs.

A lovely walk on a warm afternoon. Gardens in Paris in summer tend to be a bit austere, but the Luxembourg Gardens are an exception. A lovely way to spend several hours, just strolling through the different sections of the gardens. Relaxing, peaceful and calming in the heart of Paris. Check out the boat pond.

Elegant and relaxing. Beautiful garden with relaxing atmosphere. Perfect to take a short (or longer) brake from exploring the city’s wanders. You can even have a little picnic while enjoying the flowers and trees.
Luxemboug Garden walk. A wonderful location for an afternoon rest. It was nice to slow down the Paris visit with a walk around the park. Nice family setting with children sailing boats in the pond.
Nice Park. Nice place to chill out, big open park with lots of chairs provided. great ice creams are sold here.

Pretty park to sit a while. A lovely park with lots of chairs to sit on, a boating pond in the middle where children can sail wooden boats. The cafe a little pricey but there is a macdonalds just across the road

Just a simple House of Royals before. **sarcasm**. Wonderful Place to view, You really can imagine how the Royal life is before.. Big Palace (1/4 of land), Huge and Beautiful Garden (3/4 of land).. Now it is like Park for French people, peaceful surroundings with some tables and chairs to chill, relax and read books. Some even fly kites, there is also courts for outdoor activities and do others jog and stroll. It a nice place not to miss.

Lovely gardens. Except for not being able to walk on the grass (usual for Paris), this is a lovely, large garden with lots and lots of chairs to picnic or rest while looking at the formal gardens, pond, and beautiful chateau. Very child friendly, despite no grass access, with playground areas and, on the day I was there, pony rides and mini boat rentals to float on the pond. There is a cafe in the gardens, but stop at a boulangerie first for supplies!
Beautiful Gardens . A very nice place to have a picnic or kick back and relax. It is picturesque, clean and no one will try and sell you selfie sticks!@instabuilt

Stunning gardens. We usually visit Paris in late January so it was a joy to visit in August when we could enjoy these lovely gardens. We sat for a while and enjoyed the lovely flower borders. These were well tended.The trees that line the walkways are trimmed into squares which we noticed here and in other parks. Why do the Parisians like their trees to be such a regular shape?A lot of the plants and trees were labeled so, if like me you are not too knowledgeable, you knew what you were looking at. A lot of people also use the park for a morning jog.The Medici Fountain is worth a visit.
Perfect . The kids had a blast sailing boats on the little pond. E3.50 per boat for 30 min. Great chairs to relax in. The gardens are very beautiful.

Great place for a walk. Nice park. A nice place to take a walk. It's not just a big square with grass. Lots of flowers, a pond with kids playing with sail boats, there is an area to sit on the grass, but most grass is off limit.Great place to relax on an afternoon.
Great garden. Amazing garden with all you can imagine. it is a very romantic place in the centre of paris. Perfect to share a day with the love of your life...

Garden of Delight. For any fan of garden and/or public spaces the Luxembourg Gardens are fantastic. A virtual oasis in the middle of the city. Sundays are particularly lively - picnics, families, and a band in the gazebo.

Lovely afternoon. These are so great to go and chill for awhile. If you're seeing the Tokyo, Modern museum, or the Eiffel Tower, it's a short walk. Bring a sandwich and perhaps a jacket to lie down, relax, and stare up at the fluffy French clouds framed by the trees while children run and laugh chasing pigeons.

Breathtaking Gardens. I discovered the Luxembourg Gardens while walking early one morning, before the hustle and bustle started. The Luxembourg Gardens are breathtaking. There are benches and chairs randomly placed for you to sit, think, talk, play, or just be. The gardens are meticulously cared for. You'll find walkers, runners, joggers, and people just strolling along. The two mornings I walked there I saw three older gentlemen walking together, and because I was so in wonderment and in awe, they kindly asked if they could be of help. People in Paris were so kind. Pictures would not do it justice.
Put these lovely gardens on your list!. Elegant, memorable, and wonderful for strolling in Paris. A must see experience if you are visiting Paris for the first time or returning again and again!
Great Place To PicNic. Beautiful garden / park. Get a bottle of wine, Baggett and cheese to have a picnic in the shade and watch the people. It is a scene right out of a Van Gough painting.

A diffrent stroll in the park!. This place is definetely Worth the walk. It redefines the expression a stroll in the park. In summer this place is filled with locals playing check mates or pétanque. Gardens are filled with gorgeous flowers. If you have time, do sit down and enjoy the scenery,

Ideal for a picnic or evening stroll. If the pace of Paris is taking its toll on you and you are south of the river, then this is worth a visit. The gardens are beautifully kept with a range of seating and pretty vistas to admire. It is well suited for a picnic or an evening stroll, but lends itself to fairer or good weather as there is limited shelter. A lovely place to escape the sound of the traffic and noise of the metro!
3 days in Paris. Stunning gardens! A must do even if you're not a keen gardener. So beautiful and peaceful. We sat under a tree and had a picnic lunch.

An oasis in the heart of this great city. This is the most wonderful garden near Saint Germain. So wonderful, in fact you see Parisians taking their lunch break there, putting up their feet on a lounge chair with a novel . Add a scoop of lavender ice cream marveling at the excellent architecture of the gardens, flowers and statues of George Sand and you are in Garden Heaven. Lovely place to walk on the sand paths as well and reminiscent with a friend.
A lovely stroll. A gorgeous park to relax. Stroll through the gardens, have a picnic or sit near the fountain/pond enjoy the beauty all around.

chique. Nice park and very French. If you want to see the Parisiens relaxing come to see them organize a small picnic on the typical green chairs who are available. It is a safe place because 'gendarmerie' is surrounding the Senate who is situated in the park. Also possibility of pony riding for the kids and playing at the pond with small boats.

Always a pleasure. One of my favourite destinations in Paris no matter what time of the year. Unfortunately there was no photographic exhibition on the railings whilst I was there but the park was being made full use of by couples, families, singles, everyone with the leaves already having started to drop.

Perfect for a relaxing afternoon with the kids. We spent quite a few hours at Luxembourg Gardens on our recent visit to Paris. My 6 year old son loved sailing the toy boats on the pond and then the enclosed playground was perfect for both our 1 and 6 year old. The younger adored the sandpit area for smaller children and the older one loved the zipwire and climbing frames - and my husband and I enjoyed being able to sit back and relax on a bench.

Gorgeous. This park is absolutely breath taking. Theres people everywhere you look, but its still so peaceful and quiet. The sound of the fountains and the kids playing with wooden boats in the big pond. Bring some lunch and a blanket and enjoy it on the grass, or the many chairs around the park. Enjoy the beautiful status and flowers all around.
Lovely. Lovely garden. Just go and relax, enjoy the scene, have a coffee, play some chess, read a book, just chill.

A gorgeous place to recharge in the rush of a big city!. This beautiful park used to be the palace grounds for the Palais du Luxembourg which was built for one of the Louis' mother, after the revolution it became the seat of the French Senate. The park has beautiful statues dating back to when it was a palace. The grounds are impeccable with luscious lawns and the perfect place for a recharging picnic. We have been there a couple of times and the relaxing quiet compared to the hustle of the city surrounding it is surprising! The last time we were there on a Saturday and there were pony rides and other things for the kiddos. If you feel like a tennis match there are courts- you can tell all your friends "I played tennis at the Palace"! The best thing to do is to people watch! kick your feet up, enjoy the sun and quiet! But don't put your feet on the rim of the pool! the pool police will yell at you! and he was not kidding around!

Flanagan Ireland . Absolutely fabulous , really enjoyed the gardens on some gorgeous sunny days in august. Lots of chairs to sit on or bring a picnic and lie on the grass. So much to see and do, especially for kids. Don't miss the little boats if you have small kids, nearly tempted myself. One of the nicest places in Paris!
"Immaculate manicured". Spent walking through these gardens and what a peaceful place. Even though lots of people, we admired the manicured gardens, very nice to see..........

Stunning. The gardens are a beautiful place to take a break from your sightseeing in Paris. Take a blanket, a bottle of wine and some cheese and bread and have a fantastic picnic lunch. Simply majestic.

The Best Park. The.Best.Park.Ever. Really. It's massive with plenty of seating, and playgrounds and recreation such as basketball courts and tennis courts. There are plenty of live music events in the summer. This is also the ideal spot to have a romantic picnic or grab a group of friends to toss a soccer ball around. Great for kids. Great for couples. Great for solo reflecting. Great for all.

Relaxing break. The park is a relaxing respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. It is just off St. Michel which is quite busy. The views are great and chairs are set up around the fountain so you can sit and do some people watching. The French senate building is adjacent to the park which looks very cool.
Tranquile, beatiful gardens. lovely peaceful part of Paris to relax soak up the sun, or just watch the world go buy.Spectacular plants and flowers, great place for a picnic
A must see.. Parks are different, this one is special. Lots of locals doing what locals do.The gardens are nice and provide a great rest stop from a busy day sightseeing and walking.

Always a pleasure. Bring a book and sit on the green chairs and bring your kids and put them in the park or rent them a sailboat. No visit of Paris is complete without seeing Luxembourg gardens. Plan between 90 m and 3 hours

Beautiful gardens, but a garden is a garden in my opinion, see one seen most. If you have nothing else to do and have a down day and just want to go for a walk, this is a great place. In addition it is within about a 30 minute walk of the Montparnasse skyscraper and another 15-20 minutes walk to the Pantheon. Also in the area is the cemetery if you have interest.I would suggest going to the top of the Montparnasse tower first to get an overview of the area, I spent more than 30-45 minutes at the top just surveying Paris, and got some spectacular pictures. Then I went to the gardens and then to the Pantheon. Total time around 3-4 hours, then had lunch nearby the Pantheon and enjoyed the French lifestyle. Paris is what you make of it, no need to rush through things. Pace yourself.Anyway the gardens are good, but nothing special, for photographers, maybe great, lots of beautiful flowers to take photos of. Just if you have nothing better to do or want a short cut walk to get to the Pantheon, sure why not.
beautiful. wonderful gardens and views...relaxing lunch on sunday afternoon at La Pavillion de la Fontaine....AND SAIL A BOAT !!!!
Paris at its best. Historical, epic and very real. Great for long walks, people watching, readind a book or summer picnic...

My secret spot. You now know my most treasured place in Paris. As a student, I would come here after class, en route from the boulangerie. I'd order a half baguette and sit on one of the chairs and slowly tear each morsel of bread and watch the world go by. Sometimes I'd share with one of the cute little birds, but not the pigeons. To this day, years later, I still love this park more than any other.

Not to be missed. Any trip to Paris must include a visit to the gardens. Over 56 acres of gardens, ponds, fountains, statues, beautiful walkways, and the Palace as a backdrop make for s magnificent "walk in the park."

Wonderful place for a picnic. We decided to visit the gardens during lunch hour while touring Saint Germain. The gardens are lovely and provide a scenic backdrop for a picnic lunch that we purchased from street market before entering the gardens. This makes one feel like a true Parisian.
Beautiful garden. lovely garden to walk through, sit under a tree watch the world go by or have a small picnic, play tennis or sail your yacht on the lake... perfect way to relax!!!

Beautiful and clean. Pretty flowers and tall trees provide shade. Trees lined the grass area. The grass were very green and clean, no dog poo or rubbish. I didn't like the sand near the fountain because it gets blown everywhere when someone walks. Nice place to have a picnic, read a book or just sleep on the grass, away from the tourists.

Exquisite . The gardens are busy with families, people playing boules, tennis, basketball and pony rides. The highlight for me was watching the sailing boats on the water of the central pond. Propelled by a stick and carried across the pond by the wind . Free access and plenty of places to have lunch and enjoy the atmosphere . The grass is off limits which is not as signposted as it could be .

Amazed by this beautiful park in the middle of the city. What a treat for Parisians this park is! I just discovered it my last week of a 2 month stint in Paris and wish I had found it sooner. It is absolutely beautiful and offers everything. Quiet peaceful spots to read or absorb the beauty, basketball courts, tennis courts, walking/running trials, water features... Something for everyone.

BEST Decision of our Trip!!. We stumbled across this place by chance, as we were near by, and just happened to notice it on our map - we made the best decision of our trip to visit this garden. It's absolutely SUBLIME. Listen to me clearly - get a nice cappuccino to-go from somewhere, bring your book (or buy one), and go sit under a tree in this park. You won't be disappointed. It's the perfect way to relax and fuel up in the city.
One of our favourite places. Eat a picnic, watch the world go by, head to the fantastic children's playground and sail you r yachts on the lake... A wonderful place!

Beautiful gardens on a sunny day. Lovely gardens to walk through or even sit if you have the time. There are chairs scattered around for people to sit around the lakes so it is the perfect spot to relax and enjoy an ice cream!

Not at its best during a dry summer; museum is closed for renovation. A nice place to walk around. But In august it was quite dusty, and the museum was not open. Not too crowded - lots of benches available to sit on and watch the world go by

For Free and beautiful, a walk through the Luxenbourg Gardens. Luxenbourg Gardens is a lovely, public area that you can walk through with no charge. If you decide to walk through the building there will be a charge. It is maintained by the government of Luxembourg and has a sculpture garden which is whimsical and fun for the family. Surround yourself with the aroma of flowers and leisurely stroll through the gardens. We met with an elderly Russian Couple who didn't speak English but shared with us there bread, cheese and some Russian Milk (actually Vodka in a Milk carton). It made a great experience. So if you have had, not so nice, experiences with the Parisians, "forget about um....". And enjoy your so travelers.

Lovely park with lots to see.. The Luxembourg Gardens are well worth spending a couple of hours in on a nice day. The orchard is brilliant if you're interested in gardening as there are many different plants and fruit trees, all labelled.

A crowded Oasis!. This is another must see in Paris, this is another sight which I describe as breathtakingly beautiful. Though we were in this beauty when the weather was warm and was a weekend day - it meant that every Parisian and every tourist (or so it seemed) were there.Well worth the visit though!
Great people watching! . Walked through here when going to museum...lots of people watching and beautiful gardens. Funny to see people pull up chairs to sit by fountain for hours...
Beautiful gardens. This is the perfect place to relax! Sit by the pond, in the sun, in the winter. Or visit the Medici Fountain to get away from it all.
Very pretty. Very attractive and well maintained gardens.There is lots of seating available to use.There are public toilets here - 50c to use.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens are a must see!! We walked through the gardens and when it started to rain, we didn't care. It was such a beautiful and peacefull place. Plus, with the rain, we had the park to ourselves which was a nice break from all the August tourists!
Beautiful square trees. Fascinated by squared chestnut trees. The whole park is beautiful and very peaceful. You can spend a whole day here.
Big and peaceful. big park with lovely flowers, where you see both locals and tourists sitting peacfully enjoying their meals during lunch hours, or between trips (for tourists)

Fun park for kids. We spent an afternoon here -great playground for the kids (does cost a couple euro to enter). Just beyond the playground was the pond, where you can rent little sailboats that the kids push around. They really enjoyed this! The parents enjoyed the rest!
Boating. Child friendly in the heart of Paris. We took our boys to sail boats on the pond it is magical. Even on a sunny day it wasn't too crowded and we sat and paddled our feet .....
Good place to walk around. Very pretty but I prefer more hidden places for picnics. Not enough green in my opinion though it is still worth a visit the layout is well done

A day for a picnic in the park.. Very nice to go there for a relaxing picnic day with the family. Be careful though, as a numer of the cafes and shops in the area are closed on Sundays. So plan ahead, or look a bit harder to find the few that are open

Confusing. There were English signs that said people were allowed on the grass in one part of the garden, yet when we walked on it an unfriendly gardener started yelling at us in French. Would have been a nicer visit had the weather been better, but we enjoyed it nonetheless. Only spent a couple of hours there and would not make a special journey to visit, glad we were staying close by.
Nice Spot. Nice spot to spend a bit of time away from the madness if Paris. Lots of security around. Closes at 8 30.

Nice formal park. This is a formal park, however they nowadays allow people on the grass. The focal point is a pond where (for about 3.50 Euro) children can rent little sailboats for half an hour and have fun racing them, while adults have fun watching.There is also a pavillon where a band payed music and guests dressed in period costumes danced. Unfortunately we visited on a brutally hot day and there is little shade.There are also a number of classical statues in the park, unfortunately some were recently vandalized (Fingers broken off, etc.)All in all, a pleasant way to spend an hour or so.

Went by accident but great for people watching. My wife and I went by accident one day when we were walking toward the Latin quarter. We sat by the fountain and watched children play with miniature sailboats. Great for relaxing and people watching.

Lovely Luxembourg!. We loved Luxembourg Gardens. We had seen them one March five years ago, but seeing them in bloom was a treat. The grounds are immaculate and people of all ages are there to enjoy them at their leisure.

Beautiful, scenic, romantic. We stayed in a fantastic hotel close to the gardens so it was one of the first places we stumbled across in Paris. On a beautiful day, it really was just stunning to walk around and take in the surrounds. There are plenty of chairs to rest on if you desire and places to seek shade in. The gardens are kept extremely neatly and there are lots of signs around, informing you of the different statues etc.

A Pleasant Way to Spend a Few Hours. We spent a few mid-day hours at these gardens. This is a great family "retreat". The children could rent small sailboats and sail them in the large pond at the garden - pushing them with sticks. The gardens themselves were simple and attractive....nothing elaborate but definitely nice. We had lunch at the outdoor restaurant and enjoyed the experience. We felt very relaxed in a very pretty environment.
Must see on first visit. wonderful gardens in the middle of the left bank area. Must see if its your first time to Paris. Great Photo ops.

Budget an Entire Day if You Really Want to See Jardin Du Luxembourg. We were told by a friend that if we visited only one park in Paris, it had to be Jardin du Luxembourg. Our friend failed to mention that this "garden" is more like a city within a city and requires at least a day to visit the entire place. No kidding - it's huge.We walked here from Arc de Triomphe - it's a long walk, but when in Paris, do as the Parisians and walk. Along the way, we stopped by the boucher and picked up ham (Paris has the best ham ever), the boulangerie and picked up a few loaves of yummy bread (ditto for Parisian bread), and the fromaggerie and picked up some cheese and butter (what is it about Parisian butter that makes it so good) so that we could make a picnic in the park.We grabbed some water and made our way into the park and were immediately struck by its size and beauty. This is no corner park - this is a small city requiring a map (which they do offer on signs throughout the park).We made our way to one corner of the park where there was a long reflecting pool complete with ducks, a fountain, and ample seating all around the pool. A handful of the obligatory college students were in one corner debating something, but most of the chairs were full of locals eating, reading, or sleeping. We grabbed a handful of chairs, spread out our picnic, and wondered how we could pull off a move to this most wonderful city.How civilized to have thought of building so many parks in the city? We could have spent all day here, just lounging around and visiting the many other attractions inside Jardin du Luxembourg. I guess that we will include that on our next visit to the City of Lights.NOTE: If you want a great book on all the major gardens in Paris (there's hundreds of gardens, but about 30 are the most well known), consider "Hidden Gardens of Paris" by Susan Cahill. It was recommended to us by the landlord of the apartment we rented, and we found a copy at the wonderful bookstore Shakespeare and Company. Confession - we read it over and over and planned quite a few day trips based upon this book.

Great place to visit, stunning gardens. Great place to visit, stunning well maintained gardens. There is a small fenced playground located at the back of the gardens near the carousel for children. There is a small entry fee but they have toilets as well as food here. Good for all ages and a large number of seats for parents to sit and relax. Could take a picnic and enjoy the day at the gardens!!!!!

A typical Parisian park ! Recommended for people seeking peace. This park is huge and is highly recommended for people who want to chill in solitude and peace amidst the hustle and bustle of the busy life style of Paris. Its the best place to go with a book and a bag of sandwiches. It is a good spot to picnic, and is unusually calm and quiet.This place is recommended for people who want to do "Nothing" on a particular day and just laze out and relax !

Wasn't much impressed. Had heard a lot, but wasn't much impressed. It is like any regular garden. It has a small kids play ground which is good. Otherwise, worth visiting if you have lot of time on hand.
Nice place to walk. The gardens are easy to access and are worth the time to take a walk through them. It was a nice quiet place to take a walk.

Nice place to veg out on a summer day. This was the first stop we visited on our day of arrival while waiting for our room to be ready. Excellent place for the jet lagged tourist to hang out. Nice scenery, people watching, and sculptures located throughout the gardens. There are plenty of chairs around for sitting and sunbathing. If you are there in summer and want to lounge on the designated grass areas, take a towel or blanket. The grass has goose droppings and some trash. We especially enjoyed watching children using sticks to sail miniature sailboats in a public pond. There is a marionette theater as well. And it is a good place to run or jog.
Great for mid-day picnics. a great place for mid-day picnic. you can get your drinks and snacks and enjoy some relaxing time between the flowers and the lake.

Just gorgeous.. I love, love, love this garden. If I lived here I'd be here every weekend with a book and picnic. There are lots of tourists here but there are still a lot of space for a some alone time.
Lovely place to chill on a sunny afternoon.. Beautiful gardens and fountains that are very pleasant to walk around, or just grap a drink and sit and people watch. Well worth a visit.

Stunning, relaxing gardens. Visited on our last day when we wanted a relaxing day sitting somewhere nice and reading. The gardens are stunning, with lovely water areas, including a Great Lake for kids to launch toy boats. Just a beautiful haven.
Beautiful, tranquil place. Beautiful, well kept gardens. A tranquil space in the busy city. Great to have all the chairs supplied so you can just rock up, find a chair and relax.
Relaxing. The Luxembourg Gardens are a refreshing way to take a break from sightseeing. It is frequented by Paris natives and hence is a good way to experience Paris like the natives.

wonderful gardens for a relaxing stroll. The 60 acre Luxembourg Gardens is the perfect location for a relaxing stroll in peaceful surroundings and perhaps picnic with some crusty bread and good cheese. Wonderful treed avenues with numerous open grassed spaces usually with a sculpture or two surrounded by flowers.Sit and watch the locals playing boules and try to work out what's going on, they are very friendly and are pleased to tell you the object and the main rules. We started at the museum end and finished at the spectacular Palais du Luxembourg and watched the kids sailing the model boats in the pond in front of the Palais.Walking on the gras is not allowed so stick to the many paths.

Wish we had found it earlier. Beautiful garden with lots for little ones to be doing and great to escape and relax, sha,e you cant sit on the grass but co,pletely understand why and there are plenty of the green chairs and benches avalible to sit on and relax!

Dont miss this place!!!!!!. For me this "the" Oasis of Paris and maybe the most beautiful park outthere. Located in the middle of district you anyway want to walk all day long through the streets, this wark offers a lot of possibilities for the visitors to relax or also get occupied in many different ways. For example you can rent a little remote controlled boat and remember being a child while you play with it, enjoy the gardens flowers and trees, on some days you also get live music being played! Its just an amazing place that almost surely will have somethign to offer for every type of personality!

Absolutely beautiful- worth visiting even if you only have a few minutes to spare. We stayed at the Hotel Le Clos Medicis, just located around the corner from the Gardens. Due to having 2 very sightseeing filled days, we only managed to visit the gardens just before we checked out of the hotel- but I am so so glad we did visit, even though it was just for 15 minutes. The gardens are so amazingly well-maintained, truly stunning. On a summer day, you could easily spend hours here, just exploring and taking time to sit down and enjoy a pastry or cake.Like all of the main tourist sites in Paris, the gardens do have a police presence, presumably due to the events in Paris earlier this year, but this allows you to feel completely secure and safe. If you are an artist, the gardens would be a absolute dream for inspiration. This is a MUST visit for everyone.

TAKE THAT TIME OUT TO CHILL. If you are trying to visit this place in a hurry, please dont, cause you will miss out on the serenity and beauty of this place which needs you to just sit by on one of the numerous chairs and enjoy nature at its best
Nice garden. A very nice gardens especially for the kids. We had a very good day out and really loved it. It is in a very nice area and have met lots of people.

Hugeeeee place for kids to run around. Luxembourg garden has multiple entry points,just make sure u enter through right one. There is vast area on museum side,where u r not allowed to step on the grass, so if u had picnic in mind go towards fountains on the other side of the garden.There is a play area with lodz n lodz of swings and sitting area.Nice place for family fun

Deep Green peace and quiet.. Beautiful walk in the late afternoon. Everything was very green and quiet. I'd like to go back at lunchtime and pack something to eat. A very tranquil spot. The statues of the Queens of France around the palace grounds were all very interesting.

My favorite of the Paris parks. My wife and I tried to stop in a park each day on our recent trip to Paris and this one was our favorite by far. The beautiful grounds and statues. Plus, Le Cuisine de Phillipe is right around the corner for a fantastic dinner. Highly recommended, and the perfect spot for a picnic.
Lovely!. A great place to explore, rest, and enjoy the stunning views. The sculptures, landscaping, flowers, and fountains are all beautiful.
lovely and open. lovely gardens great for kids you can hire model boats on the pond and pony rides as well very nice cafe lots seating around the park.
Beautiful Park. Best time to come here and just stroll with the Parisians is at dusk. Great place to sit, read and watch the world go by.

A romantic garden in the heart of Paris. Very clean, friendly to the visitors of all the ages. It's a good idea for a shiny day. We chose this place for our last day in Paris, when we were tired of the museums. We sat at a chair we found there and had 2 pleasant hours in the garden and in front of the lake.

Beautiful garden. Amazing park for all the family. Still good for couples as all the french "jardins" are very romantic. The flowers & design are very beaytiful. Kids will find lots of activities to keep them busy.Stroll by the lake , while your kids play with a wooden sail boat (rent a boat at the park for just $3.00)There are also play areas & ponies to ride. Very suitable for spending half a day outdoor.

Boats, playtime and beautiful gardens.. Such a lovely part of Paris and hugely under rated! There are areas to sit and enjoy the parks with green chairs dotted around for you to sit on. There are quiet places to eat a picnic, sit in the sunshine or just watch the world go by. Our favourite thing to do was rent wooden sailboats €3.50 for half an hour and sail them on the small boating lake with fountain. Each boat has a national flag and we were even lucky enough to get the pirate ship - cue many 'high speed chases with the Black Pearl!' The owner makes each ship himself and it was one of the higlights of our trip to sit in the sun sailing a boat! There is a fantastic play park which is €2.50 per child to enter for the day. The reason for the fee is clear, it is a well maintained and cleverly planned park with a large curving zip line, a huge climbing pyramid and several climbing areas with slides, swings and roundabout. Parents can either pay €1.50 to go into the park and sit on a bench inside or pull a green chair up to the railing and keep an eye on your child from the other side of the railing. It is safe and well maintained. The park also has a carousel and puppet shows at different times but check this in advance as they are not every day. The perfect place to enjoy a quieter, slower pace after sighseeing and adventures.

A heavenly place to relax and enjoy the views. This is one of the loveliest parks in Paris, combining history, beautiful flowers, playgrounds, fountains, statues and green space in such a pleasing way. Loads of places to walk and sit, each with lots to look at. Don't miss the Large pool with toy sailboats next to the palace.

You gotta get a sailboat!. Our kids loved this garden with its beautiful statues, landscaping and most of all the huge fountain. You can rent a wooden sail boat for 3€ a half hour and its worth every penny. My daughter squealed in delight the entire half hour.
Highly recommended.

Nice place to chill but not for young kids. The garden is very big and nice, most of it with quite places to sit and talk or read a book. The place is totally not for kids and not for trolls, there is no way to travel there with baby's. Except that the place is nice to visit only if you have many days in France .

Know when to go. I spend months of each year in Paris and a stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens remains a favorite activity. There are those that jog along the perimeter and others that stroll or sit by the Medici Fountain. There are 20 wonderful statues of women famous in french history circling the center. If you want to avoid the busiest times, go mid morning. There are several buses and metro stops that will get you there.
our favorite daily spot. Best place to unwind with family. Buy a sandwich or pastry at one of the neighborhood shops and sit and relax
Lovely stroll. Lovely place to spend an afternoon on a hot day. Sit on a bench, enjoy a cold drink, chat with fellow travelers and locals.
Nice. Beautiful and cannot be missed. The palace is gorgeous and the little sailboats in the water are so charming!
Lovely park!. This is just a beautiful space in the middle of a gorgeous city. Gardens are stunning, and the history is great.
Beautiful gardens. Luxembourg Gardens is very beautiful and worth a stroll. You'll enjoy it! Sit on a bench, have a soda, and enjoy the park.
Awesome gardens. Fab place, and just a few mins from the Paris hustle and bustle, shame you can't eat and chill on the grass, but spectacular none the less!
a beautiful walk. beautiful and peaceful walk - just make sure that you know where the toilets are before you set out.

Loved this area!. After strolling through the gardens, make your way to the huge circular man made lake located out the front of the palace. A really cool spot to take off your shoes and dip your feet in the water and watch as the young ones(and sometimes the oldies) push little sail boats around. I have not seen this anywhere else on the planet. It was fun to watch and we probably stayed there longer than we should have as it was great keeping our feet in the water in the European scorching summer heat.

Beautiful and peaceful in the heart of the City. After five visits to Paris, we finally visited Luxembourg Gardens and found them an enchanting place. These large formally landscaped gardens offer broad paths for strolling, a lake with toy boats to rent, and many private quiet benches for reflection or reading. It's easy to spend a restful couple of hours in this park, away from the hustle and bustle just outside the gates. Be sure and look for the parakeets that now thrive in the trees near the front gate.

A Beautiful Garden . What a massive and beautiful garden. If you are in Paris, it is highly recommended that you visit. What else are you waiting for, go on have a really good relaxation and enjoy the scenery.

Clean and big. Beautiful,nice and clean. I think those can be the most important words to describe this place. You can visit it and everything is clean. You have birds, statues, and other things that make this place something imposible to forget

Nice garden. Having our flight in the late afternoon we had all morning to spent in Paris. After two busy days spent walking a lot and visiting many places thanks to our museum pass, we wanted to spend our last morning in this park.It's a very beautiful park with gorgeous flowers. It's well taken care of. There are many chairs laying around. We saw many Parisians running in the park or just relaxing on a chair having something to eat or reading a book. We've spent a pleasing morning.
Nice park to just sit and relax. This is an oasis in Paris. The pond in the park has wooden boats for rent. Just sit down and be a part of this.

A refreshing break from the crush of tourists!. After several days of sharing Paris with thousands of tourists, when found delightful rest, quiet, beauty and relaxation in the Luxemburg Gardens. The grounds are beautiful with lots of shaded walks and the Sailboat pond in the center of the Garden was a once in a lifetime memory! Don't miss this little spot of beauty while in Paris.
Lovely day at the gardens. We visited the gardens on a lovely sunny day. Lots of people there. There were chairs to sit on, around a pond, a play area for children ,sports and activities.
Very nice. Very nice place. If you are travelling with children, there´s a nice activity for them with little boats.
Relaxing, great for a picnic. Beautiful gardens, lovely way to unwind after a busy day in Paris. Take a picnic but not a rug as you are not allowed on the grass.

Beautiful and Doesn't Cost a Thing!. My sister and I jumped on a "Hop-On, Hop-Off" bus tour and one of the routes took us here. We weren't originally going to go here during our trip, but decided last minute to and we're so glad we did! First of all, it's free... second of all, it's beautiful! Get your camera ready!

Don't miss it. Stunning formal gardens. Excellent playground for the kids (costs a couple of Euros). Great boating lake in the centre. Again the kids loved it. Lots of room for the kids to let of some steam while you sit back and have a coffee.
Playground. Went for the playground, which has a fee to enter. It was a nice change of pace, but mostly for smaller kids
Popular park. Very popular with locals and a nice place to relax -- grab a chair and watch the kids with the little boats
Worth a walk through.. Nice large park, many statues, crowded. Mid town location, nice palace on grounds, pond. On train B route, metro ticket can be used for transfer.

Yep. Of the many "must visits" in a stinky hot August trip this was one of the highlights. Find a seat by the stagnant non functioning fountain and relax. The gardens are a pristine testament to past inequalities and an ideal location for you to ponder the source of the ever present miasma of urine that envelopes this wonderful city.

ideal for a nice walk. This very nice park is ideal to escape from the busy city. You can strawl or jog at your own rythme and escape joy the calm and the nice views. It can be somewhat crowded during summer days, that is why I enjoy it most in other periods.
Jardin. most beautiful garden in Paris, we were so worn out we sat down and my daughter took a nap. # 1 relaxing spot

A place of peace amidst the hustle and bustle. We stayed in the hotel across from the park and loved going there in the early evening to unwind from our day of sightseeing. Families and people of all ages gather here just to sit or sail boats or have peaceful conversation. It is well kept and the gardens are beautiful. It is a must visit in Paris.

Rent a toy sailboat!. Wonderful, large park with lots of statuary (including large likenesses of every queen of France), a large fountain/pond in which kids can sail toy sailboats that are for rent nearby, both shady and sunny areas to sit and picnic, and a small cart that sells snacks, tea, coffee and ice cream. We spent a whole morning there, and it was so relaxing!

I was expecting much better. I was expecting a park as I am used in London, with grass and places wher to lay down and relax. There is nothing of this! You can just sit on some bench, is you find one that is not dirty. Nothing so special for this garden. I've been very disappointed

Stunning gardens. I love the different zones of the gardens.It felt like visiting a paradise at the end of the day of sight seeing. The gardens were full of beautiful colourful flowers at that time of the year. There was large space for sitting down and picnics, another space full of trees with benches, play grounds for small children with pools! .. Large water lake with small fountains, etc.I guess families can have loads of fun there and couples can find their romantic spot as well as students quiet place to study.Lovely place. I am jealous to have such a park in the city.

Luxembourg Gardens - historical, beautiful, and relaxing. During my stay in Paris, I went to Luxembourg Gardens on more than one occasion. The first was to explore the beautiful chateau located at the front entrance. The second time, I went to a small building serving as a community gallery where I viewed photographs from an interesting photographer. There are multiple areas for children to play, informational spots around the garden for their education and amusement. There are beautifully kept floral gardens with statues of historic proportion. I relaxed in a provide chair and enjoyed a sandwich for dejeuner then walked the gardens. great place for a leisurely stroll and a favorite of runners too. There were magnificent fountains and statues situated throughout the gardens. I can't say enough about this lovely place.

Wonderful gardens in middle of Paris. Luxembourg gardens are wonderful this year. It's August and the flowers are really vibrant. It's a great place to read a book, picnic, or just sit and relax. Little model sail boats can be hired in the middle of the gardens - hours of fun to watch....

MUST GO!. Surprisingly, it was not on my itinerary. I was walking the street and checking the map when I found out myself near there. I thought 'Why not?' I went there and it was the best thing I've ever done. The garden is amazing. Enjoy yourself in one of the chairs available in the middle of the park while the sun is in the sky. It is unforgettable.
Lovely place to relax. Stunning to just walk around and relax taking in the surrounding place of wonder .... Lovely vibe and chilled out
Spend the afternoon. The kids can chase a sailboat around the pond or go to the playground -- great place to blow off some steam!

Relax in Luxembourg Park. I suggest to spend few hours and relax in this park. It is big enough to sit down and relax on the sun, or in the shadow of the trees. Kids and people that feel like kids can hire a boat in the pond for 30 minutes for 3 euros. You can sit down and read a book, watch beautiful garden or people enjoining like you are.

Busy & Beautiful. As you pass through the gates into the gardens you know you have entered a special place. The gardens are vibrant with colour both from the plants and the people. A wonderful place to stroll, sit quietly & watch the world go by or read a book.

Love it! . Completely different from the English gardens, more elaborate, bigger and more lavish. The sculptures and the fountains were beautiful and in summer the deck chairs are out, with a real chill out atmosphere.

More like a Park. The Luxembourg Gardens are more like a huge park vs Gardens. It was nice- I expected to see more flowers. Seems great for local people where there are tennis courts, basketball court and more. The grounds were all really clean and many places to sit and relax.

A nice surprise!. We were looking at the Sorbonne and saw Luxembourg Gardens was very close...SO happy we went the few blocks to see it...a nice haven in the middle of that part of the city to spend a few moments enjoying the Gardens.

Stunning!. Beautiful place in the summer. I used to come here every now and then after work to read a book or relax. The gardens are beautiful and it is practically almost always possible to find a bench or a chair to sit and rest here. A must-go sight in Paris.

Take a coffee and a pastry and just relax. With so many seating options and the absolute serene atmosphere, you can find a place to sit and take in this gorgeous garden. I suggest getting there early in the day to do so before it gets crowded. But even when it is crowded, it is fun to watch the boats in the pond and the people just enjoying themselves. A must see.
Brilliant play area. . Spent hours here with my 9 year old. She loved the park & the play area (2.50 euro entry for kids). Take a book and spend the day.

Lovely Place. This park is one of Inner-Paris's finest parks. It is also one of the largest. It is always enjoyable to stroll around during the summer days, with the tress offering some shadow when it's too hot. There's a grass spot where you can actually sit on (rare privilege in Paris). Plus now there's WIFI (just like in any other park now).
Serene. Peaceful and romantic an escape from the streets. The orangery hosts art exhibitions and the gate house too. Fontaine de Medicis is the best spot to grab a recliner and chill out, magical.

A Gem in the City!. What a lovely garden! We grabbed sandwiches from local cafe and we ate it in the garden, while enjoying the band playing in the band stand / gazebo. There are lots of chairs and benches to relax in. Beautiful and breath taking garden. It's also a great afternoon for kids to spend by the pond where you can rent a mini sailboat to set sail on the pond and let the wind carry the sailboat across the pond. The kids just have a blast fetching and casting the sailboats.

perfect for young and old alike. we spent a few hours having a pony ride, sailing boats on the pond, playing at the playground, and could have stayed longer. Our children were aged 8, 6 and 3 years at the time and they were all happy, but I would have enjoyed it even without the kids.

Green Spaces. A walk into this garden would calm an unsettled mind.As you stroll in,you will notice the place is full with people immersed in their things,some jogging,stroling,sipping on some wine in the restaurant within the garden or some sitting by the a large octagonal basin of water.

Good place to stroll around. Not really a whole lot to do here, but it's a free place to stroll around. Some good spots to take pictures, in particular the Luxembourg Palace and the Fontaine Medicis. You can also see the Eiffel tower in the distance.

Lovely Luxembourg Gardens. We walked through the gardens and the flower beds were in full blossom. We watched the pertonk and the chess games and the amount of people there - famiies - was amazing. A Wonderful resource for the Parisians and the tourists alike.

Summer oasis!. I always spend at least one afternoon in Jardins du Luxembourg every time I go to Paris. There are chairs to relax in, statues of French Queens to admire, the Palace du Luxembourg and the Medici Fountain to marvel at, and well hidden statues of Beethoven, Chopin, Watteau, George Sand, Verlaine and even a Statue of Liberty to look for. There is only one area of grass you can lie on and that is always full of Parisians, but you might find a corner to stretch out on. There's a great cafe, public toilets and a small booth that sells crepes, coffee, drinks and ice creams. And there are so many trees, there's always loads of shady spots on a hot Parisian summer's day!

Elegant relation in Paris at the Luxembourg Gardens. if you want a quiet day to relax and take a walk elegant gardens and trees, with famous architectures then come to Luxembourg gardens. Its also close to famous places that Hemingway went to like the Polidor restaurant

Lovely gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens were situated close to our hotel and, on our last day in Paris, we took a stroll through a small section.Seeing the local Parisians smoking and playing chess or cards made for great viewing and fantastic photos.As we wandered further on, we then saw a similar scene with some expert pétanque playing. Accompanied, again, by the aromas of cigar smoke and fresh coffee ... a perfect scene and one that I would definitely return to see again.This was on a balmy Sunday afternoon ... I'm presuming that you may not see the same on a cold, wet, Monday morning!
Sit back and Relax and watch the world pass by. Sit back and relax at these beautifull gardens on a sunny day and watch the world pass by. Many things to see from flowers, trees and contemporary arts
Beautiful. Beautiful place and very quiet.Go there for a coffee on the nice day!Also lot's of affordable restaurants around.
Nice garden. Nice garden with fresh flowers and suitable for both couples and families, design is great too..enjoyable place.

Gorgeous gardens, perfect for an early evening stroll. These gardens are located pretty close to the Musee d'Orsay so my boyfriend and I hired some of the bikes on the street outside the Musee and cycled over. It was early evening and we grabbed some crepes and strolled around. They are very well maintained and would be perfect for picnics and relaxing. The palace was very nice to look at, the view of it across the fountain was particularly gorgeous. If you're in the area and fancy spending some time in a Parisian park this is a great one to choose.
Best garden in Paris. The luxembourg garden are well maintained and the best option to have a break in busy Paris. Come here with the kids and/or your dog both are welcome.

Great place for a picnic with friends. We stopped at a nearby grocery store on our way to the gardens and picked up some wine, dinner, dessert, and snacks and sat and ate the evening away. It was such a perfect idea! I felt like a Parisian as I sat there and enjoyed the royal view and watched as others whiled their evenings away in their respective groups. It was probably the most refreshing dinner I could have had in Paris, and that wasn't because of the food!
Beautiful Oasis. We loved this park and atmosphere. Pull up a bench and watch children playing, people conversing and the flowers blooming.

Wonderful spot for a family picnic!. Feel free to skip the picnic blanket - Luxembourg Gardens has more than enough chairs, which you can move and position as you wish. The garden itself is lovely, and it is well-visited without feeling crowded. There is a public restroom (for a small fee) and a cafe.
Beautiful gardens. If you have an extra time ,or if you stay in hotel in the 6th district of Paris ,visit Luxembourg gardens .Its beautiful ,well kept garden that includes Luxembourg palace .

Beautiful and relaxing. Make time to pack a picnic and blanket. This beautiful park is so inviting to all people. The gardens are beautiful but the statues are quite interesting. There's also an adorable large amusement park for children. There is a fee but if you're traveling with little ones this is the perfect break for a family.
Beautiful. Gorgeous grounds, absolutley worth the trip, relax and have a picnic lunch while taking in the fresh air.
Just perfect. The perfect way to relax after a long walk of Cartie Latin!! Maybe the best garden in Paris, a small paradise in the city center...Do not miss it!
Playing with Leaves. It was a lovely place to me. Apart from the gulls flying low, I had a good time playing among the leaves on the ground. Beautiful park this was!
Relaxation. What a great place to people watch and relax after walking all day. We ate at a restaurant across the street from an entrance and enjoyed people watching.

Stunning building and beautiful grounds. I took my baby here because we were looking for something to do for the day. It was free and stunning. We walked around exploring for a long time in the park area before going were the crowds were at the base of the building. Great walking paths for strollers and plenty of shad on a hot day! I highly recommend visiting!

Day in the park. Every trip to Paris we spend a little time daily in the park. The kids love to rent boats and sail them, take pony rides and most of all go to the playground. Even though the playground has a fee, it's nominal and well worth it! The park is great for kids of all ages. It's fenced in so I always feel the kids are safe. Parents can sit outside the playground (or in) drink coffe and relax. It's a great destination if you are traveling with kids.
Lovely. Had an amazing time in the gardens-would have loved to have spent longer people watching. Lots of activities to do or observe.

Day of relaxing. The gardens are a lovely place to go if you want to have a day in the sun or around nature. The buildings are beautiful and there are loads of trees to seek shade under. You are not allowed on most of the grass parts and will be told to get off by a park ranger if you are on them! (i saw others being told to move). There are ice cream and sandwich kiosks inside :) Walk to the gardens from the Eiffel Tower side to see all the local life spots or from the Musee d'Orssay if you want to see the bustling shopping streets.

Place to relax in Paris. This is the best garden in Paris. Usually there are sculpture exhibitions in the grounds, locals and tourist go to relax and enjoy the beauty of the park. Main part is the huge pond but there are smaller ponds all around.

Spectacular!. While walking the city with my family we came upon the gardens and truly enjoyed the visit! The gardens are beautiful, peaceful and well-manicured. There are many places to sit, including chairs that can be easily moved to shaded locations. On my next visit, I will bring a picnic lunch (as many of the locals had done).
Only in France. Huge space, lots of statues and immaculate gardens. This is the perfect place to chill after a day of walking around the city.

Beautiful place to spend an afternoon. Spent an entire afternoon strolling the garden grounds with my wife. Highlights included watching people play chess, wandering through several art exhibitions, gazing at the fountain, as well as simply sitting and enjoying the wonderfully manicured green spaces.We also spend about 30 minutes watching a group of partner dancers doing period dancing (in costume). Very fun afternoon!

Beautiful ~ Relaxed - a great picnic place. The gardens here are simply stunning! The flowers, the fountains, the trees... it is easy to find a place to kick back, relax and tan or have a picnic! It is a huge area, so it is easy to find privacy if you wish. Benches and chairs throughout the area, so no need to bring your own if you're on vacation.

A very good family friendly place. We took the boys to this place. There is a great place to sit while facing the fountain and the place.Birds are friendly. The kids can join a theater act but it is only in French. They can also enjoy a good time playing in the playing ground. It is big and it can keep them busy for quiet a time

Out of the bustle.. Jardin du Luxembourg is a wonderful breathing space in the bustling city. Our son (11) loved the sailboat models in the fountain lake which you rent at only EUR 3.50 for half an hour. My wife and daughter appreciated the many recliner chairs (free) to sit in the shade of trees when the sun was too hot. There was a good band playing on the bandstand. Bathroom is clean and welcoming. Small cottage shops sell cold and hot beverages at lower prices than the bigger shops. Strangely, the park is deligthfully free from in-your-face souvenir-peddlers. A visit is highly recommended halfway through your visit to Paris!

Simply Beautiful. The Luxembourg Gardens offers a quiet sanctuary to relax and wander with a loved one. The flowers and landscaping are breathtaking and we found a fountain that was absolutely beautiful.
Great Area To Relax!. My favorite garden in Paris - take the time to bring a book to read around the large pond - and on weekends watch the fun adults and children have sailing their toy boats!

Fun for families with kids. Fun fun fun - it is a garden to visit, but it isn't an amusement park. They did have a wonderful puppet show. And there was an antique carousel for children. The kids were given a jousting pole to poke through small rings as they rode by. The children would always forget about this part until they were close to the rings. hilarious.

Nice escape from the city. This park is absolutely beautiful. It's an incredibly calm and peaceful place in such a fast paced city. You can spend your time reading, having a picnic, playing soccer, take a nap or just enjoying the beautiful nature that surrounds you.
Huge Space. A very large park with a lot of different activities. Tennis, a pond where you can rent a small boat for kids to sail, chairs to leisurely lounge about in. Great please to relax
Beautiful! . Stumbled upon these gardens quite by chance. They're beautiful, tons of photo opportunities here! Lots of families picnicking - just gorgeous!

Popular place to find shade during hot summer day. There are many people in the park where on central grass area you can sit on (it has specific signs telling that) and have picnic but on several other lawns (esp on NE and NW corners of the park) it is forbidden and park guards kindly ask you to leave from there. Park is big and there are metal chairs to sit on everywhere and read a book (many people do). My favourite place was Medici Fountain on NE corner of the park with a long rectangular pond and chairs around it.

Beautiful. Went on a cloudy breezy morning in June. The garden wasn't crowded and all I saw were locals jogging around. Beautiful place to take pictures. If you're into history, art and architecture, you will appreciate the serenity and tranquility of the gardens. Grab a coffee to go from a nearby cafe and take a seat. Don't forget to take a picture of the palace and dare I say it, a selfie. Great for kids.

A wonderful park in perfect French style. I've spent just a few hours in these wonderful gardens but I was really amazed, they reminded me the 'Valentino' that we have in Turin.Entrance is free, if you don't want to visit the museum, and you can walk everywhere looking at the big nice palace, built in the classic French style, from outside.They are huge, full of 'green' and with lots of people, however you can walk and relax quietly, even find a bench where you can rest your feet. I don't know if it's usual but when I've been here there was a classical concert in one of the gazebo, making the ambience even better! In the middle of the gardens, in front of the palace, there is a really big nice round fountain where children can play with wooden boats, making this park a perfect choice for families looking for a good way to spend the afternoon.It could seem strange but, for me, this is one of the most beautiful places in Paris, it reflects perfectly the way I imagine Paris with the eyes of a foreigner: big squared palaces, music in the streets, big parks and big green avenues.

Great Way to Spend Sunday Afternoon in Paris!. We love the Luxembourg Gardens! So many things to do. Our 8 year old loved the large play area. We observed horseback riding and people picnicking on the lovely grounds. On Sunday afternoons, there is a Puppet Show which we are so glad we did. Although the show is in French,(which we don't speak) we laughed and enjoyed the show. Very much a way to have your children enjoy the "simple pleasures"--our 8 year old loved it. She was able to sit down front with all of the children.. no adults allowed in the first few rows. To end the day, we rented a toy sail boat and a stick for our daughter and she and my husband enjoyed setting it assail in the huge fountain. Again, a wonderful, simple pleasure that we loved. As we were leaving the Gardens, we sat in on a Piano concert in the park. A very memorable day indeed!

Popular place to exercise or relax. Beautiful city space, popular with locals and visitors. Beautiful gardens, green shade, splashing fountain, tennis courts, Palace backdrop. A really cared for and well used place.

Beautiful, beautiful and beautiful....... We stayed in a hotel near by the gardens, Hotel Luxembourg Parc. This garden was as beautiful as movies and stories have told us. We have been in several parks and gardens during all our travelling around the word, but this breathtaking garden is among the finest.We shave our faces, but these gardeners shave the plants, flowers and trees. Incredible look and we felt like extras in a french movie of love. Use a long time, feel free and do not hesitate to show your love to a garden during your visit. We preciated that our hotel was a few meters from outside the garden.

Relaxing park in the middle of Paris. A great place to relax and recuperate from walking around Paris all day. Plenty of benches and chairs. Also theres a nice playground for the kids to run around, with 8 slides in total if I counted correctly.

Stunning. The Medici fountain is incredible - many people (including myself) want to get a photo in front of this beautiful fountain. The basin has little boats floating that can be rented (they all have different country's flags on them, and there is a pirate ship!) - they are great fun to watch. In the middle of the day, people are having lunch, reading their book, just relaxing in the sun. The statues of various women in French history are very interesting to look at. Some of these experienced recent vandalism - I can understand why the park does not stay open all night (it opens at 7:45am) I could have stayed in this park for hours. Highly recommended.

Great for kids ages 2-12. The gardens are beautiful and as you walk towards the "pond" and palace, you will find plenty of seats. There is shade ti be found on hot days, too. Kids (and adults) can rent sailboats (about 20inches n made guaranteed to float) for 2.50euros fir 30mins. Well wirth the $. Don't worry about the country's flag on the boat because no one else cares! Take the kids to the children's park. For a small entry fee (about 2.50 euros kids snd 1.75 adult), you'll be able to spend 3hrs here easily. There are play apparatus I hadn't seen at other playgrounds including a zip line for kids. The rules say for ages 7+ but many parents allow kids as young as 4 on these. Young kids will need help!! Most kids under 10 will need help to put the zip line in start position. French kids are well behaved and there are lots if Brits n American families here too. There are playgrounds fir toddlers and young children, too. There are few food places so bring your picnic lunch or snacks, even if you've eaten. Kids always get thirsty and hungry after playing!
Little Boys (and a Few Girls) and Boats. There really is a place where children can float boats on a pond. The garden is very formal, but lovely and there are spots where you can sit and read a book.

Fantastic green space. We walked from our place in the 13th arrondissement in the 90+ degree heat and were rewarded with a cool and peaceful hour reading under trees in this beautiful park. The Senate has its impressive building here (originally built for Maria de Medici, widow of Henry IV) , there are tennis courts, sailboats to rent for children to float on a circular pond just behind the senate, several refreshments stands with drinks, ice cream, etc. Don't miss the very impressive fountain built at the request of Maria de Medici near the northeast corner of the gardens.

Beautiful Park. The Luxembourg Gardens are quite lovely and are a well used Parisian park. There is so much to do there. It has a lot of grass and many benches. You will see people picnicking, riding bikes, sailing small boats on the pond, playing boules or just plain relaxing. This year we went on the 4th of July and took our picture in front of their Statue of Liberty (the first model made by Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi). It seems that quite a few French folks also were there to picnic and pay tribute.
Little walk .. Very nice gardens in the city centre of Paris . Everybody should visit it . The weather was fantastic so it was really busy from people chilling in the garden .

Beautiful spot to escape the hustle and bustle for an afternoon. Pros: lovely park, lots of places to sit (both shade and sun) and can move the chairs around, fountain for kids to play with sailboats.
Cons: not allowed to sit on the grass!

Great to watch the boats. One of the things I love about Paris is the public parks/gardens. The Jardin du Luxembourg were right by our hotel so we had breakfast here (top tip - visit a boulangerie and grab some croissants, brioche, pain au chocolate etc and eat out) and watched the toy boats on the pond. The boats are available for hire and are identified by country so you can have some interesting races. Plenty of other features including a rose garden. Lots of seating to sit and people watch
Beautiful green space. A lovely garden to sit on a chair and relax, have a picnic and go for a walk with different areas to see. Leafy green to open spaces and beautiful summer flowers!

A lovely garden, find the time to visit it!. Beautiful gardens and mansion. Many, many benches to sit on. Lovely pond at the center where kids can play with small boats. Have not tried the cafe at the location, but it seemed nice enough. Can't sit on the grass :(
Nice place for a picnic. Enjoyed a picnic lunch which we arrange on the way from local markets. The gardens are nothing flash but the open space is good.

Chilling in 26 degree heat!. After a couple of days walking all around Paris, kicking back in these lovely gardens for an hour or so with an ice cream in 26 degree heat was just what was needed. Stunning place!

Lovely, simply lovely. A beautiful place to walk through. Sit by the fountain and admire the Palace that Maria de Medici had built and is now the Senate building. There are statues all around and you can walk around the paths and find relaxing spots to sit, read and contemplate.
Comfortable place to relax. Beautiful gardens. Grab some foot and go hang out a relax. Lots of space, tables, fountains, etc. well located in the Left Bank.
The best park in all of Paris. Jardin de Luxembourg is lovely. You should spend a whole day in it, when it's sunny. It's better than many other "attractions".
Paris at Play!. A good place to rest your feet after all that museum and mall hopping. Enjoy a very relaxing sunset watching Paris at play in this garden when you visit.

Peaceful setting. This a a beautiful area to walk through. Not quite as crowded as the rest of Paris! There is no cost and you can pack a little snack and sit and just enjoy the beautiful flowers and people watch.

Great Gardens, check the event schedule. My favorite part about the Luxembourg Gardens is the big pond in the middle where little kids sail their boats.
I've also come across many good concerts - check the calendar online, there usually is at least one every saturday and sunday. Other than that, great place to take a book and relax and/or picnic.

Sensible shoes. Wear sensible closed shoes. The gardens are beautiful and eye catching. People tend to lay around in different areas under a tree. It's a very semi - romantic area IF you are able to find a quiet isolated area to steal a kiss. Overall, and if only the pathways weren't made of gravel, this is a very relaxing garden you should visit.
Beautiful place to have a break. Good place to have a break while discovering Paris. Many people come there to have a lunch. It's very beautiful at summer and autumn.
Nothing Excited. After we visit Versailles Garden, there is nothing to see here. The garden is very small, all in the front, take us 30 minutes to see everything. Luckily, it is free entry.
Gardens. Beautiful gardens around. You can spend whole day there just sitting. In the middle the is a small cafe! There is a very expensive coffee and it is not tasty.
Loved IT!!. Our first time in this beautifully maintained garden, it was a joy to be walking on the well kept grounds and enjoy the facilities.
Elegant Paris park. Fantastic gardens (loved the red chard in the flower beds), a great place for people watching. Also fun to watch the toy yachts racing in the pond. Best of all - public toilets!
Beautiful gardens in the middle of Paris. Enjoyed this piece of tranquillity in the middle of Paris!Interesting to watch the locals and just soak up some sunshine!

Go blend in with the locals away form the crowds. Sit and relax plenty of chairs to sit in. Enjoy the locals relaxing without the tour buses going past. Nice place to take a picnic but if you forget your food there are pleny of restaurants around outside the park
Beautiful . Beautiful gardens. Great place to sit, relax and enjoy the view. Bring water with you as the bottles are wat too expensive in the park.

Large open space with few people. Lovely open space which was very quiet on the day we visited. Very nice tennis courts and good areas for sitting and people watching. Pretty gardens and the beautiful senate palace. Very near to Bread and Roses cafe for a lovely picnic.
just enjoy and chill out. Loved sitting listening to the music and taking time out to just enjoy everything going on around the ciry
Pretty place to spend some quiet moments. Beautiful gardens that offer a pleasant oasis of calm in the midst of a busy city. We were fortunate to hear a pianist giving a free concert in the gazebo.

Not worth the time. I completely forgot to visit these 'gardens' during my previous visit to Paris and thought I absolutely must see them this time around. I even dragged my partner there, assuring him that this is supposed to be a 'must see'.Not sure what the fuss is about, really. These 'gardens' are a bust. I was so disappointed, there's just nothing there. If you're after majestic buildings, go and see Louvre and Hôtel de Ville. If you're after lush trees, memorable monuments and nature in general, go to Parc des Buttes-Chaumont. You'll even have Paris views from there.It's somewhat like the Grand Canal area of Versailles gardens - plain and boring.Don't waste your time here, Paris has so many wonderful sights and this just isn't one of them.

Luxembourg Gardens. If I lived in Paris I would spend many hours here. As a tourist we could only spend limited time. The gardens are extensive, sun and shade. We stumbled across a concert to enjoy and children racing mini-sailboats in a fountain. A great place to picnic. Absolutely delightful and not to be missed.
One of the Best. These gardens would have to be one of the best in Paris. So much to watch...you can sit here for the whole day.

H and P take Paris. Walked to this garden in the evening from our hotel. Quite large garden with lots of people around but not at all crowded. Flowers were beautiful and a lot of local character. In July it stays light out until after 10 so you can do things into the evening.
gorgeous park. awesome place to stroll or hang out with a book or friends and relax. absolutely lovely park in the heart of Paris.
Peace and quiet park to relax !. Nice place to spend an quiet afternoon walk in the morning. Jogging is good too. Don't miss out the fountain in the middle.

U must see. This is my second visit to Paris and I tried to visit new places and one of them was this garden , it is very relaxing area after a long day , it is nice safe place for children to have fun , there is toilets available and ice cream seller , u will enjoy the sun and gardens and fountains and the wonderful statues all around and after ur visit u can make shopping in the st Michel rue which it lies on which is full of shops in both sides , u must see it

Great spot for an evening picinic. I understand everyone's love for Luxembourg gardens. We stopped and picked up some dinner and brought it back to the gardens for an evening picnic. The park was just bustling with jogger, couples, people just enjoying a book, a cigarette or the views. There are a lot of pretty flower arrangements. We liked to sit by a pretty fountain in the shade.
A Dream. My wife and I love to take a stroll here, sit on a bench, read, nibble on a pastry with a few sips of water. This is where our minds escape to during a boring meeting.

sightseeing. Beautiful park to stroll through, lots of activities going on. Can sit around the water watching and or feeding the ducks. A . Nice place to be after coming out off the source museum. Nice for picnics and lots of places to sit and have one. Can also get food drink from cafes within the park if you not got your own food. Really beautiful , picturesque, relaxing and spotless clean. Well looked after and maintained.
A grand park. This is a magnificent site, perfect for a quick walk or a long picnic. A great place to visit in winter or summer - if you are prepared for some temperature extremes.

Great, relaxing afternoon. My husband and I took a blanket and laid in the gardens one afternoon. We enjoyed the views of the palace, watching the kids float boats in the fountain, and our picnic/nap in the garden.
Impressed. A lot of people, (which is good), sitting, walking, grabbing a tan, jogging, playing chess, taking photos, playing with toy boats in the fountain...Wonderful picture of life.

Beautiful Place and free of charge. It was a nice garden in Paris. You can't miss it . Walking around you could see many beautiful statues. It is not far from the Notre dame and Pantheon, Not so crowded when I was there. Just drizzle recommend to visit
A must see attraction. A very nice place to spend the evening after a hectic visit to the other sight seeing attractions. A must see for any visitor to paris

Take a promenade!. Luxembourg gardens are nice for a stroll, or a picnic. Pack a frisbee or a soccer ball, and relax on the grounds. Gaze upon the Luxembourg palace, and oogle at the guards armed with machine-guns. There are restaurants in the park, and signs with the park's history in multiple languages.

Peaceful haven to soak up the sun and relieve tired feet.. These are beautiful gardens to walk around or to sit and watch the world go by. Within the gardens are areas of shade to sit overlooking the boating lake where you can hire model boats. There is a a great little cafe that offers salads and good quality snacks for a light lunch. There are also tables to sit for a light meal. Just outside of the gardens are a few restaurants
beautiful. tranquil. romantic.. Beautiful. Romantic. Tranquil. Hard to believe in the middle of a city. Ideal for a bottle of wine and a picnic.

Relax and enjoy. A relaxing stroll viewing the statues of kings and queens, watch the children play round the pond or in one of the many play areas. Visit whatever gardening exhibition is showing or just sit and enjoy the view.

Beautiful spot to catch a glimpse of the Parisian life. Beautiful garden and a good place to catch a glimpse of the Parisian life. They have a large and well equipped playground for children (small entry fee) for kids looking to burn some energy. It is also a nice spot for a picnic and a break from the museums.

Lovely!. Beautiful. We stumbled across Luxembourg because we got lost. The garden is absolutely stunning. Unfortunately when we were in Paris a heatwave hit and it was exceptionally hot. We didn't enjoy the garden as much as we could have but were happy we got to see it. Something was going on because there was live music. It was just a lovely spot.

Mix with the locals on Sundays. Luxembourg Gardens was near the top of my must do list in Paris, but no amount of research could prepare me for the enjoyment I felt when I visited. I was there on a sunny Sunday in June, getting a taste of living like a local. I sat and listened to the band playing in the rotunda, marvelled at the gardens and the magnificent Palace, watched the local children sailing remote controlled boats on the lake and that just scratched the surface. This is absolutely a must do in Paris !!!.

The Garden of Gardens. This is by far, my favorite place to relax in all of Paris! The gardens are massive, the trees and flowers beautiful! One can only fall in love with the "green chairs" as you drag them around to your favorite place to sit -- people watch, picnic, relax, read, listen to music -- One Beautiful Park!
PARIS AT ITS BEST!. Beautiful gardens in the rive gauche part of Paris. Great for jogging and also for relaxation. Very well kept and wonderful for a Sunday afternoon walk!

Lovely place. Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful place. I feel that so many people see all of the touristy areas in Paris and miss the real Paris. I loved the time that I spent in Luxembourg Gardens. I was there in June and the flowers were in full bloom, but I think it would be beautiful during all of the seasons...
As a park should be. I love this park, whether for jogging or for hanging around and reading somewhere. Whenever we're in Paris we go there.

Relax and spend an hour. Nice place to relax from the site-seeing. Near the Pantheon, other museums. Great people-watching. Under the trees, there's a small café - grab a drink and enjoy some down time.

Great place to stroll. Walk around and take in the lovely Paris afternoon. At the pond you may see the young sailing hobby rental boats, 3 ft tall boats.
Lots of chairs and shady areas to sit.

A Trip Back In Time. Today I took my daughter to the puppet show in the Luxembourg Gardens. She is a bit old for it but I wanted to go anyway because one of my very favorite photographs is the Alfred Eisenstaedt's faces of the French children as they are watching the puppet show in what I believe to be the very same venue. The current show did not disappoint as the joy and excitement was the same in their faces today as it was more than 50 years ago. The park itself is also lost in time with the wonderful playground, beautiful flowers and real toy sailboats that are operated by wind, not remote control. If you are coming to Paris with children, you should not miss The Luxembourg Gardens.

A beautiful stroll. The gardens are beautiful. We went late in the afternoon, so unfortunately the children's playground was due to close (the playground is fenced and you need to pay a fee to attend). It was lovely to just stroll around and give the kids an opportunity to run off some energy though. There were plenty of recreational activities happening, such as tennis and bocce etc. The gardens are a good option if you are looking for a location to go for a jog or a workout.
