Ignorant tourists!. A beautiful park amid the hustle and bustle of Paris. People watching at its best. We rode bikes right through the middle - unaware that we were violating a park rule. An official stopped us and ever so gently let us know that we were not complying with park rules. We dismounted and pushed our bikes the rest of the way. Despite our ignorance, we thoroughly enjoyed the park and surroundings!
Playing with the little boats. Must visit place for my family, as we love playing with the boats or just relaxing in one of the benches.
Nice place to relax and people watch. Pretty Landscaping around the grounds. Nice place to have a coffee and relax for a bit away from traffic and normal city sounds.
Beautiful. Gorgeous and free. Take a picnic or just wander through for some quite time. Close to the Parthenon if you want to link up activities.

Peace and tranquility in the centre of the city. Saturday morning (or just about any morning for that matter) and Paris is the place for people watching. In the Jardins Du Luxembourg you can sit and watch people jogging, painting, practising martial arts and simply enjoying the air in the arms of a loved one.

Sail boats in the fountain!. Great place to relax and kick back between touristy sites and museums. Only one area (south edge) allows lying or playing grass, but numerous benches and chairs.If you have kids, don't miss sailing boats in the large central fountain (can be rented for 3.5euro / half hour). Kids love it and wonderful for pictures.
Jus if you have good shoes. Very nice garden and also a tivoli, but the area is huge and you have to walk a lot - but it's worth it.

A Lovely Park. It's a lovely park, if you have extra time to spend walking around.
We had our last day in Paris & decided to walk around town, the park was close to our hotel (we stayed in St Germain area) so we walked there.

One of Paris# wonderful green oasis. This park offers both: activities and zones of tranquility. You can play tennis, basketball and more and also find tranquil spots to sit and relax. I recommend you to bring some delicious food and have a picnic and spend some time in this beautiful garden.

pretty gardens. the perfect place to take an afternoon stroll.we visited when the weather was boiling hot so appreciated the shaded areas to be able to sit. there was loads going on; pony rides, live music from an orchestra, people playing bowls. the big fountain was beautiful. a nice place to visit to take a time out from the big tourist hotspots.

Never tire of visiting the Luxembourg Gardens!. We have a print of the Luxembourg Gardens and enjoy each day remembering this lovely place. Just returned again, sat quietly under the trees, and found the Medici Fountain for the first time. Watched a bride and groom being photographed. Later we walked all around the gardens on a quiet evening. A great spot both for people watching and for contemplation. Easily reached by the many buses and the RER and metro lines that arrive there. Plenty of cafes and restaurants around the area too, and a band stand, where different musicians play, from time to time. A good place to go to sit quietly.

Beautiful historic gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are definitely worth a visit, particularly on a sunny day. We visited on a Sunday and enjoyed the local band entertaining in the bandstand, the play areas, floral displays and backdrop of the government buildings are all picturesque. It's within walking distance of Saint Suplice and if you like parks and gardens or are looking fro space to let the kids run around it's definitely worth a visit.
Spectacular Gardens. Wow. a slice of Paris life on a Sunday morning. sail boats on the lake and beautiful landscaping. spectacular in the middle of the city.

Lovely for a break with the kids. Look for the little walled garden to the side of the chess boards, near the tennis courts, very close to the palace. There little ones can crawl around on "kid-friendly" grass.
A garden for break!!!. Beautiful Park or Garden, where you can take a break after visiting surroundings. There are a lot of residents having their lunch or going for a break.

The Most Serene and Beautiful Gardens. This garden has some of the most vibrant flowers and such well maintained shrubs. You can find tourists and locals alike strolling throughout the garden, reading a book on one of the benches or children playing with sailboats in the pond. If you are a photographer, you will enjoy taking plenty of shots. I was able to easily navigate to the garden via the metro. Tip: set your destination in Google Maps before you depart from an area with wifi and your phone will guide you there without wifi

A must see.. Recently I made my third trip to Paris and whilst there visited the Luxembourg Gardens for the first time. I was really impressed with this marvellous place. It is well worth a visit and I now consider it a must see when in Paris. There are cafes to grab a coffee and people watch, lovely lawns and thousands of easy chairs to relax on, a big pond with remote control sail boats, and it's not far from the big shopping centre Bon Marche which boasts the BEST food hall (Grand Epicirie) in which to buy your lunch.
Wow!!. These gardens are just stunning. There is a small pond/fountain where children can also "race" toy boats one for different countries around the world! Look we found New Zealand!
Must do. A beautiful oasis in the middle of busy Paris. I recommend taking a picnic. Thee are tonnes of chairs available and the park is very clean.

A Parisian Jewel. Originally constructed to remind Marie de' Medici of the gardend she knew from her childhood in native Florence, it was modified by Napoleon III as part of he sweeping reconstruction of Paris during the mid to late 19th century. The park still retains some of it's original charm and is an oasis in the midst of Paris, quite different from many other parks (Parc des Buttes-Chaumont is another of these oasis spots) in Paris. It is fantastic place to go and sit for an hour or two in the middle of the day and just relax. Worth visiting.
Luxembourg is Lovely. great place to relax and enjoy people watching and the beautiful area. Don't miss the children sailing boats in the lake.

Maybe I'm just jaded after seeing so many other amazing things in Paris. Everything I read prior to coming here raved about the beauty. In person they were nice and if you are in the area you should make a point of seeing them, but I wouldn't head for the gardens unless I was already in the area. If you want amazing gardens head to Versailles instead. The pay off is well worth it.
Delightful. A perfect place to relax after long Parisian walks. Stunning and relaxing. Bring a picnic or a book with you! Highly recommended.
Relaxing. A nice huge garden in the city. Great place to unwind and relax after a tiring day of sightseeing. Ideal for a picnic with friends and family.

Great park, and used well. We walked up from the south side, from Port Royal station, so we could take in all of the park. It was stunning and a lovely relief to the hustle and bustle of city life. Although we went on a weekday there were lots of people in the park, from the joggers to parents/kids and painters.
If you like gardens, you will like this. beautiful gardens and a lovely relaxed atmosphere. Enjoy a walk, watch the keep fitters enjoy their jog, etc.

Hidden Gem. Luxembourg gardens are very well hidden on the Boulevard St Michel in Paris. However, if you are walking in that neighbourhood, or looking for a great place to take a break from the hectic center of Paris, it is the place to go! Not only is it peaceful and relaxing, the gardens and Luxembourg palace are BEAUTIFUL! We went there for a picnic in the evening, and we found it so calm. Great place to go and visit, and worth a detour!

Morning runs....yes please!. I am a runner and found the locals running each morning. I did not have to give up my daily run while I was on vacation as this garden did not disappoint and was only 2 blocks from my hotel.

Simply divine!. Visited on a late Saturday afternoon when the residents of Paris take to the park to amble along the neat pathways. Chairs are generously provided at the fountains and throughout the gardens where one can rest and reflect on the beauty all around, or perhaps to read a book under the trees, or enjoy a glace....and so much more...

My happy place. This is my favorite place on the planet, this is not hyperbole. I love the Jardin du Luxembourg. It's where my mind goes when I think of Paris. I love sitting in this garden, people watching, reading a book, taking a nap, meditating, having lunch, having a picnic with a group or by myself. Even during busy times, I've always found a place to sit, be it on one of the benches outside of the center or on the grass with the kids. There is a little stand where you can buy small snack as well. They have excellent pistachio ice cream, perfect for a warm summer day.

Gem in the middle of Paris. I couldn't think of another place I want to be on Sunday morning if I am in Paris. Just grab a chair, put your feet up, enjoy the sun and marvel of the beauty surrounding you

A place to relax and unwind. We had a lovely afternoon in this little haven in the middle of Paris.. Took a picnic and found little corner, there's loads of chairs scattered around so no problem with seating. It's a nice place to wander around we watched a game of boules.. There's tennis courts / basketball and football.. Kids playground.
amazing and relacing place. the place is very lovely and relaxing,it is perfect for having good time and a have a lot of photos too :)there is lake inside the garden also and an old castle
A bit of a disappointment . I was really looking forward to the gardens after reading Victor Hugo for years, but it's a bit of a let down. Not very green, dusty...where's the lush??

Beautiful park, great for kids!. This park is an oasis in the chaos of Paris. It is so beautifully kept, the gardens are manicured to perfection. This park has a huge park area for kids, a puppet theatre, sand pit, insect garden and then there's the beautiful buildings and horticulture for the grown ups - a must when in town,
Uncrouded and pleasant. Watching the children and their boats was fine fun. There was a youth music session as well. All made for a relaxing afternoon.
Beautiful. Lovely place in Paris to get away from the hustle and bustle, sit back, read a book and take in the atmosphere. Loved spending time here!

Lovely Place To Relax. When the weather is good as it was when I was here this park is a great place to spend some time. It seems to be a place where a lot of locals go so you know you're onto a good thing.

Great way to spend a few hours. We wandered into the gardens in the late morning and stayed for about three hours. This garden is very large and beautiful with fountains, walking paths, and sitting areas. We rented a sailboat from a vendor and sailed it around one of the fountains for a half hour. We then had ice cream while we sat in the shade and watched the world go by. It was a great way to spend time in Paris.

Stunning park, but a bit out of the way.. I love having picnics in this park, but I find it to be out of the way and too long of a walk to get picnic-replenishments when running low on food, fruit and wine.

A Place for Everyone. Our family stumbled upon Luxembourg Gardens by chance when we were looking for a place to have a picnic and enjoy our macarons from Dalloyau which is just across the street. There was a group of students doing a very nice choral presentation in the Gardens and we sat nearby to listen. When we wandered through Luxembourg gardens we discovered that it was a place for people of all ages, especially families. You could rent little wooden sailboats with flags from different countries for a few euros and watch them sail across a pool, racing with sailboats from other countries. The children that we watched loved it! There was also a carousal, a playground for very little ones and not so little ones, a tennis court, a basketball court, pony rides, a small pear/apple orchard, and a kiosk for ice cream, crepes and sandwiches. There were many private little places where people of all ages were relaxing and reading a book or visiting with friends. The Garden is huge so you could get a good walk in if you went from one end to the other. Beautiful trees provided shade and a feeling of nature in the middle of Paris. Washrooms were available for 1/2 a euro. If you and your family are looking for a place to take a break from touring for an afternoon, I would highly recommend Luxembourg Gardens. It is a place to relax and enjoy Paris in a whole different way.
Not bad not great. Good sightseeing, in the Summer, especially. Not a lot to do though. Not sure it's still possible (as it was 10y ago) to lay on the grass... Too bad.

Some Grass in Paris!. What the French call gardens in Paris we found to be more like dirt paths with benches and maybe a small pond or two. However Luxembourg Garden was a wonderful respite in the city. Grassy areas and benches and flowers and trees were beautiful and the conservatory with 600 types of trees quite impressive. There were also areas for kids to play and also some of the oldest beehives in Paris.

What a beautiful garden.. It was beautiful and colorful with all the flowers in bloom, with the fountain. It was a nice place to relax take a break, after walking for a length of time. You could even get a bite to eat if you wanted too.

Relaxing and Beautiful. With the palace in the background and all the flowers, trees, shrubbery...it was it was a great place to hang out for a little while on a hot afternoon. We grabbed a cold beverage and sat in the shade by the pond as the children floated and guided their play sailboats. Great people watching!

The garden is lovely. Eat at the cafe and enjoy the views and the shade.. We walked through coming from the catacombs back to St. Germaine. Entering from the south is great because you see the beautiful fountain and then the palace is in the background. Walk along the east side, and as you near the palace you get views of the Eiffel Tower across the garden. There is a great outdoor cafe with shade and good food. It was a lovely spot to have lunch, and there were good restrooms with a small fee.
Green everywhere . Beautiful place to go for in the afternoon, have a picnic and chill with friends. A quiet garden to walk around or go jogging

Relaxing Parisian fun. Kids enjoyed this for a relaxing bit of fun and we loved how all the boats had different countries flags on them so of course we had to get an Australian boat. Boat hire is 30 min

Great place to relax. Went to Luxembourg Gardens on a warm day in the middle of July. The gardens are extremely beautiful and it was very relaxing to sit down in the shade. The atmosphere was fun, people were playing tennis and having pick-nicks. Recommend going there if you are in Paris and looking for a escape from the city!
wooooooooooooooow. Absolutely amazing. The fountains, the food (Nutella Crepe), were perfect, there are horse carriages, its packed with people but very quiet, a destressers heaven

Pretty park but don't lay on the grass. Luxembourg Garden is a small, pretty park with lots of chairs for a good reason: you're not supposed to sit/lay on the grass as 2 park officials told me. There is one exception, a fairly large spot where we saw mainly school aged kids. There are lots of trees and some interesting statues.Paris doesn't have lots of parks so this is a nice place to escape the heat and have a picnic.

A great combination of French Sensibility with a Touch of English. The Luxembourg gardens are wonderful. They are majestic and combine the structured style of French gardens with some areas that resemble the more organic English style. This combination makes for a beautiful walk and a great spot to have a picnic.
Joggers paradise. Joggers love the Jardins and so does everybody else. There are benches, restaurants and wonderful views of the French Senate and people walking everywhere.
A Latin Quarter Gem. Great park. Many interesting things for kids to enjoy. Nice place to walk or jog through too. Many plants in bloom, fountains and ponds. Close to the Pantheon too.
an oasis in the middle of Paris. being close by to our hotel it was agreat place to visit and relax in the sunshine. The gardens are beautiful are beautful as is the mansion..

Relax, unwind, slow down. Visiting Paris with a young child can be exhausting. We went to the gardens on our last day in Paris to slow the pace down and give ourselves a break from sightseeing. It turned out to be a great afternoon. Even if the sun was glaring a lot of kids were enjoying pushing the miniature sailboats by the fountain. The cafeteria was great especially when the band/orchestra starting playing at the nearby gazebo. Bliss! The perfect soundtrack for an al fresco afternoon.
Nice Green Space. Lovely area that was the 1st garden we visited in a charming neighborhood.In the summertime all of the roses were in bloom & very beautiful.
Absolutely stunning!. The gardens of Luxembourg are definitely a must -see when in Paris. The palace is magnificent and the gardens are so bright and beautiful.
Bring some food and a mat. This is a lovely place to go to in the summer. Make sure to bring some food and a mat to lie on. They do not sell much food in the gardens so stock up before hand!
A lovely way to spend an afternoon . Take a walk through the park, stop at the cafe for a coffee or a glass of wine. Sit around the fountain. It's a great way to spend an afternoon.

Summer heat retreat. A lovely place to wander and rest on a hot afternoon. Beautiful architecture of the palais to admire, lovely preached plane trees, ice creams to buy if desired, and even some tennis courts for the more energetic.
Relaxing Park. It is very nice, big, and relaxing. It is very nice to walk through, and also nice to sit on grass and enjoy.

Beautiful garden. We enjoyed the beautiful garden where children can sail tiny boats by placing them in the small pond in the centre court. The flowers were in full bloom and had statues and a beautiful tree lined path. There is pony rides available and a tennis court there also

Don't miss this. The gardens are beautiful and one of the few spots in Paris that you can stroll around with peace and quiet. You will see many statues, flowers,and beautiful buildings. Many locals come here for lunch and refresh for the rest of their day.
It's a little place you don't want to miss and recharge yourself.

Pretty and a nice place to cool down. If you've been exploring Paris and want a less hectic experience than the many tourist attractions the jardins are lovely to stroll through and also if you head to the super market and bakery its very easy to make a little picnic and make yourself feel like a true parisian

Terrific . I went there after visit the Pantheon and it was a wonderful discover...
I didn't know how big was that place and how beautiful could be...
Nice to walk, to talk, to rest, anyway, to have a great time!
So, don't miss it!!!!
Amazingly beautiful. BEAUTIFUL do not miss. Lots of good gelato in the area. The kids had a blast here and the gardens were just spectacular
Garden Paradise. Amazing gardens with the Luxembourg palace as context. Most amazing peaceful and tranquil gardens maintained meticulously by the parks and gardens staff. A must to visit.

No need to book a tour. We walked around in the afternoon. I travel a lot, and have visited many beautiful gardens. Although it was a nice place to relax, the garden itself was just okay. The same annuals planted around the small boat lake. If you just want a nice picnic stop, go. If you have a short time, this is something I'd skip.
Hand in Hand. Beautiful walk. We walk through these gardens in the heat of the day and still had a wonderful experience!

A breath of fresh air in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Beautiful garden with band stand and shaded areas and a chance to sail your boat or enjoy Guignol with the children or just stroll and enjoy the beautiful planting. Very French.
Mum and two teenagers!. Relaxing and beautiful. Real Paris life. Children playing with boats on the lake, ice-cream and pretty gardens. It's a must!
A relax place for the family. we all enjoy spending few hours at these beautiful gardens. Relaxing from the long walks of the day!
LOVELY. It is a wonderful place to enjoy Parisian life. I went on a beautiful day and relaxed after many busy days of travel. There are many places to sit and it is in a beautiful area.

We love this place!. We returned to this park on our second family visit to France as it was a highlight on our first trip.The kids (and I) loved the sailboats in the pond. It seemed to open at 11am the day we were there (it was a Monday but school was not yet over for the year). It was so much fun to watch and help the kids push and chase their sailboats around.Almost as much fun for the kids was the playground area which only costs a few euros per child. That zipline kept them entertained for hours.The marionette theatre was not operating at the time of our recent visit, but it was a lot of fun on our first visit.We enjoyed a wonderful lunch at the restaurant in the park, the Pavillon de la Fontaine Paris.We also made sure to visit the mini Statue of Liberty before we left the park.

Picture perfect. Took the metro to the station for Notre Dame then walked back towards Luxembourg Gardens. Along the way bought a bottle of GH Mumm and cheese and biscuits. Commandeered a couple of park seats and had dinner while watching everyone unwind after a hot day. Be sure to pack cork screw and glasses. You can buy but we always had one at the bottom of my bag after been caught without

Great place to spend a day!. Wonderful garden in the heart of Paris. Something for everyone, but if you have children, the entire playground area for them is shaded, perfect for getting away from the hot heat of Paris in the summer.
Spacious!. Massive area with lots of space to accommadate tourists. Sadly we went in winter so the grass was not green and there were no flowers. Neatly kept and clean.

An oasis in a densly packed part of the city. After unpacking our bags in our lovely left bank hotel we made a beeline here and were delighted to find a lovely place populated by locals enjoying themselves. I wish it had been cooler (we were there during an incredible heat wave) and that we had planned a picnic for our visit.

Spend the day or just an hour.. The heart of Paris, on a Sunday it is alive with locals as well as tourists. There is a lake for sailing a model boat (rental) and various playgrounds. On the weekends there is a puppet show - good fun and not expensive - but check the times. Beautiful place for lovers and families alike.

Wonderful mid-town greenery with plenty of fun for the kids. Being bathed in greeery in mid-town Paris, but also in memories of Queen Marie de Medicis who had the place laid out, after the assocination of her husband, King Henri IV, to remind of her of the Boboli Gardens in her hometown Florence.

Beautiful. My daughter stumbled across the gardens while walking round the local area on arrival to our hotel. They were very beautiful & had lovely little place were you could stop for a drink/snack or ice cream. It was very relaxing & lovely to watch the people around
for the whole family. we all enjoy spending few hours at these beautiful gardens.. with many attractions for the whole family!

Nice location. This is a nice venue in down town Paris. Nice open spaces, lovely gardens, quite relaxing. When a group of us visited there were 1,000's in the park. There was one toilet open (well the only one that appeared to be open), with a queue about 20 persons (may be longer), long. The server at the ice cream stall was coughing quite strongly whilst she server ice cream to customers. Not a good experience, try elsewhere.
Perfect picnic spot. A great park to bring some bread, cheese and wine and watch humanity pass in front of your eyes. Pick a bench in the shade and enjoy what Paris is all about.
Amazing. Loved it!!! Too bad it has to close super early :( But big, nice to read a book or sit with friends.
In the Garden!. I knew it would be a great experience going to the Garden and it did not disappoint. So nice to be able to do something free and enjoy it so much!

Disappointed. Took the grandchildren on a recent trip to Paris for a special treat. Went twice hoping for pony ride, no ponies, marionettes not there, however did enjoy sailing mini boats on the lake. The gardens are lovely and enjoyed watching little children playing but would have liked to purchase a coffee and and ice cream for the girls, however they also were closed. Check before you go

another must see in Paris. If there is one garden you would like to pick and go while visiting Paris, it should be the Luxembourg Gardens in the St Germain de Pres- 6th district. Quite a popular place for many people just to stroll the grounds and enjoy the colorful flowers they change for every season. If you have kids, make sure you go over to the Octagon Pond in the middle of the gardens and locate the "Location de Voiliers" (Sailboat Rentals) to rent toy sail boats for the children to sail in the Octagon Pond. They will enjoy this experience of sailing a toy sail boat with a stick to guide their boat in the pond. The wind acts as a motor for the boats to sail. They rent them for 1/2 hour at 3.50 euros and 1 hr for 7 euros. I always manage to come back to visit the Luxembourg Gardens during my visits to Paris as each year and season, the flower arrangements change. The vivid colors of the flowers along with the bright sunshine and long summer days make the Luxembourg Gardens such a nice place to visit while in Paris.

Lovely gardens, beautiful flowers, relaxing. An oasis amid the bustling Boulevard Michel/ Sorbonne area, with elegant gardens, and colourful flowers. Good place to relax under the trees after walking round.

Large and Delightful. We've visited in both winter and summer; either way, the Luxembourg Gardens is a delight! Stroll the grounds, sit and read a book, or people watch; whatever you choose, it's a pleasure to visit here.
Excellent Place. Do enjoy the flowers and the senate building.The fountains and gardens are lovely. Lots of walking and things to see.

Amazing garden for relaxing. After roaming the city in the evening we went to the gardens to relax, it was nice to relax there and the climate was so pleasant. If you can spend more time in the gardens it will be very nice. Going for a gentle walk around the gardens may make you to feel how big the garden is and how lovely it is!!!! Make sure when you plan for the garden visit the climate should not be hot

Little gem in the heart of Paris. Looking to sit and relax and get away from the buzz of Paris this is a great place to chill as you sit next to the pond and unwind. Many bring a picnic basket and some wine.

Lovely gardens (with ponies!). We very much enjoy strolling through the Luxembourg Gardens, sitting and listening to the music on a warm evening. It is an oasis in the midst of Paris--beautiful flowers, chairs thoughtfully placed (and moveable), and ponies!

Tranquility in the heart of Paris. Such a lovely place to visit. Quiet and tranquil. But, when I think of a garden I think of something small. This place is massive. There was even a small area just for children with a small pool and sand boxes. A real joy to visit.

A nice way to spend an afternoon with kids in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens provide a nice little diversion for families. We took our daughter here for an afternoon. She had fun and the gardens were nice. Be aware that the activities for children aren't all free -- there were fees for the little sail boats and the park. We didn't make it in time for the puppet show, so I'm not sure if there is a fee for that. It wasn't expensive, but make sure you have a few Euros on you when you go.
Place to relax. Decided to walk all over Paris. So Jardin de Luxemburg was very nice place to rest. Can buy some ice cream, coffee or snacks.

amazing haven right in the middle of bustling Paris. Went with our 4 year old and we seemed to be happy the instant we went in. Lush greenery and lovely walking paths. My daughter couldn't get enough of her sailboat and did not want to leave. We enjoyed our little picnic of wine and cheese on the chairs outside the lake. Did not get into the palace as we seemed to enjoy just the calmness and greenery around.

Nice place to walk and chill, but skip if time is lacking. Both locals and tourists like to chill aimlessly in this skillfully maintained garden. Overall, the garden is pretty but it can be skipped if you are running out of time to see the countless other beautiful attractions of the city.

Luxembourg Gardens an absolute must. Love Love Love this place. My favorite gardens in Paris.You can sail the little push boats (Cheap) Get some lunchGet a chair and enjoy the view Absolutely the best people watching !One of the Highlights of out trip. Go there and dont be in a rush.

Large Garden Area. Lots of visitors...could enjoy a picnic or just a sit down if it's not hot and you can find some shade...had a ($12) glass of Persecco and wondered off to have a wonderful meal and bevs at Tennessee Restaurant on St. Germaine!! ENJOY!

Beautiful gardens around the Palais de Luxemboug. for a peaceful afternoon after visiting the nearby Musèe D'orsay watching the Impressionis painters, go to these gardens. They are simply beautiful. Watch the children putting their sailboats on the big pool. Just enjoy the flavor of Paris !
Elegance of a Bygone Era.. This park captures the elegance of Paris from another era before WWII. There are hidden corners with elegant fountains that looked the same as they did 100 years ago. .

Boring. Just an old park. There were soda vendors and such. I did get a wonderful little coffee. I'm starting to like the espresso-like coffee that they call "American coffee". Pond, gravel, dirty grass. But pretty trees.

A oasis of beauty in the middle of the city. breathtaking gardens and architecture and so relaxing to see people sitting out on the grass with picnics and playing with their children, young couples holding hands, etc. there is a sign that is posted that says " sitting on the grass IS permitted" how refreshing
Lovely .... Like that it was a very nice place to visit, have lunch and relax -- I loved the mini Statute of Liberty and the memorial to 9/11.

Much prettier than Versailles. Loved the gardens much more than Versailles. It is beautifully kept with lots of flowers, statues and fountains. There are lots of chairs to sit on. Buy sandwiches from shops like Paul and make a lunch picnic here.

Beautiful green space in a bustling city. These would have to be some of the most beautiful gardens in a city Centre. There are designated areas where you can sit on the lawns, but beware of the guards with whistles if you stray onto another area, they will March you off, which we saw many times, then once they move on, the people are back on the lawns, a lot of fun to watch.

Relaxing visit. A great place to sit, relax and enjoy the day. Take a picnic. Sit by the boat pond and watch the children playing with the sailboats while you lie in the sun relaxing. Wander around the gardens and enjoy the scenery.
Relaxing!. The ground keepers do a wonderful job at keeping the gardens clean, and providing excellent places to picnic and relax.
Peaceful and beautiful. Although full, these gardens didn't seem busy. There are lots of quiet spots and a special area where children can play on the grass.

A peaceful haven in Paris. We have been several times and still would go again. This park is so peaceful in the hustle and bustLe of Paris. The large lake in the centre is great for watching young and old sail their boats.The little cafe very busy but good service.
An amazing garden. A magical experience for any traveller. Highly recommended as a must-see and must-walk when in Paris. Pack a picnic to make it extra special!
Pretty respite. Loved the little boats on the pond and the kids playing with them. Loved sitting at a cafe watching people go by while enjoying a drink.

Great parc and Palais in amazing setting!. Great parc and Palais in amazing setting!The Jardin Luxembourg offers a lot. Cafe, play area, small pool for kids, fountains etc etc.Nice landscaped area to walk and lie and relax in the busy capitol!

Best park we found. Only garden with flowers and no one selling you anything. Peaceful and working fountains. Bee farm and Apple farm are nice to see. Little crowd and excellent place to pick up sandwich on rue Seine and walkabout

A stroll in the Latin Quarter. On our first day in Paris, we walked in the area of our hotel in the Latin Quarter, which was very conveniently located in the 5th arrondissement. We found ourselves in the early evening in the 6th arrondissement, in the Luxembourg Gardens. Parisians were enjoying themselves in this oasis sitting on the park benches, taking a walk, enjoying the cool evening air. I would have gladly spent more time visiting its expanse and plan to do so on another visit.

Beautiful gardens, but you can't sit on the grass. Really enjoyed walking through the gardens, but really wanted to sit on the grass and soak up the atmosphere. Instead, we were restricted to limited numbers of lawn chairs and benches and people were reprimanded for being on the grass.
A place to relax. Visit these gardens and try to seat and take some time to enjoy the place or walk around eat an ice cream.

The best park in a city of great parks. We went to many parks throughout Paris, and enjoyed them all, but this was the nicest. Very large, with walking/running paths, beautiful buildings, a large pond with many chair around it, and just an overall great place to have a picnic or dessert.
Very beautiful and big gardens!!!. Very beautiful!!! Big gardens and very space for walking and ride. Perfect place to take pictures! I saw many people doing physical activities.

Beautiful. We stumbled upon the gardens while wandering. Beautiful and tranquil setting. So much going on. From watching the people to enjoying the shade next to the fountains to exploring the many statues.

Lovely gardens in the center of Paris... Lovely gardens in the center of Paris...Beautiful all around, lots of place to sit, also very nearby to Musee de Louvre, lots of things to do around for the kids...Amazing place overall
Beautiful. Always love visiting to take in the flavours of life and to watch life go by in the shade of Lime and London Plane trees. Peaceful.

Lovely to wander around, great for people watching. The grounds are lovely and I have taken away some ideas to try at home from the layout of the flower beds.There are so many different types of activities going on- children's playground, sailing miniature boats on the pond, boules, artists painting, dog walking, exercise and tai chi classes ....The area with the many different types of espaliered apples and other fruit trees was very interesting. A good place to visit for a change of pace.

Such a lovely place. Take a picnic or just grab a baguette on the way and immerse yourself in the place. Hire a pond yacht (3 euros for half an hour) or just sit on one of the chairs scattered around.

What a Lovely Way to Spend a wearm evening. We entered the garden after having visited the Saint Suplice church, very famous historical church noted for its organ filling the vast space with Romantic organ music.This is a place where people meet to play games including chess. Gardens are kept in wonderful condition and I enclose some pictures to give you some idea of why it is worth visiting.People were having picnics, talking together, playing music. The conditions could not have been better and we just enjoyed ourselves There is a lake in the middle to cool off from the heat so well done the designer for making a peaceful oasis within a busy city.------------------Check my other reviews of Paris for hints and tips. Hover over my photo to the left of this page and click forward on 'reviews'. Look for the tranche of reviews July 2015.
Lovely park. It his is a beautiful park, great for people watching and getting a sense of la vie Parisienne. It's an oasis in the middle of a bustling city that's brat for relaxing.
Bring a book, read, relax, and just be!. Best way to end a day sightseeing around Paris, find a chair (or two, the other to put your feet up) and relax in this lovely garden.
Wow. These gardens are very beautiful and well-worth a walk. It's a great place for a picnic! I wish that the park allowed sitting on the grass.

A poor version of better parks.. Depends on how you like your parks, but personally I don't think it has the grandeur of Versaille or even Tuilieres and ends up joing being a little lifeless with it's straight paths and lack of grass.
Have a lunch here. It is calm and relaxing place, you have nice view, there is nice park. Perfect place to have lunch or breakfast.

Delightful Parisian Park. One delight in coming to Paris is visiting the large parks. They have wonderful landscapes and, to a large degree, are used at vast living rooms for the city’s residents. The parks just feel different from ones in North America.The Luxembourg Jardins are the largest of those parks. The Luxembourg Palace, by the way, was the home of Catherine Di Medici, and now houses the French Senat.We visited the park twice on summer evenings in June and July. The park isn’t fancy in the sense of elaborate flower gardens, but is well laid out with walkways; fountains; and areas to sit, talk, and play. The manner in which trees have been trimmed is pleasing and reminiscent of countless paintings.This park is certainly worth a walk if you are in the neighborhood and is a very civilized outdoor gathering area in a city known for its refinement. Pull up a chair and have a nice evening with friends.
One of the most beautiful gardens in France. One of the highlights of my visit. The park is huge and have many interesting statues. There is a model of the statue of liberty in the gardens.
Best Garden in Paris. Beautiful! Feels like you're at an island oasis. The surrounding area is nice too. Only other garden I think measured up to it was Versailles.

Nice but if you are short on time skip it. Nice park but not that spectacular. It has a lot of unpaved walkways which is a bad deal if you have asthma or an asthmatic child. The park is nice and large but nothing special. Our local botanical garden has so much more flowers and is just as nice if not more beautiful. As such if you are short on time, this one you can skip.

A break from city life. This is a beautiful garden in the heart of Paris. Here you cannot sit or walk on the grass, but there are hundreds of chairs to sit on. In the south part of the park there is an area where sitting on the grass is allowed. The meridian markers (The rose line from the Da Vinci Code film) runs through the park. You can find one of the markers just inside the park to the south if you enter on the left side of the gate. There are sailing boats in the pond. Don`t forget to visit the Fontaine Médicis in the north eastern corner of the park, it is a real piece of art
Green lung in Paris. What a fantastic park to visit while in Paris, we often spent the afternoon just soaking up the Parisian atmosphere. great gardens, good coffee and crepes.

Sunday in the Park with .... I love to people watch, and this place has enough of that! It was a nice respite from our walking morning. I love the chairs you can just relocate and use. The path were sandy, which stirred up quite some dust, but I really enjoy this park. I may be strange. There are some interesting sculptures, and a wee pond for sailing tiny boats. How relaxing is that?

Perfectly manicured garden. Perfect for a picnic on a warm day, or a run through in any weather. The Luxembourg Gardens have a very grand luxurious feel. It's clean compared to some of the other gardens in Paris, a lovely space!

Pleasant break. This is a great area to visit and eat a sandwich or just chill out from the rat race. But be warned those of you who think that grass in parks is to lie on.......not here. Just to look at unfortunately. Find a bench or chair like all the well trained Parisians.

Beautiful. I visited the gardens on my first trip to Paris in 2012. I was walking with my partner and we just stumbles on it. I was so impressed, I insisted we go again on this trip. It was definitely worth it.
Photos/TaiChi/LittleBoats/Music. A place to sit and watch Paris go by. No matter how packed Paris is, there is always breathing room here.
Good place to relax. It's a good place to Judy seat and enjoy your environment. You will see people sunbathing, sleeping, hanging out, and generally just relaxing. Very cool place.

Seen greener nicer gardens. Nice but not very well groomed. You're not allowed to sit on the grass, except for a small part of the garden, which is of course packed. Outdoor concerts are a frequent occasion.

A retreat from the noise!. Gorgeous gardens that are perfect for a stroll or even a picnic in one of the secluded areas. Take the time to go here and relax a bit before heading back into the busy streets of Paris.

Beautiful park. The most beautiful park we went to in Paris. The boat rental in the large central fountain is also kind of neat. It's great place to bring lunch and relax for an hour away from the busy streets of Paris.

A restful garden in a busy city. We walked down to the gardens on a very warm July day. Under the shady trees the air was cool and the scene very relaxing. Watching people sail mini yachts on the pond was a delight. Beautiful flower beds.

A pleasant 2+ hours strolling. A extremely pleasant walk through here while in Paris, highly recommend this for the statues, trees and plants as well as the apiary site and impromptu art exhibitions. Great are to relax with the chairs provided everywhere...good for kids with the playground, small horse rides .....Even in the heat wave crossing Europe while we were there, tree groves provide shade enough
Beautiful grounds, lovely to sit and watch the world go by.. Buy a coffee and go and sit in the gardens, there are so many people walking around, exercising , lovely space particularlyon a sunny day.
Wonderful for a break from the chaos of the city. It is a wonderful place, calm and quiet. We brought our lunch and ate there while enjoying the beauty of the gardens, palace and fountain.

Sailboats. Beautiful park..... if you have kids, don't miss the sailboat rental at the large pool and the playground to the west (fabulous zip line)! On your way out, stop at nearby Angelina's (North) for chocolate!

Wine in the Luxembourg Gardens. We walked thru these beautiful gardens. Everyone is strolling, sitting, eating lunch and generally enjoying the beautiful gardens and architecture. We brought some French rosé' wine and found a great spot to sip and enjoy the ambiance! Sante'

Romantic, lovely place to enjoy Paris outdoors.. A beautiful park that houses the Palace that host the French Senate, located in the trendy Latin Quarter. A romantic lovely place to enjoy Paris outdoors, I particularly enjoyed watching the children run a play throughout the park. Many places to sit under the majestic trees and people watch. There is a lovely fountain. A wonderful place to have a romantic picnic with a beautiful woman.
BEST garden in Paris!. BEST garden in Paris! Beautiful! Should be a mandatory stop while in Paris in addition to the traditional "must do's". Go and enjoy!
Go and have a picnic. Great place for a picnic and a good place to get away from the crowds. really enjoy this place would go again for sure

One of the best parks in the world?. This park has it all. History, massive well maintained playgrounds, tennis and basketball courts, merry-go-rounds, sunny spots, shady spots, clean pay bathrooms, eateries. One of the best parks ever and I have just discovered it!
Summary: Go. Pack a picnic basket with some beverages and plan to spend the day.

Must do with children. This is a lovely park, especially if you have children. We took a picnic, and then enjoyed racing the boats on the pond/fountain. It was reasonable fee to hire the boats (less than 10 euro anyway), and the stall holder wasn't aggressive about the time limit. It was lovely to sit in the sun and watch children of all nationalities play together.

The most beautiful park of the left bank. Visiting the Luxembourg is a peaceful walk in a beautiful park that includes the glorious Palace that hosts the French Senate. Located in the Latin Quarter it has a unique youth feeling. A must that most tourists have not (yet) discovered.
Very Tranquil. Absolutely beautiful! I wanted to go back and just relax or have a picnic or tan in the park. It was so relaxing and I would give myself a day there if you have the time!
Gentile Tranquility. Grab food a porter from Gerard Mulot on Rue de a Seine, find a bench in the Gardens and watch the world go buy....no better way to spend an afternoon in Paris.

Lovely gardens. Beautiful gardens and such a great area in the city when the weather is stifling. Comprises of gardens, stately house ( Dudnt have time to explore this), pond with motorised boats, loads and loads of seats to relax in. We came here a couple times when the weather was very warm, as did half of Paris by the looks of things, however there are always seats available. There is also a small cafe where you can buy things like ice cream and snacks. I think it also has donkey rides! Just beautiful.

Gardens in Red this summer!. Always a lovely walk- and the main color theme is changed each year. If you are lucky, you will catch the little sail boat vendor renting boats to sell in the fountain "lake".

A great place to chill and listen to live classical music. We returned to the Luxembourg garden time after time because it represents and ideal park in terms of atmosphere, cleanliness and the scenery.

Sit back, relax and watch Parisians at leisure. Mid July, and Paris is packed. However the Luxemburg Gardens seemed a relative haven of peace and relaxation. The gardens themselves are splendid, but it is just as interesting to watch local Parisians relaxing, whether playing tennis, sailing boats on the ornamental pond (a tradition going back very many years), or just strolling with the family. All in all, a peaceful and relaxing break from the throng of crowds at the major tourist attractions.

Lovely for a short visit. Very nice gardens, with some wonderful statuary. Not something I'd make a special trip to go see, but if you were shopping in the area, or going to a restaurant they are surly worth dropping by to take a break and enjoy the peace. Plenty of Parisiennes are doing that too. It is a popular spot for lunch, or an afternoon break it seems. Peaceful, and large enough to not be crowded
Lovely Place to Visit. Beautiful Gardens. Wished we had more time to walk around. Enjoyed the children sailing their boats on the lake.

Great spot to see!. I was very impressed by the Luxembourg Gardens. It was so beautiful and sprawling and fun to walk around. I do suggest going when the weather is temperate. I visited on a blustery day in March and couldn't enjoy it as much.
Gorgeous gardens!. We wandered through here for an hour or two, absolutely gorgeous. We might have got lost trying to find the road to get back out, but hey. It's beautiful so it was okay.

Glorious way to spend some time. We enjoyed a few lazy hours here by drinking wine at the little cafe under the trees, and then watching the families hire little boats and push them around on the lake infront of Luxembourg Palace. The gardens are beautiful, take a book and sit in the sun like a true Parisian.
Beautiful park. Beautiful and tranquil park. Lovely pond in the middle with little sailboats. Picnic areas on the lawn, and lots of chairs to sit and read.

Pack a Lunch and Fine Some Shade. Stunning gardens, tons of statues and flowers. You'll notice there are some areas you cannot sit and picnic and the security guard will come along and ask everyone to move every few minutes - it's kind of comical. There is a stand selling gelato, crepes, sandwiches but we purchased ours before entering the garden and sat in some of the chairs to watch a view of the palace and the large fountain with boats.Excellent afternoon activity for a quiet day and lovely atmosphere.

Beautiful. Luxembourg gardens are well worth a visut! A metro line goes to right outside the gardens! Even if you want a relaxing few hours in the sun it is the place to go...the views are stunning and there's various activities too...pony rides, basketball and a playground

Memorable visit!. Luxembourg Gardens is so beautiful and quiet that I confessed when I got there I felt very impressed. Nice place to spend the day, without being in a hurry. Just walk, relax, feel the place and enjoy. That's it!
Awesome place to relax!. I went here on a rainy day and the gardens were glistening with fresh water drops. It is a great way to spend some relaxation time in the morning or afternoon.
Beautiful and relaxed!. Must visit on your trip to Paris, esp if travelling with children. Nice place to enjoy and relax on a lazy afternoon

A beautiful walk about. This park is so pretty and there are lots of places to walk, jog, sit, read etc. Lots of chairs beside gorgeous ponds. Each year there seems to be a different theme to the flower colour choices in the annual beds. So, so pretty. There is a small café in the park where you can get coffee and small pastries, I believe. A very peaceful place. There is also a building called the 'orangerie' that has various art exhibitions. Very cool stuff.
Lovely. Walking around and finding statues hidden in the place.... Look for Frederc Chopin......it is a beautiful area

Okay. A lot of people croweded into the one area of grass you are allowed to sit on. We didn't see a sign saying we couldn't sit on a grassy area away from the crowds and were ussered off by a park ranger. Good walk around, but it was far away for us to get to for what we saw.

Nature is really beautiful!. Clean place, wonderful gardens. We took some time walking it through, although our plan was to sit and enjoy breakfast. A sunny day in this park makes you realise how wonderful our planet is.

A great way to spend an afternoon. Beautiful gardens in the middle of Paris...love the cafes and the music in the park. Just pull up a chair a enjoy people-watching til all hours. They have the best macaroons at the cafes, and people are always relaxed and happy. Beautiful fountains, impeccable gardens. Just enjoy

Place to enjoy the day and Paris itself, not the buildings. I've seen better looking gardens. But that's not the point.You can so easily waist your time in Paris, hunting for this landscape or that one. If you'd like to slow down, to feel real Paris, the Gardens are great place just to sit, relax and if you'd like - to watch the people resting or passing.
Beautiful place!. The most amazing sceneries in Paris. You have to visit too the Tuileries. You will love them both. Just relax and enjoy the view. Buy a great dessert and eat it right there.

Nice place to chill and feel paris. Lovely place. The palace and the garden are beautiful, although for me the best part was looking at parisiens--people playing chess, boys playing soccer, others drinking wine. Perfect place if you want to chill in the middle of a tourist frenzy.

Nicest gardens in paris. We stopped here 2 or 3 times during our trip to Paris. In my opinion it is by far the nicest park in Paris. If you go during the day it is common to see children sailing boats In the large lake/ fountain behind the Paris. It is a great place to go and picnic or just relax and take in your surroundings. We also went after dinner one night and watched the sunset from the park. They do close at twilight, I would highly reccamend coming here to spend some time relaxing. They have many chairs that you can sit in scattered through the the park (similar to the tuliries gardens) they have green metal chairs that are regular and A lounger type style.

Nicely kept, lots of chairs!. France always does such a great job of keeping up their gardens. Unfortunately they can't always get there quick enough to pick up trash people leave behind, but by the next day all is well! Incredible grounds and setting. Sunday afternoon in the park is worth it.

lovely gardens..... Lovely park to see, beautiful landscapes and buildings, statues! Definitely worthwhile, pack a lunch and enjoy a little picnic on any of the lawns. Beautiful and very scenic place to be.

Beautiful Gardens!. These gardens are beautiful, and FREE! Worth walking around, particularly if you are visiting nearby sites like the Cluny. The French Senate building is right there as well. Be sure to read the descriptions of French Queens; they are quite interesting. See if you can find Mary, Queen of Scots!
a bit disappointing after hearing rave reviews. Had to change buses and took the longest tine to get there. Was very dirty and overcrowded. Did not see what people had raved about

Relax in this quiet and beautiful space. The formal gardens are well-tended and look great in the summer sun. People seem to slow down here. Everyone respected the place and there were no loud noises from radios or telephones. We happened along when there was a very pleasant free concert. There were lots of chairs of different sizes and the amateur orchestra was very good.
lovely place to relax in busy Paris. This park is lovely. I ate lunch here daily while in Paris for a conference. Lots of chairs and bunches and a nice place to see Parisians at ease.

a great day to do nothing. the gardens are beautiful this time of year with flowers everywhere and people lying on the benches and chairs simply relaxing doing nothing. what a delight to lay in the sun without a care in the world...bring some water it gets hot in the sun
A chance visit. Unbelievably beautiful gardens in the middle of the city!! Free to visit and so clean. A great place to take your kids too!!
Nice lake.. It was just okay for me. Nothing very unusual or spectacular. It is a nice family or hang out park and the lake is quite pretty.

Something for everyone. Beautiful garden with shade trees, flowers, lots of space and seating. There are several attractions for the kids, including a very large fountain where children enjoy racing toy sail boats that are available for rent. There is also a puppet show and play area.

See how Paris relaxes. There isn't any specific thing you come to see at this park, other than the beautifully landscaped grounds and to watch people. On a nice day this place will be covered up with people catching some sun, sharing a picnic lunch, or just taking it easy. Stroll through, or bring a lunch and join them. Walk around and look at the statues of 20 French queens erected in the mid 1800s. Take a picture by the Medici Fountain. Enjoy the afternoon.

Very beautiful Gardens. This is one of the most beautiful gardens to walk around and get the clean beautiful atmospher, Luxembourg Gardens is one of the must seen places to explore and wander around in Paris.

Sail boating on the lake and so much more. We went there on a Sunday and the park was full, but not too full. The children were sailing the rented boats on the lake. Picnics were every where. Just watching people enjoy the day. Great floral displays

The perfect Paris gardens. The Luxembourg gardens are truly great. Lovely flowers, fancy palace, a pool for kids to sail their boats, the Medici fountain, even a marionette show for kids on the weekends. The place wasn't jammed at all when I was there. And it was a setting that you could enjoy the look of or simply sit back and read a book. Don't miss it if you have time. Note that they do charge you to use the bathrooms.

lazy afternoon. lovely gardens, quite hot though , not a lot of shade.public toilets were closed from 12-1300, so make sure your legs are crossed during this time !!Lovely flower beds nicely kept,expensive ice creams .

Could have stayed all day!. Luxembourg Gardens are beautifully kept with comfy chairs sat all around for anyone to use. It's a fantastic place to sit and relax with a book on a nice sunny day. Though there is normally loads of people there it's still very relaxing and peaceful. Definitely work a visit even if it's only a quick one.

Time to relax. We stopped by on a Sunday morning and spent nearly an hour just sitting in the sun and strolling around the gardens. There was a children's choir performing on a stage nearby and was a nice plus. We enjoyed the view of the Palace and the Eiffel Tower in the distance. If you are looking for a respite from the downtown hustle and bustle, this is a good place to start.

Perfect place to wind down and have fun!. Beautiful scenery and the day I went was perfect weather! Its a great spot to sail mini yachts, talk with friends or even sit there and relax by yourself! I know people watching is popular in France and this is a great spot to do it! When I went there was a gay pride parade in the afternoon (coinciding with the US legalisation of gay marriage, not a regular event) which lit the gardens with even more colours. The palace of Luxembourg is also beautiful!
Pleasant get-away. Quiet park in the middle of Paris. If you can find a chair, the most amazing place to sit and read for a quiet moment...

beautiful garden. we stayed in just as a pitstop when visiting a site nearby and it was a lovely place to rest for a picnic. can't sit on the grass which was disappointing but very very pretty and peaceful. worth a short visit in nice weather :)

A sunny afternoon on the grass, watching kids in the distance sailing boats. The garden is large and structured with many different spaces each with monuments to consider and garden areas to relax in, either by view or just taking a seat to check out the view. Its a great place too for a picnic, with the local people treating it a bit like a green 'beach'. Natural growth trees coupled with grand staircases down to a pond and beyond trees carefully clipped into box shapes, making avenues to yet more distant places. It's close to 'luxembourg' metro located on the RER, so if you have checked out of your hotel, drag your luggage over to the Jardin and spend some hours taking it easy before getting back on the RER to Charles de Gaulle airport. Some great photo opportunities if the breeze is right and parents and kids are renting toy sailboats to watch gliding around the pond.
Boats with the kids!. only 3.50 for a boat and a stick. who knew something so simple could be so fun! Kids speaking all kinds of languages running around the circle, giving their boats a push!

I wish they had gardens like this in my city. We came upon this late on a summers evening and the seats were full of young people - students possibly - enjoying the last of the sun. It is a true formal french garden and the emphasis is on the layout and not the plants. It must not be treated as a place to see and tick off the list. Let it work on you and forget the camera - it would not do it justice.

Arguably the best park in Paris......well worth visiting!. I love the parks and gardens of Paris and the Luxembourg Gardens are my favorite. Beautiful buildings & fountains, a pond for children to sail little boats, just a lovely park to visit!

Great place for kids 2-10 to play. The Luxemburg Gardens are a great place for families with young children. Walking through the gardens are free, but the activities will cost a few Euros. There is a fabulous playground with several different areas to play in that cost for adults and children alike (2.5 for Children 1.25 for adults). However, many parents just pay for their children and sit outside to watch them. We chose to go in and sit on a bench inside. It is a fairly large area and not all areas are visible no matter where you are sitting. There are bathrooms and a sink just inside to the right after you pay your fee. My 6 year old loved the zip line and my 4 year old loved the climbing frames of which there are more than one. A dark wooden one is made for older children 5-10ish and then there is a more colorful one for the 2-5 year olds. There was a sandpit that many of the younger children 1-3 we're playing in. It had a little 'castle' that had ropes and baskets on pulley's that the children loved to move up and down. Outside of the playground there were several other activities for kids: including sailing miniture sail boats (about 3 Euros), a short horse ride around the park, and a puppet show. My kids chose the horse ride. It was about 3 Euros as well. They have small horses in a group of 4 take children around the park. The horses are led by someone and the children are given hairnets and helmets to wear - so it is entirely safe. Our 6 year old loved it, but the 4 year old was little scared when the horses got too close together. It was only like a 3-5 minute ride. There is a Marionette puppet show that was on at 4:00 and was (5.50 Euros) - we didn't make it in time to see the show. The Marionette Puppet show is in the white building next to the playground, not the brown building that says Marionettes. So, it can appear that the show is not on. There is a man that rings the bell when the show starts to get everyone's attention. For adults, definitely walk down to see the Luxemburg Palace, pool, and garders- which are just gorgeous. This is where there are many people taking photos and selfies. There may have been more to the park, but after 2-3 hours we were ready to go back home! The park is easily accessible by the metro. Hopefully you'll have a beautiful sunny day!

Great place to relax. Jardin du Luxembourg is one of the top attractions in Paris. We went here after a long day vising and we found quite literally a heavenly place.It is also really close to Sorbonne. I think that a picnic here is a great idea after an enjoyable day spent in the center of Paris.

Lovely spot to stop and eat lunch or people-watch. Went there alone in the midst of a day of window shopping. Had picked up a baguette at Le Petit Lux66 Rue de Vaugirardbecause there were 20 people lined up outside at 12:30 pm so I figured it must be good. They were right! Took my delicious sandwich to a chair in the Luxembourg Gardens and watched some tennis, then took a stroll. There's a playground (quite large), some beautifully landscaped lawns, the Luxembourg Palace (which I think is the building that houses the French Senate), and extensive gravel paths. There's a carousel too, but it wasn't operating when I was there. A beautiful city oasis.

Prettiest open space in the city. Well worth the visit- so pretty and well-used. A pond in the middle where kids sail boats and lots of chairs for just enjoying the beautiful flowers. We visited a second time, it was so lovely!

Nice place. Lots of things for the kids to do, enjoyed the pony rides and sailing the boats on the pond was fun. Only problem was the limited seating on grass - we were unable to read the signs that told us to stay off the grass in certain parts of the garden and has the "grass police" blowing whistles at us. Eventually found the place we were allowed to sit and it was fine, if a bit crowded there.

Beautiful expanses of greenery and lawn. On this hot and sunny day, at first I found it amusing to see the great swathes of luscious lawns that were out of bounds. Everyone on hot day sitting on iron chairs on gravel. Seemed to make one feel quite uncomfortable. However, gardens beautiful, trees and kids having fun sailing their little boats on lake. Funny to find one strip of lawn open to public. Everyone crowded on it like sardines.
Beautiful at dusk. Definitely worth a visit, beautiful grounds full of tourists and parisians alike. We visited in evening at dusk where the gardens looked absolutely stunning.

Luxembourg Gardens Great for Kids of All Ages. A wonderful mid city spot to make you feel you're in the country. Watch the kids jumping for joy as they sail their boats on the large pond right in front of the Palais where the country's legislators are hard at work. Stroll the grounds and planted garden sections. Smell the flowers and check the specimen platings. It's all there and very reachable by public transport.

Lovely Lunch @ Luxembourg Gardens. It was a warm day and we had just finished a walking tour. What to do next? It was time to take a rest from sight seeing and really SEE Paris. We grabbed some baguettes and headed to Luxembourg Gardens. The park was full of locals enjoying their lunch break. Mothers, students, lovers, workers and joggers all intermingled. We found spare seats under the shade of a tree and enjoyed our lunch, plus a good dose of people watching. I love French landscaping. Lawn, straight lines, beautiful paths - throw in a palace with a pond and it's idyllic! My husband decided to take a nap after lunch, so I strolled around taking in all of the statues, kiosks, children with sailboats & greenery. What a perfect afternoon. Then the thought struck me: when have I ever done this in my home town?
A quiet place to reflect. Bring a basket of lunch and relax by the fountain, or under the trees and watch the couples and families go by. A good place to put up your tired feet.

Peaceful. The Luxembourg Gardens are set in the quiet Luxembourg quarter. The gardens are peaceful and elegant, beautiful statuary. The beautiful Fountain Medicis is a lovely spot for photos, in the style of a 17th century Italian grotto. There is a statue of Saint Genevieve, the patron saint of Paris. The day we visited there were people sailing model boats on the Octagonal Lake in front of the Palais du Luxembourg, other people were sunbaking , reading on the sweet green sun chairs around the lake. Just around from thegardens is an Angelinas cafe, pop inside and have a " Signature " hot chocolate and Madeline for a treat. A lovely finish to your visit to the Luxembourg Gardens.

Lunching in the Luxembourg!. A picnic lunch in the gardens was our goal and a great delight it turned out to be. fresh food and coffee from the onsite cafe were easily and quickly obtained giving us plenty of time to choose some chairs and relax iin the sun and fresh air. The people watching was fun as was seeing the children sail their boats on the pond. Very relaxing and a break from the busyness of sightseeing !

Grand garden. This piece of land is very well manicured. I had the pleasure to both jog in the park and walk and admire its beauty later in the trip. The grounds are great for anything from history, to working out, and even picnics.

Nice place to relax after a lunch. We arrived via RER (Exit Port Royal). Great walk along a green axis between alleys, approaching the main garden from the south, was very nice. Peaceful coexistence of tourists, students, normal people relaxing in the sunshine or shadow. Some chairs stand around that can be moved to have your own individual view. Good for kids (primary school or older) are mechanical little sailing boats for rent by the half hour, to be placed on the little lake in front of the palais. Very tidy, bring your own blanket and sandwich, not good for alcohol or large(r) group play.

Wonderful & Relaxing. We stayed near le Jardin Luxembourg so we spent quite a bit of time there. From the ice cream vendor at the entrance, to the children sailing their boats in the basin, to the lovely cafe (sit down or take away), the vast expanses of trees and grass, and the beautiful statuary and flowers, this park is spectacular and is not to be missed. If you need a place to run, you'll find lots of others doing the same. If you just want to sit and relax, chairs and benches abound. We were surprised by a band concert in the gazebo one afternoon...great!
Make it civil do on Sunday. A pleasant space landscape and cafes I do on a Sunday as that is my Park day try it and sea. you can get away from the hubub of the streets by steping in
Beautiful. I find the gardens with all those statues very nice - great place for relax. You can sit either on benches or on grass, enjoying your time taking some photos in the sun or under the trees

In Winter it's white, but in other seasons.... A beautiful park, with a Museum inside, allees to stroll, many statues and all over the green of the trees and grass. Try to be there in a Sunday. Take picnic food, if you like.
Must visit!. One of the best and most famous gardens in Paris, the splendid Jardin du Luxembourg is a must-visit with its manicured gardens, beautiful fountains and play areas for the kids.
Not impressive at all. Huge garden but not impressive, parts of the lawn was dry and I didn't see much flowers. The palace that was next to it is picturesque but could not go close to it.

Must see gardens while in Paris.. Two things to also take in while you are there. First, walk slightly off the beaten path and take a look at the beautiful Medici fountain. It is tucked away and is one of the highlights. Also, just do it. Get a little boat and sail it.

Simply Gorgeous. We finally made it to Luxembourg Gardens.... Always ran out of time previous trips.You must go for a wander through this lovely place... It is so calm and really exquisite!The gardens are so well manicured and the Parliament Palace with armed guards outside is a beautiful building.In one section there is a beautiful statue with a fountain and waterfall which is absolutely gorgeous. Lots of little areas all different.If you want a very relaxing wander and calming experience go for a visit... You won't regret it. A big tick!!

Beautiful spot. Worth a detour to see this beautiful chateau, park, and general public space that is well used and loved. On a recent Saturday, it was full of local families and tourists alike. What a park should be.

Wonderful place for a picnic. This gorgeous garden has lots of little hidden areas to delight you. We had several evening picnics here with a bottle of rose, cheese and baguettes with some pastries for dessert. Just pick up your supplies from the numerous shops around the gardens, pull up some of the garden chairs and enjoy! There are also tennis courts and playgrounds for the more active!

Always A Favorite!!!. I have visited Luxembourg Gardens many times and always enjoy it no matter what time of year. When the weather is great it is a wonderful place to unwind and people watch! The gardens are meticulously maintained.

Absolutely beautiful!. Luxembourg Gardens is simply a beautiful place on the Left Bank. With the statues of the Queens of France around the edge and the wonderful sailboats skittering across the pond, it's a great place to spend time away from traffic. My husband went early every morning to power walk, and we went back often to watch the kids sailing the miniature boats. Search out the boule games usually in full swing on the SW side, as well as the pony rides for kids. Love it!

Superb.. We stayed nearby at the Best Western A La Villa des Artistes about a 5 minute walk. The gardens were wonderful. Sunny weather about 23 C, brilliant. Take a picnic and enjoy just sitting around and looking at people walk on by or watch the little boats on the pond.

Parisian Enchantment. Chestnuts in Autumn, Gelato in Summer, blossoms in Spring - the charm is always here. Boys with toy sailboats, lovers entranced, soft breezes through the trees, statues of history's greatest women - Impressionism still lives here.

Lovely. Beautiful gardens with a lake in the middle. We sat and watched the world go by. There were children playing with boats on the lake, people relaxing by the water, or meandering through the gardens.

Beautiful Gardens. I went to the museum that is located in the Luxembourg Park to see The Tudors exhibit. I didn't expect to come across such a beautiful garden in the middle of the city. The garden is located 5-10 min walk from 2 metro lines and there is no entrance fee. The park was busy with several visitors as well as locals exercising. The garden reminded me of the Versailles Palace garden. If you have some time or would like to have a picnic I would recommend the garden.

Beautiful Gardens - great running location. The gardens are simply beautiful. You can smell the flowers and flowering trees a block away from the park. A must see. There is a palace on the grounds, many pieces of art, and several trails for jogging. I ran in this park the three mornings I was in Paris.Always carry a couple of euros with you. The toilets cost (I think 70 cents) to use. There is a person at the bathroom to collect/make change.
just next door to our villa. This is a beautiful green space that offers lots of space and wonderful venues for games, dining, sunbathing, romantic strolls or killer jogs...

Beautiful flower & greenery. The flower selections and the trees were excellent, and there was nice statuary throughout the park which honored great names in literature, music, and politics who had lived in France. The house and the pond were attractive, and children were sailing small boats in the pond. Some groups of men were playing chess, and a lot of people were playing tennis and running. There were lots of convenient places to sit. The only negative for me was what you see in a lot of Parisian attractions: gravel where you expect to find beautiful green grass. There were big spaces with nothing but gravel. Overall, though, quite enjoyable.
Beautiful site for a Stroll. Beautiful well kept grounds . Cool even in summer. Great place for resting between sight seeing. Well worth walk.

Always lovely, always calm and refreshing. The Luxembourg Gardens are the quintessential Parisian experience. There is something for everybody, from babies to toddlers to teens to adults, lovers and others. The flowers are always fabulous, but especially in the spring when the tulips and iris are blooming. There is even an apiary! (bee keeping)I began taking my daughter there when she was about one year old, for her first steps on grass, on the lawn reserved for babies and parents. She soon graduated to the enclosed children's play area, which you must pay to enter, but is completely worth it. There are fun things for all kids from about age one to age 12. A big sandbox, lots of slides, a big truck to drive (very exciting for toddlers), places to hide, and even a T-bar for older kids. In addition, the nearby kiosk sells pretty good coffee, so a parent can enjoy coffee and reading while keeping half an eye on the kids--it is not so easy for them to get out of the playground.Without kids, I recommend the gorgeous café just across the street, Le Rostand, so nice to sip a coffee there or eat a meal. There are often beautiful photography exhibits along the sidewalk around the park.

Park full of attraction. Awesome park to see many different things from people playing basketball to children playing with boats in the fountain. We come back here every time we go to Paris and enjoy it more and more. Great place to bring a picnic and people watch.

Don't miss the boats and the puppet shows. A great, classic park with plenty of places and seats to get cozy and chill if there's not too much of a crowd. We even brought the classic Parisian provisions for a picnic lunch. The children sailing the boats on the pond is a site to behold. And while we did not see it, can only imagine that the weekend puppet shows must also be excellent.

June in bloom, a nice reprieve and a place to rest your feet.. Our first day off the 12 hour flight from the West Coast and time to walk off the jet lag. The Luxembourg Gardens never disappoint with the surrounding architecture, mature trees, beautiful flowers, chairs to sit and the pond to watch the young children play with the wooden boats. Less crowded than the Tuileries and a great spot for a picnic too.

Beautiful day in a beautiful park!. My friend and I stayed near the Jardin de Luxembourg in early June and thoroughly enjoyed walking through the park and sitting to soak in the sun or read a book. It is a wonderful oasis in the city and provides relaxation and great people-watching in a gorgeous setting.

Beautiful Garden with 100+ Statues, Fountains, Monuments. Fabulous gardens, which are owned and maintained by the French Senate, which meets in the adjoining palace. We enjoyed watching the children play with boats in the big water basin. Also enjoyed poking around in the orangerie, (winter home to orange trees in planters), which displays art, photography and sculptures. (Not to be confused with l'Orangerie art museum containing Monet's Water Lily panels.) We walked to side streets at the northwest corner of the park to pick up sandwiches for an informal park lunch...which is your best bet for inexpensive meals any day and in any park in Paris! (Fresh baguette, French butter or cheese, a little salad...it doesn't get any better than that!)

Amazing!. Luxembourg Gardens is an amazing place to spend time with your family, friends or just by yourself. Eating a gelato and racing a small boat on a fountain is just a few 'must do' things there.
Nice. Very nice gardens, we loved walking through them, gave us a feel of tranquility, it was quite, and really beautiful. It is a place to visit.

Great Park to escape the crowds. Beatifully landscaped park with lots of locals. There is a wonderful fountain where you can rent a toy sailboat and float it across the adjoining little pond. And it's free!

Beauty of Paris. Wow! These gardens were immaculate and incredibly well maintained. These gardens line the Luxembourg Palace, so expect to see armed guards, but don't let that detract from the beauty of this place. Grab a gelato and pick a spot to soak in the perfection.

Big park, but nothing out of the ordinary. I expected a bit more from the gardens. It is nicely located, and I am sure the Parisians use it as a nice green area to relax and excercise, but as a tourist destination it does not really compare to some of the parks in other major cities in Europe.

Romantic and pleasant place. Beautiful gardens clean and tidy. There are chairs everywhere. On weekends in the afternoon on the main stage musical performances cozy. You can take a book and sit on a bench in the shade or organize a romantic picnic in the garden.
spring time. nice place to hang out on spring time. just the right moment to catch glimpse of family, couples and friends sprawled on the grass.
Time stood still. Sit and enjoy people watching. Talk about anything. Read a book. Bring snacks. Just seat and enjoy the sun or breeze.

Beauty!. Theres no other way to describes this gradens more than beautiful! Just going for a walk, seeing the different settings, fountains. Enjoy a coffe or lunch here in the park! If you want to know Paris , you have to visit the Luxemburg gardens!m

when you need a break from being a tourist.... Great place to stroll, relax, visit or sit for a refreshment and people watch. This has become one of our favorites places to visit in Paris and on this trip found a hotel not too far away. It seems that a run in the morning or leisurely shaded walk on a hot summer day through Luxembourg Gardens always becomes one the favorite memories of our trip. It will help to recalibrate your compass after a day of being a tourist. I love watching the children with their sailboats in the fountain. We have also happened upon lives concerts.
