There are vendors selling crepes or galato. We also enjoyed a glass of wine at the outdoor cafe.

Lucky to have walked by.... I had heard of these gardens / park, but hadn't planned on actually visiting. We got lucky as we walked by -- it is gorgeous! Huge area, beautiful garden, grass, and structures. Lots of families and young couples and old couples sitting on the grass or chairs, strolling, running. Lovely evening.

Timeless enjoyment of the beautiful garden and meeting place.. Still one of the very best places in Paris to see Parisians ( and lots of tourists) enjoying this beautiful park. Enjoy watching the kids sail their rental sailboats, have a snack and see the lovers enjoying the atmosphere. Also note that it is free.

Favorite spot in Paris. I was in Paris for 2 months and I went here almost every day. Its a beautiful little garden in the middle of the city. Great people watching! A few little food stands to get crepes and ice cream are scattered throughout. Very convenient to get to so many touristy sights in the city.

Great place. I went there in a saturday afternoon to have a picnic with my brothers and there was an orchestra playing some classical music. That made my experience AMAZING. Really really good, and it was for free. The park is really big, but there are some areas in which you cannot lay or sit on the grass. Unfortunately we only discovered when we were leaving the place, after few our sitting on the chairs in the park :( Anyway, the experience was fantastic, the gardens are really beautiful, I totally recommend!
Stroll from Museum D'Orsay. It was a nice stopping point on our leisurely walk back to our hotel . We stopped for a gelato and people watched. Incredible gardens and statues and view.

A relief from museums. A completely and totally beautiful setting. An oasis of grass, water, pathways, and lovely flowers. Do take a minute to study map at entrance as it helps to figure out where you are!

Delightful.. The best of Parisian parks. Gorgeous old trees offering shade and beauty, flowers, benches, fountains, activities. Strolling, basking encouraged. Occasional film being shot. A large pond in central alley where children can launch a small boat and keep it moving back and forth. My granddaughters had a wonderful time with this. Not expensive. Marie de Medici's palace, now the French Senate, dominates the scene in a most stately manner. Find various statues hidden in groves, including a Bartholdi Statue of Liberty. Don't miss it.

Lovely gardens for the whole family. First visit and very impressed. Not so much a garden for the avid gardener as a recreation space for everyone.A small lake, kids playground, bandstand, paths to walk, lovely lawns and all quite central and set against the background of a grand old palace.Gravel paths which do get your shoes dusty.We were fortunate enough to see the Ware Brass Band (on Tour) in full flow in the bandstand and great to see so many of the visitors relaxed in deckchairs, taking in the marvellous sound. Good therapy!
Nice Break. for a change from tourist spots we sat and watched people. Also fed the birds. You can watch the small sail boats in pond. A quiet retreat in the city.
Nice for a walk. Silence, clean, trees and nice gardens... You can just stroll or go by bike. The best is to read a book in one of the chairs in the sun.

A lovely place to be in Paris. We visited the gardens later in the evening. It was a beautiful, somewhat quiet time. We enjoyed strolling among the well-manicured lawn, the statues and the fountain.Paris is a busy place. If you're lucky, you can find a quiet time like we did just to enjoy the beauty.

Perfect place to relax on a summer's day. The Luxembourg Gardens are a haven in the summer in Paris - they offer shade and tranquillity and are well worth a visit. The small pond in the middle is popular with children and it is like stepping back in time watching them chase small wooden boats around the pond with their sticks.

Beautiful and scenic park. Very nice and scenic park. The kids playing with sticks and little sailing boats in the pond took us back in time.With chairs everywhere you can just sit and relax between museums and other hotspots.

Stay off the grass. Awesome. Got picnic supplies from the lovely ladies at bread and roses. They really went out of their way to supply and guide us. The park is just lovely. We had our picnic in the park at 3pm. Some parts of the park, one cannot sit on the grass, you will be chased by very polite police folk.
Relax and long walk. Nice for a long walk with your loved ones.You can spent some quiet times as its a large garden.You can sit at the benches or close to the fountains.

Always fascinating. It's wonderful to observe how the locals use this space - for exercise, playing chess and cards, youth group meetings, concerts in the pergola, children's playgrounds, the art gallery, or just walking and observing. It's a beautiful, beautiful space.

Been to Paris many times...but first time here...great for the kids. We had never visited the Luxembourg gardens before and a friend had wanted to see it on our last trip. We are so glad we came and checked it out. We had hired bikes for the day and our local friend brought us here with our daughter. The big playground was a massive hit with her and it was great to burn off all that energy kids have. The gardens were great for us to walk around at this time of year.

Nice gardens and entry is free. A very nice place to visit and best of all it is free. The gardens are immaculate and you can spend a couple of hours in the sun around very nice fountains and gardens.

Beautiful!! But beware the gravel!. Beautiful grounds! You can see people just hanging out and enjoying the nice weather and soaking up the sun. WARNING: The floor is all gravel/sand. Do not wear black shoes, they will turn chalky white. Bring a scarf because when the wind blows, all the sand gets kicked up!

Gorgeous. We loved walking through the gardens here. It seemed very family oriented. There were lots of little kids sailing boats on the pond by the Palais. Very relaxing. Wish we could have visited it once more before we left.

Relaxing, beautiful, haven. I love coming here to see the gardens, or to wander around the gardens through the trees. I love coming here to sit for a glass of wine and watch the world go by. I love coming here to watch people play with the boats on the lake in summer, or to watch the old men play boules in the afternoon. It is a wonderful oasis in the middle of Paris for tourists and locals alike.
Beautiful Area. Natural beauty and a peaceful setting right in the middle of Paris, the large pond is a great place to pull up a chair and relax for bit, enjoying Paris

Lovely oasis on a sunny day. Just like a Monet painting, the light was dappled through the trees, the pond was full of little racing sailboats, the flowers were gorgeous they have ping pong and tennis and many couples and families were enjoying the grass.
Nice in Parts. We visited as it was on the tourist map. Few areas are impressive but overall it seemed to be a local community garden. Go if you have spare time or just want to sit and relax.

Amazing gardens. If you are in Paris these are well worth a visit. We went on a hot day and their was plenty of shade, lots of seats, a cafe and a couple of small kiosks. Prices for food and drink was ok (nothing in Paris is cheap). There was plenty to see here, including fountains, water features,amazingly manicured gardens, sculptures and even art exhibitions (not sure if there is always one there, the one running was a few local artists). Sadly, as with most of Paris, there are limited toilets. They seem to have just one, which you paid a small fee for and had a long queue.
Always worth a visit. Always a good visit, and stay away from the central area and go the the boule/petangue areas and other corners to inhale the true Parisian life style

Beautiful Garden. Lovely garden, if one likes that sort of thing. A great array of statues of various notable figures (and some you've never heard of) and figures from myth; the Medici fountain; and a delightful pond where one cna rent and sail tiny tiny sailboats, much to the displeasure of the ducks. Both the palace and the museum are also on hand, though not free. There is, however (as of July 2015, anyway), a free contemporary art museum pisplaying lithographs and abstract photography.
Relaxing!. People just go to enjoy the day, have a picnic or go for a run! We enjoyed our walk around the gardens.

relaxing. The kids (and their adult helpers) will love sailing the boats in the pond. Bring a picnic - chairs are provided (placed around the pond near the lawns and ornaments). Lovely playground further in shaded under trees (there is an admission fee for this gated playground). There is also a little carousel and short pony treks available.

Relax and people watch in very pleasant gardens. We have been here a few times and always find the gardens a great place to visit and relax. The main fountain has toy sailboat rentals for children. It is fun to see the children enjoying themselves with this simple activity. Plenty of space in the shade also.

Dreamy toy sailboats. So relaxing and beautiful. Our favorite part was the toy sailboats. You can rent them from a stand for €3,50 for 30 minutes. It's very relaxing and fun. There are many places to explore or sit and relax.
Always pretty. If I'd had more time, I would have visited every day. It's a nice place to look at while taking a walk around or sitting on the grass or bench.

Lovely place for a stroll. A beautiful park within easy walking distance of anywhere on the Left Bank. Families, couples, tourists and locals. There was a free concert by a military band in the copola while we were there. Don't miss the petanque (bocce) pits on the west side where you will see some amazing skills. Like most of Paris, it felt completely safe.

A bit disappointed. Perhaps if we were in Paris for an extended vacation we would have fallen in love with the Gardens. However, we only had 3 days and were uninspired by what we saw as we walked through. However, it's amazing how many people were just hanging out there!

Beautiful!. A lovely garden in the St. Germain neighbourhood, within walking distance of the Louvre. We went at nearly 9pm (park closes at 930pm), and found many folks relaxing, reading, having picnics, etc. It's a really lovely green place with tall, well-pruned trees. The Luxembourg Palace which houses the Senate is at one end of the garden, and is one of the few public places in Paris with noticeable police presence. The gendarmes politely refused people from entering the gardens after 930pm.
Calming place to stroll. Gorgeous gardens, nice place to visit for a lunch break or just passing through. Lots of seating, too.

The relaxed place in Paris. This very peaceful park is a well relaxed area that gets you away from the bustling city. It was near to my hotel so it was readily available to me. At the beginning I thought of it as just a regular garden, but turned out to be a very elegant and well kept one,

Lovely Neighborhood Gem in the 6th. We walked the gardens twice during our visit. Beautiful walking paths, fountains with sailboats, a great cafe for a coffee along the stroll. One could sit and people watch, catch the tennis players, or just stroll the many pathways. Lovely to have in the neighborhood we stayed in.

The best park we visited in Paris. Very near the metro station with some nice cafes on the outskirts of the park. Beautiful gardens and all the children were having lots of fun with toy sailing boats on the lake. We went on a very hot day and the park was packed.
Scenary is beautiful. We walked to these gardens they are just beyound the Loourve. A beautiful walk through these gardens and this is a must see.

Cool relaxing spot when the city was very hot.. With record high temperatures happening it was very relxaing to walk around the shaded walkways of the gardens. There are plenty of seats to sit and relax.
Busy and beautiful. Well maintained gardens with loads of runners on the circuit around the periphery. A nice walk and hire bicycles at one of the entrances. Stay off the grass!
very peaceful park in the middle of the city. Lovely well kept gardens, a fountain to sit around and places to eat .Children's play area and tennis courts.

Perfect spot to take a break and soak up Paris. We brought wine, cheese and fresh bread and headed to the gardens. There is enough land that you can choose to sit in the shade or sun. Be sure to have a blanket. We truly enjoyed a low key picnic in the gardens. All kinds of people were also relaxing and enjoying the summer Paris air. After our break we walked around thr gorgeous grounds. A do not miss stop when in paris!

An oasis of green. In the heart of Paris, there are many gardens. This is a large one with many beautiful trees, lawns, roses, water features, all carefully tended by an army of gardeners.Statues and plenty of seating make this an interesting place to sit and talk, read and reflect.

Best place to be a kid in Paris (even if you're an adult}. One of the most charming spots in Paris. Nothing will reawaken your inner child better than renting a toy boat here and sailing it on the pond. My 12 year old grandchildren thought it was the best place in city. There's a playground for kids within the park with paid entrance (a Euro or two and well worth it!) I thought it might be too young for them, but they had a blast. Especially loved the "zip line" for older kids.

Great way to waste a few hours. . This is the perfect spot for a picnic. Wether u are dining solo, a couple or a family the park is perfect for everyone. For families with young children the playground is quite extensive and fun. You do have to pay for it but it's totally worth it. The grounds are well kept and it had a ton of trees for shade which made it a lot cooler and easier to enjoy.

A stroll through a Renoir painting. My friend and I went in search of Gertrude Stein's salon and en route, decided to stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens - it's beautiful complete with the palace - we were treated to an open-air concert in the gazebo, watched the children with their toy boats in the pond and on the ponies, and enjoyed watching some older Parisians playing boules - it's a gorgeous refuge in the middle of bustling Paris and just perfect for a Sunday afternoon stroll. As someone remarked upon seeing the attached photo, it is like walking into a Renoir painting.

Beautiful Gardens. We spent restful periods two afternoons at the Luxembourg Gardens on our trip to Paris. The surroundings are beautiful and it was fun to enjoy a drink while enjoying the scenery and people watching.
Restful place to spend some time. The Gardens are a restful place to relax and recuperate after a day of museum overload. The Gardens are open until dusk, which is relatively late in the summer.
Visit in early morning. A must go in Paris and a perfect and safe (daytime) parc to relax, reading a book, or both together.
Tranquility in Paris. A great place to walk, people watch and picnic. Lots of paths and abundance of trees, outdoor cafes and benches to sit. And wi-fi. A classic.

Beautiful setting. The gardens are beautiful and wonderfully laid out and picturesque. We only spent time here briefly but the fountain and the flowers, trees etc. are wonderful. it is a lovely place for a stroll or on a nice day to sit and relax. Highly recommended respite from the busy Paris life.

Ahh calm. Beautiful calm gardens great for a rest from the super busy streets! The wee toy boats for rent look like great fun for the kids, the statues and art all around are equally as interesting for the adults. Thoroughly enjoyed it!
Luxury. Oh it is so beautiful and lovely. It feels like luxury. I had lunch in the Gardens and would love to do it again when I am back in Paris.

Quiet elegance away from crowds. In an upper class neighborhood, next to the Senate building, in the 6th distrcit, the elegant gardens are well kept and refresh you from the madness of Paris in the Summer. Stroll outside to the Panteon , the firmer Church where the great people of France, Emile Zola,m are buried. Then go dowhill to the Sorbone.

Very very beautiful. Very calm and relaxing place, full of chairs for people to enjoy the place. There are lots of flowers and a a small " lake" where children play with little boats. It's right in front of louvre so it's a nice place to unwind. I really liked it.
Fun respite from traffic.. We spent a relaxing time walking around the gardens and watching school children sail toy boats across the large fountain. Great place to have a picnic lunch!

Always nice and interesting. We were here 15 years ago and they again had photo exhibition on the outside gate/fences. These are big photos and very interesting. This time it was about the mountain areas in France. It seems they do every year one and it does not disappoint. Best of all it is free.If it is a nice day, take a book, something to eat and drink and go into the gardens where there are many chairs available or go on one of the designated grass areas and enjoy a picnic and chill-out.We were here on a sunday in the end of june on a very nice day and as you expect it was quite busy, but wehad no trouble finding a nice spot.

Best Garden in Paris. Hardin Luxembourg is a wonderful place to stroll, relax, and soak in the Parisian lifestyle. Beautifully designed, it offers seating, a pond, architecture, several sports activities (jogging, tennis), and even a small cafe with outdoor seating. There are two different public bathrooms that are extremely well maintained. It's located next to a stop on the blue RER line and walkable from St Germain & Latin Quarter. Love to go there every time I'm in Paris.

Best garden in Paris - gorgeous and with great people watching. Every time I go to Paris I go there and I'm reminded that I think its the best garden in town. The garden is laid out for a leisurely stroll to occur past luscious flowers, topiary and landscaping with the majestic palace in the background. Its instantly calming. And instantly amusing - the people watching is great, tourists and locals alike. You can get food at the supermarket just across from the metro and enjoy a lunch, or walk up rue de Tournon on the north side of the park and buy some pastries, macaroons and chocolate from 3 really stellar patisseries along the street. Great neighborhood to explore as well.
Worth visiting. Very well kept gardens and well worth a visit when you are in Paris. It is very restful and you can spend a very pleasant few hours wandering around.

Great place for a stroll. Spent a pleasant couple of hours strolling and sitting with a friend.Chatted, watched people, relaxed.In the centre of the city, yet so restful.A must for a break from a hectic schedule
I love it.. Always as a I go to scool, I go there for a while. It's so good to walk in, watch the people, the children. Love is in the air. :-)

Don't pinch yourself: Give me 30 minutes here, and your "Paris feeling" will set in. Ponds, with kids pushing some sail boat, with sticks. Moms, people walking, a lot oftalking goes on here, as it is behind the Senat, Near to the Universities. Statues,life, peacefull, among civilized people. Take a sandwich, a bottle of water and a book.I lived there a long time, and i can assure you this much: it will sink in fairly quickly,thus making you both mellow, and guilty for being here, and sorry you'd have to leave. You will come back .
Beautiful. Very stunning gardens. It seems like a great place to go running, for a walk or just relax by the pond on a chair!
lovely gardens. A great place to enjoy beautiful gardens and people watch. Lots to see in this park and see how The locals spend leisure time. One of our favorite things to visit on our trip

Great Place to People Watch and Relax!. This huge green space is filled with lovely gardens, statuary, and a huge central pond. We were there on a Sunday afternoon and the park was filled with locals sailing small boats on the pond, strolling, and enjoying the beautiful weather and scenery. There is no charge for admittance and Luxemborg Gardens is a really nice escape from the busy vibe of Paris. I wish we had purchased some cheese, a baguette, and some fruit to have a picnic there, maybe next time!

Beautiful.... A great park for a picnic. When stepping out of the metro station there is a small supermarket across the street perfect for buying drinks and snacks to bring to the park. There is also a McDonalds. The atmosphere is relaxing and the park is surprisingly clean (apart from a few cigarette stubs). Visited on a Saturday and there were plenty of available chairs around.

A quiet break. Beautiful and extensive gardens, with plenty of diversions including tennis, ponies, play areas, orchards, flowers, beehives, fountain/pond, music grandstand, statues, and quiet places to just sit and reflect or people-watch. A nice break from the hectic city.
Love the green and outdoors.. Great place to walk for a day and enjoy your picnic before, during, or after. If you are here and there is sun outside, spend a day enjoying this area.

Lovely Gardens. We walked from the river around the Latin quarter and came across this gem quite by accident. It's a lovely park that the Parisians use, the children race sailing boats on the pond. There is a fantastic palace there, its used for politics now and can't be viewed inside, nevertheless this is a lovely park.

Luxembourg Gardens. A beautiful, relaxing garden. Many photo ops. A lovely place to spend a few hours. Interesting facts are posted at the entrance of the gardens. The presence of armed guards at every corner of the building was a little concerning though.

Beautiful. Love strolling though Luxembourg Gardens. It's so peaceful and beautiful. If you have children rent boats to float across the fountains. If you have time to spare grab and chair and read. It's a beautiful place
Beautiful peaceful retreat..... Great designs with grassed and stone area and lots of chairs and shaded areas to sit. Fountain, great gardens and lots of open space. A great evening stroll.

Peace and quiet with colorful flowers.. This was my favorite part of visiting Paris. After hours of walking in Paris, my friends and I grabbed some pastries, found seats and relaxed in Luxembourg Gardens (right in front of the Palace!)
Endless beauty. The Luxembourg palace and the flowers, fountains, statues. One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris. As lovely as the Tuilleries

My favorite place.. Probably my favorite place in Paris. Just by walking through, you get a real sense of Parisian life, from young to old. Beautiful place to take lunch, read a book or people-watch. Never boring.
Walking tour. Gardens are great and some sculpture really makes the garden a place to visit. Easy walk to gardens and sights along the way are worth the walk.

Beautiful Gardens. It was a beautiful sunny day. We walked the gardens. It was a very relaxing walk. There were benches, tables and chairs, so we stopped at sat for a bit taking in the beauty and the sunshine. There is also a cafe if you wanted something to eat or drink. A beautiful park to,spend a bit of time unwinding and relaxing.

Beautiful gardens restore your spirit. Beautiful gardens and statuary in the middle of a busy city. Very clean, quiet and relaxing. Visited mid-day but heard many enjoy in the early evening. Plenty of seating and great place to share a picnic or bottle of wine. Perfect place to restore yourself. Understand Ernest Hemingway used to visit here often when a "starving" writer. He'd encourage the pigeons to come close and then grab them, strangle them, and toss them in his bag for supper. Wouldn't recommend doing that today though...
Peaceful. The gardens here are very beautiful and peaceful. It's a nice spot to get away and relax from the busy city.
Breathtaking. Beautiful grounds with many surprises from a beautiful building to fountains and many sculptures throughout the gardens.A must see.

Lovely ending to a lovely day. We took our time walking from one end of Luxembourg Gardens to the other. The gardens were lovely, and the weather was perfect. We had already done a lot of walking earlier in the day, so we stopped and soaked in the beauty around us and enjoyed a dish of ice cream at the cafe before it closed for the evening.

Relax and Take a Break here!!!. Absolutely Beautiful! The gardens are outstanding! Great place to people watch! If touring Paris, this is the place to buy something to eat from a street vendor and then sit and relax on a park bench while eating it! Maybe even a little snooze to accommodate!!! Peace and serenity here and within walking distance to numerous tourist attractions in town!!! A must stop along the way!!! Enjoy!
Nice park. Nice view. Excellent park, trimmed trees, clean surroundings.best for the whole family. near an entertainment park.

A garden to visit. A great place to have an overview on a parisian public garden. Take a chair and simply watch other people around. It is the better way to understand parisian breaks in the city. Rent a little boat for your child at the central fontaine, rent a poney tour. The only trouble is the dust.
Lovely in Spring. You can't go wrong with a garden in Paris in the spring. Just find a chair, bring a book and a snack, and prepare to people watch.
Birthday Rest. Love the area around the fountain and the peaceful way everyone just takes a little rest from the hustle of the city

Beauty and Peace Abound. This park on the left bank of Paris is drop dead gorgeous. From the flowers that ring the buildings, to the sculptures around the park, and the wide avenues for strolling, one can find beauty and peace in this place. I highly recommend a visit there.

Lovely to stroll through. The gardens are more shrubbery than flowers but it is grand and beautiful. There is an auxiliary building that there was an art exhibit to purchase artwork which was a high quality work. It is surrounded but all those amazing coffee, wine cafés and tree lined streets to sit and soak up Paris.

Enjoying the formal gardens. A perfect walk on the first day (jet lagged ) . A beautiful French garden that won't disappoint. I was interested in the apiary and visited this garden three times this visit.

Find a chair. Sit, sip and watch. This is Paris!. Traveling for us means experiencing a place the way the people who live there experience it. The Luxembourg Gardes is a place for people watching, for getting away. The gardens are beautiful. Go there at the end of the work day and you'll see couples strolling and moms and dads with their kids, older people reading or just enjoying the breeze or shooting the breeze with friends. It's a beautiful and peaceful place. Not to be missed.
Beautiful. This is a gorgeous garden park with lots of places to explore. Parts are wide open and others are hidden from crowds. Lots of people can be found running the park.

A park to be proud of. The park was a short walk from our hotel and we passed through on our way to have brunch. The gardens were in flower and looked wonderful. We decided then to come back after our meal and spend some time there before going to get the train homeIt was a warm Sunday afternoon and just sitting in the shade letting the time slip away was so relaxing.

La Jardin de Luxemburg: A Slice of Paris. We always include a visit to the Jardin de Luxemburg. We really love the ambiance here. The Parisians really enjoy their parks, and this one is one of the best in town. People here just kick back and get into this place. There's the pool and the children sailing their toy boats, charming. The Boche ball courts with the older gentlemen fiercely competing. The chess players. The unique playground toys for the children. The amazing sculptures. And the bees. Oldest aviary in Paris. Worth a walk anytime.
Beautiful and Relaxing. There was nothing I disliked! Just take a lovely stroll through these beautiful gardens and you'll become a Parisian.

I love these better than Tulleries. This garden has fewer tourists (it's in the Latin Quarter) yet I think it's more beautiful than Tulleries (by the Louvre). There are all kinds of surprises.. fountains, waterways, statues, chess pavilion.
really nice place to relax. A very beautiful place to chill out and relax away from the city bustle... a little walk away from Pantheon and Notre Dame.
Beautiful place. The children adored sailing boats on the pond and sun bathing by the palace! Such a beautiful dreamy place.

relaxing sunday afternoon. probably the most beautiful park on the left bank of the seine river (also see the garden from the rodin museum) the atmosphere is so relaxing and the view is beautiful. good spot to take photos of the eiffel tower and montparnasse tower. also here you will find the luxeumbourg palace and the medici fountain.
Paris spring in it's best!. Must visit Paris site. Beautiful gardens. Flowers, huge trees, pools, fountains. All this in the heart of the Latin quarter. Do not miss!!!

Go for a picnic... Stay for the fun!!!. This is the best place in Paris for a great picnic!!! The gardens are fabulous, and they're filled with locals having fun!!! take a tote bag & go shopping... a bottle of water, a bottle of wine, a baguette, some cheese, a salami and some olives and you'll have a great day in The Gardens!!!

2 hours of bliss. This destination is underrated. The architecture and gardens are absolutely gorgeous, and our young children had a complete blast with the miniature sailboats that can be rented for 3 EUR/half our and sailed in the enormous fountain in front of the castle. Parents can just laze near the lawns in one of the hundreds of chairs that line the garden. Highly recommend
Well woth seeing, relaxing.. Beautiful gardens, interesting statuary , very relaxing watching kids with their yachts(hirable), playground (2.5E), but nothing useful in the way of refreshments.

Not that impressive. After visiting the Catacombs we took a stroll through Montparnasse and then we headed towards the Luxembourg Gardens. We heard so much about them, but we were pretty disappointed when we arrived there. They were clean, nice, well organized, but not that impressive. There are plenty of places to seat, just to take a little break after walking lots of kilometers. But that's it.

Beautiful. The gardens are lovely and beautifully laid out, the day we went was sunny and warm, perfect for strolling around, although it was pretty busy as the season had just started. As its of historical significance it's well worth the time to go visit.
Good walk at the park. I walked pass this place while I walked back to the hotel I have stayed in paris. very nice park. I sat there for an hour before find my dinner.

Le Déjeuner sur l'herbe!. Yes we did it but nothing like a Manet painting. There was no undressed woman nor a picnic basket. Instead we had a can of beer and sandwiches from a nearby bar but we stretched out on a park bench and did what so many Parisians were doing on a fine sunny spring day. Picnicking in the park. So French.We never saw the inside of the beautiful Palais because we enjoyed strolling around the massive gardens. We watched many adults manning the sail boats on the octagonal pond, the kids eating ice cream or people enjoying a bottle of wine. Very great place to unwind. Don't miss the beautiful Fontaine Medici with its ornate grotto.
Hidden away. The Luxembourg Gardens are tucked away but absolutely magnificent. Definitely worth a visit. The mansion and garden were owned by one lady.

Flavour of Paris. This is one place I would love to visit many more times. Weekends are the best times to visit if true flavour of Paris is to be enjoyed. Carry a book with a book with and a mat to lie on. Great place for kids to enjoy.

Wonderful after a long day walking around Paris. The gardens are beautiful to walk through but even nicer to just sit and relax in after walking 20+ miles in Paris. There are plenty of places to sit and little cafes that you can get food in.

Jardin du Luxembourg Review. This was, without a doubt, our favorite place in Paris. There are quiet sitting areas, exercise trails, populated stretches, precious children with families, and beautiful views wherever you look. I hope to return someday!

Best garden in Paris. Beautiful for a quick or long walk, or to enjoy an ice cream, or just to sit and watch the Parisians during a summer afternoon. And so close to a vivid area, the student's neighborhood.
Nice atmosphere. Very nice open space with a café and a small fountain. A place to relax and chill out from the busy city center

Crowded and Disappointing. Having heard so much about Luxembourg Gardens, we were somewhat disappointed by our visit. We arrived at about 9:30 to find a long, long line snaking around the court yard. The audio tape did not work well. We found the furnishings in the palace space. What made it worse though was the large crowds. It was very difficult to really view or appreciate the palace or gardens. Later I did listen to the Rick Steve's audio, it was very helpful, but did not cover the rooms in order of the way we were "herded" in. If you choose to go, I would try to choose the least busiest of times (see Rick Seve's) Paris travel guide and preview his audio tape to help make your tour more meaningful.

It's beautiful! Worth seeing.. Beautiful, large public garden. Had hot chocolate on a drizzly day in the little café on the grounds. Lunch across the street in a café started in 1791! Love Paris!
Check out the statues of the queens of France.

Beautiful, relaxing. Really a very nice and relaxing place where people go to walk, read, nap, chat, and hang out. Great gardens, statues, fountains... the usual on all gardens during the French Royalty times. Now open for everybody to enjoy. Couldn't helped but wondered how much it cost to maintain all of these?

Wonderful Walk in The Park. A beautiful park to stroll in. I am not sure it is worth a trip to the area alone, but if you like watching people at rest and play, in a beautiful surrounding, it is worth taking in.

good place to chill out and let childre roam. A quiet tranquil place to catch the sun and watch others. Restful after doing the sites. Seats available and comfortable the only problem was getting our party to move

Great place for picnic and rest. Like: A great place to sit around and enjoy greenery, peace. A lot of Parisians seem to be using this place to relax. It's nice that many chairs are provided for visitors.
Dislike: Some visitors selfishly prop their legs on chairs, depriving others from using them to sit.

Greenery aplenty. If I was a resident staying nearby, I would visit this place practically every single day. What's not to enjoy? Great gardens, fascinating fountains, and even a Statue of Liberty (located near the West Entrance) ...... indeed, it is a peaceful place to be.Things to look out for include the Octagonal Basin, (it's right smack in the middle of the garden, so you can't miss it), where you can find children with their model sailing boats; the Fountain of Medici, a quiet spot located at the northeast corner of the garden, where you can rest both body and mind; and of course, Palais du Luxembourg (look at that clock!).Tennis courts are aplenty in the Luxembourg Gardens, and it's nice to jog here too. All in all, if you're looking for a touch of nature in a concrete jungle, Jardin du Luxmbourg is the place to be.
Stunning. Amazing 2.5 euro epic children's playground with a zip line! Sculptures to draw! Many chairs to contemplate life!

Beautiful and people friendly. Well worth the trip - convenient to metro. We were there mid afternoon and the park was alive with people enjoying the gardens and the pond and the shade trees. What a wonderful treasure in the city
Great place to just be Parisienne. Boat races, small gardens, the Lus Museum, the Orangerie - all fantastic. They have chairs that recline and you can nap by the pond.

A Paris MUST. A visit to Paris isn't complete without strolling through Luxembourg Gardens. My wife and I have an annual ritual which involves walking through LGardens, stopping for a beer, then exiting on the north side near the Senate and great eats at L'Avant Comptoire. One of these years we will hit a few tennis balls but to date we have just enjoyed a few hours of strolling through LGardens each visit. A very special place indeed.

A beautiful place to stop and watch Paris go by. We enjoyed a brief visit to the Luxembourg Gardens on a Sunday morning, seeing the exercise groups and runners go by. Lots of lovely spots to sit and enjoy the scenery.

Lovely spot to relax. We stayed near Luxembourg Gardens on our recent visit, and used the park as a break from the heat and a place to relax and rest. The gardens are free to enter. This is a very popular spot with the locals as well as tourists, but is large enough to feel like an escape from the crowds.

Paradise in the middle of the city. i rented a bike and was riding down the seine. out of the corner of my eye i saw a ferris wheel so i went in that direction. out of nowhere was this amazingly gorgeous massive garden in the middle of the city. wish i had more time to spend there but it was so amazing.

Amazing place, must see!!. Don't know if it is my nostalgia of childhood days, or if it is an unbiased review, but this park is just wonderful.Weather permits, it is a must see place for so many reasons.1- if you have small monsters you want to entertain head there for sure. Depending on the days (weekends, Wednesdays, school holidays) there are pony rides, and also puppet shows. A gated playground (yes you pay for it) is also a great option for children to vent after a full day at museums, shops and restaurants. There is also the swing section (also paying) but surely a delight for small ones. THE highlight is the pond with the boats you can rent from the kiosk across. For half an hour your child will make you smile while slightly going crazy trying to keep an eye on him or her while trying to steal the wooden ship across the pond. For the record it is only 30 minutes! 2- If you are heading solo, with friends or as a couple, it is a perfect place to relax, talk, listen to music, or picnic. Super romantic as well. 3- I love running a few laps there, though it does get crowded..4- Just go there for a green break in this exhausting city sometimes.Good to know: the toilets next to the playground are relatively very clean as you have to pay a fee to enter. Also the kids get stamped on their hands while entering the playground so that they can go in and out all day.

Nothing Special. I can't figure out why this garden is rated so high as a tourist attraction. It is more a community park with tennis courts, play area for kids and a big garden where one can stroll. There are statues and some fountains, again nothing special. These things can be found on every nook and corner of Paris.Recommended only if you have a lot of time on hand while visiting Paris.
Must see in Paris. A must see stop in Paris. Beautiful gardens, art exhibitions and outdoor concerts, what more could one ask in a large city.

Perfect Place for a Stroll. Amazingly quiet place to amble on a beautiful sunny day. The gardens were immaculate & the fountains brought it all to life. It was such a nice place to sit (lots of chairs) & people watch, well worth finding.

Escape from the city streets for a while. We only passed through the Luxembourg Gardens but is was an amazing sight on a beautiful day, people sat chilled out, relaxing in the sun. Couples, families and singles just soaking up the sun in these beautiful surroundings. There is plenty of seating around the park and it is well worth a visit either passing through or relaxing for an hour or two.

Super chill and relaxing. Great place to have an afternoon or evening snack. You can have a view of the Eiffel Tower from the gardens as well. On any given day, the gardens will have some type of musical event going on, which is free to attend. There are plenty of benches and chairs for you to lounge on.

Peaceful oasis. I found this park on a days walking through Paris. It is well laid out, there are gardens fountains and tennis courts too! Stroll through tree lined areas, take advantage of all of the peaceful quiet spots the park has to offer. A nice break from the bustle of the city

A place for peace and quiet. It was a lovely break from the bustle of Paris to stroll in the Luxembourg Gardens, complete with a small lake where one can rent tiny boats that are pushed by sticks. There are many benches and chairs to relax in - both in sun and shade and very oretty flower beds.

Quintessential France. On a sunny day all of France is here - the fitness enthusiasts doing their circuits, school children on the carousel or playground, going to the puppet theatre or riding ponies, older men playing petanque, tourists taking photos - some of mine are attached and will give you much more of an idea of what is like than my writing any more. Enjoy!
relax. Nice place to relax and walk around with friends. Good place to rest your feet after a long walk around the city.
A walk in the park. Beautiful park in Paris. Lucky to have been there on a sunny Sunday! Full of people enjoying this green area and seems to be the place to be for all runners!
worth a quick walk thru. very chillaxing place to visit with a beautiful pond area. did not go inside the palace. If you spend alot of time in versaille gardens, you can skip this one.
Nice spot but not unless its blooming. Went before the flowers were in bloom - it feel flat for me. Nice spot for coffee and a book. Try to hit this in late spring - you'll be glad you did.

nice. i was not sure it was a hotel. We were just strolling there for the garden and the picture perfect palace? or hotel? Its free - the entrance, i mean but we never bothered to go inside. we were outside the whole time. relaxing and taking pictures

Great place to walk and relax.. After long hours of walking and visiting, it is great to relax in the Luxembourg Gardens, and watch the senior men play Boules. Grab a chair and sit close to the water, especially during the summer. Enjoy the flowers and the sculptures.

Nice place for relaxing. We were here on a cloudy day and it was awesome. The Palace looking over the garden looks beautiful.. After a stroll here, a 4-5 min walk takes you to Pantheon. The artistic walls inside will amaze you for sure. Loved the visit..!!

My favorite relaxing place in Paris. I’ve seen the gardens in rainy and sunny days, in summer and in late autumn. They are always beautiful. It’s amazing how such simple flowers can look so gorgeous.No need to hurry when you are there. Sit at fountain and dream about something nice or have a sandwich or salad as Parisians do to feel the atmosphere of the place.

A lovely place to relax. I was very surprised to see rows and rows of chairs, instead of the usual one or two benches that I have experienced when visiting parks and gardens around the world. It is a very peaceful place and the gardens are very well kept, with water features to the side of the gardens along the walkways. I particularly liked the statues in the gardens. It is a shame that our brief visit was rushed due to a lack of time. A visit to these beautiful gardens would be a lovely way to spend a day for free, with a picnic lunch.
Great place for a quick recovery. Park is beautiful and not to big, so you can enjoy a lunch in this beautiful park. Tip: sculptures around the park are beautiful to see.

Beautiful.. I love Parisian gardens. They are so well maintained - and the luxembourg gardens are one of the most beautiful in Paris. It is great to see Parisians chilling out in them - they are well cared for and much loved places. Though, they do make your shoes quite dusty due to the chalky sand they use for the foot paths- don't wear your favourite shoes!

And the band played on. Visited July 2012. In Paris for 5 nights for 25th wedding anniversary. Loved Luxembourg gardens for a romantic stroll. Watched children sailing boats on the pond and listened to music from the bandstand. Went for coffee but weather dramatically changed, wind whipped up and took out sun umbrellas then the rain came down in torrents but the band played on regardless - made us smile and left fond memories, despite the weather.

Great place to relax. If you want to have a picnic, a jog, meet with friends or walk your dog, this place is perfect. It's so beautiful, lots of places to sit and chill, it's also very spacy and it has many different sections. Definitely worth a visit!

Experience Paris like the Parisians do. A visit to Luxembourg Gardens on a weekend is a must do if you want to feel like part of the Parisian family. It's a great place during the week, but it comes alive on the weekends, when the playgrounds are saturated with joyful children with watchful parents in tow and little ones chasing wooden boats in the pond. We were even surprised to be treated to an orchestra performance in the pavilion. A ham & cheese sandwich and a bottle of Orangina were a perfect picnic lunch on a park bench in the shade. Beautiful flowers, gardens, fountains and water features. It is Parisian family life at its best, and we felt like a local. We always make it a point to plan a trip to Luxembourg on a sunny weekend.

The ground were especially peaceful, and uncrowded with a sense of history.. The grounds were especially peaceful, and uncrowded with a sense of history. We visited the gardens several times and seemed to find something new and interesting with each visit. Even walking the paths in a light rain seemed to make the time more personal. The palace starting as a hotel begs the imagination. The pool, well you won't be disappointed.
Lovely picnic in the gardens. Bought a baguette, cheese, olives and wine and enjoyed it in the gardens, lovely! The weather was gorgeous, a nice change from eating in restaurants.

So lovely!. One of our favorite places to visit in Paris. Rent a boat to push around (even my 14 year old daughter loved this). We were there in rain and shine and they were both great visits. It's places like this that make you realize how much the Parisians value outdoor space and respite from the bustle of the city. It's so nice to see everyone sitting and relaxing in such a peaceful place.

Nice scenic walk. Nothing to write home about. Nice garden for a leisurely walk. We walked through the park fairly quickly en route to Notre Dame. It was pretty, but I've seen enough parks in my days.
Peaceful respite. Luxembourg Gardens is such a delight. Enjoy a peaceful respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. Pull up a seat and enjoy the view and the people watching!
Beautiful. This was a very large area and the families were enjoying themselves. I likes watching the small sail bouts in the small "lake."

Beautiful park and gardens. This is a lovely visit if you have a bit of spare time, the gardens were a bit disappointing when we visited, very few flowers and the grass looking a bit sad. There is a nice big pond and if you have small children you can hire little sailboats which they let sail across the pond.It was quite windy on the day we visited and the area around the fountain and benches has no stone, just very fine gravel, which was blowing everywhere making it quite unpleasant but I'm sure if you visit on a nice day it is quite spectacular.

Just another park. I don't quite understand why the French is making such a fuss of this park or most of the other "jardins" in Paris. It's nice, yes, there's a lot of statues, if your into that, and the castle is small and pretty. Flowers here and there, a little fountain and you have it.But at the end of the day this is just another park, there are lots and lots of other places much more interesting in Paris.

Delightful gardens. One of several utterly delightful parks in Paris. Very well manicured without feeling pretentious, wander, enjoy and hope it doesn't rain. Sometimes there is an art exhibition on the outside fence.

100 Monuments, Fountains and Statues - 25 of which are of French Queens.. What a fabulous Garden Park. What I really liked about it at first sight was that it is perfectly flat and open to the soft Paris sun. What Park can you visit that has the Country's Senate at one end and that maintains its grounds meticulously.Being a French Park this is basically for relaxing. Here one can enjoy one's lunch, read, sit on the grass, or sit on the provided chairs and benches or maybe listen to music on your phone. Yes, there are a few people jogging, - but don't worry, these are Americans.As you look around there are wide, white flat paths, palm trees, shady green trees, boxed shaped shrubs and yellow, red and orange flowers overflowing in their pots.The children are well catered for with their own play area and they can also hire a little sail-boat and float it on the large shallow pond.Three statues I particularly liked were the original model of the Statue of Liberty, the fountain for Eugine Delcroix and the statue of Saint Genevieve the patron saint of Paris.However, do not visit in mid-winter - not unless you really enjoy snow on the ground. Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Stunning oasis. Boulevard St. Michel is a little like the SoHo of NYC. Lots of little back streets to explore and the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens provides a great break from a busy day of visiting the city. Even in winter it was beautiful. It's also a short walk to Notre Dame
Relax. You need to spend some time in this place. It's gorgeous and very nice to walk and have a good conversation. Prepare some delicious food and have a picnic there!

Very well kept. Absolutely beautiful gardens. This was one I the most spectacular gardens I've ever visited, very well kept. I did like that the gardens were neat and restrained yet would have like to have also seen a few more natural areas. However there were a lot of native plants that were cleared labelled. Definitely worth a visit, lovely relaxed day out. Just wish my garden looked as beautiful as these.

Always something to see and do. Walking through these gardens is like walking through a picture. The gardens are well kept brightly colored and have beautiful views. You can picnic, walk, sit, bike or simply enjoy the views. There is even am area with little boats that can be operated. If you need to unwind and relax this is the place for you.

Lovely Sunday Afternoon. I was travelling with teen girls and my mother in law. We enjoyed a walk around in this lovely park. Don't miss the small pond with adorable sail boats for rent. If I had small children, I would DEFINITELY want to do this. It was very clean and well maintained. Lots of chairs to pull up to the water side or over for a picnic. Many people enjoying the gorgeous Paris day, but not overly crowded.

My favorite park in Paris . This is pure magic, best visited in the early morning to participate in walking or jogging with the locals. Don't miss the fountain and all the other amazing sculptures and statues in this park. Bring a camera or good phone with pixels to capture the moment.
Dusty and bare park. Big parts of park covered in sandy walk ways. Where is all the grass?I found it quite sad really. And if there is grass only being allowed on it were pigeons. So sad!

A beautiful place to stroll. We happened on the Luxembourg Gardens and they were lovely. There is a wonderful picnic area (bring wine) a fabulous play area (I believe there is a fee) and just a pleasant area to walk through.
One of the best gardens of Paris. Beautiful relaxing gardens with great views. The streets around the garden are full of interesting small restaurants and shops.
Relaxing moment in the city. A nice stop while walking around to relax a bit, have a snack and enjoy the sun. The pond in the middle is nice and allows to play with the sailing boats.

must seen. We visited the gardens on Sunday the day of music in June. The gardens are in the center of Paris, with a lake and a beautiful chateu of Maria de medici. So calm, you can walk, play with small toy boats, or just relax listeniing music and enjoing the sun.

Relax in the sun. Fantastic garden in the heart of Paris. Bring your picnic, grab a seat and sit by the fountain, eat on your own or in good company and enjoy the sun in winter as well as in summer. It is located next to the Senat that you can visit and Musée du Luxembourg where nice temporary exhibitions are usually hosted.
Nice neat French garden. A nicely manicured French garden. It has benches and chairs so people can hang out. Well used by the locals. The negative are cigarette butts plentiful in some places.

Beautiful gardens, lovely walk. Flower beds and sculptures, orangerie with modern exhibitions -perfect afternoon outdoor, can have picnic, play tennis or just seat in the sun by the fountain with the book
Great hangout place. Beautiful and well maintained gardens. Nice place to hang out and have a picnic. Tons of chairs that you can move around the terrace and sit where you'd like.

Relaxing Open Courtyards, Fountains and Gardens. This is an easy to walk to area that's beautifully maintained, near many significant Parisian attractions and worth a stop to take a break and enjoy on a beautiful day.

Absolutely gorgeous!. We spent an afternoon at the gardens and it was spectacular. So many beautiful plants, statues and flowers. The only thing we were not prepared for was the grass...Paris does not have nice grass...plain and simple. Most of their parks have large dirt areas that we are just not used to...it was different! Lovely park though...very beautiful!

take a run there :-). one of the most beautiful parks in Paris. Love it and I try to come back there every year. this year I went twice there for a run and this is a nice experience too.. enjoy the beautiful gardens, sit on a bench and watch people or bring your breakfast or lunch there... definitely worth it :-)
Favorite place in Paris. Great place to hang out and people watch. Especially around the water pond on a sunny day. Bring a cappuccino and a sandwich -- or a good book.

Beautiful. Beautiful Place, nice to sit, relax and enjoy the garden.
Paris has a lot of these places, but this one is very beautiful.
Very clean as everything around the city.

Relaxing break from the busy streets. We popped in here for a picnic after visiting the Pantheon. We got there via the L'Open Tour bus which stops right outside the gardens. The gardens are in a good condition by Paris standards but they are busy. A lot of the lawns are apparently off limits. I say apparently because we weren't chased off any nor did i see any boards that specifically prohibited access. In the middle of the gardens opposite the palace entrance is a big pond where you can hire toy boats for sailing. There were some musicians in the gardens as well, fitting for the relaxed atmosphere.

The gardens are worth the trip!. Be sure to stop and take in the amazing views at these gardens. We stopped at the cafe and had a coffee and just enjoyed the beautiful space. They have chairs and benches all over the park. If you have your children with you be sure to rent a sail boat and allow them to sail it in the pretty water "pond" in front of the palace. If you have time, take a book and just relax in all the beauty.
Nice Gardens. Great place to walk around when the weather is nice. The summers here are the best bring a book and read on the greens.

Beautiful and Stunning. The most lovely garden I've ever seen. The grass was green, the flowers colorful and in full bloom, and the temperatures were perfect. This garden is well maintained and manicured. This is a great place to take a simple stroll or sit in the shade and read your favorite book, or have a quiet and intimate conversation with a friend or loved one. A highly recommend a stop at this beautiful place while in Paris.
nice little place in Latin district. All is OK - plenty of chairs for resting, plenty of boats for children to play.Rather interesting statues around, especially that of Calderon.

A really lovely bit of Paris. A trip to Jardin du Luxembourg has become almost obligatory for me when I visit Paris. It's such a great place to sit for a moment or two and enjoy the surroundings. Most people I take tend to share my appreciation for it's elegance and general peacefulness (despite being fairly popular). I usually include it as part of a walk around the St Germain / Latin Quarter areas. I recommend grabbing a baguette on the way and having lunch there. Plenty of seats around.

Nice way to spend a lazy afternoon . Beautiful grounds. Walking paths. Places to sit around the lakes. You will see children with toy boats in the lake. There was live music in one area that we walked by. Plenty of open green space. Overall pleasant relaxing visit
Beautiful Luxemburg Gardens. A romantic place for walking, talkling, thinking. A quite place and in the same time a lot of events happen there - music, a lot of people.

Best Parisian Park. A huge pond, picturesque trees and bushes, and a spectacular stone fountain, this park his it all! I found the pond and the shaded area around the fountain great places to eat lunch or just to rest at, and the park is extremely easy to navigate through.
A must See When in Paris ! One of Hemingway's Favorites. Yes The Luxembourg Gardens are a must see when in Paris. Hemingway lived near by and loved to stroll here. Don't miss it.

Heerlijke plek om uit te rusten. Jardin du Luxembourg is situated in the fancy area of "Quartier Latin". There is a hughe variety of high class shops in the neighbourhoud (a lot of the well known brands have a store here). But this park gives you a good rest * As in all of Paris there is a hugh number of chairs. * A nice coffee is available at the restaurant (count up from 2,50 for expresso to 5,50 euro for a latte as everywhere in Paris). Chairs and service were OK when we were there last june* There are some other facilities that offer food en drink (stalls)* They have toilet (paid and "hosted', clean but do not expect to much). Be aware there is no lift and you need to take the stairs down.* The fountain, gardens, and palace give you a nice view and photo opportunity* It is not to overcrowed * Sometimes if your lucky, you can see a proffesor teaching his or her class here!* You can avoid stairs in the park. Getting around: Because i travelled with someone less able ot walk, some information about the BusThere are to major bus lines that stop at either sides of the park near the entrance. We got of the 85 from le Marias. Get your bus 82 to the eiffel tower, stop at "Ecole Militaire" and walk across the park, under the Eiffel tower , across the Seine to get a bus ther to your next area of interestOf course you can use a Metro as well...
Very pleasurable . Was a perfect place to chill out in the sun, we grab ourselves a picnic and enjoyed the surroundings, very relaxing and well looked after.
Lovely even in the summer. Paris gardens are always lovely. I'm sure this would have earned 5 stars, if I had gone in peak season
Perfect for a sunny day. Great place to stop on a sunny day to read, write, or just soak up the atmosphere! It's in a good location to combine it with a trip to the Montparnasse cemetery.

Time your visit depending on what you like. This large and lovely park has many faces. You can visit it for the monuments within it or you can use the park as a way to glimpse aspects of French life. I like to sit when there are few people in the park (early on a weekday) to enjoy the light and the design. I enjoy it as much on the weekends when it is used by families for exercise or to entertain their children. The large pond in summer afternoons is gorgeously alive with sailboats large and small. The trail around the outer edges of the park are used by joggers on Sunday morning. Biking children with (often) their fathers, also on bikes, having a conversation while riding is perhaps my favorite thing to watch.

Picnic at the park. We wanted to take a picnic to the park on this visit, so we went to the lower level of Le Bon Marche where they have a fabulous Food Court. A bit of this, a bit of that and Voila! It's an easy stroll to the garden and there are usually chairs to spare! It was delightful!
Beautiful gardens - enjoy walking, running, picnics. Beautiful, manicured gardens! Stayed on Rue Madame so walked through the gardens most days. Very Parisian.
Europe 2015. Just beautiful to behold. With the pond in the middle and surrounded by lawn and trees to sit under and watch the passing parade

Being seen and not to view. When viewing French Impressionism art where there are public gardens, it is usually of people strolling as if wanting to see others and of being seen, which means viewing space and nothing to obscure them. Hence, few trees which is less enjoyable a walk in the heat. The idea of preening while walking was also a motif, which means few areas to recline. There is not much to view there and few people today have the need to preen in gardens. There are some seats there, but most people want to sit in the grass and every now and then an officer would chase them off and when he left, they would sit in the grass, which means they do not have many areas that are for the public to relax. They did have a Great War exhibit outside the gardens of battle areas then and now in France. That was very interesting, but nothing to really view in the garden.

Beautiful place to picnic, walk, run, or sit and take in Paris. We stayed in a hotel near here so we had the daily pleasure of walking through the gardens. They are exquisite. Perfect spot to take a nap, relax, get some exercise or people watch!

Gardens open to the public. This is a garden that is available at no charge (although the bathroom has a fee). It is large, relaxing and enjoyable to tour. You can rent small boats to sail on the pond, or just park yourself on a bench and enjoy the sights.
Nice to sit and have lunch. Sort of out of the way if you're heading other the central sightseeing place. Good to stop here and eat your packed up lunch if you're going to the catacombs.

Teenager review. These gardens were absolutely beautiful. I'm 16 and I went with my sister (14), brothers (10&12), parents, and grandma. My sister and I had fun just walking around and taking pictures. For my brothers, there was a large fountain/pool of water thing where you could rent a mini boat and play with it in the water. They had fun racing their boats. They also really liked the playground, and I have to admit it was a pretty cool play ground. All around the park there were people having picnics and sitting and reading. Definitely good if you're looking for a laid back afternoon.

Take a lovely walk. This is a lovely garden to walk through, for no other reason than because! We visited Notre Dame de Paris and then walked through the gardens on our way to the Catacombs (about 1.8 miles away). For an American family, Luxembourg Gardens showcases Paris life: Parisians sitting on chairs talking, college students meeting in a group on the grass, children playing with boats in the pond, families and couples strolling, workers eating lunch outside and chatting. It was a great way to remind the teens that sometimes you just stroll and smell the flowers. I would love to walk thru there every day!

A lovely way to spend an afternoon.. We picked up food at Gosselin Paris and enjoyed a lovely picnic at Luxembourg Gardens on a warm, sunny day. It seems to be a popular spot for locals and tourists alike to enjoy on a nice day. Very picturesque and a relaxing spot with a view of the Eiffel Tower as an added bonus.

Visit to escape sightseeing tour of city for a couple hours.. Beautiful, relaxing gardens to give you a break from the hectic, noisy city around you. My husband, 13 yr old son and I spent a few hours at these gardens during a stay in Paris sightseeing a few days ago. It was lovely, such beautiful gardens. Our son is a little old for children's playgrounds now but we walked past the playground and were surprised by how big it was with so much there for children, under the age of about 12, to do. The remote sailing boats looked fun too.

There's also a Zoo!. We wanted a culled out day and thought these gardens would the trick and we were pleasantly surprised to find a zoo inside the gardens and I mean and half descent zoo! Make you see the gardens and animals

Lively, peaceful, lovely, haven.. This garden area has something for everyone....Do you want quiet? It is here. Do you want live music? Come on! Do you want to sail a home-made sailboat in a resplendent setting? Bring it on! Maybe you want to sit among flowers and rest. Ok. This is your place. Maybe you like to watch young people play and laugh and live. It's right here. This is a piece of heaven in the middle of many historical sights that may be overcrowded at times.
Spacious. We had a sunny day...plenty of space...seats all around to laze in the sun. A rest from the hectic attractions around Paris.
always beautiful. a central hub for parisians and for tourists, filled with leafy lanes and fountains. it's close to other landmarks but stands on its own as a place to visit

An oasis in the busy city. Open green spaces in Paris are at a premium. But this hits all the buttons. Easy to combine with Panthéon, marché Mouffetard and Jardin des Plantes. Use Vélib, of course! The unexpected highlight was the amazing art exhibition on l'orangerie. And free too.
Classic French Parc in the Middle of Paris. A beautiful, leafy parc right in the middle of the Left Bank, with a water feature where generations of children have floated their toy boats.
Great fro the young ones!. Beautiful, relaxing with plenty for the young ones to do. You do have to pay at the parks. It does get dusty.

SERENE ESCAPE. did not intend to go here, was walking from notre dame to the Panatheon and got lost and came across this amazing AMAZING site. just the place to relax on a warm afternoon or have a picnic lunch.

Lovely Place to Stroll!. This was on my list of things to see in Paris, but time was ticking and I didn't think my boyfriend and I would make it, but we happened to be in the area one day and decided to walk through.We didn't spend a lot of time here, but it was lovely and very relaxing. We even happened upon a mother duck and her ducklings. Well cared for park area and worth a stroll if you happen to be nearby.

Probably my favorite park. Every trip to Paris includes many visits to these Gardens. Nothing is better than sitting in a chair (ok, truthfully you take two chairs: one for your body and one for your legs and then you snooze and read) by the lake. It is fun to watch the kids with their ever present boats. Depending on the season, the flowers are so beautiful here. We were there a little early this year so they were not in their splendor but it was still beautiful. The only problem with this park is it is very dusty. You can take the RER and it will exit you right by the entrance.
garden. Its a nice enjoyable place!!! I couldnt find a restroom easily but overall its good for a family outing!!!

Used to love.... Luxembourg Gardens was one of my favorite places to go in Paris, until my last visit. I have never seen more people. It really looses the romance where there are thousands of people jammed packed into a space. Maybe it would be nice to go back in the winter.

A Peaceful and Quiet Busy-ness. So much to see and hear and enjoy about this part of Paris. We went there to check things out and walk around. Great statues and fountain. There is a large man-made pond/fountain encased with stone that is used for sailing toy boats. Highly recommened! If you have children aged 5-12, bring them and rent a toy sailboat for three and a half euro for 30 minutes, or by the hour and your kid (especially boys) will be entertained! Restrooms are difficult to find, but they exist. When you're done, head across the street and enjoy a great beverage!
So peaceful as evening fell. Quiet, beautiful, surrounded by the attractive busy streets. I always love the photography exhibits around the fence.
Beautiful. We enjoyed a nice afternoon here! We especially had fun with the toy sail boats. Walkable from the Notre Dame area.
The original model for the S tatue of Liberty.. Gardens were free, museum had a charge. Was great to see the original model for the Statue of Liberty.

Enchanting and Beautiful!. The Luxembourg Gardens are stunning. Such an enchanting place to picnic or just stroll through for a few hours. Or jus stop by and watch the children sail the wooden boats on the pond with the palace as a backdrop. Every area of the gardens are wonderful.
great for kids. Very fun, little wooden boats to set for sail in the pond. And very fund play ground for 10 year olds with an amazing zip line.

Relaxing walk through the park.... We took an hour long stroll through the gardens. It was very pretty, and seems like a great place to just relax for a bit. There was a lot of nice scenery and interesting paths to walk.

Lunch in Luxembourg Gardents. Make sure to picnic in Luxembourg Gardens, you won't be disappointed. Bring some wine and stop at the local stores for your wine, bread, cheese and charcuterie. The grounds are spectacular and huge-- we wish we had all afternoon to spend there.

Grab a sandwich, grab a green chair, sit and watch!. Best spot for people watching and enjoying your surroundings, particularly at the fountain located in the northeast corner just east of the Palace. Also love their museum; the Tudors exhibition was fantastic!

Beautiful. These gardens are beautiful and full of activities for families and local residents. It felt more like a great place to hang out if you lived in Paris than like a tourist attraction. However, it would be a great place to bring a picnic!

Don't miss the Medici Fountain. Wonderful and beautiful park to relax in. We took a picnic lunch and enjoyed the peacefulness and views with many Parisians. And seeing that beautiful fountain only adds to the experience. Enjoy . . .

Luxembourg a Gardens - a relaxing place on a Sunday. We stumbled into the gardens on our way back from bike riding through the city on a Sunday. It's a fascinating place to watch Parisians at play. The gardens are Hugh, and pretty, but it was more interesting to see people sitting watching an excercise class, or sitting beside the lawns reading., bocce and chess also occur here. We had a drink and a snack in the cafe in the park, and whilst it was not great value, it was a lovely end to a pleasant visit

Beautiful morning run. A beautiful garden with some beautiful architecture inside - particularly enjoyable on a crisp spring morning when there aren't too many people there other than joggers and the occasional person meditating...
Beautiful!. This was great to stroll through on our first beautiful day in Paris. I would recommend that anyone exploring the city make a stop here.

Gardens Deluxe. Our hotel was near this lovely large park, so we walked through several times. This is a well-maintained and heavily used park in a high-density area. On a fine afternoon, there is one area of lawn open for sitting, and it is covered with students and families relaxing and chatting with languid animation. The other lawns are off limits--look but don't touch. The children's playground, the tennis courts, the chess tables, the petanque grounds, and especially the large pond with model sailboats were all in full use.There are some sculptures, some flower beds, and lots of shade trees, but this is not a garden retreat, this is the Left Bank's backyard, and they love it.

Beautiful park in the city center. Great place to relax and reflect after a long day full of sightseeing. It is closely located to the major attractions, so that one can get there easily by walking. place is full of trees, flowers, monuments. Enjoy)

Beautiful gardens to spend a sunday morning before or after lunch.. I love the museum inside Luxembourg Gardens. It always has very well selected expositions. The gardens are fabulous with huge trees and lots of grass where to read or just lay there enjoying the atmosphere.

Very nice park. Totally recommend to pay a visit when weather is good. Very relaxing to sit in the metalic chairs that cover the park. Worth it go enjoy an apres-midi with some friends for a long walk. Its besides in one of my favourite districts in Paris.
Beautiful. We stayed very close to the Luxembourg Gardens and they are definitely worth visiting. The gardens are gorgeous and there are many breathtaking monuments on the inside.

Packed with people but still beautiful. A lovely spot - I've never seen it so crowded though! There is a nice little pond in the middle where children play with sailboats. Worth stopping by and sitting on a bench to absorb the ambience. The garden has lovely flowers.

Beautiful space for a walk or a relaxing picnic in the sun. This space is beautiful and is thoroughly recommended if you want a relaxing walk in beautiful surroundings - lots of places to sit by the lovely ponds, the beautiful Luxembourg palace and a nice place to go to read, catch up with friends or have a picnic lunch.
Nice Saturday afternoon. Went on a great Saturday afternoon. Everyone was out. Just a nice place for a stroll and a break Kids with boats were fun to watch.
Beautiful Garden. Very beautiful garden, where you can just relax and eat ice cream :) Also you can rent small sailboats for 30minutes (2.50€) and they sail on a bond.

Jardin magnifique/Beautiful garden to visit!. Un très beau jardin à voir que l’on soit Parisien ou touriste. On peut également en profiter pour admirer le Sénat.
Very beautiful garden you should go and see, whether you are a Parisian or a tourist. You can also see the French Senate from there. Enjoy!

Have lunch or just stop a smell the flowers. This park is a great place to just stop and relax. Take in the beauty of the flowers in bloom, sit by the huge fountain and watch children play with their wooden boats in the water, admire the magnificent palace, or just have a quiet lunch. Go by yourself, with family or with someone your love and just admire a wonderful garden in the LQ
This place is a must!. Just great place for a walk or for a picnic with french wine, cheese and baguette. You will enjoy the nice gardens and monuments around this place.

Hidden Gem. This park situated in the heart of Paris is a superb place to spend a few hours and re charge your feet. The gardens are beautiful with lots of seating and space to eat your lunch. Parents watch their children sail boats on the water in the centre which you can hire for a few euros while there is an abundance picturesque views including the Eiffel Tower in the background. A brilliant place for mid day rest.
Do yourself a favour - go here.. This is without a doubt the best location in Paris to sit, drink coffee, people-watch, and admire the outstanding gardens.
Take a walk. You can spend your time to relax.No noise,no many people,lovely and peaceful place!I just loved this place

Perfect on a summer's day. We were tired and had been walking around Paris all day. We sat by the water on the green deck chairs and relaxed in the sun. Children were playing with toy boats and the building facing us was beautiful! If you're in Paris on a nice day, head here

Park complex just off Boul' Mich. This is one of my favorite parks in Paris, as it brings back memories of 50 years ago, when I lived nearby and would spend endless hours here, sitting on one of their "pay" chairs, doing my reading and soaking in the ambience. At the northern end of the park is the Luxembourg Palace, built in 1615-1645 as the royal residence of the regent Marie de Médicis, mother of Louis XIII of France. Since 1958 it is the seat of the French Senate. In front of it is a large basin where children let their mini-sailboats ply the water, and the rest is basically flowerbeds at the center and treed areas with mainly chestnut trees providing shade at the side, including the typical heavily pruned "square" trees at the southern flanks. In the north-eastern corner is a bandstand where on several occasions we have experienced different music groups playing, recently a Salvation Army band, on an other occasion a group of music students from Slovakia. All over the park there are a great number of beautiful statues and the famous Medici Fountain is located at the southern end, with at its back the intriguing little noticed Léda fountain. An enchanting place to visit.

Absolutely breathtaking. This is one of my favorite places in Paris. The French know how to create common spaces for their citizens. This park is absolutely gorgeous. It’s worth having lunch at the café on the property and then taking some time to lounge if you’re touring. The café has a brunch-like menu and the staff is so attentive. After lunch pull up a chair around the water fountain and enjoy the view or there’s space for picnicking in the park under trees. There is paid public toilette available.

Beautiful park in the middle of Paris. Spent a relaxing few hours in the park strolling and taking in the sughts. Attended a great live concert.There were many secluded spaces and it wasn't crowded at all.Definitely worth a visit.
Best Outdoor Space in Paris. Plenty of space to walk, exercise, sit in the shade or bask in the sun. Beautiful gardens in bloom. Preferred "shortcut" to other sites.
Cool. Nice park but it is not the greatest, they have a copy of Statue of Liberty from NYC, it is a nice place to be with friends and relax.

Great park to spend a few hours. This is really truly a beautiful park that gives you a good sense of french gardens. The play area for children costs 2.50 euros per child and 1.50 per adult, but our 6 year old enjoyed it for a few hours. There are many people relaxing throughout the gardens and its a great place for a picnic.

If only one day in Paris this is a must!. I have traveled to Paris many times and always return to stay and to dwell in the Left Bank because of Luxembourg Gardens. Regardless of the season I love this magical park that lives in this very busy cosmopolitan city of beauty. It is a true must for everyone, children, teens, adults, seniors. You can sit by the side of a beautiful garden or the pond or walk the paths or jog/run or picnic or read or sleep or browse the artwork located on the gates or people watch.... you choose, but don't miss this lovely park on your next visit, it is a Paris must! One cold, windy December morning I saw Santa dressed in all his glory sitting in a chair beside the pond with a bag filled of little toys that he was giving away to the toddlers passing by... It was a beautiful memory.

Great place for a coffee and people watching. Lovely formal gardens, well worth a stroll around or to idle a couple of hours away reading a book - about the best place in central paris for a bit of greenery and (relative) quiet
An oasis in the city. We were charmed by the Jardin. Beautiful landscape, statues were exquisite. Really appreciated out time out here.

Nice gardens!. These gardens are lovely. They have a nice atmosphere and they look very pretty. It is a good place to visit and they are fairly busy but not crowded. Entrance was free and we had a great time near the fountain. Good place for walking and exploring.
