Excellent place to chill out. This is a very nice park. There are many statues including one of a greek actor holding what looks like a cell phone and is taking a selfie. It is actually a small cue card help up so he can read his lines. Nice place to walk around and to sit by the fountain.

Beautiful and relaxing. This is a much nicer park than the more famous Tuilleries - more grass, more art, more chairs and benches, more things to do. It's a great place to bring a lunch to eat while you watch the world go by, or you can find a quieter spot in one of the side gardens or near the Medici Fountain and read a book. It's always fun to watch the kids having sailboat races in the big fountain behind the Senate building, or rent one of the boats yourself and join in the fun.

Beautiful Gardens - Grottos, Statues, and Flowers. This is a bit off the beaten path - and a step cousin to the larger gardens in central Paris. The Luxembourg Palace is closed to tourists, but a nice classical architecture to enjoy. The formal gardens are beautiful, filled with flowers. Be sure to wander to the Medici area to see the grotto and some of the statues scattered in the park setting. Really lovely break from museums and tour lines.

Beautiful and popular. This is a lovely place for a lunch, reading a good book, sunbathing or whatever and it's free. There is a large fountain where you can rent small sailboats with country flags in them. Ice cream and toy vendors are nearby for a treat in the shade. Lots of chairs for sitting all around the grounds.

Like Central Park in NY only smaller. That was my sister's impression after she visited the gardens. The eastern end in front of the Senate building contains beautifully manicured lawns, topiaries, sculptures, and fountains. The western end has parks, playgrounds, tennis courts, etc. The gardens are large, and we enjoyed a peaceful walk around them. Well worth the trip.

Worth walking through. Take a walk thru the gardens and find the fountain/pool where the little children are sailing boats. Very peaceful place to sit and relax. Be sure to sit only in the areas allowed - otherwise there are loud whistles to get your attention and move you off the lawns!

Nice to just sit and watch life. Lovely place with plenty iof shade during the heat of the day. Lots of chairs for sitting and lovely setting for an evening picnic, but not allowed on the grass! Parakeets living in trees.
Beautiful Gardens. Had a picnic here. Lovely gardens with seats everywhere and lots of little areas to relax. Can be quite busy.
Relaxing in the sun. Families walking and playing in the fresh air. Lots of joggers, people painting in the sun around the fountains. A great relaxing way to spend a few hours
Great family afternoon out. Sailing the boats was a hit for our kids. And we could relax with a drink while watching them! The gardens are stunning. You could spend a whole day here.
Lovely rest stop. The Gardens are lovely, busy. Great place to sit and people watch on a nice day. Both sunny and shady areas with lots of seating.

Beautiful place. Lots of chairs and benches, where you can stop for lunch or just a rest between the day.
You can find drinks and food in the kiosks around or in the restaurant, close to the Palace.
The tip, on hot days, is to find a shadow, of many trees around, and lie down for a while, maybe take a nap.

where were the flowers?. Was expecting a beautiful paris garden as I'd seen great pictures, but it looked like they possibly had a light frost recently? The flowers were pretty pathetic & nonexistent in some places where there should have been nice flowers. No one was floating boats. All in all pretty blah...but I must have just been there at a bad time

Beautiful with areas for everyone. Beautiful park with bright flowers, shaded areas and open space to enjoy. It was very busy when we went, but we were able to find the bench and take a rest quickly. People were walking dogs, running, children were playing and Parisians were enjoying the outdoor space. A nice way to enjoyA picnic or take a break from seeing the sights.

Interesting urban park. In the heart of the City, surrounded by a number of unique buildings and sites. Close to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter. Worth walking through, beware of morning joggers on the path though!
luxembourg. great place just to hang out and relax.. would always stop here just for a stroll or to sit and pass some time. only downside is it can be really busy come nice weather

Lovely place. Been here a few times in different seasons
Always such a lovely, well manicured, peaceful place. Beautiful gardens. Just watch the people sitting in the sun, riding boats on the dam, playing chess under the trees, enjoying life. All cities need something like this
Very beautiful gardens! . It's amazing place to walk after louvre visit ( if you still have energy) Lovely Meadows and cozy benches, shapes of bushes and composition are so neat and nice...

Gorgeous beyond gorgeous. These gardens are so beautiful it's hard to believe they r real what an idyllic spot to just sit n chat in middle of the city n bustling day
Bring wine n picnic n just enjoy
A lovely place to sit for a while. What a great place to sit and people watch- jogging, saliing boats, pony rides or just to walk through. even better when the sun is shining
Luxembourg in Autum is so pretty. The hop on hop of bus will drop you of at the gate. These gardens would be worth seeing any time of the year. Great place to sit and rest and look

f you want to have some rest.... A wonderful garden, in middle of the busy streets. Here you can have your peace, sunbath, even picnic if you want. There is always something happening, people just love this place.

Delightful Park in Paris. This park is massive. Great to just walk around and take in the views or sit on the grass with some lunch and people watch. Only thing to watch is if the wind gets up you get white dust in your eyes. The trees, sculptures and gardens are just beautiful.

Love this Park!. Has an authentic French carousel complete with brass rings! Wonderful puppet theater and great playground, which the only downside is you have to pay to enter. A great break for the children from the frenzy Paris can be.

Great spot to visit in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is often overlooked as a great place to visit in Paris in the 6th Arrondisement. The peaceful atmosphere and beautifully landscaped gardens, rich with colorful foliage, make a tranquil setting for a quiet afternoon in Paris. Great photo opportunities, places to pick up food or just sit at a cafe table and soak in the ambience.

A quiet oasis. We were overwhelmed by crowds in Paris so needed a break. This is it - we were staying several blocks away and decided to visit. The Luxembourg Gardens are lovely, do not miss the Medici fountain! Highly recommend taking a tourist break and enjoying this park.

Great place for picnic. Luxembourg Gardens was a great place for relaxing after a long day and having a picnic. The garden is well maintained and very pretty, featuring lots of beautiful statues. We went to Luxembourg Gardens on a bit of windy day, so there wasn't that much crowd. Very pleasant place to just wander around or read a book. Peaceful and beautiful!

If you like parks, definitely visit this place. Great park! Many thanks to Maria Medici for creating such a wonderful place with beautiful sculptures)) One thing I cannot understand about Paris parks - why is the ground covered with this dusty-sand thing? Is there no other material that can be used? When strong wind blows, you may end up being covered with dust))

Our favorite park in Paris. We rented an apartment in Paris near Luxembourg this past month and, after a few days of drizzle, the weather got very warm - this park was fantastic to walk in both conditions. From tennis courts to beautiful roses, from sunbathers to joggers from the local college- the place had everything going on everyday. We would walk the park once a day and it was always enjoyable. We never felt like our wallet was in danger (like at the eiffel tower and other landmarks) and the locals always seemed to be enjoying themselves. Book a dinner somewhere close by (La Cuisine du Phillippe for example) and walk thru this park on your way to dinner - it's the best!

Picnicking in the park . We had a really splendid time here a massive park where kids can run and play there's also a large boating lake where you can hire model boats and sail them. What we liked most was you can take a picnic with you and in this particular garden there are lots and lots of chairs .There are toilets dotted around the garden there is a map of the garden outlining where they are located a snip for 50cents half a euro.

Enjoyable Strolls. When I visited with my partner a few months ago it was raining - yet I still found the visit a delight. Perhaps more should be said of the intimacy that comes from finding shelter under the same umbrella?It was a joy to see the variety of flowers on display around the manicured lawns. The wide use of colour in the floral displays was something I particularly enjoyed. I liked weaving in and out the trees in the gardens too taking time to view the statue displays. Stumbling across a singing group also added to the experience. The rain did not dull them and the personable happy birthday they sang to a troupe member brought good cheer to all watching. If it had been sunny it would have been the perfect place for a picnic although for those that travel light there is a cafe in the grounds. I think that if you enjoy being outdoors or gardening in any way you will enjoy a visit here.

Great place to picnic or laze in the sun. I missed this the first time i went to Paris. Made it the second time round and it is a massive complex with well maintained gardens, ponds with toy boats. Thankfully, the sun was out and the place was packed with tourists and locals picnicking in the sun or just taking a leisurely walk. Definitely worth a quick visit if not a afternoon picnic.

Picnic in the park. I had read up about this park and we decided we would have a picnic here. Such beautiful grounds to walk around and take a seat and appreciate the beauty of the park which is incredibly well maintained!We spent an hour and a half just enjoying our time in this gorgeous park and could even see the Eiffel Tower too!
Play with the boats!. We had a fantastic time hiring a couple of sailboats on the boating pond. It's 3.50 for half an hour and it's the best fun! Why just leave that sort of fun to little kids?

Very Grand Palace.. On the day of our visit to the Luxembourg Gardens it was very cold and blustery and almost deserted. I am sure a visit to the Gardens in Summer would be best in order to see the garden beds filled with colourful flowers. The Luxembourg Palace is very grand and a surprise for first time visitors.

Great Spot to Relax. The gardens are easily accessible and a wonderful place to sit, snack, and people-watch or nature-watch. My wife and I spent two hours just relaxing and soaking in the scenes. And it's free!

Visit to Luxembourg gardens. It is a great facility to have in a big city like Paris. You can stroll in the cool of the evening. There are sports areas and picnic areas. There are exhibotions . It is lovely. Well worth a visit

Relax and Soak it in.... There are many things Paris does well, but few things are better than their public parks and green spaces. The Luxembourg Gardens are a case in point. This is not just an enchanting tourist attraction, but a living, breathing part of Parisian life. Beautifully manicured grounds and statuary meld with Parisians whiling away a sunny weekend afternoon--reading, talking with friends, watching their kids play on the playground, and more. We stopped at an amazing nearby patisserie, grabbed a baguette, some cheese, and a bottle of wine (they opened it and supplied cups!) and camped out on a bench to talk and watch the world go by. Behind us, a group of friends played charades. Then we meandered over to watch some men play petanque and tried to figure out the rules and objectives of the game (much like curling). In all the tourist hustle and bustle of seeing one site after another, this was one perfect gem of an afternoon...Watch for signage, as some grass you cannot sit on. (Plenty of seating is offered, however).
beautiful. wonderful place to sit and relax after a day of walking! Very large but beautiful flowers and foliage.

I love these gardens! Classic Paris!. This garden palace park is a wonderful refuge; the palace, the formal garden, statutes, medici fountain, temporary artwork on the perimeter of the property, the pond for boats, the benches and chairs. Must see pitstop for fun, photography or to sit and watch the world go by.

A great place to loiter on a summer evening. I never get tired of strolling around these wonderful gardens. It feels odd to pass the armed security guards outside the Senate building on the edge of the gardens and then find oneself inside one of the best city parks in the world. There is a real sense of being in a green haven away from the hustle and bustle of France's throbbing capital city. Some of the landscaped lawns are quite exposed but there are still plenty of places to find some shade, especially the tree-lined avenue to the northern side of the gardens. These were absolutely full of families, young people and romantics of every kind the two evenings we walked through the gardens in early June. We also liked the excellent photographic displays attached to the railings on the southern side of the gardens overlooking Rue Vaugirard. You might want to pop in to the Le Luxembourg brasserie at 58 Boulevard St Michel after touring the gardens - we enjoyed a very good and reasonably priced (by Paris standards at least!) evening meal and late night drink there.

Luxembourg Gardens. What a beautiful spot to picnic or just visit, very close to the Sorbonne! A delightful place to walk around and enjoy the Parian horticulture, in the heart of the Latin Quarter....
Beautiful. Beautiful oasis in the heart of the Left Bank. The Orangeries had 2 interesting exhibits - and the toilets are clean!
Relaxing and beautiful. If the weather is sunny, you should visit this garden. You'll not regret at all. The park is big and you can sit whenever you want!
Beautiful. Beautiful! There are plenty of chairs and benches, grass and sand, garden and alleys, castle and park- all in the middle of the city. Gogogo for some time off.

lovely relaxing gardens. the fountain was very beautiful.take your coffee and croissant and enjoy the peace and quiet.there is a cafe here and a pretty boating lake.the palace is spectaular.a highlight of our trip

Luxembourg Gardens -- take a leisurely stroll!. Beautiful place to stroll around and take in the local people and the beauty of the grounds. We were there on a rainy day in early spring and it was still gorgeous! Highly recommend!

Overhyped but worth a look. Nice enough Gardens, but in a city with a wealth of attractions I wouldn't go out of my way to visit. May be a nice venue to sit in the sun with a picnic and a bottle of wine, and to embrace some Parisian people watching. But don't expect the wonders of Central Park in New York or St James's park in London... it's not in that league.
Beautiful. A beautiful place to visit. Lots of nice shady places to sit on a hot Parisian day. Beautiful flowers and gardens. well worth a visit.

A relaxing way to spend an Afternoon. Every trip to Paris includes time spent whiling away the hours in the Luxembourg Gardens. We love strolling the paths, or watching children push boats across the pool. Many runners avail themselves of the paths as well. Our favorite is to pull up a couple of green chairs, soak up some sun, and people watch. Look for the model of the Statue of Liberty. (There is a larger one on the Seine, facing in the direction of the U.S., by Radio France.). They often have a good art exhibit at the Senate.

My favorite. Amazing park. Hands down, my favorite!I could never get bored from this place. There is something about it that makes you fall in love with it and it makes you want to keep coming back!You must go!

Hot and relaxing. The weather was in our favour today so we went into the garden as a finish to our latin quarter walk tour. The palace is stunning and a garden was huge with full of flowers. Really enjoyed our stop there foe an hour and walked around the fountain too. Sadly can't go into the building but it is beautiful from the outside too.
Great place to relax after sightseeing. I love this park loads of place to sit and enjoy people watching and realx after long day of sight seeing. great place to bring food and have a picnic.

A beautiful garden near the palace. Just lovely to be able to amble through.. Gardens are magnificent and vast. A lovely place to stroll through. So much to see and the beautiful fountain is really eye catching.

Nice to relax. We visited during May so the weather was just perfect, sunny but not too hot. The garden is very well kept, with tons of people lying on the grass, listening to music, reading, having a picnic, drinking French wine or just napping. Lovely to go lay down and relax. There are lots of chairs to sit down by the water fountain facing the palace. So nice!

beautiful grounds. It is a beautiful, well-kept park, with many nice spots where you can sit around, have a picnic, watch the kids play, or just go out for a stroll. Many people go there on weekends, but the place is so big, you can always find a quiet spot to relax.
A gem in the middle of Paris. A real gem in the middle of a busy Paris. You can easally spend hours there just bring a blanket, a good book and enjoy this lovely garden.
Lovely Gardens. Stopped here on a city tour. Had a short visit and time to take pictures of palace. Returned later on our own to sit and relax and have a crepe.

Place where Parisians relax. I loved lying on the lawns together with hundreds of locals who were chatting, resting, reading and enjoying their day off. Imagine Tuileries gardens but with much less tourists and more cozy atmosphere. This is how I remembered Luxembourg gardens. I was surprised to hear Ukrainian language from the group of young people who sat on the lawn nearby. Same as to see a small model of the boat with the Ukrainian flag that was floating in the fountain. Definitely a nice place.

Luxembourg Gardens hardly needs another review, but by all means go .... Free concerts, saling toy boats, jogging, basking in the sun, people watching, walking, reading monument markers -- it's always a low-stress, easy-to-find uplifting park. when you eant to leave its gates and sight see or eat, you need only walk a block or two in any direction.

A Parisian Silent Movie. We merely passed through on the way back to our hotel, but unlike the rest of Paris, this place is blissfully quiet. If I lived in Paris, I would certainly make this place a daily visit spot to de-stress. The gardens are beautiful and I loved the central point where all the benches face inwards to a water feature. Definitely a must-do but wouldn't take up much time. There is also a McDonalds right over the street- highly recommend a slow walk with a McFlurry to round off a hot day!

Best of public gardens visited in Paris - don't pick the flowers!. Lovely weather and a happy Sunday spent with many Parisians and visitors in the Luxembourg gardens. A beautiful lawn bordered with flowers and a model boating lake bringing memories of childhood back. (There is a modest fee for hiring yachts) Little people with a boat with their national flag and a pole to direct the yachts that get stuck on the side. Thank goodness for the light breeze it was so hot. The trouble with french public gardens is the paths of fine white grit that make your shoes so dusty and mucky. There are lots of green metal seats to sit upon under the shade of the trees or in the sunshine to catch rays. Sculptures, statues and works of art grace the lawns and paths. An oasis for apartment dwellers and visitors. Lots of open space for fitness enthusiasts that you will meet at every turn. You should not expect "English Style" gardens though.There are loos and armed guards :)

So beautiful. Another great spot (among many!) So many fantastic types of flowers and different landscaping architecture here! There are people picnicking and relaxing everywhere so don't go there in a rush. Take time to walk around and see the fountains and flowers!
Nice location for Eating/Reading. Make sure you grab a chair and find a location where you can relax and take in the views or read a book. Peaceful gardens with a nice boating lake at its centre.

3 day visit. The streets around the gardens are packed with good eating places however we took a picnic and a couple of bottles of red and sat in the park people watching and relaxing loved it the weather was very warm no better place to be nice walk back towards the river
GREAT PLACE FOR A PICNIC. Oasis of peace in an a luxurious setting. This is an ideal place to take a stroll and smell the flowers and site by the water.

Spectacular!. The Gardens are so large that you have the opportunity to view many different types of landscape architecture, from the geometrically stylized formal gardens to the more tree-lined areas further from the Seine. Everything is equally beautiful…. you can spend hours here.But certainly, whenever you are in Paris, see the formal gardens. Beautiful promenade with pools, geometry, flowers in bloom. The only parallel are the gardens near the Louvre.
Lovely place to relax in the afternoon. This is the best park we've been in Paris. Very quiet and romantic. Seat by the lake in the park's center and enjoy the afternoon sun.

Charming Paris Garden. We went to the Luxembourg gardens on a Sunday afternoon and it was like a movie; people were sitting on benches, there was live music, children were playing soccer. I'm not sure if it gets more French than that. We stopped and split a bottle of wine and sat for a while and had a pleasant afternoon. Tables at the cafe were hard to come by and the waiters were quite rude, but it was a great afternoon in the park regardless.

Seminal Parisian park. A must see and great way to walk from the latin quarter to observatoire...full of life and activity from childrens donkey walking, tennis and pétanque players, musicians performing courtesy of the bandstand, French senators walking around and one of Paris' original foutaine or public drinking foutains (medici fountain) which supplied clean drinking water....

A surprising gem. Beautiful palace and gardens, a place where the Parisians congregate with their families and a picnic. We visited on a warm Sunday afternoon and it was a perfect place to spend a few hours relaxing after much walking in the morning.
luxury garden. this is a beautiful garden with tennis courts and lakes and fountains it is very well laid out and is used by locals and tourist equally
beautiful. I was there in the evening before the sunset it was such a beauty, I strongly recommend a visit as a break to tiring Paris.

One of the best parks in Paris. This is a place to see Paris relax. Exercise groups, kids sailing boats on the lake etc. Beautiful landscaping. A small cafe offers refreshments. Good exhibit at the museum about the history of the Tudors of England.

Nothing much to expect but a good place to just relax. It's a garden, what can I say. No bad if you have some spare time and the weather is nice. The place was filled up as we visited on a Saturday, but not too crowded.

Lovely green space in the south of Paris. I liked the Medecis Fountain (beside the Palais du Luxembourg and near Rue du Medecis). I also loved the rows of horse chestnut trees (Aesculus hippocastanum) which have been trimmed into very neat rows. They are especially pretty in spring with their light-pink flowers. There was a notice inviting people to sit on one of the lawns - it would be nice for a picnic. The lake invites children to sail their toy boats.

Lovely. A beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. The Gardens are varied such that there is a perfect spot for everyone from couples on a romantic rendezvous, to families with children & pets and runners & tennis players.We enjoyed a picnic lunch, complete with wine, in a fairly private area and then moved on to a stroll throughout the Gardens. What a delight!Even the police assigned to the Gardens appeared to be more on a stroll than on patrol, engaging in easy conversation and banter with visitors.Can't wait to return!

A picnic must. On a hot June day in Paris, this is absolute heaven. The expansive gardens give you an escape from the city and offer a combination of open air spaces, tree lined paths, recreation facilities and fountains. It's lovely to watch families play or business people take a well earned break. It's a favorite with runners for good reason but don't miss the chance to just sit still for a bit and breathe in the fresh air.

Luxemburg Gardens relaxation. We stayed in the Latin Quarter only two blocks from the Gardens, so it was nice to stroll them in the late afternoon after various trips, enjoy the green and people watch.
Fine but not worth a detour. I think if I lived nearby I'd be incredibly proud of having a park such as this nearby but I found it pleasant rather than spectacular.

Great Place to Visit on Any Afternoon. It is a very nice area where you can just sit and relax and enjoy the afternoon. There are people all around just doing there own thing. It reminded me of Central Park on a Saturday afternoon.
Relax in Paris. It a beautiful, relaxing place where you can sit on the grass, have a picnic or just enjoy the sun. Pleasant is also the café just outside it.
Not a better place to be on a Sunday afternoon. Not a better place to be on a Sunday afternoon,Make sure the sun is out any day of the week for some R & R while visiting Paris

Do not miss the Tudor exposition. There is a Tudor exposition until July 2015. Do not miss it! The highlight is the little photomashine that will take your picture and then really nicely paste it to the painting of Elisabeth 1st or Henri VIII. This is for free and the quality of the pic by email is great. If you do not want to see the exposition but still do the pic just walk in past the ticket counter as if you were heading for the loos then take the picture and walk out again. You will love this one :D

Great place for the daily picnic.. Our goal on this trip was to relax a bit everyday instead of grinding out every single site. This park was perfect. We stopped in a small shop, two fantastic sandwiches, some cheese and a 15 dollar bottle of cold white wine. Wowzer, do it everyday.

Great place to relax. Wonderful place to wander, chill, sit and admire the sculptures after a busy day sightseeing in this, one of the best areas of Paris. Also the gallery alongside hosts some of the best exhibitions in Paris.

Picnic Perfection!. Serene setting for a respite among shady paths leading to a calming fountain. This, for me, was the highlight of our trip so far. It's the perfect spot for a bottle of champagne, cheeses, a baguette, and chance to relax. When you get tired of sitting by the soothing fountain, you can lazily stroll among the trees to gather moments of pensive reflection.

Run/relax/people watch. An absolutely amazing park and palace with fountains, reflecting pools, comfy chairs and plenty of well worn paths to engage any interests (e.g. runner, readers, and people who just want to have a seat, eat something and people watch).Beautifully maintained, copious flowers and a great view.

Beautiful and Relaxing. My son and I really enjoyed strolling through these lovely gardens, and just sitting and relaxing after a long day of walking. Very peaceful and serene in some areas of the park.
Paris vacation. Since I was staying in the St Germain area this time in Paris, I was able to stroll in the afternoons to the Luxemburg Gardens. Nice little tea room, fountain and gardens are lovely.

LOVE this place, full of energy and life!. I always go to Luxembourg when I visit Paris , A great place to have a picnic and people watch. There are many Parisians in the garden, there's so much to explore and do everything sectioned off in specific areas. In some places you can go on the grass in other places you can't . A lot of seniors play this game with the balls with these magnets attached to strings and they pick up the ball kind a like bocce it's very fun to watch.b The beautiful fountain in the middle is just fun to sit and relax by. This place has a lot of heart and soul, lots to discover .

Great for a quick stop. It is a beautiful place for short rest during sightseeing. Mobile chairs is a wonderful idea. Near to the Latin Quarter which is very nice place for having a drink or some food.

Further away from the main tourist area - nice. It was a pleasant garden with far less crowds (late May, early June) which can make other places tedious. Unfortunately my wife had no say on the date she was born and we were in Paris for her birthday and just had to take it as it came. Still, nice fountain, well maintained and good scenery.
Relax in a park. This is a lovely refuge from the bustle and rush in Paris. Pull up a chair (they are plentiful) to enjoy people watching, miniature boat sailing and beautiful flowers.

Beautiful. We stopped here for a stroll and an alfresco breakfast on a lovely sunny morning, we had coffee & croissants form the cafe here, it made a very memorable start to my partners birthday - Wonderful! Very special!

Quiet time in the city. We loved this place. Was so peaceful and the kids were well entertained.Top points:1. There's a miniature copy of the statue of liberty2. The kids playground costs 2.50 euro to enter, but it's well worth it.3. You can hire miniature sailing boats.Enjoy!
A little bit of heaven. Beautiful gardens sufficiently varied to make you wish to explore every corner.Full of flora and spacious for some quiet meditative time.

The experience of being part of the Royal family just by walking here!. That's the garden that the guys of fancy royal family used to walk, play and have maybe affairs! the garden is still frozen in the past time!

Beautiful vast gardens. Beautiful diverse large garden in the heart of Paris, complete with Orangerie. You can sunbathe, read a book, walk around or sightsee here. The fountains are absolutely gorgeous. Lot's of cafés in the area as well.
Great space to relax in the sun. Interesting art works are situated in the park and the cafes offer a nice shady place to have a coffee or cake. Bring a picnic and enjoy the space, Parisian style.
Unforgettable. Nice park and magnificent palace. Good for pictures and stop for a breath and taking a rest. Worth a visit when you are in Paris.
Worth a visit. A lovely park where you can rest & watch the world go by. Full of history if you want to suss it out but beautiful if you just want to relax.
Feel like a royalty. Amazing place with beautiful trees, alleys, flowers and a palace right in the middle of it. It looks impecable, spotless and very posh.
Beautiful. Amazing gardens with benches, flowers, trees, statues...and the views on the tower and Louvre depending on where you are in the gardens were both breathtaking.
Sail boats. Sailing the ships on the water was one of the highlights of our holiday. Just remember that you must ONLY push your own ship - don"t even touch anyone else's...

Relaxing in a Historical Garden. Jardin du Luxembourg is a large park at the center of Paris within a walking distance (20+ min) from Musée d'Orsay and The Louvre. The garden has several attractions in it and I'd recommend starting by walking on its outer paths where you'd meet many interesting statues and, of course, the beautiful Medici Fountain!Then you can go inside and enjoy the view of Luxembourg Palace (French Senate residence) which can be unfortunately visited only in groups and requires an advanced reservation. There are also some sports facilities inside the park, food kiosks, and of course, a lot of benches and chairs everywhere so you could relax for as long as you wish.At the end you can visit Musee du Luxembourg which is located near one of the garden's exits.Very enjoyable experience (especially early in the morning) and highly recommended!

Beautiful. I found the gardens a delightful place. Full of people enjoying the beautiful Sunday afternoon outdoors. Children playing in the playground, people visiting on the grass in the sun, and a musical group entertaining on the stage.
Amazing garden!!. You won't want to miss this place. The garden is great for relaxing. I love the seats around the lake. They are perfect for couple like us.
A peaceful location to take it all in.. We walked around the park and then sat for a glass of wine and a beer, quite expensive at 25€. But it is all part of being in Paris.
Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful gardens , relax by the fountains watch the street entertainers along with all the local Parisians just out enjoying their day. Lovely place.

Gorgeous. I have been here many times..lots of history. My best memory though is a quiet jog at 6am through the park...its a perfect place to do this. Also wonderful for a picnic...get some wine some cheese and some bread and go and relax.

A very pleasant surprise at the end of a long walk.... We had time to kill and the gardens were suggested. We arrived after quite a lenghty walk to the museum which was having a special Tudors exhibit but we were too tired to view. Strolled around the back and there were the gardens -quite extensive and surrounded by beautiful architecture. There is plenty of seating as well as play areas and maybe even picnic spot. Very pleasant!If you visit the museum you might enhance your visit.

Wonderful place to sit quietly and enjoy. Stroll in the garden and join the Parisians sitting about, especially if the weather is nice as it was - not sticky hot as in July and August, not as cold as in February.

Relaxing and peaceful. I could not pick a more beautiful spot to sit on any of the benches and take a rest from walking the city. Walking the grounds or just enjoying a rest the whole place is breathtaking
Beautiful. This is a great park and is obviously where the locals hang out on the weekend. Great people watching.

Beautiful area. Started our Paris trip with a walk through Luxembourg Gardens--beautiful grounds, flowers, sculpture, de'Medici fountain, senate building, and pond with miniture sailing ships. Plenty of seats to sit and take in the sites.Many locals exercising, jogging, relaxing--enjoying the day. Worth an hour visit and it's free.

Lovely gardens. The gardens are huge and easy to walk around I especially liked the large pond and watching the children playing with their yachts on the water running round the pond trying to catch their yachts. There are nice trees plenty of seats and some flower beds but it would be better to see more flowers. It's a nice place for a long walk and plenty of space for children to play and run around. Would be a great place for a picnic weather permitting it's worth a visit.

Idylic Oasis!. The Jardin du Luxembourg, or the Luxembourg Garden, located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, was created beginning in 1612 by Marie de' Medici, the widow of King Henry IV of France, for a new residence she constructed, the Luxembourg Palace. The garden today is owned by the French Senate, which meets in the Palace. The park, which covers 23 hectares, is known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, the model sailboats on its circular basin, and for the picturesqueMedici Fountain, built in 1620. In the sprawling concrete metropolis of Paris these wonderful immaculately kept gardens dotted throughout the city are a welcome respite for weary tourists taking in the multitude of attractions in the area. With glorious ornate gardens, impressive architecture, lakes, statues and fountains it’s ideal for photographers or simply to relax in one of the many seating/reclining areas and chill with a glass of wine and simply watch the world go by. The gardens are popular with tourists, locals, walkers, runners and lovers alike taking advantage of this tranquil setting. The fact that the sun was shinning when we visited the gardens only added to the beauty of these idyllic gardens. Naturally there are also cafes and public rest rooms.
Excellent for relaxing. Perfect for a relaxing afternoon; very nice flowers; as far as I've seen you cannot picnic here, but you can sit on the chairs

Amazing gardens not to be missed. Such a peaceful and beautiful place to visit. The flowers in the gardens are excellent and the seating around the lake is a great way to relax and enjoy the surrounds. Terrific for children to play with the small boats which keeps them occupied for some time.

Gorgeous, really loved these gardens. Gorgeous, really loved these gardens and could spend hours there. Has a nice charming character to it unlike the Tulieries. Was closed on a Sunday evening for some private function, thus went back another day.

Luxembourg Gardens. Great location, the gardens are spectacular. The area is nice for a picnic or just to stay and relax after a day of walking and visiting the city. A must visit attraction in Paris.
Orderly gardens. It has pretty parts in the garden and also the standard of orderly trees as seen in other Parisians public parks/ gardens.A pleasant place to rest & reflect

Typical and yet. Not exactly in the thick of tourist areas, in the heart of the city, lovely gardens, great place to stroll, have a sandwich or a drink, reasonably close to walk from Notre Dame and the Latin quarter, the Luco is one of my favorite spot in Paris.Don't fool yourselves though : the brand of Parisians you'll encounter is nothing average. Rue guynemer is one of the most expensive piece of real estate in Paris, and this part of the sixth quarter makes it one of the chic part of the left bank.

This is a wonder of Paris! Please don't miss it. It's gorgeous, and filled with life.. I love the Jardins du Luxembourg, and there is nothing I wouldn't recommend about it. The plantings are beautiful, it's full of benches to rest on, and on this most recent visit I was treated to a band concert as well! Children play, adults enjoy -- and there's The Petite Trianon -- Marie Antoinette's summer residence.

Mr Fawlty would be please... The gardens are magnificent especially on a Spring day, but if you want a true French experience, try the cafe in the park just to the east of the main palace. The menu is good, prices are excellent and the main waiter will entertain you with his attitude. He runs hot and cold. I've come back 3 times for the scenery, the food and that ATTITUDE.

If the weather is nice and you need to catch a breather.. The fountain of Medici, the palace of Luxembourg, serenity, calmness, and refreshing view. The gardens offer those and more to its visitors. If you come and miss to just lay off on the grass, you never get a full Parisienne experience
Nice Garden and Park. We walked throughout this park during our visit in Montparnasse. Many local people and artists use this park on a daily basis. Well worth taking the time to visit.

Wonderful Park!. We walked through Luxembourg Gardens on our recent trip to Paris and found it a very relaxing and lovely place to visit. The various statues placed around the park were very lovely and created an artistic background to this lovely park. The DiMedici Fountain and Palace are also another lovely spot to stop and linger a while and enjoy the view!

Not to miss and free. A lovely peaceful walk or sitting any time of year. This is the place to jog, walk, look at the leaves, talk with your mate, have a small picnique. Includes the Senate in the small chateau of Catherine of Medici.

Romantic relaxed gardens, a nice spot to relax and people watch. My girlfriend and I headed to the gardens after walking solidly around Paris all morning and afternoon. Pick up one of the green chairs and find a spot in the sun to spend some time having a nap or watching the people go by.

Lovely gardens.... And the sun came out during the visit. Perfect day. Lots of people were wandering the gardens so a bit crowded but not too bad. We didn't cover the whole gardens - looks like a full day with lots of walking. But the parts we saw the flowers were beautiful and the kids playing were having heaps of fun.

Great Location for a Picnic Lunch and Relaxing. The park is located close to several attractions and can be used as a great picnic spot. There are ample chairs provided to relax and great views of the Palace and Gardens.Being a tourist can be exhausting; if you have time, enjoy a break on a sunny day here.Good restaurants nearby, such as Le Comptoir. Also close to an historically famous coffee shop, Les Deux Magots.

OK, but not spectacular. We walked through these gardens after we had gone to the Louvre and were on our way to Arc d'Triumphe. They were nice - shady - but we have toured much more spectacular gardens. If they are on your way - worth a quick walk through -but I wouldn't go out of my way.
Neat place to spend a little time. If you run, stay near here. It's a great place to run, walk, stroll, or just sit and watch humanity pass by.
Lovely. wonderful to see the local Parisians with their families on the weekend enjoying these lovely grounds. Beautiful and scenic place to sit and relax and have a crepe!
Lovely. wonderful to see the local Parisians with their families on the weekend enjoying these lovely grounds. Beautiful and scenic place to sit and relax and have a crepe!

AFTERNOON DELIGHT!. We spent a sunny afternoon at Luxembourg Gardens and found everything in the park just delightful! I felt just like a local strolling through people-watching and enjoying the beautiful surroundings. Plenty of chairs for all to sit and rest and the pretty lake with the remote-controlled sailboats was a favorite with all the children. Gorgeous statuary and even enjoyed briefly watching men playing a local sport (bocci ball, maybe?). Pony rides for the children and a wonderful playground/park for children as well. Lots of flowers were in bloom!

Beautiful day and nice park. Just perfect with the little sail boats and families and people coming together... The park is big and has lots of green areas and benches. It can be loud or quiet depending on what you want.

Afternoon in the sun. I must say that this may not have been a first choice but I'm pleased I went. In the sun the gardens looked really attractive. They were very well maintained and no too crowded. They give a great idea of what life must have been like when the palace was used as a homeThe cafe is worth a trip, we enjoyed a bottle of wine although it was cool as the seating is in the shade. Great place for photographers
Lovely park. Big lawns, a lot of reallys big trees, lovely to stroll along in, many chairs, nice atmosphere, well-tendet flowerbeds. Take a breath here!
May 2015. a great park to pack a picnic lunch and sit back and enjoy being in Paris...........................................
Great to relax and enjoy Paris. Beautiful park, great for enjoying Paris, sitting in one of the green chairs, and eating a picnic. It is a must do in Paris.
Nice place to have a picnic. pretty park. Lots of chairs to sit in. Grass was heaving with visitors.Nice place to stop and watch the world go by.

One sign says it all: Please walk on the grass!. Think of it as a canvas upon which you can paint your own experience for the day. With cafes available at the edge of the park, here, in the middle of the city is this vast space with lawns, chairs, benches, fountains that stretch out in many directions. There is exceptional public art, simple walkways, children's areas. It's just lovely. Have fun!
Perfect little spot to take a break from the shopping. Beautiful gardens and the palace and pond is a great backdrop as your rest tired legs. Medici gardens a quiet haven. Well worth a visit.
A nice place during spring and summer. Great place to tale a walk. There are chairs all over the park so you can just sit and read under the shade on sunny days :)

Garden in the City. In Paris, where there is lots of concrete, this is a very nice park to run or stroll. There are beautifully tended gardens, and lots of green space. Lots of people were running around the perimeter.
Peaceful gardens. This place is brilliant just to chill out. After long day of sights in the city, you can sit there and just relax.
Lovely place for a picnic. It was a lovely place, beautiful for a Parisian picnic! We stopped at a local shop and got sandwiches and wine and sat on the park bench and had a terrific day.
A Beautiful Space. Nice, expansive gardens in the heart of Paris. A great place for a jog or to lie on the grass and take in the clouds on a summer day.

Relaxing and beautiful local garden. Lots of local French families were there in the weekend. There are pony rides, fancy playground for kids, mini yachts to play on the mini pond in front of the palace.
Wonderful place to be spending family time!

A lovely place for a walk in Luxembourg Gardens Paris and to sit and relax in. We decided to get some lunch before entering the park and found one of the many benches here free to sit and have lunch while enjoying the surrounds. This park really is gorgeous and makes for a very nice walk around. The water pond is the main focus.

An Idylic Oasis. We just needed a break after walking 5-7 miles a day through the streets of Paris. We lucked out on a brilliant sunshine, warm afternoon (our only one) at this gem of a city park. We grabbed a couple of chairs, took off our shoes and socks and just people watched until we both feel into a hazy nap. It's everything an urban park should be: green, quiet, well-manicured surrounded by urban delight. Only the super-crowded bathrooms (50 Euro cents) with long lines were a detraction. This place is worth a wander.
Beautiful. Glorious gardens with lots to see. Don't miss the Medici Fountain - both sides! Enjoyed the recliner seats in the sunshine.

Beautiful gardens. Extensive, well maintained and very pleasant. We stopped for a picnic but worth a visit on their own merits. Quite extraordinary how well behaved the French are - even on a sunny bank holiday weekend when the gardens were packed with people it was still very pleasant.
Peaceful respite. Take a stroll through or just sit awhile. Paris is a bustling, busy, noisy city and this is a lovely oasis.

A very varied park with a beautiful castle. This park easily ranges within the top 5 of all parks I have ever seen. You have a playground, a boule field, a beautiful castle and it is big but not too big. You are only allowed to sit on some grass areas, for the rest they will provide chairs, which I haven't seen so far in a park.

Always beautiful. On our first day to Paris we took the bus to this beautiful and sphereful park. It was a beautiful sunny day and it was full with tourists and locals, old people, couples in love, parents with children, etc. We have a good cup of capucinno in the cafe (very expensive). The only thing I missed (from a long time ago) were the children, who sent their little sailboats sailing on the little lake.
Tranquil spot. A difference of these gardens is that the seats are not fixed so you can sit where you want, move around to catch the sun. Good place to people watch.

Lovely Gardens. I would suggest this is a must for any couple going to Paris. Try to go on a warm sun day to appreciate it further. At the time of our visit i commented that i could sit here all day reading.

Lux gardens NB. Great place to relax in good weather. Easy walking distance to the Rive Gauche and all its attractions. Basic seating available for free. A place where Parisiens go to relax and therefore quite atmospheric.

Weekend best time to visit. As we are staying close by I visited the gardens a couple of times on my current stay in Paris. On Saturday children were having great fun with little sailboat races on the large pond. There were pony rides too. This is a very well used park by the local Parisiens who have a stroll or indeed a run or even a game of tennis on the courts there. During the week there is less of a carnival atmosphere but it is still well worth a visit. Angelina's cafe is at the top of the park and a lovely (but pricey) place to have morning or afternoon tea after a leisurely stroll. It is truly lovely.

What A Way To Spend The Morning. This beautiful psrk is super easy to get to via the metro. Spend the morning, wonder around, sail a mini sail boat, have a picnic on one of the picnic area and enjoy a coffee at the cafe. Bottom line relax and enjoy the peace of the park.
Nice for a walk. This place is located right in front of the Louvre museum. It is nice for a walk or to sit and eat/have a picnic. It is also busy.

Nice to relax !. Les jardins du Luxembourg is a very nice place just to walk and discover. Have a seat on the grass, contemplate around you, flowers, statues, architecture are all here to make you feel the magic of Paris. Just avoid overcrowded hours.
Wonderful. We went on a rainy day and it was still wonderful. We were working in Kuwait for a year so the light rain was very welcomed!

Amazing and so very Paris. There are many gardens in Paris but this one is a must see... the grottos, the alleys, the fountains and the sculptures.. find a bench to your liking and enjoy this one - it is special.

A place to relax, and enjoy. This place has ample area, of all kinds of surroundings. Sit in the lush green grass or by a pond, surrounded by statues or vast orchards.For architectural trips, roam about to see hundreds of pieces of beautifully carved stone, plus the Palais du Luxembourg.No matter how big the crowd, you'll always feel there is a lot of space for you to move around.Sport lovers, there are basketball and Tennis courts, in addition to the long jogging track that circumferences the gardenKids can enjoy the place as well, as it has a special play area for them to frolic in.

Beautiful Bloom. The Luxembourg gardens are a place where one should go in the morning or evening to escape the heat. The fountains, the gardens, statues and the shaded walkways. Spend 2-3 hours to soak in and move on

Great to kill a couple hours on a sunny day!. The gardens are beautiful! It's great for a stroll between visits to museums or if you get pastries or coffee and enjoy the sunny weather. A must see if you're in Paris!
A pleasant park. It is a park and a palace, very neat and attractive to the eye. They have metal chairs around the lawn, where you can sit and relax, or just come and read a book.

Worth the walk, metro or taxi to get there.. These gardens are better than the Tuileries. Mostly locals here with no Gypsys (thank goodness). Grottos, statues, flowers, great garden paths, bathroom (.50), sail boat rentals (for the fountain area), and if you walk up and through the Explorers Gardens you seen a spectacular fountain and can eat at La Cloiserie des Lilas. OMG.

Beautiful Park and People. We went to the gardens on Sunday to people watch and lo and behold, it was closed. First time ever for us.... and the locals. Police said there was a private memorial celebration going on and it would be closed all day. We went back a couple of days later and it was as great as always. We always take a Sandwiches from a nearby shop.

Gorgeous. Great place for my young son to run around. We didn't realize it was so extensive; we intend to return again and again to enjoy all the park has to offer. Lovely area of town as well - can't think of a much better way to pass a sunny afternoon in Paris.

Very pretty. It was a very beautiful park, great for strolling around and looking at. But only that, you can't picnic here or anything because you are not allowed on the grass. I probably won't visit again, (even though I live nearby) because I like to bring my dog on my walks. There is only a very small, boring portion of the park where dogs are allowed unfortunately. That's the funny thing about Paris -dogs seem to be allowed just about everywhere except for parks, haha.
Lovely garden. Within an easy walk from our hotel, nice place to picknik. There is a really nice pond there with huge fish.

Always a great place to stop and enjoy life!. This is where the residents of Paris come to unwind on a weekend day. It is such a pleasure to be able to stop into the Gardens and watch the residents and tourists unwind.

Real Local Flavor. The gardens are beautiful and peaceful, but I really enjoyed watching the locals taking time to enjoy the space. As Americans I feel like we are always in a hurry and it is so refreshing to see people just sitting and relaxing throughout the gardens.

An Oasis in the City. What a beautiful landscaped haven. The staueus, fountains, flowers and grass, with chairs everywhere to sit, make this one of the nieces center city gardens we have ever seen. We sat back, relaxed and soaked up the atmosphere.
Picnic perfect. Pop in a fromagerie and a patisserie and find a spot overlooking the circular lake. Lovely. Backs on to the boulevard st michel but I never saw Marie claire.

Beautiful respite. A great place to have some solitude in the 6th! The flowers were beautiful. Lots of people on the day we went, but people watching is fun there too. Different parts of the park have different things, so look before you go to the wrong area. We went to the ball field side and wanted the other side.

Wonderful. This is where Parisians come to chat, wander around, let the kids run about, share their packed lunches and float their boats. I enjoyed just being in these gardens watching the French relax with family and friends. Oh, there are tourists too - but they were OK!

A Slice of Life. Behind the small palace here you'll see Parisians in green chairs soaking in the sun, enjoying their lunch breaks, and well… just being Parisian! This is a nice place to recharge when you're exhausted from sightseeing. There are many lovely statues and benches in shady spots. But the best feature of this park is simply to watch the residents of Paris and get a feel for the mundane in such a special city.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful garden and a peaceful place to see. You can go for a picnic also and have lunch there.

Paris at its best. Paris does a superb job with it's beautiful gardens and landscaping. Luxembourg Gardens are a wonderful place to stroll and relax especially during the nice weather. You'll find a lot of morning joggers and others exercising and taking advantage of this tranquil setting.
Crowded. Maybe I was spoiled by Regents Park in London, but I didn't see what the big deal was about this garden. It was just crowded, dusty, and noisy

Typical corner Ok also for children. Amazing garden and not only: not very full of tourists (happy to be sometimes out of the most trodden trails) enjoy a cassis ice cream, let your children play with wooden small boats on the central lake (to rent for not much), see the beatiful photo expositions that often are placed on the outer gratings of the garden...

Great for a picnic. Quite large, some very formal parts but also grass areas to picnic and a lot of chairs etc.
Playgrounds, tennis courts and pony rides, pretty much good for the whole family
An oasis. Great and unexpected find in the heart of Paris. Plenty of space to walk and talk, and take in an exhibition in the Orangerie

An oasis of beauty, cleanliness, and relaxation in a bustling city. Luxembourg Gardens was possibly my favorite experience in Paris, in large part because it is not tourist-y or commercial. Nothing is sold there. It's simply an oasis of quiet, calm, and stunningly landscaped flowers and greenery where Parisians go to relax, talk, and read. The anchor is the beautiful Palais du Luxembourg. Take a leisurely stroll and soak up the Gardens' statues, flower beds, hedges and delicious ambiance. Don't miss the breathtaking Fountain of the Medicis, which we did not find until our third visit.

Beautiful Sprawling Garden. A gorgeous escape from the city life of Paris. One of the inner city's biggest gardens. Packed with tourists and locals alike. We were there on a Sunday in late May and it was packed. There are some chairs you can grab to sit in. Which is what we did to eat our breakfast. In the distance you can see the Eiffel Tower. There was also a free concert going on under the trees. Just a nice escape.

Beautiful gardens and worth a visit if you want some quiet time. We walked through the gardens and was surprised how lovely they were. Although busy with tourists and locals there is plenty of space to find a quiet spot if you want to rest, read or people watch. Some good photo opportunities within the gardens and over to the Eiffel Tower. I had not been before and would like to return, hopefully again on a sunny day, as this really made the gardens a special place.

A Peaceful Getaway. We stayed in the Latin Quarter so we were close to this garden/park. It is quite beautiful, with it's grand palace, boat basin, statues and garden. Read up on the history of this garden and you will see why there are palm trees here. It's a great location to stop and rest if you are between the Latin Quarter and St. Germain. We visited the Cluny Museum the same day, which is close by.

Awesome for kids. We found an amazing play park settled in the center of this beautiful flower tree filled park. So many neat rides within this park. European parks are amazing! Also we went to the pond infrount of the Luxembourg and our children pushed around big boats with sticks. Defiantly a great way to spend a Parisian afternoon.
a wonderful park. more native Parisians then tourists. a wonderful park.a rich history. a park used by more Parisians than tourists.a must see when you're in Paris. It is free and very enjoyable
Sunny morning with family. Nice garden and activities for different age groups. We like the playground for small children. If you visit Paris with children, this is one of the place to enjoy.
Good place. Good place for a walk and beautiful garden.Personally I am not a big fan of France and french people.

An oasis in the city. In spite of the rain, I fully enjoyed my time in the garden. A perfect place for walking, or jogging, as so many did, or just sit and admire the surroundings. An excellent exhibition of the Tudors made the visit perfect.

Relax!. One of my favorites places in town , wen you want to relax and reed a book , take a walk and a good place for kids to play with small boats that you can rent next to the lake(fountain).
In the center of the city you only hear birds !
Nice way to walk. We walked through on our way to the right bank..lovely park very close to the hotel. Pretty gardens, good place to go for a run. Tennis courts, People watching.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens, try to spend there at least a couple of hours, you can take lunch there and eat it in front of its lake, its a good place to rest for a while.

Not one of the great Gardens. This garden has a grand vista and a Chateau. You have a large water body in the center and a fountain. People sit around the fountain and appreciate the chateau. but beyond this there is nothing in this garden. Visit this place if you have ample time but if you have less time then you can avoid this garden. Be assured you will not miss much if you don't visit this garden.

one of our favorite Paris gardens. This is a great place. We went on a sunny weekend day and watched the kids sail their boats for hours. You can get a meal and coffee, you can walk or sit. A beautiful way to spend a day.
Relaxation times. What beautiful gardens! So lovely to see Parisians of all ages out enjoying the weather and each other's company!

A favorite. A beautiful destination and a classy get away from the rest of the city. A great way to really appreciate a trip to Paris to come here and recenter yourself among the Parisians that frequent this place often.

Bring your picnic!. On a sunny or even an overcast day this place is really nice. There is a massive green grassed area that is perfect for a picnic and for kids to run around. The statues around the place are a great piece of history.
It's very clean and well maintained, also there is plenty of seating!!

A walk on the quiet side. Great place for a walk, beautiful gardens - not crowded. A respite from the busy streets. The Palais, built between 1615-1645 for Marie de Medicis, mother of Louis XIII, and now the Senate of France and the Senate President's residence.

Go on a weekend. These gardens are beautiful and peaceful. If you have a choice go on a weekend as there are many families, children, people exercising, yoga groups, tai chi groups and sailing boats on the lake. It is bustling and full of atmosphere.
Early May. Probably too early to enjoy the full impact of the gardens. But the layout is amazing. A favorite spot for joggers.

Very popular Garden to visit. Bring some bread if you are coming here, you can feed the fish in the north east pond. The kids can play with the toy boats in the main fountain area. Very relaxing place to sit down or have the kids run around, play tennis, or ride the donkeys.
Nice but nothing extraordinary. May be we have seen many better gardens. We found it just average. There were few tired looking tourist and localities sitting there. No activity. Can be skipped.

Beautiful!. We went to Luxembourg Gardens on 2 different occasions, once during the week when it was raising and there were only tourists around, and once on a Sunday when it felt like local Parisians had come to the garden in droves to enjoy the May sunshine and their Sunday afternoon to take in their surroundings as only Parisians can! Loved both times! The gardens were beautiful in the rain as well as the sunshine. The Medici fountain is a must see, simply beautiful.

Oasis in the Latin Quarter. Lovely huge gardens with shady spots on a hot summer's day, families and couples wandering, interesting flourishing plantings and a comfortable park bench to sit and watch the model boats sailing.

Beautiful Park, wonderful way to relax. Spent a couple of great afternoons and evenings in this park. The chairs are very nice, people are friendly, and nobody going around hassling you. Be sure to check out the mini sailboats that they rent in the center pond! The bathrooms in the park are very clean and nice -- definitely worth the 50 cents to use.

Garden for visitors and locals alike. The spring flowers were over and summer planting had begun but you could still appreciate the beauty of the garden. Plenty of seating and also a restaurant in the sun or shade if you choose for a decent lunch, great quiche!

Like a picture. I wanted to see the Luxembourg Gardens after seeing a painting of the gardens in a museum in Giverny. The gardens did not disappoint. Even on an overcast morning, these were worth taking a walk to see. They reminded me a bit of the Huntington Library and Gardens in California, but had their own flavor. I would return here on a future trip, with plans to spend more time.
Paris Secret-Medici Fountain. The Medici Fountain in the Luxembourg Gardens was one of our highlights to our trip....it is so enchanting.
Great escape from the city. This is a beautiful park and a great getaway from the business of the city. It's free to get in and completely worth it.

Straight out of a Monet Sunday in the park painting. Nice placement of sculpture in meticulously groomed park. Parisiens were very respectful of it and enjoyed it in a manner that let everyone enjoy the park.

Nice place to relax and people watch. Beautiful fountains, seating available throughout to sit, relax and enjoy the scenery. Wonderful view of the gardens with the Eiffel Tower in the background. We were surprised that they close the gardens in the evening before sunset as we wanted to get a great photo opt.

Beautiful. We stayed near the Gardens and would up walking in them nearly every day of our stay. The gardens themselves were lovely even this early in the spring. The people watching was outstanding. This was a favorite spot to eat a lunch which we bought at a nearby boulangerie.

Beautiful, free park to visit. First time in the park and really loved the grounds. The fountains. The only thing to dislike is how your shoes get the white dusty mess all over them but it's just one of the tells that you walked through Paris park!

Parc lovers unite. I sit here as often as I can I read, sketch, write in my journal, wander through the parc, talk to people, eat crepes at the cafe, sit along he Medici fountain and eat a pastry from Pierre Hermes that is a short walk away . In general I live in this parc as often as I can

Catch Tudor exhibit while there. Beautiful gardens and wonderful travelling exhibits ...don't miss.Take lunch and spend the afternoon Parisian style .Cute Cute military personnel to look at too ;-) nice staff ,reasonable prices.
Just a garden - but a FAMOUS one!. Glad I got to stroll along this place where historic acts took place. I had a quick lunch here before my tour of the Eiffel Tower.
Picnic. Beautiful gardens. We picked up some cheese meat and wine at a local market. Best lunch in a park I ever had.
icecream in the park. this is the right place for a relaxing walk in the park! On walking distance from your hotel, safe , clean and nice people walking around

beautiful historic gardens. We walked through the garden with an ice cream. The beauty of the palace and the grounds . the water fountains were awsome especially if you bring your history book. On a sunny day it is a great place for a picnic

Great place to relax. A haven for walkers and runners. Plenty of chairs if you need to rest, and lots of shaded areas to escape the sun if necessary. This is a lovely escape from all the noise of the city, and would be ideal to bring children - and their bikes.
Walk and relax. It's worth it to walk through the gardens in the middle of the center because its calm and cool and you can rest by the tiny pond for a while summarise day's activities

My favorite walk at all times of the year. The gardens are a delight. Every season has its charms.. even in the rain. When the sun is out on sunny summer afternoons it is wonderful to watch the children sailing toy boats on the the pond. In the fall it is an experience l to swish through the fallen chestnut leaves. My most favorite place in Paris.
Diverting Green Space. A lovely little park with charming historical surroundings that provides a nice breathing space. Great spot for adults and/or kids.

Best in Paris?. Very very nice. Nice landscaping....fountains...statues.....trees.....actual gardens......orangerie...rosaerie......playground....sandboxes...bocce courts...tennis and running paths. We also strolled thru Parc Monceau and this was much nicer.

A pleasant refuge in Paris. A pleasant place to walk. Popular with families on a Spring afternoon.
Worth detouring through. We used it as a pleasant route to avoid busy streets - the sculptures are interesting and the sight lines to the observatory are good.

Beautiful! . It's my last day in Paris with my mother and we didn't know what to do, so I jumped onto Trip Advisor and saw that these gardens were really close to our hotel with great reviews and seeing that we both love gardens and we wanted something to do that wasn't to hard on our last day, we went. Beautiful, beautiful well kept gardens. The best park/gardens we visited in Paris. We were stoked with this find. It's the perfect place if you want to go for a walk or run or just stroll through and take a seat somewhere and enjoy some sun, or eat a baguette. It's a lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of the city all while still being in the city. Beautiful.

cool place to chill for a while. it is a nice place to chill and rest a while, after the long walk through the city.
i felt like a local there, whith the crowds and cameras.

Really nice and relaxing. Really nice and relaxing parc,nice fountains and nice to walk through.
Amazingly clean and surrounded in a nice area.
Gorgeous!. These are definitely some of the most beautiful gardens in the world. A bit crowded on a sunny day, but a must see. Grab a green chair and relax!!

Great family place. This is a beautiful park with lots to do for kids. We sailed little boats, went to a puppet show, spent time at the playground, and just had a great time walking around. Really wonderful.
Refreshing views. I found this place to be nothing but lovely. I had a tough day and ended up visiting the gardens and found the entire evening extremely refreshing

Evening stroll. As we were staying at a hotel just a few hundred yards from the gardens we took advantage of their proximity for a pleasant pre-dinner stroll. The gardens are beautifully laid out and manicured and are a delight to walk round.

Beautiful gardens. Placed right in the heart of Paris. These beautiful gardens, flowers galore, lovely statues, fountains.
It's a must if you visit Paris.
Gorgeous!. This was a great place for a picnic on a beautiful day! There are chairs set up all over. The Medici fountain was one of my favorites of the whole city.

Wonderful Experience, don't miss it!. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed the few hours we spent here. The grounds and gardens are stunningly beautiful. There was a fascinating photo exhibition of female scientists in a pavilion. For only 3 Euros we rented a boat with a Canadian flag to sail on the pond. It was a highlight of Paris for my son! It was a great place to relax after a busy day of sightseeing.

A Daily Gift. Gardens such as this in the middle of a large city are a daily gift to the inhabitants and visitors of Paris. Full on any nice day. Seats are free now (they weren't always). The flower beds have been spectacular in color in the past. They aren't this year, when they seem colorless. Too bad for that but the gardens with an occasional impromptu concert near the Blvd Mich entrance are always a lovely respite from the hectic city.
Park in Paris. Lovely garden setting with large gravel walk ways and seating. Nice place to relax while visiting Paris.
Nice Place to visit in a Sunny Day. Luxemburgo Gardens are awesome. I recomend to visit them in a Sunny day. You can spend the afternoon there reading a book or just looking the trees.

A wonderful garden, worth the visit!. What an unexpected little gem in the heart of Saint Germain! Lots of people enjoying the park, a choral group was singing and the weather was perfect!! There were tennis courts, a man had miniature pony rides set up, and the flowers were gorgeous.

Walking through history. It's a city park at its best, where you can walk, jog or just sunbathe in a chairs available everywhere. It's a stylish traditional park with flowerbeds that gives your eyes a pleasure and rest. It's a history of Paris with old fountains and statues of French queens. It's worth visiting inbetween Musee de Orsay and shopping at Bon Marche. Or even skip the shopping and spend the rest of the day there.

Wonderful for family, couples, or singles. Experience the good life at this park. It is great for people watching, perfect for kids, and an abundance of chairs to pick your favorite spot to read and relax. This park is a great sanctuary from the city.
Really nice. A great place to visit!Bit of entertainment, but also peaceful. Beautiful gardens, and a gorgeous lake!Would suggest visiting!

Tranquil part of Paris . These beautiful gardens are located in the heart of Paris, but when you're here you would feel like you were away from the crowded streets of the city.A must visit when you're in Paris!

A relaxing break. I have periodically visited the Luxembourg Gardens since 1981. It is always a pleasant respite from the hustle and bustle of the surrounding environs. A large circular model boat pond is located on the North side, usually plied with children's boats. Bocci bocci ball is played on courts to the West. The attended public toilets are clean and the charge is 0.50 Euro. You may relax on the lawns when opened by the landscapers for a power nap or local Boulangeries can provide the items for an inexp

Quiet and beautiful. Lovely, quiet place. We had a picnic here and it was a perfect day in Paris. Nice fountain in the middle. Sadly, people don't enjoy the grass, so you must sit on the chairs or steps.

Whats the big deal?. We walked all way the Luxembourg Gardens, walked inside hoping to find something special.Other than people running, reading and enjoying the sun, nothing great about this place, seriously.

A Must Visit in Paris!!!. Outstanding park in the 6th Arrondissement of Paris! Our apartment was adjacent to the gates and we visited the gardens in a Sunday. Full of local families and some tourists. The Medici Fountain is the highlight. Visit if you can!

Beautiful Taste of Local Culture. Of course, the Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. They are well maintained, stunningly designed, and a joy to experience. But a visit to them also gives a tourist a real taste of French culture. When we visited, there was a band concert going on, children were racing toy sailboats in one of the fountains, and literally thousands of locals were picnicking and just relaxing in the gardens and on the grounds.

My go-to park during a semester abroad. My study abroad program has two different university buildings - one just east of the Luxembourg Gardens, and one just west. So Monday through Wednesday I would walk from the east building through the Gardens to the west building. It NEVER got old or boring. During the nice days in Paris, the Gardens are brimming with people running, laying in the sun, playing frisbee, drinking wine, and even playing chess.You can rent tiny little sailboats and sail them through the fountain in the center of the gardens. There are tons of benches to sit on if you'd like to relax, as well as bathrooms and food kiosks. Great for a nice afternoon.
Nice place to pass an afternoon.. Nice place to pass an afternoon and bring a picnic. Easy walking for those with mobility issues and chairs in which you can rest.

Beautiful place to take a walk. Such a beautiful, peaceful place to take a walk or sit and relax. So many things to see.We went here two times during our six day stay in Paris. Lovely neighborhood surrounds the garden.

Family friendly park.. Beautifully kept gardens in central Paris,well loved by Parisians and visitors alike.Plenty of level avenues suitable for buggy and wheelchair users.Shade provided by an abundance of beautiful trees.

Heaven on Earth. A Palm tree in Paris? Yes there is and its here! This place is so beautifully manicured and gorgeous. If I lived in Paris, I would like to work here. The flower designs and color combinations were breathtaking and inspiring. This year in my own yard, I thought what colors will I do? I decided I would do all colors like the Luxembourg Gardens.
Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful place to stroll, sit and relax and just contemplate beautiful Paris. Lovely gardens and walking/running areas - great place for a jog if you're looking for a fitness fix.

An oasis in Paris. This is a place that makes me feel t home in Paris. Enjoy these gardens like the Parisians: sit down and read a book during a lovely afternoon. Children are playing with their boats in the pond, runners are exercising, and some old french are playing games. A green oasis during summer and a completely different landscape during winter.
beautiful. gardens are great!!! you can just bring something to eat and spend the evening!! excellent place for kids to play
LOVE these gardens!. central to the majority of Parisian landmarks. It is such a lovely scene in the Spring time and perfect for a picnic! this is one of my favorite spots :)

Beautiful garden!. We spent few sunny afternoons here. Just so beautiful,relaxing at the same time. Love the chairs it's amazing to sit along the edge of the lawn & watch greenery. It's fab for kids. Loads things happening around you but for me just sit & relax is enough outside the garden lots of caffe's if anyone fancy. It is busy park but worth it specially on the sunny day.

Great Romantic place to stroll in Paris. Great time to visit this garden. The flowers are in bloom and the weather was a bit cool but beautiful all the same. The days are long right now, so an evening stroll after a great Paris dinner is highly recommended for this lovely spot in Paris
Lovely Quiet Place. Just sit and enjoy the trees and birds. Remember how many famous people have sat in the gardens throughout history.
Go for the atmosphere, stay for the chocolate. The living room of Paris on the Left Bank. And, a branch of Angelina, whose hot chocolate is legendary

Simply Beautiful!. I went for a jog around the Gardens, and it was marvelous! So clean and green! I'm glad I jogged because there are so many 'hidden' statues on the outskirts. I wished I had more time in Paris to come back here with a coffee and book on the chairs.

Lovely park. The garden was absolutely charming: the kiosk concert, the fountain with little sailboats,.. There are also plenty of take out restaurants around the garden. You can grab something to eat and have a picknick in the park.
Great for kids. Rented sail boats, rode ponies, played in playground... what more can you say when you have a couple of kids with you that couldn't care less about the historical sites of Paris ;)

A place to sit. Luxembourg is beautiful; we spent several afternoons sitting and people watching in the chairs along the edge of the lawn. We used the gardens as our meeting place at the end of the day and I could have just stared for hours at the beauty around. It gets a little crowded, and don't be afraid of a little gravel (or a lot of gravel) but you have to swing by to check Luxembourg Gardens out when you're in Paris!OH! Bathroom access is very limited and it's not free! Such is all of France!

Beautiful Garden to relax in.. If traveling with children, this would be a good park to take them to on the Left Bank. There's a "pond" and you can rent wooden toy sailboats for the children to put in the pond.
Great spot to walk, relax, enjoy the flowers. beautiful, peaceful, well manicured gardens and lawns, perfect spot to enjoy the day or a few minutes.
A walk in the Park. Very enjoyable even though it was raining the first day we visited. Returned on a sunny day to a quiet peaceful oasis in a busy city.
Ideal for family chill out. The oldest merry go rond, Poney ride, play ground, boats to push on the big fountain. A heaven for a day outside when you visit Paris with children.

Delightful gardens & surprise engagement!. The most gorgeous gardens in the world, made even more special by a surprise picnic and engagement! It's a must see - particularly with a bottle and some cheese!
As you like. whether relaxing with a book, people watching, spending time with friends, exercising, eating or sunbathing the garden has a spot for everyone.
nice. Nice Garden with lots of runners and families. Fun sail boats on the water fountain for kids. Lots of chairs for sitting and enjoying the green. Medici Fountain is beautiful.

Nice and calm. Nice and peaceful gardens - perfect place to spend some time on a pretty day. We visited during pretty cold spring day so didn't quite get the best experience, but still worth the visit.
