A Pleasant Afternoon. if you can spare the time from the hectic pace of running from museum to museum, grab a baguette, champagne, cheese, and a little dessert along with a blanket ( we used the one from Air France! ) and head to this beautiful park. Although any day would be great, go on the weekend to be fully immersed in the scene. Laughing children, a band playing in the background and a spirited game of bocce. Allow the whole day, don't rush this experience.

Beautiful and in full bloom at this time. We walked through the gardens and enjoyed the peacefulness from the hectic traffic/crowds of Paris. The fountain/monument located at the east end of the gardens is truly peaceful and tranquil.

A great space to unwind for the whole family. The Luxembourg Gardens is an oasis of peace in a busy city the quiet space was welcome and there are an amazing amount of seats available to sit and relax. The model boating lake is great for kids and there is something for the whole family whether running, sun bathing, relaxing, or just passing through it leaves you relaxed and calm in a busy city.

Beautiful. We took a stroll around the park and it was beautiful. There are fountains, huge green spaces, statues, and of course, lovers. People were enjoying the sunny day with picnics and books. We wish we had a baguette, blanket and bottle of wine. Oh well, maybe next time!

Beautiful Gardens in the Heart of Paris. The gardens are a great place to walk, enjoying the paths and gardens, or sitting, watching people and breathing in the relaxing atmosphere. We went there several times, and even when there were lots of people around, it still was not crowded. A wonderful oasis.

Meh... It has potential, and maybe it's just because the bulbs haven't come out yet, but it wasn't mind blowing. Retiro Park in Madrid, to be honest, is better. It is pretty, definitely, but something other than lawns and trees would be nice. Good for a post-lunch stroll with someone you love, or to read a book or have a coffee (BYO) on the grass.

even in the rain!. A beautifully serene public park at the top of Bvld San Michele -- come to sit and people watch/ sail toy boats in the lake/ watch the locals play chess in the open or admire the many carefully manicured colour-coded flower-beds. Buy a takeout coffee and a madelaine and let Paris take over!

Great relaxing gardens - full of life. A great place to be in the sun, full of life - lots of families and Young people as it's close to the Sorbonne. tons of free chairs to sit around in.bring baguettes, ham and tomatoes :-)
relaxing tour of the Luxembourg Gardens. I enjoyed a relaxing tour of the Luxembourg Gardens, taking many photographs of statutes, sites and buildings.

Fantastic respite in the middle of the city. When we travel in Europe with our kids, we always reserve time for relaxing in the cities' parks. Luxembourg Gardens is really beautiful - a fairly formalized garden structure with trimmed shrubs, flowers, etc. - but we still found a spot to kick a soccer ball around for a little while. There's also a really fun playground space from the looks of it, but we got there as it was closing so the kids didn't get to check it out. One tip - stop by the patisserie sadaharu aoki, which is only a couple of blocks away, to pick up what are rated as among the top 25 best pastries anywhere in the world. We brought some with us to the park, and they were out of this world. Just compounded the beauty of the park.
Created with love.. there You can rest, relax, dream. Everything harmonious, tasteful, created with love. The song of J. Dassin sounded in my soul.

Absolutely beautiful!. Loved the architecture. Very friendly people. Really close to a metro station (right outside the gates), the Sorbonne and Pantheon. A band sometimes plays live music in the marquee close to the evening time. Suitable for families and large groups or to even go alone. The fountains are gorgeous and there is plenty of seating available.

Nice park. It's better than the Tuilleries. Love the view of the palace and the squarely trimmed trees. Don't like the light dust from the gravel that sticks to your clothes and can't be easily dusted off.

perfect for a picnic . Nice french garden, with hundreds of seats to take the sun: when it gets out in paris
As it is in front of the Sorbonne, you will meet many tourists but also students taking the sun and having picnics

Charming and historical.. We actually found the Luxembourg gardens by accident as we strolled through Paris ( it is perhaps the best walking city I have ever been to). French congress has a beautiful building in the Gardens and there are beautiful fountains and open space to explore.
Beautiful; free entry. Chairs and lounge chairs available for people who like to sit down and enjoy a picnic lunch. Restrooms are not free though (50 cents).
Restful Gardens. Itinerant musicians (even Dixieland!) play just outside of the Gardens while you relax by the pond. There is a palace that is also within the Garden walls.

Spring in Paris. Great spot to run, take photos, chill out and keep going back to. Gardens are well organised and best spot was the waterfall/fountain under the shade of the trees, with Venus the sculpture prominent.

Beautiful garden in the middel of Paris!. Went here for a stroll on a Saturday afternoon, and liked it a lot. Music to listen to, chairs to have a rest in, and a small rastaurant for a glass of wine or a coffee, and lots of things to look at and enjoy.
Just like the locals. On a bright sunny day, all locals come out to this beautiful garden to play, lounge and relax. And just for a while, we felt like Parissiens

Great for a Picnic. The Luxembourg Gardens have lots of green space that you can sit on and have a picnic. There is great people watching and beautiful scenery. I noticed one small stand selling crepes and ice cream, but I'd just get your picnic fixings from Rue Mouffetard (not too far of a walk). We brought bread, cheese, wine- it was amazing!

Beautiful park for a walk in the sunshine . Stayed in a hotel near to Luxembourg gardens. We walked through the gardens on our first day in Paris. Unfortunately, the weather was really poor at the time so we didn't stay. However, i imagine this to be a beautiful area to spend an hour on a sunny day.

Relaxing, beautiful, must go . Beautiful! Must go. Bring some drinks and snacks and enjoy a few hours here. The garden is very clean and ofcourse great for pictures. Once ur done with the touristy stuff just lay around and enjoy the atmosphere. It was a bit long of a walk from the river so my wife and I rented the city bikes, which I thought enhanced the overall experience of Paris.

A rest in the Heart of Paris. I am so attached to this garden in the heart of Paris. When I was a little girl, I used to go and see the puppet show Guignol. It still exists.. Nowadays, it is a pleasure to wander near the Senat building

A place to to just to sit and be part of Paris. Make sure it is a sunny day, grab a chair and just sit by the fountain and watch Paris go by.Or join the students on the grass with a baguette. A pony ride for the kids or hop on the carousel for the perfect pic. This is a destination not a pathway so give yourself the time.

Nice park for morning run. This is not a very natural park but large and with a fountain in center. The jogging course round the garden (very popular) is exactly 2 km long. In the afternoons it is full of people but in the morning only joggers can be seen.

Beautiful park in the city.. A lovely park and beautiful gardens provide a welcome break from the busy city. Gorgeous rose garden and well trimmed shrubs. Fun to see kids enjoying a sunny afternoon. Also a nice spot for a picnic lunch.
Great place to wander. Right in the art of a busy area, this is an oasis from the hustle and bustle. Great place to bring a eat a picnic!
Wonderful on a sunny day. A lovely place to sit or walk around on a sunny day. Lots of deck chairs and a lake with small boats for children.

This is a Sunday Must. Parisians have the article of living down to a science, and for many this includes spending time in this lovely park on a Sunday. Many come to exercise, and others to relax. A huge number come with picnics. One sees every one from babies to 80 year old lovers (yes really).There are areas for sunbathing, others for playing sports, but they are separate. Families cluster in areas with pony rides, places to sail small boats and playgrounds. Singles and couples congregate in areas determined by whether they want to relax or be social. There are areas to listen to music and other areas of quiet. With 60 acres of green space, paths, fountains and statues, there is a place for everyone and everything. It was a true Parisian experience, and it was free, except for the wine, bread, cheese and cookies we brought for our picnic.
Relaxing and pretty. The grounds are lovely and well maintained. One can see many Parisians relaxing around the area with many chairs available and a nice little restaurant.

Beautiful, peaceful spot (with a hidden restaurant). One of the best gardens in Paris (if not THE best). Peaceful, even when it's busy. Plenty of seating (but if you plan to eat a picnic lunch, be sure to get there early because students pour into the park at lunchtime). We always stay hear here when we're in Paris, and we frequently visit the park. often sitting with a book for a couple of hours. On the north-east side of the park, look for a fountain (Fontaine de Medici). Ascend the steps near the fountain, and you'll find a restaurant (Pavillon de la Fontaine) with lots of outdoor tables. Great place for a glass of wine, and if you're hungry it has reasonable menu
A lovely place to sit and while away an hour. Lovely peaceful gardens in the heart of Paris. plentiful chairs to sit and soak up the sun. Situated near St Germain
A lovely place to sit and while away an hour. Lovely peaceful gardens in the heart of Paris. plentiful chairs to sit and soak up the sun. Situated near St Germain
Nice park. Decent park to have a walk around if you're in the Luxembourg area, when we visited the fountains were off which was a shame. Small park for children, plenty of benches to sit on.

Time to relax and enjoy the atmosphere. . Love to go these places where the local also enjoy to hang out.
Being playing chess, tennis or just laying down on the grass and relax.
For me this is more fun than wait in line for hours and hours to see monument.
Hope you have nice weather when you visit the park.
Nice for a walk or picnic. The park is quite nice for a walk or a picnic. It's also a good place to go for a morning jog. Lots of trees and flowers. More for adults than kids.

Beautiful space. We spent a couple of happy hours here. Lovely to watch some surprisingly good tennis players having a crack on the tennis courts. The worst thing was the scales we found because we worked out how much weight we'd put on staying in Paris. Lovely lake, beautiful trees, a gorgeous respite in the heart of Paris.

On of my absolute favourites!. No matter what weather or season, this little place is very close to heaven on earth! I very much enjoyed strolling through the park, resting on the green chairs infusing some sunlight and simply diving into the prevailing special atmosphere. Would go there again and again! Chapeau!

Beautiful flora & statues throughout the park!. The park was between my hotel and the metro station I used quite frequently. Each time I walked a slightly different route hoping to stumble into new art and the park was covered with sculptures from various time periods. The flowers were just coming into full bloom and it couldn't have been prettier. With more time it would have been nice to sit around in the grass or by the fountain to have lunch and relax. If you're in the area it's worth at least a walk through.
A great walk. This is truly a wonderful place to walk and observe Parisians. There is always so much going on in the park it provides a great window to the city.

A must see. Grab a baquette, some wine and cheese, and wander down to this park. It is beautiful. The grounds are meticulously manicured and the park is spotless.A great sanctuary in the area...it is a fantastic respite from the bustle of the city

Let your kids run wild!. This is a great place if you have kids under 12! Go ahead and pay the toll and let your kids play in the play ground! It is well worth it with the zip line and open space to run! This is the park that got my kids to love Paris!

Beautifully Utilized Space. It is not only beautiful to look around, but it is very much used by locals. We were impressed by all the people exercising in the park. Little groups here and there doing tai-chi or other exercise classes and tons of people running.

Nice stroll. The gardens are really large, so if you want to go through it thoroughly, you'll need 1-2 hours, more if you visit the museum of palace inside it.
Strolling through the park was a wonderful experience -- grab a seat and just unwind and watch all the people milling about.

Just go there!. A truly beautiful place. Gorgeous palace and gardens. My advice - go to a nearby boulangerie/patisserie and buy a picnic to take (get some extra bread to feed the ducks!) and just sit on one of the many chairs in these beautiful gardens, taking it all in. Take a walk around the orchard area, watch the boules games and relax.

A Great Place to Do Most Anything. After a particularly difficult time, we traveled to Paris to seek a bit of distance from everyday life. We found it in Luxembourg Gardens. A large public place with a plethora of mini-areas that are distinct and yet seem tailor-made for various situations. On a number of days, we jogged through the park and turned around at the distinctive Pyramid of the Louvre. On other days, we wandered the various paths seeking solace with what amounts to nature in the middle of a massive city. We sat by a small lake, surrounded by Parisian families just enjoying the spring air and feeding the ducks (and unfortunately the pigeons) while keeping thought of returning to work at bay. There are a number of dining options within the park but they seemed either too cheesy or too expensive (poor value) and so we never ate anything in the park that we didn't bring with us from outside. But, I would say that the Luxembourg Gardens are a fantastic place to take in some of the ambiance of Paris without the crowds.

Peaceful.... Wow! This place is so beautiful and serene. I came hear early one morning just to take in some greenery, which is missing from my normal desert life, and the gardens didn’t disappoint. Apparently it’s a place where people go to job. There are nice trails for jogging/walking. The place is sprinkled with beautiful sculptures. There’s a recreation area as well. There I saw a children’s play area and a tennis court. I didn’t get too close so there may have been addition things there. There are nice places to sit near the fountains and along the paths. It was refreshing. The neighborhood leading up to the garden is one of the cleanest ones I’ve seen while in Paris. There are also shops near by and plenty of cafes and restaurants. This was one of the highlights of my trip to Paris.
Pretty. A nice place for a stroll, cup of coffee or to read a book. It is a lovely well kept park. Too bad it closes too early

Relaxing, laid back, lovely fruit trees. The gardens are huge, the seating-- all kinds of chairs, lounges, benches, are so convenient, and every patch has a different bit of art. Walking groups with sticks are fun to watch. So are the boule games.

A little quiet in a big city. This garden was a short walk from our hotel,lovely grounds, and art work. The fountains are not to be missed, go in the morning lots of space, and time to stroll along this wonderful space.
Lovely. Loved the, however...avoid the parks when it's windy - not a lot of pavements in any, so when the wind blows (like it has when I was there) the dust flies in the air.

A Beautiful, Amazing and Widespread Garden. An example of 18th century appreciation of gardens for everyone, beautifully maintained with a couple of miles of walking paths spread out over a 1/3 mile wide garden.
Iconic. What a park! I prefer Vondelpark and James Madison Park in Madison, WI over this. But when in Paris, it just feels magical. Explore the quiet corners of the park.

Dreamlike. Beautiful, experience full of allegory. It was absolutely amazing to wander through these beautiful gardens. I would highly recommend a visit here and spend an hour or two basking in its glory.
A lovely spot in the middle of Paris. A respite from Paris that lots of people seem to ignore. Well worth a wander in here to watch the people walking by and to take a break from the city.

Exercise with restraint. It's the outdoor running track of Paris, as well as the place for young mothers to bring their babies and toddlers. Beautiful fountains, typically careful plantings and lots of space and benches, it's a perfect outdoor exercise and relaxation venue. Personally, I like my parks with a little wildness to them, but this is a really lovely example of Parisian response to public need for escape into the outdoors.

Beautiful!. We stayed in a hotel right next to the Jardin de Luxembourg and it was such a nice treat. There are plenty of chairs to sit and enjoy the weather and the ambiance and there's even a restaurant/bar where you can grab a drink. Definitely a must-see.

Beautiful. We came to visit because the gardens were so highly recommended. Unfortunately due to metro closures we found it difficult to get there but once there we loved it!We didn't walk around too much as our feet were sore but enjoyed the serenity of the gardens. We visited on a lovely Sunday early afternoon and the park was busy with families, couples, runners and travellers.Initially we made the mistake (as did many others) of lying on the grass which was lovely. However, this is forbidden (although we didn't see any signs) so we were asked to move which we did. There are lots of great individual chairs that can be moved around which was nice.Overall, it's a beautiful park so if you need some downtime after exploring Paris and want to relax away from crowds I highly recommend coming here. Bring a picnic and good book! There is a lot to explore and the history is really interesting so google it before you arrive.Highly recommended!
Tranquil. A walk through these gardens topped off the final day of our vacation and we felt like we had stepped back in time.
Peaceful and relaxing. Great place to see and wind down from the hectic movement in the city. Beautiful and marvelous and a sight to be seen.

Beautiful. This is one of my favorite gardens in Paris (with Butte Charmont, for a totally different feel). It's the very groomed, well preserved French feel that makes it stand out- it has a lot of variety in a comfortable amount of space, and it's fun to listen to music from the bandstand while watching kids play with sailboats in the central fountain. Definitely worth a visit if you've seen a Parisian park- fewer people than the Toulleries Gardens, and more interesting things to look at.
Great place to relax. Such a beautiful park to read a nice book, have a drink nearby and just watch the day go past, Parisian living as it should be!

Clean, Green and Peaceful.. Going to Paris and not visiting the gardens - just not possible. The pleasing greenery and the peace and calm is wonderful, as are the fountain and the lake. Visit this after a bit of hectic touring to get your energy back.

Where Paris comes to relax. These gardens are the ones to see within the city. Children playing with the sailboats in the pool, mothers with their children. People reading and sunning at leisure. Chess players at the tables. All in a spectacular formal garden several centuries old. Check out the 300 year old potted trees. The Senate of the French Assembly sits in the former chateau.

Gorgeous. This garden is the most beautiful green space I visited in all of Paris. It's sprawling and loaded (although not crowded) with people lounging and enjoying the garden. The massive topiaries reminded me of something out of Alice and Wonderland. My only regret is that we weren't able to spend more time here, and I can't wait to come back and explore further.

Lovely place for a walk. I love gardens. This one is amazing! even in march, when it's not green and full of flowers. If I ever go back to Paris, and bring my children, I will definitely take them there to play!!

History and relaxation. The Statues of the Queens of France including one Queen of England. The statue of the Mask merchant. Renting and sailing a boat. Sitting in the sun people watching and rating a picnic lunch bought at a gourmet baker's. 'The Tudor's exhibition. The bee hives

Spring and the French. I was lucky enough on my first visit to see the trees brought out of the green house. It was quite an experience to see the tractors carrying the large boxed palm trees, the olive trees, etc. The children were playing with their boats on the little pond and everyone was either basking in the sun or exercising. I walked there again today and marveled at how sun brings out everyone in a good mood. You will hear a lot of tourists, but it doesn't change the ambience.

Beautiful oasis in the bustling City. We spent a late afternoon walking through the garden park. We saw kids running about and enjoying themselves on the playground. We missed the puppet show at one of the indoor theaters. We saw locals playing pétanque, a game where steel balls are bowled as close as can be to a target wooden ball. We saw many pieces of sculpture, old and new, as well as an interesting grape vine garden. The central pool of water was surrounded by folks on ubiquitous green park chairs, sitting in the sun or having conversations. The park is a great place to wind down and chill.

So lovely. I looked forward to the Lux Gardens for some time. And it is a beautiful as you have read and heard. But dang does it get crowded on a warm weekend day. If you're goin for a picnic go early or go during the week. And for heavens sake bring some wine and cheese! You're in Paris!
quiet time. the gardens in the spring, in Paris. It doesn't get much better than this. Time out in lovely surroundings,.

Nice!. It's really nice and a beautigul place were to chill out!Chairs available for free next the little lake where you can rent and play with little boat! You can just stay on the grass and it's great for children!Horses, playground, big areas..
Sit down and relax. Just stay around the lake, laying out in the chairs, enjoy nice sunsert, the view. Kids can rent a small boat, sounds like good fun.....

Romantic walk in the garden . We walked all over the garden. Although very crowded, Paris ensures its gardens are very well kept. The stretch between Le Louvre and les champs élysées is beautiful. We stopped for a drink at on of the cafes to enjoy the sun.

Nice walk. We went there on a cloudy day of April. It was nice, we took a few pictures, walked the whole thing, watched people play chess, etc. Of course, it was early in the season so there was not that much flowers and stuff, but it was cool nonetheless.

I like it sooo much. It's amazing place to spend 3-4 hours in it, the landscape is lovely, u can join other groups in a yoga lesson, or walking. Children enjoyed the inside lake feeding the ducks, there is also a playground for kids.
It's highly revommended to visit

A nice escape in the middle of Paris. This huge park is great for a nice walk when you just want to relax. Nice for people-watching. There's a pond where kids can push around little sailboats. The park branches off into a bunch of smaller paths to discover.There's also a great playground/play area for kids. It's a few euro to get in, but it looked like a lot of fun and very well-maintained.Everything is so green and peaceful.. even on a rainy day, we found it very pleasant. It's a nice distraction from the tourist shuffle.
Great spot to kick back. Loved walking over from our hotel. Grabbing a beer and just kicking back in a chair. Great people watching.

Live like a Parisian. In any weather, you'll be joining everyday Parisians to enjoy the beautiful gardens and statues of Luxembourg Gardens. A relaxing stroll with lots of opportunity to sit and people watch.

For relaxing. When we visited the weather was great, about 70 Fahrenheit and sunny. The park had many people out enjoying the weather, but you could still find plenty of room for yourself.If you wanted to sit on the grass and have some wine and cheese, you could do that (on some parcels of grass). If you wanted to play chess, there were many games going. Chairs for sitting upright and lounging are all around, too.

Beautiful park and palace!. Every see a movie in Paris with children push sailboats w a long pole into a fountain/pond? Right in front of the luxemborg palace! A beautiful park with several amenities running track on edge of park, tennis, playgrounds and more. Great picnic place!

A refuge from tourist Paris. This is the playground of Paris and if you want to see what Parisians do on a nice day, come here. It is pretty and busy, especially on a nice weekend day. Chess matches, boules and tennis. A bit of sculpture. A nice place to relax and watch the world go by.

Well manicured garden. I can only describe it as a garden which is in keeping with the beauty of the palace. What a beautiful sight to watch the Parisians running, playing tennis, cycling or just walking during the morning, lunch or evening. The healthy Parisians in a beautiful garden setting!!!

A little bit for everyone. Lovely stroll thru the park shows the locals kids enjoying the sail boats, romping across the park and a few taking a pony ride. The grounds are beautiful and clean and a perfect resting spot especially with a picnic lunch.

Beautiful gardens. Wonderful open spaces and numerous walking tracks.There is something different to see around each turn.There are two gents that sail RC yachts,every day,for the enjoyment of the many families and children that come to the gardensThere are many areas for solitude(recommended after a day of tourist stuff),or areas to soak up the peacefulness of the gardens.Very well maintained and clean,and as is the case in most of Paris, an obvious absence of people drinking and eating as they walk.A truly world class park and gardens.Thank you to the workers that maintain this area.

Pretty spot. The Gardens were just a ten minute walk from our hotel. They are a popular spot for Parisians wanting to soak up the sun. There is a lovely water feature and pretty gardens to stroll around. We were there in late afternoon and still lots of people just relaxing on chairs near the water and catching the last rays of the sun. The top of the Eiffel Tower can be seen in the distance.

Sit and dream in the sun, or just watch others enjoying the serenity.. When visiting Paris we head for the gardens to relax, enjoy a bottle of rose' with a baguette for lunch, or just sit and admire the flowers and doze in the sun. If energetic one can just jog around the gardens, stretch, and do what the Parisians do.............watch others or juust ignore the busy world outside. Relaxing.
It doesn't get much better. Spring time in the Jardin with your favorite just can't be beat! The horse chestnut trees, tulips, and other flowers were magnificent.

Urban Idyl. Located on the Left Bank, the Luxembourg Garden and Palace (now the home of the French Senate) but originally the home of Marie de Medici make for a perfect break from the city and offer truly a breath of fresh air. Well worth the stroll.

Oasis in the heart of Paris. I was so fortunate to stay close to the gardens. It was perfect for my pre-marathon jog and I enjoyed a lazy lunch on one of the green chairs a couple of days later. I was also treated to some kind of changing of the guard that was v Parisienne and French! A lovely spot to chill out after the rigours of touring Paris.
Perfect walk. A must , we combined with the visit with the museum and a walk to the Sorborne University + Panteon , the gardens are a pleasure to walk and are small enough to do with in an slow hour
fantastic. Nothing to dislike, it's a beautiful church. I would allow at least a couple of hours to see everything inside. You can snap go to the top of the church...

Nice. A cute wander through the lovely park. It is filled with big trees, a big water feature, and a wondrous palace. Unfortunately, I went during the winter while the trees had no leaves and the flowers weren't in bloom, but it was nice just to walk around.
Beautiful gardens and open spaces. Only a short walk from our Hotel Grand Hommes, the gardens and space was great to walk through. Buy lunch at a nearby cafe and enjoy the gardens

Luxemborg Gardens. A must stop if you're in the area. Expansive with alot of local attactions aka boule and school children playing. Really a beautiful respite and a nice area to walk thru. Highly recommend many visits here.
Beautiful garden. Definitely a great place to visit. Much bigger than I expected with great views and lots of seats. Not quite as varied in flowers as I hoped though.
A delightful suprise. We stopped at the gardens during a bus tour of the city. They were delightful with shady lawns and tree lined boulevards and plenty of seating.
Breathtaking!. Gorgeous gardens and architecture! A great place to admire and stroll around, grab a snack and enjoy the view!

A Bustling Oasis. I loved these gardens. In the evening there were lots of people walking, jogging, and just out enjoying the sun. I was looking for a geocache. The flowers were in bloom. A great place to relax and enjoy April in Paris.

PICNIC TIME. A very nice park to rest those weary feet in .Bought picnic from M+S down the road, very handy. Quiet no thumping music just the odd guitar strumming away. Boating park for the kids, and some dads with the hire yachts available. Handy for a rest after the Pantheon or walking round the Sorbonne area. The Palais looked very impressive.

Lovely garden. Lovely to stroll. We were delighted to hear a large choir singing in the bandstand while enjoying our hot chocolate. The gardens are full of surprises, like a man made pond with sculptures and waterfall, lots of ducks and other birds, all tucked away throughout the park

Great park for children and adults alike. I remember going to the Luxembourg Gardens as a child and loving the different activities. There is a cool area reserved for under 12's with slides and monkey bars and swings. There is a dedicated area with face to face swings that is always very fun. There is a merry-go-round with a typical Parisian game of "catch-the-ring-with-your-wand-and-get-a-prize", and puppet representations in a traditional théatre de marionettes. You can also rent miniature sail boats that kids can have fun maneuvering with a stick in one of the basins.For adults, it is a great place to run, to sun-bathe by the fountains on the chairs and deck chairs at your disposal, to visit (do not miss the Medici fountain), or to just stroll. Not far from Montparnasse and the Pantheon it has much less tourists that the Jardins des Tuileries, which makes it much more authentic. Do not miss the photo exhibit on its outer gates which takes you on an exploration of the French mountain landscapes.

Wonderful oasis. These gardens are a wonderful oasis in the St Germain area of Paris full of flowers and lawns. We were there on a Monday afternoon and watched the old men playing boules. There is also a small Statue of Liberty along with many statues of famous artists. This place is not to be missed

Go around lunchtime! . Buy some lunch at a boulangerie and take it to this garden. sit and enjoy!
Very nice gardens, pond with sailingboots, tables to play chess
Take a stroll. If your young kids are tired of walking on the streets of Paris, let them sail a model boat in the pond. It would be a god trade-off.
Beautiful. Definitely a beautiful and relaxing garden. A great place to sit and do some people watching. The palace and museum are beautiful as well.
great picnic lunch. What an amazing place to relax and have a picnic lunch! Bought a cheese and eggplant quiche from a vendor in the park and it was amazing. Fantastic food is everywhere in Paris!

Perfect for reading and snacking. Absolutely lovely plantings and chairs scattered all around to read in the sun or shade. We bought baguettes, cheese, woodland strawberries, etc. and had a restful and refreshing lunch in this beautiful park limning the Latin Quarter. Playgrounds, apiaries, statuary and little nooks as well as wide open spaces. People do not sit on the grass, chairs are used, Fermob, I think? Anyway, a nice place to take a break.

Beautiful and so much fun. LOVED the gardens! So pretty, tranquil and such a good energy. Even if you don't have a lot of time on Paris, get yourself a one hour quiet walking in the beatiful gardens. It'll make you feel so good :)Highly recommended

Gorgeous gardens!. And I even went in the rain the first time! But definitely a sight worth seeing - and if you have the time, relaxing on one of the benches, whether it's reading a book or just relaxing and looking around. I doubted the beauty of it when people recommended it to me, but definitely worth a walk over there.
Worth a walk. Had a lovely Sunday stroll around the gardens. Great to see locals excerising and enjoying time with their families. Beautiful gardens and sculptures.

beautiful garden, 2nd best in Paris!. in my opinion, one of the best in paris! very beautiful garden, big and well located in the city, call (not so busy) and a beautiful palace behind. walking by you can see tennis courts and bars, perfect place to be in the end of the day!

Good place to jog. Wonderful place to jog in the morning
Would highly recommend.
It helps that there is a carrefour express and bakery nearby too!

Sunday in the park. We strolled through the gardens on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and enjoyed seeing residents enjoying their park, and not being overwhelmed with a tourist crush. Young people lolling on the lawns between the plane tree allees and watching people play bacci ball were two delights.

Wonderful!. The gardens and the palace are just amazing. I recommend an hour of just wondering around or sitting by the Grand Bassin to take the beauty all in. There are boulangeries at the near boulevard Saint Michel where you can grab a croissant to make the experience even more french... Be sure not to miss the fountain de l'Observatorio at the southernmost part of the gardens as well.
Nice. Average city park with a large, well maintained play ground (visited mainly by local Parisians; paid entrance, including toilet facilities). Nice place for families!

Very Pretty. It was worth the trip to see, not many people were visiting. Sadly we were there during a time when they wasn't any water in the pond. It was dry and kind of sad to see. The flowers were beautiful though. Was nice to walk around and see those having a picnic on the benches. Doesn't take a long time to walk around.

Worth the trek. The Luxembourg Gardens are a bit out of the way and require both a metro and train ride, but is very easy to get to. You can use your metro ticket to board the train, no need for a separate type of ticket. It is absolutely worth it. Take a book, settle into a green lawn chair like a true Parisian, and enjoy. Plan to spend an hour here, between sitting and walking around, exploring the gardens. Route:Very easy. You need to get to the train Line B - on this line, the stop is LUXEMBOURG. One possible route: Take Metro Line 1 to the CHATELET stop, then change to Line B of the Train in the direction SAINT REMY. Get off at LUXEMBOURG.

Beautiful, but full of dust. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful and they offer you so many things- enjoy and relax on the sun, visit Luxembourg Palace, listen to a classical music, do sports or eat and drink outside. The only problem is that it is very dusty, because there is no asphalt.

Magnificent gardens. No visit to Paris can be complete without a stroll through the magnificent Jardin de Luxembourg. In late afternoon, especially, this is a restful, lovely place. People lounging on chairs around the central lake; perhaps some live music; it is all much like a Renoir painting in a great many respects.

Stunningly stylish garden that contains the very ORIGINAL Statue of Liberty ( yes even before New York's version). The French do gardens well. The Luxembourg Gardens are no exception.Well well worth a 2 hour visit in a tight schedule.The gardens are beautifully landscaped and you'll see Paris residents relaxing here. Many who live in apartments see the gardens as their front garden. You can't take a bad picture here.Find the very first Statue of Liberty here. Its fiendishly well hidden. Indeed they don't make a big fuss about it.But it predates the New York version.It is of course much smaller. maybe 2metres high.Get there by number 38 bus going south from Boulevard San Michel. Costs 2 euros. Or take the RER to Luxembourg station.Try a cafe Corse at the booth, which was surprisingly good. The park shuts overnight so don't think about a midnight trip here. There is no entry fee.
gorgeous and in full bloom in April. These are so beautiful and were in full bloom in April. Lots to explore and areas to play palenque if you can get a local to teach you. (like bocce)

Wonderful. What a wonderful and delightful place to stumble on. It was beautiful strolling through tree lined paths observing people doing what they like on a gorgeous spring morning. Tranquility at its best.

gardens are beautifull even in the rain. While the gardens are nice, there are so many other things to do in Paris that would be a higher priority. We visited because of Labor Day May 1 when most of the other museums were closed. On a sunny day--it would be a great place for a picnic-there are lots of sitting areas (when we visited it was raining so we didn't linger)
Beautiful, Even in the Fall. Still beautiful and well worth the walk to see in the late fall. Lovely fall flowers and foliage of all colors, less crowded, peaceful on a Sunday afternoon.
Luxembourg Gardens afternoon. A place for locals to enjoy picnics, reading, lounging, family gatherings, students studying, great architecture and flower gardens
One of my favorite parks in Paris. I love this place with to without kids. It is just so Paris and organized and a bit up-tight! The park for kids is fantastic but can get very busy.
Excellent.. I'm often here, strolling around and sitting down..basking in the sun like a local. Don't forget to grab a coffee!

Beautiful relaxing space. The Gardens is a beautiful open space with beautiful flowers, trees, green grass, sculptures and a big central pond where the children play with their yachts. A perfect place to relax in a warm spring day. There are many people (locals & tourists) but nothing can't ruin the atmosphere of the place.
Often overlooked gem. Awesome gardens not yet over run by masses of tourists. Well maintained clean and a nice place to hang out for a bit of a break from the tourist rush.

Beautiful Gardens. An amazing hive of Parisian activity in a beautiful setting. When we arrived one spring afternoon;a period movie was being made, nearby a group of girls practiced a cheer squad routine, many couples or small groups sitting on the grass or on the multitude of loose chairs provided, talking or eating or reading or snoozing.Parents or grandparents with their children/grandchildren enjoying the park,were everywhere. The flower beds were an art form of colour and flower combinations. It was just beautiful and immaculately cared for.Don't miss it!!

The Central Park of Paris. A people place, with lots of room to roam and relax. Playgrounds, food stalls, beautiful spacious Versailles-like gardens and, of course, the historic bees. It was a bright sunny day. We strolled through the park eating hot sugar crepes made by one of the vendors. Glorious!
A nice stroll. Nice gardens to take a stroll through in the middle of the city. Take a baguette and sit under the trees. There are little boats for rent to sail on the pond, fun for kids.

Not for a windy say. I am in two minds about this place. The gardens were lovely but we were not allowed on the grass. There are extensive areas of gravel and very dusty. It was windy the day we visited and we were constantly eating dust! Having said that, the boating pond was great fun, watching the model yachts racing, pony rides for children and a small fun fair. I just missed being able to walk on the grass and get away from the dust..

Favorite place in Paris. I always end up here if it's a warm day. Oops. Now you will (because I'm so reliable), so I take that back. Seriously, can't be beat when the weather is nice and the flowers, trees and grass are in full glory. And the STATUES! And the FOUNTAINS! And the lovely hills with evergreens at the eastern (?) quadrant. Pure delight.

Beautiful gardens. The Gardens are a wonderful place to sit and relax. The grounds are exquisite, and there was activity going on in every corner - whether it was pony rides for the children, a game of tennis or just walking. There was a choir performing the day we were there, and it was truly enchanting!

Must visit garden. Beautiful garden well worth a visit .My friends and myself are going to be staying at an apartment in October just outside the gardens so this will be ideal for lunches and relaxing .Lovely water feature with small sailing boats for children .A must for gardeners and photographers .
peaceful paradise. Very good place to unwind. Walking is recommended and very easy. Good green chairs to relax in and lots of people to watch.

Beautiful in every seasons. Near center Paris, rive gauche, is a place where everybody is welcome. A large garden surrounding french Senat, with wooden boats on water bassin and comfortable chairs to spend some time. Scared around is lot of various sculptures (animals, historical personnages...) and the famous Fontaine Medicis (where the lovers Acis and Galatee wait for their doom in the shadow of cyclop Polyphem). Whereas you are traveling solo or with a large familly, if you have all the time or only few minutes, if you're near this place you should go. For those who like photography, there are thematic expositions displayed on garden's fence. (note : excuse my english for i am french.)

Just a very pleasant place to pass some time. After a long morning visiting one of Paris' main attractions we were delighted to find that the Jardin de Luxembourg is still the lovely place we remembered from many years ago. The central circular pond still has boys sailing model yachts across it, albeit that they now seem to be hired rather than self-built!

Relaxing in the romantic public park. After the hectic non-stop museum tours, I had a much relaxing hour stroll in this romantic park. A good suggesion is to have the take away burger lunch here (there is a McDonald outlet acrossed the road near the entrance) near the large pond in the centre while enjoying the model sailboats racing in the pond. There were many tourists during the Easter season. The weather was alright and you can imagine how sought after the iron chairs here as they were always occupied. This is really a great people park as i could that people here enjoying the well maintained public facilities here. The big plus point here is it does not charge entrance fees unlike similar park elsewhere such as Kew Garden in London.

Beautiful garden for a relaxing outing. We have been there a few times at different time of the year.In the spring, there are less people around and you can walk around enjoying the beauty of the place. In summer, on a hot day, it is always great to stroll in the shade of the lovely trees. There are flowers everywhere, people enjoying the place, sitting on benches and chairs or having picnic on the lawn. It is definitely a must see.

Very very big garden, but nothing much to do apart from sitting there. Nice and big garden. The palace inside it is guarded. The water spot at the center is nice as well for kids to play the boat (it is sold near by). But there is nothing much to do apart from a relaxing enjoyment.

Fabulous statues, lovely gardens and not to miss fountain!. We took the opportunity to picnic on the lawns (you can only sit on the grass where signed) in the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. There are many chairs scattered throughout to soak up the spring sunshine, many of them were located in front of the incredible statues for an extended appreciation. In Spring the tulips were blooming in front of the Palace which was an added bonus. The tulips almost distracted us from seeing the beautiful Medici Fountain on the right of the Palace - fantastic background for photos!

Beautiful in summer. I have been here in summer and winter. It is nice at both times of the year but more lively in summer. In summer there were many people just hanging out, and lots of people painting.
Little of everything. Love the sailboats, the open space, the covered space, so many places to explore. Everyone tourists and locals alike bring picnics into the gardens and soak up the noontime sun.
Beautiful in April. This was my fourth trip to Paris and my first trip to Luxembourg Gardens. It was such a welcome oasis of calm. Grab a chair, look at the gardens, sip a cafe and act like a native!

Fresh air in the Montpernasse area. Even as a tourist, you must run around le Jardin Du Luxemborg. It's a great place to take a break from crowded sidewalks and noisy traffic. Well worth the time to pause and rest here!
Nice peaceful city park in a busy district. Pack your lunch and eat it there on their nice green lawn or on their steps. A peaceful and spacious park in the center of Paris.
A place to rest. Well designed and maintained public park and palace. Great to rest a while or just observe the crowd of bypassers.

Worn to a nub. I was last in Paris 45 years ago, and remember the Luxembourg Gardens as a green oasis. Perhaps time coloured my perceptions rose, but now the poor gardens are trampled by too many feet, offering a bit of shade but little else. The grass has given way to gravelly sand walkways, and while the trees look good, there is sad beaten down feeling. The Tuileries suffer much the same way, but not nearly so badly. It made me miss our local Vancouver Parks, for sure...

Lovely place to spend an afternoon. When this place is filled with people you can sit down and feel like you're right in the middle of Parisian life. Families with small children playing boats in the fountain pond. A sculpture garden and lovely flowers. Fountains, paths to strolls, and a park to play in. There are even pony rides and areas to play games. It's a great experience with lots of free entertainment perfect for a visitor who wants to watch Parisians at play!

Beautiful park in Montparnasse area. Large, busy, filled with school kids, couples, tourists...this is an oasis of green and flowers and statuary surrounding a beautiful basin pond with toy sailboats, reflecting a classic French roofed mansion. Lots and lots of chairs and benches to sit in, rest your tourist feet, soak in Parisian atmosphere.
Gorgeous spot. Few better places in the world to while away a few hours! Wander around to look at the sculptures and plants or simply sit and watch the world go by... Heaven!
Fresh air in green. Regular garden area belongs to MEDİCİ family means nothing for me. But ıf you want to read a book or wanna have breakfast it suits you.

Beautiful and well manicured garden and a good place to unwind in lovely spring. My wife and I spend about three hours in the lovely spring afternoon to enjoy the cool weather and the atmosphere of people unwinding. The lovely pmanicured flowers made good photo shoots and the tree lined walkways made good walking path in the cool spring day. People were everywhere soaking in the sun and enjoying the company of friends and loved ones. Some were seen enjoying a meal as they people - watched. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting under the trees and watch the world pass by. Worth a visit to really understand what Parisians do. If you are near Notre Dame walk towards the St Michel square and up Rue St Michel to reach Luxembourg garden
Beautiful. Best place to relax in the evenings, A very peaceful ,relaxing and pleasant visit . kids also enjoyed.
Best Place to Exercise. Even as a tourist, you must wear your comfortable clothes and run around the Jardin Du Luxemborg. Nice air and amazing landscape.
Picnic spot. A great, busy place to bring lunch and enjoy a beautiful spring day. Take a walk and find the old market near Odeon if you need provisions.
lovely park to enjoy the day. This is a large park with many different things to see and lovely place to sit and enjoy people watching.

Most Charming Garden in Paris. I came here for an afternoon during a short Paris stay, and it was just lovely. From the toy wooden boats to the gorgeous statues, this park made me feel like I'd taken a step back in time. Highly recommend.

More sand/dirt than flowers. Very busy with locals. Not allowed to sit on grassy areas. Not that impressive. Locals hog the chairs to prop their feet up. Only useful thing of this park are the bathrooms yet you have to pay to use them. If you are near it, then make a short stop here. Skip if not in the area.

Wonderful place to walk and take in Paris and Parisians. One among may of the wonderful green spaces in Paris. Worth a walk around. Includes a Statue of Liberty, the famous Medici fountain, and the Palais du Luxumbourg, seat of the French Senate, and a museum.

Get away from traffic. Take a break from crowded sidewalks and noisy traffic and strollin through this nice oasis on the left bank.
There is very nice little cafe there where you can lunch outside in the shade of the trees. It is very relaxing.

nice walk, great view. enjoyed the gardens, very peaceful. you can sit on a chair and enjoy a few minutes of peace from the noise of the city. walked into the luxembourg Museum, they had an exhibition of the tudour family, all in all, a very very nice time

How to pens a pleasant afternoon when you have time to spare.. With a full afternoon in Paris with no-where to be it was perfect to spend three hours relaxing in the beautiful gardens of the Palace Luxembourg. The ambience of the gardens, the trees, lawns and totally relaxed setting was ideal after a busy few days or sightseeing in Paris. Everywhere you went there were people reading or sharing picnics with family and friends. A truly beautiful experience. When you are finished relaxing you can watch the local playing Pétanque or tennis or smiling model boats in the lake. What a treasure in the heart of Paris.

Sublime and guilty pleasure, getaway from work or too much travel. Relaxing beautiful, the real Parisiens hang out in the back, play chess, le Boule, read, rest. Wonderful playgrounds for the children. Absolutely huge lovely place.

Expansive, Well manicured Park. Enjoy a stroll in this lovely large park filled with sculptures, flower beds, trees and groups of people exercising. The park is very well maintained & heavily used. Lots of fountains & a large pond in the center. Enjoyed the statues of French queens dating back to 534.
Fun to run!. Had a wonderful morning run through the gardens. A beautiful spot nestled in the busy left bank. Well worth the time to pause and rest here!

Beautfiul and Relaxing. Stopped here to relax for a bit after a day of exploring Paris. Definitely worth seeing. Everything was meticulously maintained, and absolutely amazing looking. It's definitely relaxing to just sit on the lounge chairs and take in the scenery.

Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city. The Luxembourg Gardens on a sunny day is a wonderful place to be! Not only are the grounds quite large, but there are so many things going on and lots of Parisian's enjoying picnics. Any visit to Paris should include a stroll through this beautiful space.
Tranquil. We were fortunate to be staying down the block from the gardens. A lovely place for an afternoon picnic or stroll before dinner.Free no entrance fee

Morning walk. The gardens were lovely to walk in, even with a slight drizzle of rain. I love the way there are chairs that you can move around to catch the sun. Very beautiful place to spend some time.
Lovely Place to Relax and Wonder in the Sun. Lovely beautiful Garden, lots of chairs to sit and relax in the sun, or you can wonder around, not too far from the River Seine, had a nice time here.

Parisian Beauty. The gardens are a true Parisian beauty as everything around look fantastic and serve as a perfect photo background. Apart from the beautiful foliage works, the park also provides with a lot of eye pleasers like the ornate statues all around and the small spaces around for one to sit and enjoy. In whole this is a great space to relax after a daylong tour of the city.
one of the many beautiful parks of Paris. Absolutely beautiful and a delightful spot for lunch. Great sculptures. Wonderful to walk beneath the famous chestnuts in blossom in spring in Paris

Must go on a beautiful day. It was a spectacular spring day and all of the locals were on the lounge chairs "catching the rays." The children were playing with boats on the pond - which is always fun to watch. The gardeners were planting the spring flowers so it was a bit early for a beautiful floral display. The Parisians love this park and they use it to jog, relax, picnic, play tennis, walk the baby and to socialize in general. It is a very tranquil, peaceful beautiful park and is definitely worth visiting.

Great place for a picnic. If your hotel does not serve breakfast, grab a sandwich and bring it to the Luxembourg Gardens and have a little picnic. Good people watching. Also a great place to bring kids.

Great spot. This is a great facility with large gardens, large areas under tree cover, great water features and beautiful flower beds. My daughter loves photography and took many pictures. I saw people feeding koi fish, some over a meter in length, at a beautiful pond, in a shaded area with great sculptures. The gardens are at various levels and can easily be accessed by stairs. I saw kids sailing little boats in the big pond in the centre of the grounds and kids on ponies. The locals obviously enjoy the facility and one of the lawns can be accessed. There were a large number of people on the lawn enjoying the spring sun. This is a great garden to visit.
An urban oasis. What a lovely place to hang out when in this part of town. The grounds are just beautiful. Grab a chair and watch the world go by!

Peaceful place to take a break.. We decided to visit the Gardens to take a break from our frantic tour on Sunday. It was beautiful. We took a seat under the trees and enjoyed the calm. There was many people but it didn't ruin the atmosphere. Perfect for a stop, either long or short. The kids were playing with some little ships in the fountain while the parents were enjoining the warm sunlight or playing bowls. The only "bad" thing is the wind: beware of the sand that rises from the ground when it's windy.
Would love to see in warmer weather. Looked beautiful, but it was too cold for people to be out. Would love to return and see it in full bloom and full of people.

Great place to go to relax or with kids. One of the best place to relax in the center of Paris. Let's have some good time reading a book and sunbathing in one the numerous free chair available.
Alternatively, go with your kids to the playground and/or do your jogging all around the park and share some pleasure by seeing how beautiful it can be.
A must have gone!

Lovely park. This is a large park on the left bank, It is lovely and there are many seats, activities for children such as boats to push around the pond, Lovely trees and a great place to sit after shopping or sit seeing. A great place in good weather to people watch.
Flowers Galore!. A beautiful place to be when visting Paris. Beautiful grounds and a wonderful opportunity to see the diverse population of Paris. A must see!

Restful Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are a restful oasis in a busy city. Beautiful trees, graceful fountains and a wonderful array of movable chairs are there to be used by visitors and locals. On a sunny Spring Sunday there were lots of family activities, the lake was a focal point and lazing in the sun a popular pastime. Put the pep back into your Paris visit by resting and recharging in this interesting parkland. The Palace is a Museum in one area and another section houses the French Senate.
Nice but croudy.... I have a picture from this garden. We've been here in a sunday and the image that came in my mind was that of hundreads, thousands of people in Gange river in India...

Love the gardens. We were lucky and wandered around on a nice sunny day. You have to check out the Medici fountain when you visit however I would advise looking all around. It really is a lovely park and it is where Parisians go when the weather is nice.

Great place to run in the city. The gardens are beautiful and it is the place to run with others in the city. You will find many joggers and walkers taking in the beauty of the surroundings and when we were there they were starting to film a period piece - great fun

Lovely on a Sunday Afternoon. My family and I walked through the gardens in April. I was not expecting much to be blooming, but was pleasantly surprised. Lots of people having a picnic, sailing little wooden boats, and just sitting admiring the scenery. Next time, I would pack a picnic or snack and eat there.
Great Garden. Lots to see, very peaceful. I'd definitely go again, didn't get a chance to look around the whole garden.
Very peaceful. A very peaceful and pleasant visit on a beautiful sunny day in April 2015. A true Garden as opposed to a park.

Le Palais and Le Jardin. An amazing, peaceful stroll past the rows of ornate statues, rolling lawns, and beautiful palace. I got a small cup of coffee from a nearby stand, took selfies, and sat with a patriot from the states in one of the chairs provided for relaxation. It was amazing, the number of Parisians and tourists lounging. and having picnics on the lawn.
Beautiful but.......... Absolutely beautiful but there is a charge for everything, even to use the bathroom. The kids had a lovely time and it is also very relaxing and peaceful for adults.
Beautiful place to relax. Beautiful gardens to relax in. We spent a few hours here with a baguette and some wine on a lovely warm Paris day. Plenty of places to sit in the sun or shade.

Wide open spaces. Really great and very large gardens right in the middle of St. Germaine. A stroll through the vastness reveals kids playing iin a massive segregated play area, adults playing a game kind like Bocci Ball (wish I knew what the call it here) and Angelina's for hot chocolate at the north entrance.

Nice Gardens. The Luxemburg gardens were nice to visit and good if budgeting as entrance is free. There was a little amatuer band on in the bandstand shich also made it nice.
The thing that really let it down was the open site of several openly armed guards at the palace.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens are very lovely. We barely made into the gardens before they closed for the evening but enjoyed the little time that we did have exploring. I wouldn't say that it was a must-see on my list but I was glad that we had time to wander the grounds for even a short while.
BEAUTIFUL GARDENS. What a treat, to be able to stroll through these beautiful gardens in the middle of a busy and amazing city.

Just gorgeous. After an exhausting day running around seeing the sights, it is nice to just sit and watch the people. This is an excellent garden. It calms your spirit from the first time you enter there. Ideal for reading and relaxing. Of course, day of your visit should be sunny.

A really beautiful and quiet park. You can arrange the chairs as you see fit, and everyone is very calm and quiet. It'r really relaxing wander by this place. People respect the flowers and grass, and it has installations for the children and some sports as the petanque. Take some sandwiches, beer and go to the Luxemburg garden! Here you can forget about the hustle and bustle for a while. It’s peaceful and the view of Luxemburg palace is just the missing puzzle piece of the perfect Paris picnic.
Beautiful and relaxing. Best place in Paris to relax in afternoons.The garden is average sized, not the biggest in Paris, but really cosy, and feels like home.

to make o walk o rest for a while. visiting the garden of luxemburg is always a pleasure because you could make a nice walk and rest in the several nice places and eventually listen to a nice concert.
Beautiful location. Great place to spend an afternoon. Many locals and students having a nice afternoon with their families. Wonderful surroundings!
Spacious, beautiful and serene. As per the heading! Pretty much in central Paris, an oasis for students, strollers, workers...everybody.

Just beautiful. Spent a lovely afternoon walking around the gardens. Very French!
Plenty to do or do nothing! Rides for children, pony rides, marionette theatre, remote controlled boats. Palace is just stunning

Great place to people watch. The gardens are a nice place to go to sit and watch people. I was surprised there wasn't more grass, but not all parks are as nice as Retiro in Madrid. There were plenty of chairs for people to sit on.

Beautiful gardens - do not miss. the Luxembourg gardens compete with teh Tuilleries for the title of the most beautiful Jardins in Paris... Take an hour or two to stroll, relax and enjoy the wonderful views, gardening, fountain and palace. If you jogg - do your morning training there - it is a wonderful way to "mix business and pleasure" and feel like a local.

Flowers only around the senate building. The gardens are really just a big open space with trees and paths through lawns , and a few flower beds that we saw were, notably in the centre around the -in use - model boating lake , and directly around the Senate building well stocked and colourful. There are tennis courts and other ball playing areas within the park ,and was on the day we were there well used by local , Security was in evidence - a sign of the times .A quieter spot in the middle of the bustle of Paris , plenty of places in surrounding streets to pick up refreshments.

Just gorgeous. What an amazing place.We visited the gardens twice while in Paris - so beautiful with all the spring flowers, and the gardens are just amazing.The palace is beautiful to view from the outside, and there are lovely areas to walk.There is a nice little restaurant in the gardens - a great place to sit and relax, eat, drink and soak in the beautiful surroundings.
Stunning!. This is the place to go on a sunny day if you want to sit and relax in a quiet and beautiful place. There are benches provided, and the gardens are immaculately maintained.

Nice Life. It is quite impressing that Paris has such “Public Goods”. An excellent Garden. It calms your spirit from the first time you enter there. Ideal for reading and relaxing. It is an asset of Paris. Simple, Beautiful, living

Wonderful and peaceful. My visit to Luxembourg Gardens was at noon time with a bit of rainy sky, wonderful place to relax and ‎spend a time with family and friends, just sitting and letting time pass by watching ‎Parisians jogging or playing with their kids, just don’t miss it its worth seeing.‎
Nice for a winter walk. Beautiful garden and so big. Lovely if you want to get away from the traffic and business of the city.

Great place to run!. Seems to be a very popular spot to run, so we did! There were many pictures to take so not the best run with all the starting and stopping , but it was a real treat to be running in such beautiful surroundings. There were a few spots that were a bit heavy on the bird excrement smell but once you knew where they were it was easy to avoid. Do NOT go on any of the grass areas! They are heavily monitored and someone will let you know ASAP that you can't touch the grass at all. But the grounds are beautiful , and lots of places to sit if you need to and a charming bocce ball court as well!

beautiful & clean. The gardens were beautifully kept and there was plenty of seats and sun loungers all around the fountain in the centre of the garden. You were able to go for a walk through trees or lounge i the sun. Dogs allowed.
Relaxing. Great place to set and relax and watch the world go by. We took a walk from the Vendome to the Gardens and just kicked back and relaxed.
Evening Walk. Walking distance from our hotel-Villa Luxembourg. Great for children. Lots of places to sit. Nice fountains.

Unwind and slow down yourself. Very relaxing and it's always the first place I visit whenever I visit Paris. Normally the flight arrives in the early morning (7am), then I drop the bags in hotel and start my day by unwinding myself with fresh Frenchy air there, do some stretching before my shopping exercise! :D

Great place to relax and take in all that around. What a great solitude. Nice to be able to read relax and take a break from touring the sites in amazing Paris. Enjoyed a tasty picnic while people watching. Used the hop on hop off bus service.

A little piece of Heaven!!!!. A must see!!! Well maintained and amazing gardens. Highly recommend. Visited Luxembourg Gardens as part of a day tour while in Paris in September 2014. Next trip, will definitely make sure to make time to enjoy this little piece of heaven in the middle of Paris. Won't be disappointed.

Beautiful Gardens, Beautiful Building, Beautiful People. Upon visiting the Luxembourg Gardens for the first time I was blown away. I was lucky enough to visit on a warm sunny day and was the perfect place to meet up with one of my best friends' and his children. Watching all the children run around together was so cute and the gardens/park made a great place to play hide and seek (hehehe it was a perfect place to be a 4-6 year old again) The place is very relaxed, something quite amazing considering you're in the middle of a large city, and its beautifully designed with both French and English styled gardens, numerous statues (including a miniature version of the statue of Liberty (Because yes she's French)) and monuments a HUGE pond (Grand Basin as its known) and smaller ponds dotted around. It even has its own little theatre.The gardens are very safe, as it is also the home of the French Senat, which has to be one of the most stunning buildings I've ever seen (It's completely different from a lot of the other palaces in Paris and was one of the first to be built so close to the road (many were set back)), it is dutifully guarded by Gendarmes although their presence is non opposing and its almost like they make an effort to stand back just far enough for you to feel free to do as you please but still know they are there. Not to mention after talking to a few, my aforementioned friend being one of them, you come to find they're pretty nice normal people even on duty (I wouldn't recommend it but I even got away with a little flirting with one, I was in Paris would you expect any less?)All the people I saw there were also unbelievably beautiful just like the gardens they were sat in. It is true that there are different seasons for different visitors and almost unanimously every time I visit its filled with predominately French people.The only thing I'd note is there is only one patch of grass you're allowed to sit on but there are so many chairs that's not a problem and there are signs to tell you were you can and can't sit if you get confused
Great way to spend the morning. The gardens are beautiful and is a nice way to relax and enjoy the view. We went in the morning. It is a must for anyone that visits Paris

Beautiful Gardens. These gardens, like all the others in Paris, are large but very well kept. These gardens are possible the nicest one we went to. Especially in spring time they are lovely with the spring flowers and trees starting to get there leaves back. The park itself is split into several areas, one of which is a large seating area with tables, benches etc where people were playing chess etc and there are also some tennis courts. Then there is the 'main strip' where you have a round pond and another grass area, both of which have chairs all around them so you can sit in comfort and relax.If you are in Paris and just want to relax in some beautiful surroundings then I would take a walk to Patisserie Sadaharu Aoki and get yourself some tasty treats and then pull up a seat in the park and just people watch for an hour or two.

Beautiful Paris Park. Can't recommend highly enough. Beautiful location to relax and enjoy the view, or just read, while in Paris. After an exhausting day running around seeing the sights, it is nice to just sit and watch Paris walk by...
Lovely on a nice day!!!. Went here and the gardens are lovely, if the sun is shining!!! We had rain so this took a bit away from the gardens, however well worth a visit!!!

Gorgeous and fun for kids. Rent little boats and a stick for 30 minutes to float around in the koi pond, pony rides (though we felt bad for the ponies) and a play ground (1.5 Euros for kids 2.5 for adults) with an amazing zipline. Prepare to spend most if not all day with kids.
A True Paris Experience. The flowers, the guys playing that ball game, people watching, the art.. it goes on and on. We enjoyed a quiet lunch here, enjoying the wonderful people watching.

so civilized. These are really such decent, civilized gardens with something for everyone. Although we were there in early Aril, shrubs were budding , tulips and dafodils out and lawns vibrant fresh green. People enjoying it all with no boom boxes or litter. A genuine sight for a New Yorker to behold...plus a concert in the band shell? I guess. It wasn't the Philharmonic, but it was free! Definitely worth a sunday stroll on a beautiful day.
Beautiful Gardens. Early spring full of colorful flowers is a delight, as well as seeing children enjoy their boats in the fountain. It was a very pleasant, peaceful walk.

I m sure that its better in the summer. Beautiful grounds but at the beginning of spring the flowers are not in bloom..so it is just a big park to walk around in...It is near or in the st Germain neighborhood worth stopping by
Lux Luxembourg Gardens. Don't miss the apiary and the heritage fruit trees in the SE corner. Take time to watch the men playing boules and, over by l'Orangerie, chess games.

Lovely Gardens. Beautiful building, flowers and trees. We sat and had lunch on the grass next to the rows of tall trees which was lovely and peaceful, we thought it was brilliant that there were loads of chairs dotted around that were movable for anyone to use, definitely worth a visit.

Great for kids and adults. We took a 15 minute walk to the Luxembourg Gardens after a morning of shopping at Le Bon Marche. Along the way we picked up baguettes, salads and meringues. We parked ourselves amongst thousands of others enjoying lunch on a beautiful sunnyday. We paid 9 Euros to enter the playground. Our kids enjoyed the many play areas especially the flying fox. They have clean toilet facilities, many seating areas, a kiosk for food and a water fountain to refill water bottles. We looked for the sail boats on the lake but it didn't appear there were any when we visited.A truly relaxing afternoon and well worth it.

A formal garden with English rows of chestnut trees and French flower beds. A place to walk and rest. Admire the statues, watch the goldfish in the long pool or hire a model yacht to sail in the central pond.
Too orderly. Typical of the "jardin à la française", a bit too orderly, just behind the Senate (Palais du Luxembourg). But nice for a walk, jogging or a stroll before going to work or at lunch time.

Beautiful in summer & winter <3. Have visited during both June and January and February months and have enjoyed the gardens immensely in both states. A lovely place to walk and relax, plenty of seating and a lovely scattering of statues to gaze at. I love Luxembourg gardens and always make a point of visiting when I am around. Next time I hope to catch a show at the marionette house which I believe is still functional. The gallery which is located within the grounds often houses wonderful displays also which is worth taking a look.

Nice Oasis. A beautiful, warm spring day is perfect for a tour of the Luxembourg Gardens. The neighbourhood around the gardens is less touristy than other parts of Paris, too, so it's a lovely respite. Sit by the water, take in some sun, enjoy lunch in the shade at the gardens' restaurant.Just take note that if you have to use the toilet facilities, the line up will be long and it will cost you! (I believe it was 50 C)
Grab a chair and relax. A wonderful park! Bring a packed lunch, grab a chair and relax. It was a hot day when we were here, and we couldn't have found a better place to spend the day.

Come to people watch . There isn't so much lush greenery here as opposed to a lot of the parks I have been to across the world but I guess it works here. It was a weekday but somehow or rather everyone seemed out to enjoy the sun. After a long walk around Paris, sitting here to eat crepes or strawberries is very relaxing. Children also have space to run around.
Beautiful. Lovely place to walk, in the sun or shade whatever your preference. Nice place to have a picnic. The variety of flowers and plants was amazing.

A very nice place to spend an afternoon. It can get a bit crowded but that's the only downside of this park which is centrally situated and extremely nice all around, in a student neighbourhood. Best enjoyed in sunny spring afternoon !

Beautiful!. Very lovely place, just so beautiful! It was a great place to spend Easter Sunday with our seven year old boy. I love that the playground is divided by age group, and that you have to pay to get in, really controls the crowds.

Pay for the Playground. The gardens are beautiful and very quaint with their metal chairs filled with sunbathing Parisians. The children's playground makes a nice break but you do have to pay to go in there.

Beatifull. A big park with green areas at centrum of paris.
Really nice to enjoy the sun with a lots of people.
You might take a sit and enjoy.
Close to metro stations
Timeless. On our last visit, in 1980, our young son played with the toy boats on the pond -- delighted to see nothing has changed.

A green space in a crowded city. The gardens were great. Lots of green and plenty of seats to people watch and soak up some sun. Note to visiotrs stay off the grass or one of the workers will remind you.

Paris at Play. Sundays in April lift Paris to exuberant peaks, nowhere more than in the 403 year-old, nearly sixty-acre Jardin de Luxembourg. Any sentient tourist has at least seen pictures of kids pushing model sailboats in the Grand Basin and of the glorious French and English gardens, but nothing captures the pulse of the place better than a stroll through the gates and along the miles of gravel paths. All ages, shapes and sizes of Parisians take to the paths these mornings, in such densities and speeds that strollers like us retreat to the hundreds perhaps thousands of olive green steel chairs that the groundskeepers devised more than 90 years ago. The chairs are relaxing for reading, sunning and courting, perhaps obscuring their real purpose, which is to discourage people from lounging on all but a small patch of the impeccable lawns. For services and surprises, the Luxembourg Garden clearly outranks other celebrated playgronds from Eden to even the 14-times larger Central Park in NewYork. For 200 years, for example, the garden has supported an apiary, a museum in itself and a brilliant service to the surrounding flower beds. Then there are the orchards of more than 500 varieties of more than 1,000 pear and apple trees, all splendidly espaliered, from seedlings to octogenarians.

Lovely and relaxing on a warm spring day. It was great to see the Parisians eating their lunch and the statues, flowers and green areas were pretty. The lake and fountain were impressive and we liked how the chairs were movable and plentiful so you could form a group of any size. It was a shame the play park was so expensive but it was a lovely garden to visit.

Great place to soak up Paris. This classic Paris park is a great place to hang. Be warned that sitting on most of the grassy areas is prohibited, as is pulling the iconic metal chairs up to the basin where you really want to be sitting. Great people-watching and also a great place to stroll and check out the sculptures that dot the park.

Fun place to stroll on a spring day. We walked miles through Paris and loved to sit in these gardens, beautifully looked after and tidy. It must be wonderful here in the summer when all the flowers are in bloom. We meant to stop at Angelina's for hot chocolate, next time!

A nice Sunday walk. At this Sunday in April we had a nice walk in the Luxembourg Gardens. People were walking, sitting on the benches or in the grass, jogging, exercising their dogs or just relaxing everywhere they found the oppurtunity to do so. This was a very nice experience. I will repeat this another time when in Paris.

Relaxing stroll . To see what Parisians really do on a Sunday when next to everything else is closed - this is the place to see! Very cute sailboats and families having fun, lots of reading, eating and lazing in the chairs - so relaxing and peaceful!
Great for a walk!

Almost got in a fight.. So me and my girlfriend (at the time, she's my wife now) were enjoying the view when this lady came up and gave us a bit of paper that stated she could not talk or hear, and that she wanted money. Of course I knew this was a scam so politely declined and moved on, she then continued to follow us and my girlfriend was getting annoyed and told her to go away, she then puffed out her chest and asked if my girlfriend was looking for a fight, then the lady must have realised my wife's pregnant belly and walked off. During our time in Paris I found most of the people very rude , apart from one nice man did offer his seat up to my wife on the bus. I don't like Paris and probably won't ever be back there on a holiday.

Always a great place to relax. Visited the gardens again on 4/10. Beautiful, sunny day. Park gardens are beautiful and a must-see. Never quite understood the stay off the grass policy here and many other sites in Paris, but it is well maintained. The people inside the food stands are very rude and food there is overpriced - make sure you bring your picnic to the park with you.
Where is the grass?. Lovely park, but would be gorgeous with some grass! We stayed next door and it was nice to have a space to walk through in the Spring sunshine.

refreshing break. This is such a wonderful park which provides a nice break and breathing room in the hustle of Paris. The sailboats in the central pond/fountain are charming and something you can't see just anywhere.
Jardin Delight. Such a delightful place to walk around and enjoy. Amazed by the number of locals who take part in enjoying this part of their beautiful city.
