Beautiful. Shame about the drunks. Lovely gardens spoilt by those less fortunate than us but clearly drunk sitting around. If you want peace get there early or late. But very pretty.
Nice spot. Nice spot to take your lunch and go relax to eat it. Enough area for kids to play or to quietly enjoy the gardens and water- whatever you're in the mood for.

Popular Park. Nicely laid out, perfect for a stroll or seat in the sunshine. Good kids area for a charge of 2.5 EUR - charge of 1.20 for adults so we stood outside. Cafe very expensive and ice creams tiny for the price. The coke is in cardboard cup and is watery and filled with ice - take your own or buy outside of park! Toilets for a charge - free toilets out of action. Quite a bit of building work going on. On the plus side, the gardens are beautiful and the atmospere typically Parisian.

lovely walk. These garden are beautiful, very well kept and the surrounds very old buildings..beautiful iron work on the gates and fences.make sure you have a coin for the loo. like a lot of places in Paris you need to have your money at the ready

Relaxing!!. It was our second trip to Paris and we especially visited this garden. Its so beautiful with wide parks and all that greenery. It is very big, quite nice. There are two big circular ponds in the garden, surrounded by chairs. So, we sat there for hours and enjoyed watching the kids play with boats in the pond. Its was amazing. One can actually see Obelisk facing west with Arc de Triomphe at a distant all in a line.
sail boats!. My 5 yr old daughter LOVED floating the rented sailboats in the fountain. Big hit! I understand the boats are available Sat/Sun/Wed and school holidays.

Peace and flowers. This place is perfect if you want to enjoy the green side of Paris. Lots of flowers and trees (at least during the spring), and you can even take a nap in one of the hundreds available chairs. People normally buy something to eat in one of the adjacent bakeries and enjoy it seated here.

A place to relax. Parisians a plenty studying, enjoying tennis and games, model boats on the central pool. There are some nice buildings and cafe and toilet facilities are present. A place to escape the hustle and bustle of the City streets in sun or shade.
Loved it. Whole lot of room to stretch and enjoy the landscaping, see the locals enjoy themselves and just walk around with a special someone and enjoy life.

Superb parisian gardens at the heart of the Quartin Latin. I personally enjoy stroling around these gardens where I used to go and push a little wooden boat as a child, accompanied by my grand-parents.Sitting in the sun with a good book, watching the Parisian life going by, definitely a must do when in the area!
very busy. went on a sunday morning to see the boats on the pond which the kids loved, but I was disappointed by the lack of green and lawns.

A Beautiful Jardin in Paris complete with chateau. At this time of the year the garden is coming to life with colour, watched over by the statues of French queens. A quite spot at the Medici Fountain is worth visiting for a spot of solitude in busy Paris. Look for a replica Lady Liberty statue on of 5 in Paris.

This is a must see in Paris. Although it's not as well know as the Eiffel Tower. "This is a must see in Paris. Although it's not as well know as the Eiffel Tower or the Notre Dame among many other Parisian landmarks, this is one of the best places to see Parisians in their natural habitat.It's lively without being crowded, and there something to do for everyone. Whether you're a child who will delight at the sailing boats and marionettes, or an avid people watcher, it's difficult not to enjoy time spent here."

Lovely place for a stroll. Great place for a leisurely walk, serious talk, or small picnic. Variety of quieter areas and busier open spaces. Small and manageable with decent seating areas. Beautiful in the summer and romantic in the rain.
Beautiful. Stunning gardens, a little oasis in a busy city. Lots of space and seats, great for people watching and taking a break from busy sight seeing.
A nice, peaceful spot. I liked how people were just peacefully hanging out there during a weekday. The children were playing in the playground nearby.

Very nice and calm place to relaxe. Beeing with the french and enjoying the sun. A very nice garden with a beautifull palace, a lake , sculptures and enough chairs for every body. A place to bring your lunch and enjoy
Nice. Been out there with the family for easter. Very nice garden to find peace within a very loudcand hectic city. Also always worth a run with the rest of the joggers you will find out there.

A Beautiful Park.. I love this beautifully laid out park. It leads the eye towards the observatory, which really should be obeyed and walked to. Both my wife and I always play the gardens a visit when in Paris. A must see.
Early Spring. So this wasn't the best time to see the gardens. But it was still very impressive. It's a medium sized park. Easy walking with a nice lay out.

jog, walk, peaceful. this is an amazing place to come to for a few hours one day.
I love walking around and jogging in the summer here

great for a walk or to run. It is beautiful to enjoy a nice day for adults and kids. Took my kid to play there and she enjoyed, was a little annoying to pay to use the playground. There is a small lake where you can rent little sail boats, kids love it. There are many people exercising, would be a good spot to run if you want to avoid running on the street.

Watch the little boats sail by!. What a beautiful beautiful park in Paris. I especially loved watching the children push their little sailing boats from point to point around the lake! People lazing around watching talking, music playing, fountains, something new down each path. Just lovely!
Relaxing. Relaxing and pleasant. The weather was not the best so I guess it would be even better when it is sunny.

Fairly average. Neither the best nor the worst park experience you will find in Paris, this is large and very popular with locals. Navigating the park is difficult without a map. Somewhere in there, you will find a replica of one of the scale models produced as a precursor to the Statue of Liberty. Generally, if you have been to other parks and you are on a tight timeline, you could easily skip this place.
Gorgeous! Pack some wine, and enjoy your day!. Ahhhh, Luxembourg Gardens! Pure bliss. Rent a bike, buy some wine and cheeses, and enjoy the people watching! Extra gorgeous at night! :)

Luxembourg Gardens. We walked from our hotel in the St. Germain du-prez area on our first afternoon. This was a great walking outing on our first jet-lagged day. We stopped at a couple pretty churches and then kept walking to the gardens.

An oasis in the middle of the city. French people are well known because of their gardens and the art applied to the conservation and protection of these areas. This is the perfect place to have a pic-nic, a nap, take a run, or simply walk through the gardens and fountains. There are certain green spaces where you cannot step in. Best month to go: April. The location is an advantage since it is in the middle of Paris, very close to the quartier Saint Germain des Prés.

Late spring and not much was blooming. Lovely old gardens. Paris garden walkways are made of sand which is unusual for an American tourist to see but on a windy early spring day it was like being in an unpleasant desert sandstorm. Lots of smokers and dog poop. Not much was blooming so it wasn't terribly beautiful
Luxemburg gardens. Nice place to relax in between sightseeing. Good for picnic, jogging, walking etc. Or grab a chair for people watching or just enjoying a sunny day...
Spring in the air. The gardens are spectacular to stroll in. The museum had a wonderful temporary exhibit of The Tudors. Very well put together.
Old - needs improvement. A lot of trees, but not much else to see apart from visiting fairs etc. In between Museum Orangerie and Louvre so it does make a pleasant walk in between both attractions

Easter Sunday amble. gorgeous large gardens to stroll through on a sunny but fresh public holiday. Many people including families were out to enjoy the sun, sail boats on the lake, play soccer, tennis or other games or sit in the many chairs provided. There was a band playing in the rotunda and the ambience was great.

Awesome playground and nice gardens. My family really enjoyed Luxemboug Gardens, despite the weather being cold and wet. The gardens are well kept, and there are several entrances so it's easy to get in and out without having to walk too far.The playground was perfect for our son. It's not free (€2.50 per adult and €1.50 per child) but I guess having a charge prevents over crowding. The best part of the playground is that there is a separate area for kids age 7+, so little kids don't get trampled by big ones. Also, there is a covered area with benches, as well as a kiosk selling snacks and drinks.Outside the playground is a really old carousel, and I have read that there are also pony rides, but we didn't see it. We did see the remote controlled toy boats available for hire, but we didn't try them.
Wonderful Family activities. A great place for kids. One of the best playgrounds and well worth the $1 entry just for the Swing. Be sure to catch the puppet show right next door.
A little Slice of Paris Heaven. I love the Gardens; I cannot say anything negative. I am a painter and there were so many opportunities to create.
Great strolling. Being an Israeli it's hard for me to understand why they are charging for the playground, but it's a great place

Formal gardens/park. Perfect for strolling or people watching in one of the cafes! Traditional, formally laid out gardens, so has a feel from a bygone age. Children play with boats on the toy boating lake.
Free entry.
Pretty in Springtime. Lovely elegant walk around the statues. Pretty plants in bloom. Somewhere nice to sit, read and people-watch.

Disappointing on a grey and wet day. Unfortunately when we went to the gardens it was a grey and wet day and it meant we rushed through the gardens without really getting to explore. It didn't help that we were towing a suitcase behind us! Will go and give it another chance when next in Paris on a sunnier day!

Gardens, People Watching, and Ping Pong. This garden in the center of town is a place to relax and people watch. Come around lunch time and you will see Parisians sitting in a chair or on a bench, eating a sandwich, and soaking up the sun. A few steps away is an area where kids play soccer and on the play ground and adults and teens play ping pong.
A perfect place to escape the busy city. Beautiful garden to unwind your mind and sooth your heart with tranquility, colors and many different attractions.

Best playground in Paris!. My 4 year old granddaughter insisted upon a return to the playground at jardins Luxembourg before we left Paris. It has an entry fee so it is well maintained, has matted surface, a concession and toilettes. Such an exciting and safe environment for children. On Wednesday afternoon it was full of life! The nearby carousel with classic brass rings was a huge hit. We did not enter the adjacent puppet theatre but others seemed pleased with it. There are plenty of other things to see in this park.
Very good. Even though it was coming out of winter it was still worth a look around and see the gardens and the statues.
Nice walking park with masterpiece sculptures. Nice walking park with several masterpiece sculptures. Great way to walk from Montparnasse to Ile de la Cite -- with or without a stop at the palace.

Nice garden Paris style. An enormous, large, well kept, beautiful design garden. Besides the alleys, visit the Museum too. When I was there there was an exhibition about the Tudors. Very well organized. The garden is a must for itself.
Not much color in March. Visited on March 27 to 29. Lots of buds on trees, very few leaves, nice green grass everywhere. Relaxing time sitting and people watching.

Paris Life. This park is a must for any trip to Paris. Once the Spring comes the park blossoms into a slice of Parisian life for all ages. Great for the kids to play, a leisurely stroll or to while away the hours with a book! I aways plan an afternoon here when I'm lucky enough to visit this gorgeous city.
Great gardens to visit. Waking around the gardens in the peace and quiet and sitting and watching the locals walk by. Sitting and having a coffee

A must see!. I have been to these gardens each time of four trips. If you have children you MUST take them to the playground. For the rest of us we will just have to enjoy the amazing flowers, statues, buildings, bacci ball and the hot chocolate while overlooking it all.

Nice for a walk around. Coming in March, the park seemed a bit, um, sparse. The flower beds around the statues are lovely, and added some much needed colour. There are some great play areas, where people were playing tennis and football, and the kid’s playgrounds are really impressive. I do like the French gardening with straight lines and defined borders, but, at this time of year, it’s all a bit bare and cold. Would be lovely in the warmer weather. I will definitely come back at another time of the year to enjoy these gardens.

A relaxing outing. You may think that this is just another garden. Yes, it is garden, but this is what it so good about it. Walking through museums and chateaux and you wish to relax like a true Parisian, then I suggest you take the Metro (underground railroad) to the Luxembourg for a few relaxing hours. The Metro station is Luxembourg.I suggest you walk around the garden to admire the statues and the bee 'school' before you sit down beside the large pond. On a warm day you may even be able to dip your feet in the pool and no park guard will blow his whistle at you.There are kiosks in the garden if you feel a little hungry or thirsty, and there is also a restaurant where if the weather is kind you can sit outside under the trees. As this area of Paris is where the students live, the prices are not at all steep.There is no fee to enter the garden.If you exit the garden on Rue Guynemer, you will see a Rue Fleurus which runs from it. Just a few buildings along Rue Fleurus is where Gertrude Stein and her lover Alice B. Toklas lived and where the two played hostess to such famous writers as Ernest Hemingway and Scott Fitzgerald, and the Spanish-born artist Pablo Picasso. There is a plaque outside the building where they had lived.

Paris in the Springtime!. Okay, I'm a Canadian still thawing out from a harsh winter. but how can one go wrong with an abundance of flowers, shrubs, trees, and greenery set in stone architecture! Lovely.

Pretty much just a European Garden. This garden is like almost any garden I've seen in Europe. It's beautiful, has a places for kids to play, tennis courts, and fountain, but other than that, it's just a park essentially.

Paris at play. This is where the citizens of Paris come to relax. The park has multiple attractions including formal gardens, a carousel and children's play area, tennis courts, a pond to sail model boats, donkey rides and numerous chairs to sit and watch the world go by. Take time to look at the statues and wander round the gardens. A pleasant way to spend an hour or so away from the noise and bustle of central Paris.

Another Enjoyable Parisian Park. As the gardens are located on the right bank of Paris it tends to be slightly less 'touristy' but it is an excellent park, especially if you like to go for a run or sit an take some time.The Luxembourg Museum - a small museum that holds temporary exhibitions throughout the year is also located here. Check it out as there is usually something interesting on display.

A Great Place to Relax and for Kids. I always make it a point to stop here at least once during my Paris visits. Sometimes I come to give my feet a rest or to sit on a bench or in a chair and eat lunch. But often, I just amble through the beautiful gardens, which encompass about 57 acres behind the Luxembourg Palace, seat of the French Senate. I walk along the promenades, admiring the colorful flower beds, statues, lovely lawns and the stunning Baroque Medici Fountain.Visitors often gather around the large octagonal pond with a central fountain known as the "Grand Basin." Children can rent model sailboats to sail there. Other activities for the younger set include a puppet theatre, a fenced-in playground, a merry-go-round and pony rides. There is also a cafe on the grounds.The Musee du Luxembourg, the oldest public museum in Paris, stands on the edge of the gardens. Many excellent temporary art exhibitions have been held there, and I recommend checking to see if one of interest will be on during your visit. Sometimes, the wrought-iron grill that surrounds the gardens features an art exhibition, and I have never been disappointed in any that I've seen.To escape the large crowds that come here, I recommend arriving in early morning when most visitors will be jogging around the inside perimeter or late afternoon. There are many restaurants near the gardens. RER B Luxembourg Gardens is closer than any Metro stop.

Quaint park in busy city. Quite a quaint and nicely kept park in the middle of the city. After all the sights and sounds of the busy city, these gardens provide a welcome break for a while. Although it is not a major tourist attraction and can be skipped if you are on a short visit to Paris.
Picture perfect gardens. Set in a well heeled, affluent neighbourhood. Chairs to lounge in the sun and watch the world go by. We picked up some pastries in a little patisserie on the road on the Y n

Something for everyone. Saturday afternoon: pony rides for Parisian children, masses of cheerful young adults jumping rope (!), playing basketball, children with toy rented sailboats, tennis, and this was on a gray 45 degree day. Imagine, in the sunshine!
Beautiful Afternoon Walk. What's not to love about a beautiful Paris garden. There was a lot to see and just spend a relaxing afternoon walking around the gardens.

Very nice park where you can do sport or listen to music. US orchestra playing in the garden!! so nice... nice wlk in the park close to muséums and many places to visit (Musée du Luxembourg, Panthéon etc..)
Have to stroll. There is so much to see in the area. From the Obelisk to the Louvre that you will enjoy sitting and resting a bit in the beautiful gardens. Families, tourists, and locals.
A Walk through the Gardens. Such a beautiful oasis in a busy city! Loved seeing all the Parisiens simply enjoying the sun, leisurely lounging around the park!

More fun that the palace. The gardens are so expansive, wear comfortable shoes! You'll want to wander around all of the individual gardens as they are each unique. Make sure you are around while they are running and classical music is playing. Cafe was a nice stop.
Stunning. An amazing walk through one of the loveliest places. Very well kept, with nice little cafés situated near by. Perfect for a 1 to 2 hour visit.
First thing we did.... Seek out the gardens and just explore. Lovely stroll and relaxing walk about the gardens. Will be coming back here in the summer!

Despite it being a rainy Sunday the gardens were lovely. I adore carousels and there is one of Paris' oldest here. Despite it being closed I enjoyed sitting and photographing the animals. The Medici fountain was listed in one of my guides as one of the top 10 fountains in Paris and it was a stunner. Many children were playing in the playground and there were many statues to see. The daffodils were in bloom and despite it being gray and drizzling the gardens were a lovely walk.
Lovely place to watch Paris go by. Came here on our first and last days of our trip. Loved to sit and people watch. The views and grounds are lovely.

Pleasant stroll. It's a beautiful city park, flower plots already planted around the Palace building (now French Senate) but trees were bare & waiting for warmer temp to arrive. Lots of open space for walking, & chairs around the pond. During previous summer visits, there wasn't much shade bec all the trees were geometrically pruned in the formal manner of Fr. gardens. So if you are visiting with children need to be aware of the heat/no shade aspect. It also has special exhibits (by admission) but we went before the Tudors exhibit was to open in later March.

Beautiful gardens.. Easy to find, and lovely to stroll through. There are garden chairs scattered throughout the whole area which was abit strange to be honest, but probably very useful to locals and alike! The palace was a lovely back drop. The clock was an hour fast though! :-O but still chimed.

open space for an afternoon stroll. ewrly springtime in Paris, the gardens were still quite bare from winter but we're still a lovely way to spend 30mins strolling around with many locals enjoying the open space

relaxing couple of hours. Wonderful large garden - mix of shaded tree areas and open space ..with a large pond ringed with statues paying honour to many women with ducks and model sail boats for hire. As well as the grotto and water fall. So relaxing. To wonder through and spend some times relaxing on the chairs. A pleasant walk back to Note Dame. A fantastic half day.

Bring a book and relax. What a wonderful park. This is my favorite place to spend a quiet afternoon in Paris. On the weekends you can watch the locals playing bocci ball and the kids sailing their boats on the small pond. The many chairs there make it a great place to bring your coffee and a book and just chill. It is just a magical and relaxing place

Lovely park a must see. This park is beautiful, even on a cold but sunny Jan morning, it had a lovely boating lake with children playing with boats, cafe, nice gardens, locals running and working out, tennis courts, swings it was full of life, it also had lots of chair to relax in and people watch.

Lovely gardens. Wonderful place to relax while visiting the St. Michel district of Paris.
Places to sit beside the fountains and coffee shops just outside the gardens.

adorable. Absolutely adorable. To me personally it was a place where all the stereotypes about France proved themselves to be true. It is so nice and peaceful there. I didn´t notice hoards of tourists, so had a chance to enjoy my ice-cream next to one of the refreshing fountains.
Fabulous!. I love luxembourg Grdens! this place is very beautifull ! I definitely recomand to visit this amazing garden to every body!

Serene Escape . Traveling can be overwhelming, especially on big cities like Paris. The Luxemburg Gardens offers a great escape to find a bench in the corner of a garden and escape the busy city life. Its in a fantastic, prominante and safe neighborhood, so don't forget to go exploring once you've regained your walking legs. Don't miss out on this gem if you're in Paris and also don't forget your camera because if you have an eye for photography, there are beautiful shots lurking around every bush just waiting to be captured!

A Beautiful little park on the Left Bank.. A beautiful little park about one kilometer south of the Seine, reached by crossing the Pont a Change and continuing along the Boulevard St Michel, passing the famous Sorbonne along the way. Fronting the park is the Luxembourg Palace, seat of the Senate of France--terrific architecture, even in a city full of it, but don't expect to visit. Entry is "Interdite" (forbidden).
Paradise. Walking through the gardens is a dream. I love to stop by the espaliered fruit trees and the apiary. Even when there are no flowers it is an oasis in the city.

The Quintessential Paris Park. The formal gardens are magnificent, but you can also do as the Parisians do and just enjoy the space: come to run, to walk, to sit, to read, to watch children sailing their toy boats, to enjoy outdoor concerts or coffee in the pavilion under the trees.
Beautiful quiet oasis in Paris. Take a break from the crowds and traffic and stroll through this lovely park for half an hour or an hour.
Nice place to do a morning run. Pretty--also there's a bathroom in the garden which is convenient since I was walking around all day
Great views of Paris. Lots of reasonable brasseries around this are garden with spectacular view of Paris. The museum here is also well worth a visit.

Beautiful way to spend a couple of hours on a spring day!. This beautiful park located in the heart of Saint Germain is great for walking, sitting and people watching. It is beautifully maintained and the gardens are absolutely fabulous.

Beautiful place to walk and enjoy so early spring sunshine. Lovely cafe, Le Pavillon de la Fontaine, with nice food and beautiful view. We had the smoked Salmon open sandwich and the kids had ham and frites. We could have sat there all afternoon if we didn't have a train to catch!

Fabulous gardens, relaxing atmosphere. No better place to walk round & relax than Jardin de Luxembourg on a sunny day.A favorite place for locals & tourists alike this large & beautifully laid out garden is a joy to visit for both adults & children. There is a large, modern children's playground, pony rides, tennis courts and a large pond where children can hire toy boats to sail. There are two toilet blocks, one at each end of the gardens and two cafes with outdoor & indoor seating. Runners are in abundance as it is a safe and pleasant area in which to run circuits. There is plenty of seating around the gardens & pond. A haven of peace & tranquility in a busy city.

The Picture Perfect Park like in the Movies!. I love this park...it used to be, in my twenties, for the fact that at one end of this park...I could go to a little street at the end of the park and find A.P.C. General clothing stores..But really, this is that lovely, park with families, couples, people reading by themselves...kids launching boats in the pond on a Sunday, picture perfect park you've maybe seen in the movies. Definitely a great park to visit when you have the time to wander and unwind.

Best place for a rest during a go, go go day. We entered from the southwest corner on Sunday morning and saw so many locals taking advantage of the early Spring day! Tai Chi classes, pony rides, joggers, remote boat sailers, it was lovely!

One of my favourite parks in Paris. I love the Luxenbourg Gardens at any time of the year. I feel like it is two parks in one. To the west is the gardens and tress with sandy walkways and a special area for children to play. It is the quieter part of the park and not in the sunlight. This is a more functional garden. Then there is the main area with all the people sunbathing on metal chairs even if there is only a hint of sunlight. It is a joy to watch the little ones with their boats flooding around the pond with a fountain in the middle. When our little one was a bit younger it was a great investment of 3 Euros for 15 minutes.
relaxing. 5min walk from our hotel,and lovely for a relaxing stroll,or sit down in the numerous chairs around the pretty lake.

The Pick of All The Gardens In Paris.. We have visited the Luxembourg gardens in every season and found each has its attractions. Our favourite would be in spring and autumn when the crowds are a little less and the trees are the most attractive.Our recent trip to Paris we took our grand daughter and she spent most of the day exploring and talking to other children. She liked the pony rides and had an attempt at sailing a yacht. Some kind men asked her to throw a boule and explained how it is played.The number of visitors and Parisians who regularly visit the gardens must be considerable and each would leave refreshed as we did.

One of My Favorite. I love sitting near the water fountain and reading or watching locals enjoy this beautiful garden. Lots of chairs around to sit. Also like the areas where there are statues. That has bit of shade and lovely too.

Nice. Beautiful gardens, nice to wake around. It is amazing to think that the whole place was a Medici personal garden. It is nice for a stroll, fun to watch the boats in the fountain and a great place to have a picnic lunch. If you travel with children, this is a great place to let them run wild for a bit.

Gardens full of memories. I first used to go there as a little girl and have a ride on the donkey and go to the puppet theatre. All those still exist. It is a lovely garden to go when you need a break from walking all over. You can sit on a bench and watch people playing the petanque. It is quite large and full of charm particularly from the spring time to october. The borders are lovely and if you are in Paris in the summer the trees will protect you from the heat. Take young children there there will have plenty of entertainment.
Loved it. I really love walking around the gardens. There's even a place where you can have a pic-nik on the grass and there's a pond in the centre of the gardens. It's a great place to go and relax.

Would be pretty in Summer. We just passed through but it looks like it'd be a lovely place in the Summer. You can imagine lots of flowers and the greenery in full bloom. The ponds and statues are really pretty and really makes the place picturesque. I could imagine relaxing here in the Summer, in Paris people are rushing about all the time but they don't seem to here.

Very beautiful. A relaxed place in a busy city this is a nice place to relax and watch the world go by. We took a walk through the gardens and watched people enjoying the boating lake. A nice thing to do and seats to sit on whilst we enjoyed the ice cream we had bought from a nearby shop.
Gardens for the people. This is a beautiful peaceful place. There are chairs to sit and relax beautiful gardens. Lots of family's gives you a real sense ofParis.
Just relax!. One of the best places in Paris to have some wine, cheese and relax with a spetacular view of the gardens.

Well Worth it. Loads of seats for you to watch the world go by at a very relaxed pace. Walk through theses beautiful gardens and walk up to see the Pantheon and through the quaint streets of the latin quarter

Very nice place to relax. Very nice park to relax, read a book or go for a picnic. We went there exhausted after walking from Eiffel tour to there, we actually though it would take less time, but worth it :)

Stayed nearby the southern end - our regular thoroughfare!. Parisians love this garden - for walks, jogging or simply hanging out. It is a beautiful garden. Take some time to sit by the boating pond as enthusiasts launch, sail and retrieve their craft. Or just watch the world go by!

Would love to return in the summer. Stunning grounds and lovely building.
Would love to see in the summer and spend some time there when the sun is out!

Every day a new experience. This is a wonderful place to relax and watch Parisian life. There are chairs scattered throughout the park, and at the water feature, there are motorized sail boats that children play with. Always a pick up game of futbol, as well as beautiful gardens and fountains.
Blooming Flowers. Although we went at the end of winter with bare trees and lawns. The Luxembourg is a very nice place to visit and relax. The garden is conveniently located by a Metro stop.

Slow down, relax and enjoy the view. If I live in Paris, the Luxembourg Gardens will most certainly be my choice read and people watch. Situated on the border between Saint-Germain-des-Prés and the Latin Quarter, it is super convenient to walk from many Metro stations such as the M12 -Notra Dame Des Champ and M10 - Cluny- La Sorbonne. There are plenty of seats for you to rest your tired feet when you are tired from walking and admiring the stunning manicured lawns and statues. The gardens is also a favourite hangout amongst students, so expect a little noise but all in all, it is a wonderful place to visit to experience a little bit of green in the most romantic city in the world.
Beautiful grounds even during off season. We missed the flowers because it was early March, however, this is such a beautiful area, even without flowers. Peaceful!

Cold in March, but still green to see. Nice open space in the middle of the city, great for strolling and unwinding at your own pace. We saw ponies leaving, as we short used the park as a short cut from the Medici Fountain to La Coupole on Montparnasse.
super jardin. i liked this luxe gardens my fiancialle and i spent agreat time there you fell like you're in paradis i highly recommend
a paradise in Paris. a quiet park inside Paris... no noise expected...you can sit anywhere, or even children can go and make a poney ride....in spring, there are plenty of flowers

A respite from the city. These gardens were built as a respite for a queen, and they have served generations of ordinary citizens ever since as well. As a student in Paris I walked through them daily, and love to return. Here you can take a deep breath, enjoy the sunshine and relative quiet, and imagine Ernest Hemingway doing the same thing back in the 1920s. So much of Paris can be enjoyed for nothing, and this is one great example.
Great outdoors. Beautiful gardens for walking and admiring the beauty of the landscape, visiting the museum, and nearby Rue du Bac is a must

Where's the grass?. Ah, one of the most lovely parks of Paris. Amazing architecture around you, impressive waters, many trees and vast spaces of gravel. Wait, what? There's no (or very little) grass around here? What a pity. No picnicking in the grass. For a "jardin" I did expect more natural wealth but it's nice nonetheless. There is a fun attraction for the kids here on the South-West end, a so called "aire de jeux". There is a small entry fee but our son had a blast. The kids can also ride horses but that's rather expensive.

Tranquilly in the centre of Paris . Staying in St German, we were lucky enough to be close to the gardens.We stumbled across an open air concert celebrating St Patrick's day on Sunday. It was lovely to see many different nationalities swaying and jigging to the music.Stunning tranquility in the centre of Paris.

Stopping Time. Hello travellers, this is the ideal place if your around to sit a bit a let time go by, you will relax and you can grab a snack or rest from your walking , or if you have much time to spend you can read a book. This is one fine Garden!.Everything is well care. My Congratulations to frenchmen!Recomend it !Visited 2006

A have-to pass. Hello,If you have only a few days in Paris, then you will get some fun if you pass by Luxembourg garden and have a few time there, specially in the morning.The only bad thing about it, is that it closes very early - just like a lot of french places....

Favorite place to relax in all of Paris!. Luxembourg Garden is my number one 'go to' place if I want to just relax a bit with a book or simply watch the world go by. I've been there at all different times of year. It's stunning when flowers are blooming riotously and the pond is surrounded by children and parents directing remote control sailboats. It's also beautiful in the winter. You will miss the flowers but be even more impressed by the architecture and statuary. Very easy to get to from pretty much anywhere in Paris. Lovely!

A relaxing Oasis in the center of busy Paris.... This place was a joy and one of my favorite places in Paris...that is, if you can find one of those comfy green chairs! You could easily spend the whole afternoon here and not even realize hours have gone by.

Jardin De Luxemborg. Beautiful area. I highly recommend this as a more relaxed place to visit. We went early and had coffee there. There is a cafe on the grounds that you can get lattes, ice cream etc.... Several beautiful fountains.
lovely formal gardens. these lovely formal gardens are out of the way a bit but after you have seen the usual paris highlights worth a visit,

Beautiful Gardens in the middle of Paris. Go for breakfast to one of the cafes at the edge of the gardens and then have a morning walk in this beautiful garden. If you are in to running the outside edge is a perfect 2 k circuit

Lovely tranquil place to walk through. Gorgeous gardens are well kept and create a nice place to walk through its nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and just reflect. Trees and flowers where not really in bloom in feb but could imagine it would look great in spring and summer :-)

Grey drizzly day did not challenge the beauty. I could have spent hours walking through the gardens even though the paths were muddy and the trees did not have leaves. It was interesting to feel the structure and organization of the park. The gray and brown made the walk soothing. Don't skip the gardens if it is raining.
Pleasant gardens for a drink on a warm day. The gardens themselves are nothing to brag about but worth a visit for the history. Also nice for a break and a drink when in Paris on a warm day.

Such a Peacful place!. This garden was recommended by the staff at our hotel. It is beautiful with the many flowers. They have a playground as well as a carousel for children to ride. It is a great place to relax, read a book and drink tea.

Romantic well maintained gardens. Home to the French Senate. The building is surrounded by beautifully designed gardens. Definitely worth a long stroll amongst its allies, its statues. On one side as a playground for children.

A Parisian Gem.. It is one of the most relaxing places in Paris, I absolutely loved it there. In fact, it quickly became our go to place for picnic-like lunches whenever we found ourselves in the Latin Quarter.I absolutely loved the contrast of bright flowers and green lawns with the multitude of browns, reds and yellows that are so characteristic of Autumn; I also adored how filled with life it was, from outside concerts, to painters rendering their rendition of the Medici Foutain, to people, of various ages, playing a game that looked like "outside bowling". And although some sections of the Garden are extremely populated in the afternoon, there is still space aplenty for those who crave the solitude of a quiet corner. It was just the perfect location to recuperate, relax and enjoy the Sun.

Great garden but too many people. This is a great garden to take a walk, vast and beautiful. However, when I visited in a recent Sunday afternoon, I was overwhelmed by the sheer number of people pouring into the garden! The trees in the garden, with its knotted branches, were strangely captivating to me. I could not peel my eyes off them.A great place to walk, sit, enjoy a book and people watch..
Awesome place to relax. So relaxing. It was a sunny day when I went there and I really enjoyed it. You should also see Pantheon which is very close to the garden.

Beautiful Garden, Nice Stroll. This is a very beautiful garden and is definitely worth checking out for a stroll if in the area. I came here to admire the history of it. Hemmingway wrote about how he hunted pigeons in this park for food when he would run out of money in the 1920s. It is always interesting to see places you read about firsthand.

Paris no 1 darting place. This is where many of Paris’ couples go for their date. It is also an excellent place to check out people if you’re ‘on the market’. And it is easy to understand why. Central, extremely well kept, nice flower arrangements and then there’s the fab fountain where the kids play with the boats provided by the municipality. I just love it even if it can be a bit chilly on early spring evenings.
Pretty..just not in early march. They were doing some work and getting things ready for the spring. It was a nice place to sit down, take in some sun, and eat a panini though.

Luxembourg Gardens. Brilliant place to sit and chill. Even though gardeners are busy re doing plots for coming season great place to sit in the reclining chairs and just chill. Busy on a weekend with locals jogging or playing tennis or bringing the family to boating pond. Cafe is a little pricey but they don't bother you and you can sit in the sun for an hour with only a coffee so you are not just paying for the drink. We used as a rest stop between Notre Dame and Monparnasse Cemetry

Really lovely. It was wet and a little cold but lovely to walk around in. If you are partially interested the local visitors centre run cheap walking tours 3 times a week. There is a lift built to one side of the valley that makes getting in to the lower parts of the city more knee friendly. Definitely a high light of my time in Luxembourg.
Nice Garden. Another nice romantic place in heart of the city. Perfect for a stroll at anytime of the day. People really enjoying in Sun , lying down in benches engaging in friendly banter. :)
Ok for a quick walk. Nice but not a lot to see in February. Loads of joggers about so you could join in. The lake is tiny and statues are scattered. It was nice what more can I say.

Perfect location for a lovely walk!. Very nice location for a romantic walk as well as a great place to take original pictures. The inspiration for the statue of liberty in NY can be found in this park and is well worth a visit!

Lovely park. We came to Paris for a Valentine's break and decided to visit these gardens. The garden is not quite like the kind of gardens you'd find in London, it is quite small and more like a park than a garden. It's still worth visiting, we got some lovely pictures of the gulls. They're quite tame and will fly right up to your hands if you offer them food!

A big space with not much in it. We thought that this would be more 'garden like' with flowers shrubs etc but it really more of a large open space on different levels with a big pond where people can sit around.

an odd park. Maybe it's just being British, but I'm used to the being alot of grass in a park to sit and have a picnic. This park is large but we found very little space we could sit and have a picnic on (okay March is an odd month for a picnic but it was nice weather!).
Beautiful. March isn't the best time in the year to visit the gardens and yet they were beautiful. I can't wait for chance to visit in the summer

Beautiful Sunday Stroll. Spent a couple of hours in the autumn sun wandering through the gardens taking a gentle stroll, it was great to see the locals enjoying family time with picnics, kids learning to ride bikes, gents playing chess, artist sketching it was a great place to have a coffee and watch the world go by.

fantastic for children. Definitely worth the trip if you are travelling with children, or if you want a casual Parisian outing. So many things to do- walk through the gardens, rent some wooden model boats to sail in the fountains, pony rides, tennis courts, the famous green lawn chairs to sit, read, relax or watch the world go by. I first came here as a 23yr old to admire the gardens in spring and summer and now bring my children 18 yrs later!! the gardens in spring and summer are magnificent- absolutely mandatory if you visit Paris!

Time-out from the Parisian stress. Bring a blanket, a baguette (or two!), a wine, good friends and some music, and look forward to hours of relaxation in arguably one of the most beautiful settings in Paris. Within walking distance of the Latin quarter and Notre Dame.

Lovely Morning Stroll. We took a lovely crisp morning stroll through these fabulous gardens. It's very peaceful and easy to relax before or after a frantic day of sightseeing or shopping. Great spot for people watching, sipping coffee or having a picnic. Definitely visit here - you can spend 10 minutes or hours - it's very "Parisian".
Peaceful. This is a beautiful garden and a nice, quiet place away from all the hustle and bustle. Short walk to the St. Germain area, which is ovely. Had great crepes in a local place there.

a sunny day is a day in paradise. when you come from destinations where the sun is plenty you tend to forget what it's like to walk in a park on a sunny day in Paris - like it was this lovely day in mar have!! a piece of heaven with just happy faces and merry sounds! do stroll down the gardens, it's enchanting
It's a park. Nice for a walk around, Sunday afternoon very pleasant, statues ice creams, model yacht lake, Parisians taking their leisure....

Parisian. I had read it is a park frequented by Paris families and it really was. Nice Medici fountain. The noise of kids playing was fun to hear, also saw them in ponies and with the sailboats. A nice walk.

Beautiful, despite the weather.. The wind was blowing the rain horizontally and I'd given up using my umbrella but the Garden was still quite beautiful. The absence of people gave me a chance to really study the layout and planning of the garden and how it fits the Palace. I won't bore you with details, but this is really a garden that rewards your taking the time to really appreciate it.
Beautiful year-round. A wonderful place to people-watch - the symmetry, greenery, pathways - a great spot to immerse yourself in the City of Lights.

Probably much nicer in the spring. No flowers were blooming when we visited (February)and it was a cold, overcast day - I'm sure this negatively colored my view of the Luxembourg Gardens. Mostly all we noticed were the huge sand walkways - blah. I can imagine this place would be beautiful in the spring with flowers everywhere and a bright sunny day. But, if you visit Paris in the winter, it's definitely skippable. The Jardin du Tuileries is marginally nicer because of the statuary and beautiful buildings surrounding it, so I'd pick that over the Luxembourg GArdens in winter.*if you like my review, I hope you'll click the 'helpful' button; those of us who write reviews love to get them and it motivates us to do more :) *
mostly enjoyable all the year round. It was really heavy rainy and windy day, despite it we had hot-dogs purchased at the parks gate, fed the poultry in the pound, really enjoyed...

short visit. been before short visit in winter the naked trees loose some of the charm of the retirees playing Bocce.
all in all good to visit even on a cold windy day.
LOVELY. Lovely restful gardens, A nice place to set while seeing the sights in the district. Take the time to relax and reenergize.

The beautiful park which captures the heart of Paris at leisure. My wife and I often go to this park to relax and to enjoy with the Parisians the wide variety of activities there. It is in some ways the trendy part of Paris at leisure: watch or join in with the serious exercisers who religiously canter the de rigueur perimeter route for jogging; the groups executing their tai chi routines or the young female professionals boxing with their personal trainers, or the aspiring Roland Garros wannabes in the tennis courts (some of whom are very good). Or just sit on one of the many parkside benches for a picnic (as do many of the Sorbonne students or office workers in the area. There is also the Musee de Luxembourg for latest exhibitions; and often there are excellent outdoor photographic exhibitions lining the perimeter railings of the gardens. Oh yes, and lots of statues scattered about the gardens. Choose a sunny day to go.
Beautiful. Fun and beautiful place to relax. Great for people-watching too! The gardens are beautiful, even in the fall when we were there.

Very Relaxing and great place in the city.. Just off the main busy streets and easy to walk to in order to take a few minutes to relax. The park typically of most in the city is very well maintained and clean.

Lovely even in February. It was exciting to see crocus and daffodils waking up at winter's end. Landscaping was immaculate and amazing. The Medici fountain is magnificent even though it is not yet running. My only disappointment was that I could not find where the puppet theater was, despite the maps that were displayed throughout. Perhaps it is a non-permanent seasonal structure. I especially loved the lovely statues of various queens in the area just south of the octagonal sailboat pond. The Senat building on the north side of the garden is beautiful (and heavily patrolled). On weekday mornings near the tennis courts, there are people who do something like tai chi with swords and fans, with an instructor standing by, and they can do it because there aren't so many people. On the weekends, there are families and children, so nice to see. Charming place to visit and revisit.
peaceful. we spent almost every day for a month at least an hour or two there, reading, people watching or simply laying on the beautiful grass... I miss it more than anywhere else.
Quiete place. In March the garden do not look really green, anyway it is a nice place in the city, where to relax or sport.

Nice place but not for Winter. I visited Luxembourg Gardens just few days ago and there is really not much to see there. It's definitely a summer attraction but it made a quick shortcut walk to Saint-Mitchel area.

Beautiful gardens - even in winter.. If you are anywhere near the Louvre, it's well worth a stroll through these gardens. They are laid out to a very geometric design and are usually quite busy but the boulevards are so wide a group of 50 tourists with their guide are barely noticeable. Admittedly, it was a wee bit cool but a small glass of wine soon warmed us up afterwards.

perfect sunday afternoon. whether you want to enjoy a walk among the park, sightseeing the beautiful statues, or take your kids in the play area, or loose a few pounds of that so tasty french food playing tennis for a couple of hours, you'll find the perfect place at Jardins du Luxembourg, right behind famous St Germain des Pres. A wonderful family place right in the heart of Paris Rive Gauche.

Very beautiful place in the heart of Paris. These gardens are really beautiful even in the winter. But of course it is just great during summers where a lot of flowers are grown. There are also very comfortable chairs close to the pond where you can relax after a long walk. Take a lunch and enjoy it next to the pond with beautiful ducks and amazing beauty.

Peaceful. We took a slow walk to the gardens and even in February,they were soon nice. Had a break there at a small stall selling coffee. We watched the runners doing their training. I wished I could have joined them . Would love to see the gardens in the summer
A beauty even in winter. Where better to have a lovely stroll in Paris? These gardens are clean and pretty, an absolute must see in Paris. No one around to take advantage of tourists either.

Charming, elegant park in which you can relax and enjoy a picnic. The Luxembourg Park, housing the Luxembourg Palace and its gardens, is one of the prettiest spots to spend a leisurely day in Paris. The park has a central fountain and abundant gardens and benches, and is surrounded by numerous statues, mostly of French queens. One may sit, on warm days, under the trees and eat a picnic meal, or sit and take the sun on one of its many benches. There are children playing in the area and putting small boats in the basin. Worth a visit and a nice stay in the area. The palace is not open for visits.

beautiful and a must see. Such a lovely place, so colorful yet so elegant at the same time. A must see while in Paris. The only thing to be reproached is a crowd of people and the dust cloud they create but again you can understand them wanting to be there. Go see it, the most beautiful park in Paris.
So beautiful. This place seems to be where the French come for lunch and after work! It is beautiful and the flowers are stunning! I recommend a picnic lunch here!

Beautiful. This is a beautiful garden to stroll through. My friend and I happened upon a jazz band during my visit there which is quite fun. I'd recommend popping by for a visit if you have the time. Our hotel wasn't far from it so it made visiting easy ad there are a lot of great restaurants close by.

Fun for little kids. My first time here. A cloudy winter day. My six year old daughter enjoyed sailing a little sailboat in the fountain pool (3.5€ for 30 minutes). She also had a very good time at the closed playground (2.50€ per child, 1.20€ adult) which is clean, well maintained and has a large variety of facilities. The merry-go-round is fun too for little ones (1.50€ per ride).Yes - you spend money in a public park, but I think the maintenance is worth it.

Stumbled upon. These gardens were around the corner from the hotel we stayed at yet we only stumbled upon them on our last day in Paris.Beautiful setting and large open spaces make them a great place to go for a walk, let kids run riot or take a dog for a walk.It's also a fantastic place for people watching as you could spend hours sitting on a bench relaxing here.Monceau is also a beautiful park to visit
Beautiful, relaxing. Pack a picnic, a book, sneak some wine, and relax with the rest of the French in the beautiful garden behind a lovely palace! I mean, it's a no-brainer, and a favorite spot.

Not so much in the winter. This the first time i went there in the winter. while clearly it's a beautiful place in other seasons, it looked a little bleak. The status looked a little more sinister. Still worth taking a look, but only if you have the time.
Lovely even in winter. Beautiful grounds, especially the fountain. Relaxing lovely atmosphere and wonderful even in winter. Worth a wander... Will save the 5 stars until summer

Attractive in winter but beautiful in summer. We walked through the park in February and the flower beds were disappointing as hardly any flowers were out. The views however of the buildings, fountains, statues and ponds were pleasant and there was a restful atmosphere.  If you enjoy a walk through nicely laid out gardens with the opportunity to tarry a while then this is just the place for you, especially in the spring or summer.

My favourite park in Paris. Lovely peaceful park not far from St Germain, Luxomborg. Lovely place to sit in the sun , great statues of french queens incl a couple from England/Scotland., worth a walk if in the area.

Nice place for walks. Fair amount of people despite the rainy day outside. A lot of joggers and people that worked out in groups, doing yoga or exercises. Some statues of former queens of france aroung a big fountain. Overall, if you decide to go on foot around Paris, is a nice place. We passed through it on our way to Notre Damme.

Perfect sunday picnic!. It was a sunny sunday in the end of August. We were a group of 6! We decided to have lunch at the Jardins du Luxembourg, so we headed out to a nearby supermarket, picked up various charcuteries, breads, cheeses and a few prêt-à-manger (ready-to-eat) sandwiches from the fridges (salmon & cream, eggs & bacon, brie & jam, etc...) and two wine bottles, and that was it!Light breezes, shining light, good food and friends: the perfect picnic in the heart of beautiful Paris !

Very large garden with some old traces.. Maybe because it was late winter when I visited the Garden, I didn't find it that much attractive. If the trees inside turn greener, the Garden will be much nicer in harmony with quaint sculptures and white-stoned stairs.

Did not inspire. May be it was a bad rain day ,but despite keeping the sunny side up there was no wow factor. It seemed to b just a large sports area. Totally deserted except for two children playing in one of the play grounds. Yes there were defibrillators at every corner and in the central area.soldiers on guard at the palace , museum closed. Tea shop closed. Perhaps next time in spring I may review again
Stroll, sit, picnic. Even in the midst of winter, this is a lovely place. On Sunday it seems that most of Paris is here with their children, and that makes for a wonderful experience.
Awsome setting. Don't go to Paris and not walk round these gardens . It was a lovely sunny day and everyone was sat out in the sun enjoying the views.

Favourite Garden in Paris. The Luxembourg gardens are my dearest parisian attraction, the gardens are gorgeous, it has a wonderful playground area, which pleases from babies to 12 year olds, a charming antique carrousel, you can practice running, there are tennis courts, chess tables and a puppet theatre. It also hosts a spectacular museum, which only hosts temporary exhibitions which are always great quality! Last time I was there there was an Angelina café right outside the museum, in the park entrance close to saint Germain des Prés!Go for a stroll where all the parisians do!

Review of Jardin du Luxembourg by John Sanderson. Only a short trip from the centre of Paris, these gardens are a peaceful haven where you can get away from hustle and bustle if the weather is good. There is a central ponds where children can hire toy wooden yachts to sail. Lovely gardens to walk around and adventure playgrounds for children. Good for picnic. Take the RER Line B to Luxembourg.

Great place to wind down and people watch. The gardens are great all year round but my favourite times are late spring and autumn when so much comes into bloom and the couleurs are so vivid.You could spend hours here walking the paths, looking at the statues, the magnificent Medicis fountain or just sitting on a bench or a seat and watching the world go by.Bring your lunch, a coffee or a ice cream and just soak up all the calmness before going back out into the real world and everyday life.

Very pleasant surprise in the heart of the city.. We visited the Gardens today and it was beautiful. There are lots of works in the gardens going on at the moment. This I can only assume getting ready for the Summer. The whole area was well tended and although a little cold, I can imagine it being a calm and relaxing place to visit when the blossom and leaves are in the trees. The gardens cover a vast area, with cafes, tennis courts and play areas. Because of the flatness of the area it does attract a lot of runners. The French Senate building sits at the end of the gardens and is a good looking building enhanced by the gardens. Would definitely return in warmer months to be able to take in the atmosphere and sunshine.
Stunning could spend all day here!. A must see!Amazing landscapes, gardens and history!Great park area for kidsCentrally located easy to get too

Favorite place for lunch takeout!. We stayed at Port-Royal which was a 10 minute walk away from the gardens. February is very cold for a picnic or lunch takeout but the Jardin du Luxembourg will make you forget how cold it was.

Very pretty in Summer. I can imagine this being very pretty and relaxing in summer but it was cold, raining and the greenhouse section was closed for renovation until March, so we did not stay long. An indoor restaurant or coffee place would have been good.

Aniversario Mexicano. We flew from Mexico into Paris in First class, I Met wonderful people on the plane and some one try to describe Luxembourg Gardens to us. It did not come even close to what we saw, once we visit Luxembourg Gardens. I had a picnic in the gardens and took a bottle of red wine to drink, I spend the whole afternoon in this garden I really love this place.Please put this site on your to do list in life, its a great relaxing place in this world.

Relaxing. Beautiful gardens with more than enough space to sit down and watch time pass by. Loved it! After your visit you feel relaxed and for some odd reason exited about what you might find next ... Typical Persian atmosphere... Pure awesomeness

Lush bimble in the sun. never had chance to visit the museum, but the grounds were lovely. We had a rare moment of beautiful spring sunshine and the park was filled with runners, couples, families and strollers.
Would definitely recommend as a free way to spend some time in beautiful Paris... Especially as the surrounding suburbs are some of the nicest we walked.

Pique-nique. Picnicking in the Jardin du Luxembourg is an exquisite experience - I felt like I had taken drugs but it was actually just a natural high induced by the excellent setting, the glorious weather, and the stunningly well-textured duck pate.

Peaceful and beautiful. You can spend hours here, sipping from your glass of Chablis, observing the fancy French families on a walk, couples having an improvised picnic and the elderly catching up some some sitting on the chairs that are available everywhere. Despite all of the people, this place is an oasis of peace in Paris. Totally worth spending several hours here.
Absolutely, but not in the winter. Beautiful. Watch the men play petanque. Put the kids on the carousel and "catch" rings. But, boy, it is bleak when there is no foliage.

Beautiful area. The park is very easy to find and get to by walking or by the Metro/RER. Even in winter it is still very pretty and scenic, not to mention peaceful. Perfect for grabbing a bite to eat or taking a stroll. It also has many activities for children making it suitable for all the family.

A Walk in the Gardens. For us, Paris is a "walking city," and parks, such as the Luxembourg Gardens are a big reason. One can just ramble around the extensive grounds, taking in the statues and architecture, which are, in turn, framed by some of the most lovely vistas anywhere.Even with the number of locals and tourists, the Gardens always seem quiet, and a visitor can easily forget that they are not alone there.
Beautiful. Beautiful views and pleasant atmosphere--even in the winter! I personally enjoyed the area where children can rent boats to push across the fountain.

a bit out of the crowds. Luxembourg gardensParis can be exhausting so if you have the time go for a walk away from the crowds and appreciate the Luxembourg gardens.There are places to seat, to grab a drink, beautiful gardens for contemplation and over 100 statues, including all the famous women in French history.Enjoy it!

One of Our Favourite Spots. We never get tired of Luco. There is something in the gardens for everyone. We especially love to go early in the evening and have a quite appero and do some serious people watching. For children there are the playgrounds, sand pits, lake to sail boats on and donkeys to ride, puppet theatre and old fashioned carousel where they can practice their jousting skills. Then there are the tennis and basketball courts, boules area, chess tables, apiary and band stand. Whatever the season it is always a wonderful place to visit and take a picnic. Oh and don't forget to check out the prototype for the Statue of Liberty.

Pretty in the Winter. These gardens would be amazing in the Spring , Summer and Fall months. We had a nice pretty day and so many people were outside sitting in the sun and admiring the gardens. There were no flowers but I just imagined how beautiful it would be in those months.

Calm place in Paris. Enjoy a calm and relaxing moment, walking around, sitting on a chair or playing. You can spend hours in this park, all around you can view nice statues and Paris building. A great experience.

An oasis in the city. The pick of the gardens in the inner city. Delightful, picturesque grounds - its lawns, its trees, the monumental Medici Fountain. A place to unwind and rest for a few hours. Lots of photo opportunities. Loved the band playing on the rotunda alongside the cafe under the trees. Wiled away a couple of hours enjoying the music, the coffee and the beautiful grounds. Peaceful despite the crowds on a very warm Saturday.

Art and gardens. Close to the Pantheon, the Luxembourg Gardens includes the Medici's Palace and fountains. A lot of statues, and one of those famous Arago medals, that marks the Rose Line in the ground.

Enjoy the location. Stopped here for a lunchtime picnic as a respite between sightseeing endeavors. Wish I had more time to explore the Gardens, we ended up lounging in the sun, relaxing and people watching as we enjoyed our cheese and baguette lunch

Perhaps you might consider staying in this nice part of town. I've been to Paris twice. The first time, we stayed near the Louvre and the neighborhood was a tad seedy and not particularly pretty. The second time, however, we stayed across from Luxembourg Gardens and I think this was a great choice. The Gardens were a great place to just get away from the hubbub of the city and this little oasis was a welcome retreat. Plus, Angelina's is at the edge of the park--and it might just have the best hot cocoa in the world! Some nice restaurants and sites nearby and a reasonable walking distance to sites such as Notre Dame and the Pantheon make this a good choice for tourists.

Typical French garden. I wouldn't say you have to go there if you are on a short stay but, as it is pretty central it's definitly worth going if you're in the area, or if you want to enjoy a typical Parisian garden. You can rent a model sail boat to float on the pound. If you have young children there is a popular paying play area, poney rides, a merrygoround and a puppet show (although language maybe an issue).There is also a museum with good exhibitions.

Luxembourg Gardens. Great place. Lots of paths, Lots of flowers. Great to sit out in the sun in the many chairs provided.There are tennis courts, and a pond that provides toy sailboats for the kids to sail.Also severall statues and reflecting ponds.
Revitalizing and inspiring. One of my favorite places in Paris. All in one place. Amazing place with loads of nature and architecture. Simply stunning specially in summer.

Pretty, well-kept gardens. The gardens were very well kept and beautifully Parisian. Plenty of benches to sit down, and a large pond in the centre. Shame about the Feb weather though - I bet they're marvellous in the summer sun!

A jump back in the history. Le jardin du Luxembourg is one of my favorite place in Paris not only for the beauty of the garden but also for the traces of history that you "feel" when you walk around. When I'm there at sunset with my girlfriend I feel like being in the "Three musketeers" book by Alexandre Dumas and it's like D'Artagnan could appear at any moment in front of us!Great place and great feelings
Must do. Luxembourg gardens and the Musee is a must do for me every time I am in Paris. What a pleasant place to be after a crowded day Nature and Culture are in together their.

Beautiful and Tranquil. A really lovely way to spend an afternoon with a walk in this beautiful, peaceful and tranquil garden. Watching other people play tennis, picnic on the grass or just sitting in the sun lounging on the many relaxing chairs provided. Make sure you leave at least 2 - 3 hours to enjoy this beautiful garden. We spent 4 hours here and could have stayed longer as it just such a relaxing way to spend the day.

Relaxation Time. Beautiful gardens! Great place to relax and enjoy the view. Also has a pastry shop just inside the entrance (Angelina) so you can enjoy pastries and coffee while you relax. Lots of activities also going on, including a small lake area for children to sail mini boats. Obviously a popular spot among the locals.
Lovely, even in winter. Worth a visit. I wasn't going to go because it is cold, but one of my most pleasant mornings was spent walking around the park.

Tranquility in the Heart of Paris. when I was younger, I used to jog either along the Seine or do leisurely loops in Luxembourg Gardens. This is a wonderful park to look at well-maintained flower beds or just sit on a chair by the artificial lake and watch the children sailing toy boats as they did at the turn of the century. This is a wonderful park in which to escape the hustle and bustle and noise just outside its tall wrought iron gates.
Birthday trip. Lovely sunny day to show Luxembourg gardens and palace off at their very best. It's beautiful in the summer when there are concerts in the band stand and the trees are in full foliage.
Great place for relaxing in sun. If it is sunny, the place place to relax in Paris is Luxembourg gardens. Relaxing chairs are provided in the garden, where you can lay down and take a spurt of sun.

An Oasis of Calm and Beauty. An often overlooked place to visit in the City of Light, the Luxembourg Gardens is a place to go and relax a, enjoy, and have some fun and cultural enrichment (or just stroll or sit and enjoy the scenery). Wide paths, trees, flowers, topiary, beautiful sculptures, free exhibitions of art in various media by up and coming French artists, boats to sail on the main fountain, bee keeping, fruit trees, and the luxurious Luxembourg Palace all combine to form a calm place to slow down any frenetic trip through Paris. There is a small café on the grounds, so you can have a beverage and/or snack and people watch for a while as you gather your composure before continuing your stroll through the garden to find the next gem of discovery. You can take as much or as little time as you desire, but, once there, you'll want to stay longer to see what you can find. Spring and summer are the best times to visit, but any season will be a delight for the entire family.

Great for a morning walk. A great idea for a morning walk. Lots of people jogging, you get an impression Paris Gardens are all about lifestyle sportsmen. There is a nice scenery in the nearby streets where you can venture for more authentic experience.
Lots of fun. We took our bats and played pingpong in the park. Even in the wind is was very good. Lots of fantastic fountains with Horses in them. Brilliant

Truly Breathtaking!. I don't think there is a park elsewhere in the world as beautiful as this one. Front the trees to the flowers and statues, it's an amazing experience walking through this park. Also a great place to people watch and take in Paris.
Peaceful. A very nice park to walk through with manicured trees, a huge lawn and nice view of the museum. You can even weigh yourself if the desire hits you!

The Jardin is a must... We have stayed in Rue Bonaparte many times and the Jardin has been a short walk away. I have enjoyed many a jog around the perimeter on the footpath side in the early mornings, joining a lot of other joggers. Over time one gets to recognize regulars and there is a hint of acknowledgement. My wife and I have enjoyed a lot of walks in the Jardin, and when our children were young we watched the people sailing their little yachts around the pond when the time of year favored this past time. We did feel sorry for the ponies in our earlier years in the Jardin being led up and down the path with children on their backs. In our last visit we noted that the children's playground had been upgraded considerably which would please the younger generations of parents.

Gardens were beautiful. Sadly we went in winter and so although you could see the garden was pretty it definitely lost something. It was also surprisingly busy, despite the freezing temperatures!Definitely worth a stop if your passing
BEST PARK IN PARIS.. This park is stunning.. I love it. Visit it everytime I go to Paris. Nice layout, very safe, friendly people, has nice features etc.
Breathtaking. The gardens were spectacular in October 2014. We had a picnic late in the afternoon and the park was filled with people enjoying the unseasonable warm weather. The flowers are gorgeous!

Must Visit - Glorious. This park is just glorious, if the weather is good make it one of your stops in Paris. I visited the park on a sunny winters day and it looked glorious. The gardens are grand, in fact everything is on a grand scale and take advantage of the many chairs available for you to sit on.If you need space, a place to relax, read a book, write in your journal or just visit a beautiful park add this place to your list of must see sites.Recommended for people of all ages and all physical abilities. It is also safe and you don't get hassled.
A wide open, popular space in the centre of the city. Well worth a stroll about; be it sommer or winter. There's always something to look at, even if you're just people watching.
Beautiful. A wonderful walk from start to finish and would recommend to anyone for a midday/morning walk with a croissant and coffee!
Sunset here.... ...sitting near the fountain in a green chair with everyone else in quiet admiration of light on stone and water. Even better if you bring a crepe with you to savor!
Beautiful stroll. The Luxembourg gardens are lovely - probably more beautiful in summer and spring however, even though we went in February it was still pleasant.

Perfect Sunday place with something for everyone!. Awaken you inner child with a trip to the Luxembourg gardens. Vast expanse of greenery, open spaces, Kids playground, tennis courts, walking tracks, a small water body - there is something for everyone including pets that love running around the garden! Great place to spend a weekend evening strolling around. Pick up a cone at Amorino & enter the gardens for a serene outing :-)

beautiful even in winter. The gardens are a must see. I've seen the gardens in every season and they are always beautiful. Get a coffee from one of the local coffee shops and just stroll around the gardens. Wonderful.

So beautiful. Beautiful gardens in Paris and they have a small but perfectly formed Angelina's. We loved walking round the gardens before stopping there for coffee and macaroons - thoroughly worth a trip there.
Very beatiful garden. It's really nice place to spend couple of hours walking around in the great garden, better in summer

Old fashioned children's fun. Nice place to take the kids on a Sunday, even in winter. The sailing boats on the ponds. The visitors doing different forms of physical exercise and the small childfren's playground. This playground has an entrance fee, correctly children pay more than parents (€2.50 vs €1.20) - some will find it strange that it is not for free, but then if you want a clean, safe and well-kept playground it is not abnormal that one has to pay for it. I'd like to come back without the grand children to see some of the more historic landmarks in the park (and sneakily rent my own boat and play with it on the pond :-) )
Amazing. This place would be great to visit in spring or summer. I was there in winter and still beautiful. Place to be relax and drink you coffee.
Little hidden gem. This park has hidden art work (my fav was the Fontaine Medicis). This park is larger than it seems and its good for a run or basketball or just sitting for peace and quiet.
Spectacular. Bring your camera.. This well manicured garden is a welcome retreat to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. As it is so picturesque you may want to bring your camera along.
Great place to take the sand-box set. Play with toy boats on the pond (5 euros). Beautiful gardens. The playgrounds you have to pay for though which is a bit of a shame.

Great for a relaxed break from the city. Loved the atmosphere in the park, really peaceful away from the busy city. Lots of yoga classes going on in the tree covered area, and the centre of the gardens in front of the house was really beautiful with lots of flowers, a large fountain, and many sculptures. There were lots of families and picnic-ers there, so I'd say it's perfect for an idyllic afternoon's rest from the city.
Lovely even in the rain.. Still lovely even in the rain. The garden and water fountain is lovely. I bet it would even better in spring/summer times.

Chilli wander round the gardens. We spent a bit of the morning here today, wandering round the gardens. There is a beautiful chateau type building with decorative fountain and grounds surrounding it. Beautiful avenues of clipped trees, and lots of private romantic places to sit and watch the day go by! A lovely part of Paris to discover!
Beautiful flora. This place is gorgeous. The perfect place to take a leisurely stroll, read a book, people watch or just soak in Paris.

Luxembourg Gardens. One of my favourite places in Paris. It's really pretty in the summer and it's lovely to walk around on a Sunday and sit near the water and see the little boats sailing. Very close to Saint-Germain-des-Près and the Panthéon too.

Short Cut and Escape. The gardens cut nicely through the heart of Paris and offer a reprieve from the crowded side walks. Make a picnic and enjoy a nice afternoon relaxing or simply stroll through. The gardens are nice even during the winter and offer an easy way to navigate yourself.

The first day of the cold. We arrived back in Paris on the first day of what seemed like the impeding approach of Winter. The distinct chill in the air doesn't diminish the beauty of these gardens or even want me to shy away from sitting by the fountain. All and all- a lovely place to discover and see how Parisians inhabit their parks and open spaces.

perfect escape from the bisy streets of paris. Very close to the hotel we were staying at- took a walk here each morning and just loved the peaceful and pretty surroundings. Would recommend for everyone as it has gardens, fountains, a children's play area and a lovely cafe

Beautiful even in the winter. Lovely gardens, free, if it is warmer it would be a great place to sit and have lunch. There is food available in the park. Also the Palace, which we didn't go through. Lovely little restaurants and shopping on the streets around the gardens. Would love to go back when the trees are in bloom! I'm sure it would be amazingly beautiful!

Great park. This park is filled with young people and old people. The young ones seem tone having an endless lunch break from classes while the elderly play Petang. The Medici fountain is especially nice.

Move Over Central Park. This is Paris!Go on a beautiful weekend day and experience the joy that is Parisian living. Luxembourg Gardens could serve as the subject for impressionist painters, photo and movie shoots. Its beautiful as are the lovers, families and others who bask in the sun and enjoy the joys of living. Come early and stay late. Great fun for all of the family: FREE!

Grab a pastry and eat it here.. We stayed in the 6th arrondisement, so we ended up at the gardens a lot. It's the perfect place for photography, relaxing, reading, strolling, people-watching, and enjoying all those delicious chocolates and pastries you can purchase nearby. Plus, if you like having a local experience, this spot is not to be missed.

Beautiful even in January. Stop by a boulangerie or patisserie for breakfast, and take a walk in this park early in the morning. Even in the crisp winter air, you'll enjoy the beauty of this park, as well as how alive it is with locals. Fantastic!

Loved the special Impressionism exhibit. Thought we've strolled through the gardens on previous visits, this was our first visit to the Museum, on the recommendation of friends who took in the special exhibit in the fall. Crowded, but a lovely venue.

" … a walk in the park." Great day !. Boats sailing on the fountain "lake". Men in 'serious' games of boule. Winding tree-lined paths. Matrons feeding & talking to pigeons. The Luxembourg Palace built by Marie de Medici to imitate the Pitti Palace of her home in Florence. The monumental Medici Fountain. Lovely gardens & flowers. And even a smaller-scale replica of the Statute of Liberty, crafted by Bartholdi in 1900 for the Paris World's Fair. (Note- This is a bronze duplicate. Original replica was moved in 2012 and is now at entrance to Musee d' Orsay. )
Beautiful at 6am. Just got to Paris and ended up in the gardens at 6am with a McDonald's coffee and really enjoyed the peace and the view.
A Perfect New Year's Day. After several gray and gloomy days in Burgundy, New Year's Day in the Luxembourg Gardens was sunny and 50. Families out enjoying the park and the weather-lovely!

Lots of Statues. We were there in December and there were still many people visiting this very large garden.
