Nothing was in bloom of course, but still fun to walk around and admire the statues and the garden... and even though it was winter it was sunny and so many people were out just "sunning" themselves.There are also many joggers and people from everywhere... nice park to just walk around, but dress warm if you go in the winder.
Nice Park. Lots of local people utilizing the park. Great to see so many active people. It was nice to get a flavour of where the locals hangout.

SO WONDERFUL. what a great spot in a great location! you could spend hours here! We went in the fall and admired the flowers and turning leaves. there is so much to do! myt husband and I mostly strolled around and people watched. they have bball courts, the pond for the little boats, and shuffle board (i think thats what it's called), places for children to play and so so much more. ... a relaxing spot to enjoy Paris.
very nice place. we decided to spend some hours in this garden.it is very relaxed and very clean with a lot of green.good idea if you want to relax yourself.in summer is better.

Paradise in the middle of Paris. This has something for everyone, from the huge ornamental lake where you can hire toy sailing boats and take them for a spin, to the lovely 'ACRES' of manicured gardens in typical French style but especially for the kids playground - its really big and it's by far the best playground in Paris....especially because you can buy an ice cold beer right next to the secure, guarded and gated playground to sit and sip while you watch the kids play! This is an easy place to spend the whole day.

aug 09. HUGE park. Good stroll or jog in the middle of summer. There more than a hundred pretty sights to take in and take photos of. They had carts that sells drinks every now and then for quenching your thirst on a hot summer's day.

One Of The Best Urban Gardens In The World. We have spent many a happy afternoon in the summer and fall walking the many paths of the Luxembourg Gardens and have never been disappointed. Whether its lounging by the main fountain, or listening to a free concert at the Gazebo, the Gardens offer everyone something to cherish in their memory banks. I have particularly loved their sculpture displays done in the water, near the Gazebo (see picture). The flowers, the people, the trees, the birds, the smells of the garden all come together to make a very heady mixture for the senses and one not to be missed while in Paris.
Great garden. Love to run to this Garden and around a few times. Lots of people in the summer but still a must walk/run through!

Must visit the museum. The Musée de Luxembourg has some of the best exhibits in Paris. We visited when the Paul Durand-Ruel (art dealer) collections was there. He was an early supporter of the impressionists and his collection included Monet, Renoir, Pissarro and others. Wonderful!

Be parisian!. I used to stop by the Fontaine Medicis on my way back home whenever the weather was warm enough to enjoy the shade and the water...The Luxembourg is our Central Park (well, a very modest version): you could come here alone (reading a book, enjoying some Pierre Hermé macarons), with children to ride poneys, to sail boats, to get fun on the old carroussel... You could play chests, tennis or "pétanque" with friends, watch the seasons pass by in the fruit garden, buy local honey, or enjoy an exhibition... You could exercice and run, join the Taï Chi group on a saturday morning, grab a bite at the "buvette", or catch the last sunbeam, seatted at Le Rostand just outside the park, watching the neighbourghood celebs reading the papers...It's THE place to be in Paris, after a walk on the pantheon hights, or before going down to the Seine river by all those narrow streets in Saint Germain des Prés....

snowy morning walk!. lovely gardens to take a morning's constitutional. various structured formal and informal spots which looked beautiful in the snow. take a stroll and watch the tai chi enthusiasts execute their flows. probably even better in the spring as the winter planting was taking place so a few bare flower beds but still very lovely.

a lovely place to rest and watch. the parcs in Paris a major attraction. this does not disappoint. it is big, it is restful. grab a chair and just relax before venturing on thru the neighborhoods on all sides of the parc. it's just beautiful

I adore these gardens, such a wonderful place to go and people watch!. These gardens have everything! We took our 18 month old and she ran out all her energy and loved the place. There is a big fountain outside the senat where you can rent wooden sailboats which was so lovely. There are pony rides, a zoo, a big carousel, a wonderful playground, bees that make honey, lots of statues and fountains and gorgeous trees. You could spend al day here and bring a picnic and not spent a cent! There is also often a photography exhibition on the street around the gates of the park which is very interesting.

Painting in the Jardin. Just for fun last June, I attended a one day painting class at the Jardin du Luxembourg. What an incredible experience! Even though I am not far beyond painting stick people, the artists who taught the class were wonderful, and showed me how to mix paint and experiment with color. The Jardin was so beautiful, verdant, lots of colourful flowers, Palm trees, fountains, along with some hidden ones to discover. The restaurant under the canopy of trees was fantastic to drink coffee and for people watching. The painting class only enriched the experience of the Jardin, and allowed me to take it all in. Google "Laurie Pessemier" for contact information on the painting class. She and her husband Blair are wonderful people, fantastic painters and will encourage you to bring out your inner artist!
Underwelmed, but it was Winter. We went in January so I don't think that we could enjoy the beauty of the jardins. We could see the potential. Great to walk through on route to other locations.

Must ago again in spring time. We visited Paris in February. It was sunny and warm then, but I can surely imagine that the park would be perfect to visit in spring time. Must visit again! Remember to take your book and just sit in the sun and relax!

Breathtaking. The gardens aare breathtaking and full of activities which are refreshinh and healthy. I can't think of anyone there would be able to be in any mood but refreshed and happy. Cafés and restaurants are found around the gardens... i tried some of them and they are all so friendly. A restaurant beside brioche doree there is amazing, i loved their glasses and their service. Food was delicious too!For me it is a must go place for sure!

Only in the summer. A royal park if I've ever seen one. I love the design and size. Not to big and not too small. Unfortunately I was there in the winter, so the naked trees didn't have much to say for themselves. I'll definitely go back there in the summer.
Love it. One of my favorite places in Paris... Definetly a must see, specially in the spring........………….............,,,,,.
Nice. it was 15 degrees above zero and everything was in bloom. We really enjoyed the place despite winter

Beautiful place in the middle of a busy city. Loved Luxembourg Gardens !!! Beautiful palace and all of this in the middle of the busy St Germain des Pres. Nice for a stroll and then eat in the nearby restaurantes.
Peaceful garden . The garden is very beautiful and you can really relax here and enjoy .Young people and old age people can really enjoy here but teenagers will probably bore
a park with lovely chairs. so espacive so diverse kind of romantic quiet ambiance with students artists children family exhibitions gallery cafe

Very nice - probably would have been nicer in Summer. My husband and I strolled through Luxembourg Gardens. It was pretty quite - not a ton of people. We enjoyed looking at the statues and right before we left a band set up and started playing. It was nice sitting and people watching, but it was a little too cold to sit out too long.

A great Place for kids. Few steps from our hotel- a great play ground and a magnificent park. My 5 year old loved the play ground, there was a charge of few Euros but well worth it. On a sunny day it is a great place to sit, relax, get a coffee and pastry from the sandwich bar and just relax on the lounge chairs.

Beautiful garden. A beautiful garden and a very nice place for a picnic or for sharing a bottle of wine.
We want to go back. :)
Nice but a bit rundown. I guess in the summer this is beautiful but right now, the dead trees, cold winds, barren grass, turned-off fountains, etc. Doesn't really do anything for me.
charming, relaxing, simply beautiful. Great for a relaxing stroll, beautiful scenery and great for photographs. Doesn't cost a penny and great for a glimpse of how beautiful Paris really is.

If you miss, you'll regret forever .... The "Jardin de Luxembourg", located at Paris' busy and affluent "6éme Arrondissement", quite near famous "Boulevard de Saint-Germain" and "Boulevard Saint-Michel", may be considered the green heart of the "Quartier Latin"! Amazing gardens, manicured lawns, all extremely clean and well kept: a real wonder in our days! "Jardin du Luxembourg was created in 1612 by Queen Marie de Médicis, widow of King Henry IV and mother of King Louis XIII of France. Missing her native Italy, she decided to build herself a new palace (the "Palais de Luxembourg") in imitation of Florence's "Pitti Palace", surrounded by parks and gardens resembling those of her childhood. Queen Marie de Médicis, regent of France, probably didn't imagine the importance of her gestures for the future generations. The "Palais de Luxembourg" is still there and houses today the French Senate. The garden, covering 23 hectares, brings shade, freshness and beauty to Paris. Stroll slowly along its lawns, alleys and promenades. Enjoy each corner, each detail and pay special attention to basins and fountains (specially the fantastic "Fontaine de Médicis"). During Summer months, hundreds of students are seeing around the garden at open-air drawing classes! Really amazing! If you dare to miss a visit to this magnicent garden, I bet you will regret forever! Enjoy!

Lovely park but a bit bleak in winter. Great for a stroll and plenty of people jogging through the park. Not a lot to see in winter however the Museum du Luxembourg is on the park and this is a must see when in Paris.

Lovely!. The Luxembourg gardens are simply lovely. Beautiful green space - serene & peaceful - right in the middle of the city. Lovely plants, a nice water feature and a very relaxing & pretty place to spend a few hours. Recommended!

very beautiful and romantic. do not miss. Indeed, very beautiful and romantic gardens. You can spend a sunny day there. Enjoy the sun and have a cup of coffee in the shade of the trees. Enjoy the little kids playing around. An amazing place to relax and charge your batteries on a Sunday morning!

One of the best coins of Paris. Grab an ice cream and walk around. There is plenty of chairs and you can sit down and read a book in quite and lovely atmosphere, surrounded by trees, sculptures and little fountains. This garden is historic yet part of daily life of all parisians. You might find photos of your friend as little childs playing in the fountains with petit bateaux. It is just lovely.

Amazing formal green space in the center of Paris. Wonderful playground for kids up to about age 12 with a coffee bar! Other great things in the park: marionette theatre, pond for sailing model boats, classic metal chairs.

Unexpectedly beautiful. This was located a few minutes from our hotel, and it was the most beautiful park I have ever been in. I couldn't believe how clean it was for starters! There's something for everyone in it! Beautiful location to take some pictures. The pond in the middle of the gardens has little toy boats that you can rent, and is surrounded by a hundred little chairs. Very beautiful! Would recommend going on a nice day even for a walk. Worth seeing!

Delightful. Although we visited in January the gardens were still very pretty just in a different form. We had a gentle stroll around and took many photo opportunities we might not have had had it been teeming with tourists. It appeared to be a spot where the locals came to relax and feel apart from the city for just a few moments. In the warmer months I imagine it's busier but that it would be a perfect spot to enjoy a picnic.

Historical king Garden !. This garden is an historical place which are famous, many kings an aristocratic and writers were there ! It'a a beautifull garden, always full of people, french and tourism..closed to there, there is a very famous place the pantheon..should see !
Very Pretty and relaxing. We brought some wine ans snacks and just hung out for a few hours. Very relaxing and beautiful park setting. Free to walk in.
Awesome!!!. It's more than I expected. A beautiful dreamy place It seem as if you're in a movie. Totally Worth it seeing....

A smallish park - nice for a stroll but not spectacular. A smallish park (compared to the Jardin de Plantes or Tuileries) in Paris. Pleasant for a short walk. Luxembourg Palace (modest size) is found here but we did not visit the inside. All in all, a good place for a stroll and a spot of people watching while eating a French baguette!
Go to watch the locals. Beautiful gardens with historic fountain. Go to sit and watch Paisiennes watch the world go by in the early evening sun.
Garden Paradise. The plants in this garden! Even the potted mums were spectacular. Loved the water features...don't miss LG!

Wonderful respite from the hubbub of city living. Any day is a good day to visit but A walk in the gardens on Sunday with Parisians is a treat, especially when the sun shines and the wind blows. Soak up the weak winter sunshine in a deck chair around the lake or walk the gardens length and read the story.
Beautiful. Just to walk around the grounds and take in the sights and sit and relax , I Loved all of it !! I can't wait to go back !!

Peaceful Place. An expansive park and a great place to escape the busyness of the city. If you doing a quick trip, not a must. But if you are looking for decompressing after a few days of hectic touring, this is a great place to people watch and reconnect with nature.

Not as great during winter. We went in december and although there weren't flowers and colors as in spring/summer we enjoyed our time here. There were many kids playing and staring at the water and people just relaxing talking or eating something in one of the benches there.
Wonderful. One of the most interesting points in Paris. A wonderfully kept garden, one of the nicest in the world. Nice palace and fountains. Wonderful neighbourhood. Not to miss.

A nice place to stroll. These gardens are full of families, couples and tourists - but you will not feel crowded or jostled. There is plenty of room for everyone to enjoy walking the pathways or stopping to watch a bocci ball game. A fun place to spend some down time when in Paris.

Quite place!!. Huge gardens, very quiet and relaxing place!!!.."..............................
........................... Just go!!

Great playground. We were in Paris for 12 days over the Christmas holidays with our 5 and 8 year old granddaughters. The playground at the gardens was a great energy outlet for both girls and they especially enjoyed the Zipline.

A great way to begin and end your days in Paris. I fell in love with the Luxembourg Gardens in Paris.Each day we would begin and end our Paris explorations here and join the great celebration of humanity enjoying French landscape formality and colour at the height of spring.It difficult to miss the Luxemourg gardens, as they are enroute to the Louvre and Arc d'Triumphe and contain Musee L'Orangerie.We discovered Paul's mobile boulangerie and also tried the restaurant in the gardens midst and joined the Parisiennes enjoying a break around the fountain and exploring the amazing aray of sculptures and hidden spots that crowd the garden's perimeter.Enjoy!
Absolutely gorgeous!. A delight for the eyes! From the moment you enter, you relax completely and not stop to marvel at the color and beauty of the gardens arrangements.

LUNCH IN THE GARDENS. We went to a lovely Greek deli bought some goodies then some wine some bread and went and had lunch in the gardens an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Paris what a wonderful day the sun was out nice and warm gardens looked amazing my wife and kids had a wonderful time

A Perfect Place to Relax or Stroll. This beautiful park makes an excellent spot for resting along your path through Paris. The location makes it a great break either on your way to or from the Pantheon and Sorbonne. Do not miss this lovely place. To this end, the park is open until one hour from sunset at which point the guards turn into shepherds and herd you to the gate with their whistles.
Stunning. I liked the lake and many birds, namely seagulls, pigeons, ducks, swans. Also, there are nice palace and monuments of famous French rulers.

Perfectly Peaceful. The gardens are stunningly beautiful. It is the perfect place to take a pastry (or 2) and sit and people watch. There are lots of seats even though sitting on the grass is not allowed. My favourite spot was the Medici Fountain. Conveniently there is an ice cream vendor outside one of the gates. A lovely part of Paris to spend and hour or two.

Napoleon's Hideaway. Beautiful park and enjoyable anytime of year. The grounds are incredibly pristine and the gardens and landscaping were well kept and flourished. Great for a run or people watching. There are also ping pong tables and chess matches throughout the park and kids will have a blast.

Decent Location for A Family Picnic. We visited this garden in the winter on a sunny day. It was a pleasant garden with benches to sit and eat at. We enjoyed watching the kids run after pigeons and enjoyed the view of the palace there. The rocks in the paths do get dirty and cause our children to trip and fall. Not saying the path was poorly made, but that was a small concern for us with small (under 3) children.
would love to see in Spring or Summer. visited in March. was hoping for pansies evergreens or something in the beds and vases. The gardens looked neglected.
Gorgeous. Gorgeous views. Even in a December winter this area deserves a visit. Great choice for a walk in a sunny winter day (Yes it happens)
Very nice. We went to Teatre du Luxemburg and we and our children loved work of puppets "the three pigs". There is a huge kindergarden close to the theater, you need to pay but it's good.

Beautiful place for a stroll. We visited Luxembourg Gardens on a clear, cold December day. Even in their bare winter state the gardens are lovely and a nice place for a leisurely stroll. Sit on a bench and take in the view or people watch. A nice respite from sightseeing and museums.
lovely. the gardens are perfect for an afternoon stroll. Lovely fountains, landscaping, fields, ect perfect for a croissant, a book, and a nap

Tranquility in the City. A very peaceful, large park in the city. Enjoy a stroll among the trees or sit around the large pond and relax in the sun. Great place to bring a book to relax and read or to sit with your guide book to decide where to go next. In the 6th.

One of my favourite places in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are said to be the most popular park in Paris and I can understand why.
It is a very peaceful place, representing a gathering point for a lot of Parisians and tourists.
You simply cannot not love it!

Tranquil paradise in the middle of Paris. What an amazing place - certainly one of my favourite places to visit when I am in Paris. Spacious and well kept, beautiful gardens with interesting statues and a wonderful park for the children to play in. The central water feature is one of the biggest delights of the garden and on a summers day it is great to watch the little boats being sailed across the pond. It is worth taking the time to visit - take some time out from the hustle and bustle of Paris!

Excellent idea for a lovely walk on a sunny day, if you are lucky!. We were so lucky to have a few sunny days during February, so we thought it would be a very good idea to enjoy a walk there. Best place to do so. Lovely surroundings, beautiful nature, colours and animals, unbelievable beauty, very well kept gardens. Highly recommended.

Peaceful relaxation. We chilled for the day in the Gardens and drank beer at an outdoor café under the trees. For those with little time and on the go, this is a highly recommended stop to relax and people watch!

Doing what Parisians do. Parisians love their public gardens. They know how to relax and enjoy. Watching young children sail their boats in the large pond was fun. Hearing a girls band playing with enthusiasm was amusing. Take the time to stroll these gardens.

Sometimes Overlooked but Worth the Visit!!. My favorite park in all of Paris but not always well-known. This is where the Parisians hang out especially on a Sunday afternoon. Enjoy watching the children sail their boats in the lake and stroll around leisurely or bring a good book. There is a beautiful fountain sculptured by Medicis that is not well-known. Came with our teenage boys and made them find the Statue of Liberty replica--there are actually 4 located in the city of Paris. You can play boules near the western exit or just watch the locals. Amazing ice cream (gelato) that you must sample is sold near the gates by the rue de Vaugirard. You can definitely get a peaceful, relaxing feeling of Paris--away from the bustle and hustle--in this park!

Relaxing park. The Gardens of Luxembourg Palais are beautiful and I would have loved to have seen it in summer. it is a great place to sit with family, a baguette, some wine and cheese and just enjoy the tranquility.

I could not ask for more. I had the luck to visit it on a sunny automn afternoon and it was just perfect.Altought it was full of playing children - it was not difficult to relax. There were plenty chairs to sit and read a book or to plan your evening. The flowers, the wery well kept loan, the fountains and the smiling faces invite you to stay longer.Do not miss this place if you visit Paris. Alone or with friends.

So Parisian and Romantic. This Garden is a very peaceful place in the center of parís. You can have a walk when the weather is nice, ther,s the Palais du Luxembourg and some Tennis Ground which is funny to see.
The garden is so French, so typical.

Beautiful park in the city center. Perfect place to take a break after exhausting museum visits.Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. The place is not too crowded and is very clean and well looked after. There are plenty of chairs all around the fountain for you to just sit around, relax and maybe have a snack or some coffee. Garden is very well groomed and is just pleasure to look at. And your hotel is nearby, then you should definitely go jogging there!It is a much needed change from indoor sightseeing in Paris, which often requires queuing up and long hours of waiting. Whereas here you can enjoy fresh air.
Worth visiting. Lovely garden worth a visit! Many free chairs make that u can be comfortable everywhere in the park.

it is not impressive in december. the famed garden has high rise iron fencing and almost bland in December !!probably in summer months,it is a blooming and excellent garden in Paris.same is with jardin des tuileries.so all these similar gardens are basically half gardens.but by hype, location and history, these are great gardens.but no doubt.it is excellent in layout,safety and security.perfectly enjoyable.

Tranquility, an occasional concert, and beautiful surroundings.... The Luxembourg Gardens is wonderfully situated behind the French Senate, a glorious in-town chateau. In spring and summer, everything is blooming. Even when temperatures drop, children have their pond yachts in the reflecting pools. Out-of-town musical groups often provide spontaneous concerts. There are chairs everywhere for people watching, quiet time, and reading your favorite book. Often there is a photo display on the iron fence just up from the Odeon. This is quintessential Paris, and free. The Luxembourg Palace was also Nazi headquarters during WW2 and a prison during the French Revolution (1793). The Senate is not open to the public (except by special arrangement, I think), but there is a Museum to explore (with moderate charge). This a great place for walkers, readers, flaneurs, and people of any age.

Stunning. Even though we were here early November, the gardens were still beautiful and worthy of a stroll around to take in all the beauty. Even a take-away coffee sitting in the gardens is a great way to enjoy this wonderful area.

Beautiful Gardens. Peaceful, tranquil gardens beautifully maintained and obviously loved by the Parisians. The gardens have chairs where people can sit and relax and enjoy the beauty of the place. We saw school groups doing their daily exercise and sport. The sculptures are amazing. Definitely worth the visit.
Pretty but not worth spending too much time in them. These gardens are beautiful and well groomed, but you shouldn't spend too much time on them. You should spend time at Rodin's Museum.
Gardens and Gallery. Great place near Pantheon to wander and relax. Much like a mini-Central Park for Paris. Art gallery in former Palace du Luxembourge orangerie is well worth a visit.

One of Paris's main parks - worth a stroll. The gardens of the Palace of Luxembourg are now open to the public as a park. The palace itself, which dominates the park , is now the French Senate. The park has fountains and trees, grassland and gravel paths. It's definitely worth seeing if you are nearby
Amazing. This is AMA amazing experience. It's free to access and is without doubt an amazing place to visit. It gets busy. I would advise paying to go upstairs. True architecture.

Tranquil yet vibrant. Everything that is French. That is how I would describe Luxembourg Gardens. A beautiful, well enjoyed park in the middle of the city. Many statues, beautiful ponds and fountains, shaded areas and groomed walking paths. I marveled at the abundance of garden chairs throughout the park--you could move them about, to take best advantage of the sun or shade. Great for picnics, lounging, games of chess and boules, or grabbing an afternoon nap. Lots of families enjoying sailing boats on the large pond in the main garden. But do observe the 'Keep off the Grass' signs or you'll be told to move immediately.
Beautiful. We had a lovely stroll through the park with our family even on a chilly day. Great place to relax or go for a run.
Beautiful gardens. Lovely gardens. Very expansive with plenty of places to sit when required. Museum on site (charge to enter). Visitors can watch the locals playing Boules, exciting!

Beautiful & worth a visit. Majestic & beautiful gardens that invite you to sit with a good book. Plenty of space to stroll & soak up the Parisian summer. Easy to get to by public bus/ train or walking.

Catch the Winter Light. On a beautiful winter day, a walk through the gardens is perfect. The location, south of the Seine, introduced me to a new neighborhood. I enjoyed the gravel paths and the interesting tree lines.

Great place for a picnic. We did not tour the building but the grounds are gorgeous, a great place to people watch and have a picnic so bring a sandwich and bottle of wine. If the weather is nice sit on the grass with the locals. Public restrooms were clean with contract attendant that charges 1/2 Euro. We walked about 3 km from the Latin District with lots of window shopping along the route.
Beautifull. Luckily, the day I've there, it was sunny. The garden looked marvelous. I really liked them. There was many local people doing exercises, running bicycles... The place is really friendly

Watch out for the closing times!. It looks beautiful! But 2 minutes after we got in, the "garden keepers" didn't let anyone in anymore and started whistling for people to get out.. cause the garden was about to close. So the exact time when they close... 1 hour before sunset :(
Lovely!!. Wish I had more time to wander...it was a beautiful day but our time was limited. A quite peaceful respite off very busy streets!

Beautiful, relaxing walk through the park. Even in the winter the gardens are beautiful. Flowers blooming in many areas even though it was December. Also fountains and statues to be enjoyed as you casually stroll through the park including a small Statue of Liberty near one of the gates. Park also has a cafe. the French Senate also occupies a former Palace. A relaxingmake unique experience. Nice place to escape the crowds of Paris.

Nice place to chill out, take a picnic in summer!. This is a really nice park, with a mixture of mature trees and grass, with some flower beds around the edges. The gardens were originally the palace gardens, for the palace which is now the French Senate building.There are chess boards in one area of the park, next to tennis courts, other ball game courts and petanque areas. Pony rides available in another part of the park during the warmer months. There are normally small kiosks selling snacks and drinks, and a permanent cafe installed in the park. There are bathrooms open during business hours, with a 0.20E charge.This park is a great place to bring a picnic during the summer, and many Parisians and visitors to the city will do the same. It's nice to watch the little boats sailing on the fountain pond in the centre of the park, and a good place to go running as well, you will be in good company!
Good place with kids. Our kids enjoyed very much in playground, İf we go to Paris we will definetely visit again ,green and the museum were perfect
Very relaxing atmosphere . It is an ideal place for a picnic under the sun beside the lake with flowers, birds... That's fir sunmertime but I'm not sure about winter. Might be cold out there!
Real Paris. So fun to watch the kids sail boats and the Paris people stroll...A great place for a picnic and to relax.

Gorgeous but bring your Euros. Kids and adults alike love Luxemberg Gardens. If you come in the summer months, bring plenty of water, cover yourself in sunscreen, hats, sunglasses as there is barely any shade in the area where you sail the boats, this is a fabulous place for he kids but bring plenty of cash. You pay to race the boats, you pat 4 euros to go on the swings, there are go carts and other activities, it's a lot of walking and the sandy pebbles are hard to push strollers on. Try to come before the best of the day sets in.
Wonderful. Where we always return and orient ourselves in Paris. The grounds and the lake are beautiful and restful.

Fall Gardens. Much of the greenery was brown lacking the beauty of spring or summer seasons however, you could see during the fall what beauty the gardens hold when you're walking and strolling them during warmer seasons when blooms and blossoms are apparent. Definitely worth a return trip in the spring or summer season.
famous - nooks and crannies to explore. some big great buildings where sometimes exhibits are shown, and lots of walkways next to museum of luxembourg where there are always shows to see = go!!

A walk in the park. Beatiful gardens surrounding Luxenbourg Palace - Great for a sunday stroll where you can wander around the gardens and lake passing by the many beatiful statues that are dotted around the gardens.

Beautiful Gardens/Space in Paris. Another gem to see. We went in December but it must be outstanding in Spring or Summer. Lovely play ground for the children to play in, clean and superior amusements.

Would be much nicer in summer. I wasn't that impressed with Luxembourg Gardens - but I visited in December! I imagine it would be beautiful in spring and summer. It's very peaceful, and there's a nice skyline view to take in. Ideal for a picnic, or a jog if you're staying nearby.

Nice Pleasant Lunch Spot. If you like going to the local bakeries and small grocery stores, then buy yourself a pick nick lunch and go the Luxembourg Gardens. Locals come here to have lunch all the time and the gardens are large enough to have a nice wander around looking at great flowers and lots of statues.
Relaxing stroll. This is a lovely garden to stroll through. Quite green for a Parisian Park. It was ab risk cold December day so i can't wait to visit in the summer. I imagine it will be idyllic.

Just the gardens are free. If you just want to walk through the outside for whatever reason (like us), it's free. I bet it's amazing in the spring/summer/fall. On this winter day, it was at least sunny and peaceful. Lots of open space.Tip: rather than waiting at this Angelina's attached to the building here, head to Porte maillot just past the arc de triumphe. There is a smaller one inside the station upstairs which has nearly no wait at 11am-noon.

Beautiful park. The weather was cold, rainy, and miserable but the park is beautiful. We bundled up and strolled through looking at the statues and fountains. Had the weather been better it would have been the perfect place to enjoy a warm baguette while sitting on a bench. I'm sure in Spring and Summer the view is amazing.

really amazing victorian like park. I've visited the Luxembourg Gardens in December and luckily the weather was good, no rain, little sunshine and barely any people. From what I saw in different pictures, during the summer it seems packed and you wouldn't be able to fully appreciate it's beauty. It was an amazing visit and loved staying there to relax after some visiting through the city.Follow the garden exit up until the street roundabout for nice buildings and small parks along the way.
Lovely place to relax. The Luxembourg Gardens are a lovely place to relax, grab some chairs there, take a snack and just relax and unwind.

Paradise in the city. I always got to this par in Paris....I take all my overseas friends here....in spring the gardens are so beautiful....the people are all out and you forget you are in a big city...you can sit and watch the people go by

Awesome place for kids - who doesn't love sailing and a zip line at the playground!. We went for a museum break but had more fun than we thought.The boat rental was so much fun. My daughter spent ages running around chasing an poking her boat. It was hard to pull her away but the playground did it...The very large playground was a big hit. She played with lots of kids and loved the zipline.Even she thought the very dirty looking pony rides were sad - no appeal to that or the merry-go-round.

Great for kids but get there early.... We were there in December so no one was renting boats to float. My kids still loved watching the remote control boats and the sail boats some kids had. My kids also loved the park but just know that there is a fee and it closes rather early. While we were there it closed at 4 pm. If you want to feed the birds bring some bread!!

calm and life. A lovely place to go and sit, with a book, or just to look at the flowers, the water, the senat, the statues, and people - children playing, joggers, tai chi practitioners - and relax. When the sun is out, it is magnificient; when the sun is not out the expanse and colours and air are still restful after a walk through the Latin Quartier
one of the most beautiful parks. This is one of the most beautiful parks. There are mostly local people. It has several playgrounds and a beautiful castle inside. The park closes in the evening
Specially during summer. Going to Paris and not making a "pic-nique" with french wine and baguette sandwiches is like not going!

The Gardens!. This is a very big Garden that is obviously popular among Parisians as it was heavily congested the day I went. This park could be very relaxing in the early hours of the morning when it's not as crowded. A perfect place to walk, read a book or just meditate. You got to get there early though, as they day goes on, the crowd grows and grows. Definitely a nice place to visit nonetheless for someone stopping through Paris!

20 Women and Atget. A beautiful garden, well kept, substantial and the home of beautiful statues, (20), of famous women who etched the history of France. A very famous French photographer named Atget illustrated these scenes in sepia and black/white fiber based paper in the late 1800's and early 1900's. A visit here is a step back in time. Serene, yet spectacular. Don't miss this one.
Good even in the winter. I went there in december so the nature was not at its finest but it still worthed it! Very nice fountains and buildings, also saw some guarda with the horses! Don't miss it!

Amazing history. Liked knowing how was the lifestyle of the kings and queens of that era...the history of the gardens, the statues, the games playing there chess, ping pong, tennis, "bolos", the flowers...

Morning Stroll. Along the way to the Pantheon, the Jardin du Luxembourg is a beautiful, smaller garden that is calming and relaxing. There were no annoying, pick-pocketing, partitioning girls to annoy us. The garden is not hard to find and is perfect for a nice stroll amidst a busy sightseeing schedule.

Beautiful Gardens. Staying near Montparnasse it was an easy walk to these spectacular gardens. We entered the gardens to school children doing running races, what a lovely sight. Walked a little further and there were tennis courts, sat and watched for a while. Plenty of seating. We hadn't even made it to the Palace. We walked into the centre of the gardens to see the Palace, what a place to sit, relax and watch the world go by. We easily spent two hours here just wandering, sitting, watching and soaking up the gardens.This is a special part of Paris that has to be enjoyed by anyone who visits this beautiful city.

A stroll in the park. If you're tired and want to rest and want to people watch, head over to luxembourg gardens and pull up a chair and put your feet up. You can stay right next to the fountains or under the shade of the trees if it's too hot. But be warned, you might fall asleep like i did!

Lovely garden on a nice day. If you go to Paris you should visit here. The garden is a lovely location to walk around and see some great colours from the flowers which are kept nice and tidy. The manor house is good to look at as well as walking around the water feature in the center. 100% bring a picnic and sit down, it is very relaxing and a nice thing to do in Paris, especially here.
Pretty gardens. We were their in winter so it was a little bear but the grand sweep of the landscaping and the classical sculpture made up for it.
Lovely Tranquil Garden walks.. Lovely tree lined avenues and scenery. Peaceful away from the maddening crowds of Paris. Definitely worth a visit.

A beautiful garden to jog in the morning!. Lots of people jog here in the morning. My hotel was near it so I took the opportunity to run in the morning and was surprised that the place was lively. Lots of people doing their early morning walk. Nice place to take pictures!

Wonderful Day Spent in the Gardens.. We spent our first day in Paris at the Luxembourg Gardens after traveling for 12 hours the day before. It was exactly what my family needed! From the sailboats, to a race course, to pony rides, paths to walk, and a fantastic playground it was perfect. We did the marionette show- but will probably skip it on our next visit.
Pure Romance!. Buy a bottle of wine, cheese and a baguette...sit in the park under a tree and take it all in. Best park in Paris.

Great park to relax and feed the birds. I really enjoying going to this park and stroll around or relax in the shade of the trees. It is a good idea to bring some bread to feed the birds in the fountains/lakes
Greenery picnic spot. Water grass benches and much more to enjoy. Check out the closure time as I had to leave only 45 minutes after arriving.
Great place to go on a day with good weather. If you want a place to relax and see the gardens its a good place to go when the weather is good. We enjoyed it and there is a lot of ground to cover

Nicer in summer.... I'm sure it is beautiful when the flowers are in bloom and the trees are leafy green. While the grounds are undeniably gorgeous any time of year, in winter it didn't have the 'wow' effect I imagine it to have in summer.

Beautiful, relaxing. This is a large park in the center of Paris - a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of urban life. We enjoyed walking through the park to appreciate the outdoors. Even in mid-september, the gardens were well-tended and beautiful.

Love these gardens!. Watching Parisian life 1st hand, wonderful park no matter what time of tear, Sunday's give a warm glow when all of the families are crowded in. Love the park attendants blowing their whistles at 4.15pm on a winters day to let you know the park us closing. Boules, ice cream, chestnuts, carousels, tennis or just sitting by the fountain watching the play boats. Wonderful!

Beautiful Gardens. Always worth a visit, at all times of year. A real oasis in a delightful area of the city. There are cafes, a very interesting collection of apple and pear tree varieties, and of course the Senate building - previpusly a royal palace - surrounded by wonderful (in most cases!) statues.
wow`. what a beautiful place!! its like a royal garden!! so nice and clean, full of sculptures and flowers!! must visit

Beautiful any time of year. This is my favorite garden in Paris. I have been there throughout the year and though the gardens are mostly "put to bed" in winter, it's still a peaceful place to wander. Other times, the flowers and shurbs are beautiful, as are the fountains. Kids sail toy boats in a large pond. There are beautiful sculptures, lots of hidden benches for picnic lunchs, joggers, tourists, students, and families. Great location,easy to get to by the metro.

a paris treasure. i am not sure who laid out the grounds, but it was a brilliant move. the gardens are gorgeous, it provides a great way to talk through paris without using sidewalks and on a lovely day a wonderful way to sit and enjoy
Must See. This is a must see while in Paris. I was doubtful about walking the distance to see this but it was so worth it. Just beautiful. Bring a coffee, snack, sit back and people watch.

GORGEOUS. We went to the Luxembourg Gardens twice during our stay in paris. The second time we visited we brought with us the makings of a picnic and spent the afternoon soaking in the beauty of the gardens and people watching. So Parisian.

The most beautiful garden. We went in the summer and it was beautiful, we walked from taking the water bus and it wasn't very far from that point maybe a 15 20 minute walk and we got to see the city while we were walking. There are so many flowers and fountainsp, it's great for taking pictures,
Good gardens!. Beautiful Gardens and a good variety of things of interest to look at. Useful places for a cup of tea! Handy for nearby museum.
Beautiful Gardens. I always take a walk through these gardens when visiting Paris. Always something different to see and a great place to sit on a garden bench and people watch.

A lovely walk. Really lovely well tended gardens, worth cutting through on your way to other attractions. It did seem quite busy so maybe not something I would count on getting a bench (but you could always bring a blanket)

Still Beautiful in December. 100% classic French tradition! Beautiful lines, well groomed and perfectly laid out. Granted we visited in December so the flowers were not in bloom and it was still amazing! My wife said she had to do a morning run through the gardens. Just breath-taking.

Fantastic for kids. This is a beautiful place in all seasons. I imagine it's especially gorgeous when all flowers are in bloom. Find a chair and relax...or send the kids to the Playground located in the southwest corner of the park. I think you pay a couple of euros for each child to enter, but it has one of the best zip line equipment ever. Our kids 5-11 year olds had a lot of fun.
Nice place to Relax. This is one of the most beautiful gardens in Paris.. Is a great place to relax and If you like to run.. Is nice to go for a run around the gardens.

A daytime oasis. If you are looking for an oasis of tranquillity on the south bank of Paris and like sculpture and formal gardens, this will be of interest. We lodged near the gardens during early winter and the leaves were mostly off the trees, but it was always a pleasure to stroll through them. Especially enjoyable is the long vista South from around the pond in front of the Musee. The gardens are closed at night and you wouldn't want to go in them anyway, as they are unlit.

A favourite. My wife and I love this park out of all the parks in central Paris. To see the Parisians go about their recreation and enjoy the trees, statues and formal gardens. It has some much of a mix. We have been in many seasons and it never fails to delight and create some relaxation from a busy Paris schedule.

very formal. for me, it is too stiff. i was a student just near it and the Luxembourg was a nice place to hang out after courses. still if you come from the boulevard St michel, it is a place to see as it is very beautiful in its formal category.
Beautiful. Lovely even in winter. Nice place to sit and relax and for having a picnic. It's magical place and you can take excelent pictures there.

Gorgeous. Such a great place to walk around, grab some food or a coffee, and sit and relax. The Senate building is situated in the center of the Gardens and several benches, tables, and paths are available for those to relax or take a stroll. We were here in the fall and loved the foliage and flowers that were still in bloom. Highly recommend stopping here for a bit to relax from the craziness of Paris!
Down from Pantheon. Nice for a promenade, formal planting, esplanades tree avenues, and tennis courts , good shade in summer

Peaceful. This is a lovely area to stretch ones legs and get away from traffic and the buzz of big city life. I enjoyed watching children play soccer, folks playing bocce ball and joining Parisian folks while they enjoyed a beautiful day in the park. At the entrance to the Luxembourg Gardens is the the Musee du Luxembourg.

Beautiful Experience. It was just lovely to walk around and have your own picnic at the gardens with your own snacks and favorite cheese from the local shops around the area. Had a wonderful time walking around the beautiful garden. The air is just filled with so much romance, happiness and joy.
is this an office?. closed at 5pm??? surprised to see the guards whistling at 5pm... funny that people try to explain that they cross the park for a short way to the metro station...
Tranquil. Lots of students as the university is next door, good to see how the Parisians spend a quiet afternoon.
beautiful promenade. Recently, there is in the LUxembourg´s Museum une exposition of impresionist pictures very profitable. And the promenade in the park, with the autumn colors is unforgettable.

This place feels like Paris!. Beautiful paths, lovely architecture, great people watching. The Luxembourg Gardens is the perfect place to head for a picque-nique after stopping at one of the near-by boulangerie and charcuterie.

Absolute Favorite Parisian Spot. Nothing in Paris compares to the tranquility of this parc. The main gardens are superb, but the Medici Fountain built in 1630 is unique. It is a shaded oasis of magnificent sculptures with heart shaped greenery. It resoreth one's soul.

Great place to sit and enjoy the scenery or go for a run. Living in Paris this is one of my favorite places to sit and read or go for a run and view the gardens in its full glory. In the summers a man lets families rent sails for a time period to sail in the middle large fountain.

Not at its best. The fountain in the middle of the park smelled a little bit off, building work had begun on the gardens, fountains were off. There's a lovely fountain towards the side of the garden closest to the metro you must see. The avenues of trees were well maintained. In the spring/summer it must look beautiful.

Beautiful in Fall. We stayed in a hotel two blocks away from the gardens and had the opportunity to walk through the gardens every morning. It was just beautiful to see all the changing colors in the Fall and walking past the museum and the pond seeing all of the children playing with the boats was a great view.

A lovely place to stroll through. It was interesting to see the Parisian locals on a Sunday afternoon. Lots of families, sports, joggers and others spending some time outside. Lovely gardens and atmosphere, a nice place to relax for a bit.

Great children's playground. A wonderful park to stroll around, even in winter. Pull up one of the chairs around the 'lake' in the middle of the gardens, soak up the winter sun and watch the parade of varied people. For us though (incl kids aged 10, 8 and 4), the highlight was the excellent children's playground - all kinds of activities, including climbing equipment, slides, a great zipline, and separated between the younger and older children. Kept our kids fascinated and active for hours - a great break from the more adult-directed activities and an easy stroll back to the Latin Quarter for a late lunch. Great way to spend a winters morning with the kids. Note that there is a small fee for entry to the playground - 2.50 euro per child and 1.20 per adult.
Dry but still beautiful. I can only image what this place looks like in the summer. It was beautiful even without the lush green .
Winter time. Gorgeous scenery even in winter!!Was lovely to see joggers and people playing tennis etc!Would have loved to see this garden in summer time!

What a great place to rest in the sunshine in Paris. I loved the afternoon at the gardens; just to sit in the sun and read and chat. I love the wide open space, tennis courts (I didn't know about them or would have planned on playing:)Just a great place to hang out in Paris!

Heart of South bank of Seine. Very nice place to walk in the middle of the day if you came to Paris for long everyday walking around the city. Good place to rest, to sit undisturbed in beautiful place with flowers (all times of the year), statues, view on Luxembourg palace. For those who seek beauty and wide open spaces and stillness in the middle of Paris fuss.

the most refined Parisian garden. The gardens are very large, with a variety of trees and plants and a very well planned layout.One can sit on the grass or on banches; one can play tennis.The location on the top of the Latin Quarter is also excellent.

Memorable. If you are visiting Paris during good weather and on a Sunday - this is a must stop. I guess even if it is not Sunday. But Sundays brought the children to play with toy sail boats and people sitting reading a book just letting time go by. The manicured landscape and magnificent architecture makes for the perfect backdrop with energetic runners passing by the side trails. It was one of my favorite stops in Paris. One of the most memorable.

Relaxe. Usually the Parisan gardens obey to the strict rules: you walsk around following cuple of pathes but you don't sit on the green. Here is different. The green grass is accessible to everyone - in some parts. Each part of the garden offers something different. There is children corner, chess corner, tennis corner, big pool with a small fountain, a museum (Musee du Luxembourg) and The Senat in a XVIIth century palace. And of course "original"of the Statue of Liberty (human size)
Stumbled across it. Lovely environment must be even more spectacular in the growing season a must visit though any time of year.
Lovely day out. This is nice to walk through after the pentathalon and is free.Easy to find, lovely area, good for kids
Beautiful garden!. It's a beautiful place to walk around and have a pic nic! Very nice and pleasent. A must do when in Paris, I fully recommend!

It's really the Parisians' place. Parisians love their parks. Here one sees people lounging on benches, watching kids and adults sail boats in the pond. But there's more: an urban "forest" with trees, kids' play areas, even a sand box garden. Fun to watch Parisians enjoying their own.

Lovely gardens. Come here, particularly in the proverbial spring. Bring a picnic, a baguette and some delicious cheese. No need for expensive restaurants. Just soak up the Parisien atmosphere. Superbe !

A wonderful Sunday stroll. We decided to wander around to see these gardens on a cool but dry Sunday afternoon.They are magnificent despite most flowers and foliage gone due to season.Possibly the nicest part was seeing how much it us used by the locals - old people reading their papers, young lovers, many families with kids and miniature boats sailing on the pond!A joy to see.Although you cannot go into the building itself (how wonderful it's still being used!!) they are truly beautiful and so well maintained. Young gendarmes guard the place well.

Slow down and soak it up. Paris has so many sights to visit that it is easy to exhaust oneself trying to get around all the main ones. Well, maybe the Luxembourg Gardens are not among the traditional 'main ones', but, if you need a break from haring around, this is a good place to do it. Just give yourself an hour or two's rest in these gardens and you'll be ready to get back on the tourist treadmill, revived and refreshed. When I first visited these gardens in the 1970s I was disappointed. They did not appear to be well looked after, with their patchy lawns, lack of flower beds and abundance of dog poo. Revisiting in 2012 I was very pleasantly surprised, with all the above problems rectified, and in 2014 I found myself going there four or five times during my 10 week stay in Paris (for work). The highlight this year was seeing the interior of the Luxembourg Palace, at the north end of the Gardens. It is a beautiful former royal palace which now houses the Senate (the French equivalent of Britain's House of Lords). Its Conference Hall, which overlooks the gardens, is simply magnificent, with superbly preserved tapestries, painted ceilings and the throne that Napoleon used to sit on. It isn't open often, but is well worth the visit if you find a day when it is. It opens to the public on the "Journees du Patrimoine" (Heritage Days) which happen during one weekend in September each year. They also open the palace greenhouses with their rare orchids (again not usually open to the public). The Gardens' focal point is the Octagonal Pond with its toy sailing yachts which can be hired, great fun for your kids, but the Gardens contain other points of interest. It's a very relaxing place to stroll around, and has lots of tree shade, should you find yourself there on a hot day. Oh, and it has many hundreds of chairs to sit on, should you wish to really relax, or people-watch. When you're ready to resume your 'serious' tourism, the Gardens are very close to the Pantheon, the Latin Quarter and the church of Saint-Sulpice. These Gardens do not charge for entry, and are a welcome, tranquil haven if you have enough time in your schedule.

Jardin du Luxembourg, a time travelling space. Ordered by Marie de Medicis in 1612, to surround her palace, Luxembourg gardens design have been restored under the first Empire area. It is now owned by the French Senate based in Luxembourg Palace. Its a perfectly placed spot to have a break while touring in Paris, up the hill next to Notre Dame Cathedral and below the Pantheon. I go there almost every Sunday morning from 10 AM to 1 PM to practice RC sailing boat within an informal club of hobbyists. During summertime, little sailing models (not radio controlled) are for rent to enjoy kids and make them having some fun around the fountain while parents are in need of time to relax. Many chairs are available, some more comfortable than other, would you find the one that fits you the best? It's a nice place to meditate on where your are, where you come from and where you go. With the Actual Senate Palace next to you, and those little sloop sailing yacht in the basin, you might drift backward in time and see little kids in old fashioned clothes, or the Duchess Marie looking at you from the Palace windows. Once recovered from your resting time, you may have a few walk down to the gardens and enjoy the techniques of cultivating fruit trees or just have fun under big ornamental ones. It is true that many joggers uses the park to improve their pace, but they are just turning around the park, once inside, you'll see them only on your way to quit the place. Then it's you choice: go up East to the Pantheon, down North to the old center to Notre-Dame or South to reach Montparnasse or West (North west) to have a walk form there to the Hotel des Invalides (passing close to Hotel Matignon). This last option is a long walk but will make you see some really nice architecture all along the way.

the kind of parisian garden to drink a red wine with your lover. the gardens are huge, coloured and so bohemian; I find this place perfect for a wine in two accompanied by a delicious parisian chocolate cake;

Lovely place to relax. The gardens are large and have that French charm of formality mixed with sculpture, a beautiful palace, fountains, and reflecting pools with people sailing miniature sail boats and fabulous flowers. I have been several times and loved it every time. Lots of seating for catching the sun, reading and relaxing.

A beautiful spot to take in Paris!. On a nice day, you can sit in the gardens just about anywhere and enjoy people-watching and some warm crepes from a street vendor. The fountains offer dozens of chairs, so grab a seat!

So peaceful, so beautiful. I was on my way to a special Impressionist exhibit at the Musee du Luxembourg -- when I noticed a garden next to the museum! I had seen the garden on the city map, of course, but had no idea how expansive it was, or how beautiful.There were so many joggers running on the footpath, you had to be a little careful about traffic.It was a sunny day, but quite cool. Even in mid-November, the trees and flowers were still beautiful. There were a number of people reading newspapers, reading books, soaking up the sunshine ...So I did as the Parisians do: opened my bag and pulled out some bread, fruit and cheese; sat in the sunshine, and people-watched. It was rejuvenating, and refreshing to my soul.A little later, I walked around and admired the many statues, and took lots of photos. When I felt sufficiently relaxed and refreshed, I made my way back to the museum ... and am happy to say I enjoyed the exhibit with more focus and energy than I might otherwise have had!

Fabulous place to rest and have a bit of a picnic lunch. Absolutely beautiful place. We stayed in Paris for a month and spend several afternoons here reading. You can't walk on the grass in most areas, but there are lots of chairs on the paths and it's peaceful and good people-watching. Little shops in the neighborhood where we picked up coffee and pastries on the way. I don't see this as a place to come look at, but to hang out in if you have the time.

Beautiful spot to people watch. While in Paris in October we were blessed with beautiful weather. We took a break from active sightseeing to sit and relax at Luxembourg Gardens. The people watching was fun and it provided a nice break from an otherwise busy day. It was nice to slow down and watch Paris go by.
A local garden. It is a beautiful garden with lots of grounds to walk. A lovely fountain in the middle and impressive statures to admire
Very French. and beautiful garden. Many green and flowers. Large enough to walk around. Indeed, many jogg there. And, a pond and a chateau complete picturesque scenes. The best park in Paris.

Amazing place to visit!. I would highly recommend a stop at the Luxembourg Gardens when visiting Paris. The flowers are lovely, there is seating all around the perimeter or the gardens and people just sitting enjoying the beauty while having their coffee or lunch. It gives you a feeling of community and the love and enjoyment of life.

A Paris favorite. We were fortunate to live nearby the beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg and visit it often with our young children to play with the boats in the pond, play tennis (reservations and fees necessary), play in the great playground (though there's an admission price), race the pedal cars and just relax and people watch until the gendarmes blow their whistles for everyone to leave. A must for families.

pack a picnic or go to Le comptoir. Great place for a stroll!. We ate at Le comptoir after a morning walk which is very close. However, you could also pick up a baguette and charcuterie and have a wonderful picnic.

A nice rest between exploring the city. Nice place to have some rest midst the flowers in the middle of the city. The garden is nicely arranged, lots of flowers, lots of statues. We visited only the area around the fountain in front of the senate building. There are benches and chairs around the fountain. Kids can rent a mini toy boat to sail on the fountain. Also, there are listed some rules what you can and can't do in the park (i.e.no alcohol or sitting on the grass only where permitted) and there are uniformed guards - but they were really nice. The garden closes in the evening and the guards send peple out - when you hear the whistles, it's time to go :)

A cosy park. It's very nice that it does not get as crowded as the Jardins des Tuilleries. It feels like a neighborhood park and on week-ends, one can just walk around here without being accosted by souvenir vendors.
A very nice garden in heart of city. I visited the garden in the evening on a sunny day.Great place to walk, sit and relax. There are lot of café around.
A peaceful promenade. What an amazing place to spend an afternoon away from the city buzz. The Luxembourg garden has become better and more attractive with a lot of passionate green surprises!
A slice of Parisian lifestyle. Go there on a weekend and people watch.It was a lovely day for November and the park was packed with locals, sitting, playing games
Gorgeous stately park. Lively on a sunny Autumn Sunday when were there. A surprising space in the middle of suburbia and worth the walk from nearby St Germain.
Lovely spot to sit and people watch. Love this garden. Was disappointed that when we went back on our last day the garden was closed to the public and we couldn't figure out why.

Lovely garden - Nice walk. The Luxembourg Gardens are lovely especially when all the flowers are out or in the fall. The colours are just beautiful. If you have time, go there for a nice walk, and maybe to sit and eat something. Very relaxed place, people in the morning are doing sports all over the park. It's just a great place to relax.
Off the beaten track. Worth it though, the gardens are beautiful and carefully planted and landscaped too. Although out of season a delightful walk whilst on to another location

Outstanding park with great walkways and history. This was a nice surprise, had to walk from the latin quarter and went thru the gardens and they are just beautiful with a great design, walking, cycling and running or just sitting in one of the many chairs or benches available. Worth the visit.
Nice gardens even in late fall. Beautiful gardens. we were lucky to visit on a warm day in late November. It must be absolutely magnificent in the spring.
Lovely. This is not my first trip to Paris the garden have more flowers and color earlier in the season. It is a lovely place to visit anytime.
very peaceful. Even on a winter's day it was a beautiful place to visit, take a seat around the lake in the middle and it will be really peaceful... perfect for a walk with your other half
Beautiful Gardens. Came across by accident, lovely and quiet with numerous beautiful statues. A great place for a rest!

Paris at Play. I love this garden on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon when Parisienne families come out to enjoy it. Even on a sunny but cooling November afternoon it is vibrant. Children play with sail boats on the lake in front of the Senat building as they have for generations. Students study on benches in the quieter lawned areas. The energetic play tennis while others are engaged in serious boules contests or play chess on little tables by the Orangerie. The trees are stunning this Autumn, especially framing the Statue of Liberty (the original model from which the New York version was scaled up).
Beautifull. In Auntum the leaves falling down around the park are a beautifull and peaceful scene. The fountains and the pigeons complete the beauty of this garden.

Luxembourg Gardens. Such a lovely peaceful place to sit and ponder life. The gardens are pretty and the palace absolutely magnificent. It's such fun to watch the men play boulles and enjoying unwinding in the garden. A real delight.
Must be lovely in summer with a picnic. Still beautiful in fall but I wish I could have seen it in summer with a picnic. Nice break from the city, in the city!

My favorite park in Paris!. This is my favorite park in Paris! I like the mix of very well kept gardens with its relaxed ambiance. I love it that you are supposed to grab a chair and just sit back and relax (and if you happen to have purchased some baguettes and brie, even better). The neighborhood is also charming, the Rive Gauche at its best!
Worth it if sunny. Yeah ok if not raining. Also, you have to pay for public toilets in France, bring a few coins, and don't forget the toilet selfie, why not, you paid for it ;)

Beautiful. Very peaceful, clean and calm place ! You need to visit it...
Très propre, calme et relaxant ! Vous devez vous balader là-bas...

Crepes in the gardens. Beautiful gardens of a classical style. All the better for eating crepes and watching the children guide their little wooden yachts on the lake. A haven in the St.Germain/Latin Quarter of Paris.

best garden. luxembourg garden is well mainted garden to find such garden in center of the paris was amazing when you are in the garden you can not imagine that there is such a beauitful city there and when you are in city you can not imagine about the garden

This is Paris. Take a picnic lunch from a local boulangerie and settle into one of the chairs that are liberally available ... let the people watching begin. Students from the Sorbonne, local residents, gendarmes, joggers, and the older folk out for a stroll.

Paris, defined. Le Jardin du Luxembourg is all your dreams of Paris. As I started each morning with a run there, it was a reawakening not only of body but soul. Such beauty and order, such past and vital present

I must return at least yearly!. This is one of my favorite places in Paris. When I've had it with the shopping and the crowds, I will find a bus to take me to this garden. And not just because I'm a gardener! I take an extra chair, put my feet up and relax. It's THEE place to go for people watching, kid watching, sailing little boats, napping, and looking at all the gorgeous landscaping. Don't miss the Medici Fountain.
nice place. a good place to take a break in Paris, was very nice, but you can see much places like this in Paris as Versailles

Second visit, second time I was amazed. This, in my opinion, is THE prettiest public garden in Paris. Yes, it's packed with tourists and locals; yes, it's not that big considering the number of people around, but the place is fantastic! Very, very well-maintained, lots of beautiful sculptures and gardens to see... I know I don't need to tell you to go, since it's a big attraction, but I'll do anyway: go!

I always visit the gardens when I come to Paris. A peaceful haven in a busy city. At any time of the year (even a cold damp autumn day) it is a lovely place to walk. Shelter under the awning and play a game of chess or draughts (bring your own pieces) on the boards printed on the table-tops. Or visit the Musee where there is usually an interesting exhibition.

Brunch and a break from the Latin Quarter. The gardens are great for a stroll after brunch (we recommend Le Gay Lussac) on Guy Lussac 5 mins away.The gardens are beautiful and the tour of the statues of prominent historic Parisien woman is great (self directed tour with some help from the net!). There's a small boating lake, donkey rides, a lot of keen runners. We just took baby and really enjoyed this little piece of Paris. Go for an hours break from the latin quarter.

Large, but probably more pretty in summer or spring. This is a very nice, safe appearing park. We were there in November, so there weren't many beautiful flowers etc. People walking and playing. Lots of different ages and we felt safe sitting and walking around. Beautiful castle, but I am unsure if you can go inside - we didn't. People were playing chess, tennis and kids were riding scooters and bikes. This closes rather early - 5pm when we were there in November. At this time of year, I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, but it you are near the Pantheon, not too far to walk from there (or Montparnesse).
Must visit on weekends. A beautiful park for a morning jog, a slow stroll, or simply relax and watch Parisians enjoy family time on weekends.

Respite from Walking. Sitting in the beautifully maintained gardens and watching all the people was a perfect way to relax for an hour and soak up the sun as an intermission to all our Paris museum visiting. The chairs lining the crushed stone pathways are very comfortable, and there is both shade and sun to be found.

Wonderful run through the gardens!. great way to see all areas of park on a Saturday morning. There were a lot of runners out. Ran perimeter then through sections to see Statue of Liberty and enjoy the cool morning. Soft wide paths were nice for running.

Well-kept park, just delightful. The Palais du Luxembourg, originally built by the powerful Marie de Medici, queen to the assassinated King Henry IV now forms the backdrop to this delightful park. While the Palace serves as the seat of the French Senate, ordinary folks are free to enjoy the park grounds. And its popularity shows in the number of visitors that are here daily. Families bring the kids for a stroll, feed the ducks or sail toy boats in the central octagonal basin facing the palace. Others sit, read or reflect on the benches or lawns. All in all, it's a good place to slow down and relax. But the park is also well known for its statuary collection - stroll a short distance to find the stunning Fontaine Medicis, and there are also about twenty statues of French queens or famous women arranged in a relative semi-circle around the basin.

A place to quietly reflect on life in Paris. We happened to pick a balmy, sunny day and were able to ramble the grounds and get a glimpse of outdoor life in Paris. We sat for a while listening to school bands playing in the Rotunda which was exceptionally pleasant. The students (& their teachers) were really enjoying themselves which flowed into the audience. Didn't appear to be over inundated with tourists - mind, we were there around lunchtime and they were most probably catching a bite elsewhere though we noticed dining/coffee facilities are in the grounds. We had come prepared with our own baguettes and cheese. Spent a relaxing hour or so there and well worth the visit. Bit of down time in a busy city.

lovely. We were there in late October so the flowers weren't as abundant but it was still beautiful. I loved watching the children sail their model boats on the fountain. They were powered only by the wind and the kids were thrilled to see which direction the boats would go!

Not very green. We went november time and they were still rebuilding the garden, it also wasn't very green... I was quite disappointed. That being said, if its a sunny day and you are near by, give it a go!
Beautiful. Beautiful garden! Paris has tons of gardens full of life and history. This one must be in your schedule, it has a beautiful artificial lake and cute ducks on it!
lovely. So beautiful garden, to bad I was last there in winter, not very much to admire, but i do love to see it is always clean.

VISIT AT ANY TIME. Sunny or foggy day, visit this garden in the PARIS center, close to the senate. Very romantic garden with statues and a nice pond .If you have to go from SAINT MICHEL to MONTPARNASSE, please use this quiet, green and pleasant way. if Weather OK, choice a place and seat some time to look at studients and parisian people. so romantic that it is good for lovers.
Beautiful. I wasn't really lucky because they were rebuilding the garden. Still, it's very nice and beautiful to walk around.
relaxing. well cared for,clean, wide open space, very relaxing morning walk. It was a quiet mid week in November

Gorgeous.. We took our morning run/walks at Luxembourg Gardens. A breathtaking spot in the Fall with all of the flowers, plants, trees, ponds and statues; can only imagine the explosion of colors in the Spring. Bustling activity with playgrounds, tennis, runners, and walkers along with chairs around the main pond for relaxation. A must see.

Great for all times of the year. I have seen this garden in the summer, winter, spring and fall and its absolutely delightful. Pack a picnic and plan to stay awhile. The gardens are great to walk through and its so fun to people watch. Arrive early on summer days the chairs get snatched quickly!

Perfect for relaxing and enjoying nature and people!. The best about Jardin de Luxembourg is that you sit on one, or two, of their typical green chairs and enjoy some food while admiring people and nature!!
Wow. A lovely city park well worth a wander round, it was so busy and a great idea to have chairs all around the ponds. A popular place with locals and tourists. Quirky and fun.

Relaxed place for a stroll. Lovely gardens on an Autumn day... trees turning gold, the iconic chairs largely deserted, wondering what the Senators are doing in their amazing palace (sleeping off lunch, I imagine). A perfect park for a stroll. Shame about the Tour Montparnasse...

Most beautiful park to spend a splendid day at. Luxembourg park is the most beautiful place for me at Paris, after Versailles.The park is huge, you can see people jogging, people enjoying the fountains, enjoying the flowers, playing sports, watching the statues, feeding the doves, kids area, or just enjoying the atmosphere. This place really bring positive energy.
Beautiful. Took time to get there because it was hidden but once you do get there it was amazing. Good day out with the family

Great place to spend a day outside. If you have kids, or just want to spend a relaxing afternoon outside. This is a great place to go. It has a great kids playground, there is a cost to get in, but it is a great playground for kids to hangout and play. There are tennis and bocce courts, and an old school carousel. We spent an afternoon here, even in November, it was a fun time.

Luxembourg Gardens - A great place to hang out at lunch. When we stayed in the Latin Quarter we would grab a baguette and some chocolate at one of the local boulangeries and then go to the Luxembourg Gardens to eat, relax and watch the college kids from the Sorbonne at lunchtime - what a life!There are a million places to sit and have lunch, or wine and cheese, or just to kick back for a while. I never understood why this place was so popular until we came - WOW it's cool. There are amazing gardens and statues and places for kids to run and play - good times for everyone 1-100.The park is an easy 10 minute walk from the river and Notre Dame.

oh my. its nice garden,, peaceful place to sit down, rest a bit or eat something. I've been reading about Luxembourg garden in so many books so it was must to me to go here and I'm not disappointment. its open from 8am-5pm.
nice for jogging. Nice place to jog, but it doesn't open early--which is my only frustration with it. There are lovely fountains and greenery, and it's spacious, so we never felt crowded.

A nice escape in the city. The gardens are very beautiful. The kids playing is exciting. The small boats on the pond are fun to watch. We even watched a painter work on a plein air painting while we relaxed. Overall it is just a nice escape in a big city.

Luxembourg garden in Paris. After living in Paris for three years as a x pat I can honestly say these gardens have been my saving grace. I first visited as a tourist five years ago & fell in love with the place then, to experience Parisian life first hand watching the locals enjoying their space and the atmosphere that is created by everyone from tots to teens & beyond making use of open free park space is magical. From jogging to tennis, Nordic walking to tai chi, kite flying to sail boats, donkey rides to go carting, boules to swing boats, the list is endless including a childrens puppet theatre & several places to sit and eat or drink or picnic if the weather permits . There are changing free exhibitions in the orangery during the summer months, and a extensive list of concerts at the band stand which for me is the only time I came close to being home-sick when listening to English school children playing to a large audience and really enjoying their moment. There are no bikes allowed in the park and only a very small area where dogs are allowed, but I think this is a bonus as it means it is dog dirt free which can not be said for the rest of Paris ! Of course to see the park in the spring & summer is a bonus, all the planting is at its best but living in the arrondisement I visit almost daily and it never fails to please me. Playing tennis there is another highlight or simply just sitting and watching others play, taking in the sunshine or chatting to people from all walks of life, my idea of heaven, will it be yours ?

Dissapponting. We had read about the Garden and were really looking forward to seeing it. We visited in mid-November and there were no flowers so perhaps it was the time of year. For us there wasn't much that interested us.

Lovely place - 2nd tier though in Fall. There just aren't enough flowers and foliage in the fall when the trees are almost bare. It's a lovely place, but don't go out of your way to see it until the Spring. Has 4 public tennis courts which is very cool.

A park like any other. Its a lovely park but then so is Hyde Park or Regents Park in London or other parks referenced in the reviews. There is nothing wrong with it - there are expansive grounds to stroll about and enjoy the peace and quiet, observing the local at play. One facility not encountered before is the free chairs scattered throughout some Paris city parks, especially those that incline backwards - great for a rest in the sunshine.As Gardens go this is probably average compared to that in other major cities. A good spot to relax as part of a city visit but not worth a special trip.
Nice Place To Relax. I enjoyed taking a break from sightseeing and just relaxing. Pick a chair by the pond, put you feet up and watch the local Parisians enjoying a day in the sun.

Lovely. These gardens are very well kept even though they appear to be well used by joggers, children playing etc. Love the way they have many little nooks. Great places to relax and read or to people watch. Not a big pond but it looked in good condition.

Great place to take a stroll with the locals. This is where the locals on the Left Bank take take a stroll, meet friends, and eat their lunch (on the green chairs scattered throughout).
