One end of the gardens is located a block from the Pantheon and the Latin Quarter so definitely visit while you are exploring the Left Bank. The gardens are nice, fairly quiet, with fountains, playgrounds for kids, and the buildings which house museums. Also a good way to get from the Latin Quarter to Montparnassse.

Whatever. This place looked nice enough, but it's no better than Balboa Park in San Diego or Golden Gate Park in San Francisco. I heard lots of folks preach its virtues, but when I got there, it just looked like any old large European park, or American park, in a great city would, better than most, but not worth flying around the world to see. Even so, Paris was a fine thing to see, (although how they manage to have a more miserable subway than San Francisco is somewhat of a wonder). Anyhow, this park is fine if you need to cut through it on the way to something else, and/or, if you have lots of time around town. If you have only a couple of days, maybe brush by and peek in it to say you saw it, but don't worry that you missed anything. In fact, if you want gardens that are the best on the planet, go to Versailles first, then if you have time, pass though this park just to check it off your bucket list.
Beautiful!. I went there on summer, so the weather was perfect and the garden was very beautiful and full of colorful flowers... It's worth the visit... nice place to take some pictures!

Smelly flowers but beautiful gardens. Sorry... this is the only thing that stood inside my nose... the smell of the flowers... it's not disgusting, but i don't know what happened back there... aside of that... great place to stay... its not gigantic... you can sit, read... enjoy good company... really liked it.
A quiet park. This was a quiet park. It was nice to walk in. A nice change from all the other very busy tourist attractions.

A space to relax.. We walked from the banks of the river Seine, Pont Saint-Michel, up Boulevard Saint-Michel passed Université Paris IV Sorbonne, it's a little up hill but well worth it because at the end are these gardens.On the day we visited it was a lovely Sunday afternoon in late Autumn when every age group and nationality came to find a space to relax and you would never guess you were in a major city. Find a chair, one of those reclining ones, perhaps a little wine and snack, and just chill out ! people watch. These gardens are more family orientated because of the swings and park, sail a boat on the main pond or if you feel more energetic play tennis.Don’t miss the art posters on the railing surrounding the garden !
Just beautiful. Awesome place to relax! We were there before we left back home and it was amazing experience with all the French people around who were reading books and just relaxing.

Really beautiful. It is a very nice place to visit , tidy and clean with magnificent plants . The buildings are also amazing. It is advisable to have a walk in its neighbourhood , there are many interesting streets to visit full of little traditional shops and many of the buildings around are beautiful too. Another interesting thing is to see how much local people enjoy of the gardens,
Nice place and big. For couple of hours afternoon walk. It has a lot of panting artest and photoghers. School students are every corner of the place.
Wonderful place to walk and relax. It was great seeing all the activity-runners, walkers, children and their sailboats, children in the playground. Took many pictures.

A Lovely Garden. Stroll through and see the statuary and fountains, especially the Medeci fountain in the northeast corner. See the Luxembourg Palace's exterior only as it houses the French Senate and the public are not allowed to enter. The Musee de Luxembourg is in the northwest corner and sporadically has wonderful exhibits. Went on a drizzly, autumn day but it only added to the "Parisien" atmosphere.

Beauty lover. This is an enchanting place to visit. The gardens are magnificent, the pool where children come to sail their boats, and the chairs where you can sit and enjoy or take a nap....I am motivated to visit every day of my stay!

A large city park loved by many. A great layout of space and places to sit and watch or run if you like. Public art in statuary and water features, manicured lawns and gardens. The lovely Musee du Luxembourg is adjacent and worth a stop. Right now there is a great show on impressionist artists and a dealer that promoted them.

Beautiful. A good place to chill on a sunny day and read a book. Very calm and big park. With tennis courts, a lake and other areas to practice any activities. Also a lot of people walking and running arround the park.

A nice place in a nice city. You will go there not only because it is known, it is also very pleasant to be in the park. You can find some quite places, but you will see also a lot of people, so you will not get "bored" of the trees, grass and fountains.

A green gem in the middle of Paris. This parc is a perfect place to relax. I was surprised to see this place in the middle of crowded Paris. When I was there, the weather was very good. So you could relax, using the chairs which are all over this place.

You should really visit these. You really get that romantic wibe visiting this place. Its highly organized and well maintained. You really would be amazed to see certain flowers plants and the beauty of the place is really amazing.

One of my favorite spots in Paris. Of all the lovely gardens in Paris, this is probably my favorite. In fact, the greenery is so terrific that you can even "smell" the garden a block or two away. The other reviewers have really said it all. This garden is in particular quite a center of Parisian life, no matter the day of the week. Relax and enjoy it, no matter the weather!

Fabulous gardens. Wow! My 30+ year old daughter loves these gardens. It is a really great place to relax in Paris after a day of touring. It's a great place to watch people, while enjoying a time of leisure.

Perfect Park Stroll. On sunny days it's hard to find a park bench or seat. It's lovely to walk around the flower, greenery, fountains and statues. The perfect place to get lost and bring a book when a seat opens up.

A Walk In The Park. Couldn't be more pleasant, beautiful, accessible. This really is "the people's park" despite its royal lineage. From the athletes running the circumference to the noontime nappers using the classic "double chair" technique to the "Petanque" players meeting up for their weekly games (and our particular spectating pleasure) to the toddlers taking their first pony rides, it's a park that depicts the meaning of "joie de vivre."

The best place to be on a beautiful Fall day. We were so lucky with the weather we had in late October. It was sunny and gorgeous every day. I do not know how so many Parisians have the time and freedom to "hang out" in this beautiful park on a weekday, but I envy their ability to do so. The Fall plantings were just being installed and the sail boats in the pond were still there. I just love watching the kids float their boats. There is nothing like that in the United States.

lovely place to spend half a day, people-watching. We walked through here one afternoon and liked it so much that we detoured to walk through it again on the Sunday. The world and his wife (and their children) were there, playing tennis, sailing their model boats on the pond, jogging, in the cafes. we spent a couple of happy hours people watching and wandering around enjoying the gardens and statuary.

Relax like a Parisian. Loved that in the middle of the week, in the middle of the day, the park was full of locals soaking in the sun. Some were reading, some snoozing, some smoking and other lounging in the grass like they didn't have a care in the world. The flowers were out and it felt like no one was in a hurry to get back to work!

Peaceful oasis. Great place to take a break from museums, cathedrals and crowded streets. Stroll around, pick up a lunch and park it for a couple of hours. One of the few places where you can actually sit on the grass
The nature's beauty. It is a very beautiful place to visit! The architecture is astonishing and the gardens take your breath away. I personally greeted all the queens ;0)

Beautiful in autumn. Just walk around here, it is a very nice relatively quite place in the middle of busy Paris. Walk around, sit by the pond and watch the little sail boats and enjoy the people walking by.

beautiful garden in central Paris!. Since I was staying 5 mins away from this garden, I actually ended up going there couple of times after breakfast for a stroll before starting my business day. The park is huge and has some nice water elements which are soothing and add to the overall beauty of the park.You can also grab a coffee at one of the cafes there and just sit by and watch people go-by.Sadly it closes by 5:30pm, which I think should be extended further. If you are in the area, don't give it a miss.

Beautiful!. The first time I visited these gardens was in April when all of the flowering trees were in bloom. This time was in the fall. Everywhere we went, there were an abundance of fall mums and flowers still blooming in the vast gardens.The colors along with the architecture of the park itself is gorgeous. You will find locals as well as tourists relaxing, running, strolling or just sitting to enjoy the ambience. On a nice day it is a place one must visit when in Paris as it is removed from all of the hustle and bustle of the city.
Don't miss this Jardin on a nice day!. It's always a pleasure to walk through the Jardin du Luxembourg, especially when the weather is nice, or even not so nice.
Fantastic. Absolutely lovely. You can enjoy a quiet fountain with beautiful statues, surrounded by trees. Very tranquil !!!

Lovely gardens and interesting layout. We took a 15 minute stroll and spend about an hour inside the gardens. Very lovely, well maintained, totally safe and good facilities --- cafes, restrooms, security. Go on a "nice day" for an enjoyable relaxing visit.
Lovely gardens that should not be missed. One should not miss visiting the lovely Luxembourg Gardens when visiting Paris. Children have a nice time visiting this excellent sightseeing.
Real Paris family life. Relaxed Parisians reading, picnics and playing with children. Beautiful trees and flowers, fountains.

A breath of air in central Paris. I have been here many times and will go again many times. Easiest access is probably the Luxembourg merco/rer station.These are beautiful gardens and it is great to sit and watch people passing bye, It has a nice pool for model boats. It has tennis courts, a centre for cultivation of bees. You are not supposed to walk on the grass with dogs, but one of the best notices I have ever seen unfortunately gone was- forbidden for dogs except blind dogs. It also has a statue and Mary Queen of Scots, marked Marie Stuart Reine de France, which of course she was also.

Relaxing in Paris. One of my favorite places in Paris is the Jardin de Luxembourg, where the little lake with the sailing boats and the free chairs all over makes it a most agreeable park to relax and stay a while.
A must-see garden. One of the most calm and beautiful places in Paris. You must stop there for a 30 min break from your tour in Paris. I loved the free access to chairs, the castle is beautiful.

Flowers in combinations I have never seen before.. The massed plantings of annuals mixed with colourful foliage plants was a delight to the eye. Walking around this beautiful place was one of my most enjoyable mornings in Paris.

Stunning. Playgrounds, plantings, ponds, just a really beautiful, relaxing place that draws a huge diversity of ages, races, etc. etc. A very nice place to relax, stroll, enjoy seeing Parisian families. Great place.

Wonderful park. We enjoyed a leisurely walk through the Luxembourg Gardens. It is a very relaxing and peaceful place. We were there on a warm fall day and many people were sitting in the many chairs lined up along the edge of the grass and pond. There were little remote control boats in the pond and a fountain. It is a great place for families, as there is a great playground. There are restrooms in the park, too. The fence around the park on two sides had interesting pictures on it. It is next to the Luxembourg Museum, too, but we did not have time to go there.

Keep calm and visit Luxembourg gardens.. When we are in Paris its pretty hard to imagine that we can find a calm place in the city. But its possible. Calm, beautiful place with a lot of chairs to relax . Definitely I recommend this gardens to see!

A little bit of an oasis in a very bustling city!. The gardens are beautiful! even if it is busy with locals and tourists, there is enough space for everyone and provides for a very relaxing visit- whether to rest from all that walking or to just people watch.

Beautiful Gardens in the heart of Paris. How wonderful to have such a beautiful garden in the heart of Paris for people to relax in. Beautiful trees, benches to sit on. Just so peaceful. A delight to visit.
A garden to sit and enjoy. It's a beautiful place with many sculptures. There are chairs around the pond and one may relax and just enjoy the view. I enjoyed it very much.

Place for relaxation inside the parisian madness. The fountain, the ducks, the families, the fountain of Medici, all there making it an oasis of calmness. Great place for a run, for watching time pass and letting your thoughts fly a while. That's what it was for me.

Beautiful in the autumn sunshine. We spent a relaxing afternoon in these lovely gardens recently. There were many colourful flower displays and an outdoor cafe where we had a drink in the sunshine then watched the children sailing boats on the pond

Beautiful space en plein Paris. My school was just a few blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens, and I spent many happy afternoons with a baguette sandwich while just chilling in this lovely space. The Medici Fountain is not to be missed, and it's just such a relaxing way to get away for a bit from the busier tourist areas. There are a few restaurants in the area, but it's much more fun to do as the locals and just bring your own lunch. A great way to spend an afternoon.
Lovely. Walking through the gardens, one will observe how the Parisians love their parks. Especially endearing was watching the children sending their sailboats across the water.
Beautiful and serene. This is a beautiful park - a hidden gem. Worth the trip, lots of cafes and shopping near by.A lovely place to enjoy watching people and having a picnic.
Brilliant. What beautiful gardens. Not to be missed for a lesiurely walk in fab setting' Went there beginning of November and weather was just perfect - the colours of the flowers delightful

A sanctuary on the Left Bank. A regular visitor for 40 years. Improbably landscaped and planted for the seasons with a classic venue for the ages, starting with the Mediche Fountain and proceeding by statues of famous French ladies (women) and people watching all the while.
Calm and Peace in the Centre of Paris. The site was fab, a joy to walk around so clean and kept so well. Wonderful experience would certainly go again the next time in Paris

MARIE OF MEDICIS'S GARDEN. How many city gardens give a chance to :- have your kids play with wooden boats- play tennis- look at chess players- enjoy incredible plantations- see the senators at work- walk you dog- see a litterature Nobel Prize walk through, followed by a Physics Nobel Prize and a few other famous actors, walking their kids to the Ecole Alsacienne - in the very middle of the historical Paris ?The Luxembourg gardens, created by Marie de Medicis, does, and big time !I've lived in the neighbourhood for 40 years and was never bored of it, and the 140 gardeners take care of changing the flowers so often you sometimes wonder what magic happened...One must spend an afternoon there, whatever the season, it's Paris at it's best, and an unforgettable experience !
The Epitome Of Paris. Go in the spring when the flowers are full bloom. Any other time is scenic but not as breath taking as the full bloom.

Nice Garden to Visit After Visiting Museums. The Luxembourg Gardens are a lovely place to visit after touring the museum sites in Paris. It is nice to be able to sit down and watch the crowds. The gardens are formal in nature with nice flower beds and a pond. It also contains the Luxembourg Palace which houses the French Senate. It is a short walk from the Cluny Museum and the Odeon Metro Station. It also has its own Metro stop, Luxembourg.

The nicest gardens. I love the LUxembourg gardens because it is at the center at the city bu tyoure ally don't feel it. It's very peace full and it's a wonderful place to enjoy a walk on a nice day or just rest on one of the many chairs. In summer there is also (sometimes) free classicals concerts.This is definitely one of my favorite place in Paris !

Elegant beauty. Very special and lovely place for romantic walk. Full of historical and cultural references. Usual route for Ernest Hemingway visiting Gertrude Stein. So it's also interesting for amateurs of literature.

Beautiful on a sunny day!. These gardens are so lovely to relax in. They have chairs everywhere and the views are really nice. If it is sunny and you are carrying your lunch eat it here. It is also about a 20min walk to Notre dame from here so this was a nice resting spot for us. The garden is also very child friendly and has activities for the children and a lot of space for them to be free in!

cute. I skimmed over the reviews and apparently someone mistook this for a hotel. This is a garden/park, not a hotel. The grounds are lovely. This is a great place to take a walk around or for families with children to come (there are play areas). The palace is wonderful as well - you can't go inside except once a month I think. Just a magnificent large building to look at though. The flowers, fountain, landscaping is lovely.
great place to eat lunch. It is so fun to take a bag lunch to this park and watch the old men play boules. they take it so seriously. look for the statue of liberty look a like here.
Jardin du Luxembourg. Beautiful park in the middle of the Latin Quarter on the Boulevard St Michel.. Plenty of cafes, restaurants etc in the Jardin .

The most magical gardens in Paris. This park is the most romantic and the loveliest space of green in Paris. Look for the bee hives, the Medicis fountain or go to the Luxembourg museum.There is so much to see and it makes for a perfect afternoon with the family too. We often go with the kids to takeadvantage of the playground, the litte sailboats you can rent or even a ride on the small poneys.If you speak some French, the guignol is a theater for the little ones that is timeless. We have fond memories of this park and would advise everybody to go when visiting Paris.

Hint of the Parisien Lifestyle.. If you are visiting Paris on a nice day, and it's time relax and plan your stay, buy a snack and walk through the gardens to watch Parisiens enjoying their book, playing petanque, the families at the park, the boats in the fountain, etc. Personnally I get tired of walking in a dust bowl but since my wife and I live in Paris occasionally we will stumble through on a nice evening just to see what's going on and people watch. Grab a bench and hangout for a while.

The typical Parisian Left Bank
Garden. You will breathe the true Paris way of life in this garden.A unique mix of all generations,Happy high school boys and girls ,intellectuals reading their books ,retired people doing crosswords and even Chess or Pétanque players Among a beautifull natural surroundingsSpend one hour here and you will love Paris
Luxembourg Gardens. Great place to stroll through and look at the beautiful gardens. Make sure you have some spare change if you wish to use the restrooms.

Find the time to visit.. We were staying nearby and enjoyed our lunch there on a couple of days. There are a whole host of activities but we were happy to take a rest from sightseeing to admire the gardens and peoplewatch. The Medici fountain is a great spot for a quiet shady stop.
So So. It probably wasn't worth the visit except for watching miniature sailing boats and ducks. Think the weather was too hot for kids to enjoy the park as we got there by lunchtime/noon.

Nice place to people watch. I would give the gardens about 3.5.... Don't get me wrong, it's lovely, esp on a nice day there are plenty of chairs out to sit down and people watch. But I guess I was expecting something more? Still very nice park and open space to relax and kick up your feet for a while, especially if you've been on your feet all day.
Awesome in october. The best view is in october because of the different colors you get to see...recommend to walk and take time just to admire the view.

Lovely!. Step back in time and out of the glorious hustle and bustle of Paris, and wander around the Jardin du Luxembourg. The grounds are beautiful, and there's something about just sitting gown and enjoying the surroundings here that will be one of your prettiest memories once you leave Paris.

Beautiful. Peaceful, beautiful and such a nice place to read a book a eat a snack!
Great pics I took there, between the trees.
Take a quiet stroll. This is a beautiful park in which to stroll, to see fountains, and to see other people who are also escaping the city noises.
Not much grass and had to pay to play!. Was looking forward to visiting here, although a bit disappointed. Had to pay for play area for kids which we didn't bother. Also, very dusty, not much grass.
GREAT PLACE TO RELAX. Very nice park with a lot of flowers and benches. Ideal to rest while walking through Paris attractions.

Beautiful park and more.. This large park on the edge of the Latin Quarter is much used and great for a stroll or picnic. There are gardens, statuary, game courts, children's playground, a lake, jogging trails, many trees, and a palace! The museum near the palace at one end of the park had an exhibit of impressionists' work from the collection of Paul Durand-Ruel, an art dealer who did more than anyone to advance the popularity of this art when it was new. Well worth a visit!

Perfect place for a Sunday morning stroll amongst the locals. What a beautiful spot. We entered and just wandered enjoying the flowers, the lake with all the people sailing toy boats and in particular just watching the people going about their normal Sunday activities

Pretty garden. It's a pretty huge garden! I suggest bring a blanket and have a little lunch or snack. The flowers are beautiful and very colorful. There are a lot of places to sit with a lot of benches around. If around the area definitely take a little detour and around.

Beautiful. This is beautiful place to visit. There was a man feeding birds from his hand because they are so tame, is was magical. Its just a shame in the gardens there is only one toilet for hundreds of people, so if you get caught sort, you waste a lot of time queuing.

Best place to relax. Beautiful, well manicured gardens. Its a great place to spend a sunny afternoon in a winter day. Just hang around, walk through rows of trees and when tired just grab a seat and read or just watch the world go by..and also..see the antics of pigeons..they also seem to love this place :D

Disappointed. I understand that we went at the end of October but even so, me and my fiance were really disappointed. We picked a nice day and prepared a picnic expecting there to be lots of grassy areas or gardens to sit in and eat. Instead the only garden we saw was around the fountain (which was small). There are lots of chairs to sit on and you can move them where you need to. There is a small hut where you can borrow a wooden boat to sail on the fountain but other than that, there was nothing to do. We spent about half an hour and then left.

Great walk. Well worth a walk around. Didn't even mind the rain. I have been here in the summer with a bottle of wine which is when the gardens are at their best. Just sit down and watch the world go by.
Very pretty. But very busy in half term week. Parisienes as well as tourists use this park. One location we weren't hassled by beggars. Loved watching the children sailing model yachts on the pond.
Lovely walk. Lovely place to seat and watch the world go by and have a good rest after seeing all those painting.

Wonderful park. This is a park as it should be. For people. And people really use it! Could not believe how many activities Parisiens can enjoy in a park.Reading, knitting, sun bathing, studying, kissing, playing tennis, chess, eating, drinking, playing, jogging, basketball, chatting, playing cards , crochet.....It was an unseasonably warm day and we spent ages in the park and then treated ourselves to a nice lunch in a nearby cafe. The highlight of my trip to Paris so far and, if I'm being honest, the safest I've felt in a few days in the city.

Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful serene gardens , walk through real Parisian life! Me and my boyfriend sat and watched the Boules and sat by the lake watching the boats float past and it was just a gorgeous serene day to end our stay

Lovely. Some beautiful gardens if you have a bit of time or even if it's just a quick walk through. We had a bit of time to spare before we went to catch our flight and this was the perfect way to spend it.
Lovely park. This is a beautiful park in one the best areas in Paris, full of nice restaurants and wine bars. Strongly recommend it.
Little Piece of Paradise. Beautiful park sat in the sun watching the children sail boats Perfect! Lots of seats available and shade if required where you can watch the games of chess being played.

A great place to stroll. Do not miss a visit to the "Jardin du Luxembourg" one of the most beautiful parks in Paris. It is the perfect cadre to take a walk around the flowerbeds, and the perfectly aligned trees, take in the beautiful sculptures or simply stop for a well deserved break. The garden is located in the sixth arrondissement near the "Quartier Latin” between the Boulevard Saint Michel, rue Me Médicis, rue de Vaugirard, théâtre de l'Odéon and rue Auguste Comte. The garden is also home to the Senate which is housed in the Palais du Luxembourg.

Lovely stroll in a quiet part of town. We had a lovely walk from our hotel in Montparnasse towards Notre Dame - very peaceful evens though there were plenty of people about. Very enjoyable. Free entry to the gardens.

Lovely. PROS: Lots of space, good walking areas, great people watching from the little kids renting boats and racing in the fountain to the oldies playing chess like it's a sport, nice photo ops. Pack a picnic and take in some relaxation.

Amazing, beautiful place. We picked up a couple of ham & cheese baguettes, a bottle of wine and dessert, and had a wonderful lunch while people watching in the park. There was a band playing and kids with small sailboats on the water, and people relaxing everywhere. Very nice. After lunch we walked around the beautiful grounds and saw people playing tennis, chess, cards, all kinds of things going on. We really enjoyed it.The only negative was there's a charge to use the toilets. Although they are nice & clean, it was still weird to me. So glad I had some euros on me.It's definitely a great place to walk around, enjoy the gardens, people watch, or just relax with a book.

Love the Gardens and Kids with Boats. These 60 acres of beautiful gardens are wonderful to visit. Lots of people watching, lovely plants and flowers, and children launching sailboats or riding ponies.

Our favourite Parisian park. There's something for everyone in this sprawling Parisian park:--fantastic flower-beds;--card & chess games;--tennis;--puppet-show;--ponds & fountains;--Fontaine de Medicis (not to be missed, a gem, in north-east corner of the gardens);--photo-op of The Pantheon;--statuary, including a miniature Statue of Liberty; &--several Arago disks (Google it).
Unexpected Colorful Retreat. I basically stumbled into Luxembourg Gardens on a very sunny fall day. The gardens were impecably peaceful and lovely.
Perfect Place to Read on a Sunny Afternoon. Whether you want to relax and read a book or just watch the passing crowd, the Luxembourg Gardens is the perfect place to be on a sunny day.
Lovely gardens. So french. Everyone out with the chair around one for the many fountains enjoying the warm fall day. A nice place to have a picnic after touring the Latin quarter.
How very French. Nothing quite like a warm summer day in the Gardens....see the flowers, the bee hives and watch the Parisians enjoy themselves. Bring a picnic lunch and watch the world go by!
A Wonderful Break from the Hustle and Bustle of Paris. So beautiful to walk around any time of the year. Mingle with the real Parisians who know a good thing when they have it.

Love this jardin!!. This is one of the prettiest parks in all of Paris. We always visit at least once or twice on every visit to Paris. Take a picnic and relax in chairs or on the grass. Could not spend a day in a better place in this beautiful city, really.
oasis in city. it is calm and tranquil. not only a park but also contains tennis courts and many more attractions for Parisians...
Fontaine de Medicis. is a quiet spot in this large park...a visit to the luxembourg gardens is a must even in the depths of winter!

If I return as a ghost, you’ll find me here.... Some earthlings fear being left behind in a ghost-like form to walk the earth forever. If that should ever happen to me, I wouldn’t mind if I were left in the Luxembourg Gardens! It is one of the most “heavenly” places on earth for people watching, feeding the birds, smelling the flowers or just lying on the acres of green lawns, watching the clouds float overhead while you keep asking yourself: “Should we be standing in line at the Louvre?” No, or non!, as the French prefer you say. You’ll thank me (unless it rains heavily) if you just stay on the lovely perch you found - part shade, part sun, if it is summer - and envy how the Parisians take such joy in an afternoon with their kids, grandmama or papa or just their new puppies. I can’t define what makes this “process” so different from, say, going to Central Park, except to say that the French are “natural beauties” and don’t seem to have to “pose for holy pictures” (as I like to say) like the Americans do. I’ve never seen a Frenchman remove his shirt to gain attention; his cut little buns gets enough glances, I suppose! Enjoy...
Beautiful. Take an hour to walk these stunning gardens. The area is just gorgeous with its foliage. Grab some cheese and bread and make a picnic.
Beautiful garden. This was a beautiful garden, even in October. Pretty fountain/pool in the center, and kids were renting little saidboats to float in the pool. Would be nice on a beautiful day.
Great place!. Peaceful, and quiet instead of surrounding stress and haste. Just to sit and relax. One of my favourites.
Amazing!. A very cute and amazing place to take a walk or relax! Definitely going there if i'm back in Paris. Specially nice in summer.
Beautiful - wonderful!. I love the atmosphere, the grandeur, the people, the trees, part of Parisian life! Go to see how people read, jog, kiss, walk and enjoy. Great in early morning!

A beautiful park to begin the exploration.. I love this park. I imagine all the children who live in the tall apartments surrounding the garden playing in this park as their back yard. A place to play with the boats, paths for their bicycles, tennis courts, and other attractions. But I also note that many, many locals sit out, facing the sun, capturing a few moments of rest, warmth, and relaxation during their day, before work, during lunch, for a break. But perhaps, that is just how I would use such a great park if it were in my town.

Must see garden in Paris. Any time between spring and fall is a good to rest your mind while walking and seeing Luxembourg gardens. It is a must see attraction in Paris. Don't hesitate to include it in your trip plan.

Wonderful way to spend the afternoon. Stroll through and explore then gardens, and watch the Parisians enjoying them. You can sit by the fountain in one of the free chairs, play tennis, or visit the kids play area - or simply explore.
Beautiful gardens!. Great place to stroll or just sit and relax......try exploring the surrounding neighborhoods as well....lots of cafes, shops, and people-watching everywhere!

Beautiful. We thought the gardens were a peaceful haven in a busy city.
Take a picnic or get a drink in the café.
remarkable. Any travel to Paris MUST be the Luxembourg gardens. The design the space and the constant caring and maintance are so impressive.

Beautiful :). Beautiful garden where u can take a sit and enjoy the views
Get to know the history of the garden and the visit us gonna be even more interesting ...

Lovely Place for a Sunny Afternoon. This visit to Paris I finally got the opportunity to sit in the sun in the garden for a couple hours. With half the population of Paris! Well, not really. But the Parisians love the place too. It was an odd October Saturday afternoon - 80 degrees! Sat and stared and relaxed and read. Only issue was making sure I wasn't close to someone smoking. A lot fewer smokers than even 10 years ago, but still... And it's so fun to watch the little kids with the boats in the big pool. From the gardens, it's a short walk to Boulevard St Michel where I discovered Simon - the parapluie or umbrella store. Pricey? I replaced my traveling umbrella with nice sturdy model that was worth it. And a short stroll further on down to the many Gibert Jeune bookstores! Print is not dead! I picked up some great books to improve my French. And you can find English language books too.

Island of green and quiet. A quiet and peaceful park where one can sit back and relax. Contemplation, reading, yoga, watching people or birds, whatever you like...the choice is all yours.Beautiful statues and landscaping, and an excellent museum to boot.Don;t miss mind-blowing photo exhibition on the external fence.

Saturday morning walk. Saturday was the day of our departure from Paris. Our flight was in the late afternoon so we were looking for some place to spend a few ours ... and the 2 hour morning walk in Luxembourg Gardens was just what we were looking for.

Fun walk in the afternoon. I love all the statues in here. It was very cool to take a walk through here before we went to Le Louvre. My favorite statue was of this lion standing over an ostrich. Like some of the other reviews have said, there are plenty of benches and places to sit and just relax in this awesome place.

Green heart of Paris. Beatifull flowers ,colourfull trees in every season Medici s fountain is magnificient Luxembourg Palace building is serving as Senate building.Just over the corner there is a museum with wonderfull exibitions Entrance fee 12 euros ,not listed in Paris Museum pass.
A beautiful autun afternoon. I was there las week for the first time. People enjoyed themselves. I thought life can be sometimes so perfect!
Relax and enjoy. Beautiful gardens to walk and to spend some relaxing time with the locals in a sunny day along the place and the fountains
Beautiful gardens. The gardens are beautiful and it is a great place to walk around or have an outdoor picnic. While not as large as the Tulleries, it has the same charm without all the people.

what a great place to kill an afternoon!. Lots of seats, benches, and lounge chairs. Beautiful trees. The grass looked fake it was so green. Sat and had a bottle of wine, anda crepe from one of the little stands. Just a great place to enjoy scenery and relax.

Incredibly Beautiful. One of our favorite places to go when we are in Paris. We love to take a lunch with us and sit in one of the many, many places and enjoy the beautyof the park and people watch. This park is so big it will take you some time to see it all. They have a nice little cafe near one of the east side entrances. Just take a leisurely walk around the lake, look at the beautiful and colorful gardens and relax. Don't rush it, just enjoy and take in all of the great history surrounding this lovely place.

Relax in the Gardens. Despite the busy and noisy streets of Paris.... you can get away from it all in this beautiful park setting. Grab a bottle of wine, and a chair by the pond and people watch till the bell rings at 6pm and everyone must leave.

Luxembourg Gardens. my husband and I got lost while riding the metro so we just started walking around and stumbled upon this garden, we were so happy we did it was beautiful! A great Place to rest for a while and enjoy the beautiful French Gardens I will add pictures later whereas trip advisor rejects my pictures stating the file is to big?

Luxembourg Gardens. Sitting in the garden was restful and visually stunning. The Medici fountain was my favorite spot as it is beautiful. The whole park was immaculate and provided great chairs for relaxing after hours of walking.

Charming. We went here for a walking portion in the gardens while we were on a bus tour of the city. It was beautiful and we enjoyed it very much especially when we had a little stop for refreshments and to use the bathrooms. The history of the Statue of Liberty with models of Lady Liberty in the Park were some history that we enjoyed and did not know about. The surrounding neighborhood looked pleasant if we only had more time to explore on our own.

Don't miss this place!. It was the start of Autumn but the gardens were still full of colour. Children were sailing the little wooden yachts in the lake and pushing them off again with bamboo poles. People were sitting around relaxing or eating lunch and under the trees there was a band from out of town playing in the old zinc roofed bandstand. Pastries from the nearby patisserie take on a special flavour in such surroundings!

peaceful and home-y. The park was near my hotel, and I found this to be a relaxing place to just walk or sit and watch the people go by. Parks for children, running routes, important statuary and fountains, stands outside the gates for all kinds of "treats," and surrounded by decent to great restaurants. Very near RER & Metro. Moderate walking distance to many sites. Nice place to bring a backpack picnic on a foot-touring day.

Deserving of it's high ranking. It's a beautiful garden for being so unembellished. It's flat. It's fairly clear and easy to navigate. But the grounds themselves really are very pretty. From the statues, to the variety of trees, to the fountain. It was a beautiful day out. I enjoyed just sitting and watching people walk and watching the old men play what I'm told is not actually bocce ball, but something pretty much exactly the same as bocce ball. So I'm going to call it bocce ball. They'll deal with it, I'm sure. Anyhow, it's a lovely place for a walk. Or a sit. Or a nap.
Beautiful!. The gardens were amazing and more than I could have imagined. Definitely try to fit this into your trip. They have several benches and parks to stay and have a picnic.
cant miss it. Beautiful. Beautiful. Beautiful. Find a free seat and just watch the world walk by. If you can, organise a picnic and enjoy it like a local.

Lovely place to stroll. This is slated as the most popular garden in Paris, and rightfully so. Even in October, when it is drizzling, the leaves are turning, and you you would not expect flowers.... There are flowers. They were planting Pansies when we walked through (my sister and I), .. Love,y place to be in Paris.

Beautiful Gardens. we wandered through the Luxembourg Gardens on a late morning Sunday. It was beautiful. Well kept, neat and tidy. There were little quiet hide always where people were peacefully reading their books. Plenty of attractions for young children and coffee stops for parents. Seating was in abundance. A delightful lake in front of the grand house where families were sailing remote controlled boats - you could even hire them. A real find of Parisian weekend life.

Beautiful, a little like a French Central Park.. Much nicer than the Tuileries Gardens, we arrived on a sunny day and hundreds of locals were realxing around the park and enjoying themselves. It has the added bonus of having the palace adjacent to the park, just adding to the ambience. We also got the cheapest cup of tea in Paris at one of the stalls - just EU1.50, after paying up to EU4.60 in most places. We were even offered a Twinings tea chest to select from :)A lovely place for a cuppa and a stroll with your loved ones.
Paris Sunday. Do visit on Sunday and be a Parisian for one day. Stroll, sit, talk, watch kids sail boats, enjoy life.

Fine place to relax and take in the beauty of Paris. We arrived in Paris in morning and spent a sunny afternoon relaxing in the gardens. There isn't a lot going on here ~ just Parisians and tourists hanging out in a beautiful place.

Go back as often as you can.. Granted, we were in Paris for over a month and had the luxury of time, but this place does require more than one visit. It is that big, that beautiful, that well maintained , that extraordinary. During our month long stay we visited Luxembourg Gardens 3 different times and each time found something new at which to marvel. Sometimes it was just the garden itself, others, the boules players, picnickers, or musicians. All make this place special. Go here, go here soon and then go back again.

Amazing. The Luxembourg Gardens in Paris is a very relaxing place to spend some time. The grounds are well maintained and very beautiful. The park is also good because not ever part of the park is covered in tourist. There are plenty of places to sit down and enjoy your surroundings. The day I visited the park there was not a cloud in the sky and it was great to sit down and just take in the beauty that the park has to offer. This is a must see attraction while your in Paris and is right near one of my favorite restaurants in Paris that I wrote a review about recently. Overall if you have the time and its a nice day the Luxembourg Gardens are a must and walking around for about an hour will give you plenty of time to take pictures and relax.

In the footsteps of Hemingway. The Luxembourg Gardens are a place to relax, contemplate, and people watch. The Gardens are beautiful and when you think of all those whose footsteps have preceded us, it is mind-bending. Enjoy the beauty and serenity.
Beautiful gardens!. I loved the gardens and fontains! Aditionally I did not need to pay to visit the external area. The architecture of the buildings is beautiful.

beautiful!. Gorgeous gardens, plenty of seating even when it was busy. If you get nice weather take a packed lunch and spend a lovely day there. There's also a large fountain where you can hire little sail boats to push out on to the water.

Afternoon in the gardens . It's great to stop and relax after walking all day. It's beautiful and is a great place to people watch. If your only in Paris for a few days, it really isn't an absolute must do in this marvelous city.

Beautiful, Calm, Relaxing. We wandered around these gardens fairly early in the morning. They are just so peaceful and perfectly manicured - we could have stayed all day! It definitely is worth trying to fit in some down time here.
Lovely Garden. Nice garden to stroll, relax and people watch. Lots of seats near the main fountain. Great place to spend a Sunday afternoon in the park away from the hustle of the rest of Paris.

Amazing gardens & a great spot to hang out.. These gardens were beyond beautiful. They were magnificent. There is a little lake in the middle where people hire little boats, and it seems to be the spot to grab a chair and sit and chill in the gardens. Great spot for a picnic, to play with the kids or grab a book and chill. Lovely relief from the city noises.
So beautiful!. We always go to the cafe in the park next to the marionette theater. It's a charming spot for lunch or a drink. Both self-service and waiter service.

My favorite!. I just fell in love with this place! What a beautiful garden! I had lunch in one of the many chairs displayed around the flowers and fountains and it was a delight. Definitely one of my favorite places in Paris.

Ok but not Spectacular. I visited these Gardens on a weekend trip of Paris. I had heard many tales of how beautiful they were and how peaceful the site was.However I did not find them that awe inspiring, although yes they are beautiful, they most certainly are not a quite and tranquil place, as you could hear the loud traffic almost anywhere in the garden.It also is annoying how in Paris they rope of the grass to sit on, as if they feel everyone will destroy it who sits on it, which is a little disappointing especially when all the seats have been taken in the park.
Where I Fell in Love with Paris. Absolutely gorgeous no matter the season. Lovely place to relax, take a stroll and great photos, or even have a picnic.

good for relaxing. we strolled around the gardens almost all afternoon and it was really nice especially for kids.the gardens have lovely chairs all over to relax and some food vans to provide you with coffee and snacks!
Lively. The garden is simply lively. I loved everything about!It is huge and full of entertainment sources especially for kids:D
Classy. Very well maintained grounds and gardens here. They (Le Senat) collect and sell the fruit grown here at certain times of the year. They even have their own Apiary!

Beautiful autumn colours. This is a beautiful place for a stroll or to sit and enjoy the well kept gardens, lawns and avenues of trees. The lake in front of the Palace (now the Senate) is enjoyed by children sailing boats.

Garden at Leisure. We have visited Luxembourg Garden on 31 September after touring around the Latin Quarters.There were many water features and flowering plants amidst the various statues in different corners of the Garden. Lots of local residents also visited the garden in a leisurely speed. All these added up to a peaceful environment that most people would like to enjoy. Come and share the beauty at your leisure.
Yes ! you can breath in Paris. Its a huge Parc or "jardin" in the hearth of Paris next to the Latin quarter, a nice place to see the excellence of the architecture of Paris
Good place for rest. A nice area with water, green areas and a café. Lots of places to sit an enjoy the scenery. It was busy park with many locals eating lunch bought in cafes and shops close by.

Flowers, fountains, taking break. Lots of activity, yet places to sit and stare and take a break from making the touristy rounds of the city. A far away Parisian feel sets in and so does a smile. Kids and toy boats a plus, nice little cafe under the trees.

gorgeous. bustling gardens open to the public. Beautiful flowers and water features. People were just sitting around and enjoying the weather. a small band playing in a gazebo in the park. I know I did not see 1/8 of the gardens. The beautiful Luxingburg estate was on the grounds.

Classic Grench Presentation Garden. Located a few blocks away from the Latin Quarter, the garden is a classic setting with promenades, a child's model boating lake, and a wide array of seasonal Parisian plants.
Stunning. Stunning beautiful gardens and lovely to have a leisurely stroll through any time of year. Take your time to explore it all

One of the most beautiful places in Paris. This park, also known as Luxembourg Gardens, is a great place to relax and admire the french gardens beauty. With Eiffel Tower in the background, you can admire the flowers or the little lake in the front of the Palace, while you sit on the chairs that are surrounding the gardens. It is one of my favourite places in Paris, where you detach from the city life and simply relax. Great place for taking photos even if it's raining, the contrast between flowers and sky being fantastic. Highly recommending.

My favourite part of Paris. Absolutely beautiful gardens! I would go running here in the mornings at around 8 (early for Paris time!) and enjoy the quiet serenity with the other runners. The autumn leaves were crunching underfoot and made for some beautiful photos along with stunning flower beds. My must see of the trip. It does get very busy throughout the day so I would go early.

Linger on the Lawns of Luxembourg. Longing for a little laziness and languor to be added to your frenetic Parisian vacation schedule? Look no further than the lovely Luxembourg Gardens located on the Left Bank. Lushly landscaped, it's the perfect locale for a lazy lunch.
Beautiful setting. We had beautiful weather so we just sat and enjoyed the sun, the scenery, the young couples in love and the children at play. A great spot of beauty and respite.

Chic gardens in the Quartier Latin!. Lovely garden where one can picnic on the grass or else stroll around on the paths, lovely place for couples, friends and families with children! Was also packed with students studying in Paris.

My favourite oasis in Paris. I have retreated to these gardens for as long as I can remember when visiting Paris and it is always such a pleasure. It's great for kids with donkey rides, little yacht boats for hire to push for kids to push with sticks from the sides of le Grand Bassin, a merry-go-round where kids can collect keys as they glide round and every-so-often a puppet show. As for the adults - a feast of the senses of the French and English gardens, and a discovery trail - whether seeking out the bee hives nestled in a corner since 1856, the orchid and rose gardens, the graceful Baroque Medici fountain (or the more secret Fontaine de Leda) or the free photography exhibitions hung on the railings. Definately highly recommended!

Formal gardens. The finest formal gardens in Paris; an army of gardeners work tirelessly to give a magnificent display in all seasons. Fine atmosphere of people jogging, reading, enjoying a coffee, or simply strolling through.
very nice. very nice garden. u see a lot of green space ( unlike the jardin des tuileries ) .. nice flowers . one must go and hang out there especially on a sunny day
Take a break!. Nice stroll thru the garden....spectacular Fountain. Or just have a sandwich on a bench after a long morning walk.
Relax. Why not take a break from this frenetic city and relax in this little Eden on the center of the city and pick a bench to sit on and smell the roses.
Beautiful park on the left bank. Beautiful park to sit and people watch, fountains, tennis courts, exquisitely maintained, classically Parisian spot

No better place for a picnic lunch !. Pretend you are Parisian ... get some bread, cheese, some meats, fruit and of course some fantastic French Wine. Pick a spot - any spot in the Garden on a warm day and just enjoy how the French enjoy relaxing and strolling through the gardens. it does not get much better than this.

Dinner in the Gardens. We spent a couple of evenings just sitting under a tree watching the world go by. There are plenty of chairs scattered around to sit on. A perfect place to eat baguettes,cheese and tomatoes.
Area of ​​wildlife in the heart of Paris!. Wonderful palace and park ensemble in the heart of Paris! Ideal for walks together and for a solitary pastime: contemplation and prayer!

Never wanted to leave. I literally spent an entire day at and around these gardens. So relaxing to just sit around the fountains. The Medici fountain is a must see, its incredible! It was nice and quiet throughout the afternoon, around 5pm this place came alive. Tons of people just strolling thru the park enjoying the beautiful weather. At one point a small orchestra was playing the most beautiful music in one section of the park. This was by far my favorite place in Paris.

Wonderful gardens especially in good weather. How about 70 degrees and no clouds in mid-October........everybody was out enjoying the wonderful Luxembourg Gardens........playing tennis, running, enjoying lunch.

Most magnificent garden and park. An oasis of beautiful gardens, fountains, and park space in Paris. What a way to spend an afternoon...walking, sitting, people watching, and imagining all the history that has occurred here!

Really nice but not much grass available to sit. It's funny how this happen, but this gardens have many chairs and not so much grass space to lay in. The place is still beautiful - you need to visit it - but there are 2 strips of grass which are prohibited of stepping on so everyone cramps in the middle. Come on people release the grass! Joke away, you need to go it's beautiful.

Beautiful. We visited on a chilly day but would love to return on a warm day with a picnic. The grounds are maintained perfectly. This is a great place to let kids run around and enjoy some fresh air while exploring the beautiful scenery.

Excellent Place. I must say of you want to enjoy a sunny afternoon or morning must go there for a relaxing experience, or reading or a walk. Beautiful place with good crowd and gardens. Grab a chair and sit anywhere you want to. A must visit in Paris.

Wonderful atmosphere. We walked through the Luxembourg Gardens on a lovely sunny autumn day. The gardens are beautiful and the buildings in and around the Gardens are spectacular. There were lots of people in the Gardens on the day we visited both walking and sitting around the pool. There was a really nice atmosphere in the Gardens which made our walk all the nicer. A very enjoyable hour in the sun.

Beautiful. Its just gorgeous. I won't spoil it with words.So relaxing. So beautiful. So central.The atmosphere takes you away from a bustling city and transports you into a relaxing garden with beautiful flowers, great cafes and views of the louvre and Eiffel tower. Magnificent.
Relax and enjoy. Relax and enjoy, many places just to sit and watch. Beautiful and safe. Food at the restaurants is OK, but there is room for improvement.

A must see. Beautiful, quiet gardens in the centre of Paris. Had to see it after reading that Hemingway loved to visit here. Don't think it would have changed that much since his time. Lovely, serene gardens.
Great for reading. Beautiful gardens where you can relax, read and people watch. Such a diverse gathering of people locals and tourists mix well.
pretty place to relax or take a stroll. When we needed a place to relax this was the perfect location, beautiful landscaping and buildings and a lawn to have a picnic on.

Beautiful Oasis. Luxembourg Gardens is a lovely jewel of a park just a short walk from the Pantheon and Sorbonne University. This massive park has gorgeous flowers, a fountain, the architecturally beautiful Luxembourg Palace and lots of lawn chairs to sit and relax in. There are great photo opportunities wherever you look. You can spend an hour or more taking in the beauty and resting when you need a pause from touring the city.

Beautiful Park in the Center of Paris. Great place to take a jog early in the morning. The park is huge and the estate and grounds are just gorgeous. You can get some amazing photos from this Garden. When you want a break from the hectic pace of Paris, go to this Garden and just enjoy the peace and tranquility for an hour or two. Plenty of chairs to sit around the fountain and just watch the world go by!
Lovely place for a break.. Very pretty gardens and it is a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. We had a soft drink and sat in the shade - very pleasnat.

Lovely but confused by the map!. We really enjoyed the gardens as a relaxing place. It was very busy (although it was a Wednesday) but our disappointment was self-inflicted. The map showed a young children's playground in the north west of the gardens and we went expecting slides and swings. I think these facilities were in the south west of the garden (it is massive, and very well kept) but unfortunately we had to take our increasingly irritable offspring off for some food.My only advice - leave some time to explore this place!

Beautiful Gardens. The beautiful garden hosts the French Senate. You can have a pleasant walk there or have a seat around the water basin and enjoy a lovely morning or afternoon with friends or family. There are many sculptures of French queens all around the garden. This place is good for relaxation and tranquility.
The Gardens. Beautiful, tranquil, sit for a cup of coffee and watch the world go by. We go every time we are in Paris.

An Oasis in the heart of Paris. The gardens are wonderful. The leaves were just starting to change colors. There were children sailing their boats in the fountain. A wonderful place to sit and eat your simple bread, ham and cheese sandwich from a local shop. Very quiet, even with a lot of people around. Very relaxing and refreshing.

Wonderful park. If you have kids, you should consider staying near this park, which has plenty of area to run around in, and plenty of activities. There is a W.C. which charges, but at least it's nice to have one available. There is an RER station (connects easily to the metro) at east entrance and two just north. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and it is within walking distance of excellent shopping and sites. Even if you don't have kids, this park is well worth seeing and staying close to.

A place to relax & a beautiful venue when the colorful flowers are in bloom.. When you are tired from all the walking on pavements go to the Luxembourg Gardens for some relaxation. A large, magnificent garden with many chairs for you to sit & just contemplate the loveliness of central Paris - period buildings & colorful flowers with well manicured lawns make it all so pretty.
No wonder the Parisians love it. Such lovely gardens to wander around. Sit by the lake and let the world pass you by. Little wonder the place is popular with visitors and locals.
very popular. Maybe too popular, it is very crowded on week-ends and you can not find a seat around the fountains. Better go in the morning.
Lovely gardens!. Spent a nice quiet hour or two here, just to recharge and enjoy some fresh air. We ate some ice cream and watched a group of men play a pretty intense game of boules. Simply lovely.
time to relax and enjoy. an enjoyable walk from our hotel. Once in the park, one is able to amble about at leisurely pace and enjoy the surroundings. Offer a peaceful spot in the busy city.

Best garden in Paris. One of the best maintained gardens in Paris. So many other have deteriorated or are under construction. Visit on a sunny day, get a gelato and sit by the water and enjoy the beautiful flowers.

A love-ly spot any time of the year. Le Jardin du Luxembourg is one of my favourite spots in Paris. I don't come back time and again for anything particular. Just like in Central Park in NYC being in a green oasis in the heart of the metropolis is enough for me - any time of the year! When the chestnuts blossom, or on a hot July afternoon, or like now when the leaves turn golden and fall.For reading - be it a newspaper, poetry or my iPad -, having an improvised picnic, lazily watching busy children running after their sailboats around the central pond, socialising with friends or watching people - those many available green chairs have a magic attraction on me. And compared to Central Park Luxembourg Garden is tiny - there is no risk of getting lost. So try it, try getting lost, wonder around without a purpose (I still haven't found all the statues which are supposed to be famous...), and enjoy your day.Joie de vivre...and highly recommended!

Perfect picnic spot in the city. The Luxembourg Palace was built by Marie de Medici.The gardens surrounding the palace are now used by the French Senate. It is about a twenty minute walk from St. Germain Boulevard. There is a big playground for children, tennis courts, an area for boule (French game played with hard balls) and a big pond where toy boats can float. There are statues of different aristocrats.It is nice to enjoy the greenery and the flowers in this very attractive park.

Picnic in Paris with Parisians. After an astonishing morning at the Rodin Museum, and with the sun peaking out of the clouds, we headed for the Luxembourg Gardens by a short Metro trip. As we entered we hit lunch time and legions of Lycee and middle school students with food purchased locally headed into the park We walked past the beekeeper's school (live hives to pollinate the fruit tree orchard) and saw high school kids eating in groups, a one on one exercise class with a personal trainer, tennis and lots of flowers. After a leisurely lunch on chairs in the park, we sauntered to the pond and the view of the Palais de Luxembourg (Senate stis here - can't go in). We picked green chairs around the beautiful flowers and watched real Parisians enjoy. A great setting and one no one should miss.A formal but relaxed place, and a great place to get a sense of what it might be like to be a Parisian.

Beautiful garden to spend a day. We visited the Luxemburg Garden the day before we left Paris. The garden is beautiful and it is a wonderful place to people watch. Pack your lunch and a bottle of wine, a good book and stay the day and relax. Then head for dinner in one of the many cafe in the area.

A nightly walk in the Park after dinner. Our first wonderful sight of Paris after getting off the RER from our flight was Luxembourg Gardens....our apartment was a few minutes walk away and we visited many times especially some evenings after dinner.....we came to realize that the Parisians use this park as an escape from their hectic pace of life.....it was where they relaxed, brought their children to play tennis or in the playground or sail there small sailboats in the pond and where people gathered to talk and laugh or read a book or catch some rays from the sun or to sit on a blanket and have a picnic....sometimes the park was very busy but it always felt comfortable, safe and relaxing....we often walked through the entire park and enjoyed it immensely.

I didn't find anything great. There is nothing great for a tourist, unless wants to spend a day relaxing in a park kind of feel. Very little flowers and hardly anything to see.There are few pay and use rides for the kids and tennis courts. I didn't find anything great.
Pleasant. Stopped here a couple of times as it was near our hotel. Fun to watch the children "sail" the sailboats. So much going on here it was fun just to stroll around and watch people.

A lovely afternoon walk. On our first day in Paris, we decided to take a walk towards the Left Bank through the gardens. There were a lot of people enjoying themselves. They were playing ball, chess, drawing, reading, in the children's playground or just watching other people. There were lots of flowers in bloom, no litter around, and we were surprised to see a small copy of the Status of Liberty. Everyone seemed to be having fun.
Beautiful. Nice park with attractive statues, inconvenient bathroom, maps unclear to English only traveler, no indication where the miniature Statue of Liberty was which I wanted to see.

Very well kept. The restaurant/cafe offers very good light bites and extremely good coffee. It's a nice place to sit outside and watch the world go by. Staff very courteous and friendly and not overpriced.
Spectacular. Lovely oasis right in the middle of Paris. Beautiful gardens, good clean public tioilets. Nice cafe.

Relax and watch. This is one of our favorite places in Paris. We spent an early morning having coffee in the park cafe and watching families stroll around with their children. It is a beautiful, peaceful way to spend time getting away from the streets of Paris

Restful garden in Paris. A lovely garden (beware it closes at 7 in October) with strollers, walkers, and joggers. Beautiful trees, flowers, fountains and gardens line the stone footpaths- not to be missed.
Great Gardens. We wandered through the gardens away from the hustle and bustle. Nice place to relax in the heart of Paris. Lots of chairs to sit on and people watch.
Beautiful Gardens. Was a very nice gardens. Beautiful flowers and well maintained. Went on a sunday morning and it was full with joggers and children playing with their families.
Majestic and peaceful. Now I understand why Parisians spend their Sundays in the park ... This one is so tranquil and beautiful, and I will return every chance I get!

A fun weekend outting!. Great place to take little ones. The sailboats are fun for the whole family and an affordable activity. The playground is great, but very busy on weekends. We brought our own lunch in and had a picnic.
Lovely and quiet. A lovely spot to sit and have some time out. We grabbed some yummy macaroons from Pierre Hermé and sat on a bench. Wasn't over crowded and didn't feel touristy.
Great park for sunny days. This park is one of the best to read or study during a sunny afternoon. One of the most chilling places of Paris.

beau jardin. very beautifull garden if weather is good.
we made a picnic and children liked alot.
i would certainly come back in summer.
Wonderful. A beautiful garden to visit, take a stroll, people watch, and relax. This is a great place to capture some photos as the garden has some gorgeous views.

In a word ... gorgeous. The Luxembourg Gardens are a beautiful oasis in the middle of one of the most vibrant sections of Paris. It was amazing how spectacular the flowers were in late-September. As with many parks in Paris, chairs are everywhere, making it easy to stop and smell the flowers.

A nice quiet location in the Latin Quarter. After driving in the Paris traffic and coming to the Latin Quarter, it was a welcome stop. It is a very beautiful garden with a wide range of plants, flowers and trees. There are benches and chair all around for use for viewing the gardens or resting. there are restroom facilities on site.

Take a picnic lunch to really stop and relax.. The Luxembourg Gardens are a lovely place for a relaxed picnic lunch. Easy to get to on foot, with plenty of space to grab a chair, and take a break from the bustle of the Latin Quarter.
The gardens are very big, beautifully laid out and well maintained. I would go out of my way to visit them.

Beautiful walk. A beautiful walk and something different.Pretty and scenic.Well maintained. Although would not go to the stall that sells food and drink. Ordered a tea and was given earl grey with milk already added that looked like milk water in a small cup and was charged 3.50 euros for it!Other than that the gardens are worth a trip to on a sunny warm day.

A lovely relaxing outing. If you would like to spend some quiet time relaxing perhaps on a Sunday when most things in Paris are closed, head to the Luxembourg Gardens. It is a peaceful day, which you can spend reading a book on one of the many chairs available, or watching little children race tiny toy sailboats across a pond. There was some live classical music on the Sunday that I was there. Ice-creams are for sale at the entrance which could be nice. Or take with a lunch and eat it on one of the benches under the shady cover of the pretty trees.

Picnic in Luxembourg Gardens. Not sure what sets Luxembourg Gardens apart as a picnic destination, but this place seems magical. Friday at lunch there are a ton of people enjoying lunch and hanging out in the lawn by the chestnut trees. Enough people to make it feel fairly 'local,' but not so many as to be overwhelming. The flowers and garden are immaculate and of course, the palace, pond and statuary all add to the ambiance. Bio Marche St. Germain is a great market for supplies and Le Bon Marche also has everything your could need for a picnic, including many bio (organic) items. Lovely place!
Lovely. Very busy gardens, visited on the weekend near closing like everything in Paris the view was breathtaking.
Beautiful place to visit. The Gardens of Luxemburg was a beutiful place, super relaxing and gorgeous gardens and views. Make sure to bring your camera with you

Live a little. This was a lovely garden and Parisiennes were out in force to relax and enjoy life. Americans could learn a lesson here about really living. We had done a lot of walking the day we found the Luxembourg Garden. Taking an hour to just sit and relax by the fountain, people watch, read a book was very reviving.
Beautiful Gardens. What a perfect place to grab something to eat and watch the world go by. From Tai chi to tennis there was lots to see. Well maintained very beautiful
Stunning gardens. The gardens are magnificent, well worth a morning or afternoon visit when in Paris. We enjoyed wandering the gardens and enjoying the peace and tranquility there.

Wonderful Garden. This is one of the loveliest gardens in Paris. You can wander thru the quiet greenery, view the beautiful flowers and statues, sit by the large pond relaxing in the green chairs, watch children playing in the playground (all ages), tennis, basketball, chess and boules games. It's a great place to have a picnic or dine in the charming café while listening to the music in the bandstand. This is an absolute must site to visit when in Paris and plan to be there several hours.

Paris has the most beautiful gardens. but I think this one tops them all. Just sit and people watch while you sip a glass of wine. We always go there our last day in Paris to say goodbye until next time.

Unforgettable day at the park. We decided to buy bread, ham, cheese, red wine, chocolate and have lunch at the park. It was so much fun and it was for sure one of the highlights of our Paris trip. The Park it self is beautiful and you can easily spend there the whole afternoon. A must visit if you're in Paris!
Beautiful place. This place is buzzing of locals and tourists, but there still are enough seats around the park for everyone. Everything looks well cared fore and beautiful.
Great playground for kids. Nice gardens with a great playground for the kids, although the playground did cost 2.50 euro for admission.
Beautiful gardens. Loved just sitting, watching the world go by. Watching the boats being sailed on the central fountain/lake. It's where all the Parisian families go to relax. Simply lovely

Luxembourg Gardens. What a beautiful place to stroll, sit, and have a glass of wine. The Parisians were out in full force this day after having cold and rain the month pf August. It was wonderful seeing them enjoy such a a lovely place in the heart of the city. There was a jazz band that paced in a gazebo just over from the cafe. The entire day was just fun and relaxing.

Breathe the Paris. The sun, children, seniors, lazy walk, joggers and all the merry Saturday business at it's very best, in the heart of life inspiring city. Isn't that something to witness and be part of? À bientôt :)

lovely place to walk through. We took a casual walk through the gardens, a lovely place to relax in and enjoy the gardens and the people. There is a place to eat in the gardens but it is not cheap so we went over the road from the gardens for a coffee
An oasis. A beautiful park to sit, relax and watch Parisians sit, relax and play. One of the nicest spots in Paris, and close to some really interesting sites such as the Pantheon.

Resting spot in Paris day - also good for kids. A nice park, a bit off the beaten track for tourists but not for French - there are always many people in this park. The central part is a large pond the area surrounding it has many chairs occupied by people reading or just chatting. We usually grab a coffee and relax for a while when we "do Paris". It is a short walk from the Pantheon (3-5 minutes), Sorbonne (5 minutes), and Quartier Latin (10-15 minutes). The Musee de Luxembourg is located in the park which often features nice exhibitions. For kids is a nice place to run around, and you can hire boats which they can play with in the pond which keeps them busy and running for at least half an hour. Perfect when the weather is nice. Note that it has opening hours - first half of october it closes at 18:45, second half 17:15 and so on (time table available on webpages of senat.fr).

What a nice green area in the heart of Paris.. It was so nice to see fall come in and the joggers out on a Sunday morning. Good view of Eiffel Tower and a great place to see lovely flowers and just take a good walk and relax. Very close to hotel

Beautiful Gardens with so much to do ... During our stay in paris in September 2014 we visited the Luxembourg Gardens quite a few times with our three children ( 6yo/8yo/10yo)..First time to look around and sail the boats along the lakeThe next time for the children to play in the playground which costs a small fee of 2.5 euros but they were occupied for hours in there. Finally just to have a picnic . As we were staying quite close to the gardens it was very easy to do this numerous times. It was also great for the kids to have a bit of a disconnection from all the sights of Paris ..

Great spot for a picnic. This was our second time in Paris, and after all the top-tier places to visit, the LG were on our list. Though we didn’t do it, the gardens are definitely picnic friendly with several places near-by to get all the necessary fixin’s. The garden is large, but manageable, and in my humble opinion more fun to visit than those of Versailles. The picnic is one thing, but so too is the lack of crowds and the free admittance. The property has many, many statues including a smaller version of an American favorite. There are plenty of chairs and shady places to sit. Bring a Frisbee, a bottle of wine or a book and enjoy the day!

Jardin. Luxembourg gardens is one of the most beautiful parks in Paris. It is filled with flowers, ponds and chairs and locals just relaxing or doing their work. It is really neat and nice and peaceful, despite it is situated in the centre ville, as they say. A must visit.
Beautiful Gardens. Stumbled across these gardens while walking through the area. Great place to sit or walk through in the late morning or to each your lunch like a lot of the locals.
Excellent spot. Wonderful park in Paris, nice and calm and away from the swathes of tourists that occupy the rest of the city.

Give it a miss unless you're <10 or over 65. Its a garden, with walkways and a small water body in the middle of it. If you're in Paris for 2 weeks then perhaps bring a small picnic bag with you and enjoy the sunshine, but if you are in Paris only for 3-4 days then give this a complete miss.The only merit of going here could be an easy walk to Pierre Herme the renowned Chocolateur.
Great place for a morning walk in September. The park is like a living room for people both local and tourists to spend some quality time in the busy city of Paris.
A beautiful park in central Paris!. If you need to unwind while in Paris, this is the perfect place! The surroundings are filled with beauty and will surely inspire you.

Family park. It was a family fun park! Kids playing with their friends.. Dad playing badminton with his son. Some people just sitting, reading, looking for a warm sunshine. Flowers are really beautiful and colourful.

Exquisite, just exquisite. I didn't go here until the last day of my trip, and I wish I would have gone sooner. It's so close to the Pantheon and Notre Dame -- do yourself a favor and hit this place early in your trip in case you want to go back. Iy is littered with sculptures, flowers, trees, and a beautiful view. This is a perfect place to grab a seat and eat lunch, read, chat or just relax. I had planned on just having lunch here, however, I loved it so much I came back after some sight seeing to just sit there and take it all in.
Sunny Oasis. Was there in September. Not a huge park but an oasis away from traffic and noise of Paris. there are chairs provided to sit by pond and soak up the flowers and sun.
Very beautiful!. A relaxing place to take a walk or sit on one of the many chairs that are put permanently in the garden. You can even jog if you like, as many people do there.

Must come for any visit to Parix. Beautiful garden with many places to sit and enjoy the landscape and people watching. I like this much better than the Tuileries garden. It's a short walk if you visit the Pantheon.
Great place to relax, go jogging. Ran in the Luxembourg gardens. A nice park in the middle of the Quartier Latin. Lots of people go there to relax.

Very nice spot. I spent some time here, as it was close to the hostel I was staying at just to relax and refocus my thoughts on everything I had been seeing during my solo trip to Paris. Granted, I was there in the winter, so the park was not too busy as it was cloudy and cold.
Wow, so tranquil. Such a beautiful tranquil area in the heat of Paris. A must see when visiting Paris. Pack a pinic basket and make a day of it.

A world away. So tranquil even on a busy weekend. Here it is impossible to imagine there is any trouble on earth at all. Egalitarian, too, welcoming old-age pensioners, couples, young families, and solo strollers alike. Beautiful lawns, gardens, trees, walking paths, statuary, a palace, even a little cafe with outdoor tables, grand but approachable too. A favorite spot to rest and enjoy.

Go to these gardens!. Paris is full of beautiful gardens and parks but the Luxembourg Gardens were simply outstanding. Take a book and a snack, grab one of the green lounge chairs, and sit back and enjoy yourself with the scores of Parisiennes who really know how to enjoy themselves.

Amazing garden - take a picnic. As we walked to the central gardens through the trees it just opened up to beautiful flowers, sitting areas, fountains and sculptures. It was so beautiful! and such a fun surprise. We had packed a picnic and a bottle of wine. And there are chairs scattered about everywhere for visitors. It appeared to be many locals and college students (Sorbonne University is nearby). Everyone was enjoying a lovely Sept afternoon - a wonderful respite in your day, whether sight-seeing or working.

A Bit of Peace and Quiet in Paris!. Spent 10 days with my beautiful wife in Europe. Started in the city of Bruges, Belgium and ended in "La Ville-Lumière" or The City of Lights - Paris! During our 4 days of venturing out, we visited all the major sites to see. The Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triumph, the Louvre, The Palace of Versailles....too many to list! Pictures in history-books-past did not do justice to the true beauty of these historic places!A true stand out worthy of mentioning was The Luxembourg Gardens. Once only accessible to royalty, the grounds of this magnificent palace were breathtaking! Perfectly manicured and teeming with locals, we were able to grab some chairs and bask in the sun for an hour. A great break from the hustle and bustle of exploring the streets of the The Left Bank! Highly recommend a visit!
Best Urban Park In the World?. Does it get any better? Perfection in gardens, trees, fountains, strolling, park luncheon tables and chairs....no park anywhere is more pleasant.

Like Central Park in ny. Many zones for many activities. Old, old trees. Sculpture. Large left bank presence. Really impressed by paris parks and more playgrounds for kids than I recall from prior visits

Relax here and read. This is a beautiful park. It isn't like the natural parks of the untied states but it has a great charm. The trees and the statues make for a nice place to relax. There is a nice boat pond and pony rides too which make for some fun scenes to watch. Went back twice. It is a marvel to witness. Seeing a palm tree in the middle of paris should make it worth it.
