A favorite park in Paris!. It's beautiful, peaceful, and constantly changing, with new plantings happening often. The location is in my favorite area in the city.

Flowers everywhere. The gardens are spectacular and are a lovely place to take a break and do some people watching. It was a bit far from where we were staying (which was close to the Tuileries), so if you are short on time and can choose between Luxembourg and Tuileries, there is not too much of a difference, both are beautiful, so choose what is convenient.

Sunday afternoon in the park. lovely gardens, great place to stroll on a nice day. very crowded with locals and very few places to sit on the grass, if that's what you're looking for. Great live music!

Relax in a Beautiful Garden. Take some time on your visit to Paris to relax in one of the most beautiful gardens in the city. Grab a sandwich outside at le Fournil, an eclair at Dalloyau and sit at a bench in Luxembourg Gardens to enjoy the sights, sounds, view and food of Paris. It is a busy place at lunch and beware upon entrance, those joggers are quite serious around the outside path.

A pleasant walk. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle, just step back in time a bit and take a leisurely walk through the gardens.Plenty of seats, shade, sunshine, whatever you need.Its free too !

Perfect for Children and Grown-Ups alike. There are pony rides and you can hire an old fashioned model sailing boat and stick (with which to prod it on it's way) to sail from side to side on the central ornamental pond. Manicured lawns and formal flower beds in profusion........buy a baguette and a pastry from a nearby Patisserie and sit in the sun whilst the children play contentedly.

Watch the Kids and Their Sailboats, Sit in a Chair and take it All In. Great break near the University and Boul Mich -- the fancy end of the Left Bank, but totally accessible to natives and visitors. I love the basin and the sailboats.

Beautiful Gardens in Paris!. We happened upon Luxembourg Gardens as we were exploring Paris. It's such a beautiful, tranquil park with chairs surrounding the pond that you can rest back and relax on! It was a nice break from our explorations!

Relaxing place. This is where all Parisians flock to on a Sunday with family and friends. The place is teeming with activity from boat-racing in the pond to baseball to outdoor performances in the pavillion.It's a very lively place to do sports of even to just have a picnic.

Parisiens at play. After a morning at the Rodin, we strolled to the Luxembourg Gardens and enjoyed an afternoon picnic in the park. It is a lovely park with grassy meadow, ponds, children's playground and rides and even pony rides. It was lovely to spend a Sunday afternoon watching families relaxing together. And, it was a good respite for us after a week of touring museums.

hangout for the locals. Jardin de Luembourg is a popular hangout for Parisiens of all ages, and it is easy to see why. There is a sandy area for playing Petanque (just watch how the old guys do it) and paths for running and strolling; the historic orchard with trees from two centuries ago is there; and there are playgrounds and palces to picnic.

Fun place to people watch or enjoy some green space. My wife and I stayed at a hotel pretty much right across the street from the garden. We were in the garden every day. This place is huge. But there is plenty of seating and grass for lounging. Be sure to watch out for the joggers around the outside.

Very nice. Our Left Bank Rick Steve's self guided walking tour ended up here and unfortunately we didn't allocate enough time to spend here but will upon our next visit. It was getting late and we had a night tour set up so we had to pull ourselves away before we were ready to leave. Great place to see Parisians living life.
Lovely Evening Walk!. The gardens are beautiful with various evening activities and events! We enjoyed a lovely evening walk with live choir playing in the garden! The place is very rejuvenating!

Finest gardens in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are in a relatively quiet part of Paris, south of the river and away from top tourist attractions. Nearest metro stations are Luxembourg or Saint-Sulpice. The Pantheon is very close by. It is a perfect place to bring kids. The huge central lake has model boats for hire and plenty of park benches. Elsewhere you will find tennis courts, boule and hidden away a puppet theatre. The grounds are Italian Baroque in style and were built for Marie de Medici in 1615, who lived in the impressive Luxembourg Palace. Today the palace is home to the French Senate and guarded by gendarmes. Hidden away near the park entrance on Rue Guynemer in the west is the earliest version of the Statue of Liberty.

Great place to set and relax. While touring around Paris running from attraction to attraction, this is the place to just stop, sit and enjoy the park for awhile.No major sites, but a great park in town ... but sit and watch the people stroll by ... very relaxing before you start running around again.

Beautiful Color!. Color abounded when we strolled thru Luxembourg Gardens....while I had been to Paris several times before, I had never been to these Gardens....there were a riotous color of summer flowers planted everywhere which contrasted beautifully with so many large urns.The Gardens had ample seating where one could just sit and enjoy people watching!
Best park for kids. Nothing in the guide books about just how wonderful this park is to hang out with the kids and have fun. Loved the pony rides in the mini cart.

extensive fun place to run, walk or relax. The gardens are huge with lovely trees and many flowers. Runners are frequent as are folks eating lunch on one of the many benches or just visiting or taking in the sun.

Luxembourg gardens to enjoy some tranquil time. I was lucky to visit this time in early Autumn.... Such a beautiful place to be...with the ever changing colours and shapes of Autumn. Time out to sit and read, lay and watch the sun disappear into night or escape the heat of the day and the buzz of the streets, people and the continuous cafes.... Yet in the heart or this amazing city.

Free in Paris. This is a place to sit down and people watch. No specific sights. Just wander around and grab a chair and a coffee from one of the nearby outlets. The area around the central pond is the best spot to be.Relax.......

Simply beautiful - if only I lived near somewhere like this!. I'm keeping this review short and sweet because it's one of those places I think everyone should visit during the Spring/Summer in Paris and see for themselves - I don't want to paint a picture for anyone because I went to Luxembourg Gardens by chance on my way to Notre Dame and was overwhelmed by the beauty of it - I hadn't expected anything like it.We were lucky that it was 27 degrees with blue skies when we stumbled upon here. I could have stayed for hours. The gardens are huge and the flowers are stunning - I've never been to a garden like it. There are hundred of beautiful metal chairs and benches around, with people sat reading and relaxing in the beauty...I was so jealous of all those you could tell lived near by and were able to enjoy the gardens whenever they wanted!I would never visit Paris again without going back here.

Delightful walk in the Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are pure delight in the heart of the Left Bank. This is often an overlooked Parisian site because it is not particularly near some of the other more traveled sites. If you are looking for somewhere that is just for pure enjoyment (and perhaps a small orchestra recital - which is awesome), make the effort to stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens.
Best garden. Very relaxing and beautiful garden ! one of the best in paris. Well placed fountaines and really nice landscaped gardens amazed us.

A Fun Place to Rest or Play for Kids and Adults. In early September, on a beautiful sunny day, the grass was a deep green, the flower borders were in full bloom, and Parisians were out in force. In addition to the more formal areas, where you can relax in metal chairs and do whatever, there are also a number of statues to study, paths to wander down, and more. We watched kids have a really loud and fun time in an enclosed playground, toddlers in sandboxes and wading pools, older folks playing boules, and beekeepers tending their hives. And, we only had time to visit a part of this oasis in the city.

Kick-back, Relax & Enjoy .... My partner & I spent quite a few hours here at the Luxembourg Gardens. Taking in the beauty of the landscaped gardens, and equally surrounded by a number of well placed fountains was a sight to behold. Even though there were many a tourist attendance, we had no problems locating a nice quiet spot to ourselves.This was our first visit up close and personal, and hopefully, it won't be our last!

Beautiful garden. I could have sat there all day just people watching if I didm"t have such a huge list of bookshops and museums to also visit! Beautiful huge gardens - its of spots for sitting by flowers or the fountain, with the backdrop of the senate/palace
Nice way to spend a Sunday in Paris. What a beautiful way to spend a Sunday in Paris. Bring a picnic and sit in one of the chairs or stroll the gardens. A nice slice of Paris life.

Lovely way to spend an afternoon. Wow a big formal garden in the middle of Paris, lots of flowers and open space to just walk around or sit in and chillForm the L'Open tour take the orange route and get off at Stop 31 - Luxembourg

A lovely tranquil park which is used regularly by locals. It was great to see seats placed all around on paths so that people could rest, read or chat. Well-kept lawns, interesting statues and one of the prettiest display of flowers in gardens in Paris. Lots of joggers and activities and a community atmosphere.
Busy Garden. It is great to see all the locals playing and utilising these beautiful gardens. A pleasant afternoon.

Beautiful. A pretty peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Loved it. Like that it so close to the city centre and a great place for a picnic. Pick up one of the scrumptious filled baguettes from a local bakery a bottle of wine, heaven.
Beautiful!. A great place to sit back and have a little romantic lunch with the wife and rest for little while. There are some amazing statues and water features to enjoy.
Leisure at it's best. So relaxing to take a stroll and just relax along the benches, chairs by fountain, or along the grass...a must see especially in the warm months!

Well appointed and laid out. Well kept french formal gardens and less formal tree lines surround central fountains and look upon a grand palace converted now into the French Senate. Visitors can re-arrange chairs to make picnics, or play cards or just enjoy the beautiful space.

Luxembourg Gardens - Always Beautiful. The gardens are always lovely, but this was the first time we were there in the fall. There were tons of gorgeous flowers still in bloom, and visitors taking a break (or having a picnic. Lovely.
Beautiful. Can't miss this! The gardens are spectacular! We enjoyed walking around and admiring all the flowers that were in bloom. Picture perfect setting.

An Urban treat. Beautiful flower filled gardens with plenty of comfortable places to sit and enjoy the views and fountains. A great park for tourists and locals alike with tennis, running tracks, and majestic sculptures.

A Must Landmark to Visit. Classic French gardens where you can see / watch a variety of activities. Relax watching children guide toy sailboats, young artists drawing, children taking tennis lessons, men playing card games etc. The gardens are well maintained & offer a unique opportunity to spend hours seeing the Parisian lifestyle. Enjoy !!
Take time to sit and enjoy the peace.. What a beautiful place to be with your sweetheart. Lots of benches and park to just sit and talk, people watch and plan your life! Beautiful!

Just go there and enjoy. We went to these lovely gardens twice during our trip to Paris and simply loved it. We sat near the large pool and watched the kids play with the sail boats. It was a lovely way to spend a few hours on a beautiful sunny afternoon. Just go there and enjoy.

Beautiful place for all.. We stayed in an apartment just down the rd from Luxembourg Gardens, loved them we visited a few times,also walked through to go to other places. Beautiful. Great place for family's with a great area for mums & bubs. Plenty of seating very relaxing.
Simply gorgeous. A lovely open area full of Parisian charm and seats to sit and enjoy the flowers and scenery. We liked the gardens so much we returned later for lunch in the park!

Beautiful park to just sit and smell the roses.. Great park to relax in after touring all the museums. Children playing near the lake, birds chirping, flowers blooming. Stop touring for just an hour to rest and people watch.
Simply Beautiful. This is some garden! Nothing like you would expect to find in the middle of the City. A must visit after all the museums .
a must see. if you want a relaxing afternoon, take a baguette and a bottle of wine to the Luxembourg Gardens. Gorgeously groomed with a fountain for children to race sailboats. Fantastic in Fall.

"Chill". Viewing the gardens is difficult to imagine this was someone's back yard. The Chateau is spectacular on its own. Very pleasant, folding chairs are every where for sitting. You can also sit or lay on the large sections of lawn. Beautiful.
Always beautiful. Good place to relax and have a picnic while enjoying the gardens or watching the tennis players. There is also a bee keeping school and a fruit orchard, both started centuries ago.

Excellent town centre park. Well supported by the locals; plenty of people sitting, strolling, jogging, painting, playing tennis and generally relaxing and enjoying the generously sized and carefully maintained flat spaces. Plenty of metal chairs are scattered around for you to sit on if you feel like a rest! There's about a 5-10 minute walk from the Metro to get to a gate. However, a better park, perhaps, is the steeper Buttes-Chaumont, at the end of Metro line 7, with its waterfall and lovely views of the city.

Go, just for the Statues and the Medici Fountain. So beautiful. Take a picnic and just wander. We spent a half a day there and it is a wonder! Download a map from the internet on where each statue is located. We asked a few workers where the Medici found was and they couldn't tell us. It was my must see at the Garden and we found it eventually. It was as incredible as I imagined.

Lovely. Beautiful garden, and architecture and definitely worth the walk. It is quite colourful and active. There were people jogging, drinking coffee and it's just a wonderful place to take it all in and relax.
nice and wonderful place. nice scenery, very clean and beautiful place. you can go sunbathing here :) the palace and the garden are very nice

One of my favorite places. We stumbled onto Luxembourg Gardens and went back three times. It is the perfect place to relax, picnic, people watch and enjoy the atmosphere. We were amazed at how well the grounds are manicured. Everyone was doing their own thing and enjoying life.We liked the green chairs that you could move to wherever you wanted.

Bring your wine and picnic. Absolute treasure. We came as a last minute decision around 18:30. Filled with young people, friends, business associates relaxing at the end of the day on plentiful chairs. Beautiful gardens, water features, views. People enjoying their wine and socializing. All of sudden around 19:15 loud whistles and gendarmes hearded us all out to close and lock up the park for the night. Don't be like us, pack your wine, your cheese and get there early and enjoy a very Paris afternoon.
Great Playground for Kids. For 2.50 euros, your kids can play on a small zip line in a large playground within the Luxembourg Gardens.
Relaxing. Paris relaxing in the sun. Full of workers and shoppers. Holiday makers and young familiesWonderful time

wonderful park for the family. We spent a couple hours with our children, ages 2 and 4, at this lovely park. It is literally right off the steps of the metro and is a wonderful green space. The playground costs a small entrance fee €2,50 per child and €1,20 per adult. It is nicely enclosed and isn't so sprawling that you lose track of your kids. Great equipment for various ages and very well maintained. There are lots and lots of benches and shade trees so you can stop and enjoy a picnic lunch without bumping into someone else's stroller. There are swings in a separate area that you cannot see from the playground, but as it was a small area that cost another €1,50, we decided to forego it and just head home. Overall a wonderful time for all of us.

Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful gardens, it has something for everyone! Couples picnic'd on the grass, peace and tranquility. In another corner is a large play area for children. Vast amounts of seating. I loved it.

A place to sit in the sun or shade, watch and relax.. I really enjoyed going to the Luxembourg Gardens. A relief from walking endlessly to see the monuments , up and down stairs in the metro etc.... Very relaxing, peaceful, very pretty flowers. Beautiful settings, landscape. Benches and chairs everywhere. I wish it was allowed to lie on the green lawn. I would have loved a quick snooze. But nevertheless so stress relieving , romantic and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are cafeterias lined up on the outside of the park if you fancy a delicious cup of cafe creme. There is a cafe within the park but we didn't try that. Definitely recommend for older people and families.
Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful place to sit and relax. Pretty gardens. We enjoyed walking around and then just sitting for a while.

Charming even in the rain. Beautiful manicured gardens, lots of people, interesting statues... very pretty. Found ourselves under a shared umbrella for 15 minutes in the rain with travellers. Makes for some interesting conversations.

Dropped In. I didn't get to spend as much time here as I did on my last trip. But this is a great place to spend Saturday or Sunday afternoon watching people and little boats. This time I went just before closing on a weeknight. The light was fantastic.
Have a picnic here!. Beautiful place, go to a boulangerie and enjoy a picnic with the great views. Walk around and sit in one of the chairs conveniently located by the lake.

My new favorite place to visit in Paris!. This royal palace is certainly one of Paris' smaller royal residences (esp compared to Versaille, Fontainebleau, and the Louvre - which was originally a palace), but the scale is perfect and the grounds and gardens are lovely. There is a large pond where vendors rent small model sailboats to children on week-ends. The flowering gardens are beautiful, and the formal gardens are lovely. A very popular place for locals to relax and sun on week-ends. The palace is now a government building, but it is a regal and royal setting - and fortunately the gardens and grounds have been kept public. Not to be missed!

Delightful. These delightful gardens are set right in the heart of Paris. They are large with a beautiful collection of trees, a lake, walkways and large expanses of ornamental shrubs and flowering plants. One can enjoy an afternoon simply by wandering the walkways and resting on benches to enjoy the vistas and watch the world go by.

BEAUTIFUL. Walking through these gardens was such a WOW. We have so many beautiful pictures from various vantage points. The fountains are quite unique and the flowers are so stunning. The locals congregate here on Sunday to relax among the beautiful flowers, read books, and enjoy the company of that special someone. You won't be disappointed, that's for sure!!
Stunning. We worth the trip--we were staying in the area so it was easy, but these gardens are just beautiful. The old fountain is lovely.

Great people watching!. we walked here from our hotel several times to run, it is about 2K circumference and has plenty of chairs and benches. There are clean bathrooms, take some change though, they charge to use them. There are very fit locals running at high speeds as well as school kids and tourists alike. It has an extremely safe feeling, beautiful statues and fountains and a museum.

Great for breakfast and watching the world go by!. Great for breakfast and watching the world go by!.An oasis in a busy city. On Sunday morning the locals are out doing tai chi/martial arts in the open air.

Away from the city's buzz. Having enough from all the buzz in Paris? Then take some time of rest in this wonderful and peaceful park Jardin du Luxembourg. You may even spent there a whole afternoon of relaxation, before jumping back into the noise of the streets. Particularly recommended.
Beautiful!. Much more beautiful than any park or garden I've ever been to in America. I sat and read a book and enjoyed the scenery. At the very least you must wall through this place.

slightly off the beaten track. Known for the peace and calm, this garden dates from the early 1600s with updates and renovations through the 1900s. The floral color combinations here are outstanding. There are delightful places to sit and read or nap in the sun. There are fenced in children's play areas. The grand alee, the statuary, the pools and fountains make this a wonderful place to see.

Pretty. A nice park to take a break and relax for a while. I personally wouldnt make a special point of visiting if you are not already in the area. Its a nice place to sit and enjoy a snack from one of the nearby shops but not a place I would say you must have on your itinerary.
peace of mind. It was so quiet to have breakfast each morning but not empty. Parisians going to work or jogging went past but all seemed to be happy.

A riot of colors. Luxembourg Gardens was worth the time and the walk from the Metro to get there ... we could see why Parisians loved it there. Lots of folks picnicking, sailing boats, playing music ... it was beautiful and enchanting.

Fun for everyday Paris.... We visited on a Saturday afternoon and enjoyed watching Parisians relaxing in the park or sailing sailboats in its Octagonal Lake. As for formal gardens, we've seen better. The local people socializing made the garden a fun visit.
Gorgeous gardens. We walked through these gardens on two separate occasions. Beautiful sculptures throughout and many places to sit to relax and people watch. Don't miss.
Great Gardens. A pretty & large area of gardens to relax and enjoy as a family or by oneself. It is patrolled by police, which also makes you feel safer.
Something for everyone. Gardens are genuinely pretty, but loved the outdoor ping pong tables and the seats for people watching!

Arts, park and flower -a nice reest when you seightseeing. Quiet, beautiful, picnic...sculptures. A lot of sitting places, but to little grass to lay down, some dust from the sandy path and toiletfacilities are poor...Food are very expencive inside, but many take aways right outside the park or try La Creperie just beside the Pantheon...good lunchtime in the middle of the day

A Great Place to Stroll Through. The Jardines du Luxembourg was right around the corner from the hotel where we stayed, and we strolled through numerous times. There are lots of benches for people watching, gardens, a pond where children sail boats, a cafe, etc. It's a great way to get a feel of the city and very relaxing. I'd highly recommend it.
Beautiful flowers. A nice lovely place to spend an hour or two. We arrived late so got kicked out too soon. The flowers are bright and beautiful.

Nice place for a break or a picnic!. The gardens are beautiful and there is a good mix of sun and shade with chairs a plenty. If you are looking for somewhere to sit and enjoy the views and people watching - this is it!
Beautiful scenic gardens.. Lovely bright flowers and lawns with ample seats to sit and relax. A very short stroll from the Pantheon.
What a place!. What a nice mixture of bustling garden and quiet tranquil hide away on the side of the park. An oasis in the middle of Paris!
Breathless. You will be in awe of this enchanting gem! Wonderful place to have a picnic & relax, also I didn't see any gypsies lingering like you usually encounter at most tourist attractions.
Lovely chateau and gardens. Easy to appreciate especially in the spring and fall where there is a lot in bloom sans the summer crowds.
Very Relaxing. A bit of piece and quiet in a busy city. The gardens are very colorful and well laid out lots of statues and water features to admire as well
Great place to relax. Very beautiful gardens in the middle of the city. Many Parisians seem to gather there for lunch. Good place to "people watch"

Favourite Parisian spot when the sun is shining.... Beautiful, landscaped gardens with chairs dotted around a large pond/fountain that kids skip toy boats over. Just sit back and relax. C'est tres joli!

Nice walk through the park. Nice place to see locals sit out with their lunch. Bathroom is so-so but there aren't a lot of public facilities in paris. 50 cents to sit and 20 cents to stand. Old but reasonably clean. Not a lot of flowers, just a nice big grassy park with some sculpture.
Stay around the house. The pool and grounds around the house are beautiful, but the long extended part of the garden is dusty and full of kids playing football, and is dirty

Nice formal gardens. Liked everything - not too busy; typical formal gardens and a good café. In the early morning there are lots of fitness fanatics with plenty for them to do and a little later on guided tours arrive, but they don't affect the single traveller from their enjoyment of the garden.

Great boating lake. Super gardens and a particular highlight was the large boating lake where you can hire a sailing boat for 3 Euros and sail if off with a stick and watch it sail around the lake - each boat had the flag of a different country so all the children were enjoying watching them race around and bump into eachother. Great fun.
Great show of animals. Out side of the Gardens on the iron fence around the garden has a beautiful show of lizards, frogs ect. The photos are huge and lit up at night that makes them look alive!

Beautiful Gardens. There is no better place to sit back and enjoy a relaxing day in Paris. Buy a picnic and enjoy in the Gardens, then explore the many little nooks and crannies the gardens has to offer.
beautiful park!. This park was close to where I was staying and I sometimes went running here in the morning. Absolutely beautiful. Perfect for relaxing or sitting with friends.
Always a treat. The Jardins du Luxembourg are always a treat to walk, sit and enjoy. They are always clean and well kept.

Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris with something for everyone. Beautiful setting to take a moment and just enjoy. The gardens are a wonderful series of contradictions that all come together for a delightful experience. Formal gardens yet engaging and not pretentious. Exceptional use of color, texture, space and motion in the design of the flower beds adds to the enjoyable experience. Wander among the trees and check out the sculptures. I found them hidden along the winding paths. The morning is quieter and has less people. Those enjoying the garden included people relaxing, reading, watching people or just talking to each other. Children were playing kickball with their school groups or climbing on play equipment. There is enough space for everyone to do their own activity without getting in the way of others. Park attendants were helpful. Walking paths are clearly delineated. I loved the energy and essence of these gardens.Hidden away and almost missed is the Medici Fountain.
Glorious and peaceful. Planting and layout beautiful ,lots of places to sit to enjoy and relax or take a picnic or meet friends just enjoy!
very pleasant for an evening stroll. Lovely garden and well-used public space. It has something for everyone. Spend some time watching the petanque players - it's a fascinating game.

A peaceful, gorgeous place to spend time. Luxembourg Gardens is one of my favorite spots in Paris. The gardens are gorgeous, especially the Medici fountain. There are lots of chairs and shade to relax from the heat of the day. This is a perfect place to have a picnic, read a book or newspaper or take a little nap.

A nice place to relax on a sunny afternoon. We came here in between charging around Paris and had a relaxing time just sitting and watching people. The grounds are beautiful, and there are chairs and benches everywhere. We especially enjoyed watching the children sail boats on the pond.
Central park of paris. Anything you could ask for in a park. Soooo much green space to roam. We even noticed an interesting array of beehives, which seem to be the rage in Europe these days.

Best Garden in Paris. South of the St Germaine 6th arrondissement is this magnificent living garden which is the absolute best in Paris. Besides the natural well kept floral beauty, the walk from St Germaine is wonderful, and the well kept gardens magnificent!One can sit in offered chairs and benches and do the Parisian thing; people watching, of course! Or one can stroll through shaded groves and luxuriate around fountains. There is also the gem of the statutes and fountains offering picturesque and peaceful environs. To say one is pulled to return time and again is an understatement. We can't wait to return here on our next Parisian visit.

The most beautiful gardens I have ever seen. I am from the Hershey are in Pennsylvania and I used to think the Hershey gardens were the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen. As soon as we arrived that all changed. This property is breath taking and is a perfect spot if you want to have a picnic, rest, or exercise. We did all three. There are a lot of runners and people doing yoga all around the property and its just a great place to come and relax for free! I would come here again in a heart beat.

Beautiful gardens. My friends and I enjoyed a wonderful picnic here. It was absolutely beautiful! While there were no areas allowed for blankets and traditional "picnicking", we found a perfect spot with plenty of chairs and a bench for our wine, cheese, and bread :).
Beautiful Gardens, nice place for a lunch. Sunday afternoon this place was alive with many families who brought their lunches. It was a great place to take a walk or relax after walking all day.

Gorgeous for an afternoon walk. If you can fit this into your trip to Paris, I highly advise you to do so. It's free to go there & there is beautiful architecture, sculptures, and grounds. Often locals set up shop and paint and frankly you could be entertained people-watching or simply taking a relaxing walk through the grounds on the way to your next destination.

Family Friendly retreat from Paris, yet in Paris. My children and I have spent many afternoons in Luxembourg Gardens enjoying the retreat from the sun and business of Paris. There are play areas, fountains, tennis courts, table top tennis etc and simply "green space" to enjoy. We usually stay close to Luxembourg in order to enjoy what the Gardens offers in and amongst Paris.
Where to go on a hot Saturday afternoon. Stroll around the flower beds, watch the sail boats on the pond,sit in the shady cafe with a cool drink, sit and read a book - it's what the Parisians do!

Oasis in a busy city. Perfect for a stroll, sit and read a book or just pull up a chair and people watch. Great little garden vignette throughout. I would like to take some ideas home especially great creative color/ plant combos, just stunning.
Beautiful. The most beautiful park I've ever been to. Bathrooms were very dirty, even though you have to pay for them.

What a gem. The gardens offered a welcome and lovely brief respite from the hubbub of paris
Garden beautiful and well kept and enjoyed by all generations

Wow!! Don't miss this! . We arrived in Paris at 4 pm by train. Decided to walk up to the Gardens after enjoying a cool drink in the Brasserie opposite. It was a balmy Autumn evening. These gardens are magnificent. Not only are they visually spectacular due to the design, buildings , fountains, other water features and flowers, the ambiance there is totally romantic and very unique. Everyone is relaxing on metal chairs and benches , just absorbing and admiring the surrounding beauty. It's divine here.

Great place to wander and people watch on Sundays. Very pretty especially on a Sunny day. A nice place to wander and stop for a rest under the trees. Watching the children playing with the small boats was fun.

Amazing gardens, lots of places to relax. These gardens are not only huge but wonderfully maintained, laid out and presented. There are chairs scattered all around for you to kick back and relax in the Paris sunshine, or to watch people as they walk past. As seems to be the thing you do in Paris.I spent an hour or so just wondering the gardens and taking breaks here and there, it was very relaxing, and in such a great location.
Charming gardens. The gardens are a nice, serene place to hang out or stroll through while in St. Germaine. You can take a picnic lunch to get away from the hustle and bustle of Paris.

Go spend some time walking there. It is a beautiful park it is worth taking a book, a newspaper or a magazine or even an iPad there to read. Seat on a typical chair and relax it is the parisian way of life.

Lovely Gardens. These are large lovely gardens, where one can walk around, or just sit and enjoy. On a lovely sunny (but not hot) day, its just great to just sit in the sun and enjoy the surroundings.

Garden sanctuary. Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris. A great place to stop and catch your breath.
Use the seating provided as some grass areas you are not allowed on and you will be asked to move on.

For children of every age. Everyone will enjoy a stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens. Instead of battling lines, jostling through crowds, paying expensive visitor fees and generally rushing through the city, why not take the time to enjoy this beautiful park? There is so much history here, from the architecture to the generations who have grown up with this beautiful setting as their playground. Lucky for you if the sun is shining and you can stretch out on a bench or on the grass, but even under cloudy skies there is a magic to this place that should be experienced at any time of year.

A Thing of Beauty!. Luxembourg Gardens is very beautiful. It is so much. It has a palace, a museum, a garden, a child's playground, has great statues, has food and drinks available. The flowers were pretty. Prepare to walk alot to see it all. It is very large.
Impressions of a park. Gorgeous day, spent time just people watching! Eiffel Tower is in the distance and we had a marvelous time sitting on the benches watching everyone enjoying the sunshine.

Picnic Escape. Packed a picnic lunch and headed to the Gardens for a peaceful meal beside the Medici fountain. The Gardens are absolutely gorgeous. It isTHE place to observe Parisians breaking for lunch, sunning in chairs, artists at work, children sailing boats in the ponds, joggers, men playing chess- you name it. Yet all this doesn't distract from the beauty and immaculate surroundings of the Gardens. Truly, one of the most beautiful parks in Paris.

Lively, Lovely, Romantic. This place is amazing. I returned after a five year hiatus and this place still rocks! On a sunny day, grab yourself a chair, bring a picnic, or get yourself some ice cream and enjoy the weather. The sculptures are beautiful, although they do not take center stage. Very tasteful. Often, there will be a band playing in the cupola in this garden - you can enjoy it for free! (I've heard Bossa Nova, Beatles Cover, and Rock and Roll so far). Words don't do it justice. Visit and enjoy.

Beautiful and relaxing. We toured the Gardens on a Sunday morning and got to see how many Parisians spend their leisure time. There were many joggers staying fit, dads with their sons operating their remote control sailboats, families picnicking or walking with their sons and daughters in their Sunday best, lovers and others taking in the sun, kids playing in the parks, and a group from the Sorbonnes celebrating frosh week. All this in the most beautiful gardens in Paris.

Get off your feet and relax. This area is beautiful and free! Near the Pantheon and Sorbonne. Lovely places to sit and drink a coffee or crepe from the lovely little kiosk. We watched locals enjoying the sun and the local university students eating their lunch. I liked the gardens here better than Versailles.
Beautiful place, incredible gardens and ponds. The Senat building is gorgeous in itself and the way the gardens are built and maintained are amazing. Great for photo ops on a nice day.

Quiet retreat in Paris. This is a lovely spot in central Paris if you are tired walking around looking at the sites. You can't sit on the grass, but there are loads of seats all around the park and it's a lovely place to have a picnic lunch. There's also a cafe/bar and really clean public loos.
As good gardens get. Not my thing but the Luxembourg Gardens are as good as gardens get. It is very well manicured and well kept. Worth a visit.

Spectacular. If I had one reason to visit Paris it would be to relax for hours and gaze in awe at the splendor of the Luxembourg Gardens. It is a spectacular place with beautiful architecture and sculpture. A magnificent, serene, wonderful place to spend an afternoon.

walking, sitting, enjoy .... walk, sit, contemplate! go in spring, indulge with flower beds, sit in one of the chairs, read, sunbathe, wander, enjoy life, wonderful !! three gardens that I love about Paris: Luxembourg, Jardin des Plants and Tulleries !!
Easy Spirit. Spend the evening with my friend. Nice environment, wonderful chat, good cafe.

A Truly Beautiful Parisienne Park. The Luxembourg Gardens is truly an impressive Parisienne park filled with a lovely color spectrum of flowers and trees, the Medicis fountain, a large central pond, statues, and a pavilion for performances. The day we were there, the weather was perfect for enjoying the full beauty of this park. The Luxembourg Palais, which is an impressive structure in itself, is the backdrop for the park.

A fun run in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens serves as an excellent spot for running or relaxing. I took a run around the gardens, and it was heavenly. It certainly beats running on the busy streets of Paris. So, pack a pair of running shoes and enjoy the view.

Nice place for a walk. Although in the warm days this place is quite crowded, it still can be really relaxing if you simply take a chair and sit under the trees or under the Sun. The gardens were beautiful when I´ve visited and the colors around, painted by the flowers, gave the charm...
Beautiful. The Luxembourg Garden was very close to our hotel. We really enjoyed strolling through it and looking at the amazing scuptures and landscape - would highly recommend.

A lovely place. We never miss an opportunity to visit these lovely gardens. They are beautifully kept and we find it very relaxing just sitting in the provided seats watching people sailing model yachts, exercising, learning martial arts, walking, talking, reading etc. Any tourists are greatly outnumbered by locals

ONE OF THE MOST BEAUTIFUL GARDENS IN THE WORLD. It's almost like being in a film when you visit these glorious gardens. London and other rival European and overseas cities have NOTHING compared to the Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful well tended plants and lawns, beautiful flowers, clean and peaceful and very safe if you have children. Relax with a picnic, play tennis, stroll with your lover or family-this is one of the most beautiful places in the world to chill. You don't have to travel to Thailand or Cambodia or Ayres Rock in Australia. Luxembourg Gardens has a special aura about it..a special feeling and presence. And because it's French or should I say its Parisienne, it has all that chic, elegance and style. The Paris council take a lot of credit for maintaining this beautiful place to such high standards. A must go location.
Beautiful!. Beautiful place with plenty of seating even on a busy day. It's a pretty touristy location, but it's well worth a visit if the weather is nice and you want to relax an people watch.

a gem inside of a beautiful city. the gardens are away from other famous landmarks in Paris, but cannot be ignored. if you take metro to get there, make sure you have data service (roaming) or compass app (or a real one) with you because it can be confusing once you get out from the station. you can follow the signs or follow the crowd. never seems to fail me. haha. just beware that the gardens are not THAT close from the metro. need to walk a bit to get there. once you walk through one of the gates, you see gravel and dirt. it was very disappointing to see but gems are always hidden under unpleasant layer.Have faith/hope and just walk towards the middle of the gardens. soon you will see the gem that's been hiding!! down few steps, you will see what everyone is talking about. a beautiful garden with statutes and trees that are cut like ice cream bars. there is a section where you can sit or lay down on the grass. you can take a nap there or have a picnic time. we brought wine and chocolate and just had a relaxing time in the middle of a beautiful city.MUST-GO!!

Gorgeous gardens-great for relaxing or exercising.. One of the prettiest gardens I have ever seen, with all of the beautiful flowers, fountain, children's play area, etc. Loved walking through and people-watching.

BEAUTIFUL PLACE TO RELAX IN HECTIC PARIS. This was my second favorite garden in Paris, bested only by Monet's garden in Giverny. So many beautiful flowers and sculptures. People jogging, playing tennis or just relaxing around the fountains. I never did find the carousel, but I'm sure it's lovely.
Beautiful. These gardens are really beautiful. wonderful flowers and plenty of places to sit and rest. Nice to watch the children sail their boats which can be rented on this site

An island of serenity in the middle of Paris. We spent several hours in Luxembourg Gardens one afternoon, and returned a second time. There are tree-lined paths, chairs and benches for enjoying a lunch or soaking up the sun. In one area, we watched men hunched over tables playing chess. We also found the bolle courts and watched several matches. In another spot, there's an antique carousel that children were enjoying. On our second visit, children were sailing boats in the pond. One of my favorite spots in Paris. Buy a sandwich nearby and come in and enjoy.
Always lovely. We enjoy the gardens whatever the weather, even in the rain. People watching can sometimes be the best part.
Children can enjoy this park.. At Jardin du Luxenburg children can enjoy pony riding or radio control sail boats. This place is family friendly compared to Tuilellies.

Like walking through a Seurat. Pleasant park, experience the calm, relaxed Paris. It's well-tended and beautiful, less frenzied than a New York park. A great place to walk through between Musee D'Orsay and visiting Notre Dame. A nice place to have a conversation and walk around if you want a refuge from the city streets.
Beautiful and vibrant . The garden is beautiful Nd vibrant. Throughout the garden people are running and lounging and children are playing. A beautiful place in Paris with lots to see!

Pretty, Relaxing. Take a walk, have a drink, hang by the fountain... The flowers are beautiful and so many people are just sitting enjoying the outdoors. We had a drink at the little restuarant in the gardens and then walked around the grounds. Plan to walk through and waste a little time.

Beautiful park with children's playground. I'm very impressed with the park. It's huge, has beautiful flowers, romantic shady trees, a large well maintained children's playground, tennis courts, plenty of garden chairs & benches, cafés & a museum. Such a lovely sight!

Spectacular flowers!. Having picked up wine, bread, cheese on Rue Cler, and scrumptious desserts at Dallayou (right outside the east gate), we had seats overlooking the Gardens, which were just GORGEOUS in full bloom. Great spot for people watching. One of my favorites in Paris!
Garden in the City. Very lived in Park inside the busy City. Playground, Gardencenter, Places to sit. In the morning very busy with Joggers.

Peace and Quiet, Awesome views. If you are into relaxing, then the Luxembourg Gardens are a most for you. I loved them. People reading whilst sunbathing. You could have a lunch on the grass or visit one of the many cafes surrounding it. The museum is closed until October.
Our pick of the Paris gardens. Location, layout and the bonus of the Police band playing in an old iron rotunda under a canopy of gorgeous trees, a stunning outdoor cafe.
Beautiful. the gardens are a wonderful outdoor public space with jogging runs, children's areas, fountains, statues, and just a nice calm environment

Relaxing Time at the Garden. It was so pleasant to be able to walk down the different pathways of this garden, complete with waterfalls and statues. There were many benches to sit on and enjoyed watching the children sailing their little boats on the pond. Also, we enjoyed listening to a band playing classical music while we sipped cappuccinos at a cafe.

Nice place to wind down. You have to beware of pickpockets and fake petition people who try to distract you. Still, it is a lovely park to take one of the many chairs and have a rest after a morning of walking.

Pretty to look at. It was beautiful especially in the lovely sunshine. You can only sit in really specific areas which was annoying. And then some people where sitting in one area and we sat down there and were told off even though others were allowed to stay. However, as I say it is definitely worth going to.

beautiful. it is a really big garden with it's palace at the one end. there is also a museum, the luxembourg palace museum, but it was closed when we've been there. still a lovely beautiful garden. it seem's to be also very popular for the parisian. a lot of people spend time there for relax

Beautiful Gardens. A little piece of Heaven in a crowded city.. Gardens are beautiful. There are lawn chairs to sit and enjoy the view. If you want to people watch, this is the place to do it. Flowers are amazing and the tranquility is perfect.

nice garden nearby Saint-Germain-Des-Près. I always visit to this garden, cosy and beautiful traditional garden in Paris. Many people jogging in early in the morning, relaxing and good access from Saint-Germain-Des-Près area.
Beautiful Gardens. Very nice. They change out the gardens 3 times a year. Also has a nice place to eat outside but is a little pricey as is all food in Paris.

Absolutely Beautiful. While on a recent stay in Paris, I decided to forego the usual cafe lunch and bring a sandwich to the Luxembourg Gardens. It was an extremely hot day and the shade of the trees was so nice. I had been to Paris once before, but never to the Gardens. I absolutely loved it! The landscaping in gorgeous and well kept. There is a fountain in the center where passerby can buy toy boats to race around the fountain. It is a perfect place to walk or stop for lunch. It was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend it!

Beautiful gardens...watch out for sand flies!. We loved walking in the Luxembourg gardens and visited twice during a recent weekend in Paris. They are, in our view, more beautiful than the Tuileries. However, we visited during a lovely warm spell at the end of August and I suspect that was where I was bitten by some particularly hungry little bugs that seemed to be the equivalent of French midges! I had about eight bites on one ankle, five of which emerged a couple of days after the first three, which suggests they happened on our second visit. This would OT put me off returning, but I might just spray a little insect repellent on my ankles next time!

The 3rd Stop on My Favorite Walk. The best walk in Paris starts in the Cardinal Lemoine district and has 5 compelling destinations:1. Saint-Étienne du Mont.2. The Panthéon. If you're lucky the bigger-than-life JR Installation will still be there. This massive exhibit apparently ends Wednesday 31 December 2014. 3. The Jardins de Luxembourg.4. St. Suplice.5. Saint-Germaine-des-PresFrom Saint Germaine, it's a hop, skip, and a jump to the Louvre. To us, the walk is a peer to the Louvre.

Splendid little break. Luxembourg Gardens delivered welcome moments of peace and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of Paris yet only a few moments from Notre Dame.Take time to relax by the fountain, walk amongst the rows of trees or maybe have a game of tennis?Luxembourg station next one of the entrances.

Nice gardens... but don't miss the....... We've visited the gardens a few times over the years and we always try to do the museum of "minerals" natural history.. These museums are tucked away in the corners of the gardens.If not sure where the entrances are? Ask. There always seems to be someone around that knows.PS...... If you are 70 or older always ask if an attraction has a senior citizens price.
Beautiful garden. This is one of Paris most beautiful gardens. It's a very good place for a rest if you are in the south bank of the river.
Great place to take your Velib. Great place to bike to using the Velib (almost free bike system). Beautiful and pretty - great place to relax.

A great place for a city break!. How lucky to live in Paris and be able to lunch in this park. The formal garden area was beautiful but it was the more casual area that I really enjoyed. Lots of space and equipment for kids, tennis courts and locals playing Petanque, the French version of bocce. We sat for about a half an hour and watched a match. It was great fun.

Outstandingly beautiful gardens. We were amazed to see these beautiful gardens a little distance from the crowded Latin Quarters and they absolutely took our breath away. Very well maintained and lovely ambience to just walk around or lounge on the many chairs kept around. I would surely recommend a visit to these beautiful gardens.
Great spot for a visit!. Such beautiful gardens....a wonderful place for a day's stroll. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a spot to picnic or just see some pretty gardens!

Wonderful park to sit in, read a book and take in the people!. My wife and I got some coffee and pastries and came here for a few hours and sat in a chair, enjoyed the sunshine and the beauty of these gardens. Wish we had more places like this in the big cities of America. Well worth the visit!

Peace in the city. When you reach culture overload, grab a picnic or a pastry and head off to the Luxembourg Gardens, a sanctuary of peace in the city. Sit on a park chair amongst beautiful surroundings and watch the world go by.
Beautiful Gardens. >> Nice garden to relax, take pictures>> They have very good chairs to sit and relax in the shade>> Not very large and its good to relax for a bit after lunch

Enjoy a stroll or take a picnic!. Wow, what a way to step into life as a Parisian. The grounds are traditional and impeccable. Take a bottle of wine, some cheese and of course a baguette and enjoy the view of the sailboats in the pond, kids playing in the park, locals playing tennis or just the statues placed throughout the gardens.
Oh so beautiful. Visit these gardens - they are spectacular! What an oasis of peace and beauty in the middle of Paris!
Relax Plan in Paris. It's nice to go here, make yourself a picnic, and enjoy the sun (in summer of course). Its peacefull and its a good way to stop and relax for a while of your journey in paris.
Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful gardens. Lovely place to relax and read a book. Children sailing boats on the lake and families enjoying picnics.

Pretty, not large. This is best as a 'swing through' or destination to end up to have lunch. It's pretty but so are most parks in Paris. We used it as a cut through from one place to another, had it been the right time of day a picnic would have been nice. This is not the destination park I imagined it to be the Louvre park is bigger and prettier, this just seems like a place for locals to have lunch.

Great!. Loved that you can just pull up a comfortable green chair almost anywhere you choose to sit and enjoy these beautiful gardens, whether you want to sunbathe or sit under the leafy trees. Two styles, one for laying back in! People playing tennis where you could sit and watch and others doing yoga or fen shui on the grass. A beautiful park with such atmosphere and plent or buy takeaway or icecreams. Only negative comment is we were approached several times by young women asking charmingly 'do you speak English?' and when you smile, assuming they need help with a map, they ask you to add your signature to 'help deaf and mute children'. A big con so beware. My husband had to raise his voice to get rid of them the third time!
Amazing. The beauty and serenity of these gardens are amazing. For a quick break or an extended time to relax and reflect this place rocks.

Very relaxing gardens to sit in and watch the world go by.. When we visited the gardens this sept on our trip the weather was gorgeous and we sat in the gardens with our pack lunch and enjoyed watching the world go by. The fountains are very charming and relaxing sitting there listening to them.

O so beautiful. We spent some time over the week we were In Paris at the Luxembourg gardens We went back 3 times it was so beautiful There were the most stunning array of flowers and trees The locals were settled in the chairs that were plentiful around the gardens Joggers walkers and others that weren't that agile were all enjoying this beautiful oasis in a Paris Children were playing with their boats in the main pond area with their parents It was great to see so many people just enjoying life in a Paris
Beautiful!. It's a gorgeous place and not to be missed if in Paris! Well worth the time and a wonderful place to wander and wonder..
Calm and beautiful. Nice place to spend a afternoon with a good environment! There is a place to practice some sports or some chairs to read a book or just apreciate the day!

A great place to relax. This garden is one of my favorite spots in Paris. It is easy to walk around and admire the statues or you can sit on one of the many chairs and read a book and relax, just like the locals.It has a couple of cafe/restaurants as well as a few kiosks which are open on weekends. These are reasonably priced.It is a great place to visit and relax and watch the world go by or just read a book.It is far better than the Tullieres garden up near the Louvre which has a plethora of African souvenir sellers selling Eiffel Tower key rings and the like.It seems like it is the place where Parisian families go to relax. Well worth a visit.

Breathtaking Gardens. This is a lovely gardens to just stroll around and enjoy the sun. My husband and I were there in May and the weather was just gorgeous. We really enjoyed just sitting and enjoying people passing by. The gardens are beautifully maintained and well worth a visit.

Beautiful and Clean. The Gardens are wonderful, with beautiful areas throughout and no bums or trouble-makers (probably due to the proximity to the government building). We noted many singles, couples, and families enjoying the park.

Great place to escape Paris hustle (and cool for kids). The highlight of the beautiful gardens is the kids playground, tucked away in the back. It's 2.50 Euros for unlimited play per child, while adults can sit outside looking in, basking in the sun or shade. it closes at 7pm. The toy boating pond is very neat. A great place to relax.
Peace and energy. A really nice energy surrounds this place, excellent to take a calm walk, enjoy the nature and the presence of people, take a drink and a snack and let yourself go for a while.

Lovely way to spend a sunny weekend day. The lovely gardens are well used by Parisians of all ages. We enjoyed seeing people enjoying the fine September weather. Children sailing boats on the pond and lovers enjoying the shade trees. It is a peaceful oasis in a busy city. Great place to take a stroll and people watch.

Parisienne Trésor. This is one of the most beautiful treasures that a city could ever possess. The trees, the roses, the music in the park, the boat pond, the flowers...all extraordinary. I am convinced that when a Parisienne leaves their hometown this is unquestionably the thing that they most long for in a new city. A true sanctuary! I loved it!!
Nice Gardens with a toy boat lake. Nice Garden adjacent to the Pantheon and The Bombardier Pub. Good for a stroll and to watch people play with toy sailboats.

Pleasant garden. Maybe the best garden in Paris! There are every thing for your a rest!
We did not have enough time to look at all but what we saw enough to appreciate.

Paris and its gardens. Luxembourg gardens and Tuileries gardens are a breath of fresh air in the middle of a great but busy city.
Do avoid The Tuileries in the summer as they have a fair going on , but well no you must go there to take the view of Paris from the 'Grande Roue'
Beautiful. Don't miss this for a break from the hustle and bustle of your day! Like they say, take time to smell the roses, you won't be disappointed

The leisure pleasure heart of Paris.. This is a must if you want to experience a relaxing environment in the heart of a city and see the French people in their natural garden.
Many of the famous wandered this place and you can sense the spirit of their ghosts. It is a place for the picnic, as the world passes by.
Must see - amazing gardens. I bought beer n ice cream - brought my papers and colors, and sat in this garden for like 4 hours, drawing and looking on it's beauty!
Beautiful day. A good place for you to experience the park culture of paris. Beautiful espeical under warm early summer sun shine
A lovely place to watch Parisians go by. Pretty gardens. Great for a stroll and enjoyed watching the boats on the lake followed by coffee & a crepe.

One of the most beautiful garden in Paris. One of the most beautiful garden in Paris ....
flowers; exposure ... everything is superb.
For lovers of classic. Concerts weekends are good.

Incredibly Relaxing Place. We spent an afternoon in this garden after a morning on the Tour Eiffel in splendid sunshine.
On entering we heard a full orchestra in full swing who were entertaining the crowds for almost an hour.
The palace is stunning, the gardens more so, a great place to get away from the hustle bustle of the Parisian tourist areas.
Pretty flowers everywhere. Very popular for locals and tourists. Really nice for a stroll along the many paths, well looked after with endless greenery and flower beds with spectacular colors

So very pretty. Grab a drink, book and a chair, relax and enjoy the lovely grounds. Just incredible that such a large, busy, city has such a large green space for people to 'chill'. A must if you are visiting Paris in nicer weather. Last time I was in Paris I visited in January and there's not much to enjoy at that time of year here.
Beautiful. We enjoyed the Gardens, very beautiful. If you enjoy relaxing and walking around a little then this is your attraction.

Most Beautiful. I loved visiting these gardens. They are in walking distance from the Hotel Belloy. I visited three times. The Parisians love it too. On a Sunday every chair and bench is occupied by people reading, resting, and resting. Children enjoy playing with the sailboats using pushsticks to send the boat on its way to the other side of the pond. The flowers were extremely lovely. The garden has an Italian formal design. The reflecting pool is exquisite.

Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens that we walked through on the way to some shopping. Lots of people just watching the fountain and sitting and visiting. Very calming in the middle of a bustling city

Green, clean and a most to see!. I had read about the gardens on trip adviser before I visited Paris, so this was on my must do list. I was really pleased that I found a few hours to visit the gardens as they were beautiful. Luscious green grass and bright colored flowers centered around a small boating Lake and the Luxembourg Palace.The gardens were very busy with tourists and loclas, with live music and traditional french sports being played it was somewhere to relax and enjoy the afternoon sunshine. Plenty of refreshment outlets too, and lots of room to sit and enjoy the surroundings!

perfect sunny afternoon. enjoyed a lovely wander around, ideal for people watching, sun worshipping or just relaxing in wonderful gardens! Fabulous lake with model boats floating around (rent them by the half hour!) and most wonderful restaurant under the trees....superb value and awesome quality, thoroughly recommend this!

On the trail of Hemmingway. The Luxembourg Gardens is exhilarating and peaceful all at the same time. The big surprise is its vastness. I spent the whole afternoon there conjuring up images of Hemmingway meeting his friends at the Pavillion cafe. Winding tree-lined pathways criss-cross the gardens. Beautiful flowerbeds form much of the 33 hectres and there are plenty of chairs and benches along the paths and around the medici fountain where I sat and ate macaroons from Georges. The best time to visit is spring when everything is fresh and the trees are in bud. Students frequent the gardens too as Sorbonne University is quite near.

BEAUTIFUL. I had the chance to visit this beautiful gardens both in summer an in winter. Every season it is beautiful. But in summer time it is very relaxing to sit on the chairs and watch around. Lots of nice flowers, trees. Very accesible. Around there are lots of eating options. A must visit in Paris.
Just perfect. I may be biased for I love gardens and flowers but this place is just so beautiful I must say it's worth the visit, be it for taking pictures or stay longer as for a picnic.

Great place to hang out in the heart of Paris. Whether you want to walk around, sit around, or just people watch, this is a great park. The beauty of the park, and its location, calls all the people there. Stop in before or after one of the nearby museum visits.
Peaceful and relaxing. Great place to unwind. You could have breakfast here. We just had a coffee and watched the world go by. Lovely gardens only spoiled by the wasps.

Beautiful day at the Gardens. We enjoyed all the people watching, eating our lunch and the gardens themselves. There were people renting little toy boats for the fountain. The trees were beautiful and thick. We watched a wedding party deciding whether to take pictures there that day.

Beautiful and Relaxing. A beautiful garden where Parisians relax and have a picnic lunch. It is also a informal meeting place for university students nearby. There are many beautiful flowers and sculptures. A perfect place to take a break from the busy sightseeing.
Great gardens to just wander. There are quite a few things to do within the gardens and a great place to take kids on a sunny day. Can be quite busy though so prepare for this.
Breath Taking. If you have the chance to go here, please do! The gardens are absolutely stunning and you will not experience this anywhere else!

Beautiful way to spend 2-3 hours. This is a few minutes walk from the Pantheon and Notre Dame. The gardens are very pretty. They have metal chairs everywhere, so that you can sit and relax for some time.

VERY BEAUTIFUL PARK! LARGE, MUCH ENJOYED BY PARISIAN PEOPLE. This is the second time I have seen this beautiful and spacious inner city garden park. It has elegant palaces on the borders and a wide variety of gorgeous plant life replete with colorful flowering plants. The history of the park is pretty clear cut. The gardens were designed for a Medici princess who later became queen of France. Construction of the gardens began in about 1612 and its design was heavily influenced by "Italian Baroque."While the history is important, this background was the furthest thing from my mine when I was walking though the gardens. The beauty of the plants and sculpture in this setting transcends the history. I have some photos to enjoy.

beautiful garden. this is a huge place with fun areas for kids as well as places to relax , paint , people watch . There are treed and open areas fish ponds , fountains , statuary and a magnificent old building to use up a lot of film on

Relax for picnic lunch. Make a picnic of it by stopping to a local cheese, wine and bakery.We sat for hours relaxing.Entry is freeAccessible directly from Luxembourg metro, and a short walk from other metro station too.

Beautiful. Take in Paris. This place is awesome and is so close to my school- often I can spend lunch here and watch people jogging or just enjoying. The garden is huge and there are a lot of nooks to take a nice picnic. It is always busy sooo bring a lunch and settle in and people watch!

Beautiful oasis in the center of Paris. Highly recommend a visit to the gardens. Particularly liked the history of the palace, being the location for the first interim government after the revolution. There are some great views in the gardens and nice photos to be had. We had a very relaxing sit down and a coffee, a welcome break from a days sightseeing. There's a very nice family atmosphere here and a wide range of ages and types of people. It certainly made me wonder why we can't do parks this well in the UK more often.
Amazing spot for kids. Huge park with great little kiosks at the entrance for coffee and ice cream. The kids play area was particularly good and we spent hours relaxing on the grass.
Gorgeous. Beautiful gardens, lots of places to relax and just enjoy them. The colourful gardens were peaceful and just a really good place to 'mooch'.

Beautiful big garden :). We walked to the garden from our metro station Notre dame des champs. Its a very big garden with lot of sports activity. There is a big fountain where you can sit around. The flowers and trees have been very nicely cut in patterns.
Lovely. Always a beautiful spot for a wander on a sunny day. Check out the little children playing with the boats on the pond.

nice reprieve. Constructions going on at moment but pleasant overall to get away from hustle and bustle of city. We found some friendly jandarma who gave us good directions however many locals didn't speak English. Good location

Beautiful, peaceful place. we almost skipped this and would have missed out on a beautiful place. Gorgeous flowers, sculptures, etc. Had a lovely time sitting outside at the garden's cafe and relaxing after much walking. Don't miss!

Relax. Luxembourg Gardens is a large bustling park. Grab one of the many chairs and relax! Watch the toy sail boats being navigated on the pond. Wonderful to spend an hour in the afternoon sun. Little kiosks around to grab a coffee and a baguette. Will definitely go back if the sun is out.

A great place for lunch. We started the day with an idea of getting sandwiches in one of the bakeries and eating them there. When the time for lunch came we realized, we couldn't have picked a better spot. Tranquil, peaceful and absolutely beautiful.
We have eaten in a few nice places during our trip, the Luxembourg garden lunch was by far my favourite.

Paris parks. Family oriented park
relaxing & chilling atmosphere
needs to have more coffee shops inside, I was craving for a nice cop of coffee near the lake
nice play area for kids

If the grounds could talk.. Sometimes when you go to places with so much history and tradition... all you need to do is walk around, stop, sit, or stand and listen... look... smell... feel.... let your imagination go and FEEL all that has gone on there. The beauty - the high vibrations... the pomp... the history... the Holy Blessing of Creations through man. Like anything in Paris -- take it slow. It's all about experience, memories and gratitude...

What a gem. This is a place for a peaceful rest amid a beautiful garden and greenery. There are sculptures around the entire area. The grass can be sat on to enjoy a take out lunch. A wonderful place to visit.

Beautiful - must visit.. As always, Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful spot to stroll and unwind. I just love it here! Make sure you allow yourself enough time to take a leisurely stroll so you can take in all that LG has to offer.

A very quiet nice garden, in the middle of the city.. It was so nice sitting close to the flowers and looking at the children (including our young girls) running after the cute ships in the nice fountain. We felt parisiens for a day!

Oasis in the middle of Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens on the left bank near the Sorbonne and the Pantheon, is a perfect place to go for a little timeout from the crush of tourists in Paris, especially if you have children. The large beautiful garden of the Luxembourg Palace is a place where the locals go to relax, play table tennis, kick a ball etc. There is a large pond with miniature sail boats for children (or adults) to hire, a tea garden serving light meals under the trees, plenty of chairs, clean loos, lots of grass and trees for a picnic.

Best place for relaxing and people watching. We packed our food and drinks to picnic there for an afternoon. It was a half rainy half sunny day, so it wasn't too crowded and tons of chairs available. Here it's perfectly legal to drink wine and other alcohol beverage in parks. So it's a totally different picnic experience from what we have in Canada. Beautiful garden and fashion conscious people there build the best scenery. On top of that, we had classical music played in the background by a small band. A truly enjoyable alternative to museum-hopping in Paris.
Beautiful getaway. Tranquil, well manicured gardens a 10-min walk from the Seine. Locals take advantage of this lovely space to walk, jog or just relax.
Great playground for kids. The pay for entry playground is very good value, with a beautiful old carousel just outside, and the garden itself is beautiful and tranquil.

Hot and Green. Beautiful sight walking around the gardens and water areas. We sat down on chairs placed by the Government building there and just took in the sun and the people. Wonderfull and restfull
Lovely calmer side of Paris. Spent a morning walking through the gardens. Who knew so many runners in Paris? Lovely park...don't miss it!

Parisians at Leisure. We walked through this park on a Sunday afternoon. Some people were reading their books and sunning themselves in the green areas on the sides of the garden. The middle area was a hive of activity with hundreds of children climbing over all sorts of equipment. There were also tennis courts and basketball areas. One area was set aside for young children accompanied by their parents could play. There was also an art exhibition in a building at one end. All of this was set in a lush green garden with colourful flower beds. What a wonderful place to experience Paris.

Good Place to Rest the Feet. We took the time to rest from our sightseeing in the Luxembourg Gardens. We bought a very good salad and a uniquely Paris grilled cheese sandwich, which was all prepared in front of us, from a little kiosk in the park. Next we found a bench. There we watched what appeared to be many locals basking in the sunshine, reading and relaxing. Children play at the waters edge with little boats. Plenty of loose chairs are casually placed throughout the park for everyone to use. It is very relaxing to take a break and rest the aching feet. Found my favorite planting here too.
green green green. one of the most beautiful gardens I have seen in my life, so green and beautiful, its hard to believe have so much great taste.

Good but not Jardin des Tuileries. Our 5+ time to Paris but first time in this arrondesmont. We elected to stop by here and very very nice - Speed Chess players, tennis matches, an art show in one of the buildings, grass to lie on and picnic (need to check the signs as to what grass is OK to step on), a small concert under the trees, of course the fountain with children pushing boats. We had great weather and that helped make it almost perfect. only real complaint is people take 2 chairs around the fountain area - one to put their feet on and relax which does not make sense when others are looking for a place to rest their weary dogs.

Beautiful gardens - well worth a visit. Just lovely to stroll through, or take a book/newspaper and relax in one of the many chairs provided. Food and drink can be bought from various locations. The gardens contain one of the most amazing children's playgrounds I've ever seen.....my 14 year old daughter couldn't believe it and was a bit disappointed to no longer be of playground age and size! There were also boules and tennis.....lovely place!
A relaxing place. Famous for its castle. Just a nice park to walk around in and rest and watch children playing, view the statues and markers...
Paris garden. I liked the Carnival area, but some parts felt a little "tacky". I liked the Gardens. They were very pretty. Friendly atmosphere.
great place for kids. my kids loved the pony rides and the playground... we even enjoyed a wonderful picnic by the pond while watching the children play with the toy boats.
Grab a baguette and a bottle of wine to bring!. Beautiful, beautiful area to sit, relax and people watch!!! Gardens and flowers are gorgeous and create such an enjoyable atmosphere!!

Beautiful Park. This is a beautiful and relaxing park. We liked the movable chairs that were all around the park grounds. You could move them where ever you liked and then seat and enjoy the beautiful flowers and sculptures in the park as you relaxed in the shade or sun, whichever you prefer.

Peaceful and Serence. If you need a break from running around sightseeing, then Luxembourg Garden is an ideal solution.The Gardens are less crowded and full of beautifully planted flowers and well coiffed trees. A large fountain sits in the middle flanked by benches and trellis chairs - great for a moment of peaceful reflection, engage in a quiet conversation, read a book or watch children launch the toy sailboats in the fountain. (The boats remain in the fountain; no need to bring your own.)The chateau building was not open when we visited so I can offer no comment about its interior.
Beautiful and Relaxing. Beautiful flowers in the summer. Great for strolling and people watching. Enjoyed seeing the children riding ponies and the sail boats on the lake.

Love, love, love this park. We lived 1/4 mile from this park and it is one of my favorite places in all of Paris. When the weather is warm, the young children sail boats in the large fountain. The college students go running, the middle aged play tennis and the old men play chess. Whole families spend their afternoons here. It is truly a diamond in a city of gems.

A place to rest in Paris. There is a lot to learn from this Garden first the way the French make gardens and you will learn a bit about the French Queens and you can see the Eiffel Tower and montparnasse tower from here as well.
A slice of heaven. Love the LG. Beautiful, peaceful and worth exploring. I try and spend 2-3 hours there on each trip: reading, people watching, walking and eating something French.

One of our favorites in Paris. For years in a row, this has been among our fav places in Paris for an easy Sunday morning stroll, Saturday picnic-brunch-on-the-grass, or just quickly running through to go to the nearest metro. If you are in Paris, don't miss this one!

chess and people watching. loved seeing the tai chi and yoga and misc. other groups practicing in the shade between walkways. husband played chess but found some hustlers and some not that interested in playing with non regulars. beautiful flowers, fountains, statues. great place to hang out.
Beautiful scenery.... Very nice, one of my favourite places to relax in Paris without too many tourists. I especially liked all the statues of the Queens of France all around the property!
beautiful. we strolled through the gardens on the way to somewhere else. They were just lovely but very busy. nice to see statues hidden in the bushes etc.

Do the little boats! Great place for the kids.. Not first time here, but a new activity: renting little boats to sail in the main fountain. Our 6 yo had so much fun! Beautiful gardens, and a great place for kids to decompress from all the sight-seeing. No cars, many kid's attractions, and just nice.

Fabulous gardens . Many people sit around these beautiful gardens soaking up the sun and the beauty. Fabulous statues and fountains adorn the beautifully manicured grounds. Kids can hire little sail boats and race them around the pond. The cafe is situated overlooking the palace - a great place to enjoy wine and cheese on your visit.Free entry any day. Close to boulevard st Germain Don't miss it.

Better than Versailles. Located in the beautiful Saint German area, these gardens are a real treasure to Paris. Landscape is impressive, flowers are always beautiful and the atmosphere just invites you to seat observe, relax and enjoy!
Relaxing garden in the middle of the busy city. Pretty, relaxing and beautiful place in the middle of the busy city. We went here on the way to another museum- worth the stop!
Great place for chilling and people watching!. It is quite big and lot of local people hang out there. Next time, I would bring a blanket and enjoy a picnic there!

We were sailing along.... After a hectic day, we headed to the gardens to soak in the beauty of the grounds and the architecture. To our delight, the park was packed with kids who were happily sailing boats in the beautiful fountain. Chairs are plentiful, bring a picnic lunch and enjoy this enchanting oasis.

Just magnificent. While on a river cruise with Viking we did a pre on our own 4 days ahead and visited Luxembourg Gardens. The weather was perfect and the gardens and fountain were beautiful a must see.

Stunning. The Luxembourg gardens are a joy to visit and fun for all members of the family. Enjoy strolling around and watching the delight on children's faces as they play on the model boating lake. The flowers are beautiful all around. Go and enjoy a picnic and watch the chess players deliberate their next move. Wonderful.

Beautiful well situated gardens. Art exhibit enhance the visit. Can combine with a brisk walk or jog.. Lot's of Parisians and tourists. Good visit from area where we stayed in the St. Germain area. Art Gallery in one of the buildings was a plus as we enjoyed the show going on.

C'est bon. I have lived near luxembourg Gardens for 6 months, and I do enjoy the afternoon sunshine on the bench and watching different people passing by. Also don't forget about the restaurants around!

A bit of beautiful paradise in the middle of Paris. A most stunning garden which is clearly designed with the local community in mind. Beautifully presented, extremely well kept, place for small kids and young people as well as adults to play, relax, watch others at play, run, watch exhibitions etc.
Definitely an oasis of green that is free to be used and enjoyed.
