An oasis. Such a restful place in the heart of Paris - do it! Acres of green & trees & flowers & water - just the place to get your breath before heading out again to immerse yourself in the Paris masses!

A must in Paris. Great garden to see and to enjoy a relaxing few hours. Lawn chairs are provided so visitors can enjoy a rest and take in some sun. A great place all year round. Typically, the museum next door features an interesting exhibition...this summer it featured Josephine, Napoleon's wife.
Nice Park!. Easy access from Métro, in a very nice arrondissement of Paris. Close to Sorbonne and Saint-Germain-Des-Prés.
Amazing view. Forever beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg. There are always chairs for tourists to sit down and enjoy the view. It seems to be peaceful most of the time I was there.

Great place to visit. The park is huge and beautiful with many different types of displayed summer flowers. There are areas for relaxing under shadows of huge trees or calm seats close to the water falls linking to a small lake. Also play-grounds for kids, student are very interesting with free wi-fi ;)
Very Nice. Not the best palace gardens I have seen. But it is a very nice. Lots of people strolling and sitting. Worth walking through.

Boats and ponies. Dream come true to sail boats in the pond! Rent boats for only ?3 for 30 minutes. Pony rides under the tree lines lanes! We were delighted to wander through the park and view the fountains and statues. Be warned: The awesome playground costs ?2,50 per kid.

Feel like a Parisian as you stroll. Just a wonderful place to get away from the hectic pace on the sidewalks and in the museums. Many seats surrounding the pool allow you to sit & take in the sites. Beautiful flowers, shrubs, and walkways. Definitely worth a visit!

Wonderful Gardens. We entered the park through the NW entrance and exited though the SE entrance (or so I think) and right away we found a kids playground which our 6 years old daughter wanted to try (small entrance fee, but totally worth it - she loved it). My husband went inside the gated playground with her, and me and my son rested on the iconic 1923 designed sage chairs. After a while, we decided to go for a walk and what a treat that was...those majestic trees and the way they were trimmed looking almost square, the beautiful art all around us (statues, fountain, the palace), the impeccable lawn, the flower beds, kids playing with their boats, etc. - they all created a serene atmosphere, making us feel as we all belonged there ..hard to explain in words. Visit these full of history gardens and see for yourself!

A stroll in the Luxembourg gardens will make your day!. There are so many possibilities when walking through the Luxembourg gardens. In all seasons there is so much to appreciate... the trees and plants are always a treat as are the ponds and fountains. There is the possibility to sit and relax just about anywhere, on benches or seats. You can have a meal or grab an ice cream, or bring your own picnic. In the winter you can get a hot chocolate from Angelina that is next to the Luxembourg museum and head out to the gardens all warmed up inside! Watch the Parisian children playing, or head out to the tennis courts for a game. The Senate building is beautiful and impressive inside if you get a chance to visit it (during Patrimony days).I strongly recommend strolling through the gardens to compliment any visit to Paris!

A time to rest and a time to see kids and their sailboats. It is just a lovely experience. Enjoy your morning coffee. Watch the children excitedly guiding their boats at the fountain. So Paris. Both relaxing and invigorating at the same time.

Amazing to read in, picnic in and run in!!!. It is huge and beautiful, and different parts look different. There are a lot of public chairs, so you can always find a place to sit. It closes at 9pm, so don't try to go too late, but it is wonderful. Definitely picnic in the park at least once.
An oasis in the city. A beautiful and quiet place to soak up lovely gardens and grounds. Fun to watch families float miniature sail boats on a fountain, ringing back days past. Don't miss!

So pleasant. Loved the gardens. They were just what we needed to relax a bit after walking all over Paris. The pond has small sailboats that children can rent and "pus" with sticks. It was really quite charming to watch and your kids would enjoy.

You can't miss "Luxemburg Gardens". I keep going and going everytime I visit this city.
If you really want to fell how Parisians enjoy their time outside you need to pay a visit to this great and beautifully laid gardens and enjoy and relax.
It was great. It was a great experience and we really enjoy there .we went there after lunch and went there via train and it is almost 9,10 station far from the arc de trimphe

Idyllic!. One of my top three favourite places in Paris! What more is there to say? It is a park in the centre of Paris. Just go there on a sunny day and stroll around. Have a sit and a doze in the sun, watch the toy boats on the lake. If you are feeling energetic there is a museum and an orangerie which hosts temporary exhibitions.

Refreshing. So luxurious and green, an oasis in the city. Beautiful place to just sit & watch the world go by. Buy an ice cream and take time to wander through the different areas, admiring the work of dedicated gardeners, beautiful sculptures, or just relax & watch a fascinating array of people and families enjoying time out.
Splendid place. Very beautiful place to visit in December, a liitle cold, but if you are conveniently dressed, no problem.
Beutiful. They are boutiful even in winter. They are full of charm and stillness. It´s a fantastic place to have lunch in a seat if it is not too cold
Beautiful place to visit. We loved the chairs to sit and relax in wherever you like! Don't forget to bring drinks with you as they are very overpriced to buy inside the park! Lovely place to relax

A summer picnic in a small quiet paradise in busy Paris!. Grab some delicious antipasto, bread cakes and Champagne and head to the lovely Luxembuourg Gardens to share chat and laugh with a friend...perfect location!!

Beautiful flowers in a historical setting. Be sure to visit these gardens and go in the l'orangerie if there is an exhibit there.It's pleasant to walk through the length of the various,individual gardens before you get to the main buildings.

Sitting in an Impressionist painting. A perfect city garden - vast, beautiful, historic, full of Parisians and their beautifully-dressed children, lots of friendly dog, flower beds out of this world, Paris at its best.
Relaxing stroll.. Nice place to relax,look at gardens ,listen to a band playing( at certain times) ,sit and watch the world go by.

Place for everybody. Wonderful rows of flower and chairs for people to sit on. Tennis courts and kids playground. Also a lawn area to have picnic. This place was really nice to relax for couple of hours during the day.

Amazing family park. This park defied all descriptions! It is wonderful to stroll through and watch the children at play, the tennis games, the chess players, and the locals enjoying sitting around the pond and taking in the beautiful ambiance. Our grandchildren loved the playground , seeing a marionette show and sailing sailboats on the pond. I believe it is the most delightful park in Paris! If you have the good fortune to stay near there, then you can partake in its beauty as much as you can!
A Visit to a Classic Parl. I always love the park Toy boats ailing in the ponf A surprise concert beautiful scenery and had a delicios=us crepe nutella

Beautiful and well kept.. We enjoyed our visit to the Garden. What a beautiful place. There were plenty of chairs if you want to sit down. It would have been nice if we were not in a hurry. This is the place where you can sit, relax, read, take your children to play, etc. The gardens were well kept.

A park like this in every city!. It would be fantastic if there were parks like this everywhere but sadly no. What a wonderful hour we spent people watching as we relaxed in the plentiful chairs and admired the symmetry of the gardens. Must see!

Lovely place to relax in the sun or shade. Beautiful flower gardens, interesting color arrangements. The Italian Grotto is lovely and shady. The park is so big, even on a sunny Sunday it didn't feel crowded. So many available chairs to sit on, watching the children float their sailboats, have a picnic or just read. It was a very pleasant surprise how much we enjoyed it.
Such a piece of heaven. Full of flowers places to sit and relax just amazing . Walking is a must beyond the boat pond ..large walking paths ...great for color oictures

Another sunny day, another Paris park. After a Saturday family lunch in the 5th, we took a stroll past the Pantheon through the Luxembourg Gardens. Half of Paris had the same idea, but the park is large enough that there was room for everyone. Lots of free chairs around the pond, some lovely lawns (no sitting!) and beautiful flower-beds, even in late summer.Plenty of activity for all - pony rides, model sail-boats for hire, play equipment and space to kick a ball for the little ones, tennis courts (book max. 3 days ahead), jogging track and petanque for those a bit older.We even had some live music from a Russian-sounding band! Fun place for a picnic or just to unwind.

Lovely spot. A really nice alternative to the hussle and bustle of the Tuileries and other more central spots. Tucked away it boasts some lovely gardens, a playground for young kiddies and a decent cafe to buy lunch and snacks. A small 'lake' can be used for hiring sailing bioats, Eu3 for 30 mins. all in all not a bad place to relax.

Tranquility plus. Want to dawdle through a kaleidoscope of flower beds, cosy little spots with tall greenery leaning over you and a "coupla" reasonable cafes nearby? These gardens are for you. We arrived lunchtime and saw French folk chewing up the tracks trying to get fit..the sweaty bodies only added to the whole atmosphere, come dinner time when we returned the place abounded with families and kids sailing boats in a delightful big pond. It just felt " nice"

Don't Visit Paris Without Seeing This. The day we visited was a picture perfect day, with temperatures in the low 70's and bright sunny skies. Absolutely delightful. Every part of the garden is worth exploring, but definitely don't miss the Medici fountain.
Stunning. Stunning and relaxing place to visit. Great to just stop and have a drink while you take in the beauty of the place.
Byegone Era. Beautiful flower beds, fountains and boating 'basin' for model yachts. Sheer style and elegance and right in the Latin Quarter. Very relaxing and uncrowded

Picture book perfect. We spent a Wonderful afternoon with my daughter at the boating pond and in the children's garden . Bring spare clothes and a towel if going anywhere near the little paddling pool though!

Just Beautiful - An Absolute Must visit when in Paris!!!. I easily and conveniently reached here thanks to the metro train. The subway exactly opens at the entrance of the Garden. So if you are new to Paris (like me) I would recommend taking the metro to reach here.Before I came here, I had just heard about this place through one of my colleagues who has been here earlier and had squeezed it in my itinerary, but trust me it was worth a visit. I was here with my 1.5 year old and my wife and they both loved it.It is a HUGE, beautifully landscaped garden and has something for everyone. It is a place where you will find the Parisians in a different AVATAR (experience a different side), some enjoying with their friends, some reading books, few families come for a picnic, someone sipping beer and some just come for sun bathing... Its a place to relax and unwind. One can grab a chair and sit at any place which you like. It has beautiful old fountain called Medici fountain and of-course one cannot miss the huge Luxembourg Palace. In case you are thirsty or hungry there is a food kiosk available. If you are low on budget then there is a MC Donald right outside the garden, across the street.Enjoy!;-)
Big park, lots of people. Nice place to take a break on a sunny afternoon. went in August so many flowers and kids and tourists.

Peaceful time out.. Excellent gardens, so many quality statues well situated and placed to get the best, prolific flower gardens -brilliant colours and so well maintained, lovely water features. Can plan your visit to see it all or as much as you have time for. Really enjoyed it.
Lovely for a chilled out afternoon. The gardens are gorgeous. If you're visiting with kids, check out the play park. Perfect for a sunny day in Paris.

Just beautiful - a must to visit in Paris. We visited the gardens one rainy evening in August, just before dusk. These gardens are lovely, the formal design is elegant and soothing after a day of walking the city streets. We loved the garden plantings, including an unusual planting of swiss chard (silver beet) at the base of a Statute!. A beautiful garden. A must se
e!
Lovely gardens. I visited these gardens many times during my three months in Paris. They are a great place to sit and relax and watch the world go by or eat lunch.

My Favorite Garden in Paris. We went to the Marche St. Germain to pick up some bread, cured meats, and cheese and headed to the park for a wonderful lunch. There was plenty of seating in the shade with benches and chairs. Afterwards we went to the self-serve small restaurant in the park to have an espresso. It was a beautiful sunny day and a leisure picnic in the park.

Beautiful gardens. The Luxembourg gardens are somewhere you can spend a few hours of a day or even all day if you wished, looking around and taking in the authenticity of the Parisian heritage. They are extremely well maintained and easily accessible from many of the arrendisimos, and surrounded by many lovely brasseries. One of the guards of the palace was very nice and approached us to see if we needed any help as we were sat looking very confused at a map! He very nicely directed us to the Notre Dame where we walked to in under an hour. After a day around Paris, we waLed back through the gardens and were lucky enough to see lots of little boats in the pond being raced/ pushed by children and their families - very sweet to see! A very lovely place to visit in Paris.

Nice, Nice, Nice!. What a beautiful place to take a picnic or just to get your thought together, perfectly manicured and taken care of.Its wonderful to see such a sanctuary in the middle of a major city.

Great for the kids. This was a great place to take our kids to give them a break from all the museums on our trip. They played with the boats and loved the playground. It was a fantastic place for them to be kids while the adults could sit and relax and just take in all that's around you while in this fascinating city.
Gorgeous. Beautiful gardens, lake to push boats, ducks..lovely for walking, relaxing, and close to great cafes as well, fantastic statues abound

Florence in Paris. You can experience Palazzo Pitti and Boboli Gardens in Paris.Great for a nice walk(or run) or have a picnic. You can read your book under trees with fresh air or watch people playing tennis.
Sailboats. Little children rent small wooden sailboats, and sail them around the large central pond, so much fun to watch.
Very Nice Gardens. Great place to sit and enjoy a sunny day in Paris. Very nice gardens and a short walk from Notre Dame.

Our first Paris Gardens. Within walking distance of both Notre' Dame and our accommodation. We spent several hours in this large park. Unlike the gardens in London and like our gardens in Sydney it was free! The gendarme in front of the palace responded in a positive and friendly manner to have his photo taken. It was a great open air area away from the hustle and bustle. Somewhere to sit and muse.

:D. Unfortunately it was still mostly winter when I went there but it is a beautiful place to see people as they go by and spend some time with your kids as they play around! I know that during the summer when the flowers are in bloom it is one of the most relaxing places in Paris.

Beautiful!. Just beautiful! It's free to go in, walk around, hang out, and just take it all in. It's a gorgeous area with pretty green grass, colorful flowers, statues, and a pond where people were sailing model sailboats. There's a lot to see, or you can go to just relax or have a picnic. Stunning!

A well groomed park!. We were there on July 27 at the opening and the park was closed, no one could say why, no sign outside just closed gates. Then we saw a helicopter leaving the ground in front of the main palace. The gate opened and once inside we saw a board saying the park would be closed!!!great once you are inside. One of the gentleman had a prostate problem, you follow bathrooms but they are all closed, we eventually found one near the puppet show...but I would not really recommend it!The park is nice though but our visit was spoiled.

A free garden that you can spend a couple of hours. It's free and beautiful, need I say more? Flowers are in full bloom in August. many lovely statues. It's a place to walk around or even for a picnic.

Stunning. The day we visited it was hot and many Parisians were enjoying the sun and warmth. The gardens were a buzz with people and children enjoying the sail boats on the huge water feature. With plenty of shade it was a relaxing afternoon.

C'est magnifique. Jardin du Luxembourg was probably my favourite spot in Paris. It was so peaceful and tranquil, and even when little children are playing and laughing. My friend and I merely stumbled across the gardens on our first visit and bought an Australian sailboat and placed it among all the other countries which for us was such a beautiful thing to see. Perfect spot for a picnic or sunbathing or admiring the multicoulour rows and rows of flowers. I visited in Summer but I imagine regardless of the month or season these gardens would be c'est magnfique
Good. Good for relaxation. You can just sit there, have you panini as your lunch while looking around watching people or make friends.

Beautiful gardens where you can feel the parisian spirit. I loved these gardens so much , especially on sundays morning , where you can see and feel the Parisian family spirit .The trees formation is awesome , as well as the fountain of medicis , the senate building with its majestical architecture is in the right corner of the gardenspigeons are everywhere eating & playing in peace near the feet of the visitorsthe corners are equipped with metal comfortable chairsThe fountain of the gardens is beautiful where a lot of children plays with their plastic toy boats The thing I like the most in the gardens is the amazing statues , especially the statue of mask vendor , and the statues of queens of France and the statue of the reolutionist lionI took a lovely photos from the gardens where you can see the dome of the PantheonI enjoyed visiting this garden soooo much

so beautiful. Such a beautiful park, I was there three weeks ago, it was my last day in Paris and I am glad I went. There are so many sculptures and a large central fountain in front of the French senate, a beautiful palais. Also, the medici fountain is on the east front side of the senate. Nice place to go on a walk.

A very nice garden in the heart of Paris. I hear that whenever the sun pops in, Parisians all flow into this wonderful garden. And it is indeed wonderful. No words needed here, you only have to check the many photos you can find.
Perfect for jogging, walking in couple, with family or friends.
Perfect for eating too as dedicated areas do exist in this park.

Wonderful getaway from the chaos of the city. Simple to get to/from, perfect for a stroll around and is beautiful...
Would be nice to just sit down and relax on a warm summers day with a few drinks and a picnic.

Gorgeous. Lovely place to walk and enjoy the flowers and statues. Lots of variety in the plants, trees and other gardens and even a working bee hive. A very enjoyable experience to walk though the gardens and learn about the plants. Relax and enjoy your time, a quiet oasis in the bustle of Paris

Tres Parisian. Tres Parisian and a lovely stroll by the trees and small Lake with tiny little wooden boats floating around. Don't miss the Orangie museum near the end of the park, often overlooked but home to Monet's water lily murals - so pretty.
Gorgeous & very relaxing! . Walking through these gardens is something you have to do when you visit Paris! Such a relaxing place, with gorgeous scenery.

Sailors needed. Huge space allows you to shake off that cramped feeling. Also you don't have to be a kid to enjoy the sailing the boats. Nice shady areas allow for great picnic spots. Bring a Frisbee and make it a few hour break.

lovely in spring. went running here one afternoon from my hotel and just loved watching everyone out lounging on the grass in the nice weather, a very popular and beautiful spot but the outside path was great for a jogging loop

Awesome Park. My kids loved Paris, but all the walking, sightseeing and museum visits were starting to wear on them. This park was a welcome change of pace. Lovely grounds. My 8 year old just loved renting a small sail boat (3 Euros for 20 min) to push it along the pond. There was also an excellent enclosed play ground (small fee). Plenty of spots to sit, relax and enjoy.
Beautiful. Lived off the garden. A beautiful daily walk with magnificent plantings and fountains. Wished we could walk on the grass. A gem

A Great Find. We found the Gardens while wandering one day and it came at the perfect time. We were tired and needed a break. Bought some delicious glacé and settled in to comfortable chairs to watch the children sail boats in the pond and enjoy the beautiful flowers!Although it was a busy place, it still managed to be relaxing and peaceful. Highly recommend this when visiting Paris!
Peace & quiet.. Fantastic place to soak up the atmosphere. Pull up a chair and rest your feet and do some people watching.
Lovely gardens. Walked through the gardens on a sunny day. Very relaxing. Very beautiful. Watched children play with sailboats in the pond.

Relaxing. I adore Paris and in this garden it make you feel you are Parisian. Kids enjoyed playing with the boats available for hire in the garden, while us having a rest on the chairs you find all over for free.

So relaxing!. The gardens are beautifully laid out with a lake where children sail toy boats. The flowerbeds are colour themed and there is a quiet area with a water fountain and ducks swimming. There are plenty of chairs provided throughout the park for visitors to sit and relax.
Relaxing gardens. A great place to relax under the sun, enjoyin the view of the palace and the lake. Also a perfect choice for having a picnic like french people do.

A bit of paradise. Beautiful place to rest and enjoy, the enviroment is perfect to spend the day reading a book or just strolling around. Near you will find the University of Arts and Archaeology, do not miss the decorative frieze of the façade evoking the art of past civilizations.

Beautiful Gardens in the heart of the Latin Qrt. Great spot to sit and watch the passing crowds. The gardens are fine example of French design with a large pond in the middle with children sailing model boats..

A Delight To The Eye & Peaceful Oasis.. My latest visit here was on an evening and approached via theorderly groves of trees at the south end. This gives way tomagnificent borders of flowers of every size, colour and hue. Near the Palace is a round pond where you can sit and recover from pounding the streets and museums. At other times the pond keeps small children happily amused with little sailing boats hired from a kiosk close by.

A nice place to relax, but not something to seek out. This is a very pretty park, and a nice place to relax. We weren't so overly impressed that we would recommend that someone without a doubt should include it in a Paris itinerary. If you happen to be nearby, grab some wine and a snack and relax for a bit.

Great place to relax, enjoy nature and people watch. What a beautiful oasis in the city of Paris! The gardens are absolutely stunning - flowers, trees, grass, places for you and your family to sit and relax, have a picnic, people watch. There are a lot of activities to do in the park - various sports, running tracks, donkey rides, sail boat launches etc. etc. You can easily spend hours here. There are also food outlets, restaurants and clean washrooms.You must visit the gardens during your trip to Paris. You won't regret it.

So pretty. A lovely respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. Perfect to just walk along and take in the view. There is seating dotted around and you can sit by the fountains if you've walked too far. Worth a visit to recharge your batteries.

Gorgeous gardens. This was the most beautiful park. Plenty of seats, a lovely lake, an impressive mansion and well-kept flower beds.
The whole place just gave us a wonderful 'uplifted' feeling and we enjoyed sitting here, watching the world go by, for quite a while!
Go and enjoy!
Very Scenic. Lovely garden, went on a sunny day and it was totally amazing. The garden has an array of flowers and the senate building makes for good pictures.
Beautiful in the Parissienne Sunshine. Beautiful gardens not too far from the key tourist area, what a place to relax for a few hours especially with the sun shining....

Lovely and relaxing! Take a break from the museums and enjoy!. Our hotel was only a few blocks away, but we'd been so busy trying to see the major attractions that we didn't make it here until our 4th day. We enjoyed sitting on the benches watching the children play with their boats, and came back with some lunch the next day for a repeat!

Very beautiful gardens.. Very beautiful gardens, there are all kinds of activities for children.
After visiting the gardens - you can walk around in Saint Germain.
A Lovely Stroll.... Simply gorgeous and perfect for a leisurely stroll.In spring the flowers are beautiful. So nice to see everyone out enjoying the weather. Definitely a lovely park.

Beautiful, peaceful, and historical. This is a beautiful oasis in Paris. It's a wonderful place to rest, look at statuary, flowers, and visit the secluded fountain tucked away in the gardens. A real respite from the crush some attractions can be in Paris.

Do not miss this and plan to spend time!. Another free site in Paris. There is so much to do in this Park. Watch the kids with their boats and sticks and you can rent one for your child. Ride a pony. There are wonderful shaded fountains to sit around and relax or read. Sit in the green chairs that are all through the park. This place is beautiful.
Beautiful. very nice , very quite. good place to relax a bit and just sit in the warm sun to read a book or just rest a bit
Gorgeous. So beautiful here - we decided to do all of our families' professional photos in these gardens with lovely flowers, small food venders, and a view of the Eiffel tower from the right spot.

Chillax at the park. If you Paris trip is hectic then head on to the Luxembourg Gardens to relax, enjoy some greenery and also see the replica of the Statue of Liberty. Just take a stroll, chill out, see other families enjoying the park and old men playing chess.
The children's playground will give some enjoyment to the kids.

Beautiful place!. The Gardens were close to the appartment where we stayed for 4 nights. We went there right after our arrival and entered the gardens by one of the side gates. The first part we walked through was next to the Orangerie. Very beautiful flowers and a quiet place, compared to the rest of the Gardens.We walked around the basin to take a look at the Medici Fountain, really worth it! Just sit down and relax, enjoy the view!

Lovely place to relax. Sitting by the pond watching the sailing boats and fountains. Beautiful palace. A great place to visit on a warm day. You can hire a model sailing boat for much fun with the kids. Well worth a visit

Just stunning - we got married here. We chose the Luxembourg Gardens to get married in. It's where the Parisians go to relax and enjoy their social outings. The view of the Eiffel Tower from here is normally wonderful, except the day we were there it was a high pollution day....happens when the seasons change and the pollution gets caught for about a week before the winds clear it out. The grounds a large and colourful. wear comfy shoes, take a picnic basket and enjoy the afternoon in the sunshine

An oasis in Paris…a must stop with kids. Traveling to Paris with two young kids in tow can be a dream or a nightmare. Luckily we managed to end up with dreamy memories thanks in part to smartly packing delicious french sandwiches for mid day picnics in the parks between sites. The Luxembourg Gardens are the best. Next to climbing to the top of the Eiffel Tower, this was the favorite place in Paris for our 8 and 11 year olds. Peering in from the gate promises lush fantasy settings for picnicking or setting up your eisle to paint, but there are so many things to do here beyond leisurely reading a book, polishing off a bottle of wine or snoozing. For only 3 Euros (for 30 min) our kids were completely thrilled to slide a little wooden boat into the big fountain pond and captain it with a wooden stick like kids have been thrilled to do for more than 100 years. Seriously they LOVED doing this. It may be the one thing they tell their own kids about one day. That and the little carousel by the playground and the puppet theatre. Don't be shy, ask where the pony rides are and walk just beyond them to the little carousel. This little ride is only 1.5 Euros per child for a nice long ride….but unlike to touristy carousels near the Eiffel tower, this old fashioned little ride is a game too! Be sure to get a horse on the outside of the circle. Those children are the only ones who get a small wooden baton which they use to try to hook a small brass ring (think jousting knight) as they pass a little green dragon. It's a very old game invented right along with carrousels, but somewhere forgotten in the larger display models in touristy areas. Our kids were in heaven.Also a kid classic-- the Theatre Guignol. Guignol is a famous puppet from the early 1800's in France. The puppet shows are at 4pm on weekdays and 11am & 4pm on the weekend days. The plays are in French, but they are full of action and are so much visual fun, everyone will enjoy watching this very traditional show.Fill your spent water bottles in the drinking fountains and save your Euros for an ice cream. Your kids will think France is magical.

A way to step back in time. love this garden, full of chairs to sit and paths to walk. In the centre is a pond that you can sail your sailboat in, "old school" with just the help of the wind and a stick. A perfect place to rest and take in beauty
Dream-Escape-Breathe. What a beautiful and relaxing place. Go there with the kids, go there with your mom, go their with your lover. You will enjoy it everytime regardless of the company!

Unbelievably colourful. I was surprised by the variety of species of flowers and palm trees, and I found it a relaxing resort as Paris is quite a crowded city. As a traveler, you can think the gardens as an early afternoon siesta where you can enjoy the view, plan your trip forward or enjoy outdoors activities (they have a small tennis court as far as I remember

Gorgeous, boats and playground too!. This is now one of my top paris attractions. Could not believe the beauty of the gardens! Meticulously planted and pruned flowers and shrubs, absolutely gorgeous. My sons loved the boats...and a bargain too! 3 euros for 30 minutes. There is also a fantastic playground. About 2 euros eAch but well worth the money, my children ran around for 2 hours!  A must see!

Gorgeous! Pack a picnic and enjoy. What a great way to spend an afternoon and for free! Luxembourg gardens is perfect for picnics, chatting with friends, reading a book, painting, or just to relax outdoors.

Visit late in the afternoon. We visited later in the afternoon when the sun was just starting to go down. The view standing in front of the Palace Luxembourg facing into the gardens is beautiful.
Grab a chair and sit by the large pond, a lovely spot to quietly relax.

yes!. Summer, winter walks and history, this garden is one of my favorites! Adults children i guess eveybody can say they love these gardens!
a must do of course!

Charming and funny. We and our daughters still remember the wonderful hours we spent in these wonderful gardens in the heart of Paris. We played with a wooden sailboat in the central fountaine, we relaxed on the free chairs available for visitors, whe walked around slowly admiring flowers and beautiful monuments. We also spent an hour in the children playground (which is beautiful and funny, but not free...) and we rode the wooden horses of the old merry-go-round.

Beautiful gardens. During my week in Paris, I covered all the usual suspects, the Eiffel tower, the Louvre, the Arc de Triomphe, the Sacre Couer, etc but I most enjoyed the hour I spent wandering around the Luxembourg gardens and just taking some time to sit and enjoy all the beauty before me. If you go, please grab a chair, sit and take it all in.

Peaceful & Relaxing.. Go on a picnic, read a book, see the original Statue of Liberty, and a copy of the Pitti Palace (original in Florence, Italy), watch the ducks/flowers/fountains, and take a stroll through this beautiful garden in the heart of Paris.

A beautiful park. After two days of trawling the sights of the city, we were ready to rest out tired feet. When we finally found the park, we loved it. There are plenty of chairs (including some recliners) to relax in. The park was peaceful and had a real family feel. Even the toilet attendant was glamorous!
Peaceful. This is a very good place to visit when you just want to relax. The gardens were just starting to bloom, but we enjoyed sitting on a bench and people watch.

Kids had fun sailing a boat!. We walked into the Gardens just to have a look. They are very nice and have lots of people stopping in for a break from all the other attractions. It's a nice place to rest and relax. There is a good sized pond and they had small sailboats that you can rent and then push around the pond from the edge and then move around to meet your boat and push off as it sails across. Our kids had fun doing that.

Make time to see. On a sunny day there is no nicer place to be. Bring your own lunch. So much seating. A cafe and restaurant should you require them. Stunning gardens, Performances on the stage/bandstand. Children sailing boats on the pond and a great place to people watch or sit and read. Make sure you go when the weather's good though as the palace isn't open to the public and the museum isn't open in the summer.

MUST visit!. This was our first stop after landing in Paris--- to soak in the sun, and take a Parisian nap in the unreal gardens of the city. We could not believe such luxurious, stunning, and peaceful gardens could possibly exist in a city! The views from every corner are beautiful, some with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Great place to take breaks in from all the city walking. Grab a baguette, some wine, and park it in the gardens for a relaxing Parisian afternoon.
Romantic, and prefectly beautiful. The late summer flowers were in bloom. the reflecting poo dazzled.The early evening crowd was all smiles.

Beautiful garden. A breath-taking museum in the heart of Paris. There are swans in the fountain area. so beatiful and the air is fresh. Less crowded than the other Turille garden. Do visit if you have the time.
Beautiful & serene. Luxembourg Gardens is a delightful place to stroll or sit and listen to music. We loved walking through the gardens and enjoying the beauty.

Great for the family. We were staying in an apartment just around the corner of this garden. Great place for a stroll an my son enjoyed the small rental sailboats pushing them around the pond even though he is 11. Well manicured gardens and a delight to visit!

Really gorgeous. I visited it in 1999 but didn't remeber much... instead, going there last sunday was really beautiful: incredible nice colors and everything so very well taken care of. Together with St. James' Park in London, one of the best "small" parks I'v been visiting.
Peaceful Oasis. If you are keen on walking around all of the Parisian landmarks, this green oasis is a great place to stop off for a rest.

Great place to stroll. It is so refreshing to see so many locals use the historic facilities of a city and keep it reasonably clean. Although Paris itself was not very clean in June 2014, the Luxembourg Gardens were. A great place to just sit, watch the crowd, enjoy the sun, and chill out. We were treated to an unexpected exhibition of World War 1 with very rare photos. There was one of various Indian soldiers fighting in France basking in the sun. It was a dramatic display of the pain Europe had gone through the war and how many Indians, Africans, Australians, etc fought for a cause they had little connection to. You should plan to spend about 1-2 hours here.

beautiful. Something for everyone. Relax, kids can sail a little boat, smell the roses, have a snack, watch the men play Petanque, stroll or sit with your love, incredible playground, pony rides, art museum in l'orangerie, clean bathrooms (.50 euro). Spend an hour...spend an afternoon. Can be crowded because it is such a lovely place.

relaxing. A great place to get away from the busy streets of Paris, an enchanting place to sit and have a picnic , there is a palace in the grounds along with tennis courts, childrens play area and even a place where children can sail little boats for a small fee There are many trees and flowers here along with some great art especially the Medici fountain. Plenty of seating available. Something for everyone here. Well worth a visit
Luxembourg Gardens. If you love gardens and flowers this garden is worth seeing especially in July when it is full bloom!

Beautiful Place. This garden is extremely well maintained and quite beautiful.
There are some information regarding various places outside the garden which is quite interesting.
Tranquil. This was such a wonderful walk enjoyed by myself and my two teens. We sat and watched the kids float their toy sailboats for a long time - beautiful

A Breath of Fresh Air. Take a stroll here and get the sounds and scents of the metro out of your head for awhile. We enjoyed a concert in the bandshell. Be sure to see the Medici Fountain, built in the 1600's and remodeled on order of Napoleon. Even if you're just strolling through, it's a lovely respite.

Great way to spend an afternoon. We were staying a 10 minute walk from the gardens with our children. Visiting the gardens was a perfect thing to visit with kids so that they could burn some energy. There is an excellent playground in the gardens. You have to pay a small fee to enter, but it's well worth it! We had to drag our kids away.
Beautiful Garden/Park. Really enjoyed my sit down and walk around this garden away from the walking and sightseeing around Paris what a lovely oasis in such a busy city.

Statue of Liberty. These Gardens are very pretty and well laid out. We sat out in the sun around the lake where there were toy boats with flags of different countries floating. When the boats came in to the wall around the lake children took great pleasure in pushing them out again with long poles. While we were there a man with a very thick accent came over and asked us in English where he would find the Statue of Liberty. I thought it was some kind of joke and I looked around for TV cameras. I discovered afterwards that there is a replica of the Statue of Liberty in the Gardens. Unfortunately the rain came down very suddenly and heavily and took the sun away so we never got to find it.

Where the crowds thin out. This is a fantastic place to visit to get away from the frenetic areas of Paris.Pros: quiet; room to spread out and catch your breath; beautifully manicured gardens with colorful plants, fountains, sculptures, and shade.Cons: kids may get bored quickly; there's limited shelter and you can get caught in the rain.Metro is nearby as is the Pantheon, so you can make a morning of that part of Paris (just South of Notre-Dame and Sainte Chapelle). There are also some fun cafes just East of the gardens (between the gardens and the Pantheon).
beautiful gardens in center of Paris. Relaxing, spacious, beautiful trees and flowers. There is a café, pond with toy sailboats to rent, vendor stands with cold drinks, ice cream, even wine!
Nothing special. Grades are nice and flowers were out in full bloom making it very pretty but not much else to see or do.

very nice couple of hours to spend with the kids. Beautiful gardens, well maintained.
It has nice activities for kids, all require payments (even using the swings), but nothing too expensive. A couple of euros per facility.
Don't miss hiring a toy boat and let the kids sail it in the pond - mine had a great time.
Salt shaker. Usually the best view is not on the top floor. You can climb for free to get a good view. Be prepared for a long queue. Usually you can climb any of the four legs at the start.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens very well maintained lovely to sit and have a coffee or bite to eat and take in the views!
Beautiful & Relaxing. Must visit this! Very relaxing get away from the hustle & bustle of the city. We were sitting there like everyone else watching the pond of water.

BEAUTIFUL AND RELAXING. I love gardens so I had to see these, they were beautiful, lots of flowers, trees, chars, statues, fountains, very large, relaxing and spacious.
Near the Palace there was a large map of Europe on the ground and details of World War 1, which we all found interesting.

Beatifully presented gardens. We loved the fact that the gardens had an abundance of chairs that you could use. There is a pond in front of the Palais where you can hire sail boats. There is also numerous statues around the park
Pleasant Experience. Having breakfast in the park. We had chocolate crepes and ham and cheese crepes and lovely coffee from a booth located in the grounds which was delicious. Nothing to dislike.

Beautiful place to relax away from the city chaos. Lovely place to relax away from the busyness of the city centre. If your feet are burning from all the walking around, to and from different metro stations, sight-seeing then this is the perfect place to put your feet up and relax (Weather permitting). Lots of space, plenty of chairs and a huge selection of trees to provide shade if the sun is too much to bare.

a peaceful and artful oasis. a refuge for Parisians and visitors alike, with everything from boules and tennis courts to magnificent flowers and fountainside seating. Plus a fabulous playground for kids and many nice cafes. A real treasure.
A nice place to visit. It was very nice visit as I watched I life waltz dance with 19 century customs .Thank you trip advisor as you helped me alot while my visit to paris

Beautiful gardens. Paris has lots of beautiful parks and gardens and this is probably one of the best. It has lovely benches in shady pathways under the trees as well as chairs in sunnier spots. There is a charming boating lake in the centre of the garden where children can hire small yachts and push them around the water with sticks - it feels like going back to the 1950s. A delightful place to sit with a baguette for lunch and there's a man selling ice creams outside the main gate.
Wish we'd brought lunch to enjoy!. These gardens provided the perfect place to sit and rest for a while. I wish we'd had more time to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.
Beautiful garden. This is a beautiful garden. Kids loved playing with the boats (3 euros/30 minutes). Lot's of flowers and shadows.A nice place for relaxing at the end of the day.

sit on the RIGHT seat on the carousel or else.... Nice park with the pretty areas being cordoned off... But still nice place to chill out with lots of chairs to enjoy a nice takeaway meal! The children's play area was mostly pay-to-play and with so many kids being herded in, we decided to give it a skip. The carousel was not that pretty but there was some sort of improvisation to make up for that: kids were given a stick and as they went around, they had to use it like a lance to catch some metal rings. Don't think there were any prizes for the kid with the most rings, but it still looked quite fun. Only thing was that any kid unfortunate enough to be sitting on the inner parts of the ride were not able to participate, making the experience a very depressing one for both kid and parent. Every round reinforces what a dumb and terrible decision it was to sit in the inside and eventually, after some irreparable psychological damage has scarred your kid for life, you will feel so guilty that you pay for another ride (so he can sit on the OUTside this time) but all the while you know its too late... the damage has been done.

Best playground. We are 2 families traveling in Paris for 4 weeks with 5 kids between us ages 11-7. This is hands down the best playground we've been to yet - they played for hours while we waited and talked. Lots of very different equipment and huge sand area. We will have to go back for the puppet show or anything else the parents want to see since they were so happy on the equipment (and meeting other kids) we couldn't tempt them away. In fact we saw a couple playmates at a crepe stand on the other side of town the next day and another at Versailles after that - the place to be for the under 12's:-)
gardens. Beautiful must see, very nicely planted gardens and historic building with amazing statues throughout. The maze of trees and a little sail pond in the middle. It was very nice on the eyes.

Wander and linger. Don't rush thru here. Instead zigzag your way discovering the unique segments and the people attracted to each area of the park. The yoga grassy picnic area, the formal gardens and sculpture, the kids playground with different gym workouts, the game tables, etc. Also, we loved the featured WWI photos of France that were hung along the outside fencing!Unfortunately, we were alittle too early to try the ice cream near the senate building but it looked like a great pushcart and restaurant?The rumor is that underground is the location of the French equivalent of the CIA? But didn't see any evidence?We spent the morning here and then walked to the Pantheon for a quick inside tour and lunch in the square at one of the Brassieries...delightful!

Smelled Cat Pee Everywhere. Looked mice but smelled like cat pee everywhere. Just disgusting I feel for the kids trying to play in the sandbox. Everything smelled. The place is just infested with cats.

Beautiful scenery!. A beautiful stroll in the early morning will make your start of the day more agreable! The park is very small yet serene. Make sure you visit the museum. A must see while in Paris.
nice. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a nice garden, it's really big and beautiful with a little lake in the middle and many flowers.
A Gem. Beautiful gem in the middle of everything. When we visited an orchestra was performing. It mad for a magical setting.

Nice place to unwind and relax. Not a whole lot here to actually do. It is a large botanical garden area. There is a playground for the kids and a couple tennis courts. Lots of room to walk around and sit down to just relax and recharge. Nice view of the Senate building with a large pond and a lot of flowers. If you have kids this is the place where they can run around.
Beautiful and spectacular. Awesome setting and an incredible atmosphere. You feel that you are in another world, not in the center of Paris.

Very relaxing picnic spot. Great place to give your feet a rest when touring Paris. Just find a couple of chairs and enjoy this perfect place for a picnic lunch while watching the kids playing with the boats on the pond.
Colourful view. A large park with fountains, statues and great display of flowers. I visited in a showery period but it was still a delight and a great place to sit and enjoy the sun
Great place to relax. Free chairs to sit in, sun and shade, pleasant walk around the garden. Toy boats to rent and sail on the pond.

All the best of Paris. Jardin du Luxembourg is my favorite spot in Paris, no trip to the city without a stop at the pard for me. It's so beautiful and peaceful. A great place to have a stroll far from the hustle and bustle from the city. It s a great place to stop by with kids too as there is a playground (you do have to pay though, I gather it was 2 euros a kid last time) and a fountain where they can rent a wooden boat and play with it in the fountain. Furthermore there is a museum at one end of the parc and there are some real beautiful statues in throughout the parc. Great atmosphere all together.

Nice to sit and relax. Stopped here for a rest while walking around Paris. Nice gardens with plenty of places to sit. The palace and surrounding gardens are impressive. Loved seeing little tots sailing boats in the pond...adorable.

Excellent park. Brilliant park, very nicely maintained. Visible security presence so you always felt that you could completely relax. This is obviously the place to come for a jog! My daughter is a bit older now, but those under 10 years are catered for with sailing boats, pony rides and a nice play park. Lots of chairs available for you to position where you like. Lovely on a sunny day!
great place to relax. all the chairs around the park where you can sit and put your feet up, gorgeous gardens and a perfect place to sit and unwind as you watch the people go by

Flowering Garden. The Luxembourg gardens were very well maintained and there were many flowering plants there. There were lounge chairs placed all over and many people were just relaxing and enjoying the sun. There is a fountain close to the palace and you can rent a small toy sail boat for the kids and they can run around the fountain pushing the sail boat off the side of the fountain.The garden stretches for miles and its a fun relaxing afternoon to spend in Paris.
Beautiful Gardens. Just walking one day and came upon this garden. Beautiful area. Bring a lunch and sit for awhile, worth the walk.

Beautiful, peaceful, relaxing--ahhh!. Spent our last day in Paris at Luxembourg Gardens, and we all agreed it was our favorite day! From the gorgeous palace, to the spectacular gardens, the Medici fountain with the sailboats going by, the vendors selling crepes, the people having picnics and just relaxiing--it was perfect blliss! Bought sandwiches and drinks on the way to the gardens and then enjoyed the superb people-watching and slow pace all around. There are even wonderfully comfortable chairs situated under the grove of beautiful trees. The perfect place to spend a day or at least part of it. Do yourselves a favor and don't miss it!

Beautiful place to relax. Paris is a great city, but you may find that all the sightseeing and walking wears out your legs quicker than you think. On our last few hours however, we took in the lovely Luxembourg Gardens which can be accessed free at several points. It's perhaps not as large as some reviewers seem to indicate, but it is a great size to wander around at your own pace and sit on the free chairs which are scattered around, either in the sun or the ample areas of shade. The old Palace provides a stunning backdrop to children playing with toy boats on the small boating lake whilst a band played nearby under the trees.If you are in the area and fancy a short time of reflection away from the busy streets, then take a stroll through here, you will enjoy it.

beautiful gardens. went on a sunday afternoon - beautiful gardens. a lot of people lolling around enjoying the sun. beautiful flowers and greenery (more impressive than versaille, except for the size) very nicely laid out. the pool was fun - lots of little children with sailboats. and a map of the world on the ground so that people could trace sites from world war one.
Fairytale Garden!. It's a very nice garde. You must take a RER B and stop in Luxembourg. I suggest you to go there while afternoon

Great for the kids. We spent an entire day here with the kids. The gardens are beautiful and free to enjoy, but almost everything in this park for the kids costs money, but it is still cheaper than any of the museums in Paris. Here are some of the activities we tried:1. There is a large playground which you have to pay to enter (2.50 Euro per child, 1.20 Euro per adult but adults can wait outside if your kids are older ie. 5+). The playground has good climbers and slides, and the big attraction is a zipline like ride that does a little loop. Go early in the day for the zipline, as it gets lined-up in the afternoon.2. You can rent a model sailboat for 3 Euro for 30 minutes and "sail" it around the pond. Watching other kids at first it seemed a little lame because you just direct the boat with a stick and give it a push (a remote control would seem more interesting), but the kids enjoyed their half hour, and you meet lots of other tourists when your boat collides with theirs.3. Pony rides for 3.50 Euros last about 5 minutes.4. There was also a puppet show (http://www.marionnettesduluxembourg.fr/acceuil.html) for 4.80 Euros that appears to run daily in the summer, but we did not go.The park is also a busy place with an area for chess matches. There were also a few tables playing contract bridge. We also saw a boot camp and a tai chi class.
Beautiful place. Very nice gardens. We were lucky enough to visit when the weather was good. Not too crowded on a Friday afternoon and definitely worth a visit.

Really beautiful Setting. The Luxembourg Gardens were so beautiful to visit. My boyfriend and I visited a nearby bakery and bought some croissants, then wandered into the Luxembourg Gardens which is an ideal spot to sit back and relax in between sightseeing. I love how you can just grab a chair, take it to your favorite spot and relax.

A terrific place to relax. Truly a wonderful urban park - I would recommend a visit to anyone. Its easily accessible and appropriate for families and those who want to just relax in a beautiful formal garden.

Great Place. We stopped here one a very nice day. The weather was perfect for a walk in the gardens. It is a great place if you like to people watch or just enjoy nature. The garden is so well laid out and the way the flowers are done is just wonderful. We really enjoyed the time we spent there and it was a great rest day half way through our 7 day trip in Paris. Next time we will have to do lunch in the garden.

Splendid. . Stunning, vast and peaceful gardens. I can spend an entirely day just walking around. Luxembourg gardens is huge. I was only in a small section of it but it is the place to go for a peaceful walk in a gorgeous garden.

Refuge from city streets. we visited on a Saturday afternoon, on entering we came across a rotunda with people of all ages dancing in it, to music that went from rock n roll to current hits. Very charming, beautiful formal gardens, lots of vibrant summer colours, statues & fountains, toilet is at rear of café (50c to use). Lots of chairs & benches to sit on to soak up the sun & atmosphere & rest weary feet, a lake in middle with sailing boats, people playing chess & tennis & sandpits & paddle pools for children. probably others that we didn't see as we weren't there that long.

Relaxing Garden in the Latin Quarter. We visited on our last afternoon. It was a beautiful day so the park was packed, but we were able to find a place to sit and relax. Highly recommended if you have some time.
Lovely for afternoon visit. Greatly enjoyed our afternoon visit. Easy to get to by bike. Many shaded areas to rest our weary feet and relax.

Good example of French style garden. If you don't have time to visit Versailles, which has the fanciest biggest French garden ever, this medium sized garden has all the basic French garden elements: perfectly planted and trimmed trees, statues, a nice building. But versailles garden is a bigger and much much more amazing garden with more variety and fountains too.

Lovely place to relax. Some beautiful landscaped gardens plus sections where you are able to lounge on the grass. Lovely place to pass a few hours when you need to get away from the noise and bustle of Paris.

Perfect spot for relaxing. After a hard morning of sightseeing and museum visiting, how lovely to find the perfect chairs in the perfect sunny spot. Watching the world go by, Parisians at leisure, in a beautiful setting.
Beautiful. A beautiful place to rest and relax for a bit after a lot of walking. Go there after visiting St. Germaine des Pres area.

Picturesque. Beautiful to do everything and nothing in... Every angle was simply picturesque! Perfect for family and couples and even walking there by yourself for a leisurely stroll. Its good that it's simply outside of the Louvre.

Great park, steer clear of the cafe. We loved the park. You can spend hours there, walking around, sitting on one of the many chairs available for free, watching people play tennis, etc. It's a very beautiful and relaxing place to be.The cafe is another story. The waiter was extremely rude to us. There's a walk up window to get food and drinks attached to the same building the restaurant is in, but I guess they are separate. It is not obvious. We had some drinks from it, so the waiter would not help us find a table and chairs (people move them around) even though we wanted to order lunch from the restaurant. He didn't send us away, but wasn't helpful either. Later I guessed it was because we had drinks from the walk up stand, but I'll never know for sure. He made hand gestures at us, gave us dirty looks, and somehow got my wife to clear dirty plates of previous guests from the table we were trying to sit at (while I was off trying to fetch chairs). He ultimately refused to wait on us. As one of the reviews below noted, it did sort of ruin the experience. I also saw the waiter chase and confront another patron into the restroom area. Incredible. Almost like a parody of the well-known stereotype, except it was for real. The people in the walk up stand were nice though.
Beautiful!. We walked through here, the gardens were bright and outstanding, if we had more time we would have went back and had another picnic here. Such a great spot!

Quiet and lovely. The best way to enjoy dusk in Paris. Pull up a bench with a cup of coffee and a baguette and some cheese. Watch the children play and the lovers holding hands while they stroll. Calm and peaceful.

Pleasant place to relax. These Luxembourg Gardens in the centre of Paris are a little touch of Paradise! It helped that we visited on a warm, sunny afternoon I guess. We could have spent hours there just soaking up the atmosphere, people watching and strolling through the manicured beds of flowers. I just love how the French align everything!! Even the rows of trees and the park benches are neatly organised in these gardens, as with others. There is a lovely spot beside the large pond where we sat and watched the children playing with the little sail boats. I took plenty of photos and will enjoy looking at them when I can no longer visit for real.

Place for a lunchbreak between museum visits. It's a very good place for a relaxing and cheap lunch break between museum visits. The bufess there are quite cheap and you can stetch your legs, having your sandvich and coffe. You can see sunbathing Parisian during summer months.
Beautifully Presented. Not such a large garden, but immaculate and really beautiful.We took a picnic - plenty of places to sit in the shade, but be prepared to need clean away bird droppings.

worth a visit. This is a nice relaxing place to stroll and let the kids run off some steam. Grounds are quite well done. Takes around 30-60 min to see main areas, we watched a pick up game of football and then some brilliant guys playing an animated game of chess then at closing a security guard comes over and smacks the pieces off the table. They were not impressed but it was memorable!
A gorgeous oasis. Great place to grab a ham and cheese baguette and some drinks and wile away a few hours just watching the world go by. A timeless, beautiful place.
Much nicer than Tuileries. Much much nicer than Tuileries. Worth a visit. The fountain near the north end on the east side is a nice place to rest on a chair.
Great place to relax. The Jardins de Luxembourg are a great spot to relax while you´re in Paris. The well manicured gardens are the place where many Parisians go to relax in the afternoons.

Great place for great rest. Paris is just lovely city. The Jardin du Luxembourg, or the Luxembourg Garden is one of the green and beautiful places, where you can go for a walk, to read a book, to run, to take a picnic or just staying and watching all the beauties. There are lots of chairs to sit on and tables around the gardens.

Lovely gardens, don't eat/drink at the cafe.. We spent a great couple of hours at the park, it was very hot out so we tried to find the most shaded activities. The kids really enjoyed the playground (you have to pay to get in) - it was shaded and fenced in so they could play and we could relax. They got boats and sticks to play with in the fountain, that was entertaining for a bit, and then we got a drink at the cafe. The waiter was overworked and insanely rude to us - we asked for a small lemonade and he brought us a giant Sprite (for 6 Euro). Sprite is not lemonade, FYI and 2 small lemonades shouldn't cost 13 Euros! So when we complained he got really rude and that sort of ruined the experience. Overall a lovely place to spend an afternoon, just avoid the cafe.

Stunning. Had a lovely walk through the gardens but you need to remember that there is more to be seen than just the main part. In smaller more out of the way areas there was a small allotment, a fallen tree sculpture so you need to get off the main paths and explore. Security guards chased away any unwanted street sellers so we were rarely hassled by them.
Gorgeous Gardens. This is a beautiful and tranquil setting, not to be missed! We spent an afternoon leisurely strolling, sitting by,the water, watching the wee sail boats.

A Fun Place to Stroll No Matter the Time of Year. This lovely park is a Parisian favorite and is always well used. You'll see people strolling, sitting on the metal chairs around the ponds, kids sailing the sail boats on the ponds, having snacks at the cafe, kids in strollers, young people on skateboards etc.It's especially lovely in spring, summer and fall, when all the flower beds are planted and every year we visit we take our hate off to the gardeners who do such a good job.The paths and the huge circle around the ponds are lined with statues---some are French saints and queens, some nymphs, all really good, So, you can stroll around and admire those too.Even in winter you can stroll and still feel some of the beauty.

Kids' Paris. Paris is a heaven destination for families with young kids with its many parks surrounding almost all tourist attractions. In the beautiful neighbourhood of musee D'Orsay and St Germain, this huge park has different parts for different visitors. Loved watching the children poking their sailboats in the pond, people chilling out on the green metal chairs, joggers, picnics on the grass further in.The big fenced in kids playground is at the back near the tennis court, €2.50 per child, €1.20 per adult and has a cool sandbox, huge slide buildups and a climbing net. Drinks for sale and Toilets on site. There are pony rides and carousel nearby. Playground closes at 7pm but the park at 830pm. Flowers are in bloom made the park very pretty.

Great place to have a picnic and people watch. We visited the Luxembourg Gardens on a Sunday afternoon after spending the previous 5 days walking all over Paris sightseeing. We took a picnic here (visited a local supermarket) and bought a fresh baguette, cheese, salami and wine. There are PLENTY of chairs and tables located throughout the gardens. You can sit back and relax, have a picnic, watch people, read a book or walk around admiring the beautiful landscaping. We almost missed this place but decided to go after being exhausted from running around for 5 days. This is a wonderful place to relax and unwind and still feel like you are visiting some place special in Paris

Visiting with children. I visited jardin du luxembourg a couple of days ago with my three children aged 3, 5 and 7. First of all we hired a boat to sail on the pond, which was hectic but fun, then we sat in the sunshine and watched the children play on the grass...for all of 3 minutes, until they were reprimanded by the park guards! The man who told them to 'keep off the grass' said that there were dangerous animals that could cause them harm on the grass!! I really couldn't work out if he was joking or not. We gave up on the grass and headed for the playground. By the time we got there it was around 5.20. A quick play on the climbing frame and then we would head out for food, or so I thought. However, when we got to the playground we realised that to enter we would have to pay 2.50 euros per child and 1.20 (approx) euros per adult. We were disgusted. It was absolutely packed in there and looked like a complete headache, without having to pay for the privilege! If we had been intending to spend the whole day there it would of been slightly different, but for a 10 minute play it just wasn't worth it. I don't think we have ever had to pay to go into a 'public' playground before. Even the Diana memorial playground in London is free of charge.
The perfect combination of beauty and recreation in the heart of Paris. A great place for a short break from the city busy life. I did my running there every morning. Perfect!

Beautiful spot for relaxing. Take a bottle of wine, a baguette, cheese and charcuterie and go relax in these fabulous gardens. We watched tennis, enjoyed the gardens, rested on the benches. It was a lovely afternoon.

beautiful gardens. these are worth a visit, you can walk from central paris, or via Metro very easily. We had the most beautiful day, and you can walk around and see everything. Angelina's cafe/patisserie (famous in paris), is close by to stop in their tea rooms and enjoy

Relaxing and Beautiful. I could walk for hours and hours and not even realize it. I have been many time, but still go back every time I visit Paris!
Dr. Mohamed Abdalla Tillsonburg
Simply beautiful. I love stolling through these beautiful gardens, always very peaceful & a nice place to relax! We make a point to visit these gardens everytime that we're in Paris!

Stunning. Prettiest park I've ever seen. Chess in one corner, Baby pools and sand pits next to it, people watching around a pond and kids playing with boats in the pond. The garden was meticulous. I loved just sitting there and soaking up the surroundings.

Beautiful part of Paris. Watched our daughter play in the park bandstand. The music was great and a local youth band from the UK attracted a large Parisian audience that was so appreciative...encores demanded!The park is beautiful and a quiet oasis from the bustle of Paris.We ate at the park café and the food was simple but delicious and for a stunning location, with a captive audience was surprisingly good value.

A dream park, it has everything!. WOW! Loved this park. It is enormous, beautifully maintained. Even the citizens try to pick up litter to keep it clean - that is impressive and shows pride locals have in this park!This park provides for such a fun ambiance, it have beautiful trees, tons of flower beds, ponds, statues, and a JOGGING PATH! If I lived in the area, I would spend all my time here.While mostly locals visit the park for the traveler looking at things to do in Paris, this may not be on the top of your list, but do try to make it here especially since it is so close to Notre Dame. It is one of the things that makes Paris so charming.

Toy sailing boats on the lake. This is a very grand park and very well maintained with a lake in the middle where the children sail their model pond yachts.It was a beautiful summer day when I visited and I found the visit enchanting.

Simply Beautiful. Luxembourg gardens is a beautiful place to visit on a warm day. The gardens are expansive and perfectly manicured. I would recommend having a drink in one of the cafes whilst watching people and the stunning scenery

Awesome for families. The one thing I learned a little too late on our recent trip to Paris, was to make sure every day has some time for the kids to run around and be wild. Don't get me wrong, we had a great time at all the sights, but going to the play area at the Luxembourg Gardens made the kids feel like they had something all their own. The area we played in was great, you have to pay a small fee to get in, it's fenced in, and the play structures are awesome. Beautiful gardens, gorgeous all around, and a perfect place to let the kids run around, meet kids from all over the world and to relax a little bit.

Breathtaking. These gardens are amazing. They are laid out so nicely, with huge vistas of sunshine and grass and flowers, and then rows and rows of trees and tables and chairs that can be moved around. The locals clearly love it, with many joggers, and people reading and eating in the shade, people tanning, people falling asleep in the shade. It has a wonderful atmosphere. You can buy sandwiches, crepes, ice cream throughout. There are playgrounds for children spread throughout in discreet areas so there are plenty of quiet places for grownups to chat. The gravel walkways are peaceful to stroll along. There is a dark, shady pool with fish in it and ivy all along it. I'm so glad I went to see it one morning as it was a relaxing and useful way to spend my time in Paris.

Give yourself time to explore. It was every bit as beautiful and French as you see in the movies. Take a seat near the fountain and watch the children with the sailboats. Walk around and admire the flowers. Check out the older men and women playing some kind of card game, or just watch the people enjoying themselves in this beautiful space.

A lovely place to spend some time. The Luxembourg Garden in the 6th arrondissement was created beginning in 1612 by Marie de' Medici for a new residence she constructed, the Luxembourg Palace. The garden today houses the French Senate. The park is known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, dating from 1620. In the winter or the summer, a walk to the Gardens is worth the experience.
Luxembourg gardens. Great oasis in the middle of Paris. Grab a free chair and chill for a little while in beautiful surroundings.
Tranquil. nice place to visit on a late summers day - very tranquil and well looked after. We had a pleasant rest here, people watching and eating our lunch. Worth a visit
very nice, a place not to be missed. well set out, and the people were very helpful , just a very nice place to visit, not to be missed.Easy to get to.

Delightful. Such a gorgeous space. Luckily I was staying just a few blocks away, so I could spend hours here. Walking, sitting, lying on the grass, having lunch watching people. Great spot to be alone amongst hundreds of others seeking the same.
Peacefull and guiet. Time to chill. Lovely flowers. Handy chairs to relax in. Senate looks wonderful. Great location for pictures, eating lunch or playing a game of tennis.

Lovely with sunshine. I love this beautiful place , especially when it's sunny , the century trees , the lovely park , you can play chest , run , rest, eat a pancake ( not so good!) or a tartine with melted cheese !!
Live music in summer, just fantastic !!!
History and beauty. Wonderful place to stroll, sit, people watch and photograph. A great respite from the crowds when Paris is filled with tourists.

Beautiful Gardens. The Gardens are beautiful for a casual stroll or for a picnic - there are facilities to purchase food/drinks and also use of toilets nearby - on a windy day the chalky paths do create a bit of dust clouds so perhaps need some shades to cover your eyes

Unremarkable. We walked for quite a while to get to these gardens after reading reviews about them and were disappointed as although it was an open area it still seemed very crowded and the only grass you could sit on was packed. We only spent about 30 minutes there as we got bored, I would recommend for people who enjoy sitting down but for people on a weekend wanting to see paris, don't waste your time.
Wow!. Hands down our favorite park in Paris. We had picnics here and would have like to spend more time here, Ahhhh...we love Paris!

Beautiful Park and Gardens!. The grounds are magnificent and it's such a relaxing place for people watching and photo snapping. There are lots of benches where you can sit and enjoy a picnic. We saw lots of people doing yoga and meditating as well as tourists enjoying the park.

One of the best garden in PAris. One of the best garden in Paris, and definitively the most central.You can walk around as well as enjoy playing tennis on one of its 6 courts that you can rent for about 8 euros an hour!Highly recommended in summer time
The place to hang out. What a lovely place to sit and read or listen to music. The summer has concerts and in the evening one can see all the joggers doing their thing.

le jarden de Luxembourg. when ı was there I remember Joe Dassın's nice song " Le Jarden de Lüxembourg"it is love ,peace,and so on beautiful feelings give me always,l'humanite ,fraternite,egalite ..vive Le Jarden De Luxembourg..

Awesome for kids. Could spend all day here!. Our kids loved it here. The playground, which you have to pay around 3 Euros per person was one of the highlights for our kids. They have a kids' zip line for kids over 6 years old and my kids just couldn't stop doing that one. If as a parent you don't want to pay the entrance, you can just pay for your kids and then sit outside the fence and watch them from there. As an american, a bit weird to have to pay to use a playground, but it was well worth it. These gardens also had sailboats for 3 Euros/ half hour. We got sailboats and the kids pushed them with a long stick. The fountain in the middle of the pond eventually brings the boats back to the edge. Our kids enjoyed this as well. Nicely kept gardens as it belongs to the government. Great trees and shade. They sell snacks and sandwiches. there was even a pony ride that you can pay for but we didn't do it.

Great place to visit. It is a great place to visit either with or without family.It's in the middle of Paris easily accessed.I personally find the place, even when crowded, tranquil with enough space not to be bothered by anyone.
beautiful. true European style gardens centrally located for tourist and locals alike, beautifully set out and clean and tidy, with great statues and buildings within the grounds
Magnificent. Beautiful garden, with flowers and trees. I must say it a small Versailles just center of paris! Great place to chill out when the weather is nice.
Picturesque Gardens. These gardens are lovely! It is also fun to watch the boats maneuvering by radio control in the fountain water.

A gem of a park. Situated in and around the Luxembourg Palace which houses the French Senate, this park is popular with Parisians particularly students from the nearby universities including the Sorbonne.Pull up a lawn chair and sit not far from the Fontaine de Médicis and admire the fish in the water or the beautiful that come and go.In the key shaped park, you will find sculptures of the Queens of France.You may strike it lucky and hear a free concert at the bandstand.Have you ever heard the famous song Les jardins du Luxembourg? We kept signing it as we walked around the gardens.The park is a great place to stop and sit and take a rest before moving on to see other wonderful Parisian highlights.
The best picnic ever!. The park is gorgeous! Locals play chess there every day, children play in the sand boxes, people are all over. Great for people watching and getting a feel for life in Paris.
Beautiful Gardens. Well worth a visit - Gave us a chance to relax and watch the kids play with the wooden boats. So adorable

Stroll through this park. My wife and I stayed very close to the Luxembourg Gardens. After checking-in we walked to the entrance. My wife had read about the Gardens prior to our trip. It was on her to-do list. If you had asked me ahead of time I honestly would have passed. It turned out to be a wonderful introduction to Paris and a great way to decompress after the flight and the Metro ride to the hotel. It is so relaxing and the grounds are impeccable. We got a kick out of watching several men play Bocce ball. I could not understand a word they were saying except for, "Oh, merde!" after a miss-throw and, "Viola!" with a winner. Here one will also find the Luxembourg palace, children pushing toy sailboats in the Palace pool, many statues including the original model for our Statue of Liberty. We sought out the marionette theater but we could not find it. There is much going on here yet it is still very calming. One could spent the good part of a day here with a picnic basket and a bottle of wine. My wife and I had neither so after about 90 minutes, we left to see what else Paris had to offer.

Spend time here!. We enjoyed Paris so much, but the afternoon here was a highlight. We strolled the gardens, watched children push boats in the pond, enjoyed intense Bocci ball, and then had a sip of hot chocolate at Angelinas! Perfect afternoon.

Stroll through on way to Notre Dame. It a big lovley park with a huge palace looking building and and an avenue of trees every where and loveley gardens.also it has a huge OS Map which shows the extent of the WW1 with explanations and details on the map which by the way you can walk on to, a beauytifull park
Nice for an afternoon stroll. But not much more than that. Maybe for families with young kids. We just missed the band. Nice gardens, but not much else to do.

Great for a peaceful break. Great place for a rest in the shadow of the trees, after intensive exploring the city. Good for a lunch or coffee break in a peaceful surrounding full of flowers with a pond in the center.
The most beautiful place!. A must! Absolutely beautiful, lovely to sit with a picnic and relax, gorgeous scenery, a nice gallery displaying local art too.

A beautiful place in a busy city. Perfect place to stroll and chill out for a while, away from the bustling Paris metropolis. Manicured gardens and water features with views of some of the great icons of Paris.

A quiet beautiful place. These gardens were a short walk from the metro. It is a local park with a large pond that kids "sail" boats on, couples hold hands and the general feeling is of relaxing. There is also a replica of the Statue of liberty in the statue garden. If you want to relax and take in the local scenery, away from the touristy side of Paris, head for the gardens! ( take some change with you for drinks and the toilet!)

Nice gardens and great playground .
