Came with my 18month old and enjoyed it thoroughly as she saw fish in the pond as well as in the sailing boat area plus she went into the playground for at least an hour which cost €2.5 child and €1.2 for adult for the day. She liked it so much we went back next day

Nice park, summer crowds. The gardens are on the list so I guess you have to go there. But if you've been to Hyde park or Central Park you'll find this place disappointing. Very busy in the summer and therefore not at their best - loads of people and vagrants lying on benches. However, we enjoyed walking through them. The gardens have a great history but not a great present unfortunately.

Favourite spot in Paris!. Luxembourg gardens are every bit as good as I've heard people describe it. What can I say, it's just a pleasant vast oasis of green in the middle of the city that never ceases to impress me. Inspite of the tourists, joggers, and locals that come to these gardens it still feels very calm and relaxed. A perfect place for a picnic spot; a sleep; reading a book; pondering over your thoughts and expressing you inner creativity; or just some exercise and running around the park. No other open-air attraction in Paris beats the Luxembourg gardens for me.

Sail a Boat for 3 Euro. Luxembourg Gardens is a great place to relax in the late afternoon and evening. Pay 3 euro and sail one of the sail boats in the fountain great for all ages. Each sailing was to last for 30 minutes however, no one was keeping time. You take your boat back when you are finished.
Lovely Park. Great place to relax. Beautiful flowers and trees and a great atmosphere with all the locals and families.
A reprieve. Grab a sandwich or salad from Mark and Spencers on St Michel Blvd, then head to the blessed shady areas of the garden for a picnic lunch. Everyone needs a break now and the.

Great for travelers with kids. In addition with the pond with toy boats for kids to enjoy, there's a super fenced-in playground for young kids. Our 3 1/2 year old grandson had a ball with the local kids, even though he only speaks English. Entry costs 2.5€ for a kid and 1.25€ for an adult. Definitely worth it.

World's best kids playground!. Awesome and safe playpark for kids. Sadly the pony rides we promised our kids werent available that day which was disappointing but the playpark made up for it. Our two didn't want to leave. Best of all, there are seats (Luxembourg chairs of course) all the way round the park so you can pay the low entry for your children to enter it , then sit with a coffee and watch them through the railings. Recommended.
Simply Wonderful. Very French. Take your kids for an old fashioned toy boat experience. Romantic. Beautiful and the heart of the Left Bank.
beautiful gardens. fabulous flowers and buildings. Lots of shade anda lovely cafewhere you can sit undertrees and listen to the brass band playing ( check on times).

Leisurely lunch in Luxembourg Gardens. My daugher and I spent a week in Paris and one day, instead of starting off trekking through the attractions, we bought lunch at Le Bon Marche food hall and sat in the Luxembourg Gardens to relax, read and enjoy. This is the most magnificent place that is exactly the same as when I first brought my daughter to visit 16 years ago. And that's a good thing. There are plenty of chair in which to lounge and enjoy the sights. There is a playground and children were enjoying pony rides also. Definintely worth the visit and remember to spend some time just enjoying the scenery and look up! You'll see the Pantheon!

Worth a quick stoll. I will say this, I have never been surrounded by so much physical beauty in my life and I think that made me jaded to how beautiful this garden really is. That said, you should plan to stroll the grounds and maybe take some food for a picnic lunch or buy from vendors around the park. There are some quiet spots you can stop and relax in. But, I would tell you to do this as part of a trip that incorporates others stops (e.g. the Pantheon is close by). Do not come just for the gardens as there are other gardens in Paris that are just as if not more beautiful

Runners in Paris!. If you are looking to run in Paris on a dirt path uninterrupted by street lights, this is the place! Many runners were out every morning, and the perimeter loop is about 1.25 miles with a bit of uphill and of course the complimentary downhill. I saw the same faces every morning and enjoyed being able to keep up with my 'trail' running while in the city. Of course, the views of the gardens are spectacular as well, and a stroll through the center is recommended.

Picturesque. We visited the Luxembourg Gardens again after 12 years (the previous time was on our honeymoon) and found it had changed a little bit. The first time, I remember "wild" birds would come to you and eat food you could purchase at the site. This time, it seems that has been discouraged, and bird seed is no longer sold. Apart from that, the gardens are well-tended and tidy, and the place is very relaxing, even with the number of visitors strolling around. There are metal chairs around to sit on, with some that are reclined, and it is quite possible to fall asleep (as some people had done). Plenty of items of interest there, with ponds and fountains, and the Luxembourg Palace stands proudly at the north section of the site.

Shady escape. Ok it was 93 degrees f. Picked up shrimp salad across the street & discovered lovely cafe inside gardens. Oh well, the shrimp was delicious to eat under trees. Watched children ride ponies. Slowly tours fabulous grounds. Relaxing cool Beauty.Absolutely worthwhile
A classic to see. A calm oasis in the middle of the city. Plenty of place to sit and relax your tired feet. Nice statues to look at beautiful gardens
A beautiful place to stroll and relax. I loved the beautiful gardens, children sailing boats in the fountains and the old statues. It was a nice place to stroll about and relax....
Truly beautiful. Just a lovely place to walk around. Was crowded but still lovely. Just a very pleasant experience. Well worth a trip.
Awesome. Very beautiful place, loved to spend my time there with my wife. Large landscape with many gardens, statues.... The fountain is a must!
Great walk. It was one of our favourite places in Paris. Really enjoyed our walk in the park. The atmoshpere is realaxing and the view is very beautiful.
Great Place Out of the Hustle and Bustle. We took pictures, saw an art show in the Orangerie and relaxed in this beautiful park with awesome sculptures and plants.

Weekend in Paris. A very nice park. My grandson throughly enjoyed it. Nice greenery and pleasant walks. Parisian crowd is more family orientated than the English and they readily smile.
Mainly went there for a stroll and my grandson to have fun in the play area.

Beautiful. The Luxembourg Gardens are delightful in the summer (we visited in July). The flower gardens right in front of the Luxembourg Palace are especially impressive and are a great place to sit and enjoy a drink or snack while you admire the palace, enjoy the colors, and watch the tourists go by.
Gorgeous Gardens. Certainly worth a visit. These are large gardens, beautifully manicured and just gorgeous to walk through and have a picnic lunch.
A great place to chill out !. Beautiful gardens so much to see and on a good day can spend hours here nice and peaceful despite the Crowds!

Beautiful!. Not only is this park massive, with a stunning museum (we didn't go inside but it looks gorgeous from the outside!), it has plenty of greenery and seats/chairs/benches to relax and take it all in.We stopped at the playground (there's a fee of 2.50 euros per child and 1.20 euros per adult to enter) for our 2yo daughter to play. Hubby took her in while I sat outside the fenced area and relaxed in the shade under a tree. The little one enjoyed it immensely and it was money well-spent. The playground is quite large with areas set up for various age groups. I noticed a stationary train, lots of slides and climbing structures, and even a zip-line for the older kids.Definitely worth a visit, especially if you're in the immediate area!
Nice Stroll. Very nice to walk around and enjoy a break from museums and metros. We were there in winter,; I can only imagine that it is so much nicer in warmer weather.
Great. plenty to do for kids and adults alike... spacious, cafe, toilets, playground... lovely chillout zone.

My favourite outdoor space in Paris. Lovely place to go to get some fresh air and open space in the middle of a busy city.
Loads of free seats (metal) to use, some reclining. Views of the Eiffel Tower and Senat building.
Cafes if you want them. Beautiful planting scheme.

Get lost for an hour in a beautiful place.... Lovely way to spend a few hours. People watching, strolling or having a picnic. It was very well kept with many areas to sit. No cost to enter the garden. Opportunity to rent little wooden boats to sail in the fountain. Beautiful place to take photographs.

Beautiful Park. This park was one of the highlights of our visit and we wished we could stay longer. The gardens are beautiful. The atmosphere was very relaxed and not too crowded. We didn't see any boats for hire in the fountain, but our kids had a wonderful time - the park inspired their imaginations. While our children played, we just relaxed in those fabulous chairs and enjoyed the people, the flowers, the landscaping and the scenery. It was a glorious sunny day. Please just go!

Wonderful experience. We visited the Luxembourg Gardens three times during our stay and enjoyed each time so much. Gorgeous esp with kids - pony rides, play equipment (for fee), and marionnette shows - so fabulous. Really worth it esp if you have children.

A day of perfection. Walking through these gardens is like being in a Victorian novel the grounds are pristine, the shade is welcoming and the afternoon we were there was a Free concert! Lovely place to roam, sit or just enjoy- love it.

A personal favorite. One of my favorite places in Paris. Perfect to spend a sunny afternoon in the company of a good book or playlist. Very beautiful and well mantained, it's good for the eyes and mind.

Lovely setting but not great for active kids wanting a kick around. I think the setting here is lovely for sitting around and enjoying the view. We went there with the children hoping to have a run around and perhaps kick a soccer ball and this wasn't the place. The "grass police" were there and enforcing the no sitting on the grass policy which is in place on most grass areas there. A nice visit but not for active kids wanting a run on the grass.

You could die here its that nice. Luxembourg was far from our hotel as we were staying in the champs elysees district making it a 15 minute drive. We decided to take public transportation through the public bus which was only 8 euro a person. If we took the metro we would have stopped to many places for transfers. The bus dropped us off right in front of the majestic Luxembourg Gardens entrance. As you enter their are many cafe's which are very overpriced so I recommend going across the street to pick up stuff or find a small non commercialized hut selling food/drink. The gardens are nice many locals exercising and reading. Beware it does get crowded after noon so arrive around noon to get a chair.There are chairs dispersed all over the park some lounge chairs if you can find them. There is a small view of la tour d'eiffel and of course the palace of Luxembourg. There is art all around the park specifically lion statues. The park has flowers all over and is beautifully maintained. We went on Bastille Day so the palace was closed and I dont know if it has an entry fee. Bathrooms in the park cost money to attend also. In the park their are people trying to sell boats to put in a fountain but they wont bother you unless you bother them. My favorite part probably of this is their was no venders trying to sell a eiffel tower or t-shirt. Afterwards you can go to the pantheon down the street a block away which is also nice. Overall this was beautiful and would gladly attend again.
Great place to hang & picnic. After a lot of touring had dome downtime here & had a wonderful picnic lunch. It gets busy on weekends but you can find a place to spread out & relax.
Beautiful park in the 6th arrondisssement. A wonderful place to relax, admire the flowers, watch kids sail remote-control boats, read a book and spend some time away from the crowded attractions.

Beautiful walking park. Well maintained park and a respite from all the sightseeing around you.
Usually has large photo displays on the outside fence that are informative
Tranquil in the evening. Nice park. There are garden chairs all about so you can sit where you want. Have a look for the original statue of liberty!

A five star park. But it is just a park. I'd include it as your "expedition" down Saint Michel and also take in Montparnasse, both the tower and area. You have a fine view, in fact, of the Montparnasse tower from Luxembourg Gardens. There is really nothing to do at the Gardens save relax and enjoy the landscaping and flowers. There is the cemetery Montparnasse nearby and the Catacombs.If you take the bus, or walk (its a pretty good hike from St. Germain), WATCH for pickpockets. Just putting your wallet or money in a side pocket is not enough. An interior, under your outer clothing zipped pocket or more is what you need. Really.

Beautiful plus kid friendly . These gardens are beautiful and not too crowded. The kids had a great time playing with boats in the fountain. This was not too expensive too (3 euros per half hour) There was live music playing and ice cream for the kids. Nothing complicated just go and enjoy!
Beautiful Gardens. Great attraction for resting and taking pictures. Don't miss is, no paying there - just enjoying views.
Free outdoor music!. Chanced upon a free band concert - super fun - lots of tourists - but it's Paris & everyone quite civil. Lots of gorgeous flora & space to explore. Beautiful!

Oasis. We took breakfast and ate in the garden since our hotel was fairly close. The garden wasn't crowded at that time and was beautiful. Enjoy the little sail boats on the "pond" and pick a shaded bench for people watching.
a must to visit. The Luxembourg Gardens are a "must visit' if you are staying nearby. I enjoyed them so much, that I revisited them twice more during the day - before and after an early dinner.

Relaxing after Bastille Day parade. Loved relaxing in these gardens after the heat and crowds of the Bastille day parade. plenty of shade to be had and lots of chairs to rest in. Paths to wander or jog whichever is your preference.

Picnic Here. Make sure you put together a little picnic, and pull up a chair in this nice, shaded garden. There are plenty of places to eat leisurely, and enjoy fountains, ponds, people watching, and the cutest scene with children playing with miniature boats. I adored it! There are public bathrooms over by the small cafe up the stairs in the Northeastern corner of the park, but you will pay to use them. I understand a lot of government business goes on underneath the park. Kind of a James Bond experience, if you will.
Small. Not sure what the hype is about. There's some nice art, but it's rather small. You can't ride bikes in the park either.
Beautiful and lively. Bustling and pretty! Great place to go for a romantic stroll in the evening! Lots of cafes and bars around!
Just Beautiful!. Beautiful gardens, peaceful and shady. Perfect for resting a little and listen to the children play!!!
Beautiful. Well worth a relaxed stroll through the grounds - it has been called the best public gardens in the world by some.
Beautiful Surprise. We ended up here by accident. The gardens are really beautiful. There are many spaces to just sit and read a book or eat lunch. It was a very relaxing and beautiful experience.

5 Girls in Paris in Fall. Loved the gardens. Great place to just relax and walk ..Beautiful flowers .. A must for great pictures. We also saw people that were taken an exercising class in the park. A beautiful place to go.

Favourite Spot in Paris. We visited the gardens on a lovely day and it was a fantastic place to relax in the sun! The gardens are immaculate and the views spectacular. On a Saturday afternoon the place is buzzing with a mixture of tourists and locals which gives it a nice vibe. An absolute must-see!

Breathtaking Gardens in the middle of Paris. If you like parks or gardens or want somewhere to take the kids to run around for the afternoon and be occupied with playgrounds and activities etc. this is definitely worthwhile to visit.

Try to make time for these Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens may well be one of the most beautiful parks in the world, it is so well integrated into the city, which makes it easily accessible. There are also many things to do there, You'll see children, older people, students, people cutting through on a lunch break, artists just to name a few. People come to stroll, play chess, to sit and read, people watch, to sit at one of the cafes or to bring their children or grandchildren to one of the many attractions for kids. Organized activities at the park include tennis, pony rides, puppet theatres, and toy sailboat rental (children float them in the large central fountain). Visitors can also stop inside the Palais and attend a hearing of the French Senate, which is open to the public.

Nice and calm peaceful environment to enjoy. Behind the Odeon theater lands a very big garden where citizens and visitors can enjoy a peaceful time under the shade to talk , rest and take sunbaths. There is a pond where kids can rent a model boat and enjoy playing.

Wonderful place for children. I took my 2.5 year old son here so he wouldn't be bored strolling around the Louvre with my husband and his older sister. What a great park, there is a large playground like non I've ever experienced in the center. The entrance fee was 2 Euros but well worth it, there are all kinds of playground equipment for the youngest up to the older children who even get to enjoy an amazing zip line course. There was a snack restaurant next to the playground where we ordered a croq monsieur and enjoyed it on the lawn in front of the lake/fountain area. After lunch we went down to the fountain and found you could rent little boats that you could put in the fountain and push with sticks when they got too close to the side. There were also plenty of fish and ducks to feed to my sons delight.

Beautiful Grounds. Luxembourg Gardens is fantastic for children of all ages. Take a picnic, and hang out in the sun. Rent a small sailboat to float in the fountain. Walk through the gardens and down the lovely paths. Play tennis, or sit on a bench and relax. I love the relaxed atmosphere at Luxembourg Gardens. Be warned: the children's play area is cool, but you need to pay to get in. Even for adults. Also there are little kiddie "rides" that require a small fee. I paid for my kids to use the playground and they had a marvelous time, although I would venture to say that the play area is primarily directed to ages 3-6.

Lovely Garden. This was a beautiful garden and appeared to have more flowers than others I visited while in Paris. It is very rewarding to witness how both locals and visitors make use of the gardens throughout Paris and a wonderful place to simply sit by the fountain and enjoy the sun or maybe pack a lunch and enjoy a meal.

What a chill out. . We headed here late afternoon and chilled out with the locals in the fading sunshine. No nasty groups of Gypsies trying to nick your stuff by thrusting a clipboard, sign here as others flock to your bags. Just heavenly.

A lovely place for a leisurely stroll. Away from the crowds and the traffic noise, this lovely park holds it's arms open to surround you with peace and quiet. Parisians are there with their children, playing with sailboats in the water, riding tricycles; and lovers are walking hand in hand through the perfectly groomed grounds. We even watched an outdoor ping-pong match. Benches are strewn throughout, in case you want to sit for awhile and soak it all in. We enjoyed it very much!

Perfect place to relax and take in the atmosphere. Stopped here to have a break from exploring Paris by foot and was impressed with the beauty of the gardens. Would be a great place to bring a baguette and have a lovely picnic lunch.

To be in peace!. Take a bottle of wine and some croissants in your visit to Jardim de Luxemburgo. It's beautiful and somehow quiet to be in the middle of Paris. This is a place to sit and watch people coming and going!
pretty, charming. This beautiful park made me want to sit for hours and look at people . The plantings and the park itself are beautiful. It is such a beautiful way to spend time in Paris.
Great green space. great green space in the middle of Paris. Obvious favorite of the locals on fair weather days. great getaway from the hustle/bustle of the face-paced city.

Better Than Imagined!. The gardens are vast and stunning. This isn't a traditional tourist stop and it seemed like most of the people enjoying the park were locals, but that made my time there extra special. The park is so incredibly well groomed and just perfect. Everybody was sitting about reading books and newspapers, having picnics and lively conversations, watching toy boats bob around the center pond, and definitely enjoying themselves! If I had more time in Paris I would have absolutely made a picnic and spent an entire afternoon enjoying the park. MUST SEE!
The Garden. it was so peaceful and tranquil walking through the garden with all the sculptures and colorful flowers and foliage.

come jog, walk or just relax!. Our hotel was only a 3 minute walk from the gardens, so we often passed it, or a couple times walk through it during our week stay in Paris. It is quite beautiful with walkway, broad promenades, walking/jogging ways, chairs and even grassy lawns to recline on. The weather was quiet hot for much of the week we were there, and as a result the gardens were full of people seeking shade to enjoy whatever breeze there was. The are kiosks there to sell food and water, as well as restrooms, so it is a beautiful spot to visit, which we did after hours of walking, just to enjoy a bottle of water. We noticed many runners of all levels of seriousness there, especially early in the day, so consider packing your running gear. Had it not been so hot, we would have joined them. Set aside a little time to visit here and relax!

Ya Gotta Love the Classics. Who can resist the allure of the original Paris Park, the one that is painted over and over again? The French know how to use their parks well. Look for readers, kids floating boats, lovers cooing, and special performances in the shady areas near side entrances. Many options here.
I love this park. This is a great family park, with gardens, a palace, sculptures, a small lake.... It has a really relaxed vibe, and it's close to everything in St. Germain and Latin Qtr.
Bring your own picnic to this lovely part of the city!. The gardens are so pretty such a cool setting during the hot summer! Great for the children to run off steam.

Beautiful gardens. The day we went we had a huge rainstorm and everyone in the park was sheltering. However, the sun came out and we were able to stroll around the beautiful gardens and sit on the chairs by the pond. The part we visited (and I know there was more to it) was stunning and so relaxing and we finished our afternoon with a cup of tea at the little cafe. Will go back and explore some more, maybe on a drier day.
Garden Gazing. Beautifully landscaped, this park has it all--tennis courts, playgrounds, sculpture, chairs and benches, a small lake for children to launch model boats.

A shady beautiful haven in summer. We strolled around the Jardins du Luxembourg on a very hot day and enjoyed the many cool spots to sit under the trees. The gardens are glorious in any season and the views all around delightful. Not to be missed if you need a break from the bustle of a big and noisy city.
Very beautiful and buzzing. On a lovely sunny afternoon there can be few greater pleasures than to walk and sit in the Luxembourg Gardens and to see the world go by

Great space, lots of people. Some very beautiful gardens here, but not just tourists here, your average Parisian taking lunch will be here so you get a real flavour of Paris. Some excellent patisseries on the way to pick up lunch too.

Beautiful, but you can't sit on the grass. I was terribly excited to come to the famed Luxembourg Gardens after doing my research. The park was beautifully maintained, with gorgeous landscaped grounds and many picturesque statues and fountains. However, we left this visit until the end of a very long day with the intention of relaxing on the grass with a good book. Unfortunately sitting or even walking on the grass was forbidden, and we were forced to settle for the chairs they have scattered all over the park. All in all it was fantastic, and we didn't let this small detail ruin our visit.

A great slice of Paris. A haven in the middle of a busy city. We went there on a boiling hot day, along with the rest of Paris. It was still manageably cool under the trees. We saw Parisians doing their daily routine -- lunch, tending children, playing chess, kicking soccer balls -- all in a large beautiful park with many different areas, each notably different.

My daughter's FAVORITE playground in Paris!. The playground costs a nominal fees, but there's a zipline, merry-go-round and lots of climbing. When you're done there, ride a pony, sail a boat, and have a delicious, fresh crepe. Perfect Afternoon!
A Haven In The Middle Of A Busy City. Calm and beautiful - even though there will inevitably be a fair few people there. Nice 'woodland' cafe (with usual Paris prices) and clean toilets (50 Cents).

Amazing experience with so much to do. On a sunny day you can walk around St Germain and buy some meats chocolates a bottle or wine and head to the garden. There's plenty of place for everyone. Grab the easy chairs or park yourself at the bench. Chill and watch the world go by.There is a food corner in the park as well. If you feel more a tube you can carry a ball or play tennis or cycle around too. My fave is to just sit around eat n watch the world go by.
Beautiful. Great place to walk through. Definitely a spot to visit if you have kids...the playground and carousel are beautiful.
Beautiful. I created a list of places to visit before my trip and this was on my list. The place is absolutely huge and beautiful! Nice place to stroll and sit to eat lunch.

Romantic afternoon, after rain. Trees, fountains, flowers, little benches and extravaganza Medici fountain: everything makes romantic stroll absolutely perfect. Leave one hour and relax in green garden, have a little coffee in garden cafe and check out statues (Zadkin site near by)

A Gem!. When in Paris you must make a special effort of visit this lovely park and gallery. Stroll along shady paths, picinic at a table under one of the shelters, wander the rose garden or sit and relax near the beautifully grand fountain. You can catch a puppet show on certain days and a must is a visit the photo gallery with it's ever-changing exhibitions. You can spend a day or an hour here but it is worth every minute of your time.

Go. Beautiful - perfect for a lovely afternoon. I had so much fun watching children pushing tiny wooden sailboats around in the main fountain. The park is huge, charming, and accessible. Outdoor bistro under the trees is expensive, but memorable.

Nice to stroll through. These gardens are nice to walk through--there's some shade if you want respite from the heat during the summer, and there's a large grassy area where people congregate/picnic that was nice.

Beautiful gardens.. The gardens were well laid out, boating lake was lovely to watch the little boats sailing around. The palais was stunning to look at. Lots of shaded areas to escape the extreme heat. Park police moved people off the grass.

Glad we didn't miss this!. Exceptional gardens, not your regular park! Be amazed by the nicely trimmed yard and well taken care off plants and flowers. Lovely to take one of the many chairs-for-grasp and to sit and enjoy the lovely surroundings.This place is not just a famous place for wedding pictures.We were lucky to have an American student band to perform in the parc. Great atmosphere. Next time would like to spend some more time here!
absolutely beautiful. We were especially impressed with the flower gardens. It was fun watching people playing chess. Tourists should be aware that there is a "pay" restroom here.

Definitely worth a visit. The Luxembourg Gardens and Palace were beautiful! If you can, grab food before-hand and eat in the gardens, sitting in one of the many chairs/benches available. It was a great afternoon watching people float the miniature boats in the water and admiring the gardens.
Nice place for a sunny day. Beautiful place if you have time to rest a bit and do a little picnic, take nice pictures and enjoy the view.
Peace & Quiet in Paris. A lovely area of Paris to relax and enjoy the peace and quiet away from the bustling tourist areas. I wish I could have spent more time here.

Fine music in the park -- free and front row seating.. The pianist is a winner of many awards and she played wonderfully. I knew most of the music she played and it was great hearing beautiful music outdoors in the park. Nothing to DISLIKE about her concert!!!!
Good for a wander. We enjoyed the gardens with a picnic lunch after we meandered around this beautiful setting. Good for kids to let off some steam after sightseeing.
beautiful, peaceful in a bustling city. Worth the walk. A cool stop on a hot day. Green grass, cool architecture, flowers. There are many cafes on surrounding streets.

Wonderful day at the gardens. Sunny day and child's play! If you're looking for so,etching to do with your children after making them look at all of the cultural sites what better way than to let them ride a pony and see a famous puppeteer perform in Luxumbourg Gardens? Soak up local culture and grab sandwiches from the park shop while the kids play in the large playground or ride the carousel.

A lovely place to hang out. It's impressive how many people were just sitting and relaxing here - reading, having a snack or meal, and enjoying the scenery. Kids don't run around and shout, there are no rough, loud sports played here. It's a beautiful, tranquil hang out.

most beautiful garden in the world. Take your lunch and eat it there - it is spectacular - there is a castle, ponds, plenty of chairs and seating areas, a creperie, playground, walking trails, flowers, grass, most picturesque landscaping. Do not miss this on your trip to Paris

Crowded. Like many of the European cities, this is a relaxing place to sit, think, read, etc. Tourists beware, though; the scam artists, pickpockets (use a money belt!!!! and keep it hidden), knick knack salesmen, etc. are out in full force. It was funny as many of the young men had their wares set out then scooped up the tarps and scurried off when officials came by as did the mini-Eiffel Tower salesmen. Very enterprising, especially the young man with a bucket containing bottles of water; I was almost willing to buy one over the bright watercolor prints of local highlights (I didn't buy either as I had a watercolor print from my last visit to Paris, and I was also afraid that if I pulled out money and bought something would be like the images of showing money to beggars in other areas). Later it looked like the young men were handing off to the next shift off to the side of the gardens, just like a changing shift at a factory; later we spoke to a local where very indignant as those free enterprise vendors don't pay taxes to the state. I'm pretty sure that there are rule against stepping on the grass, but I can't guarantee it as we stayed to the wide paths. The benches were full as we wandered mid-day on a beautiful sunny day.
beautiful grounds. Especially beautiful after the rain / sunset. Worth a walk around if you'd like an escape from the crowds. We went before dinner and enjoyed a laid back walk.
Stunning. The weather was awful, butthe gardens were beautiful. I had to go buy a jacket in July!! But it was worth it so I could stroll thru and see everything.
Tranquillity. A peaceful and colourful gardens worth visiting. Take the time to explore. Rush and you will miss out.

What a place!. I was just walking near there and decided to enter. Certainly it was one of the best moments that I had in Paris! It's extremely beautiful and I recommend you to go on sunset and sit over the chairs available!
Peaceful day in Paris. Beautiful place in Paris, quiet and relaxing.The only cons was there are not enough toilets and long distance walking to find them.
Relax. A gem away from the main tourist attractions if you are looking for a beautiful spot to relax and spend your day.

Relaxing and charming. People watching was delightful. There was a band concert that was free and well attended beneath shade trees. Elderly, families, toddlers, even some teenage ballerinas all enjoying the music.

Wonderful way to spend a day in Paris. We went to Luxembourg Gardens with our 4 year old and loved it. Took a picnic lunch with us and enjoyed the shade and beautiful flowers and people-watching while we ate it. Afterwards we went to the playground (2E50 per child for all-day play with in-and-out, and I think 1E20 per adult).There were plenty of seats outside for parents to watch their children play from afar. There was a great climbing net, a fun zipline and a big climbing/slide structure in the part that was meant for kids over 6, and the other side had equipment for kids under 6. Our 4 year old loved the big kid side. I wished we'd gone there earlier in the day to get more bang for our buck and more play time for our kid.We also treated her to a pony ride (3E30 or so) of 300m which she loved. The flowers were just beautiful. I really wished we'd had more time to spend here.

RELAXING. The gardens are all part of Luxembourg House which is now owned by the Government. There is only access to the gardens which are basically used by locals to sun, read, and relax. It is ideal for quiet time because although there were many people the gardens remained serene. Not much to see but statues and gardens and the great. Not much time needed for this visit.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful formal gardens, a great spot to take a walk around, relax in the sun or in the shade, and admire the various exotic plant varieties. We went for a visit in the early morning, and discovered that this is a prime spot for a morning jog!

Wonderful green space. A must do when in Paris. Lots of different spaces to explore, plenty of seating under shady trees and a nice cafe make these gardens lovely to explore. Many children were enjoying sailing their hired model boats on the lake.
Excelent view.. Good for rest and walk. Lot of greeb places and trees. I dont want to write anymore, so i'm just writing crap amd stuf. Goodbye.
Lovely!. Lovely gardens looking either down to Plac du Concorde or up to Louvre - so stunning both ways. Lovely walk through and great place to enjoy the sunshine and have a picnic.

Beautiful central parkland oasis. When we were there in Paris, it was beautiful sunny weather (that is, after a day if rain!). We went to Bon Marche and organised our own picnic, bought some wine and went to the Luxembourg Gardens. Plenty of portable seats (you aren't allowed to walk or sit on the grass). Had a great time. Could have seen more, ran out of time.
Excellent. Nice place to walk with the children, had band playing music added to the atmosphere and activities for young children where great pony rides

One of my favorite places in Paris!!. Beautiful park to visit, take pictures, enjoy, pic nic, etc. It has a big fountain, flowers and a castle, so you will have a nice view... It is nice to walk around the park... Take some time to lay down on the grass and enjoy the sun!!
Excellent place. A beautiful garden, where you can enjoy one day, leaving kinds in the park. 2,5 euros the entrance, and have fun around.

Beautiful. Perfect place to just chill out for a couple of hours and very picturesque, especially during the summer. It wasn't as busy as we expected so we all got seats (which there are plenty of) which is always a bonus.

Picturesque. The palace and gardens are worth a visit and I actually prefer this garden over the Tuileries. There are many fabulous gardens/parks throughout France and this one is probably in the top fifteen. Hemingway loved this place and I can see why.

An Exceptional Garden. A very tastefully designed and well maintained park with no entrance fees, there is no reason why this garden should not be on the list of all visitors to Paris. There were quite a lot of people around on the day I visited, but this did not detract from the joys offered by this garden. From the line up of trees, to the lovely colorful flowers, to the sculptures and the hidden canals, there was something to see at every turn and all delightful to experience. There were chairs and benches were visitors could sit to read, eat or do whatever else they pleased. As it is located close to many of the other tourist draws in Paris such as Notre Dame and the Louvre, it can serve as a nice stop over after museum touring. The time I spent at this garden was extremely pleasurable, and unforgettable. I highly recommend a visit to this garden.

Haven for runners. This enormous park is runner's paradise. Mostly crushed gravel surface, easy path around circumference, beautiful, and shady. Nice sculptures to look at as well as lush gardens and the chalet is impressive. Lots of runners and many entrances and exits.
Rainy day, but worthwhile. The gardens were magnificent even in the rain...location is easy to find among shopping and restaurants. A peaceful place amongst a very busy city.

Gorgeous!. This should absolutely be on your must-do list, even if you only have one day to spend in Paris.The park is huge and even on a busy day, you should have no problem finding a bench to yourself to sit and watch the world go by. The gardens are gorgeous and I would recommend grabbing a tea or a coffee, a snack or a sandwich, find yourself a perfect spot, and enjoy.Plus the palace and the fountain are very pretty as well.Enjoy.
Peaceful. so good to visit ~so relax the garden is clean and beautiful!!!!
Grand formal space. Elegant, water leading the eyes to the lovely palace, avenues to stroll and the changing gallery of photos on the outside fence. Brilliant!!
A must see. This is a wonderful park, great for an outdoor meal. Many locals could be seen having their meal. There are plenty of chairs to sit and enjoy the lagoon and the environment.

Don't skip this site in your trip!. It's a beautiful place, free, with no lines in the entry. The only perfect site in your trip!
I've been there on a sunday afternoon/evening and the place was very vivid. Recommended!

So beautiful!. This is a great location in Paris to relax and enjoy the Parisian everyday-life since the gardens are most often filled with students and families. There are some very nice buildings all around that are nice to look at and take pictures as well as the fountains in the small pond in the centre.
Visited March 2014

Enjoy the greenery and the space in an otherwise crowded city. We visited here on a drizzly day-----Still we enjoyed it and were entertained by the children sailing toy boats (rental). There were some strong winds which is apparently common, as there were signs warning of the wind. The garden is spacious and provides a nice relaxing break from the busier parts of the cities.  We did, however, encounter some young women with clip boards trying to get us to sign their petitions --and attempt to pick pocket us. Beware. Their paper mentions the "deaf and dumb" so this is the ruse. Avoid them.

I was disappointed .... To be fair, structured gardens are not really my thing and as well, as it is summer in Paris, when we visited, it was wall-to-wall people. Masses of people negate being able to appreciate nature and to savour the potential peace of the space. The oddest thing of all was that visitors are not allowed on the grass at all so if you're wanting to walk barefoot and feel your toes on the grass or lie on your back on the grass and feel the sun on your face - then you're at the wrong venue! They even have 'Grass Police' - ie people who tell those naughty people who dare go on the grass, to get off!

Beautiful!!. From our hotel we walked a few minutes to the Gardens. We enjoyed watching people play Baci ball, children on the play ground, the statues, the Orangery, and walking through history!! Beautiful grounds in the heart of Paris!!

Garden versus Park. After seeing many Paris sites, I've come to realize the Parisians should appreciate Napoleon and all the others of the time that created these wonderful palaces. If not for them, I don't think Paris would have much green space for today's public/ tourists at all. This was lovely, formal, and a tiny piece of Versailles walled within the city.

For the people.... This is not the most elegant or florally brilliant park I have ever seen but it IS possibly the most relaxing, people friendly park I have ever enjoyed. It is just lovely to stroll this park watching families enjoying the wonderful facilities: Playing with sailboats on the pond, Horseback riding, Enjoying the playground etc. It's also a beautiful spot to pull up a chair and enjoy a sandwich under the shade of a tree.
Beautiful, family friendly gardens/park. Lots of gardens, but plenty of lawns to picnic on; pony rides and chess games and benches--something for everyone to get away from the city hussle for awhile.

Must visit for any Paris visit. A must visit for any Paris trip; this is old school European era park at its finest. Spend a day and forget all thehigh tech gadgetry. You could spend an entire day in this small but activity packed park. It really is a stressrelieving space. It has something for everyone to enjoy, adults and kids. We came here as a family and the kids loved it.In the summer they had various musical performances in the pergola band stand including a highschool bandAnd then a professional jazz band in the evening: Highlights include:Ø Beautiful grounds, architecture, and flowersØ Various fountains and water featuresØ Great enclosed kids playground with things for kids up to pre-teensØ Courts for tennis, basketball, soccerØ Kids sail boat rental in the main fountain area.Ø Pony ridesØ Cafés Ø Lounging spaces Bring some snacks, a baguette, some wine or beer and make it a day.
strolling with the world. on a pleasant day strolling through the lux (or Tuilleries or Parc Monseau) is one of the delights of Paris
Beautiful park to spend a day. Awesome park and easy to get there by metro. There is also a big children's park. But it is a paid facility. My son loved the park. Can be quite crowded. Must visit.

What a great place to walk, run or even sit for awhile. This garden is rather large. It is beautiful to walk in and there are also several running/jogging groups. My best part about this park is that it is very dog friendly. you hardly see a leash all the dogs are close to their masters. There is a small pool area which all the dogs seemed to love. Not only would they splash in the water they would jump into the poor area nearly coming up to their necks. I think I saw "dog laughter" for the first time. This is such a beautiful park. A little something for everyone. If you don't like to walk you can rent a pedi vehicle which can sit two, four or six (it also has an electric motor).

Peaceful and beautiful. Lovely gardens with lots of flowers that weren't over-busy - not many tourists at all. Small lake on which young children were sailing boats. Nice fountain and lots of chairs to use to sit and take in the view of the Eiffel Tower or to read if the weather is warm enough. a hidden gem in a busy city.

Getaway from the city within the city. The largest park in the center of Paris with lots of routes and things to do. Usually crowded, especially during the weekend. Sometimes events are organized within the park. A great opportunity to avoid for a while the city noise and relax in close vicinity to nature.
Central Park eat your heart out. I guess the French have figured out how to relax in a park we loved it with a bottle of wine and sandwiches it was do beautiful. Viva la France

Relaxing stop. This garden is a beautiful stop over if you would like a slow stroll around after a bite in a nearby bistro. There are seats scattered around for you to just sit down and relax. Some people have their picnics while a couple of people were jogging. It's one of those rare gems for FREE in Paris. Go there way before 9pm because at around 9:15pm, the gendarmerie will blow their whistles to get people to get out of the garden.

So peaceful in such a busy city. The perfect place to take a break in such a bustling city. It is so peaceful and beautiful in the sun! The gardens are very well maintained and it is an ideal spot to have some lunch or just to relax. A truly lovely spot in such a busy city.

Luxemburg Gardens. It is an oasis from the busyness of the city. My grandchildren want to go there every day when I take them--beautiful scenery, small boats to rent and sail, and other children to meet.
Luxembourg gardens - get away from the crowds. We visited on a bright sunny day for picnic lunch. Beautiful gardens easily accessed by Metro. Great location to get away from crowds for a while.
Lovely garden walk. We walked through the gardens on a gloomy rainy day in Paris. The gardens and glorious and very colorful. Great trip on a Sunday afternoon.
Pretty Gardens. Like many Parisian gardens, nice to sit around and enjoy, but not much else. It is pretty though. Good for at least 15 minutes, if you're in a hurry.

Gorgeous formal gardens in urban setting. Love this park. In the middle of St Germain du Pres area of Paris is this gated park full of formal gardens, a fountain, a chateau-like building, statues, a small stage for plays, a small cafe. The atmosphere is so European: there are plenty of seats to sit and chat or just watch the world go by. And it's free! I wish there were places like this back home in the US. One of my favorite places in Paris.

early morning jogger's paradise. Up early and went for a walk in the gardens around 7 am. Beautiful and almost deserted at this time save for a few joggers. Flowers, trees, lawns benches, fountains and statuary - a great place to collect one"s thought before a busy day.
Just lovely. Just Magnificent . . Short walk from our hotel at St. Denis this lovely garden is worth spending an entire afternoon in

Great Gardens in a wonderful location!. This is one of our most favorite gardens in the world! It is nicely laid out and there are many features to enjoy. The Maire Medeci fountain is just fantastic! This is our fourth visit to Luxembourg Gardens and we will return again and again to just walk, sit in the shade, have a picnic, and just relax.
Beautiful and peacefull. Nice green spot in the little of a busy city. Good for rest remember to bring the famous macarones and a cup of coffee :-)
Great garden to enjoy on a sunny day. Beautiful gardens and fountains, enjoyed walking around and taking in all the natural beauty of the Luxembourg gardens.
Beautiful gardens. We enjoyed our walk through the Luxemburg Gardens as apart from the history was a truly tranquil place to visit.

Peaceful and beautiful. We were walking through the area and came upon these gardens so took the opportunity to walk through them Beautifully kept with lovely fliers in bloom and lots of life - we saw a band playing in the band stand in tribute to WW2 and there was an interesting interactive area to see the allied forces map further in the garden People eating picnics and playing games, schoolChildren about with their leaders and folks walking dogs; all very civilised We were there on Friday so not too busy Take a picnic and join in Would seek it out next time I go

Breathtaking park great for a romantic walk.. Amazing gardens and trees was the perfect place to walk with the one you love. Lots of amazing trees fountains and flowers. Just be weary of peddlers who ask you to sign what looks like a petion but is actually a scam, there were several near Tower

My favorite Paris Garden. I return every time I visit Paris. I find the Medici Fountain so mesmerizing and magical. Love to walk around the grounds and just imagine what it was like in earlier times. The is such a strong sense of tranquility.

Very nice Gardens for a restful afternoon. Beautiful gardens with many nice venues for sitting and relaxing with your family or friends. We saw several small groups with wine and cheese, enjoying the late afternoon weather and views.

Worth a visit if you have time. Unfortunately we visited Paris on a unusually rainy 6 days in July (usually a sunny month) so we didn't find the gardens at their best. But they were still beautiful and very photogenic so I recommend seeing this site although it is not as spectacular as for example Shonenbrun in Vienna. It is better than the Tulleries but not as convenient since that is next to other attractions so easier to access.Paris Pass lists the closest Metro station as Odean which is technically true but if you use RER line B there is a station named Luxembourg which is right next to the gardens so use that instead. There are other lessor known attractions in the area if you have time to explore them.

Lovely. All of Paris comes here on the weekends and in the heat of the day. Full of green, coolness, and statues, there is yet a hushed silence. Take your picnic and grab your own tree, enjoy the space as a welcome respite from Paris streets.

Lovely gardens to while away some time. Loved how chairs are provided everywhere and how the Parisians enjoy the place as well as tourists.Nice cafe / take away outdoors and lovely outlook. Great for a respite from walking around

A Great Place to People Watch. We visited the park on a lovely sunny day and we just sat near the fountain and watched a steady procession of joggers go past. It is a beautiful park and I will go back with my journal and just sit!

A Stroll in the Park. While this park is tres historique et politique, housing the Senat, it is also a great hangout on a summer's day. Don't miss the Medeci fountain. Currently there is a show of photographs of contemporary Vietnam in the Orangerie that is not to be missed.

Splendor on the grass. We walked through this beautiful park at what must have been lunchtime. Many people were sitting on the grass and eating. There was an orchestra playing classical music as you would expect in Paris. There were many people there but it is so large it wasn't a problem. Buy a nice picnic lunch and enjoy it here under the trees or in the sunshine, whichever you prefer.
Just a short visit before we leave Paris. Vibrant, nice view and many local people, near Panthéon.Handmade icecream at the entrance is actually nice.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful garden. There is so much to see and do in these gardens. There are beautiful flowers and many great activities to do.
Beautiful. Beautiful walk through the Gardens. Excellent photo display on WWI posted on fences outside and great "floor" map of WWI right by the Palace!

It's a Park. Maybe I was expecting a bit more. Maybe because we went on a Sunday. I'm not sure, but it was ok...a little sleepy. It's a park. We had wanted to have a picnic here, but there wasn't anything selling take away sandwiches nearby to do this (let alone a grocery store or bakery). It's a nice place to relax if you are tired....especially after walking around the St. Germain area, which we enjoyed.
Medici Fountain and lots of room. This is a beautiful garden with lots of great statutes and fountains and ponds to see.; and very restful.

Amazing garden for kids of all ages. This garden is amazing. I would have never guessed how much there was a to do...First you the gardens are absolutely beautiful..You can rent a mini sail boat for 3 euros for 30minsRide horses for 3-5 eurosSmall places to eat. There are lots of people running. There was a small concert when we attended. There is also a playground which is 2 euro per child and and 1.20 euro per adult with a ton of climbing and playing objects, including a small zipline which you would never find at a park in the US.We attended the Garden's twice because our kids had so much fun. You can make an entire day out of it and bring your own lunch.

Relaxing day with kids. Great stopover, especially for people with kids as they can rend and sail the boats on the pond in front of the palace (great photo op!) Also an outdoor cafe - a nice stop to escape the bustle of the city.
An oasis in town.. It is a beautiful park with an excellent cafe to sit down and enjoy the locals passing by, it is very much worth visiting.

Lovely place to stroll or just sit and people watch. We had just had a snack at L'Atlas on rue du Buci, and were in the process of making our way back to apartment near Bd Raspail. We wanted to go the gardens, but were a little tired, so decided to take a taxi. We arrived at the gate on the Bd Saint-Michel side and walked toward the big fountain. It was later in the afternoon/early evening, great weather and is wasn't that crowded. I imagine more people were watching the World Cup game right about then. We took some pictures and met some very nice people, and then went off and found a place to sit. I think we just sat and talked for an hour or so, before deciding to get a crepe from stand in the park. All in all, a nice place to just hang out for a while. The government building is beautiful as well.
A great place for the kids to run around. A lovely park with a very good children's playpark. Entry was 7.50 Euros for 2 adults and 2 children - it was safe and clean so we felt it was worth it.
Great area to enjoy a park in Paris. Nice place to take a stroll and enjoy beautafull park. Some trees have identification. There is a lake, bee hives, and nicely manicured lawns

Relax in Paris. We booked our hotel based on the proximity to this garden. The calm and beautiful area is the perfect spot to take a break away from the hustle and bustle of other tourists attraction.

Luxembourg Gardens. We walked a few blocks from our hotel to the Luxembourg Gardens. The gardens are beautiful. The fountains, statues, flowers, pools make the setting bucolic. We strolled in the morning along the gravel paths past statues, perfectly manicured lawns, trees and hedges. We relaxed on the chairs and admired the Palace! Paris was just coming alive and people were starting to arrive. What a beautiful setting for a public park!
Great place to relax and hang out. Beautiful gardens with a fountain in the centre. Great place to chill out and eat lunch, or dinner, or just have a beer or some wine.
Lovely gardens. A very well utilised park with an interesting fountain & walking/running track. Crowded at lunchtime but every person took their rubbish with them when they left!
Absolutely delightful. It's a place to relax, walk, sit, read, watch the little ones sail their model boats, and just recharge your soul. When the weather is pleasant, don't miss it.

Beautiful peaceful garden. We enjoyed the pool and fountain area the most. The governments official building is fantastic. They preserve the grass by denying access to grass but supply plenty of chairs and benches for visitors.

Luxembourg Gardens - a beautiful escape in Paris. These gardens were such a surprise - we visited on a beautiful sunny afternoon and enjoyed walking around the stunning gardens and the promenades of beautifully pruned trees. There were areas in both the shade and sun to enjoy and chairs scattered all of the gardens so you can stop and take a moment. The local Parisians also seem to enjoy this beautiful part of the city. There were many people wandering around and others just sitting in the sun chatting with friends or reading their books but it never felt crowded. There was also a wonderful children's play area. Lovely!

THE SUN CAME OUT AND THE GARDENS CAME ALIVE. Arriving at the gardens in a wet and glum day was not what I was looking forward to. After all, there are so many wonderful cafes to hibernate in when it's raining. Within 10 minutes of arriving the rain stopped and the sun peeked through the clouds. Another 15 minutes and the gardens radiated in sunlight. The flower beds were stunning and the lawns were cut and trimmed with military precision. Sitting by the lake with a coffee and a baguette from the cafe in the park was a wonderful way to while away several hours. Watching families and friends talking and picnicking together was a joy to see. Not one person had their face staring at a phone screen. Walking along the paths and taking in the beauty and tranquility of the park was great for the soul. A sanctuary for Parisians and tourists alike.
Wonderful!. We had the opportunity to listen to wonderful classical music concert outdoors. One of the highlights of Paris. Summertime is the best time to visit to see the beautiful gardens.

Beautiful.. This is a beautiful setting in the heart of Paris. The day we were there there were dancers dressed in attire from the early 1900's who were dancing in the gazebo. It was wonderful to watch.

Beautiful And Serene. My hotel fortunately was near the Luxembourg Gardens. My stroll through the gardens was wonderfully pleasant. The statues, gardens, and the comfortable stroll will stay with me for a long time. There are many small garden patches in which different statuesque art works are placed in the gardens. It sort of reminded me of an outdoor museum.As far as I could tell you were on your own pretty much. There were a few joggers, but I didn't see any wheel chairs, nor did I see any restrooms. There may have been some inside the garden building. It was not open when I was there.

What a wonderful place for children and our inner child. My wife and I returned to Luxembourg Gardens after 13 years and this time with our 7 and 10 year old children. She had remarked that it would be so great to return here some time with kids and let them enjoy sailing boats on the lake and ride ponies thought the gardens. She was so right and this became one of the highlights for our children while we were spent a week in Paris. There is a large play ground and for 1.50 euros they can play all day or rent a yacht for 30 minutes for them to sail across the lake or line up for a pony ride around the grounds - all so much fun. Better still bring a baguette or two, some brie and ham and have a wonderful picnic - this is a magical place.

An oasis in the middle of the big city. This is always my first destination in Paris. This time we were lucky to have a hotel just two blocks away, and as always the Jardin du Luxembourg lived up to my expectartions.

Fun outdoor time. People watching...kids playing...have a snack...take a nap....luck up on a band playing or children's music recital. Rent a toy sail boat. Fun outing for the family. We enjoyed our evening there before dinner while visiting Paris.

A beautiful respite in a busy city. Not only is there beautiful flowers and paths to wander with magnificent statuary but on Saturday mornings there are concerts in the pavilion that is free as is the garden! Don't miss this.
Relax. Very relaxing, lack a bit of restrooms only one if you find it open, but nice for a quick picnic and fresh air
peaceful and relaxing. Beautiful gardens in the heart of a busy city. It's well worth taking the time to go there if you are near Notre Same or Pantheon. It's an ideal place for a picnic.

The Best Ever!. This is a fantastic, beautiful park not to be missed! We walked there several different days just to soak up the local ambiance and to relax with our picnic lunches. Children were launching beautiful wooden sail boats to sail across a wonderful concrete pond, family were playing tennis on the multiple courts available, multiple youngsters were engaged soccer, a steady stream of little types were taking pony rides, and a band was playing under a large gazebo! I honestly felt like I had stepped back in time. One of the best spots in Paris!!!

Great Place to Sit and Relax or Walk Around. Relaxing place to visit. Go on weekend to see model boats sail on the lake. On our visit one gent had a radio-controlled submarine that garnered a lot of attention.

Luxembourg Gardens. This is a fantastic park not to be missed if you like beautiful scenes. You will spend at least 2 hours here. great place for kids to play in the park away from maddening crowds on paris streets!

Big space, Pretty garden. Just a quick one from me on this one - this is a pretty nice park, lots of statues and things to look at. But to me it was really just another public space! None of the public bathrooms were working either, which was frustrating. Lots of nearby shops though, so don't panic! Its a great place to sit for a little while and catch some sunshine :)

Nice to sit for a while, but not that great of a garden. The French are not great at gardens as are the Brits. Broad avenues are good, but not much there. There is an area for picnicking on chairs, cannot sit on grass.

What a beautiful must see in Paris. The grounds are wonderful and open to walk around or just hang out and relax in a great setting. If you are traveling with kids I think this is a nice stop also. I would definitely put this area on my to do list in paris

Great place for a glass of wine and a book. The Luxembourg Gardens were one of the highlights of our trip! My wife and I set out there to burn a couple hours in the afternoon. Instead, we enjoyed some wine and a great sunset over the beautiful gardens.

Park with heritage status and fountains. We stayed nearby and and ran every morning. We lived in Hong Kong so having such a nice park nearby with heritage status and fountains were our greatest pleasure and motivation to run every morning.
Huge park in the middle of town. This is a huge park behind the Luxembourg palace which allows no admittance. The park had a concert in the bandstand and a huge round concrete pond

Favorite respite in Paris!. Lovely free park with beautiful flowers, tree covered walkways, statues and park benches. It's open and so large it never feels crowded. A wonderful place to recuperate from the tourist bustle. I'd go there daily after visiting one of the main attractions as a way to unwind and just BE in Paris.

Escape from the busy city. These gardens were a spectacular oasis. We went thru there daily and spent time relaxing, reading, people watching, and even brought a picnic. A truly beautiful place to relax on a nice day. If you are in the area, be sure to stop in for a rest during all your walking around Paris.

if you want a breath of fresh air during you busy voyage to Paris. It is a perfect place to giverest for your feet after long wnd busy voyage by foot. You will find there chairs around of the pool, beautiful garden and amazing statues. The garden is worth visiting!

Not once, but twice. Large, wonderful place to escape the hustle and bustle. Groomed but not overly so. Seating in shade or sun (some of the metal lawn chairs have a slanted back, so perfect for a 10 min snooze..). Places for water or ice cream. Worth packing a blanket or towel for a picnic lunch. If you need a sport fix, there are b-ball and tennis courts tucked away to one side. Great for people watching too. We put our feet up here twice during our recent stay!

Beautiful. If you have the chance look for a hotel in this great neighborhood and don't miss the original Statue of Liberty located within the park and used as model for the big one in NY! It's great for jogging and picnic as well.
Wonderful place... It was a very peaceful place.. Full of green and flowers.. And the big pool inside the gardens was awesome, you should get rest there.

Nice way to unwind, but . Pack a picnic ( or don't) but escape the craziness of Paris traffic and sea of people for a little park stroll. Mind you, it's not exactly desolate, but at least it's just people and the loud Paris traffic. The whole keep off the grass thing a big bummer, but w this many visitors, it's probably a fair request. Beautiful way to bring a little calm to your Paris madness. No exemplary dining options at or close to so eat pre or post. If ever a time to pack a picnic lunch...
beautiful garden. come and visit Luxembourg Gardens on Sunday. There is a live show of a jazz band. Near the garden their is a plasenet coffe shops and Souvenir shops. go and visit the Panteon.

Pretty. It was a hot summer afternoon but there were plenty of shade to be had and chairs that you can move around to suit your sun preference, the gardens are beautiful and it's such a pretty place to relax. My kids and I had a nice time strolling and sitting and chatting to each other with the very Parisian atmosphere .

Nice place to rest!. when you get tired of exploring Paris , Luxemburg Gardens are great to have a break!especially for the travellers with kids ; kids love to be around the fountain and play with birds..and you have plenty of time for yourself to have a drink & snacks & enjoy the beautiful view of the gardens!
A Must do!. You will miss out on a truly Parisian experience if you do not have a walk through these wonderful gardens. Children, Mothers, Grandparents, students all enjoying the Gardens.

Lovely but...... Spent a Spring morning wandering around the Gardens. Loved the fact that they were big enough to explore, but not so big that you can get lost in. It was a work day, and there were lots of mums/grandparents with their chidren/grandchildren. The flowerbeds were full of Spring colour, and the whole gardens were in tip top condition. The 2 things that i cant quite understand, and which prevail in Paris are the amount of dog poo which is just left on the ground, and the fascination with not being able to walk/sit/play on the grass-but i suppose each to their own :-)

So beautiful. If you're tired from a lot of sightseeing, this is the perfect place to stop by. The Luxembourg Palace and the fountain are so pretty and you could just sit down and admire the view for half an hour. The idealistic image of Paris that goes through your head when you think of it is summed up in the Luxembourg Gardens. Don't miss it.

A stroll through the calm. A lovely stroll through a well maintained and stunning garden. There was a interactive WW1 display which was very interesting as an Australian and was about to travel to many of the places on the map.

Beautiful place for a stroll. Pretty and well maintained, these gardens are a lovely spot to walk and relax. There is a small boating lake with quaint wooden children's boats - a good place to sit, rest aching feet and watch the world go by.

Take your kids to the playground (aire de jeux). I used to live in Paris and it was always a treat to spend a weekend afternoon in the Jardins de Luxembourg with my friends.However, when I returned last week with three kids in tow, I discovered the playground. My kids made be bring them back twice.There is an admission fee of E2.50 for kids and E1.50 for adults but in return you get a safe, clean, modern and well maintained playground. There is a good mix of tourists and locals. My daughter made friends with a local French girl who spoke some English within minutes.

Pretty but not the type Garden an American expects. When you say Garden to me I think Botanical Garden... Luxembourg is more like large giant green yards with some flowers sprinkled about. Its more like Park. Its pretty but don't expect to spent more than 30 minutes walking around and exploring.

Calming. There were a lot of tourists and locals just sitting around relaxing however I was a bit disappointed with the gardens itself. Didn't have too much time to relax as I had a lot still to see in Paris.

Luxembourg Gardens. This garden is one of the many in Paris where you can stroll or sit and people watch. In good weather you can watch the children sail their boats in the fountain. In summer there is an old fashioned puppet show for the young and young at heart
Nice walk to conquer jet lag. Entertaining bocce ball and chess matches, lovely gardens and cool shaded paths to walk make this a relaxing place to visit when you first arrive in Paris.

Strolling. My Daughter and I enjoyed strolling through the gardens and taking time to relax among the beauty of the Palace, fountains and tree lined paths. Seating is provided around the Fountain or the lawns for sprawling and reading, a beautiful place away from the hustle and bustle.

Fun for Children and Relaxing for Parents!. We went to the Luxembourg Gardens for our 8yo Son, who needed a break from visiting Museums. We really enjoyed the boats on the pond and was only 3 Euros for 30 minutes, good value. The boats are wooden and sail very well with the light breeze we had that day. I enjoyed sitting in the green chair and watching people go by. We also went to the play grounds, which were great for our son, but there were a few injury accidents with children playing on sections of the playground that were do suited for their age (which I fault the parents for). That was a cost I'm not sure we felt as a good value, only because were were there for one hour and the adults had to pay as well. Beautiful grounds. Wish we had more time but will plan to return on our next Paris visit.
Beautiful and relaxing. Took a stroll through the gardens as the sun was beginning to set. There was a very relaxed vibe and the statues are awesome!

Very beautiful and quite place. If you want to talk with your friends or just spent the time reading the book, there is no more appropriate place than Luxemburg garden. Beautiful flowers and trees, elegant architecture and a lot of benches)
Very pleasant gardens. Liked the formal structure but disappointed that the fountain wasn't working and we would have liked a guide-map but none seemed to be available.

Respite from the City. First visit to Luxembourg Gardens. Sizeable green space with large trees, fountains, formal gardens and people of all ages enjoying the peaceful surrounds. Kiosks selling crepes and ice cream, beautiful sculptures, and a fountain where you can rent small boats for sailing. I was not aware of the museum located on the edge of the gardens and they had an exhibit on Napoleon's wife Josephine I would have enjoyed. Will visit next time for sure.

Very Parisian. Taking a walk through the gardens is really a nice relaxing way to enjoy some leisure time in Paris. Very beautiful grounds with chairs everywhere for people watching. We enjoyed a nice late agternoon picnic.

Home Sweet Home. Let me begin with what I didn't like...the dirt. Paris in general is covered with sandy dirt instead of pavement or grass so my boots were destroyed after.That being said, this garden/park was beautiful! I loved laying on the small bit of grass it did have and catching some rays in the Paris in April sun. You can also sit by fountains and pretend to be a royal relaxing in your garden. When you go, keep in mind this property used to be the private area of the royal family, imagine having the whole place to yourself to fully appreciate the beauty.
So peaceful. Just a really beautiful peaceful gardens. Lovely to pop in, have a picnic and get away from all the traffic/other tourists for a bit.

Great Gardens. We love this garden. Smacked right in the city and a great relaxing spot. Metal chairs are provided for you and the flowers that are now blooming are so beautiful. We had our picnic there and it is such a nice place to rest our tired feet after a long day of sightseeing.

Better than the Tuilleries?. Uncrowded, magnificent landscaping, beautiful flowers and statuary are key to this visit. The garden provides a nice respite from the intensity of many tourist sites in Paris with no fee entry and no crowds. Truly a wonderful, relaxing place.

I return on every visit to Paris!. I cannot visit Paris in the summer without visiting the Jardin de Luxembourg. Love the greenery, the beauty, the children playing with the sailboats in the pool in front of the Palais du Sénat. I love stopping for a café, waffle or crèpe at one of the small kiosques. It's a place to stroll, sit, relax, watch the world go by. Greenery and beauty to catch your breath. And les Parisiens know its value!

Take a walk in the gardens. We just walked in the gardens and saw the beautiful flowers and park. We did not go into the Pantheon just walked around it. Very lovely not a must for first time visitors.
Beautiful. Beautiful, and very large with a variety of flowers, trees, playgrounds, and unusual landscaping. It was very nice to see how well used the gardens were.
Delightful. I adore the Luxembourg Gardens. They are an essential respite for the traveller from the rigours of shopping, dining and sightseeing. Very pretty and extensive.
Delightful. I adore the Luxembourg Gardens. They are an essential respite for the traveller from the rigours of shopping, dining and sightseeing. Very pretty and extensive.

Central Park inside Paris. Quite difficult to find but an oasis in the middle of the City of Lights. Nice neighbourhood and it was pleasant walking around the garden. Nice layout and beautiful plants and flowers. Remember to check out the restaurants near the garden entrance.
A nice way to spend the afternoon. Lovely to walk around and enjoy the gardens. There are some very nice fountains and statues to enjoy or just laze about on the lawns and enjoy Paris.

Oasis in Paris!. Such a beautiful spot.Love sitting by the large fountain/little lake relaxing and people watching!Paris has some of the best people watching! One thing though...watch out for the latest scam.Last time some guy came up to me with a gold band ring,gave it to me claiming it was real and then tried to extort $$! Thank goodness there was a policeman nearby!!

Beautiful outside gardens!. My friends and I stumbled upon this by accident and I must say it is beautiful here! The gardens and well manicured and spacious with a unique look. You also have a nice, different view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance.
March 2014. Luembourg Gardens is a beautiful place to visit. I was there in early March and the flowers where just befginning to bloom. It is a very relaxing place to visit.

Lunch at Pavillon de la Fontains. The gardens themselves are beautiful but eating in the outdoor gardens was one of our best experiences in Paris. The food was wonderful. We had fish with potatoes au gratin and Cesar salad. Absolutely delicious and delightful experience!. Our waiter- an older gentleman-was so pleasant and the best waiter we had in Paris.

Beautiful flowers, great outdoor space. Its amazing that a city as compact and crowded as Paris has such a wide open and beautifully landscaped garden such as Luxembourg. Very well kept, clean, safe, and packed with nice flowers, fountains and many locals and tourists eating on chairs and on the lawns. Nice for when you are strolling through the city, a great place to relax and enjoy the parisian atmosphere and sun.

Great Gardens. Gorgeous Gardens to walk around in, very peaceful and relaxing there is also the Musee Luxembourg to visit but we just enjoyed the gardens. (It was a lovely sunny day).The gardens are quite large to stroll around in so you need a couple of hours to visit. Great place to escape the busy city!

Beautiful Gardens. These Gardens are well worth a visit for those who appreciate gardens and parks. It's more of a Park on a grand scale where Parisians spend many weekend hours, as it offers space and a place to relax and enjoy various pastimes. Here you will find children enjoying slippery dips and sand pits, joggers keeping fit, men playing Boules, Chess players and many quiet corners that Parisians also can enjoy.

Always a favorite. When we think of Paris this is a spot that comes to mind. Beautiful in every way along with great people watching. A pleasant cafe for lunch or a coffee and if you're lucky you'll hear some music playing.

One of the most beautiful places in the most beautiful city.. I can't even count how many times we visited the Luxembourg Gardens during our month in Paris. It never disappoints. It is beautiful in and of itself but it also features the Musee Luxembourg, Angelina Cafe for very expensive sandwiches and famous hot chocolate (which I hope to try before leaving) and lots of areas to sit and do some primo people watching.
Free Gem in Paris. Definitely stop for a walk in these gardens. Sit and enjoy a glass of wine under the trees and imagine how royalty strolled these beautiful lanes in the days of yore.

Beautiful gardens. We were lucky enough to stay in a small hotel in front of the Luxembourg Gardens. We strolled through the gardens instead of using the streets. It is just magnificent! These grounds are huge and usually filled with people soaking up the sun.

Beautiful. Had a picnic, seating plentiful and park beautifully maintained. host of good eateries on the way to the pantheon which was a hidden gem to view, especially the crypt. metro right outside too

Jolly park. One can run,walk or sit. There is a lot to watch, lots of seats. You can hire a pond yacht, eat in quite a pleasant cafe with prompt service. During my visit there was music and later, dancing by couples in 19th Century costume. It's easy to access by bus or metro.

Mix of magnificence and family laid back time. On a mild sunny day this was a delight. Parisiens were pulling up chairs to imbibe the view and the gardens were beautiful and very well cared for - both formal and informal. Little cafe tucked away near the Medici pool was a welcome find.
Nice gettaway. Paris is full of gardens and this is one of them. When Paris gets to crowded or you just need some recreational time this is one of the places to and relax.

Relaxing getaway from noisy paris. Paris is huge, noisy and crowded.A walk in the gardens really relaxes and calms your mind!Have a cold beer in the cafe or just relax in the bench - it will soothe your heart right away
island of peace. A really peaceful place in the middle of a busy and noisy, but gorgeous city of Paris! Don't miss it... and it's for free :-)

Highly recommended with children. We visited the Jardins de Luxembourg with our 2 children, aged 13 and 10, on a summer Sunday. It was a great way to escape the many other Parisian attractions that were overrun with tourists.Yes, there were lots of people at the gardens but they seemed by and large to be locals and we did not feel crowded. There is a lake in the middle of the gardens where you can hire little boats to sail on the lake for about 3 euro for 30 minutes. Our 10 year old loved this. There are also pony rides, swings and a playground.The gardens themselves are magnificent.Highly recommended.
A fountain not to be missed. Lots of peaceful venues for resting from the city - best of them is the fountain near the St Michel entrance!

a place to take a break from sight seeing. Visited the Gardens and found a shaded spot out of the sun. But you will need to find a bench as it appears that sitting on the grass is not allowed.
