I thought parks were places to sit on the grass!A quiet refuge where the locals come to eat their lunch.A bonus when we were there was a free exhibition in the adjacent pavilion showing black and white pictures from a French newspaper of World War One. All very poignant and an added dimension of an understanding of those times.

Nice for a change of pace. The kids needed a break from the hustle and bustle, and this was perfect. There is a lovely playground ( a small charge to enter) and we combined it with a trip to Notre Dame.

Don't miss if you are in the area. There are so many beautiful spots in Paris and this is surely one of them. It was a short walk from our hotel, so we ventured over and enjoyed sitting in the sun watching families and young children enjoy the park. There is a giant map that shows battle lines in WWI that my husband and son were fascinated by. There was much more to explore, but we were due to take the train to London in the afternoon, so we just enjoyed our half hour in the park. A lovely spot.

We Had a Wonderful Picnic Here. This is such a beautiful, peaceful place. My husband and I had a picnic in the park consisting of fresh cherries and an array of French cheese. This was one of my favorite moments of our trip. It is so romantic. We had a great time relaxing after walking all over Paris.

Beautiful - take a stroll!. Beautifully maintained gardens and park. Great vibe- so many different types of people simply enjoying the environment. Don't miss the men playing pétanque (looked like French form of bocce ball)...lots of enthusiasm and gamesmanship. Grab a gelato or macaron and simply stroll.

Lovely for children!. The gardens were lovely, plenty of space for children to run around. Pony rides and playgrounds. My 8-year-old daughter and I spent a terrific half hour chasing a model boat around the lake with a stick - well worth the €3.00!
Ideal for a picnic. Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris. Ideal for a picnic or a family fun day in the park. The grounds are also stunning place for picture taking.

Lovely Oasis on a hot day.. We decided to stop here for a picnic lunch during our walk around the Latin Quarter. The gardens are very pleasant, however beware of the grass police. We and many others who were enjoying our lunch were chased off the grass! Luckily we found a shady bench to continue. Didn't visit the palace, however the gardens provided a lovely setting for it.

Beautiful site!. This is a lovely place to visit! The palace is gorgeous and the gardens are lovely. It was significantly larger than I was expecting and there are lots of sculptures, fountains and gardens to admire. A must see!
Ideal For A Picnic. This is a large,eautiful park in the Latin Quarter.It is an Ideal place for an afternoon picnic or an evening stroll.

Side-step the hectic tourist scene.. Pick up a sandwich on a baguette and a bottle of house wine at a boulangerie and make your way to Luxembourg Gardens. It's only a short stroll from the Latin Quarter on the Left Bank. It is an island of serenity. Many locals take their lunches here while basking in the sun. You can enter from the Boulevard St. Michael side and exit towards St. Germain heading back towards the Seine and the Metro stations, Musee d"Orsay, etc. Sometimes the journey is better than the destination.

nice place to relax. The gardens are extremely nice when it is sunny and warm. I didn't find it like something super outstanding, but that is not necessary. You go there just to read a book, catch some sun tan or chill with friends.The thing I didn't like was that you can't lay/walk/sit on the grass. There are chairs and benches all over the park. But maybe that is something that makes the gardens authentic and unique.I would recommend it. :)

Delightful 17th century gardens. Fantastic, manicured gardens with incredible attention to detail and great architecture. Wonderful to stroll and view the scenery and people doing their thing, be it boules, running, sunning, eating, romancing and talking.

Great way to spend an afternoon. One of the most beautiful spots in Paris. There are chairs to sit down and read a book, musicians and dancers entertaining around, tennis and games fields. The Jardin du Luxemboug are suitable for whichever age...

Beautiful in every way. The park is a fantastic oasis in the middle of Paris. You can find stunning architecture, beautiful gardens/trees, and plenty of walking/running trails. I like to go running here in the morning if my hotel is nearby.
peaceful but very interesting. very impressed with the gardens but more so the 1st world war information that was highlighted on the fence.

Hype. This park is huge and very well done. I didn't find it outstanding or worth taking part of a limited vacation time to see it. If you are nearby for another attraction or staying in the area it is definitely worth a walk through especially in beautiful weather.

Beautiful gardens to rest with a laid back vibe. We rode our bikes on a very hot day and were in need of shade. This was a lovely place slowly browse the gardens and enjoy the ponds, fountains and endless flowers. While it was bustling with both tourists and locals it was very laid back and it was especially fun to watch children play with those little sail boats just like in the movies. We were fortunate to find a shady bench while relaxing and taking in the beauty of the gardens.

Huge & Peaceful Beauty. A haven of peaceful, relaxing beauty and ambiance in a large, bustling city. We enjoyed some down time in the evening as sundown approached while we viewed the grounds, trees, lake & fountain and chose have a picnic dinner one evening there. Even with hundreds of other people enjoying the scene, the park is so large that you will not feel crowded at all.

Beautiful Garden in a Beautiful City. Strolling through the Luxembourg Gardens is a real delight. It is beautiful and really alive with Parisian families enjoying the open space, the shade trees and beautiful landscape. Great place to visit.

Lovely even in winter!. Large garden that is very well maintained in a centralized location. Great photo opportunity here so if you're a shutterbug, you'll have a field day. While the adults can get busy taking breathtaking photos, bring loaves of bread for the kids to feed the swans and ducks in the pond as well as birds that would come very close to get a piece of action. One can simply sit int he park and do absolutely nothing except to enjoy the tranquility and beauty of this vast garden.

A Wonderful Oasis. my husband and I stayed in an apartment next to the gardens and made a point to walk through them every day. It was wonderful to see people out running, playing with their children, or just sitting and enjoying the beautiful surroundings.

Absolutely gorgeous at sunset. The title says it all! I went there for an hour or so, and the colours of the hedges, fountains, and flowerbeds were amazing. There are a few chairs to sit on, but failing that there is plenty of grass to sit on.The grounds are so extensive, it's nearly impossible to see it all.

Good on a hot day. Good place to sit under the trees and get out of the sun. Busy on a Sunday afternoon but with what seemed to be real Parisians instead of just tourists. Buy a drink and people watch.

Beautiful example of Parisian garden. There is a lot of shady spots to sit, a small restaurant and the garden is beautiful. You can sit in the shade on the grass, unlike Tuileries where the grass is out of bounds I loved this park

Great break away location for tired travellers feet! . Just go and relax in this vast gardens! Many different areas with each its own benefits and character. Perfect to have picnic lunch, on the grass area, and save some expensive euros!! :-). Will be one of the first places I will visit again when back in Paris.
timeless pleasure. timeless, approachable yet extraordinary place to laze in the sun, talk for hour or read a book in a unique setting

Great Saturday Picnic Time. We packed a picnic and went here for the afternoon. It helped that the weather was perfect. A band was playing and we had music in the background. The grounds were immaculate. We strolled around after lunch to check out all of the statues of the Queens of France on the property. Bathroom facilities were few and far between and we had to pay to use them. Have some spare change on hand.
Awesome!. Most amazing park in Paris, the organization of flowers and green spaces is so well performed. It's calm and wide, with a wonderful old fashioned coffee shop inside.

Great park for kids. The garden part of the park is very well used and attractive. The best parts of the park is the facilities for kids. There are boats to float, pony rides, merry go round and one of the best playgrounds. There is the normal play equipment but also some cool, challenging pieces that aren't used right now in the USA because of liability issues. We stayed for hours and it wasn't enough.

Beautiful place to bring a picnic and relax. These are lovely public gardens where the locals (and tourists) come to sit and relax with a picnic, go running or play tennis.We ended up visiting here twice for a dinner time picnic - there are plenty of seats around to sit and relax and do some people watching. The gardens are beautiful and well worth a walk around.Very pleasant!

Always on our Paris itinerary. Could spend every day visiting Luxembourg Gardens and not see all there is to see. From the children riding ponies and sailing their boats in the pond to the lovely plantings to the Chess and Boule players, it's live theater!

Brilliant Park for Older Kids. My kids, aged 10 & 11 yrs spent 3 hours at this park and did not want to leave, its worth the 2.5euro entrance fee for the playground... the equipment is perfect for all ages, toddler through to 13! And once away from the equipment, its a beautiful setting for a picnic if you buy your bakery/patisserie items from one of the stores in the nearby streets, or use te on-site café, wish we had parks like this in Melbourne Australia!

A step back in time - peaceful, serene. A beautiful formal garden that is well used and nicely maintained. It has something for everyone, including a wonderful, clean and safe playground for younger children. There is a small fee for entering the playground; you will find well maintained equipment with plenty of space to for kids to roam. There are sandboxes, climbing gyms, balance beams and merry-go rounds. Also, you will find clean, kid-sized potties located next to the snack bar.There are plenty of chairs and benches around the park with joggers and walkers enjoying the many paths. It is large, so plenty of space for everyone. It is a peaceful oasis in the center of Paris. Highly recommended stop while in Paris and a MUST with younger children.

Great break from Museums for the kids.. Took the kids to Luxembourg Gardens to walk around and take a breaking from touring museums. The gardens have a great playground that the kids enjoyed. The playground has all the standard playground equipment, but it also had a zipline that the kids thought was awesome! Unfortunately we had to pay 2.50 euros per kid, but it was worth it because they enjoyed the playground so much.

The Ultimate Park Experience. Luxembourg Gardens is more than a park, it's an experience. The landscape is surreal, doesn't matter where your eye travels, there's always something magnificent to take in. I love looking sky bound at the Eiffel, then turning a mere 25 degree in the opposite direction and there stands Basilica of the Sacré Cœur. What I enjoyed most was watching old aged couples stroll slowly through the park holding hands.

Love this public garden in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is one of Paris most famous public garders. You can find green grass and statuses spread all over. It a nice place to visit in the sunny days. In its center, stands the glorious Palais du Luxembourg and you can enjoy a nice guide tour inside the palace during some days of the week.

Best garden in Paris. I was very pleasantly surprised at these gardens. So much to see and it is a very beautiful area. Walked the whole way around, loads of statues and seating areas. Found a petanque area and watched a view games. Lovely place to visit

Nice city garden. Clean, lots of seating, shady spots for those who want to enjoy the outdoors without direct sunshine, family friendly, so spread out that there's a spit for everyone. Very peaceful and serene. Joggers running quietly around the park, colorful flowers and well-sculptured trees. Great place to enjoy a pucnic lunch.
So classy , so delightful. The Luxembourg Gardens are another do not miss thing to see in Paris ... It's like walking back in time to a much more elegant time.. Enjoy

peaceful oasis in beautiful Paris. Perfect place to chill and find some peace in beautiful vibrant Paris. Cool fountains and plenty of cool shade to relax in between sight seeing, the palace is handsome but not open to the public...,French Senate sits there I believe.
Located in a beautiful part of the city, a.short stroll to one of favourite discoveries the Place de la Sorbonne.

Nothing beats the charm of Luxembourg in the spring. We made a trip to the Luxembourg Gardens in mid-June and the weather was so unbelievably perfect. Our children (9, 7, 5) loved running on the paths, playing on the amazing playground, eating at the cafe and walking around the palace grounds. We just missed the time of the toy boats (they close at 6:00 I think). Also, a tip: look for surrounding metro stations vs. trying to navigate the RER to the Luxembourg station.

Idyllic Setting. This is an amazingly beautiful public park near the Sorbonne on the Left Bank.Gorgeous flowers and perfect for strolling , reading or a picnic.Part of the true Parisian experience for tourists and residents alike.

beautiful place. A lovely garden, with many many spots to sit and relax and just enjoy the gardens, the fountain, & the palace. We were there on a beautiful sunny day and there were so many tourists and locals either reading a book or listening to a local band rehearse. A very peaceful place.
Family favorite. My family of seven spent quite a bit of time playing and exploring. The carousel is quite dated and so much fun for the little ones. It's like stepping back in time !

Sunny afternoon in Paris. Walked through on a beautiful sunny afternoon - the garden was packed with locals ad tourists alike. The huge pond was a great photo spot with the kids launching the boats. Medici fountain was beautiful as well as the palace.
Very Large. This is the place to sit and people watch, chill out or meditate. The gardens are beautiful, cool and spread out. Just a 10 minute walk to the museum.

Enjoyable . We walked from Notre Dame and reached the garden ( too long a walk with kids and a little uphill! A large well manicured garden, people lazing around, a small fountain with mini sailboats! Had heard about these a lot but didn't find too many around! Yet the statues, the weather, the wonderful Parisian people relaxing makes for great pics and a good time! Get a book and while away the time!!

Speculator gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens has both peaceful hidden nooks and wide open formal gardens. The fountains and paths meander through beautifully planted beds. Lots of benches to sit and reflect the beauty.
Most beautiful in Paris!. The most beautiful public gardens in Paris! Loved coming here to sit and relax. The grounds are well manicured and people are just doing their own thing! Loved it!
Relaxing and great people watching. Great place to have a picnic with friends. There is a designated grass area you can sit on but still enough space to stretch out.

Gorgeous. The gardens with the palace are stunning and relaxing at the same time. SAd that the Nazis occupied it as a headquarters. A nice walk to this area up from the Latin Quarter. Deak into the Pantheon and the churches around there on the way back down.
relaxing. Nice tranquil break from the madness of general paris. Sat by fountain, in a grand seat in the sun. No hustle and bustle in the gardens at all.

Relaxing space -left bank. Beautifully structured gardens. Ideal place for a pique-nique or reading, relaxing. The Medici Fountain is not to be missed. There are chairs to sit on, or relaxing on the grass is also permitted. Child-friendly!

What a lovely place to relax in Paris. I went to the gardens because I missed going there on my last trip to Paris. I found myself enjoying the sun just like a Parisian taking a break. I was hoping to see children floating boats on the pond, but that day was an afternoon of band concerts given by school children in the pavilion. Proud parents, grandparents and casual observers were able to enjoy concert of exactly the same beginner band music I remember from my children's first concerts in Naperville, Illinois USA. I felt a part of our shared experience. The gardens are huge, walking around to the shady fountain pool, people were reading, relaxing and of course, kissing..after all, this is the city of love! Spending a leisurely hour or so in the garden is good for the soul.

Too early?. I was hoping to see a lot of beautiful gardens in Paris but was mostly disappointed. It appeared that we were a few weeks too early arriving the last week in May. The Luxembourg gardens has many areas being prepared for planting and the those plants which were there were not yet in full bloom. As was the case at several locations, the fountains were not running.Overall, Luxembourgh is a nice park to sit and relax but nothing to write home (San Diego) about.
Beautiful place. Really nice spot to eat some lunch and people watch :) which is exactly what we did. The only thing I struggled with is that you can't sit or walk in the grass. Pretty though!
Ahhh Paris. There is nothing that can compare to sitting in a park in Paris and watching the Parisiens walk by.It is a nice break from a sight seeing tour around Paris.

Right Spot for Relaxation. Jardins de Luxembourg is another big and beautiful park of Paris. When compared with Jardins de Tuilleries, it's less impressive but still very relaxing. This park seems to attract less tourists as majority of the visitors the day we were there, were locals. There is a big pool in the middle where children play with remote controlled sailing ship and there are chairs all around to sit and relax. Another activity for children is ponny riding. The parc is very big, so you can chose any place you like: under the shadows, under the sun, away from all others etc. Unlike Jardins de Tuilleries, there is no café inside (or at least we did not come accross to any), so if you want to have a light lunch here (which I recommend), buy it from one of shops/cafés outside. If you are tired of walking (which is very probable when visiting Paris), these gardens will be a great spot for relaxation.

Wonderful!. Got the sense that there were a lot of locals there. The gardens were beautifully kept and the landscaping was superb. Also enjoyable was the on-site palace and the many opportunities provided by the park to simply sit and enjoy the scenery. The park is gated, and while it is surrounded by the bustle of Paris, the inside is quite peaceful and pristine. No litter, beautiful trails to walk/run. Highly recommend a visit.

Early for flowers. We visited Paris in Mid May and found that, due to the cold winter, we were too early to see the spring flowers at their peak. When we visited the gardens, the crews were in the process of planting thousands of flowers so we missed the full effect of this beautiful area. Hope to see them next time.
Well maintained and peaceful gardens. Lots of flowers, shade trees, and benches. Nice place to sit or go for a run around the inside of the park. It's free and in Paris, enjoy

Wonderful place for kids and adults!. Loved the main 'lagoon' and that you can rent little sailboats to sail. There are so many activities, including tennis, basketball, lounging, ice cream and others.
super-european place. just go around and enjoy watching kids playing, people talking... awesome place for a walk if you want to go a bit off the usual tourist route.
Beautiful place. A great place to relax and take a break in th hustle of a busy city. Nice walking place, sit and admire the people walking by. I had a crepe a nd watched the world go by.

Parisian at its very best. Walking through the gardens and marvelling the monuments and all things Parisian. Sit and enjoy the view from a bench, a cafe, meet friends, visit nearby Museums or shops. The options are endless. Jsut dont sit on some parts of the lawn as the park police will shoo you off. Thats why it all stays so pristine.

Just a lovely place to rest. Gorgeous gardens in the middle of Paris. Nice big playground for the children, band was playing. Plenty of seating on chairs and benches. Several lovely cafes right outside the gates. Well worth a visit.

JARDIN DU LUXEMBOURG. This is an extraordinary place to visit in Paris. I went there in all the seasons....and it was absolutaly amazing to visit the garden all the time.The garden is a place for all the ages....babies, kids, teens, adults and old people.There you can see the most beautiful flowers, monuments, play ground, restaurant...wonderful views. .. You can sit and enjoy your time with friends in a picnic...or just read a book...or feel that you're a very lucky person cause you're in a lovely treasure in Paris.

Should See this Location. A trip to Paris is not complete without a visit to Luxumbourg Gardens! Don't get caught up in the hustle, the go go go of seeing the major attractions. Sit and absorb the beauty of this location.
Spend an afternoon on a sunny day. Fabulous place to walk around, have a picnic, people watch, (don't bother with the museum) the grounds are the main attraction.
Nice respite from a long day of touring.. Gardens are peaceful and beautiful. A nice walk south from the Seine. Boats on the pond were fun to watch.

Landscaped beyond belief. This garden embodies all that is French... perfection. The garden is large but feels cozy and has a lot of sunshine throughout. The fountains and flowers in the middle are truly spectacular on a sunny day. Must stop and smell the sweet scent of Linden trees that line the west walkways.

Such beauty!. I love this place. It is really relaxing. You walk across different statues and the garden is really well maintained. The only negative thing are some people selling in the way that start to pressure you to buy their things, like every 5 minutes or so.

Go to be reminded of democracy but not for the fountain. Tennis courts, day care areas, carousels and boules immerse the visitor in the dally life of the Parisians. A welcome change from the rush of the tourist agenda.Statues and wandering paths in the heart of the city make this a pleasant break. Watching the seniors playing boules was worth the visit.The mansion is now home to the government and the fountain is a dribbler but seeing the locals enjoying this park gets you thinking of Les Miserables.Go if you want time out to relax and think history but not if time is tight.

A very nice place in Paris. We were walking through the Luxembourg Gardens and it is wonderful Nice easy walk with lots of great fountains. The Senate which is in the Gardens were showing photos from WW! which was very interesting. If you want to take a nice relaxing walk through a beautiful garden then go here.
Great waling park. Just a very nice way to spend an afternoon. Very nicely maintained. A neat collection of citrus trees (probably not during the winter)
Great place for a stop and recharge your batteries. It is a lovely place to stop and unwind from the hustle and bustle of Paris life. Plenty of benches to sit at and enjoy a picnic.

Best of paris! Kids paradise. Loved everything about this garden for adults and kids. Our 5&7 year old voted to go back in the hours before our flight left. Go to take in the sculptures, read a book, go for a jog. For kids there is the pond with boats to float, pony rides, but the topper was the best playground we have ever seen. You pay a couple euro to get in but totally worth it. Great for kids 1-10. Visit Bread and Roses around the corner for amazing sandwhich and pastry and cheese.
Tranquil. Beautiful gardens in the middle of Paris. We were lucky enough to see the gardens on a beautiful spring day when all of Paris seemed to be out enjoying the sunshine. Well worth a visit.

Rest your tired feet here. The setting is beautiful. The landscape so beautiful. There were plenty of chairs to sit on and watch people and the ducks near the pond with the toy sailboats. I was suprised to find sheltered tables with retired men playing chess. Loved that scene!
peaceful and pleasant. a good place to come, relax and watch the world pass by you. A perfect play to open a bottle of wine and let the day pass by you.
Relaxing. I spent a beautiful day there reading a book and going around the place. The whole place is so relaxing I can spend the whole day there.

A Paris landmark and great for kids.. The Luxembourg is so great on a sunny day. You can sit around the water feature, listen to music played. There are many areas for kids and a great puppet show on Wednesdays and Saturdays.

Hidden Gem. We travelled to the Luxembourg Gardens mainly to find the original model of the Statue of Liberty which is believed to be the template used for the New York version.It was a beautiful sunny day and ended up staying in these beautiful gardens all afternoon. Shady areas are available but we sat by the main water feature with a bottle of vino and chilled.

Beautiful gardens in the centre of Paris. Great place for families to spend the afternoon, playground was fantastic and a big hit with our 4yr old. The gardens and fountains are just beautiful. Highly recommend a visit to the Luxembourg Gardens
Beautiful!. Make sure to bring lunch for a picnic. Relaxing, and so fun to see everyone walking by and how different they are from myself!

Pleasant park for people watching. Lots of paths and garden areas with manicured lawns and artfully arranged flower beds. Most flowers looked recently planted and needed more time to "fill in" for a lush look. It was mid-June so these may be the flowers planted in early May waiting to fill out. Similar gardens in the states often transplant mature flowers into their beds and replace as needed, which doesn't emulate a natural garden at all. Color combinations in the beds were fascinating. There was a large pool in front of the palace that had small toy sailboats for rent being operated by children. It was great fun to see their excitement as they poked them from the edge with long sticks. There was also a bandstand area with many people arranging chairs to get close, but we never quite heard music being played. Lots of set up but never heard the music. There were a few food stands and also a toy kiosk for the kids. There's mounted benches and portable metal chairs everywhere which can be easily dragged around to make whatever seating arrangement you wish. Great area for people watching. A very pleasant place worth visiting more than once.
Beautiful!. A beautiful oasis in the city. Pick up some lunch, find a square of grass or a deck chair and sit back and relax. Gorgeous surroundings.
Great place to chill out. A very nice large parc on the south bank of Paris. Great to sit and rest for a while, get a coffee or a crepe and just have a good time

Always a Pleasure. Visiting these gardens is always a joy for the eye ! In summer there are so many types of flowers blooming , the fountain is working and there are so many people and yet it is so quite and peaceful !!
Do not miss !

The Perfect Day. Sat in the most beautiful gardens, eating baguetes and sharing a bottle of exquisite french wine, with your beautiful woman. Suddenly you are a part of a Manet or Degas painting. Give it a go and have a "Perfect Day."

A great place for a mid-afternoon rest. The Luxembourg Gardens are truly beautiful and quiet large - there are lots of sections to explore - a wonderful playground, a marionette theater for the kids, tennis courts, Marie de Medici's palace and their gardens, several beautiful sculptures. One could spend hours exploring. However, the locals just seem to pull up a chair or two, take out a book and lie down for a rest - I highly recommend that in the midst of a hectic sightseeing schedule.

relaxation at its best. even if your'e not green fingered you can't help but love the colours, smells and touching everything around you. great to get away from the business for a while for a breather or meditation.

Free special exhibits. I will not repeat how beautiful the park is. That alone is worth the visit. However there are currently two free exhibits that are also worth visiting the park for. There is an exhibit of war time pictures from one of the main newspapers. It is located in the L'Orangerie behind the Luxembourg museum. These are pictures that appeared on the front page of the newspaper. They are blown up to be huge and their is a write-up on each. Separately on the outside fence there are huge photos and stories behind each about war areas before and after. The fence photos start just past the Senate. Both sets of exhibits are free and worth seeing.

Luxembourg Gardens. I spent a week in Paris...I had no idea there was a park like this in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Paris. I speak (broken)'fluent' French, and met lots of locals in this beautiful, magnificent horticultural marvel. Lots of reflection here...walking paths...a little cafe...and, believe it or not...lots of friendly Parisians. I spent 8 hours here one day, and it was raining to boot! A must see....

Great escape in busy Paris. We went to Luxembourg Gardens twice while in Paris on vacation. It is a beautiful place to visit and you can just relax, watching children sail small sailboats, older men playing chess or young people relaxing on the lawn. It is a beautifully manicured retreat from busyness. Plenty of people there, but a large place with lots of things to do and see

A must if in Paris. Went for my daughters birthday to pairs for a few days and happened to be staying near the gardens. We walked there and it was well worth it. Such beautiful gardens and monuments. Gorgeous sunny day so the park was full of families and couples enjoying the sunshine. Very pretty and a great place to take a picnic or just lye on the grass and watch the world go by. Would highly recommend a visit.

My Favorite Garden in Paris; Sorry Versailles!. A "refreshing" stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens in the cool of the early evening was definitely a simple, yet rewarding highlight of our visit to Paris. Catherine de' Medici's vision for a bit of her hometown Firenze in the midst of Paris remains true to this day. The fountains, gardens, sculpture, hidden waterways, pergolas, and grand buildings around the perimeter are not to be missed. It is a true oasis nestled beside the bustling arrondissements of Saint-Germain-des-Pres and the Latin Quarter. There was a noticeable absence of tourists at this time of day; rather local people walking with their children, walking their dogs, taking an evening run, sitting in the many chairs offered or on a stone bench tucked away near a secluded waterway, or meeting friends under the arbor for an impromptu "picnic" of wine and cheese! My only disappointment (and of course why I just HAVE to return!) is that we had trouble finding the entrance to the adjacent Musee du Luxembourg where there is currently an exhibition of Josephine Bonaparte: An Extraordinary Empress. Unfortunately it was very close to the museum's closing time and I suspect that the entrance was probably outside the park on the street side. If you're having dinner at a nearby restaurant, I highly recommend Luxembourg Gardens as the perfect thing to do before you dine. Although next time I might delay dinner and bring my running shoes!

A beautiful place. Just to stroll through the gardens and to observe the activity of the nearby residents, students, school kids and tourists is a wonderful introduction to Paris. The gardens are spectacular.
Worth the walk. We visited on a Sunday. Families were out in the park and a big band played. Quite enjoyable overall
Busy. A short stroll through the gardens is all you need. Park of historical significance. A busy place. Know which street you want to end up on before you start walking.

Oasis in the middle of the city. great place to go for a run if you're staying nearby, as we did. Also, art museum within the gardens which we went into on a whim and found it a lovely little place. . lots of history here (as everywhere in Paris!) Cool bee keeper's area right in the middle of the walkways.

Huge...beautiful...relaxing. Worth an afternoon! The gardens are huge and feature several different areas. Some are open, some are wooded; all are beautiful. We were there in early spring, before most of the flowers are planted or in-bloom, and it was still wonderful. Lots of places to sit, so don't hesitate to grab a baguette and some cheese, bring a book, and relax in the sun or shade. Make sure to stop by the Medici fountain.
Beautiful grounds. Pretty much a garden to hangout in. Super spacious. Lots of people sitting around relaxing or picnicing.
Look for the hidden gems. Such beautiful gardens but allow time to explore as there are beautiful statues and fountains that are worth discovering.

Gorgeous and tranquil. Lovely and spacious place to relax, people-watch, and bring your lunch! If you have little ones and understand French, be sure to take them to the classic puppet theatre there---it was delightful!

Nice place to relax. This garden/park is beautiful as you would expect for Paris. Their are lots of places to have a picnic or enjoy a pastry. The palace is also beautiful. The little boats in the "lake" are fun to watch. Their are grassy areas you are not allowed to sit on but the police are nice about asking you to leave.

Running in the Gardens. The Gardens were very nice to run around, shared with some fit Parisians. Watch out for pedestrians though - as is the case all over Paris, pedestrians tend to not value personal space and walk randomly wherever they want to walk! If you exit the Gardens from a different gate, be careful, Paris is not set on a grid and it is very easy to get disoriented, especially on a cloudy day - but getting 'lost' is half the fun sometimes?!

Treasure of Paris. I've been coming to Paris for years and have never missed visiting the Luxembourg Gardens on each trip. It is an exquisite jewel on the Left Bank which is gorgeous in all seasons. Bring your own racket and ping poll balls to play a game under the shade of trees . This is such an active happy place enjoyed by Parisiens and tourists alike. Not much to eat or drink inside the gardens so get your fortifications before you enter.
wonderful. Very beautiful place and very well maintained. Very good for a stroll in the spring and summer. Beside has several wonderful restaurants.

Fantastic well maintained park. The park is beautiful and very well maintained. They have put out chairs for everyone to use. Just relax and enjoy the view or read a book.There is a good playground (entry 1.5EUR) for kids of all ages. They also have an old carousel (1.5EUR per ride) that our three year old daughter loved. Each kid gets a small stick and the game is to fetch as many rings as you can on the way around, simulating the way knights trained back in the day. Great fun for kids! A lot of people use this park for running as well. Mostly along the perimeter so this is not a nuisance for people who just want to walk or sit down and relax.

A calm and elegant space.. A glorious retreat from the bustle of Paris. You can always find somewhere to sit, either in shade, or in the sun around the fountain, with magnificent views in every direction. It's a wonderful haven for a stroll.
excellent place to rest and have a bier. the place is the right one to take a break and have a beer or wine after an exhausting walking day. Prices will force you to moderate quantities though.
Beautiful and spacious setting. We enjoyed having our light lunch here after renting bikes to get there. Really spacious and relaxed, which can be rare in Paris!!
Relaxing in the Jardin - June 2014. Very Enjoyable and wonderful place to relax in Paris. Sit on a chair , drink something and enjoy the day.

As Parisian as you can get!. Lovely, not least because of the different areas and the hundreds of chairs that are all free to use. If only London parks were like this! Good for running too - many runners going round the outside of all abilities. A perfect park!

Relax and Refresh your Spirit. If you are visiting Paris and find yourself one day exhausted and not wanting to do much of anything go to Luxembourg Gardens. There is a lovely outdoor cafe, fountains, lovely flowers and plenty of places to sit down and do nothing. How nice does that sound...

Enjoyable. Huge, maintained and pretty - a wonderful place to relax in Paris. You can be entertained by watching other people, play and have fun. Bring your own food and drink or buy it here. Sit in a chair, on a bench or on a blanket at the yard.
Bocce. Old people sitting and lunching on park benches, kids playing soccer, young and old playing "French" bocce I fed pigeons left over bread tres cool
a classic. Drizzling rain the day we went, so no picnicking, but a classic stop in Paris to refresh. Short walk from Pantheon.
Relaxing & Beautiful. A great place to visit as you wonder the city. Also has a huge playground for kids (small fee to play). Come here on a nice day to take a stroll, picnic and take some photos!

Pleasant walk. We walked through Luxembourg Gardens on our way to somewhere else and it was a very pleasant experience. The gardens are huge and well laid out. We came across the biggest playground we have ever seen in these gardens!

The perfect way to spend an afternoon. Followed by a walk in the Latin quarters, we picked up a sandwiche and headed the the Luxembourg gardens
An ideal and beautiful place to sit back and relax with statues scattered all over. Its huge and very popular with the locals who come here to picnic or simply read. Highly recommended !!
Don't miss the very beautiful Fontaine Médicis

A perfect summer Sunday afternoon. We took a picnic lunch and sat in the shade on a couple of the many chairs available. There were local people sunbaking, reading, chatting, children lining up for pony rides, playing at he playground, or sailing boats on the pond.There were people playing chess, tennis, practising time chi, and over on the other side of the park, there was a jazz band playing.We passed an enjoyable and relaxing couple of hours and would recommend it highly if you want to see a little of Parisian life, or to just relax.

Excellent Walk. LG is such a great place for a walk and each time I visit, there's something else I discover. In past walks, it was the apiary or the profusion of chairs to rest and watch. This time it was a huge map of the second world war in France (in front of the palace).
Nice little place to sit and relax.. One of the few places with enough chairs for everyone to sit around and relax. Nice little remote control boat pond.

Grand Gardens. These are really severals gardens that have been made into public space. You can find a space of your own to contemplate royal excesses ( and grand spaces), enjoy artworks, watch people and view Paris. Enjoy!!

Wonderfull to relax. This is the place in the middle of Paris you want to go to if you want to calm down in the green without leaving the city. But even if you are just passing by, take a moment to go around and enjoy life over there. =)
nice place to relax. magnificent views, especially in spring/summer. Nice place to have a sit and rest before keeping on!

fantastic place. The Jardin du Luxembourg, or the Luxembourg Gardens, is the second largest public park in Paris, located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, France. The park is the garden of the French Senate, which is itself housed in the Luxembourg Palace.The garden is largely devoted to a green parterre of gravel and lawn populated with statues and centred on a large octagonal basin of water, with a central jet of water; in it children sail model boats.The garden is famed for its calm atmosphere. Surrounding the bassin on the raised balustrade terraces are a series of statues of former French queens, saints and copies after the Antique. In the southwest corner, there is an orchard of apple and pear trees and the théâtre des marionnettes (puppet theatre). The gardens include a large fenced-in playground for young children and their parents and a vintage carousel. In addition, free musical performances are presented in a gazebo on the grounds and there is a small cafe restaurant nearby, under the trees, with both indoor and outdoor seating from which many people enjoy the music over a glass of wine. The orangeries display art, photography and sculptures.this place feels like heaven.

Relaxing. A good spot on a Sunday morning. Get a chair, sit around the fountain, watch the sail boats, watch people running, watch people doing Tai Chi, watch children playing, watch older couples walking. The gardens, the play areas, the paths all of them perfectly placed.

Nice place for a stroll. This is a really nice place to walk around there are chairs everywhere so you can sit and take in the nice scenes and there are several cafe's as well we walked around a bit and then ate at one of the cafe's the only thing is the café was really expensive the soda we drank cost more than the baguette sandwich we ate but overall it was way too pricey for what you get. These gardens are huge and we walked through the area that connects to the Louvre and it was nice to see such a great garden in the middle of the city.
Oasis. A large Oasis in a concrete jungle. Great place for a time out to read or picnic or watch the little ones sail their boats. Highly recommend.

For looking not touching - give it a miss. Here in Australia, we have signs to tell us to make sure we walk on the grass, to take our shoes of and relax on the grass. Not in the Lux Gardens you don't. The merest hint someone might step on the grass is met with loud whistles from the tourist police. I couldn't believe they expected mothers and children to lay on blankets on the gravel, rather than touch the sacred grass. It's nowhere near as pretty as Tuileries either. Give it a miss.
Nice for an afternoon stroll. SSSSOOOOO French! It's a beautiful place to relax, enjoy the scenerie and people watch. Lots of opportunities for greath photo ops.

Who doesn't love a beautiful garden. Our hotel was located steps from the Luxembourg Gardens. Every city needs a green space and these gardens don't disappoint. Don't miss if you're in the neighborhood.

Worth the visit!!!. Everyone goes to Paris and say "oh, the Tulleries!" - you should go to Luxembourg Garden and say "wow!". I think it is in a much better shape than Tulleries because it is more well preserved, once the Senate is there. Go there!

Peaceful, even with crowds. We strolled through the park on the French Mother's Day so it was packed with families but it was fun to watch families having a wonderful time. There was a bandstand where we easily found a bench in the shade and listened to "Alexander's Ragtime Band" among other American offerings. Watching the beautiful French children play in the play area was fun...it's so surprising to hear perfect French come from their mouths when we were struggling to say a few words! :-) Away from the bandstand and play area, there was plenty of room to sit on a bench or chair and relax. There are gorgeous lawns but no one is allowed to sit or play on them...so tempting!
Lovely gardens. Easy to get to on the hop on hop off bus, worth a visit. A lovely stroll around the gardens and to look at the Luxembourg Palace. Lots of shady places to sit and have a break.
Beautiful!!!!. Great place to "people" watch and just enjoy Paris. Have been in the summer, early spring and winter - beautiful in any season
Great place to run. This is a lovely park. It has paths along the perimeter that are great for running; exercise while taking in a piece of the city.

Beautiful gardens. One of my first things to do after arriving in Paris, and it was beautiful with the afternoon sun shining down on the well manicured gardens and fountain. A great place for a walk, or to just grab a seat and relax.

tranquil park with a museum. this is a lovely green space where you can relax and feel like you have found hidden paris. there is also a lovely small museum in the park that has very good exhibitions so you can see art and then relax in the park. You can pick up food for a picnic in the market nearby on Rue Mabillon (around St Sulpice) or get coffees from the little huts in the park.
Superb gardens. The gardens are lush, large ,set out for easy access, take great photo's a good place to walk and unwind ,soak up the French atmosphere.
Elegant and restful. Escape the city traffic in this green oasis. Many chairs. Perfect for a warm sunny day. Great for people watching too.
A relaxing walk. Very relaxing walk and nice cafés to stop for a coffee. You can always find people jogging or relaxing.

Beautiful gardens, so relaxing and special. Well maintained gardens. Thousands of the locals sit and drink in the beauty everyday. Beautiful statues, magnificent fountain, the trees are laid out so immaculately. A real treat

From 1 to 100yrs old, you'll love it !. Fabulous huge Park and Gardens, where you'll see families sailing small boats on the pond, games of Bocce and Chess, fruit trees, where each piece of fruit is wrapped in a paper bag to protect it, and wonderful picnic areas with lots of space and privacy.

Lazy sunny afternoon. What a lovely way to spend a few hours. There was a very noisy reggae band playing in the band stand which gave the park a great atmosphere. There were people playing with boats on the pond and comfy chairs dotted around which didn't cost anything...unlike the deckchairs in English parks.I would recommend going to look at the World War 1 pictures on the railings as they were amazing.

Grand gardens and fountains. Enjoy a peacefull walk or sit and have an ice cream and people watch. This is a fabulous place to do both. Also look for the little cafe in the park and have a bite to eat under the trees. All in all well worth a visit.

Just like Victor Hugo described it!. Amazing garden in a great city. Very well maintained garden. Great War photo exhibition on the fences of the garden attracted a lot of people attention and showed cut cultured French are.

great garden, great palace.. The gardens are very close to Notre Dame and not crowded at all. The palace is really beautiful with a nice pond and lot of chairs. The kids play area is huge with lots of rides and soft floor, so don't worry about them jumping from one ride to another.. There is about 5 euro charge per kid but its for unlimited time. Its a great place to chill between hopping the attraction for everyone - with or without kids..
Skip it. The gardens are huge but not much to look at. Nice if you wanna jog or stroll. Not for tourists. Better to spend more time at the Eiffel tower.
Great for relaxing. Chill out and relax. Get there and you will understand! Just chill, forget, and de stress! Ideal place for a picnic.
Typical parisian garden. Typical parisian garden. Big trees and beautiful flowers. Charm in this place. It was nice and very pleasant. i recommanded.

Stunning gardens. These are amazing gardens. Not the biggest, but it the sunshine, well worth a few hours walking around, soaking up the happy atmosphere and enjoying the peaceful surroundings. Lots to enjoy for kids.

Too early. Fantastic setting, groundsmen had only just started to plant out so the colour was absent. Wanted to have a tea and coffee but the cafe was closing. It should have closed just before the park closes. There was great photo display about the 1WW with maps you could walk over.
Lovely. Really serene, beautiful. And locals are pleasant and charming and very friendly – not rude as I had been led to believe!

A pleasent escape from the city. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a beautiful park on the Eastern fringe of Montparnasse. On a good day, be a Parisian and buy a sandwich to eat in the park. Two possible choices for sandwiches are The Boulangerie Julien at the corner of Rue Vavin and Rue des Notre Dame des Champs and Subway around the corner on Vavin. Its a short walk East on Vavin to the Gardens.

Stunning Gardens - Great Atmosphere. I visited the gardens one sunny evening recently for a little picnic. It was such a gorgeous and well maintained garden. It's a very relaxed environment with lots of seating and places to relax. A truly stunning garden to visit

Wow, we could learn a lot from the French when it comes to parks.... We were staying in a hotel near the Gardens and having two children under often started our day with a walk through the park. The trouble was, it was often quite hard to leave! Firstly, there are chairs and deckchairs scattered throughout the gardens, so you can settle anywhere and watch the world go by. There is a little boating like where children can hire boats and push them round with a stick, in that very old-fashioned way. The edges of the park have lovely green spaces and glades, perfect for picnics. There's a bandstand so quite often music would come wafting across the grass. Then you can watch the locals playing boules - quite absorbing once you start! There is a lovely play area in the middle for children which costs a Euro or so to enter per person, but the facilities are excellent inside for tots and bigger children. This is a lovely spot. Happy memories made here!

wonderfull !!. I love the Jardin de Luxembourg, in the spring time the gardens are really nice, full of flowers, and in early summer there are the Chopin concerts every week, and it is free. I usually go there to run early morning when there are very few people and you can really enjoy the beauty of the french gardens.

Great park, toy sail boats in center fountain awesome for kids. This is where a lot of folks go to relax, read a book and just people watch. For us, the rental sail boats that kids can push in the central fountain were the best. My kids ran around the fountain for 30 minutes chasing them. Tons of fun and a very memorable visit that my kids still talk about.

A lovely place to stroll. We visited on a sunny Sunday afternoon and the gardens were very busy. We enjoyed strolling around and soaking up the Parisien atmosphere. The gardens are huge and we didn't walk around everywhere but if you are in the area it is worth stopping in.

Beautiful Park. Parisians know how to use their public parks. We found people of all ages enjoying the many different spaces in the beautiful park. The Palace is the focal piece, but the grounds are full of so many different kinds of places. There's the floral gardens, tree lined avenues, tennis and all manner of sports areas, and areas for special events. Mostly people spend time sitting or reclining on the lounges, benches and chairs that are readily available. This is a lovely place for a walk, an artist to paint, or just to relax.

A grand and beautiful park an rive gauche. This is a top park even amongst the many in Paris. If not as famous and prominent as some others in Paris, it stands it own for its design, maintenance, location, and beauty. A nice piece of history along with the museum, Senat, and other buildings. Grab a coffee and pastry or some lunch and enjoy the park in a great neighborhood for exploring.

Perfect spot to retreat from the hustle and bustle of Paris. There isn't a bad garden in Paris, but this is certainly one of the best. Whether you want to just sit and stare at a fountain and a beautiful palace, hit a tennis ball, or let your children play - this is the place for it. It's all very French in its formality - tree lined avenues, grass you're not meant to walk on - but I guess that what makes it special. Amongst the hustle and bustle of Paris, this is a much appreciated tranquil space - so grab a baguette from a nearby bakery and enjoy a sunny afternoon of people watching. If you have kids, they'll love the open space, or racing a yacht in the ornamental lake. Enjoy.

Such beauty in the heart of Paris. Simply beautiful. Go, walk around a little, sit on a bech or a chair to read a book, have a picnic. The trees, the flowers, the bees, the orchards, so much beauty and peace in such a busy city...

Holidays in France. We went to these beautiful gardens and it is well worth a visit. An oasis in a busy city.BEWARE if you buy food or ice creams etc at the Kiosk/Restaurant. My wife got ripped off. Gave them 50 euro and the woman said no you only gave me 10 euro. They said they checked their cameras but would not show us the images. I don't think there are any cameras, I could not see them. Avoid buying food here. It is an old trick to say you gave me 10 when you gave more, particularly if you are on your own with no witness. Staff attitude was appalling it ruined a great time in France.

Just a big garden. It is nice, don't get me wrong. But when something is titled "garden" I imagined it would have beautifully themed gardens, and lots of different flowers and plants. There wasn't really anything that amazing about it. It's nice to walk around or sit in if you're having lunch; but if you're going purely for the plants/flowers I don't think it's worth it.

One of the most beautiful spots in Paris!. We visited this park on a Saturday while in Paris and it was really beautiful! We sat in the chairs by the pond for a while and just relaxed and enjoyed the views. They have sailboats the kids can rent on the weekends so it was cute to see them playing with those in the pond. There was what looked like a full orchestra playing in the park so we sat and listened to them for a while as well. A wonderful place to relax for a few hours!

Marvellous gardens to take a break. Off the saint germain/Latin quarter area, a beautiful garden connected to the Luxembourg palace. Nice to take a rest, watch the people go by, and enjoy the beautiful flowers

"Sit and Stay a While". In the heart of a bustling city, it is nice to know that there is a place one can go to sit, stroll and relax even if it is only for a short while. The scenes you encounter: babies in strollers, children playing, lovers enjoying each other's company, a gentleman sitting and reading his newspaper...all of this adds up to people enjoying a little moment in daily life in a picturesque and beautifully manicured, historic part of Paris. And you will too.

Just the best place in Paris. Whether you are running in the early morning or sitting drinking tea at any time of the day, this is the perfect place in Paris to come and people watch in a glorious setting. Always entertaining, always lovely, gentle, peaceful and beautifully laid out. And a view of the Eiffel Tour to boot. My favourite place in Paris.

Amazing Garden and View.. One of the most beautiful gardens in the world that I have ever seen. I could picture myself sitting there for hours unfortunately have to get on my feet as I was just getting so comfortable because we want to see different sights.
Grand gardens. Very nice space in a very busy city. You step off the busy sidewalk and it is as if you step back into a more tranquil time and space. Even with the people there it is still quiet.

take a picnic take your time. the typical dusty path shady park complimented by open wide spaces with plenty of seats around a perfect pond, le bon marche is close so perfect to grab a picnic and while away a good-weather afternoon
Gardens Luxembourg. Close to our accommodation in the Latin Qtr. Very French and formal but very relaxing. Great map of WW1 battlefields that you could walk on.

Incredible isn't enough. Goodness gracious do I wish I had had more time in Paris to which I could spend roaming the Luxembourg Gardens!! They were sooo gorgeous!! Gosh I just wish I could have spend more time roaming & seeing the palace within the Gardens because it gorgeous!! we only saw one side of the Palace but I absolutely loved it!! I'm sorry to be that stereotypical American, but my first thought when seeing the palace was the movies The Prince & Me, & prince diaries... :) It felt fairytale like which was maybe my favorite part about the gardens. Make time to spend a few hours wondering!!
Beautiful. This park is charming and a refreshing place to rest from the busy streets of Paris. The statues were beautiful and the park has a nice coffee shop.
Nice place to take the Grandkids. Beautiful gardens and palace with many play fields and a childrens playground. It was a nice break from the city while still in the city.

The best way to spend a sunny afternoon!. Unspoilt, peaceful, quiet, tranquil, relaxing - this place is such a tranquil and peaceful place in what is a very hectic and bust city. Grab a chair by the main fountain and sit back and relax! The Palace is not bad to look at either!There are also no souvenir sellers and with the police walking round (because the Luxembourg Palace is now the French Senate house) is just feels safer somewhere you want to spend a lot time.
Perfecto for an afternoon chill. Just go there, lay in grass when good weather and enjoy - either the fountains, the chateau or the view of Montparnasse
Lovely Gardens. We only spent a short time here but loved walking around the gardens and well worth visiting! Give yourself an hour or two, longer if you want to visit the museum.

Beautiful Palace, full of life. This was a nice little discovery - we had never heard of this park previously, and as we were walking past we heard the sounds of Mozart and followed the music to this lovely park. The grounds are lovely and filled with people. Kids will like the sailboats that are in the pool in the center of the park.

Best playground in Paris. We love the playground in Jardin du Luxembourg and return to it at least once every time we are in Paris. Yes, you have to be a few euro for entrance, but the kids are entertained for as long as you're willing to sit and wait....or why not get on the zip line swing yourself?! Adults are welcome to use it too, and we have such a blast on it! There are definitely some climbing structures that are for older children (7 and older), as they are quite high, especially by US standards, but there are many play structures for even the littlest kids.

A great way to beat grey skies. Second time and both times have been in cool weather. I image that in warmer weather these gardens must be spectacular. I have observed the hedges being trimmed with such precision that it seems absurd but the results are stunning. A great retreat.

On a pretty day, visit Luxembourg Gardens with Parisians, young and old. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful and deserve the big crowds of Parisians that come here on pretty days. You should, too, to not only see the gardens but also the people of this city enjoying their leisure in good weather.

The True Paris. There is the Paris of the Champs Élysées, of the Louvre, of the Eiffel Tower, all wondrous but any visit to Paris must include a walk in the Luxembourg Gardens with its long rows of horse chestnut trees, its sculptures, the Medici fountain and lake and all the people enjoying the wonderful setting, sailing boats, playing games the real flux of life in this almost mythical city. This is a place where you can feel the spirit of Paris and immerse yourself in its flow and beauty and delight.

Nice in the springtime. Most notable in our travel down from the Arch De Thriomphe down Avenue Des Champs with its thousands of high end shops to the location where all the guillotine action occurred during the French Revolution, and then on to one gigantic former estate (Palais Du Luxembourg) where we walked the grounds and enjoyed the sun along with the many locals in and around the grounds.
Just lovely. Always worth visiting what're time of year you're in Paris. Le fountaine cafe is perfect for sipping a coupe and watching people.

Beautiful Garden in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are a must-see if you're going to Paris! The park is well maintained and contains a variety of flowers and plants. Also, it is free and there are usually some small events going on in the park. You can tour the gardens in 30-45 minutes. The only downside is that it tends to be packed with people and sometimes it is hard to find a place to sit on the grass.

Neat sailboats!. Beautiful and manageable in size with plenty of seats, my favorite feature of this garden was that in the center fountain there were a bunch of toy sailboats and children prodding them with sticks when the boats got close to the edge. A nice way to rest tired feet!

LOOVED IT. Loved the park and the nice small bar in it. We where there on a Saturday and they had a live band playing. Really nice cofee and music....... The lace nicley looked after easy to stroll around and take a breake at any point you like. A lot of chairs aroudn in teh midle you have a small " pound " where kids can rent small sailing boats and play with them. Really nice as it was Quite windy so teh sailing boats were really gliding....

Beautiful and peaceful. Even though there were many people there, it didn't feel like it. Mostly Parisians in the park, and they sang together as we walked into the park. That was so nice! We were lucky to find two vacant chairs. Sitting on the grass is strictly forbidden, so the police will ask you to move. The garden has beautiful trees and flowers, fountains and statues. It is really a romantic, peaceful and romantic garden.

Time Stands still. I am from Vancouver, the city of gardens. I have been to London, New York, Montreal... Luxembourg Gardens are so far my favourites. 2 things will bring me back to Paris: "Chez Andre" restaurant and the Jardins du Luxembourg.
crowded, lots of Africans trying to sell trinkets. Beautiful setting in May, weather was wonderful.Lots of Africans trying to sell trinkets, they are really intrusive

Beautiful gardens!. What a beautiful spot to spend an afternoon in Paris! The grounds/flower beds are immaculate. I took so many pictures! Was great for people watching and just to wind down after sightseeing or before an evening out. They could easily charge a fee but it is a free experience and great place to hang out and watch families, couples and kids in the middle of the city.

One of the best in Paris. A very pleasant and tranquil way to spend an hour or two. The place is well maintained. It is easy to walk on the various paths. There are plenty of seats for a rest. In addition, it is in a good location in Paris. We stayed in a hotel within a short walking distance from here.

Great garden on a sunny day. The garden was only 4 blocks from our hotel and we planned on seeing this first on our day tour. Very well kept garden with wide paths and a museum at the end of the walk. Had early breakfast and spent 2 hours strolling through everything. Very child friendly

Quieter than Tuileries, and Free. More Parisian everyday life than the Tuileries. This park is where joggers, tennis players, Tai-Chi practioners and dog strollers are in their elements. Near the Senate, Poilane (Cherche-Midi) and the Church of St. Germain de Pres.I had the rare privilege of viewing the Exhibit on World War 1: Fields of Battle, Lands of Peace. History lessons, refreshed!Guess what I had for breakfast? Poilane tarte tatin! Flaky, buttery, fruity and just the right sweetness.
Relax. Beautiful park. Plenty of seating in sunshine or shade. Wonderful pictures around the outside railings about first world war. Facinating.

A beautiful place in a beautiful city. I happened to be there on a warm Sunday afternoon which made all the colors glow. The grass was lush and green and a perfect place to watch people enjoying themselves. I especially enjoyed watching the children sail the boats on the pond.

Lovely Luxembourg!. We have never taken the time to visit this lovely oasis in the city and decided to make it a priority. How charming! It was a sunny afternoon and we walked by the Medici fountain on our way to two comfortable chairs next to the pool where children pushed their sailboats back into the current.

Put This on Your List. Plan to spend some time here. We visited this location a few years ago but did not really take it all in. This year we did. We went looking for the statue of the Statue of Liberty. The very large Statue of Liberty is located by the Eiffel Tower but the smaller version is located here. Enjoy the park, statues, fresh air, and the folks either playing sports or just enjoying the sun. On certain days there are musicans playing in the vestibules. There is also a museum located on the property which houses many rare paintings. Get a Visite Paris Metro Pass as the metro services everything in Paris and is super easy to use.Rich and Dr. Linda W

Lovely, lovely, lovely. So lovely with ponds, fountains, flowers, chairs, and a restaurant. In the middle is the Luxembourg Palace which is now the French Parliament. Children race sail boats in large pond in the summer. Most wonderful place to unwind when running all over Paris gets to be too much. Just people watch, read, or do nothing at all.
Decent. The gardens are pleasant and beautiful to look at. They are huge and provide a nice walk. I wouldn't say they are a must see, but if you have time they are worth a look.
Spring in the rain; beautiful garden. I really love this garden and wished it had not been raining - plan to bring lunch and stay the afternoon if you can
amazing, must see!. beautiful and romantic, great to walk in or chill at a bench, there was live jazz music at the gazebo when I was there (it was a Sunday afternoon)
Awesome!. Had the pleasure of visiting the gardens, admiring the flowers, trees and beautiful sculptures and of course the palace. This is a place to spend most of a day.
A peaceful interlude. A very well maintained garden.Great for some downtime just strolling or sitting watching the world relax.
So good you should pay to enter. We visited on a sunny Saturday and all Paris was there. Boating pool, bandstand and formal garden setting surrounded by a backdrop of attractive buildings

Queens all around. Really enjoyed all the sculptures and statues but especially the Queens and important women encircling the pond and fountain on the East side. Also enjoyed the French espalier garden of fruit trees and plants - such organized and functional beauty.
lovely ambience. Lovely place to wander through and had the wonderful surprise of a free brass band concert one afternoon. There is a cafe and many seats to enjoy the atmosphere and people watch too.

So glad we visited. We gave ourselves a day off, we were waking around without an agenda and decided to stop in to the Luxembourg Gardens. What a treat! We had never been there and fell in love with the fountain (a highlight of the trip). I loved ht paper boats in the water and the relaxed beauty of the place. There was an area where people were having chess matches, it just added to the charm. Absolutely worth the visit.

Beautiful gardens. Went here on the first day of our visit trying the walk off the jet lag. These gardens are wonderful and well worth the visit if you are craving some green space and open space. Nothing too special to see except the scale of the landscaping and some statutes of former queens. The palace is closed to the public as it is home to the senate.

Don't Miss It. You know that Jardin du Luxembourg is a special place because it's usually full of Parisians. The beautiful Palais du Luxembourg and it's spacious pond, Grand Bassin, are the central features of the park. There's a spacious grove of trees on the east side of the park that offers cooling shade and live music on a hot afternoon. Don't miss the adjacent Fontaine Médicis, which sits at the end of a pretty, tree-lined, rectangular pond. South of the Grand Bassin is a large rectangle of grass that's flanked on both sides by avenues of square-clipped trees. It's the only place in the park where you can sit on the grass so it's full of people. If you can't find a spot on this patch of grass, there's plenty of metal chairs to lounge on throughout the park. On a busy day, the chairs are at a premium but be patient as you'll eventually find a vacant one. The best way to enjoy this special place is to while away an afternoon with a good book, bottle of wine, baguette and cheese surrounded by the locals.
Paris Vacation. Amazing gardens, worth the time to check them out. Not to busy or to many tourist when we went, such a lovely setting.
Lovely way to spend a few quiet hours. Take a quiet, lovely stroll through these beautiful gardens while the French CIA plans to overthrow the world underneath your feet
Great walk!. Don't miss the fountain... Is one of those quiet beautiful spots that make Paris such a great and romantic city

Must Do!. Went here to just see it - and wanted to stay all day just to enjoy it - the chairs everywhere near the gardens and fountains, made it so inviting! Loved seeing the families and flowers and people enjoying the atmosphere!!!!

One more example of beauty of the french jardin. Beside the Versaille as the top sample in paysage architecture, but outsde the limits of Paris, here in Paris, we have got another example of top scenery, when it concerns the gardens with the lawns,trees, flowers, pools, fountains,statues, pathways, cast iron and wooden benches.Bordered by the Rue de Vaugirard from the north and by the renown Boulevard de Saint Michel from the east, that stretches right up toward the northeast and the island, Ile de la Cite with a famous Cathedral Notre- Dame, this vast grounds around the beautiful Luxembourg Palace represent the one of the most wonderful and powerful parc, that I've ever seen in the whole world. It is a second largest public park in Paris and is located in the sixth arrondissement.There is a spectacular view, through the alley of trees with the tiny graveled walkway, at the Pantheon in the distance. I was delighted, as I strolled by the park lanes, with the monument to Jean Antoine Watteau, and naturally by Medici Fountain, since the Maria Medici, native from Florence, was the founder of the Luxembourg Jardins and the palace in the center of it. This palace was designed as the imitation of the Pitty Palace in her Florence in Italy.Beside, I stopped for a moment, to cast my glance at the original model of the Statue of Liberty and at the statue of great french writer Gustave Flaubert.After the Buttes des Chaumont, another place for genuine repose.

Massive Park in Paris. This garden is massive and you can't believe you are in the heart of Paris. We were walking south of Notre Dame into the Latin Quarter of the Left Bank when we stumbled into this great park. You can jog, picnic or just walk around and observe the people.

Palatial Gardens. I was fortunate to visit the gardens just after a storm, so they were fairly quiet. These are formal gardens, beautifully manicured, surround the beautiful Luxembourg Palace. There's a vast array of statues and fountains celebrating historic and mythological characters, including the original version of the Statue of Liberty. I am not sure that I would visit the gardens when the weather is fine as it's clearly a popular tourist attraction.
Beautiful Gardens. Walked through the gardens, they were beautiful. Would be a great place to relax and enjoy the sunshine!

Beautiful, well kept, culture-full gardens. As per the title. A lovely area to take a break in. Grab some food from nearby Sorbonne and relax in the gardens. There are lots of chairs/benches to sit down on. Views of the tower.

More than just a lovely garden. We were amazed at the size of the grounds around the Luxembourg palace. Even in the rain, it was pleasant to stroll along the walkways.Posted on the fence outside the grounds, we noticed some large, attractive photos. How tragic to see the aftermath of a war-torn region, so lovely today but so totally ruined in WWI depicted there. Truly humbling to reflect on the good fortune of those of us who didn't love through those times.

Wonderfull garden, peaceful and pure beauty. So many hours spent in "Luco" - when I was kid, learning to walk, student preparing for exams, now jogging in the early hours of saturday morning… Probably one of the most beautiful and powerful gardens in the world, combining "jardin à la française" architecture, past memories of kings and queens (statues), and the French Senate combined with art exhibition. A must do (must be) in Paris.

Absolutely worth a visit any time of the year. These wonderful gardens are full of art and flowers. The fountains are breathtaking. There are places to eat outside within the gardens and places for young children to play. Also small sailboats can be rented and floated in the very center of it all. My favorite time is in the early Spring when the tulips are in full bloom.

Beautiful Garden. I am glad I had time to visit. This garden is beautiful in the Spring time. I enjoyed strolling and just sitting and watching. For me, the best is to watch the French families enjoying this great park. When I visited, the flowers were just beginning to bloom and the air was full of the scent of roses.

A real Paris experience. Don't miss a stroll through this beautiful park! It combines historical significance with real life; we saw kids playing games, adults playing tennis, folks siting and reading - and tourists like us walking around eating ice cream. A lovely, peaceful respite in Paris.

PEACE AND QUIET. The Jardin de Luxembourg is a wonderfully quiet place but with the enjoyment of watching the Paris world go by. On Sundays it is possible to see the man with the toy yachts hiring them out to children to sail on the pool and afterwards to stroll through the leafy grounds of the Palace.
Wonderfully Paris!

Central Park of Paris. The largest park in the center of Paris is a wonderful place to sit or walk, but especially in the warmer months when they have exhibitions. Plenty of children playing so if you have kids this is a great place to let them roam. There are lots of chairs and benches to sit and read, talk or simply watch people. Bring a picnic and live like a native:)

Perfect. I love it in the Luxembourg Gardens. Go for a short trip or a whole afternoon. Especially when the sun is shining, it's just beautiful. If you want to beat the tourists, go pre-9:30am. Lose yourself in these beautiful gardens and forget about the hustle and bustle on the Paris streets!

Great for running off the streets. Two laps around was a nice morning run before pain chocolat! There were quite a lot of people running and some groups. It is also mostly sand/dirt not paved all around.

A perfect way to spend le dimache. Relax in the gardens like the locals, watching the world go buy, take a newspaper or something to read and grab a baguette. A great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful place to relax. A beautiful place to just stop and relax and you will see many other locals and tourists doing the same thing. Plenty of chairs are available. Don't miss the grotto hidden away down a path behind the central cafe.

To feel parisien. I had the chance to live nearby.it s a place where you can read a book, see the clouds going by, taking the sun or looking at children with their boats in the little lake ( they rent them, you can have one!). A mix of nature and architecture, the feeling of the rich and powerful Paris that does not exist anymore, the feeling of artist painting sunsets in the latin quarter ( it used to be very famous for this last century!). Take a paper, and a sandwich if you want too...there are free chairs where you can built a little memory of your holiday in paris.

Great stoll thru a wonderful park. We arrived here after several kilometers of walking and just enjoyed the serenity, water features, flowers, etc.
Spend some time wandering around and people watching. It's a must visit in Paris.
excellent outdoor space. beautiful garden and lovely when the weather permit, to just sit down and relax, or picnic like the parisians do it

Peaceful park near the Latin Quarter. Go here to rest your feet after walking through the Latin Quarter. The Senate building is here, as well as water features and plenty of chairs to rest yourself for a while. There's a good outdoor restaurant in the center of the gardens as well.
Beautiful. Beautiful tranquil gardens in the heart of the left bank, filled with Parisians and tourists alike. An enchanting place to walk through or have a picnic lunch.

Nice stroll around the Park. Fun walk through the park, watching kids run around to play with their sailboats around the huge pool. It was a beautiful sunny day where we could have enjoyed the music of the orchestra for a long time!

One of the most beautiful spaces in Paris. If you don't visit the Luxembourg Gardens while in Paris, you're missing a lot. It could easily be one of my FAVORITE spots in Paris. It is a huge park (for Paris), with gorgeous greenery everywhere. Everything about the gardens is beautiful, from the statues, to the gorgeous fountains, to the Luxembourg Palace, to the huge trees and colorful flowers. Entrance is free, and the gardens stay open until sunset. Grab a coffee and something to eat (we had some Pierre Herme macarons, which is on a near by street) and sit on one of the many many benches or seats everywhere in the gardens. Incredibly relaxing! I also saw many people running around the tracks of the gardens, so it's a great place for jogging/running.P.s: An Angelina store can be found right at the entrance of the garden, so that's a huge plus. It closes at around 7 pm, though.

Relax & enjoy. Beautiful garden to enjoy the sun & beautiful green lawns with very old trees. We walked through the garden & took a little sojourn on the classic green chairs on our way from Tour Montparnasse to Notre Dame Cathedral
Beautiful and peaceful. lovely gardens whether walking through or relaxing. flowers are beautiful. could spend time here everyday.
Beautiful Gardens. Great place to spend an afternoon. The palace and grounds are large and beautiful. Grab a bottle of wine and a light lunch and enjoy the joie de vive of Paris life.

Luxembourg gardens don't miss. Perfect Even in the rain. Watched serious bocci players. Gorgeous plants and flowers. Famous sculptures. Romantic. Chairs that don't get stollen, incredible. Bathrooms. Well labeled plants. Museum on premises.
One of my favorite places. Wonderful place! I see some senior guys playing a game with iron heavy balls, I wonder what´s the name of that game!

pleasant place. It was nice to be in these gardens while still in the center of the city. Plenty of chairs to sit around the pool, listen to the musicians play their tunes, and just relax in this pleasant place.

Beautiful!. very beautiful garden with lots of things to do and to photograph if that is your hobby. Spend at least one hour there. The Pavilion restaurant is expensive but it's reaaaaaaaally good and service is exceptional.

Peaceful and Well-Kept. We found the Luxembourg Gardens by accident after a morning at the Panthéon, and it turned out to be the perfect spot to sit and eat lunch.
