The abundance of seating meant that we could put up our feet and take a break in the middle of a busy day of sightseeing. A pretty, peaceful spot.

Lovely Park. Well kept, clean park with lots of seats to sit and while away a warm spring afternoon, watching the locals go about their daily life. Just mind the price of your coffee if you order without seeing the menu at the outdoor cafe.
Luxemborg Gardens. Beautifully manicured. A very nice place to go to relax and chill out after a hectic day of site seeing.

Relaxing and beautiful gardens. Great place for a picnic as there are benches and chairs all over under shady trees. Beautiful grounds with tennis courts, lake. There is a bathroom for a small fee, less than 1E. Although later we found these free bathrooms all over Paris.
Much Ado About Hardly Anything. The gardens are very pretty, but really not worth the bother of seeking out. If you're in the neighborhood, and want to drop by for a few minutes, they're OK.
Beautiful. I am glad I made time to visit. This garden is beautiful in the Spring time. I enjoyed strolling and just sitting and watching

A walk in the parc. Beautifully maintained formal gardens where you can walk and talk or just sit and enjoy the scene. Be prepared for a small charge to use the bathroom facilities as in other Parisian parks.
Springtime in Paris. It's such a beautiful French park and great for people watching. I also enjoyed watching the chess players.

Great place to visit- especially sunny weekends. This is the thing to do on a sunny Sunday in Paris. The gardens themselves are gorgeous. Luxembourg Palace inside the gardens, is the seat of the French Senat. It is interesting to view from the outside. For me, the best is to watch the French families enjoying this great park.

Peaceful and refreshing on a hot day!. We took a bus to go there from the centre of Paris, and walked, sat, read. There is plenty of space there so that, even on a day when Paris was teeming with people, it did not give the impression of being crowded. Children with their families, young people, or lonely readers using one of the many chairs available. There is a small lake around which people sit and chat. The building of the French Senate and the many trees provide interest and shade. Well worth a visit to pause at the end of a day sight seeing, and there are plenty of cafes in this area of the Latin Quarter to take a glass of beer or wine, or a cafe.

Public space for the people.. What a wonderful place for spending some time. When I visited, the flowers were just beginning to bloom and the air was full of the scent of roses. Young people playing, running, families strolling, lovers sitting on benches tourists taking photos, this garden has it all. I saw groups playing basketball and an interesting game which looked like Bocce. The lawns were green and the trees in bright light green foliage, spring time in Paris. Great place to stroll, smell the roses and reconnect with nature.

Beautiful Peaceful Setting in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens is the perfect location for a picnic lunch in Paris! The property is very well maintained with many sculptures and an adequate number of chairs for visitors. I highly recommend a visit here if you are in Paris.

Sunday afternoon. Walking around Paris can be a terrific full time experience. When you want to see want Parisians do on a Sunday, take a walk through the Gardens. Lots of young people running, young families taking time out and couples falling in love again. There are also model boaters skippering remote control craft on the little lake. You might say to yourself "what is missing?". Answer, people are not focussed on electronic devices. They are enjoying the day distraction free and so should you!

Beautiful spot to relax and people-watch. Beautiful gardens with lots of chairs so you can have a nice picnic or just sit and enjoy the scenery. Also fun to watch groups of people playing chess. Playgrounds for children, also.

Beautiful space. The Luxembourg Garden was about three blocks from our hotel, so we visited here often, even if just passing through. This is a beautiful public space, laid out behind the French Senate building, and is a great space to picnic, run, wander or just sit and watch people pass by. Do not miss the Medici Fountain, which is oddly Italianate for Paris.
Lovely and peaceful. Really nice and peaceful, although the park was busy. The cafe by the Luxembourg Palace is the nicer of the 2. Nice place to stroll around and have a coffee / crepe etc.

Enjoy the nature. The garden is big enough to find a cosy, silent place for have a picnic. Or you can sit in the middle of the garden, near the fountain. If you like jogging, you can take hotel near the garden.

yes yes yes. If you appreciate beauty as much as i do then you will love the gardens. The scenery is breathtaking and it stays in your fantasy. You don't even have to take pictures if you don't want. Although it was a bit of a rainy day i enjoyed it a lot.

Most picturesque garden in Paris. Jardin du Luxembourg is one of the largest public gardens in Paris. Is well maintained and manicured with flowers and trees. There are chairs along the park for people to sit for sun bathing or people watching. Along the park there are many statues. As a central focal point is a fountain and the beautiful Palais du Luxembourg, which serves as the French Senate. On weekends, Parisians come for picnics, enjoy the tranquility of the park, as well as children could play with rental model sailboats floating on the fountain. At the edge of the garden, there are also ponies for young children to ride. Strolling leisurely through the garden can discover many monuments, statues and several fountains.

Lovely Setting in the Heart of the Left Bank. We visited the Jardins de Luxembourg in early May, when the weather was beautiful and many different types of flowers were in bloom. It's a beautiful oasis with so much history, dating back to Marie de Medici in the 17th century. A jewel on the left bank just off Boul St-Michel. Definitely worth exploring. Can't imagine a nicer place for a picnic lunch on a nice, sunny day.

Great free outing but not the best garden. Had visited Luxembourg Gardens after seeing the gardens at Versailles and the Tuileries Gardens, so I'm sure this coloured my opinion. It would be a perfect outing with children and for picnicking. In terms of gardens, the flowers currently blooming were mostly snapdragons, petunias ... nothing breathtaking. It's relaxing, there are lots of locals and tourists around taking advantage of the beautiful green space. The games areas (chess, tennis) and the pond for model boat sailing were fun to see. Nothing wrong with it... but in my opinion, not a must-see.

Oasis in Central Paris. These gardens are massive and beautiful with lots of colourful flowers. I love to walk around in the mornings,it get busier later in the day. There are a few cafés and plenty of places to sit and relax. We saw a busker playing a lute the other day.

Peite Bateau!. If you have young kids, I highly recommend taking them to the Luxembourg Gardens. We spent an hour or so playing with the little boats in the fountain. This is a great place to unwind between other sightseeing stops. Bring a picnic and enjoy the peace of the park.
Enjoy the sun and a picknick. Beautiful garden and palace. Nice to walk or just sit down in one of the green chairs, relax, enjoy the sun and a sandwich.
Great place to take photos.. Beautifully laid out gardens with many walking paths and an amazing amount of green metal chairs to sit on while taking in all the beauty.

Divine gardens oozing culture. We grabbed some local produce and headed to the gardens for a picnic. There were hundres of others doing the same. Sunbathers, lovers, readers, writers, painters. A French band was playing traditional music and people were singing along or dancing. Gardens are divine. A must see.

Beautiful place to relax. This is the place to go to experience the relaxed, laid back beauty of Paris. Buy a bottle of wine, your favorite cheese and a baguette. Walk around for an hour or so to see the sights and find your favorite place. Sit down and enjoy!!!
Wonderful green in the middle of Paris. A very trimmed garden indeed. Wonderful access from every point. Ideal for taking a seat, a book, and relax on a spring afternoon! Enjoy it.

Great People Watching. Lovely and peaceful even in a bustling city. It is a great place to People watch on the Left Bank. Just sit on one of the chairs placed around the central octagonal pool. Admire the formal gardens, statues and the Palais de Luxembourg

One of my favourite places in Paris!. The Luxembourg Gardens are absolutely beautiful, well maintained and are lovely to either lounge in on a sunny day (there are plenty of chairs and benches dotted throughout) or walk around admiring the flowers, statues, fountains and the Palais du Luxembourg. Make sure to check out the Medici Fountain!

Beautiful balanced formal French gardens center of town.. Expansive gardens, formal balanced. Many beautiful statues fountains and lots of green grass and benches
Parisians, when the sun comes out bring out the wine, the sandwiches in rustic French bread and sometimes off comes the clothes in isolated instances.
Sun is to be celebrated, and here it is done in style!
Visit repeatedly and then some more!

A favourite meeting place for Parisians. When I lived in Paris I used to go the Luxembourg Gardens almost every Sunday because it is one of the best park in Paris, located in the attractive Latin Quarter. It is definitely the best place to discover the "real" Parisian life: you can watch locals enjoying themselves with their family and friends or just having some rest. You get a better insight into what it is to live in Paris, unlike many other tourist attractions.

Ernest Hemingway loved it here. Earnest Hemingway strolled through these gardens almost daily on his way to his favorite cafe Closerie des Lilas before visiting his dear friend Gertrude Stein. You need no other reason to stroll through the magnificent palace gardens!

Must See Park in Paris. This is a nice easy stop from the Tourist trek to observe a nice park and see how the Parisians enjoy the sun and relax. The park itself has the classic gardens with trimmed trees and a palace that Medici built. Best to go on a weekend when the Parisians bring their kids to play with sailboats in the fountain, see music performances, and you could even see a traditional Marrionette (French puppets) show.It a close walk from St.Michel/Quartier Latin and good place to do a cheap picnic with some great sandwiches and beer. Lots of chairs around to soak up the sun, and nice hidden areas with sculptures in the gardens for quieter relaxation.RER has a stop there.
Gorgeous. Can't think of a better place to relax on a Sunday afternoon enjoying some macaroons. You can't sit on the grass but there are plenty of chairs.
Beautiful Park. Great place to relax or stroll. There are chairs available to take a break. There are restrooms, cost is 0.50 euros.

Go for a stroll in le Jardin du Luxembourg. And then sit down on the chairs and enjoy the weather, the beautiful surroundings, and watch students talking, children playing, or people reading the paper or a book.
Relaxing. We stopped by the gardens not knowing what to expect and were pleasantly surprised to see lounge chairs which we sat in for an hour or so to enjoy the beautiful scenery.

Lovely oasis in center of the 6th Arr.. If you are staying on the left bank, it will be your version of the Tuilleries. Smaller but less touristy, it lies behind the Luxembourg Palace and is more Italian in design. In April the flower beds were all in bloom with tulips and daffodils. The children enjoy sailing small boats in the fountain which can be rented; we enjoyed watching the children. The garden is elevated at one end so you can enjoy a raised view of the planting. The trees are pruned in a most unusual way making for a very beautiful corridor on exiting the garden from the far end opposite the Palace.Even on an overcast, drizzly day, it was a lovely respite.
Peace and quiet on a Spring morning. An oasis of calm and an ocean of people watching opportunities. A spot to settle down and be a flaneur, watching the world go by.
Wonderful on a Sunday afternoon. Caught a late afternoon concert for free, which was even better in the beautiful surroundings and available seating.

Peaceful park with interesting statues and fountains. I went to this park in January so there were very few flowers, no leaves on the trees, and it was slightly overcast. Despite this, it was a beautiful walk. I enjoyed looking at all of the different statues, fountains, and terraces. My favorite part were the twenty statues lining the central green. The statues were of queens and female French saints. There also were not many tourists in the park when I was there. I hope one day I return to Paris in the spring or summer so I can see all of the flowers and trees in full bloom.

Gorgeous! . We had not planned on going here but stumbled upon it on our way to the pantheon. Let me just say OMG! So beautiful! People were everywhere just sitting and talking which made it feel very comfortable instead of nerve racking like other busy parts of Paris. I wish we could have spent an entire day here just sitting in the sun looking at everything. Very relaxing and great to stroll around.

Beautiful Gardens. The gardens are open to the public and beautifully manicured. We visited on a Sunday afternoon after a rainstorm and the gardens were filled with locals enjoying Mother's Day. The gardens were beautiful and very picturesque. Definitely worth the visit.
A beautiful setting for a little rest.. We watched the children play, admired the gardens and were blown away by the Museum and the lake. Gorgeous in Spring. Stop by and take a break.
Paris at its best. Enjoy seeing Parisians living their normal lives and enjoying their wonderful city. What a marvelous place to spend a beautiful Sunday in the park!
Nice. Very beautiful park. Not many tourists there. Near palace you can find very interesting map that is made on the ground so you can stay on it.

Beautiful. These gardens are stunning, clean and kept in excellent condition. I would say that the Luxembourg gardens are defiantly worth a visit. There is lots of chairs and benches for the public to use and cafes dotted about for refreshments.
Nice and peaceful. I loved being able to walk this park on a gorgeous sunny day in Paris! It was perfect! This park is wonderful to stop and take a break from all your busy sightseeing.

gardens in paris...... There in the middle of a great city are beautiful sculptured gardens which are a joy to wander around in, and so many things happening........people wandering about or relaxing and reading, pony rides for children, a lovely little cafe in the middle of the trees - all magic........
Great park for quiet break. Great park for quiet getaway for weary tourist, very walkable and enjoyable. Take time for a break well worth the time to do so.

Formal Beauty. We had the disadvantage of visiting this lovely park on a day that was cold and wet so we did not see it in its best light. The park has quite a formal layout with lakes, fountain, tree groves and games areas. There are chairs everywhere. I wish we could have seen it in its full glory, being well used. Our favourite area was the MediciFountain.
lovey relaxing gardens. Lovely gardens lots of seats to sit put your feet up & chill out . Several tennis courts all ages playing on them . Nice oark for familes to take there kids to .
Great Garden. Very fine garden, big and well organized.Be carefull, the kid area is with ticket for children and parents

Sunny spring day is wonderful for a visit to this place which had been so often take part in so many books. It's a part of Paris which is good for everyone, elderly people and children, those who in love, those who are romantic. I like the parc in the morning when there are no such a big crowd, but I think everyone could find it's own Luxembourg gardens time and place.

Pure Parisian Beauty. I don't have much to say about what I didn't like about the Gardens. I had been there on a brief visit decades ago and I found the grounds astounding and sublimely beautiful then and even more so now. The statuary is classical and the flowers in Spring were a delight. I can't wait to spend hours there, reading, sketching and just enjoying the moment and the place.
great place to relax. Bring a book. Sit, read, relax. So pretty. There's a lot to see in the park and many paths to just sit and enjoy nature.

Don't miss it. If you like the Tuileries garden, Luxembourg garden is not to db missed. Less crowded with tourists, cleaner, more beautiful... The original model of the Statue of Liberty stands quietly at the corner of the garden, near rue guynemer entrance. There are great restaurants nearby, worth spending a morning or an afternoon there.

Family Gathering on Sunday Afternoon. We visited the gardens on a Sunday afternoon and enjoyed watching local citizens enjoying a lovely, sunny, cool, Parisian afternoon. People were playing games and sitting on lawn chairs and blankets sharing time with their families and friends. The grounds are beautiful and the expanse of the area affords lots of room for families to gather and enjoy. When in the area, enjoy the opportunity if you can.

Best central park to enjoy the sun. If you don't have time or inclination to trek out to Vincennes or Boulogne either side of Paris, consider Luxembourg. Quieter and in my estimation more attractive than the Tuileries, it is the perfect place to pitch up on the lawn with friends or on your own. We had a great picnic here with friends the moment that Spring sprung.

Great parc to chill and picknick outside the grass. We had a great day in the parc having a small picknick which is not allowed everywhere on the grass, but you have enough pard chairs to choose, even those at the pond in front of the palace you have chill chairs watching children playing with their toy sailboat. Looking at a old everlasting joy for children and adults.
A must on a sunny day. A great place to eat lunch and to sun your self. It was delightful seeing all the children float their boats in the pool

Peaceful Respite. Came across the gardens and what a delight! A very nice place to relax, take in the scenery and have a picnic. Lots of people watching. Sorry that the castle wasn't open for viewing that day.
Beautiful. Lively gardens with boating lake, lovely for picnics, flowers beautiful in spring, many sculptures too.

Peaceful, relaxing and beautiful. When you get tired of the hustle and bustle of St. Germain des Pres and St. Michel, just walk a couple of blocks and you are in the garden, adjacent to the Palace. Built by Marie de’ Medici, then queen of France as her "humble" abode away from the Palace of the King, it now houses the French Senate, a museum, and is the second largest public park in Paris. Two Medici women were Queens of France, Catherine and Marie. The first one taught them to eat with fork and knife as opposed to using their fingers, the second one brought a great deal of culture and beauty to the court and the capital, including building this Palace to remind her of the Pitti Palace in Florence and the park surrounding it. And the beautiful Medici Fountain. Yet, the French still look down on Italians… beats me why…In any event, there is a Musee de Luxembourg which we did not patronize, because we wanted to benefit from the lovely afternoon in the Park. The rain had stopped and the intoxicating aroma of the blooming flowers, the buzz of the bees, the quiet talk of people walking around or seating on the free chairs all around, the blue sky, it all combined to make it just a perfect moment.

Enjoyable time in an exquisite garden. Superb surroundings, all great except for the white dust settling on yr shoes and clothes, and for the little stones getting inside yr shoes. If you don't mind that, then nature and architecture will make yr head spin literally....till you will stop to play tennis, or smell the flowers. Great place!
Beautiful and restful. Not too touristy for a major Parisienne landmark. Still full of locals coming to lunch or while away heir time here. The Palais du Luxembourg is elegant and stately.

Wonderful & classic French palace garden stroll. Its a postcard moment. The Palace exterior over the lake and garden is a great photo. Try to explore the paths around the edges of the park. There are many sculptures and lovely scenes. If you think you may need the WC note their position before and be aware tour groups can tend to crowd them. As often in France, carry some 50 Euro cents for WC visits.

Perfect spot for people watching. Apart from it having a museum, lovely flowers, lake and all the usual stuff you'd expect in a park, the main thing that makes this park so delightful is the generous sprinkling of chairs everywhere, so that you can sit, read a book, sunbath, talk with friends, put your feet up ... a lovely relaxed atmosphere.
Beautiful gards. VERY well maintained gardens. Tons of greenery and the luxembourg palace is nearby to boot. Great views. Not too crowded. Good place to relax.
A beautiful park. Beautiful gardens. Enjoyed looking and reading all about the statues in the park. Great for a picnic lunch, walk or just sit and relax.

Spring in a Paris Garden. We were lucky enough to be in Paris for 10 days in April visited Luxenbourg gardens twice. Had a picnic there with many Parisians sitting around. The flowers were in full bloom as were the trees it was truly April in Paris.

flowers and a great playground for kids. many different flowers making the garden amazing. The playground is also really good. You pay 2,50 euros for the day per kid and they play as much as they want. Very nice!
Wonderful Gardens to Visit. Beautiful flowers. There are chairs to sit in the sun and enjoy. There is also a cafe for drinks or food. Interesting people watching too!
Nice. Beautiful gardens, we were there on a wet day so we didn't get to explore it all. Would be nice on a dry day.
A pleasant place for a stroll. Really there are much better places to visit in Paris, however for a relaxed place to sit and watch the world it is fine.
beautiful surroundings. A magical place to experience the history and beauty of Paris.Picnic, or just strolling around ... its perfectly located across from hotels, shops, and restaurants.

Great slice of "real" Paris.. I probably wouldn't have ventured here, but I was training for a marathon and couldn't skip my run; I wanted to feel safe and wanted safe (non-cobblestoned) footing. I left my friend sleeping and hit the park before dawn on a frigid December morning and ran the outside circuit in loops, criss-crossing the interior when I got bored. It was a delightful place to run and watch the sunrise; around the park, shops and bakeries slowly opened, the smell of coffee and pastries filled the air. I began to see other runners, too, and my New York City Marathon sweatshirt attracted some attention. It is one of my fondest running memories.
Beautiful Park in the city. Recommend you walk around and then sit by the fountain. There are lawn chairs (some recline!) with great views of the Eiffel tower.
Great place to visit. Beautiful Garden with very good places for a pic-nic. Kids and adults will love to play with the antique sail boats to be rented in the lake inside the Garden

Beautiful gardens, a must visit in Paris. The Luxembourg gardens are absolutely gorgeous and perfect for a nice walk to get away from the hustle and bustle. The lake in front of the house where children play with model boats is particularly love.y

A place of peace and tranquillity; just up the street from our hotel. It's such a beautifully set out park. The sailing of the little boats on the weekend add an extra charm to a beautiful garden, seating all around the garden made it so comfortable for visitors.We walked in this park everyday for the 6 days we were in Paris.

Liberty Garden!. The gardens are a large area within Paris that has many attractions within it from Tennis Courts and a small amusement park for children. The gardens are well laid out with flower beds, tree lined avenues and at one side of the park the original statue of liberty.

Enjoyable time. We had a walk around and sat and had lunch in these lovely gardens. Lots of chairs available and things going on to keep you entertained. Toilets are available in the park which is helpful and not always common in France.

Beautiful.. Visited these beautiful gardens, sculptures and fountains. Unfortunately, the fountains were not filled and not on. Nice place to stroll and watch the old men play bocci ball. There are bathrooms, but there is a .50 euro charge to use them. Not much in my book- bathrooms were clean and there was an attendant. There are benches scattered around - so one can sit and watch the people watch by.

Beautiful gardens..not to be missed. Everything was in bloom when we arrived in Paris and the gardens were one of the most beautiful I'd ever seen. The variety of flowers and the sheer colors of it all are a delight to behold. Be sure to visit when you're in Paris!!
A beautiful stroll. Spend a few hours strolling through admiring the amazing statues and beautiful flowers . Lots of room to lay out a blanket and enjoy lunch alfresco !!

Beautiful!. We visited the park on a very sunny Sunday morning and loved every minute of it. Wished we had more time to spend there. Take a picnic and have a seat at the octagonal pond. Very nice area around the gardens too, much less touristy.

A fantastic central oasis in the 7e!. Gorgeous centrally located property which offers a respite from the city bustle and crowds! Lots of space to walk, jog, look at buildings and statues, or sit and relax.

Peaceful spot. We spent a couple of hours just walking through the gardens, flowers were in bloom, lots of miniature boats on the lake, we were lucky and found a couple of chairs and just sat and rested our feet for 1/2 hour. If you need a quite spot to rest this is it.

Beautiful and relaxing. Strolled these gardens in fabulous weather. Great to linger and just enjoy the day. Beautifully kept and a wealth of plants abound. Quiet places to contemplate and also lots of places to be active too. A welcome calm to the hectic side of Paris.
A beautiful park. One of the most beautiful and best-kept parks in Paris. The whole area is just beautiful, probably one of the best areas in Paris. Definitely not to be missed.

beautiful Garden. i visited this garden/park twice during our week stay in paris
it has great kids play area, pony ride, carrousel ....
very recomended with kids
Relaxing. Kill some time and just rest your feet. Watch the men and boys sail their boats in the central fountain. Smell the flowers. Thats it.

Nice resting point. Nice place for a rest. Besides the wonderful garden, there are chairs enough to accommodate visitors allowing a good moment for talking and relaxing. Even have a pic-nic, if you brought some food.
A worth visiting place. It's a must to see place in Paris. One of my favorite gardens. And a good place to hide from the heat and the Sun.

A bit of calm and beauty in the middle of Paris. We stayed at the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg, right across the street from this lovely, huge, perfectly manicured garden. I spent an afternoon sitting in a comfortable chair, admiring the green expanses, rows of trees, and especially the pond/fountain in front of the palace. About mid-afternoon, a guy pulled a large cart with a couple dozen small sailboats for rent (3 euros for 30 minutes), attracting little kids (with grandparents) running around the pond pushing the boats back into the breeze. Beautiful flowers, perfect place for a chat, a run, and for some quiet moments after the crowds of the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc.

Love these gardens. Stumbled upon a live DJ here on a Saturday afternoon, which was awesome in these beautiful surroundings. Loved the WW1 map you can stand on that shows the various advances and boundaries of World War One that is temporarily there near the palace end.
People's gardens. Complete with stunning 'Palace' this is at the heart of the Monparnasse community and is an absolute delight.

A beautiful place to take walk..... A beautiful place to take a walk, sit by the fountain, and just enjoy the beautiful garden and statues. If you're "museumed out" and just want to get outside for a bit, perhaps let the kids run around, look no further than Luxembourg Gardens. They also have little motorized "sail" boats floating around a huge fountain. It is the "job" of the little kids to turn the boat around if they run into the wall of the fountain. I can see this entertaining younger kids for hours. Enjoy this beautiful place!

Gives Central Park run for its money. There are so many things you could do in the park. There is a great fountain by the senat, where you could watch people play with toy boats, there is a tennis court, running lanes, flowers and trees everywhere. It can get dusty, so no dark shoes!
Lovely even in winter. Grand, elegant gardens that provide a really peaceful area for walking or sitting in the sun. I have visited in all seasons and there is always something to offer here.

So romantic. Go to one of the two cafes and have a coffee or tea. Even if it is raining take the time to walk around and study the statues. Most of all just 'people-watch' and relax. It is an oasis of pleasure in the middle of all that Paris chaotic traffic.
Nice in fresh sunny days. Very pretty and spacious, full of chairs to enjoy the sun.Nice rectangular shaped trees. Also some intersting rc boats on thelake, and some simple ones, not rc, to rent

Beautiful Gardens. We have been in Paris several times and in this trip chose to visit places we had never been to. The gardens are extremely nice with well tended flower beds. A quiet place to read a book, walk or just sit and check out people as they walk by. The palace you can tour for a fee but the gardens are free.
Lovely Gardens. These lovely gardens are free and offer a tranquil and beautiful park area for walking and relaxing.
A beautiful respite from the hustle of the city. It is beautiful and peaceful. It is very well kept. Just go, sit, and enjoy the beauty. There is no stress that a few minutes here will not relieve.

Beautiful. The gardens are beautiful and grand. The children play, the old and young walk, and the lovers hold hands and kiss as they sit on the benches. It is one of those special experiences one should not miss and we've walked there on all of our visits to Paris.
lovely. perfect place to spend a few hours with the kids- especially the amazing playground (although it costs a few euros to get in) so much space to run around or relax, well worth the visit!

Amazing. We visited the gardens for the first time to have family photos taken. We arrived early in the morning, around 8 AM and there were a few runners, but we basically had the place to ourself. The park was everything that I expected it to be. The sun was out and the flowers, pam trees, and fountains were beautiful. We took our pictures and then stopped in at Cafe Richard for coffee, hot chocolate and crepes. Then it was off to the playground for the kids to have some fun. Make sure you have cash to pay for everyone to get into the playground. It was fun to watch the park wake up as tour groups starting walking through, the ponies being led in and the boat cart being pushed in. By the time we left around 11:20 the fountain was full of boats and there were people everywhere. It was a wonderful day and we can't wait to go back.

Stop and smell the flowers, - Beautiful, peaceful serenity.. Very beautiful Paris garden. Absolutely stunning. If you are traveling with children and need some downtime, take a moment to visit this special garden. There are tennis courts, playground equipment, pony rides, ice cream and fountains. The gardens are gorgeous. It will recharge your soul.
a charming place for a quiet walk. Historical place. Many beautiful sculptures. Beautiful view of the Luxembourg Palace. If you take a lunch + wine, you can get a pleasant pastime for two.

Take the weight off your feet.... A visit to Paris can be a taxing affair, and it was with some relief that we detoured to visit the Luxembourg Gardens and enjoyed a pleasant interlude in the sunshine. A definite haven in this bustling city and just the place to relax and take the weight off your feet for an hour or so! Plenty of seats and a charming cafe under the trees.

sailboat watching. this is one of the great parks in Paris. i did not go into the house, but sitting in the park or runnung which is very popular is great.Watching the children rent and play with the sailboats with families is very entertaining. worth taking the time.
Grab a butty and chill. A great public space with fine views, plenty of seats and the surrounding areas have lots of shops from which to purchase take out food. Go on... have a picnic.
lovely gardens. lovely gardens, we saw people jogging, out with doggies, kids playing football, mothers with strollers etcgave us a taste of how locals live
Gorgeous Gardens. Gorgeous Gardens in Saint Germain. Neighbourhood worth going great place to chill out loved the flowers & Statues

Lovely place for a picnic. This formally set out garden is a lovely place to have a picnic lunch. Bring your own. The day we were there it was very peaceful and a wonderful way to enjoy Paris whilst having a rest. A good way to relax after seeing the Pantheon as it is close by.

Visited twice. Both experiences unique and beautiful. Our first visit took my breath away. Such beautiful grounds. We sat in chairs and watched the remote controlled yachts.
Second visit. We walked around more. We saw young girls taking horse rides in another part of the garden. It was part of local parisian life. Riding lessons.
Well worth the visit. Very beautiful, great view from the city. The neighborhood is also a big plus, you can roam around the streets easily. Pay attention to the buildings, you will be amazed.

Beautiful Gardens!. I visited here twice during my recent visit to Paris. The gardens were in full bloom, and it was a great place to walk around and enjoy for a couple of hours. Be sure to walk around the lesser-traveled parts of the gardens as well!

... Overwhelming beauty.... My wife and I went to Paris for 4 nights some days ago...One day we took the Metro... We got off the Metro and up in the open... And WHAT a surprise... We had no idea of where we were and what to come.... We were just "blown away" by the great beauty of this perfect park... There were perfect spots all over the place... Perfect and poetic sculptures... Tree - alleys... Areas of grass.... Waterfountain.... Romance.... This is actually a place to stay and explore... I guess a whole day wouldn't bee enough... Here you certainly will feel tranquility and relaxation... Our mission this day was something else, unfortunately, so we just passed through, slowly though because of its overwhelming beauty.... Many good photoes were taken.... And we will come back one day... Guaranteed.... T

Formal, green, sociable . Like many of Paris's green spaces this is a place of gatherings and families. The trees are constrained in typical French style and there's very little that is wild or unkempt. The central pond sported some remote controlled yachts when we visited. Worth a visit.

have a picnic. My tip would be this: wake up early get to Notre Dame before the busloads of crass tourists descend upon it after your visit grab some lunch and walk across to the Luxembourg gardens, it should take you 10 minutes and you can enjoy a great picnic in the sprawling grounds. The views are fantastic, lots of people watching, loads of chairs to sit. It is just divine!

Luxembourg Gardens. It's a beautiful garden close to Notre dam cathedral. One can easily spend couple of hours appreciating the greenness & flowers in the garden. There is a children park at the corner of this garden. My kids did like it very much. This is a good visit if you are travelling with family.

Sunny day picnic. We loved strolling around this park on a sunny afternoon. We bought sandwiches from a food stand in the park and ate lunch overlooking the pond in the middle where little children were sailing wooden sailboats. It was so charming! It was probably my favorite lunch of our trip to Paris (and the least expensive).
gorgeous gardens. Lovely place to chill and enjoy the summer days. It is a nice place to have a walk, relax, read a book, do 'people watching' and enjoy summer.

A beautiful place for a stroll and a picnic. We had stayed next to the gardens when in Paris at Xmas time years ago. It was beautiful then even in winter. It is stunning now and was amazing place to have a picnic.

Spend May Day Here!. Miniature boat races in the pond, chairs to leisurely play chess or sketch the beautiful scenery, sculptures, artistic landscapes, and the best people watching place in the world. For all ages.
wander and people watch. I had a conference nearby, so I got to spend many pleasant lunchtimes there; good for strolling and people watching.
Best park in Paris. The grounds are huge and the flowers and grass are gorgeous. Great place to rest and relax. Pack a picnic and chill for a few hours.
Going back in time.. It was truly grand you could close your eyes and see the carriages,soilders, and imagine what an opulent life they led the in the royal court.

Beautiful in April. This was a grand and beautiful gardens that a number of Parisians will just come by and sit or have a picnic lunch or run through at any time of day. I wish we had more time to walk around it - or just sit in the many chairs.

Gardens Lovely but. When you want to walk around here, remember the grass is for looking at and the paths are that gritty & dusty white gravel which clings to your shoes! Having said that, there is so much going on like boulles, children's pony rides, tennis, artists, sailing toy boats in the pond, etc. Plenty of seating but at the weekend, all of them taken. There are little cafes/eateries dotted around if you choose to linger for lunch or a snack. We were here in April and the weather was unseasonally hot, so the flowers were out on show. Also lessons were available for bee-keeping - now that's a first in a city! We did go back for a second walk, during the week when it was quieter and enjoyed every minute.

People watching at it's best. We came here at the end of our week long trip for a bit of quiet and people watching. The day was warm and sunny, the gardens were beautiful and there was people watching at it's best. Nice chairs around the pond to sit in and watch the little children with their rented sail boats. We spent at least an hour doing just that. The Luxembourg Gardens take up about 60 acres and are filled with fountains, statues the sail boat pond and the French Senate Building. This is a quiet oasis in the midst of the city - a welcomed retreat.
Nice and cosy. You can enjoy and relax in these gardens while you eat your lunch that is the delicious Parisien baguettes.

Popular park for a promenade. This is a good place to come on a pleasant day to just stroll, watch fountains, watch people, sit and relax. Also popular with joggers. It's mostly gravel/sand with long rows of trees, rather than grass, and not as many flowers as you might expect from the name. But on a nice day, it's obviously a popular retreat from concrete and traffic fumes.
Green corridor. Lovely to walk through this elegant and stunning garden with avenues of trees, statues and fountains.

Amazing for kids and adults. Heavenly! Bought baguette sandwiches to each in the park and had a lovely time. Plenty of available seating and wandered to sail boats in the fountain area for a couple of Euros, pony ride for a couple more euros, and then on to the phenomenal kids park for another couple of euros. This is the most amazing playground I have ever seen for kids. Truly magnificent. Kids of all ages would have fun, but probably best for the 3-10 year old set. Because you have to pay (even adults) to go in, many send just their kids in and watch from just outside. Plenty of lounging chairs for parents and you can definitely keep an eye on your child even thought for a playground it is quite big. Zip lip type activity, rope climbing structure, slides, etc. Could have spent an entire day here.
Place to rest a little bit. It is a good place to run or just walk and see the nature. If you have time, try to drink a coffee or tea in the cafe that it is in the park.

A lovely walk. We took our time to stroll thru the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens while in Paris and it was lovely. If you have young children or are young at heart, you should take the time to push the toy sail boats around the fountain. It is also a lovely place to relax from rushing around site seeing.

Stay off the grass. We wanted to go here and have a relaxing time eating some pastries sitting on the grass. Yes it was pretty but make sure you stay off the grass and bring some cash to use the toilets. Grass is only to be looked at and not sat on or walked on.

A very nice place. Every time we visit Paris we like to visit this place during the weekend. Many people are doing exercise like taichi and other unknown sports. We also like to watch the mini sailing boats on the pond and the excitement of the children and grown ups ! Just visit this nice place !

Beautiful, flowering gardens. We walked the Left Bank and ended up at Luxembourg Gardens. These were among the most beautiful we saw on our trip to Paris and filled with lots of activity including playgrounds, tennis courts and chess playing that added to the French atmosphere.

Beautiful. We went to Luxembourg Gardens 14 years ago when my nephew was 4 - ate crepes in the little restaurant and watched the kids play on the playground. Returned this year with our children (17,14,9). This is such a beautiful place. You must come and spend a relaxing moment drinking it all in and imagining the lives of the residents from centuries ago.

Tranquility. April visit, so weather so and so.. Mainly tourists like myself.. Gardens lovely to wander through.. Fountain not working but can imagine delightful in season... An elegant simplicity to the design and planting...

Great to waste time soaking up the sun. This is just a few minutes walk from Notre Dame and very enjoyable if you have time to waste, watch the world go by and soak up the Paris sun. Lots of little cafe's and bars dotted around the place for snacks and drinks. The boating lake is fun for all ages.
lovely. a pond where parisian folks sail little sail box. Tres bien. Quaint lovely spot to put your feet up for an afternoon.
A lovely place for a picnic. Stop by a bakery, fruit, cheese and meat vendors, get some wine and take it to Luxembourg park for a picnic and stroll. Then shop the streets of Saint Germaine.
fantastic!. Beautiful, user friendly Gardens. So much going on and so much to watch! Many chairs for sitting, relaxing and people-watching!

LOVED! Beautiful. An oasis in Paris.. The weather was gorgeous and we wanted to escape for a while from the chaos of the traffic filled streets, this was the perfect oasis. The gardens are lovely and the atmosphere on a sunny day is lovely. It is a very civilized affair, you can not sit on the grass, find yourself one of the many seats around the edges of the pathways and just relaxxxxxx. We ended staying for 3 hours, just people watching and chatting. No phones, no laptops, no books etc.
must beautiful garden in paris. the must beautiful garden in paris .you can visit after a hard walking day .the Peace and quiet in the place is amazing .high recommended
beautiful gardens. Well worth the visit, a visit to the Orangerie is interesting. The fountain near the entrance is spectacular.
Luxembourg Gardens. Very pretty, nice stroll thru the gardens on our way to the famous pastry shop. Great picture taking is available and beautifully landscaped.
city visit. Beautiful gardens a must visit when in Paris. They do close at night though. Took a lovely leisurely stroll through gardens lovely colours

Serenity in the gardens. I love walking through the Luxembourg Gardens. I lived across the street when I was 15 and always passed by the gates and went through. The grounds are beautiful and the fountains as well. I love to sit on a bench in the sun during spring and watch people go by. You can enter from the side where the News Cafe is and exit out on to Blvd. St. Michel where it's so busy all the time.
Gardens are beautiful. Very comfortable walking areas, gardens are beautiful, museum was great. There were many venues to visit here, the museum offered a great value for the ticket.

Beautiful gardens and kids playground. Visited with my 2 sons in spring...bright sunny day...families picnicking on the grass. The boys especially loved the large fenced in playground. There was a small entry fee 2,50 euro just for the playground, but well worth it. It had clean equipment and bathrooms, and ice cream for purchase. Playground equipment was fun and challenging for even bigger kids. As we were leaving the gardens, we caught an adult game of what looked like bocce ball. How fun!

Stop and smell the roses!. There is so much running in Paris and the Luxembourg gardens is where I go for a rest, sit on a chair or a bench and breathe, or simply watch the children sail their boats on the central pool. In the summer the boxed orange and palm trees are out. There is a small production of honey for sale if you are lucky enough to find it.
Gorgeous. We walked through these gardens and they were so lovely, it was a glorious sunny day and plenty of parisians doing tai chi.Worth a visit

another must visit place. Many of the tour operators or people visiting Paris, miss out on this Garden. We did manage our time and went for this. Were simply amazed to see this wonderful garden with lovely flowers and trees. The garden is simply maintained well and gives the perfect ambiance to sit with family, click lovely photos and have a time with nature.
Wonderful. Really recommend this for families and lovers. The park is the ideal spot for a picnic and relaxation on a nice day

Simply Lovely - A must see in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is where the locals take their children, go to read the paper, relax, people watch and enjoy the surroundings.The gardens are amazing, with fountains, huge grassy areas, trees flowers... The list goes on.It's a beautiful spot to stroll. Bring coffee and a croissant and plan to stay a while.

A very popular garden. The magnificent Luxembourg Gardens is high on my list of places to visit when in Paris, particularly when the weather is good. This time we approached by bus from an unfamiliar angle, and discovered for the first time the interesting and historic apple and pear orchards.The "guingette" (open-air cafe of the old-fashioned sort) serves snacks, drinks and light meals, and one can eat inside if the weather is inclement. Be aware, when eating outside, that many birds frequent the trees around the cafe, and that accidents can happen!Children love sailing boats on the large pond, or playing in an enclosed sandpit area with pleasant places for parents to sit; and it is wonderfully pleasant to sit and chat, and watch the world go by here on a nice day.

Beautiful and relaxing. Lots of people reading, playing, listening to music. Don't wear good shoes, a lot of dust! After walking around, head to the cafés right next to the exit, very good food, drink and people watching!
April is Paris is Gorgeous!. A stop at the Luxembourg Gardens in April is a MUST! The flowers were in full bloom and the grounds are absolutely beautiful!

This is a wonderful oasis in the middle of probably my favorite city on Earth. Walking here is such a treat. It is just beautiful and you can see some of the other wonderful landmarks of this wonderful city. You feel that you are in the presence of all the other that have visited this special spot over the centuries remembering the paintings by Sargent and others. This is a place that you need to devote a little time to explore all that it has to offer. It is also nice to allow yourself a little time to just sit and take it all in.
Beautiful!. The most amazing and well kept gardens! Plenty of place to sit down and relax, enjoy the view and the atmosphere!

Escape the City without actually having to leave!. Paris is a beautiful city with incredible architecture and countless picturesque bridges to photograph but if you, like me, sometimes prefer to escape the hustle and bustle of shops and cars then Luxembourg Gardens is a must!These incredibly well maintained gardens are perfect for a picnic on a nice day, a gentle stroll or even just to sit on one of the many chairs and read a book. Perhaps the greatest thing about this escape from city life is that it is actually only minutes away from the centre of Paris so it is possible to have a short break to relax without wasting too much valuable sightseeing time if you are on a short vacation.

Nice quiet garden. I checked out Luxembourg gardens before I went to Notre dam as they are quite close to each other (walking distance). I got to Luxembourg by metro and then a short walk.Definitely something to check out, even for a rest on the many green chairs available around the main garden fountain. 2 hours are a good amount of time to spend here. It was so peaceful!

Lovely park. Visited this park twice during our trip to Paris last year. We walked through the park on our way to dinner one night just as it was closing. It was very quiet and romantic with the sun just setting. (Perfect for a proposal!)We then visited the following day when the sun was shining. There is a lovely lake/pond in the middle of the park with plenty of seats so you can enjoy the view. There are kiosks dotted around for drinks and snacks.

Perfect day picnic spot!. Grab a picnic lunch from Gerard Mulot and head over and spend as much time as you have. We have gotten to where we plan a day around just visiting the garden. The gardens are beautiful and you really get swept away to a different time! You will love the chairs!

a relaxing place in Summer time. a hugh park, with beautiful scenery, historical building, fountain and trees. we enjoyed the time hanging around there, a perfect place for sun bathing, picnic and relaxing during summer time.

Great Place to Visit - Jardin Du Luxembour. What a jewel to visit in Paris. I went there at lunch time - it was amazing! There were many people eating lunch, taking in the sun, reading, relaxing, etc. Awesome!

Beautiful location for a picnic. We took a picnic and sat for hours in the gardens. there is something for everyone. A lovely little area for model racing boats, people playing chess, friends meeting. Very relaxing and worth a walk around
Quiet space in Paris. An evening or morning stroll through the park was bliss. A must see. The sculptures were fabulous, the architecture of the buildings inspiring and the people watching amazing.

One of my favourite places in the world. Even if you're only in Paris for a couple of days, go to the Luxembourg Gardens. They won't disappoint. They're magical, beautiful, relaxing and peaceful. Go, you'll love them!

Beautiful Garden. Was here in early April. Beautiful flowers. Interesting fountains. Manicured trees. It's right by the RER B station so you can cut through the gardens and partake the view if you don't have the time to spend an hour or two to dedicate to this place. As a bonus, there's a Dalloyau at the corner by the RER exit on Saint-Michel Blvd.
Nice Park. It has a very nice kids play area and close to a very nice cafés locations so people can have a nice breakfast and walk to the park

Relax and breath a bit of nature in central Paris. The park is nice and wellkept but most of all it is a fine place to relax your tired legs and enjoy watching all the people walking by. We went there on a sunny day in April and enjoyed at least one hour just sitting in the chairs in front of the small lake watching kids playing with sailingships.

A must if you are in Paris and the weather is good. Spending a couple of hours in the Luxemboug Gardens should be a must, if you're in Paris and the weather is good.Bring a friend and/or a book and just grab one of the free public chairs standing around - then find your perfect spot and relax ... and then you ca relocate to another spot and continue relaxing.Even my 15 yo daughter found this place worth returning to, just to sit around reading and enjoying the atmosphere.A true gem of Paris
nice park. nice park in the centre of Paris! A great lake with toys sailing boats and a lot of places to enjoy sunshining!
Best garden i have ever visit ! specially on weekend. I loved the lake with small ship-toys guided by kids :)Weekend was great to spend on the garden.. !

Nice & big park, but not free with kids. Nice and big park! Alas, most things are paid here: 0.50 for toilets, 2.50/kid for the playground (per day, it's a nice one though), 2.50/lap in the go-carts, etc.Overall I preferred the Jardin des Plantes over this one. While the playground there isn't as big, it's just much fresher, and the kids aren't constantly begging for something that costs.

Run, Walk, Sit, Relax. Beautiful gardens and palace, a short walk from our hotel on the Rive Gauche. Active park, with runners, skaters, musicians, artists out & about. Well manicured, flowers, trees, fountains. Good place to take a stroll, or sit & read, enjoy the atmosphere.
Lovely. This is a lovely place on a sunny day! There is a beautiful little Cafe shop outside the gardens called Bread & Roses where you can get fresh Baguette's and Croissant's to eat in the park :-)

Beautiful Gardens. If you are nearby it is well worth a walk through. They are nicely laid out with very colourful flowers. The chestnut trees were in flower when we were there which added to the beauty.
Ordinary Park. After walking and lying in Amsterdam's parks, it doesn't seem beautiful at all. I think it's popular because of scarcity of parks in Paris.

Gorgeous in the sunshine. Our last day in Paris and looking to kill a bit of time before our flight home, we decided to walk to the Jardin du Luxembourg. It was lovely to sit and watch the boats on the pond, as well as all the people out enjoying the sunshine. A perfect way to while away a few hours. We didn't do it, but it would be perfect to have a picnic.
Excellent Public place. So many activities to do. Good outdoor place to take the kids. Tennis, playgrounds and open spaces! We enjoyed walking around in this area.
Beautiful green space!. Lovely gardens with beautiful planting, places to sit, a boating lake and a laid-back atmosphere. A lovely retreat awayn from the hustle and bustle of the streets and traffic.
Wonderful . Wonderful place! Take a seat and watch the beauty of the garden and the people walking, exercising and admiring the view.
Pretty and atomospheric. A lovely space to relax in on a sunny afternoon with plenty of people and entertainment to watch. We visited on a Saturday in March, the sun was out and it was very busy.

Nice park in Paris. Spacious park in the town centre, with a play ground area with an entrance fee also covering toilets. Only well suited for children up to 8, but they allow up to 12 year olds. Nice to sit in front of the palace at night and zip wine and have a pick nick.

Free entertainment. Adorable public park to just sit down and rest your feet for a while. We recommend bringing a baguette and a drink while watching everything happen around you. We sat in the sun and watched the entertaining tennis. We wanted something to drink. The kiosk we found had far too long queue.
Spring time. We were lucky to be in Paris during the spring. The gardens were in bloom, the runners were out, the garden just felt full of life

Magnificent. It is a sheer joy to visit during all four seasons. The grand vistas, magnificent statues and flower arrangements are truly remarkable. One can also appreciate a wide variety of activities ranging from chess playing, boules, tennis, to free concerts. There are pony rides for children, puppet theatre, and they can also hire small sailing boats. During Summertime one can enjoy free art exhibitions in the Orangerie. Meals are catered for by its two restaurants, refreshments are available in the gardens.

A place in the sun!. A beautiful day to sit in the sun and relax. All kinds of chairs provided free including comfortable recliners! Lots of well behaved young students mingling with residents and tourists. Gardens beautifully kept. A good place to walk and relax away rfom the bustle.

sail boats, puppets, play ground. 2 boys 5 & 8, one of the nicest places for them in Paris, the play ground is totally worth a visit it you need some kid down time. I was enchanted by the sail boats, noted on prior visits pre kids, but truly enjoyed when seen w kids. Play ground is 2.50 euros and sail boats 3 euros for 30 min. VERY worth the cost

A truly relaxing Parisian moment. A lovely city park for strolling, or whiling away any amount of time on one of the many park benches. There is a great playground area (entrance fee) for young children within the park.

Perfect for a stroll, picnic, or just a lazy afternoon!. Love this garden. I have gone through it 10 times and still love visiting it! Spring is the best season, as you get to appreciate the wonderfully maintained plants!

Favorite garden in Paris. Favorite, favorite, FAVORITE garden in Paris. It is so idyllic and so peaceful. There's beautiful statues of former queens lining the park and lots of color flowers accent the large stretches of green.

Go float a boat!. This is an excellent park to stroll, sit and watch, feed the birds, play tennis, sail a boat across the water and enjoy the scenery. If you only have time to visit one park, i would recommend this one. Excellent all around.
Beautiful a must see in Spring!. Gorgeous! Great place to relax and take in the beautiful scenery and gardens in Spring! No bike riding allowed but great place to sit and relax.

beautiful. This was right across the street from our hotel and we strolled through here in the morning. What a beautiful sight. Very busy with joggers/runners in the morning. They also have chairs around the center area to sit and enjoy the view and to people watch.
Lovely place to watch the world go by.. Loved its ambience- families , couples, old and young. Great to sit and people-watch. Elegant formal gardens and avenues

Yes, I know, it's one of the Paris icons but it's too large, too open and too crowded to me. And the person who came up with the idea of covering the footpaths in Paris parks and gardens with that horrible white dust should have been treated with a guillotine (I hope he was).

The best urban space ever. Sunday before Easter and the gardens were full of people just chatting and palying - their own games, tennis or chess.Everyone must have their own favorite spot in the gardens and their preferred time of day because the character does change with the clock and the weather - my favorite - winter and wet - but this springtime - unbelievable!
Lovely spot. Enjoyed sitting on the free green chairs having a packed lunch. Lovely place to recharge your batteries before heading out once again.

Your garden in the 6th. If gardens in Paris are on your schedule, Luxembourg is worth special effort. It is the second largest garden in Paris, 25 hectares large. But not too large to stroll in an hour or so. It's a combination of English and French gardens with many trees for a summer shady respite. The Luxembourg actually inspired Florence's Boboli gardens. The centerpiece is the Medici fountain where flowers bloom and people can put up their feet to catch summer sun.On one far side people are playing chess and various board games. There is often a Sunday band playing near the Senate (which often houses major art exhibition, last year it was Chagall).The garden borders the 5th and 6th arrondisement.

Gorgeous. An absolute treat during our trip to Paris. The gardens were in full bloom, and were gorgeous. We brought a bottle of wine and a book and spent an afternoon rejuvenating during a busy Paris trip.
Perfect pit stop. Wonderful getting out of the hustle and bustle and sitting soaking up the sun and watching the world go by. So peaceful.
stroll. just for a stroll if u dont visit it also its ok not a big deal well its good ina old city a good garden in the paris latin quarter
colorful place to rest. colorful place to rest after long walking through Paris;Parisians used it as location to sunbathing
Perfect on a summers day. Gardens in Paris are part of the whole experience and this is one of the best. Pack a baguette, a bottle and some cheese and spend the afternoon under a tree.

Morning and lunch.. Wonderful for morning jog (or walk) round the perimeter. Lunch-time people watching. You find the grass that you may sit on eventually, but you need to like to sit close. Or watch the boules clubs at play: serious stuff.

Perfect for Paris in springtime.. Just spent a lovely family afternoon here, some warm sunshine, happy people relaxing. Plenty seats available round the pond even though lots of people in the park. Only three euros for half an hour of enjoyment for nine year old to hire a boat for the pond. Enjoy.

My Favorite Place to Spend a Sunny Afternoon. Luxembourg Gardens has something for everyone. For just sitting and chatting with friends while soaking up the sun, it's perfect. It's also just as enjoyable if you are alone. A wonderful place to relax after walking all over Paris.For children there are lots of sandboxes, several playgrounds, a merry go round, pony rides, and little boats that you can rent and push around on a stick in front of the Senat.On any day you can watch French men and sometimes women playing pétanques. You might just see a very famous actor playing there with his friends, but if you are from the U.S. you probably wouldn't know him. I didn't until I saw him in a movie much later.There is a nice little café near the bandstand where you can have a coffee or a glass of wine and even lunch. And of course it's just beautiful, with fabulous trees and pretty flower gardens, sculptures, and windy paths to walk along or jog.

Worth your while in all seasons. Much of Parisian history has taken place in these gardens. The Parisians love to have lunch there and you can get some (heavy) metal chairs and locate them wherever you please (except on the grass). The gardens are beautiful and the statuery is worth looking at. Just take a book (kindles accepted...) and enjoy a lazy afternoon. Do not miss the back side where there are all sorts of varieties of apple and pear trees planted.

Lovely and a nice place to relax. This is a lovely place to take an afternoon break when sightseeing. It is a smaller version of the Tuileries Garden. Once inside the gardens you will be able to relax, read and even grab a snack. The gardens are laid out in a formal manner with two tiers, open space, pools of water, and tree lined spaces. A variety of seating, benches, individual chairs and lush lawns are available for use. Scattered around the perimeter you will find various statues and a unique fountain. Inside one of the tree lined area is a small café where you can enjoy a snack and/or drink. This is a nice place to recoup after a morning of sightseeing, enjoy some sun and feel like a local. This attraction is free.

Great place to walk and watch the world. Great free way to spend an hour or so relaxing and enjoying the weather (if you are lucky enough). The gardens are lovely and typical French design. The main fountain is gorgeous as well. Worth a walk around before visiting other attractions close by (Pantheon from memory was just up the road).

Come here to relax like a Parisian. On a sunny spring afternoon the ornamental lake is covered with an armada of model yachts sailed by small children and doting parents. It is a colourful centrepiece of the grand formal gardens where the locals relax and exercise on holidays.

All of Paris on view here. see how the Parisians relax- bring a book and relax on a seat. Surprisingly no one sits on the grass- beware the paths are dusty but good atmosphere with pretty gardens. Food and drink available
Always Beautiful. I love the Luxembourg Gardens - it is beautiful, impeccably kept, full of people, especially children. A wonderful walk and a great place to sit quietly and read or people-watch.
Nice place to sit down. Nice place to enjoy baguette and wine and relax for a while. It's sad that you are not allowed to lie on grass.

if your kids need a break from museums, take them here.. We took an afternoon off from touring the many museums in Paris to let the kids (6 and 7 years old) run around. We were not disappointed. There is a play area with lots of jungle gym-type of climbing things not seen in our native California. The kids had a fabulous time, and I was able to get some guidebook reading done, without having to worry about them. The play area is fenced in, and you have to pay for the kids to go in (I think it was under 3 Euros.)

An oasis in the city!!!!. A wonderful place to visit!! Grab one of the chairs there, relax and enjoy the view... Or sit down at the grass, read your book and enjoy a coffee. The gardens are beautiful ,there are colorful flowers all over, the scenery is just magical!! It definitely worths a visit!!!
Very nice. Nice gardens but quite formal in layout, not much in the way of grass areas which the public were not allowed on during our visit in April, very dusty paths.

Londontan. Lovely place to visit and excellent children's playground (small entrance fee of €2.50 per child and €1.20 per accompanying adult). We came on a Sunday morning and our 2 year old daughter had a great time. Park was not too crowded and after lunch, we sat for a while listening to live music at the bandstand. Perfect Sunday in Paris!

Stop and Enjoy. The gardens were the perfect spot to stop and rest my feet from walking around the city. The scenery was beautiful and everyone seemed to simply want to sit and enjoy it. I would recommend you sit in one of the many available chairs and do the same.

Great resting spot and people-watching. The gardens are lovely and a large fountain in the middle has plenty of chairs where you can rest up between museum visits and long walks. Many folks picnic here, bringing food from other areas or from carts and small cafes within the park. Locals and tourists comingle making for interesting people-watching. Take time to kick back and put your feet up for a while and take an afternoon break here. The beautiful Luxembourg Palace is also here but I don't believe you can visit it, just admire the view from outside.

Wonderful place, (cafe within terrible). Such a beautiful place, with intense history, wonderfully relaxing, unfortunately the Garden cafe was a dreadful service and complete disappointment which in turn made us leave the area to eat elsewhere, bad bad bad waiter service! Arrogance at its most saddest!

People watching at its best. On a warm and sunny afternoon, buy yourself a box of macaroons and a coffee and sit yourself down on one of the free chairs. We spent a couple of most agreeable hours doing just this last weekend, watching the very chic Parisienne ladies with their fabulous handbags!! The gardens are immaculately tended and were in full bloom when we visited. Everywhere was clean and tidy and the gardens were full of people relaxing, chatting and soaking in the atmosphere. Wonderful!!
oasis of calm. after the madness of the latin quarter retreat to this small but clam and orderly French park sit by the fountain or pond and feel at peace

Beautiful Parisian park, with a superb children's playground. This is a beautiful park with tree lined walkways and grassy areas to lie in the sun or have a picnic.The main attraction for a family with children is the superb playground.. This is akin to the Princess Diana Memorial playground in Kensington, London. The playground has areas for under and over 6 years old, with age adjusted climbing frames and slides. Entry was €4,90,for 2 adults and 1 child (for the day). There are simple refreshments and a nearby cafe in the park. It can get really busy, especially in the holidays and weekends.

Relaxing but no WC's. A beautiful area to walk and relax.Suggest a visit.But absolutely no facilities for children. WC signs lead to closed facilities.We found the open spaces of Paris have a very few WC and facilities..

A Blissful Afternoon. This was the first place my husband and I went to upon arriving in Paris and we weren't disappointed. The fair weather helped but the place ensured that we had a truly blissful afternoon.A relaxed atmosphere made us forget that we were in the middle of such a huge city and we were immediately able to get rid of the stresses and strains that we were taking a trip away from. It is very easy to imagine spending more time here either walking through the beautiful gardens which are so tidy and well-kept or just letting the day pass you by.
A lovely place. If you want a some peace and quiet in Paris there is no better place than to spend a sunny few hours relaxing than the vast, beautiful Luxembourg Gardens.

Pretty place tucked into a busy city. Our hotel was nearby-a nice place to stroll and meander. There was an exhibit on Josephine-the only thing we didn't like: the staff told us there was English text and there was not.

My favorite place to stroll in Paris.. There is something so sentimental and romantic about strolling in Luxembourg Gardens even by yourself. On every trip to Paris I never miss my stroll through Jardin de Luxembourg, it makes me feel like a local. Besides the nice stroll you can also enjoy museum and cup of hot chocolate in Angelina. Do not miss Medici Fountain.

beautiful. This is a wonderful place to have a picnic and take pictures. I love how the trees here are perfectly manicured and lined up nice a straight. Something that I don't get to see here in Boston. This place does close in the evening though, there are police at the garden who will sound a bell and alert patrons about the closing.
Beautiful gardens. These gorgeous gardens are a sanctuary away from the busy streets of Paris. Would be a dream to sit here in the summer with a picnic.
Relax in Paris. Just grab a chair and join the Paris people in relaxing and reading a newspaper/book at the pond. Nice relaxing spot in the middle of Paris.

A Very relaxing garden. There is nothing we disliked. We did get up and walk out of the pavilion restaurant thought because it was as if we were invisible. We walked towards the Odeon and had lunch in a corner cafe just across the road and it was cheaper, the waiters very friendly and the food was good.
Lovely gardens, good for people watching. Well kept, charming, safe. Police presence to deter cyclists (obviously banned). The area around the pond is particularly pleasant.
Nice stroll away from the crowds. Just round the corner from our hotel, so had a good wander in the early evening. Oasis of peace after the crowded streets in the Latin Quarter.

Not that impressed. Handy place to visit for a rest on a long day sight seeing. But, the benches under the trees were very dirty, covered in bird droppings and gum residue from the trees, take a plastic bag to sit on! The gardens themselves were not very inspiring, particularly as it was early springtime, would have expected better.
Relaxing and quiet. Lovely park with great atmosphere of people just doing what they do to relax. Lots of chess games etc going on

Great Walk with beautiful flowers and ponds. Our hotel was very close to the gardens and we enjoyed walking thru the gardens. There are flower beds everywhere, fountains and ponds surrounded by chairs for anyone to sit and enjoy. There is a vendor at the central fountain who rents out little sail boats that all the kiddies were sailing around. There is also a museum, but I cannot speak to the content as we were happy to be in the garden itself.

Beautiful gardens. A lovely park with views down to the Palace de Luxembourg. Plan a picnic lunch for your trip and enjoy this place for a couple of hours. The gardens are lovely and it is a good place for getting the atmosphere of the city.

Lovely relaxing Sunday walk. Walked around on a Sunday morning, the weather was lovely and it was really relaxing just watching people watching pushing model boats around the fountain. Definitely worth a visit if you've got time. Just a short walk to/from Notre Dame.

Pleasant setting for a walk in the middle of the city. We were in Paris in March, so little was blooming. That said, the Luxembourg Gardens offer a nice respite in the middle of the city. There are plenty of benches for people watching.

Good on a sunny day. very pretty gardens, nice seating areas with space for kids to run around. Toy boats that kids have to push with a pole to change course available to hire from 3 euros. There were restaurants nearby and so we got our lunch the water side. unfortunately was a very windy day and we couldnt stay longer
great park, but it's a park. Beautiful, nice grand fountain. But yeah, it's a park. Not much more than Central Park or any typical European PArk.

Big let down. Having read reviews I thought this would be amazing. It simple isn't. It is a fairly large area with some sections that are just nicely maintained grass which you are not allowed on so a picnic is a bit pointless unless you want to sit on chairs. There were only a few flower beds and I thought there would be loads of impressive floral displays. We walked around the whole place in about 20 minutes and looked to have something to eat/drink in the on site shops but the prices were ridiculously expensive. Far better walking outside and getting something from the nice cafes nearby. For me, a disappointment.
Almost April in Paris. Beautiful flower beds, ponds, fountains, lots of outdoor seating to relax and rest. Be sure to see the fountain that Catherine De Medici had built.

Nice to relax after a busy museum morning. A very popular place on the weekend, especially if the sun comes out after a cool cloudy week of winter! We thoroughly enjoyed our stroll through the gardens and will definitely return in Summer next time to see the flowers and gardens in their full splendour.
Perfect Place for a Picnic. We purchased a picnic box and went to the gardens for lunch. Be aware that picnicking on the grass / lawn is forbidden. But there are plenty of chairs and trails.

What a wonderful afternoon. It was the first day of April, and Paris was celebrating the beautiful spring weather. Pull up a chair and sit by the water, or just walk thru the grounds. The sculptures are amazing. The surrounding neighborhood has some great bistros.

Real French cafe. What a wonderful place to have lunch. So authentic with great food. So pleased with thé place we bouught more to take away an eat for tea in the park Luxembourg which is only 20 nins away
Relaxing in the garden.... Beautiful flowers and scupltures such as Statue of liberty... We were blessed to have a sunny and beautiful day when we visited this garden.

Beautiful spot to chill out with a picnic. Definitely worth a visit if the weather is nice.The Luxembourg Gardens are a beautiful spot to spend a couple of hours while you recharge yourself for more sightseeing. My advice would be to visit one of the markets in the morning and buy lots of tasty things for a picnic. There are plenty of chairs and loungers around the park so you don't need to sit on the grass. When we went there were lots of students studying in small groups in the sunshine.

Flowers in Bloom. Always worth a visit, the LGs are a big hit for locals as well as tourists. When we visited, there was a huge map showing WW1 positions in Europe with some of the signage on English. Spring flowers were all in bloom with all of the cord of Spring.

Great place for a little relaxing picnic after some sightseeing. I'd highly recommend taking an hour or two here to unwind, say mid to late afternoon, after seeing some touristy sights. During my stay the sunshine actually felt great as it had been a little chilly, but based on reviews, I can imagine how it gets hot during summers. Great for pictures and people watching, but also can find some spots to relax and sit on a bench away from all the people. We grabbed a baguette and some pastries, snacked a little, and then took advantage of the gardens and snapped a lot of photos.

Great surprise garden in hidden part of city. Great afternoon garden to spend some time in, just lounging around. ok for sitting, reading, jogging, drinking wine.Some say one of Paris most fashionable gardens.
Delightful slice of Parisian life. We visited on a balmy Saturday afternoon. It was amazing to observe the Parisians at leisure and play.

Quiet, Peaceful, Off the beaten path and Lovely. These beautiful gardens appear to be a favorite with Parisians. The gardens are huge with something for everyone. There are areas for the children to play with various kinds of rides. Beautiful walkways to stroll and just enjoy the day. A lake where children launch their sailboats and chase them as they sail across the lake. If you don't have your own, you can rent one from the vendors. This place is so peaceful and never crowded. You can easily find your own corner to sit and read. If you want a break from the hectic pace of Paris, I recommend you visit this park. It is well worth the visit.

Beautiful spot!. These gardens are wonderful and well worth a visit aka a lazy stroll. We stumbled across here by accident and was very happy with our 'discovery'. Next time I will definitely be taking a picnic - you could easily spent several happy hours here!
For Spring or Summer visits. A beautiful space to enjoy flowers if you go during the right months. A good location for a picnic and pictures.

Fabulous place!!!!. If you want to feel parisian life this place for you. Area for young loud people on the grass, intimate coners for lovers and kisses, relax places for eldery people. Just enjoy your life!!

Universal kid fun. Luxembourg Gardens is a great break for families touring Paris for some universal kid fun. For my daughter, this included sailing a boat, ice cream cones, and a massive playground. Kids don't need a common language to play and our kid was happy enough after a visit to let us return to the museums the next day.

Lovely gardens. Very nice gardens well worth a visit and well deserving of its high position on tripadvisor? Very peaceful and well looked after and also was on the doorstep of my Hotel Lenox Montparnasse which is highly recommended.
Take a picnic. What a lovely, well kept garden. There are lots of chairs around to sit on for free. So grab a baguette and make a little picnic. Don't go in the rain.

My favorite place in Paris. No matter how many times I have already been in Paris and how many more times I will go to my favorite city in the future, Jardin de Luxembourg will always be my choice to relax from a busy travel schedule, watch Parisians, beautiful grounds, bright flower beds, and just sit and enjoy traditional French baguette for lunch.
