I love strolling around the pond looking at magnificent Palace de Luxembourg and Medici Fountain, elegant statues among lush greenery of old trees, kids playing and having fun riding a pony...No wonder why Hemingway loved this park so much! It is one of the places where you can be completely happy.

Do not step on the grass. The gardens were beautiful though i suggest you choose a sunny day and go midday as the gardens are shaded if you sit. A great place to read and people watch. Take a blanket and food to make the most of it.
Nice Place to Chill. Fabulous location, well appointed park area, plenty of free seats and loungers, reasonable priced food/snacks.

Place to relax after sightseeing. When we were in Paris, we did a lot of sightseeing and were absolutely exhausted from walking. Here we found a surprisingly calm place in the center of Paris for resting and perhaps reading books. There were many people in the park, but the place we really nice for having a rest and picnic :) DO NOT miss it when going to Paris!

Lovely with the flowers blooming. After the brutal winter I endured in Pennsylvania this winter, it was sheer heaven to wander around Luxembourg Gardens in March with the flowers in bloom. Lots of places to sit and ponder the meaning of your life.

Picturesque. We took time out from busy Paris to let our daughter run around this beautiful park right in the middle of Paris! We had a lovely time relaxing (there is plenty of seats), eating yummy ice cream and watching our daughter play. It's a lovely area with a beautiful carousel, playground and pretty ponds - very French!

A place to relax. Between one museum and another, between your shopping and your dinner you will need a place to have a sit and rest in a charmy ambient, over all if you have something to read, you must visit Louxembourg.
Lovers Lane. You MUST go to the gardens and drink wine. There is nothing better in Paris than wine at Luxembourg, and a nap.

Such peace and green in the midst of busy Paris. We made a point of going to Luxembourg Gardens several times for the peace and tranquility--even taking books to read while sitting in some of the provided chairs while the afternoon sun set. But the best time of all was walking through the park during a light spring rain--the gardens were empty and magical and so green that it refreshed all our senses.
Beautiful gardens. This would be a great place to take kids with a big playground, pony rides, and toy sailboats. Lots of pleasant walks and beautiful city pools.
Lovely for a walk in the sunshine. A lovely park with views down to the Palace de Luxembourg. This area is obviously popular with local on a weekend with families strolling and children playing.
Visited here almost everyday. Trees and flowers were just blooming and it is beautifully maintained. The residents and visitors both take advantage of this wonderful park in the city.
Gorgeous way to spend a Sunday. Beautiful garden setting, surrounded by Parisians enjoying their weekend, basking in the sun! feel good Sunday afternoon.

Peacefull, quiet and FREE in Center of Paris. We only walked through the gardens to see them. It is a tranquil oasis in the center of Paris. I wish our trip allowed simply hanging out with lunch and a bottle of wine. Plan a picnic lunch for your trip and enjoy this place for a couple of hours.

Just a Beautiful Respite. Find a seat and relax. There are folks doing Tai Chi, if you want to join. We just wanted to sit in the sun and let the city noise wash away. The grounds are beautiful and well-kept.

Lovely early morning walk. These gardens are stunning. Definitely worth visiting. Lots of seats and places for sitting to have a picnic. The gardens are popular and a lot of people go for a run, to draw etc. There is a delightful cafe with very clean toilets.lots of space for children to run around safely . i didnt want to leave !!

Uninteresting gardens. The gardens were very busy with locals - men playing chess and children playing on lots of swings and shutes. I was disappointed that there were few flowers but it is obviously a playground for the flat dwellers around it.

most beautiful Paris garden. We lived for 7 days 10 steps away from this garden.. and do i even have to say that we loved everything about it? Everyday we walk through it on our way to city center and enjoyed every minute of it!

Great Lux. What a great public space. We happened to visit many times, last time on a very hot day in May. Even though the park was packed, it still managed to be serene. There were lots of places to sit -- on the well kept lawns, which were almost completely occupied, or on the chairs distributed throughout. The combination of the beautiful Palais de Luxembourg/Senat building, gardens, trees, and people watching make this a worthwhile respite.

A beautiful place to drink wine and people watch!!. We were a little worn out of sight seeing so took a bottle of wine and macaroons to this beautiful park to relax and people watch. It was wonderful! We highly recommend!

Ooh la la. How can you not like visiting the Luxembourg Gardens and seeing the pretty array of flora. Just so tasteful and elegant. Strolling around in the garden makes me wish I had a romantic encounter.

lovely. We did big mistake, we was thing we just walking in the park. Don't try to "see" the Luxembourg Gardens. Do as the Parisians do: come here just to hang out with friends, and watch the world go by. There are specific areas for playing. Its good place for relaxing and have to lunch. Lots of Parisians are doing that. There is only a couple designated areas you can sit on the grass but lots of chairs you can borrow to sit, the chairs are free on charge.When the weather is lvley there are lots of visitors.Worth to go back.

Lovely Spot. On a short break in Paris in lovely sunshine this was a great place to include in a walk around the city. The gardens are lovely and it is a good place for getting the atmosphere of the city.

Fantastic place to enjoy the sun. It's HUGE and very PRETTY, with flowers, fountains, historic buildings and all that. Crowded on a sunny spring weekend but it is a fantastic place to sit on/by the lawn to enjoy the frickle Paris sun. Recommended to whoever that lives in Paris.

Sit and watch the Paris life go by. My favourite place in Paris to have a breather. After a day of wondering around museums or soaking up all the culture of the city, there is nowhere better in the city to just sit back and relax absolute perfection. There is just so much beauty in these gardens I wondered around getting photos of all the statues I could and the fountains also.
Lovely gardens. A lovely was to spend a few hours relaxing in the sunshine before getting the Eurostar back home. Free entry and surrounde by bars and restaurants.

Beautiful garden for a stroll. The Luxembourg gardens are a must do in Paris on the left bank, especially if you are going to visit Rodin's garden. Extensive parks and garden "rooms" plus a beautiful central "lake" make it a pleasant place for a stroll or picnic if the sun is out.

A breathing space in busy city. Well worth a wander through and a seat to just chill and watch the world go by. Some hidden statues and water features are very attractive. There is often a band playing music in the afternoon which can be enjoyed free. A very pleasant place.

Enjoy Life. Luxembourg Gardens is the Parisians backyard. You will see people savouring life and enjoying the simple pleasures (reading, sunning, conversing, studying etc.) The gardens are clean and a delight to the eye. In March the Garden had already planted flowers everywhere. There were even pony rides for the children. This is truly the way that all peoples should enjoy life.
Be with the Parisians. A great place for people watching and chilling out in a beautiful setting. Such well behaved children here!

A relaxing stroll through a beautiful park. One of the highlights of our stay in Paris. Very much worth a visit, if only for a picnic or for a meal in the cafe near the boating pond, which was quite nice.

A haven in the Latin Quarter!. We were staying nearby and were able to escape from the noise of Paris into this beautiful and well maintained garden. Plenty of places to sit and contemplate. Less crowded and much cleaner and calmer than Tuileries!

Great park with nice atmosphere to it. This is without a doubt a great park to unwind and take a break from the hectic streets of Paris.Buy some Macarons, or a Mcflurry ;-) and enjoy it in the park while soaking in the sun watching all the people walking around.Great atmosphere and a great place to chill out in.

My favourite park in Paris. I'm totally biased about thus place, my grandmother used to take here as a kid, to see the marionette show, to sail boats on the circular basin in front of the senat building......hasn't changed at all, you still get told off for walking on the grass!

Sailing Sailing. There's nothing better than sitting in the chairs arrayed around the Jardin Du Luxembourg watching your children delight in sailing classic wooden boats across the pond with long sticks for launching. My favorite memory of Paris
A great place for a sunny Sunday morning. we spent a relaxing morning strolling and watching the boats on the boating pond ,plenty of chairs to relax in the sun and watch Parisian families go by .
Most beautiful place, even in winter. Beautiful park, amazing architecture. You can tour the building with reservations only. We loved our walk in this area!
Well tended gardens providing a peaceful have in Central Paris.. Formal gardens and large toy boating lake surrounded by terraces in grounds of Palace of Luxembourg.

Great place to hang and people-watch. Don't try to "see" the Luxembourg Gardens. Do as the Parisians do: come here just to hang out with friends, and watch the world go by. There are specific areas for playing chess and bocce, and for kids to run around screaming. Stay off the grass except where specifically allowed.

french perfection. Perfect example of a French garden. Huge playground. Trees, flowers, everything in perfect lines. Don't walk on the lawn, a strange concept for an Australian. And the usual lack of toilet facilities another strange concept.

A must visit. Parisians and tourists love this place for relaxation. Surrounded by iconic sights. With chairs everywhere to sit and enjoy the sun or the shade everyone enjoyed their visit to the gardents.

A lovely place to take a break and sit in the sun. We came here as we were very lucky with the weather and wanted somewhere to relax and eat our lunch. The gardens are really lovely and well kept. There is only a couple designated areas you can sit on the grass but lots of chairs you can borrow to sit and relax around the large fountain or anywhere you like. Most locals come here to eat their lunch and also take two chairs each so they can really relax and put their feet up so don't be shy, take a second chair and soak up some sun Parisian style!
What a day to visit. We visited early March when we were having beautiful weather, the gardens were packed with people sitting out in the glorious weather. Well worth a visit
Love it…. Have a picnic, read a book, walk around, or sit and enjoy people watching! There is not a bad place to be in this slice of nature in the middle of the Parisian concrete jungle
Be a local. Go there anytime of the day to sit and read. Bring your picnic and be a local. Beautiful on any season.
Great place to have a picnic. So much fun to sit on the grass or on the chairs and have a picnic. You can bring your own wine if you are discrete. The castle is amazing. Go when the weather is nice!
5 days in Paris. Very nice to just sit enjoy the sites and people watching. You can see the Eiffel Tower from the park, Nice place to relax
Beautiful Gardens. On a nice sunny day the gardens are lovely to walk in. there is so much to take in and plenty of places to sit and just chill out.

A little piece of heaven in the city: Great for kids, too. We stay near the Jardins du Luxembourg on every visit to this amazing city. It has great paths to jog or walk on, lovely places to sit and read or enjoy nature, and now we have kids, so this is literally the best place to bring them for hours of fun: Pony rides (5.50e), puppet shows (4.80e), cars to peddle (1.50e), a carousel (1.50e), an amazing playground (2.50e) and remote control sail boats. We spend at least several days in the park on each trip.

Delightful to see the Parisians enjoy a day in the park. This is a fabulous park. So many things to do. Jogging, men playing Petanque (Bocce ball), tennis, boys riding pedal cars, remote controlled sail-boats, swing-sets, picnics

Perfect for lunch. The garden is ideal for relaxation. Personally, I did not find it that interesting, as I am not interested in gardens and nature. However, we had our lunch there and it was quite pleasant and peaceful. Sitting on the grass is not permitted, but there are chairs all around, so sitting wasn't a problem. This was a nice place to go, but not necessarily a "must see."

favorite. Going to Paris for the first time, I was fully emerged in being a tourist. I saw all the famous, big attractions and loved it. After Notre Dame and an early morning, my traveling partner and I picked up some fruit, bought a book, and relaxed at the gardens. After everything I did in this beautiful city, all the world famous attractions, the gardens are definitely at the top of my list, if not the top. I absolutely loved just relaxing after a day of walking, sitting with some local ripe fruit, a book, and a blanket and feeling at ease. It was such a relaxing activity compared to all the excitement of the rest of the trip. It also seemed that many locals were there with friends, on their blankets, playing games or with their kids, too. It is crowded and may be hard to find a place to lay, but, once you do, the people watching and relaxation is beautiful!

A beautiful park to walk through or take a break in.. My husband and I took a walk through the park the first evening we arrived in Paris as it was near our hotel. It's a lovely, relaxing walk with plenty of benches to sit and take a rest. We also popped out of the park to buy sweets at Dalloyau next to the park. In the north-east corner sits the Medici Fountain which is also beautiful to see and take photos of. It's a great place to rest between sight seeing or for a romantic walk.

Great Park, but..... This is a beautiful park with lots of shady walks and interesting things to see - the replica statue of liberty is a 'must'. But - the park 'police' will not let you sit on the grass! They are polite but firm and we couldn't see why people weren't able to enjoy the cool shade sitting on the grass under the trees.

Definitely a must do. The park is not big compared to hyde park or central park in NYC. But I would say this is the best park I have been to. The park has everything, a small pond where you can play with your little boat, chairs where you can just chill, and of course the trees and flowers. I sat at the chair around the pond and chill, and that is what I miss the most when I was in Paris. (Not even macarons haha!)

Tired after visiting the museums and walking / biking several hours arround the city?. You might not be aware how close you are from a really relaxing park, usualy less crowded than Touilleries, less crowded with turists anyway, with several locals, especially students from the universities in the vicinity, reading, chating, or just enjoy taking a deep breath in this calm atmosphere.

Lots to see. Very pretty and popular park - with two outdoor cafés (with inside space too but not so much fun) for meals or snacks in the sun. Lovely walks with views across the park, children's play area and pony rides, a pond sailing model boats, people exercising or just sitting and relaxing.

home of the France senate. This nice parc is the home of the France Senate. It's nice to take a little stroll around, the entrance is (obviously) free and it's very welcoming. I found it a nice place to walk around for about an hour or so (it's not that big)

We love it in winter. Even during cold weather The Luxembourg Gardens are fabulous. Grab a warm wine from one of the vendors and enjoy the beauty.During spring and summer it is even more beautiful and jam packed with spectators.

Absolute must in Paris.. A true slice of Parisian life. Great people watching, street food, and a beautiful setting. Unfortunately we only allotted ourselves an hour to enjoy this gem, and I wish we'd had half a day. Perfect for really soaking up Paris.
Go on a weekend. People who live in Paris take their kids to this garden on the weekend. It's crowded, but a nice place to walk around and see kids playing and people enjoying the outdoors.

Very pleasant. This was on our to do list so we literally did a hop off the bus at this stop. Although the garden was very bare in its winter garb it was still lovely and we (my adult daughter and I) really enjoyed the statues of queens and important females in French history. Even more entertaining was watching the Japanese tourists 'pose'. We couldn't resist copying their poses :-)
People Watching!. I really enjoyed walking through the Gardens and than sitting for a bit and people watching. Lots to take in!

Take a stroll through the Gardens. Our first day in Paris we arrived late morning. Within walking distance of our hotel (Hotel Le Six), we set out on a gray, damp afternoon. I can only imagine what this place looks like in spring. I do agree it would be nice to see the inside of the Palace. This was a nice way to unwind from a 10hr flight. Do visit the tearoom Angelina, this is a high class place that may be a price shock at first, then you realize the quality of service and food. Do indulge in some Macaroons. Don't worry if you miss this one, there are several other locations one can experience Angelina. Overall, one can get away from the busy streets and enjoy nature in the gardens.

Even Worth a Visit in the Winter. I walked through the gardens en route to the Pantheon. Being the dead of winter I wasn't expecting much, but I found a great amount of beauty left in the sleeping garden. I'm sure it is spectacular in the springtime.

Great for families. Across the street from the Luxembourg Metro station, this park was a big hit with our kids. In particular, they have a mega-sized playground that you have to pay to enter (about 1.5 Euros per person) the positive of which is that you feel relatively comfortable within its confines and there is a plethora of activities for the kids to choose from. We've visited Paris a handful of times and always come away with a greater admiration for the city.

One of the "lungs" of Paris. Originally founded by the Medicis in the 17th Cent., these gardens are now adjacent to the home of the French Senate, the Palais Luxembourg, separated from the gardens by a large pool. Situated in the Latin Quarter,they are the 2nd largest in Paris, and contain many points of interest. The surface is largely composed of lawns and gravel divided up by intersecting paths, along which almost 100 statues and busts are placed. They are devoted to French luminaries from the World of the Arts, notably the poets Baudelaire and Verlaine, the painters Delacroix and Watteau, the composer Massenet and, the writers Georges Sand and Flaubert. Napoleon’s great military companion ---- Marshall Ney----- also has a spot. The only foreigner of note is Ludwig van Bethoven, the subject of a dramatic statue by Bourdelle, but Bartholdi’s first model for the Statue of Liberty adds a recognizably foreign note. Not to be missed, and built at one end of a long ribbon of water is the Medici Fountain, constructed by the wife of Henry lV, behind which is the Fountain of Leda that once stood in a Paris street scheduled for demolition. At the South end is the Fountain of the Observatory, the work of the prolific sculptor Carpeaux. The Garden is not notable for shrubs and flowers; the only truly formal section is that of the Petit-Palais Luxembourg. Its main purpose is as a place with liberal seating where tired Parisians can park themselves, read their newspapers, gossip with their friends, and breath in a better quality of air than they will find in the rest of the city.
Beautiful gardens!!. Ohh right close by to the entry of Luxemnourg Museum is a peaceful fancy tearoom! Angelina... loved having our mid day tea with pastry, signature dessert and ohh well wine! ;)

Beautiful. The gardens were great and very active. It is close to the Sorbonne which is nice to see. Another place to see that is really worth it is the Hotel des Invalides/Musee' de l'Armee which has Bonaparte's body and those of leaders. The Musee de L'Armee was very interesting.

Great gardens, great fountain. This is a lovely spot to find a spot to sit and take in the view. There are nice statues of historical figures. The only downfall is you can't actually tour the palace in the gardens, so you only go for the gardens.

go to the luxembourg gardens. if you are in paris on a sunday afternoon, go to the gardens and relax while watching all the people. you will feel like a real parisian. take a book, bring a picnic and just sit! it's free and you will be among families, kissing couples, old folks strolling arm in arm and just regular parisians. there is nothing quiet like it...especially during the golden hour near sunset when the fountains and flowers glow in the late afternoon sun. enjoy!!!!

Nice if you're in the area or love this sort of attraction. We spent a nice hour here one sunny winter afternoon on the many chairs that are scattered around. It's a nice tranquil spot that would probably appeal more to people who specifically like gardens of this kind. We enjoyed it but wouldn't necessarily have made a special trip. The café is very very overpriced!

Beautiful Garden. Went to Paris alone during the summer, around late June. The weather is sunny and calm and the garden was simply huge and amazing. Flowers bloom and the place is well maintained. Bought a cup of coffee and sat near the Fontaine Médicis. Luxembourg Garden is worth calling the "World Most Beautiful Garden".
Amazing Place. Very beautiful garden, it's a must see in Paris. It's close to Notre Dame Cathedral, so you can have an amazing walk till it.

Luxembourg Gardens. A carefully coiffured park in the centre of Paris. Lots of statues and fountains to enjoy. We only walked through so I'm sure there is more to see. A hidden gem is a statue in the north-east corner.

Relaxing place.. Try to relax and have a snack in the Luxemburg Garden after a long tour in the Paris. Sit in the iron seats in the Garden , look the big trees, the green gardens. Walk in the Garden and you 'll see people playing games in the Garden, or relaxing. You must visit it!

Luxurious garden. Paris, the city of love. I have always dreamed of roaming around the city of fashion, culture and a whole lot more. Of course I really had to have my picture taken with the famous Eiffel Tower. I didn’t waste a minute more in moping around in our hotel room. I really wanted to explore some more until we got to the Luxembourg gardens. It used to be the garden for only the royals, now, the public can feel being royal too. This place is the perfect destination when you want to relax and enjoy the view. The afternoon when we visited was less crowded, opposite to what we were told that there would be a lot of tourists and people. I would gladly recommend anyone who’s in Paris to get around the venue and relax.
The Gardens of Luxembourg. The gardens in a sunny day and spring is a very unique place to be, wonderful to walk through in the morning or afternoon

Stroll the grounds, feel the history..... This park is so utterly Parisian, and although you'll find plenty of tourist unfurling maps and snapping selfies, that doesn't mean the natives have given it over just yet. go see the old gentlemen playing boules for instance, or the young parents keeping their kids entertained on all the play area climbing frames, or look perhaps a little enviously at all the young Parisian lovers dotted around the rows of benches, lost in their partners gaze; Here you will see life being lived in a seductively stylish and wonderfully French way.Might be an idea to read up on the history of the place too before you go, so many important historic events have had their roots here, not to mention all the books and films that feature it too.PAris can be hectic, brash and not a little frustrating (especially if you are used to more attentive levels of service and politeness!) but here in the gardens you slow right down, breath deep, and let life drift quietly by.....
relaxing. very good place for a strolla billboard with its information would be beneficialvery clean and well kept

Time Machine. These Gardens are like taking a trip back in time. Children are laughing and eating ice cream, men are enjoying games of Bocce ball, dozens are playing chess, and others are simply sitting and reading. An orchestra played in a charming gazebo beneath the trees. Most evident was the total absence of people taking on cell phones or using iPads. How refreshing! A wonderful stroll on a sunny Paris afternoon.
Nice park. Nice place to relax or take walks, There is a pond in the middle with ducks and the Castle of Luxemburg close to it.

Nice place to hide away from the hustle and bustle. I still am not keen on the French version of how a garden/park should look, but the whole object of their parks are there to be places for families and friends to meet and spend the day. So there is plenty of seating and wide open spaces.There are some fantastic statues to study, the Palais is beautiful, plus you have the Pantheon nearby to go and explore.
Peaceful. Peaceful gardens in the middle of the city! A welcome break before or after visiting the Pantheon and Saint-Germain des Prés.

peaceful place in the heart of Paris. luxembourg gardens is a public space open to all, you can come here for jogging, bring your kids out to play or just to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There is a beautiful fountain in the park and it is nice to spend time in this place frequented by locals.

What a nice park !. Big spacious park in the heart of Paris many trees fountains playgrounds and a really good place to relax especially in a non rainy day in Paris!Open until 17.30 pm on winter period!

Excellent to take a break. One of the most beautiful parks in Paris! You can sit in the sun, take a little nap, walk around or feed the ducks in the big pond.
It's such a nice park, I love it!
Do not miss this. Do not miss this! Absolutely charming - easy to get to from the Metro, sit down and have a cafe lait and crepe and watch the day go by
a quiet space in a vibrant city. We came across this area by accident as we moved from the Pantheon to the catacombs. It was an area of tranquillity and peace.

Wonderful!. What a beautiful spot to rest, reflect and people watch! Fabulous gardens! We spent an afternoon walking and sitting. These gardens are huge and well attended by the Parisians. It is a favorite spot for everyone. The gardens are beautifully tended with every manner of flower and foliage. An important and famous part of our Paris visits!
A Perfect Place. It is a wonderful historical garden with a big and beautiful Palace. It's a good place to visit in any weather.

A nice spot to hang out. A grand old building (that's actually the Senate) looking out on a magnificent garden and grounds. You'll probably feel less crowded walking around the grand space that is Luxembourg Gardens. We tubed here and then up to the Pantheon, before walking down to the island for a meal.

Beautiful. Amazing that somewhere this relaxed is in the middle of Paris! The gardens are beautiful with the fountains, flowers and trees just adding something extra as you walk along. I'd recommend sitting on one of the many seats and just looking around to take it all in!

Definitely a great experience, even in cold weather. I have been here in the summer and in the winter, and definitely prefer the summer BUT I was surprised to find that eve in the winter it is a bustling place and worth a walk through. You might not linger as long in the winter (the great chairs are, however, still out for the public's use), but you will most likely find it a refreshing break from the activity surrounding the park.

Beautiful Spot. This garden is a great way to spend an hour or 2 on a nice day just relaxing, the L'Open bus for the catacombs stops here so you could do both in 1 day, I wouldn't walk to the catacombs from the garden as its a bit far!
Sunday walk. These gardens are beautiful. Great to people watch on a sunny Sunday. Lots of people sailing their model boats.

Perfect for chilly sunday walks. Or picnics!. This huge park reminded me of London's green areas, it was huge, completely tide and clean. It felt like everything was at the right place and so many people were laying on their blankets enjoying the summer weather. Very beautiful. Definitely worth a visit.

The place to be on a sunny afternoon.. What a delight to stroll through this superbly maintained and presented paradise of flowers and statues. The other amenities (children's playground, petanque and tennis courts and sailboat lake) make ideal for families as well. One of the best free attractions in the world!

Great place to relax. I'd start off with saying this place should be on everyone's list of 'must dos' while in Paris. After walking around quite a bit in Paris, it's the best place to just unwind and relax. We were here on a sunny day and the park had lots of people having fun. There are lots of shops and eateries nearby so one could even get a takeout and picnic here while just looking around and enjoying the park.

Rest in green. Great green garden in the central part of Paris. We have visited the place during the warn sunny day, we have enjoyed a cup of coffee and les crepes under the trees. We can only recommend this place, do not forget to visit is!

Beautiful and majestic park in the city. On a nice summer day, there will be plenty of people sitting under the sun or strolling or having a picnic on the lawn. It is a large and nice garden conveniently situated next to RER B station Luxembourg station. There are plenty of families and kids activities in the park like pony rides and mini playground. The beautiful French garden centered by a nice pond of ducks and mini sailing boats in the centre with a background of the castle. Great day for a family or friend outing doing nothing just waiting for your day to pass by. It is also a stone's throw from Boulevard St Michel with many eateries, shops and cafes.

A must to visit. Les jardins are only a short metro ride away from most places in Paris. I would recommend that you take a day to explore these wonderful french gardens and iconic buildings. Take lunch, sit in the sun and relax.
Beautiful. Even in a rainy day it's beautiful. If you're in Paris you must visit. And if you have time, you can spend the day there, just enjoying, reading...

enjoy Paris in a Park. Luxembourg gardens is a delightful place for a walk. Enjoy the place, have a picnic linch, sit on the benches, have a cafe or drink in the cade of the park. See at your relaxing or down time as a rest from the museums.

The girls loved the playground. On a nice day in January, we went to visit the gardens. I enjoyed the stroll and looking around at the nice sculptures and such, though it probably looks better in summer. The girls loved the playground (note you need to pay to enter - 2.50 per child and 1 euro and something per adult -the baby, who was a few months old at the time, did not have to pay. There is also an attended pay toilet next to the playground - 50 cents per visit) - especially the omega. Overall recommended, especially with kids.

Chill out & feed some birds. Great spot for a break from people and shopping. Lots of locals do their jogging here.My favourite is actually just watching the very fat/big sea gulls being pushed off by the smaller pigeons near the fountain. (Quite weird, would think that it should be the other way around lol) They are funny to watch, especially moments after you thrown some bread.*take some crumbs with you for bird feeding, there are no vendors here*

It is a Museum too. Enjoy sitting on one of the most famous chairs in the world. Watching kids playing with the their "sailing boats" on the pond, watching people walking by, relaxing while eating great ice cream you bought at the entrance - it's a real pleasure. Visit Rubens' painting in the palais du Luxembourg - it's amasing.
My favorite garden in Paris. One of the most beautiful gardens of its kind, especially in the summer. Beautiful and relaxing--right in the middle of a very busy neighbourhood.

Pleasant and interesting. A good place to walk and sit in the sun, even in December. Lots going on from guys playing timed chess games to sailboats in the pond. We saw many couples and families enjoying the day. Mostly it's a good place to walk, relax, and talk. It looked good in the winter, so it must really be gorgeous in the summer.

Beautiful even in winter. The gardens surround the interesting palace and even in winter were a delight to visit. The statues of queens regally dominate the upper level looking down onto a large pool and other statues. It was fun exploring.

Did Not Understand the Hype!. Must be because we visited in mid-Dec, but this was a rather huge disappointment after London's Kensington and St James Parks. Nice gardens, well kept etc, but we saw nothing to warrant the hype, especially in winter - must be different in summer! Be very careful with the birds though - drop a crumb and they would be all over it. Makes sense to visit together with the Pantheon.

Stunning Gardens. Myself and my boyfriend travelled here in November 2013. Even though it was out of season the gardens are still really well kept. Clear of rubbish and litter. The grass was lush green, with impressive sculptures. Lots of seating area. Only downside is limited opening times so check when you want to visit.

great oasis in middle of paris. this is a beautiful garden and has kids playgraounds .. it is a few minutes from the pantheon and has a lot of great restaurants and cafe near..cant wait to go again.. I was tehr on teh fall so I can imagien how gorgeosu will be on the spring

Gorgeous place to relax. We happened upon Luxembourg Gardens while wandering around Paris, and we're so glad we did! On a very hot summer day, this was an oasis. We grabbed a baguette at the snack stand and found seats under the shady chestnut trees. From there, we just ate our lunch, relaxed, and watched the world go by around us. The park area is quiet, peaceful and calming...perfect for a picnic lunch and a good book. We also loved the fountains, gardens, statues and corridors of trees surrounding the perimeter. Our experience at Luxembourg Gardens is one of my fondest memories of Paris...it was a perfect place to stop and just BE.
Like an Impressionist Painting!. Just gorgeous to roam around, sail boats and explore .. a fabulous playground for the children, pony rides, or watch the older men play boules. Heavenly.
A Parisienne institution. Just take your time and wander. Grab a seat and read a book. It's a beautiful, peaceful place. Just enjoy.

A garden for every one in Paris. A nice open place ideal for strolling, jogging, people watching, leisure reading.. Whenever time was permitted during my stay in Paris, I would love to spend an afternoon or morning here, doing nothing but relaxed and enjoyed myself.There were always kids playing with their parents and running around the pond/pool area. You heard laugh and happy screams from families. Sometimes there were concerts and performances for visitors... The Medici Fountain and the great sculptural group with the giant Polyphemus were old but timeless, a fascinating piece of art with stories and history behind. What else, you won’t miss the magnificent Palais du Luxembourg that houses the French Senate..This was a well design, well used/shared garden for the public in Paris.It was worth to spend time to drop by, enjoyed the openness of this huge green space, the garden, the landscape, the view, the fountain with great sculptures.. Best time to visit : May-June. Dec.-Feb. may be chilly and too windy.A little more for sharing...My favorite itinerary when I have half day free time to spend in this neighborhood :1. Take the Metro and get off from Odeon, visit Luxembourg gardens in early afternoon.2. Have afternoon tea at Dalloyau, indulge myself with a piece of their signature cake..(Dalloyau was just across the road of the park.)3. After tea/coffee time, walk to the Pantheon direction and spend another 1-2 hours strolling along the scenic narrow streets and small courtyards..4. Find a restaurant and enjoy my dinner at Quarter Latin..
beautiful garden. stunning place very large garden, its the second largest public park in Paris.walking peacefully surrounded by all these green areas is one of the best things in Paris.
Beautiful. A beautiful garden which glistens with life on a summer day and is a stunning place to sit on the grass and watch the world go by, I could spend all day here and never become bored!
Beautifu as always.. This is always a fun place to go and watch the people. We always see something unusual. This time it was a lime green parrot flying around!

Medici Fountain a must. During the summer months, Parisians escape the summer heat by taking their lunch to the Luxembourg Gardens and sitting in the metal chairs that surround this little fountain. In January, there are almost no other people there but the fountain is still running and even more lovely. It is only a short walk from the Luxembourg Palace, on the east side. Take a moment to savor the beauty of this fountain and garden in the middle of Paris.
Very nice gardens to visit when nearby. It is a nice park with a small lake and beautiful hall now used as a Senate building. Ideal for a sit after busy trips or eating a picnic.
Beautiful. Despite visiting in late autumn, we thought the gardens were gorgeous. Very tranquil and relaxing. Would love to visit in spring.

The highlight of my Paris vacation !. On my birthday, I visited Le Jardin du Luxembourg with my wife and two teenagers.It was the perfect place for a Summer afternoon stroll. The garden is gorgeous, in addition to the ornate plants and flowers, you will find a pretty fountain, beutiful architecture and sculptures.There is also an area with tennis courts and outdoor cafes. We walked on most of the paths, we took great pictures, we had ice cream and sat in a shady area.Very simple afternoon, full of joy, beauty and affection. Just perfect!

Will be prettier in Spring. After a sun-shower, I strolled through part of this garden. There is a pretty pool and some statues in the garden. However being Winter, the flowers were sparse and it was too cool to sit outside. It is a nice place to visit on a sunny day.
Even in the mid of winter. Those are nice gardens to walk by even in the midst of winter. We were lucky it was not raining and not too cold and the gardens were fairly crowded.

A beautiful respite in busy Paris. I used this garden to jog around each morning and I enjoyed the universal camaraderie that goes with those of us mad enough to exercise when we could be eating croissants. The exhibition in L'Orangerie was of the work of Chagall and it was extremely good.
A beautiful park to walk around or to picnic in.

Amazing. The place is adorable, i enjoyed walking around- you would see tourists and locals relaxing on the many chairs scattered around, a cafe is also available. the place is simply amazing especially if you are on a family vacation kids will love it, the many statues are also nice you would want to have a look at them and take some photos; visit when its sunny
Beautiful in Autumn. The perfect location for a stroll on a brisk Autumn morning. A great place to go for a little picnic or just to relax and read a good book by the lake.
Awesome. This is absolutely one of my favorite places in Paris. The gardens are gorgeous and I could have spent the entire afternoon just wandering through them. This is definitely a must see.

My favorite place in Paris!. I love this place! A magnificent old, yet still glamorous building borders 1 side of this wonderful outdoor area. During the spring and summer months, you can often hear a band or 2 playing in the bandstand whilst you sip your coffee from the cafes located inside the garden and getting some lovely sunshine. Or if tennis is your thing, have a lesson and play a game on the courts. Overall, even in winter, this still remains my favourite place in Paris!

Gardens. I enjoy walking around in nature as much as the next person, and these famous gardens were by no means disappointing, but by this time in the trip we had done a lot of garden strolling and I was a bit underwhelmed. It was gorgeous and it seemed to be a popular spot for tourists and locals alike to recline and take in the afternoon, but when it came down to it it was a garden. Some greenery to glance at, say "ah how nice" and sit on the grass. I would recommend visiting to anyone who wants to relax for a while or spend a little quite time mulling over the tile of your novel, but if you are looking for excitement and fanfare this is not the place. If you are on a limited schedule I would say put this on your list of things to see, but maybe toward the end where you keep the things you might not get to.

Wonderful place to walk and stroll, Amazing children's playground. This is a wonderful place to stroll. The children playground was amazing. There is also a Angelina cafe attached near the museum now. Pop in for a hot chocolate.

Peaceful and Beautiful Historic Place. This is one of those places to escape the crowds (if your are lucky). Even the locals visit this wonderful gardens to relax, and to breath clean air. You can even bring a sandwich or something to have a picnic, and enjoy the magnificence view from one of its many fountains. A real jewel.
Beautiful. It is really is a beautiful place. Very busy with tourists, but you can see why. It is quite nice. Beautiful, great to wander and get lost.

Even in Winter, Very Nice. Even though nothing was in bloom, a walk through the Gardens was still very nice on a beautiful day. There is a lot to do around the Gardens from food to museums to other entertainment. I would recommend just taking a stroll through the Gardens after you visit The Louvre.

Nice place for a picnic. Definitely a haunt for the youth of Paris. Lovely quiet park, perfect for a picnic or a rest stop. There are some lovely patisseries nearby for you to pick up a snack. The seagulls are very territorial, they seem to pick and choose humans to watch and guard. Witnessed a funny situation where three girls let a flock of seagulls get the better of them - dropped their belongings and their big box of hot chips and ran. Pro tip: If you are scared of birds, don't eat hot food here.

Nice place. Really nice and relaxing place. However, we were there in the heart of the season so there were way too many people around for us to enjoy the gardens fully. We couldn't even find a place to sit down. That's really unfortunate because the place itself is amazing!
Drab in winter. We stumbled upon these gardens on accident. I would love to go back during the spring/summer...it is probably a lot nicer to look at.
Full of peace. Our Hotel was next to Luxembourg gardens. The place is full of peace. You can see people riding bikes at the park.
Beautiful. This garden is so beautiful and relaxing. Even though the weather wasn't the best it was still a lovely place to visit

If only this could be captured in a bottle. This is the place to sit and people watch and be ensconced by the beautiful gardens. the care of the gardens is exquisite. People sit, rest, have a picnic lunch or bring their children to run and play: quintessential Paris.

A pleasant and interesting place to stroll in.. Nothing at all to dislike. Plenty of variety to view. Excellent children's playground and cafeteria. No doubt a great place to be at in the summer, when it's all going on, on the bandstand etc.

Relaxing and beautiful place. Walk around the gardens then get a sorbet, grab a public green chair In summertime and relax while watching the wonderful plants and flower in front of the palace. If you are crazy about getting some tanning, do like the parisians: lay down on the grass and let the sun toast you. Actually this is what I would dislike in this place if I had done it... However, watching those desperate white bodies stuck to the grass was almost a surrealistic open air installation which worth to check!!
Relax!. It's a beautiful parc, spacious with lots of chairs around the pond so you can sit back and relax. Must be really great in spring / summertime!

Not in winter. Visiting in winter is not the ideal time to visit where it seemed to lack atmosphere, vibrancy and colour. I can imagine that in summer with the gardens in full bloom and the crowds out and about this would be far more interesting than when I visited. It is nice for a stroll, although it's smaller than expected but it does have an authentic feel with locals using it. Unless I was already in the area I wouldn't regard this as a must see in winter.
beautiful gardens. The gardens are a lot of beauty to ride and photos with the statues and flowers. Operates a museum with ticket.
Beautiful park in Paris. nice and very big garden park. it's very good for Picnic.Quite haven in a busy Paris - good place to go to sit down in the sun or shade and relax
Amazing sight. This is an outstanding garden right there in the city. Huge area with a lot of open spaces with fountains and trees and benches...In a garden, you cannot ask for more...

Good For Eating Baguettes in the Rain. This garden is lovely, even in the rain, even in the cold. I would love to go back in the spring or summer when everything is actually in bloom but get a baguette and cheese and sit in the garden and take it all in!

#1 in Paris, so beautiful.. If you've got more than a week to spend in Paris, this park is a must-see - I lived in Paris for 3 months and couldn't get enough of the place. Ride a bike there, or get off the train at Odean, grab a panini nearby and walk to the park for a picnic lunch. Most beautiful in Autumn or Spring, you can't help but feel happy walking around and watching the children push the little sale boats around the pond. The park is so large that it's easy to find a secluded spot - not an easy feat in Paris! It's a little further out than Tuleries (which is also great) but well worth the trip if you love getting away from the hustle and want to take a break with a book.

Beautiful park in Paris. Relaxed atmosphere but be careful with joggers! Ideal place to read book or have a picnic to rest after sightseeing. Near Notre Dame and Latin Quarter and lots of good restaurants nearby.
The place to stroll and have a picnic. If you want to have a picnic in paris, this is the place to go. Surrounded by beautiful gardens and with surprisingly comfortable garden chairs.

Sunday in the garden. While visiting Paris I did a walking tour which included the Luxembourg Gardens. I find it amazing that so many Parisian parents spent the day taking their children to the park, and not only watching them, but also playing with them in the park. Walking through the park was amazing and it was quite beautiful. And it was even more beautiful to see so many parents playing with their children.

Everything but the theatre. I know this garden for a very long time. Actually, I used to live nearby.This year I was visiting Paris with my little kids, we decided to go to the garden.It is one of the very nice quiet area in the city and the playground (not free..) is very good.We decided to go to the Theatre de Marionnette. The show was awful (Patachon), really ugly colours, all recorded,...Well, the kids enjoyed it, so I guess it is not too bad. If you plan for this, make sure you attend a real marionnette show.
Beautiful. Great during summer months and a nice walk during the winter. The palace is a wonderful photo opportunity.
Give it a miss in winter. If you absolutely need a jog, fine. If you are looking for a beautiful place to relax, this is not it. Go to the place des Vosges

Relaxing on a Sunny Day. Quite haven in a busy Paris - good place to go to sit down in the sun or shade and relax. Not a great deal to see but it links a number of neighbourhoods that are interesting to explore.
Beautiful Gardens. Our visit in December was not the greatest time to visit the gardens but the Luxembourg Gardens were still lovely to walk through and certainly worth it on our sunny day there.

A lovely place. I love the Luxembourg gardens! Unlike most public gardens in cities, this is truly a well kept and safe area for lots of fun! There are so many activities to do and it's great to see the local community take advantage. Groups play ping pong, tennis, basketball, and football (soccer). We also saw several pilates, yoga, karate, and fitness classes going on. The area feels very safe and clean and there are so many options for children, adults, and elders. The big fountain pond is kind of the center of the gardens. Parents lay out in the sun in chairs while their children play with sail boats in the fountain. There are a few food options and public bathrooms. It's not usually over-crowed. In my opinion this is one of the best places to visit in Paris!
Excellent!. Lovely gardens with lots of Parisians AND tourists using together. Great Paris feel. We're able to relax on seating in park and enjoy a bite to eat in an open air cafe. Wonderful!
Nothing Special. It seems like the nicest Park in central Paris, but it was nothing compared to what is here in London, and I imagine most cities across Europe

Beautiful Gardens!. Even in the winter time (Dec 2013), this was a wonderful stop on our trip. There were lots of benches and seats to just sit and enjoy the view. You can even catch a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower. Definitely a great place for an afternoon picnic or snack after walking on the streets of Paris all day!

Lovely break from city. A sunny winter day was perfect for a walk through these gardens. It was pleasantly busy with visitors, but a break from the push of other attractions. Great for young children, with play areas and a theater with a live marionnette show. Many sculptures and benches for enjoying the peace and quiet. If you can't make it to Versailles, visit here and imagine this palace and gardens times ten!
Fun. Very beautiful for a stroll around. We came in the winter so the trees were not green but it was still lovely. It is not a must see but if you have the time i would check it out

Great park, too bad it is winter. The park is great and inviting to slow down from the Paris crazyness.
Too bad, it is winter, as we could not seat there too long (it was cold!) but great place for people watching.

one of my favourites. I used to dream about hv a good book and read it in the garden, so I made it and was perfect. this is one of my favourite place in the world. sit on the grass, zipping a good red wine, just enjoying the moment of beauty.take your pic mic basket and let yourself feel the ambience from another time

Don't go in the winter months.. I'm sure the gardens are beautiful in the spring and summer. Not so much in the winter. It was still nice to stroll around and see the palace, statues, etc. But definitely not a must-see if you're visiting Paris in the winter.

a surprise and a delight. a vast and impressive garden in the crowded streets of St Germain. We chanced upon this glorious space and spent some time walking around the vast and open gardens. Ponds and water features, puppet shows, childrens playgroups amongst the backdrop of what was once a palace.
The kiosk with clafouti provided a welcome sit down. Lovely flower beds and ponds. Plenty of seats! More maps of the gardens would have been appreciated.

A favorite "find" in Paris. We happened upon the Luxembourg Gardens on our first trip to Paris. This trip, it was on our "definite to do" list. It is a wonderful place to simple "be" and enjoy. The grounds are beautiful, and many things are available to entertain the children (pony rides, puppet shows, slides, swings, and remote-controlled boats). I believe there are over 100 statues, fountains, and monuments. We enjoy seeing the adults sitting around the pool visiting, reading, and relaxing. In a busy city, a quiet place to rest and reflect is very refreshing.

Very good for families with kids must go to. Many things for kids to play in closes at 4 pm Nice place for kids, the play ground is perfect must go if you have kids many things to play with pony rides and more
Very nice, especially in warm weather.. The Luxembourg Gardens are very attractive, and very well maintained. They are an oasis of tranquillity inside of a very large city.

Glorious gardens. I loved this place after my recent visit to Paris. After hours of walking the city's busy streets the gardens were a chance to relax by sitting in the glorious surroundings. The gardens were in full bloom with rich colours from the many flowers. There was children playing, people eating picnics and couples walking hand in hand. All this with the wonderful Luxembourg palace in the grounds to gaze at, this really is a must visit on a trip to Paris.

Escape within the city. An extensive serene park located near the latin quarter of Paris. An ideal escape from the hustle bustle of the city any day of the week. Manicured gardens and classic architecture await you in this idyllic setting. Leisurely stroll in the garden or have a seat and contemplate whatever is on your mind. Maybe even read a book while soaking up some sunshine on a clear day. An afternoon in this park should be a prescription for high blood pressure because it makes you feel as though all life's pressures have been taken away.

Great garden. This is a very impressive formal garden even in the winter time. Loved the layout and the surroundimg architecture but most of all watching the Parisians enjoying the fresh winter outdoors (including jogging in shorts and tshirt in 5 degrees!). Also saw young french couples stealing a kiss on a quiet park bench - oh Paris - the city of love!

Nice place to relax. It is a little far, but is a nice spot to relax a little bit after a full day of activities in Paris. On rainy and cloudy days it looks just dirty. On summer might be full but anyway good idea to visit it if you are around. If not, well you can just skip it because there are way more things and places to see in Paris that this park.

Beautiful, but don't ride a bike. This garden was beautiful and large, a nice place to go visit centrally located in Paris. We read a review below saying they rented bikes and rode around the park so we did the same. We got there quickly from our St. Germain location and entered the park. It was crowded with people and we noticed no one else was on a bike. When in a less crowded place a runner spit on my husband's bike- no lie. A couple minutes later we were spotted by the police and told no bikes allowed. We left the park and ditched the bikes. Came back in on foot and enjoyed the park that way. Good free activity, lots of people watching, just do NOT ride a bike or you may get spit on for breaking the rules. ;)
Chilly-romantic autumn walk!. This park is beautiful even on a cold autumn day. The leaves on the path and the colours of trees and bushes make the Luxembourg Gardens a must-seen place.

Great spring Sunday afternoon. Lovely atmosphere on a Sunday afternoon watching Parisians enjoy the park. Nice cafe with hot chocolates , people playing basketball, football, chilling out and people watching. Very chilled

Simply beautiful!. What a beautiful space located between St. Germain des Pres and the Latin Quarter. Sit in one of the chairs or better yet one of the chaise lounges and enjoy! This is a relaxing, serene place to just breathe outdoors. People are in the serious business of relaxing with a book, something to eat and drink. There is no walking on the grass here. I found a perfect seat at the head of the Fountain Medicis. What a beautiful view! Take some time and just breathe.
gorgeous. gorgeous gardens. We managed to go visit on a whim and find the sun reward us with warmth and kindness. we ended up walking about for most of the afternoon.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful part of the city. I came with a friend and we just relaxed here for a while in the hot sun.

Relax with classical music concerts during summer. If you visit Paris during summer, you can't miss the free classical music concerts in Luxembourg Gardens. Concerts are held every summer weekends in the morning and afternoon. Take a sandwich and something to drink with you, sit in one of the hundreds of chaise longues of the garden and relax...

Roaming Around. After walking the "entire" city, this was the place to just sit and savor the gardens and the ambiance of the park. Soft and quiet . It was like walking into a bubble.
August is the month when all of Europe goes on holiday. I'm glad they left this for me. (us)
beautiful Jardin. We were there in August. It is a beautiful garden with various flowers and plants. I also recommend this to the family with small children.
Great flower beds. Parisians know how to plant flowers. The color themes are bold and yet in real nice layering. Just eye candies. Don't miss them!
Beautiful!. I came during a cold time, but the grandness is worth the visit. On nice weather days, pack a lunch and enjoy the people watching!
Lovely. I had been to this place plenty of time, when ever I got I seem like new place to me, I will recommend this garden in paris

A must see part of Paris. We have been to Paris a number of times but have never visited these well known gardens so decided to do it this trip. I am so glad that we did as the gardens are lovely - with many different areas but with a coherent overall design. It is a restful place where you can spend many hours enjoying the plants and the fact that lots of the plantings are not at all formal but blend in perfectly with the formal areas. Well worth a visit !

Unforgettable trip. Our whole Paris experience was fantastic, there is just so much to see in this beautiful city that we will have to return a third time as we have only touched the surface. Next time we would like to rent a self contained apartment

Relaxing, Romantic!. We left the walk / stroll in the Luxembourg Gardens for last Day in Paris.We took the metro from our hotel and arrived just besides an entrance.It was a very cold day, fountain was partially frozen and grass was with a thin layer of ice.But even the cold weather didn't hamper us as we walked around the gardens, enjoyed the fountains, were marveled at the statues and suddelny the day was winding down!This is another of the must visit places when in Paris!

Open air and beautiful. Stay a while, walking around, not for a long time (it was 0º C ) The lake was frozen with birds and ducks ice-skating. The palace (where is located the Senat) it is magnificent. All the gardens very well keeped. Lots of chairs around the lake and fountain, which in hot weather would be so pleasant. Recomend to spend some time peacefully.

Beautiful, even in winter!. I've only ever visited Paris in the winter, but both times we have gone to the Luxembourg Gardens. Even in the winter they are lovely, especially on a sunny day. There's chairs everywhere for you to sit down and have a bite to eat like a picnic, the ponds and fountains are lovely and the atmosphere is always nice and quiet (I don't know whether this is because it's winter or not...). It reminds me very much of Buckingham Palace for some reason, the building itself obviously just smaller but the gardens are well worth a visit to have a walk around.
Great walk in the morning. The gardens are well maintained and provide a beautiful, quiet oasis in what can be a busy city. lots of places to sit down and watch the world go by.
1st Time. Beautiful gardens even in winter. Not unlike a mini Versaille. I would expect it to be busy in summer but there is plenty of room.

Have a picnic. We sat in the garden with our delicious lunch which we purchased at Le Grande Epicerie de Paris. Gardens are large with varied possible activities, lots of interesting statues and a wonderful place for a picnic and a stroll. Quiet place to escape the wonder of Paris.

Beautiful french gardens with a former queen's palace on top. I know it was not the right season to discover the gardens of Paris as winter has destroyed all the flowers. But still, I've soaked up the so parisian atmosphere while eating my croissant on a bench. Freezing cold but lovely!!

resting. A resting place in Paris near the Luxembourg Palace in the center of Paris near Bd st Michel.
You can go by walking in the better Paris

lux gardens. First of all: where the hell are the gardens? I mean where is the green stuff?... they call it gardens and 90% is sand all over...
Second: it's not that big as they sell it
third: they have a cute fontain
not much to say...

Wonderful. One the best places in Paris. It is not a large area but it is enough to have a walk far form the traffic, to read a book or simply to meet some person. The atmosphere is great and it is amazing the silence you experience on a public area.
A must-live garden !
relaxing and beautiful. For a quiet stroll around gardens, this is the place to be. A great place to sit and relax, read a book, have a coffee. But be out by nine PM, or they will chase you out.

Lovely Park. Really beautiful park, great for a walk and very close to a lot of good restaurants. Lovely area of Paris, much quieter than the touristy bits by the Eiffel Tower and closer to the centre in general. Well worth a visit.
FANCY. it is a fun place... nothing to do, just stare, take a picture ,and tell everybody you went there. the garden is well mentained and security is all around the garden

Beautiful Gardens. Luxembourg Gardens are huge and beautiful ... a great place for a stroll on a sunny day or to watch people play chess or tennis in the park. One of my favorite activities is to watch the children sail boats on the pond.

My favourite gardens in Paris. My favourite gardens visited in Paris. I loved getting lost in all the beautiful gardens of different colour themes. With plenty of private places for a picnic or if your an active person, get out early for a morning run.

lovely gardens and point for relaxation in the left bank. a great place to catch the Parisian feeling and relax durnig your visit to the left bank very close to the Sorbonne and St. Germain and St Michell .
A magical place in any season of the year. Even though I'm not a huge fan of Paris' harsh winters, I can't stop praising the beauty of these gardens with snow. Simply stunning!

romantic. some sections of the gardens are very romantic such as the Luxembourg fountain, some others interesting, the beehives, the orchard, the statue of Liberty... a good spot to stop and rest some time while visiting Paris on foot

Nice place to talk a walk and hang a few hours. + nice park with many different views and paths to take a stroll
+ lively park with lots of people... but still calm enough to read a book or enjoy the sun
+ secure feeling as it is the park of the Senat there is a certain Police presence

Best seen in summer, but amazing place!. This is a great spot in Paris. The gardens are absolutely magnificent. This is a great place to go with kids in the summer — there are usually sailboats in the ponds and there is tons of space to run around. It is a great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the big city.

Beautiful!. We went through the gardens early morning on the last day that we were in Paris. Even though it was late fall/early winter it was still very pretty and I got quite a few wonderful pictures! I would recommend visiting sometime in the spring, I think that it would be a lot more beautiful then, but all and all, it's definitely worth the trip!
Exquisite!. Lovely site, well maintained and an opportunity to sit down and take in the location. It`s a convenient route towards the Eiffel Tower

Spacious!. Went for a walk here...there was an artistic exhibition outside too..Great to take a stroll and look at restoration projects throughout France. Def makes you think outside of Paris...Fab country...Gardens are fabulous...good to see so many things in one place and people are doing something different....worth a visit if you are in Paris and want to go for a walk to digest a meal or to process thoughts..

Lux is right. These wonderful gardens are all over Paris but some are special, this is one of those. Art work on display fountains and the deign is so pretty in a lovely arrondissement. Go relax anytime of year and enjoy the views.

If you need a little zen attitude.... Even in December it's a pleasure to visit. People jogging, doing tai chi or just breathing in the peace of the place. Beautiful gardens, statues, fountains - not to be missed!

Very romantic. Very romantic park. I like the flowers and fountains. The little lake is very cute. You can sunbath on the chairs beside it on the sunny weather. Senat has beautiful architecture, but I do not know if you can enter inside the building. On the entrance of the park you can buy really nice ice cream.

Very nice park for a picnic or stroll. Very nice park for a picnic or a relaxing stroll. The park is very clean and has very nicely groomed grass and trees. There are also many nice statues and nice fountains. It's really very quiet and relaxing there with plenty of places to sit and take in the sun and views. It's also a good place for taking a run. I recommend visiting this park.
Wonderful. Visiting Fontaine Medicis on a rainy day way the best part of our trip. Such a beautiful atmosphere, a must!
Beautifully designed gardens. Although the summer flowers had faded, there were many plantings of multi-colored mums. This is a nice place for children to play.

Perfect Park and Great Running Track. My fiancé proposed in le jardin Luxembourg so I am a little biased but I love this park at any time of year. In the summer, the jazz on Sunday afternoons is straight out of a movie, the running track around the outside is great fun and the little green chairs around the pond are great for passing the hours in the sun. C'est super!

GORGEOUS. This is a very beautiful place in Central of Paris therefore it is a must visit. This park will look the best during the summer but even in the winter it looked stunning and breath taking. Fountains, flowers, gorgeous trees and cute chairs and benches.

Not a must. Was expecting something a bit more wow but it wasn't. Just a big open park with benches a plenty. Good place for kids to run around with a play area for them too. Seems to be the local hangout for students etc. Pleasent, but nothing to see really.. was nice for the casual stroll around that we had. Does have a Parisian feel but didn't really see much greenery, probably as it was Autumn/Winter.

Quiet space in the middle of the City. For some quiet time, a great park to wander around. Has a lovely old fashioned boating lake, where you can hire sailing boats. Lots of statues scattered around, giving something extra to look at. Really nice space.

romantic gardens. I love Jardin de Luxembourg. besides its romantic side especially in spring and summer when it's decorated with beautiful colorful flowers, it's a breathing garden even though it's always crowdy with tourists, students, children and jogger. sometimes you can listen to an outdoor concert. you can buy an ice cream in summer or some chestnuts in winter. you can even play tennis, walk or jogg all around the garden. i really love it especially when it's sunny. you can hav a sun bath on one of the chairs of the garden !

Beautiful Gardens with Many Things to Do. Definately walk through these gardens to enjoy the scenery and if you have time, sit and listen to an outdoor concert, watch the children sailing toy boats on the pond, study the beautiful buildings, watch the people and savor the ambiance.
Quite and peaceful.. We liked to relax for a while after a long movement in Paris city. It is a beutiful park with some sport play areas. You may see Eiffel and Montparnasse Towers.

Kul Gardens/Park. My favorite place in Paris by far. Not being a city or a crowd person it was so nice to be in the gardens in the offseason and enjoy a little nature in a large city. The gardens is just a large park really, trails through trees, large fountain, playground for kids, pony rides for kids, tennis courts, basketball courts, just a great atmosphere. I am sure that in the spring/summer/fall it is absolutely beautiful, as it was quite lovely in the winter while we were there. Make this a place on your list the next time you go to Paris!

Perfect for a sunday morning stroll.. Be a true Parisien and stroll (or jog) round the gardens on a sunday morning. They are not big, and can easily be circumnavigated in a leisurely hour. Highlight is the pond, used by children of all ages for their sailing boats, and the Palais de Luxembourg itself. Additionally you do get good views of the Montparnasse tower and Eiffel Tower in the distance.
Beautiful. You have to go, easily accessible and you can't miss it. Very tranquil garden with lovely restaurants on the side. Just the whole area is incredible. A top pick for sure.

Beautiful. Luxembourg Gardens seem to be the sort of Central Park of the Left Bank. They have wooded areas but they also have beautiful formal gardens. There are often bands playing on the bandshell. People hang out and have a great time. This is a wonderful experience. And when you're finished, you can walk down the adjacent streets and find wonderful restaurants.

Stroll along in diversity... The more lively park in Paris : of course, interesting statues of famous people (writers Verlaine, Sand, queens...) or typical symbols of France (Statue of LIberty, first Puppet show, Celtic Veleda...); a huge Renaissance fountain... Kids playing around te pond with their tiny boats... Students studying... Grown ups playing chess, or bowls or getting sun-tanned... Two restaurants almost just like in the XIXth century... Some people trying to find a lover (less and less every year though)... Quietness... Beautiful flower beds... Have a rest !

Excellent choice for families with babies and toddlers. This garden is beautiful, has some activities for children were they can enjoy a nice promenade, if it´s with a stroller or walking, lots of fun, you can enjoy the view, eat something, get a ride on pony, or be by the fountain..

Everything you want in a park. This park has Pony rides, Museum,Tennis Courts, Cafes, Playground, Merry go Round, Duck Pond, Bee hives and more. You can stroll around this park for hours and be amazed at every step. It is the most tranquil yet vibrant park in Paris. Not to be missed.

My favorite garden in Paris.. Gorgeous and fun. During the warmer months, this garden swarms with kids sailing boats in the fountains, joggers, moms taking their babies for a walk in their strollers, people sitting on chairs talking or sunning themselves, crowds listening to the frequent, and free, musical events, etc. etc. It's like a modern-day Impressionist painting come alive. Wonderful, wonderful garden.

My "Home Away From Home" and My Gym At The Same TIme. I go to the Luxembourg Gardens almost every day. There are so many things to see. The landscaping is incredible and is changed with every season. I also job in the Luxembourg Gardens quite often. There is a path around the inside of the fence and two or three trips around will earn you enough calories for an extra baguette. In the Summer, there is often music. They have a working bee hive, classes for gardeners, fruit trees and a nice playground for children.Additionally, there are two restaurants that serve lunch, snacks, coffee and drinks. The Luxembourg Gardens is an ideal place to go in Paris.

Relax among art and greenery. Wonderful place to come anytime of the year. Sit and relax under any of the centenary trees, buy a waffle or read a book, chat with a friend or meditate on your own, the Jardin of Luxembourg is one of those fantastic spots in a wonderful city. Not to miss.

beautiful, calming place to relax after whole day bustling Paris. we came here on a great, sunny afternoon so we really got the best of it. Our kid immediately went for the boats (you can hire a small sailing boat for 2 €) and we enjoyed full hour chasing the boat on the small artificial lake/fountain. Luxembourg Gardens has very calming, relaxing atmosphere. Chairs are just lying about and you can throw yourself in any and just look at the people and scenery around you.

Relaxing. Best green space in paris.In a city as vibrant and loudy as paris take a well deserved break in the jardin de luxembourg, whether a chess player, a tennis player, a bookworm or a nature lover this is your place to be.

Idyllic. A place of tranquility. We had our first visit at thd beginning of November on a Sunday afternoon and enjoyed walking around with our son. It was quite amazing to see so many people of all ages practicing Tai Chi. If you need to chill out in Paris this is the place to be.

Our favorite garden in Paris. We spent a beautiful Sunday afternoon in the garden watching people and the beautiful flowere. In the pond in the center of the garden people were sailing their model sailboats much to the delite of the children. The paths through the wooded portions were filled with delights. All in all, we loved it.

Quite & nice garden. Its nice garden for picnic. If u want a nice hang out, its good to sit by the fountain. They have a tiny rose garden & a garden with apple, but i was there during winter, the rose garden was in maintence. Bet it should be pretty in summer

Underrated Attraction. These gardens are ideal for a stroll, and there are also many photo opportunities. It's easy to reach them by RER or by bus - with many lines passing the gates, and you can combine with the trip to the Pantheon too.

Great place for adults and kids. We took our kids to this lovely garden several times. The have a fantastic playground with a zip line roller coaster and a huge play structure. (the do charge a small admission fee for this playground) The walking paths were beautiful, and the park was teeming with life. There is a pond where toy sail boats are rented. Our boys loved this...for 3 Euro per half hour, they sailed their boats across the large pond. While my wife and I enjoyed a bottle of wine as we sat and watched.
tremendous impression. tremendous impression .Big palace nice garden too many monuments when you can read who is that person . Nice to have a walk no qwik just enjoi atmosphere historical sity :)

Very nice garden. How much better does it get; going for work to Paris a few blocks away from the Luxembourg gardens. After work went for a nice jogging session of an hour. The park is beautifull (in Autumn as much as summer) and the palace is very interesting. Do visit if you can.

Beautiful garden! Loved it!. The Luxembourg Gardens is the second largest public park in Paris, located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris. The Park is the garden of the French Senate, which is itself housed in the Luxembourg Palace. Marie de Medicis, the widow of Henry IV and the regent for the King Louis XIII decided to build a palace in imitation of the Pitti Palace in her native Florence.The garden is beautiful. A large octagonal basin of water is in front of the palace, in which children sail model boats. The Medici Fountain to the east of the palace, an artificial grotto and fountain, with gold fish in a pond. The garden full of beautiful flowers, fountains, sculptures, ... A lot of chairs near the water where you can sit and relax. The amount of flowers and how they arranged in flower beds, blooming trees & bushes are absolutely amazing! We loved it!

Sprawling Gardens Filled with people. My hotel was a few blocks away from the gardens. I brought my lunch and sat in a bench and watched the people. It was filled with locals and tourists. Large gardens for a long walk, take some photos and enjoy the space without the traffic.

Serene spot in the centre of Paris. Don't miss these gardens if you are in the area. The palace is stunning, the statues amazing, and the little lake is so peaceful. I love the history of it as well. You can sit on a bench and watch a bit of Parisian life go by, as a few children play, as birds fly by. It's a place to rest for a bit before you go back into the busy Paris streets., while your eyes feast on the surroundings. A lovely spot that I will always remember. It's close to everything, so you can pop in for an hour if you like, and get a good sense of it, then go on your way. Or, you could take your time and spend a couple of leisurely hours walking around to see all of it.

Peaceful garden. The one thing you notice coming from the madness of the Paris traffic is the peace and solitude in this lovely garden. Walking around the manicured gardens you can almost see the ladies many centuries ago, walking in this garden. My favourite thing to do is watch the children playing with the leaves and chasing the birds. You really do forget that your right in the heart of this beautiful city.

Visit to jardin du Luxembourg, PAris. We spent as great afternoon wandering in the beautiful Luxembourg gardens in the centre of Paris. Go to the small lake in the middle of the park to watch the toy yachts and speed boats. The gardens are kept in an immaculate condition. Only negative is the price of the children's play area and the expensive cafe.

Nice for a rest. You can sit on several places enjoying the gardens. It is a nice place to stay for escape the busy citie. At some places you can buy food and an drink ( in a truck at a corner) the gardens are beautifful

My favorite parc in Paris. Right in the middle of quartier latin, right behing Senat Palace and Senat museum, the Luxembourg gardens are exquisite. I always say that this is the place were the sky is the bluest in Paris

Perhaps my all time favorite (since 1958...). Seven years old, having traveled much of the world, awash in history; Paris (sorry, mes amis) is almost nouveau in terms of history; but the resonance, the energy, the reticence (note: reticence does not mean "rude"; it means privee/private/privacy respected) blew me away. Have returned throughout my lifetime; am now a 60+ year old lady; it is where my heart resides. So back to LG, my most loved, enjoyed, revelled in place. In the old days, puppet shows. The gardens are what I love most. And the history. Look at the statues! Almost exclusively women, because the palace was built at the behest of the Medici queen of a lackluster French king, a wife who wanted a little bit of breathing room.. The statues are essentially a tribute to strong women, starting in the 12th century. In summer, the garden is usually a vista for installation art that is built around the marvelous sculpture. To die for. (Note: I am not given to hyperbole.)
