Favourite place in Paris - beautiful in autumn. Spend a morning walking around here discovering the statues and enjoying the views through the autumn trees. Parisians seem to use the Jardin as their running course so you get to experience a real bit of Paris life as they jog past. Love it

Beautiful park. A beautiful park in the middle of Paris, just down the street from the Pantheon; a bit hidden by the fence and hedges that surround it, but a real joy once you enter it. The gardens are behinda majestic palace that was built for the Queen Marie de Medicis in the 1600's. Even in the beginning of November the trees were beautiful and the mums in bloom. Seems to be as popular with regular folks as well as the tourists. A great place to relax and wander. We went on sunny day, and still had to side step some puddles; so be careful if it is raining, as not all the walkways are paved.
Charming. Larger than I expected, great walking paths to stroll through the lovely gardens. Very well maintained a must see.

A piece of Peace and beauty in the midlle of Paris.. 5 Minutes of our hotel it was this lovely palace and garden created by Maria Medicis ,perfect to walk or run,appreciate the beauty of the gardens and enjoy Paris.

Amazing day at the park. We were lucky to have in mid October one of those warm days to enjoy in Paris. So we went to the Luxembourg gardens and we had a blast. There was a band playing music, kids having fun at the fountain with their model boats and other ones enjoying pony rides. We sat in one of the several green chairs that they have all over the gardens and relax for the whole afternoon.

Very Pretty!. What place in Paris is not romantic and beautiful! The Luxembourg Gardens is so beautiful in the summer time as many other places in Paris are. This will more than likely be a stop on you hop on hop off tour. It is a wonderful place to take pictures and create memories.

Love this place. A place that has a sentimental place in my heart. Wonderful to take my child there for the first time after so many years. What a dream to see him on a pony trotting through the autumnal leaves. Slightly shocked that we had to pay to get into the playground though - what is that about?! Still, there's something you just can't beat about the elegance of this place.

Spend Quality Time Here!. This is the best place in all of Paris. Bring a book. Walk around. Watch the children play on swings or pony rides. Watch a Bacchic game. See fountains. This is place to experience, not just visit.

A slice of heaven. Paris is overwhelming with buildings, museums and traffic. Luxembourg Gardents is one of the nicest gardens in the city, giving you a beautiful spot for a respite in a bustling city.

have a picnic here. I went to this place in the morning with husband and toddler. She really had a great time here feeding the birds.. with its scenic view and beautiful flowers, this place is perfect for morning picnic with family. Just grab your sandwich from food parlors outside the garden, or maybe McD if you were too early ;) ..we love this garden so much.

My favorite location in Paris. Perhaps I'm partial because I lived next to the Luxembourg Gardens one summer; still I think they are the most beautiful gardens in France. They have everything from historical statues to beautiful fountains to playgrounds for children and tennis courts for adults. When we visited most recently they had a dance competition going on in the Pavilion. The gardens are always full of energy and are a wonderful place to run, stroll or sit for awhile. There are areas that are abundant with trees, making it easy to have your own corner or open areas that make it easy to people-watch. I highly recommend it.
Lovely. The fall colors were so pretty. Such a wonderful park that everyone enjoys. Sundays are special days in Paris, and they use their parks for family outings and long walks. Perfect.

Beautiful park with great museum. Walking through the gardens, having a picnic there are wonderful Parisan experiences. My favorite part is the museum, where this past spring I saw a wonderful Chagall exhibit. This is a peaceful spot not to be missed.

Most enjoyable place in Paris. Paris has so much to offer but we had our best time in Luxembourg Gardens during our time in the city. We went on a sunny Sunday and got to enjoy the Gardens with locals and travelers. The moment one steps into the Gardens, it's as if all your troubles from the everyday life gets left outside the gate.

Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. We stumbled upon the gardens on a Sunday in June. It was like a scene from a movie with Parisians of all ages picnicing, children playing, etc. We went back the next morning to see a lot of the locals jogging there in the morning. It's a safe place to run and absoutely beautiful in the summer. We went back a third time and bought crepes from a vendor while watching someone paint a picture. If you're near it, stop by and check it out.

Tip visiting Luxembourg Gardens. There are restroom facilities located within the Garden premises, where one pays the attendant 50 centimes to enter. It's worth paying this small amount for clean facilities considering the crowds visiting this attraction.

One of my favorite spots in Paris!. Gorgeous gardens, beautiful building, great niches and smaller areas. A wonderful place to relax and get away from the big city for a few hours. Plus, Dalloyau chocolates right across the street. Who could ask for anything more?

Love this Parisian oasis.... A beautiful oasis in the heart of Paris. Impeccably maintained with beautiful plants and flowers, the park is a great way to escape the hustle and bustle of Paris. It's especially great for kids, with lots of activities for them (playground, pony rides, merry-go-round, puppet shows). The playground there is brilliant - definitely worth the small entrance fee you pay to get in. It entertained our daughter for over an hour. There is a small cafe right next to the playground with snacks, drinks, meals, etc. Just check when the childrens' activities are held (day/times) before turning up - they're not every day and mostly on the weekends.

Just where I wanted to be. My wife and I recently had the occasion and pleasure to visit a French friend of ours who lives in Paris. On the Monday of our stay we visited "le jardin de luxembourg". Although we have been a number of times, there remains something magical and timeless about the place. A great place just to sit down on one of the many chairs and take in some peace, a little late afternoon sun on your face, people watch or smile at the children sailing their boats on the "pond".

Get a feel for what Parisiens do. Go for a stroll on a Sunday morning in the sun around the Palace and the little model boating lake. Sit and watch the joggers and Gendarmes pass by with a coffee,,,,lovely.

Nice dinner. We were with another family for a total group of 9. The service was excellent and the food very good for what seemed like a "touristy" type location. We were staying at hotel Cujas so the location was very convenient. Would recommend for a nice, casual meal.

Beautiful. We got off the metro stop at the top of the gardens at the suggestion of a local who saw us looking at a map plotting our visit to the Musee d'Orsay. What a great idea. We then trekked through the massive gardens for about 10 minutes. It was outstandingly beautiful even on a cloudy Sunday. So many people were outside by the water, enjoying the day. There are a number of outside restaurants to dine at before you reach the Musee. You can't miss it. Walk towards the Arch. Plenty of photo opportunities as well. Take your time. Oh, and enter the Musee d'Orsay on the side near the bridge, not through the main entrance. You'll save time. I hope you find this review helpful.

This is not your Central Park. The weather was dreary, but the park was charming. I am still amazed how much time, money, and effort France putsintinits parks. The flowers are breataking. There had to be over a thousand mums in the park. A nice place to read, eat or just take pictures.Enjoy..

Beatiful place to relax and have a cafe or it a crepe.. We loved the gardens and the design they have.You can have a tea or café and it something like a baguette, and enjoy the nature alone, with your couple or with your family.Great place!
Lovely gem in the heart of Paris.. Calm, beautiful, spacious and, like other Parisian gardens, wonderfully equipped with comfy designer chairs in which one can sit and relax!
Beautiful place to relax. One of our favourite spots in Paris to relax and even to read a book by the very beautiful and romantic Fontaine de Medicis (fountain was built in 1620).

Don't miss this!. We had been to Paris before, but never made it to the Luxembourg Gardens. We visited on a crisp, clear Sunday morning, and the park was filled with French families enjoying the beautiful day and the beautiful surroundings. Children were sailing rented boats in the large pond, and others were sitting in the numerous metal chairs, just enjoying! It really is a wonderful spot, especially if is a planting season. When we were there, the chrysanthemums had just been put in all the planters!

Beautiful Gardens easy to get to on Metro. My Husband and I were looking for free attractions to visit while we spent 10 days in Paris. Very elegant great for walking around and people watching. The fountain rents little sail boats and children push them with sticks much the same for the last 100 years. A great slice of Paris

Relax after a busy day. The gardens ar big, full of people but that is not a problem. Is nice the buy a bottle of wine and a baguette or macarons and just sit down and relax. But not to late. The gardens are close down at 6, is i remember well.

Great !. One of the best outdoor gardens in Paris ! If you're coming out of the Louvre from 4 hours of walking take a break and have a seat. This is the place where in summertime the Parisians have a sun bath and generally relax. You will also find surrounding you copies of statues from the Louvre including the Hannibal one if you're into history.
Elegant. it is a big and elegant gardens. a good place for couple to walk around, family to spend time with.... other than that, i have to say it is a garden!!! a big one..so prepare to walk a lot

Amazing park. We were lucky to go here in October, during fall when we saw all the blooming fall colors and the natural beauty of leaves on the floor. Surprisingly amidst the busy and cramped city there is space for such a beautiful park. If you are romantic and a nature lover take out 2 hours for this park, for some nature love, a satisfaction to the eyes and fall in love. Somebody plays violin, while the kids play in the pond, lovers hand in hand while old folks resting on the bench.Loved it !!

A lovely stroll!. We started out walking from Rue Cler and thought it would only take @ 30 min. Wrong!!! It was a@ a 50 min walk but well worth it. We were able to really take in a part of Paris we have never seen. The Gardens were reflecting fall foliage and fall flowers. The palace there was lovely to look at from afar. We enjoyed watching the others strolling, painting, just sitting in the sun and reading. A very relaxing time! Until we realized we had a long walk back to our hotel!!

Worth the trip. This isn't as iconic as other Paris attractions, but it really is a great place to take a stroll. The museum on the grounds is impressive and there is plenty of people watching that you can do. The gardens themselves are great.
Beautiful gardens..... It cost nithung, a beautiful lake with children pushing boats with sticks!Stunning place just to relax and take some lovely photos too!!

Why not hire a boat?. Sat and watched the children sail boats on the pond - you can hire them there, drank wine in the cafe (the food looked good too but we had just eaten) We walked through on our way to and from the Catacombs. Lovely!

Luxembourg- Respite for the soul and feet. Every trip to Paris for us must include at least one visit to Luxembourg Gardens to sit in the sun for a little while, or to snack on a baguette or pastry or to simple stroll in the greenery. This trip was no different and we were rewarded with an afternoon sun, cool breezes and lush fall florals.

Simply elegant. Do yourself a favor and allow @ least 3 to 4 hours in this amazing garden. It was a rainy afternoon and we still spent 3.5 hours strolling through. The fountain de Medici is amazing. The bee skeps,the l'Organgerie,the boules courts,puppet theatre,pony rides, and all the different plantings simply dazzle. Just go,pack a picnic too!

a must see. Do not go to Paris without spending some time here. Sunday is wonderful. Small children pushing boats around the fountain. A band in the bandshell. Have a coffee or a glass of wine at the cafe. People watching is at its best here.

Paris Parks are Awesome. They are safe, well manicured, beautiful and a delight. Luxembourg Gardens is especially beautiful and quite large. Fountains, statues, flowers and even areas for children to play. You can easily spend 4 or 5 hours here especially if you bring a packed lunch with all those wonderful Parisien foods. There are stands that sell snacks. Very safe too! Don't miss it.

A great place to rest and stroll. We loved these gardens. Beautiful, serene break from the traffic and the crowds when we visited. And it was great fun watching the families sail their boats in the fountain!

a peacefull place to relax. what a beautiful place to just walk around enjoy the sunshine,grab a chair and just sit and listen to the Parisians talking and discussing life...the flowers and gardens are well kept.Alsohave a Nutella crepe from the little green kiosk..not the big busy one! recharge your batteries ,rest your feet here and then get back out into the streets of this wonderful city...Au revoir

Such a wonderful place to relax and watch the world go by. We loved this place! Having bought fresh pastries at the local boulangerie, we headed to the gardens for a sit down to enjoy them. What a lovely place! Lots of people around but at the same time, so relaxed. Not only are there benches all around the place, there are literally hundreds of 'loose' chairs. There are basic chairs, ones with arms and even some with a reclined back to soak up the sunshine!We enjoyed our pastries (there were many people having picnics) and watching the little sparrows and pigeons picking up the crumbs.It was a beautiful sunny but breezy day - ideal for the children playing around the boating lake with little hired sail boats.We didn't walk all around the gardens - we just sat and enjoyed the lovely atmosphere for an hour or so. A very memorable visit - and somewhere we would definitely want to return to on our next trip to Paris.
A Sunday stroll. We stayed near here so had a stroll on the way to the metro before heading back. It was lovely seeing families spending time in the open with each other, good place to people watch

Beautiful gardens, even in the rain. This garden in the middle of Rive Gauche Paris, is wonderful even on a cold and rainy fall day. I went there for a run (and was in good company) but it s also good for a stroll, a picnic on a nice day, or to have tea in one of the Dining pavilions. It is a vey large urban park with a museum that I have not yet visited but intend to.

Don't Miss!. Luxembourg Gardens is one of my favorite destinations in Paris. The thing I love most about Luxembourg Gardens is that it is a park where the local Parisians enjoy. While there are definitely tourists about, it is enjoyable to watch the Parisians participating in their day to day activities. Within Luxembourg Gardens the Parisians play tennis, cards, chess, eat lunch, play on the wonderful playgrounds, enjoy the beautiful gardens, catch up with their friends, sail toy boats in the ponds, etc., etc. The Gardens are some of the most beautiful and well maintained within Paris. While visiting Paris try to fit in a trip to Luxembourg Gardens. Pack a lunch, bring a bottle of wine, a great book and head to Luxembourg for an enjoyable, relaxing visit!
Nice gardens. These are pretty gardens though we were mostly past the blooming season, but, they were not as exciting as many other sights in Paris

Beautiful and relaxing. On an unseasonably warm fall day we stopped in Luxembourg Gardens to recharge. It was relaxing to watch the kids sailing their boats on the water and see the diverse crowd of people going by. Plus our favorite pasty shop is nearby for some much needed french pastries.

Great fun for kids. Reminded me of Central Park on a smaller scale. It is very pretty - with bistro tables and chairs scattered about for people to sit and enjoy the surroundings.Our kids (8, 10) loved the large playground. There is a fee - I think 1,50 euros per adult less for kids. But the playground is large, the ground is padded and there is a short 'zip line' that my kids loved.

Love it. Must go and spend some time there,it have cafe , public bank you can sit on with your partner watch other tourists or the Parisien families enjoy their lunch break.So big if you take a bit of exploration walk you see they even have a chilcare centre there also.I love this visit to Luxembourg garden because Autumn season I can see the orange colour leaves falling flying with little breeze.

Perfect place. You feel like a local when you wander around these gardens. Everyone that lives in the area comes here for a range of activities, from yoga to miniature boats in the pond, or to walk your dog through the many winding paths. Loved it!

Very pleasant oasis in Paris. The gardens are a great place to walk thru, and to sit and relax. As usual in Paris, the gardens are usually full of activity, but you can find areas that are quiet and good for people watching, having a picnic, or just taking a nap!
The gardens are open dawn to dusk.

Possibly the nicest park in Paris. I visited on a warm day, the sun was shining, flowers blooming, autumn leaves piled around the trees, children sailing their little boats on the pond with the palace in the background, what more is there to say?

Another purfect day in Paris. We brought wine, cherry tomatoes and bread and set in the chairs by the fountain and watched the remote controlled boat on a beautiful September day.. The park is very big with plenty of things to see and do.. What a magical place to be with your lady. We have been to Paris 4 times and always go to the park.

A haven to visit away from the busyness of Paris. A surprisingly large park within easy walking of the Odeon metro station. It is part of the gardens of the Senate Assembly. Lovely statues, boating pond for the children and lots of space for peace and quiet. Great security. Highly recommended .
Another find in Paris. Nothing better than a beautiful visit to this great park on a sunny day. Great place to take a break for any kind of travelers from singles to families.

nice stroll. Nice place to walk through to get to Le Bon Marche locals playing tennis and bowls perfect to have a picnic or break as there are lots of benchesWe treated ourselves in the tea room there but it cost 32euros for 2 teas and 2 cakes mind you it had to be done and was lovely tea is very weak though we sneakily put our pg in the pot cannot believe we paid 15 euros for 2 teas then added our own bags ha typical English! it was still worth it.

Beautiful gardens. Jardin du Luxembourg is a lovely place to go and rest your feet after wandering around Paris. There are so many seats it's difficult to decide where to go in order to get the best view. You can sit and gaze at the Palace, or look at the statues, or race boats around the pond. And if you're looking for the Statue of Liberty - she's in there, I promise!

Great for kids. This is a perfect place to take a breather from sight-seeing if you are travelling with kids. It has an amazing playground, go-kart course and pony rides. You can also play with model sail boats at the fountain.

A nice place to stroll. It rained on us but it was still a wonderful place to experience, loved the floral displays. A few vendors rounded it out, everyone has to experience it, even with the rain it was fun to people watch here.

Taking a walk back in time!. I imagine our experience would not be common in colder months, but it was a Wednesday evening after 5 pm. Talk about community! There was tennis, boat sailing, chess games, bocce ball, and just wonderful conversation all around us. In the pavillion was music and dancing! Amazing! It was one of my favorite things to witness on our trip! We in America could learn more from their pace of life and just appreciating relationships!

Spectacular in October. I've twice visited this garden in October and regard it as my favourite place in Paris. It is a delightful walk, where you can enjoy glorious scenery while watching Parisians enjoy themselves playing boules, tennis, pushing boats on the pond outside the Senate, riding ponies, or just chilling out. The children's playground is the biggest I've ever seen and this year it was packed full of very happy children.
Amazing for a picnic.. Take a bottle of wine and your snacks and this is the best afternoon ever. Beautiful grounds and great people watching.

Excellent destination. The grounds are lovely - well-kept and not very crowded. there are numerous chairs and benches so a visitor can sit and enjoy the lovely atmosphere. It is a popular place for teens to spend their lunch break - so a tourist feels immersed in the French culture. It is a lovely place to have a sandwich or cup of coffee.

Sailboats, Chestnuts, Music, Marionettes, and More. No wonder Parisians love the Luxembourg Gardens. It is free for the most part, and beautiful with its fountains and statuary. It is filled with Parisian couples and families enjoying themselves. For 3 euros rental fee you can get a sailboat and stick for half an hour's enjoyment at the main water basin (that is, if you can bear to take your turn ahead of a young boy or girl). The marionette theatre at less than 5 euros gives you a 45-60 minute show that will have you laughing and admiring and (if they present the daisy or marguerite marionette routine) even crying a little. There are pony rides to watch (unless you're a child small enough to ride), a bandstand/gazebo with different musical performances every time you visit, more than enough chairs and benches to sit, a museum, a Medici queen's chateau that is now the French Senate, and even a chestnut vendor near the gate at Boulevard St. Michel. What a place to enjoy, have a picnic, rest, and share a space with the people of Paris.
peace and beauty. Come there and feel this exiting beauty, relax and just walking through the paths. After that you realize that how wonderful life is!
Ommm. Liked: gardens, children playing with boats in the pond, gardens, whole scene...spent a lovely sunny cool afternoon just enjoying all the variable sites, sounds, impressions.

A place to take a break. With chairs around the lake & the various beds, together with avenues of trees & space for pétanque these gardens are a wonderful to just sit & relax in. Whatever the season, you will see some beautiful blooms & a splendid array of colour. The Palais du Luxemborg is set in the grounds & as many international meetings are held there, it is possible to catch sight of someone famous. On this visit, there was a collection of wonderful photographs around the outside railings.
nice place for a morning walk. Beautiful gardens, a good place to spend some peace and quiet, go for a run or enjoy a walk on a Sunday morning.

how to relax in Quartier Latin. After a long visit to Quartier Latin, grab a sandwich, a coffee and some magazine or whatever book you might have bought and go to Luxebourg Gardens. Around the lake, you just relax under the sun and feel Paris getting into your veins.

gorgeous. love the park for a nice stroll, sit in the chairs and relax. was there around october 19. was still in bloom, with beautiful weather. police did come through around 6pm or so and round everyone up and get everyone out! i guess they lock it up at night. lovely, lovely place to go.

Beautiful, tranquil setting.. We visited Paris for a long weekend and this was on the list of places to visit. We weren't disappointed and if the weather had been warmer, am sure we would have spent much longer there. The seats round the pool in front of the palace are an ideal place to "people watch", and the whole place is one of chilled relaxation.

An oasis on the Left Bank of Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is a delight for anyone visiting Paris. It is a large sprawling park that is much used and loved by residents of the 5th & 6th arrondisements, the neighborhoods that border the park. There is a wonderful small museum, Musee du Luxembourg, off of Rue de Vaugirard that regularly features new exhibits. And around the Rue de Medicis, along the outside of the park, there is usually a photography exhibit along the massive gate. For small children, a visit to the playground is a must despite the small entrance fee. There are are great amusements and fun climbing structures. The small carousel near the playground is not to be missed! Children love to take a ride and to try to catch the rings with the sticks provided by the person who runs the merry-go-round. There's a place near to buy drinks and snacks. Children might also enjoy the large pond where they can push wooden sailboats across the water and race to catch them on the opposite side. Tucked away near where the (mostly) men play chess, there is a wading and splashing area for children. Very refreshing and fun on a hot, dusty summer day. If you are fortunate enough to be traveling with a dog, you may bring your dog to Luxembourg Gardens but only to certain parts of the park. The entrance by Medicis is the allocated dog entrance. Finally, I recommend Paris to the Moon by Adam Gopnik and Hemingway's A Moveable Feast for expat / insider's look at the park and the neighborhood, and The Autobiography of Alice B. Toklas written by Gertude Stein who lived just a couple blocks away. Enjoy!

Beautiful!. We happened upon the Luxembourg Gardens after visiting the Pantheon. Our tied feet were in need of a rest, and what a wonderful place to take a break! The Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. The views around the fountain are so captivating that if you sit down you'll likely find time escaping as you relax and reflect.

Very Nice. Very nice to walk around. You can buy bread and cheese at a local store, then sit by the fountains and have a nice lunch. On a nice day there is always a spot you can find to sit and read. The garden is pretty peaceful and accessable by buses, metro, and RER.

Great Stop!. absolutely beautiful park to visit and relax in. Great place to take a break in the middle of a hectic sight seeing day to lounge on the grass (take a scarf or blanket to lay on the grass).

Planting fall 'mums. Every Fall the gardeners plant cascading potted mums throughout the garden. They are beautiful. They were just planting them when we were there and within two days they were done. The gardens change seasonally and are always stunning.The gardens are well maintained and the Parisians make good use of them. Joggers are in abundance. As soon as the sun shines, people are sitting in the specially designed leaning back chairs "catching the rays" and eating pic-nic lunches. The children rent boats to play with in the ponds and there are all sorts of other activities going on - tennis, basketball, tai chi and bocce. It is really fun to observe how lively these gardens are. It is also nice to see how respectful people are. Even though they are well used,there is no litter or grafitti.

Fantastique !. Beautiful Gardens. Lots of people out walking there on a Sunday. Children playing with Sail Boats in the large Pond. There was even a large band playing in the band stand! Beautiful statues!

Parisian Relaxation. It was a gorgeous sunny day in August and we totally enjoyed our short time here.The ambiance is wonderful..........locals,turistas,kids.....all having a grand time. It really was a giggle watching those who rented mini sailboats working with them in the water.We sat a while and people watched.........we strolled.....and then we took the #89 bus back to the ap't in the 15th Arr. that we were staying in.
Nice - sprawling. Nice main fountain area with cool statues, sprawling, more for locals I think than tourists (tennis courts, etc.).

2 hours in paradise . Absolute beautiful especially in sunny days , gardens , lakes with ducks swimming , just sit there and read and u will feel peace inside , unfortunately I had limited time in Paris so I couldn't spend more time there , I didn't check Luxemburg museum inside while it seems beautiful outside , the only negative thing that it is not allowed to sit or walk on the grass .

Great place to people watch. It was a delight to watch both tourists and locals at this location. Get some crepe from nearby creperie, bbring it along with your coffee, and enjoy the outdoor on a bench and soak it all up, or just chill.

Great place to get away for a little bit. Beautiful respite right in the heart of Paris. I visited in the afternoon and it was quite busy with people enjoying themselves, but not overly crowded. I prefer to visit for an early morning walk when the place is almost deserted. Peaceful with plenty of places off to the side to get away. Having read Les Miserables it was cool to find the Medici Fountain off to the side which was in the book.

Great for kids but nothing is free. Spent a very happy two hours in the gardens, which are peaceful, beautiful and spacious. My three-year-old went on a short pony ride, we hired a miniature sail boat, used the slides/swings and bought some paninis.... It was lovely but very expensive. The children's play area is not free, so while lovely, a bit of a rip off to have to pay for something that is free in other countries.
Great place for a walk or relax. Relaxing and beautiful place. You can always have a sit at the free chairs and enjoy beautiful views of the garden, people, fountain

Beautiful and stress free visit. Large open space that is well used by all ages. Tennis courts, fountains, ponds, bocci courts and lots of areas to walk or jog. The landscaping and gardens of fruit are lovely to look at. Lots of benches and chairs all over to sit and relax. Many ways to water and exit around the park.
What a surprising park. Not only is this a well-used park, but they grow fruits and vegetables in this park. We really enjoyed it.
Relaxation à la Parisienne. I walked through here late in the afternoon of a sunny, autumnal day. It was nice to see people sitting, chatting and relaxing in a casual atmosphere.
Comfortable. Expansive and relaxing place for a walk to see something typically Parisian. Families , couples and singles all enjoying the outdoors in a quiet space in a busy city.
great running area. wide open pathes and many different directions, about 1 mile around the outside, plenty of other runners and toilets!

So Peaceful... I went several times. These are truly beautiful gardens - the best I've seen in Paris and so tranquil. There are water features, sculptures, all manner of activities, great places to walk or sit and any amount of things to just watch happening. The most relaxing place in Paris!

Not much of a park, actually.. Just rows and rows of small trees; pleasant but nothing to write home about. It was kinda like someone planted a field with trees 5, 10, and 20 years ago. Actually, the well constructed children's playground (accessible with a small fee) was the best part of our visit to the park. Our small daughter had a great time playing there!
Nice gardens in the center of Paris. Lovely gardens in the center o fParis , just near Latin Quarter and a lot of bus stops. You can visit Senate who is just near .

Great relaxing park. Very nice gem of a park on the south side of the city. There is a small cafe and a place to rent sail boats. My wife and I were able to relax and take a cat nap in the park. Very safe place with others having picnics. Great place to people watch.

A must see. Luxomborg is a refuge in the busy city. It is truly beautiful and restful. A must see for any visitor to Paris. After seeing Verseilles, we actually liked Luxomborg a bit better. It is smaller, but very colorful, has fountains, etc. A great spot to explore, sit and rest and watch.

Picnic in the Park. I spent this past summer in Paris and my favourite memories all involve having a picnic in Les Jardins du Luxembourg. On a sunny summer afternoon, there is nothing better than sitting out on the grass, in what has got to be one of the most beautiful parks Paris has to offer, eating a baguette with french cheeses, terrines, and charcuterie. Of course, the only thing missing is the wine, which while technically not allowed, seems to be tolerated so long as you're discrete.
Romantic Stroll. Great place to stop for a casual picnic, or simply take a walk in the gardens. Sheer beauty, Hollywood couldn't script a more romantic place.
Premier Gardens. In a city renown for its gardens this place was amazing. A "must see" for anyone visiting Paris. The place shouts relaxation and beauty. Even in fall the flowers were vibrant.
looks to see in the gardens. a great place for a walk and a lunch to watch the views. chess and tennis games on the go and lots of people watching.

Relaxing afternoon. We visited on a beautiful 65° sunny PM after touring all AM. It was an incredible respite lounging around the pond watching the kids sail the toy sailboats amid the fountains and statues.

Most beautiful gardens. This park is very impressive in the late afternoon. The flowers are still blooming in late October alongside dramatic fall foliage. Most fun to watch young children excitedly sailing their toy boats on the pond. Overall very peaceful even though full of people. Well worth a visit.
Great left bank park/gardens. IF you are in the Left Bank head here for a nice stroll. It is a great place to bring a picnic and just to hang out

Wonderful public space!. We loved it! We sat in the garden and ate a snack. One day we there were very few people there and we easily got a comfortable seat next to a beautiful fountain. Nearby there is a dining cart with pastries, drinks and sandwiches. It was nice to grab a bite and sit and people watch in such a well kept garden.

A piece of peace in Paris. Lovely place for a walk, jog, picnic or photoshoot. Sit and watch the kids (and sometimes adults) push the little boats around in the fountain, play tennis or a game of petanque. Peaceful place you can sit for hours on a sunny day.

Saw the sailboats & had a picnic. My husband and I went to the Luxembourg Gardens mid day on a Saturday and the park was fairly busy. We had a picnic and watched children rent and float sailboats. The statues and fountains around the gardens were impressive and the gardens were beautiful. There was plenty of available seating. We enjoyed our romantic picnic and wandering the gardens.

wonderful place to relax and enjoy. It was just wonderful to walk into the gardens and see so many people sitting and eating their lunches on a beautiful September day. After strolling around the gardens for some time it was now my turn to sit and people watch for an hour or so. The colours of the flowers, the shade of the trees, the plentiful chairs and seats to sit on, and of course the magnificent building itself. Be careful though, as you could just walk by and not realize that it exists just behind those gates. Don't rush just take your camera and snap as many photos as you can.

An idyllic afternoon at Luxembourg Gardens. What a beautiful and inspirational place. My daughter and I spent several hours two weeks ago at Luxembourg Gardens walking tree-canopied paths, gazing at beautiful statuary, lovingly tended flowers and fruit trees laden with golden and blush-colored pears and apples. After an hour or so, we sat on a bench to enjoy our French pastries and expressos in the sun in front of our favorite statue -- a magnificent stag, its mate and their fawn -- and people watch (our favorite past time in Paris!). Besides the warmth and joie de vivre of its people, what I love most about Paris is its respect for history and art - of beauty. You get an overwhelming feeling of permanence there, that you are part of history. The park bench we sat on, the paths we walked and the statuary we gazed at were all 100-200 years old. Think of the thousands of people - ordinary and famous (Jim Morrison loved to sit and write here, as well as many others) - who have sat on the same park benches to reflect and drink in the beauty of this idyllic place on a sunny fall afternoon - and so it will be for centuries to come. Such is the beauty of Paris. There is nowhere else like it and I can't wait to return.

gardens of Paris. large beautiful gardens,well laid out formal gardens,it is well used by the people of the city, I saw lots of Parisians enjoying the wonderful weather, flowers and in the bandstand,couples were doing the argentine tango,which was marvelous to watch. lovely place to relax and enjoy life.
Lovely Gardens - perfect for a picnic or nap. Great way to sit down and enjoy a picnic, or read a book. Lush gardens to admire and plenty of room for people to walk around.
An unexpected & unplanned visit. I wish I had more time...Next time I visit I would love to go early morning to have a mind blowing experience!!I wish I was allowed to pluck the flowers!

Charming!. A charming, and well known corner of Paris.
Recommended for a sunny day, if not for summertime.
A relaxing, renaissance garden experience that you can easily build into your central Paris sightseeing programme.
IT will transfer you to another era...

Take a Break and Grab a Chair. Do like the Parisians do and grab a chair and relax. Authentic Paris experience. On sunny days the place will be full, but will still be relaxing. Great way to do some people watching. : )

Beautiful and Relaxing. We stopped outside the gardens to grab a picnic lunch. It was Sunday and there was a lovely symphony concert being played in the gardens for free. A wonderful spot to relax and take a break.
Nice place to take a break. Very pretty garden, if you have extra time in Paris, buy a baguette and some fromage and enjoy a couple of hours here!

Beautiful Gardens, Lots of runners though mind.... I couldn't believe the tranquility of the place, all the runners must have thought the same thing! Its a great place for a stroll, I would love to catch it early in the morning though next time
Very beautiful. Nice place to stroll and walk around. Worth visiting. I noticed a lot of college students and just sitting and hanging out. I also loved the area nearby.

Such an unxpected pleasure. Those who equate a trip to Paris with shopping on the Right Bank are missing out on an awesomely Parisian experience. For 40 years the Luxembourg Gardens have remained one of the first spots to visit when I return to Paris. I have been there in all 4 seasons (late Spring is my favorite) and in weather more reminiscent of Chicago than of April in Paris. The sculptures are amazing: George Sand, close to Blvd St Michel, is achingly lovely and Diderot looks appropriately philosophical. Once, the Museum had a Rodin exhibit that rivaled his home a few kilometers away. Have a picnic, walk your dog, watch the people, recharge your batteries. Enjoy!

One of my favorite rest and hang-out places. First of all, it is very large and very beautiful, with statues, flowers and a large pool and fountain just in back of the Senate. I love to rest and watch the pétanque players when I get tired of walking. Senior citizens can be seen in groups walking with trekking poles, which I highly recommend. It`s a great student hangout as well. I actually taught small classes on some of the benches in beautiful weather.
YJ. Beautiful garden a must see . Ideall to spent weekend with the children. Perfect to relax and dreams.
Relaxed, easy-going. This is the place Parisians come to relax, a nice park to sit back and watch the people on a sunday afternoon.
An isle of tranquilliy. Peaceful place any time of the year! Parisians come here to jog, play tennis, do marshal arts and read books. You will enjoy it weather you are a couple or a single traveller.
Beautiful. Excellent! Especially just after reading Hugo's Le Miserables, puts Marius's walks in the garden into perspective! =)

most stunning garden in planet. As soon as I found my first afternoon in the Luxembourg Gardens, I knew I would love it for the rest of my life! The park has many chairs to sit in - you are not allowed to sit in the grass. Take a coffee in the morning or grab a baguette and some other picnic items and enjoy the after noon sun. This is also fantastic for children as there were lots of areas to keep them entertained. Great place to relax and take a break. Everything one needs for a stroll away from the bustle of the city.
The perfect place to relax.. The perfect place to relax, have some rest from crowded streets, museums and shops and enjoy beautiful and quiet atmosphere of the gardens.

One of the most beautiful gardens. One of the most beautiful gardens I have ever been...the place is huge, includes a palace, a museum about the place, lot of green areas and sculptures in all park...I recommend it for all ages if you visiting or live in Paris. Its located very close to St Germain Des Pres, which makes a perfect combination to have a happy hour and a good dinner after walking to Luxembourg Gardens.Uns do jardins mais bonios que eu ja estive...o lugar eh enorme e inlcui um palacio, um museu sobre o lugar, muita area verde e esculturas espalhadas por todo o parquet...eu recomendo para todas as idades se estiver visitando ou more em Paris. E muito perto de St Germain Des Pres, o que pode fazer uma otima combinacao..para um happy hour ou um bom jantar depois de uma caminhada no Jardins de Luxemburgo.

Beautiful Parisian Gardens. It doesn’t really matter whether you’re looking for somewhere to relax, ticking off another Paris landmark, a lover of gardens or just looking for somewhere peaceful, beautiful and romantic, a morning or afternoon in Luxembourg Gardens is a great place to visit. It’s not grand like Versailles, but it’s hard not to be taken by these magnificent gardens. There always seems to be enough people enjoying everything there is to see but never so many that you can’t find a great spot to sit. You probably won’t take a thousand photos, but you will leave relaxed and with a smile on your face. Simply a “must see” for any garden lover in Paris and a “should see” for everyone else.
Serene. Beautiful gardens and sculptures! Lovely pond in the middle where you can rent a little radio controlled sailboat.

spacious and refreshing taste of Paris. After a day of walking for miles and touring multiple museums, it was always wonderful to stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens. The local bands playing in the Gazebo was an added bonus!
Beautiful gardens. Luxembourg gardens are very charming and well maintained. They are always full of people having a good time.

Fantastic for kids. We went there several times recently while on holiday with two young kids 3 & 5yo).My girls love the swings, carrousels, playground and the marionettes. Overall an amazing place to spend a few hours while the kids run around. We loved the outdoor cafe for some crepes (and best fries i have tasted :))

The "Central Park" of Paris. Great place to relax and watch Parisians and their happy families. Me and my husband spent and afternoon there sitting facing the "chateau" and walking around. Beautiful gardens, better than the Tuileries.

great place to take a break. Just a beautiful and cool place to spend a few hours watching it.
the place is clean, quiet, nice atmosphere and walking around it gives one a sense of how wonderful people can make things. Gorgeous.

Perhaps on a warm sunny day. I went there to see the gardens, but the weather did not help at all.
It was rainy, cold and windy. The flowers were still in bloom, however when you are mostly thinking of covering yourself from the elements, you cannot really enjoy the views.

A beautiful place to relax. A quiet and beautiful place to relax! The gardens are lovely in the Springtime. Watching families with their young children enjoy a sunny day is always a pleasure. It is also fun to watch the young children sail their boats in the pond!

Beautiful and great kids playground!. Gardens are beautiful and well located. I have stayed twice near these gardens. Last time I found within the gardens (west side) a great new playground for kids. You pay about 2 euros per kid and maybe 1 euro per adult. There are other playgrounds for free towards the south side end.

Beautiful and great for kids. This was my 7 year old daughter's favorite park. Feeding ducks and pigeons, then pretty nice kids playground. This one zip lining swing type thing was all she played. Kids loved it.
A LOVELY END OF AFTERNOON. We walked by the Luxembourg Gardens, during about 2 hours. The Gardens are practically well maintained .
Beautiful and charming≤. Large well maintained and beautiful so worth a visit.Peaceful and spacious very near St Michael and the bicycle stop so to ride there on the bikes for hire is a double treat
It was beautiful to walk through despite the rain!. Really a beautiful place in the middle of the city! There were many chairs and it would be a wonderful place to sit and relax in the sun!

Perfect place among gardens to relax in Paris. These gardens in Paris are a great escape from the big city´s buzz. It is the second biggest green area in Paris, prefect for relaxing, read a nice book and enjoy the view.It is located in the Quartier Latin, in the neighborhood of Boulevard Saint Michel, close to the Pantheon.It is an oasis, full of green, beautiful gardens, a few small kiosks that sell coffee...a fountain and the beautiful Luxembourg Palace dated from the XVII century, where the French Senate operates.In the morning, lots of local people come to run in its paths, so its also an option for those who want to exercise before going to visit the city. From time to time, there is a different nice photo exhibition hanging in its fences.

Make time!. I walked briefly through these gardens with a walking tour and was disappointed in myself for leaving it until then to explore them. I didn't get to walk around the gardens properly but wished I had after a brief stroll through one part of it...its beautiful. Make a day or it and take a baguette or two ;)
Beautiful, relaxing. even though a cold wind was blowing at the time, I enjoyed my stroll through the gardens. many gardens still bloomed even though autumn was starting. Took many beautiful photos

Beautiful Even in Autumn. I hesitated to visit these gardens as I was in Paris in October. I'm glad I decided to give it a chance. The flowers were still in bloom and the grass was still green. The gardens and fountains did not disappoint -- even on a rainy day. The Luxembourg Palace graces one end of the garden.
Most beautiful garden in Paris. Take some time here when tired of the busy paris streets. Get some pastries or food from Gerard Mulot and enjoy peace and sunshine.
Beautiful!. Stunning gardens, large stately buildings and beautiful large fountains. Walked through on a warm, sunny blue sky Paris afternoon. Gorgeous!

Probably my favourite place in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are wonderfully civilised. Metal chairs painted the characteristic green are dotted all around for general usage. There are little kiosks selling coffees and ice creams, donkey rides at weekends for children, toy boats to sail in the fountain, tennis courts, boules pitches, rose gardens, a vintage carousel.There are so many small paths and quiet corners that even on the busiest days it's possible to find a peaceful spot.

Great spot for strolling through these massive gardents. A great "park" since its so immense, to stroll through on a afternoon. The architecture of the Palace de Luxembourg is well worth taking the time to explore as well as the gardens. The only thing is the palace is the home of the French senate so there is no internal access.

Kids Will Love It!. The park is beautiful, and a great place for a stroll, or a nice spot to settle in for a little reading, photography or some people watching. If you have kids, however, it's a must! I have three little ones and we've been going there the past three summers whenever we get to Paris. There's an amazing play ground, with zip-line and other unique forms of entertainment; as well as puppet show, pony rides and places to eat. One of my favorites is the old fashion sail boats...no frills or modern technology, just an antique sail boat and a stick. The kids sail them in the large central fountain and get to chase them from one side to the other.

Great Escape. Once the hustle and bustle of the city starts to wear on you and it can. Head out and pick yourself up a nice bottle of wine and the fixings for a great picnic trust me the options are endless in Paris and head over to Luxembourg Gardens one of the many gems of parks throughout Paris and my personal favorite. My favorite picnic spot is over by the Meddici Fountain where there's plenty of seating and a beautiful fountains though with all Luxembourg has to offer you can't really go wrong picnicking or playing anywhere. Don't miss the mini Statue of Liberty and 9/11 tree in the far corner. Luxembourg is a great escape from a busy day.
Just superb. Absolutely beautiful gardens. Met other travellers here who were also enjoying the late afternoon sunshine, safe and friendly, shared by tourists and locals alike.

Secret Garden. The Gardens are so beautiful and a wonderful respite in a busy day of sightseeing to gather your thoughts, recharge your batteries and appreciate the beauty of the gardens and breath in the fragrant air. A lovely way to wile away an hour or two enjoying the sunshine.
Lovely grounds. Great place to relax and watch the world go by. Bought sandwiches nearby and enjoyed lunch in the park with the locals.
Beautiful. A most beautiful place to stroll and enjoy a picnic. The perfect way to spend an afternoon just people watching or reading a book!

Beautiful to the eyes, heart full to the soul. I did not want to leave the gardens after I entered the gate.The trees were yielding fruit, the flowers were still in bloom.There were groups of young and old stretching and exercising, joggers, walkers, photographers, people sitting and talking, reading and meditating.I must have heard 6 different languages being spoken.I walked by a locked area in what I believe were bee hives. Another gated area had experimental plantings.What a great way to unwind and really relax."Next Time" I'm bringing wine and a sandwich, will sit and observe then take a nap!Sandwich a visit here between two museum visits.
Peaceful beauty. Love the Medici fountain which envelopes you. Just a beautiful place to come and get away from the hustle. Go for a walk or just sit and think.
A real taste of life in Paris. Even in Mid-October, the plants were blooming in the Luxembourg Gardens. Many families and couples enjoying the autumn Sunday afternoon.

Restful place. The gardens were beautiful. We decided to tour the Pantheon in the am then walked over to Luxumberg gardens - so refreshing and peaceful - one of our better mornings! Bring a snack, lunch, a book and enjoy the sights and sounds - a break from all the touristy things to do.
Beautiful. This garden is one of the most beautiful gardens. Be it sun shining or snow, it is very picturesque, if you can take a small picnic to enjoy the full atmosphere!

Take your time for a quiet walk. I love the Luxembourg Gardens! No matter what time of the year you go it has something beautiful to offer. Take the time to slowly meander. The flowers are so well looked after its a feast for the eyes. A great break from the craziness of Paris.
Gorgeous and very Parisian. A typical Parisian garden. Beautiful in the rain or sunshine! The park attracts a lot of attention however you can still have a relaxing time.A must see for anyone!

Beautiful Classic Paris. Beautiful and clean. Play chess in the park, jog, play grounds, there's even dance classes going on. A Café. A must visit for families, tourists, locals and like ourselves couples (so romantic).

Haven of tranquility. An beautiful and peaceful destination in the heart of Paris, allowing you to catch your breath and reminisce on the greatness of this city and the uncivilized nature of its inhabitants...

My favorite garden in Paris. We visit it every time we're in Paris.
It's especially beautiful (to me) in Autumn.
Walk along the many paths in the park and you'll be surprised to find something new every time.

Serenity in an ever changing Garden!. Having visited this garden for more than 40 years it is interesting that I never visit Paris without revisiting it. For the past several years the City of Paris has used the decorative iron fence to hold a wonderful walking photography exhibit. Currently it is a remarkable collection of world class photos of different parts of France. This spring it was devoted to the Tour de France over 100 years. Inside the park the gardening is just beautiful and well maintained. Wander through the various corners and diverse portions of the park to appreciate Parisians enjoying the various aspects with their children or look for the miniature version of the Statue of Liberty. Or, just pull up a chair and read or snooze as you soak in the history and the calm beauty of our favorite garden in Paris.
Beautiful location with scenic views. Went there with my wife. Beautiful location with scenic views. Got a fountain there near the castle. Good place to have a picnic.

Beautiful. I recently was in Paris on a business trip. In between sessions we had some time to walk around. We came across an absolutely beautiful garden with people sitting, reading, enjoying the sunshine. We later learned it was the Luxembourg Gardens. I thoroughly enjoyed our walk around the paths, and would have loved to have had time to sit, relax, and take in the beauty.
Tranquil place in heart of large city. Very beautiful and tranquil garden on the left bank. After all the hustle of seeing the crowded sights in Paris it was a restful break.

a beautiful garden. I enjoyed my day in this park, a lovely park with nice flowers everywhere, it wasn't so big, but it was really nice.. had a good time with my friend, and also in the information center at the garden.. there were some helpful ladies which helped us with the map to find some other attractions in Paris close to this garden

Don't miss out on the gardens in Paris. Anyone who visit Paris must make time to visit one of the gardens, I would suggest Luxembourg Gardens, you will miss out on something very beautiful if you don't go. It is really worth the effort and it is very conveniently located. We walked from the Notre Damme to Luxembourg Gardens.

Nice place to rest and close your eyes. Pop a seat with a coffee or pastry and just relax. It's beautiful here and the crowds have died down in the off-season. Chairs are plentiful and it's a nice place for a rest.

Always a happy place to visit. When my husband and I were in Paris in July 2013 for the finish of the Tour de France, there was a beautiful exhibit of pictures on the wrought iron fence around the Luxembourg Gardens of Tours past that was awe inspiring. There is always something going on there - FREE. We enjoyed the exhibit then meandered through the gardens. Not our first visit but always on our route somewhere and we always stop in. Love the Medici garden and fountain as well as the pool in the center of the garden where you can watch children play with sailboats. So Parisienne! The day we were there, there was a free concert so we sat for quite sometime just sipping rose and enjoying the music!!

Flowers and the original Statue of Liberty!. The Luxembourg Gardens are delightful, full of Parisians, and a wonderful break from museums and monuments. Americans should find Bartholdi's original casting of the Statue of Liberty which became a makeshift monument after the tragedy of 9/11. When we visited in March of 2002, there were notes, flowers and mementos to the memory of those lost on 9/11. Shortly thereafter, an oak tree was planted next to the statue and dedicated to the memory of 9/11--it's very moving. The park also has cafés, playgrounds, pony rides, a marionette theater, the palace which houses the French Senate and fabulous flowers.

A favorite place. On a nice day, there is no place like the Luxembourg Gardens, either for reading or simply sitting on one of the many chairs or benches or walls and watching all the different people flow by. The design of the gardens, the tree-lined walkways, the flowers and the beautiful fountains never disappoint. It also tends to be less jammed and touristy than, say, the Tuileries and at one end is cupped in the Latin Quarter with its broad range of cafes and bookstores. My husband and I picked up two lunch crepes from a hole-in-the-wall in St Germain and then sat in the sun by one of the fountains happily munching and people-watching for more than an hour. It was bliss.
Great place to unwind. Paris can be hectic in the summer but a visit to the gardens is free and relaxing. It is also a good place to go jogging if you have the time
GORGEOUS. This garden/site is absolutely beautiful. Grab a sandwich around the corner before you go and a bottle of wine and sit and enjoy the view. Plenty of seating.

daily walks, writing, and visiting. i love Luxembourg Gardens. They are two blocks from the small apartment I rent each june. It's great early in the morning to sit and write and have a decaf, or later toward evening to observe people walking their dogs, just chatting, or taking a leisurely walk.The Queens of France who circle the Gardens have always intrigued me. I enjoy their steadfastness. I can always count on them being there for me.So be sure, in your first or next visit to come to the Gardens.

Spectacular Gardern with Great Views. A walk through these gardens is so hard to describe. Places for kids to play, places for residents to sit or lay down in the lawn and relax. Flowers and plants were gorgeous and everything was so well taken care of. Be sure to have lunch and a glass of wine at the cafe (le Pavillion) in the gardens.

A peaceful spot in a busy city. It has something for everyone. You can take a break on one of the benches under the trees. Walk or run around the area. Enjoy the flowers or tree lines walk ways. There is a pond in the center where children can rent a boat and launch it. Play area for children to run. We even seen a professional bee keeping area. Many people brought picnic lunches. It was a warm day and we took a break from all the fast pace touring. We got a taxi easy when it was time to leave. It is free. If you need a little peaceful time I would recommend feeding the senses here.

Beautiful place to take a break from Paris. I stumbled upon the Luxembourg Gardens on one of my walks and ended up spending a few hours there. It is such a wonderful place to rest your feet and people watch. One of the things I love most about Paris is that there is music everywhere. They had tons of great bands playing in the park on the day I was there so it was nice to just chill out in a lounge chair and take in some amazing music. If you want to get away from the crowds and feel a bit more like a local, this is one of the places to do it.

Very beautiful, and not so full of tourists! Very parisian!. The best park of the city, especially because there aren´t as many tourists as Tuilleries.. very parisian, with amazing gardens, and views of the Pantheon. A really good place to relax and be inspired by the city.
Simply delightful!. Paris is one of the most cultured and historic places on earth! Ironically tho the people are not very cultured! They are rude and it seems they dislike tourists!

Beautiful and very inviting. The gardens were absolutely beautiful. The sun was shining and the flowers were still in bloom during our visit, which made it picture perfect. There were a lot of people just hanging out and sun-bathing. If we had more time during our visit, we would have stayed longer and joined them.

A lovely place to stumble upon. An unsuccessful visit to the Catacombs (because it was a Monday and they're closed), led to an unplanned walk down the Av. Denfert-Rochereau and the discovery of the Luxembourg Gardens.The combination of green grass, beautiful gardens, ornamental lake and large shady trees made a very hot summers day in Paris much more enjoyable than it might otherwise have been.Well worth a visit.

great place to stroll or run. We stayed a few blocks away from the Luxemborg gardens. As I am a semi-serious runner, I decided to check it out, and I was not disappointed. The gardens are beautiful, and there are a number of asphalt and cinder paths around the perimeter and winding through the gardens. There were a lot of people out on Sunday morning, and one might have thought it was a race except no one wore numbers. I think that the perimeter of the park is somewhere over a mile long, and I ran several laps in each direction on different days.I believe that the park is only open during daylight hours, and there are gates and tall fences (with spikes) surrounding it. As such, it is kept very clean and beautiful.

Nice place to relax and enjoy the gardens. We both enjoyed the gardens and just relaxing and getting away from the tourist sights, even though we are tourists. It was a nice break away from the crowds! All the flowers were still in bloom in September, and it never feels really crowded.
A Wonderful Place to Hang Out and Chill. I love everything about this park! Beautiful! Nice metal loungy chairs! A place to grab a bit to eat ( expensive!) Flowers.

A nice change from the busy city. We visited the gardens in Autumn, so it wasn't as spectacular as everyone had said, although it may have just been the season. It was a nice change from the busy city and there were lots of different areas. This would be a great park for locals, but I don't know if it was worth the long walk we had from the Notre Dame to get there. We also found it very hard to find toilets - when we found them, you had to pay to use them.It is possible that I would rate this differently if we had visited in a different season and if we had taken the metro instead of walking.

Love, love, love!!. The Jardin du Luxembourg was actually the first garden in Paris I visited 10 years ago and was a delight this time around. It was a Sunday and there was an orchestra playing in the gazebo. I loved the mini apple and pear orchard. There are plenty of paths to stroll along and many benches to just sit and relax. I packed myself a picnic lunch my last day in Paris and spent a nice couple of hours here reflecting on my wonderful trip.

Excellent "green space" in a busy city. Feel the need to be active? This is a large, multipurpose park used/visited by locals and tourists alike. People walking or running around the perimeter, having lunch in the grass, playing boules, sailing toy sailboats, admiring the gardens, fruit trees and the buildings. We also saw a group doing tai-chi in the grass under the trees. Absolutely beautiful. Food and drink are available. There are clean restrooms with toilet paper and hand dryers that cost .50 euro to use. What a lovely place.

Nice respite from busy Paris.. Lovely gardens to take a stroll on a nice day. Just wish there had been some food somewhere! We'd been walking for hours but couldn't find a vendor anywhere. Definitely worth some time to soak up the ambiance and think of the history seen in this park over the past 400 years.

nice getaway from the town. when you're here, just turn on the music on the headphones (earphones) and just sit somewhere and relax! after a long, long day it was really nice to relax here.. it's peaceful, people run, old people walk, children giggle and it's adorable.. if I ever get another chance to visit this beautiful city and if my soul ever gets lucky enough to be in Paris for at least one more time, I will definitely come back here!regards :)

very nice garden and free entrance. me and my family had a pleasant afternoon in Paris visiting the jardin du luxenburg.plenty of space, nice lake, nice flowers, good location ,a lot of chairs to seat and rest and all of this was free.

Nice place for a sunny Sunday afternoon. Park is a popular spot and easily accessible by Metro. We enjoyed an outdoor lunch that was very tasty and reasonable, and it was fun to watch all the activity. You can rent a model sailboat at the pool in the center of the park and watch it sail around the pond. Lots of fun. There are pony rides and flowers everywhere. What a delightful place to spend Sunday afternoon.
Nice..... Was a nice place to visit if you are in the area, might not make a special visit out there again though.

Just Relax. The great thing about the Luxembourg Gardens is that it is the perfect place to stop and enjoy being in Paris. Much of our visit was going to museums, the Eiffel Tower, the boat rides and of course the food. The garden was just down from our hotel - Grand Hommes and near where we would catch the public transport. The plantings and the palace that is there give it a great feel. As with any great urban park, it is a great place to stop and relax.

classic Parisian park. The Jardin de Luxembourg has something for everyone - play areas, fountains and statues, pleasant tree-shaded areas and a fantastic collection of apple and pear trees - over 600 varieties, apparently. Tip - get refreshments from the pancake kiosk by the boules court, rather than the very expensive pavilion, if your budget is tight.

Don't miss the gardens.. There are not a lot of cities in the world where you can spend a week or more as a tourist and still have so much you want to do. Paris is such a city. Once you have done the high profile tourist attractions you can take your time to enjoy the vast array delights Paris has to offer. The Luxembourg Gardens are a delightful stop, especially after a slow wander south from the left bank. Enjoy the ambience of the dappled light in summer and the sparkle from the water where young and old play with toy yachts. There are lots of statues and a stately building. You will find few nicer places in Paris to sit and rest your tired feet. One small warning. The cafe can be a very mixed experience, especially if it is busy, which it often is. The food is average for above average prices and the timeliness of the service can vary enormously. Recently I have taken to using the take away counter so my precious holiday time is not spent waiting around to make a payment long after I have finished my coffee or a meal.

Paris being Paris?. Almost as much as the Tuilleries, it is a pleasure to be in this beautiful place with its mix of gardens, locals, tourists, lovers, students and lunchers. Everyone minding their own business while doing the same things. Makes you glad to be a human being.
Relaxing Gardens. Well worth a break in your day to sit down here and have a break . Pretty quiet and not too many low life's trying to sponge money off you or sell Eiffel towers.

Get ready for the romance that is the Parisian family. Huge and beautiful and filled with families in good weather, with all manner of special ('though always quaintly French) things for the kids and their parents to do. For us adult visitors to Paris, it was in the Luxembourg Gardens that we came closest to experiencing true contentment. Wow !

Colorfull. a variety of plants, flowers, animals zoo some unusual
Few benches to sit and enjoy the view
More directions where is everything situated so you could do on your pace the visit

Amazing Garden. This is a beautiful park with amazing gardens. It is so interesting with lots of different activities or just sit in one of the many chairs looking out over the gardens or the fountain. So much still in bloom in early October and the colours were magnificent. It is like entering another world once you pass through the gates.

Go out of your way to see this one.. This garden is huge and it's easy to miss areas of the park that are most beautiful. Make sure you get to the palace area of the gardens where there is a large fountain with ducks, there are statues and a great place to take pictures. They have beautiful flowers everywhere but we almost missed this area. Bring your baguette, cheese and wine and have a picnic. Great place to people watch. Wish we could have spent more time here. It was a cold windy day who we only spent an hour or so there. There is even an area where you can play tennis. A bit further you will be in the Latin area of the city where they have some great places to eat. So glad we didn't miss this area of the city. Definitely worth going out of your way for this one.

Lovely park with attractions for children. It's a bit of a trek but so worth it. You can cross the river via Notre Dame and wander through the Latin Quarter which in itself is worth a visit for pretty shops, cafés and atmosphere. The gardens are beautiful with wide open spaces for children to riot. Check out the delightful little theatre.

Great walk. This is the first time we had to stroll around this garden after many visits to Paris. It is really beautiful, and so great to see it well used by joggers, families and tourists. The flower gardens are well worth a look

Beautiful Place to Stroll. The gardens are gorgeous. My guide told me that the themes for the plantings are planned years in advance. This is a welcome break from the many museums. The Medici Palace is worth a visit as well.
Peaceful. Place to live in!!! You need a whole day just to sit and enjoy the moment. Wish I could more time for it. A great finish point after visiting a Latin Quarter

My favourite place in Paris. This is my third time in Paris and having done the usual tourist attractions this was easily the best one I have gone to. It was very relaxing, great place to people watch, excellent if you would like to take some fresh bread and cheese and just watch the world go by. I ended up spending an hour having an entertaining conversation with a French lady in broken French, which made it even better.

To do nothing is reward enough. For Ann and I the Luxembourg Gardens are one of the 'must see' places in Paris. We just keep going back. Not for anything in particular, - just to relax and watch, I guess we always try to cram so much in while in Paris taking the time to do nothing is reward enough
Luxembourg Gardens, Peaceful. Popular place for Parisians to sit, relax, walk through the park, feed the ducks. Plucked in the middle of the city, pass through the gates and you are transformed.

Luxembourg Gardens. Nice park to spend your lunch hour in but what ever you do , do not stand on the grass . A little man will chase you off. They do have bands playing some times in the summer months.
Nice but there are nicer places to see in Paris

Excellent garden to relax and enjoy. My wife has embraced gardening in a way I couldn't have imagined.This makes all of the best gardens a must visit where ever we travel. Luxembourg is truly one of the best, given its wonderful setting and free admission. I especially like the fountains and statuary, while my wife enjoys the formal gardens and eclectic plantings.Grab a rustic lunch from a nearby deli and forget about the crowds and traffic outside. Sit back, (plenty of chairs provided) and watch the little sailboats float by. Don't forget to bring a bottle of wine and little dessert.

My Favorite Paris Jardin. When you go to Paris, you must plan to spend a day in this beautiful park. It is so peaceful, beautiful and interesting--I know of no other place like it. Do some research beforehand as there is so much to see inside the gardens including the Statue of Liberty, Medici Fountain and Musee Luxembourg--not to mention the French Senate!

A peaceful place to sit and relax. Very popular with Parisians especially those with young families. Donkey rides, and sailing ponds and the fact that people are just out enjoying themselves in beautiful surroundings. Metal chairs on which to sit back and relax are found in the Park, and a stunning building built by a husband to ensure his wife was not homesick! Visit early morning preferably.
See all the action from here. Our hotel was only a few minutes away, so we ran here and enjoyed seeing the people relaxing in the park. Lovely.

Great place to sit and rest.. This is a lovely park. In this park you can sail a toy boat (rent for something like $4 for an hour) on the pond, listen to a band, play some tennis, or just sit on a bench and watch the passing parade. Well worth the time to get away from the crush of crowds elsewhere in Paris.
So pretty.... Very pretty in all for the eyes, and to rest your feet. Heaven on earth in the middle of Paris (St Germain des Pres)...you cannot miss these gardens...

Beautiful place to relax and enjoy the view. I enjoyed people watching as the lovely gardens gave a relaxing feel. I enjoyed how there was plenty of places to sit and relax and even grab a drink or ice cream,
An unexpected treat. We did this park as a afterthought, but it was great. A really excellent (paid for) playground for the kids. Donkey rides (cost). It was just lovely.

A Walk in the Park. A lovely stroll through these beautifully kept gardens and grand stately palace. We visited in September when the weather was still warm and flowers in bloom. There are plenty of benches and areas to relax and enjoy the views.
Great place to stroll. This is a vast open garden area, with ponds and trees and formal gardens. It is a very nice place to spend a sunny afternoon.
Yup!. It's in Paris and it's a must see. The grounds are as beautiful as any and if you have a little extra time on your hands it's a great place to just sit and enjoy the beauty.
So resourcefull. I love going there in the morning when not so crowded to walk or jog around. This is the true Paris!

Sunday (or any day) in the Park. We had a wonderful afternoon in the Luxembourg gardens - they are really beautiful and give you a chance to relax after touring all day, or to observe Parisians at their most relaxed. Or just to catch your breath. And right on the subway. Add this to your itinerary!

Lovely well kept gardens. Lovely place to stroll in the morning - lots of flowers, most of the trees etc are named so you know what they are, plenty of places to sit, relax & read etc - well maintained. There's a mini Statue Of Liberty in there too which is worth finding. Lots of places to play for the kids too - although not sure if you had to pay for that. No fee to enter though.

Its a peaceful place in the middle of Paris. You really must visit these gardens! They are simply beautiful. I have seen them in the spring and that was amazing and beautiful and have now seen them in the early autumn and once again they did not fail to impress me.They have an old world feel and I could spend hours just sitting on the metal chairs and watching the people and the day roll by. I love the feeling of these gardens.Its a beautiful place with loads of charm.Great to have a break from the busy streets surrounding these gardens. I love them.

A delightful place to while away a Sunday afternoon. What a delightful garden this is, and very well used by locals and visitors alike. I loved seeing the children sailing little wooden boats on the central pond. There are plenty of spots to sit and enjoy the park and the sunshine.

Great for people watching.. Make the effort to go to Luxembourg Gardens, you won't be disappointed. Not only are these gardens beautiful but the locals all congregate, especially on weekends, and you can see how they spend their time.

Magnificent Gardens!. We visited the Luxembourg gardens and were on the edge of losing our train back to Brussels... Time passes by so quickly in such a calming environment, apart from the fact that the gardens are situated in the heart of the city.

The most beautiful gardens I have ever visited.. The centrepiece of the gardens is a beautiful pond where anyone can sail remote control boats.The flowers in the summertime are in full bloom with exquisite colours. It is a very tranquil place to rest during or after busy sightseeing. Everyone there seem to be well behaved while enjoying the beauty.

A Beautiful Place in Paris. We visited Luxembourg Gardens twice during our visit to Paris, plus my boyfriend jogged there one day as well. A beautiful place with wonderful flower gardens and fountains. We even rented a wooden sailboat to sail on Sunday. Great place to seat and relax away from the other crowded areas in Paris.

Lovely. Nice to walk through and and much quieter than the Tuilleries. Ther are some chairs available near the pond to sit an enjoy the scene. It's a nice place to cur through from one place to another.

Beautiful afternoon in the gardens!!. The gardens themselves are amazing,but what really was great was to see everyone out and enjoying them. They are easy to get around and beautiful, a perfect place to picnic and rest before more site seeing!

For any garden lover .. A must see. Beautiful garden in commercial neighborhood... A bit of solitude. Many Parisians Eating their lunch having brought thermoses of soup , coffee, sandwiches etc. Even though october still beautiful colors, brilliant combinations of colors. Well maintained, lush lawns . for veiwing not walking on yet numerous chairs and benchers for picnickers and resting, soaking up fall sun .

The #1 picnic spot in Paris. While exploring the Latin Quarters, we found a delightful open market selling all kinds of Mediterranean food that we HAD to buy and eat for lunch. The Jardin du Luxembourg was less than a km away, and the perfect place for a cliched picnic lunch. Plenty of benches, lush greenery, a public toilet in the vicinity, all the right ingredients for an enjoyable afternoon.

Excellent place for kids and parents. We stayed not far from here (10mins slow walk). It has a big playground for kids (be prepared to pay to get in) and a lovely carousel which our two little girls loved. Lovely for walks or a small run...nice to get away from the bustle of Paris for a while. Also sand pits and little slash pool (free). Best part was the puppet show in the the theatre next to the playground ...don't miss that, so quintessentially Parisian for young and old!

My Favorite Park in Paris. Each time I visit Paris, I always visit Luxembourg Gardens. You can sit here and pretend you live in Paris. It has such a relaxing feel about it, and the park is great for people-watching, as well. Autumn is an incredible time...the air is crisp, leaves change color and drift on the breeze to the ground. Truly lovely!

Peace in the heart of the city. It is always lovely to find a beautiful garden in the heart of a big city. These gardens are lovely. It is nice to see the locals relaxing around the water and enjoying the beautiful surrounds. This is such a lovely place to just walk around and enjoy the beautiful surrounds.

Just stunning. We spent hours walking around here on our last trip to Paris.
