It helped that it was a stunning day in fairness but its just so relaxing strolling around watching people sail their miniature boats in the lake in front of the main house, grabbing a crepe or hot chocolate at one of the many little trailers, watching people play tennis or play with their kids in the playground - just a people watching experience really. Worth a visit if youre anywhere near the area

Beautiful. I spent an entire morning during my solo day out in Paris just wandering all around these amazing gardens. The sculptures are beautiful and I felt very serene and happy there. If you enjoy sketching this would be a lovely place to visit.
Luxembourg Gardens. Best enjoyed in the morning, watching Paris come alive and getting some fresh air and well being before heading down into St Germain for a coffee.
Beautiful. No particularly large, but a lovely place to visit. It seems very popular, going by the number of people there when I visited. Nice place to relax or take photos.

Relaxing gardens. the only quiet place in Paris! great placer to run away from the crowded city to sit and relax in a wide open garden, very well taken care of. it is also a great place to consider a picnic.

What a stunning place!. Beautiful, serene, …. like nothing else I’ve seen pictures and thought sure it’s pretty however there’s nothing like being there. We had the Luxembourg gardens penned down as our top 10 things to see in Paris however I did not expect such serenity in the middle of the city… absolute peace. I definitely recommend this place and I could spend hours in the gardens. The only thing I’d say pack a picnic and enjoy the sunny afternoon beside the beautiful fountain, flowers and perfectly cut trees.This garden has tennis courts, basketball courts, citrus trees lion statues and countless chestnut trees.Must see when in Paris.

Do not miss this. The best!. Located just two blocks from our hotel I think we could have spent the week here. We took a picnic and ate in the park. We watched all the Parisians with their families. The gardens are stunning! Do not miss this when you are in Paris

as lovely as always. I have been to Paris three times and twice stayed nearby, but when I didn't I still went for a visit to the park. I love its simple beauty in all seasons. the statues of the Queens of France are entrancing especially if one knows who they are.

Next time have your coffee in this parc. In the center ( almost ) of huge city but you feel you are out in the country .Urban oasis full of nice flowers ,plants and a decorating Palace .You can have your coffee and or do a picnic .

So tranquil and calming. What a peaceful and calming place to sit and reflect. We had just walked down from the Pantheon and decided to walk back though the gardens, so pleased we did. After sitting a while we decided to explore the gardens, they are exquisite and immaculately kept. The flowers, statues and the avenues of trees make you feel in another world far away from the hustle and bustle of Paris city life. No wonder the students from the Sorbonne favour this place to read or relax during their lunch hour. I wish now we had brought our baguettes and coffee with us instead of eating in a nearby café.

Beautiful place to sit and relax. Wonderful setting, beautiful gardens making it all that much harder to believe that you're in a major metropolitan area. Sit and relax, stroll around and if you have children there are great play areas. Oh, don't miss watching locals playing bocci.

K & S Canada. Taking a walk through the gardens, enjoying the statutes, flowers, and little quiet area, is a gift in another wise busy city. Take the time to just wonder. YOU will be glad you did. Worth the effort.

A wonderful oasis. This is a garden in which you can sit back and sip your coffee while reading the newspaper in the morning. You can also choose to jog or do another exercise. The flowers, the palms, the statutes, the buildings... they are all magnificent. It is very quite, and you forget that you're in the middle of the City of Lights.

Serenity . Such beautiful gardens. I live the tree lines paths all over Paris, but it's so beautiful when incorporated in this park. One of the days I was there I saw a goat landscaping the grounds! I thought that was pretty cool. Overall it's so beautiful and relaxing here. Perfect for a peaceful day alone or romantic picnic.

The colors and grounds of this urban oasis are stunningly beautiful.. This is a true urban oasis located behind the Nation's Senat building in the 6 Arr. The flowers and plants will knock your socks off, both in their arrangement and colors which change with the seasons. Despite the traffic of residents, students, children and tourists, the park is always well maintained. Take a seat besides the fountain and watch the children play with their sailboats in the fountain or play in the nearby shallow pool. Have a picnic or just relax on the benches and take it all in. There are various niches with sculptures surrounding pools and both shaded and sunny areas, The paths are paved with lose small light colored gravel that presents a wonderful contrast against the flowers and green lawns.

Take some time to sit and relax with a baguette.. This is a lovely spot to slow down a bit as you rush around Paris taking in the sights. The comfy green chairs around the pond were a relaxing spot to sit eating our lunch and take in the scenery. Afterwards a walk through the gardens is nice. I think it is a must do in a trip to Paris.
Beautiful. I loved the spaciousness of the Park, the detail of the decorative pots, the layout of the gardens and the brunch!
Magnificent Gardens. This gardens are beautiful. My husband and I love walking in itWe also enjoy it because we feel peaceful..
Α pleasant surprise!!!. A very beautiful palace and lovely garden in the heart of Paris. Great place to relax, love, laugh and do not forget to be prepared for a picnic!

Beauty in a formal setting. This huge public garden is situated behind the Palace of Luxembourg, formerly part of the Palace's grounds. We sat for several hours painting the scenery and the visitors to the park. Parisians come to bask in the sun or to walk along the carefully managed, colorful flower gardens. It's a perfect people watching location.During the time we were there (on a Saturday), there were three different orchestras playing music - a popular jazz set, classical music and military march music. Each set lasted an hour with an hour break between. Food is available, but it is pricy and very average. Better to bring a sandwich or something to keep you going if you intend to stay for a long while.

Jardin du Luxembourg. One of my favorite outdoor spots in Paris is Jardin du Luxembourg. I have jogged, walked, eaten, sat, and felt positively Parisian in this garden. I have been even been asked for directions in French! The Fontaine de Medicis is my screen saver. This is a place to savor. Enjoy the Luxembourg Gardens on your next visit to Paris! The date 11/2012 is incorrect. It is the latest date offered by Trip Advisor. The Gardens are on of my first spots to visit when I have the pleasure of being in Paris. Hoping to be there soon...

Outstanding!. Relaxing and peaceful. Beautiful floral gardens. The Luxembourg Palace is just awesome filled with history. This public park has everything including pony rides, swings and a carousel. Great place to take the kids. Truly a must see.

Beautiful park, feel relaxed. The park is full of beautiful flowers and trees and statues of famous French ancient women. There are chairs for people to grab a book to read or to take a nap. Some students were drawing or running; some painters were drawing on the canvas and some people walked their dogs.Felt great to find some greenery in the city centre.

Relaxing stroll. This place is gorgeous! There's not that many people when we went there on a weekday morning which made us appreciate the beauty of the garden more. It was quiet and peaceful. A number of people lounging around had luggages with them so it's a nice place to hang around while waiting for check-in to accommodation or trip.

A lovely space to walk, enjoy a picnic lunch and watch people. So unexpectedly lovely. Bought food at a local fast food/bakery after seeing at least 10 people with bags of food from there. Sat in the park for hours enjoying a beautiful garden, folks playing tennis and little kids with boats in the pond. Lovely.

Sunday Afternoon. If you really want to get the full feel of the gardens, visit on a Sunday. The gardens will be bursting with activity from boats in the pond to pony rides.It is a lovely garden to walk through and you will get many happy photos. Plenty of children with their parents having a great time.Start by buying an ice cream, there are public toilets available they cost 50 cents.Take a book, relax on a chair or say hello to someone, it is a very happy atmosphere.

Beautiful garden. This garden is just so lovely. I love walking through it or just hanging out. Always make sure I go here a couple of times each trip. It's great too the amount of movable chairs they provide for those who just want to stop and rest whilst admiring the park.

Calm and beauty. Often visit the park on school pickup. A beautiful place of calmness exquisitely laid out. Great care is taken in maintaining it and nothing is left to chance. Very interesting horticultural displays like espaliering of fruit trees and a large beehive collection. One of the calmest parts of the City.

One of the Nicest Place to see and be seen. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful and on a nice day are among the choicest spots to see and be seen. Close to the Pantheon, and chill left bank haunts. Sail a boat in the pond, play tennis sit on a bench and read a book
Lovely. Beautiful for a stroll or lounge around in the chairs. The trees and plants were lovely. No walking on the grass though!

Stunningly beautiful, a great place to wile away the hours. I spent over half a day wandering though the gardens on a recent trip to Paris with my 8 year old daughter. My daughter also played for about 2 hours in the childrens playground while I sat on a bench, drank coffee and daydreamed. I just loved this place, it is so beautiful and so well maintained. Like many places in Paris, the gardens and landscaping are very grand and opulent with huge fountains, statues, columns and monuments, everywhere you look it is a feast for the eyes. We were blessed to be here on a warm and sunny September day and although the park was full of people, there was a certain tranquility and relaxed feeling that was just magical. I love how this park is full of chairs that you can just plonk yourself into, stretch out and people watch to your hearts content. The playground was fabulous; large, shady and fenced off with a reasonable entrance fee. My daughter was so upset to have to leave the playground and make our way back to our hotel, she could have stayed for hours and hours more and frankly, if I wasn't catching a train out that evening, I would have been happy to stay too.

Great for people watching. This was a nice spot to stop and enjoy and sandwich while watching the world go by. Garden is beautiful and plenty of benches and chairs. No rush, just sit back and enjoy the view.

Beautiful!. Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful and relaxing spot in Paris. We went on a sunny and warm Sunday afternoon in September 2013. There's gardens, walking paths, rest rooms, refreshment stands, playgrounds and even pony rides for the kids. There are chairs for just sitting and a large fountain for pushing around little sailboats which you can rent.

How did I miss this?. I have been lucky to travel to Paris a few times. A friend of mine recommended the Luxembourg Gardens and I'm so glad she did. So relaxing and very beautiful. Very well maintained and a great place to relax and read a book.

A real Parisian Experience. We just loved this park. First it is huge (60 acres) and has so much to offer: tennis, kids' playland, gorgeous statues including a replica of the Statue of Liberty presented after 9/11, bocce ball courts, pony rides, pond, etc. etc. Tons of chairs throughout the park where the locals just sit and relax and read or rest. WOW, what a change from all the hustle and bustle of this huge metropolitan city.You are not allowed to walk/sit on the grass except for one area. We had sufficient room to plunk ourselves down and have a picnic and short nap. It was a glorious day and we so enjoyed watching the locals, many with their families. Lots of small children so well behaved playing with their parents or other small kids nearby.When we got up and walked around again (about 5 p.m.) we were just enthralled in all the activity going on around us. These were mostly NOT tourists so it was great joy to observe them. Very few cell phones and no electronics for the kids. They were simply playing and well behaved.Flowers were gorgeous. Everything about the place was joyful. We left finally, with big smiles and a real appreciation for Parisians and how they enjoy themselves.

Flowers, sun, and a bottle of wine. These gardens were absolutely beautiful. Everything was in full bloom, the grass was green, kids were playing, and parisians were enjoying lunch, reading a book, and just soaking it all in. I grabbed a sandwich, a bottle of wine, and joined them. I can't think of a better place to unwind and relax in Paris. If the weather is nice, this is a must-visit!

Green, flowers, water basins where children play with their sailboats ..... A beautiful garden with green spaces and flower beds, inconspicuous statues, children playing with their little sailboats floating on the water ponds. This is a great place for what the Parisiens call "flaner" - just walk for the sake of walking and appreciating your surroundings, no particular destination in mind.

WOW. I can't believe I didn't come to the Luxembourg Gardens the first time I went to Paris. It was incredibly beautiful and worth the few hours to hang out there! I highly recommend going to a Nicolas wine store or even a Monoprix to pick up a bottle of wine, some ups, a baguette and some cheese. It was one of the most magical days on the entire 17 day European vacation!

Great place to people watch. The gardens are gorgeous and each area is demarcated for a purpose, tennis, dog walking, playground, quiet area etc. There is a fabulous pond where you can rent sailboats and race them around - our "twenty something year old kids" loved it...and so did the younger kids we saw there...There are chairs to sit and relax and contimplate the beauty of Paris. What a great spot.

The Extensive Garden of Paris. Although we have been many times over the years, we went again today. It just gets better and better - by a lot this time in our view!We went at about the same time two years ago and the garden was alive by comparison - even taking into account the interesting summer weather that France/Paris has had this year.The extensive trees and gardens are a given, but the orchard, especially the espaliered apple trees, and the colour and texture combinations in the floral displays were extraordinary. Well done the Parisians - keep it up!The maintenance was first rate especially the arbors and pathway edging. The burner use was fascinating to the uninitiated.

Relaxing in the Luxenbourg. Met friends who are also from Canada and we spent a beautiful and relaxing afternoon here. This is my favourite park in all of Paris. Young people, older people, families, lovers, everyone was connected to the park and enjoying their time reading, sleeping, talking, playing, eating...it's a reflection of how the French know how to enjoy life. Sit by the Medici Fountain and give it a try.

Beautiful spot in Paris. Very nice garden/park to spend some time while in the city of lights. It is located in the Latin Quarter. The Luxembourg Palace, the home of French Senate, is located there. We enjoyed sitting by the nice fountain in front of the Palace and watched kids playing with sailboats. We took very nice photos there.

Our favorite spot in Paris. Grab some meat,bread and cheese and go here and enjoy the flowers and the fountain and have lunch. beer and pop are available in the concession stands. We had so much fun we went back twice. There is a tube stop right in front of the gate. best of all it is free. Watch the kids sail boats on the weekend in the fountain pond. Just a beautiful spot to rest and reflect.
Bring a picnic.. Beautiful place to have breakfast or lunch al fresco. Very popular with students and workers at lunch time so great for people watching! Very well maintained.

An oasis of tranquility in the heart of Paris. A restful peaceful place where one can sit and enjoy the beautiful gardens and setting. The colours and blooms of many different types of flowers and plants only add to the beauty of the gardens and one can sit by the Octagonal lake and while away time. The Fontaine Medicis is also worth a visit.
Shouldn't miss Luxembourg garden. Worth your time strolling through this magnificent garden. Sit on the chair provided next to the awesome fountain while enjoying a cup of hot coffee.
Where the locals go. Worth a visit and good for people watching. Lots of Parisian people hanging out. Fun to see the little kids with their sailboats.

Wish we had more time to spend here. This was one of the prettiest spots in Paris. Would have spent much more time here if we had checked it out earlier in our trip.Grab a bottle of wine and a blanket and enjoy this beautiful spot!

Nice but not very pleasant scent. The park is quite pretty and you can find lots of benches, chairs or areas to sit and relax. However, while strolling through some of the floral areas, we did experience some unpleasant scents like manure.

My favourite garden in all of Paris!. Love the beautiful greenery and flowers. Such beautiful landscaping. There is such a variety of things to do here (sit and people watch, jog, play chess, watch kids float their sailboats at the fountain, enjoy a picnic). I love this oasis. It gets you away from the hustle and bustle of the big city and you can sit and relax with a book and read. Because the sun is setting earlier now, the guards usher people out by 715pm. It usually happens around dusk when they close up the gardens. Too bad :(

Visiting Luxembourg Gardens is always a good idea.. Whether summer, fall, spring or winter we always enjoy walks through Luxembourg Gardens. In summer through fall the flowers and gardens are spectacular. It is fun to watch families--particularly those with young children, the toy sail boats on the reflection pond, people jogging or just walking. Very relaxing.

Love This Place. Luxembourg Gardens is a must stop for us on each trip. Particularly good in September as it is in full bloom and full (but not too full) of locals enjoying their city. Much more relaxing for us than the Tuilleries, which are also good.

Just wonderful. This as many out door spaces here in Paris gives one a place to relax or play games with others is like mind. It is a pretty spot and just a nice place to stroll through or sit and watch the world go by.

Beautiful. Just gorgeous landscaped gardens with central pond and fountain. Lovely cafe to people watch. Luxembourg palais is impressive too. Come on the weekend to relax, watch the children playing with their boats and listen to a brass band in the central gazebo
Really enjoyed.. Such an oasis in busy Paris. We really enjoyed wandering around and taking in the views, people watching etc.
Lovely to stroll through. Wandered through here on our way back from the pantheon, well presented and a great place to rest and relax for a while.

best week end leisure. We wakled through the gardens in Saturday morning, very nice, a orchestra was playing classical music, all the area from the gardens, to saint germain BD to the musee dorsay became the best place in Paris. A lot of small streets with galleries and designer shops, best coffee and restaurants , heaven!
A great way to spend a Sunday. It has everything a Gardens should have and more. We sat at the restaurant and ate lunch while listening to the music from the bandstand, perfect.
Gorgeous!. Even in the rain, this is a must see. Really enjoyed watching the children and their families playing together in the park. Bring a picnic and stay!

Do NOT Miss!. Even if you only have time to stroll through on your way to another sight - go there! If you can make time to wander and even sit and relax for an hour, do. It's so lovely. A great people-watching spot, too. Bring a picnic lunch and sit down for a while taking in the luxury of the grounds. A terrific respite during your travels.
Beautiful Place. Free and a nice walk in a beautiful spot. The gardens are well maintained and pleasant. There is a nice cafe as well if you want to sit and relax.
Just wow. The feelings you get when you stroll in this park cannot be measured. It's amazing. Perfect place to chill.

Beautiful gardens, lots of seating. . .. Nothing beats the Luxembourg Gardens on a beautiful day in Paris. The landscaping is absolutely beautiful, there are various ponds, shaded areas, open areas, tennis courts, etc - something for everyone. What I appreciated were the multiple benches and seats, so it was not difficult to find a place to relax and put your feet up. The Gardens attract families and couples, but I also saw many older women reading their books under the shade of the trees, etc. This is a perfect place to relax when the weather is good. I highly recommend a trip to the Luxembourg Gardens if you are in the area. It is about a 10 minute walk south of Blvd Saint Germain. I imagine, however, that the Gardens would not be so pleasant in the winter nor in the rain - in that case I would probably say that a visit is not mandatory.

Splendid. Don't miss Luxembourg gardens, a splendid, must see in Paris. A relaxing setting for a stroll, enjoy the French and English gardens. A great place to walk off your delightful Parisian pastry.Lots of activity in the park, glad we made the time to visit.

Great place for a picnic. We were headed to the Cattocombs but the line was so long we skipped that tour and headed here instead. What a great diversion. The gardens, and fountains were unbelievable and there was live music playing on the day we went. Had we known this was going to be such a great place to relax we would have planned a picnic here. Next time it's on our list. While you can't get into the palace, a garden stroll is worth going to see, and the best part--it's free!
Splender in the Garden.. Relaxing and beautiful! Delightful flowers and fountains. Have coffee and enjoy the people watching and serenity of the gardens.

Paris' most beautiful garden. Nothing could be better than spending a Sunday afternoon at Luxembourg Gardens. Thousands of Parisiens agree. This park is huge and has so many facets: floral displays, statuary, benches and chairs, fountains, tennis courts, boules areas, children's playgrounds, an outdoor restaurant, pony rides, a huge pond with boats for children to play with, and the beautiful Palace to behold. This is my favorite place in Paris.

Not just a park. One of our favourite places to visit. Step into the park and marvel at the range of activities for all ages and interests. Perambulate the tree-Iined walks towards the magnificent and historic palace and take one of the hundreds of available seats to a place of your choice to rest in sun or shade; snooze or watch Paris at play. The sporting opportunities include a running track around the inner periphery; tennis courts; football and basket ball areas used by local schools; very well equipped childrens adventure playgrounds; roundabout; toy sailboats for hire and use of the large fountain basin by families with model ships of all types;well used petinque courts; chess tables and willing players. For the horticulturalists there are flower beds to gladden the eye and a large collection of apple and pear specimens with every type of cultivation demonstrated. An apiary is a demonstration site for courses held in the adjacent gatehouse which is used for diverse activities. The park is home to many outdoor sculptures and houses international and local art exhibitions. There are places to eat and drink and clean, staffed toilets. We never come to Paris without visiting this old friend and we take a new memory away each time.

Luxembourg Gardens. Interesting to see such formality in a garden, however it is also able to be used and people can sit on the grass in certain areas. There is also plenty of seats to sit and relax on and places to buy cheap food. The flowers here are simply amazing and with the beautiful vistas in many directions, statues, vases, ponds and fountains, a very beautiful and serene place to visit. Lovely to see the joy people were getting from the tiny sailing boats. My only criticism was having to stand in a long line to use the toilet which I also had to pay for. I don't know what the disabled do in this instance? Also the woman who was taking the fee for the toilet practically threw me my change and was clearly angry about having to give me 50p change from 1 Euro. Where I come from, we do not have to pay for toilets so this part is a culture shock. Overall, a very enjoyable visit and worth seeing.
For Families or couples. Great grounds laid out so you could walk, jog, sail boats on the pond etc. Nice palace open to the public. Plenty of space despite it being such a popular place.

Not much to see. If you're looking for a lot of gardens, this isn't the place. It did have flowers around a fountain and a lot of shady trees with chairs to sit either in the sun or in the shade. It was mostly sandy ground around one fountain.

So much space. YOu'd never believe you were in the middle of a large city. The gardens are a place of tranquility in a never quiet city. It's huge...bigger than Central Park with many activities going on. The day we were there a movie was being filmed at the carousel.

True Parisian Garden. We came here in a nick of time. 15 minutes just to enjoy the park before it closes at 9pm.
The garden is so beautiful, it will be at its grandest at autumn.
Will definitely going back here to enjoy it at its finest.

Beautiful - all times of year. With Fall and then Winter fast approaching it is a good time to remind people that beautifully laid out gardens are exceptional spaces at all times of year. With an attraction as popular as Luxembourg Gardens, the colder months may be an even better time to go and appreciate the lines and forms of the garden. With the French love of tree-pleaching on full display in the Fall and Winter, visitors can see the structure and bones of the formal side garden and still appreciate all the greenery of the less-formal English park part of the garden - this evergreen oasis section of the park tends to be less-crowded too. I don't think you can visit a city and appreciate everything about it without also seeing its public greenspaces.

Great place to grab so lunch and sit for an hour. We had been walking around all morning so we grabbed a couple of Panini's and went and sat around the lake. There were a numberOf people doing the same thing catching a few rays, quite a lovely area these type of parks are so needed in our big cities

nothing spectacular. this is just another garden palace with spread out lawns, sculptures here and there scattered, peaceful, serene but highly touristic. There are much better examples of garden palaces all around Europe than Luxembourg, even the Versailes palace is much better.

Gorgeous!!!. We did not plan on going to the gardens, when we walked in we we so surprised!!! Amazing green green grass, beutiful flowers, chairs to sit on, lots of activities for kids including go cart racing.I would def recommend these gardens!
Calm and well maintained. A lovely garden with lovely tea rooms. The coziness under the gazebos when it rained was pleasant with all the people playing board games and reading.

The best gardens in Paris. Relaxing and beautiful gardens to wonder around, on Sunday's they are especially fun! The streets around the gardens are also very nice - check out Rue Bonaparte with all the small boutiques and Pierre Herme

The Luxembourg Gardens is a must see for gardeners.. The last few times we've come to Paris, we always spend some time strolling through the Luxembourg Gardens. This year, we went through an area we had not discovered yet. It was really impressive. So much enjoyment seeing the beautiful plants as well as observing people of all walks of life. Fascinating.

Amazing spot. The gardens were absolutely amazing.. In the beginning we did not plan visiting them but i read some suggestions that it is worth seeing. I wasnt disapointed, just contrary these were the best gardens i seen.. The grass is so green ", flowers are everywhere. Great place to relax and take a break from beautiful Paris :)

One the best in Paris. We walked in, and with great surprise the green carpet were better than any other time. U very relaxing corner in the core of Rive Gauche.My Best advice. Get a snack and have a pic-nic lake fountain side.

Spectacular. Remind you this is not Versailles, but LXG is a fantastic experience. The color was in perfect bloom and we had a wonderful sunny Sunday so the park was full of life. HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you enjoy love flora and a peaceful setting to read, picnic and to enjoy your company.

Beautiful. Very beautiful to seat in some chair to take a rest in the middle of a long walk visiting places. You can also buy something to eat on many places that exist near (like subway, etc) and eat there.

Urban oasis. Very nice park. Smaller than we expected for such a famous place, but very relaxing place to just chill out and people watch. Not a ton to do there, but it's a nice break from the concrete jungle. Lots of places to sit and soak it in, and even though there were lots of people, it didn't feel crowded because there was actually space to accommodate them all. I wish that were true of the rest of Paris! Seems to be lots for kids to do, although we don't have kids. A bonus, they opened an Angelina's at the entrance to the museum at the north end of the park, and it was very accessible, friendly, and not at all busy. You can get your world-famous hot chocolate to go there and enjoy it in the park without the wait of the downtown location.

What a beautiful amenity. A large, sprawling garden encompassing a fountain, lush gardens, tennis courts, a basketball court, a running track and chairs everywhere for people to soak up the sun and take in the views. There are also a few quaint outdoor cafes that I hope to check out whilst here.Beautiful statues dot the property, including a replica of the Statue of Liberty given to France by the creator of the original in New York.Additionally, the Senate building is there which is stunning building to look at in and of itself.I highly recommend checking out the gardens if you are in the are.

A wonderful find. My first time in Paris and this spot was a hidden gem not originally on my itinerey. Our tour guide Jonathon of Riviera Travel showed us parts of Paris because it was a Sunday places that would may not be have been as accessible during a day in the week.On our free time my friends and I decided to go on our own and what a wonderful surprise. The palace which is now the Paris Senate is a beautiful building within the gardens of which were well designed and manicured. Local people relaxing with their families and students studying on the free chairs. A children's play park. an orangerie where they have very many rare species of apples and pears which are protected by bags over them. As I have been fortunate to have been to New York and seen the Statue of Liberty there is a small version of this icon in the gardens. Also the original is on one of the bridges in Paris.Difficult to find but it is on the outer pathway in between the Palace and the orangerie.

Beautiful Place to Spend a Few Hours. This is a very user friendly park. There are lots of benches and the flowers are amazing. Find a vendor outside making sandwiches and bring it in to the park to enjoy a totally relaxing lunch.
Gorgeous!. It's everything a garden should have and more! What a pleasure to walk through, sit in, eat in and just view on a sunny September day, or any day for that matter. Great neighborhood too!

Peaceful Stroll through Beautiful Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens were really lovely, with large numbers of flower beds that were prolific with flowers. The park was a wonderful place to stroll for a peaceful few hours to get away from the hustle and bustle. As like many othes, we had a picnic lunch on the grounds. It is wonderful to visit on a busy day to see how many Parisians of all ages take advantage of this park, older couples, joggers, and young children.
Very Beautiful. The fountain was very beautiful also. The gardens are kept so well.Such a relaxing walk around the Gardens

Beautiful park!. I really enjoyed looking at the kids playing with the boats at the fountain, and also a very nice place to go for a walk in the afternoon. If you want to go with wine and dips, i will recommend another park like Champs de Mars because Luxembourg is managed by the French Senat so its very secured and not the best is what you want is drink at a park! A beaufitul park that you must see in paris though!
Beautiful Gardens. Loved the gardens and was very relaxing in this area. Alot of people around and had a nice atmosphere.

The best!. Just the place to go everyday and just sit and people watch for hours! We go often and enjoy the flowers, pond and especially on Sunday when families are abundant and so are the boats on the pond. Just wandering and the find a new place to sit to view it all. Truly Paris!

A stunning escape in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Spent about half an hour in Luxembourg Gardens before departing the city to return to Dublin. It was a beautiful warm afternoon in September and we enjoyed two ice creams whilst taking in the beautiful surroundings. The park was packed with people, from the very old to the very young. One man 'played' at the edge of the lake with his remote-controlled yacht. It was a lovely sight to see as it slid across the lake leaving a mark behind it in the water. The absolute essence of tranquillity - even the ducks didn't mind the yacht. They seemed to know it didn't mean them any harm. Beautiful flowers, trees and shrubs adorn the park and there are ample chairs which can be moved around to suit wherever you want to sit. It was a lovely end to a wonderful few days in Paris. Do search the park out if you are visiting the city, it is very well worth it.
Relax. One of the fascinating gardens suitable for relaxation in Paris. Here is a copy of the statue of liberty. Make sure to take the time to sit and enjoy the tranquility and beautiful views.

Amazing Atmosphere. My wife and I packed together a little picnic and sat in the park while people watching and enjoying Parisian foods for nearly 3 hours. An absolute beautiful setting where you can take in locals playing Pétanque, renting a toy boat for the pond, or simply getting in their daily jog. Wonderful Paris spot.
Different Paris. Here you feel like you're in Cote-d'Azur: same-style Palace, palms, people just sit there and relaxNear you can find plethora of book stores and take a glance at Sorbonna University

hidden gem in paris. good place to breath some fresh air but a bit too small for a city like Paris. not a good time to visit in Autumn simply bc most trees turned yellow and a bit chill walking inside

Stunning and relaxing. This park is one of the most beautiful parks I have been to. And people love to come visit it, sit on the green Paris signature chairs and hang out with their friends. So relaxing and beautiful.

not to be missed. on business, a couple or even alone, don't miss this spot it will provide the calmness you need while enjoying magnificent scenery and people all around you if you care to meet people and chat. right across the pond standing tall, a beautiful the Luxembourh palace renders an even better scenery

Weather permitting - FANTASTIC. Wow. I really don't know what to say about this one. Gorgeous buildings, sensational topiary and well kept flower-beds/grass. Free chairs and loungers in abundance around the various water features. What's more, there was a band playing in the bandstand on the Saturday we visited. If you want to take the wait off your feet or simply enjoy a nice treat from the Boulangerie then this is THE place to do it. So relaxing and cute to see all the children playing with their sailing boats.

Lovely way to spend Sunday. A lovely park and gardens. Not the most dynamic gardens I have seen but love all the activities going on, the boats in the pond, Luxembourg Tennis, basketball, playground and band playing. There is plenty of space to find a seat and relax. Well worth seeing.

Gardens in the sun. Never thought about going here which are located next to the Senate building. It was a very nice park/gardens and has lots of seats which are placed strategically by lawns and other areas. I guess lots of people visit these in summer. Next door is the Senate which we didn't have time to visit. The Pantheon is only 5 minutes walk away from here.

a hidden gem in Paris. our hotel was walking distance, and we just wanted to sit down after a long day at the museums. We got some wine, some cheese and bread and headed to this beautiful park. It's clean, peaceful, very well kept and romantic. Now when in Paris we try to make a point of going there with each visit. Loved it!!

nature in the heart of paris. paris is the place to do tourism, and it offers attractions for all tastes, and of course, for those who enjoy sitting under a tree and read a book this is where you have to go!

Wander, sit, relax, repeat.. Luxembourg Gardens is such a gem. It is huge park with so much to do and see but also to take advantage of the Paris park chairs and just sit and people watch with no shortage of characters.The gardens has beekeeping, amazing horticultural displays, statuary, tennis courts, children's play areas, walking and jogging paths, a museum, gorgeous fountains (seek out the Medici), sailboats to play with in the basin, boules to play or watch, a lovely cafe, sometimes live music, chess players and more.Take time on a Sunday when Paris slips into low gear and take in the park with the rest of the city's gracious residents.
A secret garden!. Tucked away 40 mins wlak from the 'sites' this is a wonderful, peaceful escape .... great if you like to 'jog'
still have flowers in autumn. this garden is really really beautiful and mesmerizing..very good neighbourhood..enjoy reading and picnic here :D it is one of my favourite place in Paris

Gorgeous place to relax and enjoy the beauty of Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful place to spend some time enjoying Paris. The gardens are lovely and a great place to people watch on the weekend. The flower gardens are just lovely and frame the palace beautifully. We plan to return during our stay with a picnic lunch :-)
Great spot to wander an picnic. Clean well kept gardens and architecture. Nice slow pace.Gardens are well attended. Lawns are well maintained.
Good but there are better. This park gets crowded quickly and if you want a relaxing time with someone go to less known parks where locals live and enjoy those.

My kids favorite playground and park. During our time in Paris we repeatedly visited the playground in the lovely Luxembourg Gardens. Located in the southerrn part of the park, the private play ground has a 2.50 Euro entrance fee per child and a lesser fee for adults. My 5 and 7 years old went in by themselves so I never paid. I watched from outside the park fence, sipping a cafe, with all the other mamans and peres. Kids quickly make friends with other children and have a wonderful time engaging in many languages, especially on the zip-line, the likes of which my kids had never seen in a NYC play ground. The playground also had a couple of great self-propelled merry-go-rounds and a giant rope web for climbing, among other wonderful play feature. There is also a small W.C. inside the playground, which can come in very handy.Beyond the playground, the gardens themselves are wonderful for kids to explore with lots of hidden nooks and crannies with statues and fountains. One day we also caught the puppet show in the theater near the play ground, which was charmingly old school and made me happy to have spent the money to support such a rich tradition. And no visit would be complete without sailing boats on the large central fountain. Have a crepe and call it a great day in Paris.
Beautiful!. This garden is a really nice place to have a picnic if oh are with friends. It is absolutely beautiful and right next to the exit of the metro so easy to get to. Check it out!
Gorgeous Gardens. Very pretty gardens with lots of relaxing areas to sit on the very comfortable chairs which are provided.

One of the most beautiful gardens!. I adore Luxembourg Gardens. The flower displays are stunning year after year. There are plenty of chairs for lazing in the sun and benches for sitting in the shade under the trees. You can rent a tiny sailboat for the pond, watch people play tennis or basketball, and further along behind the children's play area are the teams of boules players and more benches & chairs for watching the games. The Guignol is a novel experience for visitors, both adult & children, and there is always something going on along the main entrance walk into the garden. Immediately outside the entrance during summer is one of the best ice cream stalls in the city...dozens of flavors, too...and inside the park there are two cafes. The one closest to the entrance I prefer as a tearoom. Waiters can be rude (worse here than elsewhere in the city IMO) and tricky, ie I've had them put off taking our order until right AFTER the time for serving food has passed. The other cafe on the other side of the pond, back by the basketball courts and the children's play area, is more casual and this summer had lovely friendly waitstaff. The food used to be better, more French, than it was this year but, although expensive and catering more to touristic tastes, for what it is, it is still very edible. There is so much to see in this park I can't possibly detail it here but suffice to say whether you are interested in trees and flowers, sculpture, games, a stroll or a lazy afternoon reading in the sun, this is the place to for you. Of course there is the excellent Luxembourg museum attached to the park as well, but like most museums in Paris it is open only on certain days, so be sure to check it out first.
Great park. In September, the gardens were still great, nice place to relax, make sure to see the Médici fountain
Oasis of gardens in the middle of Paris. Lovely open space with plenty of tendered gardens and water features. Seats were provided which was a welcome rest from all the walking!
Gorgeous!. A beautiful garden to wander through or pause for pictures. Get there early - the museum was closed around 5.
nice stroll. The flowers and art in the park were very well maintained and it was a nice stroll. The palace was not open for tourists while I was there but it is beautiful.
Visit in September. As colorful as a garden can be. The gardens were at their peak. If you want a restful spot to relax, this is it. C'est magnifique!
Beutiful, Sweet Garden. We walked here on a sunny afternoon. The kids were sailing their sailboats and the flowers were in bloom. Don't miss this spot

So beautiful. These were my favourite gardens that ive ever been to! Stopped and had an espresso overlooking the Parisians living their life and it made for a fantastic relaxing afternoon. Just gorgeous...

Stunning. Cheap Paris hotels may not be up to scratch however you can sit in these gardens for free!
Add some food and wine from one of the many markets or even local stores, amazing (in summer)

Beautiful. Such a wonderful place to walk through, have a picnic, jog through, there is a beautiful water fountain hidden away in a corner, the only reason I saw it was because I was curious as to why someone was taking photo!s, make sure you find it!
Pretty (busy). Very nice gardens with a lovely chateau and water features. Plenty seats if you want to rest. Popular and easy to get to. Not as big as you may expect

Surprisingly beautiful!. We visited the gardens because it was close to a few other sights we were seeing. After seeing the Jardin of Tuileries and not being impressed, we didn't think Luxembourg Gardens was a must see. Boy were we wrong! It was not only beautiful with the landscaping, flowers, etc but you almost escaped into another Parisian world with the palm trees and green space. You could tell many of the people sitting in the grass with friends or relaxing on a bench were Parisians. I was so glad we ended up seeing the gardens - I only wish we had had time to sit and enjoy the wonderful scenery. Next time!
Great relaxation spot in Paris. A great place to kick back and relax after a hard day of exploring Paris. All walks of life in the park, especially when the weather is nice
Ahhhh, green space in a city.. They are lovely and a welcoming place to sit an people watch on a warm, sunny (or cloudy as the case may be in Paris) day. Relaxed atmosphere to just stop and rest.

Another must see place in Paris. great palce to relax after walking around the city, buy some baguete or quishe in the near bistro where you see students and spend few hours in this beautiful garden, get new energy and watch the parisiens... you will lern another lesson about this great city

Even in the rain!. I was staying less than a mile from the gardens so decided to incorporate it in my morning run on my first full day in Paris. It was miserable weather but the beauty of this place shone through. There were people under cover reading poetry (well ok just reading but my romantic mind imagined it to be poetry) and people in the gardens doing Thai chi and meditating. The gardens are in very good order clearly maintained to a high standard. A beautiful place to spend and hour or two and was so many of the things I hoped Paris would be.

A very nice place for a light lunch. The Luxembourg Gardens is a great place for a light lunch if you have the crepes. If you order the ham and cheese, it won't be light...actually, it's enough for two people. The garden is lovely and full of people when the weather is nice. A must see if this is your first trip to Paris.
Beautiful place. One of the most beatiful places in Paris, the gardens are very impressive and there goes the real parisian people to have a walk or a conversation

Cherchez La fontaine Médicis. The French have such sensuality and savoir faire but they also love strict geometry and rigid rules in their gardens. Still this is a lovely place to stroll. And they make up for the rigidity with some outrageous sculpture. We were astonished and delighted by La fontaine Médicis - a romantic over the top expression of a gigantic Cyclops coming upon his sea-nymph lover in the arms of a human. This alone is worth your half a day in the Garden.
Gorgeous gardens. One of the most beautiful places we visited in Paris. We really enjoyed our walk through the gardens and even though it began to rain while we were there it was still wonderful.

Most beautiful gardens in Paris. I have now had the pleasure to stay near the garden on two occasions now. It Autumn at the moment, the flower are still in full bloom grass is green and lush and every man and hid dog are walking running, or of to work in the mornings, at great place to get the feel of Paris. If I lived here I would have to come here every day
Tranquility in Paris!. Peace and serenity, excellent city park with lots of photo opportunities, especially around the lake - yes get the Eiffel Tower in background.
Stunning - simply stunning. This has got to be the Rolls Royce of parks. Just go and see for yourself. Never mind the sheer size, it's beautiful.

Beautifully maintained and worth the trip. A stroll through this historic and beautiful garden is worth at least an afternoon in Paris. We spent a few glorious hours and took numerous photos. Take a picnic lunch, plenty of places to spread out and relax.

My favourite gardens in Paris. After visiting many gardens in Paris, I can safely say that the Luxembourg Gardens are my favourite. A lovely place to relax and people watch for a while away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I love sitting around the main fountain watching the toy sailing boats that can be hired there. There are also many beautiful statues and walkways throughout the gardens. There is no better way to spend an hour on a Sunday evening in the sunshine. I will definitely stop by here every time I am in Paris. Also, the Luxembourg metro stop is just outside the gardens so they are easily reached from anywhere in the city.
Great garden. Went here yesterday and it was a great relaxing place there are many sights nearby and not a lot of tourists. I Highly recommend this spot

Would have given a higher rating if not for the park police stopping people from sitting on the grass. After hours of walking in Paris, we decided to buy some cheese, bread, and pastries and go for a relaxing picnic at the luxembourg gardens. We picked a nice shady spot on the grass and settled in for the afternoon. After 20 minutes some nearby friends were told by the park ranger that you were not allowed to be on the grass so we had no choice but to pack up and leave. A shame really as there are heaps of grassy fields in this park that are unusable and the seats by the palace are uncomfortable and in direct sunlight.

Go on a Sunday. The gardens are a wonderful place to relax and feel "Parisian" on a sunny Sunday afternoon. We love going and sitting around the main fountain and watching all the young children have fun. It is relaxing and beautiful. On the east side of the park, there is great ice cream place on your left just as you exit the garden.

Beautiful gardens, but horrible dust!. This is the thing I hate about Paris parks: there is dust everywhere. The combination of heat and dust resulted in a serious rash on my legs which annoyed me during my entire stay. Please, dear Paris, replace the dust with green areas!Coming back to the gardens, they are wonderfully taken care of, filled with lots of trees and flowers, there is also a mini-lake and, of course, the Senate with its beautiful architecture. Do come here for a lovely quiet stroll, but make sure you wear long trousers if you have a sensitive skin!

Perfect. Would recommend seeing these gardens on a lazy day... they are perfect for those who would like a little "faire du promenade" (sorry, my French is awful), people watch, tree watch, sky watch or just nap. Loved this park...

less crowded than Tuileries. A perfect place for relaxation: shady alleys, spacious open areas, fountains and gorgeous flower-beds. The gardeners seem to prefer red and violet colour pattern which looks festive. You can rest on a bench or a chair, which are everywhere in Paris, very convenient, you know. A lot of people were jogging and riding bikes, but the garden looked so peaceful, so restful, we made ourselves comfortable and enjoyed Paris twilight. And it seemed less crowded than Tuileries Gardens, too!
Nice and ok. Very nice gardens, but nothing special. Not really big place with a lot of people. Luvre gardens are more beautiful.

Beautiful gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are a lovely area to walk, stroll, run, sit, relax, talk, picnic, read, nap or just enjoy the perfectly manicured gardens. The flowers were vibrant even in September. The abundant and unaffixed chairs invite visitors to "take a seat" and are such a wonderful aspect seen in gardens all over Paris. They are conducive to creating your own social circle depending on the size of your party and whether or not you might want to put your feet up. This is my favorite garden in Paris!
A beautiful park. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful with lots of different activities for all ages. Our grandson loved the playground - it's huge and requires an entry fee but worth it!

these guys sure know how to garden. an amazing park full of open space, sculptures, flowers, trees, fountains--a wonderful place to walk around and explore, or to find a bench or seat and read, write postcards, people peep...very lovely.

pushing boats. We visited the gardens for only a short time while we were on our way back from not getting into the catacombs... Anyway we were glad we did, we sat on the park bench and just watched people. We saw a group of kids pushing little sail boats back and fourth across the pond. there were couples kissing, people relaxing, It was just a beautiful place to relax!

wonderland. It was a rainy day in Paris but that did not stop our walk through the gardens. This a beautiful tranquil place. The rain was a bit chilly but only intensified the colors of the flowers. The trees were manicured and made canopys over walkways. It would be hard to critisize a thing about these gardens. Possibly a few more benches to stop along the way. This a place you want to visit and stroll along not dash through.

garden. we stayed at the hotel le senat very near this garden which houses the Luxembourg Palace which is the home of the French Senate. the garden is well used but very large which allows you to find quiet spots or areas where you can watch children sail boats in the pond or men playing bocci ball or kids playing soccer. the park is a great place to relax and people watch.
Lovely park. Took a lovely sunday afternoon stroll through the park. Children sailing boats on the pond and everyone chilling out in the sun. Just a fabulous place.

Lovely place to rest and people watch. It seemed to me that there were many locals here. The vibe was very relaxed and very French. There were tables with people playing chess or very animated games of cards. My favorite was watching kids push boats with long sticks in this large man-made tank/fountain. There are lots of cafes and patisseries near by, including the famous Cafe Flores

A great place to unwind. We spent an hour or so on a Sunday afternoon in these beautiful gardens. We happened by a band playing in the park and watched kids play with boats on the man-made pond. The gardens are huge and the setting is peaceful, even though it was fairly crowded. If you have a few hours and want a peaceful getaway from the hustle of Paris you can't go wrong with a visit here.
Beautiful colors. Great atmosphere wonderful statues.Great place to relax and watch the world go byeColours of autumn worth the visitFree to visit.
An oasis in Paris. Wonderful place to walk or just sit and read a book. Sometimes an art fair is available to visit. Several ponds where children play with boats.

Beautiful gardens in the 5 eme. Despite a grey showery day, the flower beds exploded with colour, the avenues of trees were glorious and the Palais de Luxembourg majestic. Passed a couple of tranquil hours here and enjoyed the exhibitions in the Orangerie

Make the trip. I highly recommend making a trip to the gardens if for nothing else than to just have lunch. Amazing place, plenty of places to relax and enjoy (in and out of the sun). Very peaceful, beautiful, and relaxin.

An ideal sunday afternoon.. I keep a wonderful memory of this place during spring and summer. I used to go there with my friends when I worked in Paris. You can feel a friendly and convivial atmosphere. It's the perfect location for the end of the weekend to feel the peace and reload your battery before started your work on monday morning.It's a nice place to take fresh air.

Worth a stroll.... or a picnic!. Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris.... definitely worth a visit and a stroll. Perfect place for a picnic... although they aren't too keen on letting people on the grass so grab a bench and enjoy the view.
Jardin du Luxembourg. Awesome and free of charge garden to relax, walk and fall in love (is Paris!). You can bring some food, sit, walk a little or just relax and people watch.

Wonderful place - a must. Such vibrant place. Something for all ages. Whether you want a picnic, a gentle stroll or to listen to a concert it is perfect. Tennis courts, pony rides, an art gallery and it goes on. A wonderful reflection of so much that is right about the French attitude to life.

Mesmerizing. Elegant gardens that are a reprieve from the noise of the city. Flower arrangements were breathtaking and I felt like I was in a dream. It was nice to sit down and read a book. It was significantly more enjoyable than most of the other gardens in the city.
Beautiful!. I love love this garden. I would recommend packing a blanket and a book and a picnic and just vegetating all day on the lawn like all the local Parisians. :)
Beautiful. Loved strolling around the gardens, lovely way to spend an afternnon with a picnic or just walking around.

A great spot for a picnic. We had one afternoon and evening in Paris and started it with a picnic in Luxembourg Gardens. We ate sandwiches from a nearby shop on a bench under a tree. And then walked around the pond, admiring the statues and Luxembourg Palace. It was perfect

Jardin du Luxembourg. This is a delightful expanse of formal garden which is a relaxing place to sit a while, watching the activities around. The gardens are full of flowers and beautifully manicured. It would be a great place for a picnic after strolling through the nearby neighbourhoods of St Germain and the Latin Quarter.

Beautiful place to relax and people watch. This was our first stop after arriving in Paris recently. We were meeting a group for a river cruise and wanted something to fill a few hours, close enough by so we could get back in time. We were eager to experience FRANCE on some level , in the meantime. The Luxemburg Gardens were simply beautiful , with many gardens of blooming flowers, ponds and small ( man made lakes), trees with benches to sit under, groupings of chairs that many school groups use to enjoy a lesson in these historic and lovely surroundings, or others moved as needed to play cards, or chat. Don't miss the sculptures as you stroll along the grounds, too. We additionally enjoyed some refreshments at a cafe , up on the left side of the grounds, with a great vantage point to people watch.Picture taking is spectacular. The setting is both energized with all kinds of people, and quiet and peaceful with folks reading , painting, biking through the grounds, walking babies, etc.If you get a chance, and enjoy gardens, this is a must see in Paris!
Who needs Versailles?. Lovely gardens. Located just south of the Latin Quarter. Beautiful flowers and fountains. Great place to walk around and take it in.
Amazing specially if you have kids. Amazing specially if you have kids, where they'll enjoy the grennery, can rent boats 2 sail and can watch the muppet show theatre.

Jardin du Luxembourg. A beautiful garden. I loved watching the children sail their sailboats in the large pond. The flowers all over the garden are splendid. If you wish to rest peacefully, this is the ideal place.
Pretty and relaxing. Fun to stroll around and then sit in the shade and people watch. I enjoyed all the flower designs and watching little kids play with mini sail boats in the pond.
Beautiful. The gardens are wonderful and a great place to walk. There are several small coffee boutiques and a restaurant inside the park. Close to other attractions and the metro.

Just What WE NEEDED. After several days of sight seeing we planned to take some down time and just take in the momment. A short walk from our hotel we entered the gardens fromRue DE Vaugirard and were greeted with a tranquil wonderland of beauty. We stolled about the grounds enjoying all it's offerings.We found a cheese, wine and a small store to purchase all our pinic lunch needs. A short after lucch snooze top of the ealy afternoon.

Absolutely beautiful!. Worth a trip to this beautiful garden. Easily one of the most beautiful places I visited while in Paris! The gardens closed at 7 so get there early to enjoy all it has to offer!

Very pretty and relaxing!. Im so happy my parter and I had the opportunity to visit the Luxembourg gardens on a lovely summers day. The gardens are well maintained and very beautiful. A must do but don't forget your picnic !!
Superb!!. It was my 6th visit to Paris but the first to Luxembourg Gardens, we were lucky the weather was perfect so we could admire the beautiful garden!

Very nice, and relaxing. We visited the gardens on our last morning, perfect way to wind up our trip. The gardens are nice and a nice size, so allow about an hour or so to enjoy and relax. The peddlers outside the gates selling bottled water were a bit annoying, but they are not allowed inside the gates, as no peddlers are allowed inside the gates.

Nice place to relax.. Really enjoyed relaxing in the gardens after a long day of walking around sightseeing. Fresh Crepes available from a small vender in the gardens. It was also fun to watch the kids sailing their toy boats in the large pond.

Lovely gardens. Lovely gardens right near The Pantheon. Loads of metal chairs around the grounds that people can relax on - there was a nice feel as there were solo visitors that were just sat there taking in the grounds or reading books.

Very Beautiful. A most enjoyable garden with huge circular ponds to float toy boats in. A wonderful place to people watch, read a book, or just relax with the family. The play ground options are large from merry go rounds, to swings. The kids will love this place.
Beautiful!. It was a beautiful garden, I did not realize how big/nice it was, was actually my husbands idea to go and I am so very glad we did. Great to take a walk through, and sit and eat lunch.

Safe and inviting. Great area to walk, jog or stroll morning or evening. Fun to watch the people playing chess and bocce ball in the park. Safe with many tourists and locals at all times. park closes each night and opens early for the runners.

Day in the Park with my Wife. We had perfect weather. We grabbed sandwiches, drinks and desert and had a lovely lunch in the gardens. Afterward we spent hours strolling hand in hand admiring the flower blossoms. Would spend all day there I we could.

Beautiful. These gardens can be enjoyrd by all. Sit stroll run walk. Serene and lovely flowers abound. Many joggers in September pass by on their circuit of the gardens. Make sure you. visit these gardens.

Enchanting!!!!!. What a spectacular day we had. Climbed up the Arc of Triomphe, walked to the Panteon, and bought Sandwhiches, and felt like we were in Alice in Wonderland. Just simply georgeous !!!!!!!The weather was perfect with sun, slight breeze, and my friends the birds. My husband took pictures of them while I made the mistake of feeding them food. Oh well. Everyone was out enjoying the gardens. A big 10 for perfect. Please if you have time go and enjoy!!!
Family park. Really nice and clean family park. Lots of activities here. Sports, picnics, small boats, swings for the little ones, even horses. Nice.
Peaceful oasis away from busy streets. Loved this park. So much activity but still a quiet place to enjoy some peace. The gardens are lovely.
Don't miss this when you are in Paris. You don't want to miss these gardens. They are just too beautiful. Lots to see and lots of walking involed.
Visit this garden. Really lovely. Beautiful gardens with lots of seating and crepe vans to buy crepes, but the Luxembourg building is not open until October unfortunately.

Don't miss it, one of the most beautiful Gardens in the world.. I have been to Paris on three occasions and would not miss a visit to these gardens. Just make sure you take your camera and allow plenty of time to just relax and enjoy. These gardens are a must on any trip to Paris.

Don't Miss It!!. Visiting Luxembourg Gardens was the highlight of my trip to Paris. The shady trees, beautiful flowers, massive statues, fountains, ponds,... everything about this place is heavenly. There is a tranquility about this garden that makes you relax even if it is crowded with visitors. Plenty of benches to sit on and enjoy the view. Pack your lunch and take it with you so you can stay longer and feel like a Parisian, you won't regret it.

worth twice the price :-). Yes, this park is free. A joke. Great place to people watch n see how French families operate. Watch out for joggers. The park is fully of them and many are in poor shape, so they are looking down or in a daze. Really. Go to the pond and watch grown men sailing model ships seriously. There is a funky WC by the north entrance. 20c 'to peee'.

What a beautiful place. Great place to walk around or just sit and relax and enjoy the view. We were lucky to be there in June, on a sunny afternoon. If you're not in a rush, join the parisiens and simply sit on the grass and relax :)

Beautiful relaxing area in Paris. This is a short walk from the Latin Quarter and well worth the visit. The gardens are extensive with plenty of seating scattered casually around. We did not enter the house itself but you could easily spend a few relaxing hours with a baguette and bottle of wine, watching the world go by. Well worth a visit
so so so pretty. What a nice way to spend some time in the warm afternoon sun. Even though the gardens were crowded we were able to find some chairs to relax. The flowers were beautiful!
Lovely Garden. Great place to walk around or run!! There were many running enthusists getting in their morning jog when I was there. Many places to sit and read, enjoy a coffee or just people watch.

Perfect spot to eat a baguette sandwich!. Lovely gardens with lots of seating. We had glorious weather. It was fantastic sitting in the shade, eating a baguette sandwich for lunch, watching people, and feeling very Parisian.

just beautiful. We visited Luxembourg gardens and absolutely loved it. Lovely Parisian community feel to it, old and young mix, great people watching! The gardens themselves are stunning and there s a lake where people can sail lovely old miniature boats, very quaint. Chairs everywhere, only surprise you cannot access the grass, it looks so divine though!
A very civilised park. Loved the formality of it and watching the children sail boats.Not so keen on lack of shady areas to sit (but a very minor point!)

Flowers, folks, and fun. If you go to Paris with a long list of sites to see, you've missed the point! Paris IS the site to see. It is to be savored, lingered over, and enjoyed. And one of the best ways to linger is to spend a few hours enjoying its gorgeous public parks! From little patches of green and color (they are all filled with flowers in the spring and summer) between the stones to massive spaces to explore, you have a lot to choose from. Parisians love to get to a park whenever the sun peaks through the clouds, and so should you! And one of the most beautiful parks is the Luxembourg: a patchwork of several city blocks of flowerbeds, fountains, trees, benches, small cafes, and playgrounds. The central fountain is breathtaking in the spring when it reflects all types of gorgeous flowers, and there are plenty of chairs to go around to sit with your family and friends and have a picnic. Well worth it! Go and enjoy and savor!

A lovely way to pass time in Paris. We went back again and again, to stroll, have coffee and have a picnic. The grounds are magnificent and we loved all of the statues lining the Garden. a wonderful getaway in the city

Relaxing. My boyfriend and I stopped over in the gardens for a rest after a day sightseeing in Paris. It was a busy sunny Saturday and we had to hover for chairs to become vacant. Thoroughly relaxing afternoon.
In the heart of Paris. We liked the large beautifully manicured gardens, lots of people just relaxing, very clean, very well maintained

Beautiful place right in the city. I would have never imagined that in the heart of the city you would be able to find a place like Luxemburg Gardens! This is a small (when compared to the usual gardens you can find in other palaces in Europe) garden that shows the typical style of Parisian gardens. Simply beautiful

Beautiful gardens on a sunny day.. The gardens are beautiful and on a sunny day was bustling with artists, children playing and people soaking up the sun and atmosphere. U can view the top of the Eiffel Tower from here. It is free to visit and is wonderful for an evening stroll.

Expensive. My family and I enjoyed watching the local children race their sail boats in the large fountain in front of the Palais de Luxembourg. The garden it self is broken up into many areas, it is more like Central Park, but with alot more flowers. There are pony rides, a playground, swings, and cafes that will all gladly take your money. Yes, you have to pay to let your children play in this park. Crazy!!
Gorgeous gardens. This is a must visit destination in Paris. It has many visual delights and is a perfect place to sit, read, jog, walk, picnic or people watch.

Wonderful laid out flower gardens. From the gravel pathways with joggers and walkers to the manicured flower beds, this garden with the Medici villa is splendid. Plenty of spots to sit and enjoy people-watching in the shade or simply sunbathe by the water feature. In a very central position on the Left Bank, certainly worth a visit.
Worth the visit. Great place to relax stroll around people watch and take photos. Great flower displays. A place where the Parisians go to relax.

Beautiful but painful in spring!. Gorgeous gardens to walk through on the way from Pantheon to Notre Dame, but beware during the spring, especially if you have sensitive eyes like me! Even my big sun glasses did not stop the pollen from getting into my eyes and causing a horrible pain!

Nice walk with the little kids. Sound nice walk and refreshment at afternoon time during nice breeze time. I dislike dogs to be close to visitors as dogs do bother my kids . Beggers are also was observed .

Peaceful Parisian Haven. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a beautifully landscaped park with magnificent fountains and lakes. The flowers were in bloom and the the trees and shrubs immaculately shaped, as is the fashion in Paris. It is a perfect spot to run, walk, or just sit and reflect. There were little toy sailboats for rent on the lake which just added to the charm. Do not miss this lovely garden if you visit Paris.
Beautiful setting.. Great way to spend an few hours taking in Parisians enjoying thier city and leisure time..Beautiful grounds and fountains.

Most beautiful garden in Paris. I've really been missing out! Didn't get here until my 3rd trip to Paris...had to do all the compulsory museums and monuments first.....wish I had known how beautiful and peaceful it is here. Great place to ride a bike to and people watch, buy a baguette and a beer. The French really know how to do a garden. It is amazing how well tended it is, yet you never see any gardeners??

Luxembourg Gardens a great place for children and adults. Luxembourg gardens are a lovely spot to get away from the hustle and bustle of Paris. We visited twice during our recent trip, once when we were down the street at the Pantheon but then returned later in the week just to have some rest and relaxation. While there, we listened to a great concert, watched a colorful parade of local college students travelling through the park in what appeared to be some type of ‘initiation’ took in numerous gardens and enjoyed watching the locals play games of bocce ball. Luxembourg has something for everyone, if you want to sit in the sun, there are plenty of spots around the gardens but if you want a shady spot, you can find that as well. Adults and children will both find things to pique their interest.If you are travelling with children, the the playground and the sail boats provide a respite from museums and monuments. The playground which charges an entrance fee is a busy spot but your kids can join in the fun and might even be daring enough to try and communicate in French. When we visited, the French children practiced their English with our grandson. Another attraction for children are the sail boats which sail in the fountain in front of the Medici palace. The sail boats which are for rent in good weather are maneuvered around the pond with large sticks. While it sounds quaint in comparison to a video game, plenty of kids were enjoying this throwback activity and if your kids are interested in sailing the boats, it creates a great photo opportunity. We brought along a stale baguette and my grandson spent time feeding the pigeons which are always looking for a handout. I always enjoy a visit the mini Statue of Liberty (another great photo op) which resides in the park and of course the numerous flower gardens and statues. There are food stands inside the park near the bocce courts and right outside the gates you will find numerous places to grab a snack. I would recommend this park as a lovely place to visit.

Heavenly Outdoor Space. I have been visiting Paris for the last four days and will be staying for a month. I have been to this garden twice already and plan to make weekly visits. It is that great! The French know how to design gardens. That much is obvious. What is really interesting is how they go about keeping people in the park. It's simple - provide lots and lots of chairs which can be moved about. I have been in so many parks where the absence of places to rest just entices you to keep walking and leave. The Medici fountain is so beautiful and offers a cool sanctuary when temps get high. The pool is a great place to people watch, especially the children sailing their boats. In an era of high tech toys, all a kid really needs is a wooden sail boat, a pool, a stick and a bit of a breeze to have the time of their lives!Put on some comfortable shoes, pack a picnic lunch and head off to this fabulous outdoor space. Leave yourself at least three hours to really enjoy it!

One of the best places we visited.. This was the most charming walk. The sculptures, the fountains, the nature is beautiful. We enjoyed a glass of wine and a crepe in the park and it was one of our best memories from our trip.
Fun with the family. Beautiful day at the park. Toy sailboats in the pond, "chic" cafe's, marionette puppets, folk music bands..... wonderful afternoon!
Beautiful. Neat. Clean. Well organized. As the title of my review says, relaxing and just nice Maybe bring your own food and don't forget sun-cream Tho when we visit, i couldn't find toilet/restroom.

Nice - if you like public park/gardens obviously!. This is a nice enough place. I'm not really that into public parks/gardens but looking at it for what it is, it's a nice place to visit. If you're into that sort of thing I'm sure you'll really enjoy it.The scenery is all very pleasant with statues, well pruned trees, shrubs, etc.There is also an "orangerie" which tends to have small-scale art exhibitions (free to enter when we went). This is a nice bit of culture which doesn't cost anything and can be a visit that's as long or as short as you have time for.
Beautifull!. Very beautifull! And the kids can play with little boat on water. You can sit near the fountain. There is not much to do but enjoy the beautiful garden.

A Medici inspired it. The gardens are so beautifully landscaped that you will find something breathtaking everywhere you look. There are enough chairs around for people to sit under the shade and have a picnic.

A lovely lovely park. This has become one of my favorite places in Paris. You can walk, you can jog, you can sit and read a book, watch boule, chess or have coffee. Something for everyone. And it's beautiful!
Parisian family fun. Classic family afternoon....kids playgrounds, ponys, boats on the lake, ice-cream at Amorino on rue vavin, pétanque. A must-do with kids.
Beautiful. This place is amazing. There are many bakeries nearby you can get some food for a picnic. There are shows and events all year long.
An oasis in the heat.. We loved stumbling off the hot cobblestones into this lovely garden. There was a dance troupe straight out of a Monet painting.
Peaceful. We walked thru near the end of the day. So peaceful, beautiful and relaxing. The flowers awesome, the children's play area and the boat pond made a nice relaxing way to end our afternoon

I got engaged here!. This place is magical and a great place for a special stroll, a quiet place to study or a place to meet friends. They have chairs scattered a bit everywhere so that you can sit down and take in the city, the sun and the romance!

My favorite place in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is one of the attractions in Paris that shouldn't be missed. It's by far one of my favorite places to relax and take in the views. The gardens are centrally located (close to Montparnasse and the Latin Quarter), free (always a bonus), and the perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle of city. I recommend stopping at one of the many surrounding Boulangeries and/or general stores to pick up a baguette, cheese, and wine. There's a long strip of shaded grass where many people go to relax and enjoy a picnic in the park. We always bring a blanket, some small cups, a knife for the cheese, and a corkscrew. Whether you are site-seeing or looking for a place to relax, picnic, or read a book, I would highly recommend stopping through Luxembourg Gardens. You can enjoy beautiful views of the gardens, check out the palace, or take part in some of the surrounding park activities. There's something here for everyone. Side note: Bring some extra change to use the bathroom facilities.

Gorgeous, clean gardens. Luxembourg Gardens was one of my favorite stops in Paris. Is so magestic and quientessentially French. We walked around the park and then stopped at a Cafe outside the gates and enjoyed the foot traffic. Simply beautiful!

Lovely corner of Parisian life. We took a walk through Luxembourg Gardens on the Sunday we arrived in Paris. It was such fun to get out and see Parisians and visitors alike enjoying the beauty of this park. We saw men playing chess, children sailing boats on the pond, enjoyed the beautiful plantings and the cool shade of the fountain.
very beautiful gardens. wonderful gardens. All the gardens in Paris are amazing and very well maintained. Lots of flowers, pidgeons and fishes.

Perfect place to get away and relaz. Luxembourg Gardens, near the Pantheon, is a bit of Central Park, a bit of Golden Gate Park and a perfect place to sit and relax. Lots of games being played, beautiful fountain in the middle and these funny but comfortable chairs that allow you to sit and enjoy. Recommend.
beautiful. simply amazing, very clean and there was an aura of tranquility. its nice to stroll along the garden, taking pictures and then sitting on a bench eating warm chestnuts ...simply relaxing

Paris gardebs,. it was the end of September and very hot the gardens were still very nice but a little dry. nevertheless French type gardens are always worth the visit specially if you are a gardener yourself. read a little about the history it helps.
The most beautiful park in Paris. A very beautiful park, the best I've seen in Paris, which is saying something considering how many wonderful parks they have.
