An oasis in the city. A wonderful quiet place to spend some time. Beautiful gardens and trees with plenty of seating to sit and reflect

Great Spot with Kids. Float the little boats by paying at the stand, you'll get a boat and a stick to steer it around. There are ponies, a puppet show, playgrounds and a carousel where kids can grab the brass rings. Grab a sandwich at a bakery, a green chair (not on the lawns!) and soak in the atmosphere.
Didn't make it to Versailles.. Had wanted to go to Versailles, but Luxembourg was a wonderful substitute! It is such a beautiful garden, very relaxing. It is easy to get to and a must see!
Worth seeing for a change of pace. So nice to have a beautiful place to just sit and relax or go for a stroll right in the heart of Paris. Tons of nice pubs and shops in the area too.
REAL Paris!. The Luxembourg Gardens were fantastic! The palace itself is majestic, but it's the gardens, cafe and live music that make it worth the walk. A great find!

Away from the hussle and bussle. A lovely large park area with a pond that children race wooden boats on. No technology required! An ages old activity you can watch sitting on one of the many provided seats and calmly watch the world enjoy themselves. The gardens themselves are very nice and it is an opportunity to relax in the busy city. Look for a nearby café "Bread and Roses" for the best hot chocolate ever.

Beautiful green space. A must see for travelers to Paris. The rows of chestnut trees remind one of a Rembrandt painting. Stayed in an apartment just across the street. So nice to have this park so close by.

nice place to unwind... i love being in this garden..very relaxing..you can just sit on the bench and read a book, or just simply watch people strolling in the park...everyday, i see to it that i should pass by Luxembourg park before goiing back yo my hotel to relax and enjoy the place..
A wonderful place to Unwind. The gardens were beautiful!! We enjoyed strolling the grounds and taking pictures of the statues. It was a very relaxing way to spend the afternoon.

Stunning. We got off the LeTour bus at this stop to walk around and see what this garden was all about. It was beautiful with the palace, walkways, trees and perfectly thought out flower arrangements with the pond being in the center. It was around 5:00 pm and there were a lot of locals as well as tourists walking around and sitting on chairs enjoying the beautiful 75 degree weather in August. We did not venture far into the garden because we were already tired from sightseeing since early morning but this is a perfect place to stop, relax and maybe bring lunch or an early dinner with wine and just enjoy the serene beauty.
THE Place to Be. An awesome respite from site seeing. Calm and restful, great environment for a picnic, chat, people watching and photography.

Perfect place to enjoy the sun. After having a tour at several colleges and schools in the neighbor, I got lost and saw the garden (that's a shame, but it's a fun way to explore, you never know what you gonna find)It was the perfect place to go to enjoy the sun, read a book and chill. Lots of people come here, for different purposes, but the place is still clean and nice. You can take pictures of the garden or the palace, or sit on a chair and chill with your book or your friends :) absolutely love it here.

Rainy Tour. Even it was rainy it's just great to see the gardens, you can enjoy the view, the fountains on a sunday and if you are lucky (wich it's really easy) you can enjoy a picnic there... Relaxing is something you should expect

Stroll through Luxembourg Gardens. Just a beautiful place to stroll through, admire the gardens and enjoy seeing all the people enjoying the green space, the playgrounds, the children's water area, and other activities. This is what a public space should be like!

Better than Versilles. why this garden is better than the Versilles? cause you can relax! you can enjoy the beautiful flowers in the garden. children who play with his or her sailboat toys are just pure joy. sweetest day!

Beautiful place - must see. On a gorgeous day - 28 degrees we spent the morning here relaxing and drinking coffee from an in-park cafe. The coffee was gorgeous and the gardens looked beautiful! There are many people relaxing on their own or with friends here and it is great for tanning, reading or hanging out with friends. It is my favourite park in Paris and is not to be missed. It makes a perfect place to go before heading to Paris Charles De Gaulle airport because there is a direct metro from Luxembourg station right outside the park.
good place to chill. very beautiful, a good place to chill and have a nice time...good place to run also...I went on the winter, so in the summer must be even more amazing.
Awesome. Amazing grounds...enjoy a break from the long lines and hang out in the sunshine. Bring your own picnic or buy some treats on site.
Great walk. It's hard not to like Luxembourg Gardens. The scenery is wonderful. The downside can be the crowds and the garbage. Paris is not a clean city.

My favorite place to be in Paris. This garden has so many memories attached to it: poney rides and boats in the bit fountain as a child, time spent chitchatting with friends as a college student, playing chess, romantic picnics on the lawn( with delicacies from La Grande , etc. I love this park.

Excellent place for jogging and .... If you are a jogger and live in an hotel nearby (ex: Hotel Cujas Pantheon), it is a great place to jog : 1.5km or such of uninterrupted run in a very very beautiful location. Perfect in the morning. It opens at 7:30. If you want to run earlier, you can run around it too, it is almost as great as running inside it.

Everyone must stroll this oasis.... I would suggest that you seize every opportunity to walk through these gardens....to sit and read or watch the world go by. This is a magical place to come after stopping at the many bakeries for a picnic snack. Sit in one of the metal chairs that abound or bring a little blanket and sit on the grassy lawn where the sign says "sitting permitted!". You will never regret slowing down your time in Paris but spending some special moments or hours here.
A beautiful place. Very Quit and nice place.We were with 2 children and spend few ours in the playground.Very easy to get there.

Best people watching in Paris. These are my favorite gardens in Paris, grab some macaroons and head on down to the park. You can watch tennis, catch some sun, watch children playing it's so beautiful and relaxing.
Gorgeous and relaxing. Such a lovely garden to visit and relax. We were sad that the Orangerie was closed, but it was a lovely afternoon stroll nonetheless.

Relaxing afternoon. With a beautiful palace and extraordinary garden, this is the perfect place for a relaxing afternoon. Even if this place was full of people everytime we visited, it is such a joy to go there and read a book near the fountain or just relax on the grass. A very special bohemian touch is given by the young people who often sing and play the guitar.
Beautiful. It was very nice and the flowers were sooo beautiful. Had a pic-nick there in the nice shade (it was warm weather). It was a nice to take a break from the city stress.

go just to see the gardens. the gardens are beautiful and really let you know you are in Paris and not in the US/NJ. There is a walking tour (of sorts) around the palace and gardens so be sure to take time to stroll through and read up on the current use of the building (the Senate).

Wish it had been more than a 1 hour visit.... Perfect place to sit down for reading and spending the rest of the day in a relaxed and beautiful place. I only walked around and sat down for half an hour. I wish I had spent more time in the gardens. I went in August and it was sunny and full of tourist.
Imagine you were a King. The scale of the garden, the flowers and plants - everything is so...luxorious if u ask my opinion. Definitely worth seeing if in Paris!
Place to relax. Its a nice place where to finish tour in Paris! You can lay down on the grass and have a nice picnic or just relaxing! And the view is also where beautiful!
Nice place to relax. I was at Luxembourg Gardens and it was very relaxing... You can take a chair and place it wherever you want, you can play with toy-boats..., you can watch the fountains...
Enchanting garden and park. We loved the magnificent floral displays throughout the gardens and enjoyed watching the children wrangle small toy sailing boats on the lake in the centre of the park.

Good Place to relaxe. Wonderful Garden. Amazing flowers.
Sit Down and relax; Chairs available or Sit on the meadow. Don't forget to bring your Food, wine ...
Children Love the Pond to boat the sailing ships

Perfect end to a lovely weekend. We visited the gardens on our last day to just relax and chill before returning home and it was th Perfect decision. We arrived via the Senate building end of the gardens and immediately came across the most wonderful cafe. We stopped for a drink but after reading the menu decided to try the chocolate fondant filled chocolate cake! It was heaven and would recommend to any chocolate lover! The staff were very friendly and we were able to banter and joke at our lack of French speaking skills and the waiters very good English! The gardens are lovely with the children running around the lake with boats. We also discovered the tennis courts and pony rides for children too. Then we found a beautiful statue hidden under the trees to the right hand side of the Senate building with a little lake in front of it. It was lovely to sit there with the sun shining through the trees above and watch the ducks swimming around and watch the world go by!

A Gem to be found in the hustle & bustle of Parisian life.. Beautiful gardens. Immaculately kept for everyone to enjoy from runners to families with small children there's something for everyone. It really is delightful with stunning views and delightful stalls it really isn't one to miss

Great place to relax. There are music performances quite often - I think every Saturday at the least. They are in an open-air stage area and there are plenty of seats. And there are benches and chairs throughout the park - and you can move the chairs to your liking. Also, there is a pond in the middle in which people can push little sail boats. The are for rent and are relatively cheap. I was amazed how the little boats sail themselves on a pretty straight course. You get stick so you can push the boats if / when they get to the edge. It's a good park to hang out and relax.

Perfect garden for stroll and snack. Stopped here every morning with baguette sandwich with our family. Gorgeous place to sit and look at the gardens and fountains. Impeccably clean and manicured. BEAUTIFUL PLACE!!!!

Our favorite park in Paris. This park kinda has it all for families. 3 euros and you are sailing a model boat in the fountain near the palace, which is a ton of fun for both kids and gown ups. there is a very nice pay to play (2.5 euro's for all day), playground with a kinda zip-line like thing that would never get insurance coverage in the US. my daughters loved it. the park has a ton of shade which is nice on a hot paris day, as well as a good number of nooks to explore.a very popular thing for kids is the carousel on which children compete to "grab the brass ring", (well more like skewer with a stick). Whomever gets the most rings gets the next ride for free. it feels like a junior circular jousting match.For adults the park is a perfect place to get away from the noise and rush of the city. BTW, Tennis courts can be reserved...although not so sure how that works just yet.

Every City should have one. Grab a chair and an ice cream, people watch, sail a boat on the pond, relax on the grass, wander and note the statues, the flowers, and barely a sign of any litter! other nations please note! Wonderful.

The best park in the heart of Paris. History, great nature, culture, right in the heart of Paris, for free. Totally worth the visit no matter if you are looking for the astonishing views, sweat a little or just to chill out.
Great garden. Loved the chairs around the pond, great for sitting down and having your sandwich, watching the world go by
evening visit. although it was a wet day we visited these gardens , the wander through was pleasant , some lovely plants and flowers and statues to look at . definitely worth a visit

Relaxation in the city centre. These well laid-out gardens of the Palais de Luxembourg (shere the French upper house, le senat, meets) have a central round pond where model sailboats may be hired for 3 euros, and children of all ages enjoy guiding and retrieving them with special canes. There are plenty of seats throughout the park, and people sit there to relax, enjoy good weather, read, picnic or meet friends.
Still the king. The most beautiful garden in Paris and maybe anywhere. Go there, lounge around, take in the staggering beauty, and stop at the cafe for breakfast.
Must See. I never tire of the well kept gardens of this place. You can make your visit as short or long as you like.

One of my favorite places on Earth. I've been here twice--and it's such a beautiful sanctuary.Parisian parks differ from American parks in one major respect--they invite you to STAY. Comfortable chairs line every point of interest. Parisians and tourists alike (you can easily spot the differences) are gathered around every one--reading, doing the crossword, chatting with loved ones, sunning, relaxing...in no hurry to get anywhere.The grass is beautifully green, the trees huge...lots of activity yet very quiet and relaxing.Make this place one of your destinations in Paris--it's a great way to get away from the tourist trap, sardine cans. You won't be sorry.
Fantastic park setting. Great trails for walking and running. Nice areas to picnic in. Great multipurpose areas: tennis, children's playgrounds, fountains, etc.

Beautiful gardens in the centre of Paris. Luxembourg Gardens provide a quiet escape from the busier parts of the city. Well kept flowers and plants line walkways and the view of Luxembourg Palace is superb. Well worth a visit, particularly if the weather is decent.
nice quiet place. do the boating on the lake great fun for 3E for 30mins! bring some a picnic and enjoy the scenery. ..
Stunning beautiful gardens. A gem amongst the bustle & hustle of Paris. Wonderful place for a walk or picnic. Beautiful well maintained garden and park.

Loved the statues. We had a relaxing morning here in perfect weather before it became too clogged with tourists. As a huge fan of London's informal parks, I am always amazed at how the French manage their formal gardens. So much work, one thinks, but such a delightful result.

A little bit of Heaven. What a beautiful place in the hustle and bustle of Paris. We visited on a Saturday afternoon in the holiday season so there were many people here but there was ample seating for everyone to sit and relax and enjoy watching the sailboats on the lake. The gardens were beautifully manicured and well kept and the former palace took centre stage. It's a great place just to sit and relax or have a picnic or even just a long stroll.

Lovely spot for reading, walking, people-watching. This is a lovely oasis in Paris, and a place to go to simply soak up the ambiance and see how Parisians love to relax on weekends (or jog/walk on weekdays). Lovely formal gardens, lots of trees, children playing with sailboats, etc., etc. If your feet need a rest from hoofing around the city, this is a terrific spot for a break!

Beautiful, peaceful. We relaxed in the Luxembourg Gardens for about an hour after a lot of walking, very restful, beautiful gardens. Then we walked down the Boulevard St. Michel towards Notre Dame. Nice way to spend an afternoon - nothing negative to say - try to get the chairs that dip back and get another one to put your feet up! Lovely place.
beautiful gardens, well worth a visit.. beware-expensive cafes ! Cafes near attractions are very expensive. The gardens cater for all ages. It was lovely to hear the brass bands playing.

A nice place to rest while out sightseeing. Luxembourg Gardens is another beautiful must see in fabulous Paris. I especially enjoyed the small lake with children surrounding it playing with the sailboats. I visited in August so it was very hot and crowded, but I still enjoyed sitting in the shade, people watching and absorbing Parisian life.
Watch the world go by. These a really well kept gardens. Watch the world go by as you pull up a seat and watch the boats on the pond...very relaxing.

Beautiful and relaxing garden. Pack a picnic, bring a book, and enjoy a stroll around this lovely park. We took an afternoon break here during a walk to the Catacombs. We sat in front of the fountain with a view of the former palace. It's the perfect place to relax and people watch.
Strolled the magnificent gardens!. Great way to see Parisians enjoying the beauty of their city. There was a band giving a concert, and people picnicking and strolling to take in the gardens.
Beautiful. Outstanding on a fine summer day. Lots of chairs to sit on and relax, whether by the side of the fountain, or beautiful flower gardens. Also a nice play area for children.

A very pleasant afternoon stroll. The gardens were just round the corner from our hotel so we decided to take a wander after lunch. The day we were there was very warm so we had a quick potter about, looking at the people with their boats in the pond, then headed to one of the cafes under the trees for a cold drink.And very nice it was too.

A city Oasis. when traveling with children in Paris one must find activities to allow the little ones to take a break from the -sometimes- overwhelming city attractions. This garden is a must if you wish to experience the parisian life. my son made me take him back to "Les Jardins luxembourg" three times during our stay in paris. We always found something new to do there. I opted for a French book and a nice "Cafe au lait" while my son made new friends in the playground.
R and R. Brilliant place which is worth visiting for gentle strolls around the gardens or relaxing in the shade or sun using the many seats readily available.

Great place to chill and relax. Little oasis in the centre of Paris.
Great place to chill out and have a picnic lunch and plenty of things for the kids to stay occupied.

Beautiful. Well worth taking a stroll through the gardens and to watch the children play with the push boats in the small lake, not something you see everywhere. Beautiful gardens, fountains and buildings. Also a huge playground for children. I highly recommend the nutella crepe cart :)

Beautiful place - Music in the park. A wonderful place to relax in a beautiful green park. We packed a picnic and went to the gardens one sunny afternoon, and were treated by a live classical music performance by a school orchestra. Another highlight was the art exhibition they had going at the time. The park is huge and we didn't make it to every corner, I'd definitely come again.

Beautiful Park. The Luxembourg Gardens is a very popular park in Paris judging by the young and old people we saw there. It was a warm day and we wanted to just rest for a few minutes before we resumed sight seeing. We only saw a portion of the park, mainly where the boat sailing pond is and some beautiful flower gardens. I wish we had taken more time to see the entire park. Definitely should be on the sight seeing list.

Lovely for a Picnic. The Luxembourg Gardens are some of the prettiest in Paris (although top honors goes to Parc Monceau for me). The former Luxembourg Palace lends a regal air to the park, and the beautiful flowers and fountains make for a peaceful rest during a busy day of sightseeing. Heck, even join the locals and pack a picnic lunch on a nice day! Just be aware you have to sit on the benches or chairs when you eat - no picnicking on the grass.
Magical place. The gardens are beautiful, in summer there is outdoor music and you can get something to drink in the cafe. I rented a boat for my daughter to play in the fountain, she was delighted.

Simply beautiful. I was really surprised by how beautiful these gardens are. We strolled around, watched the little sailing boats, then picked one of the many chairs dotted around and sat back and enjoyed. Fantastic break.
Best in Paris............ Stay for one hour or all day, what Paris does best, class and relaxation in beautiful surroundings - I would live here tomorrow. Best park in Paris for the kids too.
Beautiful - palatial gardens. We rested our legs in the early evening. A perfect location to take a break from the sightseeing yet still feel like you are on the set of some 17/18th century drama.

One of the nicest gardens in Paris. After a hectic day in Paris, Luxemburg garden is a paradise: nice to walk around, to relax on the confortable chairs around the lake, to picnic, to play tennis, to enjoy a crepe etc, to visit the exhibitions etx. The main attraction being the chess players playing chess on original chess tables.

Must see. We visited in august and the huge gardens were still full of flowers.Watched the beekeepers collecting the honey from the enclosed bee area and were impressed by the orchards fruit. Great to see the kids and parents enjoying the model sail boats that they can rent on the central pond.Each boat has a country flag attached and the kids get a wooden stick which they use to push their own boat out and the breeze carries the little boats about the pondLovely central park with seats where you can sit and unwind,relax and watch the world go by.Don't miss it.
parks. very beautiful and a delight to walk thru in the morning or eveninggreat park to jog thru and share the views
Beautiful. A must see even if you are not into gardens lovely layout pond with mini sailing boats, we got there as a band was setting up that was awesome to relax and listen to
Great break from hustle & bustle. Flower borders beautiful, sat & watched whilst families hired the boats for little pond, Very relaxing & plenty of seats even on busy saturday afternoon.
A lovely Summer haven. Just to sit and enjoy the peace and cool,in this large metropolis. Just to sit with the Parisiens on a warm sunny afternoon. Very calming
Paris Trip. Great park to walk around and relax. Great cafe across the street La Rostand. Best Quiche Lorraine on the planet.

If you have a child rent a sailboat!. The gardens were directly across from our hotel, so we walked over on our first afternoon. My daughter wanted to rent one of the sailboats available for children to play with. I reluctantly agreed. I'm glad I did. I think my wife and I may have enjoyed it more than my daughter. We chased the boat around with the other families and just enjoyed a wonderful afternoon in the park.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris. There were lots of places to it and enjoy great people watching. The flowers were beautiful .
Great for a break. Nice for a leisurely walk or to sit a while. If traveling with kids, they have a playground and a small course for foot-powered carts for kids.

Nice playground. There is a nice playground In the south western corner of the Luxembourg Gardens. Slightly surprisingly, you have to pay to get in (I think about 5 euro - children AND adults!), but as we had been to Disneyland Paris at vast expense the day before, we must have been sensitised to having to pay through the nose. But, the kids loved it - there is a sort of zip wire which was slightly terrifying to watch but was marshalled very effectively by the children playing on it and only became dangerous when some interfering adult got involved. My wife and I spent the whole afternoon reading books on a shady bench whilst the kids played happily. One implication of the charge, I suppose, is that it didn't get too crowded and the fence around it means that you feel safe that the children won't wander off.

Great place to sit and relax after walking through the champs Ulysses. Beautiful setting close to shopping. Loved the park and gardens. Great place to relax after walking all day. Lots of things in Paris cost a fortune this is one that's free
Lovely respite. Grab dinner at a boulangerie and head here for a picnic. It's a great location, the pond with motorized toy boats is really fun. Beautiful and quiet. Good people watching!

Luxembourg Gardens. *Quick Note*Don't waste your time for getting tanned somewhere else, while you can get a great clear winter sun here with a glass of wine by your side, of course with a cuddle of your girlfriend/boyfriend does the rest of the magic...
great for kids and adults. I liked the miniature sailing boats kids can play with, disappointed with not being able to walk bare feet as we were warned of the glass debris everywhere

A hidden gem. A beautiful place to relax . Good for adults & children.Easy to get to by metro (even when part of metro line not operating and you have to get the bus part of the way )My sister & I arrived at Luxembourg Gardens late afternoon, and were thrilled when we first entered the Gardens and found that you could buy food as we hadn't eaten since breakfast.A french crepe and a cafe creme in the park , followed by a casual stroll around half of the Gardens, then a sit down to admire the scenery and watch the people passing by. And to top if off... it is free !I would definitely visit Luxembourg again

Beautifully maintained grounds, highlighted by the Medici Fountain. Well worth the visit for the romance of the Medici Fountain, the playful exuberance of children guiding sail boats in the basin (look for the pirate ship!) and the relaxation of pulling up a lawn chair and enjoying a beautiful Parisian afternoon in the sun (or shade).

Family-Friendly and Beautiful Park. See how the French enjoy some free time. This park is larger than most and has playgrounds and activities for children. Want to just sit and read a book? This is a nice place to do it in. Lots of sun and shade to meet everyone's needs. Flowers galore. Not sure I would seek it out over other things to see in Paris, but if you want the children to run off some steam, or are just in the area, definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful, relaxing afternoon. My daughter and I strolled into the Luxembourg Gardens while visiting the Latin Quarter area. The grounds were beautiful and there were many Parisians just sitting around relaxing in the lovely surroundings. We were amazed at how the French take time to just sit and relax. It was a very enjoyable afternoon sitting and people watching, far away from our busy, stressed lives. There was no fee for admission so that was a plus!

Beautiful Calm in Busy Paris. We loved our visit to this picturesque park. It was nice to sit near the fountain and watch artists sketching, and to see children sailing their small boats in the circular pool. The garden is wonderfully maintained and is a nice place to walk and escape the more hectic-pace of a big city. It was one of our favourite places in Paris.

Nice relaxing place to walk through if you're around the area. Visited the gardens while on our way from the Pantheon to Pierre Herme.....and turned out to be better than we thought it wouldYes it is another beautiful garden, but there was a choir singing and kids playing with boats for hire in the fountain in the middle.We were tired so stopped here for about 1/2 hour to relax by the fountain which was nice and funny to watch the kids running around the fountain chasing their boats

Beautiful gardens next to the Luxembourg Palace. These gardens are the second largest gardens in Paris and well worth your time to visit. In August the flowers were all out and it was a pleasant walk to wander through and enjoy the sun shine. The park sits behind the Luxembourg Palace which is the home of the French Senate. Open all day in the summer months. There is a café inside and ducks so great for the kids to have free time to run around or the parents to just sit and relax. There are free chairs provided.

Beautiful. Had a lovely stroll through the gardens. Much more beautiful than I had imagined. I wish we had time to bring food and enjoy a picnic in the park. Lovely place, filled with locals instead of tourists. Next time we will bring food and enjoy the ambiance.
Wonderful. We went to the grocery store and got a picnic together. One of the highlights of our trip. Just sat on a few chairs and enjoyed the wonders of Paris
C'est magnifique.. Very beautiful garden with the nice trees, flowers and fresh air. The best place to enjoy meeting friends or just to relax there.

Nice park with a great atmosphere. Great park in the Luxembourg area. Not so many tourists and there are chairs you can use to take a break and to enjoy the atmosphere in the park. There is also a small pond where miniature sailing boats are sailing.

Great place to chill out away from noise and bustle.. As part of a leisurely stroll to La Bomb de Marche - heute culture up market trendy department store dropped into the Luxembourg Gardens nearby. The gardens are a wonderful place to spend a short time walking around or through with lots of passing tourists and locals. But the real charm is in taking the time to sit and ponder in one of the restaurants inside the garden. We were travelling with some friends and pulled up a chair and spent some time enjoying the atmosphere and passing throngs whilst enjoying a nice salad and a cool beer and wine. A really enjoyable and relaxing time and very quiet away from the general city noise. As reviewed by many if you are able to drag yourself away from the main attractions well rewarded.

Tranquil. Went for the gallery but these are shut until October. However, the gardens are beautiful. Children's boating lake, paddling pool, adventure park. Plus lots of peaceful space! Just sit and relax. All free.

Absolutely stunning. Spent a few hours here, and it was so relaxing. Exactly how I'd imagine everyday Paris to be. fabulous ,well kept gardens,with a pretty boating lake. Well kept ,clean toilets( well that's important when you are out and about for the day LOL).Lovely cafe,where I enjoyed a delicious ice cream.

Simply Stunning!. Beautiful gardens near the Sorbonne areas, very clean and with some amazing views. It is a very quiet and peaceful place, bringing you away from the hustle and bustle of central Paris. Great for strolls, an easy afternoon or some relaxation. A must visit!

Very big and very beautiful. On a sunny day, this is the perfect spot to relax! There are lots of beautiful statues and lots of chairs to sit on. It's just so fancy! Where I come from there are no parks this beautiful. Why not have a picknick here? That's what my group and I did. :)
Lovely gardens - well worth a visit. Nicely located with lovely walkways - a lovely place to stroll on any day.The essence of Paris. A serene place away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beauitful, Paradise In A City!. Beautiful gardens! A mass of life, kids in the fountains sailing boats, people sunbathing and picnicking ect. Just beautiful! Just of Boulevard St Michel so easily located and near shops so can pick up picnic supplies. Could spend a whole afternoon here with a family!

Pretty but watch out for runners!. This is an expansive, well kept, varied gardens.Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the scenery whilst having a coffee and pastry from the kiosk/cafe located in the middle of the park.A nice place to while away a few hours on a sunny day.Watch out for runners though, I have never seen so many in a single park. Keep an eye out to make sure you don't get in their way when walking on the paths.

Don't sit on the grass!. This is beautiful park, perfect for relaxing after a long morning sightseeing. It was the hottest day of our trip, so we bought deliciously refreshing lemon ice drinks just before entering the park, and sat under a tree in the shade. We had commented how wonderful it is that in every Paris jardin there are so many benches and chairs provided, then realised why when a park official very kindly pointed out our error. We were excused - I think he's used to the British not understanding park rules! I was great to see locals playing petanque and engage in spot of people watching. There is an excellent children's playground, where you can also buy drinks and ice creams, and clean and well maintained toilets, although there is a charge for this. A peaceful haven to rest and relax a while.

just beautiful. beautiful park in a great area. i love just to go here , sit on one of those metallic green chairs in front of the lake and read a book. this is a park that you have to take your time, walk around and enjoy it and then have a tea and pastry, read a book , relax and then off you go shopping in st Germaine area.
Tranquility. Take the time to relax in these beautiful gardens. takes the hustle and bustle out of your day and is truly beautiful and historic.

A must do for families!. No one walks on the grass, the gardes are so beautifully maintained and the flowers were in full bloom. The sun was shining down brightly. We got off the bus that ended there. The kids had a grand time, renting and sailing the sailboats in the duck pond there. Would have loved for some glace/ice-cream there! A definite do not miss!
Pretty Garden. Nice Garden, not everything was in bloom, closes early although there are many more hours of summer sunlight left.
Great picnic spot with playground. The perfect place to picnic, watch the boat races in the pond, then take the kids to an amazing playground!

A beautiful and tranquil place to relax on a magnificent summer's day. Although there are parks galore in Paris -- every place you turn -- but this is the most akin to New York's Central Park. It is literally the backyard playground for the city of Paris. Quiet walkways, benches everywhere, lawns for sunbathing, tall shady trees, tennis courts, pony rides for the kids, a large reflecting pool for young boys to play with their toy sailboats, and flowers flowers everywhere.A quiet and peaceful place to soak up the sun, write a letter while sprawled on the grass, or simply to contemplate.

Outstanding Gardens. Besides being very pretty we were there on a Saturday and the dancing on the stage was very entertaining. Spent extra time just sitting and watching the old dress and the dancing. Something completely unexpected.
Always beautiful. When I'm in Paris, I usually stay nearby so I can run in the garden and get my morning exercise in. A stroll through is also another way to enjoy this little slice of heaven.
Perfect Park. Yes it was crowded - it's August, but this is exactly what a city park should be. Loads of places to sit,plenty for children, and a lovely garden, Best people watching ever.

A must see in Paris. Very interesting. Well laid out gardens and full of interesting sculptures. The gardens house the Senate building. a great venue to visit and relax in. Very close walking distance to the Hotel.
Beautiful. Well cared for gardens, a lovely place for a stroll between site seeing. I passed through them quite early and they were a marvelous place to see Paris start to wake up.

always relaxing in the heart of the city. like the trees and the nature, can walk, jog or relax! Park is located very conveniently. There are good restaurants and bakeries nearby you can have something to eat and have it in the park.

Perfect for families needing some calm time. It is crowded here, but somehow it feels like you've stepped out of the hectic pace that is Paris. Great for picnics - pick something up from a market/bakery before getting here.I had almost as much fun as the kids with the little rentaboats that you steer across the fountain in the middle (3e per half hour I think)

Beautiful place for a picnic. . The Luxembourg gardens were close enough to the hotel for us to be able to walk to them for an evening picnic on two nights rather than eat in cafes or restaurants. We entered at the North West corner off Rue de Vaugirard and walked to the centre, grabbed chairs from the liberal supply to be found in most parks in Paris and had our picnic in the evening sun with a glass or two of chilled Rose wine. Drinking in public is quite acceptable in Paris and there is no drunken thuggery as a consequence. This makes for a really pleasant atmosphere in the parks at lunchtime and evenings. The park shuts at 8.15pm and the Gendarme come round warning everyone 15 minutes beforehand. When the time comes they walk through the park, blowing whistles and everyone leaves the park. We left through the South entrance and walked through the Sorbonne area, a treat in architectural terms. Picnic in the park, any park, if you get a chance!

A haven of relaxed peace.. What a lovely formal Italianate garden which so many Parisians obvously love very dearly. They sit and read with their feet up, people run, promenade or do their Tai Chi. It's a very relaxed place in a busy city and a place that many tourists will miss, when fulfilling a crowded itinery seeing the famous and more higher-profile sites. Many Parisians it seems have moved away from the St Germain area to Montparnasse in order to be nearer the Jardin de Luxembourg and I can see why. It is just a joy of a place, try not to miss it.

Beautiful!. These gardens are absolutely beautiful; perfect for photo opportunities! The colours are so vibrant and the gardens are perfectly maintained. The only downside is the toilets cost 50 cents to use!
Nice view. We liked the view on the fountain and the flowers. There is always interesting exhibitions in the park. A little bit noisy in some parts of the park.

A must-do. Lovely gardens to relax, enjoy the sun or take a walk.
You aren't allowed to sit on the grass but there are hundreds of chairs around.

Fun for families with small kids. My family came to Paris for 2.5 weeks and this is the only activity/attraction we did twice! There is a section in the park suitable for kids ages 1-11 with entry costing 1.5-2.5 euro, depending on whether child or adult. Lots of fun for the kids. We also rented a tennis court for 1 hour (8 euro) which was fun. But you need to bring your own rackets and balls for that - you cannot rent the equipment on site. Besides that, as previous reviewers have noted, the garden is beautiful and relaxing.

Wonderful gardens & sights. Colors in gardens magnificent! Fountains, statues, café to sit awhile what more could you ask. Day we visited there was a musical little theatre taking place in the 'kiosk' an added surprise.

Beautiful. Wonderful place to wander around. In our opinion, the prettiest of the gardens in Paris. After seeing other attractions, this was a lovely way to end the day. A casual stroll and a delicious crepe from a little stand, was just perfect.

Best Gardens in Paris. I just love these gardens. It is the first place I like to go whenever I'm in Paris. They are not the largest but they have the best setting in my opinion. The gardens are always beautiful with a wildflower feel to them. You have chairs and lounge chairs to sit around in and have a baguette and read a book or just relax a little from you Paris adventure.

Delightful. We were staying very close & this made it so easy to stroll in & enjoy this lovely green space in the city. We have been before & it is always a pleasure to see what is in bloom, as well as watch Parisians (& the tourists) walking, sitting, watching, running, playing, reading, generally relaxing in a beautifully laid out garden. Enjoyed very much the open air "strictly come dancing" display, don't know if this is a regular feature? does anyone else know? Would never watch this at home, but there was something quite different coming across ballroom dancers in a bandstand on a sunny summer afternoon in a Paris park! It definitely required an ice cream to add to the enjoyment & one was nearby.Would recommend this park to any visitor.

Splendid Gardens. This vast garden is filled with a huge variety of flowers, trees, and shrubs. It also contains a large children's playground, bocce ball courts, statuary, bee hives, and ponds. It is a real pleasure to stroll through.

Beautiful garden with enough thing to do. I visited these with my wife and our two year old daughter . I had thought that she would be as much happ here as in Disney. I was not wrong. It has enough to keep kids of any age busy for a long time. It even has activities like tennis etc for anyone else . Add to it beautiful flowers and lots of greenery. Any body who enjoys garden would love this. it is also centrally located.

Beautiful. Gorgeous place, so interesting and a massive variety of things to see. My only problem was we were visiting with a disabled family member and there were no disabled bathroom facilities which made our trip shorter!

Amazing, must see. These is the most beautiful park I've ever seen, so nice and lively, the students hang out there in the afternoons and have picnics, families hang out by the fountain where the kids have those remote controlled boats, it's very nice.
Relax and enjoy the atmosphere. A relaxing space in the center of Paris to sit on one of the many chairs and enjoy your lunch time picnic.

Beautiful. We visited these gardens early in the morning on the day we were leaving Paris. They were beautiful in the early sun, quite a few people around but still tranquil and relaxing. Lovely flower displays and shady walkways under trees. A very nice end to our stay in Paris.

Great afternoon for the family. We spent a wonderful afternoon at Luxembourg Gardens. The French sure know how to entertain both children and their parents at the same time - wonderful playground and cappuccino!

Central Park in the Middle of Paris!. A huge, green refuge in the city. Lots of activity, bocce ball (the French have a different name), tennis courts, children's playgrounds, gorgeous gardens, Parisians and visitors sit and read and talk around the lake. Stroll through - you will feel like a Parisian!

Beautiful!. a lovely garden, well maintained and nice for a wander. Oddly this is the one place in Paris that we saw quite a few joggers. So if you feel the need for speed, but don't want to stick out like a sore thumb, Luxembourg Gardens is your spot
very pretty. lovely place for a walk or picnic. Best to go in the morning if you want it quiet and peaceful. I will be going again on my next trip to paris

Park Paradise. Parks are an enormous part of Parisian culture, and the Luxembourg Gardens is an extremely beautiful park in the heart of Paris. On weekends, especially, it abounds with families and all Parisians who wish to read, chat, play games or just enjoy the beauty of the park! A slice of Paris you must embrace!!

Just Another Garden. There are a lot of nice "Parks" throughout Paris which really negates the need to make a special trip to Luxembourg. They're nice if you're staying in the area but there are friendlier places to hang out.

Beatiful Park. A stone's throw from our apartment, this park was a daily fixture! Quiet areas, manicured areas, tonnes of history (statues etc.) and a great place to just sit and do nothing. Kid's (or adult's) can rent little wooden sailboats to navigate a central pond. Tennis courts and other rec. areas, many benches and tables. A must see part of any trip.

Fabulous - a great experience with kids. The fist tourist attraction our family of four (2 adults, kids visited in Paris was the Luxembourg Gardens - not too far from the apartment we rended in Paris. First of all, the gardens are magnificent - beautiful sculptures tucked away in every nook and corner, lots of beautiful fountains, and much much more. There are Parisians sitting around, reading books, having lunch, or just whiling away the time with their friends.For those with young kids, there are two specific ways to keep your little ones busy. First, there is a nice playground with all kinds of amazing playground equipment. My kids, 8 and 10, had a wonderful time here. Be warned though - there is a fee to enter. I don't remember what it was, something small in the 2-4 Euro range. Many Parisians send their kids in and sit on the benches outside (presumably so that they don't have to pay). The second is a circular artificial lake in which you can sail a boat. You get to choose a boat with a national flag and use poles to guide it around the lake. The boat can attack other boats, etc. My kids had fun watching this, especially as one boat had an encounter with a resident duck. In retrospect, I wish we had rented a boat.In short, its hard not to enjoy yourself here, irrespective of your age.

Lovely place to visit. The garden was lovely to visit, especially if you fancy a change of pace from a lot of sight seeing. I really enjoyed napping in one of the deck chairs and resting my blistering feet after being dragged all over Paris by the excited wife. It's a relaxing part of Paris to visit.

Beautiful park in the middle of the city. Very nice place to go and chill out amongst true Parisiens. Not many tourists, which gives you a true French experience. Very picturesque and quiet place to rest in between all the touristy attractions

Beautiful...should be more famous!. We stumbled upon the Jardin du Luxembourg on one of our days in Paris. The garden is breathtaking with its beautiful flowers, pond with miniature sail boats and many beautiful statues. It seemed like a great place for families and children and for relaxing.

Beautiful. We loved our lunchtime in the gardens. We picked up a baguette and ate on one of the many benches. The landscaping is beautiful and we enjoyed watching children push their boats in the lake.

Pretty but very crowded. Bear in mind, I was there in July (tourist megadon). The gardens are beautiful and are very centrally located. Many Parisians relaxing, catching up with friends, reading a book, enjoying lunch. If you want to sit on the grass make sure you are on the right lawn, not all are allowed to be walked and sat on. If there is no one on it, chances are you can't sit there.
Great for a morning run. Just around the corner from my hotel and is perfect for a morning run before tucking into a large hotel breakfast.
Boat rides. Cant miss it while in Paris!!! The boat rides in the lake are amazing!!! lots of fun for the whole family!!!

Great for kids. We visited the large kids playground and had a bottle of wine while the kids had a blast -- only downside is that it is 2.5 euros to enter, which is cheeky. We also rented a boat in the big fountain in the center and watched the sun set -- awesome. (Oh yes -- also with a bottle of wine, cheese and crackers.)
Pretty and so civilized!. Great break from the traffic and crowds, and clearly popular w/the locals. Not enough benches in the shade
Relaxing. Beautiful, busy yet relaxing gardens. Perfect for any day. But don't walk on the grass as you'll get told off!!

We love this one!. On our way to the Pantheon we stopped off at the gardens for a while, and just watched the people. Some were enjoying lying on the lawn, while others strolled in the sunshine.We pulled up those lovely reclining chairs and made ourselves at home for a while.For kids there is a marvellous play area in the far, top corner.
woah!. amazing or what!!! Beautiful place,Huge,Colourful,so many things to see,which we had,had more time to spend here as we only literally walked through it on way to elsewhere.

away from the madening crowd - almost!. It was really nice to have an icecream and a beer and sit in the shade of the trees on this boiling July day. The little children were bathing in a paddling pool in the gardens (away from my tranquil spot) ... much hapier than the ones being dragged around the city!

Stroll in serenity. Do not miss this beautiful garden in the heart of Paris. We visited on a sunny day in early August and got lost in the beauty. Or just lounge in one of the green chairs by the huge fountain and become a Parisian for a few hours.
Beautiful place... Take a break here with some snacks or drinks..ideal to get away from the busy Paris streets. Drop by if you can..you won't regret it!

Dreamed place. When you go in there, it may seem too crowded, but it's just in the museum area. If you keep on walking, you'll find a totally different thing, which I found much better! There are lots of spots if you walk enough! Also, after a little bit of walking, there's a place where you can rent a bycyle (totally recommend it!), just follow the path, and you'll find an ice cream shop and some other stuff to eat, with bathroom facilities. You could even rent a boat!

Nice Garden. It's always great to escape city streets into a garden, and the Luxembourg Gardens in Paris were no exception.I had pre-planned to visit this garden on my way walking to Tour Montparnasse.They are well laid out gardens with plenty of different zones, with a different feel in each.One of my pet hates is gardens without sufficient seating, however the Luxembourg Gardens has plenty of seating, which can accommodate hundreds of people, yet the garden is so large, with lovely wide pathways & open spaces, that the volume of people in or travelling through the garden isn't a factor.Well worth a visit.

Excellent spot in the middle of Paris. Excellent spot to spend a few hours and get away from the buzz of Paris when you need some peace of mind. For those with kids it is also a great place. There is a pond where you can rent a little sail boat and play with it in the pond, a playground and a puppet theater among the possible activities.The downside is that for almost everything you want to do there is a fee. So take some cash with you, especially if you're going with kids.
Not crowded, felt local. A very nice park, it felt very local and not touristy. The Museum at the edge of the park was also worth seeing.
Stunning gardens, don't miss them!. Beautiful gardens, children sailing little sailing boats on the pond and a beautiful palace to look at. How very Parisian!

Great garden. Garden that only allow to sit on chairs and benches, no sitting on grass -.-|||
The garden has a great big pond. Ideal family outing destination.
.
Hidden Gem. Short walk from hotel found this lovely garden and park area. Great place for picnic and just lazing around. Plenty of seating, lovely gardens and flowers and large pond

A beautiful oasis in the city. Whether you want to stroll or just sit and watch the world go by you could not find a more lovely place to do it. The flower beds are wonderful and there are plenty of chairs to relax in whether in the sun or a shady spot.
Get Some Cheese and Wine. Great place to have your own little picnic. There were beautiful gardens and fountains. Bring your camera.
A Beautiful walk. I loved the chairs randomly placed throughout the garden. It is an ideal place for watching Parisians at leisure.

peaceful haven. well worth grabbing some lunch and spending a couple of hours in these gardens.
plenty of seating and shaded areas
events sometimes occuring in the bandstand - historic dancing was on whilst we were there

Favorite Garden in Paris!. There are so many beautiful places to go in Paris, it is hard to know where to look sometimes..but if you want to go somewhere to relax in nature and still see some beautiful statues..along with gardens, fountains, etc..go to Luxembourg Gardens! It is just a fantastic area to explore and within walking distance to Pantheon, Sorbonne, Latin Quarter, St. Germain etc.
Fascinating Place. The Luxembourg Gardens are right beside the Metro station. Wonderful place to visit with magnificent fountains and grounds, then there is the palace....Well worth a look.
Just beautiful. We walked really fast through the park but the area is just beautiful. The trees are formed in a line and the gardens are all nicely arranged.
Great place to hang out. Gardens were lovely the day we visited. Many nice sculptures as well as greenery. I wish we had taken a picnic and just rested there.

Nice break from the Tourist hustle & bustle. The flowers were really pretty. The day we were there it was beautiful weather and many people were enjoying the sun. It's a nice place for a stroll or sitting on the many available chairs. Many tourists using one to put their feet up for a rest. Enjoyable visit to gardens in the centre of Paris!

Quintessential France. The Luxemburg Gardens are a treasure. Peaceful, spacious and so mentally and physically relaxing. A wonderful spot to sit and people watch on a warm Parisian evening. It is very popular amongst the locals with a large pool and fountain surrounded by chairs and benches, palm trees to provide shade not to mention the coll, shady avenues which were so welcome during the 30+c days and nearly as hot evenings. There are a large number of tennis courts but they seemed to be in very high demand. There is dancing 'al fresco' and a cafe as well. I just loved the opportunity to sit and watch Paris at play and families enjoying the more simple side of life. Summed up France for me.
Great Walk. Be sure and visit gardens on the way to the museums. A great cut through to many sites. Pond with boat races. Very relaxing

What a treat!. We strolled to the gardens from our hotel on Rue de Seine, stopping at St Sulpice church on the way. The gardens were alive with people walking and playing and eating and listening to live music, etc. There are many facets to this public space--lawns and a pond and a palace and an alee of square-topped trees and a picnicking area and a bandstand and many more spots we didn't even explore! We found empty chairs near a large water feature and sat stitching and sketching and people watching for part of a warm afternoon. Ate a yummy lunch outdoors at the garden's cafe. A truly beautiful place to hang out and soak up the culture.
Pack a picnic!!. Go buy a baguette and pack some snacks and just sit and enjoy this spectacular garden and public space. So great for people watching and relaxing amidst a busy, noisy city.

For a Sunny leisurel afternoon. It is always a relief to escape the urban landscape for a garden. And these are lovely gardens. I usually visit the nearby museum and then wander to the garden fior a yummy take away sandwich. The experience of the garden is always enhanced if you are accompanied by children.
Beautiful. Spacious gardens with lots of chairs and benches , the Buildings make good backdrop as well. at week ends can get busy but still enough seats.

What a place to read a book!. There is so much to do in Paris its hard to narrow your list to a few key things. But make sure a walk around the gardens is one of them. I like to bring a book. It's delightful to pause and look up at such lovely horticulture and palais.

Beautiful. The gardens are really beautiful. The colours are very aesthetically pleasing. Bring some food as there is plenty of picnic areas and cooler areas in the shade by the trees. Also tennis courts to enjoy and pony rides for smaller children. You can take very pretty pictures here too and plenty of places to sit down and relax. Also if you wish to go to the bathroom during this visit bring some change

Picnic, Stroll or Run. Pick up a picnic lunch at the nearby Gérard Mulot and enjoy strolling thru the beautiful gardens. Plenty of quiet shady spots to plant yourself for an afternoon. This is also a great spot for a run on the perimeter pathway.

Yes it should be included in your visit to Paris. I was so surprised by how beautiful the flowers, trees and all plants are. It was a place you could spend the day. We watched people playing boules; saw an apiary; kids on ponies; people sailing model boats and many sitting in the sun. Wonderful
divine - even on a sunny August. crowded, but gently so, unless you're looking to sit on the grass (there's only one stretch of lawn available to sit on)

probably the most charming garden in Paris. This place is always alive. Foreigners, students, people living in Paris enjoy to walk there or read quietly a book or bring their young children to ride for a small tour a poney or play in the children space or play "pétanque" or chest all that very near of the boulevard Saint Germain near the metro station Odéon...
Wonderful Place to Hang Out on the Left Bank. Beautiful setting, wonderful fountains, children sailing model boats, people picnicing, pretty flowers. How else to spend an afternoon?

Always worth a visit. We are "old hands", I guess, at visiting Paris ( my spouse lived here for many years and is fluent in French; I've been here at least a dozen times), yet we still enjoy strolling through and sitting in this lovely, grand park. Yes, it's a tourist magnet, but it's also a favorite spot for Parisians as well. So, here we were, still jet-lagged from our arrival the day before, on a lovely Saturday afternoon, lazily walking through the park, flowers blooming everywhere, watching boule players intently focused on their games, hundreds of locals just sitting in the sun. It was a grand way to kick off our 5-week stay here and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Paris.
nice Gardens. nice place to walk around and take pretty pictures. it's close to the Pantheon so we did them both in a row.

Quiet and peacfull. If you decide to visit, please bring along a small snack and a sit somewhere. During my visit, I was able to sit down and write in my travel journal here. Great place to escape and relax with a small snack after sightseeing Paris and people watch.

Most beautiful garden. I could have stayed there all day enjoying and photographing the amazing flowers in this massive garden. We rented a little toy sailboat in the park and our boys, 8 and 10, really enjoyed "sailing" it on the pond. Don't miss this garden!
The most beautiful part of our Paris trip. make sure to go on a sunny day right around 6-8 PM. It's gorgeous! Definitely one of the prettiest gardens in Paris.
Bottle of wine and a crepe.... You must go with a blanket, wine and buy a crepe... have lunch and lounge around. The is a beautiful garden with a lot of activities.

Beautiful!. Great way to spend a couple of hours. The park has so many beautiful flowers, trees and walk ways. We grabbed a couple of the reclining chairs and a couple of straight-back chairs and sat to play Scrabble with our feet up. Enjoyed it so much, we went across the street, grabbed some sandwiches and came back to eat near the lawn area!Position yourself right and you have views of the pond (kids with mini sailboats having fun) and the Eiffel Tower in the background... and again, flowers, flowers, flowers! And Palm trees :) Well kept up, clean... nicest park we ran into in all of France!

Largest Garden Park. The gardens include a large fenced-in playground for young children and their parents and a vintage carousel. In addition, free musical performances are presented in a gazebo on the grounds and there is a small cafe restaurant nearby, under the trees, with both indoor and outdoor seating from which many people enjoy the music over a glass of wine. A must see when you are in Paris...!
A haven in the heart of the city. Beautiful flower beds, well-tended. Plenty of chairs in which to relax (free!) and recover from a hard day on the feet

Beautiful!. Beautiful park and gardens. Something for everyone! There were men playing bowls, cards and chess. Kids racing Go Karts and riding ponies. Enormous park area with swings, slides, climbing, running and activites too. Kids playing basketball. Little kiosk selling crepes, drinks, snacks. A lovely restaurant which ws very reasonably priced. Lots of history and statues, fountains, sculptors, a palace a gallery. Beautiful citrus trees in great big purpose built wooden boxes. Lots of portable seats everywhere. A beautiful fountain feature and people chilling around it. Lots of colourful and amazing plants and flowers. All in all we absolutely loved this park/gardens. Our teenage children wanted to come back again and again.

Pictoresque area. We have really enjoyed the nice view of the elegant palais, the pound in front of it with boat toys the children played with, gorgeuos flowers, historic sculptures, tennis courts and the overall environment offering a nice relaxation and pleasure. It is quite suitable to go there with children, to play tennis and make jogging, and just to enjoy the nice view.
Lovely place for a walk. We spent sunday morning just sitting around and watching the world go by. It is very peaceful and beautiful.
Very nice place. Nice garden, another park ideal for children (Paris is full of them). you can use the available chairs and tables and have a picnic, children can have a tour on a pony

Garden filled with plenty of tourist but fortunately also plenty of seats available.. Garden filled with plenty of tourist but fortunately also plenty of seats available.Beautiful flowers with literally birds and bees. Must visit after you see Notre dame and latin quaters

Our Favorite Jardin. I think this is the most wonderful place on earth. There is so much to see, so much to do and yet... everyone just sitting around, visiting with each other for lunch or after work... just like they were in their living rooms. Puppet theatre, innovative playgrounds for the kids, boats to rent to sail in the pond, boule tournaments every afternoon, chess and backgammon, open air cafes galore, plenty of restful spots to lounge around, art museums, fountains....We cannot say enough! Spent every afternoon there....

Not a must see, but great break. We headed down to the garden to sit and relax after walking around the Latin Quarter and St. Germain. There are tons of seats and benches. My favorite part was watching the children push the wooden sail boats (3 euros for 30 min) with their sticks in the big fountain in the middle of the park.
Nice place for thd eyes. Beauty but some babies games to pay (a lot). You can play tennis, basket (free) and take the sun on a portion of the grass.

Well worth a visit and a stroll. A must if you bring kids. Beautiful park in central Paris. You can easily spend a few hours here strolling, people watching and taking in the scene. This is the place to go with children. Between the boats, the play grounds, the wading pools, the ponies and the puppet shows they can be entertained for a day.The gardens and potted trees are beautifully maintained and there are plenty of quiet spots to escape with a book or your thoughts.

Luxembourg Gardens with the family. Getting the opportunity to sail miniature sail boats with the children was such fun. The play area near the tennis courts was safe and clean and everybody enjoyed it.

Fun for all the family. The gardens are spectacular, but the highlight are the sailing boats, which keep kids and dad occupied for an hour.... not very expensive and well worth it. The children's play ground is a little expensive but very well equipped.
Gardens. This was a beautiful garden and we could have spent all day bathing in the sun, if the cafe was nicer and more French. It has become very commercial and last a bit of charm

Beautiful!. The gardens were gorgeous. A little more seculded and down to earth the the Tuilleries or some of the other major parisian gardens. It was nice to be able to enjoy it without a lot of other tourists. Hopefully you can enjoy it on a nice warm day, with a slight breeze to keep things interesting.

Great place to luch and watch Parisians. There are several very good bakeries in the vicinity of the Luxembourg Gardens and this enables one to have an inexpensive lunch while observing the locals relaxing in a beautiful setting. It seems as though walking on the grass is frowned upon in the park. There were plenty of seats when we were there and this was in the height of Summer. Take time to wander through the gardens and enjoy a laid back break.

Beautiful. The gardens are beautiful, but the point of our visit was for our son (age 14) to enjoy sailing model boats in the pond. Rental of the boats is quite inexpensive (3 euro for 1/2 hour). He had great fun trying to catch the wind and race his boat across the pond and back, and had a great time chatting with other children (from Paris and around the world) who were doing the same. There were young children (3-4 years) and young teens and adults all joining in the fun.

Relaxing.....very nice garden. Full of roses....many people enjoy having their breakfasts in the early morning there....It is quite amazing garden in the heart of Paris ....In front of the Pantheon and beside the Sorbonne university.....Try to have your breakfast or lunch there.

Great place to Run. If you are looking for a great place to run on the left bank, then head to the Luxembourg Gardens. There is a nice gravel path that circles the park and is close to a mile in length and is predominantly in the shade. If you run in the morning, you will have multiple other runners to keep you company. Be sure to be on the look out for one of the Statue of Liberty's found in the park.

Quiet and relaxing.. Where the locals spend time. Take a newspaper or book, get ahold of one of the hundreds of chairs available and sit under the trees near the bandshell to experience Parisien atmosphere. This stop will not appear on many bucket lists but it offers and enjoyable respite in a busy week. Oh, and the gardens themselves are beautiful too.
A pretty place to picnic. Quiet paths, beautifully kept gardens, very disciplined. A restful place to spend an hour or two after walking to all the "must-see" monuments.

LOVELY!. What a fantastic place for a picnic! Back in the day, the queen didn't like living at the Louvre because of the smells and noise of Paris so she had a palace built in the countryside! It is just south of the Latin Quarter but the gardens are fantastic! Just behind the palace is the flower gardens and pond. You aren't allowed on the grass here but there are chairs and benches to sit on. Past the flower garden is rows of tall trees. Here is where you can sit on the grass. Even though it is busy, it is a great place to sit and enjoy the view while having a bite to eat.

Picturesque. This is was I imagined a French park to look like. The gardens were beautiful and it was just fun to walk around. It seemed like a lot of locals (there were tennis courts, play grounds, etc,). To me it seemed to have a mini New York Central park feel.

Beautiful to spend a day in the summer. went here for a day as part of the best trip in Paris ever! The little boats are darling and the gardens are so lush and pretty! I've written all about how perfect my trip was an why here i you fancy giving it a gander http://charlottys.blogspot.co.uk/2013/08/paris-pour-les-pauvres-paris-for-paupers.html

Beautiful retreat in the city. Gorgeous grounds, of course. A wonderful park where you can just sit and read, people watch, enjoy a picnic, etc. we made it a point to walk through whenever we could as its just so peaceful. Better than navigating busy streets and sidewalks!
nice afternoon. very nice place to spend an afternoon, just enjoying the view and a nice hotdog at the park.I was there in sept, the weather was perferct...

Stroll and enjoy an ice cream. We entered thru a side entrance and lounged on benches for a while enjoying ice cream (bought outside of park). It has a large childrens play area separated from rest of park. It wasnt until we strolled around we found the pond and fountains. Stayed a couple hours. Only draw back was lots of bathrooms but all closed. May have been due to time of day (5-6pm). recommended

Lovely Gardens & grounds. We had a lovely family day at Luxembourg Gardens.
The flowers & arrangements were stunning.
We particularly enjoyed the model Sailing Boats. (I felt like a child again!).

autumn splendor. walking in this park in autumn or just sitting and staring around would just make you taste the splendor and silence of this season.children around and oldies playing chess with the smell of burning Chestnut:unforgettable.
Nice Place to Sit. A nice shady place with plenty of seats. There was a good band performing and plenty of places to eat.

Lovely place for an afternoon stroll, and great for kids. The gardens are beautiful, and the pond in front of the palace is a delight. It is so much fun to see the kids pushing the little sailboats around. Our daughter was too young to partake, but enjoyed watching the kids, the boats, and the ducks, with their recently hatched ducklings. It can be a bit busy on a warm sunny day, but it still feels like an escape from the bustling city, and there are quiet, shady places to be found on the periphery of the gardens. Wonderful!

Worth seeing. Beautifully manicured gardens in a classic Parisian stylee. Lots of sitting on chairs, not much sitting on the grass. Our 6 year old had much fun running around the place. Beware of tourist trap restaurants close by.

gardens and exhibitions. manicured and bursting of flowers - a well known place to relax and enjoy the sun in spring and summer in the busy trendy 7eme arrondissement. A nice seasonal exhibition about marquetry in July August 2013.

Jardin with a playground. Lovely garden with lots of activity happening. No direct entrance fee but sadly we have to pay for the children to play in the playground. 2.50 € per adult and 1.5 € per child. Unpleasant encounter with the counter person by the playground. 2 dudes collecting the fees whom doesn't have a child friendly approach. Nevertheless the children had fun and big enough space for 50 kids to scatter around. If the kids can have fun the parents will be contented.

Great place for a rest. A great place to just relax from all the sight seeing for an hour or two. The gardens are beautiful with hundreds of chairs dotted all around the place to sit and admire the view.
Simply gorgeous. Beautiful flowers. Interesting historical background as well. A very relaxing spot for a walk, a read or a lunch.

peaceful. easily reachable,beside luxembourg RER station. very peaceful inside the garden. visited on a Saturday morning and saw children taking part in an exciting game of miniature boat race in the central fountain pond, really a lovely experience. for me main attraction was the Statue of Liberty - The first (original) statue used by Bartholdi as part of the preparatory work for the New York statue; the artist offered it to the Luxembourg museum in 1900 and it was placed in the park in 1906.

From what I'd read, I though these gardens would be perfect. They were not that well tended and sort of run down. But they are an oasis of greenery in a crowded city, so from this aspect a nice asset to this neighborhood.

Lovely spot for a walk. As everything in Paris, this place is superb and well worth a visit. Definitely sit at the main water area with a sail boat and just relax, it is the best way to spend an afternoon. Love it!

A very popular spot. Excellent for people to walk around, sit down and relax by eating lunch, soaking up the atmosphere, or some playing chess, etc. For the kids there is a huge playground area, there is an area where they can hire and drive billy carts, there are tennis courts and court for basketball and areas to kick around a football, there is even an area to play bocce.

Like heaven on Earth. I had to visit this place more than once! It was so pretty and relaxing. If you like to people watch or just stroll through a beautiful park, this is a great place to do so. You can easily join the locals in a chair or near the fountain. It is even great to grab a bite to eat and sit on a park bench. Flowers, statues and artwork to see! It'll make you feel like you're in heaven (as if being in Paris weren't heaven enough).
Beautiful Gardens. Lovely park with plenty to see. Great for a relaxing picnic lunch. make sure and find the pond with the little wooden push boat rentals.

A family park. THis was my favorite spot during my 3 month stay. On a warm weekend day, children rent little boats, put them in the fountain and push them along with big sticks. Everyone basks in the sun and technology is in little evidence, though books are everywhere. Older persons play bacci ball and there are band concerts in the grandstand. There is a children's play ground, places to eat, hundreds of green chairs to sit on and statues to look at. It is such a beautiful place, I went often, even on cold days it was peaceful and inviting.

Glorious gardens. Beautiful, beautiful spot to have a bottle of wine and a loaf of French bread. The children playing with boats in the lake in this glorious landscape while the band played in the trees was a little bit of nirvana in the heart of the city. Lovely!
perfect afternoon stroll. Even with the full heat of July, the gardens were magnificent! Plenty of seating. Nice easy pace with sculptures throughout.

Luxembourg so beautiful Garden. It's great to have a trip to France, the capital of light and is the capital of the love.Ardin du Ardin du Luxembourg - or simply Luxembourg garden is perhaps the most famous, largest, and particularly most beautiful in Paris and France in general, the park is located in District 6, near the Sorbonne University.In the 19th century, Luxembourg garden open to the public to visit and play, so it was redesigned in French style - but the layout is preserved.Here has the beautiful fountain. In the central area of the Luxembourg garden, visitors travel to France found a lake called the Grand Bassin. Children can rent small boats on the lake cruises. It is surrounded by lots of fun to play as puppets dancing or horseback riding, very suitable for tourists who have children.Among the fountains in the Jardin du Luxembourg, the two most beautiful fountain are Fontaine de Medicis and the Fontaine de I'Observatoire. Fontaine de Medicis brought romance spirit of, smoothiness of Greek mythology, a small lake located in the northeast garden. As the Fontaine de I'Observatoire expressed solidarity with her five continents representing the continents of the world. This fountain is located at the southern end of the park, so Davioud, and Fremiet Carpaux designed in 1873.Please go to France to experience. Mercy.

So pretty. One of the highlights of my trip to Paris. So beautiful and relaxing. Join the locals on one of the hundreds of chairs and eat lunch whilst watching the kids sail boats on the pond or the men playing boule. Beautiful lawns and flower gardens. Huge playground for the little ones. Free entry. Go, you will not be disappointed.
Gorgeous!. Beautiful calming walk. superb landscaping. good people watching.if you are in St. Germain, you can't miss it.

A Lovely Picnic Spot. These gardens are lovely! Beautiful sculptures of the Queens of France lace the gardens. Children push little boats in the fountain with long sticks. Flowers are blooming everywhere. Nice snack cafe and clean bathrooms (.50 Euro fee). Gorgeous view of the Palace. Very relaxing.
Delightful. Beautiful grounds to stroll in. Also some nice shaded areas to help cope with the Paris heatwave during our stay.

Take a picnic and spend a few hours. A real oasis of calm in the middle of Paris. Also a nice way of crossing from the quite snazzy 6th arrondissement to the (more liberal and certainly more touristy) 5th arr. with Notre Dame and the book shops of the 5th. Take a picnic, sit in the park, watch Parisians and tourists alike take in a little green, rest your weary feet without having to pay for the pleasure...
Nice Place to relax and enjoy the grade.. Nice garden and a good place to just sit down and relax (and people watch). Enjoy your day here to have a picnic on a sunny day.

Such a beautiful place to spend a few hours. We planned a visit to the Gardens as part of a walking afternoon of Paris and were delighted with what we found. Such a beautiful setting with plenty of space to run around and enjoy our special family time. Although the weather was brisk (okay very cold!), we enjoyed watching the children play with their motor yachts in the small ponds and admiring the spring flowers slowly coming into bloom. I would imagine during mid summer, the gardens would be packed with locals, soaking up the sun in their lunch breaks. Within the park, an enclosed kids play area operates with excellent equipment, a little cafe and toilets. There is a charge for entry (both kids and their parents) approx 2.50 EUR but still good fun. We wrapped up with delicious homemade crepes, coffees and watched the people go by from a lovely little caravan also located within the park. A really enjoyable afternoon and well worth the visit.
Stunning park on way from Notre Dame to Eiffel Tower. Fabulous, fragrant flower beds, art exhibition in the Orangerie, music and dancing on the bandstand.
Feel like a royal .. Beautiful gardens with flowers, statues and fountains. great place to relax and rest between site seeing.

Quaint gardens to walk around in.. Fascinating place to walk around, with that gorgeous Parisian feel to it. Lots of pretty ponds with children playing around with little boats and young couples walking hand in hand as well as runners jogging. Very nice gardens to see. Very expensive to eat out anywhere around it! Lots of great little street artists around when I went, including a band who did a great rendition of the tetris theme song! Worth a look!

Incomparable architecture and beauty. Jardin de Luxembourg contains several large areas of formal gardens, pond (where one can rent boats and feed ducks), an area where people gather to play chess, and a formidable palace. Admission is free, but the park closes at sunset (in summer, 9 pm). It is most easily accessible by the Luxembourg Metro stop on the RER B line. We grabbed some food in Le Grand Epicerie at La Bon Marché and headed to the gardens for a picnic. There are areas with chairs and shade. The gardens are large and open, and there are policemen walking around to ensure safety. Even at dusk, it felt like a very safe area, with many families and couples strolling, and no merchants selling tacky wares or other people soliciting tourists. On Fridays and Saturdays, there is an area for a marionette show. It appears to be a well-established outdoor theater in the shaded woods. The stars of the gardens are, of course, the formal gardens themselves. The perennials and annual flowers in their beautiful coordinated shades, and the formally sculpted trees give a feeling of the architectural rigor of a royal French garden. One could feel immortal here.

Large Beautiful Gardens to sit in and contemplate. Always a winner to go to. I could sit and watch the little children push their boats in the round pool of water forever. Flowers are beautiful and people watching a must.

beautiful gardens. these gardens are so beautiful and so peaceful.... the paths are lined with statues, and the plants and trees are breathtaking...tok a lunch and had it by the tennis courts... very relaxing... wish i could have taken it home with me....
Beautiful park. It was a very big park, the trees, flowers, ponds were very nice. My daughter rode a pony. A nice place to rest and see.
Beautiful gardens. A great break from the heat of the day in a lovely, famous park. The large pond where you can't rent little toy boats is right out of an Impressionist painting

Sunday in the park. A great way to see Paris locals enjoy their Sunday afternoon & the gardens are gorgeous. There was a live orchestra playing that day, so we had a glass of wine & joined in the fun.

Such a beautiful place. It's a must if you are with children and even if not.
