The flowers and the garden are awesome, the pool with the small boats is adorable, and the Cafe has some nice dishes although too expensive. I would suggest to buy baguette and cheese before and have a picnic on the lawns.

A pleasant respite in the heat. These immaculate and beautifully colour co-ordinated gardens were a pleasant way to take some time out to relax on a bench in the shade and watch both locals and tourists: suntanning, reading, playing tennis and playing chess. The children were engaging in the time-honoured pursuits of sailing wooden boats in the large fountain, going on pony-rides, playing in the sandpit and splashing in the paddling pool. Beautiful statues abound. There is a bandstand as well as a marionette theatre, but no activity in either of these as we were there on a weekday. Should you wish, there is a café for light meals or refreshments.On the surrounding fence there was quite an extensive display of photographs of the Tour de France from way back to more recent times which made for interesting viewing.
Great place to soak in the sun!. This beautiful garden full of green chairs to sit and relax is the perfect place to be when enjoying the great summer weather.

Beautiful and relaxing. I very much admired the beautiful flowers, the colors, the nice cool breeze under the trees, the plenty of chairs all around so you can sit and enjoy, the beautiful statues....

Take a breather. This is a lovely place to just relax and watch the Parisians enjoy the park and fountains.We found it was a great place to take a little time to rest while enjoying the beauty of the gardens as well as watching the boats in the pond.

Fabulous buildings & so peaceful. These gardens were amazingly calming; it was fabulous just to wander round in the sunlight.
There are a few different areas to the park & loads of metal recliners scattered around to have a seat on & watch people walk by.

Beautiful!. The Luxembourg Gardens are gorgeous. You can be a Parisien and simply go and sit, read a book, lie down on the grass or people watch. You can play tennis, sail a wooden boat, buy a crepe, eat ice cream, visit an art display, admire the sculptures, go into the museum, listen to the sounds of children playing... Go there!

Stroll, sit, eat, admire for hours. You must visit these huge, free gardens. You can walk through, sit in one of their many free chairs, sail a mini boat (on the little lake in front of the administrative building), eat at a little outdoor cafe, or just admire the hundreds of lovely flowers. Only a 10-12 minute walk from Notre Dame. A great place to visit on Bastille Day, or any day.
Beautiful gardens!. We went to Paris with our 4 year old. The park is beautiful,shady with a fab children's playground.Lovely place for a stroll or a picnic.
So clean and green. So many people enjoying the gardens. I guess it's because the city people don't have any green around them.
Beautiful gardens--great place to chill. Really pretty park. Great place to relax after the congestion of the touristy sites. Seemed like there were a lot of Parisians there.

Magnificent. Beautiful. Include it in your trip. Just an exquisite example of how to create beautiful public space in a large metropolitan area. The Luxembourg Gardens provides a relaxed respite from the quick pace of Parisian life. Local or tourist, it is well worth a visit.
My favourite place in Paris. I always come back here when I'm in town. Bring wine, cheese and a blanket and everything is perfect for a picnic!

Ahh so french :). The part I always see in pictures online is right in the middle- the floating boats, flowers, etc. Great atmosphere, peaceful. Lots of people watching to be had, grab a bench or cafe chair and just hang out!

Beautiful park to get away from busy city. After several days in the heart of busy Paris, it was nice to get away to a quiet and peaceful setting. Luxembourg Gardens had very few tourists, and many lovely areas where you could walk, or as we did, pack a picnic lunch and relax. Shared our bottle opener with a Parisian couple and had a friendly chat. Wonderful!

Beautiful and peaceful. The gardens are beautiful and there are wonderful statues scattered around to look at. There are lovely chairs scattered around to sit on and this is the perfect place to look sit and enjoy a picnic and to relax. I ran to the a cafe over the road where you can buy a meal deal for less than 6 euros (baguette, cake/tart and a drink) and sitting and eating it in such a tranquil place was wnoderful.

Great for kids, but watch your stroller. Beautiful place with lots of open space to walk / run around with kids. The large fountain has small kid sail boats you rent (3euro for 30min) which is nice for a little older kids >4. The boats sail from side to side making the kids run around the fountain. Little snack shop displayed the stereotypic French waiter attitude towards "tourists" which was not nice. Also prices for soda/ water drinks were double in price to what they should be, however, it's expected at places like this. Lastly watch your stuff at all times. Our stroller was taken while playing with the sailboats. This is an obvious statement, however, needs to be stressed. The local police were not helpful and there are no "lost and found" sections.
Beautiful gardens. Very pretty with lots of lowers and greenery. There are seats and a big pond. Nice place to relax away from the hassle and bustle.
Much fun for kids. Easy 3 hrs relaxing letting kids use sailboat rentals...very coolPark is rather large with various entrances and a snack bar.
Great place. A very quite place in paris, the flowers and trees are very beautiful.Place to rest in Middle of Paris

Free in Paris!. The Medicis would be rolling in their graves if they new we bought a bottle of champagne and orange juice and spent a wonderful Sunday afternoon in their back yard. There are chairs, various levels for sun and shade. The weekend has concerts and puppet shows. There is a rather reasonable cafe. Oh, and you can rent boats to sale in the boat basin too. Kid friendly. You have to stop by or at least pass through.
A Beautiful Park.. Sit and watch the sailboats on the pond. It will take you back to a simplier time! Find a chair and people watch or sit on the grass and have a picnic!

Great for children!. OK - so you need to warn your children before you go that they can't play on the grass - but they will love the sailboats and spend hours at the pond. It's a terrific way to see a slice of French life.
Unexpected. We stumbled across these on one of our long walks and spent a couple hours enjoying its great surroundings.
Haven in the City. Beautiful and not too crowded. It's possible to find a chair and just sit and take in the beauty. I lovely quiet interlude in a busy day.

Beautiful. These gardens were absolutely beautiful. There was a bandstand there with someone playing the piano (free for everyone to listen to). It was a really hot day when i visited and everyone had just pulled up chairs (these are chairs that are provided free in the gardens in Paris) and were relaxing/sunbathing.A lovely place to chill out and read a book

Historic, enchanting green space, an oasis of beauty.. We use the Jardin extensively when in Paris. it is a great place to meet for a light lunch and in which to hve a picnic. With young children, there is an excellent children's playground where little ones will be kept happily and safely occupied all day, if desired. There are also excellent exhibits in the Musée so adults can take it in turns to visit. the museum was exceptionally kind to us and lent us a baby sling to carry our baby in while we visited the Chagal exhibition.

A Garden Fit For Royalty. At one time, only royalty and aristocrats could visit these exquisite gardens but now you can live like French royalty in this beautiful government owned gardens, park, and recreational area. This is where the French go to picnic, eat lunch, let children play, walk dogs, and much more. There are 60 acres with gorgeous flower beds, trees, grass, ponds, children's activities, and fountains.The original palace was built in 1615 by the widow of Henry IV, Marie de Medici who missed her hometown of Florence, Italy so much she had this re-creation of her childhood home Pitti Palace. Her son Louis XIII grew up to be a creep and drove her from her palace into Germany. You can rest, take your dogs to the doggie area (special place for this), jog, walk,eat in a cafe, picnic, play chess, play tennis, play cards, or enjoy the children's area. There are toy sailboats to rent for the kids, puppet shows, a toddler wading pool, sandbox, merry-go-round, slides, swings, jungle gyms and pony rides. There are plenty of chairs for loafing. Enjoy some live music. This is the peaceful side of Paris right in the Latin Quarter.
Okay. Relatively small walled park. Not allowed on the grass so you have to walk along the dirt paths. A few suspicious groups of idlers hanging out under the trees.
worth a stroll through. Sample the quality of relaxed Parisien life; water features, statues and an old palace. A popular venue to relax in or to run around.

Sailing boats on the pond. The gardens are beautiful and have a real Parisian look and feel. They are a nice escape on a hot sunny day in the city. The children really loved the small sailing boats (and the icecream of course)

My favourite park in Paris. This park is just simply beautiful. Extremely well maintained and even when very busy it's still possible to find a quite place to be alone if you want to. The playground area for the kids (not free) is always heaps of fun for kids from 2 or 3 up to 10 or 12. The flowers are stunning, there's often live music and (free) exhibitions.Dogs are kept to one area of the park, so no need to worry about sitting or walking on any surprises. You can play tennis, ride a pony, play chess, watch a puppet show, play with boats around the pond.....just endless things to do or nothing at all.

Fantastic. Great Place to about anything. Big grass areas if you wanna go smooch or take a nap. Don't miss the fruit orchard in the back right corner , they have done a great job on working them in different directions

Superb place to while away the hours!. Went through the gardens a few times whilst we stayed in Paris - very well kept and clean with gardens staff on patrol.Great seeing the children sailing their boats on the pond!Liked the idea of the chairs being left around - seemed to be plenty to go around.

Park used by Parisians and good for a leisurely stroll. This island of quiet is favoured for a lunchtime break by many who work in the surrounding area such as Montparnasse and the SenateThe gardens are lovely, and have both water and statues to admire as you stroll around.Enjoy an escape from all those tourists and perhaps stroll over to the Montparnasse Tower for a ride to the top and that spectacular view.
Beautiful. The Luxembourg Gardens are so beautiful. A great way to spend an hour or longer just taking it all in and relaxing around a wonderful environment.

A lovely pocket of green in the middle of Paris. If gardens in Paris will never compete with those in London, this one still is a lovely break from the urban hub of the Quartier Latin. Easy to reach (a few minute walk from the Seine), refreshing and peaceful in most parts, offering a bit of freedom for children to run and play around and lovers to linger about, with fountains and lots of different little corners, it provides more shade than the beautiful Tuileries Gardens on a scorching sunny day. Above all, it's one of those Parisian places that's kept most of its original typical flavor through the years.

A French garden. As a Parisian, I cross the Luxembourg garden twice a day from my home to work and vice versa.The garden is the property of the Senate and is extremaly well taken care of. It is groomed every day, flowers are changed each seasons.The garden has different parts, the "bassin" where you sail boats, the old part where you can read under very old trees, the children playground, the orchads where are grown very old species of fruits, the apiary, the Orangerie with art exhibits, the museum and the tennis courts.You can picnic, you have 2 restaurants, you can buy ice cream and eat French pancakes.It gives a sense of what must have been the French garden of a palace, yet it conveys a great sense of modernity: children, families, students, lovers, aging people can share this experience.

Beautiful garden "à la française". The Jardin du Luxembourg are the gardens of the Palais du Luxembourg which is the Sénat, the French second legal chamber. They are located in the Quartier Latin, one of the most lively areas of Paris, with its universiites, libraries and cafes. These gardens are one of the nicest ones in Paris with a typical design "à la française". Highly recommended for a walk or a rest.

Our favorite Paris hangout. There is no better place to spend part of a day--or several parts of a day--in Paris. The gardens are spectacular. There are frequent free outdoor concerts by musicians from around the world. (We heard a Chopin piano concert on July 14--with at least 1,000 in attendance.) You can watch children sail small boats in the basin, watch people playing tennis (or play), take children to a marionnette performance, etc. There are often art displays on the fence nearest Boulevard St Michel (Tour de France photos at the moment). We usually take our breakfast into the park in the morning and often go back in the evening to take photos of the flowers or watch the sky turn colors with the Eiffel Tower in the distance. Just perfect.

Stumbled on a gem!. We had never heard of this park, and walked there just because it looked sizable on our map. What a BEAUTIFUL palace and park! There was a piano concert in the park when we were there, and countless people just enjoying the day.
Beautiful. It is a great area for couples to relax and talk in a beautiful setting. The garden is really beautiful and you can close your eyes and think you are in Paradise.

Lovely place to take a break from sight seeing. Stopped off here on our way to see Saint Chapelle. A really lovely combination of formal gardens with more informal areas dotted with trees offering shade. There is a large pool with toy boats for youngsters to play with and there was a very pleasant cafe set amongst the trees where we had a tasty snack and watched the world go by for a while. There were also pony rides available.Highly recommended for a break if you are in the area.

The place to be on a Sunday afternoon!. Imagine strolling people... lovers, elderly locals, tourists, children and parents with babies in prams.Imagine deep shade and plenty of seating, people resting and reading peacefully.And in other parts of this huge, lovely garden there are Lots of flowers, a place to sail motorized toy sailboats, a playground, a cafe and at least a game or two of soccer or ball.The adjacent museum has special exhibits, and seasonally there are large photographic exhibits displayed on the exterior iron fences.It's a world in itself!
Pretty Gardens great use of public space. Lovely large gardens, nice for a stroll, picnic or just to people watch, something for all ages to enjoy.

Perfect family day out. After a couple of days seeing the tourist attractions of Paris, these gardens were the perfect location to wind down. There are lots of Asian and other take away eateries in the area to grab some food for a picnic or you can eat at the restaurant on the grounds., There's lots of shade and plenty to keep the kids amused...hire a little boat to push around the pond, watch a marionette show or play for hours in the amazing playground before a carousel ride to end the day.

Great place to run. Central place to exercise and jog. Beautiful Luxembourg Palace is a great distraction that breaks the monotony of your run. The fountain dedicated to Marie de Medici is beautiful and one of my favorite spots in the city.

Lovely!. Plenty of seating and a perfect place to come and relax. We brought in a snack and enjoyed a lovely hour of relaxing and people watching on a shady bench. One night there was music and dancing in a pavilion area. My favorite part of Paris!!

Great place to take the kids. We spent three hours with our grand kids in the park. The play area with the zip line, slides and climbing structure is fantastic. They loved chasing sailboats on the fountain pond as well. A great way to spend a warm summer day.

A not-so-secret garden.... Some people just love gardens, and enjoy sitting around doing nothing - for them, a visit to Jardins du Luxembourg will not disappoint. If parents are willing to indulge, kids will enjoy renting little sailboats and pushing them around the pond. Smaller kids - even those not speaking French - will enjoy the Punch and Judy - style marionette theatre. Everybody pretty much enjoys the crepe stand.Do not plan to spread out a blanket and picnic on the grass, as that is forbidden here (and throughout most of the green space in Paris) - but you can pull up a few of the green chairs and enjoy your feast and a little nap.As far as the museum goes - it has recently had a face-lift, which really makes the artwork stand out. Unfortunately, more people than ever crowd into this very small space, and it can be downright disagreeable. I would strongly suggest taking a tour, if there is an expo that interests you. It will still be crowded, but at least you will learn something about the art you came to see.

Beautiful gardens and the Statue of Liberty. Went here specifically to find the original artist's sculpture of the Statue of Liberty that was used to build the one in New York. Not well advertised, it is on the West side of the gardens - take a left after the tennis courts. Lots of other beautiful statues and flowers to see. You can even sail a boat on the fountain in the middle of the gardens
Beautiful. A great way to spend a summer day mingling with the locals. There's play parks, tennis courts and dozens of people picnicking on the grass.

A great place to relax and enjoy the more peaceful side of Paris.. Stunningly beautiful gardens and very impressive architecture. The gardens are the perfect place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. We enjoyed sitting and watching the children sailing toy boats. Take a good book and a picnic and recharge your batteries after a morning of sightseeing.

A welcome oasis. We visit the Luxembourg Gardens several times each week and have come to think of it as our private sixty acre park. Every stroll can be its own unique experience, from observing the petanque games, watching the little kids collect their rings on the carousel, seeing the toy sail boats race around the central pond, being mesmerized by the bees as they do their work around the hives, lunching on a bench and just sitting in our chairs watching the world - and all sorts of people - go by. The park is clean, meticulously cared for and safe, filled with walking paths, a huge variety of trees and thousands of flowers, an impressive collection of classic statues and an excellent museum. We never tire of this inviting property.
A very cool place to visit. A great place to get out of the sun and watch Parisiens exercising and socialising. Very pretty flowers.

Beautiful and peaceful.. See this place, you won't regret it. Once upon a time, you had to be royalty to enjoy these gardens. A perfect place to relax -- great for a picnic, admiring the formal gardens, a peaceful stroll or for a jog. This is Paris' (smaller) version of Central Park. See if you can find the original, and smaller version of the Statue of Liberty, it's in the west side of the park. There are tennis courts, bocce courts, playgrounds, chess corner, a couple of small cafés, and a pavilion that, if you're fortunate enough to be there at the right time, has classical music concerts. Do remember though, the lawns are meant to be admired, not walked on.
The Central Park of Paris. While not one of the most breathtaking sites in Paris, these charming gardens give you a chance to see the locals hanging out and having a good time

Great little hideaway in the middle of the city. My husband and I visited the gardens after being told by another couple that they were a must see, and I would have to agree. When we first walked in a military band was playing live music so we sat and listened for about 15 minutes and then took to walking around the gardens. Mind you we were both extremely hot and tired as this was towards the end of the day and the temperature was 95F so we didn't explore much. What we did see around the gardens was amazing! We had been to Hyde Park in London and found these gardens to be much more pleasant, and less crowded! I was a perfect end to a very hectic day.

Delightful formal gardens. These delightful formal gardens are wonderful, with lots of chairs around for you to sit and watch the Parisian world go by. Many colourful plants and always well-maintained.

Stunning Gardens. I could have spent all day here just walking around and watching people. The fountains are beautiful, there was dancing on a raised stage (mostly elderly bust still fun), glace was delicious and so much to see. I didn't get pooped on by a pigeon even once, so that was a plus. And one of the pigeons I'm guessing was a writer taking a smoke break as he looked much more stressed out than the others, almost as if he had been running his claw through his feathered head. He disappeared pretty quickly too, so I'm guessing he had to get back to work on his novel.
Beautiful relaxing! A must visit!. You could spend a whole day here relaxing, have a picnic, people watch, sit by the ponds.. such a beautiful place!!
Nice rest stop. Nice to find a quiet spot to stop and relax in Paris. Our little guy fed the ducks. Grounds are well kept and the old palace is a nice back drop for photo's.

Lovely garden. If you'd like an escape from the hustle and bustle of the city, walk into Jardin du Luxembourg. Magnificent gardens, nice "chateau" like building (you can't enter it). There is a pond where kids can rent a tiny wooden boat to sail, there is a bigger play ground, usually pony's to ride, an area to play chess etc. You can also just sit down in the chairs and on the benches and read a book or have lunch. Loads of people use the park for a run too.

A lovely surprise in the middle of the city. I finally found this amazing green space in the middle of Paris. No one was sailing the miniature sailboats, but that's all that was missing. There were tennis courts, sand boxes, pony rides, ponds, gardens and an amazing palace.

Good place for a read or a jog. If you've had enough of traipsing round museums or feel you have over indulged this is a good place to come. Go for a jog or read a book in one of the many chairs on offer. You will still feel like you are in France. Some of the building house small free exhibitions of paintings

Back in time!. We walked through here late on a lovely day. The gardens looked lovely and children had little boats on the pond with little sails, some with the tricolour on. Was so surprised how lovely these gardens were. Obviously nothing here to do except walk round, but if you have time and it is a nice day it is a lovely experience and has a sort of 'old fashioned feel' about it. There is a large children's playground to the side of the park and donkey rides as well.

Romantic chalet under the trees. Le jardin du Luxembourg is a big garden in central Paris, between le Quartier Latin and Saint Germain. It has an old Palace at its center with a large stone lake where ducks and little boats (which can be rented for the pleasure of children) bobble on the green water. There are different areas: one in the formal French style of garden, one with playgrounds for children, a Guignol theater, a merry go round, another space has even bee keeping facilities, but my favorite is the "forest", with tall trees and a romantic old nineteenth century wood and iron chalet surrounded by iron tables and chairs where you can have a coffee and salad in the moving shade of the tall trees, looking at pretty statues and an old fountain. After a visit of the Cluny museum, buying books at the famous Joseph Gibert bookshop, I like to go to le Jardin du Luxembourg where lovers still kiss on the benches and children run after the pigeons. The Boulevard Saint Michel lost its charm with horrible cheap clothes and shoe shops but le Jardin du Luxembourg is still the same, beautiful, well maintained and romantic.

Luxembourg Gardens if extra time. It was a few minute walk from where our hotel was so it was easy to stop by. It's nice to see local Parisians out with their families. However, the heat wave made this journey a short one!

Absolutely Gorgeous!. After going to a Chagall exhibit at the Musee du Luxembourg, we decided to check out the gardens. They were absolutely beautiful and so relaxing. I like that there is plenty of seating throughout - you can sit around the rose garden, watch tennis matches, or sit around the fountain. It would be a nice spot to take a picnic as well. Very peaceful - a nice spot to take a break, put your feet up, and just enjoy Paris life. Très romantique!

Beautiful and relaxing respite. After lots of touring, sights and running from place to place, it was wonderful to relax on a sunny day in the gorgeous Louembourg Gardens. Lots of places to just sit, rest and enjoy an Orangina from the stand, while watching the small boats be launched on the lake.

Great for a walk and a rest. Just a nice and tranquil place to get away from the busy streets and crowded areas. Lots of chairs to lounge in, a nice outdoor cafe and also the orange ride has great art expositions.

Such a beautiful find. We stumbled on this on our walk from the left bank to Notre Dame. A breathtakingly beautiful HUGE garden that was very reflective of the history and art of Paris. If you want some place to relax and read a good book or bring young children to enjoy a day in the park (they had wading pools, sand boxes and play sail boats in the fountains for toddlers) i would certainly recommend this park.

Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful!. One of the most beautiful place in Paris. So beautifully maintained and lively. Loved to watch the kids with their sailboats at the fountain. Great place for a picnic. Was fortunate to hear a band from Tennessee playing songs by John Phillip Sousa during 4th of July and Bastille week!
Nice parks to hang out. Summer time would be the best time to visit. There was a mini orchestra which plays good music not only classics also jazz and pop.

Rest after a whole day walking. When in Paris you walk a lot, Luxemburg Gardens is the perfect place for you to rest in the end of afternoon in a summer day. Just seat in the shadow of a tree and enjoy all that beauty.

Beautiful Gardens and place to Relax. Be sure to find the formal Garden area and the fountain pool with folks sailing model boats. Local folks playing Chess and small children with their Nanny enjoying a wonderful summer nigh.

If I lived in Paris I'd be here every week.. Aside from being beautiful, there are cute little eateries and cafe's, a lace for the kids to play with their sail boats, concerts, exhibitions and more. It is a great open space to walk, sit under a tree, get some sun, breathe. It is a very Parisienne place, many locals. It is also close to the Sorbonne, so there are students from all over the world there on week-ends. A friendly "hello" can spark a conversation with someone from an exotic place who can share ideas and who will be quite interested in your origins etc.

Beautiful gardens. Beautiful and quiet gardens! Fun to take a break from sightseeing and just relax and walk around to see all the beautiful flowers in bloom during summer. Worth a stop if you are in the area.

Wow! Do it, go there and chillax you're on holidays.. What a great place to hang in the middle of a busy and fast past world city. My wife and I spend an hour or two there and watched children playing with boats on the lake. Even got pooped on by a bird and that didn't ruin the experience ;-).
Beautiful. Don't miss an opportunity to visit these gardens. However, be careful of pick-pocketer's. You can take the Metro or bus.
paceul place. it is a wonderful park with an open place and a waterpool;there are a lot of seats and chairs all over;also nice cafe
Wine in the park. Such a nice park. Grab a bottle of wine and a sandwich and go sit at one of the many places available and watch the people walk by.

This is a nice little park in the heart of Paris. I often stop here for fresh air every time I visit Paris and Montparna. Sometimes they have special functions there for free. Once they had fruit-veggie and fruit carving fair, and you get to try any fruit and veggies for free. I liked that a lot and it stays in my memory.
beautiful. Well worth a visit, nice to sit under the trees and enjoy the quiet.A short walk from Vavin station and about 20 mins fron St Michel
Enjoy an afternoon at the Luxembourg Gardens. I loved the gardens, they´re very pretty and it´s nice to stay out for the pleasure of a beautiful afternoon view and picnic.

Tranquility defined. My favorite park in Paris. Great location (only minutes from Notre Dame) and a great spot to relax after some heavy walking ;-)
Check out my blog if you're looking for more detail (and other recommendations for the area):
http://disdatdudder.blogspot.com/2013/07/paris-mon-amour.html

Copacetic Setting. Few better places to lounge around and people watch in the whole world. Just don't traipse on the lawn where you're not supposed to. The guardians have eagle eyes and will reprimand you! There are athletic fields, gardens, children play areas, and a museum on sight. This was a Medici property. When here you'll be communing with medieval history.

2 stops away from Chatelet Les Halles by Metro. If you have some spare time in Paris and have young kids do go. After 2 non stop days in Paris my kids really loved it there as in the garden there is a large playgroung. However this is at a charge. If I am not mistaken it is about Eur2.50 for adults and the children are for less. There is also a kiosk where you can have a drink or an ice-cream and even a restroom. If you go there put on hats, sunblock and wear a running shoes as we were not comfortable with the sandals. There are other activities to do. For older children there are the bicycles, sailing boats with remote control and even cars with pedals.Keep in mind that these attractions are all at a charge even though the garden itself has free entrance. There is the pond with ducks but there were no pony rides when we went. Overall it is nice.
Best place to visit with kids. Make sure you have cash on you to pay the entrance fee to the playground. Other than cost, great spot for kids.

Do you want to feel French?. There is no place like the Luxembourg Gardens! It is one of the best city parks in the world. There are plenty chairs if you want to sit, if not, you can walk around and see children playing or adults in a bocce tournament. As you walk through the park you will feel the French history all around you. I don't think it would be great in the rain I don't remember any covered areas. It also closes at nightfall. I always go for a walk on every visit to Paris!

Perfect picnic spot. Go to La Grande Epicerie de Paris, get a baguette and some freshly cut salamis (don't forget a bottle of champagne) and head down to Jardins de Luxembourg for a lovely picnic lunch.

Lovely gardens, good playground. This garden makes for a beautiful walk. Of course, like most of Paris, one is not allowed onto the grass and must walk only on the broad pathways. There is a large playground for children (1.80 euro per child per visit, multi visit passes are available at better prices). The musee and the senate are both here as well and add great architectual drama.

Great for relaxation. I liked everything about the garden. The plant arrangements were beautiful, the space was wide, there was a lot of seats to sit and relax and you can really see and feel Parisian life there.

A model that should be copied everywhere in the world. We loved this park!So beautiful, and the size was just right. Lots of activities happening, and great to see ducks on the pond with kids playing with their little boats. Parents relaxing on the deck chairs and so warm and sunny.I wish there were more places in the world that are as peaceful and wonderful as this park. It just has that certain charm that I have not yet seen in the rest of the world. Well done Paris!

A Jewel !!. Beautiful!!!! I wish we had an extra day to just sit and really enjoy the atmosphere. The gardens were so gorgeous and very well maintained . It is a must see . Be sure to allow time to ENJOY !!!!

Beware of the lawn police. While there are no signs on the grass, the lawn policeman was being very zealous on the day we visited.
It was a weekend and the place was crowded. Surely people sitting on. The grass ever so demurely wasn't going to destroy the place
Great!. I enjoyed the Gardens and it is definitely worth a visit. It is a great place to go to relax and they have chairs dotted around the place along with food stalls and a playground.

Come sit (but not on the lawn). Great place to relax with a picnic basket filled with goodies from Raspail market or nearby patisserie (if you didn't bring your own food, there is an Angelina cafe you can by from). walk or jog or sit on the scattered chairs. Nice even on hot weather.
Exceptional. A must visit, beautiful palace and gardens in a central yet quiet location. Great place to walk, have an icecream and enjoy the stunning architecture and beautiful gardens

Beautiful. Stunning park, great to sit back and relax. Castle beautiful, great for picture taking. Cute for kids to rent and sail a small boat in fountain area. Could easily pend 3-4 hours there. If rushed you can pass through it in a hour for sure. A must see if in paris

If I lived in Paris, I would be here all day.. Our hotel was located nearby, so this was our first stop. So many Parisians as well as tourists walking, running, sitting, reading, playing music, and picnicking.Many chairs are provided throughout the gardens and people are able to move them around to fit their comfort.So many beautiful things to see, if I lived here, I would make a point of visiting everyday.
so lovely; don't miss. beautiful setting, lovely flowers and open spaces. take lunch. take a book. take a friend and sit in the chair and relax. love LG.
Beautiful gardens. This is a wonderful place to wander around and see a peaceful side of Paris. Many people were there,but the gardens are so big it doesn't seem crowded at all
Loved it. We went there after a long day of sightseeing for a rest and we watched how people play petang and tennis. There's a beautiful building with a nice park. It worth a visit!
not far from the Eiffel Tower. Suitable for a relaxing, away from pik-nik. Beautiful park. Many flowers and a fountain. Luxenburg palace in the background. Nearby cafes and bakeries.
Take a Sunday stroll. This is a great place to come on a Sunday afternoon. Watch the kids float their boats in the little lake, hear a band play and get great people pictures.

Beautiful Gardens - Fun for kids. Luxembourg Gardens are just beautiful. There are tons of people just hanging out enjoying themselves and the happy mood is contagious. We let our daughter "sail" a boat at the pond and she really loved it. Just beautiful. I consider these gardens a must-see.

A must with Kids. We recently visited the Luxembourg Gardens with our 7, 6, and 18 month old. It was a definite highlight for the kids. The boats are a must and there is a really nice playground that you pay to visit (not expensive and they have bathrooms and a snack bar). The playground had a zip line for the older kids and a sandbox for the younger ones and lots to do in between. We enjoyed it lots!

Always good for a stroll. Since we love Hotel Luxembourg Parc we love the Gardens. It offers a wonderful stroll looking at the flowers, the families and the statues. You can find the Statue of Liberty here. Make sure to visit the Medici Fountain- beautiful!

Great place to relax. Wished we could have spent more time here. Great place to just walk around and picnic. Loved seeing lots of locals which was a refreshing after visiting some of the other Paris sites.

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful on a warm July day. There is no shortage of things to look at whether you want a chair by the pond with children playing with boats or prefer to walk the pathways. Plenty of shade as well. So glad we took the time to walk through completely.

Don't miss this garden on Saturday or Sunday!. This is a wonderful place to enjoy Paris life on the weekends. Free concerts and tango lessons offered after 3 p.m. The garden & museum were exceptional. We brought food for a picnic (chairs everywhere), and listened to a classical music performance under lush trees. Don't miss this garden.
Lazy Day in Paris. Loved these gardens - plenty of trees for welcome shade, lovely park café, lovely, elegant gardens, central stage for concerts - very relaxing.

Nice n relaxing garden~. Went there in the afternoon, so hot, have to put sunblock on if you are afraid of getting burn.But worth to go, you can take lots of very nice pictures here.I'm from Hong Kong, it's impossible for me to find a place like this in my city, so I really enjoying being in this garden. Love it. I'm sure I'll visit this place again.

Romantic Venue. The Luxembourg Garden is a romantic venue. You can see the Paris Eifel Tower from here. Holding hands with your special lover, its a perfect ambiance of love and romance. There are a lot of people trying to hand you flowers here but be careful they are not free.

My Favorite Place in Paris. I've had the good fortune of going to Paris numerous times and no trip would be complete without a stop at the Luxembourg Gardens. This trip I was able to picnic with my family and then catch a late afternoon nap by the fountain in the shade of the amazing trees. This is truly a wonderful experience that shouldn't be missed.

wonderful to stroll around. we happened to be there during fashion week. could have stayed all day just watching who was coming and going. Very peaceful area. you always see it in movies so its nice to just be there and stroll around taking breaks here and there. No rushing just enjoy
Beauty. We sent the afternoon at the gardens, what a wonderful quiet relaxing place to visit. People were pushing sailboats, reading books, taking pictures, people watching. What a wonderful day.

Natural beauty. Take time for a relaxing stroll with all of the other Parisians through the gardens. Families, couples and the business crowd on their breaks are all walking or relaxing on a park bench. The gardens are filled with sculptures and some of the most amazing flowers.

Romantic and enchanting. This is a spacious park with many fountains to enjoy. There are a couple that are well shaded with lush trees and beautiful gardens. A perfect place to enjoy a picnic lunch with a loved one, friend, or your own company!

great spot for a picnic. we stopped on our walk to the Luxembourg and assembled a nice picnic, ham, bread, cheese, fruit, yogurt and a couple of beers. Sat on a bench overlooking the Gardens and enjoyed the view, pristine gardens. Loved seeing all the Parisiennes enjoying their afternoon playing cards, chess, tennis. A lovely spot and a MUST SEE on a visit to Paris!

Beautiful Park with lots of shade for a hot day!. Very pretty park with lots of shade and green metal chairs to sit for a while. Great place for a picnic on a sunny afternoon. Lots of local Parisians enjoying a sunny Sunday afternoon. Great playground area if you have young children as most of it is shaded.

Beautiful small park in middle of Paris. Could have spent a full day there. Had art museum, beautiful gardens, water attractions, tennis, great shaded lunch spots, reasonably priced cafes and a bandstand with live orchestra on a friday afternoon.

I'd be here everyday if I livedneaby. So many people leisurely watching time go by with a book or a coffee...statues throughout, a small symphony concert in a pavillion one evening...kids' brass band playing the funkiest version of Can't Take My eyes off of You on the sidewalk outside the gardens...paths throughout...chairs and benches throughout...brought teas to my eyes being there our last day knowing I wouldn't be able to take a stroll through to relax the next day.

Magnificent gardens. A breath of fresh air in the heart of Paris, grab yourself an ice-cream and watch the world go by. See where all the locals hang out, reading books, doing cross-words, people watching ...

Fantastic place for kids!. There is Les Petits Bateaux - wooden model sail boats that your child can float in a fountain (€3/half-hour). A playground that you pay into (€2.5 kids/€1.2 parent) that gives you access for the entire day. It's amazing! It had a zip line, sand box, climbing structures and tons of things for toddlers to tweens to enjoy. Parents can sit in chairs throughout the park and there is ample shade. The marionette show, adjacent to the playground was also great fun. We saw the "Three Little Pigs" and my four year old loved it even with the language barrier.For adults, the gardens are a serene, beautiful space to escape the busy streets for a bit.

Best playground in Paris. The playground has a small admission charge that gives you a full day of access within a fenced-in area with a small snack bar, bathrooms, and a water fountain. The space is divided into two areas: ages 0-7, with a sandbox, merry-go-rounds, and small climbers; and 7+, with a large climber, a rope mountain, and a really cool zip line. Totally worth the price of admission to give the kids a chance to run around. The pond rents sailboats for 2 euros/30 minutes.

Great kid friendly park. It seems quite hard to find high quality play parks for kids in Paris. Perhaps it was just us but though we found a number of small parks which suited the 2-5 age group dotted around the Latin Quarter, we didn't find too many suitable to our more adventurous 5 year old and 7 year old. I came across the kids area at the 'Jardin de Luxembourg' during a morning run and once I told my kids about it they were determined to get there. Best access is from the 'B' line (extra charge over Metro lines) at Luxembourg station though I'm sure there's a Metro nearby too.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens to rest and enjoy the weather. Was nice to smell the flowers and enjoy the sunny day

A Paris Favorite. I lived across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens when I did a study abroad in 2000 and it has been a favorite spot in Paris ever since. A lovely place to just sit and people-watch as well as go on longer walks or runs. Be sure to wander around as there are lots of great finds (a cafe, a museum, a gorgeous fountain, sculptures etc etc). Lovely and quintessential Paris!
Beautiful gardens. Nice walk from my hotel and in the morning it was quite and a good place to jog or just walk. Very safe and a nice place to hang out for awhile.
Beautiful gardens. Very nice spot to take a lunch to then stroll around the paths. Lots of chairs on paths are great (most grassed areas are banned for walking, sitting etc!).
Lovely. is the word that comes to mind. But I really didnt like the large pats with sand, between the gardens. Go here when its to hot, and sitt on the many chairs ind the shade and cool off.

Our Neighbourhood. Wonderful formal garden, exceptional palace and for children, sailing boats in the pond. For £30 you get 30 minutes and a bamboo pole to push and track your country flagged sailboat...and run around the pond edge to push it back. 5 year old loved it but 10 and older were a bit too cool! Adults used children as an excuse! Find a shady spot and hang or bring a picnic from the Monopol.

perfect break from museums. Our intent in visiting these gardens was to watch the puppet show. We discovered that we had 90 minutes to wait and so sent off to discover other areas of the gardens. Our first stop was the boules (kind of like lawn bowling) courts. We sat down and watched the men play had a wonderful time. They completely ignore everyone around them so you’re not intruding at all. Next we went to the big fountains in the middle where they have sailboats going all the ground kids can take sticks provided by the park and push the boats away from the wall to keep them ceiling sailing. I kept thinking that if this were in America, the boats would be destroyed within a day but all of the kids were so respectful of the boats - it was wonderful to see. Next we found a chess game area and it was very different from what we expected – this was a super fast game that I would have lost in about 10 seconds – amazing to watch the minds at work. I was amazed that anyone could think that fast. These men however did not seen as friendly to an audience as the boules players had been and so we moved on. It was a beautiful day and I’m sure that contributed to are experience but I can see wasting away an entire day in this wonderful park. If you’re tired and need a break, grab some macarons and relax in this spot.
Goegeous. We loved it! Although it's a little hard to reach by metro. The garden is gorgeous, there was a live orchestra, but the food and snacks are overpriced
Relax and enjoy!. An absolute delight! Try to spend at least 1/2 of a day enjoying the relaxing and beautiful gardens.

So beautiful, indeed!! definitely a must see while visiting Paris..... What a beautiful garden!!!! We enjoyed every minutes we were there, eating our lunch, listening to some live music, etc. Certainly a great place for relaxing and daydreaming. A must visit especially if you travel with children, grab some lunch and relax, and you can probably feel "a piece of heaven on earth" there......

Exquisite gardens!. This time, I could only visit the pet friendly area since I had my furry friend with me. But this area is the best one, because it is where the palace and fountain is located. Great location for amazing pictures.. Loved it!
Great Gardens. Loved these gardens. Our son sailed boats on the pond and we were able to listen to live music in the park.
Great. Relaxing park. Has a small man-made large fountain/pond to sail small/mini-sail boats. My 10 year old loved it.

Make sure you experience it like the locals do. We were lucky on this trip we had been to Paris a few times before, and as we rented an apartment only a few blocks away we were able to come one day and just sit in the park for a few hours without any other agenda. Bring some croissants or pastries from a local boulangerie, a good book, and sit in one of the lounge chairs provided in the park. One of my favorite days from our trip!
Relaxing and beautiful. I was there in July and it's so beautiful! full of flowers, perfectly cared for and ornamented. I suggest going around 7 pm, seat somewhere and contemplate the view.
Beautiful!. This was my first time, though I have been to Paris many times, and I will put it on my must see list going forward. We shopped for a picnic on the way and had a delightful lunch.

A great place to have lunch. The park is quite beautiful, with lots of benches to just sit and enjoy some nature and a lot of activities for the children. There is also a restaurant (albeit with a limited offer) where you can get a decent meal, or you can just grab a sandwich and a bottle of wine and have your own lunch there. Only downside to take into account is that the park closes at 9 PM, which I found kind of weird actually.
Relax. If you're nearby it's nice for a stroll. Symmetry will strike you, calmness will come over you. Hard to believe such quiet can exist in the bustle of Paris.
Nice Garden. Great place to chill and take a rest. If you're tired from walking, sit down and take some time in the garden.

Fun for everyone!. We are traveling with children ages 8-12. They all found fun things to do here. We sailed boats, rode the carousel, and played in the playground area. What a pleasure to be able to buy espresso while watching your children play!

Charming. Strolling among the trees and beautiful flowers was already a delight. Watching children expertly "sailing" their little ships in the big pond was another wonderful pastime. If I had more time to spend I would have followed others and sat down on one of the many chairs under the shade and enjoy the idyllic air.

A great break for the family while in Paris. This is an excellent locale to get off the streets of Paris and relax in the gardens. Children have a delightful play area. Charming merry go round. Nice people watching.
Worth going. It is just next to the Pantheon and the Sorbonne (University of Paris). The Latin Quarter and St Germain districts, located on the Left Bank, are... very Parisian and you'll like it.

Green and quiet in the heart of Paris. Plenty of open green space, trees and open skies make for a nice break in the heart of Paris. As this is the garden that surrounds the French Senate, you cannot actually go on the grass, but there are plenty of benches and chairs to sit on.Of note, the garden closes at 21:00 (9:00 PM) sharp. The gendarmes and their whistles make certain that you are aware of that fact.
Beautiful!. Beautiful gardens and plenty to do for children -- we rented the boats and had a blast! Plenty of shaded areas as well which was important as the day was very hot and sunny.

very relaxing place. It's amazing place. After long walk, this garden can give you a great time to relax. there are many chairs that you can rest on. So the pond is surrounding with people. Families, kids and couples are all enjoying there. A nice view too.

Beautiful landscaping. We came to the gardens, just hoping to see the original statue of the Statue of Liberty, and we were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful the park was in general. Along with a fountain where children would play with sail boats, to perfect landscaping to park benches, and statues, and the Luxembourg palace; the centre of the park and the orangery and the area around... it is the perfect place to just sit, relax, eat or maybe read.
Take a stroll. Great spot to take a stroll and relax close to the centre of Paris, but a bit away from the hustle and bustle.

My favorite spot in Paris. As soon as you step in to the Luxembourg Gardens, you are taken aback by their beauty. A perfect example of classical French gardening, the Luxembourg Gardens are reminiscent of the ever more impressive Jardins de Versailles. Whether you want to sit down and enjoy the sun, take a nap, read a book or take a stroll, the Luxembourg Gardens will not make you regret it.
Beautiful Gardens. We bought a takeaway lunch and ate at the park. It is beautiful. It was a weekday in June but at lunch time the park is packed with locals eating and relaxing.

Stunning place for a picnic lunch. Great place to go to spend an hour chilling out on the Left bank.Go to Murlots,pick up some baguettes ,some stunning pastries,a drink of choice and find a spot to enjoy the beautiful gardens.When we visited a band from the US was visiting and entertaining the visitors with a lunch time performance .

Great weekend hangout. Visited on a Saturday. Lots of locals playing chess and renting the little sailboats for the kids. The cafe was packed, but we got a sandwich at the walk up counter and had lunch sitting on chairs around the park. Lovely.

Very Beautiful!. This was absolutely gorgeous! We had never seen gardens as beautiful as these. Great to spend a couple of hours in the afternoon and share quality time with family or significant other.

Peaceful calm. The park is full of birds, we were there in June and there were lots of baby birds. The swans were the most amazing. There were even storks. People of all ages walking, running, sitting just enjoying themselves. Vendors everywhere so you can purchase something to eat. Very enjoyable
Beautiful!. Great to end the day with a glass of wine admiring their gardens, fountains or just listen some music.Must go!
cool and nice place. a nice place to stay if you want to read a book, just relax, it has a place were the kids can ride a pony. you can relax and have a nice walk in the middle of the city.
Beautiful. Lovely place to walk around and take some cheese and wine and have lunch.Always seats available to sit down and have a picnic.
Great escape for kids. Great park with great playground. Kids played there for a couple of hours easily........... Recommended as a break from touristy stuff

A beautiful oasis on a hot July day. We arrived in Paris in early July after having toured London. Our group of 3 adults and 2 teens was feeling more than a little hot and road-weary and the kids had already declared "no more churches!" So, we were absolutely delighted to find this shady, green oasis in the middle of Paris and walking distance from our hotel in the Latin Quarter. We visited in the morning and stumbled almost immediately on the stunning Medici Fountain. We were all content to just sit in the shade of the beautiful trees surrounding the fountain, drinking in the beauty of the morning and the surroundings. Afterward we strolled through the gardens, tracking down the mini Statue of Liberty and admiring the many other amazing statutes. We highly recommend this beautiful and idyllic spot for a respite from the hard "work" of being a tourist. :) It is the kind of place that will renew your spirit and love of travel.
amazing. It was end of winter, the trees were still almost dead, but the Medici fountain and the gardens were awsome. There was an photographic exposition of the 100 years of Tour de France ouside.

Simple and lovely, take your picnic here, and a general TIP about Paris. This is the second largest park in the area, and it used to only be open to Royalty. Stop at a bakery and walk here and have a calm and peaceful picnic.We stumbled on this "garden" while walking around. There's not much to see, it's just a beautiful place in Paris that you can't begin to describe.One thing that struck me was that the "gravel" was tiny agates. I am a rock hound and we search all over for agates, and this place is lined with them! It was calm, and peaceful, and truly fit for a king.TIP: So, Paris is an amazing place. If you try just a little to fit in, you will have a great time. If you act like a rude tourist, you'll probably have less fun, since you'll be treated like a rude tourist. As with anything in Europe, if you try to blend, and they see you are trying, the whole experience will be great. If you are willing to try, and want to really experience the culture, and go with the flow, you will fall in love with this place!For example, on the plane ride over, listen to something like In-Flight French, then carry the book around. Sneak a peak before requesting a table or ordering and memorize the lines. If they see you are trying, and being polite, they will be a lot nicer. In general, everyone was VERY nice to us (in a professional way, not a southern US nice way). Also, when you go to a restaurant, the service is slow and long and very very quiet. People practically whisper. Expect this and play along.However, I can't emphasize enough, if you are perceived rude (e.g., expecting fast service, or are loud, or want people to accommodate weird requests, or demanding, or you want a fast overview and won't slow down, or have really loud kids or kids who can't sit still or listen), you should go on a full-service tour that will be able to help accommodate your needs. Otherwise, you will probably have a rough experience. That kind of personality isn't tolerated. Paris is quiet and beautiful. Go with the flow, or go with a western-based tour group and it won't matter since they go to touristy places.

A walk in a unique park. Our day here was quite cool, yet we still ventured through this magnificent and peaceful area of green. The the park is beautifully maintained. Just not your ordinary park including a small contemporary museum as well as a pond for kids to play with toy sail boats. There were stands you could purchase a crepe or a glass of wine. There is even a small restaurant if you desire more. Whenyou first enter, there is a map to show you where everything is.

Beautiful gardens. Leisurely walk through the gardens with my daughter and granddaughter. Enjoy the gelato we purchased from the. This is my second time visiting the Gardens I was here before in 2008 and the flowers were all in bloom at that time. These gardens are one of my most favorite places to visit while in Paris

Something to envy the Parisiens. This garden like many others in Paris is a fantastic place to enjoy some relax after walking in Paris. There are wonderful plants and flowers. Lot of chairs to have a sit but there is no possibility to stay on the floor/grass. A place to be visited absolutely.

Great for kids. We spent half a day here with five kids aged from 3-12. The playground is quite cheap to get into and fun with plenty of seats in the shade for adults, and a free toilet! The highlight for our kids was sailing boats on the lake in front of the palace - great photo opportunity too - and racing pedal cars. We packed a picnic lunch of baguette with ham, cheese and tomato - tres bon!

Good place for families with children. It is a nice place to spend your time for families in a suuny afternoon in Paris. Actually, anyone visiting Paris can spend for a while in the garden, because location is at top of Saint Michel. So, you will se the garden while you are walking to top of Saint Michel
Fantastic Chill out place. Loved our afternoon in the gardens, they are beautiful. Lots of chairs to sit on and a great cafe. Would love to revisit.

Nice place for a family with children.. Very beautiful. Nice to spend time for a family with young children as there are different things available for children (pony ride, puppet show, small boat etc.)

Wonderful Picnic Place. We bought a locally baked baguette, some locally made cheese, and a couple of tomatoes from a small market and had a wonderful little picnic sitting near the south end of this garden. We were lucky...it was sunny and 75 degrees although it had been cooler and rainy for much of the previous few weeks. If you're in Paris and looking for a place of relaxation with history and people watching, this could be a great option. Also, if you happen to have small kids with you, there is a large playground here where some steam could be blown off.

Oasis in the city. I love Jardin du Luxembourg -- it is easy to enter and just take a few minutes break from the busy streets of Paris. Lots of benches and chairs, in sun or shade, fountains, beautiful gardens, many pathways for walking, play area for the kids. I was in Paris on business, attending a conference, but went through the Lux as often as I could on my way to and from the conference venue or at lunch time. Paris has lots of beautiful parks, but this one is very special as it's so centrally located on the Left Bank.

Lovely afternoon with kids at Luxembourg Gardens. While staying in Paris for a week with our two granddaughters age 5 and 9, we spent a really nice afternoon at the Luxembourg Gardens. Maria de Medici lived here WAY BACK WHEN and now the grounds are a public park. The girls rode on ponies through a trial in the park, rode the very old carousel and played in the extensive playground with all sorts of climbing equipment, a small zip line, push carousels and old train car. The highlight was renting wooden sailboats with long sticks to push them around the pond, once the wind catches the sails the kids run around the pond to chase their sailboat. The gardens are serene and peaceful, the flowers and shrubs beautifully maintained. Bring a picnic lunch and have a wonderful day here.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park - Great place to relax after a day of sightseeing - or to have an early morning coffee and croissant.

Nice break from all the running around. Beautiful park with lots of benches and chairs to relax after a long day of walking. We chose to do it the Parisien way and grab a blanket, a bottle of wine and of course the obligatory cheeses, and lay on the grass along with countless locals, enjoying the atmosphere. Very chill, on one side you have the artists, on another the musicians, and so on. Highly recommend, and plus, It's Free!
Relax after a long walk. After a long day of walking sit and relax here, if you want bring something to eat too. Is an excellent and beautiful spot to chill (plus, entrance is free)

Quite a nice spot to sit down and enjoy nature.. This is a very pretty park with places to sit. And we were most surprised to meet a little group of ponies--along with several delighted children--the day we stopped by.

A must see attraction in Paris. Wow! I really enjoyed the stroll around this Park! It's one of the nicest Parks you will visit. There is such a chilled out and relaxed atmosphere with many locals involved in social activities such as playing cards, boules and chess. The children's play area is excellent and children can even ride ponies or paddle in the paddling pool. The surroundings are so well looked after and there are plenty of chairs to relax on! A must see place!

Great way to spend the afternoon.. The gardens are beautiful. Get a picnic and and some drinks and make a day of it. Great seating chairs scattered about everywhere. Very busy, popular place when the weather is nice.
Much better in spring!. Saw these gardens at the end of 2011 summer looking very tired, but on our return this spring, they were green and luscious!
So Pretty. It was a sunny day so the gardens were very busy but everything was just so pretty!!! The colours of the bulbs and flowers were thought out well.

Beautiful park in Paris. This is one of the nicest parks in the centre of Paris (only Palais Royal is nicer I think), some areas very english landscape but the pond area with the chateau have beautiful flower gardens...
Perfect for children. We adored these gardens. We rented a boat for 3 Euro for 30 minutes for my daughter. She loved every second of it. Great place to visit.

This park is huge. The park is huge. Just walk around and enjoy as Parisian enjoying the sun. There are few tennis court that you can see people playing. The flowers & the green grass were stunning on good camera. Chairs are available to stay around as much as you want.
Wow!. If you need a beautiful place to just sit and enjoy the day, this is a beautiful and huge garden!! There is a little restaurant there, too -- plus a pool, tennis courts and many other things.

Great Place to spend time with Children. The gardens are beautiful, there are many place to walk or just sit and enjoy the views and passing parade. There is always music playing, and the children love to sail the boats in the pond. The boats can be rented for 3 Euros/half hour.
GTake a picnic and enjoy

Beautiful park. Just a short walk from the Latin Quarter, we enjoyed a German rock band performing a free concert at the grandstand. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful. No one minded if you brought a bottle of wine and some cheese to enjoy in the shade. I don't think you need to spend more than an hour there, but it is a great and beautiful place to catch your breath when walking Paris.
Perfection. The gardens are huge and full of pleasant seats and beautiful things to look at. This is the best place in the world to sit on a park bench and read a book.

Don't miss it!. Our favorite place in Paris. Better than the other gardens. This is the place where the locals go. It has everything: ponds, gardens, walks, activities, and beautiful views. Don't miss it!

Great for children. The small coffee place at the corner of the park has a one of the best cafe latte in Paris. Boats in the lake that the children can play with is only 3€ for 30min, cheap and lot´s of fun!

You don't have to be a kid to enjoy this!. Luxembourg Garden is a beautiful park to wander. The palace on the grounds is magnificent. The park is peaceful and shady. You don't need to be a kid to enjoy a walk around these pretty grounds. There is an Orangerie, which was hosting a little free art show. That was a pleasant surprise. Our time in Paris was sadly limited, but this would be a great place to collect your thoughts after seeing all the treasures Paris has to offer.

Surprisingly crowded before sunset on a Sun. evening. Walked the entire length, from Carpeaux's Fontaine de l'Observatoire on the south end to the Palais on the north end, while exploring Montparnasse on the evening of Sun., 30 June 2013. Was pleasantly surprised to see how busy it was at 8-9 PM -- picnickers on the lawns, food vendors, strollers, sunbathers seated around the Octagonal Lake -- families, children, couples, groups, elderly, young. Fontaine de l'Observatoire is an especially aesthetically pleasing fountain, with its 4 female figures representing 4 continents holding up a globe. Sat down to enjoy the ambiance at the Octagonal Lake for a while. Wanted to explore more but had walked till I dropped so had to return to my room.

Stop by this beautiful Public Park. Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful public park 5 minutes walk from the Pantheon and abutting the lovely St Germain district.Whatever time of year - and I've strolled around this park in every season - it's a lovely place to stroll in or grab a chair and take the weight off.
a beautiful way to relax. gorgeous gardens just around the corner from my hotel. Local people just hanging out and relaxing in the gardens and beautiful sorbet as well!

Perfect Picnic. Great place to spend the afternoon. A change of pace oasis in busy Paris. Beautiful sculpture and plants and a great spot for a picnic after a visit to the local market street. We might have been caught on the grass once or twice...

Relax and enjoy the gardens, the Parisians too.. In addition to looking at the lovely flowers, it's great to see the locals relaxing and enjoying themselves in this free public park. There are many students seeking areas provided for people to just relax and read or converse. Bring a lunch and people watch.

A perfect afternoon away from crowds. My husband and I usually have a day limit to large crowds, so we decided to escape to the gardens, we bought freshly grilled chicken, variety of cheeses and spent the afternoon walking around the gardens, stopping every so often to dip into our bag of goods. You almost feel like a local if only for one afternoon.
Nice place to visit and relax. The gardens are big and beautiful. A lot of people seemed to come just to sit around and relax, enjoying the sunny day.

Great playground for young kids.. For a small fee, hop into the playground at the Luxembourg, and let the kids exhaust themselves. Great old fashioned equipment that small kids adore. The 'flying fox' would probably never get past OH and S in Australia, but my daughter rode it dozens of times and loved it. The French are refreshingly much less paranoid than we are about kids getting the odd bump, not that I saw any injuries during our weekly visits over 3 months. There are crepes and coffee for the adults, and a puppet theatre, plus the beautiful gardens themselves. A great day out in the middle of Paris.
Pairs. Big and quite pleasant lovely to wander around not far from the centre of paris, there are two parts to this garden

Great for kids (and adults) needing a break!. If you travel with kids, you know the need to find a place for them to play. This is a great choice in Paris. Great playground (best for ages 5-10, but enough for slightly older kids, too, including a well-designed zip line). Kids can also rent a sailboat and have fun sailing it on the pond behind the palace. Parents be warned that there is a charge for everything - playground admission (2.5 for kids, less for adults), bathrooms (.5), etc. On the other hand, sitting in the shade on a lovely Paris day while the kids play? I'll take it.

A welocme relief from all those gorgeous historic buildings. Well disciplined plants, well disciplined joggers, kitted out in the obligatory running gear. Great for a leisurely stroll (or a jog if you are that way inclined).
Allow time. On a sunny day, buy some bread cheese & wine at a local purveyor and take it here. Set up camp on the lawn or one of the many bistro tables and just soak up the ambience.

Relaxing and Amazing. The Luxembourg Gardens are a great way to spend a leisurely afternoon in Paris. The metro stop lets you out right in front of the gate. Food is available or snacks. From Ice Cream to Petit Cafe or Champagne there are some interesting varieties. There are public restrooms. The 132 statues are interesting if you want to take the time to visit them. Also, you can just sit and read a book.
My favourite place. I fell in love with this garden. Often spent my afternoons there when I had nothing to do. I loved it even more on Sunday.
It's Worth A Visit. We just stopped by for about thirty minutes, but it was a thoroughly enjoyable time. The gardens were gorgeous and it was so peaceful.
Lovely gardens in great neighborhood. Great place to stroll, sit in the sun, people-watch. The cafe is OK, we just had a soda. You are there for the view and relaxing.

Absolutely Gorgeous!. We decided to visit the organic market on Sunday. We purchased bread, Pate, cheeses, a bottle of wine and with some plastic cups and cutlery headed over to the Gardens. We sat down to do some people watching and enjoy the beautiful weather and gorgeous scenery. It was very relaxing. We observed groups of "senior citizens" discussing politics, couples drinking wine, children running and laughing. It was fantastic. Then I had to go to the bathroom... and didn't have change... So lesson learn, bring 0.30 Euros if you want a stall or 0.20 if all you need is a urinal (I call that gender discrimination, but to each its own). In any case, an experience not to be missed.
delightful all around. we arrived sunday and the gardens were full. there was a band and dancing. angelena's on the othere side of the palace was a chocolate treat. very sweet peaceful place.

Luxembourg Gardens. My husband and I visited this amazing garden in June of 2013. The weather was absolutely stunning on the day we were here. I snagged two of the chairs that are available for use while my husband walked to some nearby shops to get something for us to eat. We enjoyed warm bread, delicious cheese and wine while in the shade of the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens!! Best Day Ever!!

Great for running, walking, or just sitting enjoying the people. The Luxembourg Gardens is one of my favorite places in all of Paris. You can run around the perimeter -- about 1.25 miles -- and be surrounded by lots of athletic Parisians. You can stroll around the beautiful gardens and enjoy the many sculptures. You can visit the art exhibits in the museum space within the garden walls. You can just sit and soak in life in Paris. It doesn't get much better than an afternoon or evening in the Luxembourg Gardens.
I loved the beehives!. LG is a gorgeous park and has something for everybody. As an ex-beekeeper, it was a revelation to see beehives in the urbanity of Paris!

Beautiful!. On a beautifully, sunny day, we walked to grounds of the Luxembourg Gardens. The flowers were in bloom and the trees and grass so green. The statuary is lovely. People were relaxing, picnicking, napping. playing tennis, sailing boats...having a wonderful time in a gorgeous setting. A must see!
Great place to hang out. Nice for people with kids if the weather is good. You can pay for them to play, sit in a cafe, stroll. Lovely and right in the 6th.
Amazing Gardens. We went to gardens all over Eurpoe and this was my favorite. Beautiful French styled gardens with amazing statues and mature vegitation.
Stop for lunch. Great fora rest in the midst of Paris to grab a baguette and enjoy nature in the middle of the city.

Relaxing gardens before tavelling onwards. This was really close to our hotel so we brought a packed lunch here while waiting for our onwards train, Don't sit on the grass though as this is only allowed in one specific signposted place. Otherwise you will get old off.

Charming, beatifull and relaxed. May be the most charming of the park/gardens in central Paris as it offers huge beds of colourfull and nicely arranged flowers all over through the park, in addition to the statues, fountain and relaxed atmosphere, - - and quit often you will enjoy listing to free ofcharge open air concerts from their music pavillion

Great for a relaxing stroll. Lots of flowers, fountains and beautiful architecture to admire. Worth seeing while you are out and about in Paris. It is one of my favorite FREE places to enjoy after a long day of walking the major sights around the city.
Not what we expected. We were disappointed because the garden didn't seem as lush as we thought it would be. Hoped for more than what we saw.

Best park in Paris. We were lucky enough to stay one block away from the Luxembourg gardens. This place truly is paradise. The grounds are impeccable. The boats in the pond are fun to watch. Families are everywhere with young children playing on some pretty elaborate playgrounds. There are a few booths that sell some snacks, coffee. Lots of places to sit and enjoy the serenity. Take time to rest here in between hectic museums or touristy sites.

Definitely worth the trip. Stop and pick up a picnic lunch in the Latin quarter and bring it to the gardens. We did that on our first day in Paris and it was fantastic! Beautiful gardens and a great place to people watch. Don't miss it! Relax and enjoy Paris.
Lovely atmosphere!. The gardens were beautiful, and there was a open air concert when we were there. Kids could rent sailboats for 2 euro for 1/2 hour, but just watching the sailboats was fun, too!

Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris!. Fountains, flowers, lovely architecture, plenty of room for strolling, along with the Parisiens. Tennis courts, pony rides too. Children renting sailboats for 3 Euros to sail in the fountains. A lovely place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Chagall Exhibit. We went to the extensive Chagall Exhibit in July at the Musee de Luxembourg. Fantastic..works I did not know existed!

Beautiful gardens. We had just been to the wonderful Chagall exhibition at the Luxembourg museum and decided to visit the neighboring Luxembourg gardens which we probably wouldn't have seen otherwise. What a mistake it would have been to miss these gardens which are tended with such loving care. All you need is a bench, of which there are plenty, and a bottle of water or ice-cream cone if you're not on a diet and you're in for a real treat. Relax and watch the people, the flowers and the children at play and then take a walk to the lake. We were there for 2 hours and could have stayed for another 2, but with so much more to see, it was time to say goodbye. Definitely worth a visit - enjoy!
Nice stroll. Lovely for a stroll. Typically Parisienne and good people watching. Good place to have a cup of cafe au lait,,
Sunday afternoon. Delightful place to spend a Sunday afternoon. Children will love the large pond where small toy sailboats can be rented and sailed. Perfect place for a picnic.
Defo to visit in Paris.. Lovely gardens nice and tranquill with the bonus of on site security and no beggars or thieves. Nice place to have a picnic and chill out
Relaxing and peaceful. Organized like an art painting. There are long walking and running paths. The area is spacious, peaceful and relaxing.
Space and calm. I liked french people taking a book and reading at the gardens. Peace and calm in the center of a busy city

Very nice!!. Anyone visiting Paris must visit the Gardens! Its so beautiful and serene..we also were priviliged to hear an orchestra being conducted in the gardens by a group of school children..
A must must visit!

Lovely getaway. A walk in the garden is relaxing after the buzz in the city. Here you can find shadows from the trees to cool you down and watch
peolpe playing tennis or bowle. Or just walk around and look at the beautiful flowers.

What a great find!. We just arrived in Paris and were out for a walk and stumbled on Luxebourg Gardens by complete accident. What a beautiful green spot in the centre of a busy city. We had a great time walking the grounds of the gardens. I only wish I could have come back another day with a picnic lunch- it's the perfect spot to rest for a bite to eat. Great place. Will make a point of visiting again next time I'm in Paris.
This is where Parisians relax. Not far from Notre Dame, 10 minutes walk, watch Parisians relax in glorious gardens & the Palace, reading books in the afternoon sunshine
Amazing gardens. Beautiful garden filled with walks, interesting statues, lots of places to sit, and lots of interesting people and things to watch.

Beautiful Gardens with a Community Feel. I thoroughly enjoyed strolling through these gardens as it was a pleasant oasis amidst the hustle & bustle of hectic Paris. There are beautiful things to look at, including gardens & a large pond with little toy sailing boats for hire. We were fortunate that there was a free outdoor band concert on while we were there, which added to the exquisite experience. There was a lovely community feel there, many people, both local & tourists, out and about enjoying the simplest things in life, which were free! I recommend a visit here.

The French Senate, a Glass Gallery and Chagall. There's a lot to like in this manicured park. The French Senate building is the dominant feature, but that doesn't stop the fun at the bandstand. A gallery of artists was set up in the winter greenhouse and there was a great Chagall exhibit in the small unassuming museum in the park. Oh, did I mention that the park is gorgeous?

Relaxing gardens in the Quartier Latin. Jardin du Luxembourg is an excellent place to visit and perfect for some relax when you visit the Quartier Latin. Is very niece to see the parisian enjoying the fountain with their kids playing with scale boats.Do not miss the Palais Luxembourg and the Medici Fountain close to the palais.This garden is a couple of blocks from the Pantheon.

Great stop for lunch. We picked up some lunch and a bottle of wine before heading into the park. 3 hours later we were done our lunch and wine. We lost track of time just sitting and enjoying the garden and people watching. This was a cheaper way of lunch rather than eating at a cafe. The sandwiches were about $10euro total and a $3euro bottle of wine. Not bad for a filling lunch. I thought the gardens here were better than Versaille.

Best park in Paris. Great place to sightsee, sit back, and relax. Beautiful views and photo opportunities. We were lucky to stumble across a live jazz band concert, which made the visit more inviting.
Lovely!. Great place to relax, the gardens are beautiful. A great place to come and relax away from all the tourist buzz. Lots of locals and families in picnics.
Beautiful place to relax in the city. Grab a Baguette, some cheese, a bottle of wine, and have a picnic in these beautifully manicured gardens.

A blooming treat!. My first attempt to visit the Luxembourg Gardens (2005-ish) didn't work out because I traveled to Paris in December for my birthday and that day was too cold for more outdoor walking.
