However, since the Luxembourg Garden's hosts a museum, my friend and I toured the traveling exhibit instead.When I traveled to Paris last year in early fall, I made a point to return and was very pleasantly surprised. I found what I refer to as an outdoor museum that contained beautiful landscapes were accented by amazing sculptures -- some in plain sight and others that revealed themselves to you as you walked around. Everything about the Gardens seemed to be based in art, so the serenity of the place was palpable. It was clear that great detail is paid to maintaining the lush gardens. The many acres of Gardens is contained by a beautiful wrought iron fence. The Gardens were bustling with individuals, families and tourists who were enjoying the scenery; the many-colored foliage was quite beautiful and serene and definitely worth the 9-year wait. I sat for a while taking in the sights but did not eat at the park restaurant or walk around the small pond or lush lawns because I wasn't wearing the most comfortable shoes and had already walked a few miles down the Seine. However, the Luxembourg Gardens is worthy of being on your list of Parisian interests to take in (bring Euros for the bathroom stall since the facilities are not free of charge). I will return because in Paris I have my favorite places to go.
Beatiful. Buy a croissant, some macarons or a crepe and sit there on a sunny place. Really pleasant to observe the people there just chatting

Nice place for a stroll in the park. Beautiful place to spend an hour or two strolling thorough a big city park that lets you get away from it all. Flowers were in bloom, lawns green and trimmed, trees in full leaf. A great place to spend some quiet time before visiting the Luxembourg Gardens Museum

Peaceful location away from business of Paris. Beautiful park. Many shops nearby. A great place to rest on a busy day of sightseeing. Great for people watching as well. A very popular location for locals.

One of Paris' best outdoor spaces. Beautiful, historic park with impressive 18th Century buildings and wonderfully laid out gardens. Just go and sit for an hour on one of the hundreds of benches and chairs available and watch the action. The place is well used by Parisians seeking a place to relax and expand a bit. Great site to see how locals play and unwind. If you've got a little kid in tow, don't miss the pony rides!
Not to miss if you are nearby.. Sat outsde at the cafe and listened to Chopan being played live.Charming park, fun relaxing and listening to the music.

Lovely Gardens to walk or picnic. We spent a 'bit rainy' afternoon walking through the gardens - they are very large and beautifully maintained. There were families having picnics and playing games. Altogether a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.
WoW!. Relaxing gardens on a beautiful day with lots of activity around you! Grab a baquette, some cheese and a drink to share and do some people watching!

One of my favorite places in Paris. I have spent an inordinate amount of time here, resting, reading, chatting, watching the daily life of Parisians. I have been here with lovers, my cousin, alone. I hope I get to spend many more hours here. Lovely.

An open space in busy Paris.. Compared to the London parks, Paris seems to fall short.Still however worth a quick visit.Convenient if you are staying neat Saint-Germain des Pres and The Latin Quarter.

SUPER CUTE!!!. The last time I went there it was christmas time and they put on a christmas market that offers all kind of stuff!!! From christmas ornaments to comfort fast food to go!!! Plus it looks super cute!!! Just be very careful, there are thieves around looking to pick pocket you!!! And the police won't do a thing.
One of my favourite Paris gardens. Doesn't disappoint in scale or planting and very central - a great place to relax and read a book too.

A walk in the park. We visited the gardens in early April, so there was not much in bloom yet. There were some hyacinths and tulips, but that was about it. Yet it was still beautiful and utilized by many taking time out of their day to sit, relax and get caught up in the reverie. If you are going to l'orangerie (and you should, by the way) than set some time aside to enjoy the Luxembourg Gardens. You will not be disappointed.

Beautiful gardens. Informal and beautifully kept gardens worth a visit. Outdoor seating, open air concerts and a lovely little cafe in the centre. Visited with 3 friends and were fortunate enough with the weather to enjoy the outdoors. Worth a visit.

Serendipitous free concert. François Dumont gave a piano concert, plein air, of a few Chopin pieces, at the end of a sunny afternoon. It was a magical unexpected treat. Merci, Paris. Parisians are so lucky to have this park. Beautiful, peaceful, relaxed.

A Beautiful Spot. We walked through Jardin du Luxembourg and then grabbed a seat near the palace and fountain and took a little rest. What a lovely spot to just people watch and soak in beautiful Paris.

Picnic on a warm summer day. Beautiful gardens near Boulevard Saint- Michel. Free entry. We bought a bagette and sat on the seats provided and enjoyed the scenery. Wander through the gardens and admire the beautifully manicured lawns and flowers. Wonderful fountains and statues. Great for that early morning run if exercise is your thing.
Great place for afternoon picnic. Very scenic area with plenty of greenery and people watching. Lots of seating in the area to sit and relax.

Urban playground, Paris style. Like other parks in Paris, there are plenty of places to sit and enjoy people-watching in view of lovely public lawns & gardens - plus children's playgrounds, tennis courts, etc. The palace is the French senate building, patrolled by gendarmes in uniform.

One of the loveliest spots in Paris. Something for everyone...boules, a variety of choices for food, sailing miniature boats in the fountains, pony rides, several art galleries, even bee hives. Good for a run in the early morning, too.

very 19th century. There's a wonderful ease and old world feel about this park. There are gardens, there are winding paths, there are reflecting ponds and a pond for model sailboats and people playing bowls and pony rides and stands with ices. And people in deck chairs. And did I mention the palm trees? All this flanked by the Luxembourg Palace, standing stately in the background. Next thing you expect to see is Henry James in a top hat.

Nice Walk in the Park. It was a sunny Sunday afternoon when we went to Luxembourg Gardens. There were quite a number of people (tourists and locals alike) in the gardens that day which made the mood really relaxing and friendly. This is a nice place to sit and sunbathe or to eat a picnic or to people watch. If you want privacy, you may go to the benches under the trees where you may take a nap or just enjoy some quite time for a few minutes. Must visit while in Paris!
Relaxed gardens, yet very busy!. We managed to stumble across the gardens whilst a free Chopin concert was on, a great way to chill out before catching our flight home.

Favorite Open Space in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are a very quiet and peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of this busy city. There are quiet groves of trees, fountains and pools throughout the park. Small (toy) sailboats can be rented adjacent the the large central pool. A very Parisian activity for young and old alike. We love to site in the classic green chairs and enjoy the fountains and people watching.

Delightful, centrally located, and beautiful!. We were just passing through to get to the Seine, but ended up spending time just watching Parisians sunning, picnicking, playing tennis - really, a delightful park! Hard to believe we were in the middle of a massive city!
Beautiful and nice!. The French senate is located in it. very good place to rest in.There is a big fountain in the middle, and many french people spends there time doing sports there!

Perfect for a sunny day. Beautiful gardens, plenty of seating and shade and some of the best landscaping in Paris. Just a short walk from the left bank and Notre Dame, this garden has it all; a great playground for the kids, beautiful gardens and lawn in front to the palace, fun little food and ice cream kiosk. It is a great way to spend a leisurely afternoon in the city...I believe it's a must see.
Paris as the locals see it.. This was a great park to visit and really see Paris through the eyes of a local. There was a great free concert going on when we arrived and that was a bonus.

Stay a While and Listen. Luxembourg Gardens is one of the best parks in Paris. Just a little way off the main tourist path, Luxembourg Gardens serves as an excellent place to sit and let Paris wash over you. The fountains are the centerpiece of the garden, but take a walk and find the Pétanque games, see if you can find the Statue of Liberty, and find some grass, sit under some trees and just be still. Ive been to Paris several times and I still make it a priority to visit Luxembourg gardens each time I visit.In a large city such as Paris, this park can be a wonderful respite for sore feet and tired minds.
Lovely day and flowers were in bloom.. We walked to the Louvre from our hotel and decided to cut through the gardens. What a lovely surprise.

Green and fresh air. You must see this place if you travel to Paris. Hope you will have warm weather. you can have a walk and sit on the chairs and rest or read a book. If u like jogging in open area its the good place also that u will exp.

Playground. Great playground for kids at the Luxembourg Gardens with a mini-zipline and a climbing structure. Our daughter loved it! There is a nice area near the fountain to sit in the sun on a nice day. We liked this park a lot, except for the sandwiches at the food stand were really bad. The ice cream was good though, so it was not a total loss.

Nice, very formal. The gardens in Paris are not what I had envisioned. They are very formal with lots of manicured lawns, shaped trees, and walkways, but hardly any flowers! This garden was lovely, it had lots of activities for smaller children. We only have a teenager, but he even enjoyed sailing the boats in the little pool. They were 3 euro for 30 minutes and you got to pick your boat (he picked USA!). They aren't motorized but you push them from side to side with a stick, which was more fun than it sounds.
Perfect afternoon with the Kids. This is one if not the best park in Paris. Lovely gardens, well kept, relaxing and fun for all. This is a must visit in Paris on a nice day!

Great for kids. A great place for a family on a nice day. Rented a mini sailboat to push around for 30 minutes (3 Euro) and then went to the children's playground for a couple of hours. The playground surprisingly has a entrance charge (2.50 Euros for kids and 1.90 Euros for adults). However, they did have some really nice playground equipment to wear out the kids, so that you can have a nice meal afterwards.

Best way to spend lunchtime in Paris!. There is nothing better than taking a lunch in Luxembourg Gardens and watching the kids play, the fountains spout, and the clouds move overhead. We spent time in the gardens whenever we could.

Don't miss this park. Close to the city centre but not often on the must see list, this park at the Luxembourg Palace is terrific. And free of course. Lovely to walk or sit in the sun. Enjoy watching the little sailboats race about in the pond.

Watch the Parisians chillax. We were staying close to the gardens and visited on several occasions, but Saturday afteroon after lunch the place is alive with Parisians relaxing, families, couples, picnics etc, it gave the place a real buzz without the hassles of the other major attractions (beggers and thiefs etc).
Obviously better when the weather is fine.
Nice garden in the city. Went there on a Saturday and enjoyed seeing kids playing, people jogging in this beautiful park! Worth taking a nice stroll in

Chagall Exhibit. This temporary exhibit is not to be missed. We were told about it by jaded Parisians who seldom gush about such things and we found it to be beautiful and moving.Also, our hotel was near the gardens and I went for a morning run there. Great place to go for a run and to be part of the many other who are doing so. Fun to try to pass by all the sculptures. You have to be sharp to catch them all.

Best park in Paris. We brought a picnic to eat and sat by the Medici fountain to eat it. It wasn't crowded, there were tons of statues, a really cool playground, and lots of shady benches. There is a restaurant and some candy booths, but I suggest bringing your lunch in. The fountain and park are beautiful.

Great place to play with kids. We come here every time for the kids to have a break, run around etc. They have a wonderful kids play/park area for 2.5 euro that is a lot of fun and the old carousel for 1.5 euro. We consider this area a must do for families with little kiddos.
nice place. Well that's one of those places where you can see locals doing normal stuff, like jogging or just enjoying the sun. Really beautiful place.

Beautiful Gardens. We visited twice, once on a weekday and once on a Saturday. The park is very well used on the weekends, but you could still find a seat. Lots of families, including young children. The gardens are impeccable and immense. Lovely spot.

My Favorite Garden in Paris. This is may favorite garden for sure. It's a great place to stop for so many reasons. It's absolutely beautiful from the main garden around the fountain and museum and each of the individual smaller gardens. The gardeners are also happy to speak with you and share their knowledge. It's fun to stop by the bocce and watch the gentlemen, dressed in athletic wear extremely focused on the game. A real slice of the local culture. You can also see a puppet show at the marionette theater, stop for lunch or take a nap.
Jazz in the park. A pleasant spot to stop and watch the world go by. They had a jazz band when we were there earlier in the week as part of a summer entertainment festival.

Beautiful gardens. 55 acres of absolutely beautiful gardens. Didnt see as much as would have liked as weather was cold & wet so had to cut short our look around but on a nice day well worth couple of hrs exploring it all. Highly recommend

A Return to Another Time!. Visiting the Luxembourg Gardens was like a return to another time. Children sailed boats in a pond and families, couples and individuals, young and old shared the space and had a wonderful relaxing day. It was cool but pleasant in May and the bulbs were up in the gardens. We were so glad we came. What a wonderful afternoon!

Wow! Something for Everyone. There are some things we can learn from our European friends. One of those things is how to use public space for parks. This is an amazing use of land for the purpose of many. There is something here for everyone. One section of the park is devoted to toddlers and small children with shallow pools and sand pits in a lovely rose garden. Throughout the park there are many different gardens and a pool for renting and sailing boats. While we were there we watched many elementary age children sailing their boats and having a wonderful time. All over the park there were many chairs for sitting and sunbathing or just enjoying the outdoors. Would love to see something like this in the Rose Greenway in Boston.

Charming Left Bank Park. Relaxing, sculpture-filled garden located within walking distance of the Sorbonne and the Pantheon. Located next to a 17th century palace built for a queen dowager, which now houses the French Senate, it boasts a charming cafe, snack shacks, and a collection of sculptures honoring French queens. It's a great place to spend a lazy afternoon.

wish they had places like this in London. the best gardens of all of Paris,so much going on from table tennis and proper tennis too band playing in band stand too from what i saw cutting through,everyone flat out sunbathing, the most relaxing and beautiful flowers, and buildings and statues in the park i wish i could of spent a day chilling out in here. will def. go back like a shot
Beautiful. It was a hot sunny day so full of people. The garden was a welcome refuge from the surrounding streets.
A great place to just hang out. Lovely gardens in a busy part of the city - nice to jog in the the early morning or sit and read a book.
Closed and confusing. It was closed when we visited, even though during opening hours. No one could explain. Never got to see it.

Great place for a pic nic. My friends live near this place. So I go to the fairly nearby Gerard Mulot and the covered market not to far from Sainte Sulpice, buy some wine, pate, cheeses, sandwiches and pastries and go to the park where people play chess, exercise, boot soccer balls and just have a pleasant time. Fine park just to relax and walk around.
Wonderful house and gardens. Beautifully maintained gardens, with lots of walking paths and places to sit and admire the Palace of Marie Antoinette. Interesting story about the constructin and why.

My favourite place in Paris. When I need to relax, to get rid of the routine or any gloomy thoughts, or just to realize how happy actually I am, Luxembourg Gardens is the place I go to (provided I am in Paris, of course). Over the last ten years, every time I go to Paris, I definitely go there, at least for a while, to enjoy the calm scenery - beautiful trees and gardens, flowers, children playing, ducks in the lake, young and cute lovers on the benches, people playing petanque or tennis and the remote Eiffel Tour above the trees... When you go there, find a free seat, forget about any problems you may have, take your time and relax - you will see the genuine face of Paris, you will feel Paris and you will enjoy it, trust me!

Lovely. Beautiful gardens, this is a lovely place where you can go and relax with your whole family or something more romantic. You will find peace and activities to do at the same time. We enjoyed this place with a frozen drink :p

A Wonderful Park That Offers Much. Here, you can watch petanque, chess, toy sailboats on the pond that my father played with back in the 20s, painters, enjoying the sun or shade, sculptures, listening to music, photo exhibits around the periphery, etc.

What an amazing and wonderfully serene place in the heart of the city. This amazing space, created for a queen who hungered for her native Tuscany is the rival of central park in New York or any urban setting we have ever experienced. It is vast, yet filled with intimate places to just be. The art which populates nearly every vista is amazing and not to be missed, along with a glimpse at something the French do best, just being one with their environment. To us the landscaping rivaled if not eclipsed that of Versailles, with none of the crushing crowds or hassles. A not to be missed jewel!
Lovely area that seems popular with the locals!. We walked all around this beautiful garden. It has so many landscapes to check out. Very nice time spent people watching and soaking up some sun!
A Paris Must See. My wife and I enjoyed a lazy afternoon in the gardens, a great place to relax and for people watching.
Excellent.. Very good. No dislike. It is a great place to spend part of one day visit to Paris. Especially if it is sunny.

Where Parisians go to Play!. This is the most relaxing place we visited during our week in Paris - with its lovely formal gardens and boxed fruit trees and marble statuary, it is where families flock to after school and work. You can rent a toy sail-boat, jump rope, ride your scooter or your bike, kick a soccer ball around, read a book, jog, have an expresso at the cafe, practice your headstands (yes, we saw a guy doing that!) - or if you're a tourist, you can sit and admire all that action going on around you! We were so charmed by the garden that we totally forgot to visit the museum on the grounds!Since the Tour de France takes place next month, on the fence that surrounds the grounds the powers that be have hung AMAZING photos of the cyclists in scenic spots - if you go this summer, check them out as you leave the gardens.The Church of St. Sulpice is only a few blocks away, and you might want to stop in a moment to admire its beauty, and thank the Lord for the chance to visit France!

Nice Park. The "gardens" are actually a very large park south of St Germain. There is a very large recreational area with tennis courts, bowling, chess matches, children's play areas, etc. The park has many paths for walkers and joggers, that include many sculptures of famous French (and non French) artists, politicians, etc. There's also a museum which I did not visit and a palace which serves as government building, I assume.
Peaceful. Luxembourg Gardens was one of our favorite stops in Paris. Having a bottle of wine and people watching on a nice day...can't get more Parisian!
A must see in Paris. The garden is lovely and quiet even though it is steps away from a main road. There are chairs around the pond and two grassy areas that are in the shade at one end of the park.

Where Parisians are. If you want to watch fashionable french people walk cute dogs and sail cute boats in a fancy little pond then this is the place for you. This is quintessential Paris and it is outside of the standard tourist hussle and bussle. There are great restaurants and cafes around the edge. This is my favorite place to go for a city escape.

One of our favorites. Our hotel was only a block from the Gardens and one of our favorite things was to sit in the cafe and linger over a wine or just sit near the fountains and people-watch. Lovely, lovely. Brides come here to be photographed, there was a midday concert in the bandstand by high school students from Oklahoma and they met an appreciative audience. Yes, the Louvre is wonderful, as is Notre Dame. But take the time to just sit in the Luxembourg Gardens. Like New York's Central Park is is an urban wonder.

Beautiful and perfectly dimensioned park. Really just a perfect large city park. A central pond with rentable remote control boats along with a wonderful playground keep kids interested while parents can enjoy a picnic lunch (with a bottle of wine, of course.) For couples, romantic spots with beautiful flower beds abound. It's one of the most beautiful urban parks in the world.

Beautiful!. This garden is so lovely! We went here on a sunny paris saturday in september! We watched the little sail boats (which you can hire) on the foutain and ate lunch listening to an ochecstra under the rotunda. It was magical! I definetly reccomend a visit to Luxembourg Gardens!
So Parisian!. From the little boats on the pond to the carousel to the exquisite Medici Fountain, this garden is a must for a complete "Paris experience".
Absolutely Beautiful. Just go....take your wine and cheese.....and then relax.....watch the world go by. We loved it. We will definitely go again next time.

Great fun for kids!. My 9 year old loved this part of our trip to Paris! From the playground equipment to the soccer he played with local kids he had a wonderful time. One highlight was seeing the small replica of the Statue of Liberty in the Gardens.

Parisian color with no cost. You can spend a pleasant afternoon here with or without a picnic, enjoying the statuary, walking or jogging or just people watching. On the Sunday we were there, a band and singer were entertaining at the band shell. Watch the children sailing boats in the lake. No charge for anything.
Simply beautiful. After a very big day of shopping and train hopping we loved just having a nice quiet seat here in the garden and taking in the many views, absolutely superb.
Beautiful. Peaceful relaxing place..Sitting there with live music coming from the gazebo was fantastic. The highlight of the visit was the Chagall exhibit at the Luxembourg Museum Must see

Relaxing and calm. Nice place to sit and relax, especially if you have been walking round and round for hours. Beautifully kept and lots of space for the kids to run around safely - if you don't stray too close to the ponds and lake bits!

Fabulous. These formal gardens had beautiful trees & nice water features. There are plenty of chairs to sit on to people watch, ponder or read a book. The more energetic could go for a run on the jogging trail.
Very pretty. we were lucky to get a beautiful hot Paris day but the gardens are stunning we went as a couple had a drink on the chairs and watched the beauty that is Paris

Great place to just relax. After so many days walking around the city, trying to see everything the Gardens are an oasis of relax. Just choose a chair by the lame, city and enjoy the sun. You can see a lot of tourists and parisiens doing the same

Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful gardens and sculptures. Get off at the St. Michel metro stop and it is about a 10-15 minute walk to the gardens. A little off the beaten path but well worth the effort to visit.

Cold and damp, but beautiful!. Summer has not yet reached Paris this year - rain, wind, cool temperatures. But the Luxembourg Gardens are still beautiful. Just wandering around among the pebbled paths and seeing the blooms warms one's heart!
A lovely place for any day. Always one of my favorite places to walk, sit and read, watch kids playing with their boats in the fountain basins. One of my favorites in Paris.
A wonderful stroll through the park.. A loved our stroll through the park. Wish ere were more places to sit and relax. We were there on a Sunday and it was full of Parisians enjoying the sunny day.

Sit and watch the people go by. What a wonderful place to sit and watch not only the people but the world go by. Find a place in the sun or tucked away in one of the small glens near the edge of the park. Bring a book, or just doze, letting your cares slip away moment-by-moment.

Good place to just relax and chill.. Their is a large fountain and pond with chairs around it. Get some food and beers and just chill here. Some restaurants are also present but they are pricey given the lack of competition.
You can walk down here from the Louvre and relax after getting all the heavy art overdose.

Simply beautiful. The gardens are one of the cant miss sites of Paris. It is always busy with Parisians, but at the same time quiet and relaxing. The hidden secret is the beautiful pool and fountain in the northwest corner of the garden.
Best spot for kids in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are great. My only complaint is that they don't open the children's play ground earlier.

Walking in Paris. We went out walking to get to the Louvre and went via the Luxembourg Gardens. They are superb and really worth a trip out. Lots of people of all ages appreciating the surroundings and not to rushed or pushy like lots of things can be in Paris. Everything was well sign-posted

You do learn about it in high school French after all. Luxembourg Gardens is a great place to stroll through when you arrive in Paris after an overnight flight. Surrounding neighborhoods are charming and vibrant and many possibilities for coffee and croissant.
Joggers Delight. We visited on a Saturday. LOTS of joggers, small exercise classes, and sandboxes for children. Beautiful fountains & flowers, too.

Getaway from crowded Paris. Quiet and nice park with uncommod trees and gardens.
Good place to getaway from crowded Paris and visit a palace of Ekaterina Medici.

Beautiful place to relax. We grabbed a couple of chairs by the ornamental pond to eat our lunch and relax. It was so utterly serene and beautiful and the perfect shady spot to escape the afternoon sun. I could have spent all day there.

Chopin in the Park was great. this is a great park for strolling, sitting, relaxing, cooling off. We were there during a performance of Chopin in the Park. Great piano performance while we lounged in the shade.

What a beautiful park. The day was gorgeous, which helps things a lot. A very nice option to sit down on the grass, at a table, near a stunning building, with flowers and lots of trees. Perfect for kids and all ages.
great place must visit. It is a beautiful park. Very green and you can find a lots of different activities. Or if you want to runaway from the noise and tourists this is a good place to relax.

Another great day with the grandchildren.. We knew from previous visits to Paris that these gardens would be a good choice for a day out with the grandchildren. There is a children's area full of interesting playground equipment (small entry fee) that the children were busy on all day. There are clean toilets, a small kiosk and water points in the grounds. Nearby is a small brasserie kiosk that sells simple food. Reasonable prices and lots of pleasant smiles. Add this to the visit list even if you don't have children to entertain.

Grateful to the gardens. Early in our month long stay this year we took the bus from Denfer Rochereau to the gardens. There were so many folk doing their early morning exercise I even felt inspired to do some stretching against one of the lovely trees myself, much to the amusement of my husband who stood to one side looking at me as though I had just had a fit. Eventually we found a spare seat and began speaking with a local lady who teaches lessons to seriously ill children in a local hospital, taking a great deal of pleasure in mixing our silly French with our English and she likewise. Suddenly, there was something dropping from the sky onto my husband's grey jacket, mustard coloured and as big as a Euro coin. Pigeon???? Pigeons are a constant menace and one needs to take a plastic bag or paper to sit on as the seats are absolutely spotted on a regular basis with their droppings. Our friend immediately pulled out several tissues and we had Brian's jacket cleaned up in no time at all and also felt we had made a Parisian friend. By the way, the park polizei were there blowing a whistle to keep sitters off the grass but the flowers were a beauty to behold. Spring in Paris is the place to be.
Forget you are in a big city for a moment... and relax. Liked the sunlight just before sunset.Bring a bottle of wine and some snacks and have a mini-picnic by the lake!

Beautiful even on a rainy day!. We went to Paris at te end of May when it was cool and rainy. But that didn't stop us from walking around these gardens and taking some amazing pix! Being from a big city where I live in a high rise condo, it was so nice to walk around a huge garden in the middle of Paris with very few people around us!

Great place for relaxing or running. I was delighted to discover what a grit place this was for running.....and there are several toilets. Granted it costs 1 euro but I was happy. Paris is not runner friendly if you need a toilet. Cafes and restaurants flatly refuse to let,you use the toilet, even at McDonalds you need a food receipt with a code and this is good for only onceThe gardens are not too crowded, heaps of places to run and shady on a hotmday

A beautiful park well worth a visit.. If you are looking for a place to rest, enjoy a picnic, read your book or just watch the world go by this is the place. A well cared for park, with the added bonus of chairs and benches a plenty. You can't sit on the grass which just adds to its charm. Find a shady tree and enjoy this beautiful park.
A good way to enjoy Paris as Parisians. Bring your book and sunglasses, you can stay here for the whole day. Just enjoy Paris the way the Parisians do. Lovely garden.
Large but hot. This garden is immense and has a number of impressive statues. The white gravel ground also makes it immensely warm. To fully enjoy, go when it is a little cooler.

Loved those gardens and how parisians enjoy them.. Loved the way parisiens enjoy their gardens. So nice to have those chairs, where you can sit and enjoy the scenery. So enjoyable, everybody that visits Paris should come and spend sometime people watching.

Lovely gardens. These stunning gardens were close to our hotel and we enjoyed a stroll there one evening.
There are many people just sitting around the lake in the sun reading, relaxing or talking.
My husband enjoyed a run around the gardens twice and liked the running track. Many other people enjoy doing this too.
There were even pony rides.

The Best of Paris - on a glorious day. Paris is full of beautiful sights. These gardens exist in the midst of the hustle bustle of the left bank, adjoining a wonderful little museum which makes for a perfect outing. We first enjoyed a grand Chagall exhibit, then had a light lunch at the attached cafe, and finally spent the next few hours exploring the park. There were tennis players, children climbing and swinging, serious students, young and old on the grass or benches reading and lap-topping. The trees were dressed for early summer, in every shade of green. Flowers smiled as passers-by complimented their extraordinary colors. All in all a place of beauty and charm.

Visited on a sunny day. I visited this jardin on a sunny warm day and there were many people there enjoying the beautiful weather and surroundings. The grounds were gorgeous, the flowers beautiful, and the statues were awe-inspiring. Next time I'm in Paris, I will go back.

Peaceful, calming & beautiful. Chose to stay near these gardens because it is an area we had not explored before & we are so glad we did. Beautifully laid out, pristine & enjoyed by so many. Loved all of it especially the fountain. Had a most enjoyable lunch in the cafe nearby & then just soaked up the atmosphere & the sunshine.

A nice garden for the local. I must say I am disappointed after reading so many great reviews from others. It seems to be a lovely garden for the locals to enjoy a quiet time in the midst of a bustling city. I visited the place on a weekday so perhaps it would be more interesting had I come on a weekend to watch how the Parisians spend their time in a park.

If you have time.... Luxembourg Gardens are very pleasant to stroll so I enjoyed these as a student. However, if you're just passing by well... it's a big, peaceful french garden but isn't meant as a tourist attraction.

Oasis in centre of Paris. Shade, seats, grass, water, peace and quiet or watch the Puppet show - amazing park 15 minutes walk from Notre Damme. It's free and make it your picnic spot with a Crepe for lunch and a friend for company . What more could you ask for in a beautiful park in central Paris?
Where the locals hang out!. Luxembourg Gardens was a lovely respite after dealing with crowds of tourists at the Louve. It was fun watching the kids sail the little boats on the pond.
Free and Beautiful Garden on the Left Bank. We enjoyed a quiet walk through the gardens in a light drizzle then had drinks on the terrace at the nearby Deux Magots bar. What a llife!

Just as it started to snow!. I loved going for a walk through the Gardens, even when the weather wasn't up to scratch. There s just something so immaculate and pristine about the place, it creates a sense of calm in a bustling city. You can always escape the weather in one of the museums or cafes very closeby!

"Oasis" overused but completely accurate. We went here for the Tour de France photo exhibit, and stayed for the people watching. Very inviting park, with lots of activities for the locals. Plenty of seating and you feel compelled to take advantage of it. Surrounding area is hectic and crowded, and entering the gates of the park made you relax immediately.

Best gardens in Paris. Though a bit out of the way, the Luxembourg Gardens are definitely the best in Paris. I loved how statues were dotted around the area, and that it was big but not so much so that you are put off to explore it all. I was looking in particular for the original Statue of Liberty, and enjoyed hunting for it in the gardens while also seeing some other great work. The Medici Fountain was also very impressive, though it seemed cordoned off at the sides so you couldn't really walk around it properly. The gardens were also one place to see relaxed Parisians playing bowls, and French families relaxing in the summer - while there clearly were tourists around, it was nowhere near as intense as other areas, and it was just a nice way to relax if you have some time to just enjoy Paris (and it is well-located if you're in the area of St Germaine having visited Notre Dame). It's especially great if you have a little time to yourself away from your party to chill out. The museum in the gardens is also well worth a look - I didn't look round the permanent exhibition much but was really lucky that there was a great Chagall exhibition on at the time of visiting.

Watch the children sail their boats. The Luxembourg Gardens date to the time of the Medicis in pre-revolutionary Paris although many of the sculptures are 19thC. Still, the highlight for me is the octagonal pool where children sail toy boats. These are very traditional, not remote controlled. They run from side to side to push the boats with sticks. There is a lot of seating around the edges and you see many families. It's a great spot to pause while touring the St-Germain-des-Pres area.

gorgeous, peaceful park. this is one of our favorite places for lunch. Midway between Louvre and Concorde, there are two outdoor cafes which look like they are in a French painting. And the food is inexpensive (for Paris) and delicious! Sit in the lovely gardens, people-watch, and pretend you're part of the royal court.

Come for the gardens, stay for the Bees. What can you say that hasn't already been said for this gen of Paris. Old surly men playing petanque, young children laughing and screaming, lovers kissing in the summer shade, and bees flowing from the 19th century hives. Yes, Paris has it's own little Eden, and it's called Jardin Luxembourg.

Beautiful, peaceful setting!. Enjoyed a lovely afternoon strolling this beautiful garden and watching young French children playing with toy boats in the pond there. Found a good inexpensive creperie, La Bolee, a short walk away.

An oasis of calm and fun people watching. I love to come here in the evenings, which can mean quite late, and stroll around or sit by the pond and watch the world go by. The beautiful trees and flowers, statues and walkways are an oasis in the city, and seeing magnificent buildings in the background only adds to the ambiance. Mornings have a different vibe, as joggers pad around the perimeter and businesspeople cut through on the way to work. At either extreme of the day, the light streaming through the trees makes wonderful shadows.

Best Place in Paris for Kids, and for People-Watching. Paris is probably more kid-friendly than any other big city, and the Jardin du Luxembourg is an example of why. Right in the middle of the Rive Gauche, this huge, sprawling park has a fantastic playground, swings, tennis and basketball courts, trails, fountains, and a large central pond. Several snack booths, a puppet theater, and lots of other kids make it a haven for parents who want to let their kids burn off some steam while they sit back and do as the French do: drink a café express, watch the people go by, read a book, enjoy the afternoon.The Jardin des Plantes and its Menagerie, and the Jardin d'Acclimatation with its rides may seem more obvious choices at first, but they're both heavily programmed (and expensive to boot), while the Jardin du Luxembourg allows more free-form play for the kids and a bit of respite for the adults at little or no cost. Highly recommended.

Beautiful gardens. This reminded me a little of Central Park in NYC, only because it's an oasis in the middle of a bustling city. The gardens and fountain were beautiful. There are sculptures everywhere. Although it's crowded, it's a very peaceful place to sit (chairs and benches everywhere) and relax after a day of sightseeing in Paris. I originally wanted to come here as a fan of Hadley Hemingway, since she used to take her son, Bumby, to play here when she and Ernest Hemingway lived in Paris, and I'm glad I came.

Clean, well layed out, relaxing.. Beautiful gardens, picturesque surroundings. Liked chairs dotted around park to sit on. Great place to get away from crowds, relax and yet still know you are in the wonderful city of Paris.
Luxurious!. Absolutely divine gardens. Medici Fountaine a draw card for me every time. Flowers not quite out fully yet, but really lovely. The glorious statuary & buildings add to the atmosphere.

Lovely and lively. A lovely afternoon strolling around. People were playing tennis, checker board, bridge, fencing. There were kids playing with little sail boats and a piano concert under the kiosk. Simply lovely
Paris trip. It was raining when we were there but were able to find a spot for a quick lunch. Beautiful park . The small Statue of Liberty is there.

Big beautiful park with hidden surprises. Skipping Luxembourg Gardens on your Paris visit would be like skipping Central Park in NYC. It's the crown jewel of the city's parks. Beyond the obvious places like the central fountain and the Senate Palace, explore the park's hidden nooks & crannies for many hidden gems.

Gorgeous Summer Garden. The gardens were freshly planted with summer flowers and the roses were in full bloom. The children were playing in the playground, the yoga classes were in session, the bocce ball players were enjoying themselves and the little sailboats were sailing all over the pond. What more is there to like!

Parisians relaxing. This is a great people watching park in addition to being a breathtaking park. Lovely on a summer day to watch the locals hang out. If in the area, make sure you walk through- beautiful.

Everything is expensive and Parisian people unfriendly. Children playground are expensive and payable in this garden while not in other gardens.. Moreover people working in the park is so unfriendly. For example, today owners of the puppet theater turn us shouting us in french because we weren't sitting at the right place and we should have to sit us away from our 2 years'old baby.So don't try to go to the puppet show in this garden, people is awful.

Relaxing park. Great park close to bustling Saint Germain to relax, go for a run, or if traveling with kids, take them to large playground. Nit of the magnitude if Retiro in Madrid or Central Park in NY but nice scenery and perfect green escape in the middle of it all...
Tranquility in the heart of a big city. Right in the heart of busy Paris are the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens where people relax and where one can forget they are in a big city.

I love Paris in the Springtime. When we booked our recent tour we were undecided about whether or not to visit Paris, largely due to time constraints. But we did stay in Paris, if only for four days, and Paris was my favourite city of the whole trip. I cannot find anywhere to write a review on the city itself so I have chosen to write on the Luxembourg, since I feel that typifies much of what I feel about Paris.Firstly the bad bits: I do not like the queues that seem everywhere in Paris, and I do not like large numbers of people who smoke in public places, especially restaurants. Now the good bits: everything else!You would need to be far more poetical than I to adequately describe the feel, the ambience of Paris. I loved strolling down the boulevards, sitting on the sidewalk, the architecture, the patisserie/boulangerie, the markets, the history, the people, but possibly above all the parks of Paris; which brings me the Luxembourg Gardens. We visited all the major parks and Luxembourg was our favourite. The spring flowers were out, and the place was so colourful, beautiful lake, lots of activities like tennis, lots of people all relaxed and seemingly quite happy, and lots of free chairs in which to rest and relax.This is Paris in the Springtime, and I love it.

Recomended place for relaxing. I was there this june2013. Its recomended place to you who like walking,running or sitting. Take ur boyfriend girlfriend or ur family here. Enjoy the trees and the atmosphere. In central of the city but there are so many trees and flowers. You can see the duck on the pond too!

favorite place. everytime I go to paris I tried to stop there . I took the subway and went to pastry shop to have a sandwich and sit there and enjoy the view. very relaxing . This year I noticed a lot of people asked for direction to see if I was a tourist. They back off when I answered in french

Overrated gardens. From what I'd read, I though these gardens would be perfect. They were not that well tended and sort of run down. But they are an oasis of greenery in a crowded city, so from this aspect a nice asset to this neighborhood.
A favorite spot. Beautiful any time of year! The grounds are always well-kept; the flowers spectacular. The pool by the Palais is a wonderful place to sit, relax and people watch.

Incredible in the city park-worth an afternoon. This is a huge park with little and big kid areas, a large pond, acres of shaded area with benches. One of the best features are hundreds of chairs that can be moved and arranged as you wish.One afternoon we were sitting by a gazebo when a band pulled up in a large truck and started a concert-locals knew about it but it was a nice surprise for us.

Nice place. I recommend resting your weary feet here for a few hours and enjoy the beauty of the garden and people watching. Head t the center of the park where you can kick back in one of the reclining green chairs by the fountain.

Required walking. To really savor the Parisien lifestyle a walk through the Luxembourg Gardens captures it all.....families with children; luncheon picnics on the grass; flowers and fountains; or a bench for resting and savoring the sun on the your face.
Tranquility in the middle of a busy city. Gardens were just being planted. Just a short walk from the hotel.Cute little stands selling crepes.

A great place to run!. It was so calm and wonderful. It was the most beautiful park like setting with statues, a castle, fountains and the most picturesque gardens. One of my favorite places in Paris.
Lovely gardens. Great space in centre of town. Lovely gardens, gallery open and free. Lots of places to sit and watch the world go by.
Sit and Watch the World Go By. Lovely gardens - but don't move the chairs provided too close to the fountain or you may incur the wrath of the omnipresent Park Rangers.
The nicest garden. We like to spend some time in the garden as it's very cosy, clean and beautiful! The garden is not very big but you can sit by the pool and enjoy
Beautiful from every angle. Paris can be a bit of a hurried shuffle so this sojourn was much appreciated. Enough space to get a way and yet stunning scenery at every angle

Beautiful place to relax or picnic. Our hotel was quite close to this place so we took advantage of its proximity. The park has many chairs to sit in - you are not allowed to sit in the grass. Take a coffee in the morning or grab a baguette and some other picnic items and enjoy the after noon sun. Great place to relax and take a break.

My favourite place in Paris. As soon as I found my first afternoon in the Luxembourg Gardens, I knew I would love it for the rest of my life! Nothing better than sit on the grass or on the chairs with some friends and a drink !

Quiet, peaceful break. The gardens are a great place for a break from art museums, business, the hustle and bustle of Paris' streets. There are nice walkways, attractive flowers, families relaxing and playing, etc. We happened to be there one morning when there was some sort of kids running race, which seemed fun and good-spirited. Lots of folks sit in the sun, read, etc. A very nice park, especially for families, I suspect.

A wonderful oasis. In all my years of visiting Paris, today was the first time I went into the gardens. What a surprise. Lots and lots of chairs to sit on - in the sun, under the trees - and it is beautifully set out. Office workers having their lunch, families having a picnic, lots of space for littlies to play football. The flower beds are just lovely and will look even better in a month or two

Relaxing, but Barred Off. I liked walking here before heading to a museum. Unfortunately, there seemed to be a lot of tape barring off sections of the park. There was a large security presence though, so that was nice. It was also sunny that do, so that helped improve my opinion of the garden.

Boating for children. I spent a wonderful morning at the gardens. There is a little pond where children can rent a boat and with a stick can guide it round. Wonderful to watch. Plenty of seats, a nice place to bring a picnic. I found it a bit odd how the security guards blow whistles at people who sit on the grass. Strange. Why can't we sit on the grass!!!

Garden Tour. The Gardens are a beautiful sanctuary in the middle of Paris. The fountain is breathtaking and the statuary impressive. The joggers , the tennis and basketball p.layers melded beautifully with the sightseers

The Jardin du Luxembourg. If you are in the Latin Quarter, this is the perfect place to escape from the city noise and rest and relax on one of the benches or chairs.There are always many people, especially if it's sunny or weekend. You can walk through the garden to see the Medici Fountain, the original model of the Statue of Liberty and other sculptures and fountains.The garden is really beautiful, a true oasis in the heart of Paris.

Spring Gardens. Although I am not a lover of formal gardens, the Luxembourg Gardens were a joy and an upliftment. The garden was colourful and the beds of tulips stunningly beautiful. It was a Sunday but not crowded. However there were many families enjoying themselves, either walking, sailing toy boats on the lake, playing games or enjoying the childrens play park.
Relax!. This is one of my favorite garden areas of the world. Find a good book, go to an appropriate spot (I.e. Paul Verlaine statue corner) and settle in. It's also a superb people-watching area.

Paris Gardens. I can't believe how clean the parks are in Paris the Luxembourg Gardens are absolutely beautiful and on a warm day it is a great place to stroll and take in the city. Take a picnic and really make use of the greenery there is lots to see. This is also fantastic for children as there were lots of areas to keep them entertained.

Lock the gates and leave me in here!. Lovely place for a picnic with enough space for everyone to enjoy. As we so often do when in Paris we put together a gastronomic feast from a local Patisserie and Boulanger. A place to relax and enjoy away from the hustle and bustle.The outside of the perimeter fencing were clad with large historic photo prints of 100 yrs of the Tour de France and were great fun and really interesting to look at.

Beautiful and Restful. A gorgeous park to while away an hour or two people watching. In the Gardens it is hard to believe you are in the middle of a huge city. Perfect place for a tourist to decompress after visiting museums and dealing with the Metro.

beautiful gardens and palace, have a picnic here if weather permits. within the great Riv Gauch you'll find these large beautiful gardens, nice water pool and palace. great place to relax your fatigue after the long walks in the Quartie Latin. stop by one of the markets around it (the Moufftard will do just fine) get a baguet, a nice piece of cheese and jumbon and a bottle of wine (don't forget a bottle opener and glasses) and have a nice picnic.

Great for a picnic!. If you get a sunny day in Paris, head over the supermarket, get the neccessaries & a bottle of wine and make your way to the gardens. Find a bench or a patch of grass (near the back) and you will have such an amazing afternoon. Do it!
Beautiful. Well worth a visit. Nice to escape the clouds and relax for an hour or 2. A good stroll through and then some chill out time taking in the gardens and tranquility.
Best gardens in Paris. These are the quintessential Parisian gardens - with the gorgeous vista, the jogging Parisians, the model boats on the tiny lake and the beautiful flowers. Ah Paris!
Beautiful even in the rain. What a wonderful place to stroll. See the locals practicing tai chi, the kids on rental ponies, everyone relaxed and happy. The Medici fountain is beautiful.

Can't sit on the grass. Went here as very highly rated. Disappointed by the inability to sit on the grass. There were 2 tiny strips where sitting was 'permitted' but all the rest, it was forbidden. We dared to sit in one area, where others were also siting quietly and reading, but after 15mins were shoo-d away by wardens with whistles. Yes, there are plenty of chairs to sit on the gravelly areas, but nothing beats soft cool grass underfoot.
Observe Parisians. Beautiful gardens. Also, historic (WWII). Great place to take lunch and observe Parisians from all walks of life enjoying themselves.
a lovely place to wander. a lovely place to wander, chill or read. Trees provide shelter from sun on a hot day. Places to sit and have a drink

Peaceful, open French gardens. Our apartment was very close to these beautiful gardens, and even though it was almost freezing outside, we visited twice. The second time, there were children playing with sailboats in the fountain, couples kissing, and local Parisians relaxing and enjoying the outdoors. If you want to see what the locals do during the day to soak up the sun, you must see Jardin du Luxembourg, especially in the spring.

An oasis in the middle of the city. Beautifully landscaped, just a lovely place to stroll and get away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city that lies just beyond........but you would you never know it once you escape inside the gates.
walk. Beautiful garden park for strolling and picnic with family . Easy access. Lots of shopping and food nearby. Great for children to run off excess energy while parents rest before next adventure!
Chagall in Musee. Extensive exhibit. Quite nicely exhibited. Short lines. Very complete. Well worth your time in the Jardin

Gorgeous park in the middle of the city.. Wide avenues of crushed stone flanked by rows of amazing gardens, huge planters with exotic trees, fountains. Everything one needs for a stroll away from the bustle of the city.

Something for Everyone. It is uttering amazing how this beautiful garden within the most visited city in Europe can be so engaging and enchanting. Perfectly landscaped designed gardens, soccer fields, tennis courts, quiet contemplative spaces, and water, this garden park had it all. Take time to stroll the pathways and enjoy the sights of the beautiful greenery and beautiful people of Paris. My hotel was a half block away and I selected to park the park daily to a metro station. The gardens close each evening about 9 PM. I felt safe in waking the gardens in the morning and evening

Do not miss this gem. This is my favorite place in Paris. The gardens are lovely, but more than that it is a glimpse into life in Paris. You will see families out for a day in the park complete with pony rides, lovers having a picnic, and tourists enjoying the absolute beauty of the manicured gardens. Be sure to stop by the Luxembourg Museum near the Senate building.
Beautiful park. We went on a lovely warm day and sat in the park on chairs which are provided throughout the park. Bought a baguette and drink and soaked up the sun. The park was crowded.

Nice area for picnics. This lovely garden is the best area of Paris to rest a little, away from the traffic and the tourists. The Musée has always some nice exhibitions (currently -June 2013- Chagall). The Cartier Foundation is not far away (great for contemporary art).

Beautiful!. Paris has the most beautiful public gardens and the Luxembourg is one of them. Spring in Paris this year was a bit cool and not many flowers were in bloom, but the grounds were awesome. Definitely a must see when you are in Paris!

Where Parisians go to relax.. On a hot sunny day you will find hardly a square inch of grass at these popular gardens, which are deservedly popular with parisians to relax, sunbathe, eat ice-creams, especially on Wednesday afternoons when children are let out of school early to sail their boats on the pond. Then gardens are not an absolute first-rate botanic experience, but they are very well done in a typically french style, and are an ideal people-watching rendezvous.

Been there twice now. This time it was not such a nice day but still lovely. Better to go on a weekend when a lot more going on as the atmosphere is better then. Great to see how much use the locals make of these gardens.
Beautiful, worth a visit. Lovely, tranquil gardens in the midst of Paris. Restful place to spend a few hours.Easy to get to within the 6th Arrondissement.

like a picnic in the middle of a museum. by far one of our favorite things to do when in Paris is to go to a local market ...gather the things for a picnic..wine,cheese,bread,meat, vegetable...and head to the gardens. there amidst beautiful statues and wonder fountains and flowers you can watch the world go by and feel totally isolated at the same time. You must take the time to do this when in this great city

Maybe the best walk in town. Luxembourg Gardens are far more than flowers, indeed the flowers are mostly a garnish to a multi-use wooded urban park fronting Luxembourg Palace. Uses include miles of walking paths, an open plaza with a large pond and rentable toy sailboats for the kids (not daily except in summer), tennis, boules, chess, jogging, photographing the statues (look for the Statue of Liberty) and monuments. kids' playground, puppet theater, etc, and plenty of chairs, benches and lawns for just sunning (check the signs to see if the lawn is interdit -closed - or not). The park opens early; at 7 AM it's almost your private space. And barring the worst imaginable luck this park is safe, due to its openness and a regular police presence.

A bit of peace in a hectic city. I travel to Paris at least once a year and use the Luxembourg Gardens as a getaway from its crazy pace. The park isn't as big as New York's Central Park or evenLondon's Hyde Park, but its quiet serenity amid the hustle & bustle of Paris always provides me with a boost after a busy day. The park isn't technically quiet, as it is usually filled with families and children from the neighborhoods but there is a fountain and chairs to sit on so what more could you want in Paris? Oh yeah, there's a public restroom on the east side of the park beneath the concession stand that's only a Euro. That's a valuable thing to know about!
Nice place for a walk on a spring morning. But it's event better in the summer. Walk, have a coffee, play some tennis, relax. Watch Parisians at play. Lovely

Beautiful, Do Not Miss. Take your time walk through the grounds, stop rest and relax enjoy the beauty of the gardens. You can even walk your dog around the outside grounds it you so desire as we did. Great for people watching and laying in the grass.
Great for a nice walk!. Really nice place! great for a nice walk or rest of walking... nice view and you can take great pictures!
Don't miss it!. We were walking to the Pantheon and a local told us to visit the Luxembourg Gardens. We were happy we did! A well maintained gardens with great variety and energy.

beautiful, worth a visit. Beautiful park and gardens. Very well kept.
Numerous places to sit and the chairs are individual so you can sit exactly where you want.
Ideal for people watching, relaxing in the sun, having lunch etc.

Great Oasis. This is a great place to relax and take a breather if you have time. Plenty of space, formal gardens, shade, ponds, seats and in a great setting (facing Palais du Luxembourg - senate building). Without the Tuilerie/Louvre hawkers. And it's free.
Very popular park in the middle of Paris.. Elegant statues throughout this park. The locals crowd in here during Sundays for picnics and relaxing.
Great for people watching. On a sunny weekend, this is a great place for people watching. The gardens are beautiful and free.It's one of my favorite parks in Paris.

Amazing. As an American, it amazes me that Parisians make such good use of their parks. Nice to see children playing, adults reading, lovers swooning over each other, people jogging, all in lovely surroundings. Flowers, statues, plenty of chairs, benches. Only drawback was that it was sssooo crowded, which didn't seem to bother anyone except me, a country girl.
Worth a visit. Beautiful gardens and grounds, much bigger than expected with plenty of space for quiet time or family activities.

A little disappointed. We were expecting to see lush gardens and really what we got was a park. We had walked there after doing some walking and shopping in the morning so we rested there for quite a while. It was one of the only warmish and sunny days during our entire time in France, so resting there was quite nice. Had we known better, we could have bought a lunch and eaten it there in the park.
Oasis in a busy city. This is a brilliant peaceful park where you can relax play tennis watch tai chi,chess or eat. Lots of seats an amazing park

Exquisite. I love these gardens. The walk to and through the gardens is fantastic. Explore the area behind the gardens b/c there are wonderful little shops and restaurants. We also visited these gardens in November, which was unbelievable with the leaves changing colors

Great place for a picnic or just a stroll (or run...). Even on a cloudy day, there was so much going on in the garden. An orchestra was playing a concert, people were exercising, dogs were sniffing and the old men were playing chess. What a wonderful place!!

Beautiful garden. This is a great place to hang out and watch people enjoy the beautiful city of Paris. Even though it is surrounded by a big city, the Luxembourg Gardens seems so removed from the noise of the cars, you feel as if you are at a country estate. It's fun watching the children with their boats on the "pond". What a great way to tire out the young ones, as they run around pushing the little sailboats with sticks.

Quiet place in a busy city. We wandered into this gardens after an early dinner- and we pleasantly surprised. An excellent place to unwind and people watch. Its beautiful, quiet and relaxing. lots of chairs to sit on and just enjoy the view and being in Paris.

Pleasant enough, but I would go out of my way.. We were staying in a loft close to these gardens and had to walk by them a couple of times to get to where we were going (Metro stop, Latin quarter), so we took an extra few minutes and walked through them.They are nice enough and a pleasant break from walking on the streets, but I wouldn't make a special trip just to see them.
Flowers everywhere. Flowers, ponds, trees and beautiful landscaping in the middle of a huge city - loved the colors and freshness

Perfect for a picnic "en amoureux". Built in the 1600's by Marie de Medicis this is one of the biggest Public Park in Paris. Free to get in and close to the hype of Saint Germain des Pres and the latin quarter, this is such a perfect place to stop by, just to sit down, enjoy the time passing by and relax. From one of the garden chair, you can see in the background the Palais du Luxembourg where the french Senate is located.Do not miss this very special occasion to be in Paris without feeling you are in Paris...

Lovely Gardens. Liked: overall gardens, lots of flowers, some statues and multi-leveled. All sorts of activiites - yoga, tai-chi, children sailing rented sailboats (3e for 1/2 hr.), even occasional musical performances and near wonderful patisseries. Esp. liked that there were no hawkers trying to sell souvenir trinkets like at the Tuileries - they really take away from the ambiance.There is nothing I dislike about this garden.

We had a very nice Picnic. We found a great little store and purchased some meat, cheese, bread and chocolate and walked to the Gardens, found a statue and ate our little picnic. Very beautiful and clean bathrooms (.20 and .50 for use though).
Picturesque garden. Went on a rainy day in May, but still worth the visit. Lovely garden and a nice place to take some stunning photos.worth a quick visit and even having a packed lunch

Brilliant gardens with so much to do and see!. This is a huge park with prestigious buildings. There are so many things to do. The playground charges 2.50 euros per child and adults who want to enter the playground have to pay as well. There are pony rides, puppet shows, tai chi and whole lot of other activities going on. We had 7 and 9 year old boys who really needed the gardens for a good runaround

An Amazing Garden. Built by Catherine de Medicis in the 16th century, the peace you experience strolling under the trees, watching kids sail their boats across the fountain or watch people play chess is a wild and peaceful experience away from the noises of the city.

Perfect place for a Parisian picnic. This is a great place to relax, people watch, and enjoy a picnic. I love watching the families and their children playing, people just relaxing, or as our family sharing a picnic.

Tranquil, Peaceful and Calm with lots of interesting Art Objects. Being the biggest garden in Paris, it's still not overly crowded and remain tranquil, leaving enough space for Art University student to draw on their canvas, or for Parisian to do their regular jogging. There are many picturesque object arts for photo taking as well. If you have enough time, you should sit at one of the chair overlooking the building of Luxembourg Musee. Just don't buy crepes from the stall in front of the pond, its expensive and taste not so good.

Rainy May, beautiful garden. The Luxembourg Gardens are a total treat even this month in 2013 when it rained every day. Whoever is doing the landscaping managed to bring a breath of spring to a dreary month. A little picnic lunch, an little wine and a good book--it is a heavenly way to spend a lazy day.
Relaxing Luxembourg. After having walked all the way from the Notre Dame, it was great to be able to sit and relax in front of a lovely fountain.

if you like landscaping. Plants glorious, big and beautiful. had fresh squeezed orange juice in the middle at a small restaurant after visiting the Pantheon. a few blocks away. quite the heaven. oh Paris ,you had me at everything

Not much to add... I must agree with all contributors...a must visit. Make sure to spend time here to observe. Find one of the marvelous reclined chairs near the pond and enjoy the sun, read a book, watch the young lovers! Also, absorb the meticulous care taken by the French of their parks...here and throughout the city. We spent time watching the gardeners trim a hedge...actually setting up a horizontal plum line to be sure of complete accuracy while hand trimming what looks like miles of hedge. Bring a lunch and a bottle of wine and enjoy a sunny day here...don't rush thru!

Sunny Sunday. Heard that Paris weather so far this year has been a bear. But on the day we visited, it was late afternoon and there was a happy, relaxed vibe in the air. We just enjoyed the beautiful grounds, and there was a good breeze that helped the toy sailboats zip along in the large fountain.
Beautiful Gardens. This garden was absolutely beautiful to walk through. Lots of chairs around for you to sit on to enjoy the relaxing feel of the Gardens!!! Well worth a visit!!!

An Oasis of Beauty. Immaculate ornamental gardens set around the Palais de Luxemberg (now the French Senate). These gardens are truly beautiful and are also a major activity centre for tourists and residents alike. The main ornamental pond is criss-crossed with toy sailing yachts steered and manoeuvered by both children and adults! The place is packed with picnickers, walkers, joggers, families, tourists and strolling lovers. The flowers, bushes, statues and trees are spectacular...well worth a few hours visit to wind down and recharge those batteries!

A wonderful place to relax. One of Paris' most special places with a delightful sense of the country. Bird song is a part of it all but the sense of space with the views of the palace and the greenery within the city makes for a most memorable experience.

Goregous relaxing Gardens. Everything about these gardens is absolutely divine. To the neatly planted and trimmed trees; to the playgrounds; to the great walking paths; to the carousels....totally enjoyable experience..

Check out what exhibitions are current. The gardens are a must, but also they have exhibition. Now until end of July, 2013 great painting of Chagall.http://www.museeduluxembourg.fr/en/expositions/p_exposition-18/

Beautiful Parisian park with a large pond and tennis courts. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautifully looked after. The flower beds are neat and colourful. On a sunny day, it's lovely to sit by the pond and people watch. There are sailing boats for the children as well as pony rides, and tennis courts. There are many quieter corners of the park where you can escape the bustle of city life.

Bring your children there!. I had the opportunity of visiting a few different gardens while in Paris, jardin des tuileries, jardin des plantes (botanic gardens) and Luxembourg Gardens, and this garden is my favourite of the lot. If there is only one garden you can pick to visit, this is it! Spacious for children to run about, see the nature (the birds and the ducks) and all the fresh air!! The station is just outside this garden, so is very convenient to get there. Note that toilets will cost 0.50 euro per person to enter.
Beautiful and peaceful. Busts of great women of France adorn Catherine de Medici's much diminished but still generous gardens.

Very nice garden. Especially in late spring and summer this garden is very nice with all its flowers and trees. There are a zillion of people sunbathing, reading, playing badminton, having picnic, etc.But do not expect tranquility. Better go somewhere else then...
Great spot for a pic-nic. A great open place in the middle of the city, perfect for a pic nic plan in a sunny day.Worth to visit

Lovely place to spend an afternoon in Paris. We spent a month in Paris and brought the kids to this park many times during our stay. The kids playground is excellent and well maintained. Lots of things for the kids to run around and climb.

Jardin du Luxembourg is Most beautiful places I've ever been. Jardin du Luxembourg is Most beautiful places I've ever been.This was the first French garden to be influenced by the Italian Baroque. The gardens, and the palace, were begun in 1612. The Luxembourg has long been seen as a quintessential Parisian space and remains very popular.
Moments of peace. This is a personal favorite. The grounds are beautiful, a classical layout. The Fountain is a must see.

Great place to spend time relaxing. We were staying within walking distance of the gardens and managed to visit on our last day. The weather was not particularly good and time was against us, however the experience was memorable. Lots of people around, but lots of seating too. Nicely located restaurant in the middle, where you can sit outside, listen to live music and enjoy a glass of sancerre. Loads of activities for children to play on too - as you make your way through the park. Great way to end a few days in Paris.

Picnic anyone... Lovely park with some interesting features such as Koi carp, waterfalls, formal planting and an octagonal lake where local children sail their toy boats. Lots of seating which is moveable allows a lovely spot overall o have a view of the lake, palace and either the one you love or a good book..
Beautiful and perfect sunny day spent at the gardens. Large open spaces, with chairs around to sit and enjoyGreat photo opportunities to share with others

A true natural beauty. The garden's gardeners always manage to design nature's bounty in sensational fashion. The perimeter of the Senate with small 6 to 8 inch hedges filled in with beautiful pinks and purples was beautiful. the perfect round shaping of bushes in front of larger trees was outstanding. Simply a delight for the eyes.
Beautifu gardens. Very beautiful and very large gardens near the city centre. If the weather in Paris is good this is a place that you surely visit!

Very Nice Walk. This is a great take for a relaxed walk and lots of things that make great photos. Many statues, some even comical. The grounds are immaculately kept. How they trim the 50-foot high hedges I don't know. The Luxembourg Palace is breathtaking but is closed to the public as it is used by the French Senate.
My personal favorite. A real slice of Parisian leisure, with children pushing their sail boats, a crazy Sunday morning band concert, and locals just chilling.
Great place for relaxation. Came here on april, the weather was great, the flowers bloomed and the sun was out. me and my girlfriend had some great time sitting enjoying parisian air and estheticism.
Sunny haven near hotel. Lovely gardens to relax in the sunshine or take a walk in beautiful park away from the hustle and bustle of city living.

Relaxing place. You can see what french people do in their free time, lots of joggers, kids playng, older people playing chess, not to many tourists. The park has some nice orange trees, palm trees usw.. In spring nice tulips grow there.

Sit, watch, relax in a very Parisian setting. Houses the French Senate but is so much more. There is constant competition for the available seats (people run in the high season!), worth cornering so that you can sit in a blissful oasis in the middle of busy Paris. Lovely gardens, often music in the bandstand up on the higher ground near Bld Saint Michel during the summer. Parisians and tourists combine to promenade, sit and look, read and sleep. If you move your seat down to the big pond you will soon be confronted by a garden gendarme and asked to move it back. Picnic-ers and sun worshippers (mostly students) on the long grass section at the southern end. Can see the top of the Eifel Tower during the day. The Medici fountain is out of time and place. Food and drink available in the gardens but you can also bring your own in. Closes at dusk with the sound of a whistle blowing.

Who needs Versailles for its gardens. This was a pleasant surpise in the center of Paris. Really beautiful park, with wondrous colors and views. There is a small lagoon with a statue that is weathered over time, where many profesional photographers and couples getting married go to create albums. In the dark afternoon, the swimming pool/lagoon it was like a trip back in time. You can see the Pantheon from there but it was too far for us to go, after walking from Place VendommeWe caught the Chagal exhibit there at the gallery and spent a wondeful afternoon.
Scenic. The weather wasn't great when we were there; but you could see the potential. A great place for relaxing.

Well worth a visit. I found the Jardin Du Luxembourg gardens lovely to stroll around It is also the gardens that features in Victor Hugos novel Les Miserables where the two lovers Cosette and Marius have their first meeting.Would try and avoid on the weekend as Sunday was very crowded. The Medici Fountain is one of the outstanding features of the park.Try and get there early on a weekday and you will be well rewarded
beautiful park in unexpected area.. Left the bustle of surrounding shops and traffic to a lovely tranquil park.Even though it was raining on our visit it was very pleasant walk.

One of the most beautiful places of one of the most beautiful cities. It is very nice to enter this blooming garden (I was in Paris in late May) and take a rest of long Paris walks. You can choose one of countless chairs or benches and meditate watching lovely meadows and flowers and fountains and statues and trees and the Luxembourg Palace...

Impressive. Went to the garden on a late afternoon. The garden was impressive both in size and in design. Many people were hanging out there around the pond or on the grass. Lucky for the residents nearby the garden.

Not very family friendly.. We have been to many attractions in Paris and they all have been family friendly. This was the only attraction that we did not feel our child was welcomed. The only place we felt welcomed was the nice garden.

Amazing gardens. Beautiful gardens. Do not miss the area close to the Medici fountain, it is amazing. Great to take your kids, to take a break. The gardens are located in one of my favorites part of Paris the Latin quarter close to the Sorbonne and the Pantheon.

Split Personality (In a Good Way) Gardens. If you are staying near Luxembourg Gardens and have children with you, definitely take them there! They have a fantastic play area with tons of fun "rides" (NOT automated - kid powered!), things to climb all over, swing on, and basically wear themselves out. There's an area where older gents play bocce ball and smoke cigars. All this near the entrance corner of Rue Vivin & Rue d'Assas (Notre Dame des Champs Metro). Other side of the garden is the Palais with mini boat races in the huge fountain, lots of formal gardens and places to sit. All around are wooded glens mixed with lovely huge sculptures and planted beds. While we were visiting, bee keepers were working with bees to polinate all the plants - very cool experience.

Relaxing Stop !. We took a picnic lunch to Luxembourg Gardens and spent half the day eating, chatting with other people and taking in the beauty of the gardens and palace. It was May and the start of high season but we had no problem finding a little bench to relax on.
Summer treat. Beautiful flowers and hedges. We visited in spring with all the beautiful flowers. Plan avisit of 2 hours

The best space in Paris!. This is my very best place in my favourite city. The gardens are beautiful at any time of the year, and the human activity no less attractive: runners, tennis players,chess players, children having a tremendous time in the play area, readers under the trees, smart gendarmes strolling around. It is a place to unwind from the tourist treadmill, and to rediscover your serenity. The statues somehow help in this process. And it's free. And don't miss the Medici fountain, with its magnificent sculpture of Acis and Galatea about to have a rock dropped on them.

lovely respite in the big city. watch the kids and adults play with their push or remote control boats on the huge fountain pool. Lots of activity, nice stroll, playground, tennis courts, art both modern installations on outside wall and sculpture.

Worth a visit. Really beautiful layout &well worth a stroll round. Tranquil & great to sit awhile. Garden very pretty with statues & Flowers in lovely settings. A word of advice re the cafe, it costs extra if you wish to sit there to have refreshments, a pity really as it spoilt the need to relax in such peaceful surroundings. The toilet facilities are not free either.
Great place to pass the day. Besides the park it self, it has a great pond were children of all ages sail boats and the people just sit and relax, passing the day in tranquil contemplation.

No accident that it was the cover photo on the e-mail. One of my favorite places to go. Slightly away from the other "heavy-hitters/must-see" attractions. However, if you want to see amazing structured plantings and find somewhere to take a snack or lunch and unplug, this is the place. It is also a photo taking dream with tons of symmetrical picture taking opportunities and great bursts of color in the plantings.Full disclosure, this photo was taken in 2005, the rating wouldn't allow me to input anything older than what I did.
