Still, I did visit again last year and it was just as beautiful.Merci beaucoup

The No. 1 Park. Paris is full of parks and gardens, you can take your pick. There are even small ones if you're willing to go looking for it! But, there is one that you shouldn't miss and there are so many things to do here. If you're a lover of sculptures, go hunt down the numerous statues scattered around the park in every nook and cranny. If you're a lover of flowers, there are a variety of them too. Even if you're the lazy type, you can always just bring along your book (or e-book), pull up a chair and enjoy the world as it passes by. The only time you want to avoid this place is when it rains!

Very beautiful!!. It is a very beautiful garden, with tons of flowers and great statues; I've walked there a few times with my wife while in paris, and it's a great site for pictures and filming... also , you can cross the park and access the Pantheon, which is also very nice..

One of my favorite things. Just about everytime I am in Paris I must visit the Luxemburg Gardens. They are very beautiful with numerous attractions within them. It seems like I'm always discovering new aspects of this place when I visit. Paris is a heavily populated, heavily touristed, city, so it's nice to take time out during each visit to Paris to walk in the Luxembourg Gardens. It's an opportunity to just relax and enjoy the fresh air and beautiful surroundings.

All time favorite alluring garden. It's my all time favorite place in all of Paris. I brought back the most vivid and warm memories and photographs I never get tired of looking at. I could spend hours there absorbing the beauty. Everything in this park is so French and charismatic that words can't describe it. It's just one of those places in the world. I adore it in autumn when the leaves are turning yellow and red. Don't miss Jardin du Luxembourg -- enjoy the alluring sculptures, flowers, people, kids playing, serene atmosphere and yet the surroundings yell: "you are in Paris".
For the fauna fans. Take a stroll through the gardens. You can spend hours viewing the variety of fauna or just pass thru and take the time to smell the flowers.
Favorite park in Paris. Great place to see the flowers, wander and watch people enjoy fun activities. Nice place to find a chair and read a book.
relaxing atmosfere. The best place ever to spend the afternoon after the sight seeing. Free concerts, people having picnics, waching people,

Peaceful oasis. Beautiful gardens and trails. One could probably spend hours here especially if you brought a picnic. Astonished by the beauty of the palais. Also, we attended the Chagall exhibition---stellar! Definitely worthwhile to buy tickets online before arriving in Paris---there was a very long lineup and we just walked in!

Luxembourg Blooms. The gardens are beautiful, the energy surrounding the gardens is wonderful. So many different people and the flowers blooming all around. April is Paris is amazing and so was the Garden.
We visited Luxembourg Garden with friends.. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful. The lake where the little boats are sailing is very picturesque. There are many beautiful flowers and statues to see.

Beautiful spot in central Paris. A great place to get away from the busy streets of Paris. Go for a run in the morning or a walk after lunch, the gardens, the statues and historic buildings are so impressive. Sitting in the park listening to beautiful French women talking French makes you want to stay in France permanently
A city oasis. What a beautiful garden in the city of Paris. A lovely place to spend an hour or two soaking up the sunshine on a spring day.

One of the best places to visit in Paris!. Luxembourg Gardens was so beautiful and relaxing, we went twice on our trip to stroll around. There are stands everywhere with sandwiches or crepes, plenty of places to lounge around or picnic on the grass or by the sailboat pond. Definitely worth a visit (or two)!
Gorgeous!. Do go there! It was gorgeous even on a rainy day. There was a jazz concert in the evening in a small, covered veranda. Romantic.
Lovely respite!. If you want to get away from the hussle and bussle this is just great! Perfectly located near Eiffle Tower and Orsay.

It`s fairytale!!!. Luxembourg Gardens is located in the center of Paris! It`s wonderful show and a good staple. The park is a popular vacation among children and adults. Animators offer you pony and equipage for walk. There are tennis court and basketball playground in the garden and also a covered area for a game of chess. The main charm of this garden is a fountain in front of the palace facade. The workers of garden show open air performance in the music hall. Beauty and relaxation - what else is needed?!
Gorgeous. Perfect place to relax on a warm day! Beautiful grounds! Lovely atmosphere! Look out for the mini Statue of Liberty

Quiet and Lovely. A lovely and quiet spot for rest and reflection. Highlight is the model of the Statue of Liberty and the sight of families quietly enjoying the flowers and lawns. a must-see when you are on the Left Bank!

Beautiful gardens worth a visit. The gardens are attractive and well maintained. The main pond is nice place to picnic or read. Place is inviting and peaceful . Medici fountain is lovely. After walking in Paris city center, it is a good place to settle down and relax.
busy. we went there last sunday, rainy day, but was still busy and very noisy, i wouldn t recommend it that much, jardin des touileri is much better

Very Attractive. Jardin Luxembourg is a very attractive garden. There are plenty of places to sit and people watch or just enjoy the breeze. The only down side is that there is a lot of gravel and pavement, which can be uncomfortable to your feet after walking through town to get there. The grass is nice to look at, but I think it may be against the rules to sit or play in it. The grounds over all are very attractive. This includes the MANY statues, MANY flowers, fountains, and water features. It is worth a trip.
Flowers. We were fortunate to be visiting Paris in late April and the Luxembourg Gardens were a treat. Poppies, tulips and flowering trees.

gorgeous gardens and flowers. This is a huge park-like gardens, and is an oasis in the centre of Paris.Lots going on with plenty of people sun bathing, reading, walking, etc.One of my favourite destinations in Paris.

Most relaxing Parisian morning. Beautiful, beautiful spot, lots and lots of little nooks and crannies where sculptures are on display. The main pond in front of the palace is a wonderful place to sit and relax. Lots and lots of chairs, park is sparkling clean and well-maintained. The Medici fountain is worth the visit alone. Do not miss this wonderful sanctuary.

Beautiful Garden in central Paris. Beautifully kept gardens with many different flowers in bloom, fountains, and places to sit and read a book (for me) and to play soccer (for my children). A great place for any family to visit.

Worth frequent visits, either to walk or sit.. These are beautifully, exquisitely maintained gardens on the site of the Luxembourg Palace in the 6th arrondissement in Paris. There are plenty of places to sit and stroll. The plantings are special and usually change with the seasons. There is even a playground, actually two, for children. A nice café exists there. Children float boats in the large pond. Don't miss this if you are in Paris in good weather.
Relaxing interlude to your day. Don't miss this lovely park that is truly the place where Parisiennes go to relax and enjoy nature!!

Nice place for a picnic. Lovely large park with lots of seats and plenty of places to picnic! There was a small lake with ducks and plenty of trees for shade on a hot day. Has stunning views of the senate and pretty fountains.

Take your baguette to the gardens for lunch!. Perfect to rest those feet from all the walking around paris. Take your lunch and relax on the grass, or under the trees in the park. A few cafe's around if you need a drink too. Luxembourg palace is now home to the senate but you can look from the outside.Gardens are impressive!

So beautiful!. We wandered around these gorgeous gardens one spring morning. We were particularly intrigued to watch the little kids at the lake, pushing the little wooden boats with long sticks. They were delightful to watch! The gardens are extensive and all the poppies were so gorgeous!

Great park for kids. Huge area on left bank with a great play area for kids that charges a few euro to get in but packed with things to keep them busy. Mike most if Paris the food and drinks are a complete con so take a picnic.

Absolutely wonderful.. Put on your walking shoes that you don't care about and just stroll around the gardens. Grab something at an always nearby carefore and have a picnic. Know that the Paris intelligence is located under your feet, and have a good time.

Early visit. Our visit was a little early in the year to truly be able to appreciate the gardens. It was early May and while some tulips had bloomed, it was still rather cold and rainy (perhaps just an off year) so it is probably stunning with everything blooming.

Beautiful Gardens - great for little ones. We took our 4 year old to this beautiful garden and had a nice lunch in the pavilion - really nice food and staff. Plenty to do - he sailed a little boat on the pond which he loved. Had a pony ride and there is a terrific playground (however they charge an entry fee which is a bit cheeky). Overall completely delightful and highly recommend.
Love...love it!!. You have experience nothing of gardens till you visit this one...so busy and peaceful at the same time!!

leisure walks , quiet and relaxing. Everyone was so happy and relaxed here. Children playing, people reading , walking , talking. A huge lake for sailing your littel boat. No flowers yet because of the very long winter. Chestnuts in blossom everywhere.A nice get a way and have your bagette in busy Paris. On the outside gates of the parc, there are large photo murals of the tour de France now and then. Very interesting. Also the Marc Chagall Musem is right there.
Relaxing!. Absolutely beautiful! Very peaceful, if you go early in day. Nice to sit around and people and flower watch!

Gorgeous Gardens. The gardens were simply gorgeous & i really enjoyed having my breakfast picnic there. Only thing to note is the gusts of wind thatcan blew the sand into your face.A piece of heavenly sanctuary away from the mad crowds.I consider this a must visit while in Paris!

Beautiful. France is a garden country, and you can't visit Paris without seeing the city's best gardens. Walking around is not only a beautiful viewing experience, but allows you to see how the French use their park - from boche ball (I think they call it something else, but you get the idea) to tennis, to chess, there is a lot going on in one of Paris' most beautiful settings. Pack a picnic - don't forget the Champagne - and enjoy the perfect Parisian lunch spot. Then walk through the Garden to the Montparnasse area and have a drink at Le Select, just like Jake and Brett from "the Sun also Rises."

Green oasis in middle of Paris. These gardens are special in more than one way: they're the property of the French Senate (rather than a city park); they're next to both the Latin Quarter and Montparnasse; they have wide open areas, including a large circular pool; they're home or next to some very fine pieces of art (outdoor sculptures, fountains, the Senate palace itself, the Orangerie and the Luxembourg Museum which often host interesting exhibitions); they have several entertainment areas (playground and pupppet-shows for kids, tennis courts and chessboards for everyone); and last but not least they are peppered with many pleasant although somewhat heavy chairs you can move around to relax on wherever you please (except some of the very well-tended lawns).Hidden from the crowds, American visitors may be happy to discover a small replica of the Statue of Liberty. It may take some time to find, as signaling does not exactly abound... but that may add to the charm of these gardens!

A place to relax and unwind. Regardless of age, one needs to take some time during a holiday to stop and let one's body catch up. This is the ideal place in Paris to just do that. It is the garden for Parisians. This alone speaks volumes for the ambience. I always make sure that mid-way through my visit to Paris, I buy a small picnic lunch and sit here and unwind and watch the world go by. Just delightful.

Fun with the sailboats. We went on a Tues afternoon and my kids were disappointed no one was near the pond renting sailboats. We went back on a Saturday afternoon and my kids were thrilled to be able rent them. I thought they may be disapppointed, because I thought how much fun could a kid really have waiting for their boat to sail to the edge just to push it with a stick. Well-I was wrong. My 11 and 9 yr old son and daughter has so much fun, it was so nice to watch them having a blast. It was 3 euros for a 30 min rental.

A wonderful family park. Quick, take a peek at this wonderful warm fabulous garden. Well known to the locals, but a less known to the tourist (I think tourists normally are overwhelmed with the Eiffel, Arc the Triomphe, and Versailles, or crazy shopping at the lafayette or champ d'ellysse).First, you will have to enter a park before you reach the garden. The park itself is already a great joyful entertainment. Within five minutes walk, before you realize it, a grand palace and a huge very beautiful park greets you with its beautiful pond.It's really an amazing surprise.You better read the story of this park/building before you go.
Perfect day out. Chairs are available for sitting and taking in the day-to-day life of Parisians. There's plenty of eateries to grab something to eat at the park. Recommended!

sitting in the sun. This park has nice chairs around the water for enjoying the sun and watch the childeren play with the boats. It was very crowded and we needed to wait for some chairs. It has as well a nice view on the sénat.

A less crowded Tuileries. Great landscape, less crowded than Tuileries, beautiful tulips of all colors! Look for gardens where stepping inside is permitted and enjoy a picnic there - we went during the first week of May and it was near perfect pleasant weather!
Beautiful garden. The garden is very beautiful. Medici fontain takes your breath. But why you should stay off the grass?

The park is the centre of Paris living. 60 Acres of park. Much to do, walk, sit, read, take a nap, play chess. There are open air exhibits. Something to see and do for young and old. The park is an Paris institution since the 17th century. Rich in history and intrigue.
All the world's a stage. A great place to watch people and waterfowl..check out the toy boats and the carousel. Walk along the avenues.

Filled with Fun. Always children present on the play structures and always elders playing boule. A respite on a hot day near the boats, or under the trees. Don't forget to catch the outdoor art gallery hung upon the external fence. This year is shows terrific pictures of the Tour!

Loved it!. This park is so beautiful in the Spring with all the flowers blooming! We were fortunate enough to get good weather and a warm day last week when we came here. Lots to see when walking around but we also grabbed a couple of chairs and just relaxed and it was wonderful!

Gigantic Beautiful Garden. Plantings are beautiful, but the garden is massive. Great place to have a picnic lunch or to rest on a park bench, but if your time is limited, keep moving. This is a really big park/garden!

Beautiful break from the city. A retreat in the middle of the chaos. Just beautiful. After several days of nothing but rain and cold, we had a break in the weather and I think everyone had the same idea to get outside. The park was full of people taking naps, walking their kids, on dates, on picnics - it was vibrant. It felt like one of those perfect Paris scenes you only see in movies. The walk around this area is just as eclectic as the people in the park - so take your time.
Gorgeous place. Worth the visit, make sure you see it on a sunny day. A beauuuuuutiful gallery inside also. Take your time and read the great story about it.

Away from the (some of) the bustle of Paris. We spent a wonderful afternoon in the Luxembourg Gardens, away from the bustle of more heavily touristy areas. The sculpture collection in the garden and the espalier workshops at the southern end provide intellectual interest, but the shade and benches and families just hanging out and relaxing were just what we needed after crowded museums!
Great ambiance. A picturesque park, my wife and I had an engagement shoot here last Autumn. Lots of benches and tables, can use a coffee/snack stall though.

A Beautiful Place. This place is like an oasis in the desert. Fabulous to get away from the noisy Parisian traffic once in a while. Here's where to go.Don't forget to take a picnic basket, if possible. Check out the basin with the mini-sailing boats, the beautifully tended gardens, the Medici Fountain, the guys playing 'boules',etc, etc. Not to be missed!!

Beautiful. And full of life. These gardens are beautiful even during a light drizzle. There are plenty of places to sit. relax and people watch. There were lively games of chess, people strolling and jogging and others just taking in the surroundings. I could imagine these gardens being a different experience with each visit.

Best Lunch Spot in Paris. Beautiful gardens and a great place to go when you need a break from the busy streets of Paris. We stopped by a small grocery store around the corner from the gardens and had lunch in the park. The gardens are incredibly well maintained. Excellent park for everyone, but they have several things especially for kids including pony rides.

Marc Chagall Exhibit. I wanted to see this exhibit and it was well worth it. I bought my tickets in advance at FNAC on Boulevard Saint Germain and that was the best thing to do so you do not have to wait. It is an amazing exhibit and his paintings reflect his life over his 98 years. Truly amazing to see and is there through August. The gardens here as well as the fountains are beautiful.

This is the place in Paris!. Avoid the cafe - food isn't very good and neither is the coffee or the crepes- they're served cold and yucky! Instead, seek out the tiny, stand-alone wooden hut that sells crepes and coffee avoid the coffee but go for the crepes - They are hot and delicious!
relaxing city park. Grab a crepe and coffee and then spend the afternoon watching the little sailboats in the lake. Quintessential Paris.
Very nice and pleasant place in the center of the city. The gardens are really beautiful and amazing. It is great pleasure to take a rest in this place just watching the birds and flowers.

Stunning!. We spent the afternoon just wandering around and relaxing in the gardens. An orchestra played for the whole of the afternoon, which made the experience even more enjoyable! It was a Saturday, so it was packed with locals and visitors, but even with the crowds it was peaceful, clean and most enjoyable. A must see when in Paris.

Wonderfully relaxing. For families with young children, the hire of vintage sailing boat toys, that you push with a wooden stick across the fountain is not to be missed. In May, when the garden flowerbeds and the leaves are at their best, when classical music is played at the open-air orchestras and one can enjoy the beautiful views, this is as good a public place as it gets

Beautiful City Park. If you want to take time out and see a beautifully laid out park then visit the Luxembourg Gardens. Set in several acres, there are sculptures, a lake, a marionette theatre and heaps of things for children including pony rides and play areas. This is a busy well used Parisian park but if you want a break from the very crowded tourist areas to rest those weary feet, you could do worse then take break here.

Pleasant escape. Unlike the natural beauty of, say, New York's Central Park, the Luxembourg Gardens is a meticulously manicured and maintained park that offers beauty of a different kind. It's a wonderful place to relax, enjoy the scenery, and watch others do likewise.

Nice garden to view Parisiens at rest and play. I would not say that it is essential to visit this garden. However, it was very nice to be part of the everyday parisien experience of resting at the park or bringing young children to picnic and play.
Colourful and more active than tranquil. This is a super large area of lawns, flowers and trees with lots going on. There may be quiet spots to relax from the city scene but we did not find them.
Springtime in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful in the springtime. Nice romantic place to go for a walk. You will find a Movenpik stand there.. Best hot chocolate i've ever had! A must see.
for a birder this is a great place to visit. I saw some pretty good birds here and other birders besides. Chaffinch, Stock Dove, Long-tailed Tit, Great Tit (many), Eurasian Treecreeper.

To walk through... Is to experience loveliness. We are staying in a hotel nearby and so ambled through here on what has become a walking tour of Paris.... The gardens were a colourful and quaint - and I mean that positively...!!!! There were lots of people jogging and having lunch - it felt like a local haven....

Nice, even in the rain. It was unfortunate my trip to the gardens was disrupted by rain but even without an umbrella I wanted to walk through and snap a few pictures. I also took the subway here which has a convenient stop that brings you directly to the entrance of the gardens. If you take the subway here you might feel how I did as you rise from the pits of Paris to one of the most beautiful places it has to offer.
Beautiful, peaceful gardens. Spacious, interesting gardens with clean toilets, cafe etc. Beautiful flowers in Spring. Highly recommend.

Great park - amazing kids activities. We spent a few solid hours there in late April with my 5yo daughter. At the park she "sailed" a boat, rode a pony, rode a carousel, watched a puppet show, and played in an fabulous playground. She also liked looking at all the statues of past Queens and royals. Note that they charge both kids and parents to enter the playground.

Relax right in the middle of the city. After all those long hours of shopping, sitting in cafes and site seeing, a leisurely couple ours in Luxembourg Gardens is fantastic. Learn how to relax like a Parisian. Find a bench, read a book or have a little snooze right in the middle of the city.

A Sunday afternoon destination.. One of Paris' great joys is the effort and expense lavished on public gardens. In the spring, the Luxembourg gardens are covered with tulips and spring flowers, all behind the palace built for Marie de Medicis.
A green spot in the middle of Paris. Go there to have a walk in nature and relax on a sunny afternoon. Surround yourself with green and forget about the city's buzz for a while.
Relaxing place after intensive walking through Paris. Relaxing place after intensive walking through Paris; enjoy the Luxembourg chairs; walk through the statues of the French Queens!
My childhood garden.... My childhood garden... Always nice to visit it, as it has a special homely atmosphere... Readers, lovers, joggers, children, tourists... and lots of beautiful flowers...

Good place to enjoy a morning run or have a pic-nic. In a quiet neighborhood, the luxembourg garden has various species from all around the world, but it's not the main purpose of the gardens.
You can go take a walk or run with the parisians who like to workout there or come relax in the afternoon on the grass and have a pic-nic or simply lay and enjoy the scenery
Nice place to sit for a minute. Beautiful gardens, tulips were in bloom when we were there. It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon.

Gorgeous in good weather. This was a beautiful place. We really like to walk around and gawk at the beautiful architecture and gardens in Paris. This was a great place for both. Enjoyed a bottle of wine at the outdoor cafe and strolled the gardens.
Enjoyed watching the kids with the sailboats on the pond.

A typical Paris park - good place for relaxing and people watching. A good place to watch people and also enjoy a break in a shaded area. Near the Palais the grounds are more formal, but if you go to the other side of the park, then the grounds are much less formal, and more like an English park. It makes a good break after having explored the left bank.

Beautiful Jardin. Our first walk out into the city took us to Le Jardin du Luxembourg and it was stunning. The Medici Fountain is the first eye popping
stop as you enter the park. Flowers, topiary and a wide expanse of walkways face the palais.

Peak Experience. There is nothing better than picking up a Herald Tribune and a baguette and strolling over to the Gardens to soak up the atmosphere of Paris. Great for people-watching, especially around the pools.

Lovely peaceful expanse in the heart of Paris. Lovely palace, flowers and trees in a huge park. Lots of locals jogging, walking and passing the time of day. There is a cafe (quite expensive with the stereotypical disinterested French waiters) where it is nice just to sit and relax amidst so much beauty. The Musee de Luxembourg is at the St Germain end and I visited the Chagall exhibition which is just superb. I advise you to book online as there were queues the day I went.

Lovely gardens. Visited on the first warm and sunny day of the year. The gardens were very busy with plenty of people enjoying the location and weatherHad a drink in the cafe sat in the partly shaded seating which was a reasonable price and the service was polite and promptWell worth a visit

Absolutely ,positively a lovely spot.. Walked through the park on a general walk-about of this area of Paris and had to linger. This is one lovely spot and a great area to see Parisians relaxing and enjoying the outdoors from playgrounds to tennis to bowls. What a refreshing change from the tourist areas!
BEAUTIFUL!!. This was a very short walk from our hotel. The gardens were full of people picnicing, relaxing, running, taking photos. It was very beautiful!

Picnic at the Gardens. Do yourself a favor, weather permitting. Buy some food from any of many local vendors, grab a bottle of wine from a local store, and have a picnic at the Gardens. Eat, drink, do some people watching, enjoy it. We did.

Gardens. The only reason I gave it the average rating is because when we were there there weren't many flowers out. But the grounds are beautiful and when in bloom I am sure it is gorgeous. There are statues all over the grounds. And lots of benches to sit in and relax and people watch.

Nick gardens. Pretty big but not that much to see in October - there's some nice fountains and lots of pigeons.
Not many beggers here either which was good!
Luxembourg Gardens. A beautiful example of French landscape design and. Peek into how the French use these public spaces & parks.

gorgeous tulips. We stumbled upon these gardens by accident and later realized where we were. there are beautifully colour coordinated flower beds and little boats in the pond, really great place for a picnic in the park, there are lots of public chairs you can move and use to your convenience

Lots of people but relaxing. This huge garden was filled with people, not only tourist but Parisians, running, playing tennis, doing martial arts. There are lots of chairs around so you can just sit and enjoy the sunshine.

The peaceful heart of Paris. If you didn't know, this park is where the Parisian go.
We were lucky this time to see the Luxembourg Gardens in April with brilliant sunshine. In fact we were dazzled there in both senses.

Very relaxing.. Great for people watching. Grab a sandwich and tasty desert nearby and enjoy a picnic in the park. Make sure you get there before 12 noon to avoid the crowds and get a seat without pigeon crap all over it.

Nice surroundings, difficult to navigate inside museum. The Luxembourg Gardens are worthwhile visiting as well as the surroundings, however we entered the museum to see the Chagall exposition. The major problem with the museum is that it offers a very little area to accomodate lots of folks at the same time. The air was stuffy and it was difficult the view the paintings in a comfortable manner. I say visit the gardens, forget the museum.

Terrific for picnics. There are so many lovely statues set in this stunning garden. The children paying with their boats in the fountain in the Center makes a lovely sight. This is one of the best gardens to take your picnic to.

Luxe Luxembourg. It is one of the best deals in Paris - these beautiful gardens will restore your touring-tired feet. For free! If you have a few schekels left, there is a fine little museum aroung the corner - forget the name of it - but mostly a locals' haunt, but with first-class exhibits.
Walking Thru the Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful in Spring, Lots of Blossoms... Sit on a park bench and take a break, people watching is very fun in Paris.

Beautiful and relaxing. It is a very beautiful and relaxing garden. It is also very big. I had great time there in summer. It s very relaxing around the fontain. But it s hard to get a chair, cause it s too popular

Watch the sunset and the French. This is a great place to relax in the middle of or after a day roaming Paris. They have lots of chairs of different shapes to sit in (free), and you can watch Parisians and tourists alike wandering about, running, relaxing, or children sailing boats on the octagonal pool. It is particularly nice at sunset with clear skies, when you can follow the sun disappearing and plan your adventures, culinary or others, for the hours ahead.
Lovely way to spend an afternoon. This is a beautiful garden to walk or while away your time in Paris, a must see. Has play grounds for kids too!

Gardens on a Grand Scale. What a wonderful place for the whole family! Sailing model boats in the pool, pony rides, walking under leafy trees,admiring the blooms or just sitting and taking it all in,,,definitely a visit to be made.
Best park in Paris. Best place for a park stroll in a city infamously lacking green spaces. Moments away from the river via Boulevard St Michel
Lavish garden. Huge and lavish garden. Pretty flowers and trees line the garden lanes. Good place to just be absorbed in the expanse of the greenery. Must visit!

Ok - wouldn't go out of my way to visit. We have been to Paris before however we missed visiting the gardens on our last trip so wanted to make a point of seeing it this time. The gardens were ok, a bit disappointed, what is with Paris and having dirt everywhere in their parks? I don't think I would go back, it was a bit of waste of time really.

Beautiful. This was probably the best walk we had during our trip to Paris. The park is beautiful and peaceful...just watching the people go by and enjoying the flowers and trees or sitting by the pond, just lovely.

Very nice relaxation spot. I love gardens and this is definetely a beautiful one. We enjoyed a champagne along with fruits nearby the pool. Spending 2 hours there after the walking down the busy Paris streets was a great idea.

Floral Beauty. Collected fresh baguettes and salad fillings from near by cafe and sat in the gardens for a lazy lunch. Nice break of pace after hectic sightseeing around the city. Take your time here- the floral displays in summer are exquisite.

A lovely place for children.. When I was very small my parents and Grandmother used to take me to the gardens to play and I have always had wonderful memories of the place. Apart from being beautiful this is a special place to escape the traffic and stroll about under the trees.

A beautiful and fabulous garden. If you're in Paris during Spring time, you must visit this place. Besides watching the locals spend their leisure time, this place is full of blooming tulips and green trees. It's a great place to have a picnic and to take a break from your busy schedule and watch people. If you want to see the entire garden plan for al least half day. Make sure your camera is ready.

Tranquility - flowers - peace. Enter by the majestic gates and you quickly discover another world far from the madding crowds and noise of the nearby Metro. Visiting in April meant abundant tulip displays, chestnut trees, delicate fruit blossoms and a feeling of serenity. If this was too much quiet, then the children by the pond soon changed the mood as they played with their boats and fought over who was winning. Take a book, a baguette, find a vacant bench and enjoy the luxury of simply sitting watching Parisians, and some visitors enjoying the simple life. Also, at the moment there is an interesting display of photographs showing the Tour de France throughout the ages, some dating years ago. The variety of subjects show not only the challenges faced by the riders but fascinationg glimpses of French life in the villages throughout France. The photos are displayed on the railings that surround the Luxembourg gardens and cannot be missed, nor should they be.
Wonderful stroll. We had a wonderful stroll through the gardens and especially enjoyed watching Parisians in their daily lives.

A garden for all ages. If you are in the area and have an hour or so to spare, have a walk around these very well maintained gardens.If you have children, not only can they run around - but there is a good adventure playground, pony rides, a children's theatre and a pond where they can hire toy yachts.All of this in a beatifully manicured park overlooked by the very grand Luembourg palace.
the heart of Paris. Loved the Louvre, the ceilings the sculptures and of course the unmissable Mona Lisa. Avoid the huge crowds by going in the week.
Nice gardens. Lovely gardens but not too many flowers in bloom. Loads of seats too. Area very clean. Loads of lovely trees and a beautiful fountain. Worth a visit

Beautiful relaxing garden. Take the time for a stroll in the Luxembourg gardens. Watch the water show, just walk thru the alleys, looking at kids playing and people walking hand in hand. Very nice and large garden to get some oxygen in Paris.

Peaceful Ambience. Luxembourg Garden is spread across a nice big piece of land, its lush green with an artificial pond with ducks in them. Good benches, where you can rest and spend some quality time with your loved ones. You would be accompanied by joggers, toddlers in prams, old couples taking a walk. Birds chirping.. Over all an awsome place to spend some time for solace.

A Sunday Stroll. I'd rate this a five if there were more flowers. It's expansive and beautiful. The flower beds are artfully designed and wonderfully color coordinated, situated mainly around the palace. great place for a leisurely stroll.

A chance to see Parisians at play. The park discourages (forbids) use of the grassy lawns, so comfortable chairs are provided gratis throughout this huge garden. How classy is that! Small children float their model boats on the pond, lovers kiss away, older folk stroll and enjoy the outdoors.

Only when the weather is nice. We went to Jardins du Luxembourg in spring but it was an exeptional cold and grey day. Our son wanted to play in de playgarden (2,5 euros to play there!) and we sat down on the grey/green chairs and enjoyed watching him having fun.It is a beautiful place but please go when the sun is out, it so much better. We had coffee and hot chocolate in the cafetaria near the playground, wich was very expensive (we payed 15 euros for 1 coffee, 1 hot chocolate and 1 applejuice).

Eden in the city. It is the green heart of the 6th arrondissement with its beautiful chestnut trees, the expanse of lawns and the beautiful tulips everywhere in springtime. This year they are in the reds, pinks and orange colors......last year it was yellows. It is a pleasure to walk through this garden early or late

A highlight of our trip to Paris. What a treasure! We visited the Luxembourg Gardens in Springtime and the blossom was beautiful. Loved all the statues and plane trees and we have a beautiful photo of our kids swinging in the playground surrounded by blossom. Memories of trying all the different flavoured macaroons from the vendors alongside a ham and cheese baguette while warming ourselves in the sunshine. Just beautiful and a must see in Paris.

PARIS DOES THIS SO WELL. For a city that is so vast and built up, you are never far away from an open space. Luxembourg Gardens are a large and beautifully manicured public space. Clean and no inhibitions. Enter at the North end and escape the hustle bustle of tourist Paris. Exit at the Fountain of the Observatory and you discover the relative calm of the Montparnasse district.
Great walk!. We walked to palace and gardens and the flowers were amazing even in April. Had hot chocolate at Angelina's which was great.

Get your nature fix here. If you like flowers, trees, lawns, a good-sized water pond, and sky, come to the Luxembourg Gardens behind the buildings that house the French Senate. The gardeners keep this place up to royal standards, with extravagant, interesting plantings, groupings of annuals in varying ranges of colors, all quite "correct" in the French style. Check out what looks like an apple "library" at the opposite end of the Gardens (from the Senate part). It features an amazing variety of small apple trees, all espaliered to a fare-thee-well, and labeled to boot. You are not supposed to walk on the grass, but there are wide paths all over the place where you can walk or run with what sometimes seems like all of Paris. Even when the Gardens are crowded with sun-seekers the atmosphere is cheerful and people are careful not to run you over as they jog by. There are benches and chairs for your use; take a little time to sit and just enjoy the beauty. And if you want you can rent miniature sailboats from a kiosk next to the pond and have fun sailing them with others, both kids and adults.

A lovely walk. We lucked out and walked to the Garden on a warm, sunny day. The cafe there is decent but the service is impossibly slow. The line just to get a bottle of water took 20 minutes. But the gardens are gorgeous and well worth a visit.

A good way to spend a sunny summer day. The gardens are large and one can see people relaxing and having a great time in the gardens - enjoying the summer..
There is also a children's play area with sandpites, slides, swings etc which is quite nice..

Great place to relax. This is one of the last places we visited in Paris, after visiting all the other major attractions. It was a perfect end to our trip relaxing in the gardens watching kids sailing boats representing their country's flags. It was very sunny and hot in May and I wish I had taken a hat to sit there longer and enjoy. Pantheon was a walking distance from here.
Just beautiful!. Well worth a visit, check it out on your way from The Catacombs to the Sorbonne and Pantheon. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the view!
Plain but impressive!. The length of the garden in the city is impressive. the colors of the small flowers give a harmonized view and calm. take few minutes to relax and enjoy.
Walking to the Eiffel Tower. Beautiful and full of weekenders jogging, taking photos, or strolling. Perfect photo opportunity. A relaxing stop on our long walk to the Eiffel Tower.

Stunning. On a nice day this is one of the best parts in Paris to just hang out. The Palace is beautiful, and the gardens are simply stunning. Have an ice cream, take off your socks and just walk in the grass.

Magnificent grounds. We traveled in April so the flowers were not as abundant as I expect they are in season. However, this is a beautiful park in which you can retreat from all of the other activities you have undertaken. There is a replica of the statue of liberty and some gorgeous open spaces. We didn't do the art gallery but simply strolled with friends to enjoy the surroundings.

Relaxing Park to lay around. Slow down your paris visit with a leisurly early morning walk and watch parisians at play. Kids floating boats on the water, tennis, walkers, beautiful landscaped areas and honestly few tourists on the days that we strolled through. Parisians enjoying a leisurely pace.

beuatiful in the summer. I was there in the Parisian Summer, good place to be with family or friends or your second half. I don't know if you can compare it to Central park in NYC, but it is always nice to enjoy the Greenery in the center of a big city.

Love These Gardens. Being that I always stay in the Latin Quarter or St Germain these gardens are my choice for a morning walk.Big open spaces,fountains, cafes and a palace in the background. At some times of the year I have seen children having pony rides. Very cute!!

A HIGHLIGHT OF A VISIT TO PARIS. Vjisiting the Luxembourg Gardens is a must when visiting Paris. We enjoy walking and looking at the gorgeous flower displays as well as just sitting on a bench and resting in the sun. It's a very special park and the Luxembourg Art Gallery is a treasure that usually has exceptional exhibits that are truly worth seeiing.

A nice relaxing time at the Gardens. This was very nice to visit. The flowers were all in bloom. There are chairs so you can sit in the sun and relax with you lunch. There is a small pond where children were playing with their boats. It was a nice break from the constant running around we did sightseeing.

Great place to wander. This is a beautiful spot with so many different leisure activities going on . Felt a bit idle to be strolling rather than jogging! You'd need to struggle not to find it really relaxing, especially when it's warm and sunny.

Amazing. I was really impressed with this area, well worth visiting, very popular when the Sun is out. Great sail boat pond for the children, Picnics, Chairs were freely available to sit on, Beautiful area
Just a park in early spring. We were too early to see the gardens, rainy cool weather made that cafe hit the spot. Marvelous grounds and buildings, good for a stroll if you are in the neighborhood

Stroll through Luxembourg Gardens. Lovely park, plenty seats and benches for sitting watching the world go by. Kids play area, pony rides for the smaller ones. Baisc cafe but prices ok and hot dogs enormous. Toilet facilities for 50 c. Great place to relax on a sunny day

Great Place For A Stroll. Looking for an escape from the pomp and circumstance of Paris? This could be the place for you. With a range of activities on site to appeal to youngsters and their parents alike, plenty of room to stroll, or run around, and the majesty that is French court gardening at its best, this is a place you could lose yourself happily for a couple of hours. We went in early Spring so missed the best of the gardens, but still enjoyed a pleasant stroll, and if you are into more active pursuits there are tennis courts as well.

Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful gardens and a wonderful place for everybody to meet, relax and have such a good time together. A great place to go alone to with a book too. In front of the Palais is a boating pond where small boys sail their yachts. There is an apiary, lovely flowers and many lovely spots.

Luxembourg Gardens - what a way to relax. A wonderful way to enjoy a cool Saturday afternoon basking in the glow of these magnificent gardens amongst so many visitors and locals alike. The only downside was the fact the fountains were not operating - but springtime here is so great.

Perfect. Although it was windy and chilly when we went, it was just brilliant. We had a baguette with salami, cheese, and butter with us and sat at a bench in the view of the Eiffel Tower and chatted, ate our food, and enjoyed the scene in front of us. A quintessential Parisian moment. Pigeons and all.
BIG. Large collection of incredible art but difficult to enjoy because of noisy and obnoxious tourists who seem to have no idea why there are there and what they are looking at.

Worth a stroll in the park!. Luxembourg Gardens is a beautiful location to take a morning stroll or jog and many chairs placed throughout the park to sit and relax in the afternoon. This location offers many wonderful areas to walk and enjoy the flowers and statues. There are tennis courts and a large playground area as well as other special event areas that offer happenings throughout the week.

Jardin de Luxengourg Paris. We actually visited in Dec. 2010Very largevery pleasant to walk in during spring.Can be rather hot in summerNice for a visit as a coupleFull of flowers in springIn a very nice area, Rive Gauch, St Jermain de Prais
Beautiful!. Gorgeous gardens spread throughout. What a serene environment with beautiful statues, water features, etc.

Perfect for a relaxing afternoon!. We grabbed some chocolates from a store down the street, headed to the Gardens, found a couple of chairs and ate our treats while people-watching and enjoying the beautiful weather. The Gardens are clean and well kept and there are photo ops everywhere. I wish I'd had more time to spend there! A perfect afternoon!

beautiful gardens. You have to go through security to enter the park but the officers are very nice. The park is so beautiful. There was a band playing the day we were there. Definitely worth visiting.

A nice reprieve... I missed out on a visit here last time I was in Paris so thought I had to put it on my to do list this time around. I could have missed it and not missed much. In saying that, we went on a warm day and after walking for hours it was a nice reprieve and great place to lay on the grass watching the throngs of people roam through. If you have children, it is a great place to visit OR if you just want to sit and eat or while away an hour or 2 with your lover then it is a great place.
Can't Beat it on a Spring day. To get the feel of a Parisian afternoon like a local go hang out in this wonderful park. The light, the people watching are not to be missed.

beautiful - but they close early!. We walked by right at sundown and the guards don't mess around - they were blowing whistles and ushering people out immediately. I Really wish we'd gotten there earlier to hang out. By far the nicest green space we saw in all of Paris (aside from Versailles!)

Splendid gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are a fine example of French landscaping philosophy, which emphasizes that man control nature. The gardens are therefore neatly trimmed and organized in unnatural order. The result is a beautiful park which serves as a garden for the French Senate that is located on the grounds as well. Throughout the gardens will find many sculptures, such as the famous "Fountain of Observatory", and the Medici Fountain which is absolutely amazing. This is a good place to rest your feet before continuing on your next destination in Paris. Allocate about an hour to visit the park.
Nice place to rest. We've been walking around very long, Jardin du Luxembourg was a perfect play to have a break. Don't forget to take some lunch with you.

Vast gardens speckled with statues. The trees were not in bloom, nor were the flowers when I visited in March, but I can only imagine how beautiful and calming it must be later in the spring and in summer.

Lovely Sunday in the Park. Went to the park on Sunday and it looked like all Paris was there. Flowers and trees weren't yet in bloom, but the grassy areas were perfect. Children were playing with small sailboats in the water. Couples and families were spread out all over the grass with their picnic lunches and getting a tan. Very peaceful visit. Quite a few kissing couples throughout the park.

Our granddaughter's favorite place in Paris!. My husband and I love Jardin du Luxembourg, and our 6 year old granddaughter loved it as well. We took her to the Marionette show in the afternoon, which she enjoyed, even though she didn't understand a word. After the Marionette show, we took her to the playground, which she loved! So much so, that we took her back again. The playground is wonderful, and for adults, it's great to have those soft tiles that cushion a child's fall, as they're also good on our aging joints. Her favorite activity was sort of a Tarazan swing, with a weight on the bottom that went around a track. She must have ridden on that 4 or 5 times! She also enjoyed the rope Eiffel Tower, even though I would not let her climb to the top, as it's pretty high -- she got half way up. There was also a play gym with slides and a pole and tunnels to crawl through. We stopped at every playground our walks took us by, but this one remained her favorite. So glad that we were staying in Saint Sulpice, as it was a short walk to Jardin du Luxembourg.Sandy
What a place!!!. Beautiful architecture, park and gardens. Late Spring will be best time!!! all sorts of people strolling and sunning.. Really amazing!
Beautiful spot and the sun was out!. A beautiful spot to visit on the 1 and only day we had sun in Paris! Pleanty of places to sit and watch people walk by.

Lovely respite from the city. Unbelievable place! Something for everyone! I ate in the restaurant outside, sat in the sun and watched children play, lovers stroll, dogs run.....! Wonderful, just take a moment and enjoy it! You won't be sorry!

Beautiful public park in Paris. I love the Luxembourg gardens. The best time to visit is in late spring and autumn. It is quite crowded in the summer months. Take a stroll, sit and look onto the pond, view the flowers and chestnut trees and enjoy a refreshment at the small cafe inside the gardens.

Beautiful place.. It was a lovely sunny Sunday afternoon when we walked through these gardens, it was lovely watching all the families playing games with their children and there were people strolling and others playing chess, a hive of activity.

A relaxing walk in the park. The Luxembourg Gardens wasn't far from where we were staying so me and my boyfriend decided to check it out. It was a nice walk with nice views and sculptures. Fairly big, tidy and quiet.

Beautiful. My gf and I accidentally walked by these beautiful gardens and decided to walk through it and enjoy some nature in this big and busy city. The gardens are quite large and very well maintained and enjoyed also by locals who sit on the many benches that this park is rich of and who, while enjoying sunshine, read a book, newspaper or just relax. The French way of life is really visible here. We were here in winter and I can imagine that in summer when the sun is high in the sky this park is a small place of heaven in a beautiful, but large and busy cityDefinitely recommendable if you have the time in Paris

Beautifull gardens in central Paris. This is a great getaway in the center of Paris. Visit the Gardens on a sunny day and join hundreds on Parisians looking for that extra bit of sun. Good for a short jog or a brief stroll.

Lots to do and see!. This is more than your average park. I went here with my partner and just wandered around and had a great time.i can see the advantage for people with children (pony rides,playgrounds etc) but there's also cute little stalls with coffee and creeps and the like plus a number of beautiful statues and just a,axing scenery. Very different totherest of paris, glad we visited.

Nice to visit. Stayed in hotel next to this park. It would be stunning in the summer and well worth a visit. The palace is very pretty and at the moment, there is a 100 years of Tour de France in pictures. All around the gardens. Worth seeing.
Beautiful. Runners paradise. Parisians seem to all go here to exercise. You need to keep out of their way.. Lovely to see children sailing boats on the pond. Beautiful gardens and waterfalls.

calm park in the bustling city. My favorite park in Paris. This place is perfect for a calm stroll or a pause in front of the basin where there are many chairs. There are cafes nearby as well as trolley carts of crepe makers in the afternoon.
A Grand view of Paris. These gardens are huge and filled with people on warm sunny days. Very relaxing with exceedingly scenic views of Paris

My favourite place in Paris. These Gardens never fail to raise my spirits. I love watching people of all ages enjoy their visit to the park. There is always something to watch. The hut serving Nutella crepes is also a delight particularly when the weather is cold and grey.

My Secret Garden. Summer, fall, winter, spring Luxembourg Gardens are serene and a must see in the 6th arrondissement. The pond with the ducks is a fabulous spot for a cup of tea or a baguette. If you make arrangements with your State Senator ahead of time, they do offer a tour of the Senate (the building on the grounds) but it must be arranged ahead of time. I'd love to see the inside!

One of the few fantastic freebies in France. I love the ponds and fountains and the trails with historical statues and sculptures. You can lie on the grass but be aware they rotate which section you can sit on so some days what was allowed is not "interdite" or forbidden. Lots of little food stands, benches to hide away in the shade or sun. People watching galore. Do be careful of pickpockets. This is truly such a nice break from the constant press of people on the streets and metro. Get outdoors and enjoy this rich green space
Beautiful extensive park. We went here in the evening and it was a lovely park, found the fountain in the middle and lots of chairs to chill out.

Jardins de Luxembourg. Not a garden as we English know it! But it was a freezing April day with spring as yet unsprung! The café is tiny but sweet, and the sheer size of the imposing Luxembourg Palace makes it worth a visit.

nice gardens. Nice big garden for lovely walks during the sunset. There is a big pond in the middle with lots of chairs to sit around it. We went at the beginning of April, and not all the flowers had blossomed or grown at all so it was mainly just patches of mud and compost in areas. The areas where they had planted new flowers looked amazing though.

Big and relaxing. It's very big. We visited just the beginning when the sun was up and it was nice seeing so many locals coming out to relax.Wish we'd visited later in Spring, I'm sure the place would be blooming and beautiful

A romantic park in Paris. If you want to rest, read a book hug your girfriend or take your children to look at small ships on a tiny lake, the Gradens of Luxembourg is the place to go in the center of Paris. In any season this garden is wondefull and offers to all, yougsters and olders a place to meditate, read or play. Unavoidable during each visit in PAris

An active park with some hidden treats. Make this a transition space if you're moving from Montparnasse to the Latin Quarter. Watch for special events that may happen from time to time and go round the corners to see little protected and very quiet spaces

Do not miss Chagall's exhibition in the Luxembourg Museum. The gardens are so beautiful as it is lovely to see the couples sitting having some bread with cheese and wine, and the pond with the sailing boats controlled by their owners...But the peak of our visit to the gardens was Chagall's exhibition Between War and Peace in the museum. It is a gem that was worth our stay in Paris. Try to book in advance for the lines are long (sometimes more than an hour). The museum is small and is packed. So really important to make reservations.Is a must to see...

Great Place .. We visited the Montparnasse Tower so was in the area and having seen it from the 56th Floor decided to give it a visit . We had our 8 year old boy with us and he loved it . A great Playground , pony rides , little go carts and the best value of all was the little wooden toy sailing boats that you can hire for 3 Euros for 30 mins .. he had great fun running around the pond pushing it back out and watching the wind take it to the other side !
Not Spring yet. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful but in the Winter it's a little dreary. I have been there in season and it's beautiful.
visit the luxembourg gardens. Incredible space and gardens. Nice to sit and relax and be away from the city within the city. Beautiful. Every thing is around the luxembourg gardens.

Favourite park. This park is always romantic and peaceful and lovely, set in one of my favourite areas of Paris
Spring time is always the best time to visit, or else it can be really cold, have a walk to visit the Senat, and then the Musee de Luxembourg
Beautiful gardens. Typical relaxed Parisan gardens to stroll around. Includes Boules, childrens' playground, café and Musée du Luxembourg....and of course people watching.
Peaceful Gardens. Enjoyed seeing the original model of the Statue of Liberty. The gardens are very well kept and beautiful.
Nice park to sit and relax. Even it was a spring wit -1C, it was still a really nice place to sit and relax for half an our between visiting other attractions. Highly recommended.

Beautiful place to relax and people watch!. Wandering around the Luxembourg Gardens is great. Walk around and enjoy the greenery. Stroll over to the water fountain and watch the mini sail-boats. After a long day or in the middle of the day this is a great place to relax, watch people and soak in the Parisian Life.

Have kids? Then go.. My boys loved the playground there. Can't remember the cost, but it was worth it. It was so much fun watching them make rules to made-up games when none of the kids shared a language.
much promise. Very nicely laid out, expansive area! Very cold currently, so not much growing or in bloom. A few beds with sparse flowers. I'm sure it is lovely in the spring!
Nice place to walk and take the sun. The gardens are well laid out and attractive. Lots of people there, but not at all crowded. Convenient to St. Germain des Pres and to Montparnasse.
Worth the Walk. Well planned and clean. I had foreign park envy walking through and admiring the overall aestectics.
Beautiful area, but don't bother off season.. The grounds are very beautiful however wait until everything is in bloom to go - mid May and later. During the winter months there is not a lot to see!

Lovely place for a stroll. Very clean walk ways, not to over crowded. Nothing about this place to dislike. There is plenty for the whole family to do, or you could just sit in one of the many chairs and watch the world go by.

Best place in Paris for kids. We spent a month in Paris with 2, 4 and 6-year-olds. We wound up at Luxembourg Gardens many times, and all 3 kids labeled it one of their favorite things in Paris. Between the amazing playground (well worth the Euro or two it costs to get in), the boat rentals and the pony rides, they were always entertained. The crepe stands were an added bonus. We went to a lot of amusement parks, playgrounds and parks, and this (and the Eiffel Towel park/playgrounds) were the only ones that we visited multiple times, at the request of the kids of course. The adults labeling the park "nothing memorable" obviously didn't visit with kids.

Very pretty garden. We visited Luxembourg Gardens in May after it was raining in the morning. The ground was a bit wet with some puddles. It was sunny in the afternoon and there were lots of people (but not crowded). There are chairs you can sit on to relax, read a book or just sit to enjoy the scenary. Great opportunity for lots of photos!
For warm weather - to spend an hour to relax. The beautiful place for the spring-autumn period. Take a break in you day time tourist walk to relax there. I remember my first wisit to there for years.
Pretty spot and a lovely stroll. We wandered through the gardens and enjoyed a relaxing afternoon there. Very pretty spot. The cafe is a nice place to relax and people watch

Nothing memorable. On a cold day in early April, there really wasn't a lot to write home about. It was basically an open space full of empty flower beds and stark-looking trees. I suppose there was a certain beauty in it but I'm sure summer is the time to take a stroll here.

Great chill out park.. If you have a nice sunny day then go and have a nice stroll around the gardens. One word of warning, if it's windy I would beware because there is a lot of gravel blowing clouds of dust all over as there is very little grass. Sit down at the cafe or have a picnic and enjoy people watching. You can watch kids on donkey rides, playing with boats, joggers, table tennis, tai chi etc but watch out for dog poo as your walking around. A nice way to chill out and spend a relaxing couple of hours.
Pleasant. Agreeable spot to sit and have a beer or coffee, like most of the gardens in Paris it has gravel paths so probably give it a miss if you want your shoes to stay shiny.

A relaxing oasis in the middle of Paris. The Gardens are close to other Paris sites such as the Sorbonne and the Pantheon. A welcome stop for relaxation and rest in a beautiful setting that includes the Luxembourg Palace. It is also a short walk to the classic St. Sulpice Church and Plaza.
A lovely place to walk in the spring. I was in Paris during an unseasonably cold March, but the Gardens were still welcoming and tres parisien. A great place to wander on a cloudy morning.

roaming the gardens. We went in March and did not expect the flowers to be in bloom. Therefore the gardens were not nearly as lovely as I expect they may be in the warmth of Spring/Summer. There are so many other things to see and do in Paris, that I would put this low on the list of must sees. Unless, of course, you have plenty of time to sit, enjoy a picnic and people watch. We were on a time restraint so it really turned out to be a dash through 'jaunt'...
It's still cold so very few flowers in bloom...but a great place to visit. Go in late Spring or Summer to view the Gardens!! Winter is not the best time :-); great place to people watch!
Nice. Nice, but it's still a garden....not as much grass either. We went in Spring and it was freezing so in Summer I would imagine it would be a lot nicer to relax in.
The best of Paris. One of my favorite places in Paris. A great spot for a picnic, or just to relax for a bit. Would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris.

Beautiful. Such a wonderful stroll in the gardens of Luxembourg. Great people watching, everyone from kids hanging out between classes to old people walking around so many languages spoken . . . Also the "menage" is wonderful, with the added fun of collecting rings at each turn. The play area is also very nice, though not well supervised.The little boats that the kids push around in the water area in the middle of the jardin is quite fun too watch or play, though only the small kids really enjoy it.SAme comments, you can visist with small children, teens, adults . . .No fees to walk around or watch the occasional shows, but fees for kids play area, boat play and manage.
a must visit in Paris. brilliant! though hoped to have been there on a little more warmer weather. will leave it for next summer

Beautiful location to wander and watch the world. Enjoyed a couple of hours in the spring sunshine walking through the gardens, watching the little boats on the boating lake, dodging the joggers and horse riders and soaking up the atmostphere.Grabbed a picnic, sat on one of the benches and blended in with the locals.This is a lovely location and well worth a visit.

A nice change from the crowded city. On a nice day, it's nice to wonder in the gardens, see the kids sailing boats over the pool, look at all the statues, and maybe have a small picnic or buy a crepe in one of thr stands in the garden.

Beautiful gardens. Visited this week as the weather was glorious and we had done all the normal sights. Lovely gardens but the surface on the paths was a creamy gravel that caused lots of dust when the wind blew so beware. Otherwise, a lovely place to relax.

Walk in a beautiful park. If you have 2-3 hrs and want to see a beautiful garden in Paris you can walk from the Notre Dam Cathedral about 20 min and you will enjoy a scenery, flowers, Palace, people get together for exercises, there is no entrance fee

One basketball hoop in a gorgeous setting!. Visited in March 2013 with my sons 10 and 12 and thanks to a prior review here we packed a basketball and brought it with us to the Luxembourg gardens. I remembered coming here for a pony ride when I was 7--and was delighted to see they still have them. My boys are too big for pony rides--but just right for basketball. We arrived at lunchtime and a friendly group of 15 year old parisian boys approached my sons and politely asked if they would like to play a game. My husband and I sat in the classic green chairs and read for a couple of hours while our boys blissfully played basketball. The one and only hoop is right next to the puppet theater and a really cool playground.Little girls in school uniform were dancing around a maypole in the background. Felt like we were in a painting. It was a highlight of the trip for all of us. Also accidentally 'found' Gertrude Stein's house on the Rue de Fleurus on the way there.

Relaxing promenade. This place is very relaxing. I do recommend that you visit it when it's warm outside. I have been here several times and you can really enjoy your walk if it's hot outside. Try to walk the entire park it's full of surprises and the details are amazing.

Amazing beautiful. This is one of the most amazing beautiful sites of Paris. This is one of my most favorite places to visit in Paris. You can spend hours walking and sitting and enjoying the scenery. Not to be missed.

Sailboats for little kids!!. I would give this an excellent but it was chilly when we went and not a whole lot to do but still very good! The cutest thing was the middle pond had tiny sailboats to rent and the little kids were driving them around the pond. So fun!! Pretty garden to walk around.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit - these gardens are beautiful. IWe visited in March, but I would imagine in the middle of Summer they would be outstanding.

Favorite spot in Paris!. This is a place to really soak in the Parisian atmosphere, surrounded by couples holding hands, moms (and nannies) pushing strollers, joggers, families, tourists and "flaneurs" alike. There aren't too many places on earth better for people watching or just plain chilling out with a book.For families with children, the Jardin du Luxembourg offers distractions aplenty, from pony and donkey rides to Punch and Judy shows, a mini zip line to propelling boats in the large fountain pond in front of the Palais (now home of the French Senate). The beautiful gardens offer inspiration to aspiring green thumbs, and peaceful oases of calm in a big city. Chairs for lounging are everywhere; pick up a sandwich or pastry at a local boulangerie, put your feet up, and enjoy! (For those who miss their takeaway coffee, there is a Starbucks at the Odeon metro stop a short 10-minute stroll from here...so worth it for Americans missing that large coffee to-go).The southeast corner of the Luxembourg Gardens is pet friendly for leashed dogs, and, if your dog is small enough to be carried or put in a carry bag, you can take him/her anywhere in the gardens without hassle. In warm weather, there is often music in the park (we heard an excellent American HS band do a concert here last July). There is also a nice casual restaurant for outdoor dining (good salads).Don't miss: the mini Statue of Liberty; the tree planted as a memorial to those who died on 9-11; the gardens and apiary on the south end of the park; just sitting in the sun (or shade!) and soaking up the atmosphere. This is a beautiful, beautiful public space.
Relaxing venue. Even though we were out of season and it was very cold these were well worth the effort to visit and really peaceful in a noisy city.
Good place to relax. Nice place to spend a couple of hours on a pleasant evening.We just spent some time watching children having fun and strolled around the garden for a leisurely walk.

Lovely park for some time out and people watching !. Beautiful park in the centre of the city. Lots of little seats to share a picnic and watch Parisians do their thing. Go to soak up some rays and just enjoy this beautiful garden.

Do all the gardens. These are the best in Paris but Iit is best to devote the better part of an entire day. Go to the very end and visit the fountains of the four parts of the world. Then see the apple garden of the queen, the Statue of Liberty as Bartholdi lived next to the gardens. O not miss the Luxembourg museum and the the central gardens a la francaise!

What a pleasure. The service is slow, but polite, and the food is what it is . . .in a park. BUT, the atmosphere is so divine it doesn't matter. If you can't be happy having afternoon ice cream or a late afternoon cocktail in these gardens in Paris, you can't be happy anywhere.

The perfect place to wander. Full of greenery and statues, with so many seats that even on the busiest days you can always find somewhere to sit down. Search for your favourite monument, watch the fiercely fought boules contests, or simply wander and enjoy the beauty of the place - the choice is yours!
Quiet and peaceful. The Luxembourg Gardens were very nice and relaxing but not very exciting and we found that there was little to do there.
Early March, not green yet. Looks like they were doing a lot of work on the fountains. Just strolled around, but could have skipped.

A huge Garden in the heart of Paris. The garden was well laid and huge and in several parts with statues all over the place. There is a small lake at the centre. It has the original Statue of Liberty in the garden a huge copy of which was made and gifted by France to USA. When we went to the garden it was unusually cold there with temperature of 1 deg C and windy. We could not stay there long to enjoy it. They have a pony ride and toy boat sailing in e lake. It's a common place for Parisian to come for a jog, walk, play tennis, excercise.

Beautiful gardens. Those were my favourite gardens in Paris for years. Now my passion moved to the rive droite. But nevermind, they are still beautiful. If it's your first time in Paris, don't miss Jardin du Luxembourg.

Beautiful place of calm. Beautiful formal gardens with statues and art exhibits. Seats are provided so you can "people watch" whilst drinking coffee and eating baguettes. Always worthwhile a visit here although it can be very busy.

Pay to play? Totally worth it!. Yes, you have to pay for your kids to get into the playground section, but as you'll quickly see, it's well worth it. This is the most fun and best maintained playground ever. It costs just over 2 euros per kid, and the hand stamp lasts all day, so you can leave for lunch/picnic and come back, etc. There's fun for little kids and big kids(zip lines!).You can pay a reduced price to go in as an adult, but really - why? -- just take a seat in the ubiquitous green park chairs and sip a coffee while your kids have the time of their lives. There's rubber surfacing and excellent maintenance, and only one exit, so all's well.The entire park is beautiful really. It's one of the prettiest public gardens in the city -- beautifully sculpted fruit garden, pretty statues, soft mossy grass, and bright flower beds, all fenced in neatly. Spending an afternoon here is a must while in Paris.
Too much dirt. Many of the gardens in Paris have a white dirt packed hard for sidewalks, etc. not much green space. Me shoes and pants are filthy after walking through!
Ah the gardens!. What a wonderful place to sip French coffee and walk and view the beautiful gardens! A great way to relax in Paris!

Take a stroll through Luxembourg Gardens. Park is full of beautiful statues, has a palace in it, and boosts an art exhibit along the fence line. Must be spectacle to visit in the spring time when everything is green!
always a pleasure. to walk through, take pictures, sit and watch the people enjoying the same loveliness. beautiful in all weather. the cafe is an additional way to sit outside.

Watch your pockets!!!. It may have been the weather but the gardens felt bare and unloved. In addition it is packed full of people trying to hustle you. Steer clear of anyone coming up to you as they will try and get your camera / wallet / anything they can. You can get some nice shots (that everyone else will have posted on Facebook) of the tower but other than this scant photo opportunity use only as a cut through if you need to access the tower from the south side.
magnificent. it is like Paris living room... beautiful :) lots of people, lots of flowers.... pure relax... everyone could find place for himself there

Oasis. An oasis of calm in a bustling city. Take a sandwich and sit where you like in one of the chairs they provide for free. You can't sit on the walls of the Palace, however, although we were moved on very politely by the Gendarme.
Beautiful. beautiful place, came here after a lunch and chilling under the sun is amazing. it is near the Latin quarter and University of Sorbonne, walking distance to luxembourg garden
Perfect for running. Very nice place to walk with children or for running in the morning. Don't miss the park if you are in Quartier Latin.
Beautiful. We spent the morning walking around st. Germaine and stopped at a fresh pasta place to have a picnic in the gardens. The weather was nice and it was a very relaxing picnic.

Best place in Paris. The gardens are truly the best place in Paris to stroll, sit, watch people, and just relax after a busy day. Parisians love the outdoors and the sun and there are many benches and chairs available.

lovely gardens in the centre of paris. just next to the Pantheon, Luxembourg gardens still have something from the Pars of Renaissance.
Recommended 100%
Jammed on a Sunday. I guess like most museums on a rainy Sunday there was a 2 plus hour wait to get into the Matisse show...we passed on the wait
Take a walk in the park….rest into paris.... charming charming charming…after 30 years to paris this is the first time here …what a master piece..take time to smell the flowers...

not what I expected but still. I have read so much about it that I expected much more.. of course cold weather in march so no flowers, no warm but one thing's for sure... a lovely place if you want to feel at ease, with a sense of freedom when in the city. Try it and let me know...

Relaxing and fun people watching. Luxembourg Gardens is a must visit in Paris! The grounds are very large and there is much to see. It was so nice to sit on a bench in the shade and just people watch. Lots of kids playing in the sand boxes and lots of elderly playing chess or cards. The best place to enjoy here though is the large fountain area where people rent the boats with different countries. Great feel of the culture of Paris. Lots of good photo opportunities and time to enjoy the sun and relax.

A Parisian haven. What is not to love about the Luco? Its a wonderful place for a stroll any time of the year. When spring arrives; the sun is out, the flowers are blooming, the children are playing, the runners are jogging, the chess players thinking about their game tactic. Its blissful. The summer involves a lot of tanning and lounging (and tennis playing!) for those in Paris. Its just the perfect place to be.

A beautiful memory. I have been going to this park, since I am 5, now 52. My grand peer would take me there to sail the boats, and go to the Guignol Puppet show. It is beautiful, with beautiful; statues, fountains, and history. Take the 85 bus to the end. its right there!

Nice Gardens!. I was only there for a short visit because they close at around 17:15 - 17:30.. so that is the reason why it is not excellent. On the other hand it is a nice garden with some tennis courts! fun visit

Even in the rain....... Even in the rain on a cold March day, Luxembourg Gardens is the place to go to escape the noise and pollution of Paris's traffic on the surrounding Boulevards.This is where you find the Parisiens taking a break from work or the normal hustle and bustle of Parisienne life.Situated in one of the grander areas of Paris, this is the place to be, and be seen!Lots of things to watch.. people, joggers, lake, fountain, sports tracks, tennis and even in the rain ...picnics.I have also been here in the summer.. sunbathing on the terraces!

Wonderful. A real pleasure and joy to walk around. The old nursery area has an exquisite display of different fruit tree training, and the children's play area is huge and well designed. A total antidote from the narrow streets and crowded boulevards. Watch out for runners.
Must visit especially with kids.. Take some breads and feed the birds! My energetic kids love running around there. We took em twice in a row.

Beautiful!. The Luxembourg Gardens are really something to see! Our hotel was right down the street from here and it is the perfect spot to take a picnic, relax and people watch, or get some exercise and go for a walk or run. The grounds are beautiful and there are many places to sit in the sun or shade. Even with a lot of people there, you can find a quiet spot to relax.

Lovely garden escape. Very lovely area to walk around and was a quiet place to be in a busy city - lots of chairs and places to people watch. Tennis courts and running tracks. Was very safe with police walking around and people were well dressed and well mannered all in all a lovely place for a good wander.
Gorgeous. A wonderful way to spend an afternoon people watching, or to simply take a break in the middle of a busy 'all day museum session'. Grab a crep, a cafe noir, and just enjoy.
Don't miss this beautiful park.. Just fabulous even in winter on a cold day. There are many interesting exhibits in the park. The park is located on the Boulvevard St Michele

Stay Away its not very good.. What a sensational place, I hope no one ever finds out about it. The beautiful lake, the sunlit gardens, the massive water feature (fountain). The Palace, the horses, the wine and the bread and cheese bought locally and consumed sitting in the sunshine in this stunning place.... Stay away everyone its mine!

Lovely every time of the year. Especially on Sunday afternoons (Sunny ones in Winter) when families, friends and all come for a stroll, to sail a boat on the pond, run around or just read a book in one of the chairs.

Beautiful park. A very beautiful place during all seasons! Very big park with fontains, small corners and large ways - you could find anything you prefer. There are many sportsmen and tourists, but noone disturbs you.

The best spot for a quiet stop in Paris. Every season is different at the Gardens and every time of the day attracts a different crowd. Wonderful place for photos, people watching, kids playing and to have a noon/afternoon snack. Bring a sandwich and a blanket and take a nap. I am sure it will become one of your favorite Paris stops

I FORGOT HOW LOVELY THIS IS. A peaceful oasis in the midst of a lot of hussle and bussle. Much larger than it first appears. People from New york will be shocked to see metal chairs all over that have not been bolted down!

lovely place. Excellent place to relax in the sun with a cup of coffee and enjoy the atmosphere.
look for the basketball court ' you can play with the locales
Luxembourg Gardens. A very relaxing place. I liked the chairs arround the small lake where you can sit and relaxe. Very peacefull.

Nice Place. The garden was very nice.Though we went there in february,so there was not much flowers.
