There is a metro station just next to the garden.

An oasis in bustling Paris. Although we visited in Winter this vast garden was delightful. Its winding paths by-pass statues, monuments, childrens' playgrounds, tennis courts , manicured lawns and fountains. An ideal cost free retreat for the weary traveller
beautiful place to stroll and picnic.. Full of local people but plenty of space if you want peace. Lots of seats. A good break from the noise of Paris.
Feel like a Parisian in the gardens. The gardens are dotted with incredible statuary , benches, fountains and beautiful plantings. A great place to soak in Paris!

Pleasant park!. Watch out the temporary exhibitions at the "Musée du Luxembourg". I was very pleased to find a recently opened on Chagall: small but great!! It was worth one hour and a half of waiting outside in quite a cold morning.........
Place to relax. Bring your blanket, bottle of wine, crunchy baguette, cheese and enjoy the atmosphere of one usual day in Paris...

A nice place for a stroll and a coffee. The park has a nice feel about it with a good mix of tourists and locals going about their lives - running, lunching, playing, etc.The gardens are all well maintained, I'd recommend getting a coffee to take away from one of the shops surrounding the park then take a stroll over to the fountains, sit on the wall or a bench for a while and people watch. Good time, great memories.

Great spot to take a break. We went here on our second day when we were still fighting a bit of jet lag. It was great. We grabbed a couple of the reclining chairs (I want these!) and took a nap. The gardens were full of families eating lunch and playing games. A walk, a nap and a picnic here are a good way to ease into your vacation.
beautiful. lovely place must do for everyone. failies with little kids will definitely enjoy since its a great place to have lunch or sit and look around

Hard to believe it is the 3rd best thing to do in Paris?. I was a bit underwhelmed with this given it seems to appear as one of the top things to do in Paris. We went for a long walk to get there and pretty much walked through it and out. I'm not doubting it would be a very nice place in summer but in early March it was bare and lacking in something. There was a museum there but a sign said there was a 2 hour queue, so we didn't bother. If you like gardens with well manicured lines of trees and a large pond then this might be the place, otherwise it may be like many other gardens and not really the 3rd best thing to do in Paris?
Great place to take in the sun!. This is a great park to see and be seen. Get there early to snag some free chairs and take in the gardens! Also a short walk to St Sulpice Church to the north!
jardin de luxembourg. If you like a spacoius walk in the Latin quarter, sailing old fashioned boats, and an impressive palace, you will love this.
An oasis of peace. A lovely green space in a very busy area. The gardens are beautifully landscaped and well maintained

A glorious place!. We spent several hours of a beautiful day wandering these gardens. The grounds are lovely, sprinkled with statues, some a bit whimsical. It was easy to find a bench to watch other visitors from runners to families with kids to other tourists. At lunch time, we ventured just outside of the gardens to quiet streets with restaurants. We opted for lunch from a bakery--a simple sandwich on the always outstanding baguette, some fruit, a beverage, and a pastry--which we took back into the gardens.
quiet and very nice. the gardens are looking very good and especially the quiet from the city. it was very cold but many peolpe came to run and ship their small ships in the lake at the center.
Large gardens popular with families. Lovely walk on a Sunday morning lots of activities, groups doing every kind of exercise imaginable and a lovely lake for miniature sailing boats.
A quiet place in Paris. Beautiful park in the center of Paris. Buy a baguette, a bottle of local wine and stroll the gorgeous gardens there.
Perfect place to take a break. For sure favourite place in Paris. Full of life, but not too crowded. Take a chair and have a break. Don't miss Medici Fountain!

Very pleasant. If you need to get yourself away from (the rest of) all the tourists, take a stroll through the park. Well kept. No dog poop, and nobody will run you over on their bike. (no bikes allowed)

Wonderful stroll through gardens of Palace. This garden is part of Luxembourg Palace which is where the seat of the senate sits. The gardens are huge and very well kept. There is a cafe within the grounds. Very relaxing stroll away from crowds

children's play. The Jardins de Luxembourg are a great place to be. It is Paris in optima forma: the buildings, the grandeur, the people. And, when you have young children, you can let them play in a gate playground with a lot of great stuff. Have a book, sit on a bench, watch them and relax.
Full of charm. Go on a Sunday morning when the park is full of Parisians doing tai-chi, playing tennis, and sailing toy boats in the ornamental pond - charm personified.

Don't miss this park. Beautiful park. If you are travelling with children, you must go here. Great playgrounds and places for kids to run around. Couple of teams were playing boules. Toy size sailboats to rent and sail in the large pond by the palace. Tennis courts. Even an aviary. Lots of chairs so it's a wonderful places to sit and read, have lunch, or just people watch. Of course, the gardens are not blooming in March, but it was still a lovely place to walk.

Enchanting. Beautiful in every possible way. Lovely to see French families enjoying the extensive facilities in these gardens - puppet shows, donkey rides, basketball courts, numerous tennis courts, adventure playground, remote controlled boats to hire etc, etc. The palace is awesome and the two chalets serve excellent food; service is excellent, too.

Best in Summer, visited in Winter!. In summer I imagine this is a magical place to visit. Supposedly filled with lovers and families and old gentlemen playing chess, the atmosphere in this picturesque garden in the sun must be lovely. There are lots of varied and interesting sculptures around, probably the most famous of these is the small version of the statue of liberty, located in the west of the garden. There are also tennis courts, and a truly huge children's adventure playground that there is a fare for. We jumped the fence and were told off by park guards. Worth a visit if it's sunny and you're in the Latin quarter.
fun and pretty. Whole family loved this. Run around, playground is fab - don't skip this.Whole family loved this. Run around, playground is fab - don't skip this.
A place to walk. It is a beautiful place to walk or just sit around and do nothing, read, eat or just look around and see how life in Paris is.

A cold day in February probably not the best time to visit. The large pond in the middle of the park is attractive and the statuary is interesting but there did not seem to be much in the way of flowerbeds. A couple of coffee kiosks and some tennis courts and tables with chess boards . The huge Palais de Luxembourg which is impressive is along one edge of the park. Pleasant enough to walk through en route to somewhere but as a destination probably not.

Good for a quick visit. First of all, this review is based on my visit during a dreary winter day. The gardens were ok but nothing spectacular. I think that it might have been a different experience in the spring or summer. This is a free attraction with no line (there was a queue to get into the palace) and I think it's worthwhile visiting if you're in the area. Considering the many other attractions in Paris, I would not make a special trip to see this.

A must for your visit to Paris. I love this park. It was probably one of the first ones we visited after moving to Paris two years ago. There are many chairs available and on warm days it great just to relax, read a book and watch the world go by. Even though it's very popular it still has a great feel to it. On Sunday mornings there are often model yaughts sailing in the pond. The backdrop of the Palace is the perfect setting.

Wonderful and less expensive place, where you can see Paris in a nuts shell.. Lovely cafe in Jardin de Luxembourg. Enjoy a salat or light lunch, a glas of Wine or a cup of coffee, while the parisians are pasning by.

Walk in and around. If you pass by, walk in the Luxembourg. You will see the French way of life. Many locals living around come and spend some time in the garden. Children are running, people are kissing, reading, jogging... It is the typical French garden. Don't miss the Photography expositions around the Garden, on the external part of it.

Sit, rela. Sit, relax, people watch, play tennis, play chess, watch people play chess. A beautiful spacious park. Plenty of chairs and places to sit. Beautiful fountains and sculptures. Don't forget to bring your book and lose track of time!

Beautiful. I could have sat in the sun in this beautiful garden all day. My boyfriend and I had a sort of picnic lunch here, and even in winter it was lovely - flowers and green grass. The pigeon situation is a bit much, but that sort of thing doesn't bother me.
Beautiful!. Lovely surroundings and some fantastic sculptures which just pop out at every turn! We had a great walk, if a little cold!
Little New York. Walked miles but finally found the Statue of Liberty in its own garden in this wonderful park. Bet it's beautiful in the summer.

Wish we had visited in Spring. We unfortunately visited the park in February when it was snowing and 30 degrees F. No greenery in sight, so it looked somewhat bleak. We got the sense from how the park was laid out that it would definitely look beautiful in spring, though. It's bigger than we expected it to be, and the Luxembourg Palace adjacent to the garden looks very beautiful. As others have said, lots of exercisers in the park. People with their dogs go there too, so watch out for their "droppings" and be aware that some dogs are let off the leash...There are seats around the fountain, and it seems clear that on warmer days this is a nice place for a picnic and to relax.
A must see destination for a sunny day. On a 50F February afternoon we had a wonderful time sunning in the Luxembourg Gardens and observing locals, tourists, families and Paris life.
Meet the Parisians where Parisians come.. A great place where Parisians come together to enjoy the sun, a game of chess or just page and look at people in a good atmosfærre.
Normal gardens. We had a big walk to get here, it's a beautiful building and the gardens normal, it deserves the walk for the building, as Tulleries garden is more beautiful.

Nice walk. Very huge and scenic park with a nice fountain in the middle. I enjoyed walking, although the weather was too cold. The only negative about it is that it closes early, at around 5pm.
Would love to hang out more often at this place when it gets warmer!
A beautiful park. A large and varied park with a small orchard, an ornamental pond, wide avenues, a palace, bee hives,...
nice walk. Suprised how big these were. everyone doing there morning exercise at times we felt in the way of the runners.

Beautiful for walking or running. This park is has a lot of greenery, a giant fountain, and many statues. There is even a mini Statue of Liberty! While there are bathrooms, they are not open early in the morning. It is great for a casual walk or a run with local Parisians who do numerous laps. I liked it better than Tuilleries garden as there are more trees, tennis courts, and privacy.
Wonderful Place. Huge place with lots of families and joggers. Be sure to check out the big pool in the middle where people sail miniature sail boats. One of the nicest parks we have seen.

Great park for a visit. Nice big park with beautiful gardens and buildings. Negative was that you couldn't sit on the grass. Not far from the hotels of Montparnasse or St Germain and close to many restaurants.

ideal for relaxing. the palace Louxembourg and very huge park in hearth of Paris... In the park you can find the real palms, beautiful fountains and you can use very special chairs (the chair for one person only), you lay down on the grass and listen to music, drink some wine and have very nice time ....and relax of course
Family fun. My 8 year old son loved exploring and playing here. It was beautiful and conveniently located. The flowers and plants were stunning.
Amazing gardens!. Just perfect for a nice morning walk, a stop for a crèpe and coffee and just enjoying the scene. Don't miss this, it's very nice!

Beautiful Gardens. We arrived to Luxembourg gardens by walking, after visiting Notre Dame. It was a nice sunny day, and the garden was full of people (mostly students) who were relaxing at the grass.There was a public bathroom, I think you had to pay 50 cents of euro to use it, but was not crowded at all, and clean.There are plenty of benches and of course you have an area to sit at the grass, have a picnic, and enjoy the marvellous view!

A Walk in the Park. What a great place to take a walk! For those with children, this is the place to let them run it out with plenty of places for you to relax while they do so. Two things I would recommend while in the park would be 1) See one of the three original Statues of Liberty made by Bartholdi in the West side of the park and 2) Go to the little cafe East of the fountain and enjoying a buttery croissant while you people watch.

So civilised....... This is the place to go to relax. Plenty of space for everyone, plenty of seats, cafes, attractions for all ages (puppet show, fountains, play areas, go karts in the summer) - a brilliant place for a lazy picnic

Prefect place for a picnic. This is such a lovely place when the sun is out and you have time to kill. Take a picnic and enjoy it by the lakes. There have plenty of seat for everyone. Prefect for people watching.
Sunday afternoon. A lovely stroll in the park, watching the world go by. It was lovely to see so many people smiling and having a relaxing time.
So pretty!. Must stop in for a photo opportunity! Not many people know about the gardens so it's pretty isolated in September, but still beautiful nonetheless!
been to better gardens. went here in feb 2013 so i surpose not the best time to go round the gardens,but think this place is more for joggers and young families

So much to see in the Jardin du Luxembourg. This park is a major destination for tourists and locals alike. The statuary is worth a stroll around the 55 acre park: watch for the original model of the Statue of Liberty, and the amazing Medici fountain. There's plenty for children to do, including an exciting play ground (w/ small entrance fee), puppet shows in the summer and model boat rentals around the main fountain. Sporting facilities for adults also exist, though they're used mainly by locals who play tennis or the local favorite, pétanque. Probably the nicest thing to do is grab one of the hundreds of chairs, move it into the sun (or shade), and let the hustle of Paris drift away while relaxing in your favorite manner.
Specially in the morning.. We were there while waiting for the Pantheon to open, a great place to take photos and take a walk.Look at the trees and sculptures.

when you need a break and a place to slow down and smell the flowers. Grab something to eat and go sit and watch the Paris people walk on by. It's bigger than you think and more to it that meets the eye.
Perfect for Picnic Lunch. A nice place to take some fresh bread and cheese. There are lots of benches and chairs that make it comfortable to sit and enjoy the open atmosphere of the gardens.

Kids Fave Paris Spot. The kids absolutely loved the Luxembourg Gardens, it was cold so now flowers but the playground was more than enough entertainment! Its a beautiful place to stroll and there are bathrooms near and in the playground. There is a amall fee for the playground but totally worth it!

Great place for a picnic!. Contrary to popular belief, there are three Statues of Liberty: one in NYC, one on La Seine river next to the Eiffel Tower, and the third one is in the Luxembourg Garden. Take a couple of hours from your sightseeing to enjoy a picnic under the shade next to the Statue. Metro station Luxembourg. Lots of little food stands to get a bite to eat.TIP: BEWARE OF HOT DOGS. Hot dogs in Paris (including the ones sold in the Gardens) are very different from the ones sold in the US. Put it this way, many of my friends claimed that the hot dogs did not agree with their stomachs...

Cold winters day but still an awesome outing. We visited on a cold February afternoon and despite the temperature the gardens still revealed unique, winter beauty. Would be a lovely place to take a good book and lunch or coffee and rest in the sun.
An oasis in Paris. A pleasureable stroll through the gardens and St Germaine de Pres - cafes nearby atmospheric too. A great lens on Parisian life

stunning tropical gardens in the middle of the city. You might think that this isn't neccessary to visit in Paris when there is so much more to see but trust me, you won't be disappointed. Truly beautiful and very quiet - an oasis in the middle of the city. Grab some lunch and sit here for an hour to recharge during your sightseeing.

Luxembourg Gardens, great fountains. Luxembourg Gardens was within walking distance from our hotel, so we walked by it or through it almost daily. It is a very large place with lots of runner utilzing it. The fountains are very nice. There are lots of spots to sit & enjoy the scenery. Some lovely big trees.

Lovely, even on a dreary winters day. A perfect place to wander peacefully even in winter it is serene. The gardens are magical as is the stunning architecture of the Palace. It was the perfect way to spend an afternoon after being indoors at the museums.
The place for a stroll. Enjoyable for a walk even in winter with a dusting of snow but better in other seasons. The small Musee de Luxembourg often has excellent exhibitions.

Great place to relax. Paris is a romantic spot and these gardens are one of the most romantic places in the city, reccommend an after-lunchtime visit to relax after a big feed, well, that's what we did and it was a most agreeable way to digest lunch

Great Public Gardens. This was a really nice set of Gardens with a lovely fountain and buildings. We went in Feb so it was cold and a bit dingy but still really pretty. I would come back here for a picnic and some Tennis in the summer if I came back.
FYI: They also have working toilets but its 50cents to use

Take time for a quiet stroll. The Jardin du Luxembourg is one of my favorite places in Paris. I have been fortunate to stay within walking distance of this amazing park. It's the perfect place for a morning jog (there are people who really do jog there! Not sure how many are locals compared to visitors, though) or just a pleasant stroll. I love visiting the gardens in the morning because it's so peaceful. There's a wonderful little cafe near the puppet theatre appropriately called La Buvette des Marionettes where you can sit and enjoy a cafe and croissant. Many lovely vignettes of public art, landscaping, and statuary await as you wander through the gardens (but be sure to stay on the paths as walking/sitting on the grass is frowned upon). My favorite spot is the Fontaine Medicis, which backs up to the rue de Medicis. Or you can pull up a chair and relax near the grand basin where ducks will approach you for treats. It's the perfect place to spend a morning or afternoon reading or writing.
Lovely place!. We traveled here in August 2009. Gorgeous place! People brought a bottle of wine and their lunch, sitting in the park relaxing :) Very good experience :-)

Keep calm and smell the flowers. For me this is the centre of Paris. Whenever I'm in Paris I walk through it to get to the noisy 5th Arrondissemnt to eat, or shop or just visit leaving the less busy 6th where I stay behind for the day. It has seats where you can sit and read or just sit, a cafe and snack bar for emergencies, children on donkeys, tennis courts and the most beautiful flowerbeds you'll ever see running through the middle of the formal garden. From March to October they provide a display of colour and lightness framed by the Palais de Luxembourg, which you will find nowhere else. In the summer too there are frequently concerts and impromptu entertainments usually near the Boulevard St Michel entrance. Not to be missed on any trip.

A lovely open space. With lots of beautiful gardens and a large fountain, this is a great spot to sit and relax. I been through the park in all seasons and it's charm transforms with each. In winter it's a quiet spot. In summer, the fountain and the people are wonderful to watch. In the Spring the gardens are blooming and in the fall, the leaves are dropping and crunching underfoot.

Lovely place to walk .. This park in Paris is vast with lovely stops and the perfect way to spend a few hours. There is plenty to see including fountains , carousels, Carts with soups and Cafe au Lait.
Outdoors. Lots of seating great cafe, good signage and maps. Good access points to different bus routes from all aspects of the park. A very useful landmark.
Park n town. Large open space in middle of town was pleasant even in cold February. Would be lovely to picnic in when weather more pleasant.
Charming. Very well kept and beautiful garden, you can find some privacy if that's what you want. And let's not forget the Medici fountain, that was the main reason I wanteed to go there.

January 2013. What an amazing garden, and we were there in the dead of winter. I would love to go back and see it in full bloom. Just the maintenance during the winter showed us that the gardens must be amazing in the warmer months. It was a great place to take a long stroll, people watch and check out the amazing trees. Would have loved to play chess at the tables set up there and watch the kids play in the large sandboxes. Didn't find the Bocce courts but did see the Tennis courts. One of my favorite places that we visited.
A magical place!. Definitely a must on any visitor's list! It is unlike any other garden in Paris - the grotto is particularly magical and transports you back to the time of the Bourgeoisie!
Beautiful and relaxing. Very beautiful, I spent my last day in Paris strolling through the gardens and sitting on the beautiful little green chairs. Go it's worth it you won't be disappointed.

Stunning. What a beautiful place to while away a day, morning or afternoon. The plants are beautiful, there are many benches to enjoy the sunshine and the sailboat racing on a Sunday morning is gorgeous to watch. A real taste of Parisian life as the locals enjoy it. Lucky them!

Starting the day like a Parisian. Starting the day taking a walk or jog through the garden is a program typically parisiense. You will see children on school outings, residents doing their jogging all or enjoying the tennis courts and fitness equipment in the park. Lawns are great for a pinic and is located near Saint Germain and Quarteir latin for the next day's program.

Should picnic here in the summer.. We visited Paris in the Autumn season so it was a bit chilly, but Luxembourg Gardens is free and as close to Parisian life as you can witness in an afternoon. Lots of young locals come here with their blankets, picnic lunches and guitars. Parents bring their children to sail their toy boats in the fountain. Elderly couples bask in the sun with a book while lounging on lawn chairs provided for public use. The pathways are a bit dusty (gravel/sand paths) but the pretty roses, statues and music make you forget about the dirt. We wish to visit again in the summer time.
nice strolls and statuary. Nice to have shady place in unseasonably humid May Paris to stroll by tennis courts, by toy boat sailers in pool, and by lots of impressive statuary.

Nice for a walk and little relaxation. This is one of the big, beautiful gardens Paris has. It is well-kept, tidy and spread on a large, versatile area. You have rows of trees on the other side, and huge playgrounds for children. The center greenery is large and has chairs around it. The other side of the park has ponds and fountains with even more chairs to relax on. This is a very good spot for people-watching if you're into such. You can see joggers, office people of a lunch break, families playing with their children.
Snow covered wonderland. Cool park to stroll through and check out when heading towards another cultural site. Great photo ops!
Very enjoyable and relaxing. The place is amazing with a great greenery right at the middle of a bustling city like Paris. Buy some baguette and wine and enjoy a perfect day in the gardens.
Great space in Paris. Great to see such a large area of greenery/parkland in such a large city. Nice place to relax and watch Paris go by while enjoying the scenery.

The Gardens are a nice diversion from the Tourist Track. The gardens are fantastic and it is a great place to sit, relax, and watch people and small wildlife in the heart of the city. We really enjoyed watching the children sailing the little boats across the fountain pool; very unusual to see children having fun without batteries...It is difficult to appreciate the amount of work that goes into the maintenance of a garden this size, there are thousands of varieties flowers planted among hundreds of various species of trees and other vegetation all manicured to perfection.

Perfect summer day. Grab some baguette, cheese, and wine and go for a picnic in the gardens. You can walk forever and just enjoy the scenery or have a cheap lunch. A great romantic date or a way to spend the day outside with friends instead of cooped up in a museum

Magnificent gardens. This is a great place to just sit and watch the Parisians enjoy their lunch break in the beautiful flower clad gardens. Seats are scattered throughout the colorful garden areas and people come and go enjoying the ambiance. Beautiful sculptures and fountains are found along little pathways. Very picturesque - well worth a visit.

A taste of the local community. Went here on Xmas day since it was so close to our hotel. The park was very busy with the locals soaking up the minimal winter sun in the chairs that are randomly placed throughout.
Immaculate. I loved the fountains, and sculptures and the manicured lawns and seating areas ..just right for a rest on a busy sightseeing day.
nice and sunny. the relaxing people in the sun, the open french girls when taking photos of them, dislike: the closing hour related to sunset
Great to have some rest. Its a great place to have some rest after a full day walking in Paris. The only thing that its not so good is that it close at 4 p.m. Maybe it could be open till 9 p.m.

So Parisian. A snowy Sunday morning. The Gardens were full of families out for their Sunday outing before lunch. Bells ringing, children running and laughing, dogs playing in the snow. It was such a lovely experience!

Great spot to stop and relax. We bought baguettes and sat in the gardens to relax after a full morning of walking and sight-seeing. It was nice to have a break in the winter sun - there were lots of locals out jogging. I can imagine these gardens are simply stunning in spring/summer but they were very nice in winter too!
Lovely but no flowers in winter. Beautiful but no flowers in winter. Large garden in the middle of the city with a large palace and lake.
Perfect oasis in Paris. What is there is say -- the Luxembourg Gardens are a delight -- even in the chilly days of late autumn!
Beautiful place to explore. One of a good place to stroll around, beautiful and sure you will have a good time here : ) I was here in different time and season and its always beautiful
Refreshing on a warm day. The Gardens are a pleasing expanse with lots of shade on a hot day and a great place to watch the world go by.
Splendid. We spent one day afternoon in d Luxembourg gardens, it was a pleasant experience. We had taken a walking tour of Paris and got some good info about the history of this garden

Amazing gardens. These gardens were awesome, large open space, well keep grounds. Places to sit and people watch, chairs provided outdoors around grounds. A beautiful park setting in a huge city. Highly worth the visit. Great place to spend hours relaxing, reading or just watching the world go by.

Very French. There is much more gravel than the British or German equivalent. The trees are wonderful in the autumn standing in geometric ranks. Look for the model of the Statue of Liberty on the rue Guynemer side. the second on is on th banks of the Seine.

Thumbs up for museum open on New Year's Day. Lovely formal gardens full of joggers, families and tourists, very well located if staying at Montparnasse. A lovely place to enjoy the sun against the house in a deck-chair. Although we did not go into the museum, it was one of the few we found open on New Year's day and we spent a pleasant hour strolling around the gardens and meandering onwards then in the direction of The Sorbonne. It must be beautiful in the summer but bring 50 c for use of the bathrooms!
The most beautiful garned in the world. ... and nothing mush more to add. Just go and visit and you will see it yourself. Take a picnic basket, a good wine and spend sme time to watch teh beautiness.
Very nice. Very nice place to relax and have a break from sightseeing. Although it was drizzling we had a very good time there, they have this nice chairs that you can loll on.

Such a delight, don't miss Marie's tranquil fountain.. In 1611, Marie de Medicis, the widow of Henry IV and the regent for the King Louis XIII decided to build a palace in imitation of the Pitti Palace in her native Florence. She purchased the hotel du Luxembourg (today the Petit-Luxembourg palace) and began construction of the new palace. She commissioned Salomon de Brosse to build the palace and a fountain, which still exists. In 1612 she planted 2,000 elm trees, and directed a series of gardeners, most notably Tommaso Francini, to build a park in the style she had known as a child in Florence.[2] Francini planned two terraces with balustrades and parterres laid out along the axis of the chateau, aligned around a circular basin. He also built the Medici Fountain to the east of the palace as a nympheum, an artificial grotto and fountain, without its present pond and statuary. The main palace is now the seat for the French Senate. Take time to watch the children with their remote control sailboats in the pond.

My favorite park in Paris. My boyfriend and I had a picnic here for lunch one day while we were in Paris. Stroll around and sit on a bench for people watching. I love this park so much and it was a really lovely time.

A must on the Left Bank. We have always been to Paris over Christmas and it was too cold to enjoy the gardens. This time wet were there in October and had a great sunny day in the 60's. The gardens are a wonderful place to stroll and relax in the sun relax while people watching. I can only imagine how beautiful this is in the spring and summer when everything is blooming.

Cannot wait to go back. I just love this place! It is so beautifully kept and so loved by the locals. Pick up a panini from a local vendor and find a bench in the gardens to enjoy it. Or, go for a jog, play a game of tennis or just walk the grounds and take in the views, the sounds and the simple beauty..

One of my favourite spots in Paris. Husband and I first walked through the Gardens on our way to the Louvre as our hotel was nearby. In the morning during off-peak hours, it is just absolutely beautiful and serene. When we returned sometime in the afternoon, everyone was out on the chairs lounging and enjoying the sun. The Gardens had a completely different atmosphere at this point, still very breathtaking and beautiful despite the overwhelming amount of people. If we were in Paris for a longer period of time, would have definitely taken the time to grab a lunch and sit here for a while.
Pretty in Winter. Very closely situated to our hotel so we took a walk here and a photo stop. This park must be spectacular during the summer as it is still beautiful in the winter

Perfect for a Picnic. This is a beautiful park to stroll, eat, relax or play in. Perfect for a Paris picnic - bring a bottle of wine, bread, cheese and fruit and enjoy the gardens like a true Parisienne.

What a place!. Luxembourg gardens are lovely, relaxing place, especially when you are visiting in summer. It is a perfect hide-away from burning sun. Have a picnic, bring a book and relax like locals do. Also, great spot for morning jogging.

Quiet haven in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens in Paris are a lovely oasis away from the noisy bustle of the city. You will see lots of Parisians there escaping, having lunch and picnics and you will/ may find the original model for the Statue of Liberty if you search closely!!!

BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!. Luxembourg Gardens is BEAUTIFUL!!!! It's wonderful to stroll through or to sit and relax and enjoy the ambiance. There are paths meandering throughout, with benches and chairs everywhere. You can move a chair to any location where you'd like to sit. You'll see local Parisians sitting and relaxing and reading and sunning. It a wonderful way to spend some time relaxing and perhaps contemplating the days of Hemingway and Fitzgerald and all the other expatriates of the 1920's. I don't think the gardens have changed all that much since their time.

The gardens to have a wonderful and relaxing time. This is the aprk anybody would like to have clse to his home. Ther is plenty of space; gardens very well manged and astonishingly clean. In summer you can see bumble bees quietly getting nectar from the rainbow of flowers present all around. dont miss the rose garden. Well equipped also for jogging and other open air sports

Beautiful & Peaceful. This is the perfect place to go if you want to escape the chaos of Paris! The grounds are huge and there is a lovely fountain outside the main building to sit by. Also lots of ducks and little birds to feed!!
Fun play ground for children. In one corner of the park is a play ground with a small entrance fee. Great to visit this green and beautiful lung with two small children.
Nice Walk. The gardens are lovely, but in January a bit bear, I would imagine they are stunning later in the year!

A winter stroll through the Gardens. Well, we actually did not have much time so all we did was take a stroll on our way back from the Pantheon, in winter the gardens are rather bare so we will have to go back in late spring.
The best place to chill out on a Sunday. When you just want to go to a park and read a book, drink a bit of wine have a sandwich....watch the birds and people... very relaxing

Relax. A perfect place to relax and sit after a long walk. Perfect for a baguette and a drink, sitting in the sun with your feet up on one of the chairs. Walk all the way through to the far end and stop for lunch or dinner at Closserie d'Lilas its soooo delish !!
Beautiful spot to relax. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the day. There are plenty of chairs around for you to relax and enjoy the view and mingle with locals
Beautiful quiet park. A short walk from our hotel revealed this gem. Large city park oasis. Cafes surround. Great, extensive walk. Palace is great.
Lovely. We loved to sit on the grass and have a glass of wine, lovely place for a picnic. Was very busy on Sunday. Definately will be back
Nice to take a walk. it is a nice place to relax, very beatiful gardens. There is a palace with very interesting architecture

Picnic perfect. After long flights from the US and arriving in the early hours to Paris we dropped off our bags and headed here. We sat in the park talked about our long journey and took the beauty of the park in. What a peaceful place.

lovely gardens, great sculptures. I live in New York City and really am not that impressed by statues. I've seen plenty of them. For some reason, this place is different. There is so much history here and so much culture represented in these sculptures that I couldn't help but take notice. The palace and grounds are also amazing.Perhaps one of the nicest experiences I had while in Paris.
Manicured Garden. Lovely garden in the middle of a big metropolitan. Saw many people walking and sitting on the grass to enjoy some down time.
Gorgeous!. Was here in October, it was just stunning! Definitely a great place to visit, sit and relax. Maybe read a book for a little bit or just take in the scenery.
lovely. Nice spot for picnic. Get cheese, bread and wine nearby and enjoy the people watching. There was a band playing when we were visiting.

Be a parisian for an hour. Forget shopping! Real Parisians walk, sail little boats on the pond ... and just enjoy the park. The fountain commissioned by the grieving Marie de Medici is wonderful, as is the Luxembourg Palace itself.
Ok. We went in December so everything looked dead and dried. Very impressive statues. Noticed a lot of graffiti in the area.
Much less crowded than Tuileries. If you feel like going off the beaten path a bit, or are simply a fan of formal gardens, this is not one to be missed.

Beautiful. This is a fantastic garden and a must see in Paris. I went here with my wife and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Very serene, lively, colorful gardens. It is a great place for a picnic or for reading a book. Highly recommend.

Pretty and large place. Luckily the sun came out once we arrived here, so I was able to take some good photos. Doesn't beat the Versailles garden, but it was still really nice with their ducks and sculptures.
Beautiful open garden. Beautiful garden, with lots of statues and sitting areas. Also the location of one of the statue of liberty statues.

Beautiful experience in spring!. This is quintessential Paris. We visited in the spring and the gardens were in full bloom. There are also chairs around the fountain for visitors to use (free). A must see in Paris!
Kid Friendly. Beautiful park with lots of great play areas. Very clean. People were helpful and friendly. We felt very safe with our kids.

quiet respite in the centre of a bustling city. We enjoyed a lovely walk through the gardens with our teens in the morning before beginning our day of sightseeing. We saw some lovely architectural elements, local Parisiens jogging and practicing tai chi. in the center is a beautiful pond where people sail small model boats. A short walk to the Notre Dame from the gardens.
Nice place. It is large, full of people yet not really crowded, various, great location. Nice place for all people of all ages.

Well worth a visit even in Winter. Lovely park, so nice to see the locals and their children enjoying the space. We enjoyed watching the men play a game of Boule and seeing the children squealing with delight on the merry-go-round. I imagine the trees and flowers in spring would be gorgeous.
beautiful park and atmosphere. Not as much grass area as shown on the map but a great place to spend some time relaxing with family and loved ones
Lovely!!!. Must see site!!!! Really beautiful place, with a romantic air... take a time to site and appreciate the garden!
Just enjoy. The small fountain in the middle just makes for a meeting point. Try to go through all the statues and enjoy the amazing place

Beautiful!. Having been to Paris several times; I have never visited these gardens until this trip; I can't believe I never went there in the past; this is a beautiful garden and well worth seeing; even in winter without blooming flowers it is a lovely place to take a stroll.

A serene spot to visit often while in Paris. The Luxembourg gardens are magical. From visiting the wonderful l'Orangerie musee, walking the pathways, reading and relaxing in a green chair and just exploring all there is to see in this wonderful corner of Paris, the gardens offer something for all your senses. And if it is summer and you're in need of some humor, watch the tourists spreading out their blankets for a picnic on the grass only to be thrown off by the park 'police.' The confused expressions of those who don't understand why they are NOT to picnic on the grass but in the chairs or benches on the paths is worth a good giggle. You can eat, drink wine and be merry but DO NOT try and stretch out on the grass!

Park of Parks. located in the Latin Quarter on the left bank of Paris, this garden is home to pristine flower beds, fantastically manicured gardens, a pond where kids race miniature battery operated boats, and beautiful busts of famous French writers.
Relaxing. Perfect to enjoy a sunny cold morning eating nuts and just relaxing. The like pond has play boast perfect for families with kids.
Utter Bliss!. Love to relax here on a sunny day. Better yet in the early evening, maybe right before dinner in a nearby restaurant when no one is around!

really nice. Walk around.. see the fountainLearn a little about the gardens before you go,There is a little museum tucked away here really nice and you miss the crowds from the big museums. Have a hot chocolate from Angelina... like drinking fudge!
Best playground ever. Our kids could stay at the playground at the Luxembourg gardens for hours and hours. Open 10-4 (in winter at least) and charges a small fee but well worth it.

Grab a bottle, baguette and some fromage. So much to do and see. Pony rides, ice cream, little electric boat races, amazing floral fauna. I recommend it on a lazy sunny day with a picnic basket and make sure you leave your watch at home.

Hidden treasure!!. Stunning!! The Luxembourg Gardens are off the beaten path and were near our hotel in the Montparnasse area. We had time to kill before a train and ate lunch here on a sunny day. The gardens are stunning with the Palais de Luxembourg as a backdrop. Sit in the shade of the trees near the entrance or sit in the sun near the fountain and palm trees. Even the Eiffel Tower can be seen from here. Wish we would have found it earlier - would have gone every day for breakfast!!

Truly a must see, evening walk or morning run!. We visited the gardens one evening and were delighted to find a wonderful outdoor café where we had ice cream and wine. Also. great to join the groups running in the mornings. Lovely!

Gorgeous, romantic, unique. Those gardens are a must see for anyone visiting Paris. it is also a great place for flirting in spring summer. Don't miss the small cafes in the garden, reasonnable prices for unique settings.
Lovely space, not so much to see in December. Welcome relief to enjoy the landscape and greenery after walking the streets. Obviously not so much to see in December.

Spend a couple of hours relaxing. This is the Parisian equivalent to Central Park in New York - a calming oasis in the centre of the city.We spent a couple of hours just wandering through the park and relaxing with a coffee, as we read a book.The gardens themselves are beautifully well maintained. There is also plenty to do:Tennis CourtsChildren's play areaFountainWatch old men play BoulesTake a seat and watch the world go by

Gorgeous in both winter and summer. Visited the gardens in both seasons and it was equally beautiful !Easily accessible via the metro with plenty of restaurants and bars around it. We bought lunch from a cafe nearby and ate it in the gardens. Absolutely gorgeous.

Beautiful!. Visited here in September. Autumn colours were amazing. It is a lovely place with loads to do - just walk around and you will see experience what you imagine French life to be - old men playing chess, boules, people painting on canvas by the fountain. Lovely atmosphere. There is a play park for children (you pay to go in this bit) but well worth it to sit and relax and watch your children play on good quality equipment. We could learn a few things from the French about parks!

Do not miss this!. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful, well-tended gardens in the midst of a busy city. What I enjoyed the most was people watching: the men playing bouche (sp?), the children launching their toy boats in the enormous fountain, in the middle of the Gardens. Just a gorgeous place to sit, relax, and take in some French culture!

Even in November, the Gardens have a certain charm. Les Jardins du Luxembourg is a great place for a stroll, regardless of the weather or season. The light, the interplay of the crowds/visitors and architecture, and the calm of the gardens make it an ideal place to launch a visit to Paris. Don't limit your visits there to a sunny day--there is something to be seen when skies are overcast and the wind a bit chillier.

Kid-friendly place to people watch or relax. The Luxembourg gardens is sort of like the Tuileries for locals. There is a large circular fountain in the middle where children feed ducks or play with little sailboats, surrounded by chairs where you can kick back and enjoy a good book, catch some sun, or people watch. There are also various sporting courts for basketball and tennis and lots of benches, trees, and open grass for those who prefer a more private spot to reflect. The surroundings are dotted with sculptures, fountains, and gorgeous architecture, making it a very picturesque park, and there is a dog-friendly section (though the majority of the park is no dogs allowed).It's a great spot for people watching on a sunny day or taking time to relax after a particularly long lunch in Saint Germain. Do be aware that the guards come through with whistles at sunset to kick everyone out.

An experience - but a bit of a disappointment. Somehow, after walking all the way from the Arc d'Triumphe along the Champs d'Lessay to here was a let down. Yet considering that this exists within the city of Paris is pretty special
A nice stroll. Although on the chilly side, a stroll thru the park was a nice respite from the masses: if in the area certainly worth a stop. And they have toillettes, .10 EU.
So close to hotel, don't miss it if you have time. Beautiful gardens and once again a chance to visit an historical site. Great photo opportunities and a chance to sit on a bench and people watch.

Lovely gardens for a wander. Visited the gardens on a sunny winter day. The gardens are spacious and beautiful even in winter. Apparently the queen who designed them never got to live there so instead Parisians and tourists have this opportunity to enjoy them. I can imagine in summer they would be a hive of activity for the locals. The locals play chess and boules there so it is a great place to see the locals having fun outdoors.

A great place to relax in the sun. I was there in the winter, but the gardens still had a lot of sunshine. They have a lot of chair and benches around, so it was a great place to just sit and relax for a little bit in between all the bustle of Paris.
Relaxing. A very relaxing and lovely place to see on a sunny day, always busy but doesnt seem so due to the size.

A lovely stop on a sunny day. Paris's gardens are one of the best part of the city, and the Luxembourg Gardens are certainly a treat. Wide gardens, and a small pond provide pleasant seating and views. Paris's ubiquitous metal park chairs are available in abundance. Being removed from the center of town, they are not quite as busy as the Tuilleries and being small means that you do not run into the free lance sex workers you occasionally see in the Bois de Bologne. As an added bonus its just a short walk to Saint Sulpice and only a little farther to Saint Germain de Pres
Favorite place to sit & relax in Paris. Free live music! Great crepes! Gorgeous sites! Great people watching. Sit here for a long, long time.
awesome statues & gardens. in the centre of Paris & on a convenient bus route plus 2 blocks from the Patheon and Latin Quarter. Great for a liesurely lunch beside the large relecting pool.

Take time to take a stroll. We went twice during our 3 week stay in September. A profusion of flowers bloomed, the exhibit hall on flora and fauna was free, and the large fountain where ducks and geese congregate were lovely. This is a great place to take a baguette, beverage, and/or pastry to relax and revitalize. Plenty of site seeing.

Clean, relaxing gardens. Nice, well preserved gardens. A good idea for cleaning your head after a Paris stroll.The gardens are very well maintained, with playgrounds for children, McDonald's nearby and lots of chairs to just sit down and relax.

Lovely. I visited on a busy Sunday and the place was teeming with tourists, Parisians and little children playing with boats in the pond. It felt like going back 100 years to the time of the Impressionists. One of my favourite afternoons of the trip.

Luxembourg Garden. Serene and Peaceful. This park is full of great path ways relaxing places to sit in which you can admire the scenery theres a great duck pond which people sail their toy boats enjoy the day chat and even paint Its a great place to people watch It took us a while to find The Medici Fountain but we finnaly found it Chairs are provided there and its very relaxed. There are many statues at the gardens. Way too many to see in half an hour but if you just stroll along you will be able to enjoy more of it. The Eiffel Tower is even visible from the park. Something that was a little annoying was the fact that It was prohibited to sit or stand on the grass. Also the park officers weren't too kind when trying to get everybody out of the park when closing. Beware of the Whistles.
Great place to spend a quiet day. The gardens are beautiful and very peaceful. It is a great place to wander among nature in Paris and just sit and relax and contemplate.

My favorite place to draw and run in Paris. Great running trails, gardens of flowers and statues, and vast space to draw or read or write or think... to me, this is one of the most inspiring places in all of Paris (and the world.) I am particlary taken by the fontaine de medici. (See attached photo.)

Beautiful walk for a Sunday Morning. Lots of joggers around the park. It was freezing cold so we did not see many boats in the water fountains, but we had some sun so it was still an enjoyable sight. We walked around the park. It is very well cured and still a great place to experience the Parisian way of life.

Beautiful Gardens. We stumbled upon this when we were delayed, courtesy of Air France. We had to relocate to a different part of Paris and we were 10 minutes walk from the gardens. Well worth the visit.

Gorgeous gardens and breathtaking palace even during Christmas. We traveled for Christmas and thought we would be somewhat disappointed given then off-season nature of the visit. The gardens were still partially standing (some pansies here and there) and even the skinny trees added to the charming winter walk by the gardens. The palace is also breathtaking so you won't be disappointed with your visit.
Beautiful park. Take a relaxing stroll through this beautiful park, and maybe grab an expresso in the center of the park and sit in one of the plentiful chairs to enjoy the weather.

Beautiful. I loved this garden filled with statues, and a chateau in the background . It was especially beautiful in the Spring with all the flowers in bloom, children frolicking, people sunning. This is an area you could stay all day and never tire of it.

last minute treat. While having an extra two hours to use before catching a taxi for the airport, we decided to walk to the gardens since we were staying close by.It was a wonderful and well worth walk...even on a cold Dec morning. Such beauty on such a cold day could only be imagined as amazing on a spring afternoon.Even if you only have a short time to wander around...do so.
Fun to explore looking for something!. We were searching for the Statue of Liberty. We had so much fun looking at all of the beautiful statues!

a very pretty escape. I visited in early November so the gardens were not crowded. It was a nice slow paced quiet walk. Pretty flowers even in november. Great people watching, fun place to have a quick something to eat. Statues and such all around. It seemed like a nice place if you want to go for a run, but you should be aware that you cant run throughout the whole place, there are designated areas for just about everything, not hard to manage/figure out.

Chill. Tired of tramping the city streets? get to these gardens and relax and people watch, especially on a Sunday when the inhabitants of the posh area strut their stuff alongside students, joggers and 'flaneurs'. Take your own lunch, pick up something nice from a local traiteur.

Peaceful walk. It was a crisp November day, so not many crowds. A lot of beautiful statues, and we especially enjoyed watching the children play with the push sail boats in the centre pond...who says kids need technology to have fun? Find the crepe kiosk and enjoy! A nice peaceful walk...away from the shops and lineups.
Beautiful. This is a place where I could spend hours upon hours. It is a lovely park to bring a picnic with friends or camp out with a book for the afternoon. Great people-watching spot, as well.
Check out the mini statue of liberty. Lovely gardens with an excellent collection of statues, including the small scale statue of liberty! Go early to catch the pilates classes taking place.
A bit of quiet in bustling Paris.. Beautiful, well maintained but not fussy grounds, great people watching, and good variety of foods, drinks.

Relax in Luxembourg Gardens. Not at all what we had expected, we visited on a Sunday afternoon and it was like stepping back in time: well dressed children skipping about with happily chatting parents, on their way to sailing a toy boat on the raised lake. People were dosing, reading, discussing (who knows what?) or just sitting quietly on public chairs, which were hard to find vacant. A great place to catch our breath after a heckic day sightseeing in Paris.

Beautiful Gardens. We went here on our third trip to Paris. Each time we try to see new things. The flowers were beautiful. There are lots of benches to sit on and take in the beauty. It would be a nice place for a picnic

All the colors of the world. The best place to go eat your baguette sandwich on a sunny spring or summer midday. Full of magnificent flower and variety of colors, you have plenty of chairs to seat and enjoy the view and sun..

A great place away from the hustle and bustle. If you want to retire from the very active city that Paris can be this is your place. You can use this park for your morning jogging, too (I never recommend jogging in any park in any place around the world after dark).

Worth. Nice place for hanging around, taking some pictures and even having some food.
Not too far of the center but you have to walk like 10 minutes or you take the metro

While away hours reading, people watching and strolling. This is one of my very favorite places in Paris to grab a chair, open a book or a journal, and get some sun. There are plenty of chairs for the taking and so many interesting people to watch. The lawns and flowers are beautiful, and some lawns even seem open for napping, though I'm not sure how the Parisans seem to know which lawns. (When in doubt, just follow others, and don't set foot on a lawn that nobody else is on.)If you wander around, you'll see men playing boules and a cute cafe where you can stop for a drink. I love spending hours and hours here.

Beautiful, fun, and worth it!. Seeing the Luxembourg Gardens sure is worth it. It is so beutiful and scenic, with all of its bright green grass and fountains gushing crystal blue water. Children will find this place a great spot to romp aroung and play...a place where they could touch most anything they wanted (unlike at a Persian muesum) and laugh or shout as loudly as they wanted (unlike at a fancy Persian restuarant.) Keep in mind, though, that many people come to relax or read, so be sure to have the children play far away from those people.Tip: Bring a bit of bread. Kids will be quite amused with throwing small pieces of bread to the endless amounts of ducks and pigeons at the garden.Hope this helps. Let me know if it does ! :)

My favorite place in all of Paris!. I have been to Paris twice, and my favorite spot isn't the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre or Notre Dame. I love all those places dearly, but there is something about the Luxembourg Gardens in the morning with the crepe and coffee vendors, the children at play on the playground, and the tai chi groups doing their daily exercises that just makes you feel like you could live there. There is an apiary, numerous statues including a smaller (and earlier if I'm not mistaken) Statue of Liberty, several low-slung chairs suitable for reading and relaxing, as well as walking/jogging trails throughout the property. It is peaceful, happy and beautiful... a place I wish I could uproot and transport to my own neighborhood. Go to the Luxembourg Gardens is you want a moment to catch your breath, take in some natural beauty and reflect on what a wonderful city it is despite any complaints you or others may have about other aspects of Paris. It's a true gift to have this place in the heart of the city... don't miss it!
Very nice. Great place for a small picnic in the middle of the day. In the center of Paris this lovely place is great
amazing gardens. just to sit and relax during a busy day. is was a cold sunny day and it was beautifull with planty of flowers everywhere.

Really beautiful place to chill. For the price of $0, this place is perfect to relax in. Just go a for stroll, sit on the countless benches and enjoy the birds and plants and ponds. We had a good time doing nothing here.

Apart. Every time you need to rest for a moment do not hesitate to choose the Luxembourg Gardens. I've spent there particular moments of silence admiring the beautiful trees very well preserved in special pots on wheels ready to move when winter.The spring-well in the middle is also a particular attraction. Enjoy!

Luxembourg Playground and Puppet show for small children - Weeeeeee!. The play space is 'pay' but so much fun it should be on the must do list for families with small children. The ticket is good for all day so you can come and go. There is also a puppet show - line up 1/2 hour before it starts. Check the website for times days and what's playing
It is OK. In the winter this park is very bare but I can imagine it would be lovely in Spring. Don't bother to visit it in winter unless you want a photo for your album.
Italian flair in Paris. if you have been to Florence, you will appreciate the Parisian interpretation of a Medici palace and gardens.

Beautiful hidden part of Paris. We were there for 2 full days and made a deal that if the weather was nice we would go to the gardens and if it was dull we would do the museums. The weather did not disappoint and we made our way to the gardens. There was a brass band playing, the sun was shining and there were chairs available. Places like this make me wish i lived in Paris! A haven.
A haven on earth. Great to visit during warm times of the year. Bring your food with you for a wonderfull picnic, take your time to admire the palace and the fountains. Peacefull and cool in the heat

Place to socialize. So apparently this park is about seeing people and to be seen - sort of a daytime bar. There's also playing areas for kids (mainly bizarre swings and a fountain for small boats), as well as for adults - numerous petanque areas and good paths for running as the park is quite big. You can't walk or run on the grass though. There are many creperies in the park, but they only offer sweet crepes, and they are quite expensive.

Really great garden. I go there in the summer and it was really nice an beautiful. It was full with people. There is a lot of chairs where person could sit and have a rest. There are a lot places to play some sports or play with children.
beautiful!. Loved the gardens! Really nice for a walk. But protect from the rain... There are really nice boulongeries around! Good for breakfast before the walking!

Who Wouldn't LOVE this place??. I have visited these gardens many times. I was there twice this year. Once in May and the last time was two weeks ago (end of November). The spring flowers are an inspiration unto themselves ... unlike the formal Dutch gardens of Holland ... French gardens have a looseness to them ... In the late fall it is chilly, but there are benches and people are still out walking through these gardens. It really lifts the soul.

Beautiful Gardens and the BEST crepe!. We visited the gardens on our first night in Paris. We loved walking around the manicured trees and seeing the beautiful architecture. Our favorite part was the wonderful little crepe stand where we got a Nutella crepe and delish hot chocolate and coffee. It was so cute and everything tasted fantastic!

Enjoy a nice walk here!. On your way back from the Pantheon, if you're tired, enjoy some quiet here. You'll find both tourists and locals and be able to enjoy some nice views of surrounding landmarks. We went during the month of July and the garden was it full bloom making for a great sight.

Enjoy a nice walk here!. On your way back from the Pantheon, enjoy a nice walk at the Luxembourg gardens..nice atmosphere with tourists, locals and some nice views of surrounding landmarks. We went in the month of July and the gardens were in full bloom making for a wonderful sight.

Lovely garden. I'm sure the Jardin de Luxembourg is more enjoyable in warm weather, but even in late fall it was terribly gorgeous. The clouds parted and the sun came out just long enough for me to tour the grounds and get all of my photos.

Relaxing. We love to wander in the gardens, or relax by the pond & read, snooze, people watch..... Bliss. The Parisiens like to spend their lunch breaks here. The planting is beautiful. On a hot day its lovely to stroll in the shade beneath the trees. We usually take a pic-nic purchases from one of the many deli's in the area.
nothing compared with Central Park in NY. nice to have green space in Paris, but not as grand as it should be -- not enough green. But is a relaxing space in central Paris.

A nice stop over to rest. If you are exploring Paris on foot, it's a great idea to sit down and relax. It must be spectacular in the summer. We visited it in November and it was not so green, trees were bare but it was a great place to sit on a bench and relax a little.

Gorgeous. The gardens are lovely to walk through in the spring time. You will see many locals just lounging in chairs beside the fountains when the weather is pleasant and who could blame them. The gardens are filled with tulips that make them a must see. Make sure to take in the Medici Fountain.
Much better in summer. We visited the gardens in late November and then again in March. Great quiet place to stroll, I would love to see in the summer.

The Perfect Place for a Paris Picnic. Pretty Gardens, Ponds, People, Perfect for Picnic and relaxation in the middle of Paris. Walking distance from Museums, Metro, Hotels, Restaurants. Best in the Spring but interesting in the fall as well.

A Oasis of peace and quiet.. If want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Paris, take visit here. You can play tennis if you book ahead, you can try your hand the locals at speed chess if you are good enough but the level of playing is expert so watch first before you embarass yourself. Their are donkey rides for the kids which they love and swings and slides hich you have to pay to use though. The chairs in the parks are free but it's 1st come 1st served. Kids bring their own little sail boats and sail them across the ponds. People picnic, read, sunbathe and generally chill out. The French senate also backs onto the gardens but the palace is generally not open to the public.
Beautiful. We went on a winter day, and yet it was still very beautiful. Lovely escape from the intensity of Paris and lots of opportunities for fantastic photographs.

Through-fare. This was a very pleasant place to walk through on our way from our apartment in Montparnasse or on the return. No where near as large as the Bois de Vincennes by any means, however, a pleasant place to step into off the streets or stop at a pleasant little cafe to have a snack and coffee while we decided where to go for the day.

After visiting the Pantheon, go here. The day I visited the Luxembourg Gardens a band was playing classical music and I enjoyed a sandwich under the trees. Paris has some amazing public spaces, and this is definitely one of them!
very pretty. very pretty for an afternoon stroll and to listen to the park guards blowing their whistles, I would love to know why they were!

People watch.... Great way to start the day with a picnic breakfast and sit and people watch by the boating lake. The are numerous statues around the gardens and it is a pleasant walk around away from the hustle and bustle of Paris.

Parisian Perfection. The Luxembourg Gardens are my favorite green space in Paris. The palace, the formal gardens, the reflecting pools, the cottage, the elegant Parisian ladies gliding over the pebble pathways, the tai chi practitioners, the perfectly manicured flower beds, the hornbeam, the fountains, one can never tire of this oasis of beauty. If you're in Paris you simply must visit the Luxembourg Gardens.

Oasis in the city. Spent an evening there with my wife after dinner on the left bank. It was so nice to sit in the middle of a huge city and relax in this beautiful garden. Since it closes when it gets "dark" we stayed until 9 or 9:30 at night.

Nice place to relax. Beautiful gardens with great view and just a sunny relaxing place to take a break from all the walking, read a book or enjoy the flowers and sunshine. The outside cafes are a nice touch for a quick cup of coffee or tea.

An Oasis in Paris. The expansive and well-tended Luxembourg Gardens are reminiscent of the formal Boboli Gardens in Florence (Italy), and is where Parisians go for a stroll, a game of tennis or of petanque. Children enjoy the Carousel, a puppet theatre and sail model boats in the large basin in front of the Palace.

Most peaceful place in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens was right down the street from our hotel, and right next to our closest metro stop. We took an evening stroll at dusk one night, and brought muffins from a local bakery the next morning and ate there. Very peaceful both times.
One of our favorite walks in Paris. With each visit to Paris, we enjoy strolls through the beautiful and large Luxembourg Gardens. Also close to many wonderful cafes and restaurants.

Best Gardens. I liked the layout of the park, its nice alleys, the pigeons and statues as well as the activities happening in the park. I didn't like we had to pay for the children to get into the play area in the park.

Not a winter attraction. Yes, it was nice looking. Coming from a tropical climate the deciduous trees were exciting in late autumn but it was not as a splendorous attraction as we assumed. Not an activity to dedicate any real time too, but definitely worth a walk through whilst sightseeing.It is very close to Notre Dame so I'd recommend combining the two places to one short trip.

the French garden in the Heart of Paris. if you do not need a continuous Wifi connection (there is no one in this garden :(( ) then you can go and visit this wonderful garden.especially interesting imo is the variety of beautiful flowers all around.They change frequently upon the season and are particularly nice.you can also in this garden find some very quiet places where sleeping, or taking a Sun shine in the cold winter (close to the Orangerie)and after the garden please go to Patisserie Mulot nearby for a few macarons enjoy :)

peaceful and wonderful place. This is realy very nice place: lovely palace, beautifull flowers. We were there on Sunday afternoon: Parisians were resting in the garden, siting in the chairs, drinking hot chocolate. It looks like time stopped and all people are here to enjoy the life. Don't miss the chance to visit this place.

Sole of Paris?. A lot has been alleged about the finer points of huffing it around the city of lights. Not to argue. Art walks, lit walks, conflict walks, river walks; walks up the wazoo. There is, however, another method employed with increasing popularity – running Paris. You can search “Paris runs” and most of your results will have nothing to do with irritable bowel. They will, however, open up a workout with a view you won’t find anywhere on the planet. I started running in Paris in the late 90′s and would get so distracted and lost I’d sometimes need to get to a Metro to find out where I was. Even then, I might have to hop a turnstile and stand in that cramped subway car with all these civilized Parisians trying to ignore my stink. C’est la vie, baby.My recent visit was merely a stopover and I really wanted to get out into the city to see it in a different season. I was shocked at all the runners burning up my favorite rues and boulevards. Here’s a course anyone could complete, based on being able to click off 4-5 miles, and have an absolutely delightful time in the process…Garden Party — Luxembourg and the TwilleriesThe run between these two landmark gardens in the heart of the city is my favorite street run for a couple of reasons. The quiet, narrow rues provide a very Parisian neighborhood experience. The reserves at each end of the route combine beauty and history in a wonderfully natural setting. Both gardens are living, evolving museums that act as a refuge and a tribute. At Luxembourg, there is the formal elegance of a time long past when royalty strolled the protected grounds amidst the plants and sculpture. The Nazis also took the palace over during the occupation, but that was heroically resolved. The palace is surrounded by walkways that make great paths for exploring the park and you’ll feel like you’re running around in circles to get to every cranny.The Twilleries has a similar feel with less elaborate plantings but more dramatic sculpture. The route is straight up and back with no traffic, making it quite meditative. Twilleries is also the sight of the start of the French Revolution and you do get an odd sense of the struggle when you make your turn at the Champs-Ellysees. Head south to Pont des Arts, which is covered in padlocks. The idea here is to leave a lock with the names of the couple in love and the relationship will last as long as the lock is sealed.Cross the river to the Bibliothèque Mazarine. Circle the building to the west and then head south on Rue de Seine, a quiet commercial street early in the morning. There are several vegetable stands, bakeries, cafes and galleries mixed in. Run until you’re hungry or the carts and delivery vans clog the street to the point of pointlessness.
Great for picniking. Get your eclaire or tartine from Gerard Muller and walk to this beautiful garden. Worst thing about that is it closes before dark, they let everybody out before 5 in November.
Beautiful. Great place to take kids and people watch. The gardens are a great retreat in the middle of the city and fine place to take a picnic lunch.
Relax,read, people watch. The gardens are best in the spring time however one must visit them anytime to experience its splendor

Lots to do, including great playground. Huge, super fun playground on west side of this beautiful park, with a younger kids side and a older side. You pay a couple of euros to get in but can come and go all day. There are also bathrooms inside this palyground area so no need to pay to use the WC hut in the other part of the park. Can also get a cappuccino to have while kiddies are playing! And, a water fountain in the middle of the playground. Also, some crazy swings that the kids loved were nearby - again you must pay but we got at least triple the time promised as there was no line behind us. Lots of people on nice days here but always seemed to be able to find the perfect spot to sit. What a beautiful park!
lovely. lovely place, nice to watch the Parisians relax and have fun with their families on a sunday afternoon. nice to sit with a book or get a boat on the lake (toys!)

Beautiful gardens, even in late fall!. We walked around the gardens, took photos and enjoyed Luxembourg Gardens. It was mid-November and some of the trees were still colorful and it was quiet and peaceful and we loved visiting!

Beautiful. This park gates were closing as we arrived (~5pm) but it was a gorgeous park/gardens. We walked the perimeter and enjoyed it. The lawns were nicely manacured, and there were pretty trees and flowers (even in November). Definitely looked like a nice place to picnic or just relax for a bit.
very beautiful. This garden park was very big, and I love the classical style of it. My favorite area was near the fountain de medicis. One of my favorite parks I have been to ever.
Beautiful Place. It's amazing the flowers and gardening, the scultures around and the Palace is beautiful. I saw an exposition in there it was a very nice day around the gardens.
Beautiful. Walked here via the Sorbonne on our first afternoon in Paris. Enjoyed seeing all the tourists and Parisians strolling in this lovely park. They even arranged a bit of sunshine!
Very impressive in November. Lots of people in the park in end of November. Still green at this time of the year. Amazing views from the lawn.

Absolutely beautiful. Worth a trip to walk around and visit the Gardens. Lovely gardens with beautiful scenery. Just nice to sit in one of the hundreds of seats to watch the visitors or enjoy the views.

Beautiful. We wondered into Luxembourg Gardens on one of our many walks. The gardens are beautiful & huge. But in November - it probably wasn't at its best. I would have loved to see all the flowers in spring time. The fountains and statues were lovely. Definitely worth seeing.
Gorgeous!. These gardens are just gorgeous. There are walkways throughout, lined with sculptures and interesting plants, and there are museums on the grounds themselves. Definitely worth a visit.
Lovely, relaxing space!. Nice space to roam, quiet oasis in the city. Not much to see at this time of the year; I can only imagine how lovely it must be in the spring!
Beautiful. Ended up there by accident near winter so quite barren. Still lovely and a trip highlight ! Good leisurely walk.
Unforgetable. This garden is a wonder, beautiful and coloured flowers everywhere, many people go there to relax reading a book on the chairs, mandatory to visit.

Parisian heart.. Where local joggers go. Contains the French Senate, I counted 5 different types of Tai Chi being practiced, seats all about. A bit grim in winter but still has its trees, artificial pond, and pots of flowers.
Beautiful. Beautiful garden even in November. I can only imagine how beautiful it gets in Summer. It is a peaceful stroll where kids and adults can have fun. Not to be missed if you are in Paris.

Great walk. Is one of the most beautiful gardens in Paris and it is an historical place, more over. You can have a snack in Dalloyau, a very up scale, very French place to eat typical pastries or elegant snacks.
My favorite Garden in Paris.. Lovely spot of walking and relaxing...tres chic. Spend a couple of hours and enjoy the tranquility of Paris.
A Hidden Jewel in the Heart of Paris. Grab a bottle of Champagne and go to soak in the Beauty of this Oasis in the Heart of Paris...time seems to stand still in this enchanted place.
Take a walk through the gardens to the Patheon. A peaceful and tranquil area of Paris in between Saint-Germain des Pres/Saint-Sulpice and the Patheon...worth a stroll in the winter sun!

A calm place to visit, especially during spring or summer!. Jardin du Luxembourg is a great garden in the heart of Paris to visit. I recommend to visit it during spring or summer where you will be able to really enjoy the scenery, as the colors of the trees are really beautiful, and most of the activities of the garden will be available. During fall or winter, I think it is always a little bit sad but this garden is really a place where you can see the parisien life. You will need at least an hour to enjoy the walk, discover all the statues hidden between the trees, enjoying activities like music stand, games for children (mini-boats on the fountain, poney ridding, playground), eating a snack while relaxing on the grass, or taking pictures in front of the Senat. It is a safe garden, with many security. Many french local stars are living around and it is not impossible to see them having a chat with friends or playing "pétanque" sometimes. The only bad point is the if you have a dog like me, only a part of the garden is allowed for your pet and it is not the beautiful and grassy one, my dog often goes out of it dusty! Anyway if you stay like a week in Paris, I recommend it a lot!
Just beautiful. Had a lovely afteroon stroll around the gardens. It was just beautiful. Will have to go back in the summer1

Not to miss, Luxembourg gardens. Well, it is in cold November. Luxembough Gardens is a delight to visit. It is not crowded but it is still magistic for strolling in a cold morning. There are small gardens within the Garden waiting for discover. It is free and this is a rare nowaday in Paris.
Great for kids. Excellent place to relax with the kids. Excellent playground. Beautiful gardens with plenty to look at.

Beautiful rain or shine. I love the Luxembourg Gardens! It's a tranquil oasis in a big city. The pond is serene and you can watch the children play with toy boats (available for rental by the half hour). There are crepe stands although the crepes there aren't as good as in other places. There are outdoor cafes and tons of chairs to sit on. Be mindful that you aren't allowed on the grass. There is one area where you can go on the grass but it is so small that it's better to just grab a chair and watch the world go by. There are many maps in the park with "you are here" signs so you won't get turned around.
Beautiful, even in the fall. Lots of people in the park in mid-November. Lawn still green, views of the city from there pretty remarkable.
Breakfast picnic. Beautiful gardens and lots of chairs for lounging around. We just bought croissants and had a little picnic there. It was perfect.
must see.... Great place for relaxation. You definitely need to stop by, even if this is just for 15' if you are around in Paris.
Lovely garden. A large garden, peaceful ahtmospere. Chairs every where - there is no problem to rest and enjoy everything around you.
Can't miss this place.. Very relaxing and beautiful gardens, try to set aside at least an hour when in Paris and see this place.

Very Relaxing. Spent a beautiful Sunday afternoon in the gardens watching the Parisians go about their lesiure pursuits. Conveniently located to my hotel but still worth a visit if the weather suitable and you fancy some peace.

you will love to walk around. Watching parisies and tourist walking around and taking advantage of the marvelous scene and park watching older people playing boule , running around We had a fantastic time
Quaint and quiet Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are a very pleasant and relaxing place to watch people and enjoy the natural beauty. We enjoyed a picnic lunch from a closeby fast food restaurant.
Simply Beautiful!. What a lovely way to spend the afternoon wandering through these beautiful gardens ... bring lunch and a bottle of wine and truly enjoy your Paris experience!
