Very Nice place to see. Although they are just gardens it is still a nice attraction to go and see when you are in Paris. The gardens are very big but there is a beautiful fountain in the middle with lots of seating around it where you find people painting the gardens and children playing with toy boats on the fountain!
Beautiful walk in Paris. It's a great place to walk around, get lunch and sit in the gardens and people watch. There are chairs, benches and lots of choices around to buy food.

Feel like a Parisian at leisure. Lovely atmospheric park. Rent a boat and sail it on the lake for €2.50. Simple, peaceful fun. Sit on one of the many well placed chairs and watch the world go by. Not so impressed by the children's p,ay park which was rather small, tame and expensive. Don't buy a drink in the nearby cafe. Best to BYO in the park a la Parisians
Stunning. A virtual trip back in time, the gardens are STUNNING. Spend an hour just taking it in. You won't regret it.
beautiful, enjoyable stay. Take a walk through he gardens, watch the locals sail toy boats in the fountain area, soak up the ambience.

a glimpse of local lifestyle. We walked thru this park on our way to other attractions so did not spend much time but we were charmed by the lovely flowers and plentiful chairs. Parisians move them around, in clusters to talk, or in the sun to relax or read. Beautiful garden and atmosphere. I can understand the attraction - if I live in a Parisian appartment I would definitely come here often!
Delightful. Very pretty, even in November. The gardens are still well maintained and accessible this late in the year.

for kids and kids-at-heart, a must-see Paris location!!. The Gardens are wonderful. For children, there is the fountain and pond with sailboats, a playground, horse-back riding, and plenty of space to run and play. For adults, it is a great place to relax. I brought a sandwich and drink with me and ate lunch while sitting on one of the plentiful benches. Three generations of a Paris family were eating next to me and they were worried that the children were bothering me--and I got to speak some French while letting them know that I was enjoying watching all the people. The park was crowded but it did not feel crowded and people-watching is the thing to do. As I was leaving, I noticed a concert band warming up for an afternoon concert under the trees. There are bathrooms available and food stands also. On a rainy day, it may not be the place to be, but if the weather is good, you could spend an entire day here and have a great time.

Beautiful place. This was my second time at Luxembourg gardens. The first time was a spring visit and this time was a fall visit. It is very beautiful. I am especialy moved by the fountain along the side of the chateau. Very beautiful place.

Take some time off. Lovely place, where you can enjoy for a little bit the parisian way of life: grab your chair, place it by the sun and read your favorite book. Don't forget to visit the fountains in the hidden corners of the park; they are hidden treasures.

Relaxing break. We walked & walked (& walked!!) around Paris, so it was always nice to find the perfect spot for a rest after lunch. This is ideal!! My husband had never been so this is where we were aiming for after strolling around the Latin Quarter for a few hours. We bought some food & sat on one of the many chairs taking advantage of the autumn sunshine. After eating we moved to an area of grass (the only one marked "sitting permitted") & unfolded our plastic poncho as the grass felt damp. Here we enjoyed a well earned rest. My husband is known for his after lunch naps!!! That is until a group of teens came & sat right next to us & started smoking!!! When I first went to Luxembourg Gardens (2008) on a Sunday, I loved how the place was filled with families. I suppose if they live in apartments, then this is their backyard & the place they go so the kids can play. Lovely flowers & fountains with paths for walking at a relaxed pace.Luxembourg Gardens are really worth taking some time out from your busy sightseeing schedule to just chill & people watch. Was a good place to stop & rest before walking on to Montparnesse Tower.
lovely. It was beautiful and lovely to hang out. Fresh air, the trees, the atmosphere and people watching:-))

Great place to get some fresh air surrounded by beauty. Spacious and gorgeous paths leading to lovely views of the city. Also, there's a public bathroom in the north-east entrance which is cheaper to us than the McDonalds nearby.
Go see the bees!. Very old apiary and a beautiful garden to boot. A good place to get some walking in if you're not doing enough already (or a good jogging location)

you have to go to understand just why it is so popular. before we visited it was hard to understand just why people love a garden this much. But once you visit it captures your soul. It covers everything you think a garden should have: beautiful flowers, trees, walkways, a pond, formality and informality and people watching. Just do it!

An oasis in the heart of the city. My husband and I spent six days roaming around Paris and one place we ended up, completely by accident, was Luxembourg Garden, which I had heard about but had never been. Long winding pathways, plenty of seating to lounge in while reading a book under a shady tree or by one of the many fountains. This is the people's park and it seemed that half of Paris must be there, but it didn't feel crowded, as the park is so large. An outdoor stage was the venue for a wonderful live concert in the park. Truly magical and romantic.
Asseyez-vous. Just sit and be, in this outdoor space whether it's cold or warm. It's a destination and a convenient pause for respite while walking the city's boulevards.

Best place for kids. We are a family of 4 - 2 kids aged 3 and 8. The playground at the Garden is outstanding and worth the small entry price. the garden itself is wonderful and full of great things for the kids to find - statues, birds, fountains etc. For a reasonably good runner, one lap of the park is 10 min so it was a perfect place for parents to get some vacation exercise.

My favorite place in Paris. This is the park that we never miss on a visit to Paris. Suggest walking in from the south where you'll get to see perfectly arranged rows of trees, then the formal gardens, and finally the hexagon pond (complete with small duck house) and the palace. I love to take my time and visit all the beautiful statues of the queens that ring the center garden, then there are the treasures throughout the grounds like the Medici fountain, a small Statue of Liberty, areas for boce, chess, and tennis, and an incredible array of activities for kids like a playground, boats for rent on the pond, a carrousel, etc. After walking out the northern end, you can head to the Pantheon or St. Sulpice. But I always leave plenty of time to picnic or read in the gardens :)Enjoy these incredible gardens and Paris!
Great Place to Picnic. A beautiful park with flowers galore, a lot of people were having picnics there and the scenery makes you feel all is right with the world.
Beautiful grounds. We travelled in October so the gardens were not at their peak but they were still beautiful! The water feature and remote control boats were so quaint!

Just beautiful. Well worth a stroll through- especially on a gorgeous summers day. Just heavenly! The bars and cafes in the park were very expensive though. Im sure we'd have very much enjoyed a cold drink in the gardens but we felt we couldnt justify the prices. Next time, maybe we'll take a picnic!

Don't miss it !. No matter what you have imagined, it is bigger. And nicer. And brighter. Don't spend too much time in the inner time, the best is out there. Go prepared to walk, wear comfortable shoes. And please, take your food and make yourself a picnic. Food there is not good and quite expensive. But it is very worthy to go and imagine the old times there. Fantastic experience.

If you have children, don`t miss it. Little sail boats to rent, pony rides, a HUGE playground (paid entrance), and a puppet called Guignol show (on wednesdays and weekends) are absolutely wonderful for children of all ages.

One of the most beautiful parks in the world!. The Luxembourg Gardens are a must-see in Paris. This 17th century classical garden, a former royal residence, is now a public park. It's delightful to sit there and people-watch. Floral displays are extensive and well-maintained.

Great place to walk around. Good for both kids and just to walk around as a couple - sit back and take in the Paris scenery. There are nice water ponds, and lots of places to hang out. They laos have play areas for young children and plenty of space to run around.

Peaceful and beautiful place, even in the winter. Every major city has there famous park, Central Park in NY, Hyde Park in London, Grant Park in Chicago. The Luxembourg Gardens is Paris' great park but with a lot more style and grace. I have been three separate times, include two in winter. It is a must see park, if only to escape the city.
A must see. Take a lunch and eat it there, relax and stroll have a cigar, it is a very beautiful place not far from other main places to visit in Paris
Peaceful.. It's early winter but the gardens are delightful, there are several areas to sit and there are seats every where. Lovely watching children sailing boats at the fountain.
Oasis. Grab a baguette, some goat cheese, a bottle of wine and go watch kids playing with boats in the pond and the people in general. It doesn't get much better, or more relaxing.

Wowwwwww!. I was stunned when I first laid eyes on this majestic garden. Luxembourg is the perfect place to engage in that old Parisian pastime of people watching. You are likely to see Parisians jogging or walking their dogs as they enjoy a warm summer evening. Luxembourg Gardens is one of the main reasons I fell in love with the city of light.
Luxembourg Gardens. This is definitely my favourite place in Paris. Every time I come to this city I take my friends there. You can relax for hours in a very beautiful area.

Great place to watch Parisian life in action. I ran there several mornings while staying in the 6e and it is a wonderful park. There is a lot to see here and much to do.JoggingPetanque (Bolles)Tennis (free!)PlaygroundGardensWalkingSitting and people watchingRent model sailboats to sail in basinEnjoy fountainsTerrific photography opportinities

Take a break.. This park is HUGE, with art, duck pond, people selling coffe and crepes, and different activites for kids. Parisians love kids,and having your children with you to paris is great, they will also enjoy activities that is fun for the family there. You will find different art here, like the statue of liberty. Much to look at. And the park is pretty in november as in the summer. Go there!
Luxembourg Gardens. I was dissappointed. We bused across town to reach this garden. We had already seen the Tuileries which were glorious.

Lovely oasis. This is a lovely area to walk and relax right in the heart of Paris. Although it was autumn and quite cool the gardens were lovely and full of people enjoying the outdoors like ourselves. Well worth a vist
Heavenly. So many incredible moments here to capture with the camera. In the fall, with the colors and falling leaves, just incredible, but there is probably no wrong time to visit.

La Vie en Rose. For me, this garden is where the magic of Paris lives. I always feel so beautiful, whimsical and calm strolling through the park on a sunny afternoon, surrounded by nature and seeing others enjoying themselves too. The garden is in a fantastic location too, near the Pantheon, and surrounded by many great cafes! When I go back home to Canada, I'll miss Jardin du Luxembourg the most.

Absolutely Beautiful!. Luxembourg Gardenrs is a must see when visiting Paris! It was by far my husband and I's favorite Garden that we visited on our weeklong trip to Paris. The gardens are breathtaking and there are things to do for the whole family. The day we were there a free concert was playing beneath the trees. There is also plenty of seating in comfortable green chairs that you are able to move around to get an optimal spot. The garden also features a pond/fountain, restrooms, a playground for the children, bocce ball courts and a small cafe. It is the perfect spot to bring a book and a sandwich and relax!

Luxembourg Gardens ... A Heaven of a Public Space. Luxembourg Gardens is one of my favorite places to visit in Paris. I adore the little chairs sprinkled all around the vast grounds ... so unlike the US where seating is nailed down, stationery. In LG you can rearrange chairs to your liking. People scoot a chair in front of themselves to put their legs up. Turn several together to create a table for a chess board. Move them to a sunnier spot. And LG is one of the best places to people (and bird) watch in Paris. Lovers strolling, children sailing little boats in the massive fountain, old men playing chess. You can spend a few deliciously relaxing hours and come away feeling like a genuine Parisian.

Heaven on Earth. Take a turn into the Luxembourg Gardens on a sunny afternoon, grab a chair (or two- one for your feet), and soak up the lovely and relaxing atmosphere. You're in the heart of Paris, but, you're very far removed from the city. There's Palm trees,fountains,spectacular gardens,statuary, and, lots of great people-watching. A real treasure.

The Chrysanthemums Were Still Colorful!. We spend time in late October one early morning -- it was still lovely. The yellow chrysanthemums were filled into tall urns located throughout the park. There were autumn leaves and it was gray out but it was still magnificent. My husband and I walked through and smelled the chestnuts roasting at the corner stand and admired the views. I know in the summer it was more beautiful, but we enjoyed it!

A beautiful and peaceful destination in the heart of Paris. We have been to these gardens before because they are so beautiful! Luxembourg Gardens somewhat remind me of Central Park in NYC. This is a great place to pull up a chair and do some serious people watching! :)
Beautiful!. Very nice to walk around.. Especially in spring. Visited this time in autumn and still gorgeous and peaceful
not to miss visiting when in Paris. many statues, large pool full of model sailing boats, all very relaxing and plenty of chairs and benches where to sit.

Take a look at the bee hives. In a corner of the park are the bee hives "Rucher". Our French friends who we visited with, particularly wanted to see this as they keep bees themselves. It was interesting to see the bee hives and the "attics" that the bee keepers add to the top of the bee hive. We are now full-bottle on bee-keeping and harvesting the honey. As it is November, the bees were all sleeping but I reckon it would be interesting to visit in warmer weather.The park itself is immaculate. As my friend said "a museum of a park" rather than a park itself. You can't go on the grass, you feel like you can't touch anything, but nevertheless it is a beautiful area. A very quiet sanctuary from the busy streets.
Good place for a nap. Beautiful gardens with seating for dosing off after a crepe or morning croissant. Feels very safe for children too.

Lovely gardens. Simply beautiful gardens in the middle of the city with lake, ducks and lots of green. Check whether there is an interest exhibition in the Luxembourg museum that is located inside the gardens. You can enjoy the people watching especially in a sunny day and even take a little pick nick if you'll buy some cakes in a good patisserie before you enter the garden.

Gardens d'Luxembourg. We got off our boat at the Musuem D'Orsay and walked through the streets full of a variety of shops to the beautiful gardens Luxembourg. It was definitely a Paradise if you had children with lots of things for them to do. Although it was November when we visited there were still flowers out and I should imagine in the Spring/Summer it would be beautiful - well worth a visit.
tre bon. a real taste of paris ,music,wine and people enjoying themselves we just sat in the sun and people watche with a glass of wine thats the way to chill out and experience parisiens
parks. I really liked the beautiful grounds and the atmosphere of tranquility with men playing chess and boules. beautiful palace but unfortunately you cannot enter

A Busy Park. A lovely open space, although not a very relaxing park, it's bustlingly busy and is flanked by a busy road. There were tennis courts and treelined areas. Lots of families were out enjoying the fresh air. You can walk right up to the Senate building. There's plenty of benches and moveable seats to rest and take it all in. There were signs on the gate stating that it closed at 5.30, but nobody seemed in a hurry to leave.

Go a sit in the sun and wile away some time. We were lucky to visit in Spring, with all the blooms and garden beds looking truly superb. However, the best bit was finding a spot to call our own, pulling up a green metal chair or two, soaking up the sun and people watching. Just fabulous. Kids learning to rides bikes. Lovers kissing. Matrons undoing the buttons and sunning themselves. It was all a treat to be part of.

The place to come and watch life walk by. If you love people watching then this is the place to be.... watch the children and their parents pass the summer with their little boats, or sit by the fountain and dream while lovers whisper sweet nothings into each others ears, bring your tennis racket for a competitive afternoon swing or watch the locals compete in Boules.A place for dreaming, wishing, living, inspiring...

Lovely place to sit and relax. These gardens were a nice place to just sit and relax and observe the French in action. The flowers were in bloom while I was there which added a lovely feel to the place.
Beautiful. This is one of our favorite outings in Paris. We were caught in a brief downpour, but huddled under an umbrella and waited for it to pass. The Gardens are as magical as ever.
love the gardens. Just love the gardens, can spend a whole day there, especially if it isn't raining, free deck chairs round the fountain lake, to sit and read, just laze the day away.

A Must Visit in Paris. Jardin du Luxenbourg is one of the most satisfying places to visit in Paris. The lovely lawns and sculptures surround an expansive basin where children sail their boats. Even during an Autumn visit the fading roses are breathtaking. Of course summer is the best time to visit but ant time is wonderful.
Beautiful. Beautifully maintained grounds, under the watchful eye of the Medicis. Watch the children sail the boats in the central fountain.

Paris Park life...fabulous!. We stayed for a week a block away from this stunning garden. If you are a fan of the Tuilleries, don't miss this garden! It's smaller, more manageable, a beautiful mix of French formal garden and beloved local backyard. I love the parks in France and the way Parisiennes live in them. My favorite time was 3PM, when school lets out and the kids arrive with parents in tow. They play, parents read and chat, watching over the action. As the afternoon wears on, friends and lovers meet up after work for coffee or ice cream. It was a daily, wonderful slice of real world Paris. Counting the days until I can return!
Champagne in the Gardens. The little cafe near the pond. So beautiful to sit and have a champagne and watch the world in the park go by.
Forever refreshing. Except for the flowers (depending on the time of year), Luxembourg never changes and we hope it never will. What a gorgeous place@
Not bad at all.. Not bad at all and you can see the Pantheon just up the road, we also got accosted by gypsy children,just outside, pretending to be deaf but could happen anyway.
very serene. very calm and serene- not much in terms of flowers but a gorgeous senate building sit inside it and has lots of seating and sculptures dispersed along the garden.

A wonderful place for the family... This is a most charming place to visit with the family. Our two small children loved this place in the summer due to the numerous playgrounds, sand pits and small dipping pools.In autumn we enjoy coming here on a Sunday afternoon to have a picnic, and the children love to ride the ponies.

Beautiful Expansive Oasis on Left Bank. Felt like walking back in time. Not to miss while in Paris. Lots of nooks and crannies to explore. We visited in Autumn so the leaves were changing. I've also been in spring where the blossoms are worth the trip to see even if you're staying a bit away from this location. I

Lovely Park!!. I was in Paris in October 2012 and stumbled across this park by accident. It was a cloudy and rainy day, so I wished I had come there when the weather was better, as it was gorgeous. There is a large water feature in the middle, and lots of lovely gardens with statutes in the park. The gardens were stunning and I can imagine that in the summer, the park would be lovely with all the flowers in bloom. There is also a lot of moveable chairs around, so it would be great to sit there on a sunny day. There was also a cafe and it would be a nice place to have a picnic in the good weather. It is definitely worth a visit and would be a great place to read a book on a sunny day.

A Wonderful Public Garden!. This is a must see in Paris. Wonderful to go there and just people watch, primarily locals enjoying the beautiful fountains & vistas. There's a great public restroom with an attendant (cost a euro or two but well worth it). Don't miss the Medici Fountain.
Beautiful Park. A gorgeous park for a stroll, lounging or photo opportunities. The fall foliage was quite pretty and the open space is a welcome change from the rest of the city.
the best gardens in Paris.... Beautiful and free........ and no English! What's not to like????? A haven in the bustle of the city!

Refuge after the bustle of a day at the museums. The Luxembourg Gardens are lovely at all times of the year. It is very well suited for families with small children and the fee-paying play area in one corner is wonderful. The park is close to the Pantheon and the Cluny Museum and there are a number of bus lines that pass by. I prefer the bus from St-Lazare station, it passes the Opera, the Louvre, the Seine and drops one off in front of the gates to the Gardens. The little restaurant offers good bistro style food and the setting is lovely for a meal under the trees in summer. One can linger, sitting on an iron chair, watching the world go by....

Gorgeous, Relaxing, and Romantic!. These Gardens are very beautiful! I took my lunch here and sat looking at the gardens and people watching. Very lovely place to visit. I noticed some people jogging and school children (Middle or High School) came to eat their lunch here too. You'll also see a lot of elderly couples. A definate go to place!
Packed gardens. It was packed with people! If you want to people watch great place to go - if you are looking for seclusion and peace this isn't it

the french doing what the french do best. Hang out with the locals in this massive park. Great people watching opportunities and lots of different areas to explore. I liked the pond with the sail boats.

Pleasant gardens for a stroll/picnic. Well kepts gardens with a few attractive sculptures/water features/trees. Plenty of locals eating their lunch here on numeous seats. We enjoyed lunch at Au Petite Suisse (see my review) before a quick stroll round then park then on to the Pantheon.

Lunch time retreat. We visited the Luxembourg Gardens to take a lunch break after a morning of shopping and exploring. It was so relaxing to see everyone lazing about in this stunning garden, having lunch or just chatting - a Parisian slice of life. Definitely worth it to pop in if you're in the area.
Beautiful gardens. Watching the locals enjoy their city, seeing the children with their parents sailing the boats in the pond, oh so French!

Beautiful Luxembourg gardens. This is the perfect place to wander around and even to have some coffee at the outside café.. The French families come here with children to rest ; there is plenty to do for children.. a pond to sail their boat, or rent one, a puppet theater with a very wonderful program. and the gardens are.. a pleasure for the eyes with wonderful sculptures, old trees, and flowers. Each season the flower-beds are arranged according to the time of the year. Spring : mostly pinks and light yellows, Autumn : yellows, brown and red. The Senat grounds have also a beautiful gardens. There is a nice small museum : Le Musée du Luxembourg.. whith a permanent collection and exhibits... plenty to do for a whole day without rush. You can take a book and sit, or watch the spectacle of people going by, or take a nap after a busy day in the Latin quarter ... the Park is situated at the top of Blvd St.Michel... it closes late in the Summer and around 6pm in the Winter... ENJOY !!!
Sublime. Gardens in heaven must look like this, if they do, and I get to see them, won't be disappointed at all.

Lindo!!. A beautifull garden full of flowers, and still close to subway stations, right in the middle of busy Saint Germain.
Recommended.

Something for Everyone, Beauty for All. The Luxembourg Gardens is one of my "must do" stops in Paris, and usually a place I try to visit multiple times while I am there. From the beautiful Medici fountain to the ponds where the children sail boats, and the tennis courts to the fantastic playground and puppet theatre, there is truly something for everyone. It is by far my favorite park in Paris, and one to be visited at any time of year!

Lover's park. Beautiful and free experience. Couples holding hands and smooching at the plentiful benches. Lovely ponds. After walking for miles browsing the shops what a great way to spend a crisp Fall afternoon.

Perfect symbiosis between nature and art. It fits perfectly in your walk between Saint-Germain-des-Prés and Latin Quartier.A wonderful spot to relax and amaze your eyes!If you don't have much time in Paris, in this zone in the left bank of the Seine everything is close. Enjoy here a wonderful Parisian afternoon.

The Central Park of Paris. Beautiful gardens in the city's heart a must see if you do not have the time to go to Versailles. But if you do have the time, Versailles is a place you should take a day trip to.

Memorable Sunny Sunday Stroll. A sunny Sunday stroll through Le Jardin du Luxembourg captures the essence of Paris. Fashionable Parisians take their children to the idyllic fountain for guiding toy boats around the perimeter or watching puppet shows located around the grounds.
Beautiful Place To Visit. The garden and palace were a sight to see. Here you will find the oldest and original statue of Liberty. Beware of the joggers!

Relax in the green. Take your tome to relax in this park, among the Parisians, out of the buzz of the city centre crowded with tourists. here you will still find locals. Take a free seat, everywhere in the park, sit back and watch.

A wonderful place to relax and experience Paris!. My husband and I were lucky enough to have a beautiful Sunday afternoon in the gardens walking and watching the numerous families playing and soaking in the sunshine in the park. We had a delicious, reasonably priced lunch in the cafe.

Beautiful. In September the predominant colour is yellow and no matter what the weather this colour pops in person and photos alike! It is pleasant to wander about for an hour, watch the children sail boats in the pond and sit for a bit if you so desire. It is not crowded here, there are no annoying street vendors hounding you, and once you finally find the way here, it is a wonderful oasis.
fun gardens. Great walk from St Germain district. so much green space even in Oct. They were planting bulbs and it was fun to watch. nice to walk around. good place to bring a book and read.

A perfect afternoon. Is there anything better than relaxing on a bench in the Luxembourg gardens and letting the world wander by? It is beautful and peaceful a perfect way to stop and appreciate this wonderful city.
The Park. Was a very regimented park with little greenery, was a disappointment as on the map it gave a very different impression.

My favorite garden in Paris. We missed going here on our last visit, so I made a point to return. We went on our first visit and simply loved the escape from the big city. As much as we enjoy walking around Paris at times I need a respite from the traffic ( people and autos) and crowds. This is such a pretty park with so much art and of course the lovely Medic Fountain.

gem of open space. Lovely formal gardens, right next to Place de la Concorde. Several areas for the kids to look around and play, including some smaller free playground areas with older style equipment (worth supervising little ones from more cautious and litigious countries as we saw a number of falls, squished legs amongst the older timber rope and metal equipment). Loved the sculptures in the lawns - especially a quirky tower made of cooking pots! As with most formal gardens, you can't walk on the lawns which is a shame as they are so gorgeous and inviting.We had a lovely morning, starting from Concorde and walking across to the Louvre, enjoying gelati (the cart near the library will make a beautiful flower of different gelati flavours which looks just spectacular!)
An oasis. A huge green space with a lot going on. The few formal flower beds were wonderful. No street sellers, which was good.

Beautiful Even in the Rain. The Luxembourg Gardens are gorgeous. When we were there, yellow was the predominant color, but the colors change with the seasons. Can't wait to see the Gardens when the sun shines.

Lovely gardens good history. I liked the history better than the gardens. This is where the last phases of the French Revolution and Terror played out, where men like Danton and Desmoulins spent their last days before condemned to the guillotine by Robespierre.But the gardens are beautiful too - I just like history better.
Peaceful. The best place in Paris to spend a relaxing afternoon. Read a book, watch people passing by, glass of wine.........

Beautiful in the autumn sunshine!. It was lovely to return to these gardens after many years. There were chairs laid out all around the gardens on which visitors could sit, and no sneaky deckchair attendants waiting to pounce on you for money, as happens in other places. It's a wonderful oasis of tranquillity, very close to the centre of a vibrant, lively city.
lovely. a bit of a walk in the latin quarter, but, lovely to have a coffee and see enjoy the beautiful garden
Beautiful - great place to bring children to unwind. Lovely, we stayed near the gardens so that we could let our son run off a little steam before and after sightseeing every day.

A garden of great beauty and charm!. One of the most beautiful gardens in Paris in all seasons but especially the fall on a nice (or not nice!) day. French people love this garden and it shows - the landscaping is stunning and no cost has been spared for year round beauty. I always gravitate there on each visit!
beautiful and tranquil. Very lovely - even in autumn. Very well kept gardens - only dissapointment 40 cents to use th facilities!
Wow - gorgeous park. We did a fantastic run through the Luxembourg gardens. Great space, beautiful gardens. Worth a visit in all weather but best for a picnic

Experience Paris life. This must be close to the University as we were able to stroll and see many college students on their lunch break. Neat to see Parisian life amongst the young. There was a honeybee grove, huge bird tree, fountains, and many trees in Fall color. It was a nice stroll.

Just lovely. I recommend grabbing a coffee and baked good and sitting here in the late afternoon toward sunset. You can see the beautiful flowers all lit up with sunlight. An added perk is the uniformed guys (police?) who go around clearing the place of people using whistles after the sun sets. A real hoot.
Great garden in the middle of Paris!. A lovely grad garden in the middle of Paris. Beautiful site for photos, seeing gorgeous flowers and people watching. A definite must on any Paris tour!

A wonderful place to relax for a bit. Bring the kids, let'em have a great time. Relaxing park, very calm and so many trees, and fountains and more.
A break from the busy neighborhood.

Parisian life in a garden setting. If you want to experience the parisian lifestyle, les jardins du luxembourg is the place to be. It is a large park like garden with paths to run and exercise, tennis courts for the eager tennists and even a kid's place at the back of the garden. But most of all, it is a spetecular place to come and drink your coffee while watching people enjoying themselves.

splendid space. take a picnic, go for a run, admire the palace or just sit by the ornamental lake- this is an historical place of the people.
Delightful.

Absolutely Beautiful. What a great respite for the students at the institutions in the immediate area. The gardens have a wonderful informality along with the exceptionally well designed layout and statuary etc one expects. The variety of blooms and the Palace itself are beautiful enhancements to the overall aesthetic of this delightful Parisian civic asset. Definitely a Must See

Beautiful and peacefull.. It's a very beautiful place. We took marvellous pictures there. Nice place to relax and enjoy nature. Interessant statues. You should explore in order to have some exotic pictures. I loved it!

Lovely, peaceful park. Traditional spot for Parisians to stroll and play. The opportunity to see the locals at leisure and the parkt oneself for the same reason is delightftful. On weekends the little ones sail toy boats on the central pond.

A nice walk and place to stop and people watch. This is a beautiful garden and walkway. We loved the flowers and landscaping. We sat on a bench and watched people stroll by and actually observed pickpockets at work. Interesting how a team approaches, distracts, and then robs you.

Lovely scenery. I spent the month of July in Paris as a student and has the pleasure of walking through this garden everyday. I would walk a different route to make sure I was able to take in this beauty from so many perspectives. I looked forward to my daily walks and can't wait to get back to Paris.

Nice for a stroll. The gardens are probably much better in the spring or summer months, but were still lovely in late September when we were there. A very nice way to get out of the "hustle and bustle" and enjoy a few quiet moments on a bench.
Nothing special. I felt miffed when we got there, as this garden is so hyped up, yet is basically a manicured tree garden with a 'castle' in the middle. Maybe we were just too out of season.

Favorite thing in Paris. It's hard to put my finger on why, but this was one of my favorite things I experienced in Paris. It's truly wonderful. I can't believe I waited until my 3rd visit to do it! What a miss.

Superb!. Spent a most enjoyable afternoon here recently, listening to live music and enjoying a wine.
The gardens are stunning.
A welcome relief from the regular hustle & bustle of Paris.
Beautiful and tranquil. Lovely open space and well maintained gardens, ideal for a romantic picnic. Messing fountain is awesome!

Simply beautiful!. What a great green space in the heart of Paris. I was there in early October on a sunny day and it was so nice to see people relaxing and catching a few rays on a lovely autumn day. My advice: circle the park, admire the pool and the palace, find an empty chair and close your eyes and relax, maybe thinking of how the penniless Hemingway hunted pigeons for dinner here in this beautiful setting.
Breathtaking. Well worth a visit. Beautiful gardens to wander around or just sit and relax in if the sun is shining.
Idyllic. This rare piece of greenery in the middle of Paris is always worth fitting into a visit to the city. The palace and gardens offer an oasis of tranquility where one can watch the world go by.

Simply Beautiful. We came here not once, but three times to enjoy the beautiful gardens and views. Make sure to check out the fountain that is tucked away on the side of the Palace, it became my favorite in all of the city.
Cosy plae to spend an afternoon. In a sunny day take a book and relax in the Gardens. It is close to gift shopping area and nice restaurants.

lovely for romantic picnics. Beautiful gardens to sit in on a sunny day. Lots of benches and chairs provided which make it easy to relax and people watch. It is all so civilised with out litter, graffiti or vanadalism. Lots of extreme exercise going on at the weekends!

Visit them in the morning. Great place to walk around, take pictures and a morning coffee. It's really nice through the Fall and I can only imagine what it might look like in the winter. Definetely make some time for it.

Take a lunch and people watch!. Think New York Central Park or Hyde Park London. Huge, green space, fountain, formal gardens. Great people watching. Lots of places to sit on (their iconic) green metal chairs and just relax and revel in being in Paris.

If you have little ones and are in Paris you must come here.. We came to Paris with our 5 & 3.5 year old for a long weekend and we were so lucky to go to these gardens. They loved the swings ( I don't mind we all had to pay to get in, kids 2.5 euros, adults 1.5). On Sunday morning we sailed boats on the lake. There were pony rides. The boys loved watching the various marshal arts that were being performed. There are lovey cafes to have a takeaway coffee. It's a must.

Immaculate. We went in October and you could still see the pristine condition of the gardens and how well they are looked after. Even though it is a major tourist attraction it still felt very tranquil walking through.
Lovely. great place to stroll and eat lunch. Small sandwich shops are near by. Near two metros. Good view of Effifel tower.

Quite Tranquil Family place in heart of Paris. These gardens are extremely large and is the place people in Paris go to sit, jog, play tennis, chess, sail little boats and picnic. Quite a relief in the heart of a bustling city
Beautiful Park To Spend A Warm Afternoon In. Very relaxing Sunday afternoon in September. It was nice and balmy. Kids rent little sailboats for the pond and the manicured gardens are beautiful.

Best park to kiss in Paris. I've seen most of the parks in Paris on this last trip and this is my absolute favorite. Went twice, first time rainy so less crowded but still enjoyable, bought little salmon quiches at nearby bakery to picnic in the park. Second time sunny and warm and could sit and relax and soak up the sun. Nice sculptures and the flowers of course were gorgeous. Crowds on a sunny day. Still a peaceful respite from the city noises.

Not to be missed. do not miss, just wonderful! beautiful, Just PARIS, as you expect..the gardens are fab...just to sit there I look at this Place was wonderful,..not enough time for a picnic, next time...

Beautiful. We happened to go on a sunny day and it had a lovely, warm autumnal feel about it. There are plenty of benches and chairs around for people to rest and take in the views. There is a cafe, although we didn't use it so I cannot comment on the quality of it, but I have no doubt it would be good.
Lovely Gardens. A lovely garden for a stroll and a cool break. Worth a visit. Clean toilets are also to be found here.
Afternoon stroll. Beautifull gardens and a lovely place to relax after a day of sight seeing. Sit and have a coffee. Stroll through and when you are recharged, back to sight seeing.
!Fantastic. Fantastic place! Local people....jogging, eating,sunbathing... Unspoiled by lots of tourists....in fact I am reluctant to share as I just love the place.
A special park. Whenever I visit Paris I go here to walk in the park or to sit under the shade of a tree and read. They have flowers throughout the year.

The essence of Paris. We visited Luxembourg Gardens on a glorious early autumn day. The flowers were spectacular, gaudy and wonderfully colorful. An orchestra was playing in the band stand. Children were riding miniature ponies, charming little handcrafted boats were floating in the ponds among the ducks, people were eating ice cream cones, sitting in the sun reading or chatting with friends, everyone was smiling. A perfect Parisian stroll.
ahhhhh fun fun. so fun to sit near the lake and cute ducks, to walk in beutiful parisian autumn... clean relaxing... closes at 18:15 so pay attention
Not a must see but if you have time.. Pleasant walk in nice Parisian neighborhood. It rained the day we went so that lessened enjoyment for sure. Paths are not paved so it was a bit messy.
Peace and Quiet. So beautiful even in August. Quiet, peaceful, beautiful! We walked and walked, and sat and watched people and ducks, and took photos of statues and flowers.

Beautiful even in winter!. When we arrived at the Luxembourg Gardens, we were amazed at how beautiful it is to stroll through there even in winter when the flowers aren't in bloom. But we could imagine how much more beautiful it would be in Spring or Summertime when the trees and flowers are full!We enjoyed the atmosphere of the statues and everything was tidy and peaceful. It was a welcome segue from the hustle and bustle of busy Paris.Housekeeping: There are public toilets there, but as usual in Paris there is a charge to use them.Travelling around Europe with a toddler is hard work, so we welcomed the opportunity for her to run around and be crazy without disturbing anyone (and she had a lot of fun feeding the birds). There weren't a lot of people around, so we basically had the place to ourselves that day.We bought (an overpriced) hot chocolate from a boutique little cafe just inside the gates of the Gardens and took a stroll, eating baguettes we had bought from a patisserie earlier! Bliss!

Wonderful "stop over". Wonderful and clean gardens. The perfect stop over for a snack or a dring among the endless sightseeing in Paris. If the weather permits it, enjoy the gardens and walk around them.

Magnificent Gardens and a very impressive Palace.. This highlight is all about the Gardens as the Palace was off limits and heavily guarded as the French Senate was in house. The area is huge and the combination of many many statues and classic French gardening make this visit a must see. Plenty of cafes and take awayss in the gardens and thousands of seats to use. Take a picnic!

Beautiful Gardens. I rolled through the Luxembourg Gardens on the back 1/2 of a full day of walking. They were really beautiful, honestly. But there isn't much to *DO* there. You see a lot of people just kind of hanging out eating/drinking/talking. I would def recommend visiting here...it's free, it's beautiful, and it's a nice break after a long day of trekking through the city. TIP: If you enter/exit near Odeon (street?) there's a really beautiful foutain there.

restful. One of my favorite places in Paris to sit and watch people. I always take my book and find a great place to sit around one of the ponds. Also, usually on Sunday afternoons there are free concerts in the gazebo.

Great place to sit back and relax. Very pretty, well maintained. A great place to people watch. We stumbled upon it and were very glad we did. One of the most impressive parks I've ever seen (and I have a soft spot for Boston's public gardens).
Beautiful landscape. We loved the Luxembourg Gardens with its beautiful landscape and comfortable chairs. Nice for taking a break from all the walking.

Perfect for a sunny day. As an American you owe it to yourself to wander into this place, find a seat and people watch for a couple of hours. I understood more about French culture watching people in this place than any other way. When you are exploring the Latin quarter you want to make this a mid day, rest spot, buy some simple street food, or a pastry and just sit, obsevve the world, magic.

A calm haven. A beautiful space in the centre of Paris. In season the flower beds and the statuary look wonderful and you can relax and watch the kids sail their sail boats in the big pond in front of the Senate building.

Great for morning run but you will need to do multiple loops. I would go here for a morning run if you already done the river run to Eiffel Tower and want something different. The park is a bit small so you will have to do multiple loops. I won't go out of my way to visit just Luxembourg as there are so many other nicer attractions in Paris to enjoy.

A beautiful park for a morning walk. Even in October, the park was beautiful. We had about four days of intermittent rain, but still took our umbrellas and walked the park in the morning. There were flowers still blooming(giant mums) and ducks paddling through the reflecting ponds. The trees were in full autumn color. It was a very beautiful way to start the day.
Very pretty. I only stopped here to rest on my way some where. And enjoyed the fountains and gardens. Took some great pictures there.

If you visit just one Jardin in Paris.... Magnificent statues, meticulous plantings, stately buildings surrounded by beautiful old Paris buildings, this park has it all. Great place to sit and enjoy the day. Just walk around and see how Parisians relax.
A lovely respite in Paris. A beautiful place to walk, sit, read, drink in bustling Paris. The flowers are colorful, plenty of seats to relax on, romantic and pretty.
lovely. Beautiful gardens and scultpures. We especially loved seeing the french school children running around. After days of rain during our visit the sun came out while we walked here- hooray!

Charming at the summer, a bit dull in fall. In the summer the many people and children as well as the lush gardens and flowers make this place an ideal place for a mid-day getaway.
In fall however it is quite empty, with people jogging around. It looks much less spectacular.

A great Paris stroll. Fabulous gardens for a stroll and a visit. There is a little museum to visit and some great shops and cafes nearby. But the gardens are worth strolling all around and sitting and people watching.

A sturdy walk!!. Luxembourg ain't cheap!! But- it is lovely for an older tourist- and yet again, a reminder that the Europeans (particularly in Nancy and Lumxembourg) seem to value Art for People- this sounds so cliche and Radio 4- speak- but in this visit to Europe-the experimentation with US as audience to ART at the Pompidou Museum in Metz, the scattering of Mexican modern art (sculpture by Javier Marin) through the city of Luxembourg and the FABULOUS trains in Europe that ARE CHEAPER than the UK. But back to Luxembourg- the reason we visited was a random article we saw in the newspapers, saying that this city was worth a visit, despite the fact it has a sober reputation. And the city is gracious, with gardens that reminded me of a more dramatic park than the one in Edinburgh. The city is built around a valley (now the park) and crossing the aqueducts, a good days walking will take you to the cathedral(unfortunately closed for the marriage of the Crown prince) and lovely restaurants. The train station is ten minutes away form a wonderful restaurant 'Nouveau-cafe gourmand' (Namur) where the pastries are sinful, and the coffee is superb. We walked the whole day- in and out of the park, into churches, art galleries and shops. And if you do want to eat cheaply-there is a small Indian restaurant(Gourmet Bagel) at the cross roads of care street and the aqueduct - for a really superb curry. Luxembourg is gracious, cultured, and also has a hospitable EU office- where all the things you did not know are available from well informed staff. Finally- walk through this city- spend time viewing buildings form outside, and take the time to visit the viewpoints in the park-a good city for away trip.
Get Away From The Busy City In Lux. Gardens. Took the metro to the gardens and explored the sights in this area. Pantheon and other churches in this area.
great. Visiting on friday afternoon made me feel like real Parisian :) Lots of childrens, chess players, petangers or just relaxing families.

Beautiful Gardens - worth a visit. The grounds are beautiful and would be an ideal place for apicnin in the summer. lots to do and look at. Dont miss the opportunity to make a visit. I only had an hour to spare and wished i had more time...

good place to take children. This was a great place to spend a sunny, crisp October afternoon. My daughter loved the marionette show (all in French), sailboats in the fountain, and playground. But everything, including the use of the toilet, costs money.

Stunning garden. Beautiful lawns, surrounded by fabulous buildings (palace and Senate), a classic French arbor, and fountains galore, including the under-rated Medici Fountain. Loads of chairs to sit on and take in this Left Bank jewel.

Nice place for a picnic. Grab a some french bread, cheese, deli meat and wine and relax in the garden for a romantic picnic! Great place to just people watch, eat and spend the time just enjoying the experience.
Relaxing place to stroll. Great place to stroll on a Sunday morning whatever the weather, a place where the locals go. Liked the pond where you can hire a small sailing boat

Runners paradise, great for strolling. If you are looking for a place to run while in the centre of Paris then this is a terrific option. As it is right off the RER line from CDG and there are many hotel options in the area, then you have ready access to the gardens. Many runners can be seen from the tourists to the locals. For the non-runners, they can sit in cafes and watch the diversity of those running, taking kids in strollers or walking with toddlers. The gardens themselves are a nice way to get away from the intensity and traffic that is a part of Paris.

Beautiful Garden. We enjoyed a relaxing stop in the gardens during our first day in Paris. Unfortunately it started to drizzle not long after we got there, but we spent enough time walking around to enjoy the beautiful grounds.

Extraordinary in the fall. We stumbled on the gardens after a drizzly afternoon of strolling through the city. This little gem is delightfully romantic.The leaves were changing, making for incredible pictures. We took our time, discovering sculptures and statues, taking pictures of other couples, and sitting under the sleepy trees listening to the sounds of people quietly enjoying their afternoon.If you have a chance to stop by, it's a cute little place to sit and relax for a bit.
band. every Sunday we would go down and listen to this great band on a gazebo . they are zany and entertaining. the park itself is great to stroll around in
Nice place to relax for a while. During your city trip this is good place to go sit down, take something small to eat and lift your feet up for a while
Beautiful, even in the rain.. The garden was well kept up. Roses and other flowers still in bloom. Loved all the trees and statues.
stunning. A must see for the gardens and peaceful ambience!Also great for exploring the surrounding area if you are a fan of Dan Brown's 'Da Vinci Code'
Charming. Very nicely laid out gardens, charming that there are open air chess games in progress with all the chess tables full of garrulous Parisians! Lovely formal planting.

It is an Amazing park. When I was there I was lucky to see a Jazz band playing on a little stage. In the middle of the park the children were play if wood boats toys. It is perfect for a break and a picnic. Don’t forget to try the Amorino ice cream that is in a trailer, one of the best ice cream that I ever tasted.

Beautiful!. These gardens are lovely. After a busy day of sightseeing you might want to take some time out and relax here. You can walk around, listen to a busker or people watch. The gardens are kept very nicely and I had a pleasant afternoon here.
Beautiful, quiet walk. A nice place to enjoy some peace and quiet. Beautiful fountains, sculptures, gardens. Also an interesting museum here and a royal palace.
Nice. Nice place to walk and relax around the fountains. The blooms were a little past their prime now but Lukembourg must be beautiful during the summer.

Flowers galore. Peace and quiet in the midst of the city - the Jardin du Luxembourg is a lush, green island of calm dotted with stunning statues. There was a sculpture exhibition going on with beautifully Parisian faces. You could spend half a day here and wonder where the time has gone.

Nice View. The view is awesome, especially during the day! The place is packed with tourists and a lot of activities going on. Decent restaurants around the area. When you are looking at the city, you get the feeling of belonging to a classic and historic environment.
Just a must see. A great place for relax and loock at every day life in Paris. Pretend you are in a movie and enjoy the visit

A beautiful, peaceful garden with plenty of places to sit and relax.. Paris has fewer green spaces than, for example, London - but this one has an enormous amount of charm. There are grandly laid out formal beds near the palace with striking almost monotone planting schemes - Oct 2012 the focus was yellow -and beyond these areas are formal avenues of clipped deciduous trees and more relaxed shrub and woodland areas. Particularly lovely are the delicate metal chairs - the essence of Parisian charm - for you to enjoy in the gravelled areas. We were also fascinated to see the original smaller version of the Statue of Liberty about 10 feet high and bronze, which can be found at the end of an avenue on the western extremity of the garden. It is surprising how different this statue seems when much closer to the scale of the human body. We would always visit this garden when in Paris, which is lovely in all seasons.

One of our favorite places to hang out!. We went to the gardens three times while we were there. We were there in October and didn't expect to see the flowers in bloom as well as the leaves just starting to turn colors. Stunning!!!

Relax. All for sunny afternoons after you had a long strol in Latin quartier.p.s: Bring a small bottle of champagne,sit down...relax and watch the magnificent theatre of Parisian life in these beautiful gardens

Lovely place for a stroll. It was our first time in Paris and on our first day, we walked to the Gardens to kill time before our tour. The Gardens were lovely and we did what Parisians do, sat on the chairs, enjoyed a bit of sun and admired the sculptures and the flowers. There were several art students there sketching the the sculptures and the scenes. There were lots of marvelous photo opportunities in this huge garden and the only downside was that the chestnut pods were falling off the trees and hit us in the head and the back. But we just laughed it off.
Just lovely. Beautiful. so much work obviously goes into maintaining these gardens, it's lovely just to grab a bite to eat and sit and stare at the view

Lovely walk up to Montparnasse & Port Royal.. Fascinating stroll with detour on rue de Fleurs, the former home of Gertrude Stein and Alice Toklas. Great park for families, children with their bateaus and lovers.

My favorite park in Paris. Nothing more Parisian than a walk in the Luxembourg Gardens. Grab a chair, listen to someone playing music or read a book. The Senate is just there to be admire. Just a wonderful part of the city. Than get up and walk to the Pantheon as I always do, before losing myself in Parisian time.

if you have a sunny day in Paris definitely go there for a walk.. if you have a sunny day in Paris definitely go there for a walk. after two days of rain we went for a "promenade" and it was amazing, with all kinds of colors in the trees and the flowers. don't miss it

Did not have the WoW factor like Givernery but Good. The day was beautiful and the gardens were not congested. The views were good but not like other gardens about the area. The condition of the toilet area was NOT good and needs to be improved. It was so bad children were refusing to participate. Go before you go.
whatmorecanyousay

Beautiful gardens. We loved it here we spent most of the day. Found ourselves a chair and sat back near the ornamental lae and soaked up the sun.
I wish we could stay here forever.
Beautiful. Beautiful, peaceful, great for a stroll away from the busy streets of Paris. A haven in the middle of the city.

Go on a nice Sunday afternoon for a French family experience. We decided to visit the Gardens on a recent sunny Sunday and spent the afternoon moving from one section to another experiencing the beautifu flowers and statuary. The playgrounds were especially fun to see as they children had so many exciting climbing and adventure structures that you would never see in the US because of our "legal/safety" issues.

Bring your camera. Rain or shine, stop by and enjoy the locals soaking it up. Groups of students working on school projects; Lovers sharing a bottle of wine; Grandparents caring for their grandchildren. Bring bread to feed the ducks.
Beautiful. Great place for a jog in the morning, though it requires a few laps. And an even better place to stroll in the afternoon. Very romantic

Wonderful place to go and just people watch!!!. We strolled through at a leisurely place and discovered that it is more of a park similar to Central Park in NYC than our perception of a garden. The place was teeming with activities from groups exercising on the grass and joggers running. The most interesting thing for me was watch Yoga practice being done in french. The people were friendly and we met a french couple for which we took pictures for with Chateau in the background.
Nice afternoon. Nice and relaxing place for a promenade with your friends or your love! Really really romantic! Very very nice!!

Beautiful sunday afternoon laziness. Wandered around on a sunny sunday afternoon. A local brass band was playing in the park and there were so many people about, mostly lying around sitting around the fountains etc reading. Lovely place
great place to walk, exercise or contemplate the universe.. Walking paths wend thru beautiful trees and plants. Great place to bring your lunch to visit or read.

Lovely. The Luxembourg Gardens on a Sunday in early autumn are delightful. It's a playground for Parisians and their children. So many pleasant things to do. Watch children sailing their toy boats or small children taking pony rides; families playing tennis; listen to the band playing whilst drinking delicious coffee at the cafe/bar nearby. Wish this was my local park.
Best park in Paris. Gorgeous, expansive park with some of the best statues and people-watching in Paris. Bring a picnic lunch and something to read or draw the Palace.

enjoyable view. Grab a bottle of wine or beer from the near market and go in the Luxembourg garden to get your time, to give green for relax of your eyes, colors of beautiful flowers for full enjoyment, to free your mind with view of calm water… it’s time for yourself!Free entrance and of course during the weekends can be overcrowded. Don't be late, opening hours depends of the length of the day.
Garden supreme. An easy walk from Notre Dame through the latin quarter to one of the prettiest garden and mini palace places I have ever been to. A great break from the bustle of the city

Pleasant gardens with good playground. We took a lovely walk through the length of the Luxembourg gardens. There were gardeners everywhere working away. My children loved the big playground for up to 12 yr olds. There is a fee to enter (€2:50 for kids and €1:20 for adults) but my daughters (aged 7 & 5) got their money's worth out of the flying fox alone!!!If you are in the area with kids, pop in as it is a lovely break for them.
Beautiful gardens. These are some of the most pretty gardens we have seen. Niceand clean plenty of seats and tranquil after all the hustle andbustle of Paris and all the tourists
Beautiful October Vacation. We had mid sixties in this beautiful garden with fountains and plenty of lounge seats to sit in near them.

Beautiful Afternoon. It was a warm, sunny afternoon after a few cold rainy ones. We so enjoyed relaxing and watching the local Parisian families with their children playing with the sailboats in the pond. There was a big band playing, as well, which made our day even more special

Relax in the summer. A lovely place to wander or just sit and relax on warm days, it has loads of places for children and seems well organised. There is often a special event to view, this year it was plants from all over the world and was very interesing.
Great for a stroll. Beautiful gardens. Went early in the morning, so was very quiet and a nice peaceful location for a stroll.

For a lazy afternoon. This is a beautiful park in the 6th arrondissement, a bit like the Jardin des Tuileries but so much more lively with locals and with fewer tourists. It is wonderful to run around on the edges of the park with the locals in the morning and there are plenty places to sit and lounge around. Unlike the Tuileries which are more decorative, you will see in Luxembourg tennis courts, pétanques fields and chess tables. There are also wonderful monuments and statues, as well as the Palais du Luxembourg. In my view, it is a place not to be missed.

A must see-everytime you visit Paris!. The Luxembourg Gardens are an absolute must for any visit to Paris. This is where the Parisians go to relax, exercise and meet. Meticulous gardens and paths that wander through the area force you to become a Parisian-at least for the day.

French wine in it's natural environment. The gardens are enormous and breathtaking. We took food and wine to the gardens and found a lovely bench under a tree to have our repast. This is commonplace in Paris if you observe the surroundings with respect. Easy walk around the grounds with lovely buildings and fountains to take your breath away.

Awsome place to relax with kids. On a nice day, this is a beautful spot to take a break, sit in the cafee and just watch the crowds. On Saturday mornings, this seems to be the place to go jogging and in the afternoons, the kids enjoyed playing with the boats.

My favorite spot in Paris.. These gardens are wonderful! There is always something in bloom and something going on somewhere in the gardens. Weekends are nice because there are children sailing boats in the fountains and playing in the playground. There are people playing petanque and mostly people just sitting and enjoying the day, or strolling though the park at a leisurely pace. This symbolizes Paris and the French life at its best.

The perfect place to spend time. I can't speak highly enough of the Luxembourg Gardens. This is what a public park should be. We visited on a Wednesday morning when it was relatively empty and again on a sunny Sunday afternoon when it was alive with people. Both times were fantastic.You can find a place to do anything your hear desires here. Strolling, sitting and reading a book, tennis, pony rides, model boat sailing, eating crepes, jogging, listing to live music, watching the kids at the playground.....The people watching was fantastic on the Sunday afternoon. Families were out with the kids, lovers on the park benches, old people, young people, tourists but mostly locals. I would choose to spend time here every time I'm in Paris.

Beautiful place to soak up Paris. Great urban park! Lots to see and do, but we especially liked watching the kids with the model boats in the fountain. We spent about a few hours on a Saturday afternoon here just walking around and people watching. Although we also enjoyed going to the major museums and tourist hot spots, I often find myself thinking about that afternoon in the garden when I recall our time in Paris.FYI- There are ample restroom facilities and a cafe/snack bar available.

Beautiful.... Even if Jardin du Luxembourg was in our neighbourhood,we visited it only once.And it was the only rainy afternoon in our 9 days in Paris.Still,we were amazed by its beauty.Like the other Paris gardens and parks,it is full of statues and flowers...beautiful flowers.Take a walk to this amazing garden,enjoy the peace and beauty of the place.

Don't miss this wonderful spot!. Gorgeous in mid-September. Loved people-watching while sitting in one of the many chairs. Had fun watching kids and adults with their remote-controlled boats on the pretty pond.

stylish place to hangout. This is my favorite jardin in Paris! It has a wonderful location that is not far from Odeon and St.Germain du Pres! Wonderful to see people hanging out and children play with sailboats and riding horses in a good day. Don't forget to see the free outdoor concert somedays in the evening.

One of my favorite parks in the world. If you're in Paris I think you definitely should get a snack or a lunch and enjoy it in this park. Just very pretty in every direction. Some cool Pantheon and Eiffel Tower views within, great horticulture, and just feels Parisien.
LOVELY. These gardens are among the most beautiful and tranquil in Paris. Stay in Luxembourg Parc Hotel and have them at your front door.

Brief Quiet Interlude. We spent eight days in Paris in June and had the Luxembourg Gardens on our list of things to see. Our walk thru and brief stop here ended up being on our pathway between two other must see stops. The Paris weather during our trip was sketchy, lots of overcast, cooler temps, and seemingly a constant threat of rain. But on this day the weather was glorious. We enjoyed our stroll thru the garden. It is a wonderful place to watch how the locals enjoy some leisure time.We managed to find a few empty chairs in the central part of the garden. Was nice to rest tired feet and my wife loved the opportunity to warm in the sunshine. The gardens are very attractive. People-watching was fun. There was a great cross-section of society around us.On our next Paris trip we'll spend more time exploring this quiet oasis.
Strolling. Nothing to dislike at all. Perfect for a Sunday morning stroll. Watch out for jiggers though! There are quite a few!!

delightful. must see. A real Paris highlight with lots of pockets of activities gardens views. We saw beautiful gardens, palace, kids on ponies,autumn colourA young girls princess party, tai kwan do etc etc
A wonderful outside place to stroll. We went twice. Wonderful park with amazing sculptures, gardens, fountains and buildings. A great place to read, relax or end/begin the day of siteseeing.
Beautiful walk in the Park. The rain did not stop us from enjoying a walk in this wonderful Park while in Paris. One of our favorite parks!!

The most beautiful place in Paris. You step off the busy streets that are teaming with fast paced Parisians and there Indian driving and you walk into this serene beautiful wonderland of green. The gardens are defiantly worth a trip and take a bit of lunch with you if the weather is nice as its nice to sit and watch the world go by whilst you are there.

Go again and again. We strolled through the gardens on a sunny Sunday afternoon and had an afternoon tea at a cafe near the centre. The gardens are beautiful and its a great way to rub shoulders with lots of local families and tourists alike. We found ourselves cutting through the gardens a number of times last week just to enjoy the ambience and its beauty - a definite for any visit to Paris!

This is where I took the most photos of Paris!. This garden is like walking in a French movie. The guards had on historical French hats and uniforms. The garden sections were gorgeous, the gravel paths meandering and enchanting. I love this garden so much and hope to visit again.

A very nice park in the center of Paris. We recently stayed in an apartment a few steps away from les Jardins de Luxembourg. Even if we hadn't any kids we would have visited this beautifull park. But with kids it is a must: they kan run, the can play (nicely equiped large childeren's playground with minimal entrance fee), the can ride the merry go round, during summer season there a ponies to ride and miniature boats in the pond.There are lots of activities going on in the park such as joging, tennis and gymnastics but it is also veru suited just to be lazy en sit/lay in the sun

Beautiful. This was the first sight we saw in Paris! Wow, what a place to start! The sun was shining, lots of people sunning themselves, reading or playing sports like tennis or bowls. There were lovely lawns, statues, flowers and plenty of places to sit, have coffee, or tracks to wander around. Be careful of pick pockets.
nice. it is nice, but we just went there to marked as been there, nothing remarkable, just a nice picture :)
Great place for picnic. The gardens were as beautiful as always. It is the best spot in Paris for a picnic and great place to watch people.

A Surprise in the middle of Paris....... What a wonderful surprise to stumble upon the Luxembourg Gardens on a sunny afternoon in St Germaine. Well laid out parks and gardens with all sorts of recreational activities such as tennis, jogging, people watching and kids sailing model boats in one of the large ponds. It seemed that a large proportion of the population were taking time out from their apartments and were enjoying the fresh air, playgrounds, walking tracks and just plain out relaxing.Great place to spend an hour or two, and there is even a former palace there so it is worth the effort to have a look. Enjoy !!

Special fun for kids: sailing toy boats on the pond. We visited the marvellous Jardin du Luxembourg on a sunny Sunday morning in early October as part of a weekend trip to Paris. The real highlight for our daughters were the wooden toy sailing boats on the round pond. Together with a wooden stick they could be rented for EUR 2,20 for half an hour. Once they got a slight push by way of the movable sails and the wind they are floating from one side of the pond to another end, but not always predictable, where they had to be caught, turned and pushed again. The kids just loved it and had never seen anything like this before.
Relax and beautiful. This is one of a kind place in the city, we got there after a few hours walking around and the time spent contemplating the beauty, was amazing.

Unbelievingly beautiful and quiet.. The park is just so unbelievingly beautiful and quiet. Hard to describe, actually. Peope just sit around - reading a book, newspaper, eating their lunch bought in a store near by or just relaxing. You should do the same - and after that you are only steps from the Sorbonne university and the latin quarters.

A lovely place to catch your breath. The Luxembourg Gardens is not a place for tourists who want to race to see everything. It is a beautiful place to sit and enjoy fresh air in between other attractions - it's less than a ten minute walk from the Pantheon, for example. But the Parisians go to stroll the gravel paths or watch the kids play around the fountains, or just sit with friends and catch up on news. The old palace, which is now the home of the French Senate, is a beautiful building (on the outside, at least), and there is a garden of statues of the ancient queens of France, as well as other typical garden statuary, but really the appeal is to just enjoy the weather, the greenery all around, and the sense of being among the regular people of Paris. The gardens also have tennis courts and a children's playground for those who'd like some recreation, and there are lots of restaurants and cafes on the peripheral streets. We were there in both summer and winter, and enjoyed it in both types of weather.
Charming. The Luxembourg gardens are lovely. Combine it with the Tour Montparrenese. The gardens are situated in a lovely part of Paris and well worth the visit on a lovely day.
My hotel was across the street. Wonderful place to jog, to sit and read, to just relax. Beautiful big park such a sanctuary in a large city.

Truly delightful urban park. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful, the buildings are gorgeous, the lakes where kids sail toy boats are idyllic. The puppet show is hysterical and engrossing and the outdoor music concerts are wonderful. The only drawback--and it's not really a serious problem--the cafe in the park is mediocre compared to so many other eateries in the area. All in all the Gardens are a great place to spend the afternoon in any season.

good and bad. small fun fair is good as are lovely slush type drinks you can get& candy floss!!however the gardens themselves seem to attract a lot of vagrants and people who aren't too pleasant as it starts to get dark, so be careful with bags etc, however nothing happened to us!

Beautiful grounds, very relaxing. A must for everyone. With little lakes and flowers everywhere, not sure how you could not feel tranquil while wandering around on these beautiful grounds. Great place to people watch or just sit on a bench and read. Highly recommend.

Not to miss!. I try to get to this garden every time I visit Paris. It's gorgeous in all seasons and all weather! There's a surprise at every turn, whether it's a small statue, a fountain or a quiet place to sit.

If you don't get a chance to visit Versailles.... then visit here. The Gardens were within walking distance of our hotel, so we decided to take a stroll and ended up taking several strolls through the grounds. The Gardens were beautiful (even in late September) and filled with benches for resting and people watching. You could catch a glimpse of the top of the Eiffel Tower above the tree tops and really felt you were enjoying the best of Paris.
Lovely place. Beautiful place to sit and watch the world go by. Plenty of moveable chairs so you can sit either in sun or shade.

The Gardens are Amazing. This free gardens is amazing and a great stroll. If you are an Ohioan notice the box shaped trees - they are all Buckeye trees. There are also hundreds if not thousands of Buckeye trees along the Champs Elysees. I guess they do well in polution
The sailboats are so cute. This is a beautiful garden and the pool in the middle is filled with people just relaxing and watching the children sail the boats. Not to be missed when you are in Paris!

Delightful place to relax in a hectic city. After a hectic day of sightseeing in Paris this was a welcome haven of tranquility on a hot day. You can walk around this lovely park if you wish and look at orchards, lakes and grand buildings or simply pull up a chair and read a newspaper or book - like the locals do. The day we went, our feel were so hot that we cooled them in the large lake and watched the passing parade or Parisians going about their leisure. Some nice grassy spots too to relax and even have a snooze - just check that the sign allows you to sit there or you could risk a fine (so I am told!) "Pelouse Interdite" means keep of the grass but it's easy to tell - just follow what the locals are doing and you'll get it right.

Where Parisians go on a nice day. This lovely park has lots of ambience and we felt we were there with lots of Parisians out enjoying the autumn sunshine. I liked the flower gardens and wonder how they grow their dahlias so big.

A Perfect Garden Retreat!. We enjoyed a puppet show and seeing children scream with delight. There was a wonderful band playing in the square and we had a lovely lunch in the cafe. The gardens are perfectly maintained and it just felt like a heavenly retreat.

More beautiful than ever.... Been coming to Paris for a long time, and the Luxembourg Gardens just seem to get prettier and prettier. It's such a charming place to enter to escape, for a few minutes, the noise of the city. Don't miss it.

Needing Somewhere to Chill in Paris - This Is It. What a find! Walking in the Luxembourg Gardens was very grounding and relaxing. There are heaps of seats around to sit and just let the time pass away. There are lots of stately mature trees, lawns and bronzes around the gardens.. A must visit.

The heart of Paris. We visit Paris about every second year and we always have to have a cople of hours in the Jardins. It is a place that is very relaxing and peaceful - not counting the gardening trucks - an oasis in the heart of the left bank. It is a bonus if there are boats on the pond. The chairs are even quite comfortable by public park standards and you can move them around for the sun and/or the best view for people-watching.

Lovely relaxing open spaces with beautiful gardens. This is a great place to amble through.It was so nice to see the French & tourists relaxing in this lovely tranquil place .There were hundreds of people chilling out in there own ways,yet so quiet.We never planed the visit just stumbled upon it.

Lovely. I spent some time here my first afternoon in Paris. There were many chairs set up throughout the gardens to sit and enjoy the view. I sat for a while at the different fountains. Only thing better would have been if i was enjoying a crepe while doing so. :)

Must Visit. The gardens were exceptional, probably the best I have been to. It is ideal place for relaxtion , i went in October and the sun was out, autumm leaves were just coming, was not particulary busy that it got annoying and you can capture some really amazing scenery shots. Finally there are numerous places to sit, scattered throughout the garden and take in some of Paris's finest natural beauty.
Absolutely gorgeous and peaceful.. Serenity. Flowers were in a general yellow motif and coordinated. A very peaceful place indeed. Good family park.
A must beautiful gardens. We bought a bottle wine, baguette and cheese and sat in the gardens for a picnic. Beautiful gardens.

Paris for the child in us.... Paris revisited: There are special places I revisit each time I am in Paris. The Jardin du Luxembourg is on my list that includes the Eiffel Tower. Entering from the Blvd. Saint Michel, it is a short walk to the Pavillon de la Fontaine, a vintage kiosk, where brunch, or simply cafe or a soft drink in the outdoor setting is heart warming. From there, it is another short walk to the Medici Fountain, which is striking because one can't help but wonder why it is such an appealing sight.This time, a daughter--younger--but not a child, was with me. We both came to the same conclusion: We must take my granddaughters to Paris, and take them here to ride the ponies, watch a puppet show, and play at the pond with a model sail boat. There is also the Carousel, of course. Paris can be very child friendly Simply wander and inhale the beauty of the floral displays; see the statues dedicated to poets and royal ladies down through time. At the far end, their is the Orangerie, where contemporary artists display their art. Throughout the park, one may pull up one of the many chairs and sit to relax and absorb the surroundings.

Beautiful Park for a Saturday Run. I went to Paris to run the "Grand Classique: Paris to Versailles 16K" with my running friends. So we were looking for nice places to run in the mornings to keep fit. The Luxembourg Gardens were a lovely place to spend our Saturday morning. We joined many Parisiens running and exercising, drinking coffee and taking pony rides. The perimeter is fairly large, and one can increase mileage by adding the interior paths. This is just a lovely place to be.
