Relax in the Luxembourg Gardens. This place was unbelievable. The place was flowing with a lot of people but it never felt crowded. You could pull up a chair next to the water and just relax. Must see.

Very beautiful. Great to relax here after wandering around Paris. Very well laid out and plenty of seats. There are a few interesting things to take a picture of, and things to keep you entertained, but mostly the gardens are to relax in. My one niggle is that the toilets are somewhat expensive and it's not easy to find a tree that is private!!

Beautifully landscaped and maintained. Extremely picturesque.. Love this place. Great place to people watch and relax...especially by the slightly removed Medici Fountain. Heard a jazz band perform here which was a perfect Sunday afternoon.
Must. Just beautiful! A must see in Paris! A perfect place to grab a baguette and just relax. There are chess boards with several games in play and puppet shows on Wednesdays and Saturday's!

Prettier than expected. Attractive gardens, more flowers than many public gardens. Nice for a quick visit but not a lot to look through. Surrounding buildings were also attractive. Not too busy, easy to find a seat and enjoy the scenery.
Lovely even in the rain!. Very lovely to just stroll through while you are seeing the museums, shops and restaurants. We went when it was rainy, but it was still beautiful.

Relaxing evening. If you've got an evening to spare, or are tired from walking the streets of Paris all day, this is the place for you. My husband and I bought a bottle of wine and walked into the gardens, and we spent a lovely evening watching local Parisians be Parisians. Afterwards, we walked the perimeter of the garden as the sun was setting. I strongly recommend checking this place out for an inexpensive way to enjoy a bit of Paris!

Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens. Unfortunately due to the wet and cold weather we experienced in Paris we were unable to picnic in the park- but will be top of the list if ever i am lucky enough to spend more time in Paris.
wow!. filled with people enjoying the sun, each other, their books. beautiful plantings. amazing surroundings. i would never tire of this garden should i live here.

The magnificent garden... quintessentially Parisian. Paris is defined by its gardens: The Luxembourg is vast, historic, full of surprises for both children and adults. With its meandering alleys, old statues, fountains and assorted food and beverage stands it invites visitors to long promenades and relaxing repose on its many benches... Great perspectives! I go back, again, again and again. Every time it's the same, yet different. A gem.

The Central Park of Paris always pleases!. This is an incredible free park/garden. There are statues, a small lake, games, children's playgrounds, places to sit and relax, tennis, ...you name it and it is available here. We visited on a lovely warm and sunny day and it was filled with people enjoying all that it had to offer. What I marvel at is how there is so much space yet it doesn't appear crowded and there are more then enough seats for everyone! I definitely will never leave Paris without a visit to this treasure.
Nice retreat. nice place to take a stroll and hang out in good weather. many areas of the park to explore. great place to go if you have kids with you.
Perfect for a warm, lazy afternoon. So beautiful. I loved it. Spent some time just basking in the sun and enjoying the view of the fountains and the palace before me.

Breathtaking. Every park in every city should emulate Luxembourg. The entire park is replanted 3 times a year. Flowers, fountains and grounds are beautiful. Areas are designated for children's activities, Boule, Chess, and peaceful contemplation. People are everywhere; Paris' most beautiful park really is alive.

Gorgeous gardens and statues. Plenty of benches for sitting with a loved one or even a morning or afternoon nap. Esily accessable by metro but consult one of the large roadway maps as it is a little tricky to find at first. The price can't be beat. In the heart of Paris surroounded by terraced garden apartments. Definetely worth a stop for the price.

Simply lovely. These gardens are lobely and relaxing; somehow felt more informal and relaxing than the Tuileries. There are lots of places to relax in relative privacy here, with a number of options for children as well as those who are physically active - an extensive playground, tennis courts, etc. Be sure to check the times posted at the gate, as the open/closed times change with some regularity. You won't want to mss it.

Relaxing, green oasis in Paris. I hwas surprised by the lack of green spaces in Paris but this partially made up for it. There is currently a dry spell in the area and so the grass was dried and more brown than green. But there were flowers surrounding the pond behind the palace. There was a shaded small pond with fountain off to the side that really beakoned after walking in museum all daay. It does close at 5 pm- early and too bad since there was still another 2 hours of light. Great spot for picnic which we did although curtailed by the park closing as mentioned. No bathrooms near by so plan ahead.
refreshing change. beautiful gardens that are well respected and taken care of, could have spent the whole day here relaxing
Beutiful Gardens. Nice walk from St Germaine area. Lovely flowers, gardens and fountains. A great place to relax and take in Parisians relaxing and enjoying their beautiful city!
Beautiful. Lovely gardens. Wonderful spot to spend an hour or so relaxing in between sightseeing, shopping etc. Plenty of chairs. Very pretty.

Paradise in the City. Luxembourg Gardens are a hidden secret. The day we visited it was a warm sunny autumn day. a great place to relax and have a picnic lunch. Hard to believe you were in the middle of Paris.
beautiful. Beautiful keep gardens, so tranquil and romantic. In the city yet feel so far away. I could have stayed all day, but I had other places to interest to visit.

Mingle with Parisians Relaxing in Their Back Yard. I have visited the Luxembourg Gardens several times. most recently it was on a warm summer weekend. There was not an empty green metal chair to be found near the grand fountain! Parisians were everywhere enjoying their beautiful outdoor park. I watched children sailing their boats with the ducks in the fountain, children riding ponies, tons of joggers running the paths along the perimeter and people were playing tennis, doing tai chi and other various activities. It is truly a great place to see Parisians at rest.
Beautiful spot for a picnic. This was a beautiful, quiet park that we enjoyed sitting in every day for picnic breakfasts and lunches. Also lots of joggers if you are looking for somewhere to run.

Nice place to walk or take a break. Hemingway, Gertrude Stein and others used to walk here back in the '20's, as they lived nearby. If you are walking in this area, detour through this park and see why.

The best place on a sunny Sunday afternoon. An easy walk from the Pantheon, make sure you have a picnic with you (or buy something on the way), grab a chair and watch the world go by. Children love the sail boats and on a sunny Sunday afternoon it is rather perfect.
Beautiful spot. Every corner is different. Beautiful serene setting. It's obvious why so many locals flock here. Be sure to see the small sail boats in the pond.
Get here before 6. Like most things in Paris the gardens close at 6pm. the gardens looked beautiful through the fence. I am sure this is a great site for Lunch.

A Beautiful Garden in the Middle of a Busy City. These gardens are superb! There are fountains, beautiful trees and shrubs, people playing games or just strolling along, and, quite frequently, musicians. My wife and I were lucky to hit a warm spell last October so we ate lunch and relaxed in the gardens twice. On a third occasion, we just took a long walk and listened to a concert. It's a very pleasant spot to visit after spending half a day sightseeing. Don't miss it!

A Nice walk through the park.... Beautiful gardens with lots of activities for children and adults. Takes some time to watch the men playing bocci ball. In the summer, you can rent a toy boat to sail on their lake. Lots of playgrounds, puppet shows for the kids. A peaceful, serene place in the late afternoon.

Beautiful gardens, a different side to Paris. For those who have some spare time in their busy Paris must sees, a beautiful gardens where Parisians relax, play and soak up the sun. Conveniently located between Saint Sulpice and Pantheon, a must see -- time permitting. The beautiful large palm trees, pool and fountains are lovely in the sunshine!
Really beautiful! It's a must see place.. The garden is great, with so colorful flowers and a nice place to rest a little during a walk near the Pathernon.
Beautiful Gardens. Enjoyed a stroll through these gardens, and time out on the green metal chairs provided throughout. Lovely setting for a picnic lunch.
I love these gardens. I have been to these gardens at least 5 times. It is always a differnet experience. It is always so beautiful

Walked too much and need a break. There are lovely spots to sit in and drink coffee, snack on food and sit for an hour or 3 reading a book and watching the world go by all over Paris. This is one of the largest and varied areas - if the sun is out you can sit here for hours

Lovely!. I Loved these gardens! Lots of colours and foutnains and just ample space. i love the fact that Parisians come and relax here as they soak up some sun. Love the idea of having a all the chairs available for the public to rest. You can just spend all day here and forget that you are in the middle of the city!
average. mrs veg fell over a railing that is ludicrously low, as she went to view an inscription upon some statue or another. Dreadful that is. Nice flat park, nice ambience in general terms.
quiet beauty. Must see in Paris. The gardens must have fun choosing the flowers to compliment one another--works of art. Not so large that you can't see it all unlike Versailles.

Great Place to Bring the Kids. It was within a 3 mile walk from our hotel. There were a lot of people enjoying the sunshine sitting around a large pond with sailboats that the children could play with. Nice views of the Pantheon and Luxembourg Museum.

Jardin du Luxembourg. One of the most beautiful gardens I've seen. Amid this beauty there are several activities, and you may also have a meal there. I spent a few hours in there just taking in the views.

Natural beauty at it's best. My wife and I visited both Luxembourg and Tuilleries gardens in Paris. I believe the atmosphere and sheer beauty of the Luxembourg Gardens may be unequalled in all of Paris. Incredible foliage, ponds, and views of the city!!
Magnifique. A lovely park filled with lots of Parisians and sculpture. A great spot to take a picnic lunch or take a walk and enjoy the gardens and the toy boats floating in the ponds.

Favorite gardens in Paris. There is something so magical about the quaint statues in these gardens. Love coming here in the fall and watching the kids with their boat races in the center fountain. Cute little crepe place here also. Good place to stroll, relax, reflect.
A Beautiful Park. It is a wonderful place to walk or sit and watch the people. The grounds are beautiful and the flowers are always great. All kin ds of people can be seen enjoying themselves.

A must!!. Went here on a Sunday morning. Place full of joggers and people practicing tai chi. Enjoyed watching the old French men playing chess. The gardens are a must the place has a real atmosphere.

Great for children. My grandchild adored going here to the playground. You pay a minimal sum to enter, 2-3 euro I think, and we stayed for a couple of hours. Also he had his first pony ride.
Wonderful to sit and relax in.
DIVINE. Beautiful place to spend an afternoon and maybe do a picnic! Especially during a weekend. I really recommend not to miss a visit to this gardens!

My Favourite. Luxembourg Garden is one of my favourite places in Paris, could be the most favourite. The garden is a place where you can just put your headphones on, and enjoy the scenery while relaxing your mind and soul. The garden is huge actually, you can have a walk in the garden between the big trees. You can also relax there watching the birds or the small lake enjoying the calm and peace of the place. Many people go there for running and practicing some other sports. There are few small shops there if you would like a drink or a snack. Truely recommend for people looking for peace of mind for sometime in this busy world we are living.

Pretty in the rain. Our visit was cut short due to pouring rain but it is easy to see the attraction of the gardens. Absolutely beautiful and would have liked to relax in the gardens with a good book and a baguette!

Lovely park. A beautiful place to bring your lunch and sit and eat. Chairs are scattered throughout the park..Flowers were in bloom in September and the area was quite pretty to see..We always stop there and eat our crepes bought nearby..
Quiet Space. These gardens are colourful, with lovely borders, lawns and a large pond. A great spot to relax in, even to eat lunch in.
Beautiful. The gardens are beautiful and I love how the parks in Paris have chairs all around for people to sit in and relax or just enjoy the view.
Beautiful Park. While there isn't much to do or see, just go to surround yourself in the beauty by the fountain. A nice rest stop or read a book.

belle. gorgeous floral displays and ponds, sculptures and fountains. lots of chairs scattered across the huge gardens so you can stop and rest in this tranquil place, a refuge from the city outside its fence. resturants available or picnic if you prefer.

Wonderful formal park gardens. We stayed quite close to the gardens and walked through them every day. Beautiful formal and informal plantings. Well used by the French who obviously love the green space and quiet spots throughout the gardens.

Cool respite. An uncharacteristic heat wave hit while we were in Paris, and the gardens were the perfect place to seek relief! Amidst the beautiful floral gardens, my daughter I found chairs in the shade near a gorgeous fountain and enjoyed our books. We loved watching families picnic, children play, tourists like ourselves gawk, and all enjoy the beauty of the landscape and architecture.

Stunning gardens with exquisite Luxembourg Palace as Backdrop. We strolled through here on a beautiful September day enjoying the stunning flowerbeds all planted in yellows and purples . There was an interesting exhibition on exotic plants and how they were first brought over and cultivated in France, just at the front of the Palace and free to wander around. Kids were playing with boats on the lake, couples sitting at tables playing pétanque, people playing boules and tennis and others just relaxing on loungers. There are enormous rows of topiaried trees at one end that look somewhat surreal. A definite MUST SEE, highly recommended, oasis of calm and tranquility within the bustling city.

Gorgeous gorgeous gorgeous. Very popular public gardens with large area for families (playground, trike racing, picnic area, etc.), another area for visitors with dogs, etc. Huge pond where locals sail their miniature remote-controlled boats. Plenty of serene walking paths. Best: hundreds and hundreds of chairs and benches to welcome a long, leisurely stay. The day we were there we watched a big group of locals playing the French version of Bocce Ball, called Petanque. So quaint and picturesque! You can get fresh crepes made on the spot at a little stand in the park. Only thing missing was waterfountains, which they might have had over in the family area.
Loved the boats on the pond!. Lovely walk and especially enjoyed renting a little boat to race around on the pond. Very clean and a nice respite from the city streets.

Wonderful park. We stayed at a hotel a block away from Luxembourg Gardens and we visited on two different mornings. It is such a lovely place to walk around, or sit and enjoy. There's a great little coffee shack with good espresso and treats. I highly recommend visiting Luxembourg Gardens to see the beauty of it, but also for great people watching!

Wonderful place to relax, have a picnic or a romantic time with that special person.. Jordin de Luxemburg was recommended by a friend and we have been there several times during our stay in Paris. It has a nice small lake Palace, many gardens, free music performances.

Best Day in Paris. It was cold and overcast but still my favorite day because the Jardins du Luxembourg were so wonderful. I had a great wine, bread and cheese lunch at the cafe in the park. The pond with the boats is the quintessential park spot in Paris. The people was was Excellent with a capital E. Go there, eat there, sit there.

A Great Place for a Leisurely Stroll. I can only envy Parisians for their access to these beautiful gardens in the middle of such a huge city. The Luxembourg Gardens are gorgeous and I can't imagine they would disappoint in any season. Not to be missed!
Beautiful. A wonderful place to sit and take in the beautiful scenery. Loved the gardens, really nothing to dislike here

A lovely place to stroll. Unfortunatley, it was raining for much of our visit, but we managed to find some nice sheltered spots during the showers and then keep walking. A wonderful way to spend an afternoon in Paris!

where the Parisians go. Lovely to see Paris families enjoying Spring sunshine on their weekend - children sailing yachts on the lake, couples playing petanque, a choir singing under the trees, and all around people sunning themselves on the green chairs

How to become Parisian?. Lovely walk in here with my husband during sunset. We sat on the chairs around the pool like the Parisian enjoying the sunset. This is one of the best place and thing to do I like about Paris.

Depends on the weather. A delightful spot, particularly on a fine day in spring or summer. The flowerbeds are outstanding. The Luxembourg Palace (housing the French Senate) a fitting backdrop. You could combine a visit to the gardens with one to the nearby Pantheon.

Medici fountain with champagne and strawberries. My husband and I went here on our first wedding anniversary, it is beautiful and the Medici Fountain is picture perfect. Take a picnic and a bottle of wine, take your time and enjoy yourself.
peaceful. Great place to escape the hustle and bussle of the city, just sit and watch the world go by and Paris walks home.

Gorgeous gardens, great people-watching. A sunny Sunday in Luxembourg Gardens is a little piece of heaven - kids playing with their sailboats in the huge ponds, people of every age strolling, sitting, gazing, kissing, snoozing, laughing, gardens a blaze of rich colour...don't miss it!
Lovely for walking or photos. The gardens were on my radar to see mostly because in 4 trips to Paris I had never been there. They were really pretty, and we were very glad we wandered over there.
Very beautiful gardens. It is a must to go there when you are in Paris. You will have to sit there as long as you want and enjoy this magical picture.
Beautiful gardens with a layed back appeal. There was a band playing the day we toured the gardens. You could spend all day with bread, cheese, and wine and just relax here.
Go there on Sunday. So many locals go there and just relax on Sunday, it was fun to watch them enjoy the life. Made me think how hectic we live in US.

Beautiful park, but packed. The Luxembourg Gardens are beautifully maintained, and it's fun to see all the Parisians at play, or relaxing on the grass. We went on a Sunday, and the place is packed. I wouldn't say it's a must-see, but if you're in the Saint Germaine area, stop by. There's a long line to get into the museum here that wrapped around the block, so I didn't even attempt that.
Beautiful. Just beautiful, impeccably maintained gardens, with the palace in the background! The day we were there the paths around the garden were very dusty, glad we wore closed shoes!
nice lively park. Great garden for relaxing on numerous free standing chairs,boating lake,childrens theatre,parisiens playing boules and chess.

A must in Paris.. These gardens are the most beautiful. It is worth visiting to see their grandeur and admire the magnificence of the garden. Used by the Parisienne community as a place of recreation.
Wonderful on a sunny Sunday. Loved the atmosphere with hundreds of joggers, people playing tennis, men playing chess and children having pony rides
A haven in Paris. A chance to see Parisians at play - men playing petanque or chess, children playing in playgrounds, couples walking in the park, workers having lunch in a natural environment.
Overwhelming beauty. The gardens were stunning. Watching both tourists and locals stroll, sit, sunbathe was a real treat. We were fortunate to see the flowers fully in bloom.

Beautiful. Beautiful garden, its a little bit out of the way so bring your walking shoes, but its free. Its really just a nice park. You can rent these cool little toy sail boats and play with them in the fountain. Kids love it.

So French. Love the Luxenberg gardens on the weekend. Full of families playing more than 10 different sports from cricket to tennis, plus lots of lovers, dancing, people eating in the cafes and enjoying the small lake full of tiny sail boats. A beautiful French experience.
Gorgeous Gardens to wile away the hours in. This place was beautiful, we went and had our breakfast on a park bench twice while we stayed in Paris.

Beautiful expanse of plants,water features and statues.. We had lunch there by the water of the pond several times. The outer path around the Gardens are usually used by people running. Quite often musical events at the Bandstand and lots of chairs to just sit and read. Can be quite bumpy for wheelchairs in places.
Always lovely!. I make sure to always come here to relax and people-watch on a sunny day. Endless walking too. There are cheap, clean toilets here as well - hard to find in Paris!

Take a stroll and act like a local. This park is one of the most beautiful spots in paris. The locals make a point of walking through it as often as they can. A great place for people watching, you will find families, men and women in professional attire, teenagers playing tennis or walking home from school here. Beautiful flowers and works of art are all around and occasionally you will catch art exhibitions on display at this park. Grab an ice cream cone or a parisian picnic and sit on a bench. This is a true gem.The park closes at 7:00 Pm.

Good place to sit and have a picnic. The gardens here are really beautiful, quiet and relaxing. Close to the senate building there are ornate statues and perfectly arranged flowerbeds. Walk 2 minutes from there past statues to somewhere quieter and more natural to eat a sandwich bought from one of the nearby bakeries.If you have kids as well head to the South part of the park which has large play areas.

A garden paradise in a great location. We sat in the gardens overlooking the palace with wine, cheese and some bread. Wonderful gardens, formal, but also a great range of seating and sculpture. The locals seem to enjoy it and there men playing boce and uni students catching up on their day. Relaxed atmosphere.
heavenly. If you have the time after walking through the garden, sit on one of the many chairs and just observe the beauty. The colors are spectacular.

Nice park. If you're up for a run or scroll throught a nice park, this is a good one to do near the Latin quarter, south of the Notre Dame/Louvre area. There were high school students, eldery, tourists, runners all using the park when we were there. The foundations / statues were nice too.
Beautiful. Great place to spend either some quiet time away from the city noise or to let your kids run around in the woods.

Exciting Relation. A wonderful and huge Parisian park. The gardens, the pond where kids sail boats, and expansive outdoor cafe, create the perfect setting for people watching while relaxing. One goes through lovely areas getting there.
Luxembourg Gardens. a refuge in the busy city with fountains, flowers and lawn chairs scattered thoughout for some quiete reflection.

Best park in Paris. We love these expansive gardens for their gentle, peaceful quality. They're a perfect break from the routine speed of Parisian life. We grabbed a lunch from a nearby boulangerie and eat it on a bench in the park, listening to birds and watching kids being kids.

Charming and grand all at once. Great for people watching, enjoying the beauty of manicured nature, and taking a rest from walking around. Sit around the fountain on one of the reclining green chairs, watch the old men play chess or petanque, watch children ride ponies, read a book in a secluded corner, marvel at the landscape architecture, the quiet space in the middle of a city, even when it's full of people.
Lovely park. A large park with many flowers and fountains. It's a great place for a stroll or to just take a break, relax, people watch and soak up the beauty
fabulous place. everything is gorgeous, go here on a sunny day and take a picnic, the gardens are so relaxing. its like going back in time.

Beautiful!. We were staying very close to these gardens so I came here for an early morning jog. It was beautiful! lots of joggers and the flowers and statues are beautiful. We came for an afternoon stroll and the ambience is completely different. Children floating their toy boats in the pond in the centre, people lounging in the sun. Locals playing a snooker type game in an area reserved for it. Very active and vibrant.

Quintessentially Paris. This place could be right out of a painting. I went at the beginning of Autumn at the end of a warm day and was absolutely beautiful with pebbled paths, boxed hedges and French activities buzzing all over the place. Great place for people watching, with dancing lessons in the rotunda, picnics along the grass and kids taking pony rides around the park. Take some pastries and red wine for a truly Parisian experience!

A must, must see. This garden is so wonderful. Full of families and individuals using the beautiful grounds for enjoyment. Great cafe and restaurant, w/c facilities and plenty of free comfortable seating throughout. Most spectacular landscaping and palace.

Feel like Louis XIV. Most beautiful garden of Paris I guess. Full of 17-18th C buildings and statues. Big ponds where children play with little sailboats. On week-ends go for a jog in the morning together with the Parisians.
Favotite Gardens!. It's a little escape from the busy Parisian life! Great place in the summer for reading a book, jogging or just hanging out with friends!

Absolutely beautiful, but extremely crowded when the weather is good!. The gardens are so romantic! We just loved strolling around and people watching, taking the atmosphere in! Having visited the gardens on an afternoon of a Sunday When it was absolutely heaving I would love to go there for an early morning stroll! One of my top spots of the trip!

Something for Everyone!. These gardens and the palace are exquisite and oh so French! There are also playgrounds, bocce ball, pony rides, and tables for the chess players. A lovely place for a pleasant stroll or a picnic lunch.
Great way to relax in Paris. The grounds are beautiful and you can enjoy the park with the natives. It can be a wonderful refresher on a busy trip. Comfortable furniture for reading.

What a treat. Do what the locals do........take your lunch and people watch. Plenty of benches/seats. The garden itself was superb....planting, statues and central ornamental boating lake with kids enjoying thelittle sailing boats.

Good but very dusty. French knew beauty and they did a great job. What I cant stand is how little grass there is. You walk through the entire park on gravel/rocks/dirt. Every time there is a light gust you get covered in dust. Sat here to relax and ended up having my camera and me in need of a shower. The guide books really make this place seem magical. Its - ok - if you've seen Central, Regents or any other big parks then this will not blow you away. Just nice.
Beautiful gardens. If you have time and are in the area, definitely worth passing through the gardens or even sitting around and just enjoying the scenery!
lovely place to spend the afternoon. I spent an afternoon here and ate my lunch, read my book, it's a great place to relax, people watch and soak up the culture of Paris!
Such a peaceful place. Beautiful gardens and fountains. Definitely a nice spot to just take a peaceful walk or read a book somewhere in the middle of your busy touristy day.
nothing special. There is nothing special. if you want to have a rest its good. No need to visit . dont waste your time
very romantic. luxembourge gardens was like a piece of art for us we spent there half day enjoying the art of putting flowers coulors together in a breath taking view
Beautiful and serene. Beautiful garden in very pleasing and serene sorroundings. Come early 9'ish and enjoy the crisp air and smell the flowers.

Gorgeous and relaxing. We loved relaxing in the gardens. It was so lush and peaceful. The only annoying thing about this area is there is only one spot to sit on the grass which is in full sun. You will be whisked off the grounds by a marshall with a whistle. A great visit.
Great place to walk or run. Lovely gardens; many runners and walkers during the day. Interesting historic area. Need coins for toilet access. Food available.
Great place to relax. After being in crowds at the big tourist sites, it was nice to relax in the beatiful gardens. There were plenty of comfortable chairs where one can sit and enjoy the views.
Quiet, classic refuge in the heart of the city. Great place to relax, read a book, and feel like a Parisian. Take in the sun and people watch! Also a good place to jog without interruption.
Lovely oasis. Nice garden facing the palace and Pantheon. It is nice to walk from Seine passing churces and so on.
beautiful area to soak in the views. the gardens were stunning especially witht the buildings adding to the overall effect. Plenty of avenues to explore and enjoy even in the heat of summer time.

Simply wonderful!. I went here my last morning on Paris as my flight was in the late afternoon. Words cannot describe how wonderfully relaxing and peaceful the gardens were. As it started to rain I could not walk throughout the whole garden, however I was able to sit near the cafe and people watch.I will be going back to Paris this June and I plan on going back again. I highly reccommend going here and spending a relaxing afternoon. The cafe is also good!
relaxing. quiet, beautiful gardens - classical statues were very interesting - the Medici fountain is unusual but still beautiful

The place to relax and enjoy the gardens.. More beautiful than the Tuilerie gardens. A simply wonderful place to relax and enjoy the beauty. When we were visiting on Sunday there was a big band at the band stand. It seemed that all of Paris was there to enjoy the music and the beautiful gardens. Do as the Parisians, buy a baguette with a bottle of wine and have lunch.
Lovely Garden for a relaxing stroll. A great place to chill out in the city. Old men playing chess and Parisians chilling out chatting. Little pond in front of the palace which has ducks in.
Relaxing time. We went here on the weekend, lots of parisians to watch. Good place to relax for a bit and let your feet rest.

Magic. So beautiful, such a wonderful day at the Gardens. Really nice staff. I just loved this place and the surrounding area is nice too.
A very memorable day. Loved it!

The best way to enjoy a sunny day in Paris. What a place to "feel" Paris! The colorful gardens,a central pond with kids and their families pushing toy sailboats with long poles to watch them glide across to the other side on a Sunday afternoon. Sit on a chair, put up your feet and watch the world go by! The flowering gardens and couples necking on the side- so romantic. Walk along the tree covered paths and stop to watch the band play. After you wander out of the park, stop at a cafe and watch the organ player. A perfect way to spend a Sunday in Paris...
cool. Very nice looking garden, with big curtain just in the middle. Also there are free chairs everywhere, you can take one and put it how do you want.

Perfect spot to relax, people-watch and picnic. The gardens are a lovely break from the busy tourist areas. Take a picnic, pull up a chair and enjoy people-watching in these lovely gardens. If you go for an evening picnic, as we did, be aware that the gardens close at dusk - 8pm in early September. The police blow their whistles and start moving people out about 15 minutes prior to the closure.

Beautiful, relaxing and colourful. It was a beautiful day when we visited, and the park was full of families enjoying the sunshine, little boys sailing boats in the grand basin, and couples wandering about the flowerbeds. I especialy enjoyed the Medici fountain. Whole place was spotlessly clean and felt very safe, a perfect place to enjoy a picnic.
Worth the visit.. This was my fourth trip to Paris but my first visit to the gardens. Wish I'd gone before. One of the most beautiful places in all of Paris.
Perks of royalty, available to the public.. Bring something to drink while you sit and enjoy the pool and fountains. Leave time to walk around and enjoy all the statues.

Lush green, relaxing and fun. Lots of Parisiens strolling in the garden. Little children playing with their boats in the pond. Beautiful and green. Visit the gardens for some quite time in this busy city!

A serene oasis in hectic Paris. I was completely amazed at the beauty and tranquility of this oasis in busy Paris. The gardens were full of people simply relaxing around the central reflecting pool. Adults and kids alike were relaxing and enjoying the beauty of this magnificent, and large, park. There was even a small orchestra playing and kids sailing small boats in the pool. Great place to enjoy a quite respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris.

R&R on a summer day. It was perfect weather for walking -- sunny but not too hot -- and I strolled into Luxembourg Gardens. A riot of colour welcomed me -- purple, yellow and white flowers everywhere, to complement the bright sky. People sunning themselves , kids with their sailboats at the pond. This was a quieter place in Paris, away from the throngs of August tourists.I walked over to the Marionette Theatre , open is summer with two shows in the afternoon, pony rides , chess players , boules pitches, tennis and basket ball courts, an impromptu game of football. Lunch is available in two restaurants .The gardens are impeccably maintained , dotted with beautiful statues of famous French notables. There is also an apiary and orangerie. Avenues of trees grace the sounthern end of the gardens. The French Senate and the official home of its President are within the gardens as well -- at the Palais de Luxembourg and Petit Luxembourg. The Musee du Luxembourg is across the road on rue de Vaugirard.A wonderful place to relax in beautiful, salubrious surroundings, where everyone seems to be happy.

Jardins de Luxembourg : a bit disappointed .. I visited “Jardins de Luxembourg” in a sunny afternoon last July with my family .At first sight, a beautiful park, with lots of flowers and nice atmosphere .Unfortunately, things got very disappointing at the time we needed to use the restrooms : you had to pay in order to use them and they were extremely dirty !Also, the restaurant inside the park had good food, but it was really very expensive, well above parisian standards, especially the beverages .In a city with so many amazing attractions such as Paris, I think “Jardins de Luxembourg” stands below the average .
Picnic lunch. We visit Luxembourg Gardens every visit to Paris weather permitting. There was a jazz band playing in the afternoon. Very pleasant way to enjoy lunch in the sunshine.

Beats the parks in my neighborhood. The time of my visit was an incredible combination of all things yellow: flowers, leaves, herbs etc. Excellent place to relax after a day of walking in Paris. Time to sit on a chair and watch the small windboats floating in the pond, birds eating from hands of more frequent visitors, people promenading.

Lovely Afternoon in the Jardin!. We made an extra effort to set aside a couple hours one afternoon to grab a bagette, some cheese & a bottle of wine to enjoy in the park. It was wonderful & a nice break from all the walking around Paris!
A lovely place to relax! . My boyfriend & I ate our lunch in this park. A nice place to spend a sunny day & a short walk from the Latin Quarter.
Well worth the visit. This site was not a far walk from our hotel and is a beautiful place to take a walk or lounge or enjoy all the statuary. Lovely!

Great spot to walk. You will be competing with locals for sunbathing. I really enjoyed walking around the gardens and taking in one of the city's best parks. When the sun is out, the park fills with locals all trying to get a little sun. Great for photos if you don't mind a lot of extra bodies in your shot.

Shhhhh.... Hesitant to review this as it is the perfect Parisian park away from the tourists. Delightful, easy on the feet and with a great open air cafe. Don't want to say more as it will turn it into another Tuilleries - not there is anything wrong with that but you will only find locals in the Luxembourg Gardens.
sail boats. I loved the statues of the french queens, but our children enjoyed sailing boats in the pond. It is a lovely way to spent afternoon with kids.

Jardin du Luxembourg. We visited Paris in August 8 to 15, 2012 and stayed near the Luxembourg Gardens. The place is beautiful and we found a great place to stop and relax. You can walk around and admire the gardens and the statues, or you can do like us, and just sit around the pond and relax while watching the children play with their sailboats.

a jewel/national treasure.. a beautiful public park. great chairs (clever how they furnished the park with 2 styles of chairs -- one straight back, one recliner -- too heavy to be easily stolen. a wonderful place for a picnic, to read, or just to sit and people watch.
Delightful. Terrific place to wander through, relax for an hour with a book, or to enjoy your picnic lunch. We did all three! Beautiful oasis in the heart of the city.

Relaxing afternoon.. Took the metro here, but it was not easy. Encountered a closed station (La Chapelle/Gare du Nord) near Montmartre, which offered a direct line (B) down to the Luxembourg Gardens, but we worked our way around this problem.It was very relaxing to sit by the lake and watch little kids sail boats.We had used the last of our carnet 10-ticket pack, so needed to buy some more to get back to the Hilton. No human at the station, and the ticket machine would not accept our US credit card (magnetic strip rather than a chip). This was the only place we had this problem, although we had been aware of the possibility. So we walked north to the St.-Michel Notre Dame station. If you are adventurous and read maps well, the Paris metro is a great way to get around.

Grand But Not Enough Grass. The Luxembourg Gardens are well worth visiting. But be prepared for a distinct lack of grass. Much of the walking area is sand and gravel. I am not from the U.S., but if I were to compare Central Park in Manhattan with Luxembourg Gardens, I would pick Central Park hands down. More grass, more varied landscape, more things to explore and the water is more beautiful.
Our Favorite!. So many great things to see in this wonderful gardens - the Palais is beautiful as well! This is a must see in Paris!

very pretty, but not a must-see. I don't mean to denigrate the Luxembourg gardens because they are very pretty, but there are many other things to see in Paris that should come first.And they need to have a serious bird-droppings-removal campaign. You can hardly sit on any of the benches!

MAGNIFICENT GARDENS. We spend there four hours in this clasic formal gardens .We loved the picturesque paths with so many beautiful flowers and sculptures.This a great place for all ages.It is the best place for a picnic in Paris and for people watchting.The kids were having fun putting little sailing boats in the lake.
Quiet respite. This park has greenery, shade, places to sit and watch the world go by and you can just imagine artists working here. It makes a great resting place.
Come and enjoy everyday life of Parisian. Beautiful,big, peaceful, in the middle of crowded Paris. Come and see and enjoy the life of middle class Parisian, Pretty relaxing and enjoyable

Absolutely beautiful!. A lovely and picturesque place to relax, read, people watch, soak in the sun, stroll or simply nap. The flowers are still in bloom and the trees are meticulously manicured. A must if you're in Paris!
Perfect for a picnic!. Lovely gardens in the grounds of the palace, get some bread and cheese and relax :) Very popular lunch spot.

Worth a visit. If you fancy a quiet stroll and need to get away from the heat and pace of the Champs Elysee this is the place to do it. Tranquil gardens with people sitting around on the grass having a quiet picnic or reading a book beneath the trees.

Lovely!. This specific garden wasn't on my initial itinerary, but our stay in Paris was rather long and we had some extra time toward the end of our trip. I am so glad we decided to come to Luxembourg Gardens that Sunday. They had a band in a gazebo playing old school French favorites, children racing boats in the large pond, people playing what appeared to be some sort of semi-professional tennis match, and lovely statues scattered throughout. It was a great experience.

The most Beautiful Parisian Garden. Very Green & Flowery :) Has different parts and is wonderful to spend a full day; especially for a family with kids because of the great number of activities they can involve in. I loved the few hours we spent there and took plenty of pictures. I would love to relax there in my next visit.

Extraordinary. We visited on a beautiful day in early September. We bought a lunch to go on a side street, and ate it on a park bench. The gardens were spectacular and so well maintained. We could have spent the rest of the afternoon just walking around, but we had the rest of Paris to see.......
Nice place to hang out on grass in the shade. Paris in August was packed full of tourists and quite hot. The park was a great place to sit in the shade, have a picnic and relax
goregeous. whats not to like a haven in the city for all ages, area for children, cafe to sip coffee, rose garden and just fun to watch people.

Fantastic spot on a Sunday!. My husband & I visited the park on a Sunday with seemingly the rest of Paris, and the place is wonderful - there are rides & games for kids, small pond to launch a boat on, and multitude of benches to sit on and watch the way Parisians enjoy their weekends. Great afternoon hang-out spot :)
Rest. Very nice park in the middle of the city, where you can rest for some minutes and continue the journey

beautiful. Go early if you want to find a seat on a nice day. These are seriously amazing gardens. Everyone just sits around reading or watching the world go by.. There is pony rides for little kids a playground, little sail boats to hire and just lots to see. Really special place.
Cute!. During my walk in the garden, we stumbled upon a folk band playing in a gazebo, mini sailboat races, and palm trees! Lovely spot for a stroll.

Beautiful. Rent a little toy sail boat and enjoy a day in the park. Can be busy in some areas, but head off to the west side near Rue Guynemer and find an empty bench or one of the classic chairs and catch some zzzz;s.

Fantastic. If you have the time spend a day there. It is most amazing place of serenity and tranquility.we found this amazing in the middle of summer even at 10pm at night it is just joyous. We really loved this snippet of French city life great stuff
Lacks grass. As usual inParis , a garden without grass! Trees, fountains & flowers. But you walk on dusty gravel and sit on metal chairs in the sun!

Beautiful oasis in Paris!. Whether or not you are on a budget in Paris, everyone likes things that are free, and this is one of the most beautiful and peaceful parks that I have visited. The flowers are beautiful and it is very relaxing to sit back and take in some beauty after walking miles in Paris. I love to see the children sail the boats in the water and people watch as well!

A favorite destination for us. We love to come here, it looks as well kept as ever. On our trip to Paris 18 years ago our then 4 yr old daughter woke up with the chicken pox....oh my goodness! We were staying in a very pleasant, small Left Bank hotel (Les Marronniers) and had tokeep her as best contained as we could :(Finally after 4 days we went walking to the Luxembourg Gardens and what a wonderful relief for her and for us! While keeping her off the playground (you had to pay to enter that as I recall) she was still able to sit in the stroller and loved watching the fountain and the little boats being floated by other children... We always return here and have great memories of this truly beautiful place.
Beautiful. The quintessential french garden. Lots of different areas to relax or study in. Tennis courts and small boats can be rented cheaply for kids.
A beautiful retreat in the middle of Paris. We were very impressed with the condition of the gardens and also the layout. The whole place looked amazing the time we went there which was in May.

Walk through if you have a chance - really beautiful gardens. If you have the time, sit on the grass, bring your lunch and enjoy! Take in the scenary. You won't regret it. It's unlike any other park. Beautiful!!
lovely. lovely gardens to walk around. my partner ran throught them every day along with many of the french people.

really really nice. my hubby and i strolled though and it was really nice tons of people out soaking up some parisian air and just enjoying life. It was really beautiful..even though teh weather taht day was unseasinably cold..we enjoyed it all teh same :)
Very peaceful. The gardens were not very crowded which is unusal for this time of the year. Very well kept! Parisians like to jog and exercise there.
Try the sailing boats!. A great place to chill in this most vibrant of cities - try the boats or just relax on a chair in the gardens

Quintessential Stroll. If you really want to be Parisian, go for a stroll here. While away a bit of time people watching & relaxing to the beat of a slower "joie de vivre" lifestyle. The neighborhoods around it are my favorite to make my base at a boutique hotel &/or eat a great meal at both a famous restaurant or cafe or the next great one yet to be discovered.
A great place to walk and picnic. Our hotel was across he treet from this so in the morning we would get our breakfast and take it here . It was a wonderful wy to begin the dy.

Garden of Paradise. One of the best parks I've ever visited. Great place to sit and relax with friends and family. There is a huge pool for sailing model boats for a fee. Luxembourg Palace can be found at the very heart of the Garden and is quite a beauty.

Beautiful and tranquil. We wanted to find a nice, quiet spot to rest from all the touristy visits and commercial areas, so we were simply delighted to have stumbled upon the Luxembourg Gardens.Fabulous photo opportunities with the gardenscape and the sculptures, and a great place to stroll a lap or two without the crowds of other attractions. Best of all, it's free to enter.

Beautiful and relaxing. The Luxembourg Gardens are some of the prettiest gardens in Paris, well worth a visit. The large gardens—actually a sort of big park—are owned by the French Senate rather than the city of Paris, and are a great place to relax as well as being pretty to look at.The park is extremely well tended and landscaped. It is relatively quiet because of its large size (except for the voices of children and the wind in the trees), and it is filled with chairs in which you are welcome to sit and relax for as long as you wish. The area south of the Luxembourg Palace (where the French Senate meets) is very photogenic, although technically you are not supposed to photograph the palace itself without a permit (the Senate worries about inappropriate uses of photos—guards may whistle at you if they catch you sneaking photos of the palace). There's a pond where kids can rent small toy boats to sail. The flowers are regularly replaced so that there's always something beautiful in bloom.There are areas of grass where you can sit, and areas where you can't. There are many semi-hidden areas behind the trees that are extremely relaxing to visit. There's a puppet theater for children, as well as a very nice playground (paid admission, but it's not expensive). There are tennis courts, pétanque fields, a pony ride, a museum that hosts temporary expositions, a beekeeping area, jogging trails, a gazebo with occasional concerts, and more. I consider this to be one of the most relaxing and rejuvenating spots in the city. There are some snack bars and restaurants if you are hungry. If you choose to simply sit and read a book for a few hours, nobody will disturb you. If you have kids who are becoming irritable after hours of touring the city, the extensive playground might be just the thing to put them in a good mood. The park is nice enough that it justifies going there specifically to see it. Best to visit while you're already in the Latin Quarter, just for the sake of efficiency.

Great for kids to have a break in Paris. We visited Paris with 13 and 8 yo sons. This was the place to go to unwind. The children's playground is excellent and the sailboats that can be rented to float in the main fountain area were very reasonably priced. There is plenty of shaded area even in midday but location even more fabulous as sun is setting.

Great way to relax from touring!. This Jardin/Garden is splendor! Flowers, watching children with sailboat races, chairs to lounge, Medici fountain, and the palace in the background. There was a lovely jazz band playing in the background making for a perfect rest area!
Nice gardens and palace... but. Gardens and palace were lovely, but you had to opay to use the childrens swings?? didn't use them, and there was no queues s you had to pay...

You have to go. The most beautiful outdoor space in Paris. The Gardens are an absolute Mecca for tourists and Parisians alike. Go on a warm day and take a picnic with you. Sit by the fountain and watch the children send their model yachts (hired from a nearby stall) across the fountain. It is the most relaxing place to sit on a warm Parisian autumn afternoon - though don't sit on the grass, you will be moved on by the Parks Police if you do so - there are though thousands of public deckchairs so there is plenty of space to sit down without going onto the grass.

Iconic and peaceful. A very aesthetic and relaxing place used by locals and tourists alike. We really enjoyed the walk through, watching children with their boats in the fountain and people doing their early morning exercises under the shade of trees. It is close to St Suplice and the Pantheon on the other side. Pull up one of the green chairs and have something scrummy to eat from the food market close by and you will have a wonderful, relaxing time I assure you!

Pleasant views and relaxing. The flowerbeds are beautiful. We enjoyed sitting on a park bench in the shade of some trees after a purchase at the ice cream stand. There was a board with a map by the entrance of the park, but it did not show the location of the Statue of Libery model--we had to keep wandering around until we finally found it.

Always a delight to visit. This garden is always a delight to visit. The palace with pond in front of it and balustrades on the sides are lovely. Don't miss the 'Fountain of the Observatory' at the Southern end of the garden. It's one of the most beautiful fountains in the world.

Great Afternoon in the Gardens. So much to see in the Gardens. We loved walking around, looking at the various sculptures, had a coffee & a macaroon at an outdoor cafe' in the gardens. There was a building that had different types of artwork featured in it. And the men outside playing chess had the guys very intrigued, watching them. It was a nice day out & a lot of fun being outside with so many things to do there. It's a beautiful place to spend some time.

Can' t miss it. This is Paris' Central Park. a grat palce to a picnick, a quiet walk, to read a book or to teke a nap after a long walk. The model to the Statue of Liberty is in this garden. Can't miss it!

Very Pretty. This park somehow combines gravel, grass, foliage, floral arrangements and green metal chairs to create a gorgeous communal space right in the middle of Paris. Come sun with the locals or snap away at the numerous photo opportunities that abound. Mind the sandwiches from the in-park cafe, though. Spongy yet firm bread with stingy fillings. I was hungry and I still threw half of mine away!

A great place to run in the mornings. I love to run loops of the garden in the mornings. It is a popular place for locals as well as visitors to also run. No matter the season there is always something beautiful to see.
Beautiful. Popped to the Luxembourg Gardens for a walk and a (very expensive) drink. A truly stunning location but the cafe was ruined by a rude waiter and the astronomical price of drinks.

Pretty Park. Nice break from the main tourist attractions. Easy to access from Metro. We visited at the end of the trip and would hav enjoyed having more time to explore the quaint area that is more typical and livable Paris. Wandering about the gardens was very relaxing.

Beautiful gardens and park. We got there as side trip of Panthéon since it is so close to the Panthéon.
But, We are very impressed by the nice garden and layout of the park.
It definitely worths the visit.
Relaxation. Paris is hectic. Make sure to plan some time with your feet up! Enter this garden, where families, kids and tourists are everywhere. Lots of green space, chairs for reading and relaxing.

Excellent place to relax and absorb Parisian lifestyle. Beautiful gardens, tennis, pony rides, benches in sun or shade...very picturesque, near the Pantheon which makes a nice stroll. Bathrooms at tennis shop....40 euro cents per person. Keep walking past Pantheon to visit Cathedrale d'Etienne and continue to the arene de Lutece (old Roman arena)...all of this is walking distance and a nice stroll. Take Jussieu subway station from arena and continue your journey...

Very busy spot. But not for families with older children.. This was high on my list of places to go and as such was rather disappointing. We cycled there on a very hot day and found the park so busy that there was little space to sit away from the sun. Walking round there was little to look at and little to do. The children's play area had a 2.5â¬ entrance fee which was a nice touch! We stayed for an hour which was long enough, I wouldn't go out of my way to go back as there are far nicer places to visit.
An oasis. This set of gardens is an impressive oasis in Paris. Though take a picnic the cafe is extortionate!!

Great Place for Kids (and adults too). While travelling with family, we discovered the play area for kids at Luxembourg Gardens. Wow, what heaven for little ones. Our 2 1/2 yr. old grandson had a ball several days in a row. Many of the play structures are different than in California. The carousel was fun for him but trying to catch the rings was frustrating for a little guy. Plenty of space to run around, swing, climb and just be an energetic kid. Lots of places for parents and grandparents to sit and watch. Highly recommend it. PS: The gardens are wonderful too and as others said, you can go to relax, drink wine, have a picnic and read.

Space, flowers and music. If you visit check the times - it closes about 6.00pm. The gardens are free and a delight. Old men playing chess under a canopy, an octagonal pond where children hire coloured yachts to sail on, a bandstand - we saw tea dancing in Victorian dress, really nice coloured borders eg a yellow and white theme. Very genteel and relaxing. Plenty of chairs to sit on.

Must go if you enjoy nature and want to relax!. This was probably my favourite place in all of Paris that I visited. The gardens are so beautiful and there are many places to sit and just take it in. It almost feels like you're out of the city when you're at Luxembourg. So for those of you who find it daunting to be in the midst of so many tourists in the most popular tourist hotspots, take a break from it all and head to Luxembourg Gardens.
Don't miss these gardens. Beautiful- these gardens will make you fall in love with Paris with sculptures and fountains. We enjoyed walking through Luxembourg gardens in a soft rain.

Parisenne for the day. We visited on a sunny August Sunday afternoon and the place was buzzing. This is a great place to soak up the Parisienne atmosphere and watch the world go by.
Great gardens, free deckchairs by the thousand and a thoroughly great place to spend a couple of hours relaxing.

Beautiful even in winter time. A must see if you are in Paris. It was stunning even in the middle of winter. We were lucky, the sun was out so there was a lot of people enjoying a nice sunny winter day. Of course it is een more stunning in the summer but don't miss it even if you go to Paris in one of the cold months.

A beautiful garden in the city. I like to seat there in the spring and summer time, to rest a bit from the city. I always regret there is only one place where you can walk on the grass. But besides that part, it's very relaxing, with beautiful statues and fountains. You feel so quiet in that area !
Luxembourt Gardens. Some pretty foliage, but unless you have children and want to take a rest, this is a fast walk-thru attraction.
Bread, cheese and Luxembourg Garden. This is a place to get away from everyday life and just relax and be at peace wit yourself!Bring your bread and fav cheese and sit down and just enjoy!!
Act like a Parisian not a tourist. Don't just walk through it , get a bottle of wine and a Book and plan to just sit, read, sip and enjoy a few hours of bliss !

Beautiful and realxing gardens. The gardens are big, beautiful, and well-kept. It was nice to be able to sit down and contemplate the view. When I'm travelling, I think these are the places I like the most: away from the crowds, taking in the atmosphere. I really felt at peace and on vacation.

Favorite Park in Paris. We rested here for a little while during a frantic day of sightseeing! So beautiful! All the flowers were planted in various hues of yellow--so perfectly coordinated. The Luxembourg palace represents the perfect backdrop to the park landscape. There were plenty of chairs and we saw groups of tourists and locals relaxing in the sun around the fountains. The Medici fountain was our favorite. I would love to go back and spent more time here.

Try a picnic and give your touring feet a break.. The gardens are exquisite. So fun to see the children pushing the little sailboats around the pond using sticks just like at the turn of the century.We loved getting a bottle, opened by the clerk at the "Nicolas" store and with their plastic wine glasses, we sat in the gardens and people-watched. Get a baguette, grapes, cheese, olives, whatever you'd like and make it a picnic.

Rest and recover. Fantastic gardens, with lovely walks, plenty of spots to stop and rest, some breathtaking views and a lovely relaxed atmosphere. A really great spot to unwind and relax with plenty to see and lots to observe. Loved it and will go back again and again.
Paris Oasis. Always a great spot for a picnic lunch and the perfect place to sit and give your tootsies a break while observing the natives enjoying this fabulous place. Lots to see and do here.

Just lovely. Excellent place to sit and soak up the sun, plenty of places to sit, lots of small cafes and kiosk for snacks if needed, 40cents for the toilettes but very clean. Could happily spend all day here!

Good spot to relax. We went on a really warm, sunny day and it's a good place to go and sit and relax. The restaurant seemed a bit pricey, so we skipped that (€9 for an ice cream seemed a bit much).
The park is beautifully maintained and the palace is amazing (from the outside). There's a few nice views of the city.

beautiful. beautiful and a great atmosphere.
lots of seating in chairs around so thats good
nice fountain in the middle
Breathtaking!. Absolutely beautiful mixture of gardens and sculpture. This is a great place to relax with a book or unwind at the end of a busy day.
Luxembourg gardens. Good, lots of different facillities for every age range. A great place to relax and let the world go by
Rest awhile. The last two times I was in the Gardens it rained. This time it was a perfect sunny day. So many people enjoying the weather. Sit for awhile and enjoy the flowers and flavors of Paris.

An oasis of delight. We visited Les Jardins du Luxembourg 3 times while on a three week home exchange in Paris. It is such a pleasant place to eat a picnic lunch, wander about or relax in the ubiquitous green metal chairs. The ones shaped like a recliner are really comfy and its perfectly acceptable to use a second chair to raise your feet. We spent happy hours there people-watching and reading. The flowers are splendid and the architecture delightful. On our first visit it was cool and overcast but on subsequent visits we discovered that 25-30 degrees of heat adds to the pleasure! There are several Vélib bike stations close by.

Great place for kids. We went to Luxembourg Gardens as a break from all the sight-seeing we were doing. We were travelling with our 7 year old daughter and it was time to give her a break. The area around the gardens from the metro station to the part is very nice and clean with high end children's clothing stores. The gardens themselves are like any park but there is a huge playground in the middle with probably 500 kids running around it. You have to pay to enter the playground area but the kids seemed to be having a great time in there. My daughter certainly did and it was a nice break from the museums and churches.

Great Place to rest your tired feet. Really nice park. They have lots of comfortable seats to sit down and chill out. There was a nice little boating lake where you could hire some little model yachts. Some lovely food stalls. Great place to chill out.

Well worth the visit. I would highly recommend visiting the Lixembourg Gardens as a place to unwind and enjoy some Paris sun. Whilst we were there, it was above 30 degrees, so sitting in the shade eating icecream watching the wold go by was a great way to relax after a long day of traveling. P.s don't sit on the grass, you will get told off!

Absolutly Beautiful. wow, We walked to the park late afternoon, it was wonderful with all the flowers took some beautiful pictures and really enjoyed our visit, wished had more time since it was time to close.

Nice Urban Oasis. We stayed in a hotel right across the street from this beautiful urban park, so we had the opportunity to visit it on 2 occasions while in Paris. It is indeed a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Paris. The park offers beautiful landscaping - flowers, lawns, trees, areas to sit and relax in the sun or have a little picnic. It also has waterfall, pony rides, children play area including carousel, also tennis courts, bocci lawns etc. etc. It is located in a great area where the surrounding neighbourhoods offer cafés, patisseries, shops etc. You can spend a whole afternoon in the park and a whole day or more shopping and dining in the neighbourhood. This is what Paris is really like - in this neighbourhood - much better than the usual tourist areas on the other side of the river!

A great place to spend a relaxing afternoon in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens is my favorite place in Paris. The gardens are beautiful, and it's a great place to people watch, read, or picnic. Children can still sail boats on the little pond in front of the palace, just like they did in the iconic impressionist paintings. Take some food and wine and have a picnic or find a chair and read a book. Note that sitting on the grass is only permitted in a couple areas that are marked. If you don't see a sign, stay off the grass. Clean bathrooms available for 40 cents per use.Sometimes the gardens get crowded, especially on weekends in the summer. Who wouldn't want to spend a Sunday afternoon in such a beautiful place?

Feel like a Parisian. As you sit on a bench near a flower-filled urn looking at the Luxembourg Palace of a l7th century queen, you will feel pretty royal yourself. This formal garden on the left bank is a kind of lung for Sorbonne students and neighborhood people, too. It's not that this is a place for sightseeing or a picnic under trees---in fact, it's an open garden with formal planting, not a leafy park----but you will be delighted to have seen it and to have spent some time there.
nice visit. Pretty park--a little crowded, though. It was a warm day and sitting on a bench in the shade was hard to find. Worth seeing.

A Little Bit Crowded. This is a lovely place to sit and relax and have snack or two. The gardens beautiful and look for the fountain, it really is a masterpiece, but in the afternoon was a little crowds of picnicers and sun bathers and kids and lovers... The park a great place to watch people and relax amounst flowers and fountains and sculpter. Very nice
great place to sit in the sun. if you need a moment between sites and sounds, come here and watch the kids play with their motorized boats in the fountain.
beautiful place to have a picnic. has lots of chairs to sit on and relax can be crowded on weekends Beautiful flowers, statues and fun for people watching

A beautiful area to stroll.... On my last day in Paris this was a beautiful area to relax and stroll around. We went to the Rodin Gardens first, and then walked to Luxembourg to take in the sights. The weather was perfect and we had a lovely time just people-watching.

A must visit!. Been to Paris numerous times but this was a first, the walk from the latin quarter is lovely but the acual gardens are fantastic. Take a picnic and a blanket, you could make a day of it!

Magestic. i try to find this place and initially had to start from the luxembourg museum.
This jardin smells as a blossom.
Changed my thoughtful day.
Simply wonderful. Beautifully kept gardens especially the formal ones near the palace. You cant sit on the grass but there are plenty of benches and shade

A relxing place in the middle of your day. put it in your Agenda to get your lunch from one of the fast food restaurant and eat it in luxembourg gardens with the amazing view of flowers and lake . kids can ride pony "but take care it ends at 7 p.m "
you can listen to life music in the garden entrance

Totally relaxing.. If you can put aside even half an hour for a visit to the Gardens then try and time it for the last half hour of opening. The closing time varies throughout the year so a bit of research will pay dividends.At the end of the day the metal seats are readily available. Look around and see the very precise way the regulars choose their two seats - one to relax in and the other to put their feet on!About a quarter of an hour before closing watch out for the attendants marching out to all corners of the Gardens before a whistle blowing competition to warn people the Gardens are closing.Lovely experience - good restaurants on road up to Pantheon if you want to eat after leaving.
Beatuiful. To fid dsuch an oasis in the middle of Paris was wonderful.It's a beautiful place to walk through, or to sit or just to think and it's lovely to see if used by so many people

Great playground. Excellent playground in the park. 2 Euro entry fee, to this staffed and busy playground, where the kids can play for hours and the parents rest their legs. Wonderful break from sight seeing. Rue Vavin that leads to the park from the metro is full of wonderful kids wear shops...a great place to treat the kids to some shopping!
Brilliant. lovely area to walk through. Has seats all over the garden with trees for shade. Beautiful place to visit
A peaceful retreat. This was a few blocks from where we were staying and we very much enjoyed going through it as well as just sitting around and people watching.
Luxurious Luxembourg. Lovely at any time of the year. Take the TIME OUT tour of the statues of famous women. Watch the ducks paddle the puddles in the rain. Sit and absorb the beauty.

The best kid's garden around. We live in Paris and this is the best stop for kids when they are tired of site seeing. We stroll through the gardens to the playground and pay a few euro for them to go and play for an hour or so, while my friends and I sip an espresso and talk. When the small sailboats are out in the pond, they are worth it to rent for a few euro to push around the pond for a bit. The kids love it and it seems as if you've stepped back in time.

nice and beautiful. There is a nice fountain in the garden which can provide you some shadow if it is sunny and hot. Near the fountain it is a bit cooler than other places. Have some nice stuff to munch with some nice drinks and enjoy the picnic the day through. Very well maintained garden I must say.
Lots of souvenirs. À must When you visit Paris. AlSo the surroundings are nice and so Parisian. Try the small toy boats a classic!!!
Beautiful oasis. Came here at the height of tourist season - was lovely and peaceful, beautifully maintained and there is always somewhere to sit! Good escape from the busy city centre.
Beautiful & crowded. This garden was beautiful but crowded, especially around the fountain. It does provide shady spots to sit and enjoy people watching or a picnic.
must have a picnic.... in the gardens...very romantic..went to a little deli and bought meats cheese baguette a bottle of wine and enjoyed the sights while enjoying each others company for our picnic

Glorious extravagance!. The Palace de Luxembourg is a grand edifice, but it is the gardens, immaculately laid out in hot summer colours, dotted with very mature oleanders in vast square boxes and surrounded by statues that stand out. The weather was hot and around 30C, so the lawns were covered with people sunbathing and relaxing, but that didn't affect the wonderful spectacle. A great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful, peaceful garden. Walking into the Luxembourg Gardens I was blown away! I've never seen such a beautiful, well maintained public garden. It was the perfect place to take a book and picnic. We spent the afternoon lounging on the "recliner" chairs they have for anyone to use. Don't expect to sit in the grass though, unless you choose the 2 smaller grassy patches that are quite crowded on a nice day. The chairs can be moved anywhere though. It is a true French (symmetrical) garden. Definitely go!

Grab a sandwich, a drink, and soak in the beautiful gardens. Extremely nice city park. Lot's going on here. Place is just a pleasure to walk through and admire the flowers, plants and people. If you are in the area, make it a point to visit, but no need for special trip.
Luxembourg Gardens Worth the Walk. This is the most beautiful garden in Paris. We took our lunch with us and spent about 11/2 hrs relaxing and enjoying our first stop in Paris.

An evening well spent. Plan to reach post lunch with good stamina for a super long walk. The gardens are really large and beautiful- its a fantastic idea to visit during spring to see it in bloom. A small space on the right of the residence "Prime Minister of the State" has a beautiful calm corner with cascading water, ducks and flowers- for all its worth, you can sit don there to paint, read, gaze and just catch up on some leisure. Walk all the way through to the other end to see a fantastic fountain with mystic creatures. Kids will love running around and playing in the garden.
Very nice place. Great place to spend an afternoon with family and friends. It's great for kids. Also great just to relax

greeeeeenry every where. i like this place when visited in june 2012 it was rainning full of green and trees everywhere u will enjoy staying in this place for 1 hour or more to get the most relaxing mode ever in addition to the great restaurant inside and outside to enjoy your visit
very nice. very nice place to take a break from walking and just chill inside the park and do some people watching.

People Watching In A Beautiful Setting. I am sure that at some point during your stay in Paris you will have the opportunity to wander through Luxenbourg Gardens. If time and weather allow it, take the time to sit and breathe in the air of Paris. It is a great place to people watch, and we loved seeing Parisians with their children and families enjoying the day in the garden and just being together, watching moms interact with their children and eachother, and dads trying to entertain the kids and just people in general. We found it a lovely place just to relax for a bit and as I said breathe in the air of Paris.
A great back yard!. Great sitting amongst the flowers and fountains - a very Parisian experience. Watch the boules, visiting an exhibition, or just sit and watch the world go by
Nice one. It is a nice park in a fantastic area, make sure to walk around the park and the penton, in the Latin quarter, and then walk down to Saint Michelle metro station area. Very nice walk.
mrs c 192. really worth a visit garden well look after and great to sit place to sit in shade and people watch on a hot summer day

Paris of postcard dreams. Ate our breakfast here sitting in the garden chairs. Freezing today but this is the Paris of postcard dreams – we walked around the opulent and expansive grounds until the whistle blowers at 5pm gave the marching orders as it seems this is when the gates must close.
Great Place To Jog. I loved running in this park because there are many runners each morning in the park to inspire you! Highly recommended,

Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city. This is an absolute gem of a place just to chill out and enjoy the beautiful setting. We were there on a Saturday in the afternoon and took advantage of a nearby "Carrefour Express" mini supermarket on Rue Vaugirard to make up an impromptu picnic - water, beer, baguette and fruit etc. There were plenty of places to sit and enjoy our picnic - both in the shade and in the sun.There are a couple of stalls inside the park selling drinks and sandwiches and surprisingly enough at reasonable prices. There's something for everyone - a fully equipped childrens play area, petanque court, tennis courts, sunbathing areas as well as the fountains and natural beauty of the trees.We could easily have spent the whole day here, particularly as it was a beautiful sunny day.
Beautiful and relaxing. If you have time for a Cappuccino you want to go to this place..it is just beautiful and so relaxing. perfect for an afternoon break !
a must for families. If you have children, it is a must! Pony rides, zip lines and carousels. The carousel was the best in Paris here.
nice. a very nice garden and its was a nice place to relax after walking around paris bring a baguette or any kind of food and some wine and feel like a parisian

Always Beautiful. These gardens are beautiful even in the winter. They can be quite busy during the summer months, particularly on the weekends but there are also concerts and other events more so at that time. We particularly love these gardens in the Autumn for a stroll and just sitting for a bit. They are among the most beautiful gardens I've ever seen.

Beautiful!. We rested at this beautiful outdoor space. I'm certain we saw only a glimpse, but taking a break on the green grass with Parisians and other tourists was a nice way to spend a couple of hours.
Beautiful gardens. We were there in August and it was beautiful with flowers in bloom everywhere. Lots of people out enjoying it despite the "heat wave" (maybe 90 degrees F... not really that hot)

Quite and then crowded. I ran around the gardens in the early morning and while it was beautiful I was not over the top impressed. Then I returned in the later afternoon and found the crowds of picnicers and sun bathers and kids and lovers... The park a great place to watch people and relax amounst flowers and fountains and sculpter. Very nice
Great garden to walk around. Very beautiful and comfortable garden. There are chairs all over that can be moved. I specially recommend it after a walk in the Quartier Latin.

Something for everyone. I was just looking for a place to escape the heat and I found a comfy chair (there are 2 types here) around the pool where the ducks were...It was cool and breezy and on a 100 degree day, that is a find. I also struck up a conversation with a lovely retired French architecture professor, the perfect respite from the heat

resting day in Luxembourg Gardens. On our third day we could not to get to garden on time cause of some parade. But on our last day we come there and get our rest during 3 days of running! Park is very quet and pieceful! Of course you should not miss statues of park and fountains
Beautiful sights. Great garden, with lots of chairs and spaces to just sit or lay down and relax. No picture will be wasted here

ideal place to eat your baguette or walk your weigh off !. must love jardin du Luxembourg.. i went there almost on a daily basis during my stay in paris, and still going to do it this evening :) you may choose to play Pétanque, tennis, basketball, ping-pong , chess or backgammon.. just don't mix a game with another.. but seriously, there are so many activities going on in the park. people jog, read, picnic, sunbath and also kiss. again, don't do everything at the same time :P never boring, never cease to release the floral fragrance, never ugly, and no dog poop.. must love. for more photos, just google Panoramio Dumbellfish. RER B / Luxembourg, exit Jardin du Luxembourg.

Superb landscape designed setting for a day of relaxation or people watching. We are staying in a sweet small hotel in St Germain, and decided to read he Financial Times weekend edition in he shady cool of the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens, which is within 10 minutes' walk. The temperature reached 35C yesterday morning so we found a cool spot under he huge plain trees opposite the tennis courts. It was very empty but the nearby children's playground was packed. And noisy. Still, the vast garden caters to all ages and tastes. The formal garden is so long it stretches from one rue to another. The large fountain looks too inviting for the sweaty people but nobody misbehaved! We sat for about 2 hours reading while other Parisiens did the same, all with style. This is a free for all garden that is meticulously maintained and manicured. The city is incredibly well run and clean. This garden is the cherry on top of a meringue cake!!! Well worth a visit.

Be careful to lie on the right piece of grass!. The logic beats me - you can lie on only designated pieces of grass like sardines in a tin.
