Otherwise there are plenty of (extremely heave and not so comfortable) chairs around to sit on - which can be moved to a suitable piece of shadow.Unfortunately it was so hot when we visited the garden that we didn't have the energy to see much of the place. There weren't even many people sailing their little boats on the pond - just too hot!
Superb!. Absolutely not to be missed if you want a little bit of peace and quiet in the middle of a bustling city.
Peaceful and pretty. Huges area of pretty gardens with water fountains and live music sometimes. Amazing icecream place on entry. Perfect for spending a summer afternoon.

Ah, the gardens. they were a short walk from our hotel and we were amazed at the variety of activities going on from belote to the children's playgrounds to the puppet theatre to the art show to the fountain with the children sailing their boats
Nice. Glad we had this included in our tour. The palace is nice looking and the gardens were in full bloom.

Lovely gardens to walk in and take in Parisian life.. We walked through these gardens several times and enjoyed it. It was fun to see Parisians going about their daily lives and get away from the tourist sites with all the crowds.

Take your time. Jardin du Luxembourg is one place that would come back to when I have time to sit and just be for a while. To walk through quickly was a shame, maybe even a crime; I would have to check French penal code.

wow. It is a spectacular park with very nice gardens. A very good place to relax after walking around Paris. You can spend an hour just watching the people and the natural beauty...it was fantastic, don't miss it.
I go here all the time for walks in the park. Sometime the crowds at Luxembourg Park are a bit too much on nice days and I opt for other parks in Paris such as Parc-Montsouri.

An Oasis. A real oasis from the hustle and bustle of paris. We ate a picnic here by the pond, relaxed and people watched. When we got too hot in the sun we moved to sit under the trees. It is a lovely park. We also ate a dessert at the cafe - delicious pancakes and coffee.

Go, stroll, relax. So lovely to see so many Parisians out enjoying the sun in this beautiful park... lounging in the many green chairs or playing sports or sailing boats in the fountain. This became part of our daily routine while in Paris. Wonderful.
beautiful. is delicious for a picnic with friends, do like the parisians! wine, french cheeses, beautiful moments, beautiful photos...

The Central park of Paris. It reminded me of Central Park in New York City, people relaxing, reading a book or socializing. Very nice sight to see, suggest a visit here just don't go with a bike because they don't allow them inside.

Strolling through this park will make a Francophile of you. Just to stroll slowly watching other people is a treat. Too bad we don't have more parks like this in our American cities (tell me if there are).
Nice Bike Ride. Interesting gardens but not the biggest highlight of our trip. Nice to pickup a Velib bike and ride through the gardens.

Wonderful afternoon!. After having a picnic lunch, our children really loved pushing the sailboats around the fountain. There was a great cafe nearby for lunch or a snack, and a few small play areas near the plaza de Marco Polo. But, the other main attraction was the huge playground! There is a fence around the whole area with one entrance and one exit, several play structures for every age and a snack bar. We spent several hours here and everyone had a great time! Beautiful, relaxing, and absolutely lovely!

Great gardens in the middle of Paris. This is a real pretty park in Paris which is popular with locals as well as tourists. A very relaxing walking area, or simply to enjoy the gardens. It is quite large with plenty of room to sit down and absorb the beauty, or the sun if it is shining.
Beautiful Place to Relax. The fountain, trees and flowers provide a great spot to sit, relax and enjoy beauty. Plenty of chairs for visitors make it even more pleasant.

With kids on sunny days, rent a boat to float on the pond!. During spring and summer, there are small boats to be rented for kids. You rent them for 1/2 hour and enjoy their cruise on the central pond in the garden. It is fun to rush around the pond with the kids to push back the boat in the center of the waters. They sail according to the winds.For young kids, there is also a puppet theatre : Guignol. It lasts 1/2hour and kids can enjoy the play and usually actively participate in.

amazing. So far, these are the most beautiful public gardens I have ever seen - I have heard that the flowers in the garden are changed so that they never have the same colours year after year. Simply beautiful, a place to be enjoyed with friends and family !

Fun for kids. Gardens are very pretty and my kids love the sail boats on the lake! Very relaxing, also is a gorgeous tea house opposite that made best hot chocolate and pain au chocolate (can't remember the name)
Beautiful gardens. Luxembourg Gardens are a beautiful place to visit. Manicured, lawns, garden beds and trees. A peaceful, happy place.

Today as in the past it is a place you must visit...Those who have walked these grounds is the who's who in history...... Words cannot begin to describe it's beauty....children sailing boats in the little lake...flowers at this time of the year in full bloom.

Beautiful Gardens, Not much else. Great place to visit if you want to have a picnic, or just a bottle of wine in public. Other than that there isn't much to do... really just a beautiful place to visit and take photos at.
ok.. Big garden with a cool little like, good for relaxing after a busy day.Big garden with a cool little like, good for relaxing after a busy day.

Incredible park..... Europe really understands the need and gifts of public parks. You could spend a day here wandering around the walks and gardens and fountains and ponds. Definitely worth visiting!
a great place. i was very impresed of the beauty inside this garden. it is safe and quit even if there are a lor of visitors. you can just seat and enjoy the view

A lovely place to rest. What a lovely oasis to sit and reflect in. Gardens are immuclate and it's possible to rent a little sailing boat, very reasonably, at the pond. Try find the statue of liberty there!

lovely location for all photographers ;). i am not a fan of gardens , but jardin Luxemboug is a good location for Great Pictures.
went there in the fall, so the colors was fantastic and really romantic.

Wonderful Sunday afternoon spot. My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing Sunday afternoon at Luxembourg Gardens. Even with hundreds of other people, we enjoyed every minute watching the children with the little boats, stopping for a beverage under the trees, and enjoying the flowers and the fountain. It is a wonderfully relaxing spot when one wants to get away from hectic sightseeing and join others who are simply enjoying a beautiful spot.

Bliss!. This is one of my favourite places to sit and relax in Paris...watching the children sail the boats across the fountain, or sitting to enjoy a gelato and a good book. It's a huge garden so lots of areas to explore. Love it here.

Bring the camera!. This garden is beautiful in Summer and not to be missed from aspiring and professional photographers. The colours are fantastic and it is beautifully maintained. It is relaxing and refreshing to get away to this garden when you want to relax from sightseeing at the main attractions. Rest your sore feet whilst sinking into one of the many garden chairs provided.

Lovely pearl in the middle of Paris!. All of a sudden on a very warm day we found the Luxembourgs Gardens with the little palace inside. It was a nice place just to sit down and have some shade. I would have preferred a small place where you could just buy a drink, a soda or something else you'll need in a very hot big city day!

Lovely garden for all seasons. This garden in Paris never disappoints. It's full of history and things to see. The pond is great for people watching. Kids will like bringing their boats with them. I only wish there was a bit more grass to sit on, but there are plenty of other gardens in Paris for this. Having a picnic in the chairs their provide is just fine.

great for an afternoon of lounging. beautiful gardens filled with tourists and Parisians alike. The gardens are gorgeous, but they also have tennis courts, walking paths , etc... Great to take a book and sit by the fountain and relax

Stunning. These gardens are just delightful. Much larger than I expected and beautifully kept. We'd arrived in early May and the few days we scored with warm sunny weather saw droves of Parisian folk enjoying these gardens. Relaxing on the unique and unusual chairs around the ponds and picnicking on any spot they could find. You can't ride bikes thru the gardens - you have to push them. Which is thoughtful and makes for a very calm and relaxed ambiance. We ended up in these gardens on several occasions and i enjoyed each visit immensely

A cool spot in Summer. The gardens in front of the Palace were in full bloom, food especially icecream was available and the many chairs scattered around under the border of trees meant it was a welcome resting place for tourists on a summer day.

Good palce to relax.. When you are tired visiting sites in Paris, come and relax here. My son enjoyed a lot running behind the pigeons and playing with them. It is always lively place and good to go and relax little bit.

Traveling with a runner. Family enjoyed it. Clean public restrooms not free. Husband couldn't wait totie on running shoes for a jog around the park. Beautiful, serene. Hung out at the park like Parisienes. Also, the bronze model of statue of liberty is there...surprised us all. Didn't get to sail boats in the pond, as it was closed when we got there. P,entry of chairs to just sit and relax and take in the scenery.
Petanque in the park. We walked through this park on our way to our hotel. A really nice park, with several sportingfacilities. Sit down and watch the parisians play petanque in the park!

Beautiful. I love these gardens, they are very well taken cared of, on a sunny day one of my favorite things to do in Paris is going to there and sitting somewhere and just observe the ambience, it's very relaxing...and the "quartier" (6eme) one of my favorites of Paris. Very, very nice to go with your family or in couple.
RELAXATION. A place to relax and enjoy the beauty of gardens.can be easily reached by the bus tours where they can drop you and you can continue your visit to the other attractions in paris

So pretty!. Lots of open spaces, a beautiful central found that local children use for floating miniature boats, beautiful colorful gardens, many paths for walking, tennis courts, and the Museum is on the grounds as well. Terrific place for people watching, connecting with nature, and if you have kids, letting them run around a bit: Napolean dedicated the park to children.

A Refreshing Break!. Lovely gardens and a pool with toy sail boats scimming across the water make this a peaceful retreat from summer in the city! Take a book and relax in the sun or under a green canopy of leaves!

A little bit of paradise in Paris.. I can't say enough about these gardens. To me they epitomize what Paris is all about. The gardens span a very large area but has much to offer. The pond where children can play with motorized boats is classic and must be seen. With the backdrop of the old palace it is quite picturesque. Take a baguette or a pastry and simply sit and relax. Music is often playing somewhere in the park. There are also tennis courts and a small carousel as well as pony rides in the same area. The landscape is serene and beautiful and really is a peaceful oasis that you will return to.

Beautiful. If you want a romantic day in Paris, then this is where you should take your woman. Beautiful and relaxing. Grab a book, get a coffee and sit on one of the benches and take in the experience of Paris. Definitely recommended if you have enough time to spare in Paris.

Sunny day - beautiful place to walk and relax. stunning, lakes, gardens, the place to watch parisians relax - playing cards and chess under the shade of the chestnut trees. Sit on a chair by a fountain and watch the world go by.
Beautiful!. Located in between Latin quarter and Saint Germain - very good for a nice picnic.... And take your umbrella with you ;).

Stunning! Loads to do, great place to spend half a day. Went to the art gallery in the orangerie, had a shot at the Ittle sailing boats on the pond. Great fun with a stunning historic backdrop. My daugher went on the ponies, played in the adventure playground, we ate crepes at the cafe, wandered around the immaculate planting. You must must visit here its a top 3 to see in paris. We loved it

A chance to pretend to be a Parisian. We took the opportunity to use the Luxembourg Gardens as we saw Parsians doing -- having a coffee and croissant, sitting and relaxing, watching the children push the sailboats around, and generally enjoying a Saturday morning.
Great spot. A super formal gardens in central Paris. Plenty of free chairs. Take a baguette for lunch and relax along with the locals

Looked like a movie set. Beautiful fountain, gardens, flowers.....great for relaxing and people watching while enjoying a French picnick. Visit it and see if you can find the petite Statue of Liberty!
Great place to relax!. Wonderful place to hang out, eat a croissant, relax and people watch. Close to the Louvre. Quintessential Paris!
Oasis of peacefulness. The grounds are extensive so it's easy to find a chair or bench to occupy for a little quiet personal time amid the clamor of Paris life.

After a busy Paris day, go here to chill out and decompress. With all the walking you'll be doing in Paris, this is a great place to sit down and chill. Grab a sandwich to go from somewhere along the way, or get an ice cream just outside the gates. Perfect spot for people watching.

Sunny relaxing Afternoon. We spent about 3 hours sitting around the exellent chidren's playground watching our child play and wondering the gardens in the afternoon sun. It was very relaxing and really picturesque.

Good, even great if you haven't been to the UK. In all fairness, i keep going back, so would recommend. Not far from must see St Germain anyway? Take a walk, couple of pictures and a coffe at the Dalloyau

Beautiful Flowers and Parisiens at Play.. Nothing nicer than an evening stroll in the Luxebourg Gardens. Boule and petanc, fountains, beautifully maintained flowerbeds and lots of relaxation. A great spot for people watching.
The backdrop is the magnificent Luxembourg Palace, surrounded by bored police guards who watch the world go by in a haze of non-intervention. :-) Essentially a Paris experience. And free...
Luxembourg Gardens. beautiful gardens, nice little cafe on the grounds to sit and relax. Excellent place to people watch among the gorgeous gardens.

The dance of the chairs. Over the last ten years I have visited Paris at least once or twice a year. I always go to the Luxembourg Gardens. There is life there. Sitting for a day watching the thousands of chairs get re-arranged as people come and go by themselves, in pairs or in groups is a relaxing reminder that there are other ways to live a life.
Peaceful gardens in hectic gardens. After you did the sightseeing and shopping it is time for a nice place to relax for a moment. These gardens are the perfect place for this!
STunning. Well worth a visit as very beautiful and not crowded at all.This is a Government building and very well maintained.The gardens are stunning and full of beautiful flowers

Sit down, relax, and watch the people walk/run by. If all the city madness makes you feel in need of some air and space, I would suggest you include a walk in the gardens. There is a large playground for children, you can play tennis, or just hang out and read for a day, play some games, lay or sit down in the grass (at some areas, not all - watch out !), see the nannies walk the children and rushing back, play "jeu de boules", ... A lovely spot at any moment of the year, but especcially in Summer !

A wonderful place to waste a day. The Luxembourg Gardens are one the most idyllic places in Paris. There is so much of so little to do. Sit around the fountain and get a sun burn, watch the children play on the playground, tennis, the occasional outdoor concert . . . . Officially part of the grounds of the French Senate, it used to be illegal for men unaccompanied by women or children to enter the Gardens alone; that rule has changed, but it is still a privileged spot.

beautiful gardens. These beautifully maintained and cared for gardens are the perfectplace to go for a walk, have a cafe au lait or an icecream and justsoak up the atmophere of paris and this wonderful are.

An Oasis. We enjoyed the peaceful settiings and, like many others, sat and watched the kids play with the sail boats. We then wandered through the gardens and found many quiet little gardens to sit and relax. There is a very worthwhile art exhibition at L'Orangerie where we met one of the artists and were able to chat with her. All in all, a great place to recharge the batteries of the soul.

Paris at its best. The Luxembourg Gardens are fantastic. The formal gardens with the little sail boats in the pond are exquisite with the colorful garden beds. The cafe area is Parisian to a T with the chairs all facing the view with patrons sipping coffee and wine - a few of the wealthy even having a meal. Hundreds of people scattered all over gardens sitting in chairs basking in the sun during lunch - all observing the keep off the lawn signs! There is also a huge play area for children with a great variety of equipment all on soft fall rubberized material. A great place to take everyone for a taste of Paris.

Take a Picnic. My family took an afternoon break from sight seeing and walked the gardens, watched chess players, and let the kids run in circles. Very pleasant.One caveat...do not get sucked into using the children's wading area, it was very small and dirty. Do Rent the sail boats and play at the pond.
A lovely place for a walk. This is a great park - so convenient if you are staying on the left bank or even Montparnasse. It tends to be busy near the big boating pond but elsewhere it is quiet.
Beautiful Gardens. Really lovely gardens and what I really liked was it was so full of life from children playing in the playground, gentlemen playing boules. A must visit!

Do the boats!. I can honestly say, Luxembourg Gardens were heaven! A quiet respite from a day of sightseeing for sure. My favorite pictures of our trip to Paris are of my husband and two daughters "sail-boating" in the middle of the Gardens. It is a magical place!

GREAT RESPITE. We decided to spend our last day of 6 days in Paris at Luxembourg gardens and it was SUCH a great decision- Its SUCH a relaxing place- and so well kept. You can also duck in/out of the park and go see St. Sulpice from DaVinci Code fame and also The Pantheon. Most of all I enjoyed seeing THE ORIGINAL Statue of Liberty made by Bartholdi himself. I read the statue was on the East side of the park- but to me it was on the West side- If you face the palace, its to your left.

Incredible oasis!. We stayed a few blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens across from the Pantheon. I ran around the Gardens in the morning, and I spent as much time as possible walking around the park or sitting and people-watching. Great spot!
Very pretty. The weather in Paris was perfect, so it made our visit here wonderful. You could sit in the chairs and enjoy the scenery without dripping with sweat.

What a Great Afternoon!. Luxembourg Gardens surrounds a palace built in the 1600's and is a magnificent place to spend some time. There are chairs all around a pond and locals will be relaxing and playing. We bought meats, cheese, bread and wine at a local store and had a picnic lunch at the gardens. This was one of the best lunches we've had in Paris!The property at Luxembourg Gardens are huge and you can find a private spot or spend your time in the middle of the crowds. Either way, it's a really great place to visit!

Go to relax. We went on a Saturday afternoon which was crowded. Lots of people were sunning themselves enjoying the good weather. Playgrounds were full. Beautiful place to relax, though we weren't fans of the gravel pathways which kicked stones into your sandals and got your feet dusty. Go to sit and relax, but not much to see or do. Not a must-see for us.

Beautiful and calm garden. We had a lovely morning and lunch at the garden. It was a beautiful place, people were jogging and children was playing. We walked around looking at people, and then we sat down on the chairs under the trees. Bring sunglasses, because the sand is very bright!

I loved the gardens. The gardens where within walking distance from our hotel . They where well worth the walk. Bastille day was on the following day we where there so we saw The French foreign legion doing preparations there, which to me was a bonus.
My favorite park in entire Paris.. My favorite park in entire Paris.I love jogging in Luxemburg Gardens. A must see and walk (or run) park in Paris.Beautiful place to relax and unwind
Beautiful just to relax.. We bought bagette sandwiches and lunched in the Gardens on two different occasions. They are beautiful, well kept and very nice place to relax and soak up Paris.
Beautiful!!!. The gardens looked so beautiful. The gardens are all done in yellow this year. A great place to sit and people watch.
Better than Filey. A very good place to unwind & we did easily find seats, boating lake, donky rides...just like Filey but better!

Beautiful, relaxing atmosphere in the midle of Paris. A must-see stop in Paris, whether for jogging at any time, for a family picnic or for a romantic walk.It is only a pity that riding bikes are not allowed inside the park. But on sundays, they close several streets nearby so kids can bike around the Parc.
Pretty park to take a stroll.. Beautiful gardens and fountains. Nice place to ttake a walk late afternoon/early evening to see lots of locals.
Beautiful fountain. This is a lovely place to sit and relax and have snack or two. The gardens beautiful and look for the fountain, it really is a masterpiece. Well worth a visit.
Haven of peace and tranquility in the city center. A lot of green. Plenty of shade on a hot day. Nice view on a Petit Luxembourg Palace. Relaxing place in the city centre.

Beautiful oasis. My favourite garden on the left bank. The area around the great fountain is beautiful but crowded. Make your way to the shaded seats around the tennis courts on the western edge of the garden - peaceful surroundings for a take-out lunch or afternoon break.

Beautiful. Peaceful, and relaxing, the Luxembourg Garden is beautiful during the morning. Sculptures surround the area for people who want to look around, but there are also chairs everywhere. One can sit and watch the small fountain and lake in the middle of the gardens, or sit under the numerous trees that surround the main part of the garden.

Lovely place. Beautiful park in the middle of town, quite large with lots of chairs to sit and relax. The flowers and fountains are lovely and there are pony rides, tennis courts and other activities available.

A favorite spot for us in Paris--any time of the year.. This time we entered from the south and enjoyed the lovely green space that runs down the center. The flowers are arranged so carefully, with color groupings that merge well. Peaceful, pretty and never a place you can get tired of strolling.

Most beautiful gardens. If you are a flower lover, do not miss these gardens, they are spectacular. It is a wonderful place to walk, to sit, to feed the birds. They will come right up to you, bring bread with you.

Beautiful. Relaxing and lovely to walk through.
The pool in the middle with the sail boats is a must see. As well as the huge chestnut trees.

good escape. brilliant excape from trafic heavy Paris. Good with kids, and to relax.
this is just filer, as I need 50 characters
We had to go back. My daughter's favorite site in Paris. We spent an afternoon here and returned to spend another morning. Wonderful family destination to get away from the tourist traps and relax.

Peoples' Park. This extensive park is quite diverse and it's diversity appeals to a diverse audience - Parisians themselves, Americans, students of all nationalities and ages etc. There's even a puppet act (Guignol), tennis courts, a great fountain, the French Senate and a fabulous fountain of the Medici's. Joggers in the morning, students anytime and anyone who wants to just mosey.
Lovely!. When in Paris, don´t miss a stroll in this City Oasis. Beautiful and romantic, glad we took the time!

Perfect place to sit down and enjoy the view. It is one of the best park so far I had seen. The view is superb, large and you can just choose wherever you want to sit down to chill out. I went here with my 6 yr old daughter and my wife. They both enjoyed it as well. Easily you can just sit here for ours and not feeling bored.
Quiet relaxing area.. Relaxing area in central Paris, well used by locals. Some areas in need of replanting with grass. The main fountain not working.

Lovely garden near the Odeon Theater on the Left Bank. Since we were staying at a nearby hotel, Jardin de l'odeon, we enjoyed being able to stroll around this beautiful garden, and sit for a while to people watch. There are restaurants nearby and so it was nice to stop by the garden on the way to dinner.

Beautiful peaceful retreat. I would like to have stayed here all day.Beautiful flowers and lots of chairs to sit around and have tea and crepes from the food place there. Fabulous- plan longer than an hour so you can relax Here. There are little sail boats for kids to rent and push around in the pond-super cute to watch.

A lifelong fan. All other reviews are fine and dandy but I have a 7(seven,) decades old relationship with what we Parisians or ex-Parisian in my case call le Luco. From childhood memories of pushing the little sailboats around the central basin and having to pay old ladies(usually war widows who got that privilege from City Hall) or going to the ancient marionnettes theater on Thursdays or Sunday afternoons, enjoying an icecream frm the vendors at the gates ...to old age when our grandchildren can also play in a magnificent play area, ride poneys while I sit in now free chairs or the grass (it's no longer frowned on) or play tennis at very cheap prices (until 11am) or run around the perimeter with dozens of amateurs only to stop to admire the flowers, the fruit orchard with succulent looking pears each wrapped in paper to preserve them against pests or the bee enclosure. And then there are cafés, concerts, chess players, pétanque ( not bowling), AND the excellent art shows in the former orangerie of the Senate. There is even a world class museum next to the French Senate within its grounds. Can you say more ?

Beautiful Gardens. We spent the morning here. Beautiful. A wonderful place for families. There were pony rides,upper show and beautiful flowers and fountains. A band was playing music while we relaxed in the gardens. This is amidst for a visit to Paris
Great for leasure time. Nice place for having lunch or for relax. You can sit wherever you want (there are chairs everywhere) and relax or watch some performance or men playing petanque.
really worth a visit. fantastic place to go to get away from the bustle. We loved just sitting there and watching the world go by.
Excellent park for little ones!. Gret way to spend an afternoon at the paid park for little ones to run around. Plenty of equipment and chairs for Mum and Dad to rest!
Gorgeous. What a beautiful place for a picnic. Plan ahead, buy a bag of french fare and enjoy a day in the sun or in the many shade spots

Touristy but must visit. One of the park i go to when i need an outdoor break but don't want to spend much money. It's in St-Germain-des-Pres area so when the weather gets too hot and you're just to tired to walk around, drag a chair and sit beneath the trees. Everything is picture perfect (just like any other tourist location in Paris). Drop by the Luxembourg museum for an art refreshment (and a breeze from the aircon). Catch le guignol on wednesday or saturday. It's interesting. :)
Neatly kept.. The gardens were fine, pretty flower arrangements but easily walked round in half an hour. We'd expected something a bit more extensive! But a pretty place to take a break in.
Beautiful!. Wonderful gardens with seats provided for you to lounge in the sun and sand pits for the kids to play in!

We discovered this by accident. Me and my fiance visited these gardens by mistake. And we're glad we did! We were walking the streets, and came upon these gorgeous grounds.We spend about an hour walking through the pathways. I think I liked it better than the Louvre gardens! Definitely visit it.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens, lots of benches & seating areas, also lots of small statues & monuments to see. A very peaceful place to take a picnic & spend an hour or two people watching.
Seen from the bus. History of its establishment sounded interesting and looked like somewhere to chill in the busyness of Paris.

Restful and very French!. Thoroughly enjoyed walking round these beautiful gardens in the sunshine last week. It was lovely to sit in the sun and in the shade reading for the afternoon while people watching. It seems to be accepted to move all the chairs around and to appropriate one for your feet as well as one to sit on! People were allowed to sit and snooze or chat without interruption. Lots of families and lots of Americans - probably there for the Tour. We were impressed by the tennis courts, the chess sets where people queued up to play each other and the boules area.

A Fine Place To Relax. The Luxembourg Gardens is my favorite park in Paris. It is right in the center and is an oasis of beautiful shady trees surrounding manicured lawns filled with colorful flower beds. There are also historical starues throughout the park. Sitting on the grass is forbidden, but do as the Parisians do, grab a chair, pull it up to the edge of one the gorgeous lawns and open a book. The Luxembourg Gardens is the perfect respite from what can often be the chaos of urban Paris. An hour or two here each day should be required of all visitors to remind us of what makes Paris such an incredible city.

like the central park of paris. Perfect place for a picnic, especially if you're traveling with kids. I missed my daughter when we strolled through the park. There's a gorgeous playground- the coolest I've ever seen, people playing chess, reading, picnicing and relaxing. It's a lot like Central Park- a big, green, lush spot in the middle the city.
It's always worth stroll. I never stop in Paris without a walk through Luxemborg. It's peace. It's beautiful. It's historic. It is the essense of Paris to me
Watch the day go by. Lots of places to sit and watch people, but remember to bring along a bottle of wine and a baguette or two.

a peaceful haven. compared to most large cities, paris actually feels well organised, clean and quite beautiful. the luxembourg gardens are the epitome of this and well worth relaxing in, slightly away from the tourist congestion.

Hard even to dream such a beauty. This is a gem in town. It's quite, romantic, and SO elegant with the French Senate building overlooking it. It's a great place to go for a jog, relax on the benches, or also have a picnic (although the accessible area for it is quite small and in sunny days gets packed quickly). I think at this gardens as a way of living: walk from the posh st germain, get cheese and baguette, a glass of wine and just enjoy it!

A breath of fresh air in the middle of Paris!. I would recommend going only if you are in Paris in the warmer months, when you can see the Gardens as they were meant to be seen. I went in January and there is no comparison.

Chairs in the shade, tennis courts, and a splash pool for the kids. Lovely park, with a café and many, many chairs for people to relax in the shade (also for those not buying goods from the café), a fountain and more. I particularly liked the play area for young children: they have a couple of sand boxes and a splash pool in an area reserved for small kids and their care takers (just north of the tennis courts). I'll head there next time I have my little ones in Paris on a hot day! You can also walk five minutes out of the North side of the park and buy macaroons from Pierre Hermé's fabled patisserie and bring them back to eat in the park.

Elegant, lovely, enlightening. The colors, flowers, open spaces, and walking paths. This 'garden' is a dream...amazing. We walked for more than an hour. Don't miss the pond where the children launch ancient wooden toy boats, and use bamboo sticks to guide them. 130 years they've been doing this! Low Tech Fun!

Beautiful for having a cafe, but nothing spectacular. I would definitely recommend Buttes-Chaumont park over the Luxembourg gardens for those who are looking for a place for a picnic or a lovely afternoon walk in somewhere a little less known.

A gorgeous park and a must-see in Paris. I strongly recommend a trip to the Luxembourg Gardens if you're visiting Paris in the spring or summer. It's a large, beaufifully maintained park with beautiful lawns, rows of shady trees, fountains, statues, and great views of the Louvre buildings in the distance. It attracts visitors from all over the world, so the people watching is great too. It's also a wonderful place for photos, especially with the giant ferris wheel that we saw in July!

Beautiful relaxing place to watch Paris go by. We love these gardens and have visited them ever since we have been vising Paris for the last couple of years. There are lots of chairs that are free that you can see on throughout the gardens, as you are not allowed on the grass except in the designated areas. There are lots of things for children to do, but we go there to sit and have lunch and read our books. The palace is worth a look at as are the flowerbeds all around the gardens but particularly outside the palace. THe bandstand also provides free music performances from different visiting bands. This is a traditional park that is used by lots of french people and is the best place to watch the world go by!!!

Wonderful!. We loved the Luxembourg Gardens which we visited twice during our three day stay to the enjoyment of our 10 year old daughter! They have a wonderful play area for children of all ages and the gardens are truly beautiful! Would love to return soon!

Shame you can't sit on something more comfortable. I visited the Luxembourg gardens to escape the heat but could only find rigid benches to sit on. I attempted to sit on the grass only to be chased by a police officer.
On the plus side, the fountains are lovely.
A peaceful wander!. These gardens were just so peaceful to wander around on a great day! The available areas to sit and ponder were plentiful; should have done this on our 2010 visit!!!!

Rest in the city. These lovely gardens provide a welcome respite from the bustling city. Chairs in shady spots, a low key cafe, beutiful flowers, and relaxing water displays make for a very pleasant break in the paris bustle.

Nice and relaxing. Beautiful park with lots of trees for shade. Good people watching area. You can watch artists paint the scenery. A couple of places to eat in the park. There was a regular cafe and also a crepe stand. Would definitely recommend.
The most beautiful park you may ever see. I happened upon this by accident when going to the Pantheon. The flowers and the palace make this park stunning. I beautiful place to relax and enjoy Paris!

Idyll in the park. If you are travelling with children in Paris, this is the place to go. In the gardens, children can sail boats in the pond for 2 euros for half an hour, there is a great play area, marionette show and pony rides too. Our son loved the experience and we enjoyed the landscaped gardens and watching our son have such a great time.
Best part of Paris.. Great place to relax and write, think, and people watch. Plenty of restaurants around it. But the real draw is watching the Parisians who enjoy it.
Visit The Bees. Try to visit on a day they are tending to the honey bees a fascinating part of the parc which might take some locals directions.
Wonderful Gardens. This is a wonderful place to relax in Parisian sunshine! There are many chairs, gardens galore, a wonderful chateau - who could ask for more?
A people's park. Loved the planted gardens, design of gardens, children with boats on lake, the open and closed spaces, chairs everywhere. The gardens cater for all age groups.

Something for everyone. These large gardens have something for everyone. There's a children's playground, pony rides, puppet theatre, tennis courts, jogging track for early morning runs, fountains, statues, bee-hives, shady avenues of trees and plenty of places to just sit and contemplate. It's also a great place for a picnic which can be purchased there or at any number of nearby pattiseries.

Beautiful.... Absolutely beautiful gardens. Get a scoop of icecream from a nearby shop and browse the gardens around 1pm - 3pm for some amazing flowers and beautiful photo opportunities. Definitely worth wandering through.

Rent a Bike & Enjoy the Gardens!. I wish I had known in advance that entry to the gardens is free and we could have avoided standing in line for 45 minutes and buying tickets. We ended up renting bikes on site and riding around the massive gardens & property. We did not even go into the palace or Marie Antoinette's farm because we were having so much fun on the bikes! We took the train from Paris to visit Luxembourg which was very fast and inexpensive. We met a young couple from Norway and ended up giving them our un-used tickets, because we were too tired to visit the palace, but very happy & satisified, after our bike outing!
Lovely. i enjoyed the gardens. i sat by the fountain, reading my book with others enjoying the peace. A very pleasant place to visit, to relax, and enjoy the sun. The house is stunning!

Very pretty...sit and have a picnic. Great area for locals and tourist to sit and have a picnic or just take a little time out of your day. Great gardens to take a walk though to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
The bird Charmer. Outside the cathedral there is a grassy park area, and there is a man there who raises his hand and hundreds of birds sit on this arms

Walking Tour - Pick-up some lunch or morning tea to eat at the Luxembourg. On a Saturday when La Grande Epicerie (next to the Le Bon Marche department store near Metro. Sevres Babylone) is open, pick-up some food for a picnic just before lunch or breakfast. They open at 8.30 am Monday to Saturday. On a Sunday when La Grande Epicerie is closed, arrive just before 10 am at Saint Germain des Pres or Saint Sulpice, and walk south along rue bonaparte and pick up some macrons at r/ bonaparte 72 at Pierre Hermes. They should just be open. Head to the north-west corner of Jardin du Luxembourg. Here you will see the chess players. Stroll east through the garden and find the fountain where you can watch the toy sailboats glide along the water. Pull up some seats or find a spot on the lawn for lunch/morning tea. There are toilets but you'll need to pay a small fee. Head to the north east gate near r/ Rotrou and head north along r/ de l'Odeon. At the end of this street you will hit Comptoir or the little sister bar next door if Comptoir is full. Stop here for lunch or a small drink. Head north along R/ Dauphine to walk along Pont Neuf and get on the metro or ... Head north east towards Notre Dame and just wander along the river, visit the Shakespeare and Company Bookstore.
Calm and beautiful. A very beautiful garden, in front of a very beautiful palace. Parisian use to walk, and rest, and play in this place.
a treat in middle of city. This park and gardens are such a treat. Very large, beautiful. A great place for a run, and then the cafes by the gates are a treat also. Worth spending time here.

Luxembourg Park. A lovely park in the middle of Paris. Maybe we weren't looking hard enough, but we really missed the "garden" part of Luxembourg-seemed more like a park where families play games-not exactly what I expected

Very nice to spend some time here. Was very nice to spend some time at the Luxembourg Gardens. You can have your lunch here (instead of eating in a restaurant, take some sandwiches and drinks from a mono-prix that will cost you a fraction of the money you spend on restaurants.

My favorite park in Paris!!. There is a beautiful, large fountain in which little children can float boats of their own, or rent them by the hour....I must have taken 500 photos of various angles and views of children pushing their little boats around with sticks in this fountain...and of course, there were older people sunning themselves in this beautiful location...not to mention all the lovers sitting on benches. The Luxembourg Gardens are a splendid place to spend an entire day...food vendors are available if you don't want to leave, and there was even an accordian player to add to the ambience!

Peaceful and beautiful. After a hectic two days sightseeing around the city, we came across this park, almost by accident. We are so glad we did......we spent two very relaxing hours, in the chairs provided. The statues, flower beds, fountains and landscaping are wonderful......of course a lovely summer day really helped too. Could have spent the whole day there with a good book, just listening to the trees rustling

Lovely Sunday lunch. Ok there was a Maccas opposite the park, so we had our takeout, chose a sunny spot in the garden and relaxed. The garden is beautiful,a little haven from busy Paris. We were there on a Sunday, it was nice to blend in with other Parisians and their family. May it be sun soaking or reading a book, there are plenty of benches and chairs provided. I love the unique sun lounge, I've never seen any where else before.
Nice and peaceful. We visited the garden on the summer evening, and enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere, while relaxing on the green chairs.
Great place!!!. Not only for the building and the gardens, but the original statue of liberty is in there! A great place to hang out on the lawns and chill.

Lovely Parisian Park. What I always envisioned a park in Paris to look like - beautiful sculptures and fountains, flowers blooming everywhere, manicured lawns, chairs for everyone to sit on and enjoy the lovely day, toy sailboats floating in the pond...and a surprise - gigantic potted palms. If you want a sit in a park and rest your weary feet, worth traveling to this lovely one.

Great spot to stroll. Very well maintained park in a peaceful neighborhood. Admire the buildings, lakes and gardens. Stop for a while and use a chair around the fountain to rest and enjoy the view.Specially beautiful in spring, but I have not yet visited in the autumn.

Formal gardens, plenty of seating and much to see.. The Palace of Luxembourg dominates the northern end of this 60 acre park and the gardens are laid out in formal beds, with plenty of grass (not for sitting on) and shady trees. A boating pond, tennis courts, a bandstand and a puppet theatre provide changing activities and there are lovely views, including the Eiffel Tower away to the west. We took a picnic and thoroughly enjoyed good food & wine in the open air under a cloudless sunny sky. Heaven!

Beautiful gardens. Take your lunch and make yourself sit in these gardens ! You won't regret it! You may want to see everything in Paris and not "waste" time but, these gardens are glorious and it's wonderful to watch everyday Parisiens going about their usual routines. The flowers are beautiful and it's very relaxing sitting around the pond watching children playing and parents having a great time in the sunshine.
beautiful. Very nice gardens which could not be more French. relaxing atmosphere and within easy reach of other sites of interest and also some nice restaurants for a lunch option.
great park. This is an amazing park very long and very nice to walk through. Please try this walk if you enjoy green areas.

Always a delight. Spent a very sunny Monday lunchtime here listening to a touring Southern California big band. Gardens are a delight and a calm peaceful spot in busy Paris. Only downside are the queues and cost of using the loo!!

Great park!. Go sit around the waterfountain, its a great relaxing area! There is also a good icecreamseller at the entrance of the park (i don't know on what side it was, but he was GOOD!) There are free chairs available, make sure you'll get the laid back one, they sit great! Great for having a relaxing moment in Paris! And the sailboats where great priced and great fun! Definitely a must have experience in Paris!
Wonderful stroll away from the hustle and bustle. Even on a rainy day, which has been a typical summer for Paris and elsewhere, these gardens are worth the visit.
Relax and enjoy. Great to be in the gardens of uxembourg. People from Paris come here to relax, socialise and enjoy the sun.

In the heart of Paris the palatial grounds are a delight to the sensations. Tranquility, people are there to absorb the beauty. We enjoyed the evening glow as the sun went down. We dined at the Terasse Cafe. Relaxed.
Beautiful. The grounds are large with 2 restaurants operating within. Large fountain area with surrounding moveable chairs. Just a wonderful place to relax after a long stroll across the city.

Just Beautiful. Go when in bloom, spend some time and relax. We did and this was one our high spots for this our 6th visit to Paris. The garden is large and worth spending time watching the children play, couples walking hand in hand. Sit by one of the fountains.

A beautiful well maintained garden.. Immaculate and well manicured. Beautiful floral beds, a lake that is well used for model sailing boats. It is a very large park and also has many tennis courts, a bandstand, children's play area and open air cafeterias. Plenty of trees for shady areas on hot days. Lots of seating provided so ideal for picnicing.

Part of Paris' Beauty. This park is simply a stunning example of the beauty of Paris. We have been there on several different occasions, and each time has created special memories of the city. If you have younger children, take them there and let them play with the small boats you can rent for the fountain. Lots of fun. If you are "sans enfants," sit it the park and soak in the sun. If you are lucky, you will be there when a band is playing in the bandshell. Sit at the cafe and relax in true French fashion. We found the service in the outdoor cafe a bit slow, and the ice cream overpriced, but then you are paying for the atmosphere. Don't miss this break from the rush of Paris tourism.

Wonderful place. Great gardens,a large pool with small sailboat (toy) rentals for the children ,play ground (fenced) with many things to climb and play with for children . A few cafes as well were you can get from a cup of coffee to decent crepes .
well worth a visit. Grab a coffee, give the kids a 2Euro boat to sail for 30 mins and sit back and relax. Great way to chill out in the afternoon

Great Pinic spot. A lot of people full the park quickly on a good day, but if you wonder long enough and don't try to sit near the fountains too much then you'll be able to find your own little spot to chill out with a nice baguette.
Get a picnic..and lie in the sun. See above.......great place to go on a sunny day- watch the world go by

Beautiful Gardens. This place is beautiful and a great way to get away from the busyness of the big city.Grab a bagette, some cheese, tomato, and meat with some champagne and head here for a picnic. Lots of fun!

Wonderful Oasis in the middle of Paris. These beautiful gardens are the perfect way to recharge after walking the busy streets of Paris for hours, we went here regularly to relax and each time we felt refreshed and calm after our visits here. The place is immaculately kept and locals frequent the place and seem to really appreciate how fortunate they are to have such a beautiful peaceful place to come to escape from the hectic life of Paris for a few minutes or a few hours.
Large park in the middle of the city. This park is in the middle of Odean and the Pantheon area. There are mahy cafes and restaurants around. A perfect place for families to stroll and relax.

Lovely park. We enjoyed a nice picnic here, with goodies that we bought from the Grand Epicerie (Bon Marche). Lots of shady areas, seats, and interesting people to watch. Happy to spend a whole afternoon here just watching the day go by.

An oasis of calm and beauty. What's remarkable about this park is not just the beauty of it -- its layout, its flowers, its fountains and pools -- but how well used it is. People of all ages call this park their home, and there's something intoxicating about seeing couples, families, friends engaging in all sorts of park-like activities ... all in the middle of Paris.

Paris's BEST kept secret. Well maybe its not such a big secret but one thing is for sure, this place in my opinion rivals almost all of the other big tourist attractions and the best part... it is free. The park is so beautiful, if I lived in Paris this would be one of my favorite haunts. It is a great place to walk, jog, people watch or go for a picnic. This is one of my favorite parts of Paris hands down. There are little stalls to buy food and you can even hire a small model sailing boat to float on one of the ponds there. Really cool place.
wonderful gardens. a paradise for children and adults alike, feeding ducks, chasing pigeons or admiring the beauty of the jardins
Perfect Parisian gardens. Lovely, tres chic and a quiet refuge in a busy city.
The gardens have everything. Be sure and see the "hidden" double fountain on the back right side of the palace--a secret oasis.
Peaceful walk or run. Peaceful place to walk or jog in the morning. Great place to sit/watch Parisian life in the afternoon and evening.

Beautiful and inviting park. Luxembourg Parc is truly beautiful. While the trees and flowers are very pretty, it's also just a neat place to see people hanging out in an urban park. There's no doubt that the people living in the surrounding neighborhoods like using their park.

Favorite Garden in Paris!. This garden is walking distance from the apartment we renting so we just did it on a day we were shot and didn't have energy to walk to city.. bad call. This garden is HUGE! And really beautiful. You have tourist snapping photos, Parisians sun bathing and drinking wine in the middle of the afternoon, and even people running. Really spectacular park. No sitting on the grass though :( buts lots of chair provided!

Don't miss--especially if traveling with children. It's easy to spend an entire day here with kids....besides the beauty of the park itself, and ample room for strolling (or running), some of the best playgrounds in Paris can be found here. There are separate playgrounds for those up to age 6 and those 7 and up--not a common swing or slide in sight, but wonderful climbing apparatus, zip lines, etc. (There is a small charge to enter the playground.) The playground is conveniently located next to the puppet theater--also not to be missed. There are special low-to-the-ground benches in front reserved for the smaller children. The fact that it's in French doesn't matter--the action, puppets, scenery are enough. Then there are the sailboats which have intrigued children for years. And--some nights, there are free outdoor concerts. A wonderful break for kids and grown-ups alike. Paris is not just museums!
Stunning. Quiet, pleasant, peaceful and beautiful. It lends itself very well to sitting and enjoying the scenery.

Relaxing and expansive. The Gardens and palace are beautifully laid out. It is so nice to relax and watch the children enjoy toy boat races in the pond. A lovely place to take a picnic and spend a few hours iwth lots of places to sit. If you are a jogger, this is place to go.
Beautiful. Well tended and beatiful to look at. The sculptures were lovely and just added to the beauty of this place. Not to be missed, especially if you are a keen gardener

Calm and beautiful park. We loved this park nearby our hotell (Villa Madame).
It is just to read all the other nice word said about this park.
A park for everyone as we see it, you can excercise, relax, play, look at the flowers, do some people watching or whatever. Or just do nothing if you prefer.
Recomendable.

Rent a boat!. We wandered through the gardens on a rainy Thursday, our last full day in Paris, and found our way to the central fountain with the sailboats. Traveling with 2 teenagers and a 10 year old, we had to rent a boat and it was one of the best experiences we had in Paris. My youngest and his 16 year old brother took over and piloted the craft across the pond, completely forgetting about the rain. It's a simple pleasure, just a sailboat and a stick to send it off, but one of the memories I will cherish most of our first visit to this beautiful city.

Want to see the best municipal park in the world ??. Central Park, USA ; Hyde Park,UK-----eat your hearts out.The Luxembourg Gardens is the best public park we've ever seen.Its sheer size allows areas of privacy for a quiet picnic among the thousands of tourists and Parisians who flock there every day.A beautiful place to sit and relax after all that walking around the many tourist attractions in this most magical of all cities. Even so, many folk walk all day just day just to look at all the different parts of the Gardens and its own attractions. Not me nor my wife----we just liked the afternoon of resting tired feet in a most splendid park.When we lost park-keepers due to LA expenditure cuts in Britain, and our local parks became overgrown, untidy and even dangerous ------what would we have done if we'd had the Luxembourg Gardens : wait for Lottery money ???
Beautiful public park. This is a great place for a stroll, for people watching, or for a sandwich and a drink. It's elegance puts you in the Parisian spirit!
Nice when the weather is nice. Good chilling place. Try ice cream made from violet flowers.
Awesome!. They are so beautiful. Nice to go with children. Lot to do, like play a Private tennis Open! haha
Beautiful park. Unfortunately, when I were there the park was dirty and looking like that no one cares about it, despite of this, it´s a great place to visit
Sun, calm in midst of city. Time out from rushing about and have a quiet seat in the lovely Gardens, a lovely greenspace in the centre of the city.

Something for everyone. Beautiful.. My sister and I visited this beautiful park/gardens in July. We brought our own sandwiches and drinks, and grabbed two chairs by the bocce ball court to watch some of the games there. Then we walked past a large park with all sorts of jungle gym and swings etc teeming with kids. After walking past the pony petting area we arrived at the Luxembourg palace. There is a large rectangular pond with a fountain where several little toy boats were floating along. We got some sun here, stuck our feet in, and enjoyed the pretty views. Made our way to the other end where there were lots of shade and plopped on the grass for some people watching. It's a very large park and if you prefer to be in a more secluded and quiet area there are many of those places also. I really enjoyed my time here. The only thing I didn't love was that you had to pay I think 2 euros to use the toilet.
Picturesque. A quiet stroll through this beautiful garden is just what the doctor order. Very clean and well maintained.
Very pleasant!. This is a beautiful spot to spend a while ambling about beautiful gardens. Bring along a picnic lunch and a cafe and have a nice repast in the sunshine. A real must see,
Oasis in the middle of Paris. Lovely garden, full of real people enjoying life. Great place for an afternoon picnic away from the busy streets.
Great stroll on a rainy day!. Beautiful Gardens, and sculptures. Great Cafe across the street, we went in Dec so it was drizzling but was a great walk!
Beautiful. Clean.Quiet peacefull, beautifull couple of hours of rest.
Relaxing. Nice place to have a croissant and relax watching the parisiens playin tennis, chess or just sungazing.

Beautiful and Peaceful!. The gardens aren't far from the hotel I stayed at the last time I was in Paris. Truly worth seeing. Very peaceful. Quite restful after crowded Paris! Good for people watching! Definitely worth seeing.

Wonderful park, right in the city on the left bank.. A very large park. Wonderful fountains and grassy areas. It has a history to it. Google it and read about it. I usually get a sandwich and a coke cola and go to the park and sit and watch all the people. There is aalot to see.
A breath of fresh air. An oasis of green in the centre of the city? Great place to people watch on a Sunday morning

Gorgeous gardens and great place to relax!. Beautifully maintained gardens - flowers, fountains, benches and if you are lucky, a free concert in this park. A high school band from Scotland played during my visit. It's a great place to take a break from sightseeing on the left bank and focus on people watching and enjoying the greenery.

Fantastic way to spend a Parisian Afternoon. After touring Paris non-stop for almost 5 days, I wanted some down time. Headed to the Luxembourg Gardens on a beautiful summer afternoon, and got lost in the people watching and my Kindle.
A beautiful park, in the middle of the city. Recommendation: bring a lunch with you...then you can have your own picnic!
Great place to eat lunch.. Stopped for lunch here and it was a great setting to do so, i would highly recommend doing the same.

Old time favourite. A rare place in Paris where you can relax. Take your time to stroll on the gravel paths.Watch old man playing chess. Young ones playing tennis, students streching on the grass. Unfortunately this time orangerie was renovated
One of my favorite places. I love the fountain tucked away but wear closed in shoes for the dirt paths. The gardens are magical!

A terrific first thing to do in Paris. A short stroll from our hotel, the Luxembourg Gardens were well worth a visit, particularly on our first day, when we may not have been well equipped to handle the more crowded attractions. A peaceful, beautiful oasis in the city.
Lovely garden. A lovely garden. Great for a picnic around the pond.
Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful and peaceful place to stroll through before or after visiting Notre Dame - its in the same area. Allow at least an hour.
I love gardens. This is a treasure to behold. I love wNdering through here any season. It is beautifully kept. I wish I had the gardeners to do my garden in La Ribiere.
Fabulously and homey. heavenly, I end of living there on visits take a picnic lunch and sit by the pond.
Luxemburg Gardens. Beautiful and peaceful. Good for a rest after a busy day of touring.

Be sure to walk over to the higher woodsy part. The main attraction is the water feature and there are many people sitting around enjoying the greenery. But if you walk over to the elevated gardens - walk up a stairway - the statues are beautiful - and I like the way it's a little less formal that near the buildings and water fountains.
Favourite place to stop. This is my favourite place to stop and have lunch. Grap a chair and watch the world go by.
Beautiful!. Really peaceful and such an interesting place to people watch. So beautiful, vintage Paris!

Perfect For a break. I was travelling with a 5 and 8 year old. Found the gardens to be a nice break, very relaxing. My only complaint is the prices. I paid to enter the playground, to rent a sailboat to push around on the pond, and to let the girls ride a pony. I refused to pay for them to swing. Really?!? I get the pony ride and sailboat fee, but to charge kids for tbe playground and a separate charge for swings??? Disappointing!
gentle. peacefu; and not too crowded watch the kids and the boats

surprisingly lovely. We have visited most of the great parks in Paris, but the Luxembourg Gardens are a pleasant surprise. We felt like we were strolling in a small town park watching families together, tennis courts, playgrounds and then we came upon the gorgeous flower gardens and lawns in front of the palace itself. The day we were there, two orchestras from the USA were giving concerts all afternoon. Best of all, it was all free.

A nice relaxing place to hang with Parisians. It's easy to get overwhelmed by tourists on the left bank. This park offers a wonderful refuge from all that. We brought a picnic lunch and sat on the only patch of grass that was open to foot traffic and we had a lovely time. I was really hoping this park had lots of quiet little garden path nooks. I didn't find any. But it lovey just the same.

Magical. I felt as though I was back in time....experiencing Sunday in the Park.... envisioning Renoir painting away and inspired by the beauty, the flowers, and the general layout of the garden was spectacular. Do not miss! Grab a picnic lunch and eat here!

Relaxation. There was a little grocery store on the side street on the south extrance to the gardens we stopped at for water and some picnic items. Enjoy the great outdoors and scenery at this park. It is very busy so finding seating was a little difficult but well worth it. There are palm trees around the fountains and you can see the Eiffle Tower in the distance.
Breath-taking!. If you are visiting Paris, make sure you visit this spot! It was beautiful on a bright July day.
Have a wander. This is quintessential Paris. The only other gardens that offer a more intimate view of Paris and Parisiennes are the Parc Monceau and the Jardin de Plants.

Even in the rain. Visiting the Luxembourg Gardens was high on my teen daughter's list of things to do, so we stayed in a hotel very close and took a walk first thing in the morning of our first full day. It was raining (albeit warm), and the hotel had umbrellas for us to borrow. My daughter and her friend enjoyed imitating the poses of much of the statuary, and we have a dozen or so very fun photos of that bit of entertainment. We were unable to explore the entire park because of my limitations re. walking long and far, but what we did see was food for the soul. Just lovely. Do take time away from your busy schedules to just walk, sit, watch, listen, and take it all in.
If in Paris be sure to visit. Parks are parks and gardens are gardens but Luxembourgs Gardens is beautiful and worth your time to visit and walk through.

Peaceful..... The park itself is just wide open and peaceful....I stopped at a bakery and bought myself a croissant, baguette sandwich and a drink and had lunch in the park. There is tons of seating where you can just sit, relax and enjoy a meal outside (especially on a beautiful day).

Gorgeous Park. Don't be put off by the 3-star review. the park is gorgeous, but in a city filled with gorgeous parks it really only stands out, in my opinion, because of it's size. It's big and gorgeous, and you'll find artists everywhere tucked away working on their craft. There will be children playing and people enjoying walks. There's a few food stands and bathrooms and in most everyway it's just like every other park in the city, except there are a few parts where you can get away from the crowds, do to it's size, which makes it the park to go visit if you're looking to take a walk and get away from it all for a few minutes before heading back out and exploring Paris.
Beautiful!. I went there on a whim and was really glad I did. It was beautiful!
The Italian fountain was something else. This is a place to catch your breath. Enjoy a few peaceful moments between the other sights on your quest.

make a picnic during a warm summer afternoon. Enjoy the long spring/summer days to make a picnic in the luxemburg gardens - I was lucky enough to be able to attend a Chopin concert with the british philarmonic...even the public toilets were clean!

Tranquility & Beauty at its best!. Such a beautiful garden that you are forced to simply relax and enjoy some of what Paris has to offer, before you re-focus on what's next on your vacation itinerary...hmm "Rodin Museum" - definitely?

DONT MISS BECAUSE ITS BEAUTIFUL. Popped in here somewhat accidentally, but glad we did. Probably one of the best and prettiest parks in Paris. So beautiful!
The Tuilleres gardens park near the Louvre isnt even a park, its dirt. Skip it.
Come to Luxembourg!!! see the Palace, see the Medici Fountain, stunning!
Take a Break. Pleasant place to take a relaxing break from sightseeing. Lots of activities for children. Gardens meticulously cared for. Eiffel Tower is visible from the central fountain area.

Beautiful green garden for walk, picnic or just relaxation. We just took a walk throughout the garden, it was very nice, felt like in the old times, imagined women walking around in their pompuous dresses and men trying to show themselves smart, just my imagination) There are several monuments to the king family members as well. It is in the center of Paris, so a tourist should definitely walk by to see what it is.
Beautiful garden in the midst of a busy city.. We took a short-cut through the gardens while out walking the streets of Paris. A nice respite!
WOW. A definite must see!! The gardens were gorgeous and such a nice place for a picnic lunch.
Well worth a visit. It is situated close to our hotel and we had breakfast in a cafe (close to the fountain, wouldn't recommend it) and enjoyed a lovely walk through the gardens, so beautiful.

Serene, historic and grand. Only one way to summarize - a great snapshot of urban Parisien life yet a historic landmark perfectly preserved. One can almost sense the history and grandeur that the gardens once held. We stumbled into the gardens on a quiet weekday and saw joggers running around, people reading books and the smattering of tourists parading the grounds. Take a book with you and sit on a park bench for a while to truly enjoy this place.
Meh.. It wasn't what I was expecting...very few actual gardens. But a nice place to chat and eat with friends.

Beautiful garden. The garden was very pretty and serene. Nicely manicured trees and ponds. People relaxing.Had a laugh when we saw a mother pushing an empty pram and next to her was her daughter pushing a baby pram with a doll in it !!!
a pretty chilled out park. very active and lively, with kids all around the garden. there was always something going on such as music practice by students, a lady painting on her canvas.
Lazy life. Great just to laze about or read in the sunshine with families enjoying themselves and good location to nip off to the shops or cafe when you need a change

The second largest public park in Paris. The garden contains a hundred statues, monuments, and fountains, scattered throughout the grounds, lots of flowers, all around is green and you can enjoy fresh air!
Picnic. Pick up a picnic lunch, bottle of wine, corkscrew and a baguette and enjoy the gardens. It doesn't get much better than that!

nice & relaxing. let the kids play, drink a galss of wine/champagne, watch the boats, lovely setting with the grand mansion & water fountain. If you fancy chilling out for a couple of hours, letting the kids burn offsome steam in the play area, then pop in here for an hour or 2.
Serene gardens in the middle of the city. Beautiful gardens situated right in the middle of the city. Family friendly. Green grass and beautiful buildings.
My favorite!. I visited quite a few parks and gardens in my 18 days in France but this was by far my favorite. Leave time to just sit and absorb the beauty or plan a picnic there to relax.

Interesting but average. The gardens are very pretty, clean, nicely managed and with lovely places to sit and reflect, but it's not really extraordinary. What makes it special is the history and it's place in the city. No regrets seeing it, but no need to rush back, either.
The Luxembourg Gardens. Just one of the many beautiful gardens in Paris, a visit is not complete without strolling through the gardens...
Beautiful. We took walks without a destination and came upon this beautiful garden. Very green with beautiful trees and flowers. Also, a great view of the Pantheon and the Eiffel towerr.

Beautiful garden in the middle of the city. We stayed in a hotel close to the gardens and loved the beauty of the landscape. Locals and tourists alike just hang out relaxing and enjoying the sunshine. There are hundreds of chairs and benches for people to sit at, a pond where children can float a boat (for a fee, of course), a carousel and amazing playground our kids would have adored (ages 2 and 5). There are bathrooms on the grounds, which I believe are for a fee (we did not use them) but entrance to the park is free.The park is adorned with beautiful golden statues and has tons of shade if you want it. You'll find students due to the proximity to the Sorbonne and other universities and business people working on their laptops or people just taking a break reading a book. We enjoyed just sitting and chatting until they closed the park an hour before sunset, which was really late due to the summer solstice (June 21st). If you do go at the same time of year, the area gets very lively for the Festival du Musique, the music festival where people just set up stages and plug in their amps and entertain the public. The park is not too big and easy to walk around. There is a Senate museum right on the grounds and beautiful flowers and water features throughout. We loves the grooming of the trees into popsicle shapes. The whole area has good shopping as well and some beautiful 3 and 4 star hotels. Highly recommended as a stop for a few hours of quiet and relaxation and of course, my favourite, people watching!

Lovely calm space with plenty of interest. An oasis of calm in a busy area with some lovely little cameos of old Paris: chess players, Orangerie exhibitions etc and plenty of chairs to sit on and enjoy the sun.

Take your kids here!. Beautiful gardens and park. Play area for children. The fountain area in the centre is the place where children use small sailboats. You can rent them for 30 minutes or more. Charming. Give yourself time to walk around the whole area. Park has statues everywhere, and cozy nooks to relax. Lots of benches and chairs!
A nice place to stroll or jog .. A relaxing place to have a coffee and croissant and contemplate life or what to see next .
A nice relaxing. park like a green oasis in the middle of Paris. Somewhere to sit and relax for a while looking at the parisians hurrying by.

Fantastic Playground for Kids!. We had 2,4,7,8 year olds with us and paid the 2 Euro to enter the playground. It was well worth it: all the kids found fun and excitement. There were playground features I had never seen before, and I am a playground aficionado from LA! There are coffee stands surrounding the fenced in playground, fountains, a palace, and a museum all in this lovely city park. Great shade and tree coverage.

Lovely & Lively Gardens. The gardens are really lovely, with a grand fountain in the middle. There were many people there from many walks of life doing everything from walking to floating boats in the fountain. It was a great break in our afternoon & great people watching!
A must visit on a sunny day!. Beautifully laid out gardens which are enjoyed by both Parisians and tourists alike. Formal gardens, pond, palace, cafe - great for all ages.
sit and read. locals love to go here and just sit, drink coffe, read the news and novels. It is a nice place with grounds for kids and dogs to roam about. People to meet new and old friends
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens, and really nice area around to explore for breakfast/brunch/lunch and little stores.

Beautiful. This is a nice place to take a walk, grab a snack, or sit for a while to relax. If you have children, it's a perfect place to play. It's fun to rent a toy sailboat to push around in the central water fountain or visit the large play structure area. I believe there is a fee to enter that play area. There is no fee to enter the park.
Beautiful and relaxing!!. Get a cafe au lait and relax in the chairs around the pond, and enjoy the children sailing boats. You can even see the Eiffel Tower.
It's where Parisians breathe. Classic garden, beautiful architecture, and not overcrowded.

A walk in the Park....Fantastic!. I visited the Luxembourg Gardens several times both with my wife and on my own. As a native New Yorker I have been to Central Park in Manhattan many times but the Luxembourg Gardens are very different. They are cleaner, extremely well kept and very beautiful. For me a visit to the Gardens is a time to relax, enjoy the welcoming environment and escape from a busy day at work. I love Paris and Luxembourg Gardens make me feel at peace. No visit to Paris is really complete without spending an hour or more in Luxembourg Gardens.
Best place in Paris!. We came here right after a light rain storm so the place was deserted. It was about 7 PM and the sun was vibrant on the buildings surrounding the park, just gorgeous!
A very civilized park.. It's best with clear blue skies and coolish weather and with the gardens in bloom. A great place to walk (or jog as many do) and clear your mind and be at peace.

Ideal for a lunch break. This place is an oasis in the middle of a busy city, after a morning spent visiting various places and walking around the city, we brought a nice baguette in a boulangerie nearby and had lunch relaxed in this little piece of paradise.
Great place for picnic. Great place to bring a picnic lunch or wine/cheese and people watch :)

Paris gardens. Perhaps a bit off the tourist's beaten path, but worth a detour. Semi-formal gardens with boating lake (boats for hire) and plenty of seating (metal chairs). No cost. Good for people watching on a hot sunday afternoon.
Beautiful gardens. This is well worth a visit, gardens are absolutely gorgeous.
Relax. Spending time in this area makes you feel Parisian. It is clear that the citizens love their gardens and park, and that t is well-used. Lovely.
lovely green space. Lovely place to visit early evening lots of chairs to just take a break from all the hustle and bustle from the city, people reading, chatting and enjoying the beautiful gardens.
Great place to relax. It is a perfect place to relax. Go for an ice cream and just seat and enjoy the warmer days and the great light during spring and summer.
Very pretty. A lovely place to spend a relaxed few hours, and it can be nicely combined with visits to Notre Dame or the Panthéon

Luxembourg Gardens is the Central Park of Paris. Luxembourg Gardens on the Left Bank of the Seine River is a beautiful green spot in Paris. Unlike Central park this park has a classical design with trees spaced in rows and columns. The many statues are a tribute to the queens of French history. Relaxing, playing or people watching are all possible here.

An Impressionist afternoon in Paris. It was our last afternoon in Paris. We were heading back to the Antipodes the next day, as were our friends. So we decided that a stroll in the Luxembourg Gardens would give us the exercised needed before long-haul flights. If you haven't been to these exquisite gardens, then do go. Here is info about their history as listed on Wikipedia http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jardin_du_Luxembourg.On a warm afternoon Parisians come out of their apartments and sit in the dappled sun under the trees. It was like an Impressionist painting with the sun filtering through the lush tree canopy. People strolled lazily around, and lolled on the lawn that allowed public access. The Medici Fountain is exquisite.Of course we had to visit the tearooms where we indulged in salted caramel icecream sundaes - and this is a delightful memory that will endure forever. Sitting outside the Luxembourg Gardens tearooms eating these toothsome delights. And as if in a fairytale, a young bridal couple strolled by, she looking chic in her knee-length cream dress with full skirt, a blush-coloured satin bow at her waist and matching cream bolero. They were off to join their family and friends for a wedding picnic in the park. Utterly delightful!

Stunning. We have had a few trips to Paris and never made it over to see these gardens. But we did this time and wow. Our kids had the best time playing in the playground. It cost 2.5 Euros but was well worth it. The fountain and gardens were stunning. All the flowers were yellow, they must do themes. The scent of the flowers was spectacular.
A lovely afternoon stroll.. It is a nice walk. Earnest Hemingway used to catch the pigeons to eat when he lived in Paris in the 20s.

A beautiful garden with a touch of everthing.... A highlight of our recent trip to Paris was our visit to Luxembourg Gardens. Located in the southern most part of Paris' Latin Quarter, the Luxembourg Gardens offers the widest varieties of relaxation and outdoor family time. Paris is full of gardens from the historic, large-sized ones to the small, cozy gardens hidden throughout the city.Luxembourg certainly qualifies as a large garden. It's the gardens of the beautiful Luxembourg Palace which is the home of the French Senate. The gardens have something for everyone. It's filled with close to 100 strategically placed sculptures, beautiful floral landscapes, and fountains each surrounded by benches prime for unwinding and people watching. As we walked through these sections of the park we noticed Parisians enjoying the soothing quiet. But the gardens offer much more. There's a large playground in the center of the park with a huge assortment of jungle gymns, monkey bars, and slides. Directly behind the playground we found Parisians playing a kind of tennis while to the left we sat and watched a boules game. There are plenty of paths for jogs or romantic strolls. And in the middle lies a beautiful crafted grass section bordered by some gorgeous flowers. We sat in some chairs that surrounded the grassy garden center with a large number of locals and just soaked up the setting. The Palace sat in the background like a postcard. It was lovely.There's so much else worth mentioning including the Medici Fountain and the Luxembourg museum. We had a wonderful time there and didn't want to leave. There is so much to experience both with your spouse and/or family, plus it's a wonderful opportunity to experience the Parisian culture. We loved it.

Disappointing. We visited this park on two different days at two different times of the day and both times the children's play areas were closed. A very big disappointment for our 4 year old daughter. We found Jardin des Tuileries to be much better for our family.
A beautiful surprise.. We stumbled across this oasis and just loved it. Discover it for yourself!
Relaxing. This was a beautiful, relaxing garden in the Latin quarter. We enjoyed the neighborhoods nearby.

The best leisurely afternoon in Paris. For a perfect, relaxing afternoon, just go buy some cheese, baguettes and a couple bottles of wine and then go to Luxembourg Garden.
