Enjoy the afternoon on the grass in sun or shade, people-watching, listening to music, sipping wine and eating the snacks you brought along. You can even take a short nap. This is one of the places where Parisians flock to enjoy life.
Very relaxing moment. Friendly trees and open space, ideal for families, couples, or reading a book silently.
Take the kids to hire boats. Kids loved the boats in the pond. Go in the morning so you don't have to queue to hire the kids sailing boats. Lovely park to relax.

Do not miss this!!. This was one of my very favorite experiences in Paris and I will definitely return here when I go back to Paris someday. This is truly a beautiful park with wonderful green grass, a pond where children (and adults) can play with toy sailboats, many chairs and benches in quiet areas to rest, and enjoy people watching. I missed a lot in Paris, but I'm glad that I didn't miss this!

Relaxing oasis. When we were in Paris before, it had rained a lot so we did not get to really spend time in the gardens. This visit, we lucked out and had sun for our few days in the city, so made sure to get to the Luxembourg Gardens to stroll around for a bit. There were all sorts of people, from toddlers to grandmas to a group of American teenagers, all seeming to have a fine time. We had tea and pastries, which was OK but overpriced, especially since we had clearly ordered just one set of tea and pastries and one order with just tea and the waiter brought two (and charged accordingly); we'd put in our order in both English and French, but the waiter clearly chose to "misunderstand."
Beautiful park. Lovely clean park with plenty of seats (as always in Paris!). Lucky for us there was a brass band playing which really added to the atmosphere.

Unexpected. Travelled in August and was amazed by the number of plants and flowers. Water features were fantastic. Place was beautiful and probably my fondest memory of Paris, which is saying something.
Peace, Comfort. Take a beer, crisp and rest on the sward. Wonderful ambiance and the best garden I saw in Paris.
Day in Lux. This place is so pretty, take a camera, you will be glad you did. If its a nice day out, even better.
Great Park. Nice place, visiting on summer and autumn.Reserve at least 2 hours to see everything and take a rest.

Quiet space in the city. It is a comfortable walk from the river down to the gardens giving you the opportunity to see some of the real Paris. The gardens are best in the summer but still a lovely quiet place to visit
Free and Beautiful. Check them out! Great spot to look at cool statues, pretty gardens and ponds. Read, have a picnic. It's so serene and beautiful.
Beautiful Gardens. We took a short break here to rest our feet during our day of walking. There are a lot of chairs and benches to rest on.

Fantastic. A beautiful spot in the middle of the city. I first visited the gardens several years ago on a visit to the city on my own. This summer I could not wait to visit again whilst on a trip to Paris with my grand-daughters.They enjoyed so much that they begged to return a second day, and I'm so glad that we did as it was a Sunday and there was so much more going on.There is a lovely lake with miniature sailing boats and a fantastic, well-shaded children's play park (reasonable admision fee). On the Sunday there were pony rides, a small carrousel, go-carts and live musical entertainment in the band- stand. There are several refreshment and snack stalls throughout the picturesque park or you can take your own picnic. A wonderful change of pace from the bustle of the rest of the city and Disney!
Words fail me.... So beautiful, I actually cried. My favorite place in Paris (and that says a lot!) Look for the Statue of Liberty tucked among the sculptures.
Relaxing. We visited these gardens during our stay. Had a lovely cup of tea at the cafe and enjoyed the ambience of the garden. Fortunately it was a lovely afternoon.
Bring your lunch.. A very nice place to put up your feet and have some lunch. There is plenty of art to look at, lots of shade and you can partake in a spot of people watching.

My all-time favorite in Paris. Parks are very important for most Parisians because most apartments are small and camped, and the weather can be very unpredictable. So, whenever the weather turns nice, EVERYONE heads to their favorite park.This park is great, they always have an interesting photo exhibit around the perimeter of the park. There are fountains, chairs available and even cafe's. I use to teach school not too far from there, and my favorite pass time was to have a mini-picnic during my lunch breaks with my colleagues. There's also a jogging trail around the perimeter. It's not marked as a jogging trail per se, but it's pretty obvious once your there. There's also a small museum showing different exhibits. They also have areas to play chess etc., and for the kids lots of play areas.During warmer months, there'll be entertainment such as orchestras or visiting bands. They usually perform at the Gazebos close to the cafes... Definitely a must visit.

Beautiful garden, very relaxing!. Beautiful big garden in Paris, with many places to picnic (they provide chairs and it has signs telling you where you can picnic on the lawn) lots of statues, a real outdoor café, de Medici fountain, and if you can find it there's a Statue of Liberty around too! There's a nice chateau too, but I don't know if it's open to the public. It was very relaxing to spend some time here!
Good to people watch. lovely feel, beautiful and excellent views of the surrounding architecture.

Tranquility in the heart of Sainte Germaine. The museum is worth seeing, but don't miss the park. This is truly one of the great places to see daily life in Paris--a children's play ground, men tossing the bocci ball, jiggers, lovers, old people gossiping--all in an incredible park behind a palace.

Stunning and many locals. Nice place to see the Palace of Luxembourg as well as the amazing grounds, kids sailing boats in the small pond on the grounds, Parisians taking in the sun all around, vendors with food, tennis courts, pony rides and amazing photographic opportunities. Highly recommend and please wear good shoes for walking!

Green and relaxing. In the heart of the dusty Paris, lies a piece of heaven, with lovely sculptures, cozy seats and relaxing variety of trees and flowers. It was truly like visiting another nation. Good access for handicaps, close to metro, no beggars inside and one amuzingly vandalized pacifist composition.

I could live here. This place is so incredibly relaxing and beautiful! We had a little picnic by the fountain and wandered through the gardens afterward. It's a great place for joggers of which we saw many! My husband was inspired to follow suite the next morning!
Fantastic. Unfortunately it was raining when we visited but at Lae we had an uninterrupted view of the gardens.
People watching. Take a stroll through Paris' best city park. Pack a lunch- wine, cheese, baquette.
Most Beautiful Flowers. Found this gem while waiting for Train. Free beautiful gardens along Seine in Heart of Paris.
Beautiful gardens.. A wonderful place to sit in the sun, enjoy the view and watch the world go by. An added bonus was the youth orchestra playing in the bandstand.
Grab a bottle of wine. and pack a baguette and some cheese. The most beautiful garden in Paris.

Wonderful afternoon people watching. Our first thought was, "Doesn't anyone work during the day?!" Parisians love their parks and we do too. This is one of the better ones to stroll through or just sit and relax and watch the other people who were probably watching us. Great place to grab a sandwich or picnic lunch and relax as a break from the sites.
Picturesque. Sat and admired the view of the tower and the structured trees and gardens. The fountain was empty, so plan to see it in spring/summer
Marie de Medici's back yard. It's amazing what the royalty of Europe was able to command and control. This is some fantastic back yard!
Quiet and beautiful. This is a great place to rest and regroup, take some beautiful photos and just enjoy nature.

Great break from tours. We really enjoyed relaxing in the gardens. It was a great time for our younger kids to run around and not be in a museum. Great playground, alththough it costs to enter. We sat on outside and watched our kids (10 and 8),, but wouldnt feel comfortable doing that with much younger.
Charming. A nice place to relax and watch people. It has a timeless, charming quality.
Beautiful gardens. Worth walking through. Fountains, gardens, wide paths among some of Paris' greatest sights

Lovely green space in the city. We visited the gardens on a lovely sunny evening. Although it was busy there was plenty of space, light and views to appreciate. Lots of walks with different vistas, a children's playground, a lake with model boats and a pretty chateau type palace. Chairs to sit in in the shade. A haven in the busy city. A must visit.
So so. Quite dirty.... And smelly. But lots of activities inside, tennis, etc
A peace of tranquility. Lovely to escape here after the crowds of Paris & regain your sanity

Best gardens in Paris!. I cannot believe the flowers and the overall landscaping at this place. There were so many people having a picnic here. This is the reason you come to Paris. Grab a bottle of wine, some bread and cheese and sit on a bench for an hour or two.What a wonderful experience. I would come here everyday if I lived here!

Fun for the kids. We were traveling with two children and they had a great time playing on the jungle gym and watching the sailboats in the main portion of the park. Nice place for a great stroll if the weather permits.

Great Place to visit. This is a Paris must do..... Everytime we visit Paris we go there and it's always a highlight, just sit in the gardens or do the run around he outside. great place for the kids.....Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!

Believe the hype. This is a wonderful park to take children. I had read that in many guidebooks and websites and it's definitely true. When I was a child I would have loved the playground at Luxembourg Gardens. Our 5-year-old certainly did. I guess the only downside is the small charge for entry. It was our last day in Paris and I had successfully managed to spend all of my euros by then so the last bit of pocket change that I had was just enough to pay for my son's admission. So my wife and I just sat next to the fence and watched him play with Parisian children. It was definitely a great experience for him.

A slice of Parisian life. Luxembourg Gardens are an excellent place to people watch and observe Parisians at leisure. I visited on a bank holiday when school was out, so there were lots of children playing with sailboats in the pond. It was a chilly, windy day so I didn't stay put for long, but it was still enjoyable to walk around the park and see the dogs of Paris and their people. In nicer weather, I think a picnic in Luxembourg Gardens would surpass any cafe or bistro experience.

Activity or tranquility - your choice. This is a lovely place for taking a break from the bustle of Paris. We visited here twice during our 10 day stay in Paris, and took advantage of the comfortable chairs by the Lake. You can watch the locals playing, relaxing, and enjoying themselves here. Plenty of shade, and pretty walking paths make this a wonderful spot for a respite.

Serenity personified. The very first feeling as you enter the Jardin du Luxembourg is that of peace and serenity. The entire park exudes a sense of peace and calm. Very soothing to one's nerves and spirit.The well coiffured lawns and manicured trees add to the charm of the place. We visited the gardens on a Sunday and there were many joggers, people who had come with their kids to relax and plenty of people exercising.... But the atmosphere was still very peaceful and relaxing.The greenery is beautifully maintained. The little pond in the center had little sail boats and ducks. The only thing that I would give a thumbs-down to here was the fact that the toilets were locked (they were chargeable at 40 cents per person - but they were locked) Thankfully, there was a mechanised toilet just outside on the pavement which we could use.Do keep the weather in mind before making a trip here - we were caught there by the rains and that dampened our spirit a bit as we could not take many pictures of this lovely place.1. Romantic place if you wish to go with your partner.2. Fun and happy place with rides if you wish to take your children here.3. Absolutely the must-do place if you wish to go for a jog with your jogging buddy (or alone too)4. The place to be - if you wish to linger alone with your thoughts.Do have the coffee ice-cream here , if you are a coffee-lover. For Euro 2.50 in a waffle cone, the icecream is really value for money.
Beautiful... Not as crowded as many gardens in Paris and beautifully appointed.

Beautiful gardens right in the city centre. These gardens are beautiful and I try and make a visit each time I am lucky enough to get to Paris. There is lots to see and do or even just grab something to eat and find a bench to people watch. The large pond is always amusing.

Beautiful gardens. These are the nicest gardens in Paris and you can sit on designated parts of grass. For children, apart from the boating pond, there is the best city playpark, for which you pay a small entrance fee. It is fenced so difficult for children to run off, there are age specific areas and a small kiosk selling drinks, sweets and ice-cream and a larger food stall just opposite the play park. There is lots of seating and shade underneath the trees. Toilets too. The best place to take the little people to burn off some steam and give them a break being tourists for a bit. There are a few crepe kiosks in the gardens too.
charming. I went running through the gardens several times during my 5 day stay. A beautiful park with so many offerings. Would be a perfect place for a lunch or early afternoon picnic.

Luxembourg Gardens, Paris, France. One of my favorite parks in Paris. Beautiful grounds, lots of things to do and watching people is the best. Here is a short video I shot in May 2012 - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uztc-Qxj6Yk
Not to be missed. No superlatives suffice. It is wonderful, lovely, peaceful, always interesting. Linger here. Its worth it.

Lovely place to rest and read and people-watch. The gardens are beautiful, and there are activities there for kids and families. Just promenading is lovely. But stop and read in the shade on a hot spring day. It really makes the experience.
Lovely on a sleepy sunny Sunday. We counted no fewer than 10 snoozing in the shade in this lovely garden.
lovely gardens. statues of women instead of the old guys was very cool. The area north of the park is very cute while the east to the pantheon is kind of boring
Relaxing. Very relaxing. My wife and I came across an impromptu dance session one Sunday afternnon. It was amazing
Green in the heart of the city. A great green heart in the middle of the 6eme arrondissement. You can walk, relax, do some jogging. Nice flowers
Gorgeous!. Beautiful flowers in the spring. Great place to take photos! Highly recommend it.
the gardens. a magnificent sight to behaold, simply beautiful in appearance and maintenance
A nice walk. It's a nice city park with lots of children & teens there.
A little bit of peace and quiet!. The gardens are beautiful, it's a retreat after a hectic day exploring.

Take a Walk. What a lovely place to wander and feel like a local for just a while.There are children sailing colourful boats, people lounging in the lovely green metal chairs reading or napping, joggers looking as serious as joggers do where ever they are in the world, musicians playing in the gazebos, art exhibitions, pony rides and puppet shows, pretty flowers and superb trees,, lawns you probably can't sit on and gravelly paths that crunch under foot ...Take a break from touring and enjoy the gardens.

THE Best!. Grab one of the leaning back chairs if you can find one and sit back with a bottle of wine and watch the world go by. This is my favorite pastime in all of Paris. It makes you appreciate the little things in life...people, nature, sunshine. This place is magical.

Popular with Parisien families. Great place to relax in between other attractions... garden benches and indiviual chairs all around make it even more welcoming. There's a nice play area for kids, and few icecream stalls around. Dozens of Parisien families were out with the kids, in late afternoon.
Walking in the rain!. The only place you will see locals wearing tennis shoes!

SUper Fun and fantastic playground !. If you have children and are visiting , your young children will really appreciate a stop here . It is the most interesting and fun playground ! Definitely worth a stop!

Take the time. Take the time to walk through these wonderful gardens. There are so many different areas to explore. The gardens are beautifully maintained and it's a great place to relax in the middle of a very bustling city.

Beautiful on a sunny day. Grab some cheese from a market, strawberries, cherries and a bottle of wine and go sit in the gardens on a sunny day and relax. A wonderful pretty atmosphere filled with locals and tourists on the weekends.

The gardens remain nice as always.. The gardens and people there were nice as always. Be careful about moving a chair into the shade under a palm tree. A nice French Officer, in-charge-of-chairs, had us return them back into the sun. The other viewers had a nice laugh.
Picnic in the Park. If the weather is nice, just go an relax. There are also a ton of things for the kids to do. You have to pay for some of the activities, but the kids will love it.
Beautiful. Lovely to Just walk through and if time to stop and enjoy the statues and people watching. Sunny weekends can get very busy with locals picnicking.
Picnic Time. Great place to grab some lunch, a bottle of wine or beer and sit and people watch. The flowers are beautiful. It's a nice rest spot between museum visits.
Beautiful Gardens!. Beautiful gardens, a great place for people watching. Good little food stands. Lovely!
well worth a visit. we had a lovely al fresco lunch here and spent a lovely time listening to the band on the band stand :-)
Lovely Stroll along the Gardens of Luxembourg. Its a rather massive garden. Walking from one end to another may take a long time but its well worth the effort.

Fun for the whole family! Gorgeous park with lots to do!. This park is an absolute dream for kids but it's great for adults alike. This is Paris' largest park and it's really amazing. If you go on a sunny Sunday you will literally see thousands of people there.We went on a great Sunday after a few days of rainy weather so it seems like everyone and their kids were all here. Literally thousands of people. On the weekends they have live music concerts that are free so people are all gathered around listening to the great music.The park has chairs scattered around the park which you can move to other areas or near the fountains if you want.There are several entrances/exits all around the park. The park is massive. In the center is the fountain which is beautiful. They had small boats in it that kids were playing with on sunday. And something that some people don't realize is the fountain is FULL of big fish. So if you throw in some food watch them float to the top and gobble up the food. Your kids will LOVE it!There are tennis courts, basketball courts, and there are even pony rides that you can take your kids on. Tickets are €3 for shorter 300 m rides and €5 for two tickets which you need on the longer 600 m rides. Our kids loved it! So something great you can do if you have young kids.The Palace there is also gorgeous. It's fun for the entire family. They have various events inside the park. On Sunday they had kids practicing their fencing lessons and another concert in the end of the park near the kids playground.The only thing not so great is there are only like 2 bathrooms for the entire park. If you have kids and don't have much patience for waiting.... just go across the street from the main entrance and use the McDonald's bathroom in the basement. You have to buy something (just get a bottled water if you're not hungry) and they will give you a receipt with a Code to use the bathroom (WC - water closet). Just punch in the code on the door lock.
time to relax. If you have the time to spare, why not relax in the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg? Makes you feel instantly like a Parisian.
Good Place to Rest and Relax. Beautiful place to rest after a lot of walking. It feels serene even though surrounded by busy areas.

a top attraction. This is listed and praised as a top attraction by all the major guide books, and with very good reason. A huge garden that has something for everyone, large floral gardens, numerous statues and sculptures, a long tree lined walk up to the very large lake. Sit by the lake and relax admiring the Palais du Luxembourg, home of the Paris Senate, so no entry.. Do not miss the 16th c Fontaine Medicis an attraction in its own right. An absolute visual feast all round and with many other attractions nearby. Do not, however go to the Musee du Luxembourg, a total waste of good money.

Grandiose park with majestic air. Walk around, look at the way the park is built, look at the amount of people it can hold without feeling crowded. Sit in the famous chairs and avoid walking on the grass. Just spend time there and breath in the excellence that is Jardin du Luxembourg

Huge gardens with plenty to see. Brilliant...huge gardens with lots to see. We spent a couple of hours here people watching & eating lunch al fresco....
There was a band playing in the bandstand & the fountains & gardens make them worth a visit

Peaceful. After walking around for what seemed like forever, we happened across this splendid park. We walked around, sat for a while and found a bench to watch some people play tennis (who were pretty good by the way).
Maybe the prettiest gardens in Paris.. Visit during the day on weekends and you get a sense of average Parisian life. See the catacombs at the same time.
Beautiful Gardens!. Worth walking through if you are in the area. Beautiful gardens with lots of sculpture. Seats and benches available to relax and enjoy the views.

Stunning. These gardens are stunning. Such a beautiful and restful place. There are many sculptures to view and chars that are provided to sit around the gardens and ponds lay back. Even though we were there on an overcast, cool day it was a great experience.
Children's haven. Our boys of 20 months, 4 and 6 years made several visits during our four days in Paris to use the playground, run around and blow off some steam. What a fantastic place!
Beautiful garden. Must see - very nice and green garden. A good place to relax and enjoy the sun in the chairs around the lake

A wonderful walking museum. If the day is bright and you feel the need to gain some fresh air, go to the Luxembourg Gardens. Depending on the time of year, this getaway in the heart of the city affords the weary traveler a chance to breathe in the fresh air of the park and shed the chaos of Paris. Open exhibitions dot the gardens and people watching here is at its finest. It is wonderful and alive.

Fun with Kids. We were trying to get over get lag with 4 kids. The gardens were perfect to keep them awake & interested. We rented sail boats for our boys to push around the pond which they loved. Then we just walked around the gardens & ate a picnic dinner on the grass. Good place to relax.
Beautiful!. Great place for a picnic, or just to sit and read a book

Permitted to picnic. Beautiful gardens, we were allowed to sit on the lawn in a specially notified area and had a delightful picnic. It seem seem rather strange that we had to sit in the allocated space which was quite full of lunchtime workers and students, but very pleasant and refreshing to sit in the shade on a hot day.
peaceful. This is the place for a quiet walk. beautifully tended and quiet.

Pickup Basketball Games. Visited in May, 2012 with the wife and kids (20 and 23) this time and visited the Jardin du Luxembourg again. Discovered that a basketball court exists (next to the puppet show). My son and I came back after purchasing a basketball and he was invited to play in a pickup game. Very nice local kids, one of whom spoke a little English. Was a highlight of the trip for both of us. The gardens are beautiful and worth spending a couple of hours wandering/relaxing on a nice day.
Lovely. Lovely gardens with many children (and adults) out sailing their boats, excercising, relaxing, enjoying.

Gardens of the Senate. These enormous gardens surround what is now the Senate. Thousands of people use then everyday for walking, playing tennis, boules, jogging, or just sitting and relaxing. The flower beds and ornamental garden are beautiful and conatin all kinds of sculptures and statuary. There is a huge childen's play area.

Time for a stroll.. We always go walk through the Luxembourg Gardens. Makes us feel very Parisian. Lots of runners when we were there. The weather was nice that day. It's a great place to take a break from sightseeing.
Take the kids!. Always beautiful but a great place to take the kids to their own special playground.
Peaceful Walk. Beautifully kept gardens. Perfect for a quiet stroll.
A real Paris experience. A beautiful set of gardens with great variety. My favourites are the bee hives and the varieties of apples in the south west corner.

Beautiful gardens. We found the gardens after spending most of the day walking around the Latin quarter and spent over an hour and a half wandering around and soaking up the sun in front of the fountains.
Lovely. If you are staying in the 5th or 6th districts this is a wonderful place to have a picnic as do many Parisians.
A haven. Men playing boules (or petanque?). Beautiful statuary

great playground for kids. We came here to relax after a marathon day of touring. The grounds are beautiful - my husband and I both commented in one spot that it was the most perfect grass we had ever seen. But our main objective was the playground for our kids, and they were not disappointed. A small entry fee, and they were entertained for several hours. They playground is completely enclosed and safe/secure and offers plenty of bench seating for parents while the kids run from one activity to another. My kids are 7 and 4 and they both were entertained. We also enjoyed the marionette show and the old carrousel that were right in the same area. Snacks and drinks are available too.

Nice place to walk but not a top attraction. The gardens are extensive and well used by Parisians so a walk through is interesting. They are not fabulously gorgeous gardens like The Serebelloni Gardens in Bellagio, for instance, so I wouldn't rate them as a must see in Paris if you do not have lots of time.

Gorgeous park. Located a stones throw from the Luxembourg RER station and down the road from the Pantheon is this lovely large garden with wide open spaces and tree lined gravel paths. It is a lovely spot for a walk or a cycle particularly in the first light of morning. There is a palace with manicured gardens and set before a lake. Off to one side is the Fontaine Medicis which is a small water feature with a view up towards the Pantheon.
Don't miss the chance to spend time here!. What an enormous, varied, beautiful, and safe garden this is! Once you see it, you'll want to come back often. Enjoy a pretty day here, walking or sitting.
Lovely park in Paris. Have been in Winter and Summer. In Summer, it's gorgeous with all the greenery, yet in winter there's still something special about it
absolustely beautiful and very romantic.. A beautiful and relaxed oasis in the heart of paris. Visit if you have time in paris and are looking for a nice palce to relax, unwind and perhaps picnic.

Beautiful!. This was the most beautiful garden we saw in Paris. We also enjoyed the small cafe near the Palace. I am a Master Gardener & critical of all the tightly clipped French gardens but this one had a nice mix of natural, clipped, fountains, an orangerie & statutes. Bravo!
Great place to take a break. This wonderful park is a great place to escape from the pace of the big city and enjoy green space with the Parisiens -- it's beautiful.

Sunday afternoon family fun in the Luxembourg Gardens. We happened to be in the Luxembourg Gardens on a Sunday afternoon, in time to watch bocce ball, fencing, capoeira, wrestling, tennis, and many other family events. Besides the entertainment, the gardens and the palace are quite beautiful!
Lovely walk. We enjoyed walking through here whilst in Paris. I imagine if you lived in Paris it would be a lovely place to spend a lot of time with all the things available in there.
Beautiful park. Definitely plan on strolling through here. If you are walking around the Latin Quarter or St. Germain, this is a nice place to relax.

calm and quiet. This is a wonderful place to rest after too much walking. There are enough chairs for everyone. You can place your chair as you like. Here, one can walk amongst locals, as opposed to walking amongst the hoards of fellow-tourists at popular sights.
Beautiful park. A beautiful and very big park. A great pplace to have a picknik.
My favorite gardens of Paris. There is always people soaking in the sun, children playing around the great basins and it is a perfect place to stop, have a sandwich and enjoy the experience
Beautiful gardens. Lovely setting, lots of people enjoying the sun, on a beautiful spring day.
Gorgeous place to stroll. Make like a Parisian and spend a few hours just sitting and reading or people-watching in thsi goegeous setting. Free and not crowded - winner!
relaxing. beautiful for a walk and people watch... one of the best parks
Beautiful. Pick a sunny day, grab a sandwich and a lazy chair and snooze for a couple of hours in gardens that rival Central Park for beauty and diversity. One of the highlights of our trip.

Perfect place to relax a bit. This "jardin" is huge and beautiful, specially on a sunny day. There are chairs and benches everywhere, and it is a perfect place to bring a picnic lunch of baguettes and cheese!
The beauty of nature... Astonishingly beautiful gardens with lots of space to walk and relax..a must see..!

Great spot for families. We traveled with three young kids and stayed near this park..la great place for kids to play, lots to do on the playground and very lively atmosphere. Great cafe near the live music area.
Nice peaceful spot in the city.. Nice quiet park near to the sorbonne and St. Michel.

Perfect respite. This was my favorite stop in Paris. Quiet, beautiful and you see real Parisians just enjoying their day. I spent few hours on a beautiful Spring Day just watching tennis being palyed, families sailing boats on the pond and young couples sitting on the folding chairs watching the day. Really lovely.
lovely day. the gardens were beautiful plenty to see and plenty of seating
Peaceful and beautiful place!. Inside Saint Germain you will find this huge and peaceful place where you can walk around or simply be seated and watch the movement. Its a must see in Paris!
such a lovely park. the park is really in the middle of the town, but you feel as if you were on the countryside and you even can play tennis there!

Take your chess set along. Great place to unwind with a warm baguette from one of the many boulangeries in the environs. Do not forget your chess set at the hotel though: the many tables having a chess-board as their tabletop makes playing chess extremely inviting.

Great for a walk or jogg. Went jogging there last week, beautiful garden, extremely well maintained. The locals come here on the weekend to read their newspaper, some play tennis, some walk their dogs, some jogg. Very nice!
A place to relax and meditate!. Luxembourg Gardens is a lovely place to picnic and to relax and wind down.

Beautiful & well worth a visit on a dry day. We wanted something tranquil after manically exploring Paris so took a picnic and spent the whole day there. It was full but still felt relaxing. Flowers, water features and lawns were beautiful. There was a band playing in the band stand with an eccentric conductor who had all the kids, and adults, in fits of laughing. A vast place with intriguing sculptures here and there. Fab and well worth a visit. It probably looks good in the rain too but I'd go when it's dry to appreciate it at its best. Enjoy!
Neccesary?. Should be at the end of your priorities list. Nice gardens but that is all. If you decide to go head for the fountain!

Exquisite color accents amazing sculptures. I've been to Paris 4 times now, only this last time did I get to the Luxembourg gardens. I was blown away by the amazing color in the gardens. We were there in Sept and the colors they used were warm yellow, orange, red and purple - absolutely stunning displays of blooms. The gardens were gorgeous by themselves, but to see the fabulous sculptures surrounded by the intense colors and shapes - magnificent. And they even had this great play area with huge sandboxes for the kids to play in, surrounded again, by unique and vibrantly colored plants.

Morning stroll. This is an excellent place to start the day. We enjoyed a quiet cup of coffee here. It was very relaxing a beautiful. Perfect if you want a quiet moment away from the city hustle and bustle.

Rent a miniature sailboat and go back to when you were young. Les Jardins du Luxembourg are a great place to spend a sunny afternoon. There are chairs all over so that you can sit and stay a while taking in the different things going on, from wedding parties taking the usual photos to venerable ladies having an animated discussion. The best is to rent a sailboat and bring back memories. On weekends there's a bandstand with musicians and a restaurant.

Parisians chilling in the sun. Love the way Parisians enjoy their parks and have designated grassy areas where you are allowed to sit or lie. There was a Mexican band playing as well the day we were there.

A large garden in the heart of paris. very relaxed and varied.. A nice place yo spend a few hours. It has lots of activities going on. People playing tennis...chess (there seems to be a club of some sort), and even a special are for small kids to play (its paid. Around 2€ per head). Lovely place to amble along...or to just sit back and watch paris go by :-).

A little piece of Heaven. When I lived in Paris one summer, I would always cut through the gardens every chance I could and would take the long way home. Best time is early morning when it first opens, sitting by the Medeci fountain. Very peaceful.

nice relaxing getaway.... Our hotel was near Luxembourg Gardens, so we made our way here early one morning. It was a nice relaxing getaway ... beautiful scenery with the palace, fountains, trees, etc. Also lots of people watching with people jogging, walking, painting, etc.

A very different Paris experience. After three full days in Paris, my wife and I stumbled across the Luxembourg Gardens and discovered yet another charming element to this beautiful city.This spacious park features vast lawns, beautiful sculpture, fountains, RC boat races, and more. We felt as if we were the only tourists as countless local families were enjoying a beautiful weekend afternoon.Have a little free time in Paris? Do yourself a favor and decompress within the confines of this beautiful park. You will gain a new perspective of your Paris experience.

Beautiful formal gardens in the heart of Paris. I love the Luxembourg. One enters a place of beauty and stillness within a bustling metropolis. Wherever one stands, the avenues of the park create pleasing vistas in any direction and the formal garden at the centre is a perfect place to catch one's breath and enjoy a moment of peace before exploring more of this fascinating city.

Relax!! You're in Paris!. This was my 4th trip to Paris, but my first time visiting Luxembourg Gardens. It is a wonderful retreat that was a convenient walk from our hotel in the 6th district. The crowd is less touristy, and you feel as though this is the park where Parisians go to relax and enjoy a gorgeous spring afternoon. Be sure to watch the children's pony rides and the older gentlemen playing SERIOUS bocce ball. Next time, I'm going to bring a blanket and a picnic.
Amazing!!. Wow!!! Just beautiful!! What history, what beauty, and what Gardens! Go in May/June!! Best time to see flowers in full bloom and not too many tourists towards end of May.

A romantic place worth writing home about. You could easily spend the whole day there...on a sunny day !Just across the street from the French Senate, hip boutiques of left bank...all languages spoken there ...

Visit to Luxembourg Gardens. We came here to relax after two days walking our legs off seeing as many sights as we could (more often than not, it was quicker to walk than use the metro). It was a warm, sunny day with chairs scattered around so that you could relax and take in the view of the boating lake and mansion. An added bonus is that there is no admission fee.

Wonderful refuge in big city. This garden is massive and provides pleasure for masses of people. It has large open spaces but many interesting features to discover. The flower garden is spectacular but also the trees. There are comfortable chairs for sitting and admiring the former palace but best of all to just meander and enjoy the various features.
So beautiful!. My husband and I ran here almost every afternoon. If you like to watch people and experience on e of the most beautiful places on earth, do not miss this!
Elegant, Parisian Garden.... Definitely visit the Jardin Du Luxembourg when in Paris...Entrance is free and the gardens are stately and peaceful.
Bring a picnic..... ....and plan to stroll through the Italian and English gardens. Check out the statues, reflecting pools, the Senate, and people watch from any place that strikes your fancy.
Lovely. Had a picnic and was lovely on the warm summers day. Enough seats.
Lovely. I was impressed by the number of people using the gardens. The green areas were very peaceful and it was nice to see people just sitting in the sun enjoying the scene.

Beautiful. Such a relaxing place! Plus there is an amazing muffin bakery right up the street! Columbus Cafe!! We had a banana chocolate chip muffin and a white chocolate muffin, YUM! Grab a muffin and sit in the park :)
Quite ignored as an attraction, nice place to chill out (or get sunburn). Very spacious gardens. Good place to lie down and relax for a whole afternoon (yet the sun can be quite strong).
amazing gardens and sculptures - nice for a jog too. excellent for a stroll or jog or hanging out with friends. Lush gardens with beautiful sculptures.

No better place for a relaxing afternoon in Paris. Bring a drink, a snack, or nothing at all, and chill in the sun or in the shade. Good place to read, people-watch, have good conversations, write poetry, look at the clouds, reflect etc. It is a wonderful escape from the crowds and rush of Paris and you don't even have to leave the city.

What a great slice of Paris life!. This is a wonderful oasis in the middle of the busy city, full of amazing plants and structures, and full of people doing what people do - sipping wine, strolling, playing boules... It's free, full of sights, and a great place for people watching.

Nice large park including a good lunch. In May we went to this park which was large, filled with locals and their families, and beautifully maintained. The surprise was our tasty lunch there at Pavillon de la Fontaine

Nice and cosy piece of spring. A vry nice and cosy place where you may be either alone or with your pouse - it's a good place to look around and just to relax. It's full of flowers and happy people. Join this society, if you are in Paris

Beautiful and fun. I've been to a few of the gardens in Paris but this is my absolutely favourite, especially on a gorgeous hot and sunny day.It's quite a big garden and there's lots people can do. There's a little play area for children and also pony rides through the park.There's a big lake that sometimes you hire little toy boats to sail across it.Otherwise just enjoy a walk around watching Parisians play games or just sit down and enjoy an ice cream from the nearly by Alberto shop.

One of my favorite haunts. When it's too warm and too noisy I come here to relax, read, watch the crowd and enjoy the beautiful flowers. It has a feel unlike no other park in Paris. The french Senate is housed here in the palace built by Mary de Medici and there is a lovely small museum located on the north wall, a short walk from St.Sulpice.

The French sure know how to do gardens. This garden in the middle of Paris is a terrific place to walk, watch the kids sail boats in the pond or play in the great play area. There are always nannies there with the children of the staff of area embassies.
A hidden jem. We didn't know we were coming upon the gardens until we were there. It was a wonderful find. Highly recommend taking a walk through here
Beautiful escape. We stumbled upon these gardens when wandering Paris. They are beautiful and not too crowed. Also, giant pigeons which were pretty hilarious.
Splendid!. Splendid beauty, marvellous fountains, superb walks and grounds, the lungs of the city!
Relax and enjoy. Shady trees, Parisians enjoying the sun, a newspaper, a patch of grass, a game of boule, a stroll among the garden - a wonderful place for a picnic and some RnR.

a delight. This was near our apartment and we made a point of walking through it whenever possible, sometimes bringing the Herald Tribune and some goodie from one of the fabulous bakeries to nibble on while we sat and read or watched the folks. Stunning flowerbeds, lovely shaped trees, families, joggers, shade,sun, statuary,

Pick up food for a picnic and enjoy your day here. "Open Road's Best of Paris" by Andy Herbach has a great walk in the 7th stopping at Le Grande Epicurie to pick up picnic supplies (don't forget the wine opener and cups---we used the plastic ones from the hotel room) and head to the Luxembourg Gardens. My husband and I found one of the many benches in the sun and enjoyed our le sandwich and macaroons while watching the locals walk and run through the garden. My husband said this was the best day we spent in Paris. Easy going and enjoyable!

Enjoy Paris as the Parisians Do. A phenomenal way to spend a beautiful Sunday afternoon: watching children sail their boats; admiring the beautiful flower gardens; listening to singers and instrumentalists.

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful gardens. Sat down by the water and dipped our feet in as the sun was going down. People weren't allowed to bring the chairs close to the water which I found a bit strange. Seen a lot of people get moved back by the police/guards. Ate at a place called Luxembourg after which was lovely.

Go every day. We stayed a couple of blocks away and either began or ended every day here. Absolutely beautiful. Wonderful people-watching. Sundays are particularly active here with free entertainment in the gazebo.
Oh la lar.... Take a picnic lunch and sit and watch the crowds on a deck chair in the sun.. great for photos.

Not to be missed in Paris. Luxembourg Gardens are one of those places that is often overlooked in Paris because there is so much else to see.It took me about 5 trips to Paris to go there but it is a place not to be missed especially with kids. There are lots of activities, a fantastic playground, a large fountain that you can hire toy boats to sale on and lots more.It is also a great place to just relax and people watch.In the narrow streets surrounding the park there are lots of interesting shops and cafe's/deli's to buy a picnic in.

Nice place to take a rest as you walk the city. Plenty of nice places to sit, both in the sun and in the shade, to enjoy the well kept park. Could be a great place to eat your food and drink that you brought to the park.

Good break with young children. The Luxembourg Gardens was an absolute must for us in our recent stay in Paris. With all the very adult museums and attractions in Paris, this was a welcome break with our young child. You must pay a few Euros to get in but the playground was really nice. It is big and gated with one access point. Parents can enter or watch from outside and enjoy a coffee or crepe purchased from one of the vendors within eyesight.

This park fulfilled my expectations.. The grass, plants, and flowers were really looked after. We had a great time there. There was an excellent open-air concert in the woods which was an amazing surprise we enjoyed imensely.
When you crave some green. Beautiful classical garden inthe centre of Paris, an oasis from the city.

City respite. I have never seen a park so full of people out to enjoy the good weather. Large areas laid to lawn, many chairs along the walkways and benches all over make for a comfortable break of sightseeing. It is great fun watching the children pushing their sail boats in the big fountain.

Second Home when in Paris. Since I stay around the corner from here most of the time this has become my second home when in Paris regardless of the season. It is always beautiful, peaceful, and introspective. During the summer months the manicured trees and flowers are stimulatingly beautiful. Grab a glass of wine and some cheese and enjoy the beauty of the park

Nice park to spend some time relaxing. This is one of the best parks in Paris. It is quite big, it is quiet and there are lots of flowers. It is a good place to relax a little bit and get out of the busy streets of Paris. Definitely a must see.

Lovely Spot for a Picnic!. We stumbled upon this park after picking up some picnics things at the Raspail Organic Market. Such a lovely spot!
We sat by the pond and watched young families played with small sailboats, then walked over the gardens to drink wine and eat cheese.
Over all, a very lovely place to site in the sun and rest!
Luxembourg gardens. These are beautiful and show the grand work of Marie de' Medici mother of the "sun" king of France.
Nice tranquil spot. If you've been doing a lot of sightseeing this is a wonderful spot to sit and just soak up Paris and there are beautiful views of the Louvre.
Ordinary but nice park. If you are not to spend a couple of hours reading book, just walk through it on your way from Pantheon.
Hang out. Terrific place to hang out, have a snack or make a picnic, there are always so many fowers and so much green areas that makes one of the favorite spots of Parisians.

Expansive!. Luxembourg Gardens is a nice respite from traffic noise, an expansive park with many small chestnut trees. There are fountains, child play areas and different levels which create pleasing views. It is very popular with locals. There is a cafe just SE of the palace that serves good food at reasonable prices. There are many good places to sit and people watch.
Perfection. The best place to grab a chair and relax on a sunny afternoon. It's better when the kids are playing with their boats in the fountain.

Paris in the Spring. I have a history with Luxembourg Gardens. My husband and I stayed near them on our honeymoon in 2009 and it was the first impression I had of Paris. We came back on a study abroad in 2010 and spent a lot of time in that area again and took our picnics to the gardens. It is so nice to just sit and watch people go by and see the children play with their toy boats. I just got back from taking my mom on her first Paris trip and everything in Luxembourg Gardens was in full bloom for the spring -- my mom cried at the sight of the beautiful tulips. Luxembourg Gardens will always have a special place in my heart and I can't wait until we meet again.

More than a Garden. Le Jardin du Luxembourg, in the 6th arrondissement, is one of the most enjoyable places to visit in Paris, no matter what the season. It is very large with many different attractions within its fences which often have artistic/photographic displays on the street-side. Of course, in spring and summer it is particularly delightful and I have seen open-air concerts and operas there during the warmer months, so check to see what's on. The Fontaine de Medicis offers a shady, welcoming space to sit and dream for a while in the many chairs around the rectangular pond leading to the impressive fountain. Near here is a restaurant with indoor/outdoor seating and a public toilet. There is also a take-away with outdoor seating and an attached café near the Marionette Theatre - there is another public toilet nearby. No matter what your age, you will find many spots to sit and while away a few hours, reading or watching the world go by. And there are some very interesting attractions near le Jardin du Luxembourg - the Panthéon is just a short walk away and is a fascinating insight into the way the French honour their great men & women. Don't miss Foucault's Pendulum in the grand foyer which, despite being a copy is still impressive (the original is in the Musée des Arts et Métiers). In part of the old Palais du Luxembourg on one perimeter of the garden is the Sénat and the Musée de Luxembourg which has temporary artistic exhibitions and is often worth a visit. Buses, the Metro/RER B all stop outside the gardens so it is easily accessible.
romantic. I loved the parks. I took some of my favorite pictures in this park. It is busy ... still ... with all those people it has a poetic - romantic - feel.

Time To Relax!. This place is heaven after several days of sightseeing/walking. Pack a picnic of sorts, and go to this park, it is truly a wonderful place. The pathways leading to little surprises, the wide variety of things for children, the bee hives, the pond, the palace are all enjoyable. watching the families use the park is so refreshing to see, parents with their kids, doing things together (not dropping them of at ballet/soccer etc). But the place of ultimate relaxation for us older folks is the Medici Fountain. Grab one of the many chairs throughout the park, sit by the pool and watch the carp and goldfish lazily cruise along....while enjoying your baguette and cheese!
Very pretty. Very well kept, busy and yet peaceful gardens, deceptively big. No real dislikes to mention
Lovely way to spend the day. And go to Pain y Chocolate for lunch! One of the most delicious cafes in Paris!

Seriously?. Do these people live in a time warp? It was like the 1920's or something. Everyone out enjoying the day, eating ice cream, espresso and crepes, racing sail boats in a fountain, bocci tournaments, tennis matches and debry car races. We thought, where the heck are we? is this real?? You have to see it for your self. So relaxing

Lovely little boats. I would highly recommend this location to anyone. It was lovely and delightful. There are many chairs around a circular pond where children (and adults) sail little boats. It was so entertaining watching the children with their little sticks going round and round the pond chasing their sail boats as they floated from one side of the pond to the other and getting they pushed off again to make the trip back to the other side. This was a great sight for people watching. Free entertainment at its best!

Lovely garden. we were a bit disappointed to find that the statue of liberty was gone for restoration but should be back in the summer. Very clean toilets in the gardens near the little cafe. the st sulpice church is very nearby and worth a visit.

One of the most beautiful places in Paris. A very pleasant and beautiful place. Great to sit on one of those green chairs and relax. I recommend the end of the afternoons on sunny days, when the light is absolutelly amazing. Great place for a break during your visit to the city, where you can get awesome pictures.
Luxembourg Gardens. Pick a nice sunny sunday and you will see the Parisians as they really are.

A place to sit and relax. We popped over to the Gardens after visiting the Pantheon, unfortunately it seemed to be having a lot of work done at the time so I was a little surprised seeing users photos just now at how nice it looks! However if you need somewhere to sit and unwind with your lunch on a nice day then its a nice place to go.
A pleasant place to stroll. This is a great place for people-watching. Stroll and sit.
have lunch in the gardens!. very beautiful, not crowded, and close to the catacombs. grab some cheap sandwiches from paul's and sit down by the fountain to enjoy a great afternoon!

Don't miss the Medici grotto. I love this park for a relaxing picnic. It is more laid back than other ones. There are joggers, mothers with strollers, sports courts, beautiful planters, statues. As I said before, pick up a dessert at Pierre Herme and enjoy! My daughter likes the crepes

Immaculate. Beautiful gardens and a perfect little paradise. We took a wrong turn and ended up in this little oasis. The location is great, the gardens are lovely, lots of seats and cute french couples having a picnic. Delightful.

Our favorite Garden. Visited all of the major gardens n Paris. This one has the history, and varied garden designs/formats making it far more interesting than others. Despite wet and cool Spring weather it was a multi-generational favorite of the locals also
Jardins de Luxembourg. Beautifully maintained and a center for families on the weekends.

Beautiful gardens! Great location!. Well worth taking the time to go and see. Enjoy a day in this area and take a lot of pictures. The park is large and not crowded. Grab a bottle of wine, loaf of bread & some great cheese and go! It was one of my favorite days in Paris. A nice break from the busy tourist areas. Stunningly beautiful!
An oasis of calm. Never fails to impress what ever the time of year in all weathers.
Tulips. Beautiful flower displays in spring. A lovely place to sit and relax, lots of seating laid out for the public.
relaxing. Perfect choice for relaxing and take awesome picture

Beautiful garden for a picnic.. In early summer it's a wonderful place to have a late afternoon picnic. Great lawns, beautiful trees, and a huge fenced outdoors playground for the smaller kids to get lost in with the locals. Bring your bagets, cheese, pate and wine and just relax on the lawns with the locals. Very busy on public holidays and weekends.
Pretty and So Parisian!. Beautiful park! Lots of flowers, a little lake and lots of local Parisians!

Beautiful gardens in the middle of the city. Beautiful gardens in the middle of a beautiful city. Recommend a nice stroll during the afternoon and people watching. Nice place to relax for 1-2 hours. A must see in Paris.
great gardens!!. I enjoy this garden, I used my tour guide book and took pictures of the best the gardens hast such, statues and water fountains.. love the greenery around the park
explored in the rain and it was still stunning. The views, the formal gardens, the children playing in the park, the places to sit.
Huge. What a lovely park and garden. So open to everyone and loved the children with there boats.
Walks in and around San Germain. Not far from the Sorbonne, a week end destination for those who like to build or rent small remote controlled sail boats and those who practice Tai Chi and more.

Beautiful Park. The park was gorgeous on a nice sunny afternoon. Bought a glass of wine from the little cafe and took our pick from the ample seats available. Soaked up the culture and amazing views in the lovely weather. Well worth a look.

Lovely Gardens. A peaceful place for a great stroll or to take a break from the busy life of Paris. While I visited I could only imagine how was the life during the time while the palace was inhabited.
people watching galor. Wonderful gardens to sit, reflect, watch people strolling. Less touristy than Jardin de Tuileries near the Louvre.
A little disappointing.. Found it a little dirty due to the pidgeons around at this time of year. Tivoli Gardens were better.
A PLACE TO APPRECIATE AND TO REFLECT. This garden is special--trees are monitored and trimmed--plenty of chairs to sit in--maybe not too comfortable--and to watch the people

locals and tourists hang-out. one of the things i love about travelling is to see where the locals hang-out. it says a lot about them and their culture. we visited the gardens on labor day and it was packed with tourists and locals alike. however, despite the number of people lounging around on the grass and on the chairs all over the place, it didn't feel over-crowded. you can still feel the serenity of the garden.that's one of the things i love about Paris that is so different from other cities (like Venice or Rome) -- their tourists attractions are beautifully kept and you can see that Parisiens actually use/visit those places, giving you a better insight on the local culture, past and present.
Worth a walk through. Impressive park worth a stroll through on a nice day.
A hidden gem. We visited fairly early on a Sunday morning to see the Parisienne's relaxing, doing tai Chi, their children sailing boats on the pond, a real chill-out place
Beautiful. Classic French garden. Statues were impressive. Read up on the history first.
Beautiful gardens accessible to all. Loved being able to picnic and view the fascinating gardens so close to the city. Awesome viewing the palace from the gardens
Wonderful place. This is one of our favorite places for the flowers, the atmosphere, people watching, and more

Be Like a Parisian. Beautiful gardens in the heart of Paris. Just go there , take your snack, sit on the many chairs around the garden and just watch people passing by. Watch the joy of small children pushing the small sailing boats in the small pond in the center of the gardens. If you feel like rent one your self and feel like a child again.Luxembourg Gardens is for everyone, families, couples, elders etc.Relax,play,walk, watch. Be like a Parisian!

Calm oasis. Super green space for people watching, local artists, lots of chairs around the fountain.. Friday is boules night, locals stroll play tennis, ponies for hire, super young people playing brass just outside the gates.
That's a garden!. After having a glass of wine, or 2, at the Luxembourg Cafe, a nice peaceful walk through the park, is just the thing to get into a Paris frame of mind.
Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. Pull up a chair (at no cost), sit back, and marvel at the beauty. Just don't walk on the grass. It is not permitted.
Lovely to walk around. Lovely gardens with lots of sculptures and statues including one of the statues of LIberty. Unfortunately you are not allowed into the building but well worth a visit anyway.

Perfect place to relax. A stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens in the late afternoon was a perfect way to relax after a day of site seeing. It is nice to find a chair or bench there and just enjoy the view.
Lovely walk. A quaint walk was great to chill out before visiting the Latin Quarter. Nice place to have a sandwich.
A must-visit. Brilliant, I've been on every visit to Paris. Lots of seats dotted all over the park, could sit here all day with an ice-cream/beer/food and people watch. Beautiful gardens too.
Relaxing. fun to bring a blanket on a sunny day and have a picnic lunch...play ball and just enjoy the nature. It is very relaxing and beautiful

CHILLAX. Chillax here in this wonderful garden not too far from the very
smart St, Germain 15 minute walk would do it. Take a picnic
and dream of days gone by, lovely shaded areas for those very
hot months.
Clive Dublin
Something for everyone.. This is a little oasis in the heart of a busy city. There's something for everyone there. There is even a little amusement park for the little ones.
Lunch. The cafe isn't bad...good salads at good prices (much better than the cafes near the Louvre).
Beautiful Gardens and water. Great to stroll read a book take some sun or visit a museum on the edge of the park.
My favourite park in Paris. such a beautiful place and a santuary from the mayhem of the city. went on a warm day, it was busy but stil peaceful.
Must see. The better the weather is the better to go there...
A shady spot for an al fresco lunch!. Huge park, fountains, shady trees, cafes, lovely place. We bought baguettes and apple tart slices from boulangerie on the way there, loads in area.

Take Time Out. Take time out to sit and relax, in the sun, in these beautiful gardens. With a small lake, lots of colourful flowers and a ready supply of moveable chairs it's well worth half an hour of anyone's time. An oasis of calm in a bustling and often frenetic city.
a nice walk through the Luxembourg Gardens. It was a nice weather in Paris so we had a romantic walk through the park enjoying everything around us

Beautiful park. The public parks in Paris are like a breath of fresh air. When strolling around on trafficked streets it's so refreshing to arrive at a beautiful park and a change of scenery. There are lots of benches and chairs to rest tired feet.Luxembourg Gardens is a well maintained garden with different areas for different activities such as tennis courts and playgrounds, and of course grass, flower beds, statues and fountains. The Luxembourg Palace is situated at one end of the park and is a lovely building with the pool and palm trees surrounding the area.Great for relaxing, families with kids and scenery/great photos!

Beautiful park. This was a Beautiful English looking garden..........lovely to take a picnic on a nice day and sit and enjoy the scenery in the park. There are chairs all around the park too to sit on.

2nd favorite park in Paris. GREAT place to hang out, esp on a sunny day. Sat and Sun there are musical performances and the ones by the middle school and high school kids, jazz bands, choruses, etc., are very good, like US college musicians. The adult groups are a little too oom-pa-pa. Nice little cafe, ice cream vendors; take a book!

Stroll around the huge gardens - it's free. We visited the Luxembourg gardens in the morning. Very pleasant to stroll around the well maintained gardens. You can grab a free chair or two and sit by one the fountains. There are many shaded area for those who don't wish to sit in the sun. Worth the visit and it's free.

Chill in the park. Great park for a stroll. Kids love it as well. You can hire little sealing boats that they can play with in the pond. At some places you are allowed to sit on the grass and everyone is doing so on a sunny day. It's safe and relax. The park is clean and pretty. Metro stations are around the park, so it's easy to get back to your hotel or the centre.
Lovely and Relaxing.. This garden is very well put together and well kept. A very nice place to sit, relax and read a book or to go for a jog. Several nice statues and a very nice fountain.

Well Worth a Visit. Luxembourg Gardens will be magnificent in summer. The gardeners are planting fantastic borders now (May 2012). The layout of the gardens is great and the availablity of chairs etc if you wish to take rest is excellent. Take time out to relax & enjoy a super free location.

See the daily lives of Parisians. I would not include the Luxembourg Gardens as a must see for a first time visitor to Paris, however if you have the time I would take a stroll through the gardens. It does not matter if it is snowing and cold or warm and sunny, the French love their parks and enjoy them. You can come here for a quiet picnic lunch or to read a book, the gardens give you an insight to the a favourite past time of the French. Where else do you see a bocci ball court with hangers for the men's jackets?

One of my favorite spots in Paris. We were a short walk from the gardens and took every opportunity to walk through at different times of the day. Beautiful flowers, trees and monuments plus a nice slice of life in Paris. Go and hang out, check out the people especially the bocce players.
superb.... very clean, superb flowers, quiet, good locations, like a oasis in paris...

Spectacular Gardens. Loved the gardens, the unique flowers, the statue, fountain, it is a very large park and great for a picnic lunch. Go to one of the bakeries, or Le Bon Marche and enjoy a picnic in the park. We heard someone practicing on a musical instrument while there. It is historic, part of the Palace, a must see. There are many wonderful parks in Paris that are great to see and experience; many catering to young children and old alike. Versailles also has an excellent garden. http://www.aviewoncities.com/paris/parks.htmhttp://goparis.about.com/od/sightsattractions/tp/parks_gardens.htm
nice green island in the middle of the city. it was sunny and though alot of people not crowded.
nice gardens. nice place for a walk, but crowded on weekends and holidays
place for a respite. It's very accessible and beautiful. Everyday Parisians are all around just taking some time to relax.
Must visit. Wondederd here after visiting the Pantheon. Everything you ever imagined about laid back Paris. Beautiful people, beautiful sculptures and all around relaxing place.
Romance is in the air. Even the wheather was freezing, wife and i had really some romantic moments there. If you like gardens then this is the place for you to be in.

Probably best seen in the summer. We love our gardens and enjoyed our walk through the Luxembourg Gardens, but visiting in mid-April, the flower gardens were empty and the central fountain area was under construction. The espaliered trees in the south west corner of the garden were fascinating, as was the Fontaine de Medicis.If you have kids, this place would be a must-visit as there's a great playground here.
A great place to take a break. Its huge and you could wander for hours, but if you need a break pull up a garden chair and enjoy. Doesn't matter which part you stop in its all beautiful.
Lovely Oasis in Paris. In May they are doing the planting and that is a great time to go. Green and lush, running paths, lakes, etc. The best!
paris gem. definitely my favourite place to go in Paris. amazing on a summers day, and lovely chess
Relaxing!!. Great place to go for a stroll or just sit and people watch. Very large area with flowers and places to just sit and relax.

Zip line takes the award. If you have kids, run, don't walk to this beautiful park! The oval zip line was one of the highlights of our trip - and gave our daughter a nice chance to mingle with the local kids - and my husband a great photo opp!
See the locals. Must walk through on the weekend! Very pretty. French food. See the locals. There was a band playing in the park when we went through. Can get some pretty pictures here!
A nice stroll. A great way to spend a half day relaxing and taking in the Parisienne way of life.

Gorgeous. The Luxembourg Gardens were on the way to my my daughter's university offices and it was very beautiful in the perfect French style. Lots of chairs to rest one's weary feet. Even chaise lounges for those who need a nap.

My new favorite place. Really large, really green, luxurious colorful flower gardens, sculptures everywhere, fountains, fabulous sunset view including the Tour Eiffel, Parisians playing boules (patanque) on I think 8 courts, with a coat rack in the middle to stow while they play. Playgrounds, tennis, orangerie. Everything is here. It is a beautiful place to visit daily while in Paris, and I'll probably always stay in the area so I can easily visit every time.
Worth a visit. Well conceived gardens, the landscaping is classical French, the buildings are gorgeous. It is a lovely place to stop, relax, and rejuvenate.
Beautiful gardens. lovely palace.. It was very clean and well maintained. Wished we could go inside the palace.
enjoyable. Great place to take a break. There are coffee shops in the gardens and tons of chairs for you to relax in. We spent about a half hour relaxing and enjoying the surroundings.

Eat lunch here. Buy a baguette or something similar from a nearby boulangerie and eat it in the gardens, there's chairs galore and it's so peaceful. Just don't feed the pigeons otherwise they wont leave you alone!

Lovely to sit and enjoy the sun and the chateau. We picked up a picnic at Rue Moffard and took it up the garden. Peaceful and picturesque gardens. The boating lake is really grat people to watch people enjoying their time in the sun

Excellent Playground for Kids. I spent a sunny afternoon with my two-year-old at the Luxembourgh Gardens playground. Despite the 3.70 euro fee to enter (2.50 for kids, 1.20 euros for adults), it was worth it. The playground has a sand pit, two big jungle gyms, a climbing frame, and a zip-style swing for older kids. There's also a kiosk that sells coffee, tea, drinks, and sweets along with little trinkets. My daughter had great fun. To make it a cheap outing, I stopped at a local bread shop on Rue Vaugirard (somewhere between Boulevard Raspail and Rue Guynemer) for sandwiches and a little grocery store (8 a Huit - 31 Rue de Vaugirard @ Rue Jean Bart) for drinks and snacks. We picniced on the playground and had a great day!
Beautiful Place, must see in Paris!. Do not forget to visit Luxembourge Gardens when visiting Paris, it's just wonderful!
Beautiful. My most favorite garden in Paris! Very beautiful and I loved sitting by the fountain and watching the kids with their sailboats.
special place. this park in the centre of Paris is quiet and delicate, many special places with beautiful flowers and small lakes. a must visit
Beautiful.. Beautiful gardens. Great place for a relaxing stroll. Great place to spend an afternoon doing nothing and taking in Parisian life.
Pleasant Parc. We had a lovely evening stroll through this very clean parc. Plenty of activity from Tennis, running clubs and people playing Boules in the Sun. Well worth a stroll through.

Loved going there. Escape city noises.
Relax. Chairs are usually available.
Loved going there.

Libery the statue. This place host the first version of Newyork's Statue of Liberty, lovely place to just relax, read or just talk. The place is full of sculptures and statues, flowers or different sizes and colors and this place is easily accessible as well
Our favourite spot in Paris. Stunning. Simply stunning. A mercifully, beautifully, quiet garden in the heart of Paris. Our favourite spot in all of Paris.

Huge... Fantastic for families, couples or singles... We were amazed to find so many games being played by people of all ages... Boules, ping pong, basketball, tennis, kids on bikes etc.. People covet the chairs and sit there for hours in the sunshine reading and chatting. Such a lovely feeling to be part of it.

Experience a Parisian's life. Luxembourg may offer the best glimpse into the life of a Parisian. Although tourists abound, one can find every age and parisian lifestyle represented. It is my favorite place to people watch. Even observing the placement of empty chairs gives one a hint of what was happening before. The two cages has tasty offerings, the children's boat basin delightful to watch, the Fontaine des Medicis fun for its mysterious water flow. One can spend a whole day here exploring all the statues, checking out the bee hives, watching the chess players,or taking in a children's puppet show. Fabulous in any season and at Ny time of day although it does close at sunset.

Beautiful and busy when it is sunny. We love to sit and watch the people and the beautiful landscape. The Authorities literally spend all there time running from green grass and the next session trying to keep the tourists that don't know better that you are not allowed on the grass for photos for any reason. Buy a sandwich and have a picnic on a sunny day.
Gardens. Lack of colour but that was down to time of year we visited. Otherwise, really nice to visit. Take a picnic!

Wonderful green space int he middle of Paris. We spent a nice couple of hours in the playground near the south side of the park. There is an admission to the playground (EURO 2.50 for kids, parents also ply if you want to go in). From what I understand this is not unusual for Paris. The admission is good for the whole day, so we went int he morning, kids played for a couple of hours, and then went to lunch, and did some sight-seeing, before returning on the way back to our place. Nice place to sit and relax after a long day of walking the Parisian streets.
Sorbonne and cluny nearby. Nice park for a rest but what surrounds it is the attraction dont miss Cluny a better than advertised find

Go there in the weekend as locals do. Joggers, sunbathers, children with small boats in the fountain, flowers, statues, cafes, petanque. A beautiful oasis in Paris. Go there in holidays or weekends to feel the local part of Paris.
Most beautiful gardens in Paris downtown. Wonderful views & various recreations areas in this garden also full of historical sites. A must see.

Nice but out of the way if not staying in the area.. Very nice layout. Easy to overlook the manicured gardens and statutes as it all works so well together. Very relaxing if you have nice weather and can just sit and experience the garden. But if you are staying elsewhere in Paris, I’m not sure it’s worth the effort to get there, especially if weather is not great.
Great people place. This is where everyone goes to get out and refresh the minds. Acres of manicured beauty and great place to unwind and relax.
Summer. These gardens always remind me of summer, just walking, peoplewatching, having a picnic on a bench, watch people, just enjoying being in Paris ...
Lovely French santuary. Avenues of trees, cafe and lawns to laze and read. Stay here rather than go on to Montparnasse which is disappointing.

Lovely flowers...!!. Green lush grass...colourful flowers of different varieties....but walking on the grass not allowed...:(There are plenty of chairs and benches around the pond at the front of the palace to sit and relax.
chrisp. Nice place to relax if weather fair and not too crowded.
Beautifull!. The magnificient views, fresh air, beautifull statues...
Beautiful, relaxing place.. People exercising everywhere, seniors walking or reading a book, families with little children... green everywhere. Lovely Sunday morning walk.

Relax and enjoy. This is a wonderful place to stroll and enjoy the beautifully tended gardens but in particular the atmosphere on a Sunday when Parisians take their families to the lake for games and sailing little boats. Just watching the dogs dressed in their chic Parisian coats is an experience! Take time out to walk through the gardens.

Parisians in the park. How lovely to see Parisian families enjoying a beautiful garden. I was there on a cold and wet morning, and people were all bundled up and strolling, some jogging, children playing. A beautifully maintained garden, the tulips were out - glorious.
Wet Gardens. This is a nice stroll, but more beautiful places to see in Paris.

big park. interesting park, lots to walk around- would be nice in the summer! i've only been when it has rained so never spent a long time here.
only a short walk to the Pantheon from here...

A beautiful palace and park. Why in the UK in our public gardens can we not do the beautiful good taste planting out that they manage in France. The borders were very well planted in lovely colour combinations, subtle not garish, and the very French and delightful formal planting of trees make the Luxembourg gardens a joy to walk in.

Nicest Gardens anywhere. These gardens are so well tended, expansive and incredibly designed that I would return to Paris in the warmer weather just to experience them again! The day we visited was slightly overcast and cool but the gardens were still busy with visitors. It is truly so large that it didn't seem crowded at all. Lots of places to sit and chat, children's play areas were well tended and clean, varieties of trees, some of them quite old. And the palace itself is worth observing just to imagine the lives that crossed it threshold!
Pasris' best garden. Perfect place for a calm stroll or take the kids to see the puppet show and ride the carousel.

Pack a picnic lunch and spend a few hours. our family of 3 enjoyed our relaxing visit just watching the kids play with the boats, looking at the beautiful mansion. There weren't much flowers while we were there yet (we actually arrived in late April) but it was still a nice afternoon to have.There's an awesome playground for kids that my daughter just loved!

Pack a picnic lunch and spend a few hours. our family of 3 enjoyed our relaxing visit just watching the kids play with the boats, looking at the beautiful mansion. There weren't much flowers while we were there yet (we actually arrived in late April) but it was still a nice afternoon to have.
There's an awesome playground for kids that my daughter just loved!
Lovely!. Lovely place to visit. In april the flower are all in blossom!
Review. Beautiful gardens - peaceful feel - an area for children - and crowned by the Luxembourg Palais and the Medici fountain
paris goes for a stroll in the sun. great gardens complete with fountain, in which youngsters play with wooden boats - it's true!
So many movies. Once you see it you will realize how many times it has been used in movies.
Flowers!. The mini hedges are so adorable! It was a beautiful afternoon spent in the metal green chairs soaking up what little sun we had during our trip.

beautiful!!!. I think that is the best garden in Paris. It is really so beautiful.
Rainy, snowy, sunny, etc.. Walk there at least for couple of minutes..

Most enjoyable garden in Paris. These gardens are well laid out and beautifully maintained. As with many gardens in France there are interesting sculptures scattered throughout, plus a number of statues. The central lake has toy sailing boats for hire, adding colour and movement. There are also great facilities for children outdoor activities.
Just stunning. Beautiful gardens in the springtime, with outstanding flower beds and unusual colours . A great place for a peaceful walk and to admire gardening artists

Beautiful and classic. We took time out of our trip to visit the gardens on our last day in Paris. It was well worth the trip. The garden had newly planted tulips all throughout the park, and it was incredible. There is a lovely area where chairs are provided, and one can simply sit and view the gardens or people-watch. It's very peaceful, and a nice way to spend a couple of hours.

Sunday in the Gardens. Visit the Luxembourg Gardens on a Sunday and you can hire miniture yachts to sale on the lake. While stolling through the gardens you will see statues and opportunities to people watch as they parade through beautifully laid out gardens. If you have children do not miss the fanastic playground, although there is a cost for entry.
Tulips and lilacs galore--in mid-April. A gorgeous stop the first afternoon of our stay--a good way to accilmate after a trans-atlantic flight and get into the feel of Paris.
Lovely. This park was lovely everyone was friendly and it was a lovely surrounding there was a nice cafe to go for a snack and drink and it has a great view of the eiffel tower
didn't love it!. It was not what I expected.. its nice, but not great!

Beautiful. Beautiful place to visit on a sunny day in the Qaurtier Latin. Definitely a must see on my list even for a short stay in Paris as it only takes a 20 minute walk through the park to see its beauty.
