A Stroll in the Gardens. I never miss strolling through these beautiful gardens. There are hidden treasures in every corner: the carousel, the bee hives, the Statue of Liberty replica (much smaller!), the children sailing boats, etc. Do yourself a favor and relax in the gardens!

elegant and formal. This is a wonderful park in the middle of the city with formal gardens and outdoor art perfect for strolling, jogging, reading, meditating, etc. Close to Sarbonne and French Senate.
Perfect gardens. This is a nice garden if you are interested in gardens. However it must be noted that it is a bit of a walk from the nearest Metro station.

Pull up a chair.... ...and watch Paris go by! The Luxembourgs are wonderful; I love to lounge here and pretend to be Parisienne whilst surreptitiously watching the passing parade.
The space is beautiful; the atmosphere is enticing; the experience is renewing.
Get yourself over there!
Beautiful.. Lovely Sunday afternoon. Boats on the lake, kids everywhere. Gorgeous !
Don't miss this. Beautiful Gardens, take you time here. This is a well utilized park, not just a walk through. Sit, relax, enjoy a Parisian pace here

a charming pocket of quiet. Lovely park in St Germain area. For a terrific Paris experience, grab a baguette, cheese and pate and head here for a picnic. You can choose to sit on a bench in a quiet, shady area with beautiful flowers or have your picnic while watching men playing boule. Walk around and people-watch. Steal a kiss from your sweetie. It's a nice respite from running around seeing all the sights. (This is quite a sight of its own.)
Lovely spot to wander.. This large park contains a huge variety of plant life and is an ideal place to "people watch" the Parisians. A wonderful walk on a sunny day.
Beautiful. Gorgeous! Great place to go and relax and just watch life unfold. Relaxing and peaceful.
Bit Disappointing. Maybe March is the wrong time of year for these gardens

Nice and quiet! A place to relax.. A place to relax after all the sightseeing in the city. Beautiful gardens. Flowers are starting to bloom now so definitely a good time to visit. I jut hope that the temp. goes up soon! ;)

Beautiful. We approached it from a side street, and eventually found our way to the main gardens. Beautiful, flowers blooming everywhere, locals playing some kind of ball game, joggers, tourists, etc, but very peaceful. The building is stunning, different architecture, gorgeous. Go for a walk through it, then get out towards the Latin Quarter for some coffee or dinner.
Fabulous green space. Beautiful area. Great for running or just talking a leasurily stroll
Beautiful treasure. A beautiful manicured bit of heaven. Take some time to relax and sit in the chairs to soak up the beauty around you!

a good break. This was a welcome sight and space after being in the lines and crowds at the Eiffel tower. Loved the playground and didn't mind paying the small fee. Our 8 yr old loved the climbing tower and the disk on a rope with the glide.
Maybe the wrong time of year?. Quite a long walk with not a lot to see although we did like the relaxed planting of some flower beds
A lovely place. A great place to look at, wander around in and relax in. We didn't get to spend enough time in it, but will spend more time in it next time.

A 'must see' as respite from the city buzz. Visited in early spring and there was a very cold wind blowing off some nearby glacier! Nonetheless, the park was well patronised by tourists and locals alike. It gives plenty of different spaces to relax, walk, jog - whatever.
Good cafe in the centre and good toilets.
Always a favourite place to relax for an afternoon.

Lovely gardens and nice playground. The gardens were lovely even though it was early spring and things haven't reached their peak yet. The playground was a wonderful diversion for our granddaughter, age 8, although we wished it was open a little later in the evening.

If you have younger kids, you must go here. On a nice day, our 12 year old rented a little sailboat for 2 euros and had a really nice break from museums and walking. The Gardens are beautiful and the fountain is filled with little sailboats which float from one side to the other. It is a very charming and relaxing way to spend a few hours. There is also a sweet cafe in the middle of the gardens where you can get coffee, ice cream, etc. Tons of free chairs to just sit and relax. If you have some nice weather, this is a great little respite from the city.

Just beautiful. A beautiful garden worth the trip. It truly is the most beautiful garden in Paris. Be sure to take your time to stroll at leisure. Consider combining it with a trip to the nearby Pantheon and, if you loved film Midnight in Paris, go sit on the steps of St Etienne Du Mont (Where Owen Wilson gets in the cab).
Amazing garden. I can't believe how calming this wonderful green space is. I walked at a leisurely pace and around every corner was something beautiful. The Medici Fountain is my personal favorite!
Paris at its finest. Wait for a warm day and the sun is out. The garden is beautifully landscaped and just watch Parisians at leisure time. Beautiful to just stroll.

Relaxing gem of Paris!. This park is huge - very well laid-out, lots of benches and places for quiet reflection. The main pond has sailboats and the children we saw were having a blast with the control-sticks you can rent to play with the boats. Many locals just hang out here, sitting in the sun, picknicking, relaxing. A nice break from the big city. Enjoyed best on a sunny day!!!

Better than the Radio Station (208). The lawns were well kept, the paths well surfaced. Plenty of chairs to enjoy the vistas from. The hedging was amazing. The water features were clean and had safety edgings. Statues were clean and well labelled. Disabled access seemed good.

A beautiful jewel in Paris!. My favorite garden in Paris. Unfortunately it was under construction this week so we couldn't walk around the pond. However, the grass was greener than an emerald and you can't beat the view of the beautiful Palais Luxembourg. Great place to have a picnic!
Great space. These gardens are beautifully maintained. There is a pond where people take their remote-controlled sailing boats/power boats and display their skills amongst the ducks.
Wonderful on a nice day,. Take a picnic along, home of one of the Statue of Liberties, although it is away getting maintenance until Summer 2012!

Beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens is one of our favorite places in Paris. The Gardens show the true vitality of Paris life. The people sun bathing, lounging in the gardens, people playing bowl or tennis, children in the playground or people playing chess are all part of the Luxembourg Gardens.

Perfect Day.... The best way to take advantage of this place, is taking with you some real good pastries that you can actually find on your way there (if you´re walking) some cheese, crossaints, or wine if you please. Sit down in the grass or chairs if you find one, and just enjoy the beautiful view, that is got to be a moment in life. You can aslo feed the doves... perfect place to enjoy the view with a great frenchy meal.

Great park to wander through. Go here! It's a must see. You will enjoy wandering through people watching Parisians at their leisure. Children sail their boats in the fountain pool, they ride their scooters, bikes, play on the swing sets, play soccer, and basketball. We watched old men play boule' and checkers. People jog in the mornings on the path. People just pull up a chair and bask in the sun while taking a nap. It's an awesome park to hang out and relax in.

Enchanting gardens, beautiful walk & great photo opps. We visited here early in the morning for a nice stroll through the gardens. The blooming flowers were so pretty, and a nice (yet distant) view of the Eiffel tower too. It's the perfect spot to sit and people watch, perhaps snack on some cheese & baguette. A nice break to the busier tourist attractions.

Nice gardens!. Nice gardens, not so overrun as the Tuileries. There is more to these gardens that immediately meets the eye, and I wish I'd spent more time there. I suspect that I could have profitably spent an entire afternoon there, easily.Definitely one of the better sight-seeing stops, and I can understand why I saw numerous families with children heading to it at various times.

Worth a visit. This is a wonderful spot for the family. Despite the day we visited being freezing our son had a wonderful time. To enter the childrens playground is €2.50 with great equipment, a small shop with good coffee and LOTS of sweets all reasonably priced. There are many other attractions in the Parc, including a puppet theatre.
A beautiful place to see and enjoy. Enjoy everthing in the park - a good location also for small picnic in mid town. Note closed in evening

Nice, however, not overly impressed.. I had expected these gardens to be far more lavish. I did not think they were outstanding. Perhaps, the weather had something to do with it. It was extremely could in Paris.

The most gorgeous park in Paris!. These gardens, both formal and open and lovely. They surround The Senate which are guarded by police officers, and yet we can stroll by admiring the beautiful arrangements of tulips and forget me nots in the most gorgeous plum colourways. There are sculptures, ancient waterfalls, separate children's play areas, chess playing, boules playing ( with rails and hangers for the outer wear of players!) and then just strolling areas where people lounge in the chairs eating their lunch. It's grand and is used by all ages respectfully. A wonderful spring visit.
nice, quiet. nice and quiet park in center of paris to relax or visit around

The best playground in Paris:-). You have to pay a small fee to get into this playground, but for our kids it was hours of entertainment and one of their favorite things in Paris. The playground has a cute little place to get sweets, a tea or coffee. This garden is a fantastic place to wonder around. There is a puppet theater with a crank man who runs it, but our kids loved it (it is completely in French) but our kids did not seem to mind. Check the board out front, I think it is only a few days a week. Have a great day exploring these amazing gardens!
Beautiful Gardens. A must see! Gorgeous grounds to stroll through and enjoy.

Not much there. Just a big sprawling park. Thought there would be more???. Maybe i overestimated the park. But folks said it was a MUST SEE. Not sure if maybe i missed something, but it was just a big, plain park to me.
Refreshing garden. We arrived in Paris by the RER train from De Gaulle.airport. Our stop: Luxembourg. How wonderful to emerge from the station on a sunny day at this beautiful park.
Beautiful park!. Very beautiful park with nice pink flowers.Recomended to see
Great views!. 3 hours to queue and get in (one lift out of order)! But woth it in the end - great ride, views, and photo opportunities of Paris.

Loads of Tourists+Dusty Sand on Paths. Busy but attractive Park for a small change from Paris Streets.If you have smart shoes,beware the white dusty paths.Playground for kids,pond with sailing boats(Mini).Snacks available in a couple of places.Pancakes etc.

Great park to relax. Great place to relax or go for a run.
If you have kids it is great for the kids loose some steam
Parisians at play.. This was an amazing find. Walk through the park to see kids playing around and men playing boules (bocce). Got some great photos.
Beautiful gardens. Enjoy the stroll around the gardens and fountains. Nice few up direction Champs Elysées. If the weather allows it, grab one of the chairs and enjoy to just sit and watch.

Flâneuse in Paris. Imagine a rippling summer haze and blooming variety of gardens. See yourself there, listening a relaxing sound of the fountain next to you. Oh, you are in the Henri Matisse painting! The best way to spend a golden summer day is to sit back and enjoy life in Jardin du Luxembourg. It's relaxing enough in the spring also. There you can feel the local everyday life, which is really nice and uplifting experience after a day of hellish roaming among tons of american tourists.

Beautiful garden. A large garden in the 6th arrondisement with beautiful flowers, statues and buildings. Lots of green space, sporting areas and a courtyard in front of the palace with a fountain. Head over to the East side of the garden and you'll find the impressive Medici Fountain.

Great garden and good place to relax. Buy some food for a picnock and do as the Parisiens - sit on the grass, eat, drink and relax from all your sightseeing. The kids can rent a little sailing boat and let it sail on te pond.
Green Haven. Families enjoying the large space. Children sailing little boats on the lake.Unusual views of the Eiffel Tower.

Good chill out space. Paris's answer to central park? A large formal (ish) garden, with plenty of sitting out areas, boules courts and childrens playgrounds, well worth a visit for a chill out away from the city.
Nice gardens. A pleasant garden space in Paris. The gardens are not as expansive as Tuleries but a nice diversion.
lovely. Very nice to stroll through and whatch the world go by

Relax & enjoy. What a place to relax and decompress from all your sightseeing! Bring your book & or a bite to eat & pull up a chair by the Catherina Medici Fountain and enjoy the serenity & cool calmness that surround you. Wander the gardens.
Peace and Spring. What a lovely place to be in Spring. Wander the paths and relax on the seats provided. See Parisians walking their dogs and enjoy the ambience.
Beautiful Gardens!. Peaceful gardens in Paris. Nice for a stroll, very romantic. Beatifully landscaped.

Elegance in the Open. Great history trip. Details posted on Garden board. Fountains, cafe, (But be aware not always with water or working). Can be bitterly cold in gardens November-April. Palace Museum on site, worth a visit. Walk from here up to Pantheon, see where Victor Hugo lies.
Relaxing in the sun.. This is just a great place to roam andf sit, watching the people and admiring the garden.
As charming as you would imagine.. Loved watching children with their boats and there was also a place to rent little pedal go-carts (for kids). Beautiful public space.
Great park, lots of benches. Nice park with a lot of benches and a small lake where people can play with boats models (either owned or rented for 2 EURO for 30 mins).

An oasis in the 6e arrondissement. The second largest park in Paris, it provides a perfect refuge from hustle and bustle, shopping and the big city. Here you'll find carefully tended gardening, plenty of trees and walking paths, and enough chairs and benches. A nice fountain can be found in front of the Luxembourg Palace, home to the French Senate. The park also contains a huge playground for kids, a puppet theatre, a kiosk and about a hundred statues. Near the exit behind the palace is the famous Medici fountain (from the Italian Medici familiy that purchased the palace and area, and made it into a park in 1611).
What a great place for a walk. Another beautiful place in Paris to spend a warm spring afternoon walking and appreciating the great city.
amazing. amazingly designed, so romantic, pure and angelic place
Chill Out. Great place to take a sandwich and a book to chill out, people watch or enjoy one of the free concerts they have.
A resting place in a busy city. Trees, grass, a place to sit and reflect. A beautiful place to rest in a busy city.
Gorgeous views!. Very pretty and a nice place to walk and take in the beauty
Great place to take a walk. Great place to take a walk, with the beautiful palace and very nice fountains, especially the fountain of Medici
Beautiful. Relaxing gardens were Parisians practice the art of people watching…
If I could live in these gardens.... Simply put this is my most favorite place in all of Paris. Perfect for people watching, reading a book, chatting with a friend or pretending to be Parisian.

Excellent layout. The garden is tugged away in the more quieter park of the city. Therefore it is mainly enjoyed by locals. Just how I like it, less touristy and less crowd. The park itself is very beautiful. I recommend a stroll through if you are in that side of the town.
Let the kids roam, while you have a glass of wine. Something for kids of all ages...and no bums to be found..
Restful. We enjoyed the flowers but the seeing the locals and the children playing made it so much more.
Quiet gem. Super spot for a picnic, and to see some trees in the city.

Don't Miss the Parc De Jeux for Children. The highlight of our visit to the Jardin du Luxembourg was the Parc de Jeux. The most exciting children's playground I have come across. Although there is a small fee to enter, it is worthwhile for your little one. Slippery slides galore, climbing, swinging, spinning...it's all there. A managerie of play equipment to delight the child in all.Also enjoyed was the frozen pond (we visited in early March) and the Medici Fountain. Other than that, for a visit in late winter, it is not at its best. I imagine Spring is the time to enjoy this park at its most brilliant.

Don't leave Paris without spending time at the Luxembourg Gardens. This attraction is a “sleeper” and does not appear high on many of the sample itineraries that we read. It is absolutely worth 30 minutes or 3 hours – whatever time you feel like taking as a break from the museums, crowds, and other wonderful things to take in while in Paris.We only had 4 days – but our trip to Versailles was cancelled (for unrelated reasons) and so we were looking or something that we could do within walking distance of the Latin Quarter.It was a beautiful sunny day, with blue sky and warmth. People were spread through out the gardens, tennis courts, fountains, lawns and everywhere else that people in Paris go to just soak it all in. I might have felt less enthusiastic about the time we spent at the Luxembourg Gardens if the weather was anything less than spectacular. It is a great place for a picnic lunch, people watching, reading by the water, or strolling with someone you love – or hope to love someday!Enjoy!
Paris in Springtime in the Gardens. Can't say enough about how beautiful these gardens are in May. We spent hours there just enjoying the trees, the beautiful gardens, and all of the people.

Gorgeous, peaceful. We stayed in this area for 9 days and I went jogging on the outside perimeter 7 of the mornings. It was gorgeous and peaceful, and I found myself loving the beautiful sculptures that varied at every turn. My kids (aged 7-12) loved pushing the sailboats in the fountain (2 euros for 30 min) and watched 2 puppet shows (4.7 euros), and loved playing on the playground, which has a zipline and rope eiffel tower.
Wonderful garden next to our hotel. I dream to leave next to such a parkFull of blooming treesnot too many peopleactivities for kids on one side - amother one quiete without kids.....

A lovely oasis in this hectic city. This is a great place to sit and relax your legs after having walked around Sainte-Germaine-des-Pres. The palace itself is beautiful. Worth visiting if you're in the area.
The Senate gardens. A must see right in Paris' center. A breath of clean and fresh air where you would not expect it.
great. but very dirty just like any other park I saw in Paris, beautiful views, many people just relaxing on the chairs
See the Spring Flowers. This is the Parisians' garden. If you can grab a chair, you could spend the afternoon reading or people watching.
Beautiful gardens with plenty space. There are also tennis courts, nice walks & a play park.
Sit a while. It is important, when at the Luxemburg Gardens, to sit a while and soak up the beauty. Rushing is NOT for Paris.

Nice statues, where are the flowers?. It IS April in Paris, wish the flowers were in bloom. These gardens are usually lovely, but this grip they were a little disappointing. Still, fun for people watching. The crepe stand across the street close to the American embassy serves a really nice sweet crepe with nutella and bananas!
Relax by the pond. This is a place to sit and read on a sunny afternoon. Chairs are provided and an escape from the bustle of Paris streets is just inside the gates.

strolling hand in hand, relaxing and people watching. great area to stroll through. seating in short supply. spend hours watching children sail boats (hired there) across large pond. marvel at the buildings and statues. Courts to be used and children's play area full of delightful ambience. A pastry, a book, a quiet corner and swirch off for awhile.....blissful rest for visitor feet.

Packed with people. We were here the first of April and so all the flowers had not been set yet. But no one seemed any less excited to spend a sunny Sunday afternoon lounging in the Gardens. Boats were on the water, families everywhere. Only difficultly for us was that we were traveling with one friend in a wheelchair. Maneuvering was a little tricky on the gravel pathways.
See and be seen. The gardens are lovely on there own, but the real treat for me was to watch the locals, all gathered here basking in the Spring sun!

People Watching and Sun Worshipping. As an American in Paris for the summer, I was shocked to find out that Parisians don't really have anywhere to lay out and take in the sun the way Americans do. The jardin de Luxembourg was the closest I have ever managed to get to American sun-worshipping in Paris. The size of this jardin is amazing and I love the palace, the pond, and all the statues that are scattered throughout. If you want a lazy afternoon, grab a baguette and some camembert and head to this garden!

Bring Lunch a paper and relax. We walked the park on Sunday and again on Monday for a few hours. Both days very crowded but very manageable. Sail boat races on Sunday. Reminded me of Central Park in New York City. Park is well laid out for everyone. Smaller kids 7-12 will really enjoy this park. Basketball hoops. Kids running around or flying kites. Lots of benches and metal chairs to sit, read and have lunch. A perfect way to spend a beautiful day in Paris. Very near the Sorbonne and the Latin Quarter.

People watching at it's best. It's not a Park like Americans think...very little grass or green space. However, it's the perfect place to take a picnic and people watch. Don't forget to go shopping in the nearby neighborhoods.

A good place for a parisian picnic. First saw this park on a bike tour I took, and decided to stop back teh next day for a picnic after having seen the Pantheon. (It's really close by.) Unfortunately the Fountain of Medicci was dry, but other than that the place was beautiful. I had a great picnic lunch and took a small break from my parisian adventure. Worth a visit.
Spend a Sunday afternoon like a Parisian. and linger in the sunshine in the Luxembourg Gardens

Put your feet up & rest. Once you've discovered the Latin Quarter, the Sorbornne, Medieval Garden, Middle Ages Museum and Pantheon, walk over to Luxembourg Gardens. Find a chair, put your feet up & enjoy the fountain & gardens. Friendly atmosphere, local people, police patrolled, quiet & refreshing.
A large piece of green in Paris. The Luxembourg gardens offer green areas, flowers, water pond, chairs, sculptures, fountains to the tourist, whether he/she is in a resting mood or an exploring mood.
Magnificent. Not to be missed, near the Latin Quarter. An oasis of peacefulness in a busy city.
Great Gardens. We were a bit early in the year but by April the gardens will be coming alive, it is worth the walk to the Luxembourg Gardens just relax and enjoy people watching!

Lovely and peaceful. I love this park. It is so beautiful and peaceful. From strolling to soaking in sun, to people watching, to exercise....it has it all. And it is so relaxed! Make sure you stroll through all of it. Every corner is worth it. If you love the sun, try to nab a green chair by the large round fountains. Or pull one up in the cool shade next to the medici fountain and read a book - that's what I did. Heaven.

Playground at LG has amazing structures. Not only is Luxembourg Gardens a peaceful enclave in the middle of the city, but it also contains a great area for kids to climb, swing and have fun. My 7 year old loved being able to let lose and play after several days of sight-seeing. It costs a little to get into the id area, but well worth it.

Impoverished City Park. I didn't care for this site. Perhaps when the trees bloom it would be an oasis in the nearly treeless (and grassless) landscape of Paris, but when we hiked through it trying to get somewhere, my impression was that they needed to plant more trees and bushes. Only afterwards did I realize we'd hiked through the famed Luxembourg Gardens.... Perhaps it was once a marvel, but I didn't get much out of it.
Calm oasis in the middle of Paris. My favourite place in Paris. Even in the wintertime. It is so calm and quintessentially Parisien. Plus it is surrounded by shops, restaurants, churches and museums.
a great break form pounding the pavements. An oasis - great formal gardens, lots of space to sit and think

We can't wait to go back. We visited in Feb, and even then it was beautiful. We are eager to go back in the spring/summer when we are sure that it will be even more stunning. Take a stroll through the gardens and fall in love with Paris.

Bit of a disappointment based on previous reviews.. Having read the reviews for this place, I found it rather disappointing. I imagine this would be a lovely place to spend an afternoon in summer but there are lots of other gardens in Paris I would rather visit. This is more of a place for children to play in the activity parks than a nice place to wander.

It was huge!. The gardens is nice and huge. We went there as soon as we arrive in Paris as it was also close to our hotel. We took the Metro and walk to the garden. They have fountains were people just sit around and talk and rest, they also have nice statues inside the gardens. A lot of local folks go there to just to realx and play tennis and chess (especially older people). It was a nice way to go around, relax and refresh your mind while travelling.

Very pretty walk, not a "must see" in my opinioni. There was a military presentation going on while we visited which was interesting. Very pretty gardens and architecture. We enjoyed strolling through but weren't over-the-top excited about it.

Relaxing time. If you have an hour to spend in order to relax this may be the good place for you. For a little rest on a bench or a walk around. There are often pictures exhibition around and the building in this garden (le Sénat), is a beautiful neoclassical style.
Worth A Visit. This beautiful park is a wonderful place to pull up one of its green chairs and just people-watch.
LOVE. Definitely go. Make sure to sit on the "right" grass, though. Most of it is blocked off.
a great way to spend a day. this wonderful park is a fantastic place to sit and watch the world go by. It is beautiful and very peaceful.

Lovely place for a walk.. We found the gardens not to be the green oasis it was described to be but that was just after summer and grass was worn through trampling and it was dusty and hot. We can imagine the gardens in spring when everything is new and fresh.
Good place to relax. The gardens are beautiful, but saving some time to actually stay there and relax is priceless.
Nice. Very pretty. serene sit somewere and just take it all in. This was perfect for a rest!

Beautiful gardens. Fresh flowers. People of all ages and races mingling together. Kids playing football (soccer) and joggers fill the park with energy. Lots of amazing statues. Maze-like trails. You don't see gardens like this in the united states. We went for a spring time jog. Weather was sunny, mid 60s, gorgeous!! Took many pictures. If you have a group, grab some wine, go sit on the lawn or pull up a chair and enjoy some deep discussions!!
Haven in the heart of Paris. Really peaceful and a lovely spot, lots of lovely statues and just a pleasant place to visit.
Wonderful open space; well cared for;. Very nice area; great for people watching; plenty of benches and chairs

When the sun is out, its where you find..well...EVERYBODY!. Grab a chair and never let it go, as they are hard to come by on a sunny day in Paris. The garden's themselves are beautiful...but I love going here to people-watch!
reminded me of central park. weather was perfect in late March, was a nice stroll through the gardens in Spring
Paris's Central Park.. Enjoy on a sunny, warm afternoon, along with the native Parisians. Beautifully-planted and designed gardens, this is a short stroll from Saint Germaine.

Spend some time here!. I walk through here several times a week. It's a beautiful park, it's lovely to watch the seasons change here. And it's the best ever place for people watching. Take a picnic and have lunch here along with everyone works nearby. And if you're there around 8:30 in the morning, you can watch the Paris pompier taking their morning run through the park.

BEAUTIFUL. Beautiful gardens. Great place to go and walk around on a nice spring afternoon. Grab some wine and have a picnic and enjoy the surroundings. Paris gardens are one to def visit and hang out for a bit. Bring a baguette and wine and take it all in.. soo pretty with nice fountains.

Picnic in the sunshine. Visit the gorgeous market on Rue Edgar Quinet and then walk the 5/10 minutes over to the gardens to enjoy your picnic in the sunshine, fabulous, tres Parisienne, don't forget the wine!
A fabulous gem in the middle of the Latin Quarter. A wonderful place to relax in the sun or under the trees and read or just watch the world go by.

wonderful place to rest in Paris. Wonderful place to have a short break in the long walk around Paris. You have enjoy the park and fountains, architecture and sculptors, there are a lot of students of Sorbonnе here.

worth a visit. We visited the Latin quarter and stumbled across the gardens. Left and purchased a picnic lunch and returned to do the Parisian thing of spending lunch time with a loved one in a park. We ate our lunch amongst tourist and locals while admiring the view of the Eiffel tower, Luxembourg palace and of course french lovers stealing quiet kisses in a break from the fast paced city life.A very Parisian way to spend some quiet time.

luxemburg Gardens. the weather was very hot the day we went and so we sunbathed. As it was just the start of spring the tree's were just bursting into bud. It was lovely to meander around and take in the space
Fantastic Paris park. Famous park with senate buildings beside - always full of Parisiens - great for a central city run too!

a pleasant, centrally located park. Not big enough for a long walk. But good for a break from the urban scenery of central Paris. There are plentiful metal chairs, so if the weather is good, sit and watch the Parisiens relaxing.
In May the flowering is lovely.. A strole in the garden and just looking at all the fantastic things occurring .
Beautiful Sunday. Wonderful place to grab a chair and just be. Watch the clouds set against the wonderful Parisian architecture. Drink up a view that casually includes the Eiffel Tower.

Perfect parisian park. Can see actual parisians in this park going about thier normal daily activites. Children playing, playing tennis and just relaxing. Would love to go back when the plants and palm trees are out. There are lots of chairs to relax on. Parisian parks have closing times quite different than most big parks in cities in the US. Plan accordingly as they lock the gates at a certain time!
A lovely place to while away some time. a lovely park excellent for a sunday morning stroll in the sun.Plenty of space with tennis courts, play area for kids and lots of people doing tai chi.lovely

beautiful and fun. an amazing public space in the middle of the city- it was nice to get out of the occasionally overwhelming exhaust and cigarette smoke! There is a great park in the NW corner, not to mention plenty of open space and places to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. Jardin du Luxembourg is a must visit.
Statues. I love the statues - so many literary ones too. It's also a great place to relax away from the center.
Not great right now. They seem to be "redoing" and the garden is in the worst shape I have ever seen. It has to get better from here.

A Popular Park in Paris for children. I go to this Garden sometimes alone to read books, other times with spouse and friends to chat and enjoy its beauty. It's a garden in Italian style...huge and beautiful, originally owned by Duke of Luxemburg. In 1612, it was purchased by Marie de' Medici, mother of Louis XIII and later designed in a more French style before it opened to the public. It is a wonderful garden with a octagonal pond at its centre where children float small boats. It is full of seasonal flowers, fountain and Palais du Luxembourg. Travellers who bring their children along should not miss this spot as it is in the 6e arrondissement of Paris.
Beautiful. Nice place to relax, I can see why diginitaries enjoyed this privilaged place for years.
Always beautiful. It was nice even in winter but more beautiful other seasons
Beautiful!. The chestnut trees are amazing, the staues, also amazing.
Stroll in the sunshine. Beaiutiful setting, but too early for plant blooms. HUNDREDS of joggers on a Sunday!

An oasis. A really superb garden, with sculptures and fountains throughout. Don't miss the exhibitions of photos that occasionally dot the gates along the northwest side of the gardens, near rue Soufflot.

Beautiful on a warm day. If you are visiting Paris with children this is a must see. They have a HUGE playground that costs about 2 euros per child, but there are bathrooms available for free. My children are 7 and 9. We went to the gardens twice on our weekend visit. Make sure to stop buy a Boulangarie and to pick up a sandwich and drinks to enjoy a picnic.

Amazing. Beautiful massive gardens. I suggest going there in the late spring early summer when all the flowers and trees have blossomed. We went there on a very cold rainy day and didn't get to appreciate the full beauty of it.
Magnificent. This is a dont miss. Where there on a day temperature was in the mid 60s in March was full of Parisienes having lunch and enjoying the beauty of the garden.

Luxembourg Gardens is a great spot!. This facility is a very nice park with a large pond and seating around it. The flower blossoms were terrrrrrriffic and plentiful. We saw some beautiful fountains/statues as well that were unique and well placed. We had lots of room to roam in this park and enjoyed our visit there. It was a good place to have a picnic lunch. This facility is also very close to many other interesting Paris sights so we were able to move on to those by taking a short walk.
Nice, but. We were too early in the season to get the full effect of the gardens.
tradional france. Just to watch children push their sail boats with sticks, kids poney rides (who needs video games)
Luxembourg Gardens. This is one of the nicest gardens in Paris. This is a must see in Paris.
get away from the crowds. relax on a bench or walk in the garden, Paris at its best

Perfect for a break. Take a break here. Colourful gardens and huge fountains to chill out and maybe doing a pic-nic or drinking something. For backpackers, there is a McDonals next to one of the entrances.

Lovely to walk through. Stumbled upon these en route to collect our museum pass from the tourist info centre. Lovely landscaped park with wide fountains and chairs spread around for people to sit down on and just relax.Grab some croissants and take 30 minutes out to people watch here
Very pleasing place to hang out. There is nothing much to say than it's beautiful scenery around the garden.
restful. Had a lovely feel about the place very restful, great for a break from all the busy tourist attractions.
Admire and relax. A place to go to admire and relax for some times aside nice flowers and plants.
Parc Parisien. Beautiful, peaceful, civilised and fantastic people watching. Wonderful iconic views all around
unique park. i cant say this place was the best of pairs, but it is good to see it. don't forget to have a look at french parliament.
stroll through the gardens. Enjoyable, relaxed area in which to stroll and walk off a spot of lunch, before or after visiting the nearby Pantheon.
the garden is beautiful. i love the walk in sunset accross the garden, very romantic

Great place to have lunch!. Very cold when we went but people were still sitting around reading and cuddling, kissing , chatting and having lunch, We bought the tastiest bagettes from one of the many stalls outside the gardens and sat by the fountains and took it all in. Beautiful in winter but I would love to come and sit here all day in the summer! Bonus hot chestnut lady at the gates! scooping them up out of a giant wok thing with her bare hands!! only in Paris!

This is a must see. When in Paris there's so much to do but the Statues and vined walks, the trees are well large and established so it makes for some really lovely walks, great photos and fond memories.

Simply beautiful. Could have sat at that fountain for hours. It makes you feel like a true parisian to just sit and watch the world go by from one of the lovely deck chairs available. Just like a scene from a film (which of course it has been many times!).
Becoming a Parisian. A great place to spend a relaxing Sunday and to feel like a true Parisian.

Probably beautiful in summer but a little disappointed. After reading the reviews and seeing beautiful photos we were really looking forward to visiting. However I would say that when the gardens are not in bloom, it is really no better than the Tuileries, and not worth the trip. The area and buildings are very impressive, just don't expect to be blown away by the gardens.

Perfect Parisian picnic. Take an hour out of your hectic Paris tour to spend in the Luxembourg gardens. Pick up sandwiches, croissants, chocolates, crepes - any french delight and just walk inside the gorgeous gardens. Find a bench and just sit and enjoy this beautiful place along with all the Parisians who go there for their lunch hour. There's also a cafe inside where you can buy your cafe and crepe and just become a Parisian for an hour - you will love it!

My favorite place in Paris. Allow yourself time to wander. We have been here in the heat of summer, beautiful flowers, shade, and seats. Now we have been in March, kind of chilly out, but just as beautiful. A cafe has outdoor seating as well. Grab an expresso and fruit crepe brunch and you are all set! This park closes at dark/dusk, so best to go early.
Beautiful Place to Relax. We enjoyed sitting and walking around the gardens. The setting is peaceful.

Probably the best looking and feeling park in Paris. Nested next to the Senate parlimament house, this garden is very Parisian, with tennis courts, amazing perspectives and scenery, some green (contrary to say the Tuileries whoch is "sand only")Go there on a sunny day, lay on one of th chairs and read a book... heaven
A lovely, small and very Parisian garden.. A beautiful pocket of lush gardens, reflecting pools, fountains and grass. It begs for you to stop, find a chair, sit in the sun and enjoy life!

Popular with joggers and students eating lunch. This park is smaller than Les Jardins de Tuilleries but deserves a visit because it's on a more human scale. Close to the Sorbonne so there's an intellectual feel in the air with profs, students and university staff sitting on benches in the afternoon. The fountain des Medicis often has sculptural art exhibits floating in the water. A few weeks ago the pond was covered in ice and was covered in mallard ducks; a kind of art. There are always people getting a run or jog in during their day and there are tennis courts in the back.

Stunning. WE spend a leisurely 2 hours here after aimlessly wandering the nearby streets for a few hours. These gardens are a wonderful place to just sit (plenty of chairs around the small lake/fountain) and enjoy Parisian life go by. Take some croissants and coffee to really help you settle in.
Relaxing experience. If you want to kill couple of hours after you've seen everything in Paris, this is your place.Very atmospheric gardens with lovely views.

Nice place for a picnic. If you want to avoid the overpriced, rip off restaurants and bars in Paris and the St Germain area then go to the local supermarket...get a bottle of wine, some bread and nibbles and head to these Gardens...loads of seats to sit and picnic...or grab one of the recliners and really chill.
Spacious and historic. Quiet space in very busy Paris. Nice to wander in the gardens. Also close to Montparnasse with great places to eat

great to relax and take it all in. i love going here an just sitting adn people watching.get coffee adn a pastry or bring a picnic and just relax and hang out in the gardens.it peaceful and entertainign at the same time, and just so pretty.

A bit of green when you need it.. The Luxembourg Gardens are very beautiful and it is a nice escape from the urban buzz of Paris. I recommend a nice walk along its paths to refresh yourself in the greenery. Just watch out for the runners. It seems everyone in Paris comes here to get their running in.

Take a walk through the gardens!. We had a beautiful morning walk through the gardens on our way from Hotel Jardin to Notre Dame. It was cold and cloudy but had a charm all it's own. So much more to see I am sure but just a nice simple walk was great.

Any time but in Spring or Summer.... Between the beehives, the exotic plants and the great fountain, what's not to like.
Like everyone else there, pull up a chair and make it your own garden. Le Jardin du Luxembourg is gorgeous in Spring and all through Summer.
Very beautiful. Nice and huge place to spend an afternoon for a stroll or just relax.
Favorite Park. Be sure not to miss. Spending an afternon resting/reading while soaking up the rays - heavenly!
Nice to chill and watch the old boys play boule.. Nice to chill and watch the old boys play boule. Also the lovely palais de luxembourg is worth seeing. Lots happening in this park.
Relax. Great to relax in the summer and great for a stroll in the winter.
Beautiful!. What a beautiful garden. Such fantastic playgrounds and facilities for young children too. Our 3 year old had a such a great time here.

Peaceful Jardins. I'm sure the gardens would be spectacular in the spring and summer, but it didn't stop us from visiting in February. We could imagine the greenery and blooms. Lovely place to sit and relax, enjoy the sun and people watching.
Beautiful. A wonderful place to visit or take a jog in the summertime. Lots of beautiful flowers. Very relaxing.

Cezanne exhibit. Go early in the day-don't wait until late afternoon. I discovered that I wasn't as fond of Cezanne as I thought. I've been to the exhibit of Tiffany's glass a few years ago and it was great, so it just depends on what they are displaying.
Beautiful and Relaxing. This is a very large park that is worth a walk through. It is relaxing and quiet, with plenty of paths and statues. A perfect place to read a book or go people watching.
Huge. A wonterfull huge park with great gardens. Very relaxing.
Really romantic place. The walk on the gardens was amazing. It was very relaxed and tranquil. Definitely recommend it to in love birds.
So beautiful. My favorite memory is having breakfast in the park, people watching and soaking up Paris.

Even in winter, worth a stop. The Luxembourg gardens are nowhere near as large as the Tuileries but just as pretty. In the warmer months, everything is in bloom, but even in winter, it's pretty to see the palace and the statues and some greenery that is there. Pretty gates with gold tips surround it. It's a nice stop for peace and quiet in the middle of the crazy Boulevard St. Michel area.
My favourite gardens in Paris. Stunning gardens with a great buzz on Sundays. Definitely put on your list to visit after a wander round St Germain.
Peaceful afternoon. Lovely green space - more relaxing and comfortable than the Tuilerie
Great. Delicious place to sit and enjoy the view in the end of the day... very relaxing and wonderful view...
Peaceful. We liked the fountains, people watching and again, the history of the place.
Beautiful. The gardens are just so pretty, just sitting on a bench doing absolutey nothing would be bliss.
The most beautiful park in the world!. I absolutely loved this park, full of sculptures, flowers, gorgeous trees and old guys playing Boules! Perfect place for a picnic.

Paris' Central Park.. Paris' version of New York's Central Park where locals dress down, leave their watches and forget about the rest of the day. The park has diverse pickings for different folks- a quiet bench to read a book, gravelly trails to run and sweat out, a pond to sail a toy boat, a museum, a playground, gardens and more.
A great break from the City. Beautiful gardens, classic French buildings, plenty of picnic areas , food vendors and even beehives.

peace and quiet. this is a haven from the mad rush of the city it is great to just stroll around or take a chair and sit for a time letting the world pass you by before you have to restart the Parisien site seeing trip again.

A Paris delight. Approach by a walk down the Boulevard St Michel for a good dose of Paris. Walk through the gardens and enjoy people watching, especially the kids and their boats in the large pool in the middle. It is a beautiful venue and not one to be missed on your visit to Paris.
Wonderful Morning. Toured the Gardens on our last morning in Paris. Absolutely delightful oasis from the hustle and bustle. If you like gardens and parks, make sure you include this one.
Enchanting. Loved strolling through the gardens in the fall. The people and sites were beautiful!
An oasis of calm in a busy city!. In my head I am still sitting on a very comfortable seat, looking at the fountain wi the Palace behind it...that was three days ago but I'm still 'there'!

THE park in the centre of "real" Paris !. A magnificent park in the centre of Paris, with two cafés and restaurants. The best flowers in Paris (as it is owned by the Senate, they have great gardeners !Peaceful; A pond in the center with some kids and boat-toys. People who play chess... Sunbaking on against a certain wall (you'll see !); palm trees. Art exhibitions sometimes. A place to see lazy people; yet, no hope to meet anyone, except maybe some foreigners, as it used to be a place to "hunt" for lovers and now, people don't want to play that game any longer. Close to the Pantheon and the Sorbonne and Boulevard Saint Michel (i.e. real Paris !).Jogging and martial arts here and there...Some orchestras now and again in the romantic Kiosko... People playing traditional balls by a small cafe... Has to be seen...The Park in the centre of realParis
Cool. Nice place to walk around , good organisation but dog drops around were disgusting

Include in walk around the area. beautiful building, could imagine what the formal garden would look like in spring/summer when planted up. Easy to walk round with a lake which reflects the Palace to create great photos

Beautiful place to relax.. Easy to find, well planned gardens with fountains. Popular locals spot for brining the kids and renting small sailboats to float in the large fountain. Good place to relax towards the end of a long day of walking.
Relaxed. always good to go to a nice park after a day of shopping, just to watch the people having fun.
Cezanne at Luxembourg. Cezanne exhibit quite well done. The historical owners of the paintings were listed as well as the current lender. Even on a cold day the museum & grounds warm your heart!

Relaxing atmosphere. On my day off last summer, i took a picnic and a book to the luxembourg gardens, it is lovely to walk around. Medicis Fountain is one of the many features to see as well as the Palais du Luxembourg.

Relaxing moments in the city. The location is ideal and easy to get to. It is a pleasure to just stroll or relax and watch the children of Paris play in this lovely park. Nearby are bakeries where you can pick up a snack to picnic with. A must see.

Gorgeous place with great chairs and a bar!. Definetely recommend the park, around the main fountain there are several chairs to sit and relax. Try the tilted ones, you can probably take an afternoon nap. There's also a bar with good beer.
A short walk. Sadly all the toilets were closed on the day we visited and this did let down the visit. They are also replanting many of the trees so we did not seethe gardens in all their glory.

Average.. Average at best, the gardens themselves are not much, it's very dusty and bleak, it may be because we went in February, however the views from the park are nice seeing the Montparnasse Tower and Eiffel tower in the distance. The palace is very nice, but overall we didn't spend long there 20 minutes max.

Large gardens to rest and enjoy. The gardens are very large. I went there twice, and enjoyed the seen of the trees and plants in different seasons of the year. Its a very nice place to enjoy some peacful time. You can go from there to the latin quarter to enjoy eating or drinking in small elegant resturants with different types of dishes.

Pretty and very French. There is something so french about the Luxembourg Gardens. I am not sure if it is the plantings the way that different coloured foliage are places side by side, or the lay out of the gardens with miles of white gravel paths, fountains and sculptures. I always make a point of visiting it even if it is just to walk though it on my way somewhere.
tranquillity in central Paris. a beautiful large formal gardens with water to relax in away from the hustle and bustle of central Paris
A relaxing place in the midst of a busy city. Great to walk through and sample the delights of a real Parisien park
Beautiful!. Pick up lunch, a loaf of bread, chees and a bottle of wine and enjoy this beautiful Parisian treat!

Fun for kids. This is a great place to take kids to play. There is an awesome playground with non-American equipment, which my kids loved! There is also a fun merry-go-rounds and some basketball and tennis courts. Plus the gardens are lovely, even in the winter.
lovely during summer. One of the great gardens in Paris, a perfect place to relax.

Lovely even during winter. I've just spent many weeks in Paris living one block away from the garden. Even though it was winter I went to the park everyday. Sometimes for running, sometimes for pic-nic and in sunny days for reading. Just love it!
Paris knows Gardens. A wonderful place to walk, sit and read. Very romantic.
Paceful. Sitting in a chair....near the fontaine....is absolutely
Very beautifull and calm place!. Nice to go and spend some time with your loved one. Beautiful garden and palace, although the season was winter.

Snowy walk. We walked through the Luxembourg gardens in the snow. So beautiful. ON the rue du Flurus on the other side there is a cafe called Bread and Roses, have their hot chocolate - it is to die for!
(7Euros!!)
Medecini Fontaine Fountain. One of my favorite places in the entire world. I have visited 4 times and each time is magical!

alive and kicking. this park is great for sunday afternoons. everybody is relaxed and enjoying the number of activities in this beautiful park. after a busy day in paris one can relax on one of the many benches.

Hanging with the locals. We had a great trip, but at so many of the places we went, the tourists outnumbered the Parisians. At Luxemborg garden, we were surrounded by people from the neighborhood; kids playing ball, a bride and groom posing for photos, large extended families picnicing, senior citizens strolling hand in hand. It was wonderful.
good place. these gardens look lovely and are very central so you can go there for a while after a sightseeing day in paris to have rest

Relaxing place to visit. We stayed in Latin Quarter and picked up breakfast at a pastry shop each morning and enjoyed a cup of coffee in the Luxembourg Gardens every morning. Oftentimes we were the only ones in the park early morning. It's a lovely way to begin each day.
Very Parisian. Grab a picnic lunch and enjoy the gardens on a sunny day. Really beautiful park. Very close to Arr. #5 and 6.

My Girlfriend's Favorite Park in Paris. Went there right before sundown. Autumn is beautiful in Paris. I think it's my favorite time of year there. And what better place to enjoy autumn but in a beautiful park in the middle of Paris. Locals and tourists abound there, but it's easy to find your own little pied a terre. The smile on my girlfriend's face was more than enough to make it a favorite of mine too.

My girlfriend's favorite park in Paris. Went there right before sundown. Autumn is beautiful in Paris. I think it's my favorite time of year there. And what better place to enjoy autumn but in a beautiful park in the middle of Paris. Locals and tourists abound there, but it's easy to find your own little pied a terre. The smile on my girlfriend's face was more than enough to make it a favorite of mine too.
my cat park.... after all the hard-earned visits take a time out & seat facing the pool...there's also a cat patrolling around the park. take a picture with it !!!

Nice gardens. Make sure you enter via the main gates as they are beautiful - great spot for a picture. The gardens are a hot spot for locals on weekends - you will feel very "touristy" when the parisians run past you on their weekend run groups.Will be an even nicer place to visit in summer/spring as it looks quite cold/sad in winter with all the bare trees
statue everywhere. my son love it. it has an excellent playground. only, the garden is too big, so tired walking around. but still a very beautiful garden
Favorite spot in Paris. Whenever one is in Paris, it is always a good idea to stroll through Luxembourg Gardens. There is always something to see - art, love, nature - it's always magic.

Excellent Garden. If you want to enjoy a quiet walk in the middle of the city, this is the place to be!Perfect visit on a sunny day, close to Saint Sulpice Church.You may read about my Paris trip..http://www.cafeinks.com/archives/1267/shimmering-paris

dusty in the spring and summer. well walking to the opera house i was told to stroll the garden but i didnt...it was very dusty and i had new chanel shoes on...lol but its huge!! very peaceful and like a library...quite, pretty, you can catch people eating lunch on a blanket or jacket most days
for runners- must do. If you are a runner you must plan time for a run through the gardens. Beautiful gardens and so many runners!

Excellent place for a jog, a walk or studying. I love this place. I used to live next to it and it was and it still is my favorite place in Paris. There is a huge variety of things you can do-yoga on Sundays, tennis, jogging, chilling out... I even studied there for my exams! In summer you can sunbathe. A perfect retreat.
Picnic. We had a picnic in Luxembourg Gardens. A lovely place to stop and rest after all the walking you do around Paris.
Very relaxing. There are some really amazing sculptures in this garden and the place is beautiful. When we visited the admittance fee was 2 Euros, I think, well worth it.
peacefull gardens in the middle of the left bank. very nice gardens and nice exposititon (P. Cezzane) in the nearby musee de l'orangerie.

Parisian Playground. This park has something for everyone, formal gardens, a lovely palace, cafes, children's playgrounds, a forest, an original Statue of Liberty, creperies and a puppet theatre. No wonder the Parisians love it so much.

My Favorite Park in the World!. Stunningly beautiful, elegant in it's grace, Luxembourg Gardens simply cannot be missed!There are other parks that I enjoy, (Central, Stanley, Chapultepec and Forsyth), but LG is very simply the finest in the world! Enormous yet charming and something for all. Saw this rated as the finest jogging spot on the globe as well. No better place to be, year round.

Beautiful Escape from the streets.... Beautiful gardens and blooms, even in November! We walked from Notre Dame up to the Sorbonne and then into/around/through the gardens. It was a great walk on beautiful streets with old architecture, and of course great people watching. We ended getting lunch (and lots of other food) at Le Bon Marche, and ate it in the small park in front of the huge store. A great 3-4 hour adventure.
Beautiful. Want to spend a relaxing day? Visit a local deli and stock up on baguettes and cheeses and picnic here. Perfect for people watching, spending time with friends or that special someone.

Great escape in Paris. The other famous garden in Paris. Unlike the Tuileries, Luxembourg is quiet and peaceful. You can find some relaxing spots to enjoy some Parisian greenery or you could take in a game of tennis, basketball, and some other activities with the locals. That is what happened on one of my visits. We were just passing through the park and ended up playing a few games of basketball with some very friendly Parisians. It made the trip much more memorable.
Sunday in the park. The gardens are beautiful; one of the best spots to people watch in Paris. There are several great bakeries nearby, bring your dessert in and just daydream.

What a beautiful park.... This was truly a wonderful place to visit. The Parisians are really into family. It was evident from all the activities that were available for families to take advantage of and for free!!!

Beautiful Gardens, will return with a book next time!. Walked through the gardens on a sunny January day. Very pretty, nice atmosphere. Lots of lawn chairs available throughout the park - would definitely return on a warmer day with a book to bask in the sun and read!

Huge, beautiful gardens. Full of locals and tourists alike, this huge park that contains a castle and museums is located close to town and next to one of the larger train stations in the area. Full of people playing sport, sunning themselves and just hangin out, head down here to get a coffee and see what the locals get up to.
Lovely sunday. great people watching and photography oportunities. Do not miss the "tres chic" chairs, and be sure to have some moulles and red wine at a nearby restaurant

Green grass in February. As we strolled through the gardens in February it was fascinating to see so many people out lolling about, on computers, playing tennis, anything to be outside. People in shirts no coats in 45 degree weather. The parliament is here too. worth the visit
etheridge. liked beauty and size of garden especially Medici Fountain

relax and dream in Paris. A visit to paris will be incomplet without to go there .
I and my wife love it and our daughter like to feed the birds .
Lovely even in January. The Gardens are lovely even in the rain in January. Always nice to appreciate Paris' open spaces!

Lovely walk.. This is a lovely walk. Get to know more about Marie de Médicis, mother of king Louis XIII of France, her residence palace (today's France senate) and the gardens surrounding it. Don't miss the Medici Fountain, the statue of Baudelaire and the replica of the Statue of Liberty placed near the exit on rue Guynemer.
Lovely. One of my favorite gardens in Paris. Just a beautiful and serene place, even when there are beaucoup de touristes inside.

Indulge in Luxury for Free in Paris. Where else but in Paris can you indulge in beauty and tranquility for no admission fee? Numerous comfortable chairs and even lounge-type seating can be found surrounding the fountains and facing the Luxembourg Palace, providing a wonderful retreat from the city. I much prefer the Luxembourg Gardens to the Tuilleries, because having been to both in the summer and winter, the Luxembourg Gardens is still lively even in the bitter cold, having somehow retained its greenery and lushness. What better place to spend a few hours relaxing after all that eating, walking, and shopping?
Nice gardens near the Latin Quarter. Lovely gardens in the midst of busy Paris. Nice to wander through.

My 10 year old son's favorite stop in Paris. Despite miserable weather, my children loved this park. There's a children's recreation area with some really cool playground equipment. I highly recommend this stop for anyone with kids! It was a nice break from the museums and more formal activities. Of course, we were there when local children were in school, so my children pretty much had the run of the park. (Small fee for entrance, but added bonus of a "real" toilet - not so easy to find in public areas in Paris!)
A great place on a sunny day. Perfect for children and relaxing in general, peobably one of my 9 year old sons favorite places in Paris.
Peaceful Gardens. Whether you just want to stroll through or sit by the fountain and watch children float their sailboats, Luxembourg Gardens are worth the visit.
Musee de Luxembourg. Small art gallery contains a nice range of Impressionist paintings

Where the Parisians relax. This is truly a wonderful city park. The flowers are everywhere and the Parisians seem to just soak it all in on a beautiful summer evening. Old men play chess, couples sit by the fountains or read in chairs by the monuments, tennis is played by one end and the beautiful Luxemborg castle stands in watch over everything. We visited this in conjunction with a short visit to the Musee Orsay, a walk through the St. Germain de Pres neighborhood, Luxemborg Gardens, to the Latin Quarter around Notre Dame and dinner on Isle de St. Louis....where your walking shoes.
Good place to relax.... Went there in summer and it was a good place to relax. Lotsa shades around to cool off in summer heat. Very parisienne...
A pretty stroll. If you're staying close by, stroll the Luxembourg Gardens just to people-watch. The little cafe in the center of the gardens is a lovely spot for a coffee.
The garden so wide and spacious!. I enjoyed my walk in this garden. So beautiful! It is right across where my hotel was, Trianon Rive Gauce. Beautiful garden.
big. you can see how pretty this park would be in spring, shame they can't make an effort in winter to prettier it up. And the playground for the kids is pay!!!
a nice visit. pretty area and a lovely place to rest and eat a sandwich on a baguette on a sunny day. A break form the hussle and bussle!

Beautiful space. This is a beautiful garden in the middle of a bustling city, but it's not in its glory wonderful in December. When in full bloom it's a wonderful place to escape from the chaos just down the street.
Lovely!. The grounds, the palace and the fountain were all very lovely. Must see!
even nice in the winter !!. Love the sailboats in the pond. Great for people watching. Include a visit to St Sulpice church on Sunday to hear the organ play after the 10:30 am mass.

Grab a sandwich and take in the beautiful flowers and scenery. We grabbed some sandwiches and crepes and walked over to the gardens. It was sunny and beautiful that day to just sit and relax and people watch.

What a garden. All I can say is STUNNING must see.
The garden and statues the atmosphere. Find a sit and people watch.
Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful even in the winter. The flowers are beautiful against the winter grounds. We even got to see a bunch of young kids taking tennnis lessons.
A must see in Paris. These gardens are exquisite. We visited in December, and even then it was worthwhile. When we have previosuly visited in the spring or summer, they are out of this world
Great place to hang out. Very close to the hotel, ten minutes, go often and just relax.
favourite park. on a suuny winters day , very pleasant, stumbled across it and glad we did
relax in the sun. beautiful spot where you can relax sunbathing close to the fountain where children play with they're toy boats. A place where time stops.

A lovely respite in the middle of the city. Whether you are crossing the city by foot or looking for a nice place to have a picnic or listen to local musicians, Luxembourg Gardens fits the bill. Le palais du Luxembourg isn't have bad to look at either! FYI: Patisserie Gérard Mulot straight down Rue de Tournon (it becomes Rue de Seine) in front of the palace on the street side is a nice place to pick up some snacks to bring with you to the park.

One of the beautiful places in Paris. I think, Luxembourg Gardens - is the must see place in Paris. Very quiet, very clean park with many benches where you can have a rest. Shady alleys will protect you from the sun, and when it's raining you can breathe the smell of flowers. Warning - the Gardens are closed in the night so you can visit this place only from 8a.m. till 7p.m.

Must see. If you are looking to just relax take a stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens, with it's mix of open space and activity areas it's a must see. Particular highlights are watching all the model boats on the lake and the large groups of people doing Tai-Chi in the shade.
This is the way to observe French living. Always stroll this beautiful park and enjoy people watching, the statues, seasonal flowers. Be sure to make time for a picnic and just absorb it all
Beautiful. Beautiful french gardens, you can first visit the Pantheon and then come down to Luxembourg gardens

I love Paris and its parks. If you read "the player" from Dostoyevsky you know how beautiful this place is. I suggest you all to have a walk in this park and take a sit on a chair close to the lake. Look at the duck, enjoy your time and the amazing moment Paris has to offer!

Beautiful Gardens of Paris. With so many wonderful gardens in Paris, I have nothing bad to say about the Luxembourg Gardens - they are amazing by any standard - plently for the locals to do there - we just strolled through during the afternoon. I still prefer the monuments and churches in Paris.
Perfect small park. great place to read a book for a leisure hour. Fun little bistros nearby. classic French.

Good place to sit and relax. The gardens weren't as beautiful as I had envisioned but the fact that I was there and walked the grounds of such a historical site made the long trek from our hotel well worth the visit.
Good picnic spot and people watching. Even although it is winter, we enjoyed the gardens and had taken a simple picnic along. Lots of activity and dog walking so enjoyable to watch people and relax.

If you want to see beautiful gardens like nowhere else, Luxembourg is for you!. The gardens are unlike anything we have in the States, so a visit is very necessary if you are traveling to Paris! They are clean, beautiful, accessible, safe and peaceful. When you get married, they will let you access every area of the park that is otherwise off limits so that was a very nice perk of this year's stay! Thank you for keeping them so beautiful!
Beautiful, even in the winter. Great place for families, couples, singles, everyone!

Living in Paris and Visiting the Luxembourg Gardens. I lived in Paris for a year, 2010-2011, and one of my very favorite places was the Luxembourg Gardens. I used to sit and walk in them for hours, even in the winter snow. Don't miss them. I wrote a book about my year of adventure in Paris.Boyd Lemon-Author of “Eat, Walk, Write: An American Senior’s Year of Adventure in Paris and Tuscany,” and "Digging Deep: A Writer Uncovers His Marriages," the author’s journey to understand his role in the destruction of his three marriages. Information and excerpts: http://www.BoydLemon-Writer.com.

What you come to Paris for. Simply one of the most beautiful places in Europe. If you have ever dreamed of being a boulevardier, a flaneur, a cosmopolite strolling the streets and parks of Paris, you'll do no better than here.
Really nice views!. Went in winter and still looked impressive. Can't wait to go again in summer to have a picnic in the gardens.

Great Paris picnic. This is a fantastic park in the heart of Paris. One of our best memories of our trip to France was a picnic in the Luxembourg Gardens, sharing the experience with grade school children who came out wtih teachers for an outdoor lunch themselves.

Even Parisiens play tourist here. Many visitors don't go here but it is a must see on all our visits. There is usually a free display of photographs on the railings outside which rarely fail to delight.

Beautiful Park. We went to this park and enjoyed its beauty. The Luxembourg Palace is beautiful and its setting on the gardens is wonderful to see. The sculptures around the gardens are beautiful too. It is very pleasant to just walk around or sit down and observe the people in the gardens.

It was easy to go back in time. Felt like yesterday that this history actually happened when you become immersed in the presentation and collections of something the present world is still remembering and seeing in movies and in reading novels. Plenty of tourists, plenty of room to move.
Wonderful place to relax and unwind. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. Nice place to have lunch and enjoy a glass of wine.
Beautiful. Absolutely lovely grounds, would be best to see these at their best in the summer.
Nothing much to see in winter. It was winter so things weren't blooming as the pictures showed. But well worth a romantic walk into :)
luxembourg Gardens. Very nice gardens to take a stroll by. Very family oriented and relaxing to watch the fountains.

Excellent green area in the middle of Paris. Very pleasant place to relax, read a book and for small walks.During the spring and summer the colors of the flowers take care of the garden. The fountain in the middle of the park is also a good entertainment for the children, who can play with small boats.Sometimes it's quite crowded, but normally you can find a good place on the grass.It's a must visit.
Join the Parisians. get away from the hustle and bustle of Paris and hire a toy sailboat and be a kid
Bread, Cheese, Park.. Beautiful and relaxing park just a stone's throw from the hustle and bustle - ideal location for a lunch-time picnic
it's paris. we were there before and after christmas - and it was such a human spirited place with the strollers the families - just enjoying - great vibes

Playground for kids. If you feel guilty schlepping your kids around Paris, this is the spot for them. The playground costs money, but is worth it. But we should have checked the puppet theatre times beforehand, as they are typically only in the middle of the afternoon.

luxembourg in autumn. To visit luxembourg in autumn was wonderful the autumn colours did the jardin proud, while some of the flower beds had been turned over the autumn colours elsewhere more than made up for them overall wonderful
Gorgeous Gardens. Even in September, the gardens were still amazing. It was just like the pictures. Parisians sit around reading and kissing and almost making love on a bench. Beautiful area.

Walking in a Paris park at its best.. Although it was winter (December, 2011), the sun was shining, the trees had no leaves, Parisians were out relaxing , walking, reading and exercising (running, Tennis, etc).
This was a true experience of life in Paris where people who live in apartments, get out to relax.

Great summer place for children. Fabulous place full of various activities for children to do, playground, pony rides, petanque, motorised cars, sailing boats on the large pond, abundance of grassed areas in the shade for enjoying a picnic, summer music and a great little puppet theatre which we visited in September 2010 and February 2011.
An oasis in central Paris. Lots and lots of people, but a relaxing place to rest your feet during a hard day's sightseeing. Especially fun when the children have the sailbots on the pond
Lovely. Have been to the garden twice. once in summer and once in winter. of course, summer it better!!
Place to see... Even in winter.... The garden is in it's best on summer but it's beautiful place also on other times.

Great Park for a run. Pretty, clean, and you see the neighborhood.. I love runing the lop in the park, and also around the outside Perimeter. The neighborhoods around it are gorgeous and high-end. The buildings-- old and stunning. Worth going.
If you love parks..... A good thing to do in the morning, walk around the gardens, the sculptures and trees, even if it's freezing cold...
Great place to relax in Paris. Charming park with loads of green chairs to read and relax in. Loved the pond area. This park is one of few that has a grassy area for people to picnic on.
Best part of my daily walk. The space is vast the statues and fountains are wonderful as well as the flowers and playgrounds full of children playing
Flowers were just beginning to bloom.. A lovely spot to sit on a bench and enjoy Paris. Watching choldren and their parents on al ovely day was a peaceful interlude.

My little Paradise. Busy park but not that much because locals are spreading around gently and do not abuse of the sunny garden. Perfect for kids, toilets, poney riding, karting, big playground, toilets again, and fantastic cafes nearby music kiosk with live music...a paradise.

Even if you have nothing better to do. The Luxembourg Gardens are always a must visit. Either to relax or pass some time reflecting on life. Buy a nice baguette with leg ham and gruyere cheese from one of many patisseries outside the gardens. Back to the gardens and find two chairs one to sit on and one to rest your legs. Watch the locals, watch the children, the students and the tourists. The central flower garden plantings are famous and must be seen during the summer months.

Pleasant place to rest your aching feet. The Jardin du Luxembourg is the second largest public park in Paris and is the garden of the French Senate, which is housed in the Palais du Luxembourg. Behind the palace lie the Orangerie and some modern sculptures, as well as a beautifully sculpted homage to Delacroix. There are various statues of former French queens and famous women around the area of the garden fronting the palace. My favorite items of interest are the sculpture of the Actor (you can see the Pantheon behind him) and the area of the garden near the Medici Fountain – it looked like a nice place to just sit in. The first model of the Statue of Liberty was likewise in the garden.

Lovely garden. Beautiful and historic gardens with magnificent design, room for jogging and excellent resources for children. It also contains well over one hundred cultivars of apple tree and an aviary and is an urban home for some lovely birds.

A classical Parisian park.. I love the round pond/boating lake in the Luxembourg Gardens, and there are numerous depictions in art of this lovely space. It's quite a peaceful place to sit, on the individual metal chairs that are available in Paris parks, and just relax after a busy sightseeing trip.The park has statues, rows of trees, and contains the Palais de Luxembourg. It's well worth a visit.
A must see for tourists in Paris. You could bring some sandwiches/beer and just enjoy the plentiful atmosphere.
Pretend you're a Parisian.... The Luxembourg gardens are beautiful, a place to relax, stroll, jog (if you must), sketch, read... and pretend to be a denizen of St Germain - if only!

You & a few THOUSAND acquaintances!. Walked around this lovely area on a very hot October afternoon. Only one area of grass is set aside for sitting - so very crowded, not a single area left for us to sit, even if we wanted to join the miasma of cigarette smoke, while other pristine grassy lawns were off limits. It seems a very Parisian thing to do, strolling around the paths, people watching and spending an afternoon outdoors, to escape the intense urban streets of Paris.

Love at first sight. In the hustle and bustle of Paris, there is the Luxembourg Gardens. It is large and tranquil, separated into many different parts. The one section, my favorite section, is the men playing bocce ball. My mom and I spent almost an entire afternoon walking around the Luxembourg Gardens, specifically sitting there (crepe in hand) watching older generations teaching those younger, people on dates, etc., playing a game a bocce ball. The Luxembourg Gardens is a MUST SEE in Paris. I wish that it hadn't taken me 2 trips to realize that.
Great place to relax. The weather was so great this November that we could sit around and watch the guys playing bocci ball - or whatever the game was! We had a ball watching and enjoying their fun!

Quintessential Paris.. If you are in a hurry, if you are trying to see Paris in a day, three days, five days, skip it.
Otherwise, buy a sandwich, find a partner, and just enjoy.
ALways. This is my favorite place in Paris. Just walk around, any time of the year, take a book, a camera and soak into a special place.
Big place to love. We like the quite and the same time crowd place. Full of fresh air breathe and full of flowers refreshs the eyes and beautiful 'palais du Luxemburg" to admire.

Great children's playground. In the southern section of the Luxembourg gardens there is an enclosed children's playground with a "flying fox" (for the Aussies) and various contraptions that whirl and spin, also a large climbing frame. Voted best ever playground by my 9 year old and "awesome" by the 11 year old. 2.50 Euros per child, adults can sit outside (free) and observe (or retreat to the coffee shop). The ubiquitous green chairs are available-warm-ish while the sun is high, but cools rapidly after 3 p.m. Closes at 4 p.m. with much officious whistle-blowing.

Quiet in the City. When the hustle and bustle of Paris has you wishing for some peace and quiet, this is the place to go. Take some crepes or macaroons with you, and park yourself on a bench. Great people-watching and lots of good photo ops, too.
Beautiful even in Winter. must see! we visited two days after the soltice and sunworshippers were out in force. tranquil, peaceful setting, very relaxing!
lovely. don't miss these grounds. lovely lots of seating and shade. lovely flowers
Lots to see...... Take a walkabout on these grounds and you will see the most amazing fountains and sculptures.
Dont miss. I love Luxembourg Gardens. Very Parisien and great for people watching. A nice break from the city.

Oasis of calm and beauty. we spent a lovely afternoon here during th summer when all the parisians have left the city and the place is left to the tourists. gorgeous settings and away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist treadmill. You can truely enjoy the gardens for an hour or so when the city gets too much. there are other great gardens like the tulleires but we just fell in love with this garden.
Luxembourg Gardens. I thought the gardens were one of the best in Paris. Do go to the pond where they play with radio controlled boats and check out the Palace
Favorite. This is the best place to go in Paris. Just walk around and take it all in.
Great for a stroll anytime of year. The gardens are peaceful and elegant with the Medicis commissioned palace as a focal point.
Wonderful site. Lovely place to just sit and bask in the sun (when it's out!)...great place to spend time with family and friends.
best gardens in paris. Clearly, the best gardens in Paris. Come on Sundays and participate in a Parisian leisure way of life.

Even Better. Wow!!
