Love Luxemburg Gardens...We went there in September 2008 and we were amazed by people playing games and actually enjoying their park even though it was coolish and a bit damp.This year we were lucky enough to get beautiful 20ish degree days and lots of sunshine.That bought everyone out into the park, everyone doing their own thing, enjoying the unseasonal weather. The gardens were flowering, the tree's leafy and the lawn green and inviting you to sit down and soak up the sun, a lot of chairs and benches are provided around the park, there is also a cafe. I was concerned about dog droppings, but it wasn't an issue, and there were plenty of dogs being walked through the park.There are quite a few interesting buildings, statues and fountains throughout the gardens. and the atmosphere was friendly and vibrant.
Gorgeous Park. Great to passtime and hang with friends, A lot of ice vendors.

Nice place to relax.. Relax, get some food from the stands, see some people and just enjoy the French. It was nice.The Pantheon is close by and worth a view while you are here.Whilst in the gardens, stop and see the miniature statue of liberty in the south central section. It was nice. This is different than the one in the Seine.
So incredibly beautiful!!!. Words alone cannot express the beautify of this place!!!
Beautiful beautiful. Anyone visiting Paris should spent time in Paris' great garden and experience it like a true Parisian

My kids' favourite park..... The gardens are especially beautiful during spring and early summer. But also all year round too. My kids favourite all time activity was sailing the boats on the lake. As a mummy, sitting back and watching them and the others chasing after them is a memory now very close to my heart...

spectacular gardens on the left bank. We wandered through while waiting for our room to be ready after an early morning arrival. The floral gardens were gorgeous on the sunny summer morning we spent there, and there were large well-manicured lawns. It seems to be a favorite site for area joggers, and there's a gazebo where concerts are held (jazz piano one afternoon as we passed through).

Beautiful even in December!. We visited these gardens in the month of December, and even then they are beautiful. We enjoyed the hedges, creating variety in the gardens instead of one great big expanse. The statues were very interesting. Our favorite one was Lady Liberty (we are from the USA). We would love to return in the spring or summer months when the flowers are in bloom, but we honestly have no regrets. Such a peaceful setting.
Strolling round the jardins. As always the perfect urban space with games dogs children and relaxation
Beautiful. We went in the summer so there were a lot of people but we had a nice walk through the gardens.

Take a breath and just enjoy being in Paris. The grounds are beautiful and one can't help feeling relaxed, even when you know there's a thousand other sights and dozens of museums you want to visit and you find your pace slowing and suddenly, Paris is even more beautiful.
Crowded place. Lots of people resting, having the time of their lives. Enjoying the sun on a cold March morning.

Parisian packed people watching park!. The Parisian past time of people watching was well underway the day we strolled through the gardens. It was a sunny, November and it seemed to me that everyone had come out to partake of the lovely weather. We finally snatched two chairs near the water and munched on our delectable dates and figs that we had purchased at the street market earlier, while pursuing the very Parisian pastime of people watching. Fashionable women of all ages were decked out making me think I was underdressed. But that is Paris, people dress to take out the trash. The gardens are truly lovely, with beautiful statues that intrigues one with their history and the ever changing flower beds and massive pots encourage me to return each time i am in Paris. After spending time in the hustle-bustle of Paris I can see why everyone flocks to the parks, it certainly helps the soul to become reacquainted with nature. These city parks are the cities backyards for the people, open and free.

Great picture spots, in addition to neighbourhood attractions. I visited this beatuful garden in a sunny day in May and was luck to see its exuberant flowers. Jardin du Luxembourg seems to be used by local people for running and walking exercises, plus people that work on the Palace where the France senate is located. I'm not sure if it is possible to visit any part of the Palace, anyway you can take photos of the garden, palace from the outside and several statues.You can easily get to Jardin du Luxembourg by metro. I don't remember in what station you should stop, but all stations have metro maps with the location of the main point of interests, which include the Luxembourg. The Pantheon, another interesting tourist attraction, is nearby the Luxembourg and you can actually see it from there. There are several restaurants and fast food restaurant in the area, plus other stores that you can easily explore by wandering the street along Jardin du Luxembourg. So my suggestion is that you go to Jardin du Luxembourg, explore it, relax and of course take several pictures of the statues, birds and the Palace. After that you can have lunch no any cafe or restaurant that just steps way from the exists and finally visit the Pantheon. The area in gerenal is full of people, traffic, maps on some corners indicanting the attrations in the area. You can go around without the need of asking for directions. It's absolutely a pleasant area to spend some time.The entrance is free.
So relaxing. Spend a few hours sitting and watching the kids push their little bateaux from one side to the other - zoo relaxing and such a pleasant walk from one end to the other

Beautiful. After visiting Notre Dame and Pantheon a good relaxation at this Jardin would be perfect.
It has many seating places a nice lake with small boats, a special garden for sleeping and laying down.
winter. since it was winter, there were no flowers except for nicely arranged mums hanging from the walls surrounding the garden

Must visit. You have to walk and see it all, you will definitely find a place that you like and make you spend more time there.
I advise you to Wear your sports shoes and walk, don't forget to take your camera.

music. summer time in is a really relaxing place with "musicien"
nice park and great view to tour montparnasse
very near to sorbonne ect and quartier latin

Beautiful Gardens. Very nice gardens to spend some time in during your visit to Paris! We visited in late Autumn, so missed out on seeing the gardens in full blossom, however, was still very nice.
If the weather is nice and you want a day away from the busy surroundings, take some lunch and a bottle of red and enjoy yourselves!
Nice for a stroll. Nice place to take a walk before or after visiting the Louvre!!!
Wonderful garden ... great kids background. A beautiful garden where Parisiennes love to hang out. There is also a large playground for young kids (which costs a few euros).
Cool spot to see... This was pretty.. nice flowers.. nice place to go sit and enjoy a nice day.. quiet place to think.
Romance.... take your girl/boy here and enjoy this beautiful park!

Peaceful gardens. Go there on a sunny day, seat on a chair and just watch people.
Sometimes outside the jardin on the fences you have pictures and it's worth seeing.
Did you know that not so long ago you had to pay to use the chairs?
Gives a feel of Paris lifestyle and history. The chairs spread around the fountain provide an enjoyable setting to relax and catch the sun rays that you are likely to miss during your other pursuits.

Just watch people. Once u r there all u have to do is watching people. Walking, practicing martial arts.... Yoga... Children s first walks, lovers here and there, people reading books, newspapers magazines of each and every language that comes to ur head. Go and relax

lovely gardens in the middle of the city. "le jardin du luxemburg" is a very nice place especially when it is sunny. The park has lots of public chairs all over and mostly around the pond. It is also a popular place for parisians to relax, read and sunbath. There is also a palace at the middle.It is very close to Pantheon, Sorbonne and Saint Germain Avenue just a few minutes walking distance. It is closed during the nights.

i loved it!. You just have to see it, that's it! But, it says I have to write at least 50 characters:) It is peaceful, and sitting on the chairs and watching the beautiful flowers, statutes, etc is undefinable.

Slow down, take a stroll. Definitely a must go! Very very relaxing in summer, no need for sunblock as the green chairs spawned across the garden were all conveniently hidden under big shady trees. Perfect place to slow down after a busy morning in the bustling city of Paris. :)

A nice place to relax with a pastry. The gardens are very pleasant. It is nice to sit on the green chairs scattered throughout the park and around the fountain, and relax with a nice pastry or a baguette.
liked it a lot. We had a nice walk from city center to Luxembourg Gardens. We liked the garden. Kids liked playing around. We sat there for a while. I definitely recommend it for family with kids.

A great place for a break. Luxembourg Gardens is a really great place for a break. The park is filled with the famous green metal Parisian chairs to sit and people watch or just take a break for awhile. Every summer that I have visited, there are different arrangements of flowers colorfully displayed, great photo opportunities. There is a big octagonal pond in front of the Senate House that houses a few mallard ducks and usually during the day in the summer, there is a toy sailboat rental cart right beside the pond. For around 2-3 euros, children of all ages can enjoy sailing a French wooden sailboat for an hour. Kids and adults have fun sailing the boats with stick around the pond. The wind just pushes the boats around. During the summer, I have also seen donkey rentals for an hour for the children. They are led and walked around the gardens. The children enjoy this experience which the United States does not offer.Despite how busy the Luxembourg Gardens can get with foot traffic, one can always manage to find an empty seat with plenty of the famous green french metal chairs. A very relaxing stop. The views from the Luxembourg Gardens are quite nice as well- the Senate House, Pantheon, and Montparnasse Tower (the tallest building within the Parisian skyline).Very accessible from from Metro stop at Blvd. St. Michel and lots of shopping and restaurant opportunities in the area.
superbe. a must do. just walk around and enjoy the scenery. It is such a parisian garden
Beautiful!. Come sit with a bottle of wine. Great spot to get a little sun and people watch. Well maintained.
Fabulous. So relaxing to just sit back and enjoy with a book or lunch. Beautiful and lovely atmosphere for walks or people watching.
Beautiful gardens!. Check out Luxembourg Gardens. We went on a sunny Saturday afternoon. It's like Central Park in Paris.

A relaxing oasis. Take the time to wander through the Luxembourg gardens. We strolled through on a sunny winter afternoon: enjoy the wide open space, the lake and the stunning architecture. Don't miss the Cezanne exhibition in the museum itself: a fascinating tour through the artist's life.
A lovely parc. Are you in Paris in the summer time, be sure to pay this amazing garden a visit. Bring some food and drinks, find a place in the sun and just relax.
Beautiful Park. Great playground for kids with a clean bathroom. No picnics are allowed on the grassy areas. If you want to do go to Cham de Mars park under the Eiffel tower

Amazing. The most beautiful gardens in Paris, especially during warm weather. It's a really calming atmosphere and great for people watching, just sitting around talking or reading. The flowers are beautiful and you feel removed from the city, so it's a nice place to get away from all of the noise.
A piece of the neighborhood. The living room of the 6th arr.! I love to stay near the gardens and always enjoy walking and people-watching there.

Most beautiful over the tuileries. Right next to the Palace, which was exciting to see the Gendarmes guarding it. Many ponds and picnickers in Nov. and chairs galore to sit and admire the beauty. Great gardeners or landscapers, Kept the color going with chrysanthemums of all colors in large urns and plantings around the statues and ponds. Mini version of Versailles
Walk thru on your way to l'Orangerie. So beautiful even in winter! Worth the walk...especially if you stop at the l'Orangerie.

Better in the spring. A different experience in the fall. Fewer flowers and people. In the spring it is gorgeous and just the place for great photographs. Still it is a wonderful place to visit any time of the year. Hey, it's Paris!
Beautiful place. I liked this place but I would love to go back during spring. I can only imagine what it looks like.
Fantastic Place for a Picnic!. We loved our times in this Jardin....beautiful setting...get a baguette, some cheese and a nice bottle of wine and enjoy!

beautiful gardens. The gardens were opposite our hotel which was very lucky. It was everything you think Paris would be, people sitting in the sun, reading and enjoying the hot days in a beautiful garden.
Art and nature. The Jardin is a beautiful respite from the city; as a researcher into French history, I loved the statues of the French queens and female historic figures.

Lay back and enjoy !. Like in all Paris public gardens, you can sit on chairs that you can move around to take in the sun or hide from it, to put up your legs... it's such a refreshing view to see the locals sit and read a book or fidget with their laptops.... The floral arrangements are so special ! There is an overall atmosphere of decontracted joy and joie de vivre that gets under your skin somehow ! The Fontaine Medicis is a lot more than just a fountain-it's a work of art-the ducks and pigeons in/around it are as friendly as the ones in St James Park in London ! A great way to spend a few hours !

a must see fall beauty. After having a huge snow storm during our fall wedding this place really treated us to the fall we were dreaming of back home. With the trees in full multi color splendor and the huge potted mums its a must see for those traveling during this time of year. would come back again and again... weve even thought it would be a great place to renew vows.. that is if its allowed!!!!

Essential Paris in a Park. Spring bulbs, Summer flower beds, giant pot plants and full green trees, sail model boats on he round pond, watch or join in the petanque (boule), see the Statute of Liberty and other sculptures, see but do not disturb the tables of chess players, find donkey rides and swings for the children. All can be enjoyed here, my favourite place to picnic in Paris. Plenty of fresh markets or supermarkets will provide the picnic, so spend what you save on the evening's restautant visit, whilst you enjoy this quintessentially Parisian jardin.

Great place to relax. I stoped here with my family to have a break in the afternon. We bought some items to eat and stayed there to relax. My little one slept for two hours there while we enjoyed a band that was playing.
Pretty. Nice for a picnic. Lots of people running/exercising, children playing, students studying. Pretty flowers, ducks... Nice.
The perfect place to meet local people.. You can walk along the park. You can visit the botanical gardens. Park chairs or relax on the grass, stretched out your feet...

Beautiful. Make sure you take a camera to capture this place!
I wish we arrived earlier in the day so we could stay longer.
tranquil. Probably my favorite place in Paris. I love to sit, relax, have a coffee and people watch

Visit in the Spring & summer. This is a great little park, but not very much to look at during the late fall and winter months. Much of the park is currently under construction, but should be ready for visitors in the Spring.

A relaxing place to pass the time!. Just after hours of going around making most of our time in Paris, We decided to relax and breath fresh air. We look for this garden and true enough, the place is surprisingly full of trees around the Chateau du Luxembourg. Landscaped garden provided with benches and chairs strategically scattered around. One should not missed this place if you were in the vicinity. Tired aching feet can rest for a while and can even drift you to sleep.

Brilliant, immaculately maintained.. fantastic little spot that served as a rest stop between the Pantheon and our walk back to the hotel. Remote control boats were going on the pond.Very picturesque. Great memories.
Even in November. Even in November this is a lovely park, although not nearly as nice as spring and summer when the flowers are abloom.

Lovely place to walk and sit a while. We walked here and strolled along the gardens to the fountain where there were some seats. The day was very hot so a quick sit down and people watch was very welcome. Then walk along the champs elysee to the Arc de triomphe. Mind the traffic! Fabulous!
A wonderful place to entice the eyes.. This is a beautiful garden in the city. There are always great flowers. The art gallery also has had great shows.
a wonderful garden worth to see it. at least two three hours should be spent definitely.

Beautiful. We went in the middle of the week on a sunny November day near lunch time. It was still pretty busy with locals and tourists sitting in the sun, eating lunch, or talking.
It is very well tended and kept in great condition.
What a beautiful place to relax while in Paris.
Nice place to meander. Wonderful garden and fountain. Great place to walk but also sit to read, relax or watch people. Very French even if many tourists are there too.

Beautiful Garden and Statue of Liberty!. Very beautiful gardens and park area. Nice childrens playground and football pitches, sports areas etc. Places to buy snacks and drinks and the cleanest public toilets I've been to. There was a small fee to use the facilities but well worth it. Makes a nice change to see such a well kept public convenience. Saw one of the Statues of Liberty in the parks too. Its a small brown/bronze version.

Parisians at play. It was a beautiful afternoon for a walk through the park which has several sections, all perfectly maintained. All the seats were taken by people looking for any sun they could get.

Beautiful Gardens! An unexpected gem!. The gardens were beautiful even in the fall and it was a quick walk from here to the Pantheon, which afforded beautiful views of the Eiffel Tower from its steps. This is a charming area and I'm glad I visited it.
Everything is beatiful in the sun.. As with most gardens, on a bright sunshine-day, even in November, they're just great. This is especially beautiful and very well-tended.

relaxed day. We went in with my kids and family. Great place to have a relaxed picnic if you can find the place. There is however just one pastry shop near this garden so make sure you have all your picnic gear ready .

A lovely way to spend a lazy Sunday. On a Sunday the place is alive with sun worshippers, joggers, children playing with boats on the fountain, couples and families having picnics on the lawns. The statues of various historical and mythological personages were also fascinating, and I was surprised to find one of Mary Queen of Scots and Margaret of Anjou, wife of England's Henry VI, the latter being very moving as she clutched her only son. The inscription read "if you do not respect an outlawed queen, respect an unhappy and miserable mother"; this referred of course to the fact that her son was killed at Tewkesbury, England during the War of the Roses. I was surprised to find these personages of English history here, then realised that many were linked to french history too.Just ambling through the jardins, admiring the perfect symmetry of the french style of gardens, and reveling in the joie de vivre and enjoyment of the people there made for a perfect Sunday.
Wonderful place for a walk. One of the best places to give in to the fantasy that you live in Paris... Beautiful place to walk.
What is not to like????. Regardless of the season, time of day, whatever - to walk in the luxembourg is a dream.

Beautiful. Just a very pretty relaxed spot to take a stroll - there were heaps of people in the park doing yoga and exercises. Nice to watch someone else doing some hard work while you just stroll around feeling very chillaxed!

A beautiful respite in a busy city. This park was a 30 second walk from our hotel and we didn't take the time to see it until the day we had to leave. It's the type of park you would imagine to be in the middle of the Latin Quarter. Take some time and unwind at this park and admire the amazing statues. While we were there, they had a giant mum in every urn, it was very beautiful and the attention to detail was fantastic.
Amazing. Never seen so many flowers, such magnificence and find that peace !!!
Beautiful park in Paris. The hidden fountain, close to the senat is a very charming place, especially in summer time
Most Beautiful Public Gardens. Fun people-watching, restful gardens including water.

A true glimpse of Paris. The gardens themselves are worth the time, the statutes and fountains and flowers. But take the time to sit on a bench and people watch and just take it in. The true Paris before your eyes.
Tres Jolie. Beautiful spot to walk around and enjoy the Parisian air. Good for people watching and relaxing. Plan a picnic. Perfect place to relax.

great for people watching. nice gardens though interesting to see the locals in their native habitat. Liked the toy sail boats on the lake and the signed areas where people are allowed to sit on the grass. Have a coffee or glace at the cafe.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful places i visit while in Paris!

Beautiful gardens modelled on the Palazzo Pitti. I like sitting in the sun in a garden chair and reading in the open air. What I don't like is being sollicited by pervers after a mere 15 minutes. Unfortunately, the sitting areas around the fountains are known as pick-up spots. It's fine if that's what you're looking for. it's also a nice place to take kids so that they can rent sale boats and float them in the fountain.

Spectacular!. Each trip to Paris, one should walk the Jardin, stroll the Seine, and wander the left bank. Of course then there are all the great shops and museums too! In the Jardin, do not fall for the gypsy's look I found a ring want to buy it trick! They see you coming and then bend down to pick something up, then show you the ring they found and ask if you dropped it. You say no, and then they try to sell it to you after trying to convince you that it is of high quality gold. Watch you wallet and purses!
Very pretty. Nice place, tranquil and quite large, near Angelina's too.
Restful and Complentative. The time of year was perfect, a chill in the air and the last of the yellow leaves slowly flying in the air.
What a surprise. I don't know what I was expected, but it was beautiful in October. Really enjoyed strolling about.
A great place to relax and have a baguette lunch.. Bring a baguette, some cheese, some meats and sit and have a leisurely lunch in the Gardens. Very beautiful and relaxing.
pretty gardens. nice to walk around. would be lovely in the summer.
Gorgeous. This park is so beautiful. Make sure and take a walk, and bring your camera!
Stroll and enjoy. Try the gardens near the Museum of Natural History for comparison!!
Great place. Pretty much a walk around and look at the fountains and statues and such. I think the best thing is to get up early and join the hundreds of joggers that run around the park every day.
What a lovely place for a walk .. Sights and space . great for families or just those who like to stroll

People-watching galore. One of the best gardens in Paris for people-watching. Beautiful on a warm, sunny day OR cloudy day. You'll get better photos on a partly cloudy day anyway. Take time to sit in a few of the different areas. Each has it's own feeling.
Beautiful Gardens. The Luxembourg Gardens are a lovely escape from the Parisian traffic. Don't miss it.
Great stroll on a nice day....... Flowers were in full bloom when we were there. Combine that with the statues and pond - Beautiful, and its free.

Picnic heaven!. Beautiful and imaginatively designed borders and centrepieces of flowers and shrubs. An abundance of green metal chairs, with 2 choices of angled backs, offering seating in the sun or shade. A lovely lake, entertainment for the children with traditional wooden sailing yachts, a playground, all the usual amenities, including tennis courts to watch the locals display their skills (and perhaps refresh your knowledge of French expletives!). Overall, a great spot to 'watch the world go by' and enjoy your picnic!

An amazing park....what a wonderful place to spend an afternoon!. Aloha!We went to Paris the last 2 weeks of September, during a very hot spell when temperatures in the city reached the mid 80's farenheit - so all of the parks were well frequented with people catching early fall sunshine!This was my first trip to the Jardin du Luxembourg and I have to say it is the epitome of what I think of as the perfect Parisian park! From the lovely flowers to the large pond with the little boats, to the boule players, to the beautiful statuary, this place just stole my heart!We spent about 2 hours wandering around the park, sitting in the sunshine and people watching - I loved every minute of it and certainly plan on going back on our next trip to Paris in 2012!
Great For Lunch. Great gardens, grab a sandwhich and eat in the park..
Take your time for some great people watching. Enjoy lounging in this park and blend in with the locals.

A PLEASANT WALK ABOUT.. In late October the weather was damp and cool. The gardens were past their prime and overall not very impressive compared to many other world class destinations. Good for a walk through for some exercise.

Beyond amazing. The gardens were beyond amazing. This is also a free attraction in Paris. Definitely a must see as well. Beautiful, manicured gardens, amazing fountains and statues. Plenty of benches to sit and take it all in, while enjoying a snack.
Go if you have the time.. If you dont have a lot of time in Paris, you can skip these gardens, as there are better places to visit.
Amazing fountains. The garden is beautiful , unfortunately when we were there all the fountains were turned off , a little surprising for the first week of october
Beautiful. just 2 blocks from the Hotel de l'Abbaye. Perfect for a stroll after breakfast.

The pay to play playground looked fun to me but my girls didn't want to fight the crowds. We visited in mid October so the pony rides were finished for the year and we were never there at the right time for the marionette show. My girls preferred the playground at Tuileries Garden in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens looked like more fun to me but my girls wanted to leave shortly after trying it out.

Beautiful but busy. we wished we could have spent more time at these gardens....so beautiful. the grounds are vast and were filled with people enjoying the sunshine, playing football and chatting. gorgeous place to wander through at your lesiure

Filled with flowers, even in the Fall. Lovely grounds, well maintained with the Palais de Luxembourg in them. Lots of well placed benches, and many large pots with mums in every color....a really nice place for a stroll!
Definitely worth a visit. A lovely park in amongst the city. Well used by Parisians. Great cafe though a bit expensive - remember to take some croissant to feed the ducks!!!
Perfect for everything. Great for taking pics, a nice stroll, loads of seats/benches to just chill out too. For the kids, theres a lots of playing areas (though you do have to pay to use them).

Lovely. Luxembourg Gardens is an exquisite spot in Paris that provides you with a beautiful spot to enjoy the lovely flowers and trees as well as fountains and Parisians. I love watching the children sail boats in the large fountain in front of the Palace and the Parisian gentlemen playing chess and boule. There is also a carousel and ponies that can be found.

Well worth a stroll!. This park is beautifully designed and features well-manicured plants and flowers. Walking around the perimeter, you see statues of famous women in French history as well as other sculptures. Chairs are placed throughout to encourage you to sit and rest or read a while.

Don't Miss...especially with a bottle of wine. We visited this park at the end of several days to unwind, relax and enjoy some wine. There is a wine shop right near the entrance and the garden is beautiful.
wide open and dirty. sparse flowers , lots of screaming kids and a fair amount of litter--do i need to go to paris to see this ?
A day in the park.. It is so nice to find a tranquil place in any big city...

Great break for the kids.. This is a lovely big park with plenty of space. There is a big playground costing 2,50e per child, but it well worth a visit. After walking round Paris this was a great break for the kids to be kids. There are toilets and a cafe nearby.

Very relaxing and beautiful. This park is really amazing and so relaxing. It is in a very central location so it is possible to just drop by for a break from the exhausting sightseeing in Paris. There are nice buildings around, a nice pool, a huge green area, pretty flowers, trees and many benches& chairs to sit and enjoy the time. We stopped here, with our wine, cheese and bouquets and planned to stay only half an hour as we had a lot to see in the city but after one hour we hardly found the will to leave the place. Luxembourg Gardens is huge and it is nice for just sitting and relaxing, walking around in different parts or just watching the nature .

Wonderful park to stroll during autumn and spring. Appreciate different varieties of trees and shades of autumn. Friendly pigeons are everywhere just to amuse you. Security is quite good. Many cafes around and art shops.
Great gardens. Very well treated gardens where you have some chairs where you can seat and relax by the fountains... We lunched there on the mid-day sun and fall asleep after...

Live the Parisian way. The Luxembourg Gardens is Paris' family room. Come to see how the Parisians spend their leisure time in the City. Sailing model sailboats, reading in the sun, playing chess: it all happens here. And just a few blocks north are the great shopping streets of the Left Bank.
Free garden in the heart of the city. Beautiful garden in the heart of the city, if you get tired take a rest there.
Nice. Beautiful grounds, great to take a baguette, some cheese and a blanket and watch all of the fashionable Parisians go by.
amazing gardens. must go place with beautiful gardens and very nice scene
nice huge park. ...just like Dassin's song, a lot of kids playing in the park, some lovers kissing and me...well im am alone LOL !

Beautiful!. I've being in Paris 2 times. On the first I didn't go to the gardens and now I can tell you that you have to add this to your itinerary.Its amazing how you're transported to another place. You can't even hear the street noise. The gardens are well kept and beautiful and the Palais with the fountains give you great views. You can buy your lunch and then go eat here like may Parisians do every day.Admission is free.

Great for a picnic and day outside. Gorgeous scenery and trails. Hiked around the Gardens with my wife on our honeymoon. Took in the sights around the park with a coffee. Great for spending some time outdoors in Paris.

A neighborhood favorite. I've been to Paris 4 times before and this is the first time I explored this garden. It seems to be popular among locals and families. Grab a kindly supplied metal armchair and watch the passersby.
A great walk in the park. This is a great place to walk, sit, picnic, people watch. Just lovely.

A perfect afternoon. Get your picnic supplies, walk deep into the park and sit. It's just the most perfect way to spend an afternoon and I do mean the entire afternoon. Don't be in a rush to check out this gem of a park. The chess games, the art students, the lovers... it's all a part of a perfect Sunday in Paris.

Simply a must see. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a definite must see. Everytime you walk through it, try a different path or route, and its as if you're walking through it for the first time and discovering a hidden treasure. A great place to either read or grab a baguette and some Camembert to have a picnic.
Beautiful park. This is a lovely park and well used so do not expect tranquillity, so many things going on for all ages from little go carts for the kids to chess for the husbands!!
No words. So beautiful place, can't imagine that someone really lived there..

My new happy place. This garden in the midst of the left bank is a beautiful place to take some time and relax. My wife and I sat by the pool eating pastries. There are surprising sculptures to be found throughout the garden. We also enjoyed watching and listening to the local French children at play. Beautiful.

The most peaceful place in Paris - a must see!. When planning our trip, we weren't sure if we were going to stop at Luxembourg Gardens or not, and we are so glad we did! It was an unbelievablty beautiful and peaceful little Eden in the middle of the city - and was probably the best afternoon we had while in Paris. The ambience is perfect: children playing with boats in the water, people relaxed on lounge chairs and sitting on benches. We brought Orangina and chocolates and just took in the splendor. An absolute must for any Paris trip!
Too dusty. Sand is flying there and not so many trees as I expected to see
also in autumn. A bit of sun, also in October, is enough to enjoy this park.

Tale of two Parks. Passed by at lunchtime and could not find a place to sit - pretty incredible considering the size. Passed through at 9:30 the next day and hardly saw anyone. Both interesting experiences.

Eden in Paris. It was shocking to see so much beauty as well as work. After a pleasant and amusing trip on a bus through one of the most elegant neighbourhoods in Paris, we arrived at the "Jardin".We were really impressed by the view. Every corner has a different picture, ideal to walk or just to relax.The gardens show, knowledge, planning, art and team work. Don´t miss them !!
Formerly beautiful. Even though well kept, the gardens are not a match to thigs you can see elswhere around the world
beautiful. A great place to sit and enjoy the beautiful flowers.

Prettiest gardens in Paris. With a less austere style and more variety of trees this was a beautiful park to wander. We were here in October, so the leaves were turning but the grass was still Emerald green.

The BEST garden we visited -- and that INCLUDES Versailles!. We visited Jardin du Luxembourg on a spectacularly beautiful autumn Saturday afternoon and the place was packed with Parisians and tourists alike, soaking up the sun.Unlike many of the gardens in Paris, this one is packed with gorgeous floral displays! The geraniums, dahlias and mums were just beautiful.The highlight for this visit though was a sing along at the gazebo. There was a small musical group and about 300 Parisians singing traditional French songs, one after another for most of the afternoon. Truly a real treat.The gardens feature lavatories (bring 40 cents) and a couple of places you can buy food/beverages.

Take your time and sit and smell the flowers.. Great little cafes to buy lunch and sit and watch the people pass buy. Was there in Spring this year and the flowers were amazing and people everywhere enjoying the sunshine,
Ah, the Ghosts!. In Luxembourg one walks with the Ghosts of the Greats: Hemingway, Fitzgerald, Stein, et. al.!
Princely gardens. Great for walks, to sunbathe, and to relax watching people.

Great Garden. Every year we visit the Luxembourg Gardens it never disappoints. It's always beautiful, lot's of color. This fall the Geraniums were just Great and this year they used large bloom yellow Marigolds and they were also great. Don't miss it.

The sailing boats on the lake are a wonderful tradition.. Beutiful gardens and the palace is awesome. Visiting the castle is fairly restricted so ensure that you check times. The lake with the toy sailing boats is a wonderful tradition between parent and child. It is also very close to the Pantheon and the Sorbonne.

Beautiful & must-see if you have free time.. The Jardin du Luxembourg, or the Luxembourg Gardens is a very beautiful garden. Its huge, clean & peaceful. Visit it if you have free time or you just want to laze around.

Lovely spot to relax and take in the natural wonders of Paris!. Luxembourg Gardens were a delight! Beautifully landscaped and peaceful within a short walk to Notre Dame and Isle St. Louis. Great place to sit, relax and take a break from sight seeing. The flowers and fountains are amazing and the restaurant is a good choice for lunch or just to enjoy the surroundings over a glass of wine or cup of coffee.
Lovely Paris Autumn day. A warm day for a stroll in the garden, nice to look at the gardens and water features and draw in the Parisien experience

WAIT UNTIL LATE AFTERNOON, THEN ENJOY THIS REMARKABLE GARDEN. While during our most recent trip to Paris, we decided to re-visit the Luxembourg Gardens, always on our to-do list while visitng the City of Lights. We decided to stop by during several times of the day to determine if there was indeed a "better time to visit" these beautiful gardens decreed by Napoleon to be dedicated to children. After several visits we determined that the late afternoon was the best time for several reasons. Most importantly, the late afternoon sun bathed everything in the most beautiful, photographable golden light. No matter where you set our eyes, the earlier harsh white light of noon was turned into a soothing and tranquil glow. Secondly, it seemed that more families were present with their children floating boats in the main fountains, or just enjoying the late afternoon sun reading, or enjoying a good conversation. But be aware that the park closes down just before sunset in the summer, 7:30, so take advantage of this remarkable garden and get there early, 4 or 5, and relax, and enjoy that golden glow.

Feel like a Parisian!. Stroll through the gardens on a Sunday in any season - there were people strolling, arm-in-arm, even on a gray, drizzly day. Don't hurry through on your way to the next sight - take the time to walk slowly, look at the sculptures, let the sound of conversations wash over you - even better if you have a jambon beurre sandwich in hand! Beautiful gardens, walking paths...

A great place for a picnic. We grabbed baguette, cheese and ham on Mouffetard and made our own picnic here. I was amazed at the free admission and how beautiful, even in mid-october this place is. Don't miss it! It's huge and a bit overwhelming but just take your time and cover as much as you can.

Lunch in the park.. We bought our stuff at an open air market (a real treat and a must in Paris or France) and sat on a bench in the garden. A beautiful setting with a lake for little sailboats. Good place to relax and plan your next hectic venture.
so beautiful. Beautiful any time of year well worth a visit. The layout of the flower beds and the colour schemes are inspirational. perfect for a romantic stroll too.
Overrated. Smaller than we expected and not as good as the Jardin des Plantes.
Idyllic. A quiet and peaceful area of Paris full of chestnut trees to shade you from the sun. Very popular with students and lecturers

Beatiful!. Perfect place to go for a stroll. Just sit x 10 minutes on one of the benches and observe parisians walking (or running) by. The gardens are perfectly kept, there's plenty of explanation panels around. The area is one of if not THE nicest in Paris.

We can learn something from the French. In large cities public parks are important. In Paris we noticed that instead of a lot of benches Luxembourg Gardens had chairs that people could move to sit as they wanted in groups. Simple thing that seemed to promote a lot of human interaction.

Perfection in an urban park. The Luxembourg is a great example of a highly used beautiful urban park, with features and activities for all ages and interests. Sunbathing, to miniature boats, to kid's playgrounds, tennis, chess, qi-gong, statue gazing, jogging, reading, observing bees or well-pruned fruit trees. Though classically 'formal' in its landscape design, the flower beds never cease to amaze me in their year-on-year variety and the amazing amount of gardening effort invested.

Be there in early. Parisians love Jardin du Luxembourg. Therefore - go early - and not in the weekends! Bring with you some food, tea, coffee and a good book and a newspaper. Go the whole circle and study all the French statues of saints and queens. Maria de Medici´s fountain! But when the fountain was finished, she was banned.
A must see!. Beautiful setting. We never miss an opportunity to sit on the grass, have a glass of wine and soak in the atmosphere.

An OK Park. Good sized park with specific areas for specific activities. There is even a designated area for playing checkers and chess!!! Lots of gravel walking areas with lots of gravel dust in the air. Nothing special in our opinions.

Best central garden in Paris. This is one of the last few big gardens in the center of Paris, but what a place! You can easily spend a day here: footing in the early morning (lots of firemen from the nearby brigades on Sunday mornings), a tennis afterwards, some chess playing with players from every ranking, museum browsing (temporary exhibits of high quality, unfortunately often with a hefty charge), people watching while sunbathing... Even botanists will be pleased, as this has one of the largest & most varied apple trees collection in the world.Only drawback: food options within the park are poor value and not very interesting. Also keep in mind that the closing hour is quite flexible (depending on sunset)

Green and gorgeous. This large and lovely garden on the Left Bank just south of St. Sulpice is a wonderful place to stroll on a sunny day. Beautiful flowers, plus a great playground, if you happen to be there with small children. A nice spot for taking a break from the busy boulevards and crowded museums.

Georgeous walk - sculptures and gardens. I love walking here when I first arrive in Paris. I always stay in the Latin quarter and a good long walk after flying the red eye wakes you and at the same time relaxes you. It is so pleasurable to explore the nooks with fountains, with people clustered around sitting on chairs, soaking up the scenery and reading their books.We went in September and flowers were still in full bloom. But I love going here any time of year.Metro to get there - RER B to LuxembourgAfter your walk, enjoy a pastry at Le Rostand but be careful about the drinks - they cost as much as the desserts.

Best things in life are for free... this is one of them.. Ideal spot if you want to getaway from the city yet remain close enough. It's next to Latin Quarter, so it's very accessible, yet so serene and quite. Lovely landscaping... almost heavenly. If you're into tennis, bring your gear.. they have great clay courts. Or you can just sit and watch. Some of the players are really good, especially the youngsters.

A Must See. After seeing many of the popular, busy tourist attractions it was wonderful to experience the relaxing, peaceful Luxembourg Gardens. We bought some rolls and sat near the fountain and enjoyed our picnic lunch. There is a beautiful palace which is now used as a senate so it is not open to visitors. Many people enjoy the gardens to sit and soak up the sun, or go for a jog. There was even a fenced area with a small pool for toddlers to paddle in.

Beautiful Gardens & Palace. If you're looking for a brief respite from the hustle and bustle of touring Paris, this palace and garden is a spectacular place! My sister, friends and I did just that one day after returning from Monmartre, then St. Germain des Pres. It had been a long day and we were all tired but not quite ready to settle into our hotel room just yet. It was early evening and the trees in Paris are already changing color. Nightfall isn't till after 9 p.m. this time of year. There are beautiful gardens, flora and fauna, sculptures and fountains and many Parisians go there to relax, read or jog and best of all, it's free!

A wonderful surprise. At another attraction, someone asked our tour guide "If you only had time to visit one of the gardens, which would you choose?" The tour guide recommended Luxembourg Gardens, and so we made it a point to visit here. So glad we did. Perhaps because we had no expectations, we were surprised by how beautiful and peaceful this place was. Lots of joggers, people reading, small yoga groups, etc. I wouldn't necessarily put this at the top of the list of things to see in Paris, but after you've done the major things, you will have earned the relaxation that these gardens provide. Extremely picturesque and close to the Pantheon.Interestingly, Luxembourg Palace houses the French Senate, which explains two otherwise curious things about the gardens: the guards that are marching about, and the abrupt and serious closing time when the guards shepherd all the visitors out of the park.

How to be Parisian. Hang out here - repeat until you are Parisian! I like to eat pastries there on the grass with my husband after a long day of brocante shopping and just say goodnight to the city. Also, I like to come back when I wake up and run there. My last visit I got to run with the Pompiers ( extremely attractive young firemen) and it was the highlight of my trip! This is just a lovely place to relax and enjoy the city.

Respite for friend-hungry traveling kids!. Gorgeous spot, serene and calm and very very pretty with a kaleidoscope of floral color, but best of all was the kids adventure playground where my daughter hammered herself for 3 hrs straight, making friends with about 5 other English speaking kids and having a ball. When you're traveling with kids it's hard for them to just be kids, so the lux garden playground was a fantastic reprieve where our kid kicked off her shoes and ran amok in childish glee until she was a sweaty, dirty, shoeless ball of filth! Perfect! 2Euros very well spent.

Grab a chair with arms! People watch! Enjoy the sun.. Luxembourg GardenThis beautiful park is a popluar place for Parisians, a magnificent, peaceful 25-hectare green oasis on Paris Left Bank. The formal gardens are populated with many statues , fountains and beautiful flowers. In the southwest corner, there is an orchard where several hundred species of apple and pear trees blossom each spring. Children love the park, too especially the little boats they can rent . They push the little boats around with a stick and sail them in the beautiful ponds. Always lots of people sunning themselves on chairs (apparently most people try and grab a chair with arms, it's a status thing!) The huge grounds are wonderful for walking, sunbaking, there are lots of students, chess aficionados, people playing games of boules, and tennis players. A must visit place in Paris to get away from the crowds.

Wonderful place to relax. We liked this garden so much we came back twice!! This beautiful place was constantly filled with people from old mean playing chess, to sunbathers, and children sailing boats in he fountain. Though there were quite a number of visitors, the park is big enough for everyone to have their own personal space (and then some) and it has these awesome chairs that were scattered around for the public as well. We used it for an hour or two in between our tourist stops and it was great just to relax, have a bite and people watch(my boyfriend even took a nap!).

Beautiful, quiet spot in Paris. I really enjoyed the Luxembourg gardens. There are lots of restaurants in the streets nearby as well. The gardens close at sunset (guards will hurry you out), so plan accordingly. I thought the gardens were much prettier (more color & flowers) than the tuleries in front of the Louvre. Make a stop here and kick your feet up after all the crowds & Paris sightseeing.
Spectacular in June. We spent most of a day hanging out inthe Gardens. What a delight. The people watching is fantastic and the grounds, gardens and fountains are spectacular. Don't miss it!

nothing to write home about. uninspiring.. the gardens are ... nice.and that's it. it's nice to visit if you are in the neighborhood, and want some time off, but I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to see it. The place looks pale in comparison to most city parks I visited.

A Beautiful Place To Relax...but watch out for falling conkers!. We've only been in Paris 3 days yet already we've found ourselves in the Jardin du Luxembourg twice. It is the perfect antidote to the hustle and bustle of Parisian life..where you can pull up on of the hundreds of metal chairs, sit back and watch the world and the beautiful people pass by or perhaps, if you're lucky, take in a game of Longe Paume (a version of Real Tennis) which keptnus entertained for an hour withoutnever quite working out what the rules were. Throw in a live swing band and excelent ice cream...what more could you want to relax. Be warned though, if you're going sit under the many horse chestnut trees at this time of year, beware of falling conkers....they hurt!

If you have kids, the PLAYGROUND is a must!. This Jardin has a fantastic playground! On the southwest end of the Jardin, the playground was a welcome relief for our 8 and 10 year olds after days of sightseeing. If you ask them what they loved about Paris, they will say the Zip Line at the park! They were literally on that thing for 3 hours straight. They also loved climbing the Eiffel Tower made of rope. There were lots of Americans there so our kids were able to make some friends. There are many jungle gyms, 2 spinning contraptions and sections for toddlers. Warning: There is no supervision at this playground and some of the equipment is dangerous. We saw several children get thrown off the spinners.The playground has plenty of shade so it's tolerable even in the heat of August. There are tiny bathrooms which were clean for park standards, and a small concession stand selling beverages and candy. There's a small entrance fee: EUR2 for kids, EUR1 for adults. Many parents chose to stay outside (adding to the lack of supervision).Right outside the playground is a long strip where kids ages 3-12 can ride pedal cars for a small fee.Our kids loved the playground so much that we went back 2 more afternoons. The museums can wait till they're older. For this trip, we just enjoyed watching them have a great time at a beautiful Parisian park.

A Haven of Peace in the Bustle of Paris. These gardens are truly magnificent and not just in Spring and Summer when all the flowers are out and the weather is great. It is the perfect spot to find a chair in which to doze or, to take a walk, read, watch the passersby, listen to a performance, have a picnic lunch and just enjoy the sensation of well-established trees, gardens and space, framed by beautiful buildings, in the midst of a historical and famous area of Paris. It is especially popular with working Parisians and families and of course, visitors to Paris. The Sorbonne is nearby, along with other historic attractions. The Musée du Luxembourg is part of the Palais where the Ministry of Culture and Senate are domiciled. Check the temporary exhibition program as there are occasional gems. Sometimes, the iron railings of the park are used for exhibitions and displays and so there is always something of interest. One of our fave activities on a nice Parisian day is to get together a basket with some fresh bread from one of our preferred boulangeries; some tomatoes, ham, cheese, lettuce and apples or pears from Monoprix/Monop and along with some mineral water, enjoy a leisurely lunch in the gardens, where there are many locations from which to choose.
Beautiful Gardens. A wonderful respite from the busy Paris streets. Gorgeous flowers. Worth a visit whether you just walk through or relax with a picnic lunch.
Not to be missed.. If you love gardens then you will most certainly love this one. Such a beautiful part of Paris and a wonderful break from the busy world outside.

Gorgeous park - great for kids. This delightful park is a wonderful place to visit and a real highlight is renting the small sailing boats to push around the small pond. It's beautiful to walk around and when we visited the flowerbeds were in full bloom.

Loved Jardin du Luxembourg it is amazing!. Its a beautiful park in the heart of the latin quarter and just lovely. Their is a huge pond where children rent boats to float on the water, they push them with sticks. Flowers everywhere and lovely statues to ponder. Its so peaceful even with people present that you don't want to leave. We walked around to the back area and found many things for our children ages 5 and 8 to do. They have an amazing playground with things to climb, ropes to swing from and sand to play in. The area is covered with trees, benches and is fully fenced. You pay 10 euros for a family of four but its so worth it, to me that wasn't even expensive. They several water pumps for washing hands and feet and bathrooms too. Overall our family thought this park was to die for and wished we had one in Texas where we live. Pack a sandwich or just buy one outside the gates across the street from Brioche Doree and have a picnic. Its a must see for anyone but especially grand for families!!
Great gardens, a good place to relax. When we went there was an orchestral band set up playing contemporary music, which was cool. The grounds themselves are beautiful, a great place to just relax.

The shhhhh of shuffling shoes and the mmmmm of mummering voices always put us in a peaceful dose.. You get the impression that this is how it was one hundred years ago (but you would be wrong, of course). Kids today riding on the old fashioned Merry-Go-Round and attempting to catch brass rings with their sticks will have the same warm memories that other generations experience. Then there's the concerts, bolles games, foot-peddled go-carts, statues, flowers, bee hives... it is all wonderful, but what we could not resist was repeated visits to the sunken area in front of the Palace, around the boat pond. Parisians talk quietly in public, and no bikes, radios, etc., blare, we couldn't even hear cars, and we ourselves sunk into serenity. We'd dose in chairs, so have a tich of vino, bread and cheese. It's a wondrous place... wish I was there now and I hope you enjoy it.

Allow yourself a chance to relax here!. While on holiday many of us run from sight to sight in the hope of seeing everything, but one of the nicest parts of my recent Paris vacation was time spent in the Luxembourg Gardens devouring Pierre Herme macaroons! Watch the boats on the fountain, view the Palace (now the French Senate), the amazing sculptures, and then sit down on one of the many benches and seats and have a break. There is a McDonalds nearby and I saw a lot of Parisians bringing McDonalds into the park for lunch, so perhaps do as the French do in this case!

Perfect city park - relaxing and very beautiful. Great place to relax with kids, or just go read a book in the numerous chairs provided gratis around the park. We purchased some cheese, pate, French bread, and fruit from vendors just outside the park and had a memorable picnic in the shadows of the Medici Chateaux. The kids loved the playground and swings.

Picnic in this PARK!. Wow, it is beautiful, the place to have your bread, cheese and wine, romantic, quiet and charming! Lovely for a stroll, sit and relax and wonderful photo ops...a wonderful Haven!!!!

Jardin du Luxembourg...simply the most perfect Parisian Park for all ages!!. Jardin de Luxembourg (Luxembourg Gardens) is located within the 6th district and is the 2nd largest public park in Paris. The park also houses the French Senate, located on the park grounds within the Luxembourg Palace. This park has quite an interesting history. In 1611, Marie de Medicis, the widow of Henry IV, commissioned to have this imitation of the Pitti Palace built as a tribute to her native Florence, Italy.The calm atmosphere of the park is what I find most appealing. The park itself contains over one hundred public sculptures and works of art, in addition to breathtaking and picturesque gardens. On any given day, visitors will have an assortment of activities to partake in. The gardens include a fenced in play ground, a toddler pool, tennis courts, and plenty of seating throughout all of the park grounds. For young children there are small sailboat rentals and antique toy cars to ride. In addition, there are often free musical performances in the gazebo and art exhibitions in l' Orangerie and within the small gallery building. There is also a small quaint cafe, with indoor and outdoor seating available. What you will find most frequently are people sitting back with friends and family...sharing stories of life and love while drinking wine and snacking on baguettes.A simple yet fulfilling experience that you will not regret...just sit back and enjoy.

Must see!!!. This was my wifes favourite Paris attraction and we saw just about everything over 8 days. The gardens are free to visit and are maintained beautifully. Definitely bring a camera as there are many great picture opportunities. Great for both couples and families alike.

A break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Our first visit to Paris - my college-aged daughter and I started out walking towards Rue St. Germaine from the Bon Marche area, or so we thought. We ended up at the gate to the park and peering through at the beautiful gardens, thought we should take a look. We wandered into a refuge of quiet beauty - I immediately knew this must be the Luxembourg Gardens I had read about. To our right was the Medici Palace - grand in every way and to the front (or back) of it was a walkway filled with various flowers and statues. We continued up the path and came to a fountain and statue which we read was the Medici Fountain. The magnificent trees gave much needed shade from the sun and benches along the path offered a peaceful resting spot. Towards the middle of the area was a large, round, shallow pool where we watched children leading small sailboats around. At the end of the garden area were tall, pine-like trees lining a path out to another gate. We saw small cafe areas to the side which led to a concert area where we heard an American high school group playing jazz. I think they were called "American Music Abroad." This garden offered many things for people to enjoy and we had hoped to return before leaving but did not get the time. I am very glad we stumbled upon it as it turned out to be one of our favorite spots in Paris!

Serenity in the heart of the city. Calm atmosphere provide a retreat from city tumult. It has a nice routs to go around and enjoy the pond and the lovely horticulture. Whenever needed a kiosk or café are available for snack or drink. It provide resting area and can be nice place for spending some time and arrange a picnic. If you like sport or have little kids it the place to go when in Paris.

An inviting oasis in the Left Bank. After visiting the Pantheon with my kids, I texted my wife and asked her to meet us as the Luxembourg Garden at the octagonal pool as this a mutually convenient place to regroup. We ended up just hanging around for a while because it was so pleasant.There are perhaps hundreds of tasteful and comfortable green metal chairs available. Paris not only encourages walking, but also just sitting.This would probably be an excellent place to bring lunch.

Luxembourg Gardens - A Living Tapestry of Parisian Lif. Whenever my wife and I come to Paris, we always make it a point to spend at least one afternoon in the city's Luxembourg Gardens, the Sixth Arrondissement oasis of peace. Over the past twenty years of our visit there, we continue to be enthralled by the rich tapestry of Parisian life, of past, present and a hint of the future, strands of human existence that are woven together as in a fine Aubusson or Gobelins.The past so elegantly reflected in the stately and commanding Luxembourg Palace, the impressive Fountain of the Medicis, the Orangerie, the ancient trees, the stately, formal gardens, the statuary, the gravel-paved paths that enwomb the site. So palpable and intense is the history of the park that one can all but breathe the presence, almost reach out and touch the lives of those who once so elegantly trod here ... the wealthy, the estated, the powerful of Parisian society. The reincarnation of centuries past, of simple and unfettered lifestyles so long ago gone yet increasing, nostalgically yearned for are one of the Gardens' mystical, spiritual, arcane yet sense-arousing draws.The future hinted at with the growing incursion of technology, of cell phones and Ipods, of PCs and Nooks in this most peaceful of Parisian paradises.But it is in the present, in the people who stroll and play here, who laze and nod and nap, who paint and write, who muse and converse, picnic and play here amid the all-enwombing, all-entombing pervasive ambiance of peace that draw my wife back, year after year, to revel in the diversity of races, ethnicities and cultures that co-mingle and, while remaining separate, somehow homogenize into a cohesive and living whole for the few hours spent together in the quietude of the gardens, the silence of contemplation beneath a warm and unctuous Parisian sun punctuated now and again by the gleeful laughter of children sailing their little boats on the Garden's expansive lake, by their wailing cries when they stumble and fall on the park' s gravelly paths, For utter peace, for a place of immersion into self and self-thought, one cannot do better than to spend some time in the Luxembourg Gardens. Pull up a wrought iron chair or two (as so many visitor do, the second chair to prop up one's extended legs) and sit back, relax, listen to your heart beat, feel your life force course through you veins, let the aura of the Gardens absorb your being and, when at last you are compelled to leave this Parisian oasis, go forward from this place of beauty refurbished and relaxed. The self-healing and rejuvenation that one can find here, free as the Parisian breezes that swirl and lift their dust devils above the garden's blooms, are more physically, psychically and spiritually soothing that are the massages and mud baths that lie in wait beyond the Gardens' gates at the city's most illustrious (and expensive) spas.Ah, Luxembourg Gardens. Come and rediscover yourself. It is well worth the time spent here and it just might become, for you, a special place that touches and changes your life.

Such a beautiful place - I wish we had longer. We stumbled across this place on our last day, and I am so disappointed that we didn't find it sooner, because for me this was the first place that I really felt the famous Parisian atmosphere everyone raves about. I wish we had more time to properly explore the gardens, take a picnic, and relax with a bottle of wine and a book. It was beautiful. if you want some time out to relax from the frantic sightseeing pace, this is definitely the place to do it.
Always a pleasant interlude. relax have lunch, walk on. we go here for 1-2 hours every time in Paris. great for a bag lunch or to just relax. near St Sulpice, St. Gervais, the Parthenon.

Perfect for spending a relaxing afternoon. The Luxembourg Gardens are one of my favorite open park spaces anywhere, sprawling lawns, beautiful statues, and tranquil water features, make for a relaxing visit any time. On any trip to Paris plan a day to relax in the garden, and if you can't spare a whole day at least take an afternoon break with ice cream cone in hand to stroll through!

An Oasis in the City. This is a spectacular garden with beautiful sculptures. a lake, tree covered sitting area and the massive Luxembourg Palace. There are locals and tourists enjoying a bit of sunshine and relaxation as a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city beyond it's gates. There is a tree covered area for relief from the sun, a shelter for entertainers and refreshment stands. I was there on a day when a couple on stilts was entertaining the crowd with a live band playing under the shelter! What a great place to spend some time away from the indoor tourist attractions in Paris! Springtime in Paris is blooming and this is where you should be!!

Lounge like a rockstar. Who would have thought that you could relax like you're at the beach in Paris? My wife and I came here shortyly after stepping off the Eurostar and were immediatley impressed. We were staying in the Latin Quarter and the Gardens were just a short walk away. I don't know what it is, but as soon as we stepped foot throught the gates I just felt a wave of laid back relaxation take over me. There was a latin band playing music under the trees. When you get to the common area, there is a big pond with water fountain Surrounded by a giant gravel ring and then grass of course that makes up the park. There lawn chairs everywhere. We found a couple of chairs and just camped out. People were sunbathing on the grass, lounging on the other chairs and taking pictures with the fountain. There's a nice building surrounded with pots of flowers and statues providing a cool backdrop. Along the building their is a huge path that runners were going up and down.I have to say, back here in America, the park would be filled with people wearing clothes like tank tops, printed tees, cargo shorts and flip flops. At this park (and in Paris in general) people are dressed much nicer. I could take pictures all over the park and submit them to a fashion magazine. I felt like I was in the middle of one of those Ralph Lauren commercials or something. The weather was perfect too. 70 degrees(in May) and really quite comfortable. It's a place where you just want to come and lounge. Like starbucks...but not.

Stunning gardens!. We really enjoyed our visit to the Jardin du Luxembourg. Even going on a sunny saturday morning it was relatively quiet and those people who were there seemed to be mostly parisians, rather than tourists. The park is beautiful. Lovely flowers, a large pond, where people were sailing boats, plenty of benches and chairs, lovely green grass, where so many people were sitting having picnics, and a gorgeous house at the top of the gardens. It's very picturesque.Entry to the gardens is free and if we ever go back to Paris and the weather is nice, then we will certainly head here for a picnic and just spend some time enjoying life and people watching.I'd highly recommend this for couples, families or just those who like nice scenery and want to sok up the local atmosphere.

Stumbled Upon!. This is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been to!My boyfriend and I travelled spontaneously to Paris last year, and whilst seeing the sights, discovered this park totally out of the blue!It is a lovely place to just sit, people watch, picnic or whatever you choose to do.Definitely a place to visit, even on very short trips!

Beautiful gardens. The gardens are set out beautifully, they are up-kept fantastically by the staff, the park is wonderfully clean at all times and there are always people there enjoying themselves.The gardens are a must see when in Paris, especially on a nice day.

Jardin du Luxembourg is truely a gem!. It is such a nice, quite haven - which is a pleasure to enjoy during a hectic day. I was spending the day in St.Germain des Prey - and spent a large part of my afternoon here just sitting around the fountain. I had been walking all over (also the Pantheon and St.Sulphice which are close to the Luxembourg Gardens) and my feet were killing me. This was such a nice, lovely, quite place to just relax - even watching the little kids playing with the boats in the pool by the fountain was so relaxing. I love the way Paris parks have all these comfortable chairs placed in great locations for tourists to just sit down and chill!

When in Paris.... If the sun is shining and you get fed up with the tourist areas and fancy spending the day like a Parisien, pop into Jardin du Luxembourg, and enjoy the games, the scenery, the greenery and the atmosphere. Its a gem of a place away from the throng.

Gardens to enjoy. Our trip was so hectic that we needed to do some things to relax and enjoy some greenery. Luxembourg Gardens seemed ideal especially as we would also be able to take in a replica of the Statue of Liberty.There is a children's playground but there is a charge which angered some of the locals who turned up and shrieked 'capitalists' and then something unsavoury in French.It is a big 60 acres park, a beautiful stroll on a summers day with wide walkways, statues to enjoy, places to seat, picnic. You will see men playing chess and there was a small building holding an art exhibition.The kids still managed to have a runaround before we headed off to the Pantheon.

The best advice I got.... The best advice I got before my recent trip to Paris was this: get some cheese, a baguette, and some wine, head to a park, and enjoy a picnic and a calmer pace of life. That is exactly what we did our first day there! We took a stroll down Rue Mouffetard, as it was close to our hotel, found a bakery, a wine store, and a cheese shop (which you can easily do no matter where you wander in Paris). We made our selections based on what looked good since we don't speak much french (it's hard to go wrong in the food dept. when in Paris) and then walked to Luxembourg Gardens and enjoyed our little picnic. The gardens were beautiful, the food was great, and it was nice to see lots of locals doing the same thing we were! The park is quiet and calm and just lovely. Our stop at Luxembourg Gardens was a really great way to get over our jetlag and get adjusted to the pace of things in Paris. Highly recommend!

Paris Left Bank Luxembourg Suite, Apartment in Paris, this was perfect.. This is the first time we have tried a short term apartment rental and it was great. It was half the cost as we would have needed two rooms and the owners (foreign correspondent and french lawyer) were lovely and very professional. The location was wonderful for our family (we have 2 small children). Since it was next to Luxembourg Gardens, we could go to the park every afternoon. The apartment was clean and well-maintained, and is a very short walk from the Vavin and Notre Dames Des Champs Metro stops -- so it was easy to get to anywhere. There is a market and bakery within a 2 minute walk, so we were able to get groceries very easily. I would definitely recommend this suite to anyone -- look it up: Paris Left Bank Luxembourg Suite on Google. David and Carol San Francisco.

Spacious, quiet and relaxing. Very close to many attractions, these gardens will make feel relaxing, in the center of Paris. Take your time and visit them... I recommend to compine this visit with Pantheon and an ice-cream from Amorino...or with a walk to Saint Germain, watching the windows!

I loved Jardin du Luxembourg. I know this is not a priority for most people, but me whenever I visit a European capital, I always leave some space on my itenerary to visit a couple of gardens and/or parks. I visited Paris for first time for a couple of weeks end of November/start December, and although I know this is not ideal time in terms of weather, I enjoyed my trip a lot !!!Jardin du Luxembourg was lovely even at this time of the year. Plenty of metal chairs to sit, some tables with chess on them to play if you wished too ( I saw many locals doing exactly that!), 5-6 tennis courts, a museum hosting interesting exibitions on one side, nice plantation, a lovely pond and a large fountain and many many interesting statues are to be found here. People were doing their daily rituals, that been playing pentacle,walking, jogging or practice t'hai tsi and many people, locals and visitors alike were just seating and sleeping, reading a book, or just enjoying their surroundings. There is a metro next to the gardens, and Pantheon is 2 minutes walk away. If you wish to, you can quite easy walk to St Germain, St Sulpice and St Michel areas too.

Jardin de Luxembourg is a hidden gem in Paris. On my first trip to Paris, there were so many famous things that I wanted to see, but one that was not on my 'had to see' list was Luxembourg Gardens as I wasn't as familiar with it. However, I would absolutely recommend visiting it. It is hidden in a very nice residential area and if I hadn't been looking for it, I might not have found it. It is made up of 60 acres and is Paris' most popular park. I'ts formal terraces and wide walkways are adorned with statues of French queens and many other interesting statues. There is an lovely octagonal pool in the middle of the park where children were sailing miniature sail boats and locals were gathered in small groups over a picnic or reading a book or newspaper. There is an open-air cafe and a puppet theater, a bandstand and even tennis courts. As we walked through, we passed several lone musicians playing in different areas of the park.The beautiful gardens sweep down form the Palais de Luxemborg which we learned is the seat of the French Senate and was originally built for Marie de Medici, widow of Henri IV. The architecture is beautiful.When I return to Paris, this is a place I will visit again when I have a couple of hours to relax, sit by the pool and enjoy the view and jambone and fromage baguette and watch the people of Paris, It was a lovely experience and I'd absolutely recommend visiting the Jardin de Luxembourg.

Peace and calm in the midst of Paris. I recently visited the Luxembourg Gardens for the first time and was overwhelmed by the beauty of the floral displays, the sense of peace and space in the midst of Paris

My favorite haunt in Paris.. Full of statuary, splendid trees, fountains and laid-back people, this timeless park must surely rank as one of the most beautiful in the world. A great place to go on a hot day; a great pit stop to enjoy a picnic or a relaxing moment or two. It's only a few blocks from the Seine and a stone's throw from the Pantheon. A good place to people watch; a fabulous place to put your feet up and watch the world go by. Check out the petanque games on the western side or take in the Medici Fountain. A joy to behold. If you have some extra cash in your pocket, go have a coffee and a plate of tiramisu at the nearby Rostand Cafe on the Rue de Medici. You won't regret it.

Beautiful Oasis in the heart of the City. I'm not sure I'll have time to post a formal trip report for my Paris trip as we are doing so much every day but I thought I'd take time to post a review on this beautiful park.My wife and 13 month old baby are on a 1.5 month long trip and we absolutely LOVE parks. We've hit a few here in Paris so far. The Jardin du Luxembourg is really beautiful with a water fountain in the heart of the park. There is easy access to the park as there is a metro/RER stop right outside of the park. We walked to it as we were in nearby Latin Quarter eating lunch.The park itself has some beautifully manicured lawns but unfortunately they don't allow you to sit on the grass, which is a shame. Instead the city has placed hundreds of metal chairs within the park that people are free to use. There are some cement pathways and in the middle it's tree lines so it's good for some shade. Especially for days like yesterday that was absolutely hot and humid (about 95 degrees out). Many people were reading books, just resting or talking on the phone. Several people were sleeping on two chairs. Where there isn't grass there is just dirt areas which isn't ideal to sit on. We brought a big blanket and sat enough the trees for shade. It was very peaceful. It was especially nice as our baby is just starting to walk. There are a few statues within the park but the focus are the fountain and some beautiful flowers. In the heart of the park there are some tennis courts and also there is a child's playground where they actually charge you to get in. Adults are more than children. Nothing special. Just the usual type of playground toys. Also, they had miniture horserides for children. We only saw one person sitting on the grass and he was sleeping. Everyone else really respects the park rules. I didn't see anyone selling any type of drinks within the park but just outside the park gates there were several vendors in carts selling drinks and across the street from the gates there is some restaurants and newsstands. Also, near the entrance off to the right from the main entrance there is a beautiful fountain with statues that make for a nice photo. All in all a great place to sit back and relax a bit. Probably difficult if you are only here a short amount of time but we are here in Paris for 10 days and really love parks. If you are a park lover stop by.

Nice Quiet Park in Paris. This is a very nice park in the middle of Paris. Parking is close beside in an underground garage. Some things to note, there is a great play park for the kids but you need to pay to get them in - 2.60 Euro each - rather odd we thought. There is a musuem as well of to the side but we didn't go into it, opted instead to walk around the perimeter of the park. You can't get into the Palace itself as now used for the government.One unique thing about this park is the thousands of metal chairs everywhere which makes it great for just sitting around and soaking up the sun. now if only they let people on the grass, it would be perfect. There was one area at the top of the park where they let people on the grass and it was covered with people. Great afternoon at this park, recommend it to those with a family, some time to spare - and those wanting to relax!

Relaxing, Beautiful, and Bustling. I was there in June 2009. It was beautifully groomed, great place to relax and walk around. It is very big, so there are very quiet relaxing places and also activities in various spots, so you can wander over to the basketball courts, or the pond where kiddies are floating boats, or the little stage with musical acts, etc. It's really adorable! Take some food and have a little picnic.

one of the most beautiful parks that welcomed my dog. We specifically took the Metro to Luxembourg Gardens so our Shiba Inu could have some "outside" time and meet "Parisian" dogs...and it didn't disappoint. There is a section of the park where the neatly lined trees are that offer quite a nice shade for dogs and humans alike. The dog park area was very clean. It is certainly one of Paris' best kept secret for those traveling with dogs!

Relaxing. The Jardin du Luxembourg it's a relaxing green area in Paris, perfect to have a nice picnic, to walk along, our just to stand sitting at the lake chairs.I advise to mind the stairs near the lake, because they're a bit slippery. (my backside will remember it for long time) :(
