relaxing. After few days of wlking in Paris, you must see how the parisians relax.

Park with a twist. The word garden is a stretch, it's a park. Maybe there is something lost in the translation. It's the most beautiful park though. It's like going to a park that is manicured better than more golf courses. A great spot if you have kids for sure!It was a great way to sit and unwind and people watch before some early dinner.

The place to take in a slice of Parisian life. As you are sitting in the Luxembourg Gardens it is the sound of the gardens that is best - people talking, people laughing, the constant sound of gravel crunching under foot as people walk past. Nearby the children are sailing pondboats across the large pool in the middle of the gardens, running around to the other side once their boat passes midway across. In the distance is the sound of playground equipment squeaking & turning. It's all a background noise that occasionally gets punctuated by the sound of someone re-arranging one of the garden's metal chairs, the sound of a child running by, the raising of a voice or a drawing out of a French vowel to exclaimate a point. In the far distance you occasionally hear the crack of a petunk ball striking another - the petunk matches are really serious affairs by those men that play. Always the sound of gravel crunching as people walk by. The gardens are spectacular - but it is the respite of allowing oneself to take a break that is the magic of the gardens. Not everyone gets it.

A sunny day in Paris. These gardens are just the best gardens in Paris, there are loads of different kinds of flowers, paths, a tenis court, chess game tables...If you want to take a break somewhere while visiting Paris, this is the place to go, just grab a sandwich and a chair near the central fountain and relax...They also often organise concerts and exhibitions!
massive pretty park. I expected this park to be something more than it was, and I wouldn't make it a stop unless you were passing directly by it anyhow.

Amzing - A Must See. This is definitley the place to go if your ever in France. It is a peacuful and buetiful site to see. And unlike the Eiffel Tower or Notre Dame it isn't a huge tourist trap so you can actually get around. It is also a great place to go if you have small children because they have a huge play area for kids for only 2.50 euros. While you aren't roaming around the gigantic gardens you can stop at one of the small crepes shops or sit down for a great meal in the garden. If you ever decide to come to paris this is definitley one of the places you should see.

A lovely spot for a picnic. We bought a baguette, some cheese, and a bottle of wine, and made our way to a bench facing a lovely statue. We ate while watching birds of all types compete for the crumbs and the breeze made the leaves shake like sequins. Afterwards we walked through the park, finding the lovely pond with it's ducks and children pushing sailboats across.A beautiful place to relax in a metropolitan city.

Most beautiful gardents. I skimmed over the reviews and apparently someone mistook this for a hotel. This is a garden/park, not a hotel. The grounds are lovely. This is a great place to take a walk around or for families with children to come (there are play areas). The palace is wonderful as well - you can't go inside except once a month I think. Just a magnificent large building to look at though. The flowers, fountain, landscaping is lovely.

Wonderful place to relax in the Left Bank. Not far from Pantheon, St Sulpice, Les Invalides... Palais du Luxembourg is an art museum with traveling exhibits. Les Jardins du Luxembourg includes reflecting pond, fountains, statues of French queens, etc. Wonderful for a few hours or an afternoon in the park... great place to sit & read, people-watch, etc. During the spring/summer, the city puts out thousands of chairs for everyone to sit (wherevery you want).Kids play area looked fun (but at 41 I was not allowed in by myself!).

Loved it!!. We spent a lovely day at Luxembourg Gardens, lots of seats out for you to just relax and enjoy. We also went to see a traditional puppet show which was enjoyable even in French as the story was known and loved being the 3 little pigs which most people already know the story. My daughter then had a pony ride which she loved. The gardens are very clean and well tended it seemed that a lot of people make their way there on a weekend with a good book or to meet friends and just while away the time.

Terrific formal European public garden-- a must see.. As opposed to another review shown above on the Lux. , this is not a shabby hotel but a wonderful , large and peaceful formal public garden adjoining the Latin Quarter. There are many beautiful things to see here including the rear of the French Senate building (originally built as a chateau for one of the Medici's along with a gorgeous sculptured fountain) , a central foutain/mini-lake , many sculptures (including one of the Statue of Liberty w/ a large American Oak and a plaque commemorating Sept.11th) , rides for the kids (including poney rides -- all for a fee) ------- I could go on but chose to show some in pictures instead. Try it, you'll like it.

Perfect for a leisurely afternoon. Luxembourg Gardens is beautiful, peaceful, and yet fun. Pick up some delicious "take-out" at Gerard Mulot down the street and spend a leisurely few hours walking around the gardens or sitting in the fountain area. The place is a work of art.
